review_body: For me and my family I loved the location. It is on the edge of the strip bordered by the beach in front and the zoo on one side. I did not pay extra for the ocean view but still had a fabulous view of the beach. The safe was pleasant and helpful. If you are looking for a comfortable but more barebones hotel this is a great option.

I can't say enough about Hedwyne and Jeanette!! Truly 5 star service because of these two! Hedwyne handled some issues early on flawlessly and I could not have appreciated it more! Because of Jeanette recommending the Coconut Club, it made our stay much more enjoyable! I hope these two AMAZING Team members get recognized for there OUTSTANDING customer service. Also a shout out to the hotel in general and the rest of the Team who helped make this experience as wonderful as possible! We left halfway through our trip because of Hawaii's governor shutting things down. I was DREADING asking for a refund on our prepaid trip. The hotel refunded our remaining balance no questions asked! It was FAR beyond what I expected!Thank you Aston Team and Hedwyne and Jeanette!!!

This is my 2nd stay at this hotel, both times in oceanfront rooms. Gorgeous view and nice location at a decent nightly rate (but do remember to include the resort fee). Some commenters have mentioned the need for room refurbishment, but that didn’t bother me much. The furniture is okay, and room is very clean. My problem is that the street noise and live music at Tiki’s are LOUD. My room was on the 8th floor. The musician played until 11pm, which isn’t unusual for bars and restaurants... except my east coast body clock wanted to sleep at 9pm. The street noise and urban campers across the street did not quiet down when the music stopped. I was awaken to yelling and banging multiple times each night. A trade off for the view of the Waikiki beach and sunset.The staff here is wonderful, and I will probably stay here again, but next time I will definitely request a very high floor.

We stayed for 3 nights while transiting to Australia from Canada. A little warming up needed. Our first experience was the check in and the resort fee which seemed high for 3 nights (US$144). When we queried this we were told we had to pay it with no explanation how it’s calculated or why. We later found we had 4 nights at around AU$290 in our account. This was being sorted by the reception but now have 2 pending deductions in our account. Our check in was late due to our flight delay. This was about 1am and we fell asleep once in the room #1001. The next day it was windy and the balcony sliding door and room entry door made whistling noises all night. Not much sleep has the 2nd night. On the next day the wind has increased and the balcony door was shaking violently. We thought it would blow out. Reception kindly relocated us to a room #1213 in the centre of the tower. The balcony door still whistled but no violent shaking. We slept better. However around 4am there was a group of giggling girls around the pool. We were 12 floors up so glad we weren’t lower as no one was stopping their noise. Eventually they moved. The rooms are very dated and need an overhaul. Old timber built in robes and furnishings. Brown featured carpet. Also the blanket on the bed in our first room had dark brown stains. On the high side is the location opposite the beach and Waikiki walls. Also we had good views of the beach even though it was a city view room. I know this sounds like a whinge but you can see from my other reviews from around the world they’re generally positive. Not sure about staying again.

We booked this after a cruise. For $7 a night we were able to upgrade to an oceanfront view rather than ocean view. No brainer! We overlooked the main beach right across the street from the hotel. The location is at the end of the waikiki main drag, so its quieter than many properties, but still within walking distance of everything. The zoo is right across the street, the aquarium is beyond that, and Diamond Head is also adjacent with a nice public park. We loved the security feature of having to scan your room card to get on one of the elevators. The pool is next to the reception area as is a restaurant. The staff brought us frozen fruit cups while we were sitting in the chairs. They also supply you with beach towels and i believe beach chairs, but we didn't use them. The bed was comfy and the room was large. We were able to pay for late checkout at 4 pm since our room was going to be empty. We had a late flight and the hotel has a place to store luggage if you dont have a car and want to hang around town for a while. Valet parking is mandatory if you have a car. Our car was available whenever we wanted it by calling the valet desk. The only thing we can say negative was the lines at check-in and checkout. They need to get more staff during those times, or upgrade their systems to work faster. We got tired of waiting to check out after 10 minutes and dropped our key in a box. They did email us a receipt after i sent them a request. We would definitely stay here again!

This is an old hotel with an excellent location. The rooms are small, but you do not go there to spend most of your time in your room. Pool area is shaded till late afternoon, but the beach is right across the street go there! They have beach chairs you can take and all the sunscreen you need. Tiki Bar and Grill is pool side and has great food . They have their own convenience store, but ABC stores (they were open when ever i went there) are outside the door and other food vendors. Trolley stop on the street. Staff are very helpful but be cautious of the concierge they work for a time share company.

Highly recommend this hotel for a multiple of reason. 1. The staff are truly amazing2. Pickup point is right outside the hotel for multiple tours3. Walking distance to Zoo and Aquarium4. Beach views just a step out of the hotel

Positives- Location location location. Nice & pleasant staff. Decent sized rooms. Clean pool Negatives: Rooms/ decor has not seemed to be updated since the late 1980s so don’t go expecting ultra updated & modern settings. Our closed balcony door created a loud whistling every time the wind blew. But decent price, amazing location & the good breakfast helped us overlook the faults of this hotel.

Room was small for two people but accommodating, had a nice balcony and view of the ocean. Could use updating. Hotel staff was great. Pool was nice. Hotel had much to offer guests, ie: pool towels, cameras etc...

we stayed five nights at the aston and it was so worth it. the staff was so kind and gave us different ideas of what to explore and what to do. the food is amazing -> I‘m still dreaming of the Poke Ball

This was our 2nd stay here and as before we were very pleased with the staff and the facilities. At check-in, Sean was very courteous and efficient, our room was ample and very clean. Our favourite beach is just across the street and there are restaurants and convenience stores all around the hotel, also the Zoo and Aquarium are within walking distance. There is an activity desk and they were very forthcoming with the tours they offer. For location, cleanliness and value I rated it Excellent and highly recommend it and will be coming back for sure!

We enjoyed our stay here, it is just across the street from Waikiki beach and walking distance to tons of restaurants and shopping. The room was fairly nice but the bathrooms could certainly use some work. The only thing we weren’t happy with, which is completely beyond the hotels control, is the extreme wind. It was howling and shaking the windows so bad we couldn’t sleep some nights and made it impossible to sit on our balcony. Maybe bring some earplugs. Other than that I would recommend staying here.

We could not believe that there would be such a vast difference between the web site photos and reality. The first room we were given, had a decrepit bathroom, with towels more suitable to use cleaning up slops rather than for humans. They were so old that the colour was grey and stiff as a board. The floors in the bathroom were filthy, there were three of us in a room, yet we were only given supplies for two. The dusty bedroom had certainly not had a good clean in quite a while. We were unable to remain in such conditions and were moved to an Aloha Suite, this was a little better, but the bathroom was still as bad. The air conditioning ran very cold and we were unable to adjust it, we called the housekeeping, who sent an engineer up to check it out. His verdict was that we should turn it off and open the balcony door, which is not conducive if you want to sleep at night.At no time were we given any information as to the poolside activities, the daily resort fee is a scandalous rip off!This was my fourth visit to Waikiki, and tis hotel managed to mar the 7days we had there.
user_name:
betty3009
Blue Mountains National Park, Australia

review_body: Very disappointing hotel. The photos online are not a true representation as to what the hotel looks like. Rooms are old and dated and this triggered a dust reaction. For the most part staff were friendly, however, some of the staff lacked customer service skills and this was again very disappointing. The cleaners were very polite and very helpful.

Great location, without a doubt! The walk from the front-desk, down an escalator, across the street into the sand of Waikiki Beach is, maybe, 45 seconds! Perfect location. If only customer service was as great! It wasn't! Let's start with the resort fee -- $45 for "a lot of great stuff," as I was told. That's a joket! Did not need or want anything that the resort fee covered, and the WIFI was, at best, sketchy. My room was a mess upon check-in, with hangers, toilet paper and more on one bed and a large glass and more on the other. So, I went back to the front-desk for another room. Jeanette at the front desk saw the pictures I took, apologized, asked if I would email her the photos, then gave me an upgraded room. I asked her to reply that she received the pics; she never did. Second room on the 23rd floor, was nice, though only 1 bed and had asked for 2. Received a call in the second room from manager Chris to make everything was OK. I said, yes. He asked if there was anything else he could do for me for the issues; I said, 'You let me know,' hoping he'd waive the resort fee, which I mentioned. He said he'd check and call me back -- no call back! Upon checking-out, manager Gina said she approved a 3-category upgrade, which I knew nothing about, and that's all can and will do, regardless of the WIFI and room issues. Very rude!

This is my third time staying here. Definitely have a great staff. It is well worth the extra $$$ to book a premium ocean front room with or without club access.Great location across the street from the beach. Only down side of the place is the cost of parking. It is way out of line for the value option. Park at the park overnight for free. 2 min walk past Starbucks so not a problem.

This is our first time to Waikiki- so we wanted something walking distance to the beach- this hotel is right next to the beach- which was perfect for usWe didn’t know what to expect because we usually stay in a time share when we travel ( at least when we can get in but thats a whole other story) Anyway the staff here has been wonderful- very accommodating! Especially Jin! After a few issues with our keys she went above and beyond to make it right! Thank you Jin and Aston Beach Hotel!

Not the 5 start experience but its on Waikiki Beach so if thats waht you want to do, then this is perfect. I was on an upper floor and the views were of the beach/ocean and spectaculare as might be expected. I'm just not that thrilled with the whole tourist trap of Waikiki . I was on Maui for 10 days previous and a diffeent vibe there and more me.Fair price, good service.

What’s good; Great location near to beach, restaurants, shopping and Diamond Head. The bar/restaurants on site are really good. Pool/beach towels provided and Wi-Fi is good, cleanliness of rooms, sea viewNot so good; reception staff on check in; the guy didn’t explain anything about anything! Nothing about what’s included in the rip-off resort tax; $48 per night after tax is far more expensive than other hotels for no more facilities.The pool is old and has way too much chlorine in it, stinging our eyes. It’s also in shade for most of the day with the sun only coming around in the afternoon.Overall, I’d not stay here again, but look for better value in similar location

we stayed at this hotel for a week. the rooms were clean and the staff was helpful. our balcony did not face the ocean it was more of a side way view. which was ok since we were only in the room at night. I would stay here again.

We came to Hawaii the first time in our lives as most people do... on our honeymoon! We’ve been back several times and we always stay here even after looking into other hotels. It’s affordable! It’s right across from the beach! It’s at the end of the strip so beach is not as packed as other beaches! It’s walkable to just about everything you’ll want to do! Staff is friendly and helpful! Elevators are confusing at first. ALWAYS be sure to do the free daily activity! It’s fun for everyone! Also the Tiki bar in the hotel is awesome also! We eat there often!
user_name:
derekm300
Toluca Lake, California, United States

review_body: First off, this hotel is wonderful. Nice rooms, Tikis is amazing, a fun pool to splash in and a great location.But let me tell you about my guardian angel AKA Allan Antonio AKA the front services supervisor. This man deserves all the praise. My husband, toddler, and I were in a rush to get checked out of the hotel and to the airport to fly out. When we checked our bags at the airport we realized we had lost one along the way. We called the lost and found and they didn't have it. I asked to talk to the valet and they confirmed they had found my bag. I was still in a panic trying to figure out how I was going to get my bag before flying out and figured I would have to pay a high fee to get it sent to my next location, or even worse, leave it behind. Enter: Allan Antonio. He called me and told me would personally drive my bag to the airport to give it to me. From the time we hung up to the time my bag was back in my hand was 25 minutes. I was able to check it and get to my gate in time. My trip would have ended on such a low note if not for Allan going above and beyond to help me out when I needed it most. So Allan if you're reading this...THANK YOU.everyone else. Stay at this hotel! It's worth it! Plus their buy one get one free Mai Tai receipts are a great perk ;)

They do have nice views of the beach, however, not at all is this hotel worth $300 a night. More like maybe worth $169 a night- and I mean their nicer rooms are worth this.Its an old hotel. Its not horrible but I think that in Hawaii- they have lots of hotels in a good location that are antiquated and need to be renovated and charge entirely too much based on location. This is NOT and I repeat NOT worth $300 a night in no world. The people at the concierge are super nice and the valet guys deserve praise. The pool is old and sucks.

We were two couples here for a few days prior to heading to another island. I am mixed on this hotel because - it is close to the water, has beautiful views, walkable to everywhere you want to go, slightly out of the thick of Waikiki Beach (only a few blocks) so it is quieter, trolley stop right outside the door, the beach is not crowded and there are lots of restaurants nearby. But, the hotel is tired, old and needs some upgrades. The bathrooms especially are a little suspect. As our friend put it, we are only sleeping here for a few nights, it works.

Great spot for enjoying the city, Waikiki Beach and access to The Bus and Trolley services. From the reviews we knew the rooms are dated and smaller but the location at the end of the strip and the cost were enough for us to try it. It was a great choice, with excursions to Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay and Pearl Harbor we knew we weren't spending our days in a hotel, but the views from the balcony in the morning and at night were wonderful. The staff was friendly and helpful, elevators were no problem - always took the escalators up to the lobby before we got on them. We walked to dinner in the evenings - everything from upscale to food trucks, something for everyone. Beach across the street, no buildings on the beach side of the main road at this end of Waikiki. The negative of this area is the amount of homeless which I don't want to get into a discussion of how to solve/deal with/treat..etc, the fact is they are there (not many during the day) and the picnic tables become their beds at night and they tend to take over some of the pavilions along the beach front, again at night. Was not something I expected but would not stop us from staying here again.

We really enjoyed the hotel more than we expected. The location is good,not too busy but busy enough to feel like you were in a good spot. Food at Tikis restaurant was great. The only thing to complain about is the parking fee and resort fee charged were higher than I expected.

Fantastic location, across the street from waikiki beach and a main trolley stop right outside the front door. Friendly and super helpful staff. Always happy to assist us with any request. Great food and entertainment options right down the street

We spent 4 nights here after our stay in Kailua Oahu. It was in the perfect location. Right on the beach-front at the quieter end of Waikiki, next to the beautiful park. We felt we had chosen well. Considering it is Waikiki beach it was also very reasonably priced.Our room was great, everything we needed, clean and a side view of the beach from our little balcony, stunning. From the other side there were beautiful views of Diamond Head. It was ideal to walk out of the front door to be surrounded by everything we wanted to see. We didn’t eat here, but the restaurant looked nice, with seats on the terrace overlooking the beach. Check in was very long winded, but you are given an Aston refillable water pouch for your use while there and they have a large cold water dispenser full of lemon slices next to reception for guests which we made use of. They also lend you towels and beach chairs.Nice pool which we didn’t use as we were on Waikiki beach! Helpful staff too. I stupidly left some clothes in a drawer in my room. After filling out some online paperwork, they found it and posted it back to England for me! Thank you Aston, we would happily come again.

When I booked this hotel I knew it was near the beach but I did not realize it was actually right across the street. Such easy and quick access. It is also near great shopping and dining options. So location was great- but a very busy tourist area so be prepared for crowds.  The hotel staff was friendly and since they didn't have a king bed room ready when we checked in, they upgraded us to an ocean view room for any inconveniences this caused. I appreciated that little but of customer service. The view was awesome. The room was clean.  They also gave us some refillable water bag/bottle things and there are a couple of places in the hotel with nice cold filtered water available to fill them up. They also have complementary sun screen available in a big pump by the pool. I have seen reviews complaining about the elevators and ran into a couple of other guests while we were there who were having trouble figuring it out, but honestly, I didn't think it was that complicated and never had a problem or a long wait. We preferred the time we spent on the island's North shore but I would definitely stay here again if I wanted to stay in the Waikiki area again.

Thanks to Paula at Travel to Paradise for setting this up for us. Great location at Diamond Head end of the beach. Friendly and helpful staff. Room with an ocean view. Yes, there were homeless people across the street from the hotel. Have some compassion for these folks who are obviously less fortunate than us. Mahalo Paula for finding this little gem!

It's really hard to say definitively whether we enjoyed staying at this property or not as the pros and cons are equal.First off is the location. For us, having never been to Waikiki Beach we wanted easy access to the beach - you can't get better than Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for this. Yet after several visits to the beach, we didn't want to be actually on the beach so much due to 1) crowds and 2) homeless/drunks. We couldn't believe how many drunks were loitering around, right next to where kids are playing. We are from NZ where there are some beaches you can pretty much have to yourself most of the year so it was weird squeezing your beach towel on the sand next to somebody! So having now been to Waikiki Beach itself, a hotel ON the beach/directly across from the beach would not be a top priority for us here! If it is your number one thing on your list - you're not going to get much better in terms of beach location,The elevators/reception are at the best of times - FRUSTRATING! The front desk/reception is on the 3rd floor, so when you arrive you either have to take the elevator or escalators up to the 3rd floor where the front desk is - by the pool! IF your room is ready early, you'll then be introduced to the strange elevator system where you press what floor you want into the keypad, swipe your room key and it will tell you which elevator (A, B, C etc) you will need to get into. At times - given that there were only 3 elevators that serviced the ENTIRE hotel (another 3 went up or down from the pool level (3) only) - it was chaos on level 1 waiting for an elevator and it made us not want to pop down or out for coffee etc, knowing we'd have to run the gauntlet of the elevators each way. The rooms are very small, quite dated - and this was a bit one for us - seemingly ZERO noise proofed. You can hear every little thing going on down on the street - and we were 10 floors up! It took brute force to open the ranchslider to go onto the balcony. The bed had NO blankets and just a sheet with another sheet on top. We were cold most nights. A note had been left from the housekeeper saying to let her know if there was anything we needed during our stay. So I left a note asking for some blankets - to no avail! There is NO laundry on site. Never thought this would be an issue for us, but we were there for 8 nights, in and out of wet bathing suits - boy how we could have used a laundry! The closest laundromat was a good 15 minutes away and everything I read said to be careful for the homeless coming in and stealing washing from the machines. Luckily we moved on to Aulani in Ko Olina on our 8th day where the front desk even gave us free tokens for their laundry so we could do some washing while we waited for our room to be ready, The front desk at Aston were always friendly and helpful. Front Desk don't seem interested in going above and beyond for anything though (like the example with Aulani above) When we asked for a luggage trolley to come up on the day we were leaving, they said we'd have to wait 30 minutes at least! So we just struggled with the ridiculous elevator system and 11 items of luggage ourselves! The pool is so over powered with chlorine that we had super red eyes every time we had swam and it's shaded by the hotel itself, which is great on a super hot day, but get's chilly on a colder day. Nothing special about the pool area really. The activities that are run pool-side are great though.The good stuff - the little gift shop on level 1. Given that there are ABC shops what seems like every two steps in Waikiki, I much preferred the little gift shop at Aston. Same prices as ABC on a lot of things, cute little gifts and the ladies that worked there were so lovely. We had selected a partial ocean view room. For a partial ocean view - it was a pretty good view! The NYE fireworks were right in front of us and that was with a SIDE room. So no need to upgrade to an ocean view room if you are offered the chance really.Wolfgang Puck Express was a good, cheap alternative to dining out. Staff are great there and you never have to wait too long. We did miss Wolfgang once we left Waikiki! Right across the road from Honolulu Zoo, short walk to Waikiki Aquarium, a five minute Uber ride to Diamond Head and a few minutes walk to the bus stops - all great points.So we're mixed on this place really. I wouldn't rush to stay there again but it's not the worst hotel I've stayed at. For the price, it could be better though, Definitely in need of a face lift!!!

The location is great-right across from The beach. Rooms were average. Service was average. Pool was wonderful and clean and fun. Noticed the room was clean accept along the edges. I actually cleaned around the edges in the bathroom

We have spent New Year at the Aston Waikiki beach Hotel, great location for beach lovers.The hotel wasvery nice and the service was amazing, specially at the reception Miss Jin helped us and offered us an upgrade to a wonderful room with incredible view.Also we bought the access to the coconut lounge, great value for money and again amazing view.We loved Waikiki and we look forward to get back in the near future.

This is a four star hotel with the best location in Waikiki. Older hotel with clean, four star room. Pluses...fantastic snorkling is right across the street at San Souci beach. Tons of reef fish to see. Right across the other street is the zoo. Very large, (spent four days there), and very “green”. Guarantee you will find waves for wave-boarding at Kuhio beach next to hotel. Several decent restaurants within a block and the hotel’s coconut lounge is worth the cost for breakfast plus view alone. Minuses: it’s a hotel, not a resort, so small pool and no room service.Summary: it’s a four star hotel on a five star location. Worth staying at if you like beaches and zoos.

Great location, cost and hospitality.I got back from my third trip to Oahu in just over a year, (yeah, lucky I know) and it was my third stay at this hotel. I was contemplating staying at the other end of the strip however I really enjoyed the less hectic pace of the south end with the protected soft sand Kuhio beach for swimming. We did a lot of beach hopping (till we got to the Hilton Hawaiian Village) and was surprised at how crowded and rocky some of the beaches were. In the end, we took up a great returning customer rate at the Aston.Previously on two of my trips I had a premier ocean front room. This last trip I had a partial ocean view room which was a free upgrade. Oh my goodness, the view from the 16th floor overlooking the pool and Waikiki beach was nearly as spectacular as the ocean front rooms. It had a full lani so we often bought tropical fruits at the ABC store on the ground floor of the hotel to eat on our balcony each morning for breakfast along with coffee as the hotel had a Keurig machine with Kona and Paradise pods which weren’t too bad. A total of two per day. My husband took his own green tea so I just heated the water without a coffee pod. I also took some coffee bags with me.The hotel room was small however we were hardly in it (apart from the balcony). The room including the bathroom was clean and well maintained. There are toiletries but no shower caps, so take one with you if required. The king bed was super comfortable. The mini fridge was smallish and could only fit a few cold drinks. The room was serviced each day so we left a couple of dollars tip each morning. As usual, the staff were genuinely friendly and always greeted us with a salutation and were very eager to help in any way. We flew Hawaiian airlines and arrived around lunch time and was given access to our room straight away which was great. Check in/out was super easy.The in-room air conditioning worked well thank goodness as it was quite humid. It’s important to note that hallways and lifts don’t have air conditioning. I utilised the ice machine on our floor twice a day.The Aston’s location and price for same are its biggest drawcards. It’s a no-frills kind of place. No room service. They do have Tiki’s bar and restaurant on level 3 which has wonderful sunset views. They do charge a resort fee as do most places in Waikiki so you need to factor this in as it is over and above your room rate. That said, for similar hotels on the strip I believe it is very good value for money. The other thing worth mentioning is that there are a few different types of rooms and you get what you pay for. If you want a full lani ask for it as some are just stand out only (no chairs). The same if you want an ocean view, or partial ocean view, ask for it however it will cost more. Some room rates include the Coconut Club however this didn’t interest us.For breakfast there is Denny’s around the corner, Lulu’s next door, or the ABC shop downstairs. BTW, this local ABC shop have Costco style hot dogs with toppings for less than $USD2 for a quick lunch before heading out somewhere exciting for dinner. And there are lots of exciting places for that!The hotel has a shuttle service to and from the airport, the flea markets, Pearl Harbour and Waikele outlets which we utilise every visit. There is a trolley stop on the ground floor and a short walk to Kuhio Avenue if you want to take The Bus. It’s a 10-minute walk to the Cheesecake Factory along the main drag.If you have realistic expectations of the Aston you will enjoy staying here as much as I do.

Not a luxurious but worthy hotel with good facilities. One of the biggest dissapointments is so called Coconut club because quality if food aand drinks there is lousy. Choice is very poor and almost never changes. Well, but you can live with it. On the other hand is great view (from ocean view rooms), convenient location, pretty quick lifts.Oh yea, expensive parking is also bad.

I was well aware of the mixed reviews about this hotel on the internet - but I booked with Aston because A) they’re affordable than most hotels on Kalākaua aveB) they’re right on Waikiki beachI’ve stayed at a few hotels in Waikiki from Outrigger on the reef, Sheraton and Queen K so...And I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the reception area, Jin who was so darn lovely - super attentive and sweet.I was already aware of the resort fees and people should read the fine print when booking - it’s not just this hotel - every hotel in Waikiki has resort fees - for Wifi, activities, business centre uses, beach towels and amenities. So I was prepared and had saved up extra cash for it.Connie was also a super lovely receptionist as well ! Thanks for our Christmas pic !Our ocean view room with King size bed, had views of the ocean just more on the side and it wasn’t partial. There was enough sea views for me to be extremely happy.The housekeepers did a fab job during our stay as well.The gym is just a bit small but it was sufficient :)We really enjoyed our stay - Mahalo !

This was our second stay at this hotel. We had a week long stay from December 13, 2019 to December 20, 2019. Came to learn that the hotel is now under different management and some things aren't like we remembered. However, this stay was just as good as the one before. There is a $39 resort fee (plus taxes) charged per day which include pool access, gym access, complimentary beach towels and chairs, complimentary sun screen and bottles of water, and I think a few other services we didn't use. We also rented a car for this trip, but quickly had to find an alternative for parking it for the week. Reason being is the hotel doesn't have a parking lot, just valet only. For this service, the hotel gladly charges you a $45 fee per day to park your car on the property. Save yourself a bunch of money and go about a block and a half down the street and park your vehicle in the Banyan Public parking located at the intersection of Kuhio Ave and Paoakalani Ave. Since we were there for the week, the parking structure has a $80 cost for the week to park, or if you're there for 1-2 days, you can pay $20 per day. Either way, don't park your car at the Aston! Beds and pillows were quite comfortable, our view from our lanai overlooked Waikiki beach, which was amazing both day and night. Only real complaint I had about the room is the air conditioner system didn't seem to work all that well in our room and get it as cold as I would have liked. Engineering did come to the room, adjusted the vents, and changed the air filters to see if that would help, but it didn't seem to make the difference. The hotel did offer to move us rooms if we wanted, but we just stayed where we were and I slept with just the top sheet only. It's Hawaii, so not that big of a deal. I also liked having the Tiki' restaurant attached to the hotel so after a day of play, I could come down and sit at the bar and have a nice cocktail, snack, and good conversation with strangers. Ended up coming home with 2 Tiki glass souveniers. Staff at the hotel were always helpful and another added bonus was a small little store on the ground level where you can buy simple things like drinks, sandwiches, small souveniers, snorkel gear, body boards, or small things you may have forgot to pack like toothpaste or a tooth brush. If you want to have more options for souveniors, go around the corner in either direction from the hotel and you will find an ABC Store. Plenty of shopping in walking distance from the hotel up and down the Waikiki Blvd. The Honolulu Zoo is just around the corner from the hotel and is worth checking out, or if you're a hiker, take a small excursion to Diamond Head. I ended up walking all the way to Diamond Head from the hotel and still hiked it too. I don't recommend that and I underestimated how far it was to the entrance. Take the bus or an UBER because the parking lot is always full. My last bit of advice is take a few min and visit the excursion desk for information about family things to do on the island. If you want to get some discounts on some things like Luau's, and if you have the time, take 2 hours out of your day and listen to their presentation on their time shares. You don't have to buy, just spend the 2 hours to get your discounts. The Paradise Cove Luau generally costs $130 per person, but with the discount, that price drops to $30 per person. It's honestly up to you what you want to do with your time.In closing, if we make it back to Hawaii in the near future, Aston is always a hotel we will consider. It really is close to everything you want to do. Anything else is just a short drive from the hotel. Thank you Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for taking such great care of us!

We stayed for three days after we had been at high end resorts on other islands. We had a great time and really enjoyed the location. The room could be updated but it certainly was clean and adequate. Staff was friendly and helpful. All the trolleys and pick up/drop offs were right outside the hotel so it was so convenient. I will assuredly stay at this property again. It was good quality at a fair price compared to the other hotels. There is a resort fee that is in addition to the daily rate $39. Lots of folks complained of this in the reviews I saw but I still think it is a great value as long as you know it up front. It is very close to Diamond Head and right on the beach. Love this place!

The hotel is in a great location and we were happy with our room, etc. The tiki bar restaurant was closed the entire day and night we were there for a private party. Part of the reason we chose this hotel was for the open air tiki bar/restaurant right on location. As had been mentioned before, the $45 per night resort fee kinda sucked and we were really confused over our access to the Coconut Club. When we checked in we were given an access key to the Coconut Club but were told that is was going to be $89 per day extra which included a continental breakfast and an all you can eat happy hour. After speaking with the front desk a couple of different times we were still confused as to whether or not we could use the club. We eventually went to the club, used our access key and took advantage of the amenities there. We were asked our room number and then were told 'OK'. We asked the attendant on duty if we were okay to use the club and she told us yes so we used it the 2 days we were there. The hotel may want to consider making it a bit more clear whether you have to pay the additional fee or if you have access.Finally, the people at the 'Activities Desk' tried their hardest to lure us into a timeshare presentation. We expressed some interest in doing an excursion and wanted to do something on a boat. They were quick to recommend 2 different boat rides each for a high dollar amount but after their 'discount' the price was more reasonable. The never disclosed any information about the timeshare deal until I finally asked them. I would expect this type of trickery on the street but not at the actual hotel lobby where I assumed they were looking out for their guests best interests. They completely failed to mention a nice inexpensive catamaran boat only a few blocks walk away and right on the beach and instead were pushing for a higher priced boat ride which was miles away. This seemed like a slap in the face to their guests.

I found the experience of staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel better than I imagined it to be. The staff make that hotel a great place to be. I would definitely go again and recommend it to others. The staff phoned me to make sure I was alright. Staff were friendly and helpful. And best of all I learnt to hula dance by the swimming pool. There were many activities for guests.

We stayed 5 nights at the Aston in October, 2019. This was our 2nd stay. While the hotel itself is getting a little older and could use a little updating, it's location is absolutely perfect and overrides any cosmetic flaws. The pool is great! Excellent restaurants are within walking distance, and we walked to Diamond Head and hiked to the top. The beach is just across the street. I would recommend this hotel all around.

Thank you Glenn and you have accommodate everything for our stay! I had an amazing stay here in Aston Wakiki and you have providing amazing service for us! Not only we have some small issues but went above and beyond and being helpful.

Pleased to say my research was worth while and as a solo traveller my choice met my expectations. Having spent 10 days in Waikiki previously, I thought I had a good handle on the right area to be, however, after this stay in the beach walk area - I feel sorry for those not staying near here.The amount of eateries and bars close by are why you should stay at the Aston.Combine this with the Aston’s happy hours which is a wonderful opportunity to mix with other guests and enjoy pre dinner drinks and nibbles and you will agree this is the place to say. Huge rooms, no daily resort fees and a kitchenette also add to the appeal.

Pretty good location, if you want to be near the beach. Lots of traffic and pedestrian tourists. Our room on floor 23 was hounded by wind noise and whistling. Room and bathroom was pretty small. Pool is pretty small. Watch for $39 daily 'resort fee' that covers drinking water by the pool and beach chairs and towels. We requested 1pm checkout (twice) and they said fine. When we returned to our room at 12:30 we could not get in, had to go back to lobby to get new cards. Checkout waiting time was 15 minutes.

We booked this hotel for the location, closer to Diamond Head, and were very happy with our choice. The hotel is across the street from the beach, not directly on the beach, which was fine for us. I like that the hotel lets guests borrow beach chairs and towels. Our partial ocean view room (1002) had an awesome ocean view from the balcony. Hotel staff checked in with us by text every so often to ask if there was anything we needed. I actually needed extra pillows one day and was able to easily request it by text. This is a nice, convenient feature I wasn't expecting. The room and bathroom were fine – nothing spectacular, but clean and had everything we needed – small refrigerator, table, chairs on balcony, coffee, soaps, plenty of towels. Staff were friendly and helpful. We loved the infused waters in the main lobby, near the pool – pineapple and strawberries – what a treat! There was also a filtered water station to refill water bottles. We visited the on-site restaurant, Tiki Grill & Bar, every day since it was conveniently located. Prices were a bit high, but happy hour specials offered better deals. There was nice live entertainment each night. We were given a buy one get one free Mai Tai each day on our receipt, which was enough to make us return. The small convenience store on-site is nice, too, although there are AMC stores on either side of the hotel.

We booked ocean view and could barely see the ocean. We had accessible room... Not! Balcony is not even big enough for wheelchair to go on so she couldn’t even go outside to stretch around to see the ocean. Total rip off. NO grab bars in bathroom for toilet. Shower leaked and sprayed everything in bathroom. On plus side beds were comfortable and location is good. Can’t even walk out to beach though without going through crowd of smokers every day... disgusting!! Would never stay here again.

Half way thru our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. What a wonderful hotel to base your stay. Terrific location right across the road from Waikiki beach. Very friendly staff and great amenities. Do yourself a favor and book a oceanfront room for the best views in Hawaii. Definitely will stay here again. Aloha.

if you are looking for a reasonable priced hotel that is right across the beach look no further...now this isn't a resort hotel but its nice and clean and the staff are friendly...we stayed here because we had a conference in the hotel next to this one and that hotel was $200 more a night...we didn't think it was worth spending $200 more a night just to be in the same hotel of the conference...just a FYI this hotel is closer to end of Waikiki closer to Kapiolani Park and the Zoo...if you need a place to sleep and shower look no further...if you are looking for a resort experience look else where...I am happy with what I got for my money

charmless convention hotel except for the oceanfront views of Waikiki. If you are not booking a room with a view, go elsewhere or rent a condo. Very few amenities, a high "resort fee", teeny pool. Badly in need of a refurbishing. Staff could not be nicer, extremely pleasant and hard working. Do yourself a huge favor and walk to the left down Waikiki to the Barefoot Cafe located just past the entrance to the the beachside park. They serve great food, large portions, quick & smiling service in an open pavillion to the sound of Hawaiian music and the crashing surf. This will be my forever Happy Place. Tikki restaurant on site is nothing special, you could have this food anywhere, it gets very loud and happy at night. Great place to party if you are into that.

Very good ocean front hotel. Small pool, they provide all you need, towels and chairs for the beach, water container and sun lotion. My room was big, plenty of space and well kept. My interactions with staff were great. Highly recommended!

Stayed at this hotel 4 nights they charge a resort fee of $39 USD plus taxes which comes to almost $45 USD per night chargeable nightly. For this fee you get WIFI which I read was complementary a safe in you room that's ancient and coffee maker pool towel and beach chair pool games there are 3 Jenga connect 4 and throw the bean bag in the hole poolside treats that you have to pay for use of gym and phone calls but wouldn't you use your mobile phone. We arrived at 11.30pm so asked to have resort fees removed for that day was told best they could go was 50% off I refused and demanded a full refund for the day which eventually I got. The rooms are dated with old bathrooms the location is excellent. This hotel has one of the highest resort fees in Waikiki so keep this in mind it can make for an expensive room when you thought you were getting a good deal

Nice location, clean rooms, and friendly staff. Stayed here while attending a conference, and found that the location at the very end of the beach next to the zoo seemed a bit less hectic than areas further north (except during Halloween, which was raucous throughout Waikiki). Easy access to good protected swimming area across the street, and a short walk from snorkeling at Sans Souci. Pool area is up off the street (level three), which makes it ideal for families as well as simply relaxing while enjoying the ocean views. All in all a solid choice if you’re looking for reasonable accommodations on Waikiki beach.

If you are trying to save money and your standards are low, this might be fine, but not for travel lovers like us. We spent 6 days in Hanalei, Kauai prior to coming to Oahu for 4 days to mainly to tour Pearl Harbor tour and to catch our flight back home. After we saw the room, we quickly decided to rent a car and spend as little time in the room as possible. Best Decision ever!Let me give you a run down of issues:Paid for a ocean view room (not partial ocean view)-see pic with complimentary roof and A/C units from next hotel.Our A/C never cooled below 75 degrees-it’s bad when you come back and have to lay still and naked to cool down.We finally put a towel by the door since hallways were open air.Maintenance guy was called but couldn’t do anything. He sent up a fan, so CALL AND GET A FAN day 1.Don’t stay at a hotel unless it is directly on the beach, otherwise the BUMS in all the pavilions will be your only street view. GROSS. They apparently have enough money though for stems and seeds. Overall cleanliness was low. I kept having to wash my hands to feel clean. If mgmt is reading this have maid clean the shower head and old out of date tile floor better.Tiki’s bar in the hotel is a joke, baking in the cost of a “commemorative glass” into every drink, poor service.The tv is intermittent, finally just turned on music on my portable speakers instead.Turbo jet flush wakes up all others around including neighbors.$45/day resort fee gives you towels and a Walmart collapsible chair, inspect carefully. You could buy brand new chairs everyday for that fee.When we asked for a late check out they gave us an hourly rate...NOT a very good customer service option, more nickel and dime, even after we told them it has not been a good stay.Overall the staff are friendly and mean well, especially the valet guys.The list above should deter you from booking here. It really was the old building and the unit itself that was the major downer and disappointment.

We stayed for 7 nights and 8 days in Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and it was amazing. While the hotel is older and the rooms are small the view is amazing and the location is perfect. It was the perfect hotel for us and everyone there was so pleasant and accommodating. Thank You to everyone at the property for making our stay so wonderful

We stayed for 4 nights here. The staff at reception were very friendly and polite. Check in was easy and stress free and our room was ready. It was on the 24th floor and we had a great view of Waikiki beach. The room itself was very clean and the beds very comfortable.There is a pool on the same level as reception free to use and towels and chairs provided too. We used the pool and it was a great place to cool off in the heat of Oahu.I would recommend this hotel to anyone and the only reason I’m not giving 5 stars is because of the resort fees that you have to pay. Coming from the UK the fees are alien to me and for what you get of no use either. I know this is a US thing and I put it right up there with the tipping culture of things I hate To finish, Tiki’s is right by the pool area and is a lovely bar with live music which I would recommend to anyone. Yes I would stay here again as it has a great location too

This hotel is always great. The location is right across from the beach with alot of shopping and food. Great price and area for all ages. The staff is always helpful and accommodating.The view of the beach and local area is amazing.

A great location but Resort fees are ridiculous!!! You think you have a decent rate but when you get there they add $40 per night resort fee on top plus tax on the resort tax plus other taxes!!!For the resort tax you get free sun cream towels for the pool which is too small and phone calls.There is a tiki bar next to the pool but seriously you need some greenery around the pool area. You get 10% off the Worfgang Put Restaraunt downstairs.All that side the location was brilliant

We were here for a couple nights... the room was clean and check in easy. The bonus about this hotel is it’s across from the beach, and next to the zoo... so if you have kids...it’s great! Beds are small and rooms are quite crowded. Good value for money.

We stayed at a wonderful hotel. The staff and hotel were close to the beach and local stores and restaurants. The view from our room was better than we had expected. The rooms and hotel are kept clean and stocked. We will definitely be back again.

Last leg and hotel of 4 week trek across the USA. Lovely sized room and great view of the beach and pool. Excellent location stone throw from the beach and ABC shops which you will find is everywhere! Hotel provided poolside towels and beach chairs. Downside and surprise was resort fee on top of what we paid for the hotel, resort fee claimed to provide endless DVDs and PlayStation games which they no longer provide and beachside snack was terrible. Overall great place but as we found in a lot of the hotels in USA unnecessary resort fees with no extra benefit.

Excellent location with many amenities. This is the last, but closest hotel to the beach. even with a partial view of the ocean, it is a great view. east side has smaller baclonies but you never seem to be in the room long.Restaurant/bar on site by the pool. A little pricey but fare was nice and varied. Pool was hardly used as the hotel is so close to the ocean. Who wants to swim in a pool when you can go straight into the ocean steps away with water warmer than the pool!Hotel check in was seamless and prompt. Pleasant helpful staff on the desk at all times. Towel service for the beach and pool was always available and staffed. Intersting elevator system with nary a wait. Clean rooms and good service. lots of room in the rooms with a safe and large shower.This is good place to pick up the local Trolley and /or tours.There are many shops and restaurants withing walking distance.

We have stayed at this hotel about 8 times. There have been considerable improvements since our last stay (2018). The hotel has had painting done and there is now a lounge which is included in the tariff for some rooms but can also be purchased as an add-on (I think!!) It is called the Coconut Club and has breakfast, refreshments throughout the day and a light dinner at night - sushi, chicken, pork, rice, cheese and a few other things. The food is always the same, but is always fresh and lovely if you don't want to go out for the evening. One lady who worked in the Coconut Club was "Pilar" and she was outstanding. She welcomed us every time we went in and greeted and farwelled us as if we were guests in her own home. Pilar is such an asset to the hotel. It was so nice to be recognized and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for her. When the hotel discontinued the pool breakfast a few years ago, we considered changing hotels as it was an attraction and good value, but now with the Coconut Club, we will keep coming back.

Coming to stay at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for our final night in Oahu...from first arrival it’s been an amazing experience. We pull in and are greeted by the friendly men to grab our luggage and park our car. We make our way to the check in desk...beautiful surrounding and enjoying the hotel just from our first steps. It’s now our turn to check in....we are greeted by a WONDERFUL woman (Kalehua) she was full of smiles and making sure we enjoyed our final night here. I have never felt so welcomed. Because of Kalehua I will come back and stay here for sure on my next trip to Oahu. The room is spacious and has a wonderful view of the beach/ocean.

We were staying at the Park Shore which had a one day use of the coconut club included in our rate . We went for breakfast which was in a very nice area with great views. There was a nice buffet of fruits , oatmeal, juices and breads . We enjoyed eating outside with the beautiful ocean view and food was good. I would like to say thanks to the staff member Pilar who was exceptional and welcomed us and kept the buffet clean and stocked. She also took some pics of us and really made us feel welcome. It’s why I return to Hawaii because of her aloha spirit and caring. Thanks Pilar for making our day perfect !

We stayed at the Aston for three nights at the end of our holiday around Hawaii.... on arrival check in was quick but the rooms assigned to us were very average with views of the hotel next door and minimal ocean views..... after speaking to the front desk we were upgraded to oceanfront after paying an extra $20 per night.... we were more than happy to do that. These rooms were much better. The balcony was small but had two seats and it was lovely to sit out there. Our room was cleaned very well every day and all bath products replaced. The beds were very comfortable.... twin double beds... Every staff member we had contact with was extremely polite and accommodating. The pool area is on the lobby level .... we didn’t use the pool as we preferred the beach but the pool area needs a refurbish..... there are lots of sun beds and umbrellas. Towels were freely available as well as beach chairs. This hotel charges $39 a day “resort fee” which we discovered on check in.... basically we paid $39 a day for towels...... not very happy about that.... maybe this charge needs to be incorporated into their room rate so that when booking you get the true price. Apart from that we did enjoy our stay there.

Now I do not like to complain but we wanted to end our 7 week holiday in Hawaii relaxing in our room and around the pool, and on top of this it was my husbands birthday. Our expensive room with a view of the back of another hotel and the top of the roof of the bottom floor of the Aston was terrible. This room was sold to us with having partial view of the water “HA” you had to stand right out of your 60cm balcony to see it. Now the size of the pool was a joke for such a big hotel, it was smaller then what we have had in our back yard. The hotel is extremely out dated. You pay $45 extra in tax a night. The lady in checkin did not even ask us how our stay was overall not a great place. On the bright side the island is absolutely beautiful just next time I’ll book a nicer hotel. (My travel agent booked for us otherwise I would of done my homework)

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon for 8 days, We really enjoyed our stay, LOCATION was perfect as we were able to walk everywhere along the Waikiki strip also trolleys and excursion buses all pick you up from the front of the hotel! They have a wonderful pool area with Tikis bar and dining GREAT food and drinks and a great staff!! Check in/out was real easy, we had arrived at 1pm and they had our room ready, front desk staff was super nice and helpful we were on the 11th floor and had an AMAZING ocean front view with balcony, it was breathtaking!! The rooms are a little outdated but they were very clean and the king bed was so comfortable we slept really good after a long days of sightseeing, stores are conveniently located within walking distance, Starbucks was just around the corner and you can get food anywhere!! I only give it 4 stars due to it being outdated and it’s more of a 3 star then a 4 star!! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to everyone!! But make sure that you know it’s more of a 3 star and they have resort fees of $40 per day which includes WiFi, towels you can take to the beach and chairs and also go pros!! Thank you Aston Waikiki hotel for a great honeymoon stay!!

My partner and I stayed here for 7 days. Here are my thoughts.Location:10/10. If you pick this hotel, pick it for the location. It is a few steps from the beach and right in the heart of Waikiki.Price/value for money:I recommend this hotel, as long as you accept that it's a 3-star hotel (They try to sell it as 3.5 or 4 star). You also have to accept that you'll pay a resort fee of >US$40 per room per day when you check out (the fee has gone up). Note- when you book, this is not going to be included in your "total" even if your booking says "fees and taxes included." But it's best to accept this asap because all decent accommodation will have a 'resort fee'. I will say, there were some cool perks included - for example, you can take beach chairs to the beach and you can borrow GoPros.Views:We opted to pay extra for an "ocean view", which turned out not to be facing the sea directly. But the view to the side was nice (see photo from balcony). There are rooms that face the sea directly, so maybe you can request such a room. I must say the "mountain view" is also very beautiful. If I were to stay here again I would go mountain view and save a few $$ (I attached a photo of the 'mountain' side). Just don't go 'city view.'Staff:I can't fault the staff. Check in and check out was easy. Just be aware that a queue forms at peak times. We asked advice on taking the bus route and the guy fetched us a map and explained which bus to take. We also got a text when our room was ready (which was much earlier than their 3pm check-in time). Food:I was disappointed to find out that the hotel doesn't have a proper breakfast / eating place. BUT, there is a nice restaurant/bar called Tikis right on the property, next to the pool. The restaurant has ocean views (see photo attached). They have happy hour from 3pm-6pm. You can also grab food at the restaurant right downstairs called Wolfgang Puck Express (not fancy).Now for the Coconut club. You MUST pay the US$30 at least once for the key to the Coconut club. It is a nice dining area on the 21st floor with beautiful panoramic views of Waikiki beach. The rest of the photos I attached are taken from the Coconut club balcony. The US$30 includes breakfast and dinner. The breakfast was kind of disappointing but the dinner was delicious. Everything from cheeses, to sushi, to cookies with cream and ice-cream. The views alone are worth the money.Room/decor:Ok I'm not gonna lie, the carpets/walls/ceilings need to be re-done. But how important is that when Waikiki beach is right across the road? The room was clean and the king bed was really nice.

I visited this hotel because it was my birthday. my husband purchased the Apple Watch as a gift unfortunately, I never got the chance to wear it. The watch was on the dresser by the TV when my husband and I left for my birthday dinner. However when we returned it was stolen. We contacted Security and they assured me that they were doing everything they could to retrieve my stolen property the next day my watch still had not turned up and I hadn’t heard any information as to where it was or who took it. So I called the police to file a police report and they told me that this happens quite often and the stolen goods were usually not retrieved. The hotel took no responsibility I was not compensated in anyway, just left stolen property.

My husband and myself with two other couples spent a week here. Check in was a breeze. I mentioned our 40th Anniversary and our room was upgraded. Our room was on the ocean side facing Waikiki Beach and other hotels on 10th floor. We had an adequate balcony with room for two patio chairs. The view was marvelous. Our room was small but very clean. We heard nothing at night and slept like logs. The air conditioning worked well. The elevators were easy to use after a demonstration at check in. This hotel was located close to many restaurants and stores. Buses stopped right outside for pickup. You walk about two blocks to catch the city buses which take you anywhere in Honolulu. The staff was very pleasant an accommodating. We experienced no aggressive time share pitches. Just walk on by the booths. The Tiki restaurant has good food but expensive at night . Wolfgang Puck had good food. Denny’s is about two blocks away and was great for breakfast. You can get coupons online. Eating out is expensive in Hawaii. This hotel is so close to beach and has a rock free swimming area. You can take towels and beach chairs from the hotel to sit on. Room prices are good compared to other beachfront properties along Waikiki beach. I checked out by text and receipt was sent to email which was very convenient.

“ ROACHES”- We just spent 7 Days at this Aston location. Even though some websites has it “4 Stars” imo, it’s far from this Property 3/5- much older building that needs much need renovations. We saw 2 roaches in hallways. Staff- 4/5- check in/out very fast. Front line staff very friendly (management not so much)Rooms- 3/5 - we had a corner ocean front premiere room(not sure what made it premiere). I recommend a corner room in this hotel as it has more square footage. Furniture needs too be updated, king bed was so/so. View was awesome!Bathroom- 2/5- very small bathroom. Dirty tiles, very old tub/shower, if you’re over 5’10 you will need to bend over as shower head is very low on wall, slow draining tub. Conconut club/hospitality suite- 3/5- staff very friendly/helpful. Basic cold breakfast items, few hot dinner items, view from terrace is awesome. It’s not worth the extra daily charge as you don’t receive it back in choice of items. ### On our 1st morning of waking up, we had a 3 inch ROACH directly over our heads in bed(it was on the ceiling). My girlfriend freaked out. Went to front desk with picture of it and they didn’t seem to care. Promise to have house keeping to come ASAP. After 90 minutes of waiting and no housekeeping, I captured it in a drinking cup, took it to front desk and said “here, I did your job”. Poor girl at front desk didn’t know what to do. We would have left this hotel for another property immediately once this happen but we were unable to find another property that had availability for our remaining days. Needless to say we will not return , nor we will recommend this property to any of our friends/family. If you chose this property and you have children,please be careful of the bugs.

Very good location straight across the road from Waikiki Beach and a short stroll to restaurants, bars and shopping, Friendly and helpful staff and on the circuit bus routes. Fabulous views, The hotel is a bit tired but clean and the bed comfortable.

The crew were awesome, we stayed there 5 nights and 6 days. Although they only do valet parking, it was easy to drop off and receive the car, wouldn't take that long for them to bring it. The pool was awesome, loved how we can borrow towels and chairs if needed and can use it at the beach. The ocean room view was great and the bed was comfy. The shower was fine, the shower head is really low so had to almost do a back flip to wash my hair. If you love the city life, this is a great location to stay in near nightlife, great restaurants, Starbucks and the beach and lots of shopping. Just wish the valet and resort fees weren't so much, almost $500.00 extra for us but we would stay here again.

Our 6-yrs old boy wanted to stay 100 days more. It was very comfortable and joyful vacation. The mandatory resort fee covers wifi, towel, and beach chair. They even provide container and fresh cold water that we could self refill. This saves us the cost of buy drinking water from the market for entire stay. The location is pretty cool, just few steps to the beach, all type of restaurants and markets near by. Taxi and Uber services are so convenient and cheap. Bus station is just next corner. The room is a little outdated, but the most important for us is they have hot strong shower with nice drainage.

Located across the street from the beach. Hotel is older (like all of them on the island) but in very good shape. Room was on the smaller side, but clean and up to date. Shower pressure was 6 out of 10. Had one issue with the door closing, which was remedied quickly. Beach towels and chairs are available for the taking every day. Most tours and trolleys stop in front of the hotel. Pool was clean and enjoyable. Check in and out was a breeze. Great restaurants are an easy walk in all directions.

Our stay was at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was fantastic. The staff, the room, the location all exceeded our expectations. The room was perfect for our needs. The location of the hotel gave us super easy beach access and even gave us a welcoming return from conquering the steps of Diamond Head. It is also a short walk from many of the sights in and around Waikiki Beach.This is where we will stay on our next trip to Oahu!

My mom and I went and stayed at the Aston last year for 5 nights and would absolutely stay there again or at any neighboring properties. It is right across the street from the beach and has a pool with a view of the beach. Our room was facing the beach and had an amazing view of the sunset every night. If you are on the other side of the hotel and cannot see the beach you still have a beautiful view of Diamond head. When we wanted to go to the beach the hotel had sunscreen, chairs and an umbrella available for free, which was really nice for us as we had none coming from out of town. The hotel is also in a very nice spot and in walking distance to get food or coffee. Overall a really great experience for a reasonable price.

This hotel is a clean decent hotel in a good location at the end of the strip of hotels along Waikiki. It is not your high end luxury hotels like a Hilton, or Hyatt or similar, but offers adequate rooms with comfortable beds. They have a unique elevator system which is different than any other we've seen. in the exterior hall of the elevators there is a key pad where you scan your room key, then press the floor you are going to and it will show you on a small screen which elevator to catch. It's a good security system. Once on the elevator, there are no buttons to push, rather it simply takes you to the floor you selected. The rooms are small. The so-called partial ocean view in our room was that if you pressed your nose to the window you could peek at a small view of the ocean, but we did have a nice view of Diamond Head. The one criticism of the furniture is that there was a small high table with two wood benches at the table, but no chair in the room. The rooms would be more comfortable with a chair, otherwise the room was ok and again, nothing fancy. The view overlooking the top of the adjacent hotel was of rusty looking air conditioning systems, but I guess with how close most of the hotels are to one another it's not surprising to see that sort of view.

A very nice hotel with the best view over Waikiki Beach, and close to everything. The pool area was also great, and the guys in the bar and in the reception was very kind. The rooms were fine even though they were not all up to date..

My wife and I stayed at this facility for 7 days and nights and would stay there again. It is across the street from Waikiki Beach, near the Diamond Head en d of the beacxh strip, excellent location for everything because the buses stop directly in front of the hotel. You can go anywhere you want. The hotel itself has excellent amenities- pool, b each towels, cold water, Tiki Bar and restaurant. The rooms are great, well kept, clean, and the staff is wonderful.

Great holiday. 3 weeks of sunshine. Hotel and staff very welcoming and helpful. Lovely room with wonderful views. Will go again. Beach very close great pool area. Restaurants very good. Close to bus stops and local restaurants. Plus right in the heart of Waikiki.

For the past 5 years, our family have been spending our summer vacation in Waikiki and we have been staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach. The first and second year were nice, we enjoyed Aston’s wonderful staff, continental breakfast was provided, a little welcome package at check-in added a nice touch.Fast forward to our third and fourth years, continental breakfast stopped, but we could still enjoy their free DVDs and daily newspapers. Then comes August 2019, I was told there won’t be any daily newspapers and free DVDs are no longer offered. Im told hotel is under “new management”, hence the changes or should I say, the elimination of some basic accommodations. I paid over $40 per day ($39 plus tax) for resort fee which is supposed to come with two logo water pouches and some other miscellaneous things that are irrelevant and needless. As pathetic as they sound, I still didn’t receive the water pouches!They did some repainting in the rooms and it didn’t really do anything to improve the look, the repainting job actually makes the place appears washed out. The in-room safe keeps malfunctioning and each time we had to have maintenance come to fix it; it took approximately 30 minutes each time they come. In total, I was stuck in my room while they were fixing the safe and lost my vacation time because of the malfunctioned safe!After 5 years, I have never received a thank you for being a regular customer, yet everything is being eliminated to cut cost and I feel like this place is turning into a cheap dingy motel.Sadly to say, this will be our last year staying at the Aston. I can move next door to the Marriott and I know it cannot be as bad as this Aston!

We stayed at the hotel for five nights and had a great stay. The room was clean and very spacious, and included a fridge which was great for keeping water bottles chilled in the hot weather. The hotel is in a great location, right on the main strip and across the road from the beautiful beach. We checked in fairly late and the staff were very helpful. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant and that was very nice as well. We paid for a partial ocean view room, which is exactly what we got and whilst it was nice, if you can afford it I would definitely upgrade to the ocean view. The partial view was amazing so I can only imagine how good the full ocean view would be. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

This hotel is in an excellent location right across from the main beach and very central to everything. The rooms are pretty spacious and clean, also the staff are very accommodating and will attend to anything you need. The bed was really comfortable. I had an ocean room on the 19th floor highly recommend an ocean view room. I would stay here again.
user_name:
Raimondo C
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Location great, access to transport great, walking distance to shops and market places great. Staff very helpful. Access to the beach, plenty of eating options could not ask for more. Thoroughly enjoyable.

Upon arrival we asked for a cheeky upgrade because it was our honeymoon & we were so grateful we did. The upgrade was well worth paying extra. We stayed in rooms 1731 for 4 nights which overlooked the sea & had a comfortable balcony. Such lovely views. The hotel room itself was clean, tidy and decent size. Massive beds which is great & working air con. Dino was very helpful & tried his best to get my driving license over to the Big Island when we left Aston, it was fantastic that he cared enough to try get it over to us! So thank you! Once we’d visited a couple of the other islands we then came back to Aston & again were upgraded for our final 2 nights into room 1933 (this time for free!). What a fantastic view of the sea. On a Friday night, we were able to see the fireworks. Great location (good for Pearl Harbour, Diamond Head, the beach, shops, Hanauma Bay and much more), helpful staff and nice hotel. Really happy with our 6 nights here. An amazing honeymoon.

This hotel is perfect;y positioned at the quieter end of the beach strip, it is easy access to the swim beach and has a sea wall protecting the swim area from waves for children and weaker swimmers. The building is older older build but kept in impeccable clean condition. The staff are very attentive and it is close to all amenities and services. It is a short stroll to the shopping strip which is welcomed as we were away from the major hustle and bustle. I would highly recommend this hotel to families as it great value for money.

I really enjoyed my stay here. I’ve stayed in various places in Waikiki, but this is my favourite hotel which I keep returning to. From check in, the staff were really friendly and helpful making me feel at home, especially Joanne Daoang at the front desk who made me feel very valued. My room had a wonderful view over the beach, which I could not get enough of. The room was cleaned each day and was comfortable. The pool area was great, again with great views of the beach. I look forward to returning in the future and would recommend this hotel.

The room was gross. Period. Kudos for having a great location, but there are a ton of hotels in the area that have equally great locations and I'm pretty sure provide a better room. In addition, we paid for an ocean view, but got what I would call a partial ocean view. You could see the ocean if you went outside on the balcony, but not from in the room. Service was ok. Daily housekeeping was a little spotty. Our room was skipped more than once. Elevators are super slow. AC in the room wasn't great. It was set pretty high when we arrived (which is fine. Save some energy, I get it...) and we tried to lower it to a more reasonable temp and it literally took 2 days for it to get to that temp (like 72/73). And you had to keep the curtains closed. If we let the sun it, it couldn't keep up and the temp would go up to 75/76.TV was also super frustrating. The remote didn't work very well, it had one of the old scrolling guides, signal was really spotty, and the guide wasn't even accurate half the time! So in the evening, when we wanted to wind down, we always ended up watching on an iPad. So saved by the free wifi.

My family and I stayed here for a week on our first visit to Hawaii. This location was the perfect place: close to a beach, walking distance from tons of eating options/ shopping and only a short drive away from incredible hikes!

Our family had a nice stay for a week of touring, hiking and beach . The Aston was convenient and in the middle of all the beach, restaurant, and shopping areas. The pool & bar area a nice place to hang out. Our maids did a great job daily on our room, and the valet parking guys were very helpful and on the ball when we called, especially Bartz!!Our only disappointment was their inability to give us a late checkout time on our last day, after we were told it was a possibility.Anyway is was a reasonable beach option in a very expensive beach front area of Waikiki.

Just got back from a week here. I stayed here a few years ago when the hotel had been beautifully decorated in a vintage Hawaiian style that was very colorful and modern. It was disappointing to see that everything had been painted beige. It looked like the hotel was trying to achieve what they thought was an upscale look, when in actuality now because it hasn't been completely redone, it's left with a mishmash look that's neither upscale or charming like the original vintage Hawaiian look. Also more shade and landscaping around the pool would go a long way. Virtually all of the hotel guests sought out the shady bits, leaving the exposed lounge chairs unused. Much could be done to improve the check in process to make it a bit more humane. How about a complimentary drink and a place to sit while you work it out on an iPad? I spent a lot of time imagining how this hotel could be improved!The maid service is very good and the staff working here is a nice group of people, but don't expect any information on Hawaiian activities or interests outside of the basic tourist brochures. Case in point - I had booked a group tour for the Doris Duke Shangri La House tour. You have to take a shuttle to the Honolulu Museum to get there and not one person had any idea of what I was talking about regarding either the tour or how to get the shuttle to the museum. Ironically there was a sign right in front of the hotel that had the museum name & logo indicating the bus stop!Overall this place needs work. The best thing about the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is the proximity to the great beach right across the street and the fact that it's on the end of the strip away from all the malls, giving it a more relaxed feel.I guess you are saving a bit when compared to other places right on the beach in Waikiki.

This hotel is fine. Not expensive, so don't expect lux. The one thing I have to criticize, which can be easily dealt with, is that theres not enough shade around the pool. Not enough umbrellas, and no planted trees. How easy would it be to fix this?! The whole week I stayed here, I saw people clamoring for a shady spot around the pool, to no avail. I had no option but to sneak into other hotel pools that had some shade around them. Would have been nice if I could have stayed put at my own hotel and had a seat under an umbrella. That being said, everything else was decent. The view from our room was lovely, and the maid service was superior, they were really sweet, and on it, everyday. On another sad note: across the street at the beach, I witnessed a drowning, or near drowning the evening of Aug. 14th. It was horrifying, I can't stop thinking about it. Does anyone out there have any information about this sad episode? I asked everyone, including the lifeguard on duty the following day, no one has any info., and I can't find anything out on the net.

I live here in Honolulu, but as residents, we tend to take Waikiki for granted. It's so beautiful and this hotel is positioned right across from Kuhio Beach. You have a fairly calm area for the young ones or those that don't like waves crashing into their face, then just a few steps over you have an area for those that enjoy waves. Plus, you have "the wall" which is my son's favorite, he likes to jump off it and into the ocean. Our oceanfront room had a perfect view of everything mentioned above. Firm mattress, complimentary reusable water containers, which came in handy, and the staff if great here, all of them were very kind. A special thanks to Trisha who checked us in, and thank you again for the extra pillows :) sorry I didn't get to thank you again in person, but I'm almost certain we'll be back. We were celebrating my son's 11th birthday with a staycation and after this trip, my son is really missing our room at the Aston.

Hotel staff were so incredibly nice. Margie was out maid; she was SO kind and seemed upbeat. The janitorial staff we encountered were also incredibly helpful and friendly. We felt safe and welcome here. Had a pleasant experience from Wolfgang Puck Express’ staff downstairs, too; food was average and the staff were always nice. Our waiters at Tiki’s were also nice, but the food was “meh” for the price we paid. Hotel rooms were average. Bathrooms seemed a little out-of-date. However, everything was always clean and neat.
