We booked several tours through the hotel and I feel like they were honest and fair with their pricing. Jacob was incredibly helpful and gave great advice. The view was also amazing.

Our first time staying here. I emailed guest services to let them know that we booked a reservation for our 12th anniversary. Teresa replied and mentioned that she would note that on the account. When we checked-in, we were offered a better ocean view room at an additional $10 per night and we were given a bottle of sparkling cider. The front desk staff was great! We happily accepted and stayed on the 12th floor, room 1219. The view was very nice to wake up to every morning. We stayed in a standard size room. The bathroom was a bit small for two people, but we managed. We liked that it came with a mini refrigerator for our beverages.We were given 10 vouchers to use at the Wolfgang Puck Express restaurant on the first floor. The food was pretty good and the staff was great! We used the vouchers for breakfast, lunch, or dinner during our stay. The bacon cheeseburger and fries was pretty good.The location of the hotel is the best part of staying here. Yes, they have a swimming pool, but we were literally across the street from Waikiki Beach, the main reason why you visit Hawaii and that's to go to the beach! If you go down to the third floor of the hotel, the same location of the pool, you are allowed to take towels with you and sign out for beach chairs as long as you return them. There's a Starbucks around the corner from the hotel, several ABC stores, lots of shopping and the zoo is a block away as well. If you rent a car like we did, I recommend parking it by the zoo. There's a parking lot there and the rate is $1.50/hr opposed to $45 valet parking at the hotel. It's also free to park at the metered spots on the street from 10 pm - 6 am.We will definitely stay here again on one of our future visits to the island. Thank you Aston Waikiki for a wonderful stay!

Terrific location right across the road from the beach. Hotel pool very small, not enough umbrellas around the pool. Rooms however are in dire need of a makeover/refurbish.The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Great customer service (especially Jin at the front desk ) all the staff were so friendly. Hope we can stay here again ! Even the food at tikis and Wolfgang puck express was great and the price was fair too. Also close to everything, the beach, Starbucks, the zoo and so much more!!!

Aloha! First of all, let me say LOCATION ROCKS! We always stay on the south end of Oahu as we have access to everything and choose if we want to go to more busy areas of Waikiki. We have stayed twice at the Marriott next door and while the Aston is not the Marriott, it is a very good option. Pros-views are absolutely amazing with the beach across the street. Fill your free pouch from the concession area with ice cold water with fresh fruit in the lobby refilled regularly throughout the day. Tiki Bar was ok, not as fun as remembered but views remain amazing, live music always a plus. Would love more bar food options. Free beach chairs/towels. "Interesting" card activated elevators. Check-in was fast. Good selection of restaurants and stores near to accommodate everyone-PLEASE try the small cafe directly on the beach-they have some of the best, reasonably priced food in the area! Cons-room was outdated, chairs on patio were old and didn't match. The sink in bathroom would not shut off. Bathrooms are small and floors definitely need updating...NO MICROWAVE IN THE ROOMS-u have to go to the lobby to use a microwave (maybe that is not a big deal for everyone but when you pay as much for food as you do, it would be nice to be able to heat it up in your room). Lastly, customer service by desk staff, housekeepers, concession staff, concierge, basically everyone that we interacted with was excellent. Overall, we very much enjoyed our vacation. Mahalo to your staff for a wonderful stay!

I have stayed at this place before and thought value for money it is fabulous. We had a lovely partial beach view room with two large queen beds as we were friends travelling. Staff were exceptional, the room very clean and great linen. Not a massive pool but certainly big enough and you just walk across the road to Waikiki Beach and around the corner to a fabulous French cafe for good coffee or go downstairs to Starbucks

We booked an ocean front room with club access to the Coconut Club on the 21st floor. Between the view and the club I think the upgrade was worth it. The Coconut Club serves a limited breakfast (no eggs or meat but very good breads, fruit, oatmeal, etc.) and pulled pork and great wings every evening. Right after we got to our room we got a text from the front desk asking how everything was. I replied that we had a minor issue with the room they gave us and they immediately asked that I come to the front desk to speak with the manager. Dino went above and beyond and made everything right!My only negative is about the concierge. We soon found out that many if not most of the people at the desk are time-share reps. If you ask about a helicopter tour they'll offer you a two-for-one but of course you need to sit through a presentation. It seems that anyone in a dark blue shirt is an actual concierge while the ones in the light blue shirts are time share reps. If I asked them about something that they don't have an offer for, they'd tell me they couldn't help me and referred me to the one on the dark blue shirt. This was very frustrating after waiting in line.All in all, we did love this hotel and would definitely return and recommend it.

Great hotel and reasonably priced given its right on the beach front!! Good clean rooms.When we looked at our room we asked if they had another as wanted king bed.Reception gave us a key to look at another room which we chose..very nice if them.Room cleaned and tidied every day! Lovely pool area and Tikis bar right there!! They give you towels free of charge to take to pool or the beach! Bus stops are right outside too, so very handy.Air con in room worked well and not super noisy like some.Overall, really good, would definitely stay again!

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is a suitable property for a getaway to Honolulu. It is not going to blow you out of the water with anything it offers. It is standard stuff that reflects the relatively lower price you are paying. We upgraded our room to a suite and were told it would be a full ocean view. If I am being honest, it was not a full ocean view. It was as full ocean view as you can get for being on the side. It was still a great view though, just not what we were told it would be. The room was dated, but cleaned everyday. The TV offered a selection of channels common to most hotels, again, nothing special. The hotel was clean and we never felt uncomfortable during our time there. Ultimately we enjoyed our stay there and it let us save a few dollars. Looking back though, as we were on our honeymoon, I wish I had spent the extra money to go somewhere a bit nicer, that had something special to offer for a special life event for my wife and I. When looking at the Aston Waikiki, trust that the staff is nice enough and the area is clean, but keep in mind you are getting exactly what you pay for. A budget hotel for a budget price.

Stayed at the Aston for a week for a girls trip. We had a great room with an amazing view. Our outlet in the bathroom wasn’t working properly and after having maintenance to our room multiple times as well speaking to the manger they blamed it on our straightener.. which wasn’t the problem because it was their blow dryer that was blower the circuit. Our room attendant, Remy was an absolute delight!!! She was so sweet and always made sure we had extra towels. When she was off for the weekend it’s was very obvious that she wasn’t the one taking care of our room and was very missed.

well I am writing this review and rating this hotel 9.5/10why yes the furniture was dated but we were their in our room 1% of the timethe view from our ocean view room was out of this world and worth every centthis was our 3rd time to Honolulu but first time at the Aston Waikiki beach hotelafter a long flight and landing in early morning were tired we spoke to Joanne at the front desk and had our room ready by midday not the usual 3pm and was very helpfulwe had no problems with Check inour room was maintained clean cleaned every day it was spotless and big thankyou to Nora for doing thiswill stay in this hotel on our next visit to Hawaiicentral location to everything you need

This was our 3rd trip to Oahu and first time staying at this hotel. It was me, my husband and 13-year-old daughter. We booked this hotel based on the location and price. Price was great for the location, which cannot be beat. It is at the end of Waikiki near Diamond Head, right by the zoo. And right across from the beach and a park. The only drawback was the ocean across the street has a big wall which doesn't allow for much swimming - so we walked about a block down the beach where the wall stopped and my daughter was able to swim. It's beautiful and she could basically snorkle and see lots of fish right there. Beach is crowded because it's public beach access but it wasn't terrible. The only other negative thing to our stay was that there was a ton of construction going on in front of the hotel - the sidewalks are blocked off, so walking was a pain and got too crowded and noisy due to the construction. The hotel itself is quite nice. Nothing fancy, the rooms are well appointed and clean but not very big. We did not really have a balcony, more of a tiny, narrow ledge. But it suited our needs because we didn't come to Hawaii to hang out in the room or the hotel! The pool area is very nice - lots of seating and umbrellas and I love that they have towels and beach chairs you can rent for free each day. They also have water available as well as good sunscreen. One afternoon, they came by with pineapple shaved ice for everyone, free of charge. There are also game areas with large Connect 4 and large Jenga, which was fun. We played those while waiting to eat dinner one night at Tiki's. We have eaten there before and we love that restaurant. Other than Tikis there is not another hotel restaurant, although there are quite a few options right downstairs - Wolfgang Puck, a smoothie place, cookie place and Subway.We liked the smoothie place for breakfast as they had breakfast bowls but did try Wolfgang Pucks one morning - it was overpriced but OK but did have a nice area to eat outdoors.There is a covered area with lots of seating where we'd eat some mornings and it's also where you wait for buses for tours and airport transportation. There's a small gift shop as well.We had a nice stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone looking for budget-friendly but still nice place to stay in Hawaii. As long as you're not looking to hang out all day at the hotel, this hotel is perfect as homebase while touring all there is to see in beautiful Hawaii.

We stayed here having booked quite late. The check in was awesome, we arrived at 10 00, five hours ahead of normal check in and were able to get into the room straight away. Having flown through the night this was just what we needed, thank you to Gina who checked us in.The location is awesome- right across the road from the beach. As many towels as wanted could be taken for the beach or pool.The room was ok, beds very comfortable and clean but the whole place does need a face lift, its quite tired.We were on the 19th floor but the street noise was still loud, sound proofing needs to be considered.We had the coconut club as part of our package and this was really good, breakfast was more than adequate and the snacks in the afternoon were great. A lovely lady called Pilar was there in the coconut club every morning during the week and she never stopped working keeping the place immaculate.We ate at the Tiki restaurant in the hotel one night and the meal was excellent.The parking fee at $45.00, we thought, was very expensive and taking advantage of the fact that you have no choice but to pay it.

The room itself is nice, a little tight for 5 to be comfortable, but I would book here again. Proximity to the beach is across the street which is nice. There's an ABC Store 2 minutes walking distance in every direction for convenience. I will say, I'm not the biggest fan of the fact that maintenance isn't until around 4pm, however the housekeeping staff is quick & efficient. The best part of my stay has to be the great staff working in the Coconut Club! Pilar and Mia who work breakfast are an absolute pleasure and always greeted us with a smile, and the man in the afternoon making the mocktails is incredibly kind and has his customer service skills on point!

Hotel location is a few steps from Waikiki beach.Enjoyed the ever changing ocean views from our balcony.Room clean and well maintained, room did show signs of old age.Tolley bus stop outside hotel was a bonus. We found great restaurants in walking distance along with affordable options.Had a wonderful time at Aston Waikiki Beach will be back.Staff friendly and helpful.

Never again …. luckily we were only stay here less than 12 hours before we flew home. Check in was terrible, so many people and 2 staff on. The room was old and needed a good overhaul. There was a terrible piercing noise in our room and when the maintenance guy came up it turned out it was the toilet. He fixed it for a couple of hours and then it went all night ! I also paid the extra for a club room and by the time we checked in we were ready for a drink, can you believe they do not serve any alcohol in their club room ?? Maybe it should have been rename a kids room. I have travelled all around the world and never have I been to a club room without alcohol. We walked straight out in disgust. I complained to the manger as it was advertised when I booked that there was alcohol but apparently they changed there policy a couple of weeks before we arrived. I said it was terrible and maybe they should have contacted everyone who had paid for a club room the option to remove it from their room. Not worth the extra money... we ended up going downstairs to the bar and paying for our drinks. The manager offered me a $30 refund, big deal but I never even received that. Not one good thing to say about this hotel and definitely would not recommend staying here. Luckily for us it was only for 1 night as we had stayed 2 weeks elsewhere and had a wonderful stay.

Terrific location, not a typical Hawaii hotel. Mostly tourists with buffet lines and vouchers for guests. Nice public spaces, good for families, but a big property that is quite the opposite of a boutique property if a visitor is seeking something small an intimate.

We had such a beautiful experience at this hotel! The location was incredible .. just a few steps away from the beach and the shops. We opted to add the Coconut Club daily buffet and it really saved us money in our dining costs. The food was incredible and the view...well, you'll have to see for yourself. It's well worth the price. Trust me!! I also have to say that one of their employees, Nora, was so inviting. She was our service waitress while we were in the Coconut Club and my goodness, she is amazing!! She brought so much good energy to the experience. We loved her!!

Not updated at all. Rooms AC is broken. Bathrooms are musty and dirty. Pictures shown are nothing like the hotel. Spend the extra money, stay somewhere and enjoy your vacation. Would not recommend....

My partner and I stayed at the Aston for a week from 24 June. Had to call housekeeping twice as they hadn’t made up our room while we were out on 2 separate days. Housekeeper seemed very put out by having to do so. Another day we came back to a made up room but towels were dirty with brown spots. Otherwise a very pleasant stay.

After reading too many reviews we took the plunge.Location 10 stars Across the pad from the beach great for kids and familiesStaff 10 starsFriendly helpfulCheckin queue ran smoothly and quicklyFoodLove the tiki barRoomsCould use an upgrade but you don’t spend much time in your roomClean Worth paying for the oceanfront 10 starsCoconut clubWas sceptical but 10/10 simple breakfast but enough choiceLoved the pre dinner snacks again pleasAntly surprisedPoolGood size Would def recommendSecond stay last one being 13 years ago but def will return

Although this hotel needs some updating, it is located directly from Waikiki Beach, which is a great location. The Honolulu Zoo is literally around the corner and there is plenty of shopping and several restaurants within walking distance so you will not be disappointed. The line for check-in was long, but the wait was not. If you really want to put in the exercise, you can walk to Diamond Head Crater Trail from here, but we opt to take an Uber (the #2 bus is also and option). There is a Denny's around the corner (if you want something familiar for breakfast) as well as, a Pancake House within walking distance. For your convenience, you are able to rent towels and chairs for the beach. The only reason for the 4 star was because the concierge did not really help us. When we asked for shuttle info or excursions, they gave us little info unless we sat for one of their informationals about timeshares so we did not consult with them anymore during our stay. I recommend this hotel.

Room was clean with a nice view, , it would be nice if there was a microwave, Tiki bar had great food but the beer wasnt cold, live music everynight. beach has a breakwall that makes it safe for kids to swim
user_name:
Ted W
port hueneme, Ca, United States

review_body: Great hotel right on the beach front, get the room with a view, its such a special site to wake up to every morning.Staff helpful and the tiki bar was fun. Great pool and use of towels. We loved the idea of the free water pouches and had so many comments about them.Safe area and accessible to all the excursions and trolley tours.Thanks!

Like I said 3.75 stars, the rooms are smallish and a lil outdated. The location is great, very safe area, safe hotel. Pool on the biggish side for Waikiki. Plenty of chairs, area, and rinse of showers for their pool.  Check in was just ok, the pool towels are good, u check em out and sign em out. The elevators take a lil getting used to. U have to scan ur room key and then push ur level and then it instructs u to get it a specific elevator. The rooms are small and so is the balcony, but the views r great. Beds seem small, tv is smallish, small safe in closet, bathrooms are clean but small. 4 people in a 2 queen room is just to tight. I would totally recommend this hotel for maybe a couple with small kids or just a couple. Check out this view

The best part of this hotel was the location. Next best was the hotel Tiki restaurant & bar, the staff & food here was fabulous. Our room was second grade, check in reception staff abrupt, unpleasant and were required to stand in a long queue in hot sunshine waiting to be processed. Would look for better accommodation on next visit, this place is over charging for what they offer especially $39 US resort fee.

The only good thing about this property was the tiki bar restaurant. We had three rooms and no air conditioning for any of them. We ended up refunding one of the rooms. The property is across the street from the beach. Old decor-not good.

This hotel is great in some ways and really bad in others. The hotel has a 5 star view, 2 star accommodations and 1 star bathroom. The bathroom floor was disgusting. The sink was hard to shut off and it took 10 minutes of holding the handle to flush the toilet. There was no ventilation in the bathroom so taking a should was brutally hot. The blow dryer would not event begin to dry my hair. The room was cleaned sometimes and you never knew what you would find. Sometimes we got coffee, sometimes not. Sometimes we got towels...etc. The pillows were so hard you could not sleep on them. My neck is still sore. The view was great. Our room was ocean front and for what we paid, we should have chosen a better hotel. Parking is ridiculous. $45 a day and only valet! Down the street we parked at the Banyon Hotel for $80 for the week. Well worth the short walk. The elevator was like something out of a horror movie. I am sorry to say, I would not recommend this hotel.

My stay here was great. Very friendly staff that helped me through my vacation. The hotel is conveniently located close to the zoo and aquarium, plus right across the beach. Everything is in walking distance which helped us do more in a day. Rooms are cozy and well kept. When I needed room service cleaning they responded quickly. Elevators can be a bit confusing at first but you get the hang of it. Beach towels and chairs are rented free. Just be sure to return them. Overall great stay, I'd definitely stay again.

My stay at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was hit and miss. Partial ocean view room had a view of next door building and I was overcharged resort fees twice. According to the hotel I have never paid it, and according to my booking agent I have.The hotel ignoring my emails in regards to refund for 2 weeks now, I would not recommend dealing with them to anybody, check and print your bookings twice and be prepared to wait long time for check in, no big towels available for the beach and you can not put a chair to your balcony because it will not fit ( see my photos).Also you can not open balcony door fully, only as much as it showed on the photo.On a bright side housekeeping did an excellent job, my room was always very clean, had no issues with wifi either. I am very disappointed with my stay, especially because of the hotel ignoring mine and my agent emails for 2 weeks now, I will not stay there ever again, hope they will use my money to improve their “resort services” that do not exist anyway.

Aloha. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is beachfront down the zoo end of Waikiki across the road from Kuhio Beach and it’s a pleasant 10 minute walk to the centre of the strip. Location, location, location. There is a trolley stop and tour bus pick up /drop off just near the concierge desk. It was a short walk to Kuhio Avenue to get The Bus.Just got home from my second visit to Oahu and my second stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. They kindly gave us a 20% discount as returning customers. I requested and was given the same room as last time on the 10th floor in a premier oceanfront room which was a pleasant surprise as I did not really expect it. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable as last time. The view from the full lanai (witch had two chairs) was stunning as I had remembered it. Many a morning and night it was well utilised to watch the sunsets, fireworks and two different parades for King Kamehameha and the Pan Pacific Festival or to just chill.There is a small fridge and Keurig coffee machine in the room that was well used. They give you two free coffee pods every day. The toiletries were good quality however there was no shower cap so I would advise you to take one as I did. There is a safe, a hairdryer and an iron with ironing board and two bathrobes for use. The room was serviced every day and supplies were replenished. We left housekeeping a few dollars tip each day as I imagine it is back breaking work. We always left the room clean and tidy for her. The wifi was brilliant. Never an issue. Same with the in room air conditioning. There was an ice machine on our floor which was handy to refill our drink bottles with iced water before going out exploring.We used the pool area to cool down after a day out touring which was quick and refreshing along with a cocktail from Tiki’s bar. Economical too if you go during happy hour (s). You can’t charge to your room so you will need some cash. You can sign out pool towels and beach chairs to use outside of the hotel without cost. With the beach across the road this was very handy.One of the stand out aspects of this hotel is the staff. Sean on the front desk was friendly, professional and informative as we arrived after our long flight and he got us into our room within minutes. Mercy the room attendant was unobtrusive, thorough, and always greeting us with a smile and aloha (as did every staff member we came across). The lifts have a unique system which I think work very well. You punch in your room number and scan your door card and you are directed to a particular lift. This is a good safety feature. It seems to group floors together. That is, floor 10 and over, levels one and three etc.One day, we got the hotel shuttle to Waikele outlets for $16 each return. They had various pick up and drop off times. We had used their Pearl Harbour shuttle the visit before. Anyway, I accidently left a perfume package in the shuttle. I had so many bags that day! The kind concierge organised for it to be dropped off the next day. I didn’t get his name however I would like to thank him very much.This was a no frills kind of place however I believe the Coconut Club has just been launched which would suit some people.Thank you Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for another wonderful stay. Your staff are a credit to your organisation. I will be back. Mahalo.

When we arrived at level 1 and it was crowded and basic looking, I wondered if our booking was a big mistake. However our room was well very equipped and comfortable with a fabulous view and the staff were very friendly and helpful. E.g. the room only has a coffee machine, so I phoned housekeeping and a kettle was delivered within 5 minutes.This hotel is not flashy but it's good value and well served by restaurants another shops nearby and the waikiki trolley stops right outside the door. I do think the $39/day resort fee is too high for what you get.

I have stayed here twice a year for over a decade and have watched the prices go up as the services go down...No more buffet breakfasts, parking and resort fees have doubled, live music at the Tiki Bar was inconsistent as compared to the past...The Staff were friendly and my room was always cleaned daily but with the double the costs in fees it is no longer the great deal it used to be...At my last check in, the Receptionist had no idea I had stayed there before, she said there were new Owners and the records were purged, after 20 visits over a decade I can see they have no concern about repeat cliental...Time to explore other Hotels to find a better value...

This property is on the south end of Waikiki, toward the end of the hustle and bustle of the strip. Convenient to walk to most shops and restaurants in Waikiki and will be a reasonable walk to Diamond Head once the west entrance opens. We didn't take advantage of the pool or other commons areas, but we paid a hefty resort fee for them. The room was comfortable, though the elevator system is a pain, especially when crowds are light. Oh, and there are several desks of agents selling tours of the area; don't make eye contact.

My husband went here for my 50th Birthday. We booked this resort through Costco Travel. Our trip was June 6-June 11th, 5 nights. Room was very clean, but the hotel is dated. Meaning older....their was still carpet in the room and the tile was older not as modern. However room was clean, sheets, were clean. Safe in the closet..Refrigerator in the room and it had a high top table and two stools. On the last day before I left when I sat on the stool and got up to get something and sat back down stool collapsed and broke with me on it. Their was a report done and they replaced the stool.

Great location and so close to the beach you could almost touch it. The rooms are fairly basic but again location is the key. We have visited this place 7 times and have spent 5 of them here.They offer chair and towels that you can take over to the beach.

Great location, beach is just a cross of road away. Beautiful view of sunsets. Very clean, very friendly staff. Nice little bar with beautiful view. Little restaurant on first floor also good and quick, friendly service.

I stayed here with my husband for 7 nights. We had been put in a room with 2 double beds, we asked to be moved to another room with 1 king size bed instead. The staff were happy to do this - which we appreciated. The hotel could do with a pretty big upgrade (the whole place is rather dated) including new beds in our opinion (from the 2 rooms we stayed in as they were quite springy). The staff were friendly and we enjoyed the pool and the view from our room was lovely. I think the resort fees are quite steep for what you get, however I understand this is standard in this area. Overall the stay was fine. I hope this feedback helps, thanks.

We waited in line over 30 minutes to get to the reception desk and then it took another 30 minutes to process our reservation. Terrible!! Although we had booked 4 rooms for the family, they didn’t want to issue all of them until everyone was here. We refused to wait another half hour
user_name:
Mary C
Island of Hawaii, Hawaii

review_body: This hotel was our go to accomodation but we won't be staying here anymore. It is obvious that profit before service is their motivation & the staff couldn't be less interested. The rooms are old & worn, the bathrooms are dated & all tiles are cracked & dirty. Each time we have come here they have removed more & more services yet you pay premium price for a room (plus tax) then pay $39.00 resort tax (plus tax) per day & then $45.00 car park tax (plus tax) per day. When we booked & paid in full the resort tax was $35.00 & they even tried to charge the difference on check out. Hawaii is definitely taxing the tourist out of existence!

Stayed here with my family of 7. We had partial ocean view rooms with great views of Diamond Head. Balcony very small but it did the job. Nice pool and great amenities like beach chairs and towels to take with you to the beach directly across the street. This place is in the south end of Waikiki so you will find less expensive dining options nearby than if you were in the heart of the city. Close to bus stops and shopping and just a short walk to the heart of Waikiki. Would stay here again.

Return visit after 2 years. Still an excellent location to stay, but does needs some freshening up. We tried the "Coconut Club" for a day (as I am a member of another hotels club room), the breakfast was very nice as was the room and the view with great staff, the let down was the "mocktails" for the sunset drinks - so not worth the fee payed. Would still be my first choice to look at next time i visit.

Absolutely N1 hotel. Very good service,good price and very clean hotel room, amazing view .the hotel on the beach, they have a restaurant tikis grill&bar the food amazing you need to try .Huge recommendation Aston Waikiki beach Hotel

This was my 2nd stay at this hotel, my first stay was in 2012. It is obvious absolutely nothing has changed in 7 years in regards to hotel upkeep. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is in dire need of renovations. The mattresses on the beds, sofa beds & furniture in the lobby all desperately need replaced. The bathrooms need new tile, room carpet is dirty & tired. Loungers around the pool need replaced. We had a junior suite (room 2028) with 4 people. This room has ample space for 4 people and a stunning ocean view. We were only given 3 towels & 2 coffee cups each day. We had to call housekeeping every day to ask for additional items to accommodate 4 people, which was frustrating day after day (despite tipping $5 each day). The hotel no longer offers a complimentary continental breakfast. There is a “club level” which you can opt in to (for a high daily fee) which provides a continental breakfast & snacks each evening. This is the first “club level” I have experienced that only offers “mocktails” in the evenings. If cocktails were included the club option would be much more worthwhile & attractive. The line at the front desk was always long & slow. The best aspect regarding Aston is the location & ocean views. I hesitate to recommend staying at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel until they invest in renovations & remodel the entire hotel.

Very comfortable clean room with fantastic view of Ocean quiet considering enormous number of rooms 25th floor room. 2 very comfortable Double beds not ideal but manageable. Great facilities, restaurant beautiful, take away restaurant good prices. Staff very friendly and helpful. Easy access to main esplanade and walking distance to everything. Across the road to Ocean swimming beach.

Having an affordable ocean front room was one of the main reasons for booking this hotel. The room was very large and clean. I am still in awe of the spectacular view. Very convenient to walk to everything we needed. We enjoyed a nice dinner and ice cold beer in the restaurant onsite too. We arrived early and checked out late and were able to store our bags in a secure location. All the staff were very friendly and I would definitely stay here again.

We arrived at 4pm, check-in is 3pm. Our room wasn't ready and we were left waiting until 5pm. Finally someone with some initiative turned up to Reception and offered us another room. No compensation offered for the unacceptable delay. To make matters worse, we had been emailing them about an offer on their website for half price resort fees. These are a ridiculous $40USD per day. We booked within the specified time, stayed within the specified time but they said it was only available for online bookings. This was NOT stated on the website. If you happen to have a car they charge you another $20USD for parking! This place is a rip-off. The resort fee is to cover basics provided by every hotel plus 10% discount from the over-priced hotel shops, pool games (a board with a hole in it to throw a small bean-bag through) and pool treats (I only received one crushed ice drink in a small plastic cup in 5 days). The location is not bad but everything else is well below average for this priced hotel. The reception desk is on the 3rd floor by the pool, but nothing on the ground floor tells you this. The staff are not friendly either. We have stayed in Honolulu 5 times and this is by far the worst value accommodation we have ever had. We will never stay here again.

​The Aston Waikiki has its pluses and minuses. Its location is top notch being in the center of Waikiki with a gorgeous beach right across the street. Check in and check out can be time-consuming with a significant wait in a long line, though the bellhops in reception quickly took our bags and secured them in storage until our room was ready. In general, the room supplies were on the stingy side with only 2 sets of towels, 2 K cups of coffee, and 2 styrofoam cups in a room with 2 beds intended for 4 people. Their elevators drove us nuts! You must swipe your key card then enter your floor and it then tells you which elevator to take. There is no indicator light to let you know if the elevator is going up or down and you can't select a floor inside the elevator at all so if it misses your floor you must exit the elevator and start over again. The restaurant, Tiki Bar and Grill, was top notch and we enjoyed several meals there. Would I stay here again? Probably. As far as Waikiki hotels go it's a good value in a good location though be forewarned, the room rate does not include a mandatory $39 per night "resort fee" which sadly seems to be popping up in a lot of hotels.

My family has stayed at Aston a few times now, we love it! Great location, wonderful staff. We tried the Coconut Club this time, which offers breakfast and snacks throughout the day, and drinks! Thank you Glenn in front desk for recommending it and checking us into a room with a BEAUTIFUL view! The staff at the coconut club were also great- Pilar, Leo, and the bartenders were very hospitable. We will come back here every time.

The Front Office Manager, Gina Reeves really helped make our wedding and honeymoon a cherished, memorable experience! Originally I had booked an ocean view room, but Gina found an available upgrade to and ocean front room which was more than spectacular! She was truly welcoming and a delight to speak with regarding any questions about the hotel amenities or our stay in Honolulu! Thanks again Gina sooo much! Looking forward to our next stay, Aloha Albert and Cesar!!!

When we checked into our hotel room we found that there were no chairs in the room just a small table with bar stool seating. Pool opened and closed late and early. The pool was closed due to someone having an accident in the pool. Staff did not tell us there were beach chairs and towels for check out. You will be accosted by vendors on the first level of the hotel to try to set up tours for you. We did do a luau through them but we had to agree to do a time share presentation to get it at a good price!Maid service was great and your room will be done typically just after 1 in the afternoon.

Plenty of space in bedroom,tiny bathroom..very small balcony,no room for chairs,standing room only..Very noisy outside window,large turbo air conditioning fans on building next door..still hear it on the 15th floor.39 American dollars charged each day to service room...did not use pool etc as we were there to see Hawaii and went on tours...

Great location, opposite the beach within walking distance to the heart of Waikiki.The staff were very friendly and were a great help in advising us about transport and buses as we did not have a car. We were able to find our way around very easily, the buses stopped outside the hotel as well as the tour buses for the tours we did.The bus to Pearl Harbour and the Outlets stop here as well. There were some renovations going on at the hotel next door which were a bit noisy early in the morning. This was the only negative.There is a great bar on the upper level, restaurants,and outdoor pool.We were happy with our room, really enjoyed the partial ocean view on our lanai, nice at sunset with a glass of wine in hand.Would stay here again.

Had a fabulous time! The staff was lovely and the views were amazing! Will come back every time! This has been my fifth stay with them and I completely plan on staying there again. Very clean! Aloha!!

We just returned from a 9 day vacation where we stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Great location right across the street from the beach. Walking distance for a lot of places like the zoo, shops and restaurants. Staff was more then eager to help with things. Pivar in the coconut club was so nice. She always had a smile on her face. The only reasons I didn’t give a 5 star was there were issues with the outlet next to the bed. We. Didn’t use it because we just were not sure. Another reason on the 3rd floor the people who book excursions and tours were very pushy. The booth on the first floor were not like this at all Over all very good stay. We will definitely stay here again.

Unfortunately I only stayed here for one night when on my trip to Hawaii. But, it was such an excellent hotel I would stay here again.The front desk staff is great. I want to make a special mention to Sean who was at the desk when I checked in. He was very friendly and accommodating and provided such excellent service from storing my luggage to letting me check in early. I got a room with an ocean view and it didn’t disappoint. It was spectacular. Love the location of the hotel in proximity to the beach. Some reviews stated the bathroom is a bit outdated and I agree, but it is laid out well and functional. I have no complaints about the room. You get a lot for your money at this hotel and I will return if I return to Honolulu.

Stayed for five nights. Location was convenient. Across the street from the beach, next to the zoo, near the aquarium and Ala Wai golf course. The pink line of the Waikiki Trolley stops in front of the hotel every ten minutes and will take you to shopping areas. Our room was small but very clean, fridge in room, big flat screen, furnishings up to date and of nice quality. Onsite restaurants Tiki's and Wolfgang Puck Express with lots of others within short walking distance. Two ABC stores on the block where you can get fresh salads, sandwiches, etc. Catholic church around the corner. Everything accessible. Some issues - although there was a table and two stools which was nice for eating take out, there was no chair except for the single one on the balcony. The only place to sit was on the bed, and neither that nor the stools were good for our backs. Even on the 15th floor, the traffic noise was incessant until very late. Our friends on the south side of the building had it more quiet, but the trade off was no balcony for them. The $39.00 per day extra charge per room doesn't get you much - use of towels and beach chairs, free sunscreen and aloe, shave ice in the afternoon; but we did attend water aerobics in the ocean a few days, and that was fun. Hawaii is expensive any way you cut it, and we knew what we were getting into, we just thought the extra $39.00 "resort fee" was silly and certainly more than was warranted.

Our stay here was fantastic. The ocean front rooms have a spectacular view of the entire beach. Yes they decor is a little dated but we are here to enjoy what’s outside and mostly in the room to sleep. The hotel is right next to the Zoo. The staff are great always happy to help with smiles on their faces. There are free beach towels, chairs and they even have use of Go pro if you want. At check in we were given food vouchers for the Wolfgang Puck’s express. A definite pleasant surprise it saved us the daily breakfast costs. We will definitely come back again

My husband recommended we stay at Aston Hotel for my first visit to Honolulu! He stayed there last year while on business and loved it! Glenn at the check in desk remembered my husband and upgraded our room! We had an amazing view on the top floor and made our vacation even more special! The staff was very cheerful and welcoming. Great vibes and super fun place to stay if you like music, lively people and great food!

The room was comfortable. Good shower pressure. Air conditioning worked great. We had a partial ocean view room with a great view. Pool area is nice, lots of lounge chairs. Towel place is right there and you can purchase some concessions. The bar area is close and the waitress comes over to take orders also. Wonderful location, you can walk right across the street to the ocean with a nice beach area.

We just got back from a 6 night vacation in Hawaii and stayed at the Aston Waikiki - and LOVED it!! The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout the entire stay, and even allowed for a significantly late check out to accommodate our late night flight. We had an oceanfront room and it’s totally the way to do - the views were phenomenal, the room was large, clean and updated, and we loved it. The only minor critique is that the bathroom was a bit small and the shower head was low for me - I’m 6’1” and it was at my neck. We enjoyed the pool, complimentary shaved ice in the afternoon, and the free beach chairs were awesome to take across the street each day for the beach. The K-Cups in the room were fantastic local Hawaiian coffee and our room attendant gave us a lot since we went thru them quickly. The hotel is conveniently located next to a pick up location for many of the excursions offered on the island, as well. We liked that the hotel was towards the end of the tourist area so it wasn’t as crowded and loud as it is a few blocks down the street. We’re already looking forward to our next vacation!

Have just stayed at this hotel and had a great time. Great spot quiet at night, within walking distance of everything. Plenty of places for food eg Wolfgang Puck and Tikis Bar and Grill, and also shopping. Staff at hotel very helpful and friendly especially Lillian the front desk supervisor. We joined the Coconut Club (extra $$) but well worth it, on 21st floor great views of the beach and Diamond Head, marvellous for sunsets too. Continental breakfast from 6 - 10 am, coffee and juice all day and from 4 - 8 pm drinks and nibbles all part of the package. Will definitely stay again if we get back to Waikiki. Chris and John Bell.

Difficult to navigate old hotel with reception on 3rd floor. Staff were neither friendly nor helpful. Signage not clear. Our ocean view room was really a partial one. No early breakfast. Hated paying resort fee for being at hotel for a short overnight. I would not stay here again.

This is the 2nd time we are staying at this hotel and it was not the same experience,we had a late checking due to airline problem and I had called to inform them,they kept my room but not the one reserved,we asked for a partial view we received a city view,we asked for king bed we had 2 smalls beds.Welcoming at the desk wasn’t not what we are supposed to receive ,very cold reception.No one a the taxi reception is ready to help with your luggage,unless you show up $$$.There is better option if you want to stay in front of Waikiki.Because the room was city view,you are on an another hotel side,AC of the other hotel are very noisy.

We stayed here for our anniversary and got a great deal with half price resort fee and parking. We upgraded to an ocean view room (from partial ocean view) on check in which was a nice touch, but we were placed of the 8th floor despite telling the check in hostess we are light sleepers. It’s noisy! The sound proofing is poor and the other guests can also be loud and ignorant. The staff were all good, especially the people doing the valet, and the room was nice. We really liked the lift system! Our only other gripe was the housekeeping. We found it to be inconsistent and not as thorough as I’d have expected. Overall, we liked the hotel but wouldn’t stay here again due to the poor soundproofing. That was a deal breaker for us.
user_name:
Dippa78
Isle of Wight, United Kingdom

review_body: This is an older style hotel with a basic pool but the beds are very comfortable and our partial ocean view was amazing! Hotel had no problem minding our bags on the first and last day. Its located at the eastern end of the beach but we found this location preferable as it was close to many shops and restaurants and the lagoon to the east of Waikiki beach. We stayed in three hotels whilst in Waikiki. This was by far the cheapest and in my view the best. The older style building and small pool may put some people off but if you are out and about most days then this is the place for you with the most comfortable bed out of the three hotels we stayed at (the other two hotel were well known up market hotels)

At Aston you are within walking distance of not only the beach but great shopping and good restaurants. There isn't any reliable public transportation on this end of Waikiki Beach so you will have to rent a car or order shuttles (both are $$). The bell men are great at helping you with shuttles and tours. The room was adequate, you're paying for the great views and good location. When traveling there make sure you tell the cabbie Aston Waikiki on Kalakaua 'cause there's more than one Aston in Honolulu.

We were only in Hawaii for 2 days and stayed here. We were on the 25th(top) floor - I'm terrified of heights so that wasn't so great for me but I survived! The room was nice (For some reason we were in 2 single beds) and the bathroom was adequate - a little dated. The staff were very helpful at all times. It was a great location for our yours and the waikiki trolley stopped right outside.

Great location over the road from the beach. Rooms are old and tired. When we checked in we were told our room had no sea view or balcony despite booking one with a sea view. Upgraded to later find out all rooms have a balcony...... Got charged twice for resort fee on check in and took several visits to reception to sort out. Not very helpful. Bed was made daily and towels changed but no cleaning done. Good pool and nice pina colada's in Tikis

Has 5 nights here after our cruise. Room was a little outdated but in saying that it was clean and very comfortable. It was quite noisy due to Marriott being renovated. It was directly across from the beach which was great. Had a great view from our room and the sunsets were great. Only minutes to get to main Waikiki area.

Stayed at the Aston for a couple of nights prior to boarding a cruise. This hotel is maybe in need of some updating. That being said, it was clean, comfortable and functional. There is no restaurant, so you need to go out to eat. There is a restaurant attached on the first floor, but it isn’t part of the hotel (so you can’t charge to your room). Pool area is very nice.

Fantastic. We checked in with Lillian, who was just fantastic. Upgraded our room for an ocean view. She was simply amazing. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. All the staff are friendly and very helpful. They have awesome amenities and loan out towel and chairs you can use at the beach. Also loved the fitness class they have on the beach. Will definitely recommend you to everyone, and can't wait to come back.

Nice location close to beach and downtown.Watch for extra fees on top of hotel room and taxes ,resort fee of 35 US dollars a day wether you use them or not.Free breakfast only if you book direct with hotel not through travel agent or sites .

My family and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and could not fault it. The staff were absolutely great they were so welcoming and helpful to us. The hotel is surrounded by great restaurants and only across the road from Waikiki beach. I would 100% recommend this hotel to people and I will be staying at the same hotel next time I visit!

with just a walk across the road to the beach this was a great spot. We were also fortunate to have a view out of our window to Diamond head. If we stood on the very small balcony we could see the sea as well.Two very comfortable double beds and a good sized bathroom. Could have done with some facilities for drying swim wear though. The balconies on our side were not big enough for a chair so if you like sitting out go on the pool side of the hotel.Staff were friendly and the rooms were spotlessly clean.

My wife and I stayed 5 nights in this hotel and would do it agian at the drop of a hat. It was all and more than we needed. Right across the street from Waikiki Beach, near green spaces, great restaurant in Roicki's, super room, and amazing staff. We were right on the bus lines so could trav el with ease anywhere.

One of the more reasonable priced hotels along the Waikiki Beach shoreline. Most rooms have a direct or partial view of the beach. The Aston has a pool on the premises which is open till 9 pm and overlooks the beach. The hotel provides beach towels and water for free. There is a tour booking centre on site which makes it very easy to work out what tours you would like to do. The Aston also has a bus stop right out the front door which makes it easy to travel around Honolulu. The majority of tour buses also stop outside this hotel or on this road. The Tiki Bar on the premise is a great place to eat a special meal and overlooks Waikiki. However, it is very pricey so bring your money with you.

As well as being an excellent, well located and clean hotel, I was particularly impressed with the customer skills of the check-in staff. I want to especially mention Glenn.I was in urgent need get some legal documents signed. I didn't even know where to start to find a Notary approved person, or even what that was. In my country they are justices of the peace. Glen could see how stressed I was and just took over in assisting me.Glenn went out of his way to find the nearest person who could assist me. He was on the phone for a good 40mins locating an approved person. And, it save me hundreds of dollars. This is my 4th time staying at the Aston, and I always seem to be served by Glenn. Though I never said anything before, its about time his excellent customer service skills, compassion and empathy is acknowledged.Impressed so much with this hotel, I have booked a group of 14 people to stay there next year.Outstanding, professionally run and staff are polite and well trained and always welcoming with a smile.Thank you to whoever is in charge of customer service.

Very good location. This hotel is directly across the street from the beach. Plenty of restaurants close by as well as shopping. Convenience store in lobby of hotel. Minutes away from everything. Enjoyed my birthday here.

I was very excited about my recent trip to Oahu, my 5th visit now. I decided to book Aston due to its location (super close to the beach) and read all the reviews. I booked an ocean front view room and when I checked it, I even upgraded so top $$$! It was my birthday week so why not splurge. The wait for my room was supposed to be only 30 minutes but ended up being over an hour. Got to my room, the VIEW WAS AMAZING! But that was it..... Everything else seemed very outdated, furniture, the carpet, the bathroom, the bed was uncomfortable and amenities were mediocre. It was very MOTEL like, to be honest. I stayed because of the view but outside of that, the service was bland, food and everything else was very VANILLA! It was also my birthday and the hotel staff didn't even bother doing anything special to celebrate the occasion, not even like a card or anything. VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH ASTON BEACH HOTEL! Paid a lot of money for the MOTEL experience.

I really enjoyed staying here. The sunset everyday is amazing from the pool and bar area. The location is super convenient with lots of shopping and places to eat close by. We also had incredible views from the balcony. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were also great to sleep on. Would recommend this hotel.

Chose this hotel after staying at more pricy resorts last time. Pleasantly surprised by everything at Aston Waikiki Beach Resort Hotel ! Staff outstanding in all departments. Front desk Hedwyne was super nice and very helpful !! Housekeeping Alona, Leonora, Jun- all very anxious to please. Will make this our new Waikiki hotel for sure ! Restaurant, bar, giftshop, valet guys- all excellent. Great Hawaiian vibe to whole place. Older, but maintains great feel for a great value ! Near zoo, aquarium, Farmers Mkt, Dennys, ha ha. Beach,shops, all right there.

Very unfriendly unhelpful and rude staff was told of no amenities Rooms were left dirty until after 2 most days one room we had stunk would never recommend this motel to anybodyWe paid top dollar for very poor service

Comfortable, Clean, Safe, & Secure w/ an accomodating, friendly, & knowledgeable staff. Upgraded to a beautiful partial beach/ocean view room - including a sweet little lanai. The hotel is directly accross from the quieter side of Waikiki Beach, a short walk from Diamond Head, right next to the Zoo, & quick jaunt to the Aqarium. I did not use all amenities offered, using the room primarily for sleeping & beach-view snacking :) ... but there is a pool & more.

We have stayed here 3 nights last week. The hotel is across the beach so views are stunning if facing the beach. We found the hotel noisy. Our pillows were rock hard and had to request softer ones, which the staff obliged with. Hotel is looking tired and rooms are on the smaller side. Feedback to hotel, it’s worthy to note that most couples would prefer to sleep together in one bed, rather than in two separate beds.... may be worth checking

Hotel room was looking tired. Had to change rooms mid holiday due to foul smell coming from air con vent at 1am in morning. Transferred to a room closer to a loud industrial air con system that was located in the neighbouring building. Carpets in original room were wet from something leaking. Cost to park our rental car was extraordinary. The hotel did the job but I wouldn’t recommend.

We booked three ocean front rooms at this hotel for a family holiday , paid the additional cost to have ocean front but wasn't aware that the hotel room have zero sound proofing or double glazing , the Tikki Bar and Restaurant is located on level 3 and the noise and music travels up the face of the building and whether you want a late night or not is out of your control as the music and noise will keep you awake. on our first night the Tikki music finished at 11:00pm and then we had the night club next door till 2am and to top it off at 6am the next morning the council cleaners started up the blowers and pressure hoses to clean out the picnic shelters across the road which only inhabitants are the local homeless. Hotel is well located etc but the rooms and amenities are very wore and dated , the hotel needs a major refurbishment to justify the cost and don't start on the " resort fee" how they can justify this is beyond me , a tax by another name which seems to have no limit. In summary hotel is a the far end of the main strip , not too far from the action but you should be able to determine on your own if you wish to be kept up all night with music and outside noise , surely at the cost this hotel charges we should be able to have quite rooms and updated facilities.

Great location checkin was very busy as many people were arriving early. Staff are great very patient at checkin.Room is good with a king bed. View of the beach is great all the way to west for the sunset.

Stayed at this hotel last night. Hotel is very safe as non guests can not go up. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Staff is friendly and very welcoming.This hotel is located right across the road from Waikiki Beach which is great! I strongly hotel this hotel to anyone.

An okay place to stay. Nice people, and rooms are air conditioned. Location is ideal. However, the place is a little old and the wear and tear is somewhat visible if you are attentive to details. I would rank it a 3 star for environment, but a 4 overall bc of the service. There’s WiFi, cable television, and a swimming pool. However, the pool area always looks crowded. Did t bother going there.

First time in Hawaï and I choose this hôtel for it’s location juste in front of the beach ! The room was very clean and well equiped with a Keurig coffee maker and mini fridge. We paid for a partial ocean view and they upgrade us to an ocean view on floor 20th.This hotel is not a New one but it was clean every where. The Pool deck is facing the ocean with lit of chairs and umbrellas. Tiki bar and grill was good and they have à bande playing every day. The hotel fee is $36 per day but à lot is include like The beach chairs, bottle of water, towels. I will return to this hotel when I go back in Waikiki !!

I can't say enough about this wonderul, happy, great place to stay in Hawaii. We have stayed here 4 times and would not stay anywhere else in wakkaki. Staff is wonderful. So close to beach, just walk across the street.....

The absence of guest car park gave us considerable stress during our stay as Waikiki was spoiled by congested roads and insufficient parking.  The hotel does offer valet parking but this will set you back $45 per day plus tax. As we are on a long trip around the world this is not an attractive option. There is free parking a mile or so away if you are lucky.The hotel itself is ok. Reliable hot water. Comfortable mattress (pillows not..way too hard). Plenty of storage.  Coffee maker in room. Plenty of good eateries nearby.We did have a side ocean view which was great once we'd trained ourselves to ignore the ugly concrete on either side of the beautiful view.  There is a compulsory tourist tax of $36 per day with tax. The hotel does provide a "free" water pouch for each guest. Handy for around the pool. The pool is a small area with a small pool. Ok for kids to splash in though. The lack of space means that the sunbeds are of the "line em up and pack em in" variety so we weren't tempted. There is a fridge in the room and there are loads of ABC convenience stores around so we bought yoghurt and muffins for breakfast in the room.My advice is if you have a car try to stay as far away from Waikiki as possible.  It will be a longer drive to and from the airport but it would be worth it ...then Just get the tram into the city when you want to take it on. The best beaches are away from the city and there are stunning walks along the coast to be had.
user_name:
srablair
Lytham St Anne's, United Kingdom

review_body: Do yourself a favor and book an oceanfront room; the view is absolutely spectacular! My husband and I travel on a relatively tight budget and chose the Aston Waikiki for our first visit to Hawaii, and we couldn’t have been more pleased. The value, like the room, was incredible! The staff were all kind, helpful, and accommodating. They went out of their way to ensure that we were comfortable and having a great time. Tiki’s Grill and bar, by the pool, had fabulously delicious happy hour drinks and eats. I wish we had been able to try everything on the menu.

My stay was amazing. The staff was fantastic, the bar was great and my room attendant was unbelievable. Remy my room attendant was so friendly, did an amazing job cleaning my room and never stopped smiling. Highly recommend that you get Remy for you room attendant.The bar was nice and the music at night was very enjoyable. The drinks were not very strong. Light pours by most of the bartenders but the bartenders were very nice.

I booked this hotel through Costco Travel, and it was one of the cheapest hotels on the beach that was offered. So I wasn't expecting much. This hotel far surpassed my expectations with good customer service, extra touches like a free reusable water bottle and refilling station, and a room with a wonderful view of the ocean (more than a "partial" view, as listed). They provided free towels rentals with no hassle. The staff were very relaxed and helpful. There was a refrigerator in the room. There was patio furniture to enjoy the view of the ocean and sunset. The inside of the room was basic but very nicely kept and with everything I need. This hotel far exceeded my expectations and I would return there again for sure.

The Aston Waikiki is on a great location at a less crowded end t of Waikiki. We ate at Tiki's restaurant located at the hotel almost daily. They had great happy house specials and the food and staff were awesome.As far as the hotel the bed was very comfortable, however the bathrooms are in much need of a renovation but the room was clean. We requested an ocean view room and it was amazing but we ended up switching rooms since the 1st room's lanai was only standing room, they moved us 2 nights later to a room with a lanai with sitting room which they were more than happy to do for us.Overall this property was a great value with a friendly staff - we booked through Costco.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel 12 years ago and loved its bright Hawaiian style and free included breakfast. BUT it is not the same hotel it was in 2007. The room looked tired and shabby. The tiny bathroom was clean (as was the room) but the tile floor was in bad shape. The room was small. We booked a king bed with partial ocean view weeks ahead, and were told upon checking in that our only choice was a room with two double beds, with a better view. The view was nice, but we would have liked to get the room we booked. They no longer offer any type of breakfast. Beware that in addition to the $39 per day "resort fee" you will be charged $45 per day for valet parking. There is no self-service parking. This brings the price significantly higher. We will not stay here again.

We have had an Ocean view premium room on the 25th floor for the past week, sadly, only one week to go.What makes this hotel great is the staff! From the minute we arrived we have been greeted with friendly smiles and a keenest to provide the best possible service! This hotel is very conveient to everything in Waikikii and further beyond. The beach is directly across the road, literally a one minute walk. The hotel provides beach chairs and towels for their guests.Food is everywhere and the hotel has two inhouse resturants, Tikis and Wolfgang Express,There is a 3rd floor pool with a very large deck for guests to use. Nice if you want to avoid the frenzy of the beach for a change.We have had the most beautiful suset views this week, right up there with Satorini Greece!We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to our friends and family!

Fabulous hotel, with a Wolf Gang Puck's Express next door. Our ocean view room had a reat look directly at Diamond Head, but once again we had to go onto the balcony to see the ocean, again the fault of our AAA travel agent. Room was spacious with 2 double beds and a living area. No kitchen or micro wave, but it did have a mini fridge. There were amenities provided except for shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion. No snacks, or mini bottles of booze at all. Great location, but you have to walk, or take an expensive taxi ride to go out and eat. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

A standard hotel but a perfect location close to everything. We had a king ocean view on the 17th floor - small lanai with only 1 chair but the view was lovely. The next door Marriott is renovating so the it was noisy all day sadly. The room was clean and comfortable. Loved the ability to use folding chairs and towels for the beach. Extremely annoyed that when trying to book an excursion through the concierge we were subjected to a hard timeshare sales pitch that wouldn't quit. Not ok to trap guests in that manner. For location would stay again if the price was right but lots of options in Waikiki.

We stayed here for one week and were overall happy. The best thing about this hotel is it’s location. It is literally steps to the beach. We booked a premier ocean view room and the view was just gorgeous. We were on the 18th floor and even though we were high up, sometimes it was a bit noisy. The road outside our window was always busy with tour busses, trolleys and people, but we never had an issue with noise while sleeping at night. We took a nap almost every afternoon to regenerate and had no problem falling asleep. You have to understand that this is a hotel in a major tourist city so some level of outside noise is to be expected.The hotel could use a facelift and that I guess, is why the rates were reasonable for a hotel with a prime location. Hawaii is very expensive and hotel choice is a major part of the overall trip cost. The Aston Walkiki fit our desire for a great view without breaking the bank. That said, our room interior was nothing to write home about. The bathroom was small and outdated, but the water pressure in the shower was great. The shower head was not high enough for a tall person. The walls needed a fresh coat of paint with color. Our room was not as pretty as the one pictured on their website. There were two sad pictures on the wall that did not represent the abundant beauty of the island. There was not really space in the room for a chair and a chair would have been nice. There was a small table and two stools, but the stools did not have any backs to them. The room, however, was clean and we had no issues. I’m not complaining, just stating the facts. This is no luxury hotel, but luxury would have cost a lot more.All the staff members we encountered were very friendly, especially the housekeeping staff. We saw them most days in the hallway and they always spoke to us and made us feel welcome.A nice feature is that the hotel has beach towels and chairs you can check out each day. They also give you portable water pouches that you get to keep. They have a water filling station near the towel area. We took them everywhere and it saved us money.The elevator system is different than any other we’ve encountered, but it was no problem. There are two restaurants on site, Tiki’s, which was more upscale and had live music, and Wolfgang Puck Express, which was open from 7 am to 10 pm. We had a pizza and a Hawaiian pork sandwich one evening at Wolfgang Puck’s and both were very good.Overall, the hotel is in a very desirable location. You can easily walk to shops and restaurants. Many tour companies pick you up right in front of the hotel. Starbucks is steps away and opens at 4 am.There is a daily resort fee and parking is valet only. If you rent a car you can save on the $45/day parking fee by renting at Enterprise across the street and return the car to them each day. There is also a parking lot near the zoo that costs $1/hour that comes in handy.Overall, we had a good experience here.

We were hoping for a 4 star experience, but from our check in forward we were disappointed. The most shoking was being charged an additional $40++ per day "resort fee" and they charge $45 per day if you have a rental car to park. The room we were in on the 5th floor was just above the pool area and guests at the pool could look right up into our room. There was food left in the fridge so we had to call housekeeping to clear it out. There wasn't a guide for the TV channels. they didn't have a chair in the room to sit in for dressing, there were no water glasses in the bathroom, no ventilation fan in the bathroom, and no room service. They have a Tiki lounge and some food places on the first floor street level, but no really nice restaurant on site. The valet folks on the first floor were helpful with transportation needs.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here but there are couple things I have to point out; We had one major issues with tiny cockroaches. Our first 4 nights, we always had a cockroach in the bathroom. We called Front Desk to help and they came up with housekeeping to spray our rooms but the next few days we still had issues. Maybe it's the maintenance/engineering aspect of the hotel that needs fixing. Also, Front Desk is short staffed and I feel that we always had to wait 15-20 mins just to ask questions because there were only two people at the desk.I do appreciate the hotel being right across the beach, close to shopping malls and not near congested tourist spots. Would I come back and stay here? Probably not. Not because of the issues we had, but because there are many hotels in Waikiki I would love to stay at them all!

Did not stay at the hotel, we came for the tiki bar on St. Pats Day. So much fun, great ocean views, sunshine, good food and music. It was all I hoped it would be. Everyone enjoyed the awesome tropical drinks that are their specialty. Free valet parking for 3 hours is helpful too.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel has an unobstructed view of the beach as well as complete access to it. The hotel is up the Diamond Head end which is a great location as it avoids all the congestion and lots of tourists. The rooms are a little small and dated however the hotel is more affordable than other hotels in Waikiki.The onsite restaurant/bar “Tiki’s Grill & Bar” has great food, cocktails and live entertainment as well as spectacular views of the beach and the sunsets.The hotel staff were very courteous and the room was cleaned and made up every day before 11am. The housekeeping staff were prompt with special requests. The king size bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was very dated and small but everything worked so not too much to complain about there. The Honolulu Zoo was within walking distance as was the Aquarium, and places to eat and shopping were also close. It took us a very leisurely 15 minutes to walk from the Aston down to the Cheesecake Factory.Shuttles/trolleys all stop right outside the hotel so you are able to easily get to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, etc. We were lucky enough to be there for the Honolulu Festival with fabulous fireworks display from a barge in the water across the road from the hotel, so the views from Tiki’s were brilliant. We enjoyed our stay and we would definitely stay there again!

Overall, this hotel is great. The location is perfect, the view from the ocean view rooms are even better and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The main drawback was noise. There was road construction which the hotel can’t control. Even so, we were on the 15th floor and it sounded like we were on street level. Traffic noise and noise from other rooms was a distraction. I would still stay here again though.

Stayed at aston three days prior to hawaiian cruise, perfect location, beach right across the road, close to hop on hop off bus. Park nearby, in the heart of shopping and great restaurants.The rooms were dated, but clean,

Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is in a great location; Steps away from the beach, and close to shopping areas and a variety of restaurants of all kinds.The view from the top floor balcony where we stayed, was magnificent, as we watched the sunset every evening. the staff, including the receptionist and room service was curtious and helpful. The room was rather small, but comfortable. We had breakfast at the restaurant on the first floor several time, and the food was delicious.I think the daily resort fee was too high, compare to accommodations in other hotels near by.

Staying here was our unexpected 2 day extension to our Vacation. I decided to splurge and rented an Ocean View Suite, the room was very clean and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. Our only complaint which is not really fair to the Hotel is that the bathroom shower is very small and in comparison to the room, the bathroom feels old and dated. Other than that we had a very restful extended stay and we would still recommend this Hotel.

So this hotel is not as luxurious or glamorous as some of the others in Waikiki. They don’t have room service which is somewhat inconvenient and their key system is completely different to anything else I’ve seen all over the world. Getting to the hotel is easy, the building itself looks like it could use some work but it’s clean and satisfactory on the inside regardless. One thing that annoyed me was that they didn’t upgrade anyone into the ocean facing rooms so the hotel looked vacant. Also their booking is a little bit confusing when choosing your view, etc. I would hate to have been in a room without a view but we were fairly lucky with our upgrade. Amenities were fine, wifi was ok for me but kept cutting out for my roommate and I don’t know why that was the case. Apart from that if you don’t want to spend too much but stay at the beach, this place is it.

Staff is great, was very helpful. Rooms are clean and comfy. Not a lot of bells and whistles and very dated, but who comes to Hawaii to sit in their room all day. But be very cautious about room assignment, don’t be near Coconut Club floor 21 on weekends. Avoid rooms with last 2 digits of 27 they are near a noisy service elevator that is used throughout the night. Peace xxxxxxxxxxcxxxxxccxxxxxxx

Like the location because it has the beach and the sea walk (not having to walk on sand), close to Diamond head, close to restaurants. The room is somehow dated (old shower and sink fixtures, low toilet seat) and the sound insulation is not good (can hear people opening, closing the doors and flushing toilets). The Tiki bar at the hotel is lively, fun and serves good drinks.

Stayed at Aston Waikiki beach feb28-mar9, 9 days. Great location quieter end beach calm less congested. We paid for ocean view and although we got ocean view we asked to change it for a better view of the hotel strip along the water. The front desk accommodated us and were very nice: this was still considered ocean view but more scenic. Thanks to Connie Teresa and Gin! If we asked for extra coffee ,they brought us 4, bottle openers bought immediately etc. We researched all hotels and found out that most hotels charge the resort fee everyone hates. Airbnb vrbo May not , but hotels do. For the location and view and price we made our decision and we were very happy no complaints. King room comfortable always clean, a bit dated, unique elevator system which we found was much quicker, less waiting around. We booked with Costco, price included free cancellation up to 2 days prior , most Airbnb don’t include this , airport transfors and vouchers for food at Wolfgang puck express at hotel 1 voucher per person , per day we were there 9 days 18 vouchers and not one bad meal, great portions as well. Part of resort fees were the fold up black chairs and towels these came in quite handy. Beach very clean less busy, if you have small children water very calm, location is great because you can walk easily to busier section but then come back to quieter end of strip, we rented a car for a day enterprise at Marriott right next door, very easy. If you rent for several days you might want to park at zoo 5 minute walk they charge 1dollare an hour.Waikiki has so many great restaurants , you can make your trip as expensive or as inexpensive as you want, do some research, check out utube videos on where to eat some really cheap, and yes we tried some and they were awesome, me bbq, markome udon, island vintage for the best açai bowls and shave it,musubi snack bar , go to a luau, go to the north shore Haunama bay , climb diamond head but plan plan!! we watched a lot of videos lol it was great trip.

I will start this review by telling you that my wife and I travel to Honolulu every year and have spend the majority of our stays in this hotel.The Aston is a older building that has been well maintained over the years .The management and staff are exceptional in my opinion the hotel is kept very clean.We stay in an ocean front room on the 15th floor every stay not to high or low perfect level , there is no better ocean view anywhere in Waikiki I assure you there my be some that equal it but none better. We have looked at many some costing hundreds of dollars more per night the value and view is truly amazing. As much as we do like this hotel there are a few areas that concern us the aminities fee is now 39 dollars per night up considerably from past years ,The wonderful poolside breakfast that was included in each guests stays is now gone as well as the daily local newspaper we have enjoyed over the years,also the video gaming and movies system is gone .To be fair management did advice me that some version of a breakfast is going to be brought back soon I look forward to this .I will close with this hotel is a exception value for the dollar the housekeeping staff is very friendly Rosanna on the 15th floor took excllent care of us on this most recent trip.I can not emphasize enough the view and location on the beach is perfect , near shopping, restaurants ,and best section of Waikiki beach Thank you Joseph Bydlon

I had a room with the partial ocean view looking out over the ocean towards Honolulu. The scenery was beautiful. The hotel is a little out dated, but for the view and price, it is awesome. I checked in on a Friday afternoon, and my room was ready. The location is great being right around the corner from the Zoo, and right across the street from Waikiki Beach. I will be staying there again.

Great location, staff were amazing and the bed was very comfortable. Super close to a Starbucks and just across the street from the beach. There are always Ubers and Taxis to take you where you need to go.

Stayed here the first week of February. There website said there was a 25 dollar a night parking fee. We arrived and the parking fee went up to 45 dollars a night ! We parked around the corner at the zoo for 1 dollar an hour. They removed the playstation/DVD player with a note saying that this will "improve our experience at there property", Really ?
