I don't get that at all ! How do they know what is going to improve my experience. I thought that was part of there daily amenity fee ? That 39 dollar fee a day was not reduced when they removed that or replaced with some other amenity. I have stayed at this hotel several times and every time they increase fees without improvement to the property. I stayed in an oceanfront room and they don't even have a decent chair to sit on, the chair is basically a bar stool. Taxes and fees 498.56 for a week stay without parking ! Ridiculous. Time to move on to another hotel.

The hotel was in a good location but definitely needs a major renovation. There was also construction happening at the time and no mention of it when we booked the hotel, in fact construction pretty much surrounded the hotel. There was a resort fee of $39 a day, which I don’t really understand because there was not much for amenities for a resort fee (pool and playstation to play DVDs). The check in process is super slow so you always wait in a line, our king room we reserved was sold out so had to switch the next day and wait in line again to check into our new room. The restaurant on site is a little pricey and food is mediocre. Again, good location but needs some updates to be able to compete with all the new hotels going up.

When we checked in we were told it was not a very good room and had only a step out balcony with no chairs . We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to an ocean front room for an extra $42 a night . We decided to upgrade because we like to have a balcony that we can at least sit on. The room was OK but the hallway smelled bad . We went to park our car and were told that valet parking was 45.00 for valet which is the only option. We decided to park at the zoo. The resort fee is 40+ per day. So 85.00+ added to the room rate daily, about 600 extra for a week on top of the room rate. I won’t stay here again.

We enjoyed our stay here, nice restaurant super location friendly staff ,only complaints are $35 a day for parking the car $39 extra hotel fees and the bathrooms are in need of Upgrading bathroom tiles and paint

Literally across the street from Waikiki beach. There is Tiki restaurant attached. It has a small swimming pool. We had ocean view room which was beautiful. The rooms are showing their age, bathrooms need an upgrade. Rooms comfortable. Had a small concern with hair on towels that wasn’t ours. All in all, a pleasant hotel. Easy walking distance to a lot of tourist stuff. A main pick up point for trolleys and tours

This place is a little dated for the price but still in a great location. The staff here always goes above and beyond to make you feel like one of own! One evening while staying here my niece and were experiencing trouble with the TV remote so we called down to the front desk for assistance. Almost immediately the sweetest and funniest gentlemen showed up and help with our remote. When we were cold and needed blankets house keeping immediately addressed it and sent some up. This place is clean and right across the street from Waikiki beach I would absolutely recommend it to anyone who wanted a great place to stay in Hawaii!

Hotel is in the perfect location. Upon check in, my husband stated it was a surprise anniversary getaway, we were given champagne and asked if we wanted to upgrade, "Sean" let us look at the room, it was an ocean front suite. The best views in waikiki! We could not be happier with our stay! Every staff member greeted us with an Aloha every time we passed. The room was clean, bathroom could use some updates. Other than that, we will be back! Thank You Aston Waikiki for a memorable first trip to Hawaii ♡

After 8 hours of flight delays from Toronto due to bad weather and finally arriving at the Aston Waikiki we were in heaven. Our front desk lady "Kalehua" was outstanding. She knew we were on our honeymoon and made every single effort to make us so welcome to the island. Her professional and kind attitude was the best by far. Nest time your at the Aston Waikiki ask for "Kalehua"

Initially we had a few problems with the room, but Glenn went out of his way to make us happy. Thanks to Glenn we truly enjoyed our room and our stay at the hotel. We never expected the great view when paying for a partial view. The hotel is old but clean and the staff are great. Dont expect a 5 star hotel but clean and comfortable a accommodations with great service.

Toward tail end of Waikike, but only a 15 minute walk to center of action. It is also close to San Souci beach, which is one of our favorites. We had a Premium ocean view with balcony which overlooks Waikiki, glad we did that. .Some surprise charges were $39 for resort fee and $45 for parking per night. An option would be to park at the Honolulu zoo which is only two blocks away. That would cost about half as much (we didn't use that option, but co travelers did). We didn't eat at the inhouse restaurant because it was too windy on the night in question. Did eat a couple of times at the Japanese Food Court about 15 minutes up the street which we highly recommend. Staff is friendly. Wife thinks the pillows are too hard. All in all we'd stay there again.
user_name:
Paul L
Old Fort, North Carolina

review_body: Reception is on 2nd floor; only 3 small elevators for access & one was out of service half of our 10 day stay. Reservation clerk had promised accessible room w/king-sized bed; on arrival, was told those rooms NEVER have king beds and there was no room ready for us. On saying we'd been promised accessible room, finally agreed to provide one at about 8:30 p.m. w/2 double beds & gave us a room to use as our own in the meantime. My husband (disabled) liked the view of the pool and decided he could live w/regular room and would shower by the pool. Big mistake. There is not a single grab bar in bathroom; worse, they have the lanai door bolted and blocked so it can only be opened about 24 inches, so he had to "crab walk" sans walker to get on to it. Pool is in the shade until about 4:00 p.m. and "sun" deck (should be called shade deck) until 3:30. No sun on lanai. We encountered a huge cockroach who was too quick for us. I sent him to his just reward on our last day when he reappeared in a drawer as I was packing to leave. I didn't report him until we checked out as I didn't want them spraying the room while we occupied it. When I barely touched the shower head to adjust, it fell off. The accessible room they would have moved us to was much higher. I've had more than one occasion to evacuate a hotel room and this would have been a nightmare in an emergency for someone with a disability. If you stay, bring something to read while you wait for an elevator. At the very least, they should put chairs out while one waits. This hotel is old and tired and in my 30 years of visiting Hawaii is the worst I've encountered. I will say that the housekeeping staff are some of the nicest people ever. It's also a short walk from the city bus. Although the name says "Aston", it's no longer part of that chain.

Recently stayed at this hotel on our family vacation with our infant. Immediately noticed that room and hotel are not what is pictured on website. Rooms are much more dated. We were supposed to get a “special gift of Hawaii-made treats personally picked by the hotel’s general manager” with our premiere ocean view room as advertised on their website. Never received anything in room, called to inquire and told they no longer provide this. When inquired further, they relunctantly went into the back office and “magically” had some available. Questionable service. Crib was very old and very small for infant. No late checkout available. Other than that room was clean, good location. Wouldn’t stay here again.

Great location but the room we had (partial ocean view) 902, looked tired and lacked the finishing we expected of the Aston chain. Small details, like the bed head was coming apart or the comfort (or lack) of the bed itself. Service was not a highlight either, we had to request to get our room made up and cleaned on 3 different occasions, as rooms were serviced very early in the morning. We left our room most days by 9am, missing the room being serviced and having to request it. We have stayed in several hotels in Waikiki and overall this was a disappointing stay.

We chose this hotel after a prior visit. For a special anniversary trip with friends we opted for a premium oceanfront room and were not disappointed. Love the location at the quieter end of the strip. Easy in and out. Good tiki bar with ono snacks.

Great service in an amazing hotel directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. Great location and access to dining, bars and shopping. Staff was cheerful and. Dry helpful with verbal directions that Siri was lacking. Rooms are clean and comfortable with nice size flat screen TV’s. Great high tech security to access rooms, takes a mi item to figure out, but worth it. Great bar and restaurant in the hotel. When booking don’t forget to figure in the resort fees and valet parking.

I came here for my first ever trip to Hawaii and I was so excited. We got in a little earlier than expected and the valet guys took our bags so that we could go find some cheaper parking on the street. When we came back to the hotel to check in we were told that our room wasn't ready and our ocean view room that we had booked may not be available. That they could only "request it" when assigning us rooms. Like really? I'm pretty sure as the front desk check in staff you can choose which room I get based on my booking. We let it go and went on our way onto the strip since our room wasn't ready yet. 3 hours later we come back and have to check in AGAIN to get our room keys. Finally get a room on the 24th floor but we're facing the Marriott. So partial ocean view. Definitely not what we booked. That was disappointment number one. Second disappointment. The bathroom was horrible!!! Imagine the bathrooms that you get at rest areas and put that in a hotel. That's how bad it was. And it was so small. Literally only one person could be in there at a time! The toilet paper holder broke too. And not to mention there was a makeup stain (I hope) on the towel. And I had just checked in! Ridiculous. On our third night there was a storm. The heater in our room would not work. If you turned it on it would only cool the room. Like really? We froze that night and somehow got some sleep. Overall. This was a horrible stay. The view was slightly decent from the balcony but other than that I'm staying far away from this hotel.

This hotel is rated 3 stars. Here in Australia I don't stay in hotels rated less than 4 stars, usually at least 4,5 stars. Unfortunately cost per night is very high in Waikiki and after consultation with a travel agent we settled on this one. It has its cons. Location is great opp the beach. We had partial ocean view and Diamond Head view which was nice. We were on our honeymoon. No gift/wine but we were put on 25th floor with a view and less Street noise than lower floors. Hotel rooms are very outdated. Beds were comfortable. There is not even a chair to sit on, only high wooden stools. Room didn't have a kettle, one was brought after request. Power point was detaching from the wall, had to hold it to plug and unplug. Upon arrival after a very long flight we were told that our room hasn't been paid for. I mentioned communicating with hotel customer service manager who helped me to organise early check in they offer as we arrived at 8 am after sleepless night. Reception went to talk to her and they found proof of our payment somehow. The worst thing was loud slamming of doors which went on past 11. All door closers need to be fixed. As soon as we tried to go to bed before 11 we were rudely woken up by slamming doors of other guests. Sleep in past 7.30 is also impossible due to morning noises. I must say all staff were very hardworking and friendly and reception sent help promptly if we called. I returned home tired from lack of sleep hence will look for quieter place next time

This hotel directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. The room was very comfortable and clean. We had a partial ocean view room with a small balcony but unfortunately there was no furniture on the balcony to enjoy it. Staff was all very friendly and helpful. The elevator system is a bit unique and a bit of a hassle but I understand the need for extra security measures. We plan to stay at this location again upon our return to Waikiki. Thanks Aston for a great stay!

This was my first time staying in an Aston. It was nice enough, but very much dated. This property sits across the street from the Marriott as well as the famous Waikiki Beach. Location is convenient. Parking is valet only at $45 per day.

Checked in around five and had booked two rooms. First room had hair in the bathroom all over the shower and walls. And there was a face impression on the table. Very gross! Second room smelled like weed and beer! Called the front desk and no guest recovery was offered ended up having to call tree times before someone finally came to the room only to hand me a can of Lysol and walk away!!!! Are you serious?! A/C in rooms did not work, someone had to come up to fix that then lock on the door lost power so someone had to fix that...one thing after the other. I work in the hotel industry and know how difficult it is and how something's just get missed by housekeeping....I get it. The way this was handled was horrible all we got was "I will make notes on your reservation, so sorry" instead of coming up to fix the issue or moving our rooms. Also cherry on top the limited amenities covered by the $36+ resort fee shrunk while we were there, the PlayStation with complimentary movies and games was taken away after the first night for "upgrades" but did they lower the resort fee? Nope!

Stayed there for 3 nights before a cruise. Lillian Mesiona at the front desk was wonderful! Helpful, cheerful, personable, knowledgeable. Room was average (wear) but very clean and we got an ocean view. Did NOT like the added $39 per day "resort charge" as it came as a surprise and was rather useless to us. Very good restaurant connected. Lots of good stores and restaurants within walking distance … and, of course, having the ocean across the street was great! Some workers didn't speak English. Found this out when I asked about "snack time" by the pool and he told me to go to the ABC Store. Pretty funny! Would probably stay there again if I find out that everyone charges the extra "resort" fee.

The hotels strong force is the location. The hotel itself is a 3 Star with a 5 Star location. We stayed for 5 nights, and the room was kept clean all days. The hotel is very noisy. When in the room, We heard everything that was going on out in the korridor. And why do We have to pay 39 dollars in resort fee, beside the Price We already have payed. We did not get any value for the 39 dollars.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for two days before and two days after a one week cruise around the Hawaiian Islands in January of 2019. The location was great, rooms very clean and staff provided excellent service, especially Gibson at the front desk! We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and stay here again when we come back to the beautiful Hawaiian Islands.

I just wanted to say that I had a wonderful stay at your fine hotel. Of course you can't beat the location being right across the street from the beach and I appreciated the room with a view of the water which is always a nice experience. Your restaurant "Tiki's Grill & Bar" I enjoyed with the live music & hula dancers. Jessie the bartender was fun to watch while being very friendly and helpful. I had the Soy Salmon dinner which was excellent. The people at Pleasant Holidays and overall everyone I encountered were great. My only small complaint is that it would be nice to have the shower heads a bit higher up for us taller folks. Other then that the room was clean and comfortable.

I decided last minute to stay in Honolulu before departing in the morning. Aston Beach Hotel was great at accommodating me with my reservation. The location is PERFECT, directly across from the Beach with access to all the shops with comfortable walking distance. The rooms are basic, clean an quiet. The bed is soft and comfortable. My only disappointments are the cheap styrofoam cups for my coffee in the morning and a cheap plastic water pouch they give you at check-in. If I am paying $200 a night I would like to see them supporting the environment as Hawaii is eco conscious. They do have valet parking, it’s a little more expensive than most places at $50 a night. The pool is on the 3rd floor with the Tiki bar and a beautiful view. The staff that I encountered was polite and helpful. The elevators are definitely something I’ve never encountered before, on the wall you press the number of the floor that you want to go to then on the screen it displays F or E for what elevator is going to be open then you get on the elevator, there are no buttons to press the door closes and it takes you to the floor. That definitely threw off a couple other people as well. I would stay here again.

Hotel right across the street from Wakiik beach. From hotel walking distance to the zoo, Aquarium, parks and shopping. Rented a car toured the coastline many many beautiful places to visit. Renting a car was cheaper than paying for individual tours. Felt totally safe driving and walking around. Took the Trolley to the main big mall. Numerous places to eat and shop. Hotel is clean, staff is friendly and helpful. Hotel overall is a bit outdated needs to be upgraded. Our room was small with a small deck. We had a Ocean View room for 10 days. But location to the beach was perfect so that made up for everything. Would definitely go back to this hotel!!!

This hotel is very clean the staff was great. The pool is very comfortable great views of the ocean from pool deck and our room on the 23rd floor. The hotel room needed updating the shower head was very low. And the tap on the sink did not turn off. The lock on the patio door did not lock. But is was very clean the bed was comfy great pillows. The only bad part was the older room however the price was better than anything else in Waikiki if they fix the rooms the prices will definitely go up.

Stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Booked through Hotwire and was upgraded to an ocean front room. The view was amazing as Waikiki Beach is directly across the street. The location of this hotel is fabulous, it is on the Main Street for restaurants and shopping. There is a great Tiki bar with a really good happy hour and the pool area was simple but nice. Only downfall was that the bathrooms were a little bit grungy and no free parking. Parking was $45 a day! Better to park a block away in the Honolulu Zoo parking lot for $1 an hour. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I stayed at the Aston Waikiki from Jan 17th 2019 to Jan 23rd. It’s an older hotel but if you compare the rate with the surrounding properties you can’t beat the price. Staff were very friendly. My only complaint is that I read in TA that I would receive free continental breakfast and was told that the breakfast coupons weren’t included in my package. I had paid $500 for an upgrade to a Premium Oceanfront room. How is that not part of the package for one of their most expensive rooms? Don’t count on the free breakfast.I also read that there were free bags and bottled water in the room. Nope!There was a refrigerator in the room (1834) but it didn’t work.The tour guides were a bit pushy. They called my room telling me they had a welcome packet. I was thinking this was the bag with water and fans but they just tried selling me tours and tried getting me to go look at a timeshare. I’m was on vacation. I didn’t want to spend my time looking at a timeshare.

The staff at Aston Waikiki Beach were amazing. Thank You Kalehua for making sure all of our needs were met, answering all of my questions and providing amazing customer service with a smile. Our room was amazing. This will definitely be a place we will be staying on our next visit.

I did extensive research for our Hawaii vacation and ended up choosing the Aston Waikiki for our Oahu leg of the trip. I’m so happy with my choice!! Everyone from the front desk staff to housekeeping were beyond friendly and happy to help us with anything we needed. When we checked in we had noted in our reservation we were celebrating my birthday, the woman at the front desk wished me a happy birthday and then told us the Aston had given us an upgrade to a suite and she handed us a small bottle of champagne and two glasses to celebrate. It was a great surprise and we thoroughly enjoyed our suite. The views were amazing and the suite was clean, comfortable and had a big tv, a couch and a mini fridge. The hotel is an older hotel that has been renovated and it is literally across the street from Waikiki beach. You cannot beat the location! Also the hotel provides you with a great reusable water bottle to refill at the filtered water stations they have and you can check out wonderful beach chairs and towels to take to Waikiki. The beach chairs made our beach day very enjoyable and people on the beach even asked us where we scored the great chairs. For sunset you can sit at the pool chairs and watch the sun go down literally across the street. The fireworks on Friday you can watch from a pool chair as well. The Tiki bar has great happy hour deals and their drinks are delicious! We took a city bus one day and the stop was a few blocks from the Aston, making it very convenient and inexpensive to get around. Overall we loved our stay at the Aston and everyone who works there made it thoroughly enjoyable. Normally I feel ripped off when a hotel charges a “resort fee” but I felt like I got my money’s worth at the Aston. Would 100% stay there again when we’re in Waikiki again. Thank you for a great unforgettable stay!

Great location in proximity to the beach and NYE fireworks. As for the hotel itself the rooms look very old, and I was dissapointed with the housekeeping on the rooms. Dusty old bathrooms. Would not stay again.

Was ok besides the Popcorn cielings, I stayed for 3+ weeks. I have an issue with them still having an enormous hold on credit card even though I settled my bill! I can send them emails and call but they do jack to resolve this problem. It's been over 2 weeks since I paid. Very disappointed, would rather pay more and stay at the Royal Hawaiian again, at least there they took off the hold right away and didnt cause me any inconviences.

I was assigned to room 705 as I walked into the room I had to kill two roaches. I notified house cleaning, but nothing was done. In the night as I was going to put my 1 year old daughter to sleep I had to kill 3 more roaches. I called the front desk requesting a room change. They tell me that they will come spray the room, even with my 1 year old daughter in the room at the time.After over an hour of talking with the front desk they finally give me another room 2508. As the bellman walks in, he has to kill yet another roach. I have to request yet another room and wait over an hour to do so. This whole situation took over 3 hours (my 1 year old daughter forcing to stay up). The manager notified me that there are plenty of other hotels in the area and I was at liberty to leave the hotel if I wanted so. They would not book me in another hotel nor refund my money. I stayed here in 2009 and that was an amazing experience. I will not come back and do not recommend this hotel. I would rather stay at a hostel than here.

Stayed here for a week with my daughter. Our first contact was with Glenn at checkin, he was fantastic in getting us into a room at 7.00a.m after a long flight so we didn't have to wait until 3.00pm checkin. Outstanding service from Glen and everyone we had contact with, they were all incredibly helpful and happy! Nothing was too much trouble. Room was on the 12th floor overlooking the ocean. Highly recommend booking one of these rooms higher up as noise could be an issue on the lower floors. 1 minute from the beach and all the amenities you could need. Weather was perfect, 28c and no humidity. Can't wait to come back.

We flew from San Diego to Honolulu and needed a hotel for one night before we flew to Maui. We stayed in room 1810 with a limited view of Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head. Our visit to the Tiki Bar at the hotel was interesting. We each had a beer which came in a tall glass labeled with "Tiki Bar" and enjoyed the duo that was playing and singing. When I received the check, I knew something was wrong because each beer cost about $18! When I enquired, our waitress said that the $18 included the cost of a Tiki beer glass to take home as a souvenir! I told her that we did not ask to buy a beer glass and did not want one. She recalculated the bill minus $24 for the two glasses. We ran into a similar situation at Pat O'Briens in New Orleans. Tourist order a mixed drink which comes in a Pat O'Brien glass and pay the bill without asking why it is so high. Not realizing that they bought the drink and the glass, they leave the glass on the table and let Pat O'Briens sell it again. We slept well at the Aston Waikiki, but we would not stay there again.

This restaurant is amazing , great food and happy hour and music. Try the sir and turf. Yummy!! The staff are all very friendly and helpful with suggestions. I would not hesitate going to this hotels restaurant.

Just know up front that this hotel doesn't have many bells and whistles. But it does have a very friendly and knowledgeable staff. The room was small but clean and had a great balcony view. It was quiet and the location is excellent - beach is literally across the street. It's also not terribly expensive. We would definitely stay here again!

My wife and I stayed here for a week over New Years, and switched rooms at one point, only due to how a cruise of our family was scheduled, and the front desk staff was extremely helpful in making the transition easy, which was fantastic especially due to my wife being pregnant! There was one staff member in particular, Kalehua, who was extremely welcoming to us! She made sure we had a good view of the ocean, a nice size bed to share, and even helped us decide on the best place to watch fireworks on New Years, eat local tacos on taco Tuesday, and gave advice on how to easily get around the city for shopping. Overall, a great hotel within walking distance of many sights and attractions, and a great staff that makes sure your trip is a relaxing and memorable one!

Awesome place and a Mecca for the activity pick ups, all tours pick up right out the front which is very handy, good atmosphere its all happening and the staff are brilliant. Housekeeping is great, and if you want coffee pods, towels or anything they are there with in seconds of hanging up the phone, a lovely man comes around door to door every morning offering coffee pods, cups, sugar and milk. Have stayed here twice, only downside is its a little towards the end of Waikiki but the price is with this in mind, its the best option for this price range, have no issues staying here and its directly on the beach, I wouldn't look anywhere else. We requested a room to be away from the lifts, this was accommodated and did not hear a sound for our entire stay. love it

Ive stayed here the last 3 summers (Australian summer holidays) , great location, a little quieter than up the road which i like, beach and other swimming options right there and better priced than a lot of others - staff always extremely helpful and upbeat

The hotel is in a fantastic location but needs a thorough overhaul. Rooms were basic as well as all hotel amenities. Staff were courteous and helpful and quick to respond to any concerns. Rating: Satisfactory - could be so much more

I came here on a last minute trip to Hawaii and this place does not disappoint. Not only is it cute and clean but its right on the beach. they provide towels, chairs and everything you need to have a fun day at the beach only steps away from the front door. Theres also a bar and grill that has live music, amazing fruity drinks and food thats next to the hotel pool. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfrtable and had an amazing view of the city. I would definitly stay here again in the future.

Located East of the Waikiki Strip,right across from the beach and near the zoo which is on the edge of the busy Waikiki area. The hotel adjoins Tiki’s which is a great restaurant and you are able to order food and drinks from Tikis from the hotel pool area. Staff were always accommodating and we were able to check in early after our flight got in at 7:30am.The hotel is clean and provides excellent hospitality. Glenn the hotel desk associate was very helpful and went beyond his duty to make sure a parcel that was delivered after our departure was redirected to us in Australia. The ocean view from 8th floor pool was breathtaking during the sunset, as it provided a great view of the Waikiki beach along the strip. There are plenty of nearby shopping and dining. An excellent stay for myself and my granddaughters.

3 nights here. We decided to spring for the upgrade after some cajoling from the lovely front desk ladies Connie and Jinsile. It was money well spent since we could enjoy the sunsets from our balcony. Elevators are hard to get used to, but the drinks at the Tiki bar makes up for it.

My wife and I stayed here for a few days before going to a timeshare. It was last minute and was expensive. It's older and could use a remodel but, it was clean and across the street from the beach. Our room was clean with a partial ocean view. They don't have PPV movies but, you get a card to rent unlimited DVD's. The Tiki lounge isn't that good

I will start by saying that I read the reviews and thought I knew what I was getting in to when we booked. We traveled during the very busy holidays, and while we would have preferred to stay in a condo-type room, this is where we ended up. I booked an Ocean View Aloha Suite with a lanai. While I realize not all rooms will have a view, or the same type of view, let me warn you as to what they consider "ocean view". Our room was on the 5th floor (528) facing Diamond Head. The lanai was probably about 18 inches deep, barely room for two people to stand. The "lanai" was also about 6 inches above a roof covered in bird droppings. There was an animal trap that appeared to be put together with miscellaneous things someone found in the garbage. The front desk said the "state does that to control the birds". Um ok. In addition to all that, there was virtually no view. Maybe if you stood on tippy toes and leaned out over the "lanai" you could get a glimpse of a couple palm trees and a little water. Not a view. Certainly not one to pay a premium for, which I did.The rooms are small. Beds are double beds, not queens. Bathroom is tiny and dated with very little counter space. The décor is blah, furniture is kind of beat up and old.After checking in, I called down and asked about the crummy view. "Not all rooms have views, sorry." I asked to be moved, even if it was the next day. "We have nothing available." I was offered a break on the resort fee and free breakfast, which was nice, but it didn't change that the last 4 days of our vacation (we were in Maui prior to arriving in Honolulu) was in this room with a lousy view. They said there was nothing they could do. We were very disappointed.I booked this trip through Costco. I called the next morning and asked if they could help. Their rep called the front desk, and what do you know? We were moved for the last two nights to a room with a lovely view and a real lanai (1427). This is what I expected for what I paid. We got a king instead of two beds, and used the sofa bed and a roll away for my mom and daughter, which worked out fine. Sean at the front desk went over and above to get us the room early in the day. He was professional, understanding, and super nice about the whole thing. Overall, I would say this is an ok place to stay. While outdated and in need of renovation, the rooms were clean. Housekeeping was friendly and very responsive to requests for towels, etc. The pool set up is strange and small, we didn't use it. But, the proximity to the beach is great, and the hotel providing towels and chairs is a nice amenity. The valet service is efficient and the guys are great, they even went to our car to get something we forgot. Make the view the priority when booking, it is what makes up for where the hotel lacks in other areas.Huge thanks to Sean...his efforts saved the last part of our trip. Mahalo!

Our family of 4 stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel for 5 nights Dec 2018 and we all loved this hotel very much.We downgraded from a suite to a standard double with beach views to save money and although a smaller room and only having two double beds we still had a very comfortable stay. We loved the location, which is directly across from the beach a an easy walk to all that Waikiki has to offer all with what I believe to be one of the best views of Waikiki Beach and it's amazing sunsets. ( beach view side of hotel other side still has some beach views with a great view of diamond head)Staff were excellent and at your call anytime, hotel had excellent free wifi, free loan of beach chairs and umbrellas for the beach, a nice pool, and great resturants attached to the hotel like Tiki bar and grill, and Wolfgangpuck express.

'My husband and I stayed here for six nights over the new year, this is by far the worst hotel I've stayed at. We had to move rooms three times and got locked out of our room twice because the door mechanism was broken. The Hotel is very dated, small and the pool area is not inviting. It is in a good location but very overpriced for what you get.

We spent Christmas 2018 and New Year in the Aston and the whole experience for our 12 days was lovely. The staff at the front led by Gina couldn't do enough to make our holiday experience memorable. The famous Waikiki Beach is a one minute walk while Kuhio Beach is right across the road, so you can either hang by the Hotel Pool or head across the road to the Beach for some sun-baking. The bus stop to go anywhere is right out front as well. It's a 1 minute walk to the Zoo and 5 minutes to the Aquarium. Would definitely recommend The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel to anyone.

Stayed here December 2018 comfortable and clean though a bit dated. We had an issue with the air conditioner and it was corrected straight away. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had a beach view - stunning. Great meals at Tikis.

Great location on the beach. Very small room and tiny bathroom. Service is average at best. Pool is way too small for size of hotel, shame as the beach in front has tons of jellyfish. Had a room with 2 beds for 3 adults, was like living on top of one another, no room to manoeuvre at all. Also not enough drawers and bed side table didn’t have a drawer. I would never stay in the motel style hotel ever again. Next door at the Marriott or round the corner at the Queen Kapiolani seem better options for about the same money. You have been warned.

There are a few things missing with this property ~ but, there is so much that makes up for it! They don't have room service or a spa and lack laundry facilities but still is an economical place in an ideal location. The housekeeping staff is very attentive and make the rooms fresh and clean daily. The coffee maker is a nice touch in the room and the small refrigerator is great to stock up on drinks and fruit. We enjoyed the Tiki Bar and the Wolfgang Puck food was very tasty at both places. There was a nice spot out front of the hotel for trolley pickup and airport transportation. We were out and about daily and didn't really need the full resort experience and appreciated the savings on the room rate. We had a nice view of the water from our balcony and we loved the sunrise & sunset views. The room is on the small side and the television was difficult to navigate without any clue where the networks were located. Check in and check out were very easy and any time that I needed help from the front desk, they were very helpful. I dealt with Mia during the check in and she was very nice to let me look at the room choices before we upgraded to a partial ocean view room ~ I really appreciated that effort on her part. Jin was very kind to replace our room keys and give me an extra for our granddaughter who was there with her basketball team and needed access to our room while we were out. I think that the front desk staff tries hard to remember their guests and help with any special requests.

We spent two nights in this establishment from December 23 and just checked out this morning. As the other reviewers had mentioned, the hotel is located directly across the beach and ocean view room with a small lanai has a nice view of the beach. The room is quiet small with an outdated bathroom; the wall is quiet thin, but we still had decent rest. Instead of heading off to the other islands or mainland for Christmas, we decided to do a staycation on the island. As expected, you pay for the view and location, if you are looking for somewhere that is modern and luxurious, this is not the place. The valet parking is $35 per day with tax, resort fee is about $37 and the ocean room is about $260 per night, so you are looking at $330 per night, which is still relatively cheap in comparison with likes of Hyatt or Sheraton in the vicinity. Overall, we had a decent stay, the staff are courteous and friendly, but the premises definitely is in desperate need of an overhaul of the room.

Stayed here for 8 nights in an oceanfront room. Magnificent views over the ocean completely unobstructed. Is in a great location. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Pool deck is a lot of fun to relax and swim. Only issue was tour desk trying to get us to go to a timeshare at another hotel. Didn’t detract from the hotel itself but a little annoying. Would stay here again.

Had to wait half hour in a queue to check in on arrival and then got hit with a resort tax of 35 USD per night PLUS tax. Still, we did get a free plastic water bottle each and were allowed to borrow a beach towel for the beach!!!On the whole the room was clean and comfortable with fridge and coffee making facilities. The beach was just over the road and all shops were within walking distance. The pool wasn't the largest in the world but not many people were using the pool area when we were there.

We've stayed at this hotel several times over the last 10 years. I really liked it when we first started staying here. Staff were friendly, rooms were clean and up to date and you got free breakfast with live music and a Hawaiian dancer. Over the years, the property has gone downhill. They clearly need to renovate the rooms, particularly the bathrooms. They've gotten rid of the breakfast and music without decreasing the price. And the front desk staff are unhappy, no smiles or pleasantries and just seemed miserable. I like the location and the rooms were clean. We also loved getting to see the Friday night fireworks from our balcony. But we'll look at other hotels when we return to Waikiki.

My son was visiting from Kauai so I thought it would be nice to get him a room at a hotel in Waikiki right across from the beach. I discovered that Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel has a great Kamaaina rate! When we arrived at the front desk a warm and jovial desk agent by the name of Kalehua invited us to come over. She was so friendly and made us feel welcomed :) I asked if it was possible to get upgraded and she said we already did. Then she looked at what room they upgraded my son too and then upgraded him again! She asked if he would like the top floor and he said that would be great! The room was outstanding with a beautiful ocean view, my son was very happy to stay there. If you book a room here, make sure you ask for the lady with the most Aloha spirit.. Kalehua….she is one of a kind!!!!

PROS: The location/view alongside a few staff members was the only highlight of the trip.CONS: Upon checkin, they processed my card at reception however told me it did not go through. They then attempted to put the fee (which was $700) through a second time, but when doing this they added on a few extra 00's and tried to process a fee of $70000. This caused severe headaches and problems for my husband and I as our bank blocked our card and froze our account. This meant I couldn't use my card properly over there for the duration of my stay. I had 6 direct debtis not be processed properly resulting in multiple late fees charged to my account, my amazon account was cancelled and I had to get into contact with family back home to resolve these problems. I was only offered a measly amount of money off my booking which was not good enough considering the amount of drama I had to deal with for an issue that wasn't my fault. I'm very disappointed with this whole experience. This was my first international holiday away in 30 years and I was looking forward to relaxing with my husband and celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. This time away was instead spent on the phone to numerous companies trying to sort out payments and Card issues.

This is a very nice large hotel. It is not new, but this building will well maintained and most of the areas are very new and very high quality materials. Several places to eat or have a drink while overlooking the beach.

Was great service by the staff, so close go the waikiki beach, loved it! It's an old hotel, but the bathroom and all were veryclean, staff was so helpful with my amazon deliveries (heheh), and so my whole hawaii trip was superb!

Aloha! We really enjoyed our 4 nights at this hotel. Yes, as others have mentioned in their reviews, the hotel is old. We really don't care about old, we care about clean and a top location with a fantastic view. We booked a premium ocean front room and were so glad we did! Fantastic location with uninterrupted views of the ocean. A small balcony but we did not have anyone stay in the rooms either side of us, that we know of, so the balcony was very private. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I am a terrible sleeper usually, but slept fine here. We spent most days exploring Oahu and came back to our room to catch the sunset each night while enjoying a mai tai cocktail. We thought the cost of our room was reasonable considering the excellent location. A tip for people complaining they did not get the ocean view they wished for - you need to book and pay for 'oceanfront', then you will not be disappointed. The staff on reception, concierge and tour desk were all helpful and we are still using our complimentary drink bottles today. Tiki's Bar & Grill at the bottom of the hotel has excellent food, drinks and service.We have stayed at Waikiki before in a different hotel who fairly recently did a total upgrade, then tripled their rates. That hotel now has no soul and we are glad we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel as it still retains the 'old Hawaii' atmosphere. Mahalo Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel! And thank you for our complimentary bottle of bubbly for our wedding anniversary, very thoughtful! Mahalo!!

It is in pretty good condition for its age but the paint job did a lot. It shows that the hotel has been around for a while. We had trouble regulating the thermostat. The maid kept the room spotless. Their valets downstairs did a really good job.. We had a very good experience with the crew of the check in desk. It would be nice if charging port were provided tn the 1st floor area.

We were really disappointed in the accomodation for the price we paid. The Aston is in a great location however in desperate need of a renovation! On arrival we paid our daily fee which we were aware off. We were then offered to pay and extra USA$50 for an ocean view room in which we had already paid in Australia for! We were advised that it was a partial ocean view and this would be front on..... Not impressed at all. The room was so old and dated. Our coffee machine never worked, we had to ask to have chairs and table for our balcony as there was nothing out there, we had an ice machine at our door making a terrible noise 24/7. Unfortunately we would not recommend the Aston to anyone.

Just as in past years, we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for the Honolulu Marathon. We sorely miss the breakfast at poolside where we can gather with our friends also staying here to commiserate or congratulate each other. The free paper is a plus because it's so easy to forget to keep up with what's going on around you. Look for the Kamaaina Package for savings. The front desk staff were very efficient and helpful - yes, there was the dreaded check in line in the afternoon. Beds were comfortable and we got great sleep before and after the marathon. Having a pasta restaurant in the hotel was great for pre-marathon meals too. Having a HagenDaaz makes for super post marathon treats. Definitely looking forward to staying here again. Addendum: The Hotel was recently purchased and a few things have changed. Parking is only 1/2 off when a Kamaaina Package is purchased. Hagen Daaz is no longer there but cookie corner is there. Starbucks is just around the corner - so convenient.

We were greeted with a smile at the front desk from Gibson. He answered all our questions, and was very friendly. Helped us locate some good restaurants with friendly jokes and eased any of our worries about our stay.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is in a perfect location. Great view of the beach from my hotel room. The valet service was extremely helpful and efficient. Registration was very smooth and Gibson ensured our stay would be more than comfortable. He was very professional and courteous.

The hotel staff have been an amazing help especially Gibson who went out of his way to make our stay even more amazing. He was very nice and assisted us in every way. Beautiful clean rooms, close to everything and an all round lovely place to stay. Highly recommend!

Although a dated hotel with dated decor- it was clean which is the main thing. Friendly and helpful staff. The beach was less than 5 minutes across the road, the Waikiki trolley bus stop was outside the hotel which was a great bonus and it got us to all the major sites - ala Moana, Iolani palace, pearl harbour, bishop museum. Zoo and Aquarium within walking distance too. The tiki bar was a great little bar with good music and food every night. From here you can walk up the Kalākaua Ave and up to the eateries on kapahulu ave- Leonard’s bakery, zippy, rainbow drive through, Popeyes.Still miffed about the ‘resort fees’ thou. All in all a great hotel and we will be back

We were quickly and early booked into our Premier Ocean Front Room by the amazing Gibson. He clearly explained the hotel facilities, local attractions, eateries and tips for our stay. Our rooms view was amazing - daily room services efficient and staff in general extremely friendly. Poolside extras such as frozen slushies and fruit were a bonus. Easy towel and chair bookings made going to the beach a bonus. AWBH is situated far enough away from the bustle of the busy area but only a 5-10minute walk along the beach to them. We found food trucks, local markets and back street shops to eat at. Situated beside AWBH was an ABC shop for daily yoghurt and cereal for a quick breakfast, Subway for lunch and Starbucks for coffee and snacks all day. Out front the tram trucks and double decker buses pick up and drop off to visit many local attractions - at $2 per trip per person - the Waikiki Trolley took us to AloaMoana Shopping Centre to shop to our hearts content with great bargains to be found. We will definitely be returning to AWBH.

Gibson at the front desk was awesome. He was super friendly and extremely helpful finding transportation and food to eat. Room was very nice. Clean, nothing fancy except the balcony\ (overlooking pool and a glimpse of the ocean).Only part I wasn't a fan of was the resort fee.

We three took a 5 day trip to this hotel & area. The hotel was great - service, extras, rooms, views from our ocean front room. Hotel has 2 eating areas. On the street near is Denny's, Subway, Burger King & McDonalds for small meals. The beach is right across the street as is The Zoo & Aquaraim. Hotel has a great tour desk that we used 4 times & was pleased with all. Many places to go to & you are picked up at or near this Hotel.. Do not rent a car (Parking is expensive)& tours give you lots of HI history..This is our 2nd time at this Hotel & would recommend it to all!!

Great place to stay right on the beach. We had a balcony looking at the beach fabulous for sunsets! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Trollwy stop right outside hotel makes easy to get around. Would definitely recommend Rooms very clean!!

The wife and I have stayed here many times over the years Thris was our 58 years been together We flue in From NV.We were asked for a ocean veiiw we got a room with a little veiw the room was got in very good shape The bath room was got clean We were there one day. i paid for seven We got a call that morning that our son is in the hospital with heart failure, That day we booked a flight home When we checked out the manger said no refund then wanted to charge room tax for the seven days he was bad. I pulled out $500 more plus $3000.00 for the trip we booked this three months in advance my wife called from PORTLAND airport for a room they said they were no rooms that is double dipping

My friend and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 6 nights in November. I thought the hotel was great! It was by far the most affordable hotel close to the beach (it's literally right across the street). Yes it's an older hotel, however it was more than adequate. We booked an Ocean View room and were on the 24th floor. The view of Diamond Head and the beach were fantastic! The room was very clean and spacious, had a small balcony, a big TV, wifi, an in-room safe, fridge, coffee machine, etc. The beds were really comfortable and it was quiet at night.The pool at hotel was lovely - we would visit the beach in the morning and then when it got a bit hot for us we went to the pool for a while, as it is in the shade until the early afternoon. The hotel has towels and chairs you can use and take to the beach. I didn't love the $35 US resort fee, however I was aware of it when I chose this hotel.We did eat at Wolfgang Puck Express a couple of times which was good, as well as the Tiki Restaurant located right beside the pool. You can actually get nice views of the beach from the restaurant, depending on where you are sitting.Our flight back to Vancouver was not until 11:30pm so we were able to arrange a late checkout (for $75) and had our room until 6pm, which worked out perfectly.There are so many great restaurants in the area (there is an Italian Restaurant one block from the hotel which was fantastic, and not too expensive either), as well as shopping (I dare you to count all the ABC Stores in Waikiki, lol). I was able to buy a beach umbrella from ABC for $18 to use at the beach which was perfect, as the hotel does not have beach umbrellas for guests to use.The hotel is near the end of Kalakaua Avenue, so it's less busy there which was nice. There is a nice park right next to the hotel and getting to Diamond Head is easy as it's not far from the hotel at all.Overall I was really pleased with this hotel - all of the staff we encountered were so friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is very nice, with the rooms and hotel being very well kept. The pool by the check-in desk was very nice, and the frozen fruit we were served was a nice touch. By the pool is a giant connect four and giant Jenga, which was very fun to play with. The movie rental system that the hotel had was another nice touch. The destination dispatch style elevators where you select your floor before entering the elevator was a nice feature and was easy to use. I would gladly stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel.

We had a negative experience with Nina at front desk. We had requested a late checkout. She said that they couldn't do so as the hotel was completely sold out. I showed her the many different room types available for that night, off their website. Then she agreed to let us checkout late (at 6 pm) for a $75+tax extra charge. I would have preferred that she was honest about the fact that the hotel was not sold out for that day/night. We got the Aloha suite. It is not really a suite. It is just one room. Just maybe a larger room. Also, while the website claimed ocean views for the Aloha suite, it was just a partial side view, and that too only from the lanai. On the plus side - the Tiki bar was just awesome. Good drinks, friendly bartenders, good music, and crowd.

We are currently staying in hotel on floor 9. Don’t pay for “partial view”. Balcony tiny and “view” is of dirty parking lot. Rooms are not updated. Bathrooms are disgusting and we are showering with our beach shoes on. Dead bugs in vanity lights and faucet drips. Walls very thin. We have two children and can hear every conversation in hallway. Beds are very firm and bedding is minimal. Facility location is good. However a lot nicer hotels on beach for same $.

The hotel itself is very well kept and makes you feel welcome. Gibson checked us in and he absolutely made our stay extra special with an upgrade to a king suite with an ocean view. Our room came with a double balcony to view Waikiki beach and diamond head while we made coffee using a single serve keurig so coffee that was in our room. Complimentary water bottles were provided and water filling stations are easily located on the 1st and 3rd floors, which we used to fill the keurig. The elevator system is a bit awkward at first but after you scan your key card, you type in your floor and the panel assigns an elevator to you, which actually makes it convenient to avoid overcrowding in the elevators. Room service and coffee is provided every morning and you can request extra k-cups and cream/sugar packets if you’re a heavy coffee drinker. The hotel is also conveniently located down the street from local food spots, the Honolulu zoo, and bars.This was honestly the best vacation I’ve ever had, waking up to the sounds of the ocean waves crashing on the shore as sunrise hits the diamond head ridge is perfect for couples to take in and appreciate. Highly recommended!

This hotel was recommended by our travel agent but I have to say we enjoyed the Park Shore around the corner more. This is a moderately priced hotel at the diamond head end of Waikiki Beach. Access to the beach is across the road. The view was awesome but the room had 2 double beds (not our first choice) and the dresser and table and chairs was lined up across the other side of the room. It was very cramped feeling meaning too much furniture and poor layout. We also did not like the security measures. It was difficult and time consuming to swipe a card and your floor every time and wait for the specific elevator. Sometimes it was so busy it wouldn't take your floor. Specifically, the last night we were in the room at 4 in the morning we heard a horrific noise coming from the room above us. It was a horrific scratching noise that woke both of us from a sound sleep. We both got up and checked the vents and bathroom convinced something was trying to get into the room. Not an experience we wish to repeat.

Stayed here 6-13 November 2018. Will try to do this in point form (pardon typos as I'm using a tablet which I am not quite used to yet)Location: great location directly across the street from the walled in area of Waikiki Beach which made us feel safe relaxing on float tubes. Variety of restaurants at street level and other places such as Danny's, Burger King etc a short walk away. Close to bus stops and Honolulu Zoo.Room: had a room on 15th floor with wonderful view of Waikiki Beach. Great place to watch surfers in distance and Friday night fireworks. We found the room a decent size for the 2 of us and it was very clean. We had a small issue of the pin lock on the patio Door not working part way through our stay. Stopped at front desk to let them know on our way out to supper. When we came back an hour later it was all fixed. Keurig machine in room with K-cups replenished each day - was wonderful to have coffee and sit on balcony. Facilities: pool area was nice. Pool never seemed crowded. A few afternoons that we were at the pool they came around with flavoured shaved ice or a frozen grape and pineapple dessert cup. Towels and beach chairs available for sign out. Staff: the staff was very friendly and efficient. Always an "Aloha" and a smile. Mia checked us in and was wonderful. Glenn checked us out at the end. Our housekeeper Zeneaida was sweet. Check out day: check out is at noon but many flights don't leave until very late at night. After check out you can put your luggage into the bell services on the 1st floor but you can still use the facilities such as the pool and washrooms until your transport arrives to take you to the airport. We really appreciated this so we enjoyed an extra 8 hours of pool and lounge chair time.A couple of suggestions: (1) would be nice if there were 2 chairs on balcony so we could both sit out together. (2) realize there are smoking laws but it would be nice if the hotel could create a designated smoking section that only hotel guests could access. Some of the homeless that approached us looking for cigarettes, money etc made us feel uncomfortable/nervous.Summary: good value for location and amenities. Would stay here again no problem at all. There may be hotels that have bigger rooms and more glitz, but friendliness and enthusiasm of the staff here is the true value found at this hotel.

A bunch of us went to Honolulu for weekend shopping. There was a trade show on Veterans Day weekend. Upon checking in we were offered an upgrade to 2 bedroom suite. Staff was friendly and helpful. Earlier complaints were slow elevators but we never waited long. We had beautiful views of diamond head as well as the ocean. Definitely recommend Aston Waikiki Beach to everyone

Motel is definitely not a 5 star hotel, but for a vacation it's okay. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms small, but very clean. My wife and I very pleased. The location on the beach is definitely a plus.

What a MESS. This hotel is located at one of the most touristic areas of the island which is great and convenient for may, they have some cool outdoor like lobby where overviewing of the pool is a gift as you come in. HERE IS THE MESS THOUGH, the service at the checkin is very disorganized, people here do not know information about reservations and more than one person has to get involved at the time just for checkin!Another crazy time here and this one will take some time for the rant is the ELEVATORS, this place has the weirdest elevator system I have ever seen and I must say I did not like it at ALL. You SACN YOUR KEY and get an elevator letter, once that door opens you go in and it will take you to your floor. The only good thing I saw with this system is the fact that you avoid a long elevator ride and at worse will be stoping only a couple of times before your own flair. BUT THERE ARE SO MANY NEGATIVES HERE: - This hotel is pretty busy so you may endure a line to scan you card to find out what elevator you on!!! This is insane!!!!! - If you do not have your key….. no access to the elevator, this is again a very busy hotel so you may have to endure a line to get a new key and now a line to get on the elevator. - Going down the elevator is as weird as going up, now you need to press a button # to get you down but nobody tell you!!! - You want friends to come to your room??? Nope! You need to go down to get them, cause they need to SCAN A KEY!!!The list of inconveniences is vast here with these elevators.The room is pretty great, I had a partial view of the beach and it was amazing to see the sunset from my balcony. This hotel also houses one of the most yelp stared restaurant bars of the island so that is definitely a plus. This hotel had some great things to it as far as location, accommodations and some of the amenities, but I think that here the pice does not justify as this place has too many negatives that by a long shot out weights the good things. I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

The location was fabulous!! A short walk across the street to the beach! Lots of affordable restaurants nearby and an easy walk to others on the main street! Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Gift shop, pool, restaurants on premises. My friend and I were in a room on the 24th floor and the view of the beach, water and the hotels were just spectacular. So easy to walk in and around our hotel to find shops and restaurants.

In the heart of Honolulu, across the street from Waikiki Beach, and close to all the beautiful sites Oahu has to offer. The rooms are outdated and a bit old and small, very basic. We we on the 16th floor with a "partial ocean view", wasn't horrible. The resort and valet fees are ridiculously expensive. The location is amazing. The staff was very friendly, welcoming and always helpful. Would stay again, mainly for the great location!

This is our 3 rd trip to Hawaii from Australia- this hotel is tired room wise they need an update for sure but the location, access to beach, Tikis bar, access to transport & the staff are outstanding - would stay here again. Recommend getting an ocean view on a high floor - we were 18 th as the pool & bar can be loud but fun! Not the cheapest or the flashiest but great great location. Pics are the view from our room. Just cross the stress & beach is right there waiting.

This was a great hotel! Gibson was great upon check in. Really made the effort to provide an enjoyable experience by going the extra mile. The hotel is located at the end of the main strip. Takes no more that 20minutes to walk to the other end. Tons of shops and restaurants to stop at in between. Rooms were clean, just a little outdated. Pool deck is right beside hotel check in and the Tiki restaurant. And the pool deck doesn’t get sun until 1pm. Overall great stay and I would stay again.

Kind of average. Starting to show its age. Have never been to a hotel where the room didn't have a chair to sit on. There was a high table with 2 backless, rectangular stools. Very uncomfortable to watch TV.Having said that, the location is pretty good, right across the street from the beach. Not the main Waikiki beach, but a sheltered beach, very good for children as there are no large waves or rip tide.

In late September 2018 my daughter and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel in a premier oceanfront room for one week for our first trip to Hawaii. We then went on to cruise home to Sydney via French Polynesia and New Zealand.The view from our full lanai was stunning and well worth the extra cost for this room in my opinion. It made me constantly “feel” I was finally in Hawaii. We would often sit on the balcony with a view that changed constantly depending on the time of day. I never tired of it. The hotel is located adjacent to the Park Shore Hotel and the Zoo in the quieter end of Waikiki. It was an easy 10-minute walk to Waikiki central. My daughter and I always felt safe walking home at night. The staff at this hotel were friendly, helpful and professional at all times. There was availability on arrival to pay $USD60 for an early check in which was much appreciated after arriving from Sydney at 6am. Those overnight flights are brutal if you can’t sleep on a plane (like me). Check in (which is usually 3pm) and check out (usually midday) was super easy and fast. Natasha at the front desk made us feel very welcome. We ended up checking out earlier and just left our keys in a drop box. The pool area was very pleasant and good for a quick dip after a full day out touring. The hotel has a shuttle service that we used to get to Pearl Harbour, $USD32 return which was on time in an air-conditioned mini bus. Great value for me. The WIFI worked beautifully with no issues except that it was dicey trying to summon an Uber from the street as you need an internet connection to do so and it didn’t quite have reception that far. I enjoyed swimming at Kuhio Beach across the road to cool down on many occasions. The ocean was refreshing and not cold. You could check out towels and deck chairs without charge which I felt was a very good service. The Outrigger on The Beach charges you by the hour I believe. On check in, you can collect an Aston water bottle at the pool area that you can fill with iced water and then there are ice machines on some floors, including ours, to refill it as needed. One thing about this hotel is that there is no room service and we knew that when we booked. It didn’t bother us in the least because there were 2 ABC stores, a Wolfgang Puck Express, a Jamba Juice, a cookie store and a Subway on the ground level.Tikis grill in the pool area was lovely too. Independent of the hotel. You could have a light meal by the pool with drinks or dine in the restaurant for a more a la carte menu. There was nightly music and entertainment. We were on the 10th floor and the music was enjoyable, not intrusive.For a lovely Italian meal, I can recommend Arancino Di Mare just one block from the Aston. Beautiful food at moderate prices. A nice change from the American type food available everywhere in Waikiki. The portions are smaller however I prefer quality over quantity. The lifts at the Aston are unique. I won’t explain here except to say that they worked well. We never waited long. Every day you get two pods of coffee for the in-room coffee machine. I really appreciated this perk. Newspapers are available on every floor every morning. One more thing. I so enjoyed my first time in Hawaii that I am going back again in June 2019 and the hotel are giving me 20% off the advertised rate as a returning customer. That is very good customer service. Of course, it will be in a premier oceanfront room.

The hotel was in a good position. The hotel itself was very tired and could do with a bit of sprucing up. The rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable.The staff were very friendly and helpful.

As with many of the hotels in the area, this hotel is worn and needs to be remodeled. I've stayed here multiple times based on location and price (I stayed previously as well in July 2018) and each room seems to have the same issues, however for fairness I am now specifically rating room 1721 which is considered to be a premium room, as follows: The tile and grout in the bathroom need to be cleaned.The bathroom has yellow tile that was painted over with white wall paint on one side and left yellow on the remaining sides. The towels are course and thread bare. The door sticks when shut and needs maintenance. The closet doors squeak and the safe inside the closet doesn't work.The carpet in the room and hallway is old thin and dirty. Air from the open air hallway enters the room through the worn out gaskets around the door.The sliding glass door is not sealed correctly to the building opening and when the door is closed the outside air enters the room.Noise from 17 floors below can be heard when the sliding door is shut due to the worn out gaskets and lack of sealing of the sliding door to the building. Air entering the rooms from the hallway and the sliding doors prevents the room air conditioning unit from cooling the room.If you want to sit on the balcony you can see in the next room as there is no partition between the balcony to allow for privacy and noise reduction.The room could use some sound proofing so you don't hear the guests above, below and on either side through the walls, floor and ceiling.When I was younger I was a member of a college fraternity and staying at this hotel allows me the opportunity to re-experience my college years!

The hotel was fairly easy to navigate to check-in. Upon check-out it was not as easy to navigate. I had to ask the front desk and was instructed to put room keys in a checkout box. We were upgraded from a standard room to a room with a partial oceanview which was great to show my boys on their first day/night in Hawaii. Staff was friendly and were quick to retrieve our car from the valet lot. It was great for a one night stay in Waikiki.

Located East of the Waikiki Strip. The hotel is clean and provides excellent hospitality. Gibson the hotel desk associate was very helpful and will guide you throughout your stay. The view from the 3rd floor pool area was breathtaking during the sunset, as it provided a great view of the Waikiki beach along the strip. There are plenty of nearby shopping and dining.

We have stayed at this property for almost 20 years in an oceanfront room. The property and service have always been great, but this year the customer service was exceptional.There was a mix-up in our reservation with the travel site that instead booked us in an ocean view room. Sean worked diligently to see to it that we were moved to the oceanfront room we preferred. His customer service skills were exceptional. Mahalo Sean! We will be back next year.

The location is wonderful, right across the street from the Waikiki beach. The pool area is nice snd very clean. There is no room service, which is a huge drawback. You cannot charge things to your room from the pool snack bar, the bar/restaurant near the pool or the convenience store on the first floor. These are all real limitations. The TVs in the room are not that easy to figure out and there are no real instructions. They have a free DVD rental service, which is a nice perk. But using the PS4 to play the DVDs is not that easy. We used our computer. Our first room was a disaster, the two beds were tiny and we needed to upgrade, which was not that big of a problem, though it cost $40 a day. But that money was well worth it. We were upgraded to a suite with a good, but not great, view, because they ran out of the ocean view rooms I paid to upgrade to. The suite was comfortable and nice. The only thing old about the room was the bathroom, which could use an upgrade. The maid service was really great; the women work very hard and do a nice job. We had a clogged bathtub one day that I reported, and it was fixed with a note when we returned. It is a real overcharge to charge $35 a day for parking. It also is a little ridiculous to share the resort fee. It was also supposed to be no smoking, though I smelled the thick sweet stench of marijuana smoke in the hallway almost every evening, I don't really care but why have the policy if you let this happen without consequence? All of the staff with whom I dealt were very nice and helpful. I did see people in arguments about things, but that did not happen to us. I wish they had bartenders taking orders around the pool. I wish the snack bar by the pool could be charged to the room, as well as the bar and convenience store on 1. But that is their deal. I would really say this is a 3 1/2, but it is closer to a 4 than 3.

We stayed here for three nights in an ocean front room before boarding the Pride of America. I liked the location although it’s a little further from the heart of Waikiki. I found it to be good value for money, great views from the balcony.I loved swimming across the road in the ocean baths (Waikiki walls?). I left some expensive items of clothing hanging in the wardrobe on checkout and was very relieved to discover that they had been put aside for me when I returned to Waikiki seven days later. The only negative was the shower. I had to crouch down low to get under it. My partner is even taller so his shower time wasn’t very enjoyable.

We stayed at the Aston for 5 days it was great. The hotel is an older style hotel but clean and tidy the staff were great we had an ocean front room I would recommend these rooms for the view alone all in all it was a good stay plus it is quieter up that end of waikiki.

We stayed 5 night at Aston Waikiki beach hotel, the location is great and close to all shopping and also close to other activity on east side of the island, reception employee named " Kalchua" was very kind and helpful and She upgrade our room for free and gave us lot of useful information about Island.

I had a good experience here in this hotel. I come as a helper for my tribal elders. They like this hotel so, we've stayed here several times. They are close to ocean, have a pool. Small fridge in room. My only complaint is the Pleasant activities center on the 3rd floor. We scheduled a trip to Polynesian center and they gave us a Wrong time, the girl behind the desk Nelly was Very Rude and she gave our vouchers to someone else, who wasn't in our reservation..the girl said she said she was my sister..I said I dont understand why you would do that. She just continued to be rude with me, I asked to speak to a Manager and she refused to call the manager or give me a number. I wont be using them again.

Great location and really nice stay. It had all of the basics and the customer service was what I’d expect. The prices were a little high, even after we got a good discount. The room was a little dated and there were people smoking weed on their lanai’s, which made our room smell like weed, even with the door shut. That was REALLY unfortunate. The ocean view was really nice in our ocean front room. We tried to make the best out of our lanai and the view.

We chose this hotel from recommendations and some reviews, however I felt very let down.We had requested and paid for an ocean view, we did get one but not the full front view that we thought we were getting. On arrival I was told that we had been upgraded and I asked what the upgrade was and the reply was that they had moved us up a floor for an ocean view. Mmmm had booked and paid for ocean view. The room was small,very outdated and the bathroom tlle floor was filthy. The toilet was very low to the ground, not good for tall people, we found as we were also facing the street side where transport stopped directly outside that it was very noisy.. Each time we tried to get a dvd the cards would not work,finally got a dvd to find that it couldn't be played on the Tv, had to get the technician in ..waste of time...supposed treats at the pool ..we never saw any in the 5 days we were there. Card for elevator in foyer would not work technician said it was demagnetised, no it wasn't, as we took escalator to 3rd floor and it worked. Bell hop was was totally uninterested in helping us with a request when we were told to go to him by other staff member for assistance..international calls were blocked even though we had complimentary 60 min free calls. Rude bar tender (can elaborate if need be) Very average hotel, however on the plus side the location was good as it was right on the beach and had cafes and ABC shops nearby and an easy stroll to restaurants and major shops.I

After a finacial mix up at the start our holiday here was well worth the money. Get an ocean front premier room for tge views. The rooms are basic but have everything you need. Th e tiki bar diwn stairs is awesome with great views drinks and entertainment every night. The positiin is optimal for families with the beach across the road the zoo 100 metres around the corner Starbucks ABC store and subway. Wolfgang pucks is downstairs but value for money id give it a miss. Small over inflated menu pricewise. Pizza had better at safeway. Apart from that the staff are friendly at the hotel. Housekeeping do a great job and its a lot cheaper than the other end of waikiki.

We were placed in this hotel due to employees striking at the hotel in our booking. Was a great location right on the beach, we had an ocean view room and it was so nice sitting on the balcony. They provided dvd rentals and bottled water. The room was clean although the bathroom was old. Housekeeping was efficient. Reception staff were helpful.

First time traveller to Hawaii and this place has the goods. At the end of the Main Street and near the zoos means you’re not in the busiest part and the beach out the front is great for swimming.Although the hotel is older it gets 5 stars for the service and location and the staff make up for where the hotel decor lacks

We have just check in to celebrate our 20th anniversary and what a fabulous place to stay room is an oceanfront 1029 and so much space it is a little out dated but still nice and everything you need, on arrival you get reusable water bottle complimentary and unlimited movies all included even though we didn't bring our kids there is a PS3 in the room as well. So far so good, but the best thing is our view

Right across from beach. Next to zoo. Great view of diamond head and ocean. There are a couple of things in the room that could be fixed. Balcony door was so tough to open. We got moved from one room to another and in both rooms the faucet in bathroom sink didn’t just shut off when you moved handle down. We had to find the perfect spot to make it stop dripping. Staff is wonderful. You can check out beach chairs and towels to take to the beach. Tiki’s bar and grill is right on hotel grounds. Elevator is a bit tricky if you’ve never been there. Lobby is 3rd floor but you need to pay attention when you press the button because it will let you know then what elevator to take. You can’t access any room floors without your room key which I think it’s an excellent security feature.

Stayed 2 nights. Excellent service, right across the street from the beach, outstanding views of Waikiki. Restaurant located onsite as well as a Subway, Wolfgang Puck, Cookie Corner, ABC store and other shops located just outside on the ground floor. One minor detail, the toilets are VERY low to the floor, like they were made for an extremely short person. If you're tall, your knees may touch your ears. Very odd. About 15" high. Our room faced west with full frontal view of the ocean. View was outstanding but it does get warm in the afternoon even with the air conditioner on full blast. Elevators are also unusual in that you select your floor prior to getting in car. Everyone gets their own elevator car so that can cause delays. Hotel also has it's own very well stocked gift/grocery. Small but has most everything one would need.Would definitely stay again!!

We had a great stay here. Staff was wonderful. Room was clean and kept clean and stocked with fresh towels daily. Love having beach towels and chairs to take across the street to beach. Valet service great and very punctual. Would definitely stay there again.

We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel, right on Kuhio Beach, and only a few steps from Waikiki Beach itself. The rooms were spacious and there was a great restaurant/bar right in the hotel. We think it was a great deal for the money - and the convenience!

The hotel is older and the wait for elevators could be a whole but we were pleased with just our standard room with king bed. It was clean and provided a little fridge. We paid a little more to ensure oceanfront not just ocean view and it was worth it.
