The location is great and offers small pool with a restaurant/bar so you can have drinks at pool with games like Jenga and shuffle board. Provides chairs and towels for the beach as well. The parking costs was a bit much so we decided against a car which happy we did because one wasn’t needed. We would stay here again. Also provided a little gift for our anniversary which was thoughtful.

I recently stayed in a partial ocean view room and the views were absolutely breathtaking. The hotel is just a street across from Waikiki beach and in walking distance from food, cafes, shopping and the zoo. The staff were very helpful, polite and always smiling. The hotel restaurant (Tiki’s) had nice food and on Thursday’s have a band and traditional dancers - which put a nice and cultural touch to the evening meal. The pool area looks out over the beach and you are sure to see an epic sunset. The hotel offers free beach towels and free beach chairs available everyday. The room was always clean and well presented. The only thing I can fault this hotel for was the bathrooms, they were a little outdated and the faucets leaked a bit, however still very clean and useable. I will definitely be staying at this hotel on my next visit, as overall it was an exceptional stay.

Our room faced the ocean. The balcony was really awesome! Beautiful sunsets each night. At the end of the strip so there was privacy. The hotel is old and need some updating. The carpet In The hallway may be the ugliest carpet I’ve ever seen, haha.

Expensive for 2 night stay for what we got. The room was kinda dirty and there were bugs in it. I wouldn’t stay here again. No coffee or breakfast and parking was expensive. Also paid extra for ocean View and could hear tiki bar music late at night. Good location though.

The hotel is a great location across from the beach and a relatively good price. With that being said, the lobby area and elevators and hallways are open air in a very humid climate making it feel more like a motel, the bathrooms were disgusting, and maid service was a bit rude to us when she came to clean after we came back from spending the morning out and about. We had an ocean view room which had a lovely view but we were too scared to go on the lanai as it felt unsafe. The bathrooms were old and dated, which is okay, but they also were filthy with stains everywhere (the non permanent and perfectly cleanable with a good scrub variety) and were really tiny. Because of this we were so uncomfortable being in there. Being across from Waikiki Beach it was super convenient for washing off the sand, so perhaps that’s why the bathrooms were in such bad shape. Nonetheless, this ruined our stay there and we retreated to another hotel for a few nights of our stay (which was 300x better). The front desk was friendly and helpful however. The ocean view room was tiny and uncomfortable for two adults and a toddler. We will be upgrading to a ocean front room when we return for the remainder of our non-refundable “let’s make the best of it” stay which looks to be bigger and (hopefully cleaner) and will update our review at that time.

After staying at the Aston Kaanapali on Maui I was hoping this next hotel would be comparable. Nope. Dated. Depressing. Tiny room, horrible hard cheap foam pillows, wish I was somewhere else. The pool area, adjacent reception, looks like a concrete afterthought, hardly conjures up relaxation and reward for working like a navvy. Unfortunately am here for 2 more nights. Even the chuffing DVD machine doesn't work; wonder it's "free"! Flippin hopeless. There have got to be better places than this in Waikiki people!

Stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach with my 13 year old son for eight nights, its located in a great location straight across the road from Waikiki beach and only a short walk from the heart of Waikiki. There are a number of restaurants and ABC stores nearby. We stayed in room 2128 with a partial ocean view, the room its self is a bit dated, however nice enough. The balcony was very small being only able to put one stool out there, not a chair just a stool. The staff are nice enough and check in was fine. One of the issues I found in the room is that there isn’t really anywhere to hang your wet swimmers, etc. The pool is very small, which didn’t really matter to us as we spend all of our time over at the beach. They supply towels and chairs for the beach which is great. I found it a good place for our stay and If I come back to Hawaii would have no hesitation staying here again.

waiKIKI do you love me (best drake verision).The hotel is located on the Waikiki beach strip. The beach is just a few steps from the hotel (not a beach resort). Rooms were clean, staff was friendly and helpful and the location is everything. In the heart of Waikiki the hotel is near many places to eat, shop and even walking distance from the zoo. Biki Bikes are located outside if you want to take a cruise around the area. The hotel has an average pool where you can cool off if the beach is too hot. The Tiki bar is on the same level of the pool and usually live with people (it over looks the street/beach). This is not a 5 star location, if you want more world class comfort you may have to look at a JW Marriot. BUT if you are looking for fun in the sun, GREAT location to everything and easy access to the beach this is your spot. PS. they give you free water bottle containers, BONUS! refill them all day and take on your excursions.

My bets friend and I had 2 wonderful stays were before and after heading to Turtle Bay for a few days. We were upgraded to a more spacious room on our second check in which was a very nice surprise. The staff were very accommodating and helpful!

Charged a daily esort fee that was NOT part of quote. Stated they had new management. A quite is a quote. Slow elevators. Halls and elevators not air conditioned. Great views. Had to call maintenance to show us how to use TV. Slow draining tub needed for a second call to maintenance. Long lines to check on. Had to wait in long line again to get key when room was ready. Room staff and maintenance good. Front end should not take calls when already processing checking in a customer. Pool , chairs and towels were a plus.Beautiful views of sunset on Waikiki Beach.

Came to HI for our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel staff have been friendly and the room is clean. There is a pool and a Tiki Bar Restaurant at which we've only had a drink, nothing to eat. We've mostly been out. We spent one afternoon at the pool and someone delivered free slushies and a bit later free frozen fruit. There are towels and chairs you can take to the beach (no charge). The air conditioner in the room seems to have it's own idea of temperature sometimes. The bed is very comfortable and we have a private lanai with a front door that opens to a nice view as well. Attached two views from the room. One of Waikiki and one of the hotel pool area.

The Hotel is in a great location for ease of getting around, bus stop out the front, beach directly across the road and plenty of restaurants nearby. We had an issue in our 1st room with water leaking from the ceiling in the bathroom, but staff rectified it immediately and gave us a new room. Staff were polite and always ready to help. Would defiantly recommend for people to stay.

The hotel is located near the Waikki Beach and the bus. We had a room om 6th floor partial view. Unfortunately we cannot sit on the very very small balcony, and there is noise from a cooling refrigeration. We have lederen one King side bed and got 2 Queen size beds for a couple.You Will have to pay 35$ each Day for free water, coffee, pool towels and free dvd’s. Nice cleaning!

Excellent time, took the seven day cruise to all the islands, met some fine people and had great times going back next year for another week and stay on another island, do more sight seeing and excursions

Just got back from a pleasant trip to Waikiki. This was my 8th trip to Hawaii, but my first time at this hotel. Room was tired and in need of a makeover. Was not like the pictures. Was not impressed by being told that we “had to pay” a “resort fee” upon arrival. Have never been charged or paid a resort fee before. After a long flight we could not really be bothered arguing and just wanted to get to our room so managed to negotiate a reduction in the resort fee to $25USD per day, from $35USD. We were not happy about it, but just wanted to get our room! We were told the resort fee was for ammenities, Wi-Fi, beach towels, pool side snacks, local calls, use of the gym and a daily newspaper, that we did not use for the entire stay. When asked why we had to pay the staff and manager could not provide any information as to why we must pay, other than that we had to, with no explanation! I have since researched this so callled resort fee charge and have identified that it is no compulsory, it is not legislative and appears to just be a money grab, or a made up fee, for the unsuspecting traveller. Frankly, I would expect all the above amenities to be provided at a hotel. First of all the premises is a “hotel” and not a “resort”. We questioned this upon check-in and were met with blank faces with no explanation. Had to attend the check-in area some days later in respect of an enquiry and overheard an American guest arguing about the resort fee, which was subsequently wiped in full. When I questioned as to why they were excused from the resort fee and we were not, I was again met with blank expressions and no explanation, and told that we were unable to receive a refund for our “resort fee” payment! Why was the other fee waived and ours not? Well that’s the $1000,000 question. Frankly it just appears to be a fee for the unsuspecting traveller. My suggestion is to stand your ground and use this review as an example as why not to pay the resort fee! Needless to say we will not be using this hotel again, however we still give it a 2/5 for our experience, but would have been a 3.5 had it not been for the resort fee fiasco! Include it in you price and not hit the unsuspecting traveller after a 10 hour flight upon arrival! By the way the housekeeper was 1st class, and did a great job every day! It’s a shame that management don’t have these same standards!

We stay back in April 2018. There were 7 of us in our party and had 3 separate rooms. We had tried to get all the rooms near each other, but it didn't quite work out that way. 2 rooms were on the same floor and the other was on another floor. It worked. The elevator took a little to get used to. You used your room key to call the elevator and it automatically selected your floor number. I really liked it once I got used to it. It seemed to make the wait for the elevator shorter. The rooms were a nice size and the small fridge was nice to have. The housekeeping staff was great.We had a mini-van the whole time we were there (I've been to Oahu many times). The valet parking was great. The staff was very efficient!Would stay there again in the future.

This was our second time staying at Aston Waikiki. The location is right across from the beach and the pool is nice as well. We stayed in a suite with 4 adults and 2 kids. And it’s the perfect amount of room since most of your time is spent outside. It’s close to the zoo and closer to Diamond Head. If you want to be on the main strip in Waikiki but not in the middle of all the shops and crowds this is perfect. Everything is still in walking distance. The breakfast is really good and enough options to hold you over til lunch. We love Hawaii and Aston it’s our chosen hotel when we want to stay in Waikiki!

The Aston Waikiki was the perfect place for my husband and I to start our honeymoon! The staff was extremely friendly, and we were treated to a free upgrade from a standard room to a Junior Suite. We were only supposed to be there for 3 nights and then fly to Kaua'i, but unfortunately, Hurricane Lane was approaching, and we decided to stay put. The hotel was great to us and helped us get rebooked for an additional two nights, and although we weren't able to stay in the same room, we were very excited to experience an ocean front room for our extra days! Tiki's (the restaurant) was awesome, and we really enjoyed sitting on the 2nd floor deck and looking at the ocean and people watching. The location was ideal- close enough to the end of the "strip" so that it wasn't super congested, but only a short walk to all the shops & restaurants that we wanted to go to. Would love to come back!

We are celebrating a second honeymoon in Hawaii and wanted to stay right on the water with oceanfront room and a balcony. This hotel is the perfect location and everyone is courteous and helpful. The views from our balcony are phenomenal!!! We are pleased with our stay and choice.
user_name:
Grace M
Milford, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: This is our second stay at the Aston. We really like this hotel. It’s very well maintained and super clean. They also sport the awesome Tiki bar and restaurant and Wolfgang Puck Express. The best part of the Aston is their staff. These people will go the distance for you. From valet, front desk, housekeeping, security and all staff in between were friendly, kind and attentive! We will definitely be coming back! A special shout out to Kalehua at the front desk for going above and beyond the call of duty! Thanks again Aston!

My stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel from August 28 through September 3 was fantastic. The property was in a great location directly across from Kuhio Beach on the quieter end of Waikiki. I rented a car and arrived at the valet on the first floor where they directed me to the third floor for registration which is located by the pool and the adjacent Tiki Bar. The Tiki Bar is very nice. There is a $35 a night parking fee and it’s valet only, but the valet service was outstanding. Friendly and quick service. When you need your car, just call valet 15 minutes ahead of time and they’ll have it waiting for you. Check-in experience was great. Kalehua greeted me with a smile and was fast and efficient. She confirmed my reservation for an ocean view room with two double beds, but when I told her I would be the only one in the room, she asked if I would prefer a king bed instead and if I wanted to be on a higher floor. When she learned I had family on the island, she asked if they were OK since Hurricane Lane had just passed 2 days prior. Her genuine caring, helpful and friendly service truly represents the aloha spirit of the islands. She explained all that was included with my room rate and gave clear instructions on how to use the elevator. The elevators are like those that you find in some hotels in Vegas and California where you select your floor number BEFORE you get into the elevator and the screen will assign you an elevator. The property is very secure because you must scan your key card in order to select a floor. Kalehua closed out the check-in process with a follow up call to make sure everything was to my satisfaction after settling into my room. Great job by Kalehua!I was happy with my room, 2411. It was clean and comfortable. The view of Waikiki Beach and the ocean was so relaxing. Housekeeping did a great job and when I needed it cleaned at a certain time one day, they honored my request without a problem.The resort fee included free wifi, a free water bottle, water service by the pool and towels for the beach. There is also a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, Subway and Cookie Corner on property.Overall, I had a great stay and I’m already looking at staying at this property next year.

Loved this hotel! I would definitely stay here and tell my family members to stay there to when they’re in Honolulu! Staff was great especially GIBSON! He helped us out while checking inn and for late check out too. He also upgraded our room just because we were on our honeymoon! Staff was always great. It was one of the best experience I’ve had at a hotel.

They are so great! They go above and beyond to try to please you. Be patient if going over a holiday but still just pre register and skip the line. They seriously do their best to give you the best service. Great location and good vibe!

Excellent location right across from the beach but in need of a serious remodel. Front desk staff, Gibson was really nice. There is no fan in the bathroom. No microwave, only a refrigerator. My hotel room had cockroaches. Remodeling definitely needed.

Early check in and late check out were highlights - but not much point having a 12pm check out if the cleaner (the same one) knocks on your door every 30 mins starting at ( am despite being told we were leaving at 12.Tiki grill is always reliable, make bookings for groups of 4 or more. Kim was a great server, avoid the brazilian guy - nags you senseless with his exploits.Great place for a sunset drink

We stayed when Hurricane Lane was ‘threatening’ the staff were fantastic, kept us informed and gave us direction when required. They accommodated us for an extra three nights when our travel plans changed. Can borrow dvds from downstairs. Great location on the beachfront. Quieter than right in Waikiki beach but easily walkable to many popular places. Really awesome, thanks!

Just got back last week and had an amazing time. The hotel is nice and the staff was so welcoming. Unfortunately, Hurricane Lane decided to arrive while we were there but it didn't matter, no rain fell on us at all.Next time I go to Honolulu, I'm going back to the Aston Waikiki. Perfect location too!

We really enjoyed our stay at Aston Waikiki for many reasons. The atmosphere was relaxed and fun, the bell boy service was prompt and easy, the Tiki bar grill provided pool-side service to the hotel guests from happy hour onwards and the rooms were fine. Most tours pick up out the front, or across the road at the Marriott.There is a tour desk including Expedia and a few other companies. The Expedia guy, David,was awesome - Full of good advice and character.The staff at Aston were helpful and friendly - In particular Kalehua at the front desk. We spent the first night in a room which overlooked a roof and another building with 2 double beds - We weren't worried about the view but the room seemed a little dim. I slept terribly that night trying to share a small double bed with my very tall husband. in the morning we requested if we could have the beds pushed together but Kalehua did one better and offered to move us to a better room with a king bed which had a partial ocean view. The room was a lot lighter and felt more spacious- We overlooked the pool and could see the beach to the left. We encountered Kalehua's hospitality and lovely genuine smile a few more times during our stay and each time she went above and beyond where possible to meet our requests.The rooms, as most hotels in Hawaii, are expensive and a little out-dated. I had to keep tying our shower curtain up as I couldn't stand it touching me as it smelled a little stale but it wasn't a big issue. American hotels seem to love using shower curtains...I also have to say, I understand a resort fee is common across America, but it is ridiculous to not just include this price in the per night rate. It's compulsory, it's not an add-on package you can opt out of, and it only includes basic amenities you receive in any Australian/European/Asian hotel I've ever stayed in. Giving a little card showing what the resort fee includes is almost a laugh.. ie access to filtered water, pool towels, movie hire... These should be a given. The only other negative feedback is regarding the courtesy room. WE had a late flight to LA and checked out at 10am choosing to spend the day at the beach across the road. Kalehua mentioned if we ducked back to see her at 3pm she could try her best to get us into the Courtesy room quickly. We came back just after 3 and another girl served us and rather matter of factly said there was no way we could have it and she couldn't even let us book it so we would just have to keep coming up and seeing her. If your Courtesy rooms aren't able to be booked then maybe consider a showering room at the pool area or putting some showers in the bathrooms at least. Overall we would definitely stay here again. The location is awesome right across from Waikiki Beach, shops and food are close, the rooms are neat and tidy and the price was on par compared to other hotels.

Room was very nice, housekeeping was very prompt, especially with extra requests!!!more towels, there within 5 mins no more!!! Needed help with DVD player! BAM!! th engineer was there in les than 5 minutes to help!!!Gibson at the Front chrck in desk was always, very helpful and willing to assist, the man deserves a "BIG:" raise,!!! ASAP!!! He is a great asset to your hotel, if you don't already, know. I will stay again and again with Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel if you have Gibson in your in employ. It would of your best interest to do what ever it takes to keep him with your fine hotel. A rise or a promotion with a substantial raise would be what this young man deserves. The other staff members were great too! But Gibson stands out ahead of the crew!!!!!

Amazing place to stay, loved every minute of it. Beautiful food and drinks. And very convenient location. Directly across from the beach and close to all shops and walking distance to Centre of town shopping district. Very helpful staff also.

Great Hotel along the beach and close to all even a Starbucks down on the corner. Great walking in the evenings except for the homeless people everywhere. Rooms were great and clean. Staff was very receptive. We had a great night before our cruise on The Pride Of America Ship to all the Islands. Enjoy your stay here, we did....

Sadly, the homeless lived in the park all along the beach across the street from the hotel and often yelled at you as you passed by and fought with one another. It was not a nice area at all. There was a restraunt their but the staff was not friendly and did not give us our hotel discount. I won't choose this hotel again .

Older type hotel, very dated but clean.had to ask for a room lower down as the wind on the top floor was keeping us awake.BIG shout out to Gibson at front desk who was most helpful in getting a better room,

We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon. It's a great hotel right in the middle of everything and on Waikiki beach! The staff was great and actually moved us up 2 room categories when they found out it was our honeymoon.

The view of the ocean from our 14th floor room was amazing and it was wonderful to watch the sun set over the sea whilst sitting on the balcony in the evening. The hotel was clean and the lifts worked efficiently. The rooms were a little on the small side. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was a pool and bar downstairs which were very popular. The hotel is a bit dated but reasonable value for money.

Greetings Travelers: When I finished my NCL Pride cruise, I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach and it seemed like a wise decision. First, when checking in, the room was not ready but they kept my luggage until it was ready. At first the elevators can be difficult to use, but then it is much easier. The room was spectacular with an excellent view of the sea and the bathroom was very clean. The staff was mostly friendly and did their job efficiently. In the Lobby every day they had water with flavors to cool you on a sunny day. Also in the lobby area they give you a small bag with products like sunblock, creams and many other things and there you can ask for towels and chairs that you can use on the beach. A negative point that disappointed me a lot was that after I checked out, I was no longer allowed to use the bathrooms and since my flight was much later I had to find a bathroom somewhere else. For this reason I do not give 5 points of punctuation because I think the service should be until the guest leaves the hotel

Perfect location, right across the road from Waikiki beach and the Zoo.Plenty of restaurants and cafes close by too. The restaurant next to the pool had amazing live music every night. Definitely recommend staying here!

Staff were great, location excellent at quieter end of Waikiki and views great. Room are severely outdated and in desperate need of a renovation. A very easy stroll across the road to swim or sun bath.

This is an older hotel that is well maintained but is nevertheless showing its age. When staying in Waikiki, though, this is our favorite place. The room prices are reasonable. We pay a little extra to stay in an upper floor oceanfront room which always has a beautiful panoramic view of the ocean and Waikiki beach. The upper floor is quieter as well.

My stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was amazing! The staff and sales coordinator, Arlyn are the best! They are friendly, professional, efficient and helpful! This is definitely my hotel when I stay in Oahu. I had a wonderful time on the island! Can't wait to go back!

Checked in and had the pleasure of having Gibson as our customer service agent. He gave us a great deal, a great room, and was very professional. Have stayed here before and love the location, centrally located in Waikiki. Gibson was great and even called once we got to the room to make sure we had everything we needed. Thank you. Also arrived to this beautiful view!!

Great location but the hotel was terrible. The walls in the room where extremely dirty air/con need a wipe Year’s of grim. Bathroom was very old and in need of renovations.( second worse hotel I have stayed in) cheap nasty towels in rooms. Pool area very slippery, kids and adults slipping all over the place. Think twice

We chose Aston for the entirety of our 10 night stay, we stayed in a deluxe ocean view on the 25th floor with an amazing view over Waikiki beach, with awesome sunsets. Yeah the room was a little dated, but everything is in Hawaii. Definitely a comfortable room with everything we needed and hotel staff were great! Positioned on a nice part of the beach and close to all that waikiki beach offers. We really enjoyed the Tiki bar downstairs, which ment we did not need to go anywhere to have a great night if we didn't want to venture out. We would definitely return...

Great spot, sensational sunsets. Rooms were very clean even though they were a bit dated. Front desk staff were amazing and very friendly. Opposite beach and close to shops ABC store next door and Lu Lu Grill.

We spent 3 nights at this hotel and loved it for its beach front location, closed to lots of restaurants and shops, reasonable price and nice rooms. The beach was beautiful and the beach front pool lounging area is very nice, clean and breezy. The only downside is that our bed in room 1211 was so saggy and tilted that caused us backaches.We wish to thank a very nice, helpful and pleasant front services employee, Dely who happily stored our luggage on the day back from the cruise when we had to spend several hours in Honolulu while waiting for our flight back to Canada.

I originally gave them 1 star due to a few issues. The main problem was the room. I booked an ocean view room (requested king sized bed) thru Priceline. I called the hotel 2-3 days before my arrival to confirm, which the friendly staff did over the phone. My flight got delayed and after 12+ hours, we finally arrived. The front desk clerk was friendly but she was too occupied with something else. She told me that she was putting us in a room with 2 double sized beds. I told her we wanted/asked for king sized bed. She said “OK, I’ll see if I can find you one” then gave me the key cards. I thought everything was good since she never said anything about it after that. We left and went to our room - the keys didn’t work. Left husband watching our suitcases and went back down. By then, it was check-in time and the line was sooo long. Stood in line for a long time, got new keys. Went back up, opened the door and was surprised to see 2 double sized beds. Not to mention other in-room issues. Waited for 30 minutes for checkin time to slow down and called front desk. We were told they could save us a room with king sized bed the next day. He said to come down at noon to checkout of our current room, leave our luggage with the valet people, come back to check in again at 3pm. I wasn’t about to do that. What if they didn’t have a room with a king sized bed? Then we would be sleeping on the streets. LOLI wrote a review on Yelp and contacted corporate. Natasha got back with me right away. She jumped right on it. She blocked a room with king sized bed for us for the next day. She kept in touch with us the entire time. The next day, she called us at noon and sent people to help us move to another room. She stayed on top of our other issues as well, which was wonderful. We used to get free tote and other stuff at check in every year but not this year. ??? I’m in the hotel business. I work for the corporate office of the 2nd largest hotel group in the US. We could have stayed at 1 of my company’s hotels with employee discount but husband wanted to keep our tradition. We’ve been staying here since 2007. I’m giving them 4 stars all because of Natasha. She made things right for us and we appreciated her greatly. We’ll most likely be staying with my company’s hotels next year but if not, we’ll give this hotel another try.

We stayed 3 nights at this hotel which is located at the south end of Waikiki Beach.The location was okay but not close enough to the eateries and retail outlets, most of which were located towards the north, around 750 metres.I would classify this as a good budget hotel with adequate service and facilities.The room we were allocated was clean and reasonable but could do with an upgrade with the furniture, fixtures and fittings.The staff were efficient and friendly, and the view out towards the beach was fantastic, so we were happy with that.If money was tight, I might consider staying here again, but my preference would be to stay at a hotel closer to the centre of the beach, further north.

Booked this hotel last week for September for hubby and I. Just finished reading all the reviews and can't wait for our visit. It will be nice to meet all the friendly staff that is mentioned on all the reviews.

We got to spend a night here, compliments of the cruise line before we boarded the ship. It's a huge hotel, and the check-in process is a nightmare. You get to check in twice: once when you arrive (i.e. unless you arrive before 3-4p) and then you get to queue again to pick up your room key.The rooms are okay, but small and the place feels dated and worn, not to mention walls so thin you can hear the neighbors. The staff are friendly and helpful, it's this place's most redeeming quality.We had made reservations for our return as well, even paid in advance but ultimately decided to stay elsewhere. This is not a place I would return to.

We stayed 6 nights in early August. Our first room was on floor 24 and had a view of the ocean and Diamondhead. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room on the 10th floor for our last two nights. Rooms are small and basic, and the faucet dripped and ac wasn’t the best in the second room. Overall, the staff were friendly and helpful, location was great, we were given 2 refillable water bottles and a tote bag upon arrival and got a great deal on a reusable cooler bag with 4 drinks. Pool towels and beach chairs were provided, as well as light snacks poolside twice in the afternoon.Parking is valet only, cost $25/day, and did get backed up at times. There is also a resort fee daily of about $35. This seems to be typical of hotels along Waikiki Beach.This is my second time staying here (previous stay 10 years ago). Definitely more wear and tear at this place, but nothing too drastic. I would stay here again!

The Aston Beach hotel is situated in the perfect location by Waikiki Beach. The beach is right across the street and the zoo is basically right next door. There are plenty of shops and places to eat all around. Starbucks and Jamba Juice are right there and open up very early. I had my fill of coffee each morning at 5:30am at Starbucks.We stayed in the Premium Ocean View room on the top (25th) floor. The view was amazing and from our balcony (lanai) we could see the entire beach and all the surfers out in the water. The sunset over the ocean was incredible as well.The elevators are weird to say the least and take some getting used to. The floor buttons are outside the elevator. To go to your floor, you have to swipe your keycard then enter the floor number. The screen will then tell you what elevator to enter when it opens. There are no floor buttons inside the elevator.The room was clean but clearly dated. The room felt more like a Motel 6 than a resort. Though it was a "Premium" room, it was very, very small. There was barely enough room to walk around with the two double beds. Frankly, for the price I expected better accommodations. We were well stocked with the usual amenities (shampoo, soap, etc) as well as mini-vacation (no microwave though). The room also had a PlayStation and DVD player with free rentals, but we didn't take advantage of it.There are two restaurants in the hotel. One is a grill on the and the other is a Wolfgang Puck Express for a quick eat. There is also a pool with a large area to sit or sun bathe. Being near the beach, the pool seemed little used.The AC in the room worked well, but due to the size of the room we couldn't avoid a direct draft from it. Not a big deal for me, but my wife needed an extra blanket. The beds and pillows were comfortable enough.The staff was always helpful and pleasant. No complaints at all with personnel. We also drove a car, so we had it valeted every night. It cost us $32 per day for valet plus tip. It took about 15 to 20 minutes for them to retrieve my car, but you can call down ahead of time.Overall, I consider the Aston Beach a good place to stay if you want a view and/or a great location. If you want luxury, I'd try somewhere else.

I have never met a friendlier team! Kalehua was who checked us in, and was our first impression. She was pleasant, accommodating, and never stop smiling. It’s clear she loves her company and her job! The professionalism continued with Rizaldy, the bellman, who brought our bags and made sure we were happy with our accommodations. He also gave us some great info about the hotel and surrounding area. We were also very impressed with David and Gibson who worked the front desk in the evening. We will definitely be returning, just because of these amazing people! Thanks for everything and keep up the great work, y’all!!

The room was a little dated in terms of furnishing....etc, but clean & adequate for a short term stay.Friendly staff, but upon arriving early (around 12noon) we completed check-in & were supposed to get a text when the room was ready - never got a message.The Tiki`s restaurant staff were not overly helpful, so we did not dine in their restaurant preferring to dine elsewhere.The US$35 "Resort fee" covered beach towels,& beach chairs to use on the beach just across the road, and location was good, with an ocean view room.With the "trolley" bus stop right outside it was very convenient to use to get around, and a short taxi ride away (about US$15) is the main entrance to Diamond Head park which is a must do early in the morning before it gets too hot.Kalakaua Ave is the main street in Waikiki and where all of the main shops and restaurants are located and is an easy walk from the hotel.If you are not expecting "5 star" luxury type resort then you will not be disappointed.

Bed bugs and rooms are outdated. The management is terrible! We had people come check the room it was a nightmare everything about this hotel screams DIRTY rundown hotel! I’m so disappointed with out stay.

This hotel’s location is perfect, but other than that, at most it is at a motel level, if you don’t want to stay in a motel by the Waikiki beach, don’t stay here, it is not worth it, price can not measure value.

Reasonable hotel near ocean. Rooms good. Staff friendly. Across the street from beach. Wolfgang Puck is on street level for a reasonable meal. Lots of shops nearby. Near zoo and aquarium. Nice pool and bar.

This property is not on the beach but on an excellent location in front of it. The rooms are very clean and rooms are nicely decorated. I had an aloha suite and it was much more comfortable and roomier than the standard room. The restaurant is a great experience. Tikis bar and grille and you have great food and cocktails and views. The pool area is always bustling with activity and you are close to tons of places. Try to get an ocean view here and you will be very happy. Service is very good here. I highly recommend Aston Waikiki Beach for great value!

I would recommend this Hotel to anyone!! Rooms are clean, view is great. Now that the check in clerk, Gibson, helped us more than three times and won't even take a tip or a drink, he is very gracious to us. The flight was great, but our luggage went on a different flight. Gibson put our minds at ease that they would be here.He went above and beyond to help.If only all people could be half as gracious our world would be a better place. Thank youJ.Combs J.Faust

Just spent a week at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Staff was very accommodating. The hotel is a bit older but clean. There are restaurants on site and premium shopping is within walking distance. We decided to rent a car for the week and parked at the hotel which is valet only at $35 a day. In and out privileges and the valet staff was very responsive. There is a small pool on site with activities for the kids. This is a very good spot to stay if you don’t want to break the bank by staying at a higher end hotel. We were very satisfied with the hotel location, price and staff.

We went there for happy hour to watch the sun set and it was happy - good music, good service, good strong cocktails and good food - the sun didn't set quite as orange as I hoped but I was happy! One of the few places to sit along the beach without being crowded and overly expensive.

Comfortable rooms; great views; good pricing. Helpful staff - from maids, if you need something extra, to front desk.Easy parking; just call down for your car 10 minutes before you go. Wayne and the valets are great; remember you, and helpful with information and directions.Tikis is right there and has good cocktails, food and entertainment, with an ocean view.Wolfgang Pucks is good for a quick lunch, salad or pizza.The location is great; right up front, on Kalakaua.

Staying here for 4 nights with my partner, currently on our 3rd night. We had the premier king room with ocean view (19th floor). Rooms are nice with decent aircon. Comfortable bedding. Beautiful ocean view although balcony’s are very close to your next door neighbour. Lifts are very unusual where you enter your floor before entering and it designates you a lift (A-F). Saying this, never waited longer than 3 mins and this was when the hotel was quite full. Pool is okay with plenty of banana lounges and activities around including connect four, giant Janga etc..Overall loved the location. Close to transport, BEACH and walking distance to most restaurants, shops.Would stay here again!!

Aston hotel was awesome! We had a beachfront unit on 9th floor. Views fantasic and very close to shopping, cafes. Ocean. Great food and service tiki bar and grill downstairs. Lots of abc shops. Elevators are a bit confusing at first. No floor numbers inside lifts.

Located right on the beach, very nice rooms at reasonable prices, /we enjoyed the Tiki Bar which had very good food, and live entertainment, also located on a major bus route.We had a room which looked out on the ocean, the accommodations were great the staff was excellent.

It’s got beautiful views and is affordable by Waikiki standards but it’s located right over a bar with live music that goes until about 11 almost every night. That’s nice if you like live music or are a night owl but not if you’re jet lagged or want an early night. We’re on the 14th floor and can hear it clearly. The reception staff are very polite but apparently the bar isn’t part of the hotel so there’s nothing they can do. Just be careful booking this one. If you need your sleep then maybe pick somewhere else.

The hotel was great and the service was exceptional especially the bellman Rizaldy. It’s centrally located to all shops, restaurants and cafes and directly across Waikiki Beach. What more could you ask for? Very much recommended. Jesmond and Wayne

Our travel agent booked us at this hotel and I was really nervous to stay here after reading other reviews. This part of Waikiki is bustling and the Aston is directly across from the beach. There is a pool and I was glad to be on the secured floor. Our. Our king bed was comfortable enough and for the most part things were clean. The age of the hotel does show in the rooms. We had some flying ants in our bathroom when we returned from supper and there was mildew behind the toilet. (Not sure if these two items were connected.) If you have an outing before you fly out, they will hold your luggage. Finally, there are several travel experts near the front desk that will help you find an outing.

A very nice spot on the quiet end of Waikiki beach.with a nice restaurant. We had, and would recommend an ocean front room, worth every penny. The hotel is very clean and well kept, although it is showing some age. If I get the chance to get back to Oahu, I would stay again. Just a warning, the excursion desk will try to sell you something, they are not the concierge.

The staff made our vacation a dream come true!!! Kahelua at the front desk was THE BOMB!!! We arrived too early and had to wait a while for our room but, Kahelua made us feel so welcome and special. When we returned and the room was ready, she had upgraded us to a suite!!!!! My kids and I were in absolute heaven in that room.She helped us out so many times with directions, information, tips-so very cool-above and beyond my expectations. She made us feel like family.Lydia and Marieta in Housekeeping were the finishing touches, hooking us up with extra wash cloths, etc. Thank you all so much for everything!! Best time we've had in a long time!!!!! We will be back.

I took Ocean view room, was great!!!Rooms are ok, it’s a clean hotel.My only disappointment was the Hotel fee and the parking. Before you finish booking make sure you add the hotel fee to make sure is the price you looking for because is not in your final booking online. The parking price is to much, they tried to charge 32$ per day just for parking. Don’t do do it, you save more $ if you park across street, in the Zoo parking lot, is 24HR.Overall great hotel I will stay again if I need to!

Located right on the beach, excellent accommodations great ocean view, Tiki bar food was very good, as well as the service we received, great music in the Bar throughout the evening. we would definitively stay here again if we traveled to Hawaii. Breakfast at wolfgang puck express had a very good breakfast,available.

Stayed here for 2 nights and loved it.Very close to the Waikiki beach, I could literally walk to the beach bare feet from the hotel. Loved the Tiki Bar, a very pleasant sitting area from where you can see the beach and enjoy your beer! Free water bottle at the time of check in was a nice perk to stay hydrated while ice water was provided 24x7.will definitely stay here again.

In all respects, save one, this hotel is a great place to stay. Ample, clean, and comfortable rooms at a decent rate and in a central beach location. The staff is superior- from the front desk, to the porters, to general employees. The one knock is plumbing noise from the adjacent rooms and the room above and thin walls. While these defects in no way reduce the desirability these lovely accommodations, they only justify classing this as a very good hotel rather than a great hotel.

We were on the 6th floor overlooking the pool area with a partial ocean view. We were able to see the fireworks on Friday night from our balcony.The hotel was beautiful and clean. The elevators were an excellent system and you usually did not have to wait long. Wolfgang Puck, Tiki's and Subway were all convenient. Breakfast at Lulu's around the corner was huge portions and a great view. It was difficult to use the kiosk for movies and get them to play in the room. We would stay here again.

My wife and I come to Hawaii with our family for our 10-years anniversary. The front desk service we received from Gibson was very friendly and professional. He took very good care of our needs, found two rooms together on high floor for us, and even gave us a kind gift! This hotel is very close to the beach, and the view from the balcony is awesome! Thanks Gibson!

Had a great view. Balcony is small but view is incredible. Staff friendly. Rooms are tiny- but who spends time in their room when you are here. Comfortable room. The resort fee is expensive for what you get- but that’s provably everywhere around here.

Location is about as far from the airport as you can get, but that means less busy, which was a plus. Right across the road from the beach which I think is the main draw card, and we were lucky enough to get a beach view from our room which was lovely. Taken in the context of Waikiki hotels, this one is towards the cheaper end of the spectrum and is perfectly adequate for a couple of days. We weren't prepared to pay the ridiculous prices of some of the other more central hotels for what you get. Handy to plenty of restaurants and on the central bus routes that are easy to get on/off. We stayed here for 2 days before heading to the Big Island.

Compared to pricing of hotels close by, this was value for money. Best thing about this hotel is the location because of the beach. Decor and bathroom is a bit dated. We got room on 22nd floor and the views was nice. Could see surfers in the water from 5.30 am. Staff are real friendly and really liked the vibe and food at the Tiki Restaurant. Overall we enjoyed our stay in Hawaii very much

The pictures and descriptions of the hotel were okay. It does have a convenient location, however, i was put off from the start. The room we were in 1004 was small....the bathroom was small, there was not a chair for lounging or sitting only two wooden benches that were part of the “dining set.” The room was not clean and was worn. The toilet was so low when I sat down my knees were in my chest. We had booked 6 nights but only stayed 1 and found a better hotel nearby. We spent about 75-100 more per night but it was head and ahouldera above thia place. Be careful.

This hotel seems to be a “profit margin excellent” type hotel. It felt a little dated and truthfully felt like just a step above motel status. The hotel has an outdoor pool right next to the front desk. The fitness center is adequate and it felt like the most modern portion of this hotel. The room was decent. The bed was not very comfortable. All in all, this hotel felt like they were doing their best to do enough to get by while still charging the same rate as the hotels around them.

Stayed here for two nights in Waikiki, check-in was good and room was available at 1:30pm after a 10hour flight. I booked two rooms with partial ocean views on 23rd floor, clean and functional. Staff friendly and hotel location is great being right across the road from beach and close to shops and bars and restaurants. I would stay at the Aston again.

Got back from honalulu on the 10th of July one of the place's in our bucket list had a wonderful time beautiful island with plenty of things to do not the cheapest of holidays but well worth it we flew from Heathrow to San Francisco then onto honalulu where a mini bus picked us up and took us to our hotel about 25 minutes from aport we got up the next morning with probably one of the best beach locations we could have asked for we ventured out for a look around there was so much to take in we left it a couple of days then it was trip time first we did an island tour in a mini bus an all day event with dinner included a very cultural trip. A couple of days later we did a circle island tour in a helicopter a well worth trip lasting an hour then a couple of days later a must do is a luau food excellent entertainment first class and a few days later it was time to return home where all the flights ran smoothly. Definitely a trip of a lifetime with many fond memories on film and phone so glad we went would love to do it again but maybe go to another island so much to see and do

We booked an ocean front room and the views were fantastic. Being on a lower floor it was a bit noisy on the balcony (restaurant/bar below) but quiet with the doors shut. The location was awesome although it is on the end of the strip so a little bit of walking to get some range for food.Room was clean. Housekeeping didn’t replenish coffee stuff a couple of times. Normally I wouldn’t care but the ridiculous ‘resort fee’ means I want everything that’s included in this compulsory extra. The resort fee basically covers everything you’d expect from normal hotels in their base prices.All up fairly good value hotel in a top spot. Pay extra for the ocean front rooms is you can handle hearing life happening

My wife and I were celebrating our Anniversary and having the Honeymoon we never could afford. We were staying a week in Waikiki after taking a 7 day cruise to the other Islands. My wife likes to inspect the room to make sure we aren't staying in a dirty room, most times in results in nothing. This time, I am so happy she has this ritual because what she found was, well see the photos of the sheets and you judge. But seeing what we saw was disgusting. They relocated us to another room where we discovered the Keurig was gone and the drapes looked as if the came straight from a crack house.Combine this with their hidden fees, I really enjoyed finding out that they charge $4 for each room key card you do not hand in when you checkout, and I will never stay here again. It comes down to principles and their property is subpar in comparison to others in the same area.If you choose to stay here even after reading this I suggest you see a Dr. and get a checkup when you get home.

A great 3 Day stay with Waikiki Beach just across the street. Has a great pool area and a restaurant with a Starbucks around the corner! Shop til you drop or eat anything and everything! Sky's the limit. Waikiki at it's Best!
user_name:
Jo Lynn H
San Antonio, Texas

review_body: Steps from the beach and with a terrific view. The pool on the second floor also has an open air bar and restaurant, Tikki’s. The room was very nice with Ocean view for 179 a night. Easy walk to car rentals numerous restaurants and the night scene. Very safe area and the beach was not very crowded at all. Safe swimming area about 7 feet deep to 3 feet deep to beach. Great for all ages!Hotel staff were very accommodating and next trip there I will stay at the Aston again. Note if you are doing the Noreegian cruise, they offer a night here before your trip, do it! Off plane and to hotel to relax. We did an extra day so we had one full day in honalulu

The only good thing I can say is the great location.Checked in at 2:30 PM, room wasn't ready. They checked me in and said I have to come back at 3 PM to get my room key. They don't have a separate line for key pick-up. So you will have to get back in line. By the time I got my key, it was 3:30 PM.Finally, time to get into the room and wash up! Wrong! Scan my key card at the elevator and it took me to the 17th floor! WTH? I am on the 15th floor!!! Try multiple time scanning the key card... doesn't work. Finally, a hotel guest shows me how to use the elevator. Supposedly I am supposed to punch in the floor and scan the key card or scan the key card and punch in the floor. But guess what, it still doesn't work. Eve time we punch in the floor and scan the key card or scan the key card and punch in the floor. The elevator keeps showing 17th floor, even when we punch in 15th. Back down to front desk I go! I was not going to wait in line again.4:15 PM, key card working... They actually try showing me how to use the keycard. A little too late, a friendly hotel guest already shows me how to use it. Two out of the 5 days I was there, the key card work perfectly. The other three days, it was horrible! Every time you scan the key card at the elevator, it says to see front desk. Next day at 8 AM I get a call from the front desk to come down and see security. My car in valet has been in an accident. WTH? In valet? I'd harry up got dress and head down wait for security. Security wouldn't give me any details of how it happened. I'd asked multiple times. All they said was take this and give it to the rental company. WTH? Why can't you tell me what happened? No help, nothing! I'd spend almost the entire day dealing with the rental company. No compensation offer nothing from the hotel. They totally ignore what happen. No apologies from management. They didn't even try to help me work with the rental company. Even when I check out. Nothing was said to me. No mention of anything.This was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. I will never stay here again.

We had a week at this hotel and would return. Sooo conveniently located! We had a main tower beachfront room with views over the water. Loved sitting on the balcony watching the sunset. Also enjoyed being slightly away from main crowded Waikiki beach. Very nice beach across the road with the ocean pool. I absolutely loved swimming in a calm safe environment. Although this was during beginning of school holiday period it was never crowded. There's a rock wall that you can walk out on, and on the adjacent side of the rock wall a large beach where you can swim in the ocean. This beach has volleyball nets at the back and a beachstall with umbrellas and surfboard hire. We didn't bother having housekeeping come in, but they were present ever day cleaning adjoining rooms, and accommodated our request for fresh towels and emptying bins. Our room was spotless when we arrived, and that's from someone who can be OCD when it comes to cleanliness. Unfortunately, Aussie flights arrive early morning. We arrived about 10:30am, so expect to wait for room. No one at reception suggested they would look after our luggage (see earlier review where bell hop took care of same), so we went off to the Tiki Bar (otherside of pool) where they were happy to accommodate us and our luggage! Liked offer of free beach towels and beach chairs. We were supposed to get free drink bottles (just recalled reading earlier review), but it was not offered when checking in. Great coffee machine in room but need to supply pods of milk. Also it would be nice to have two wine glasses, only supplied with two ordinary glasses. Make sure you choose screw top wine otherwise will have to buy cork screw ($9 from shop downstairs). Wine seemed to be cheaper at this little shop than big brand store next door. A fabulous place for inexpensive healthy breakfast or lunch is Tucker & Bevvy Picnic Foods three doors down. We stayed on 8th floor, and for premium beachfront wouldn't stay lower than this for great views. No problems with traffic noise or music from Tiki Bar. Reminder, lobby on third floor. Liked the efficient card swipe for lifts which eliminated lots of waiting around. Don't need card to get to Lobby.

Our stay was fabulous at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, great views, great service, watched the fireworks from our balcony, zoo next door, beach across the road, trolley out front and will def stay there again.

The check in process for this trip was nothing but a disaster. We arrived early, and stored our luggage with the Bellhop crew until our room was ready. Once we received the call that our room was ready, we went to the hotel to begin checking in. The front desk staff called the Bellhop crew to send out luggage to our room, and they somehow managed to send it to the wrong room and couldn't locate the luggage or the guy who took it to the room for almost two hours. Due to the lost luggage issue, we almost missed the shuttle for a luau we had scheduled for that night. Once we got to the room, we noticed the rooms were spacious but were extremely dated and not put together well. All the wall fixtures were crooked and just looked like the rook was built in a hurry. The reason for the two stars as opposed to the one star is for the customer service crew on the third floor. They were very apologetic for the luggage issue and generally seemed like they took our complaints to heart. Not sure if I would stay here again.

Hawaii was beautiful but motel was not enjoyable .Paid for housekeeping and room was not cleaned every day.Bonus we had a nice view of the bay and night lights. The tiki bar don’t recommend it at all but everyone has own opinion.

This hotel is one of the cheaper ones in Waikiki. It's towards the end of the Waikiki strip, next to Honolulu Zoo. You're probably aware of hotel tax, there's also a daily resort fee. The hotel does their best to ensure that you feel like you're at least getting your moneys worth for these extra costs. We booked a partial ocean view room, the photo Im inserting is the view from our room! We got a beach bag with two drink bottles (theres water stations to fill these up whenever you want) and some vouchers inside. You are also allowed to hire beach towels and chairs free of charge. The pool area is decent but pool is small compared to some places, but it's never over crowded or fighting for space. They bring around treats like shave ice and frozen fruit for free. In the rooms, there's a coffee machine, coffee, creamer etc. There's soaps, shampoos etc in the bathroom. There's also a PlayStation, a fridge, safe and iron. There's like 50 overpriced ABC stores in Honolulu, so we were glad that there's a little convenience store inside the hotel downstairs because it was cheaper than the ABC stores (we didnt realise we paid $8 for a loaf of bread from the ABC store lol). There's also two restaurants, jamba juice, subway and starbucks downstairs. This is a really family friendly hotel, in a great location across the road from the sea walled area of the beach (safe/easy for kids to swim). Hotels in Waikiki are expensive without the tax and resort fees, we felt that we got our moneys worth with this place! Outside the hotel there's also a bus stop, this is a pickup/drop off location for tour busses, and the trolley busses that take you around Honolulu (we used Waikiki pink line trolley $2pp :) ). And if your tour bus doesn't do this hotel, 5 metres down the road is another hotel which you'll be able to wait at. The only slightly negative thing I have to say is, the housekeeping wasn't that great. Everyday I left a $2/3 tip for ours (was this enough?), the beds were made toilet cleaned, towels changed. But the table was never wiped down, sometimes the coffee wasn't replaced and the carpet wasn't vacuumed. We are pretty clean so this didn't affect us too much but my tips were obviously for nothing. They need to replace or actually clean the fixtures in the bathroom (taps, shower head) because they have staining. Overall we had a great stay here and I definitely would recommend especially for families!

I traveled with my husband who was working out of Pearl Harbor for the week. The service was amazing, the room was perfect. We both slept better than at home. You can’t beat the location and they give you free towels and chairs for the beach. I worked some and the internet never went down. I took several excursions while husband was working and all picked up right at the hotel. Directly across from the zoo, walked to diamond head on one side and to beach walk on the other and I’m not in the best of shape! Will definitely stay here again and this is my 4th trip here

My wife and I travelled to Hawaii for the first time as part of our honeymoon in early May, 2018. As a general comment on the island, we absolutely loved Hawaii and thought it was stunning. For the duration of our stay on Oahu we stayed in the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel. Overall we did have a very positive experience with the hotel, below are some Positives and “Negatives” from our stay. Now while I say “Negative” please note that these did not bother us much at all, but they may be an issue for others, as I said we had a very positive experience.Positive:- Location: Perfect Location, right on Waikiki Beach front. Only a short walk to most things in Waikiki- Views: We had an ocean view room and our view of the beach and ocean was absolutely stunning.- Service: Our experience with all the maids, customer service and other staff within the hotel was great do not have a bad thing to say.- Room State: Clean and tidy room, everything was clearly clean and neat.Negative:- Hotel looked and felt on the older side. Carpet and walls etc. had the appearance of being older and a more used condition.- Room Size: Room and Bathroom were on the smaller side, possibly the smallest we had while in America, again not a huge problem as we spent most of our time out of the room.- Noise: Room didn’t seem to have amazing noise reduction ability, although most nights it was not a problem at all, one night we were able to very clearly hear the music from the Tiki Bar attached to the hotel until about 11pm (we had our flight the next morning & were on the 14th floor from memory).- A general thing we found a little strange was the showers. This is more of a comment common to basically everywhere we stayed in America. The bathtub shows I find are not exactly the best, can be a little dangerous and they always feel very cramped. Again it’s not really a negative it’s more of a preference thing and it was something we noticed across the board in the USA.A lovely touch for this hotel was a little welcome package that we were provided which included a small fan, a couple of water bottles and a beach bag. We thought this was a fantastic idea and it added very nicely to the hotel. Overall again we were very happy with this hotel, the service was great, the location was absolutely fantastic and only a few downsides if we were to be VERY picky. We found the hotel great, especially for families with it being close to the beach as well as having its own pool it seemed like a great hotel for people from all walks of life.

First time to this hotel and Stayed for 5 nights. Hotels location is great. Next to the beach and a short walk to the nearby shops. Staff is very friendly and welcoming. The valet Allen is very friendly, informative and welcoming. Definitely will be back.

I was a little concerned at first when I booked this hotel as I was worried it was ‘too far’ away from the main area. The hotel turned out to be a great distance away which allowed for a leisurely walk along the beach front each day. The hotel room was great - no issues, we had a room with an ocean view. Tikis was in the main lobby area which had great food and entertainment each night. A couple of food places on the lower ground also if you didn’t want to walk too far.

Right across from the beach, the staff was great! All of the amenities you can ask for! We came as a family and had multiple rooms, the staff was accommodating and got us close together. The only thing I didn't like was the resort fee.

This is a small hotel directly across the street from Waikiki Beach that was reasonably priced. The front desk was more than helpful and pleasant. For our first stay, our view was of Diamond Head and a long stretch of the beach plus a deck that we couldn't sit out on that was only two foot wide, which we like to do. The room didn't have a chair or desk but two stools and a small high table. We called the desk for a chair any chair and they brought a lawn chair that was fine. We were able to switch around to the front side for our second stay after a cruise and we were very happy with the deck, two chairs and the view of the whole beach that was spectacular. There was a $35.00 daily resort fee but the cost of the hotel was reasonable. The security was the best for such a busy congested area, we would give them an AAA rating for that. The tour buses plcked us up outside the hotel and we were able to find good restaurants close by. We would definitely return. Being across the road from the beach AAA.

We really enjoyed this hotel. It is directly across from the beach and walking distance to many restaurants and shops. The service was great. Housekeeping kept the rooms nice and clean. Thank you Waikiki

We booked this through booking.com and it was easy and everything was fine. It’s a great location with plenty of food and shopping in walking distance. There is also a shuttle that stops off in front of the hotel that is cheap and takes you over Waikiki so you can see more of the island. Yes there is a beach by the hotel but it gets very crowded. So the room and all facilities were great so no complaints there. However when we booked we paid a deposit (like normal) then when we arrived we paid for the duration of the stay at the beginning and my partner and I paid cash and our friends paid on their card. Half way through our stay our friends realised that the hotel had put another hold for the same amount they originally paid and because that was all their money gone we went to the front desk and they managed to help us out since half the bill was paid cash they gave us that back and just charged the card for the full amount. So we thought it was all sorted. Once my friends went home (to Canada) about a week later they had another hold on their card - meaning that the hotel had charged them three times!! They had to call multiple times to even get some answers and at one point someone said we owed another $400 - which we didn’t. Luckily my friends bank was able to release the hold and they got their money back. But the stress and inconvenience they put us through..I probably wouldn’t stay back there, which is disappointing as the hotel and location was perfect.

We booked two separate partial ocean view rooms. The adverts show a view that looks like you can see it from the far side of the room. In one room we could only see our sea view if at the table pressed right up to the window. The other room you had to go out onto the ledge to see the view. ( The main view was the hotel next door.) The advert says balcony, but I do not call a narrow ledge, too small to put chairs (and the room had no chair at all, just 2 stools). So you couldn't sit on the ledge and look at the view. A real disappointment. Also our room wasn't ready at 3pm and we were exhausted from a long flight. And the resort fees had gone up from $US25 (at time of booking) to $US35 per day. We didn't use anything except the beach towels - could have bought ourselves a towel every day at this price.
user_name:
Christine L
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Up on arrival we where up graded to ocean view room. It was beautiful view of the beach. They gave us bottle of champagne. Ever thing was in walking distance. The beach was just across the street. Staff was very friendly. The room was always clean. Being able to book tours at the hotel was very nice.

We were right in the middle of everything food, bus, shopping, beach! We would leave our hotel and go swim with sea turtles. The restaurants in the hotel were very good and we couldn't get over how nice everyone was!

Whilst only a basic room, it was clean, the staff were friendly. It was right across the road from the beach. The $35.00 per night resort fee was a bit steep. We stayed on Level 5 right about the Tiki Bar. It was noisy at nighttime. So request a room on the higher levels.

Across the street from the best beach, close to restaurants, bars, convenience stores, Zoo and many more. Clean and adequate rooms. Very nice and helpful staff. I highly recommend it and definitely will stay in again.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel for our wedding anniversary holiday. The rooms were clean, we had a lovely view of the beach in our partial ocean view room. The staff were friendly and helpful. It is a bit of a hike up town every day but there are buses and trolley cars going past all the time. The location is directly across the road from the beach and from our balcony we even had perfect seats for the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton. I feel the USD$35 per day resort fee a bit much especially as you've already paid a lot for the room but on the whole we loved our trip and will be back.

Nice hotel directly across the street from the beach. Saw lots of beach goers walking over from the street level. Elevators are a bit confusing but great for security purposes. Only complaint is the $35 surprise resort fee... we stayed one night after a 7 day cruise. Not sure what we were getting for this fee. Definately older hotel but room was nice, clean and updated. Had a great view of diamond head and the city from the outdoor hallway.

We had a room on 24th floor facing the ocean. What a fantastic view, we were able to sit on our balcony and watch the sunset every night. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom is dated and could do with update. Staff were very helpful. Only complaint would be the $35 per night on top of room charge, for inroom coffee (which was undrinkable), plastic bottle,dvds and wifi. A large charge for things which should be included in the room cost.Tiki bar downstairs have specials every evening and music. Good fun.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Room of a good standard, although a few cobwebs on the ceiling. Let's keep it in perspective, not the end of the world. Excellent location and all service staff very efficient, friendly and helpful. Lovely bar attached offering drinks, live music and good food. Excellent lift system which a lot of higher grade hotels could benefit from. In all excellent facilities, excellent service, excellent location,just need a feather duster for ceilings.

Check in/reception area can be slow at times. Room was as appeared on their website. Hallways outside hotel rooms can become noisy. Room service offers coffee and cleaning to each room daily. I also found that we had a group of friends/sports team staying on our level that would come home late rowdy. Very central location to shops and beach. Free hire of beach towels and chairs which is very convenient! Staff at tour desk very very helpful!

Hotel is average. What makes it very good is the location and the tiki bar/grill at the resort. Swimming pool is a little small and crowded. Room is okay, but bathroom is small and below average. Hotel staff are good. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. Beach is right across the street.

Stayed for 3 nights. Location is great, staff very helpful. Room is fine, but physical plant in general needs some updating. Bathrooms small, otherwise OK. Starbucks, Subway, other convenient choices nearby. Near Queens park, Shaaka beach rentals.Dont stay here if you need a 4 star place. DO stay here if you want access to both Waikiki and the quieter beaches to east, and to save a few bucks to spend on other more important travel things.

We stayed here one night before cruising. Great location in the middle of everything in Waikiki beach. Staff was great and our room was fine but the ocean front view was spectacular overlooking Waikiki beach! It was all we wanted it to be! Bed was super comfortable! Loved it and would recommend highly!

We ordered an “ocean view” room which is pictured as having a somewhat front facing room where the ocean is completely visible from the bed/entire room, sadly we had a tiny balcony and a small side view we could only see if out on the balcony and a room that was on the side of the hotel. While the location of the hotel is wonderful and the facilities were nice the resort fee was a little high and we were a little disappointed with the room we got as it did not match the pictures. Rooms were clean and staff were pleasant.

This hotel has a great location (for us) - right on Waikiki Beach and near the Zoo. We were in a front room looking directly over the sea and beach - stunning views. However, the room was a little 'tired' and the bathroom downright in need of gutting and refurbishing. There isn't a restaurant as part of the hotel but one downstairs near the pool area which is convenient. The pool is very small and not an attractive area. The staff are good and most helpful. We were really happy with the location but if you want to be in more of the action this may not be the place for you.

We stayed here for 9 nights so long enough to get a feel for the place. First off this is a light and bright hotel and we received a nice welcome. Porters very helpful in receiving and handling our luggage. The reception is on the 3rd level and you can take an elevator or escalator there. Usual resort fee to add to room cost but encountered this at most of the US hotels we stayed. We had a partial ocean view room on the 21st floor which provided a very good view of the beach and ocean as well as Diamond Head crater. We could choose a smaller room with larger lanai or a larger room with smaller lanai. We elected for the latter. Wi-Fi was included and signal and service excellent all the time we were there. No mini bar but small fridge included which was fine as we just bought our own stuff at plentiful stores nearby. Room was relatively spacious and clean. Rooms maybe a tad dated (particularly bathroom) but comfortable enough with good AC. Probably could be made a bit more comfortable with a small lounge seat but that is minor. Seems to be popular with families and we did have some noisy children as neighbours for awhile. The very nice Tiki grill and bar is located on the 3rd floor but be aware it isn’t connected ed to Hotel so you can’t charge dining to your room. There is no room service available. Free DVD and PS3 game rental ( a PS3 in each room) included with three dispensing machines in the lobby. Nice little supplies shop in the hotel as well. Tours depart from outside the hotel or a couple of hundred metres away at the Marriott. Location is really good- just across from Waikiki Beach. There is a small pool available but it was always full of kids and the ocean is over the road anyway. Just be aware this is what I would class as a good quality mid-range Hotel- not one of the luxury brands. Certainly would consider staying here again but would go for an upgrade in room with full ocean views.

we had an ocean view room and we could easily see the ocean from our balcony. great elevator system set up so you arent packed like sardines stopping at every floor. staff were all friendly, pleasant and professional. great location. rooms were comfortable. i would stay here again.

We spent a total of 7 nights at this hotel (booked by a travel agent). I was disgusted with the state of the bathroom which was dirty and mouldy. I spoke to a staff member and reported this and showed them photos I had taken of the bathroom . I was told that a manager would contact me. I never heard back from the manager, or staff about my concerns. If you stay at this hotel DON’T stay in room 506 . (I can add photos if requested by trivago or hotel.)Apart from this, the staff were friendly and helpful.

The Aston was not up to the standard of chains such as Hilton and Marriot and was also in family area of waikiki near Diamond Head. No cooked breakfast and pool smaller than most home pools. Comfortable room with good views but I would book the centre of Waikiki in future with more restaurants and direct beach access rather than breakwater which would be ideal for children though.

We stayed in room 1417 which had a wonderful view of Waikiki and the ocean. I think the odd number rooms face Waikiki and ocean and even rooms face Diamond Head and ocean. The hotel website got changed a few months ago and isn't real clear on what size of lanai the rooms have. To my knowledge this is the way it goes, on the partial ocean view rooms that are 264 sq ft the lanai is full size and can accommodate 2 chairs and a little table. The rooms that are 312 sq ft the lanai is small and can only have 1 chair. I thought the old website explained this better than the new one. Ours was the smaller room with full size lanai. We were right above the pool and didn't have any problems with noise. The AC was just barely adequate but my wife gets cold easy so she thought it was great. The room was nice and clean and the bed comfortable. Even though the room is small it was fine as we unloaded part of our suitcases in the dresser and stored them in the closet. The rest we put on the luggage rack. When we first went up to the room I noticed that the refrigerator was empty so I called down to the front desk to see about getting it filled but found out that some rooms get it stocked and some rooms don't. The WIFI was free and we had a good signal. I know others have said they had to pay for their WIFI but we didn't. Maybe that was the trade-off for not having a stocked frig? We are not needy guests and only had the room cleaned once in out 7 night stay because we put out the "do not disturb" on the door. We would just see the person cleaning other rooms and get fresh wash cloths from them. One curious thing was the first day there was only 1 wash cloth so we got more from the cleaners but the day we had it cleaned they only put 1 wash cloth again. This was a room with 2 beds that can accommodate 4 adults. No big problem, just stopped a cleaning person and got more. Didn't eat at TIKI's, went there to eat breakfast and found they only have a few pastries and fruit for $15 so went to Wolfgang Puck's and it was fine. My wife went to Jamba Juice and got 2 smoothies, which she really enjoyed. Didn't use the pool since the ocean and beach is right across the street. Got beach chairs and towels twice and had no problems. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. Most everything is within walking distance. We went on a few tours and they picked us up either at our hotel or the Marriot across the street. There is a problem with homeless people in the area. They didn't cause any major problems and there was police in the area most of the time. This hotel was worth the money and I would stay here again.

The staff were a highlight of our stay. The "king suite" room is comfortable, the bed very much so. Pricey but right on the beach road. My biggest concern is the noise coming through the walls and especially the locked connecting doors if you have one. There is light underneath, they are thin doors, and you hear voices, snoring, tv (sometimes all night due to the free movies), slamming doors, etc. Some of this is caused by obnoxious guests who feel they are the only ones present, but some by deficiencies in the construction. I will be trying another venue.

Our second visit to Waikiki and second stay with Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. They have maintained their high standards for service, comfort and quality since our last trip a few years ago. Warning about using Google Maps - Going to sites east of Waikiki, Google Maps will take you through small residential streets. Returning can also be navigational-ly bothersome. When heading out, take Kapahulu Ave up to H1. When returning, take exit 25 exits, not 26.
