Our experience with this hotel was excellent. Check-in was quick and efficient, and we were given a gift bag with some water bottles and a fan, all of which came in handy throughout our trip. Our room was an ocean view (as booked) on a higher floor, and had a nice balcony that we could stand on to watch the beautiful sunset. We had booked directly through the hotel's website and were informed of the extra resort charges that would be collected during our stay. The resort fee includes use of towels for the pool & beach, folding chairs for the beach, DVD/Game rental, Wifi, coffee maker, etc. If this is shocking to you, get used to it - many (if not all) Honolulu hotels charge a daily "resort fee" of some kind, you can't escape it. Staff is very friendly and willing to help with any questions you may have. The cleaning staff members are very courteous. The pool was well-maintained. The on-site restaurant Tiki's was great, the food and drinks are good and there is usually live music to enjoy starting in the afternoon - great Happy Hour food and drink specials. A pristine beach is right across the street, and we found the location to be a bit quieter and less congested than further down the road. Shopping is endless - plenty of ABC stores for conveniences and souvenirs, and gift stores abound. It's a short walk to the "busier" end of Honolulu, where there is more high-end shopping. Travel desks with information on tours are available on the main floor of the hotel. Our room was a tiny bit dated, but nothing that would turn me off to the place. It was very clean. Overall we enjoyed our time at this hotel, and would definitely recommend it to anyone staying in Waikiki.
user_name:
Deirdre N
New Milford, New Jersey

review_body: My family and I booked a standard room here and much to my surprise had been upgraded to an oceanview room. The view was good, if you can get a view directly above the pool then you’ll not only have a view of the pool but a better view of Waikiki beach. Our room was small, one luggage rack (like all hotels) but nowhere to put luggage for 4 people in a room. We had a 10yr old & a 4yr old, I would hate to think if there were teenage kids or worse 4 adults in this room. Our air conditioner kept cutting off after about 45 mins. It works on a sensor, so if it stops sensing movement it turns off. Very inconvenient for during the night, our room was pretty stuffy so when one of us would get up because of the heat we would turn it on, it would cool enough for us to get back to sleep, then the same thing would happen again. I was told by the front desk that the sensor function could be over ridden however we had 2 different maintenance staff come to our room, one said the fan needed to be replaced, the next guy said there is nothing wrong with it. I mentioned it again to front desk and nothing happened, and again upon checkout, nothing said other than I’ll pass your comments onto our maintenance team, still charged me for resort tax, and nothing done to compensate our discomfort. The room however is nice and clean and no sign of bed bugs like a lot of previous people have posted. Staff are lovely and polite (other than nothing being done to rectify our situation, & language barrier with maintenance staff though). Pool area is lovely, ordered some drinks from Tiki’s bar however didn’t eat here so cannot comment on the food. We were on the 14th floor so we couldn’t here the music playing each night from Tiki’s but the street noise was absolutely terrible. I don’t know why but during most nights the trolleys would go past honking their horns constantly with the young kids on there yelling and screaming, was terrible, it woke us up most nights.

We stayed on the top floor (as requested) which afforded a great view over the shorter buildings around ours. Rooms were very clean, a little dated but comfortable and everything worked fine. Wish we'd known about the dvd/game player in the room so we could have brought our fave travel movies not that there was much time for t.v.! Beds are comfy. Room had mini fridge and K-Cup coffee maker with local coffee. Very courteous cleaning staff. Valet guys were awesome. The beach is right across the street and the zoo 1-2 blocks down the street. Lots of shopping;high and low end for every taste and budget. Food and night life galore. You can rent anything and everything for the ocean right down the street or drive over to North Shore for some awesome hikes. We did Waimano Falls trail (about 1/2 way to Manana Falls) and was sore for two days but it was a blast! Also, less crowded beaches on North Shore. Would stay here again just for its location and fair pricing.

My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach at the end of a cruise. The hotel is one of the older ones on the 'strip', but has been refurbished over the years. Our main reason for choosing it was it's position directly across the road from the beach and at the 'slightly' quieter end of Kalakaua Avenue. We had a Partial Oceanview room one room back from the front rooms. The room was large with 2 double beds, a separate sitting area and large wardrobe. The bathroom was on the small side and quite dated, but it was adequate for a short stay. The balcony wasn't useable - just wide enough to step out onto, but no furniture. The pool is on the 1st floor and adjacent to the open air reception area. It is very small and an uninspiring area, but I imagine most people would be across the road on the beach. Beach towels are loaned for free. There is an onsite restaurant - Tiki's, which is very popular with locals. We didn't experience it. Downstairs there are some casual eateries and takeaway food stores. We actually bought supplies (milk, juice, muffins etc) for our own in room breakfast. There are tour desks on site that can help you with bookings or just information. The only real negative was a 45 minute queue to check in - something we have never experienced anywhere in the world! The hotel is a basic tourist hotel in a convenient position.

Staff was nice, location was good, hotel room and areas were clean and nice. Had to call about AC not working in our room. The AC seemed old as well as some of the other hardware in the room. Got dinged with extra fees for valet parking and amenities. The amenities fees for room items each day is BS. We didn’t use any but had to pay anyway. Just another way for them to appear less expensive online and then make it up once you get there. Not impressed and will not be back. EVERY THING costs additional,

Check in went smooth and front desk people were nice. Room was a typical room nothing fancy. Big down fall was that we were never informed well of all the extra fees—valet parking bc there is no where else to park, room amenities with which many things should have been included in the room rate. Just go prepared to pay. Prob will try another hotel if we go again.

A nice hotel on the beach but the highest additional charges we've seen soured the experience.We stayed at four hotels two weeks across LA and Hawaii and the Aston takes the prize for highest extra fees. Charging for both valet parking and resort fees left a bad taste in our mouths - a taste that no free fan and beach bag can overcome. Our room was on floor 24 and was the smallest of all we stayed in. The loud and annoying drinks machine outside our room was drowned out by the loud and annoying air conditioning inside our room while the twin beds didn't leave a vast amount of room to maneuver. Of course, if the hotel had their way my mum and I would have shared a double bed as the twin bed request was ignored until I specifically raised it. To its credit the hotel is right on the beach and the partial sea view was better than we might have expected. But having to pay nearly $240 extra in fees across our four nights is frankly ludicrous and the hotel just wasn't worth it.

Great location. Check in went very smooth. Asked for early check in and received a early check in. Our room had a beautiful view of Waikiki beach. Had a small frig.with coffee maker. Room rather small with very limited plug-ins for phones. Bath room was small but ok. Room was cleaned early most days and staff very pleasant. We love this hotel and have stayed many times. The view, location and staff make up for any down side. We were here to go to the University of Hawaii baseball games playing University of Long Beach Dirtbags. We discovered after arriving that the Long Beach Team was staying here. We seen them arrive in the Hawaiian Shirts and what a surprise to see them. You would not even know there was about 40 baseball players here. They said the location worked out well for them as they were on their own to get their meals lots of places to eat. You could see them doing their morning workout on the beach. Driving from here was also very easy.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is located at the end of Kalakaua Ave. next to the Honolulu Zoo. This isn't a luxury hotel, but I can't imagine having a better experience at any of the higher priced, more luxurious hotels along the same street. Everyone, from the housekeeping staff to the valet crew, made us feel like we were the most important people at the hotel. The view from room 1825 is AMAZING! The elevator is super fast, and I loved the fact the guests have to scan their room card on the outside of the elevator to enter their floor number. This prevents people from getting on the elevator and hitting every button just to be a nuisance to other guests.The water pressure is awesome, and the hot water must be coming from the center of the Earth because it was extremely hot and we never ran out of hot water at any point during our stay. We will definitely consider staying here again if we ever go back to Waikiki! :)

The hotel is situated in heaven on earth. Hawaii is such a lovely place. It was too bad that the entire 5 days we were there, there was only one morning with sun. Every other day was cloudy and rainy. Nevertheless, my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.The hotel sits right at the end of Waikiki Beach, and this turned out to be a blessing because parking is very hard to come by in Waikiki. Because of its location, it was easy to get parking that was only 5-10 mins walk from the hotel.The room itself was comfortable, and the view was fantastic. Couldn't have asked for a better room at that price range. TIki's, the in house restaurant had great food and great ambience.There was a trolley (tram) stop just outside the hotel (how great is that?!).There was an ABC (kind of like a 7-Eleven but way, way cooler) right next door. Staff were friendly. It was great!Price wise, a bit on the steep side I would say, and I wouldn't have shelled out that much had it not been for a special occasion.But all in all, I love this hotel for the location and the memories!

We stayed here for 5 nights and were very satisfied with our stay. Room 2328 offers a spectacular view of Diamond Head and Wikiki beach. No noise from the pool or restaurant on that side of the hotel. I recommend a "white noise" or rain app for your phone to drown out any unusual noises when traveling. We slept comfortably and without interruption.The size of the suite was perfect for 2 people. The rooms were clean and housekeeping was friendly and efficient. The bathroom was a tad small and in need of some upgrades, but was adequate for our needs.Valet parking service was fast and friendly, although a bit steep for the price. There is a daily $25 resort fee which is a little annoying. I realize that many hotels charge for this, but it seems that it could just be added to the room charge so there would just be one nightly price instead of add- ons.The beach and most Waikiki amenities are within walking distance. For some cheap entertainment, buy a loaf of bread and feed the fish from the jetty at the beach. We spotted many tropical fish without getting wet!I would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Hawaii and would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

We stayed here 5 nights and I cannot complain at all. Not a luxury hotel but it was a very comfortable, clean hotel. We had a oceanview room and it was the absolute best view I have ever had. Only negative I can say is at 2am when the Tikki room had the music pumping our room location was a downfall as it was very loud. We had no issues at all with Aston Waikiki, all interactions with the staff were pleasant and the pool area was never crowded which is great. I would stay here again and I would recommend staying here to others.

We have loved our Waikiki trip. The hotel is pretty good. The staff has been excellent! The hotel is right Across the road from Waikiki beach. The only things that we did not like were the super flat pillows, I woke up every morning with my neck hurting. The trash trucks right outside every morning around 4 am woke us up too. Also, the ac in our room never kept us cool enough. My husband made fun of me for buying a small travel box fan and bringing it with me, but we would have been very uncomfortable at night if it didn’t. Overall a good stay. The views and good things about the hotel far outweighs the couple of negatives. Would definitely book here again and bring my own pillow lol.

This was our second stay. Great staff, excellent facilities and a great location. As it was our second stay, we automatically for a room upgrade to a bigger room with an ocean view. Room was very clean and no sign of those bed bugs!

My family and me want to do a stay vacation . I went to the hotel page we check for any military specials . They say that $25 dollars and taxes would be waived if you make a reservation with Waikiki Aston Hotel . I call to verify because when I was doing the online reservation it doesn’t show the amount they suppose to waived . The employee told me that the amount would be waived after you check in and show an active duty Id . I ask her clearly if it make a different do the reservation on the phone or online from the actual hotel Webside . Her response was No is the same thing . We get to the hotel and GUESS what ? They told my husband that to be waive the reservation have to be staying more that two days . I check the Webside again and in the Military appreciation program doesn’t say anything about how many days you have to stay in the hotel for you to get the discount . I try to talk to the front desk and explain to me where is it say in the Webside that I have to stay more that one night . Her respond is that I made the reservation wrong because they have 5 different kind of military programs . Well I guess I work for the Waikiki Aston hotel because all I did is made the reservation on their Webside follow the instructions and I was told that as longer you show your ID the amount would be waived . Because I don’t work for this company and I guess I don’t know how to make a reservation with the military appreciation program never got waveid the amount that was told it will . Anyways I would never stay in this hotel again . I know is just a discount but at the same time if I call and verify I going to want my discount . The personnel of the hotel have no integrity . We talk two employees and they give my husband a different excuse that they give me as longer we didn’t get the amount waived. We do stay vacation all around Waikiki . This is the first time a hotel in Waikiki have disappointed me . Any other hotel is better that this hotel . Thank you for ruin my stay vacation weekend .

Check-In went smoothly for us, but several hours later went down to the front desk and the check-in line was INSANE. If I had been subject to that, I would have probably left and gone elsewhere. The elevator system takes a minute to figure out, but once you do, the system works pretty well. Room was clean, stocked, and comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job. View was great. Valet was friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed almost everything about our stay. Very little to complain about.

First room had bed bugs, noticed after two days there, moved up to a suite, issues still persisted, filed a claim, complained several times, still pending a call back, but seeing as how they treated us, I don't expect one in return. GO MARRIOTT next door..

No nice way to say it but our HOTEL ROOM in paradise had BED BUGS. Reported it to hotel, explained that I noticed some marks on my sons knee, only to find those same marks on my self few days later. They switched us to a suite to make up for the inconvenience. Packed all my belongings, moved to suite, it was night time so I unpacked and fell asleep only to wake up to more hotel negligence AGAIN.. still upset about our first room, I immediately called the lobby and had them send a manager to my room to show him first hand that the hotel is cutting corner and its unsanitary. There was hair on the sheets that we sleeped on, yellow stains and dusty too, the carpet in that hotel is brown and I know why now.. paid a lot for my stay, and I couldn't get in touch with the hotel general manager after several attempts ( I spoke to the safety inspector) he explained the process when something like this happens I explained to him that I wanted to hire my own exterminate company to speed up the process and make sure I was taken care of properly. Not some third hotel party friend that cuts the same corners. They declined, didn't give me a reason.. bottom line they haven't made it right and I still plan to take action... TWO ROOMs showed housekeeping negligence, they gave me the run around, never spoke to general manager ( he was busy at another property).. overall I'm disappointed.. and I don't feel they've made things right.. SPEND YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY ELSEWHERE..

My wife and I booked from April 18th to April 20th on our trip to Oahu. We rented a car using Capital Points and drove from Airport to Hotel. Honolulu traffic at 4 pm is no fun. For being an Interstate - 40 MPH was probably tops and more like 10-15 MPH average. We brought our own Garmin - I like to preprogram stops so that instead of relying on phone we just punch in place and go. The 20 mile trip took about an hour. We pulled in Valet parking ( there is public parking but after fighting traffic we thought go with flow) The Valet were very courteous and we were told to take the elevator to 2 where we would sign in. Unfortunately we got on wrong elevator and ended up at 12. Without a pass card, it is impossible to use elevator. We finally got on and went to check in. The check in was good, the lady tried to get us above 10th floor for view of beach. The room was very nice, bed comfortable, the balcony beautiful view and overall well pleased - EXCEPT - they have very thin walls and at 1:30 AM ( note we started traveling at 4:00AM EST and this was 7:30 AM EST) we heard the tenants of room 231 ( we were in room 230) have a loud almost argument with more F-Bombs thrown for 15 minutes than I ever heard. I didn't know that you could have a conversation with the F-Word every other word. They finally settled down and we got back to sleep.We should have called them we got up every 15 minutes so they could enjoy their interupted sleep. Next day they were gone so that was done.The hotel has lots of options to eat and what we saw was good. We weren't real hungry when we landed so we opted for 3 appetizers and 2 drinks ($63 + tip) The charges $32 parking and $25/day WiFi. Parking I can understand but the Wifi seems petty for a place of this caliber.Location was great - 10 minutes from Diamond Head, easy access to IH-1 and everyting is close to you. Pearl Harbor is about 30-50 minutes away dependent on traffic. Beach we walked but didn't partake.

Most disappointing Hotel in HI that we have stayed in. Reminded me of an old school drive in Motel from the 70s. Very dirty, old, unhygienic and noisy. Only plus was the location. Had Lunch at Tiki's Restaurant. Staff member was arrogant & more interested in watching the TV in the Bar area. Resort Fee is a joke. Must be very loose with the defintion of Resort in Waikiki. Compared with others including Hyatt Place (next door), the Marriott (across the street) and the Hilton Hawaiian Village, it is no where near up to scratch. In desperate need of renovations!!

My husband and I stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 6 days.The Hotel I believe was the best choice for this time of year due to the sunset.The hotel is clean, we had an ocean front room, the room was fine, I did email Aston asking for a high floor but was given the 8 th floor this was still okay, however I would of preferred higher. We could hear the music from downstairs which was annoying the first night as we were tired from flying, this did not bother us other nights.The staff are friendly and helpful. The only downside was the very rude and very unhelpful woman at the tourist desk, she was that rude I moved to the next booth the Expedia booth, the gentleman there was very helpful and went out of his way to explain trips and tours to us ... he obviously got our business.All in all we would stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel

Really comfy beds , awesome beach facing rooms .. little bit noisey .. definitely need air plugs .. would definitely come again , great location , restaurant and transportation . Great staff , really helpful , very pleasant.. pool bar overlooking the beach .

We arrived without any expectations considering the reviews we read...my, I can't understand the negative comments I've read here. Staff were very friendly and helpful, room modern and well furnished, GREAT GREAT view, great location too...for a much lower price than what is found elsewhere...I mean come on people, if you can afford 800$/night for the Royal Hawaiian, then you can expect to be treated as a prince but if your wallet won't follow, just to go this place, stop whining and you will be delighted, they treat their client very well and everything is clean, I would have stayed there much longer and would recommend - TIP: park at the Waikiki Banyan about 1 block away for 20$/day. Mahalo to your team, you made our trip to Waikiki wonderful and we'll come back

We arrived at 12 but our room would not be ready until 3pm which was fine, we had to come back at 3pm, but we had taken our cases to the checkin on the 3rd floor only to have to take them back down to the ground floor where the luggage storeroom was situated. There was a queue each time. The check in staff were very friendly.Our room was on the 19th floor (pool side) and we had great views of Waikiki Beach and the coast. It was always entertaining sitting out on the balcony watching the world go by. Housekeeping staff were always pleasant and helpful.The Hop On Hop Off Bus stopped outside the hotel which made it very convenient.The ABC Shops (7/11 shops) next door made grabbing a snack/fruit very easy.Close to the zoo.

We arrived on Friday and our cruise will depart on Saturday. We prefer to arrive a day early rather than allowing possible flight delays affecting our cruise. Hotel was recommended by NCL due to proximity to the Port. Great location next to the beach but hotel is in average condition with nothing to rave about.A/C was barely adequate and ran continuously and was very loud and annoying. If you are a light sleeper, this room 1633 is not for you. No restaurant operated by the hotel but several attached to the building and food was good. Starbucks is in this block and the Zoo is next door.

We arrived at this hotel at 10.30. We queued to check in, knowing we would not get our room until 3pm. This queue was for about 40 minutes. We were told no need to queue when you come back, just come to the front and get your room key. We dropped our bags at the porter area and headed off to visit Waikiki Beach. At 4.30 we came back, only to find a queue of around 150 people. It went from the desks across the lobby, lifts etc, around the corner down past the 3 tour areas all the way to the bar. One person bravely went to the front desk in front of the queue (as advised when we all checked in in the morning) only to be told - no you have to queue to get your room key! There were 4 desk operators and the manager did not have the sense to open one of these for people who had already checked in that morning. The queue would have dropped by half if that had been done. We queued for nearly 1.5 hours to get our room key.The other lovely trick this place does is applies a resort fee if you have been booked in as part of a package holiday deal. $26US per day and it is non negotiable. So if you dont want to use their beach towels, internet or dreadful coffee you still have to pay for it. One of our friends booked the hotel through booking.com and did not have this big financial penalty applied.So BEWARE of this hotel or at least be warned as to what to expect. The rooms are clean and if you get a view it is quite nice but the queuing was absolutely ridiculous. One poor older man went up after an hour and said to the girl im not going to put up with this so im leaving and cancelling my booking. Her reply - sir checkout is before 12 NOON. He hadn't yet managed to check in!!!

Room 526 was a good place to rest and sleep. It was a bit dated and in need of some basic repairs and updates including towel racks were loose on the wall and the shower curtain rail had a screw coming loose. This room was quiet and serviced as expected. $35 forced valet car parking was more than my expected budget. Hotel is close to the beach and zoo. Bed mattresses were a bit lumpy and aged. Adding a small microwave to the room might have helped me save on some expensive restaurant costs and morning time when I was meeting a before sunrise tour. WiFi was very good. I am not a person that desires high end hotel amenities so I would stay here again.

We travel a lot as a family and stayed at 3 places on the island. this was pricey and so we expected a lot. It fell short on a number of aspects and was by far the least impressive. We expected more than was what we were delivered. The windows are single glazed - so they let the wind in and do not keep sound of the city out. The opening windows are clumsily rigged so that you cannot open them too wide - a terrible look. The fabric curtains in the bathroom and toilet are not working so collect mould on the back - as such there is no easy ventilation system. The carpet is old looking, one lift was out of action, the decor is old and tired and to be honest the lighting is chaotic. For a pricey hotel it fell a long way short especially compared to the Hilton at Waikiki (which was considerably cheaper).Shop around people

Staff very friendly, quieter end of the beach near zoo. Onsite Tiki bar overpriced but not to location prices. Negative side staff kindly waved resort fee and reallocated us to another room due to stainage on curtains,bedding and shower curtain. Even though given room upgrade on check in, I’m afraid to say I wouldn’t of liked to have seen the non upgraded version. Rooms decorated to very poor workmanship standard, walls marked/scuffed bathroom tiny, toilet so close to floor and basin, items would drop into toilet from our basin, holes in bathroom wall. Corridor has a putrid stench of sewers? Room based on 17 floor had the kitchen cooking odours filtering into our room at night which made me nauseous. First impressions filled me with dread, if I wasn’t so jet lagged I’d of checked out and found an alternative. The reception is based at the poolside area very strange set-up on arrival you have to cart cases up an escalator to get there or a staircase on side street. Would never recommend this resort for any longer than a stopover night because you be very disappointed indeed.

This hotel was the perfect location for our family holiday. We had 2 rooms (2 + 3) for 9 days. The rooms were very well maintained and the service staff are friendly and efficient. The free pool bags are a well thought out bonus, particularly as the hotel is right across the street from the beach. There are plenty of reasonably priced (by Waikiki standard) restaurants within a couple of minutes stroll. The beds were comfortable, the wifi free, and the common areas are clean. Tiki's bar downstairs has friendly staff and a great view over the beach and the hotel pool. It's not the newest hotel on the strip but we enjoyed our stay very much.

It is right opposite the beach and so close to everything. Lovely rooms with great views. You can see exactly what the surf is doing. My family have stayed here 2 times. Once in 2017 and before that in 2007.

Fantastic value for $$$. Good clean rooms. Perfect location not to busy but still on beach. High levels rooms with crater and ocean view are fantastic. Quick check in and out. Very close to zoo. Would stay at again.

The location of this property was perfect when it comes to proximity to the beach, shopping, dining. The hotel itself was very dated. The pool was small. The pictures online are very deceiving. Over priced for what it was.

We loved our stay at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Our rooms were Ocean front select, and the views were spectacular! Our room was very nicely appointed with plenty of room. The small lanai was a wonderful place to sit and watch all of the action along Waikiki beach! We would recommend a stay at the hotel, and a cocktail and the Tiki bar/restaurant. Our only negative was the pool which was a little small and didn't offer a hot tub, or kids pool. Didn't bother us, but might be a concern for those who want to sit around the pool for any length of time.

This was a beautiful hotel right across the street from the Waikiki Beach. The Tiki Bar restaurant was great with good food and a a view of the beach. It’s location is so convenient as there are several stores for forgotten items and food right at the hotel.

Arrived on Monday just after 1pm. Even though check-in is after 3pm, they let us check in early when the room was ready. Had lunch at the Tiki restaurant adjacent to the hotel. My six year-old son got a Frisbee with his kids meal.My son also got a bag for the beach with pail and shovel. Location is convenient, across the street from the beach.This section of the beach also has a wall to reduce the tide, so the water is calm for kids.Pool let us check out towels and take them to the beach, just need to check them back in.The pool also has outdoor showers so we can rinse off sand from the beach.The resort fee of $25 per day also let us check out DVD's for movies and video games on a PS 3 machine that is in the room. Nice flat screen TV. Room has a refrigerator.Since we were celebrating our anniversary, we received a small complimentary bottle of champagne.The card key system to work the elevator is a little tricky, but once we figured it out, it was no problem.We had a 9th floor partial ocean view, and it was nice, as it overlooked the area of the beach where we took our son to play. The room had a sliding door so we could step outside of our room to see the view. We could hang our beach clothes to dry off on a small deck chair.Hotel location is a short walking distance to the Honolulu zoo and Waikiki aquarium. The transportation stop for airport shuttles is also located right in front of the hotel.Only minor problem was with the TV, but maintenance fixed it quickly, while we were out to dinner. Also missing a washcloth the first night, but after we called housekeeping, they brought us two, and it was warm, like it had just come out of the dryer. Had a good visit, would consider returning to this Aston hotel in the future..

"Most underwhelming experience"눉I booked this room in August 2017 when I knew I would run the Hapalua half-marathon and wanted to be near the start and finish lines. But as soon as I arrived I was disappointed. The entire hotel is tired. When I arrived on my 11th floor is was smelly as was my room. I had to go and buy air-freshener to deal with it. I was then sandwiched between two rooms of school kids with no adults in their rooms. I had to talk to them about locking each other out on the balcony before I rang the manager (from my mobile phone because the room phone didn't work!). They moved me to another, quieter room, which was great but I lost time having to pack and relocate.The pool was empty for one of the five days as they had to repair something. There was no laundry room at all, so I can't imagine how families on long stays manage.I was so underwhelmed by my stay and suggest people look at other hotels that are much more modern and take pride in their establishment. 눇The view from the ocean rooms are the best thing about the hotel.

This Hotel is a good choice to stay if you want to enjoy more closer the beauty of this amazing place Waikiki. Is much closed to the beach and lots of attractions in this place like the Diamond Head which is an inactive volcano monument. You can walk to up there and reach to the top then from there the sight of the Pacific Ocean and the whole Waikiki city can be seen. These are unforgettable moments. Also the Hotel is very clean and organized, The Front Desk was a little crowded and we had to wait a little for the check in and the check out but are fair enough. They give you a little gift if you stay there which can be taken as souvenirs of Hawaii. Very nice initiative!! Inside the Hotel is a restaurant, bar and a swimming pool. It’s a very comfortable place to stay and rest or have lots of fun. At night you can enjoy a very party environment on the streets and pick what you want to do with the many choices available for you

We are locals and stayed one night for the great Jackson Browne concert. Very close walk, probably the closest major hotel. The elevators are funky. You swipe your card and it tells you which elevator (A-E) to wait by... we liked it after we realized how to use. The room was very good,no issues at all. A tea service/kettle would be nice. Will stay again soon!

Yes the hotel is a little tired and showing it’s age in some building issues ButThat is more than offset by location, facilities, staff and comfort. We have thoroughly enjoyed our time here and will be spending a few more nights here on our way back through Waikiki The team are most helpful and one issue stands out. Last evening there was considerable noise wafting up from the music from restaurant on level 3. We phoned reception to ask if it could be reduced as it was penetrating into our closed room. “Certainly we will have our security speak with the restaurant”. Credit to both the hotel and Tiki which is the restaurant as the noise was cut within minutes. I was amazed.

The Aston is very clean, they have the best beds and water pressure ever. Staff are very friendly, right on the beach front and close to all shops, restaurants, cafes and bus lines. We had an amazing experience and highly recommend The Aston Hotel.

Stayed at Aston Waikiki for three nights. Easy walk to Centre of town. Cross the street to the beach. Very spacious rooms and comfortable. There is a bar and restaurant which is excellent on the 3rd floor which is beside the pool. The area is quiet at night with very little road noise. Great view of the fireworks at night. We Recommend this motel.

I guess one gets what they pay for; although almost $900 Canadian for 4nights. The rooms were a bit small for 3 people, two small double beds, no chairs (a small table and two stools) a small balcony with 2 chairs and an ocean view (paid extra for that). Bathrooms needed renovating; nowhere to hang towels to completely dry out or anything else for that matter. Staff was friendly and helpful; the hotel itself was in a great location; right across from the beach and just a short walk from the Honolulu Zoo. The pool was a bit small and the restaurant/bar had mediocre food. Not sure that we would stay there again.

Not luxurious, but clean comfortable room in excellent location, we were very happy with our stay in the centre of all the action. The Restauant/bar on the premises was good, the pool well used, tour booths readily available. Within one block was the public transit which we used several times without waiting more than a few minutes. A large park with bandshell just down the road, the beach and swimming area and small pier right across from the hotel. The beach itself was clean and scenic and a ten minute walk took us to the major beach bars in the evening. Altogether we were impressed and would have stayed longer. So yes I would recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Kathy T
Ontario's Thousand Islands, Canada

review_body: I have to say - most of the reviews we read on this place before we chose it were spot on. As a result, we had originally booked at The Mariott down the street but in the end, decided to save a few bucks and booked the Aston after all. We knew what we were getting into and honestly, mostly the location earned this hotel a 3 star rating. It is directly across the street from the beach. For simplicity sake, here is my Pro's and Cons list:Pros:1. Across the street from beach2. comfortable beds3. Easy check in4. Magnified mirror in bathroom (important to ladies)5. Hawaiian Tropic bathroom products - good quality6. Heated pool but small7. Beautiful Ocean View (we were on the 25th floor)Cons:1. Totally outdated - bathrooms need a complete over haul!2. Sun doesn't hit the pool deck until at least after 12 noon.3. Beach chairs are regular lawn chairs - NOT the low kind4. Extremely noisy on the pool deck - from the busy street just below - trolley's dinging, horns blowing, loud bus engines, motorcycles, and.....loud children in the pool. It wasn't relaxing at all.5. Very noisy in the room as well when you open your patio door - street noise is very loudSo, as you can see, it does has some good points. But, your budget and level of need for luxury will help make your decision. This is not luxurious but you can save a few bucks. Hope this helps.

Rooms are a little seedy but overall a nice place. My room on the 20th floor, had a nice little balcony with a view of the ocean. I like this part of Waikiki at the end near the zoo and aquarium. Starbucks around the corner opens at 0400 when you're jet lagged. Recommended.

This was 5th time at this hotel and will be going back to it again, Was up on higher floor and rooms quiet for day or night, Most of the floors can see the ocean and pier, There are many stores and one inside the hotel it self. This hotel also has many pick up and drop off for many such as tour buses and more. There many places to go such as restaurants close as well as the hotel has one also with torches that are lit up at night. The elevators have security cards that only for people who are staying there. The park is in walking distance as well as the aquarium . If you want to rent a moped it's just a half block away in the back. You can have a dip in the pool or across you have a area of the ocean where you or the kids are safe .Have been with wife and solo and had great times.

Our room had sliding door to small patio with broken door lock and make shift lock put in it's place, didn't work, being 16 floors up used safe, bathroom had seen better days. This being said, the view we had was awesome, the hotel staff great, courteous and always wanting to help especially the cleaning crew. Had a great restaurant/bar pool area and small shop with everything Was close to the beach, right across street, and shops with many places to eat, all within a five minute walk. Would recommend hotel.

Rooms are good, neat and clean. Location vise this place is good, great views actually. Customer service is okay okay not so great. Food was a issue for vegetarians. Budget vise this place is okay okay place.

This hotel was nothing amazing or flashy. Having seen the pictures on the website, I was disappointed. Elevators are complicated, and it needs some remodeling/ retouching/re painting. Rooms were small (we had a room with 2 fulls). All in all, nothing horrible but nothing great. The restaurant in the hotel was very good! Beach is right across the street which is nice!

We wanted oceanfront room but we were on a budget so Aston Waikiki beach hotel fit the bill. After looking at photos posted by other travelers, we knew what we were getting into and all we wanted was oceanfront room. So, you get what you pay for. We paid around $450 per room for 2 nights including taxes and $25/night amenities. We didn't have a car so no parking fee. We checked in other big name hotels, oceanfront was around $300/night.The location is really good because it is towards the end of the strip and when you get oceanfront room, you get to see all the hotels on the strip, it's a great view. There are over 20 floors and we liked the fact that we were not that higher up. Honolulu zoo is 5mins walk. The beach is 3mins walk. Starbucks is located next to ABC stores which is part of the same hotel building. Tiki bar and grill and Wolfgang puck are also in the same building. Lots of options for breakfast /lunch /dinner. Food prices are pretty high ($11- $15) unless you want to eat cheap , there is McDonald's very close. OMG, Mexican restaurant, 5-7mins walk is really good and their food prices are $9-$15 - not bad for a very filling meal.Aston waikiki has its own store (mini version of ABC store) - they have snacks, small meals, water bottles, energy drinks, souvenirs, hats, sunglasses, plastic leis. The hotel gives a card to you when you check in, it's for free DVD rental - looks like Redbox. The people checking in are not too friendly but don't let that spoil your vacation - they need more training especially for a tourist destination!! Overall, great hotel if you don't care for the fact that it's dated - atleast it doesn't smell like old room. Go for oceanfront and you will enjoy your vacation. We enjoyed waking up to waves sounds and watching sunset. Will return and stay here again next time we are in Oahu.

We stayed here for two nights in early March for our very first visit to Honolulu. We had an amazing room overlooking the beach. The rooms are comfortable but not over the top in a central location to everything because we walked everywhere. The staff is friendly and helpful - the lobby area is open and inviting. The Tiki Bar also looks out over the ocean and we had a late dinner there our first night and then lunch again the next day. I really enjoyed our short stay!

Great location for snorkeling, learning to surf and relaxing on the beach. Great food and shopping is all within walking distance. One of the last hotels on the world famous Waikiki beach, so there is plenty of space to grab a spot on the beach and catch some sun.

An older hotel with smallish rooms and baths that need updating but otherwise this place has everything you could want in a hotel in Waikiki. Would recommend if you want to be close to the action on a budget.

We stayed here one day prior to meeting NCL for an Island Cruise. The hotel is wonderfully located close to the beach. The view from our room was amazing. Check in was quick and easy. the elevators are tricky as you have to use your room key to access them. Food was good and shopping is very close by.

I stayed here with my aunt during February for a week in a deluxe ocean-view suite. It was nice enough but be prepared to understand that you are getting what you pay for.Pros:- less than a minute walk to Waikiki beach- nice pool and gym facilities - generously sized rooms - good selection of eateries near by- less than 5 mins to Honolulu zoo- bus stop outside (or pickup from the Marriott hotel 2 mins walk away)- cleaning staff are just a pure delight to interact with, genuinely lovely people.Cons:- bathroom SEVERELY outdated (with shower curtains)- 10/15 min walk required to the International markets and other shopping centres - reception staff aren’t that helpful and can be a bit difficult to deal with at times - check in time is 3pm and they DO NOT BUDGE on this. My expectations were met during my stay here but were not exceeded at any stage.I booked this hotel knowing that it was considerably cheaper compared to others on the main boulevard and that I wouldn’t be getting the same service that other hotels like the Sheraton or Outrigger would provide. My main objectives were visiting the beach and zoo, so for these activities, this hotel is quite convenient.Like I said at the start, you get what you pay for. It’s a nice enough hotel but if you are looking for an amazing and memorable stay this hotel is not it.

We had one night before our dreaded trip home from paradise and we spent it at the Aston Waikiki Beach. The person at check-in was wonderful and took the extra time to find us the best room with a great ocean view. Since it was our last night of my wife's birthday trip to Hawaii we were also given a small bottle of champagne with two glasses. Even without the room upgrade and champagne I would have found the clerk very nice and warm. Very nice way to begin our stay. The hotel location is about the best on the beach. Our room was very nice with a great view from the balcony. We visited the Tiki Lounge for drinks and noticed all the food ordered by our neighboring tables looked good so we decided to go ahead and eat there. That was a good choice. Very good food and fairly reasonably priced. We had a good all around time at this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to return by in the future.

As a first time visitor to Hawaii, I didn’t know what to expect apart from internet photos but the Aston is the best place to stay with kids. It’s perfectly placed in Waikiki beachfront without being right in the Centre. There are so many amenities including Expedia experts. Only negative for us was we shared with the kids due to last minute booking over Christmas period. It can get a little noisy with Tiki’s Bar on same premises but could not fault any aspect of our stay here.

This hotel is not the fanciest - not the cheapest - not the best location. HOWEVER, the rooms were a good size and clean, but could use some updating. The bed was very comfortable! We used the used the valet parking a number of times and the car was always available within a short period of time. The Tiki Bar had a great happy hour with a tasty Mai Tai and great coconut shrimp. We were able to see the ocean from the rooftop location. The reason I said 'not the best location' is because it is across the street from Waikiki Beach, but no other buildings between the hotel and the beach. The reason I said 'not the cheapest' is because (whether you used it or not) you had a "resort fee" each day for things like wi-fi, DVDs, towels for the pool, shampoos, conditioner etc. All of that was not included in the daily rate and I thought all but the DVDs should have been included. They have Kurrig coffee makers in the room and if you wanted another cup you had to call and wait for housekeeping to bring it. The staff was friendly and check in and check out was fast.

Fairly clean, requested additional cleaning and it was done within a few hours. Great location right across from the beach. Friendly staff. Have stayed multiple times here. Elevator system can be a bit tricky as you choose your floor and one gets allocated. Good being able to take hotel chairs and towels to the beach.

We stayed in a Deluxe Ocean View room and were happy with our stay. The hotel is older but clean. Great location with shopping and many restaurants nearby. The balconies are small but can accommodate 2 people sitting. We parked at the nearby Zoo as the hotel parking is quite expensive. The staff were pleasant and professional. Check-in can be slow depending on the time you arrive at the hotel. Overall we were happy with our stay and would stay here again if the rates remain reasonable.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel from Feb 11-18. Check in was quick and easy with friendly staff at the desk. We read previous reviews regarding the elevator system being confusing. It was anything but. We liked how we did not have to wait long for any elevator and seldom did we have a lot of people in the elevator making stops along the way. More often than not it was a direct trip up and down. We also appreciated the added security of needing a key card to access the elevators.our room was clean and comfortable, beds and pillows were pretty good. The bathroom was adequate, you can tell it's an older hotel but it was clean and that's the main thing. Our partial ocean view room was on the Diamond Head side of the building and our view was very nice (Diamond Head, Zoo, and a bit of the ocean), we could even see some animals. The only small complaint I would have is the size of the balcony on that side. A couple people could stand there but no room for chairs or table.At night our 19th floor room was pretty quiet, very little street noise on this side. Tikis grill and bar is a great feature of this hotel. real nice local entertainment every night, good food and drinks. It was a great place to end the day.Location...what can I say? A few steps from the beach was exactly what we were looking for. It could be a bit of a hike to the central core of restaurants and shopping but nothing more than 15-20 minutes.I really do not have any negative comments (it was Hawaii after all). I have read where people comment on the aging decor and yes the bathroom could use some updating but that was not a huge issue for us. If we needed anything the staff was very responsive and courteous. Since our flight left at midnight they were very accommodating with a later checkout and taking care of our luggage until our shuttle arrived.Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

It is our 4th time to Waikiki and our 30th anniversary. This is a good hotel all round. The rooms are clean and spacious and the bed was terrific. We had the king size. The location is right across from the beach and an easy walk to lots of restaurants. We had breakfast in Starbucks which is on the same block. The bus stop is right outside.

Stayed for 9 nights in February. Had 2 oceanview rooms. If you want views looking back down Waikiki then make sure you ask for a room on the pool side of the hotel. Rooms are comfortable and well serviced. Quieter end of town however plenty of activities close by and only a short stroll into the city centre.

We're not in our hotel that much when in Hawaii, so we don't take advantage of many amenities. HOWEVER, what we come to this location for, and have 3 times so far, is the view and the sound of the waves. My wife and I get up early to open our balcony door, and just listen to the waves (over the sound of the street, unfortunately). The view is outstanding, if you are above the palm trees. The hotel is clean and nice, and makes for a relaxing end of day wind down. If you are on the move, and not requiring your hotel to be a 5 star spa, this place is amazing. Give it a try!

We have just got home from 8 days at Aston Waikiki beach resort.and have mixed thoughts over the hotel.Pros *Location is far none one of the best there is for Waikiki beach *Close to Honolulu Zoo*great front desk staff, pool area staff, parking staff ( friendly & willing to help) mahalo*Wolfgang Puck Express great food , reasonable priced.*Close to car rentals, restaurants, fast food, ABC store in every corner ( they sell everything)*Beds (doubles only no queens) are comfy, rooms clean , small in sizeCons* bathrooms are very dated, need upgraded. toilets are extra low not good for older people with knee or hip issues, the bath tubs are very small, but better than just having a shower. never was any hot water to have a long shower, but pool in right there and so in the ocean (that is why we come there).but nice to wash salt water off at end of the day.*Ocean View < lets word this right, we paid extra $750 a week to have OCEAN VIEW,we were on the 16th floor , side of building and yes it had an ocean view off the deck. if you want a deck looking over the front on the building straight across the road, that"s OCEAN FRONT!!!!! so don"t be fooled by the wording. still nice to see either way from your room. wake up to see the surfers and ocean.* The deck is very very small, one chair & foot stool is all that's on them, no room for anything else, we like to sit outside and play cards, not going to happen on these decks, way to small, also only one chair. no table . would be nice to be able to sit and watch the beautiful nightly sunset ( best sunsets ) with your wife on the deck.******Now comes to the title of this review, during our stay, the second day we were there, a very expensive watch, pandora bracelet , gold hoop earings, and diamond stud earings, happen to disappear from out of our bathroom. left in a hurry for breakfast and never got back to put in safe,we reported it to the head of security, filed a report ( two pages). was told they would do a super clean of our room and check with housekeeping and laundry. We were happy and didn't file a police report as offered to us from security.Was told that would check back with us in a day or two and see if any results came of investigation throughout all departments.( we were happy with that), well a day passed nothing, one the second day, in a small white pouch,( not ours ) all items show up in the top drawer of the dresser , under my wife"s swimsuits. Weird ?! Happy they came back... yes ! We pondered on going to desk and thanking them but since no one ever came back threw our vacation to report back to us, we quietly kept to ourselves & made dam sure we took all valuables with us daily. And yes there is a room safe, but its USA, not mexico. shouldn't have to lock up everything. We loved Hawaii and will be back. We travel once a year with my family and never has this happened ( not even in mexico).

After 6 months of researching the best hotel for me to stay in, I decided, based on reviews and location to choose the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.If you want a disgustingly rude staff welcome at check in, to hear every single toilet flush and hear a loud a/c fan from outside, stay here.It all started after a 17 hour trip from Perth, Western Australia to Oahu, Hawaii. I had arrived before check in time (3pm), in hope my room may be ready earlier. I was greeted by a staff member named Sean who worked out that I was on my trip solo, and celebrating my birthday...alone. He said "not celebrating with friends!?" I replied "no". He then said, "i'll be your friend, if you pay for all my dinners and drinks". I was absolutely HORRIFIED! This is how I was welcomed after a 17 hour trip and long flights?To make things worst, I was told the room would be ready in half an hour, which I was extremely grateful for. I waited by the pool at a table, no one suggested where else to wait, and no one came to get me to advise my room was ready, so I checked back after half an hour to be told to continue waiting it would be ready in 5 mins,,,after 10 mins I still continued to wait, and be told it would be ready soon. Not a good start.When I arrived in my room, the balcony was big enough for a small person to just stand on, the bathroom scungy and small and worst of all, I could hear some loud ac or fan unit outside.The next day, I had to go say something to reception, a lovely lady listened apologised and spent the time to find a quieter room for me. Which was greatly appreciated. However, they could only offer a phone call for management to apologize about how I was greeted to by Sean...I thought, was was the point in that? And unfortunately, I could still hear toilets flush, which are extremely loud by the way, like plane toilets. Must have paper thin walls? I also had to request tea and an electric jug as one was not provided, no real milk is provided for tea and coffee...the iron leaked water on and into the iron and seemed un safe to use, and also when I turned the hair dryer on, it sparked and smelled like burning then did not work...Another con is the WiFi is not very good, you can only pretty much get a good wifi connection in the hotel room, it struggles by the pool or at the Tiki's bar which is in the same area. I know this is only a 3.5 star hotel, but come on...really? Very over priced for what it is...you pay mid range resort fee's, and you have to pay for bottled water (no complimentary water included). I'll end on a happier note with some positives.PRO's: opposite Waikiki beach, most tours pick up and drop off from this hotel or near it, within walking distance to shops, bars and restaurants. Right next door to LuLu's which is nice for breakfast...free DVD's to rent at reception. I would research other places first before thinking about staying here again...

where to start...... before hand i did upgrade my room all i can say is wow..... the view looking over the beach was to die for...... some people say the place is outdated but i thought is was just nice.... the staff. ask them anything trust me they will point you in the right direction. friendly if you had a problem they would bend over backwards for you.... this was my first time to hawaii and it will not be my last... by the way the beach is right across the street from the hotel dont even get me started on the shopping that is right there

The staff were very friendly and helpful. We received a welcome gift of refillable water bottles, and a carry bag upon arrival. You needed your room key to access the elevators to ensure only guests could use them. The room itself was OK. It was comfortable but outdated. We had an ocean view room which had a great view but was right above Tiki bar. They had live entertainment nightly and it was very noisy. Had to keep the balcony door shut at night. A nice feature of the hotel was the free use of towels and chairs to take to the beach which was right across the street.

Did anyone experience falling on to a toilet because it was so short, it's made for small people not your average American , it's really bad when your knees nearly touch your chest while sitting on the thrown. Also the sofas and chairs need to be cleaned up guest bring there food there to eat and wipe their hand all over the sofa and chairs, some people sleep on the sofas, I was really discussed. It is time to clean up your act.
user_name:
Aldyne C
Fort Myers Beach, Florida

review_body: This place deserves more stars, it was a great stay!The front desk staff was friendly, fun & very welcoming, you can definitely feel the aloha spirit here!The only thing that I would ask about is the elevators, it can be very confusing, here’s a tip: to get to the first floor (ground level & valet) or to get to the 3rd floor (pool and front desk) - you don’t need to swipe your pass key, just hit the desired floor and wait for your indicated elevator.The rooms are amazingly comfy, spacious, and there are little little cell phone USB chargers in between the beds.Mini fridge is filled with Hawaiian host beverages, and the ocean view is amazing - (even if you don’t get an ocean view, there is a great view of diamond as the other option).This hotel has a great bar/restaurant called Tiki’s. This is a great hangout! There’s live music, good food or bar bites and the drinks are always flowing!There’s also a Wolfgang Puck express restaurant below, or go around the corner towards Kapiolani Park and grab a burger at Lulu’s or maybe a drink at Starbucks. If you’re a smoothie person, Jamba Juice is there too!There are free towels for guests when using the pool, there is also an onsite gym and laundry services are available.Enjoy Waikiki- and enjoy your stay, I know I did! Aloha!:)

Work brought me to Honolulu, and of course, I brought the family, for a bit of a vacation after work was all done. There were 3 of us in a room, Mom, 5-year-old son, and myself. First the good stuff. The service was great, and the staff was always helpful. Our son was very happy with the welcome gift he received from the hotel, a bucket, and shovel to use at the beach. Clearly, the hotel is family friendly. The hotel also has a couple of restaurants close by that are very good. Wolfgang Puck Express and Tiki's Grill & Bar are two restaurants on site we visited. It was also nice to have several tour desks on site, with knowledgeable people to point us in the right direction for some outstanding adventures. Lastly, it is hard to beat the location, directly across the street from the beach, and just to the side of the zoo, great for our son. On the flip side of things, personally, the room was just a little too small for 3 people. We reserved an ocean view room, but when we arrived at our room, the first view we had was of the hotel across the street and not the ocean. We called the front desk to confirm we were in the right room and in fact we were. In the morning with the daylight, we were able to see the ocean but had to be outside on the lanai, or laying on one of the beds looking diagonally out the window. Certainly not the experience we were expecting based on the pictures and information from the hotel website. For those taller travelers out there, it might be worth noting the shower head is very low in the bathroom, making it difficult to wash my hair. I am a little over 6 feet tall. The rooms are also in need of maintenance. The wood bathroom door was peeling, the metal bathroom fixtures such as the wall mounted mirror had rusted in areas, and there appeared to be mold in some spots on the bathroom walls. I was expecting better quality for the price and location. Lastly, when we booked the hotel, on the hotel website, we were given the option of a few promotional discounts, such as on a snorkel tour, trolly tickets, and shuttle to the airport. Our confirmation said we would receive information on how to redeem our promotional discounts a few days before we were to check in to the hotel. We never did receive the email, and when we asked the front desk about the discounts they claimed they never offered them.All in all, we had a nice stay, but I'll probably look more closely at some other hotel options next time.

Hotel on a whole was clean and tidy, although quite outdated. We asked concierge to get maintenance up to our room to have a look at our bathroom floor which was always wet (leaking toilet), only to be told it will be fine, don’t worry about it. After a few days our carpet was soaked, and found mould near our bed the size of a baseball. Upon check out, we informed the concierge again of our issue with the room, and showed them the photo. All they replied to me was, “aww that’s no good. Sorry to hear about that. How would you like to pay the room tax of 25 per night, plus tax” on that which is also puzzling. As stated the lobby and halls were clean and tidy, and the room cleaners were always friendly. Best part of the facility was the tiki restaurant and grill.For the money that goes through this hotel, I’m sure that a refurbishment of the hotel wouldn’t be out of the question.

Booked this hotel as a first stop for our inaugural trip to the islands. Never again! Hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade! Bathroom was disgusting and very out dated. The carpet was filthy, the room was dirty ( young could have written your name in the dust on the headboard), and the room was always humid. Booked an ocean view room and was placed on upper floor near rear of building with a very limited view. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Hotel is in a great location and also in easy walking distance to all the main wiakiki shops and restaurants. It's no Hilton or Mattiot but then again it's a lot cheaper. Very clean, rooms are quiet and a good size and you can almost fall onto the nicest lido beach in Wiakiki. Hotel surrounded by all the big fast food and coffee outlets as well as tour and travel requirements being locally catered for. We really enjoyedout 10 night stay.

Don't be disappointed with the '80s decor - it actually appears in the new series of Hawaii Five O - service was consistent everything worked well....likes their bedside sockets for charging phones etc. Beach was across the road and the " resort fee" was more reasonable than most.

We arrived at the hotel really late due to some airplane issues. When we checked in, she took one look at us and said she was going to make our day better. She then upgraded us to a full ocean view room with a giant comfortable bed and wished us an amazing vacation. The service never stopped on our entire trip. Everyone was helpful. The hotel is right across from the beach.

Stayed 3 nites at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and was gobsmacked with the views of Kuhio and Waikiki Beach. It was absolutely stunning (provided u get the right room of course). I had an upgrade to an Ocean view Select and on the 25th Floor, I can honestly say nothing beats hanging out on your balcony and simply admiring the view. I did not inform my wife that we would be staying in such a room and when we checked in to the room, she cried tears of joy. We were celebrating 20 years since we last came to Hawaii and also our 20th Anniversary of my wedding proposal. I can guarantee that Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is the BEST venue to celebrate your momentous day.Besides the great view, it is in an ideal location. The trolley stop is just in front of the hotel and you are just steps away from the beach. As it is nearer to Diamond Head (and the Honolulu Zoo), an early morning hike from the hotel to the top is easier. Also, good food is readily available (Teddy’s Bigger Burgers, etc.). Finally, a big thank you to Natasha Akee from Aston. She single-handedly made our lifelong Waikiki dream to be fulfilled.

I booked this hotel by accident on booking.com. The hotel would not allow me to cancel the reservation. I went and made the best of it.Pro’sThis hotel is in an amazing location. It is on south east end if Waikiki near the zoo. It is across the street from the beach and there are tons of shopping and restaurants near. In the same building is Jamba Juice, Wolfgang Puck express, subway, Starbucks and and ABC store. Shuttles stop there are bus stop is one block away. You can walk to everything or take the bus. They give you a beach bag on Check in and it has water bottle. I used this the entire trip filling up in lobby. Tip: for more relaxing beaches go to beaches toward diamond head.Cons: very basic hotel. Very Small pool, small dated rooms, “resort” fee. This is nothing luxurious but if you are planning to be out and about and don’t want anything fancy the hotel is a good value. The Hyatt place is right behind the hotel in case you are looking at it. You do get Ocean views from Aston is you book ocean view or partial view.5 star location with 3 star accommodations

ProsFitness center is moderately sized (part of your daily resort tax)Pool is niceComplimentary waterModerately priced. You just need to book wayyyyy in advanceWalk to the heart of downtown Waikiki in 10-15 minutesCons$30+ per day resort taxValet is also $30+ per day, not part of resort tax, but this is consistent with other hotels.Ice machine is only located on even numbered floors

My pet peeve? Hair on the bathroom floor upon first entering. And this time? The Aston passed with flying colors! Not a single stranger’s hair. Other than that, a decent hotel. Nothing special, although we managed to get rooms with a beach view so our balcony view is lovely. The other side of the hotel probably has a nice view of the park, although we didn’t ask. The room is nothing special - just average for a hotel in this price range. (Although we got a nice off-season deal.) One odd thing, however: there isn’t a chair. There’s a mini-table with a stool, but no actual chair that you could offer to a visitor to your room. Not there’s room for one; the room is not spacious. Oh, trust me, I’ve had smaller rooms. So the room size here is okay, just not spacious. They give out beach towels and beach chairs every day and that’s super convenient. The elevator system is weird - you swipe your room key (so we appreciate the security) and enter the floor you’re going to. But they need to give better instructions when you check in - it took us a while to master. Would I come back to this hotel? Absolutely.

The Aston has a great location right on the beach front and within walking distance of a lots fashions shops and restaurants also the trolley bus leaves from the front door. The only problem is that the hotel is in need of a refurbishment. the rooms are grotty and the furnishings are very out dated. Would not stay there again unless it is updated.

The hotel personnel were a great bunch of pleasurable people. My only concern was the cleanliness of our room. Needed to be updated (new paint and furniture and carpet). Looked like they didn't do a lot of regular housekeeping, vents, grout in bathroom on a regular basis. The restaurants were fine and good. The guests could check out towels for the beach and pool area along with folding chairs for the beach. The beds were comfortable but the pull out sofa was noisy and not that comfortable.

We checked in for our honeymoon and the staff were very accommodating. The woman asked our reason for being there and when we told her it was our honeymoon, she gave us a hotel picture frame. Guests also receive a beach bag with some hotel branded momentos (water bottles, fan, deck of cards, etc).Our hotel room was nice and tidy, but it was in older shape. The age was most noticeable in the bathroom. The tub was pretty shabby, and the walls had numerous dings, patches, and holes from changing around finishings.The location of this hotel is amazing, right across from Waikiki beach. We had a partial ocean view room. You could see the beach from our patio and Diamond Head Crater and the zoo when you walked out into the open hallway. We were in a room at the very end of the hallway, which opens further down (almost like a patio walkway). While the views were amazing, being in this open location had its drawbacks. The door was not air-locked and all you could hear all night was the howling of the wind against our door; we ended up playing music during night to block it out. Also, because of the location of this hotel, nights were never silent due to the hustle outdoors. The sounds of traffic, sirens, and any patio music that night can be heard, but is expected when staying in such a high volume area.The convenience of this hotel is what drew us there since it was our first time. It is right across from the beach, has its own convenience store, restaurants, a pool, and even has DVD rentals included in your room fee to enjoy during your time in the room.All in all, I feel like this hotel was a fine choice for our first time in Waikiki. We were able to experience the hustle of being right beside the beach, and were close to any amenities. The staff were always exceptional and helpful, making sure you enjoyed your stay.

Bellhop was great about taking care of our luggage until our room was ready and after we checked out until time to leave for the airport. Rooms were clean but a little shabby. Check in seemed to take forever. Location was perfect - right across the street from beautiful Waikiki Beach and withing walking distance from lots of stores and restaurants. Excursion desk was available to book excursions and transportation was available right next to the parking lot. All in all, it was a convenient place from which to explore Honolulu.

When we arrived by taxi, we were told by hotel staff that we need to take the elevator to go to the front desk. Once in the elevator with some other hotel guests, there were no buttons so we rode up and down to different floors until we eventually were back again on the ground floor. Our mistake, we should have figured out ourselves that you need to press the button for your floor outside the elevator and it will tell you which cart is going to take you there. Anyway, the front desk is on the first floor which is somehow unusual, and there is no lobby. Did I already mention the sewer smell on the ground floor? They really should do something about this. It's not welcoming and a disgrace to pass through this area every time you leave or enter the hotel. And there are actually people working there all day long!The ocean view is great. Rooms with connecting doors are very noisy, you can actually hear your neighbours talking as if they were standing in your bathroom. This is especially annoying if they come home late or get up very early.Probably not the best hotel in town but okay for a few nights, if you can stand the smell.

This is an older property, but the hotel has a premier location across the street from the beach. It has an excursion and info desk that will help you get around the city. Wolfgang Puck, Subway, BurgerKing and the Tiki Bar are here! Rooms were nice. Enjoyed my two night stay!

The location is right across the street from the beach at Waikiki, with shopping and restaurants nearby. However the rooms are dated and the bathrooms were pretty sad -- all the floor tile was cracked, the grout was rotted and everything was just old. The room smelled musty and the "partial ocean view" room looked directly into the other high-rise hotel across the street (if you looked sideways out the window you could see the ocean). Roof pool is on the small side but fine. If you want to be in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki this could be an ok option if you get a cheap price but keep expectations quite low on the rooms themselves.

King bed was comfortable, bathroom small but adequate, appreciated having a room safe and free daily newspaper, ocean view was nice, computerized elevator system was unique. Tiki Bar convenient, pool colder than the ocean and not in sun until mid afternoon. Complimentary beach towels and beach chairs were a nice feature and we used them daily. The room was not quite as clean as we'd have liked...vent on upper wall looked dirty/greasy.

Spent 4 days at the hotel as part of our Costco vacation package and upgraded to this hotel based on location and price point for being right on Waikiki beach. If your looking for a 5 star room then this is not your place. You will hate it but if your spending your time in your room while in Honolulu then you probably shouldn’t be on vacation. It is right next door to the zoo, aquarium and there is not a bad view in this place. Tikis restaurant had amazing food and drinks. The hotel staff was courteous, prompt and helpful. If I had a suggestion, it would be to renovate the bathrooms. They are in dire need of a overhaul. Other than that we were very happy. Cheers!

Out staff at the Aston are very friendly and welcoming. The facility is very well kempt and taken care of. Comfy rooms and nice overall. Great location, and great spot to stay. The beds are comfortable and rooms are a good size.

We are just checking out of here,so sad to be leaving !!!!!! The place is perfectly situated across the rd from the beach,which i might add, has a beautiful clean little protected spot for first times snorklers,theres loads of beautiful fish down the,about middle at the back near the wall.Its a lovely friendly happy place to stay.A special shout out for the lovely young guy,who ive been told his name is Shun,hope ive spelt it right.He was so helpful,and attentive,knew our room number without even checking everytime we went to the desk,well done kiddo !!Hawaii is such a special spot,cant wait to come back .

My family and I stayed for a week in Waikiki. We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. My families first time, I have been there many times. You can't get any closer to the beach. The hotel has seen better days but was great for the price. The elevators take a while to get used to. The rooms are standard, cramped size. No microwave. The shower curtains smelled of mold and the towel rack was falling off the wall. This hotel is at the end of the Kalakau strip and across the street from the zoo. The double decker bus, Pink Line, has a stop right out front of the hotel. I would consider another stay here if the price is right.

Here is an honest opinion of the current state and condition of the Hotel. Please note we are not fussy and have stayed in many hotels around the world.1. Stayed with baby. Had great difficulty organising a crib as they can ONLY request one. Not confirm2. We had 7 mth old baby and our room was with metres of ice machine that kept waking up the baby when used by other guests.3. Rooms shabby and small with towel rack falling off the wall and paint peeling. Tiles cracked and dirty bath4. Room housekeeping enter without waiting due to no privacy door signs5. No place to have quiet drink apart from Tiki bar which during busy times very hard to get tables. They do not take reservations6. Staff not very helpful and hard to find when needed.7. Pool very small.Positives 1. Opposite beach2. Provide free Dvds3. Good nearby restaurants.Note: Very expensive for a run down hotel. Definately not 4 star.

Spent an amazing week in Waikiki with myself, my husband and my in-laws! Some Tips:-House keeping only cleans your room every other day unless you specify that you want it every day. -The rooms all have a mini fridge and keurig coffee maker. Housekeeping replaced our pods regularly, but we also purchased a box from the grocery store -The pool gets sun in the afternoon from about 1:30 pm onwards-The wifi is terrific. Got solid connection everywhere in the hotel-We cabbed from the airport for arond $50 US (including tip), but took the shuttle on the way back. You have to book yourself onto the shuttle downstairs at the luggage area and it was $12/person + tip. -There is a very weird elevator system... you'll see-We used the gym every day and it was never busy. A few pieces of cardio equipment and some free weights mostly. Overall this hotel is average. The only thing taking up to the next level beyond and that I cannot stress enough is that it is in an AMAZING LOCATION. It is literally 5 steps from the beach, right above multiple restaurants (Lulus, Starbucks, Tikis, Subway, Jamba juice, etc) and an ABC store, and right next to the zoo! It is clean and comfortable and all of the employees were courteous and helpful. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. For the price, it cannot be beat!

We stayed at Aston Waikiki beach hotel for 5 nights this is our 4th or 5th time staying here - it would be one of the best hotels in Waikiki - service is excellent staff is great Hotel has trolley stop right outside of Hotel which is greatRestaurant tiki grill on the 2nd level is also one of the best in Waikiki food is great grazed pork ribs / buffalo wings with bbq & honey sauce you must try Only down was we arrived after 11am from Australia and check in is not till after 3pm so we had a long wait but we went for a early lunch at tiki grill so it made up for the wait We had a Ocean front select room with a great balcony o 18 th floor with great view of Waikiki beach

If you're used to 4- and 5-star hotels you'll be disappointed. But if you want a well-priced, full-service hotel that’s only a crosswalk away from the sands of Waikiki, this is a good choice. Some photos make it look like it’s ON the beach, so let’s start by dispelling that misconception: south of the Moana Surfrider no Waikiki hotels are directly on beach. Public areas:-Street level driveway loop & lobby w/big comfortable chairs where you can wait for your taxi or shuttle. Bell desk, small gift shop, chain eateries such as Puck Express & Subway. -Check-in desk on the 3rd floor. Access via escalator or elevator.-Tiki’s Grill overlooks the avenue facing the beach w/both open-air and covered tables.
