Salad was fresh and beautifully presented, though service was very poor for us at lunch. Bar has upbeat live music in the evenings.-Small pool on the 3rd floor terrace wasn’t getting much use. It sits in the shade of the building until afternoon. Lots of available lounge chairs.-Elevators have a quirky security system which may make you feel foolish the first time you use them. Other guests who’ve been there longer are usually on hand to give you an initial training session and it’s easy after that.Rooms:-Website gives you a good description w/photos of the different categories. Our Ocean View Select (20th floor & above) had a fantastic view of the beach & ocean beyond if you just turned your chair a bit to the left.-Amenities include free wi-fi, Keurig coffee brewer, in-room safe, bath products.-Construction materials are pretty basic quality—formica sink countertop, plastic tub enclosure, etc. What you would expect for 3 stars.-The double beds are small, not really suited for 2 people unless they're children.-There's a good amount of street noise in this area. Book a higher floor if you're a light sleeper.Other amenities:Free beach towels and beach chairs

The room was fine. Spacious for 3 people with a tiny water view. The bathroom was very small and the hotel felt quite aged. Ultimately it was the location that mattered and it was in a good spot. We chose it because it was the most reasonably priced hotel we could find.

If you travel to the area often and need a cheap place to stay, this would be an option, but for the rates charged during the holiday, it's definitely disappointing. If this is your first trip to Hawaii or you are expecting a "resort" you will want to choose another property. The location is good, a little removed from the craziness a few blocks away, right on a great part of the beach that's a little less busy. The service we received was also good, but after waiting in way too long of a check in line. Why the low rating - it needs a major update. I have to give below average due to the shower and bathroom tile being reminiscent of a Motel 6 built in 1960 and no effort being done to fix the grout. The bed was comfy enough and we had a room facing the ocean, so the view was nice. This was my 4th trip to Honolulu and booked last minute, so this hotel was pretty much the only one with availability. However, we paid way too much for what you receive at the property.

Stayed at the Aston Waikiki for two nights before our cruise. The staff was very friendly. The room was adequate-nothing special. The hallways looked like they needed updating. The pool area was small and the pool itself was cold.

Okay so certain parts of the hotel may be considered to be 'dated' but I wasn't spending my days doing building inspections! The service was prompt, their coffee pods were great, when we needed something they would deliver and Tiki's bar by the pool was a great way to spend afternoons while your kids were swimming by the pool. We had no problems checking in and we checked in on Christmas Eve. I think people need to expect that during peak periods, things are going to get busy.Initially, we booked an ocean view room but I upgraded to Ocean Front. Do yourself a favour, book an oceanfront room. Totally, totally, worth it. I'd like to thank the lady at the front desk, she was a slender dark haired slicked in a ponytail with a constant smile, who helped me with my up grade! I am so sorry I forgot your name.

The hotel is advertised and promoted as 4 star. I have stayed in better 2.5 to 3 star hotels. The rooms are tired; grout in bathroom floor tiles mouldy; bathroom fittings loose (towel rail kept falling off); walls in main room marked; door jambs broken; advertised with balcony but this was a stand-up ledge. We were drenched when checking in due to torrential rain but no offer of place to dry off/change until room was ready. Check-in staff kept taking phone calls while checking with little regard for keeping us waiting. Check-in staff said he would call when rooms were ready (we were early) but then said if we didn't get a call "I will have forgotten" and we should call the hotel!! Pool/beach towels ran out two days of our 6 night visit - no apology. We know Waikiki hotel prices reflect high demand but this was certainly priced way above its standard and misrepresented.

Stay somewhere else. Old construction has little to no sound proofing. NYE parties went on way past 130 am with thumping music. Hotel management was neither sympathetic or helpful. In fact they really didnt care much about how our stay was. Nice location but they should not rent certain room. Booking.com cares even less. No sleep and no refund.

This is a hotel with a great location , but that is unfortunately the best you can say about it. The rooms and the hotel are outdated and the bathromms are the smaleste I have seen in any hotel,I booked a suite with sea view and got a rom that the hotel classified as view, but IT was more like indirect sea view, The balcony had only standing rom. The room was changed the next day to room with a balcony with two chiars, but then again without sun. However, the worst is that this suite is located next to the service elevator and the noice is not compatible with slep. This is the case with half of the suites in the hotel. I went down this morning to see what could be done. I was about not to get back to the 22 floor due to that some guests were stuck in the elevator and the fire service had tanken control. I got back by using the service elevator after I stated that I could not get back to the 22nd floor by using the the stairs due to a bad leg.I also tried to go to the fitness .center , but was in the middel of my workout told by a lady that my sketchers shoes that I use in the gym at home was not allowed (IT had to be sneekers) and that I had to stop.... Needless to say that I have not ben back.I was waiting in line for more that 30 minutts when I cheked in and that sees to be standard.I am looking forward to go home in three days !!!

Stayed here for a week in mid November. This hotel is in the most amazing location. Just across the road from the beach and close to the zoo and Diamond Head! As with most hotels in Waikiki, the Aston is dated and some improvements need to be carried out which they acknowledge. As soon as these are carried out and the if hotel is constantly updated and maintained, this could be one of the best hotels in Waikiki! Beds are super comfy which is a blessing after a long day out exploring. We're pretty self sufficient travellers so don't require much assistance however the interactions we did have with staff were great. The concierge team were fantastic help with our bags, housekeeping were very friendly and the front office staff were fantastic in getting us checked in promptly when they could. This is a high volume hotel so check in can get slammed and lines are long but those on reception maintained efficiency and friendliness. Special mention to Natasha for ensuring our room was as expected and Sean on reception for his advice on how to get our mobile phones on the Hawaii cell network. We did exactly as he suggested and it was perfect! The lift system was great too - saves you time and gets you to your hotel room quicker. The biggest negative we experienced was when it was windy, the wind did whistle in through the balcony door which made for a long night. Overall though, our stay was very pleasant and I'd stay here again. Keep up the great work Aston Waikiki.

A very nice and cost hotel with clean rooms. And if you are lucky you can have a view into the Waikiki Zoo from your room.The location of the Hotel is therefore good, very close to the zoo, in an quiet area - still at the beach. Serving breakfast buffet you can take to the beach directly - a very nice idea.

I had considered booking this hotel for an overnight stay but went elsewhere only because a competitor offers a paid early check in which would have worked well as we were on an early flight from Australia. Big mistake! There was no room available and the manager was exceptionally rude.So, I got on the phone to the Aston and asked if they had any availability. The reservation agent was so obliging. She got us a room before 3pm and gave us a free upgrade. So for the same price I was going to have to pay at the competition, we received an oceanfront select room. My partner and I loved it. Thank you Aston for helping us out of a sticky situation. You are guaranteed repeat business from us if we return to Waikiki. Mahalo!

We really enjoyed our quick 4 night stay. The hotel is on the east end of Waikiki so we walked a lot, which we were fine with. Many of the popular restaurants and other hotels are just down the street. We got a $32 dollar shuttle from the airport to the Aston. We did Lyft back to the airport for $42. It was much quicker, but more expensive. Our room was on the 7th floor and close to Tikis, the resraurant. There is live music each night until 10:30 or so which could keep people up. The hotel has free movies and beach chairs and towels which were nice. We didn't need to bring our own towels. The rooms were nice, but not extravagant. There was a small fridge with no freezer. Ice machines on various floors, but no ice bags, just the containers. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

We loved our stay here..our room was nice beds very comfortable nice view of ocean in walking distance to everthing...wish they still did continental breakfast thou...but otherwise a wonderful 25th anniversary with complimentary champagne...Thanks Aston 4 another wonderful trip

This hotel is conveniently located to all the restaurants and of course the beach. If your purpose is to spend as much time on the beach then this basic hotel is for you. It has a great restaurant and the pool is perfect. The room is dated but clean. The best part is they provide beach chairs and towels for the guests.

Stayed at Aston hotel, Waikiki beach for 5 days before cruising on Pride of America. Our hotel was designated by the travel agent so of course we had the lowest grade of room which was Standard. I must say that the location of the hotel couldn't have been better. Prime location right across from the beach.The hotel needs a face lift, I have never been to a hotel before where the check in was on the third floor and the ground floor entrance has the appearance of an underground car park.There was nowhere to tell us where to go to sign in, eventually I saw a staff member who told me to go to the third floor.The elevator system was archaic. You had to select the floor you wanted, then wave your room card key in front of a magic eye. The elevator you needed to get into was then flashed up, either A,B,C or D. A very strange system.Our room was on the 5 th floor at the very back of the building which ended on an outdoor corridor which resembled flats I have seen on television programmes. I must say I was very disappointed, particularly with the balcony and the sea view which you could barely see for the roof tops. We were unable to use the balcony because if the wind probably because we were on the back corner.The room itself was nice and clean as was the bathroom. Towels and toiletries were replenished daily. The coffee maker was very poor and sometimes the coffee was replenished and sometimes not. Water was charged at 2 dollars a bottle.Until we checked out we were unaware of the spa charge and tax for each day of our stay. This amounted to just over 30 dollars per day. This soon adds quite a bit to your payment, together with water etc.There are lots of shops, restaurants etc in the location but we did not like the restaurant on the ground floor, it looked very cheap and tatty. We had a pizza from there one evening and it was terrible, the worst pizza we have ever had. More or less a crust which had hardly anything on it.As I said in my title.. You get what you pay for. I would have been better staying further from the beach and getting a better deal.I would not choose to stay there again although it is in such a good position.

Stayed here before our cruise on Pride of Americia and 4 days post cruise.Reception fantastic asked for upgrade received it thanks so much. Location perfect as trolley bus stop out Front of hotel great value for money. Had deluxe ocean view room amazing and the beautiful Hawaiian sunsets. Location is great loved the Tiki Bar downstairs. Free wifi and free movies. Friendly staff in all areas. Great stay and we will stay again thanks for a great Hawaii stay Aston.

From our first moment the staff was warm and welcoming. They did everything possible to make our stay feel like home. The crew at the front desk checked on us daily to make sure we were having a wonderful vacation. The day we left our housekeeper stopped by to say good by! The view from our Lanai was GORGEOUS and the view down the beach is unforgettable.The pool is refreshing, and its amazing to be able to take towels to the Beach. The Food at Wolfgang Puck express and the Tiki Bar was outstanding. The nightly entertainment at the Tiki Bar was also top notch. So lovely to have local entertainment. we were truly blessed to stay here. You are able to walk to the Zoo and large surronding park and the Aquarium.

We stayed at this hotel for a week as a couple. I don't think I can say anything negative about this place. It is convenient, had the best view and had all the amenities one could need. Michelle on front desk is a great asset to the hotel, making sure our check in and stay was seamless and enjoyable.

We spent 5 nights here while on vacation. The staff was friendly and helpful. The 12th floor room had a nice view of the ocean being that its right across the street. They have beach towels and chairs that can be signed out to use on the beach. Called down for our car and it was always there waiting for us. I will stay here again if traveling to this area

Stayed one night as part of pre-cruise package. I was somewhat hesitant about using this hotel based on reviews. However, hotel turned out to be just fine. It is a large, tour based hotel but I found it to be clean and in good condition. It is right on the beach (actually just across the main road) so ocean access is almost immediate.I was assigned a 12th floor, ocean view room with balcony. It was quiet and immaculate. Bed comfortable and room good sized. Absolutely no issues with the room. The only reason not 5 stars is check-in was, well, bring a good book and something to eat. I arrived at 3:45 pm for 3:00 pm check-in. There were 6 people ahead of me and two receptionists. After 20 minutes the line was reduced to two people and me and that is when everything stopped. Both receptionists were engaged in prolonged check-in issues with their customers. One left and did not re-appear. At this point a seriously large number of people showed up. The check-in line was now the entire length of the lobby, past the last elevator and around the back with exhausted travelers becoming more and more disgruntled. Another 10 minutes later two new receptionists showed up and began checking in people. I finally got checked in and given key at 4:20 pm. The line was still enormous, not moving much and growing as I left reception. There were now four receptionists.None of the receptionists seemed very bothered by this and kept their friendly, aloha attitude. Certainly management must know that the day before the cruise their hotel will be filled with pre-cruise passengers (this is the only hotel NCL uses) coming from the airport and arriving within a short time of each other. Failure to have adequate front desk staffing at a high activity time is a management scheduling failure.Of note is the issue regarding accessing the elevators. Since reception gave me no instructions on how to use the security elevators, I was fortunate to find a janitor nearby who showed me how to access my floor with my key card.

Great room views and across the street from beach. Rooms could use a freshening. Staff was accommodating. There is a couple of nice places to eat. Security good. It would have been nice if they had swept the lanai daily or at least every other day.

Spent 6 nights in an ocean view room and it was amazing. We viewed all across this world famous beach and out to sea. If we had of been on the other side of the building we would have had sea views and views of Diamond Head. From our personalized elevator trips we walked straight out of the hotel, across the street and straight onto the beach. This close proximity was great as we did not want to be carrying the complimentary beach chairs and towels for a great distance. We also had the luxury of having the pink line trolley stop directly outside the building. So if you are elderly or infirm or just don't want any extra hassles this is the hotel for you. The room had a lovely veranda to enhance the already amazing views, and a safe to keep our valuables safe while we swam. The local bus was also only 1 block away. We enjoyed free movies daily, as well as the daily newspaper. There is also a small convenience market on the ground floor or a supermarket approximately 3 blocks away if you have lots of shopping to do.

Hotel. Facilities. Location. Everything about this hotel was of top quality. A very gorgeous view of the beautiful Waikiki beach. Hotel was immaculate with facilities to appeal to everyone off all ages. My family and i will definitely be back.

The best things about the hotel is LOCATION and VIEWS. Walking distance from a lot of the shopping hot spots of Waikiki and right on the beach! The service / pool / room finishings are decent. Good for a quick stay if you're not spending much time at the hotel.

We stayed here for our honeymoon at the end of October into November. We got the room type we paid for (ocean view in the Waikiki side) no free upgrades for honeymoon but we did get the best possible room for the type we paid for (closest to the ocean and highest flooor without paying extra). Oh, and a free picture frame.The room was nice, nothing special but the bathroom needs updates. The facet didn’t shut off when the handle was straight down and the shower and floor just seemed old. Didn’t care though as the view from the room made up for it!!! Also I found it really odd that there was no little patio table for the balcony. The elevator had a bit of an issue a couple times, takes along time sometimes and you have to scan your card before it comes. The location of the hotel was nice, less busy at the end of the strip but extremely walkable still. One negative of the location was the homeless people who seem to congregate in the huts by the beach across from the hotel. There were quite a few bum fights we witnessed and apparently a bit of a meth problem on the island which we were not aware of.All in all it was a great location and nice hotel. If I were to go back I’d probably stay one street back from the beach and save myself $1000. One street back was just as walkable and looks like ocean view would be possible too.Also was surprised there was a per day fee to use the safe.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Aston for 8 days early November. We had initially booked our stay at the Alohilani down the block, but changed our mind due to the fact that they are still undergoing construction. I was very skeptical about our decision after reading a few of the subpar reviews. However, I have to say that our stay at the Aston was quite amazing. Our room while not the biggest, was very clean, and had the most breathtaking views of the beach from our lanai. I loved how all the people that work at the Aston made us feel very welcome. Our room attendant Chitara was very nice. You can also rent beach towels and chairs which is great. I honestly have no complaints with the Aston and will definitely stay here again.

I'll keep this brief with the pros and cons:PROS:- Valet was simple (although they don't have sell park which is a con)- Staff were nice- Quiet on the 10th floor- Beach towels, movie rentals, beach chairs provided and great location.CONS:- None of the ice machines worked in the entire hotel- The elevators were busy, complicated, and one was out of order the entire time. People were complaining about them constantly.- Our bathroom's drain was clogged and the towel rack was off the hinges- Lanais are small and don't fit a chair on them- Decor is really old and tired.(bright red doors, carpet, etc.)

Great location, views and a good price but that’s about it. The hotel is very dated with 80s decor and minimal soundproofing. The hallways echo when people walk down it and doors slam and the plumbing can be heard from other rooms. Noise from the pool, tiki bar and road traffic make for a sleepless night.

Hotel location is a little bit further out but still only about a 10min walk to the centre of Waikiki. Rooms are a good size but very basic decor which I know is pretty much the norm for most Hawaii hotels...Bathroom however is small & old. We booked a partial ocean view room & was lucky enough to be on the diamond head side so we also have a nice view of diamond head! Overall the hotel is OK & we’d stay here again simply based on price but would prefer something abit closer in!

Fantastic location! Can't beat it! Do yourself a favour and make sure you do the upgrade to Seaview - it's worth every penny & that view is the reason you are in Hawaii in the first place ! The Aston Beach hotel is home to Tikis bar and grill which runs a happy hour between 2-5pm - score yourself USD$5 Blue Hawaii's, Mai Tai's & USD$3 local beers. Oh and their buffalo wings are amazing! Another cute feature of the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel is that they give you a little welcome beach bag which have a range of difficulties such as sunscreen, lip balm & aftersun - all of which you will use! They supply beach towels & chairs too! There is an ABC (all blocks covered) store which sells Hawaiian Nik Nacs & Food etc on both sides of the hotel - plus a Starbucks to the left as you walk onto the strip. You can hire surfboards & umbrellas directly on the beach in front of the hotel. And in my opinion are located on the best side of this strip!

Get the ocean front room, not the ocean view room and you will fall in love with this place, recommended for couple who want the best view of waikiki beach. Just steps away from waikiki beach. Will stay here again

We decided to change hotels as we did not like where we were staying so picked this one after reviews. So glad we did as the hotel is fantastic! It is just across the road from the beach but also has a lovely pool area with the Tiki's Bar & Grill situated at the end with great views of the beach. Close to bus stop for the Pink Trolley Line. The room we had was a bit small with the balcony a good size. Only downside in the room was the furniture. It was a desk with 2 wooden stools and that was it...not very comfortable sitting. Great view from the room though and the staff were friendly and helpful. Wifi was good. Beds were comfortable but had small pillows. The price was very reasonable considering we hadn't originally planned to stay here. The Tiki Bar & Grill is fantastic with great service and food...especially breakfast. They have live bands or solo singers weekends and drinks are a good price. Lot's of restaurants and bars nearby....check out Lulu's Sports bar just up from here...great bar! If we return to Hawaii we would stay here again but perhaps in a different room.

We just returned from a 8 night trip to Hawaii where we stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel (AWBH). We were a little concerned when arriving because we had read reviews of the place being outdated. While the reviews were correct, the location of the hotel made up for all the shortfalls - for lack of a better word. Our room was spacious and on the 25th floor. The bathrooms are outdated but were clean. The room meet our needs. The hotel staff worked very hard in keeping the place clean and everyone was super helpful and cheerful. The best feature of this hotel is it's location. It's steps away from the beach. There's also a bunch of restaurants of various price range in the vicinity which adds to the convenience factor. The hotel is also accessible by public transit and is close to Honolulu Zoo and Diamond Head. Our only negative expertise with AWBH was that we were surprised to see a $25/night transaction charge added at checkout - we were under the impression that this would only be a one time charge. We should have done our due diligence when reserving. Another minor nuance was the elevator system. You have to key the floor from outside before you enter - a bit of an odd system but seems to work - this did add to the wait times especially during rush periods. Overall our experience at AWBH was very pleasant and the hotel met all our needs and then some. Factor in the room rates and it'll be hard to find a better location in Waikiki. If you are a stickler about room appearances then stay at the Marriott across the street - but be willing to open your wallet. Mahalo to all the staff at AWBH for making our first time to Hawaii a memorable one. We miss you already!

So well located -just across the road and you are on the beach! I liked being a couple of steps away from the main section of shops, which also meant we were closer to diamond head and the zoo. Lovely staff and i would ho back again.

I just wanted to drop a quick thanks you and big shout outs to Dave Bruce at the Aston Waikiki Hotel! Dave is extremely passionate about all of Hawaii and his knowledge of all the places to see was invaluable. I was in town for business and my wife joined me, we spoke with Dave several times during our trip and every time we were amazed at his recommendations! He planned us out a weekend trip to Kauai (based on his advice) and had an absolutely amazing time there!! We came to Hawaii 16 years ago but can truly say our time here was so much more enjoyable as a result of our conversations with Dave. He is truly an asset to anyone looking to explore Hawaii and want a guaranteed amazing time!!The property was just right for this trip but when we return we will definitely come back here to seek more advice from this amazing Concierge!!Mahalo Dave!!!Josh and Kelly Dunbar

Good location at the end of Waikiki beach. Rooms are oh so tired in desperate need of updating. Bathroom was pretty bad cracked tiles stained sink just blah. Needs painting new carpet everything done. We were next to elevator which was noisy. Wind always whistling through the sliding door at night. Tikis bar great!

The Hotel is an average place to stay, the beds are hard, the shower heads and low, I’m 5’10” and the shower head comes to about 5 feet, the air conditioning controls were a bit difficult to figure out at first they were in Celsius and are locked to not go below a certain temperature. The good thing about the room was that we were facing pool side so we didn’t get the direct heat from the sun shining in our room roasting us throughout the day and the hotel is very conveniently located near the beach, shops, restaurants, tour bus stops and the port for cruise ships. So all in all for the reasons I’ve given I gave this place a 3 out of 5

Super cost effective way to see Waikiki. Hotel rooms show their age. But who cares? The place was CLEAN the staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. You are right at the beach. They Loan you chairs and coolers for the beach. Something that comes at a high cost at like the HHV. The ocean front room is the only way to go. The view is breathtaking. If you ask for a corner room on Diamond head side. You get sunrise and the sunset opportunities. The waters are beautiful here. Many surfers to be seen beyond the break wall. I would stay here again.

we recently stayed here for 9 days, the room was quite large, the view was amazing and the beach was right across the street. We ate at the restaurant, relaxed by the pool and took some great sunset photos from our pool chairs. The pink trolley stops at the door and drops you at Alamoana and costs just $2, the Zoo is literally next door and everything else is easy walking distance. The staff were lovely and even checked us in early, would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

We arrived at 6am in Honolulu after a 10 hour flight from Australia feeling very washed out. We arrived at the hotel to be told we could not check in until 3pm. We could have a room earlier for US$75. We chose to go and find some breakfast at an ABC Store. Upon our return at 12.30pm, our room was available. We had a partial view of Waikiki Beach from our side balcony, which was great. We did not bother with the breakfast option as McDonalds is a couple of blocks away, which served an excellent yoghurt parfait with granola. Breakfast for two cost us less than US$10. The "resort fee' is a bit rich especially since we don't drink coffee, but I asked for a kettle and it was promptly delivered. I found some tea bags at the ABC Store. There were a few maintenance issues on our arrival. The sliding door to the balcony would not close and our towel rail in the bathroom was about to come off its hinges. These issues were quickly dealt with while we were out for a short walk. Staff could be a bit more helpful with visitors trying to make their way around on the buses. I got the impression that they didn't have a clue. Had to find out the hard way and ask other fellow travellers. Great location, directly opposite Waikiki Beach and a short walk to where all the action is on Kalakaua Avenue, around the Moana Surfrider, the Outrigger and the Royal Hawaiian Hotel, otherwise known as the 'Pink Palace.' Room was clean and comfortable and cheaper than lots of other hotels in the area. I would stay here again.

Room 820 could definitely use some help. Very dark. Sliding glass door badly bent, so much so that regular latch won't work and they installed a "U" shaped rod to hold it closed. If you opened it, couldn't get it closed again. Plus if the wind was blowing, it whistled. Reported it to the front desk, but nothing was done. Shower head leaks. Elevator system requires you to use your room key to go anywhere, making it a royal pain. Oh, and don't forget the $25 a day "resort fee" to have slow wifi.

We had stayed here 8 years ago and decided to stay again because we were so happy with our last stay. But, things have definitely changed since the last time we were there.Upon arrival check in was awful! The wait to check in was of about 35 min which is outrageous, not what you want or need after a 6 hour flight. Once we reached the check in desk it took them another 20 min or so to figure out our reservation. They kept confusing my sister's reservation and mine just because we had the same last name. At last they got our reservations straight, but when we got to our rooms they were double beds instead of a king. So there we go again to the awful check in line for another 20 min to switch to another room with a king bed. After all this waiting and back and forth we were exhausted. It took about 2 hours to finally settle in and begin enjoying our vacaction!The rooms also let me down. They are in serious need of an update, especially the bathrooms. The floor tile is cracked and dirty looking, very old...The rest of the hotel (lobby area, pool, etc are all in great shape, its just the rooms that they haven't updated in a long time. They have let the place go which is such a shame because the location is awesome! Your are right next to shopping, restaurants (Wolfgang Puck Express, Subway and Tiki's  in the hotel) and across the street from Waikiki Beach. Also, rental cars like Enterprise are right across the street which is really convenient.I really don't think I would stay here again or recommend it to anyone until they update their rooms and improve their customer service.

Check in was very smooth and front desk was very helpful and friendly. We had a reservation for 7 days and due to flight delays and cancelations we lost a day. They were very helpful in assisting with this. We had signed up for the membership there and this was helpful in getting a room upgrade upon check inRooms were clean but a bit outdated compared to some other hotel. Pool was very clean with a comfortable area round the poolLocation was great. Directly across from Waikiki Beach and our room had a view looking up the beach showing the water, beach, hotels, and street. Very pretty evening view as well

There really aren't any new hotels in Waikiki. They are all pretty much old buildings that either have been renovated or worn out. This hotel looks like they're trying to at least keep the building refreshed, but you will still find things like the bathroom flooring and fixtures that will remind you that you are paying $200/night for the location. Although on the small side, I thought our ocean-view room was comfortable and convenient. The only thing that I wished for were softer pillows and a more substantial blanket for our bedding. The pillows in our room were overstuffed and firm. The blanket seemed more like layers of sheets - no comforter. There is a $25 resort fee (per night) they will charge to your card when you check in. Parking is available through valet only at $32/day.

The room was really spacious. Way too much for me by myself. I am a part owner of a business in Oahu so I'm there fairly often and love staying here. Its close enough to Waikiki to walk to in 10-12 minutes and far enough that it's quiet. The staff are really friendly and never had a problem. The prices are very reasonable for what your getting.They have their own parking lot too!!

Hotel was nice though we checkin different room and moved to our room the next day.Both of our rooms had ocean view.Hotel is just across the street to ocean so beach can be enjoyed any time of day.Tiki's restaurant is good too for night dinner.There a near SKY bar for night.So all in all enjoyable location.

I stayed here with my young family for 2 weeks in an ocean front select room which we were put on the 18th floor. room had an amazing view overlooking Waikiki beach. we were in the middle of the building so we couldn't see diamond head. but your not there to see a mountain. The room itself was ok. (wouldn't recommend for long stay). tv modern, playstation if u like that stuff, beds are small and not that comfortable, there was dust stains on the wall were the air conditioning came out, and the shower was out dated and small. the room service was lovely and very friendly. the front desk were very helpful. this place also has its own tour booking places in the building instead of all the scammers on the street. The pool was nice especially to have a Mia tia of an arvo at happy hour at the tiki bar that is on the deck level. The tiki wear was really good. awesome drinks food and view of the sunset of an arvo and had good music playing. You don't need worry about beach towel as they are complementary fresh daily. As for transport down stairs is the pick up spot for most tours and the trolley which was great for young kids getting to the location. There is plenty of restaurants in the area but for some of the more liked eateries they are quiet a long walk up to the main area of Waikiki. For the beach the beach pools are straight out the front awesome for kids and just relaxing also has an all sand bottom.

We two rooms from Thursday, October 12, 2017 until Saturday, October 14, 2017. We had a load of stuff to bring up to the rooms so we decided on having the bell service assist us. The gentleman at the bell desk did not seem too friendly. As items were being put on the cart, I went to the front desk to check us in. When it was my turn at the desk, I went up and proceeded to give the clerk my ID and charge card. She informed me of the parking fee (in & out privileges), the resort fee and the security deposit. The clerk did tell me the security deposit would be returned to me but she didn't tell me when. After we were given out keys, we headed straight to the rooms which were on the 16th floor. The rooms were ocean view so at least we had a nice view of the beach. The decor of the room seem outdated but it was clean. The next morning on Friday, October 13, we went downstairs to retrieve our vehicle since we had errands to do for my daughter's wedding that was being held at the Coconut Club later in the evening. The same guy at the valet/bell desk asked me if I called for the car. I told him No. So, it took a bit of a wait to finally have our vehicle come up to the waiting area. We headed out to do our errands and returned around 12:00. We again had stuff to unload and asked for a cart. No problem. I understand about security which is the reason for the room card to be swiped against the elevator and guests push the floor they are headed to. Later in the evening, as guests were arriving to the hotel to head to the 21st floor, there was a host downstairs letting people up but I don't know how long that person was actually there. My husband was going up and down the elevator from 5:00pm to let people up. It seemed like an inconvenience but eventually things worked out. On the morning of check out, which was Saturday, 10/14/2017, we called the bell desk for a cart. A young man came up within 5 minutes and loaded stuff from the two rooms. He accidentally tipped over an orchid plant we had but he was very apologetic. I headed down to the Express Mail Drop to leave the keys since the line at the desk was long. Our overall stay at the Aston Waikiki was okay.

You couldn’t ask for a better location. Right across the street from the beach and public swimming. Close to all kinds of shops and restaurants. Plus there is bus service almost to your door step. Although the hotel is older, we feel they’ve done an excellent job in updating the building and the rooms were comfortable and clean. They’ve dealt with their parking issue by adding a valet service which were very efficient and helpful. The pool & surrounding area wasn’t overcrowded and had all the comforts of home. There is also a restaurant and bar on premises that offered food and drinks at a reasonable price and also had local entertainment .

My husband and I came to the Aston after a horrible experience at the Ala Moana. The employees here are friendly and helpful! The rooms were okay, there was a lot of mold in the washroom possibly because there isn't a fan. other than that, great hotel and the Waikiki beach is literally a few steps outside the hotel. Also, the Honolulu Zoo is just down the street from the Aston. The Aston offers complimentary beach bags with sunscreen and after sun care which was a life saver! If you have a family with young kids, this is the place to stay!

This was our third stay here and once again we enjoyed the hotel. We spent 7 nights here this time.We have had an Ocean Front Select room on each occasion and can highly recommend spending the bit extra to secure the wonderful view of Waikiki that these rooms give you.It's a bit of a shame they have discontinued the breakfast on the beach service each morning as we used to enjoy that. But we were aware it was no longer provided before we arrived so not a big deal.Tiki's restaurant which is on site was as enjoyable as ever.This is a good hotel in our opinion. The cost of the accommodation is reasonable for the location when compared to many other hotels in the area.
user_name:
Melnp
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: The suites are beautiful and they're clean. The view from our room was espectacular. Stores and restaurants are on a walking distance if you decide not to eat at the hotel. The beach is just across the street. I really liked that the hotel loans you chairs, umbrellas and towels to use on the beach. We really enjoyed our stayed.

We stayed 11 nights. We were close to Diamond Head, Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium. All tour buses that we used picked us up out front or down street at the Marriott. It is a dated hotel but very clean and lots of room. The elevator was a little confusing at first but didn't take long to figure it out. There are very few restaurants within walking distance. The beach is just across street and we had views of the beach from our hotel room. My only complaint is that we didn't have a microwave in our room. I thought all rooms had them. We didn't have a chair to sit in either. We had a tall table with two tall bar stools. Very uncomfortable to sit on so we had to sit on bed or sit on balcony. But this was only minor complaints. We really enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay here again.

The location was fantastic and the hotel amenities are nice but the rooms we had were shabby, dirty and run-down. The beds were comfortable though. Our in-laws room had a patio door that wouldn't close completely. Their bed linens had holes in them as well. Bathrooms tiles and shower surround were stained and looked dirty and icky. The pool was small but lovely and the complimentary pool bag with cooler was nice as well.

Would recommend staying here.Rooms lovely, air con great.Great location.Great views.Staff friendly.Pool area and bar service lovely spot to see sun set!Food nice..Breathtaking views on a beautiful day.

First time we've stayed here and whilst we did arrive from Australia very, very early - well before check-in time, Sean at the front desk did every thing he could to get us in our room as early as possible. In fact he ended up changing us to a corner ocean front room (we already had ocean front booked but with two double beds) which was superb in size and views but with a king bed so Sean gave us a free roll-away bed. He also didn't charge us for the second night resort tax because we had been so patient! The activities desk offers the best prices around and seems to have greater availability than other hotels. Tiki's by the pool is great for sunset cocktails and great music - food okay but limited menu. Would recommend this hotel in terms of staff friendliness, room standard and cleanliness and best location - convenient to everything. Tram out the front, pickup for most activities across the road at the Marriott, Wolfgang Puck dining with fantastic pizzas and salads downstairs, Subway and ABC store on the same block (beneath the hotel essentially).

My wife and I stayed two nights here and were not at all impressed. The elevators are very confusing to operate and you might have to spend 10 Mins just trying to figure out how to operate it. Very frustrating. We spent $25 per person at breakfast in the hotel restaurant....nice views though. Food was decent, wife’s coffee came out lukewarm. When they say ocean view it’s really only partial ocean view as the building faces another hotel. You have to go out on the porch to see the ocean. They gave us the wrong room at first, we were supposed to have a king bed and they gave us double full size. Pool was tiny and unimpressive. Don’t waste your time or money here. Not impressed at all!

Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is a great spot with beautiful views from the rooms. comfortable beds and a every person who worked there was friendly and helpful. The location gives you easy access to the best beach right across the street and easy to walk to pretty much anywhere in Waikiki the Zoo is around the corner and there are restaurants and shops onsite as well. A great place to stay relax or use as home base for your Waikiki and Oahu Adventure - Have fun, I know you will enjoy the sunset : )

Nice hotel very handily located. Rooms need a little tidy up but overall ok. Has all amenities close by. Desks to book trips and packages. Nice swimming pool and easy access to sheltered beach across road. Plenty of buses to all locations out front

We chose this hotel to spend the night before we left on our cruise the next day. The website made the pool look absolutely beautiful when in reality it is on the third floor, very small, and filled with people. The elevators were a bit different to get used to but were actually nice once we understood how to work them. Our room was nice and everything we needed, but the bathroom floor needed to be re-grouted or cleaned up. It gave the appearance of being old and dirty. We had an oceanfront room which was absolutely delightful. The views are spectacular and you are right on the main boulevard directly across the street from the beach. We were in the water within five minutes of walking. We had lunch in the Tiki bar downstairs and it was very good but we chose to eat our dinner and breakfast at LuLu's next-door and that was fantastic.

Our view was amazing!, looking straight down Waikiki beach. This motel is down the quieter end of Waikiki. Room was fine and very well maintained. Pool area was lovely and enjoyed the close proximity to the Tiki Bar We would happily stay there again.

Don’t think I’d come back here, room was very old and had been painted several times without removing old paint a lot of caulk keeping bathroom together. Was upgraded to slight ocean view only could see someone’s pool check in was very slow only two checkers. Had to go up escalator 3 floors to check in, then you had to use room card to use elevator by scanning then enter floor number and then it would tell you which elevator to use (5) doors never would get the same door (weird).

We are so glad we booked and stayed in this hotel. It is beautifully located across from Waikiki Beach, thus the views were absolutely superb. The rooms were clean and comfortable and a reasonable size. We had the use of many facilities such as the pool, tour companies in the foyer at your disposable (shout out to Amy form VIP tours - very helpful!), DVD hire, free wi-fi & newspapers, unlimited TV choice, towels & chairs that you could borrow for the day and for $7USD you could get a small cooler with 4 drinks of your choice with ice that you could take with you for the day (you get to keep the cooler and are able to refill with ice when you need it at a small cost). The elevator system used was different than anything we had used before but what an excellent way to do things! The staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble. The Tiki Bar was an attachment where we would convene of an afternoon to share great stories and even better views at sunset. I think our room was classed as 'partial ocean view' with was superb so a full ocean view would have been even better. This was a very, very good place to stay!

We booked this hotel as it offered ocean front rooms and was close to the beach and main strip of Kalakaua Avenue. The room was very clean although a little dated. The view we had from our room on the 17th floor was beautiful. We were right across the road from the beach and close to all amenities.Staff were always helpful. They offered free DVD's and on arrival we were given a pack which included sun screen, chap lip cream and after sun care. You are able to use towels and chairs to take to the beach which was great. The hotel pool is quiet small but sufficient enough as the beach is right outside your door.

We spent 9 nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel from September 11th till September 20th. We got upgraded to a suite once the hotel staff found out it was my birthday which was really nice. Room was large and spacious and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. Honestly bathroom is outdated and it looks dirty (even though it isn't) due to stains over the years. Other than that no complaints about the room.The pool was nice and there are tons of pool chairs around for everyone. The ones with umbrellas usually go first so you need to wake up extra early to get them. The hotel supplies beach towels and chairs that can be taken down to the beach which was great! Great location and tons to do around the hotel.

Very comfortable room with lovely king bed. Very clean.Amazing views. Great staff. Lovely pool area. Don't bother with tour operators attached to motel...they were not very fair. Would definitely stay here again.

The best location, beachfront and 2 min walk to centre of town, far enough away that is is still quiet also. Rooms comfortable will stay again! Rooms always clean & just generally good value for money - not the Hilton but a very very good place to stay! Where else do you stay right on the beach!!!

Was disgusted in the filth of the rooms we got . Pubic hair on the floor and in the bath . Dust over shelves . Cracked tiles everywhere. Paint peeling . Very poor . Staff dont care . Its take it or leave it . No care . Dont waist your money here . Go to tbe outrigger. Much better .

We came on a visit to Hawaii as a family holiday . We chose this hotel in Honolulu based on price and location . On arrival we checked in without Issue . The rooms are a little small but clean and comfortable. The we had a short but pleasant stay for the most part . When on holiday we all appreciate things being done in a timely manner so we can get on with our day and make the most of our limited time off . Unfortunately on checking out of the hotel we were met with a large queue of people checking in. No matter though, surely we can simply bypass and give the keys . No they couldn't have that. The checking in or out is the same line . But wait we have a flight to catch , there are no extras or outstanding fees I just want to go ! I have things to do . No , wait in the enormous queue . More than an hour and I'm still here and annoyed enough to get their attention that COMMON SENSE must prevail. Please address this at once because I can speak for a number of people in the queue now , we do not appreciate you wasting our time due to simple lack of foresight ! It ruins an otherwise pleasant stay !

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is a good value hotel in Waikiki. It is beach front, so awesome location. I found it to be the quieter end of the main road with all the shops and stuff, which I liked. They give out a beach bag with sun protection in it, which was a nice touch. The pool area is kind of small, but you have the beach right there, so it didn't really matter!The rooms were decent, however the bathrooms felt dated. They could do with a freshen up! Overall, I would recommend the hotel to friends and family if they are wanting clean, comfortable, good value!

My husband and I stayed here for a week and we were beyond pleased with the room, customer service from the friendly staff, and the perfect location. We booked the hotel through Hawaiian Airlines for a flight-hotel bundle and thought that this hotel was very reasonably priced. We upgraded to an Ocean View Select room, which ended up being located on the 21st floor and had a spectacular view of Waikiki Beach from our balcony. The king bed was very comfortable and the room was more than spacious enough for the two of us. Everyone that works here is very friendly and accommodating, from front desk and housekeeping to valet. The location is great because you are right in the downtown area and you only have to walk across the street to get to the beach. The hotel lets you borrow beach towels and beach chairs each day. We always felt safe and welcome during our stay and can't wait to come back soon for another visit. I've already recommended this hotel to friends and family wanting to experience Oahu.

Stayed here for 4 nights! Fantastic hotel for a very reasonable price! Staff were friendly and polite, booked via expedia silver members so was provided with a free upgrade from a standard to an ocean view room. Great view of Queen's beach from balcony and convenient amenities. Right on the beach front, with good restaurants And convenience stores below. Also has a expedia local expert tour desk inside. Pool is small but amenities and towels to use at beach are included in resort fee. Also on the door stop is the hop on hop off trolley and local bus stops to make it easy to get around! Would definitely recommend and stay again.

My husband surprised me with a trip to Waikiki for our 25th wedding anniversary. We were travelling with another couple who were also celebrating their 21st so I phoned the hotel and asked if they have anything special to decorate both our rooms for a surprise. Thelma the Food and Beverage Supervisor was so helpful. I ordered a champagne basket and some loose orchid petals to be scattered on the bed upon our arrival. I had co ordinated it with the Front end supervisor Lillian and it went off without a hitch. Our friends and my husband were surprised upon our arrival. I was only a little disappointed that the champagne was not chilled it was wrapped in a basket! :( Our room was amazing! We were on the 23 floor looking down Kalakaua Ave and the beautiful ocean. Yes the room could use some "updating" but we don't spend time in our room except to sleep so what more do you need? It was clean, the A/C worked well and the king size bed was comfortable! The key system for the elevators was a little confusing for some as you tap your card, enter your floor and it selects one of the 5 elevators for you! There was always someone looking dazed at the elevators! haha The pool area was clean, the bathrooms around the pool were clean and the there was always fresh towels. You could sign out beach chairs to take to the beach with you as well as the little drink stand had coolers with ice and pop you could buy I think $4. Great deal! The Tiki bar was amazing for their happy-hour as well as the meals were fantastic. It didn't get much better than sitting on the deck over looking the beach listening to the live music. If you are looking to book some activities, don't hesitate to go and see Kahea from Pleasant Holidays. She will make sure you are well taken care of! We booked a rental car, the Pearl Harbour Excursion and the Sunset Dinner cruise all through her. She was so informative and made sure our Anniversary dinner on the cruise was 5 star! She is located on the pool level, the first wicket on the Left! We will definitely come back to Waikiki and stay at the Aston! You cannot beat the view, the location and friendly n service by all the employees. If you are looking for a hoity-toity hotel, this place is not for you! We cannot wait to come back! <3

This was our 3rd trip to Oahu and our 3rd stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. At check-in there was a woman handing out cups of shave ice to everyone waiting, which was nice. We got to our room and set the thermostat to 70° before going out. 3 hours later we came back to the room and it was still 74°, which to us is uncomfortable. I spoke to the desk and they were extremely helpful and sent a maintenance tech to the room. About 40 minutes later the temperature hadn't changed, so the desk moved us to a better room. As far as the rooms go, our rooms were clean. You can find places in the rooms that need to be touched up but I'd be willing to bet that you can find the same thing at one of the higher priced hotels down the strip. Housekeeping did a great too.At checkout you'll be charged a $25/night amenity fee and $32/day valet parking fee (if you used valet). Parking in Waikiki is a premium and the $32 is pretty much what you'll find at any Waikiki hotel. If you don't want to pay that, just take the bus because you won't find any street parking. The $25/night amenity fee covers multiple things the only one we really used was the WiFi. Personally, I'd rather the amenity fee be added to my room total on the front side so it's already paid when we arrive. But it's ok, just make sure you budget for that. If you're going to be driving, the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is at the end of the strip, so getting in and out is pretty easy. If you've ever walked by any of the other hotels on Kalakaua, you know that getting in, and especially getting out, are difficult.The hotel employees are great, so be kind to them. The location is great, it's less crowded on their end of Waikiki. We have no interest in staying anywhere else when we come back. Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is our hotel.

Had an oceanfront room...paid extra...bit miffed when you meet other travellers who tell of the great upgrade they got to oceanfront rooms....LOL..we did get free juice in the fridge though.....so there..Room was clean, bright and quiet...downside of the ocean front room is that damn setting sun, could we dull it down a bit...seriously...man wants to sit on his lanai of an evening and sip a few cold suds....which he can't cos theres no table to put aforementioned suds on.......oh the humanity...and its hotTikis restaurant is OK...really not that special folks...you need to lift your game...you can only do so much with pork n pineapple.....Bar staff were great when you get a seat at the bar..which i highly recommend, cos sitting at an open table doesn't get the type of service you expect...especially if your the guy who paid extra for an special room to find out your not that special.....Seriously though the wait service to the open tables is sloooooow.my fizzy mineral water was flay by the time i received...i sat there watching it on the bar for ages until someone remembered it might be for a paying customer......Aside all that, pool is fine for a dip....no pool service though.reception is efficient and elevator process is great.

While property is due for a major refurbish, its location and 1980s tiki room charm still hold some appeal.Reasonably priced and right across the road from the public beach are a thumbs up.Long waits at check in counter, more staff needed here.If you are there for a short stay and like the slightly more laid back vibe at this end of Waikiki then give it a try.

My third stay here - great views of the beach - start of the strip so it's a great location- Has a small pool with plenty of lounges - had the Tiki bar restaurant is in top and that's amazing - rooms are clean and freshened daily the hotel room cleaners are very sweet and helpful I gave a small tip every second day they cleaned my room - their grateful and deserve it - but they don't expect it - totally up to you - close to buses and there's an On-Off tram that's stops outside to take you everywhere- totally recommend Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and I'd stay again next year - oh and you get a free beach pack upon checking in - sweet idea

You are paying for the location which is in the heart of Waikiki Beach and the beach is right across the hotel. The Honolulu Zoo is just a block over as well. The pool is also decent sized which is nice. The hotel also provides free DVD rentals you can check out as part of your resort fee. There is a room safe for valuables and there is also a microwave near the lobby. When we arrived in the afternoon, there was a long line to check in. Seems like the front desk is understaffed especially during busy check-in/check-out periods as there were only two staff members assisting guests when we arrived. Once we were up at the front desk, the staff member informed me our room was not ready yet and I would have to go through the line again in 30 to 45 minutes to see if our room was ready which was ridiculous. The room itself was a tad dirty when we arrived and the A/C would randomly have the room freezing at night when we slept. We called guest service but the staff was unable to fix the issue. Overall, the hotel is ok for the price but the service needs to get better.

We had ocean front rooms. The hotel is fine for the price compared to the prices of the more luxury hotels on Waikiki. We stayed a week, and toured Oahu. The staff was responsive when we called for more of the items we needed and left more towels and toiletries on a daily basis.

although the hotel is very well located, it is old and outdated. Rooms are very old, not very clean and the bed mattresses are the WORST ever!! The bath towels are TERRIBLE! There are just too many guests and the staff just do what they can. I complained about the cleanliness of my room twice and they never got back to me! This is a 2 stars hotel at most, and you will pay lot of money, simply AWFUL!!!!

We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our Hawaii holiday in June and found it to be a good base for exploring the city. Room was decent size and comfortable, although not sure why we were given two small double beds rather than one large bed that we could both sleep in! Room was quite noisy partly due to ice maker machine being just outside the door - who's idea was that?! Hotel staff were reasonably helpful, although never enough at reception and there were always queues. Bathroom a bit dated and in need of refurbishment. Overall a good hotel.

I have a number of bad experiences at this hotel that has brought me to this review.1) Don't bother trying to call the hotel. When I arrived I wanted to see if our room was ready and was transferred 7 times in less than 4 minutes until I finally asked for a supervisor and they figured out how to check if a room was ready...2) Got to the room, and it was a lot more drab than expected.. One of the yellow pillows was missing a pillowcase. The sheets and towels had stains on them each night even though we requested to have them changed daily.3) Valet is a JOKE. Called from my room 15 minutes in advance, and still had to wait downstairs for another 10 minutes. I could have WALKED to where I needed to be in the 25 minutes it took for them to get my car. Expect to wait 15-20 min each time. When returning the car, expect to wait in your car for 5-10 minutes either on the sidewalk or in the street. Can't even drop off your car because the cars in front aren't being moved.4) Got a knock on the door at 8:30am with NO announcement of who was there, and someone immediately putting the key to get in the room?!? Since when does housekeeping NOT announce they are outside before trying to enter the room?? Luckily had the bolt lock up because I was changing. Housekeeping also left behind a huge can of Lysol on our sink.5) A few days after leaving the hotel, checked my credit card statement and saw an additional $59.69 charge from the hotel. Tried to call to find out where it was from.... only to be transferred another 5 times to the same people, finally transferred to a supervisor, and was only able to leave a voicemail.5 stars for location, 0 stars for service, 0 stars for cleanliness. DON'T BOTHER STAYING HERE. PLEASE look elsewhere.

We stayed 1 nite, rented 3 Rooms to go to the Okinawan Festival @ Kapiolani Park... and was pleasantly Surprised !! It's an older Hotel but rooms were clean, bed & bath were clean, no odd smells !! Great Location if you're Attending an Event like we did, or even if you want to take the kids to the Zoo or Aquarium !! A Flate Rate Valet Parking which was great...because Waikiki Parking is $$$ !! A definite Do-Again !!

Great location right by the beach, hotel offer free beach chair & towel to bring to the beach. We got a nice welcome gift bag with sunscreen and lotion. They also have the drinking water dispensing machine for you to fill your own bottle. There are many restaurants and shops right around the area. We didn't use the pool but it looks clean and well maintained and plenty of lounge chairs by the pool. We stayed at the partial ocean view and it has a great ocean view. Overall we are very satisfied with our stay there.one thing I noticed is the Valet parking lot is always pack and busy always see guests waiting for their car.
user_name:
Eva N
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice hotel to stay in. The location was perfect. We only stayed 2 nights before we were taking a cruise. Enjoyed the bar and restaurant in the hotel and the hotel employees were all friendly and helpful. The bathroom was a little dated, but everything was clean. Walked everywhere we needed to go from the hotel, as it is on the main strip in Waikiki. Lots of places close by to eat and shop.
user_name:
Shayne M
Belle Chasse, Louisiana, United States

review_body: This was the third time we had stayed at this hotel and it was excellent as always. Stayed for 4 nights this trip to break up our journey back to Australia from the US. One disappointment was the buffet breakfast at the pool was no more. We had always enjoyed taking our breakfast over to the beach. The room we were upgraded to was sensational, amazing views from the 22nd. floor looking along the strip. Sensational sunsets!! This is our go to hotel in Waikiki.

We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aston Waikiki beach Hotel. The position just across from the beach and at the end of busy strip is just perfect and you would expect it to be more expensive. The room was a good size and the beds (we had two doubles) were very comfortable and the service couldn't have been better with the room cleaned beautifully everyday. We didn't use the pool area or the on site terrace restaurant but they were very popular. We would highly recommend this hotel. We had a lovely view from our balcony looking straight down Waikiki beach and witnessed beautiful sunsets.

The rooms are nice, but very old. The bathroom needs an urgent renovation and the daily cleaning is not that great. Pool is small and mostly used by adults with drinks, not very kids friendly. The best thing about the hotel is its location: right in front of Waikiki beach close to Duke's statue.

Before holiday started caught up with the latest reviews and to our horror they were less than good. This prompted a call to the hotel to check, this resulted in a immediate upgrade to quell our fears. Upon arrival rooms were allocated and upon entering we were horrified. The ceiling covers were in the bath toilets did not flush and phone to the desk did not work. The contact we had been given Natasha Akee was called situation explained and we were given another Ocean View Select room on a higher floor. It was explained that renovations were being undertaken on the original allocated rooms and were sent there by mistake. Well that ends the 1st hour. After that we were back in paradise views from room fabulous see attached. For the 18 nights we stayed could not raise a complaint rooms always maintained a clean bathroom great pool and other hotel amenities and most importantly all the staff polite, friendly and help full at all times.Hotel situated at zoo end of Waikiki which was quiet an advantage trolley and tour buses right at the door beach across the road and plenty of places to eat at in close proximity. Have already recommended the hotel to a few people and have only been home 2 days.Will definitely return with more family and hopefully some friends.

Located at the end of the "hotel strip" the Aston Waikiki is definitely value for money.We had amazing views with a beachfront room taking in all that Waikiki has to offer.Great breakfast package! Cruise up to the pool on the roof and enjoy the buffet with a good range of breakfast options.Upon arrival you get a small insulated bag that you get to pack full of goodies from the buffet to enjoy. Absorb the views as you eat, take it to your room or off for breakfast on the beach!Great staff, great facilities, great location and definitely value for money!

Let me start by saying I really like this hotel a lot and have stayed here at least once a year for the last 10 years. Love that a great beach is right across the street and that's it's close to Kapiolani Park. It's location is a little less manic than some other Waikiki locations.This trip we were greeted wonderfully by Helen at the front desk. She took care of our reservation in a way you'd want to be treated by anyone working the front desk of a hotel. EXCELLENT. Honorable mention goes to Chris and to Sean as well who checked us in last July.Having said this, I only gave the hotel 3 stars for a few reasons. For starters, the room furnishings as well as the bathroom fixtures are a little long in the tooth. Some updating is definitely in order. The bath towels are a bit on the coarse side.If you can afford it, I recommend an ocean front room, as the view is definitely million-dollar. A room near the elevators will keep you awake at night and a room off one of the side streets will awaken you way too early with the sounds of beeping delivery trucks backing in.The pool, while small, is decent and the deck area has been nicely updated. Although we didn't visit the restaurant on property this trip (Tiki's) it's a good one and Wolfgang Puck Express down below can be a life saver.I'll be back getting my Aloha on again, soon.
user_name:
lvb5th
New York City, New York

review_body: Had a great time here. Its an older hotel, but very clean and well taken care of. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The beach is right across the street. Beautiful pool, with a tiki bar and restaurant. You can sign out beach chairs and towels for your use. A great place for kids, even has fast food downstairs on the street level. Each room has a Sony Play station . You get free rentals of movies during your stay. Many places to eat and shop are in close walking distance.

Stayed here for a week. The location is fantastic- up one end of the Waikiki beach promenade so walking distance to all the attractions without the noise. It's a little dated- very small pool (not that it matters with the beach so close) but the rooms are comfortable. Has a fridge, reasonable bed and a useful DVD vending machine in the lobby. The best feature is the Tiki Bar- a fun place to hang out and watch the sunset outside with live music. Would recommend for all travellers.

Had a great time. Very nice staff, clean and right next to beach. If you enjoy shopping it is all here. Like a New York city . There are many things to do with willing staff ready to help. Just be aware that everything cost quite a bit so food is expensive but there are as a lot of Comforts from home here to like Subways McDonald's and Burger King's prices are just higher than usual for people in Ohio. If you look at more for the country then stay closer to the North Shore or some of the other smaller cities.

My family and I just spent our 1st week in Hawaii staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. The Hotel is right across from Waikiki Beach and within walking distance of a lot of shops and restaurants. The girl that checked us in at the front desk was very friendly and made us feel excited about being in Hawaii for the first time. Our room was clean and comfortable. I've read reviews about people complaining they have to wait in line at check in but Waikiki is a busy place. You are going to be waiting in line at a lot of locations. Staff was very friendly. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip!

While this hotel isn't new or modern it was clean and comfortable. Our view from the corner room on the 9th floor was awesome. We could see diamond head on the left and then all the way down the beach. The lights from the city at night were beautiful. The tour guide at the counter was excellent at helping us decide on tours and get them arranged. The only thing that seem to be an issue was the elevator system. Because of the way you had to wait on a specific elevator, you sometimes waited a while.

I stayed in the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel for 7 nights. The hotel itself is okay. The rooms are old but everything you need is there and the hotel staff were lovely and helpful. There is a trolley stop outside the hotel for 4 out of 5 lines, so easy access to transport to places like Diamondhead, the State Capitol and Palace, Pearl Harbour and major stores such as Ala Moana Centre. It is also about a two minute work from Honolulu Zoo and the Waikiki beach. Great location and decent hotel. I enjoyed my stay here

We booked this hotel for the location and expected from reviews the hotel would be average. We asked for a view and we did get a decent view for the price we paid, the room was ok but that didn't worry us, the bed was comfortable but we were woken a few times by workers downstairs or house cleaning wanting to clean the room.In general our stay was ok but I felt there was no customer service. No desk to go and ask questions about transport or general questions. We asked at the check in counter about transport and we were told to go to the Valet. We went to the valet and he was not interested in helping, we ended up booking our own Uber.The girl at the tour counter sold us the Ocean Joy snorkelling with the turtles tour for $150 each. She told us this was the only tour to do, forget the rest. It was disappointing and no where near as good as the Circle Island tour or other tours we have been on and much more expensive.Tikki's bar is always great, great food, cheap drinks and the staff are helpful - especially Jessie (not sure if that's how you spell his name).We have stayed at the Vive hotel before for about the same price which much better and more professional service and you can ask them any questions you like at the counter downstairs. It is 2 streets behind the beach though.

This hotel is in a great location. Right across fromWaikiki beach and next to the zoo. The rooms were clean and check in staff was pleasant. I wish the pool would have been nicer. They don't have a hot tub so that was a bummer. I do like that they do provided complimentary chairs and towels to go to beach you just have to check them out. Also each room has a PlayStation u can rent games from the lobby or movies sort of like a redbox kiosk it's included with your resort fee so you don't pay extra. I was bummed that my room was ocean view technically but I had no patio it was a small little area you step out and that's it nothing fit there literally and was actually pretty scary. I had 2 small children with me I just kept it locked just didn't seem safe. The hallway was really loud with wind blowing thru the halls so you could hear it all night wind blowing thru the hall. The reason it does that is because part of each floor has a open section and there is no door it's open so the air move freely thru the halls which made it very loud you could feel the air pressure pushing underneath the door had to put a towel. Over all this is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. It's clean and staff is friendly. It's one of the more affordable hotels in Waikiki that is directly across from the beach.

We spent 3 nights at the Aston Waikiki after our cruise and absolutely loved it! Is the property a little dated? Yes. HOWEVER....it is clean, the staff is amazing, we appreciated the extra little touches, and the location is perfect! We had an Ocean Front room and the view was absolutely second to none!! SPECTACULAR!The front desk staff was stellar and I'd like to say a special thank you to Sean, Stella, and Kalehua. All were very helpful and extremely friendly every time we dealt with them. We enjoyed the DVD rentals, Keurig coffee, gift bag with sunscreen etc., in room wifi, spacious room, and beach front location. We also preferred that it's down near the end of the Waikiki strip so it wasn't as crowded, beside a beautiful park, and across from the beach. One of the most appreciated features was the ability to pay for 6pm checkout (if available) as our flight wasn't departing until 10pm. This enabled us to enjoy an entire full day at the beach without waiting around somewhere with our luggage and no access to showers.We will absolutely return to this property next time we visit!

They say LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. Well this has the Location and breathtaking Views. Stayed here 2 times and both were great. I loved that they had a Kurig Coffee maker in the room nice touch! Kona coffe in room ( 30% Blend but still tastie)

Great location. Just across the road from beach. Restaurants and shopping very close by. They have free beach towels and free beach chairs. Room had a great view. Loved the double sliding glass doors. Not sure about other rooms but, ours was huge. Had a small fridge, couch, room safe, great TV.Staff were nice and very helpful. Didnt like that they add on $25.00 per day to the price of the room for "amenities". I would stay here again.

Awesome location gorgeous view for ocean front rooms, but hotel seems out of the 90s need urgent total renovation ,totally run down,smelly especially parking &reception,colors of rooms corridors lifts reception is another story.To get from valet parking to room you have to do that in 2 stages 1st.to reception then to floor !!!! over charged as u have to pay room plus resort fee and valet fee which are not cheap also limited humble facilities car come hot as it was parked in the sun 20 plus minutes to get ur car!!! . Music can be heard in the room up to late hours from restaurant at pool area(windows are not sound proof).Hotel has good potential but need more care.

We got 2 ocean view rooms (mom, dad, sister, and me.) The views are spectacular! 180 degrees plus. The beds were comfortable. As other reviews have mentioned, the bathrooms are small and outdated, little tiles not in great shape. But it worked for us.Our biggest complaint was the air conditioners. Both rooms had the same issue. It didn't matter what you set the thermostat to, could be Heat, Cool, whatever temperature. It would just keep cooling. This resulted in us freezing in the middle of the night. So we'd have to turn the A/C totally off. Then we'd be hot a couple hours later. Maintenance came, thought a solenoid needed replacing, but it never improved during out trip. We also thought the thermostats they had are not hotel user friendly. My mom and dad could not figure out how to operate it at all. Also, Waikiki beach is a bit noisy in the middle of the night, and the sliding glass door for the lanai could be better insulated.We enjoyed a couple good meals at the Tiki restaurant/bar below. They have music, and pretty good food. Many choices, including some hawaiian mixed plate and good happy hour bargains. The Wolfgang puck express was convenient, and the cookie shop below has top quality fresh baked cookies. It was nice having both of those on the ground floor. Starbucks just next door opens at 4AM so if your internal time clock gets mixed up, no problem.

This is a surprisingly good hotel, and a good value, but the best value are in the ocean front rooms. They are just across the street from the beach, but if you were on one of the hotels on the sand, for this view, you would likely pay at least double, which makes this hotel a good value. The hotel is a bit dated, the room was very clean, bedding comfortable, everything worked, but you will notice a lot of small things aren't as perfect as a true five star hotel would be. It didn't bother me, as I came for the view. I requested a room on a corner, which offers a little more privacy, as the balconies are rather exposed to other balconies residents looking at you. With a small wait, they were able to fulfill my request at no extra charge. The checkin area of the hotel is in an awkward location, adjacent to the pool, fully exposed to the elements. The staff all around were very friendly and hard working. My hunch is the rooms with ordinary views or no views aren't as good a value as their few ocean front rooms. Be sure to get as high a floor as possible for noise and some trees could block part of your view.

The location of this hotel was the best part, right across from beach and walkable within Waikiki, at the end of the strip, near park & zoo. We had a deluxe king partial ocean view room which they said was a "suite" but I'd just call it a large room with sofabed (very uncomfortable sofabed, by the way....the kids couldn't even handle it, and they're not that picky.) It did have a nice view, about half ocean view. We could sit and watch all the surfers.
