Other pros & cons:Pros - walkable & close to beach & Waikiki activities/food. - at pool - plenty of towels, chairs, shower & a counter with refreshments- you can borrow beach towels & beach chairs! - a/c was powerful and controlled humidity- regular bed was comfortable, nice table in room, desk, plenty of drawers & seating, safe, coffee maker. - you can borrow DVDs & games and play them on the console in the room- housekeeping and maintenance staff were wonderful! Always saying aloha and smiling and did a great job.- Cold lemon iced water near pool/front desk. - Welcome beach bag with fan, sunscreen, and playing cardsCons- Only 1 chair on 2 lanais- No place to hang wet bathing suits & bathtowels!! That's a biggie for me. - Why is bathroom mirror over toilet? I dropped something in the toilet once :(- Front desk staff has no aloha spirit. Especially on checkout - she didn't ask how our stay was nor even say thank you for staying!! Who doesn't say thank you for staying with us upon checkout??- My daughter left her watch in the room and told me where she left it, and I kept thinking she lost it. But the more I think about it, the more I wonder if it was stolen from where she always left it on the desk in the room. Use the safe! - Worst, most uncomfortable sofabed mattress we've ever experienced. - If you're looking for quiet, Waikiki isn't for you. It's just noisy by nature.Overall, pretty good stay. I might choose this hotel again for the location.

We had an Ocean View Select room on the 21 floor. Views were stunning and the room was very comfortable. Room service every day. Very nice clean hotel with great eating options. Swimming pool was good although when in Hawaii and with Waikiki beach literally over the road we didn't use the pool much. Buses arrive and leave from right outside. This hotel is situated at the end of Waikiki beach and is great value for money.

Visited Honolulu,HI from 7/29-8/1/2017 with family. After long flights we finally arrived to our Hotel. Aston Waikiki beach hotel. Hotel is located towards the end of the Waikiki beach next to the Honolulu zoo. however it is right in front of the Waikiki beach. There is some street parking if you can find a spot however Hotel has valet parking for $32/ per day with in out privileges. Check-in was good however When I booked the hotel it said a King bed or double bed. I end up getting a King bed and did not feel like going thru the switch. Hotel room had a partial view of the Waikiki beach and the pool. Request higher level as the lower level rooms can get noise from the pool area. Not sure why hotels don't have microwaves in the room but their is a microwave in the pool area and a small mini mart has one too by the lobby that guest can use. Over all my family had a good stay. There is a Tikki restaurant on site and a wolfgang puck for breakfast lunch and dinner options.

We were excited to finally stay at this hotel on our 5th trip to Hawaii as in the past we found it wasn't within our budget. I had checked reviews prior to booking but when a "bargain" was advertised I jumped at the opportunity. The location is the best thing here at the quieter end of Waikiki opposite the beach. We arrived late from Maui and checked into our room after being "upgraded" to a deluxe room on the 9th floor with a good partial ocean view. The room was on the small but the bathroom was tiny with the toilet so low to the ground it almost felt like you were squatting!A few weeks before travelling I checked rates for curiosity and found may bargain rate was now even cheaper. It was a non refundable rate so I decided to contact the live chat to see if I could change my room type given rates were cheaper ; I typed my query and received a very short response saying contact Reservations. I replied with a thank you and expected a mahalo in response to indicate end of live chat - but nothing - very rude. I did email reservations with my details and the same query and received no response at all; once we'd arrived in Hawaii a computer generated response that my request was received etc finally came through but no one actually responded to me personally. This hotel needs lots of work but simple things like provided additional umbrellas around the pool area won't cast much but provide relief from the sun as well as some palms in pots to break up all the hot hard surfaces. We had to sit near the toilets to get shade, the pool towel guy had 1 of the 6 umbrellas available for himself and guests couldn't get shade when needed! The room furniture is all scratched and chipped, the carpet full of dust around skirting boards but beds were very comfy.The position is not enough to book this hotel for the money.

My niece held her destination wedding at this hotel. She got married in Diamond HeadState Park and had her reception at the Tiki Bar and Grill at the hotel. They did a fabulous job. The food was excellent. We were able to get all of our rooms on the same floor. They were very accommodating. We all had a fabulous time.
user_name:
Sharon J
Maplewood, Minnesota, United States

review_body: Once again,we've booked our summer family get away to Hawaii ( Oahu & Kauai) through Costco travels & it didn't disappoint us _ once again! We picked Aston Waikiki hotel in Oahu because of it's accessibility to the beach, The Honolulu zoo, the Aquarium , the Diamond head luau,abc stores are all within walking distances of the hotel. ( abc stores are everywhere-! It's great as they practically have whatever you need for your daily needs- tuna,chicken,ham, salami & many more . if you don't want to eat @ a sit down restaurant, abc is the store you want to go to .it's very convenient really! there's also many kinds of fast food restaurants like Burger King,McDonalds, Subway, etc nearby the hotel,so if you don't want to eat @ the hotel, you have many options to go to these places &'eat! We didn't spend a lot of time in our room as we were out most of the time. Our Room was on the 24th floor & have a partial beach view, but it surely looks like the full view as we can see the spectacular view of the ocean. When we checked in into our room, the air conditioner wasn't working,so my husband called the front desk if they can send someone to have our A.C. Work as it is hot & humid in this part of town. Someone from the Engineering department by the name of " Tony?" Came & was able to immediately addressed the problem. , Thanks Tony! ....During our stay @ this hotel, I would say that it was comfortable ,descent hotel as our room was always clean & our used towels were replaced with clean ones! I have no complaints. A big shout out to our housekeeper ( Estela ) throughout our stay @ Aston as she made sure that our room was clean all the time. It surely is very important to me & my family to come back to your clean room after a long day of activities. P.S. We like to travel as a family,so I always bring with me a can of Lysol spray. so everytime we checked in into our room , we try to open all the windows & spray the Lysol to all of the doorknobs- specially the bathroom area!

We just got back from our vacation in Oahu. Visited from July 24 to August 3. Stayed at one of the Ocean Select room. These rooms are the best as they directly overlook the ocean and beach. If it's in your budget, splurge for the Ocena front Select room on the higher floors. Well worth it. (we were on 18th)We were a family of 4 (self, wife and 2 kids(17 and 11 yr old))I'm surprised at some of the negative and specific comments of the other reviewers. We certainly did not experience any of those negative things!Our check in was quick and efficient. The bell boy delivered out bags within 5 mins of checking in.Our room was clean and furnished with everything that was advertised. The view was amazing! The hotel is not spanking brand new and maybe not "5 star" , but it certainly is not run down and it is clean and well kept. Never say any bug/insect or anything ever in our room or hotel.We did not experience any bad smells at all (in room or hallways). The Air condition worked well. The hallways and hotel in general was always clean and tidy. The carpets were not worn out. While the 2 beds in the room were not queen size, it was adequate for the 4 of us. and the smaller size beds meant more room to move about in the room.My wife is very picky and did her own "housekeeping" and only asked the maid to change the garbage as needed and give us new sheets and towels. The maid was very friendly and always pleasant, smiling and helpful.We rented a car and the guys at the valet parking were friendly and prompt. never a problem or wait. Generally the stall was friendly and helpful.The small restaurant on the ground floor (wolfgang puck express) was convenient, but not the best for dining since lots of beach foot traffic. But they are not part of the hotel. Great for a quick coffee though, and they don't fuss if you wanted several refills.As for the Tiki Grill and Bar- we found that to be excellent! Food was great, the staff was very good. One manager in particular, KYLE was excellent to us and made each visit even more pleasant.While other guest may have individual negative experiences, we certainly did not see the things they complained of. In face speaking to other guest, we got the impression that they were likewise satisfied.The plus about the hotel is the location! This hotel is located in an amazing and convenient spot. Great for the beach; walking to the waikiki hot spots and driving to the highways.Our family has travelled a lot; staying in several 4 and 5 star all inclusive hotels in the Caribbean etc. We have found that what makes your stay even more enjoyable is having a positive, open attitude and not finding fault with every minute thing. Don't complain because a piece of paint is peeling on a small spot on a door or wall! Relax, you are on vacation.Lastly, we want to give a great big thankss to NATASHA AKEE. We arranged our stay through her. She met us a couple of times during our stay and made sure everything was to out satisfaction. Very personable and friendly service. I'm sure if we had a problem, she and the staff would have done every thing to solve it.Mahalo Aston for a wonderful stay!Karl & Priya and family

I booked our reservation online. It looked beautiful! I called the hotel to verify that I was getting the room and the views that I believed I was paying for. When we arrived, we didn't get what we were told. (Supposed to get an ocean/Diamond Head view and we were on the opposite side of the hotel looking into the hotel across the street and only on the 9th floor.) The dresser looked like it had been in a loosing fight with a dog. The bathroom was less than impressive and looked like my parent's back home. I was in tears so my husband went down to talk to the employees. They did give us a higher room with a view of what they told us we were getting. (Unfortunately it was overlooking the other neighboring hotel and all we could hear was the air-conditioning unit.) The bathroom was still the same, disappointing one as downstairs. There was a room safe, but you had to pay to use it. They had valet parking that we understood to be $32 for the week, but when we checked out it was $32 a day. There was water in the room, but you had to pay for that too. There was a pool and towels, but it was all charged in an amenity fee at the end of the week. We ended up paying a couple hundred dollars more than we had planned.

Hotel is very run-down with damaged paintwork everywhere and cracked tiles in the bathrooms. Our room had a huge gap under the door and as the corridor was exposed to outside (and on 19th Floor) the wind whistled under the door making a noise and creating a draught all night.Air conditioner in room was noisy and seemed to belt out the same amount of cold air no matter what setting was selected. Cleaning of the room was haphazard to say the least. Some days the tissues/toilet rolls and shampoos etc were replaced and some days they wern't. The cleaners didn't seem to do a very good job either.Staff were very matter of fact - not at all friendly or helpful.The Wolfgang Puck quick service restaurant on the ground floor was a disgrace. I realise that it is probably independantly owned and operated, but the food was inedible and the restaurant and staff grubby and the hotel I am sure would not want to be associated with such a disgraceful operation.The Tiki restaurant on floor 3 is almost as bad. The food was pretty poor and the service even worse. They managed to get 1 out of 2 drinks wrong and then served the 2nd in a glass with a bug of some sort floating around in it. The replacement drink was not what I'd ordered at all.Altogether, a very poor experience, which is a shame because the hotel is in a superb location.

We we're only staying in Waikiki for two nights - so i knew we weren't going to be staying in the room long which I'm happy about, as this room was adequate though definitely luxurious.We had purchased our trip package through our travel agent so we weren't aware of whatever room type we were to receive - but we did get a partial ocean view. We had stayed here in 2008 and the rooms were much nicer then (at least the one we stayed in).View - What they gave us was a full ocean view - just on a lower floor so some palm trees were covering the view. Still great to see. The only down side was that we were on the roof level and you could see lots of items discarded from rooms on the roof top. Towels, hats, shirts, trash. Not the greatest view.Check-in - quick and easy. I'm glad that we arrived before 3pm - when we went back down to the lobby after 3pm the line up was about 50 people long.Room - overall, it was adequate. The furniture was a little tired but the bed was comfortable. The more irritating part was that there is a restaurant in the lower levels of the hotel and you could smell it in the room 24/7. It wasn't the best small (though not foul) but very greasy, and a smell that just wouldn't leave. Also the air condition didn't seem to work that well - it was always on but the room didn't seem to cool much.Bathroom - the bathroom was definitely lacking and tired. It definitely needs a refresh - the hand rail had been repaired many times to stay attached to the wall and you should see the patchwork etc.Pool/ocean - we didn't use the pool at all, but the access to the ocean is great. The ocean area in front is walled off so more like a pool, warm, shallow, perfect. We herein the water with in a half hour of checking in!Location - you can't beat the location. Right on Waikiki with quick ocean access, restaurants super close, attractions super close, and car rental locations super close. Everything is walkable.

We really like our family of 4 to stay in the same room while on vacation to other time zones. This way we all go to sleep together and all get up together. Otherwise we run the risk of the kids getting on a different schedule and watching too much TV or playing on their phones too often. Many of the name brand hotels in Waikiki could not offer us a big enough room for the 4 of us (with 3 beds) but the Aston had a very large room and a great price. There were 2 double beds and a pull-out sofa and plenty of space. The housekeeping crew was fantastic providing extra towels and amenities once they saw that there were 4 of us in the room. The location is perfect at the far end of all the hotels - still walking distance from larger hotels and the expensive shops, but far enough away to be more quiet.The hotel is also a short walk from a grocery store, the aquarium and the zoo. While the beach in front of the hotel is not ideal, it is nice enough and you can always walk to any beach that you want as there are no private beaches.The hotel also provides towels and even beach chairs free of charge. The gym rounds out the amenities that are important to me. We even enjoyed the restaurant.In short, why pay more for a name brand hotel when you can get more square feet, a quieter environment and a better price at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.

Run down hotel with bad service and an incessant strong smell of urine throughout the lobby.The location is good, however there are other hotels nearby with a good location as well. The room was run down with a dirty dark carpet. The toilet flushed really loudly and the noise lasted a few minutes. The doors and all the furniture in the room were run down with scratches everywhere. They nickel and dime you... charging you $2 for a misplaced room key, $10 for a mug in your room (if you break it, etc.) etc., etc. etc. Service was not very friendly. The Tiki restaurant is dirty with an incompetent forgetful waitstaff. ugh!

Spent 3 night here before a cruise. Did not like Waikiki much but the hotel was nice with comfortable rooms good check in service and a nice pool all right across the road from the beach.We had a beach view room which ha d a lovely aspect.

After looking forward to our dream vacation for 6 months, we finally made it to Hawaii. Thank god we are only staying in this dump 2 nights. Place is only air conditioned in the rooms. Lobby, hallways etc not. Room is filthy and missing any amenities. I paid over 300 for this place? I've stayed in 50 a night motels that would put this dump to shame.Thank god we are only here 2 nights of our Hawaii stay. Otherwise I would've tried to change hotels. Don't ever stay here!

I went to the room and turned straight around - retuning to check in.I asked what class of room I had paid for- I was told Deluxe.The room was 1970s Décor , cleaned sometime in the last month and anything and everything apart from Deluxe.To the Hotels credit they fully refunded me.I booked through a 3rd party and I would advise anyone looking for a luxurious break that (as far as the room I was given) this is not available at the Aston Waikiki Beach.It cost me another £2500.00 to find another hotel for 7 nights due to lack of availability.DO YOUR RESEARCH....I WILL NEXT TIME.

We booked our room at the Aston. A good value considering the Waikiki Beach hotel rates. Check-in was easy. There was rather a long line to wait in before you got to the front desk and their 3 desk personnel. Maybe a couple more should be added. Waited 30 minutes for check-in. Got the room keys, electronic cards, and went up to the room. It was clean, spacious, with a balcony, and an excellent view of Waikiki Beach. The rooms are equipped with a coffee maker and mini fridge. There is a safe in the closet and iron and ironing board. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. If you were going to the beach, get there early. You can sign out beach chairs and towels by the pool. There is also a snack bar and a microwave to use to reheat your food. The hotel was a good value and the staff was very good. The only problem we had was the room keys needed to be redone almost every day.

We stayed at the Aston in late July 2017 for one week. Our experience was absolutely wonderful. The location of the hotel is at the far Diamondhead (east) side of Waikiki which is my favorite part. We had a very nice ocean view room on the 25th floor looking right at Diamondhead along with a very good view of the ocean, probably about 60 degrees of ocean view...plenty. Nice little lanai with a breathtaking view. From the time we pulled up to the hotel with our luggage to the time we checked out, the entire staff was 100% professional and accommodating. We were able to check in about noon which was much appreciated after a long flight; our bags arrived at our room 5 minutes later. The maids were so nice and kept our very nice room extremely clean and well-stocked. We checked out nice beach towels and chairs several times and it is simple and convenient. The elevators are great and secure although it took us a couple of times to learn the simple but secure process using our room cards. The safe in the room was great. There's lots of aloha at the Aston. I would have to give it at least a 9.5 out of 10. A special shout out to Natasha for taking such good care of us!

This hotel, and Oahu in general, suffered from our having been to Maui first. Everything here was very good. We got upgraded at check-in (after having told them on our reservation that it was our anniversary) and the room had a partial ocean view. The activities desk helped us put together a last-minute excursion to Sea Life Park. Unfortunately, the pool was only open until 9:00 and evenings would often find people giving their kids swimming lessons in the pool. I'm all in favor of kids learning how to swim but in a hotel pool with other guests isn't appropriate. The hotel had rules for the pool (no jumping or diving) but they were enforced like a UN resolution ("stop or we'll tell you to stop again").None of this is really the hotel's fault, it's actually mine for expecting that people in 2017 would recognize that other people exist and act accordingly. If we'd gone to Oahu first, I'd have found little to complain about but, because we were on Maui first, much of Oahu suffered in comparison.If you want to be in Waikiki, this is a great place to stay.

We just stayed at this hotel for three nights. The location can't be beat. Their service can't be beat! We enjoyed the swim bag with sunscreen gift when we arrived, and the staff gave us a picture frame as we were celebrating our anniversary. Tiki's restaurant (on site) was also great. We would recommend this hotel to any couple wanting to stay at a fun place for a reasonable price.

ASTON Waikiki is not marketing itself as upmarket. It marketed perfectly, as what it really is, a famous old beach hotel in one of the best locations in Waikiki. I found it overall clean, good housekeeping & they are working hard from my observations.If you are dissatisfied with room cleanliness upon arrival all you would have to do is let the friendly staff know and it would be fixed pretty quickly ! So don't ruin you holiday with complaints or a demeanour of dissatisfaction, be proactive and just "Say something" but be friendly will be the best approach.The pool deck area was well appointed and many guests enjoying themselves. Tiki bar and grill is big was lively and busy, right by the pool... Down on ground level is another eatery well priced, Wolfgangpuck express Delicious breakfast pizza and pasta.The free Aston gift bag was filled with sensible items I needed. Quality sunscreen after sun moisturizer lip balm in a reusable bag perfect for picking up some groceries. This was well thought out & saved me 30 or more USD.The lift card swipe allocating system kept things moving. Front desk is swift with super friendly staff. I had the pleasure of negotiating with Sean (Who quickly solved a lack of planning on my part) & Stephen excellent competent.Room amenities were good. Coffee maker with pods, a PlayStation 3 for games and DVDs, Excellent WIFI Throughout, & a decent fitness centre ! The beauty of ASTON is it can be your beachside home, you can leave all your stuff and valuables in the room and put on your swimwear, grab a towel, walkout cross over the road and get straight into the Ocean & make a quick retreat when you've had enough sun.Remember you have the power to have a great time ! or the Alternatives ! I always have a great time and Aston was a excellent facilitator. It is the no.1 location at the diamond head end of Waikiki... Beach front.Good luck with the upcoming renovation !

We stayed here for 5 nights in July 2017. We stayed on the 15th floor with a partial ocean view room. It may a small well have been full ocean view as we had a beautiful view of Waikiki beach. Check I now took longer than usual but worth it a short the room was spectacular. I enjoyed my morning coffee on the balcony every morning before most of Waikiki woke up. The Keurig machine worked great and it was replenished daily like clockwork for us. Even when I only use Sec new sugar from the packet, the room attendant added another packet so I wouldn't run out. What really stood out is in the day we checked out, although they didn't clean our room, they restocked our coffee whichever was much appreciated. Not knowing they would come in, I had my electronics laying out, an envelope with a significant amount of cash laying out. Nothing was touched! I am truly amazed by the professionalism and friendliness of the staff Fromm the check in staff, to the wonderful pool attendants, to the room attendants, to the valet Parkers. There was one security guard who patrolled the pool constantly who was a bit of a stickler and didn't allow jumping onto the pool, I read the rules posted by the pool and had my kids (5,7 years old read them). However nowhere did it state no jumping in the pool. As you can imagine, it's quite difficult to explain to young children why this isn't allowed. What is even harder is that newcomers to the pool would inevitably jump in, prompting my kids to ask why those people (adults and kids both) were allowed to do so. From my days lounging by the pool, this one guard was the only one who reinforced that "rule", no one else did. So if he wasn't around, the no jumping "rule" was never reinforced which to a 5 and 7 year old is unexplainable. There were written rules of no outside food allowed which wasn't reinforced, no floats in the pool was half reinforced as some kids had arm floating which were allowed but larger donut floats were not. All in all, no big deal except for that one security guard who's name I could never seem to catch. If you are asking why We spent so much time at the pool, it's because during two days, Waikiki beach has jellyfish and my kids go to stung and refused to go back for a few days.The beds were comfortable and the elevator system was smart and you have to use your room key card to Push your floor number before a specific elevator was assigned to you. This helped min crowding in the elevators and helped them run faster. This hotel is located toward the end of Waikiki beach whichever isn't a big deal since the entire strip is so walkable. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Wonderful hotel and we would definitely return.

Room was average, pretty noisy from the hotel bar (the set included a lot of the same songs 2 nights in a row!) and the air con smelled like chlorine. Floatation devices were not allowed in the pool so all of the kids who didn't have life jackets stayed in the same 3m square area in the shallow end. Ridic. We also felt that they tried to con us a bit by offering us an upgrade when we checked in, then saying the upgraded room was an extra $45 per night for the roll away bed for our daughter. I said no way and they upgraded us anyway saying they'd get someone to put a bed in there for free. When we went straight to the room it already had the roll away bed in it. Room was clean but tired, fridge was not at all cold, coffee awful don't bother with it. I wouldn't stay here again.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 10 nights on the 15th floor in an Oceanfront Select Room. The check in process was fairly painless and took approximately 30 minutes (we arrived roughly around 5pm). When we checked into the room, the first thing we noticed was obviously the beautiful view. It was absolutely gorgeous!! Upon first walkthrough, we did find an empty wine bottle behind the curtains. We also thought the bathroom was dirty/dingy, but after a closer look, it just appeared that way because the tiles were stained and a few were cracked; it was actually clean. The commode did leak water from around the base slightly, which was unfortunate. The shower head, when pushed as high as it would go, still was only high enough for a 5'7" person or shorter to comfortably take a shower. I was crouching down to wash my hair and am 5'9". There was one night when the hallway lights quit working completely on our floor, but after calling the front desk, they were back on by the next morning.The room and bathroom walls did have several coats of paint on it, without the previous coats being removed and was very obviously noticeable. There was minimal rust on the metal fixtures in the bathroom.We also had an issue where another guest who was staying one floor down and one room over was smoking weed on his lanai. We went inside our room from the lanai and shut our lanai door because we didn't care for the smell, and realized the door did not seal and we could quite distinctly smell the odor. We had previously recognized this to a degree because you can hear street traffic and people with the door shut at night. The valet services were generally okay and our vehicle would be brought up within 10-15 minutes of calling. However, on three occasions we called the valet station with no answer (common problem it seemed when calling anywhere except the hotel operator). There was one instance where we did call down and requested our vehicle be brought up, we came down twenty minutes later and the vehicle had not been brought up. We waited an additional 10-15 minutes before our vehicle was brought up. There was one older gentlemen who worked the valet station (later morning/early afternoon), who was particularly grumpy and unfriendly but he seemed to be an isolated case.All in all, the staff was friendly. The housekeeping staff was especially friendly and courteous; they greeted us every time they saw us or passed by us, and also kept the room very clean. The mattress in the room was exceptionally comfortable and we slept like babies most nights.We did have several packages shipped to the hotel during our stay (flowers x2, a gift basket, chocolates, etc) and they all were waiting at the front desk for us and a message left on our phone to come pick them up. We also were not sure what snacks and drinks in the room we could eat and drink, and what we would be charged for.The hotel overall is an average three star hotel; nothing glamorous or overwhelming about it. Its redeeming qualities are its location and views. It is debatable on whether it was worth what we paid for it, but bed was super comfortable and let's be honest... who is in their room that much in Hawaii. We certainly were not.

My family and I stayed there July 16- 21, 2017. The room was dirty, bathroom was discusting!!! The tub was dirty, like it wasn't cleaned after other guests! The toilet had hair on it, an a moldy dirt ring in it! The sink was nasty!!! It was clogged up with hair. Maintenance had to come unclog it 10 mins after checking in. When he was done he left it brown, dirty, an long hair all over!!!! You could see the bathroom floor had NOT been cleaned. Even the white rug had black shoe prints on it. The room itself wasn't vacuumed, sand all over, n paper pieces all over. And who wants to sleep in a bed with hair on the pillows and in the bed???? DISCUSTING!!! Housekeeping needs to do a better job!!! Absolutely don't ask for towels, you will get an unfriendly drop off!!! The rudest people I have ever encountered at a hotel!!! Unfriendly, inhospitable staff!!! I will not recommend this hotel to anyone!! My family of 4 stayed there, an my aunt n uncle also. They were treated the same way. Other guests we met staying there said a lot of the same to us!! We are coming back to Hawaii next year, and we definitely will not be staying at Aston waikiki Beach Hotel!!!!!!!!

We stayed here on our first visit to Hawaii. Location is perfect and I got a great deal for our room with the view of the ocean. They also have free movie rentals for their guests which is perfect since at the end of the day the kids just want to relax and watch a movie. If you're considering Aston make sure you check their special deals. Sometimes they have great deals which includes car rental with your stay.

Stayed here Sept. 2016. We were on the 20th floor. Loved the little lenai and I used it daily. Everyone was nice and helpful. As soon as we arrived, we found the A/C to not be working. Called the front desk, a gentlemen came immediately and fixed it in ten minutes. I liked that it was in the hub of Wakiki Beach. It was probably not the most exclusive hotel, but I would definitely stay here, again.

My wife and I stayed here for four days (July 4-8) before our cruise. The customer service is outstanding. The bed was comfortable and the view was outstanding. I like how the elevators work using the room key card.My complaints (minor ones really) is that there is no armchair in the room.There is no breakfast offered, but there is a nearby Burger King. I also think that the hotel is in need of renovations.We were not impressed with the Wolfgang Puck Express.

The hotel is old. The food at the restaurant is terrible. We enjoyed the view after we complained for not getting what we paid for. The people are kind it's just there must be so many tourists that no time to renovate. We assume.

My son and his fiancé were supposed to visit this hotel on July 23rd for a five night stay. When he made the reservation, it was a non-refundable one, so no chance of getting his money back if he needed to cancel. Unfortunately, my son got injured at work and will not be able to fly for a while. He called the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, spoke to a very nice front desk manager, and they refunded the entire cost of the hotel within the next day after he called. For that alone, I give this hotel a 5 Star review, and the entire family will be visiting this lovely hotel early next year. Thank you!!

This property is in need of renovation. The room was small and we had to return towels because of mold like substance. Staff was pleasant and helpful. I would not stay at this property on future trips to Waikiki.

Although not right on the beach, access is very easy. Ocean view rooms were great. Staff very friendly. Had a slight problem w air conditioning but only took management about 10 mins to fix it and were very friendly in doing so.

First of all the staff at this hotel was not as nice as others we met while in Ohau. The "youngsters" seemed bent out of shape that two "older folks" were interrupting their talk time by asking questions. Second, no one answered the phone at this hotel. If you needed anything you had to go to the desk. The maid service was good, but the hotel itself just seemed dirty. It needs a makeover. I was surprised at the number of homeless just lying around on the sidewalks up and down the street. I was not impressed with the bar.

We stayed here 1 night before our cruise. It looks like a bit of an older hotel from the outside but still very nice. Right on the beach (across the street), several goodies (free beach chair and towel rental), and some of the best elevator security I've ever seen. Beautiful view from our room of both the beach and of diamond head. Great staff, nice beds, big room. Overall very well done and great location.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki for the first time in 2015 and were not disappointed. We had a partial ocean view room above the pool, and it was a pleasant treat to wake up to the amazing view every morning. At that time, the free bagged breakfast was still offered, and it definitely helped, as we could grab and go straight to the beach across the street! The rooms are a bit small, as we are traveling with our 2 kids, but it didn't feel too cramped. An update couldn't hurt, but the room was clean, and thats what is most important.We are returning for a second time in Oct this year, to celebrate me and my husband's 20th anniversary! We couldn't be more excited. We will have our 2 kids with us again, who are much bigger than the last time we were here. So hopefully it won't feel more cramped lol. We booked the deluxe partial ocean view. Was considering booking an ocean view suite to accommodate our growing family, but wanted to budget and allocate some money towards fun activities this time around. Maybe next time!  Looking forward to the views of the ocean and beach and the friendly staff at this hotel. Will definitely update my review after our next stay, but am sure we will not be disappointed!

This was part of a package, so I was expecting the worst. Actually, the hotel was pretty nice and as close to the beach as you can get (albeit at the east end of Waikiki Beach). Hotel service and staff were friendly and professional. Rooms were adequate and as described on the site. In all, very pleased we stayed there.

I received a letter in the mail today from the hotel about a data breach. They had an incident involving unauthorized access to customer information associated with my reservation, which allowed access to my name, card number, card expiration date and potentially card security code. The letter stated that I should be vigilant for incidents of fraud and identity theft by regularly reviewing and monitoring my accounts. I called the hotel to get further information and to see if they were providing identity theft protection. Their answer was "they are not proving any credit monitoring services at this time." I can't believe they are not going to do anything about the problem they created. Now I have to spend time, energy, and money on a problem they created. It really left a bad taste in my mouth and I am not looking forward to staying there. The only reason I booked with them is because I received a free night with my cruise, so I decided to book an extra night on my own to have 2 days before my cruise. I feel victimized and helpless and decided to warn others not to book with this hotel because they don't care about their guest or keeping their information safe!!!!

Hotel was difficult to get to because of one-way streets. A bit out dated, but GREAT location! Close to shopping, zoo, beach and Diamond Head. Because we were able to walk to Diamond Head trail head, we avoided what looked like nightmare parking there. Cross the street and you are immediately on a beautiful beach. Wish they had a late checkout to allow some time to enjoy the beach.

Location is GREAT...across from Beach that you cant walk all the way out to wall (depending on tide).We got upgraded to an Ocean Front room.... The view was AMAZING! ( But right above restaurant/bar that had band playing till around 11pm...good music though)The room was just ok, clean, small bathroom, staff friendly.

Located in a great location right next to Waikiki Beach, the zoo, aquarium and many bars and restaurants. Getting around from here by bus was easy. The room and service was good and it was an overall good experience. We used the Tiki Bar & Grill located on site which was also decent. I would recommend staying here and would do so again

The hotel is right across the street from the world famous Waikiki Beach. The rooms and common areas are modern. The service was great; the staff was helpful. They greeted us with cool drinks. The hotel has is quite secure; the elevators require your room key and take you directly to your floor. The hotel had an arrangement with NCL so they picked up our luggage and transported it to the ship for us. They also had cruise ship personnel at the check in desk to coordinate.

We chose to stay at this hotel from other friends that have stayed here.The only negative was the room/bathroom they were both really small.They do offer pool/beach towels and beach chairs to use which was nice.Location was within walking distant to restraunts and shopping.

This is the third time I've stayed at this hotel and was a bit disappointed this last time. The rooms were dating specially the bathroom. Had to call housekeeping to change my bed sheets after checking into the room since the sheets had stains. Resort in valet fees and had also gone up. My keycard also didn't work so had to get it rekeyed. They no longer offer breakfast either.

Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms very dated especially the bathroom however comfortable and clean. Lose towel rail in bathroom could not be fixed by maintenance. Great location, across from the beach and close to shops and restaurants. Parking very expensive, although all hotels seem to charge.

Stayed with friends in this perfectly located hotel. Directly across the road from the beach. Room was comfortable with spectacular view of Diamond head and ocean. Bathroom small but adequate. Nice pool and towels provided for pool and beach. Very clean hotel with great friendly service. Walking distance to shops and restaurants but also have on site a restaurant and bar. Happy hour very enjoyable ! Live music when we stayed as well. Public transport at the front door which conveniently took us to outlet shopping !!

Perfect location in the middle of all the action on Waikiki. Booked 2 rooms for a family of 5 for 3 nights. Decent prices for Waikiki. Rooms were small and a little dated but all you need a room for is to sleep and shower. Nice little balcony to view the sunset and enjoy a morning coffee.Steps from the most famous beech in the world, what else do you need?Staff were super friendly and helpful, fee beach chair and towel rental. Pool is a great place to dip in before or after the beach. Check in will take you a bit as well as getting your car from the valet parking, so plan accordingly and relax, you're in Hawaii!

We stayed at this hotel from June 19-26, 2017 and had a wonderful experience. We arrived earlier than check-in, but the front desk was very accommodating and allowed for early check-in. After getting settled in, I was dissatisfied with our location in the hotel and went down to speak with one of the employees (Kalahua?) She was extremely nice and relocated us to a suite that was a better fit for my expectations. The property was always clean and all of the employees, including the Expedia booth workers were helpful and informative. The hotel is aged and could probably use some updates, as the other reviews have indicated but I didn't notice any specific eyesores and everything was operable. There are many eateries and shops nearby, and it is relatively close to the airport! I would stay here again.

I had heard from a few people about how great this hotel was, but never sure until I stay there. The hospitality and warmth of the hotel staff is really what makes it a wonderful place to stay. The location is fabulous, right across from Waikiki beach at at the end so it's less noisy. They provide towels for the beach and pool, which is one less thing to think about. The room was comfortable and airy. The beach view rooms are unbelievable and worth the stay in itself. The rooms are a bit dated, but so is the whole of the city so don't let that detract from booking here. I was sad to leave here and look forward to my next stay here when next in Honolulu.

As far as location goes, there are not many better than this. You are pretty much at the mid point of Waikiki Beach. The hotel itself is a bit older, and rooms are small. The bathrooms are also small, but again this is to be expected along Waikiki. We had an ocean view room; which faced in the opposite direction from Diamond Head, but the view was still spectacular. The hotel is right across the street from the beach, and within easy walking distance from shops and restaurants. Public transportation is easy to access right outside the hotel.While we were here, we did notice a water leak from air conditioner access panel in the ceiling of our room. It turned out to be a blocked drain line from the airconditioner, but hotel maintenance was quick to fix the problem. Overall the staff was friendly and quick to help.

We moved to this hotel after spending five days elsewhere. So happy to have asked for an Ocean View room, it was perfect. Overlooking the glorious Waikiki Beach we had 180 degree ocean views. The room was clean and the King bed comfortable. We could hear street noise and the band from the restaurant and bar below, when on the balcony, but silence when in the room. The staff were friendly. The pool area was large and always easy to find a deck chair. There is a little kiosk on the pool deck, but occasionally the hostess brought around free shaved ice drinks, which was a lovely touch. You will pay $25 per day, but this covers many things including DVDs, PlayStation and coffee machine in the room, plus more. You will pay this fee at most hotels and get less so we were very happy. The Waikiki Trolley is right outside the door as is the many ABC food stores and there are Tourist desks in the foyer. Also a gym. The staff arranged airport transfers for us for $12 pp. It was a perfect stay for us.
user_name:
Kaylene M
Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

review_body: Located right on the waikiki strip and directly across from the waikiki beach! I highly recommend if you stay here to get the oceanview or oceanfront the view is absolutely breath taking, and if possible request for a higher level for a better view! The rooms were overall nice does need a bit of TLC but it isnt anything major. They have a nice deck bar that we like to go to during the evening to have a couple of drinks and watch the sunset. It does get tricky though because the area is right on the main shopping area the traffic is tough to get around. But it is a short distance walk to the shopping area. And not too far from diamond head.

Overall a very good hotel.Location is excellent, good end of Waikiki beach (south) with plenty of food, drink and recreation options right at your doorstep. Nice walk up the road will cover all shopping needs.The rooms are good - views of Waikiki are amazing at any time of day. Worth getting an ocean view (levels 8 and up). Very clean, good service, maybe a bit tired and could be renovated in the near future but definitely OK. Coffee machine, Playstation included. There is an additional daily room service charge (direct from the hotel if booked elsewhere) which covers beach towels/chairs, good selection of dvds, local phone calls, newspapers and a great beach bag pack with sunscreen etc. Fair enough, many other hotels include these for free, but do the math on the room prices.Had a very pleasant stay - staff and facilities were fantastic,

We stayed here for 8 days as we wanted to travel somewhere special for my 50th birthday. I had read some of the reviews before we went so I had an idea of what to expect. Check in only took about 20 minutes so not too bad for us and the staff were friendly and helpful. We had a partial sea view room 1002. The room overall was fine but as others have said could do with being updated a bit, the cleaners keep things as clean as they can and were very friendly and efficient. They can only do so much though and the bathroom could definitely do with being updated. Saying that we had a good time and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The location made it easy to get to the beach and to restaurants and bars. If I was to go to Hawaii again I would probably pay a bit more and stay in one of the newer hotels.

This was my 2nd time staying at this location. First time was with family during our family vacation and second time was for business. Here's what I think...- Although very courteous, valet could've offered assistance with my luggage. I was traveling alone with luggage for the week.- Next to a sewer so smell can be intense at times.- Check-in line was long and on the 3rd floor...seems they could've/should've had enough staff to accommodate all the guests that they knew were coming in for the day. - obviously, its hot in Hawaii so waiting in line outdoors to check-in, after a long flight, is quite exhausting. - The front desk staff were all very friendly. Stella helped and once I got to her, check-in was a breeze. - got to my room and it was a bit stuffy. I made sure the AC was on and it took a while to feel comfortable but it was fine in the end...- Albeit this facility is located right on Kalakaua, each front, I wouldn't stay there again for business but it would be great for someone vacationing with family for the first time. - Bathroom had a tub and toilet; outdated but useful. - I didn't find my room had enough plugs for all my computer cords, etc.- I found it a challenge to iron my clothes without a nearby plug.- They no longer serve breakfast in the AM. They supply you with a reusable welcome bag with sunblock, lip balm and playing cards. - Great sunsets if you have a room with a partial or full ocean view. I caught some great pictures! Bottom line: Since I had to stay in my room longer than I would've liked to tend to business, the lackluster room was closing in on me. Outdated rooms are ok if you're just sleeping and using the bathroom but not ok for a work trip when you're prepping for meetings, etc. The staff there are all wonderful I'd say and they do give off that Aloha vibe. Just comparing differences to what I'm use to, I suppose. Great bang for your buck, though. Mahalo, Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, but I won't be back.

The great location was across the road from the sheltered Waikiki beach with fantastic views but that's the end of the pros. The room was small, dated and shabby. The bathroom was tiny - only one person could be in there. The bed was comfortable enough but holes in linen at one time. ( Please note - Paid premium room rate with booking through Flight Centre Brisbane. Lesson learnt.)

This seems like it used to be a much nicer hotel. It seems like it was generally well maintained, but things were just a bit off. Our AC was weak and actually quit working twice. Our coffee maker also had to be swapped out.The staff is VERY willing to help. From check in to check out they were always friendly and did what they could to try to make things as right as they could.We had trouble accessing the wifi from my tablet and my wife's phone, but the staff was able to get us connected. From there it was strong and available throughout the hotel the whole visit.They have a well staff concierge's desk to help arrange for "excursions" or just answer simple questions like what is the best bus to take to Pearl Harbor (#42, but it takes about an hour each direction.) or where can you get a decent hamburger close by (Teddy's Bigger Burgers is right around the corner)The location is excellent for beach access, but you have a bit of a walk to get to most of the restaurants and shops.

My husband and I stayed here 16 years ago when we were dating and after trying 3 other higher end hotel we returned here for 4 nights..We booked through the hotel's own website and had an ocean view room on the 21st floor with a super comfortable King size bed,They have several special rates ad I hear they treat you better than if you book through a travel site. They treated us pretty good.They have nice products in the rooms, shampoo, conditioner soap and body wash and will bring more on request, same with the Kerig Coffee.Newspapers by the elevators every morning, Anything I asked for extra was delivered quickly with a smile. There is a pretty good and relatively inexpensive restaurant by the pool that is not part of the hotel. It is a popular hangout with locals as well.( I say relative because if you want good food at a low price, Honolulu should not be a destination, try Missouri)The pool is nice, clean and usually not crowed with ample lounge chairs and urembrellas for shade. There are beach towels available at times but my experience is they were usually out of them and passing out bath towels. Not a big problem but could be easily remedied. It is across the street from the beach park with the sea wall;we used the beach several other places. Waikiki is not the best or cleanest beach on Oahu but there is lots of fun stuff to do and eat here, it is steps from the street and you can rent surf boards and boggy boards by the hour.The beach is public and the more expensive hotels are on the beaches with waves, you can use the beach anywhere you want. The Aston location is at the Diamond Head end, so not as crazy as some others and the price is about half of what we paid for beach front elsewhere, If you have not been to Hawaii before be advised that the room charge is where it starts, added is Amenity fees, resort fees, parking, tax and that's the price of rice in China.All things considered this is a very good value for the area. It is not new, but it is clean, comfortable, no smoking anywhere (yay!) and I am sure we will stay here again.

We stayed here for 9 days. Location is excellent for families due to the seawall beach, and close proximity to a number of eateries like Jamba Juice, Subway and Wolfgang puck express. While some of the room decor is a little dated, you have in room wifi, large screen tv etc.Ocean view rooms have a great view

My husband and son and I very much enjoyed our night there, which was included as a pre-cruise night with Norwegian's Pride of America cruise package. We stayed in a beautiful suite with two very large windows overlooking Waikiki Beach. Take time to swim in the pool and take a walk along the beach. The Aston is also within short walking distance of restaurants, the zoo, and other attractions. Also, you are always near an ABC store where you can buy souvenirs at a reasonable price.

I wouldn't stay here again. It took a full 30 minutes to check in with a reservation. I was told my credit card was declined, but when I called the card company, the hotel never submitted the charge. We had reserved a partial ocean view room, but we weren't even put on the ocean side. The valet gave us an identical looking car that wasn't ours. The temperature in the room was sweltering, and the beds were very small.

This was my 5th time staying here and it did not disappoint. Has it changed since my first stay in 2006, most definitely, but it's still a great place. Hotels in Waikiki nowadays mostly all charge a 'resort fee' which adds to the overall cost (charged upon departure) and they don't do the breakfast like they used to years ago. Positives: rooms look the same (still nice furniture and decor, bathrooms are a little small), partial ocean views still have a decent view of the ocean. Amenities are Hawaiian Tropic and they also gave us a cooler bag of great Coola samples. We only stayed one night this time, but would definitely return again. Can't beat the location and the value is pretty good considering the rising costs for rooms in Honolulu. Bonus: they film a lot of Hawaii Five-0 here, so you'll definitely recognize some of the decor if you're a fan!

The hotel is located across the street from the beach on the quieter side of Waikiki. The rooms are very dated - think peeling wallpaper and bathroom that will never look clean. All that could be tolerated because of the relatively low nightly rate were it not for the staff's seeming training to avoid helping a guest at all costs. The valet locked the keys in my car; told me I did it (it happened 30 minutes after I arrived that day); said they couldn't call anyone and that I had to call the rental company; I got charged nearly $90. Then, I speak to the valet manager who said he would write the hotel manager to see if the amount could be deducted from my bill and he would get back to me - I hear nothing. Then, I go to the Front Desk the next day and am told the manager would be notified - I hear nothing. I check out, with no deduction on the bill, and am told the manager would be notified and will get back with me - I hear nothing. I complete the survey emailed to me with the details of the issue - I hear nothing. I called yesterday, encountered a most grumpy and unhelpful employee who will guess what... Yes! He'll notify the manager and get back to me. I know you are in suspense to find out what happed next... Yep, I hear nothing. I'll never be back :(

We really enjoyed the stay here and had a wonderful time. I have lived in Hawaii and knew some things about the best places. The room was a little small but you live outside in Hawaii. There is a resort fee that you do not know coming in and parking is terrible. We paid for the valet parking and although expensive, was not significantly more than paying for the week in a garage that was not close. The location is what makes this place work.

We arrived post long distance flight at approx 0900 in the morning . We understood our room was not likely to be ready , however checked just in case . We were offered another room that was ready now , rather than at 1500 hours , but were required to pay an extra $50 per day , which we declined .The room while appearing somewhat dated was clean and comfortable , the bathroom definitely could do with some updates, however was still clean .Staff are fantastic, the best resource the place has , attentive enthusiastic and friendly .We called room service a few times,- once when the toilet flooded at 2300 at night . It was handled within minutes and sorted out . We also asked staff for coffee pods and electric kettle which were always brought to our room promptly .Great position on the beach ,great view, capacity to borrow towels for the pool or beach ,close to public transport which could take us to Pearl Harbour, Hanumea Bay ,and Ala mona shops ,Walking distance to shops and restaurants - We felt safe in our rooms and in the general area . We would definitely stay again

This resort is across the street from the beach in the heart of Waikiki. Rooms were clean and on the smaller side. But I had a great view of the beach and I was only in the room to sleep. The pool and tiki bar restaurant overlooked the beach and was a lot of fun for any age. Tiki bar and restaurant offered great happy hour specials on food, cocktails, and beer (a few little cal beers on tap). A Wolfgang Pucks Express located on the ground floor that offered great breakfast selection at reasonable prices. And of course there was dinner, luau, and sightseeing packages sold on site. All in all a great experience.

This hotel was clean, spacious and right at the end of Waikiki. Upon check in we received a tote bag with a bag of organic suntan lotion. I'm very particular about what I put on my skin for health reasons and was shocked that a hotel would give away such a great bag. From there I was excited to stay! Beautiful views of the beach and in walking distance of fun shops and restaurants. Would definitely stay again.

First of all, the walls are thin. My first night I could hear the tvs of all the surrounding neighbors. I could hear the neighbors sneezes! And I could hear their full conversations. That following morning after waking up and of course had moved the bedsheets around from sleeping in the bed, I had noticed pubic hair, big hairs, small hairs all over the under linen. I had called for new linen as I was completely disgusted. The housekeeper person literally hung up on me . Also, I found chip crumbs underneath the sofa pull out. On My second night there a noise complaint was called on my room. And it wasn't even me. Security came knocking on my door and had the nerve to say that it was coming from my room. On my fourth night, I had another noise complaint called on me. Yes, I had two friends and my gf with me in the room but we were not being loud. We were talking with normal voices. We were asked to go down to the lobby because of this noise complaint. When my gf went down to speak to the "manager" he said that we were receiving a noise complaint. And when my gf mentioned to Melton that we too could hear our neighbors, he got upset. My gf also decided at this time to mention again about the filthy pube-filled bed linens and roaches that they had crawling. As she said this, melton the manager told her to keep her voice down because there were people in the lobby. Literally, when he said that a roach came out and my gf pointed at it and said look I'm not lying there is a roach right there! When she said this he said that he was kicking us out of the hotel. We were literally kicked out of Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. This is the most unjust management and hotel I have ever been to in my entire life.

This hotel has an amazing view. The staff try really hard to keep it clean but our room was certainly run down with wood peeling off doors and towel racks so rusted they were coming off the wall. They need a major renovation. Also the bathroom was very dated. That said we barely spent time inside except asleep and the beds were very comfortable. It is probably good value for money due to the excellent location and view.

Room overlooking the beach was great, clean and neat. Staff very friendly and helpful. Easy walk to shops and restaurants. Nice to walk down along the beach in the evening watching people swimming, surfing and admiring the sunsets.

We thoroughly enjoyed both occasions we stayed at this hotel during our recent trip to Hawaii. We had a three night stay at the beginning of our break and then ended with a 2 night stay before we flew. We enjoyed the location at the more southern end of the beach and loved the Tiki Bar and Grill. Their Happy Hours are great value and their Surf Maitai's are a favourite.The hotel was clean and tidy. The staff were happy to assist and the views of Waikiki Beach were fantastic from the side of the hotel we stayed on. Thoroughly recommend this place and would stay there again.

I looked long and hard before choosing this hotel. And I am glad that I stayed there. The staff is excellent. They are quick to respond to issues and they have good follow through. I found them to be kind and professional. The hotel itself is a mix of very updated and trying to get there. Even though my room was not perfect (cracked tiles along the baseboards, a mix-mash of decor)I loved it! I had a fabulous view (Ocean View Select) and I spent quite a bit of time enjoying it. The air conditioning worked great and I loved the Hawaiian Tropic bath products. I found the food in the Tiki Bar to be just ok. The pool was quite cold and had a very loose bar for climbing up/down the stairs into the water--very dangerous. There was an awesome beach product bag that I loved and the location couldn't be beat. I truly was sad to leave and hope to return again in the future. Thanks for a great stay!

We really liked this Hotel,the room was big & very clean. We got a welcome bag with lots of Sun smart goodies in it.It had a fridge great hot water & a wonderful view. The location is great its right across the road form the beach ,its walking distance from the shops, eateries ,Zoo & a laundry mat.There is a resturant upstairs & downstairs, also 4 tour desks which are manned for your convenience most of the time.

Overall happy with the hotel, it was clean and across from the beach. Our room was right next to the elevators room 1608. We were kept awake most of the night with the lifts going up and down. We stayed 3 nights if we ever stayed there again I would request a room well away from the lifts. The bar on level one is good and the bar staff great the entertainment excellent. The location is really good you can get transport outside the hotel or walk to the shops, zoo or the market.

Had a problem with our booking at check in which should not have occurred (both hotel and travel company guilty of communication problems?!). Once this was sorted found this hotel to have all we needed for our family holiday.Location was good just across from Kuhio Beach and its protected swimming areas with all shopping and main attractions still easily accessed. Rooms were decent size, clean and as per the photos. We had deluxe Ocean View rooms on higher floors so view of ocean and surrounding area was good.

This hotel is right on Waikiki Beach at a great location. It is close to great amenities, including a small store with very reasonable prices. The hotel also has good eating eating places in the hotel (Wolfgang Puck's Express, Tiki Grill) and around the hotel area. We stayed for 9 days and had a great stay. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. Will stay at this hotel again.

I had a room with a partial view of the ocean - but actually hard to see the ocean form that room!! If I were to go again, I would get a full view room. It is an older hotel, but nice enough. I really liked its location to the beach and shops - easy to get around. Very nice bar and restaurant as well.

This great hotel has so many things going for it, it is easy to overlook the outdated rooms. I'm not saying the rooms were bad; the room we stayed in was clean and had a fridge, just a little worn. We stayed in an ocean front room, and when we opened the door, it took our breath away!! Very close to Waikiki Beach, just across the street!!Hotel was in a great location, and though we stayed in an oceanfront room, I was never bothered by the sound of traffic. In fact, I think I spent more time out on the Lanai people watching and enjoying the view.Our flight got us into Honolulu in the morning, and our room was not ready yet. However, the hotel kept our luggage for us, as we went out and explored Waikiki. Most all of the tours stop right in front of the hotel. We ended up going to Pearl Harbor on the Waikiki Trollley. There seemed to be a lot of people staying at this hotel, so staff was busy all the time. We didn't have much interaction with them.There are definitely a lot more expensive hotels on Waikiki, but if you want a great value for your money, the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is it. We will definitely stay there again.

We r staying tonight cuz we r doing the Mai Tai Sunset Cruise and don't wanna drive back to the north Shore. Lots of cops out this week.  20 story hotel with smallish pool and Tiki bar/restaurant.  Hotel.com for cheap last minute deal. I like the Aston Circle Waikiki a lot better but this is cool.  Nice balconies with chairs clean room and parking

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was nice. The bathrooms were pretty outdated and rooms are a bit small; however, this part of Honolulu is meant for you to go out and enjoy the outdoors. My husband and I like resort style hotels the best, but this is a good place to stay if you are not planning to stay in your hotel all day. Very close to lots of food and shops. Zoo is a block away and there is also a bus stop one block away as well. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. The young lady at the front desk was AWESOME. I forgot her name but believe it started with an 'S'. There was an issue with us having a double bed which would not work for my husband and I. We were traveling with a small child and space was very limited already. The young lady worked very hard to find another room for us. I'm not sure if I would stay here again since I prefer resort style hotels, which give you a lot more space, but all in all this is a nice hotel.

I booked this hotel some months back through Hotels.com.A short time after the booking I received a email saying that the booking had been cancelled.I called and was told there was a glitch in the system and the booking was redone.Upon receiving my credit card statement I found I was charged twice both by Hotels.com and Aston Wakiki.After another call this was rectified and I was told there would be a recommendation for an upgrade for the inconvenience.When I checked in I was upgraded but if that was an upgrade I would hate to see what I originally booked.I complained and our room was changed to their credit.This is the third visit to Honolulu and I would advise that you only get what you pay for and in the future I will pay the extra and book a better quality hotel.

So, the hotel is old, there is no getting around that. There are things that could be improved such as the refrigerator in the room and the beds are very small but these are minor things and did not affect how much we enjoyed staying here. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. We had a perfect view of Diamond Head (and even a small view of the ocean) and the zoo across the street. Housekeeping did a wonderful job each day even with our constant accumulation of "stuff" and responded promptly when we had an issue with our blow dryer. The room had tons of space for us to spread out and relax. My family really liked being able to swim in the pool and then rent a video game or movie on the way back to the room. We came back late one night from exploring and ate at Tiki's onsite and that was both convenient and delicious. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would gladly stay there again.

Had amazing stay here. The view from our room was beautiful. The room was clean and spacious for our needs. Tikis bar and restaurant offers great food and cocktails. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Aston Waikiki beach hotel can't wait to stay again.

Loved my recent 14 night stay at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel - I had studied reviews of various other hotels and was aware of some of the issues, the hotel was better than I expected and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.A friend and I had twin room with balcony, ocean front, which prior to booking we had decided would be worthwhile for us, and it absolutely was - we spent hours out there watching the world go by. When we arrived there was only one balcony chair so I called housekeeping, who rectified the issue within minutes. Everyone who works at the hotel was really friendly and lovely (except for one surly guy at the valet bell desk!) and we felt really safe and secure in our room. The hotel is a block from Honolulu zoo, so sort of other end of the hotel strip from royal Hawaiian village, outrigger etc, but we actually loved the location as it was a few blocks away from the madness and frenzied busy-ness but still close enough to stroll down there for shopping/restaurants. (Check out aloha burrito at 307? Lewers st - next door to moose mcgillicutty - fantastic giant burritos all $8 usd - sigh - I miss those!). Waikiki trolley pink line stops at the hotel - you can get on there and pay $2 per trip, which goes to ala Moana shopping centre - sometimes when it was super hit we would get off a couple of stops down if we were feeling lazy.The free DVDs are awesome - our playstTion didn't work so we called concierge who were in our room within minutes and had fixed the issue.Keurig coffee pods delicious coffee gets replenished daily - you can buy milk if you need from one of the many abc shops in the block, or I think they had packet creamer. There is also a handy little shop near the room lifts for items such as water (99c for 1.5 litre), drinks, snacks, ice cream etc.Wolfgang puck express is downstairs in the complex - make sure that you try a pizza if you like them - I had a breakfast pizza and I cannot tell you how much I enjoyed this - a highlight of my meals in Hawaii! The base was like a buttery and crunchy Turkish bread - delicious!We went to the pool a couple of times but the issue with it is most of the time the pool is in full hot beating down sun, so it was actually too hot to get in For risk of my fair skin burning - wished I had taken my rash vest. The beach is across the road and there are plenty of beautiful tall palm trees there to provide some shade.Fresh towels were available - just needed to sign them out and sign back in and you counsel use at the pool or the beach.I was there from 3 to 17 may and I Am already depressed as I miss it so much. Rooms themselves were not luxurious but they were clean, tidy and well maintained - beds and pillows were comfy - I loved my time at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel and hope to return in the future

Great location for Honolulu, with great views of Waikiki beach. Clean, with comfortable beds but a very dated hotel. The taps dripped, the plugs did not keep water in the sink, and the balcony was the only place on the island I got bitten by some kind of bug or spider (didn't see them, but they loved my ankles. Had to move indoors). Honolulu is an expensive city, but I thought this hotel was not value for money.

My wife and i stayed at this property for 2 nights prior to departing on a cruise. Location was the best part of this property. it's at the end of Waikiki beach, a quarter mile from the "Duke" statue. the beach out front is wonderful, with a protected swimming area. The red and pink "hop on/hop off" buses stops right in front of the hotel. The zoo is in walking distance, as are many restaurants and shops across from Waikiki beach. The hotel is in need of much work, and the rooms are small and dark. The bathroom in our room was in need of remodeling. we were in 1502, with an outside entry into our room. the lanai is small with one chair. the view of the beach is ok, with the Marriott blocking the view towards the west. we could see diamond head to the east very clearly. the room had a king sized bed, a tv, 2 small nightstands, and 2 small wood chairs with very narrow chairs. i would rate this room below expectations, and i was disappointed with the quality of room provided.other comments: the elevators are confusing at first. No instruction was provided, and i had to return to checkin to figure it out. they were actually pretty prompt, but you had to stop at level 3 to go to your room. it was a bit odd, but i'm sure it was for safety, so i'm ok with it. Pool was ok, and water was cold, which was a surprise. Hotel has a bar/restaurant called the Tiki's bar and grill . very nice bar and very good food. I'll review separately.one word of advice - they charge a deposit on the key. when we departed, we turned in the key, but the deposit was not returned. seems kind of cheap and underhanded, to keep our deposit.

We stayed on the 16th floor, beautiful views over Waikiki. Perfectly located hotel, close to everything. Staff very good, continental breakfast was included with our room rate and was adequate for our needs.Great bar for evening cocktails, would certainly stay here again.

As everyone has touched on the fact that this hotel is dated, I'm not really going to go in to that. But, to be fair, 90% of Waikiki is dated;) We just got home today from staying a wonderful 10 nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. This place is a great location, right across from the beach, and the last hotel on the Waikiki strip. Everyone working there was very friendly, and helpful. Being that we arrived at 9:30pm, and departed at 8:30pm we had zero issues checking in, or out. Our room on the 7th floor had a partial ocean view, and partial view of Diamond Head. The room was about 250-300 sqr feet. Had everything a hotel room usually has, and noise was not an issue on the 7th floor. And by the way, if you need a hair dryer, it's in the closet, in a black bag that says hair dryer (girlfriend found that out on our last day lol)Hotel had full, very strong wi-fi all over the place (but to be honest, you are in Hawaii, and shouldn't be on it;) )The resort fee was $25 usd per day, a bit of a bummer, but I couldn't find a hotel in Waikiki that wasn't charging one. And $25 was on the lower end for the area. Parking was $32 usd a day, again high, but typical for the area. A valet will park your car for you, as space is very limited this is not an option, they will park it for you. And pretty much all the "cheap" or "free" parking no longer exists as Waikiki has grown a bit over the last few years.Bottom line, if you want a solid, economic, helpful, and reliable hotel, this is a great pick. And hey, you are in Hawaii, you shouldn't be in your room that long anyway:)Oh, and as far as the elevators go (as this has come up in past reviews) they are super simple. Hit your floor number, scan room key, and an elevator is automatically assigned to you. The hotel is a busy place, don't expect the elevator to just "show up" immediately;)Hope this helps.And thank you to the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for such a fantastic addition to our holiday.

This was a great place for checking out the whole island. All the bus tours in front of the hotel frequently. Not to mention you are right on the beach. Each morning I was only minutes from the time I climbed out of bed until I was hopping in the ocean for a morning swim. Plus mid way through my trip, I arrived from snorkeling to find out I had been upgraded to an oceanfront room! Topped of with a great staff, I will stay here again for sure.

Yes this hotel is in a fantastic location and the view from our hotel room was amazing and as requested. The pool is also a great way to end the day after being on the beach.However, the theft of my GoPro camera from my hotel room can not be tolerated and hence the low review score. Other than this everything was perfect.I had been charging my camera and left this by the plug socket to remind me to charge the spare battery ahead of our snorkelling and Shark dive. But after returning to the room in the evening the camera was missing. I turned the room upside down thinking at first I had misplaced this but can now be assured this was NOT the case. I reported this to the front desk but the first response I got was to go to Walmart and buy a new one - not very helpful at all.I reported again the following morning and security came to the room and I completed a report. This was over a week ago and I am yet to receive a response.I have also emailed but also waiting for a response.As a result of this theft I was unable to record and take photos at various snorkelling sites and have had to spend more on photos and camera hire since. Various add ons I also bought for my camera are now no longer of any use to me.All in all, what should have been fantastic place was ruined by my camera miraculously disappearing into thin air. Thanks.

I had booked this hotel at the recommendation of family. It was on the Waikiki Beach strip was was awesome, and we had a 'beach front' room. The street was so noisy at night (not the hotels fault!), and the Tikki bar in the hotel had music playing into the late night (11pm). To top it off, the room next door decided to have a party every night we were there. The hotel offered to move us to a higher floor, but we had already been in our room for 4 nights; it really didn't suit us. We just had to 'put up' with them.The staff were so lovely and helpful though. The rooms were also well kept and fresh and clean. Our air-conditioner didn't work on a few occassions, and the smell from the vent was pretty musty and old. They were prompt to come and fix the problem when we asked, so I will give them that!We had a beautiful view of Waikiki beach, which we really enjoyed every morning and afternoon!I would stay here again if I had no other option. If you are just looking for a pretty average motel with a great (noisy) location - this is the one for you.

As on a business trip as a group we only had 3 nights here. Apart from a dodgy check in which seemed to take for ever we finally got to our rooms. Rooms were clean and had fresh towels and all the usual thibgs you would like to have. Hotel is in a central location with amazing views which ever room you get. If you are on a higher floor like a was (floor 26) be prepared to hear the wind whistle around the hotel. I had no major problems with this hotel and a bonus was happy hour every day 2-5pm, cant be bad.

The hotel was nice and clean. Free wifi and I like that they have a PS3 in the room and guests have access to unlimited DVD and game rentals in the lobby(*Side note if you want to get the PS3 to connect to the wifi, you have to do the internet setup but not test it. Instead to make it connect you need to open the Internet explorer so it can take you to the screen where you enter room number and last name). The beach is right across the street from the hotel which is great. Also right next door to the zoo. Elevators are a bit confusing. You need to scan your card and enter the floor you want to go to before you get on the elevator.

First off what I booked was not what I received. So it seems they have different categories in ocean view. We booked ocean view and got a partial ocean view.
