When i asked it was explained to me that there are four different types and if I wanted true ocean view will have to pay another $45 per day more. The rooms were not very spacious, thank good for the balcony. Then in order for you to go to the ground floor you must stop by the third floor and go down the escalators. Very inconvenient. Overall not my best choice in hotel so far.
user_name:
yerina h
New York City, New York

review_body: The pros: great location, very cool "Hawaiian" pool and open lobby area, delicious on-site restaurant. Oh, did I say great location? And view!The cons: The room was spacious but... 1-the toilet seat almost fell off, 2-the bath tub drain was clogged, 3-the bath tub handle was falling off, 4-the sheer drapes were so wrinkled they looked like they had been wadded up in a ball, 5-the shower curtain was torn and had holes in it. Come on, people, these are things that housekeeping sees every day, and can easily be fixed. (We called housekeeping, who did fix them right away.) Lastly, there was no chair in the room(?) Overall, I would recommend this place because the pros out weighted the cons.

The room was clean and serviced every day. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is central, close to the beach and eating places. you can walk every where in Waikiki from the Aston and buses pass the door constantly, fairs are cheap.

We stayed here while visiting my adult Daughter that lives in in Waikiki. I stayed her 3 years ago and was favorably impressed with the hotel so booking here again was an easy decision. We booked through AAA for an Ocean view room. We arrived and got checked in promptly. The desk clerk was quick and efficient. We got a room on the 23rd floor. The room had at best a partial ocean view. The room was very cramped with a roll out bed placed in it. The room was tidy but appeared in need of an update. The bathroom was the really old and worn. I was disappointed to learn the Aston no longer offered breakfast. I considered complaining but it was late and we were only staying 2 nights.

Had the worst experience with this hotel and its insurance company. We inadvertently forgot to empty our safe when we checked out in a rush to get to our cruise ship but called as soon as we were able to let them know we had left a folder with a large amount of money in the safe ... the hotel claims our safe was empty so the insurance company said the hotel did nothing wrong?????? They said they found items that we hadn't left but nothing in the safe and we know our money had been locked in it with our own combination for the 3 days we were there. I can't believe the hotel line is taking no responsibility for this.

The staff was very attentive to our needs. The rooms were clean, large with room for the whole family. Very close to the beach, and shops. We had views of the beach and Diamond Head. Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay!

This hotel is on the quieter end of the beach which is good. We went with an ocean front select and had a full on view of the water which was so pretty. Our room was comfortable, clean and the staff was nice. We loved the gift bag with reef safe sunscreen and candy, thank you! The pool is nice and there is a little shop area right next to it. We would def stay here again. If you go to Oahu you must rent a car and see the rest of the island. The only word for it is paradise! Lovely beaches with views far above turquoise water and lush green fields. Try shave ice and read about the beaches before you go so you stay safe. Thank you Aston!

Spent 4 nites May 10-14. Had an excellent ocean and beach view. Good amenities in the room - even a gift pack. Had a king bed (excellent) which filled the room. WiFi excellent (even in the room this time). Last visited 2 years ago - disappointed they cut out the breakfast which was part of the resort fee, so feel a bit short-changed.Only annoyance was a bathroom sink fawcet that needed attention. Otherwise the room was clean and tidy. Overall, it seems well kept up for an older property.

Our vacation plan was to strictly explore the various beaches on Oahu, no excursions. We wanted to stay on Waikiki for the beach and great shoppping options. This is out first time staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. The Aston Beach Waikiki Hotel location is great! We are right across the street from Waikiki. The GPS directions kept routing us to Lemon street which was incorrect. The parking/valet staff is very helpful and friendly. If you rent a vehicle, simply call valet before you leave your room. We stayed on the 5th floor. Our room was simple, standard room. There is a lot of outside noise (room 501) and I assume since we were so close to the ground level it's just downtown street noise. The bathroom floor was dirty and in need of deep cleaning. The hotel offers Beach chairs and Beach towel for hotel guest, super convenient. For the cost, the hotel really suit our needs and we were happy with our choice. We would return to this hotel again.

We had a beach view, it was excellent the room was very clean, a little walk to the Town Centre which was a nice stroll every day. The only thing I Was disappointed about is the hotel pool... It was right next to a busy restaurant.

We were booked for this hotel at the beginning of the trip and the last of the trip with a tour. The first night was a disappointment with faulty air conditioning and leaky sink faucet and shower and actual space in the room.. After talking to the front desk about the return reservation at the end of the trip, our room was good with no complaints. The hotel does not provide any breakfast, but the restaurant separate from the hotel, but part of the building, facing the ocean, was a good place to eat breakfast and other meals. The location is great and staff was friendly and helpful.

Hotel charges "resort fee" of $25/day per room for wifi, newspaper, gym use, pool towels, etc. Most hotels on the beach do this, so check beforehand so there are no surprises for you. The fee is mandatory, whether you want these add-ons or not. Hotel room is spacious with a balcony (different size balconies/views, depending on room rate). Bed is comfy, good sleeps. TV has plenty of channels. Bathroom is older and desperately needs a renovation. First, we had a long black hair in tub upon check-in YUCK. The tap on the sink are finicky and you have to jiggle it to turn off water. Very difficult to plug sink as drain lever is stuck. Then, shower head is at my neck level (and I am 5'5" tall). So you have to duck to wet your hair. And the toilet is so low, you literally fall onto it to use it. Please renovate your bathrooms!! The hotel has an outdoor pool, which is filled with families and their children. I checked the "Pool Rules" sign and nothing mentioned there about children who are not toilet trained or wearing diapers, however, there were a few very young babies in the pool (not toilet trained). This is very unsanitary and I avoided the pool for this reason. The pool attendant offers chairs to bring to the beach and this is a better option to consider....There is a Tiki Restaurant on the pool level, which is pretty good. Good food and service. There are plenty of restaurants around the strip - most are attached to hotels. Plus there is a Cheesecake Factory further down the strip (10-15 minute walk), which was our go-to during our stay.Location of hotel is away from hub on beach strip. There is a "Pink Line" bus that makes a loop through the area for $2/ride, so you can get to the other end of the beach easily. This bus runs every 10 minutes. Plus there is a grocery store about 10 minutes away from hotel. Get directions from the staff.

My review is very similar to others you can see on this site. Firstly, the staff were very friendly and the location is great. The rooms are very dated and are in desperate need of an upgrade, especially the bathroom. I also don't understand the $25 a day service fee. If this is a compulsory fee, why is it not just included in the price of the room in the first place? $25 (excluding tax) is extremely expensive just to maybe use a beach towel and a chair for a few hours a day. Despite these little details, our stay there was very pleasant. The Tiki Bar and Grill down stairs is great. The vibe there is great and also the location is excellent.

Right across the street from Waikiki beach, easy walking to shopping and restaurants. The room was comfortable but the bathroom was old and did not appear very clean. We were there for a few days before leaving on a Hawaiian cruise so it met our needs, but not a place I would choose on my own.

We spent three nights in the hotel prior to a Pride of America cruise. The location of the hotel net to the Kapiolani Park is great and the rooms have good views of both the beach and Diamond Head. The rooms are in great need of updating. The bathroom is very small with stained grout on the floor tiles, peeling paint, and an accumulation of dust on the HVAC vent. Pillows were flat and uncomfortable. There were no chairs in the room, only stools. The hotel was OK but we were disappointed with the quality of the rooms.

The photos on the website dont really show how old this place. Check in was a nightmare (took over 35m ins just to line up). We were stung for an additional $26 service/hotel fee per night which seemed like a con. It included use of the pool area and we werent able to opt out of it. We had to re-request a cot for our baby (although it was already ordered). When it arrived it was simply shoved in the room and made it impossible to move in the room. We did request they remove some furniture but this never did occur.Over our stay the phone and fridge had to be replaced as both broke down. The air conditioning was also troublesome and sporadic.On a positive note, the majority of the staff were extremely friendly and the location is hard to beat.The rooms really need a facelift. The bathrooms are tired as are the bedrooms and the linen is rather cheap and nasty. I am sure there better places to stay for the same money.

Getting off the NCL cruise at 9 am, we went to this hotel to pre-register​ drop off our bags. Went to Pearl harbor and returned to the Aston at 3. There were a number of people in the registration line so we decided to have a late lunch at their captive restaurant and wait for the line to go down. I came back a half hour later and the line was the same. Came back at 3:50 and spent 25 minutes in line. There were only 4, sometimes 3 registration clerks available. Processing time was long for many people. We spent 25 minutes in line before reaching the counter. By this time the line behind us was half again as long as when we got in line. I guess they don't care. This is queuing theory plain and simple. Wait time depends on three things: how fast customers arrive, how many stations there are to serve, and how long it takes to process each customer. Let's see. Arrival rate is predictable based on season, day of week and time. Processing time depends on work flow design but over the long term is under management control. Last but not least is the number of stations. This is definitely under management control. So if they can predict the customer arrivals, and can send staff down to assist in registration, then it is clear they just don't care how long their customers wait in line.Then get this. They tell us our room has been upgraded. Who knows why but I had not said anything at this point. But a room upgrade is nice so thank you. But guess what? Their are no chairs in the room. I wonder what would have been missing had I not got the upgrade? What level does it take to get chairs?

I had high expectations for this hotel based on their price and website and welcome emails. Unfortunately I was very let down and wouldn't stay here again. The towels were old and rough, the pillows were flat and overused, the walls were paper thin so we heard all activities of our neighbors on all sides. They offer valet but it's a huge rip off at $35 a day, there is a public lot by the zoo down the street which is much better for $1 an hour. Overall the quality of the rooms was lacking as well, old and cracking in places. To add to this there is a bar attached to the pool and if you are on any floor below 10, you will be up late until they band at the bar stops playing. The few good things: the view if you get an ocean front- but honestly there are loads of other hotels that have that going for them as well; the desk service was very nice and people were very accommodating at all times. However, if I did this trip again I would have booked an Airbnb!

My wife and I booked a 1 night stay at this hotel we got in with a very tired baby and got our room keys. When we got into the room we noticed right away that we were not given the king size bed we had booked instead were given two full size beds(I'm 6' 2"). Also the air conditioning was not working. When my wife went over to the phone too call front desk several fleas jumped on her. The front desk told her that there was no king beds available and offered to send up house keeping and a room engineer. With a very tired baby in tow we decided to just leave too another hotel. None of us wanting to sleep in a flea room. The one positive for this hotel is the staff was very friendly.

Stayed for a week! Pleasant enough but a bit outdated and in need of some loving care. Paint peeling in bathrooms but okay. Pool was very outdated but I guess when you are right across the road from Waikiki Beach you don't need much for a pool! Service was quite good! Location was amazing and the attached Bar/restaurant was fantastic.

We travelled with 2 other couples. The service was ok, we got what we paid for. I loved just being across from the beach/ocean pool. The trolley bus stopped at the front. Although it was a long way from the big shopping centre we had many other facilities nearby. The restaurant within the complex was good and there were several others nearby, plenty of ABC shops close and very near the zoo. In all I liked being away from some of the traffic. Tour desks were very helpful but managed to book 2 trips externally lots cheaper.

Nice hotel with a great location, right on the main strip and across from the beach. We had an ocean view room and the daytime and nighttime views were unbeatable. Breakfast was fair at best; very difficult to get a table around the pool at breakfast time. Staff was nice and accommodating.

We moved into this hotel after an unpleasant experience at an Air B&B. So we were quite welcoming of anything better but the Waikiki Beach Hotel was lovely. Rooms are a good size. Very clean. Love their elevator system. Staff was cordial and chambermaids were prompt in the morning hours. Great location right across from a very safe area of Waikiki for the children and two blocks from zoo. Buses were one block away and everything else was within walking distance. Food at restaurant by pool was good but a little pricey. Nice touch was a bag of sun products in our room.

I think this hotel needs to do an upgrade, paint etc to get their 3 stars. In addition to the paint coming off the ceiling and walls in the bathroom, on my last day I noticed black mold on the ceiling and wall of the hallway. Put this together with the noisy air conditioning and the vent that didn't close in the bathroom that was a wind tunnel from the bottom of the hotel to the top I would say 2 stars at best and only because of it's location, the cleaning staff does a great job and the beds (not the thin pieces of foam they call pillows) are comfortable. Other: They charge $25 a day which really only gives you WiFi and beach towels and chairs by the pool. And $32 + tax for parking. And they add $4 to your bill for unreturned key cards which I believe you only get back if you go to the front desk and checkout (not the express checkout).

Good location. Meal prices are high so eat out where possible a lot cheaper and better food. We had to pay 100 dollars for wifi and amenities this was not advised at the travel agents so going to ask for them to pick up the bill.. apart from that all enjoyable..

Hotel outside was nice but our room was so small had 2 twin beds and couldn't move around in the room with 4 bags of luggage and no dressers for clothes. Plus everything was an extra. I will not return there.
user_name:
David Henry K
Chapel Hill, North Carolina

review_body: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach. The front staff were amazing at check in!! Any of our needs were met by the hotel staff. We had the deluxe ocean view room which had a gorgeous view. Although the rooms are small, especially the bathrooms, the lanai has 2 chairs and most of my time spent in the room in the morning and evening were spent on the lanai with the gorgeous view!!. The king bed was comfortable. The small refrigerator was useful. We made use of the free DVD rental on evenings when we wanted to chill. The beach is across the street. The Tiki Lounge was delicious. I will stay there again!!

The rooms were clean and comfortable but a bit tired. The most disappointing part was the $25 per day charge for wi-fi and in room coffee making facilities.. In this day and age of free wi-fi almost anywhere you travel, it was an extra expense. We had three rooms over a ten day stay which added a lot to our accommodation expenses.

Location is great - downtown, walking distance to lots of restaurants, shopping, the zoo and right across from the beach! You can checkout towels to use for the beach, which was ideal. The resto/bar is outdoors and "rooftop" - meaning it was a few stories above ground level, so you got a nice view. Food was adequate, but I wouldn't have dined there if I weren't staying there.

I stayed at this motel for six nights in march 2017. Shortly after arriving I started noticing random insect bites, by the time my stay was over my upper torso was covered, contacted Aston and was not even able to speak to a manager. I then contacted the booking agency I went through. A few days later I received an email from the safety and security manager apologizing for my experience with "bed bugs". I then returned requested pictures of the bites. A week or so later I received an email from the booking agent that an outside insurance company would contact me regarding this issue. They claimed that the bite marks were not consitent with this particular bug as the bites were random and not in a row. However they would send a complaint form to my home address. That was almost 3 weeks ago and still have not received anything. I have sent return emails to the manager of safety and security who hand originally contacted me as well as the cooperative PR office and have heard nothing in response.

This hotel is right across the street from Waikiki Beach and right next to the zoo. We stayed at a Junior Suite and the room was great! The location is very convenient as you can walk along Kalakaua Avenue for restaurants and other places. I would not mind coming back here to visit at all.
user_name:
JennC212
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a week. It is centrally located in the area and one can walk to anything one has a desire of, shops, beauty, restaurants.. you name it.Free DVD's for your pleasure. We often ate at Tiki's Bar and grill on the first floor.. The food is a very good size serving, cooked to prefection of my taste and the cocktails were superb. There is a $35.00 a day charge for Valet parking. They are prompt with no waiting when I call down for my car it is ready. The Hotel was clean and orderly. Anything you need they provide. The waiters at Tiki's were wonderful and informative. Jason and Tom were our favorites, but they all were on top of your needs. We will return. Pleasant experienceThe hotel is older than some I have stayed in, but despite the age it is well maintained clean and comfortable. NO complaints from us.

Felt welcome from when we arrived and the feeling lasted the whole time. Clean rooms with comfy beds. Excellent location with views of the beach, which is just across the road. Also within walking distance of many places to eat and shop but just far enough away so a little quieter. Would recommend and the place where I stay again if I make it back.

Right on the beach but seemingly at the far end of town. But the location makes it great for the shorter walk to Diamond Head, the Zoo and Aquarium. Quieter beaches and access across the street is a bonus. Along with being so close to a greta strip of local eateries (Rainbow Drive Inn, Leonardo's Bakery and the Side Street Inn) all of which are a must. We paid a lower price than most so it must be taken into consideration. Rooms are newly refurbished but our bathroom was like something off Route 66. Rooms 01-05 have open air hallways which is something to consider, but are away from the elevators / noise with a partial sea view. Beds border on OK. Ours was closer to dead than alive. Service is pretty good (should be for a $26/night resort fee) but the free DVDs and Games are a decent addition. Pool is big enough to be useful but too small for a decent swim. That said - you've the pacific across the street for that. Buses stop at the far end of the block to whisk you anywhere on the island if you're without a car. All in all a decent spot for the alternatives to the usual wizz bang of the strip. Which in itself is a bonus, as there's so much more to Waikiki if you dig below the surface. A 3.5 out of five is needed to sum up this hotel.
user_name:
Vegas_Fisherman
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel very dated, in need of renovation. The walls and carpets of the room were dirty and there were long dark hairs all over the bathroom. Not clean enough. Dated, I can cope with, dirty, I can't. Even after bringing the hairs in the bathroom to the attention of reception, nothing was done. We were on an upper floor but were still unable to rest because of the noise from the downstairs bar.

I enjoyed this hotel and the staff was very accomodating. I enjoyed the pool and poolside bar view as the sun was setting each day. Please get your gifts from the football stadium they are cheaper. Take in one of the luaus if you have never experienced one. The experience is worth it...i did not really care for the food. Please take a tour of the islands and go see a waterfall while there.

We stayed for just o e night prior to our cruise, but we enjoyed the Ashton Beach Waikiki hotel very much. Nice pool, restaurant, bar practically poolside. Also, the short walk to the ocean. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds were very comfortable. Would stay there again!!

Nice hotel lovely staff disappointed as no breakfast options and no safe smoking area unlike the marriott but well positioned adequate rooms clean wheelchair friendly mice stay but prefer the marriott much more facilities

We traveled to Hawaii for the NCL cruise to the islands. This hotel came as a free perk stay from NCL. We were located on the 8th floor with a room facing the water. Room came with a small balcony. The view we had from here was great. Hotel location was right across from the beach, less than 50 yrs to the beach and water. There were many stores and dining within walking distance. Room was great for just a one night stay before the cruise. They worked well with NCL Cruise line.

Loved this hotel. Yes the bathrooms need updating but my room was very clean and let's face it who goes to Hawaii to stay in the room. The view from my room was AMAZING!!! We arrived late on so our first view was at night which was just beautiful. Being from England and the time difference we were awake at 4am most mornings and I was surprised to see how busy waikiki was getting by 5am with people running along the beach and once the sun was up by half 6 the surfers were out. I did see a lot of homeless people and they are all over waikiki but they don't bother you for anything, they didn't us anyway. The pool at the hotel is small but my children loved it towards the end of the holiday as there were not many people using it so had it to themselves pretty much. Sunbeds were easy to get as like I say hardly anyone stayed round the pool due to either going to the beach or being on trips. We used the bus lots while here to get to places, saved hundreds of dollars by getting to places ourselves. A lot of the touristy places are actually free or very cheap. We managed to get the free tickets at uss Arizona and it cost me $5 to get there on the bus. We also got the bus to punchbowl which I'm glad we did as we spent a while there paying our respects and watching some guards there practising for a funeral that began as we were leaving. It's a beautiful setting and one that shouldn't be seen through a coach window. We also walked to diamond head from the hotel which was nice. It only costs a dollar to get in so again saved money by doing it ourselves. I highly recommend the go card as that too saved us hundreds of dollars. Do your research though as like I said a lot of the touristy things are actually free or cheap. Overall I loved this hotel and didn't want to leave. Word of warning though, there are lots of birds and I mean lots. One actually got into our room at night and laid an egg as well as making a mess all over my son's clothes. Tip: close the balcony door at night lol

This was our first visit to Honolulu. The hotel is amazing as it caters for all family types.It had a wonderful tiki bar and restaurant. The beach is across the road and the stores you need are close by. The staff of the hotel are so helpful and go out of their way to assist when they can. We will definitely stay here again.

Thank you Natasha for accomodating my room request. Aston Beach Waikiki is a great place to spend a vacation.Great hotel, fantastic location and home to Tikis Bar and Grill.Would recommend to everyone.

When in Waikiki, we like to stay on the quieter end of the strip...the last couple of times at the Aston Waikiki Beach. Across the street is the beach, so great location. Not a long walk to many restaurants and the busier part of the strip, a good evening thing to visit. Over the years we have gravitated towards the Aston's onsite bar/patio/dinner place, Tikki's, for food and after beach-going drinks. Oceanview and Diamond Head view have both been very nice...try get the highest floor level, just below the major upgraded level (top 2 floors, I believe), to get the fantastic view and to decrease street noise.

We just spent a week at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki beach resort, then switched here for a "free" night paid for by the cruise line as we are taking our cruise today. This place is so run down it's ridiculous. And it's more expensive than the one we were just at which is beautiful! Had I known this I would have spent the money to stay at Hyatt again last night. It's funny to me that the cruise line would take the people who are spending the most money on their cruise and put them in such a terrible hotel, when they can put us up somewhere better for less money. Doesn't make sense to me!! I've posted a couple pictures of our lovely bathroom.

We have stayed here before, great location etc. this time we arrived early and were assigned a room we didn't like. Right away we were given other room options and mgmt was great . We will stay here next trip too .

After searching for hotels i found the Ashton Waikiki. Its was a great price especially for the busy time we were traveling..The staff were so helpful and treated us with all the ALOHAS...the room omg had a veiw of the beach so amazing especially being from the mainland. Never been that close to clear blue water...rooms were nice, had a oceanview room nice view.in walking distance to everything..thank you for the great stay..MAHALOS

Had a wonderful time. The hotel itself is older but still maintained. We had a nice ocean view. The beds were small and not the highest quality but sufficient. We did have a bad experience with one of the maintenance staff. He said he had a complaint about noise and barged into our room when I opened the door. Very rude individual. We liked the pool area and its closeness to a restaraunt. It's hard to go wrong with a beachfront hotel and if you spend all your time outside then the room doesn't matter a lot.

It look that this hotel was a choice for several large group of teens. Pool area was very crowded with them in the afternoon.Rooms average , they are old an bathrooms are dated. Needs to be refurbished.I had a good view so that made my stay a bit better.No room service available offered .

We stayed before boarding the Pride of America. There was a shuttle to to ship with free baggage handling. The hotel is conveniently located to amenities. Unfortunately our room was not clean and was very run down.

This location was seriously disappointing. I "upgraded" to a ocean view room. To be clear, not a partial view, a full view. The only way you could view the ocean was from my balcony. I called and asked if I was given the correct room and they said yes that was what they considered an ocean view. I also had constant problems with the room. The phone didn't work, the AC made this horrible noise all night then when they fixed it a new noise started which was less horrible but still prevented sleep, the shower backed up, the entryway light went out, the ice bucket and glasses were taken after the first day and I had to call and get them replaced. They were very fast to respond to issues but it was ridiculous that all of these issues occurred in the first place. I will not be returning.

Location- This is located across a the street from the beach and the hotel provides you with towels and chairs.Staff-The women who checked us in was courteous and helpful, the same could not be said for her counterpart that was talking over her the entire time wanting her to make keys for another customer. The room was quant with a comfortable bed, i was surprised by the dirty outdated carpet and bathroom. For the price of this hotel it could use interior cleaning and updating.

Excellent friendly service, room was clean, great views, Right on the beachVery helpful staff especially for a first timer visitor to Hawaii. Lovely restaurant and pool area great for laying in the sun - verandahs good also

Bathroom was very grungy. Was disappointing for the price we paid. They did bring up a nice rollaway bed at the last minute. It is across the street from Waikiki beach and very close to the zoo. Parking was $32 a day with mandatory valet. Nice restaurant bar in hotel with beach view. Pool is small but nice. Waikiki beach area was very crowded, like the vegas strip

My wife and I are seasoned travelers and have stayed at this property in the past. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay this year as we had previously. The hotel is in an excellent location; across the street is the beach, walk west on Kalakua Avenue you have all the activity, restaurants, & shopping, or walk east you have the quiet of the Kapiolani Park with the Zoo, Aquarium and band shell. The concierge and lobby/pool areas are clean and well laid out. Most importantly, our room was very clean, well laid out, and very comfortable. The view from our lanai was outstanding. The in-room safe is great for travel documents and other important items. The bathrooms are very clean, well-stocked and well maintained. The king bed was exceedingly comfortable which is a real bonus after a busy day of sightseeing. Recommend a Select (21st Floor and higher) Oceanview Room, well worth it. The hotel staff members are excellent. Every staff member we met during our stay performed their duties with skill and in a very friendly personable manner. Front desk, hospitality, pool, housekeeping, engineering and security personnel made our stay comfortable, secure, and pleasant. Any questions or concerns we expressed were handled promptly and effectively.I have to say the elevator system is the most efficient we have experienced. Swipe your room card at a kiosk and enter your floor number and one of 5 elevators will be assigned to you. Then, it’s get on and go. To go to the registration/pool level, press the star key on your floor. There are no rushes for the elevators at high traffic times and you don’t get on an elevator with all the floors selected by a previous prankster.The amenity fee covers a lot of great items. The free towels and beach chairs are a winner for us. The daily free local paper is great for finding out about the islands. We did not use the DVD and game kiosks but saw they were very popular with families and student groups. The times we have stayed there have confirmed why the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is definitely our hotel of choice.

If you want a dirty room with bugs then this is your go to hotel in Waikiki. Bugs in the bathroom, closet , bedside table and dresser. Tile floor in bathroom grimy. Carpet is disgusting and beds are small. I informed the front desk 3 times to deal with the little bugs- did nothing. I asked how they were going to make this right and they offered a $36 credit. Never refilled coffee and the elevators are a nightmareIf you are going to spend the money to go to Hawaii spend a little more and avoid this hotel at all costs! I bet the hostel is cleaner.

This hotel is the cleanest, best location in Waikiki. The staff was wonderful and it amazed me how much they pay attention to little details for cleanliness. They even mop the pool deck! I stay here every time I come to Honolulu and have been very happy.

We loved this hotel it was friendly and located just across from Waikiki beach, almost next to the zoo too. Everyone was lovely and very helpful. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because the decor is a bit tired and really needs freshening up.

This tower hotel is located right on the beach and although we thought it would be noisy, it was surprisingly quiet and comfortable. The beds were comfortable. Bathroom a bit tired but okay. We had an ocean view room with balcony, which was gorgeous at sunset. The pool was very crowded, but Waikiki beach is just over the road. The Waikiki trolley hop on hop off bus stops outside the hotel. Would stay here again.

We had a view of the Pacific that cannot be beat. We arrived after a 13 hour flight and that view was so relaxing for a couple of tired travelers. The staff was warm and friendly, the room was comfortable and clean. Everything Hawaii we could have possibly wanted was within strolling distance from the hotel.

We stayed at the Aston for three nights. Arrived early in the morning and our room was ready. Good start after a 9 hour flight. The staff were very helpful and attentive. We were upgraded to a balcony with ocean view. Views were amazing. Room was a bit dated but clean and comfortable. The hotel has a swimming pool and a restaurant which is open all day. It is situated directly across the road from the beach. They supply you with beach towels and beach chairs, they even supply you with a gift on arrival of a tote bag with suntan lotion, chap stick and after sun care cream which came in handy. Restaurants, takeaways, grocery stores, boutique stores, malls, bars etc. are all within easy walking distance. Our stay was short, but would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is wonderful! The location, value, hospitality, staff, amenities​, etc allow it to compete with the high end resorts. We stayed for a week during spring break, and we will definitely return!! Mahalo!!

Right at the top end and the view looking back towards town and the airport are breathtaking. Rooms a little dated but the vibe is there. Easy access to the beach. Staff very good and they even have take-away breakfast baskets! Good value for money in prime location. Also great view of Diamond head from opposite side of building.

We stayed here for two weeks recently and loved it.The staff were very friendly,Tina organized various trips,rentals etc.Whilst the building is old and tired,the rooms were very clean and comfy.Position is great and right across from the beach.

Really enjoyed our stayWe for upgraded to a higher floor which made out partial deluxe view fantasticRoom services and coffee replaced dailyReceived a Aston tote bag with sun screen and sunscreen spray tan after care and lip balm very nice touchRoom lovely and cleanGot a dvd hire card and could hire as many DVDs as we likedOnly down fall a very very large group of teenagers from a program or school were staying at hotel at the same time which made it very difficult to leave at enter at times and they just at would move for anyone or would push in but other than that great stayReally easy access to beach across the road we swam every morning

Just returned from spending two nights prior to going on a cruise and we were very disappointed. The hotel was booked through our travel agent and Blue Sky Tours. The hotel is definitely outdated and in dire need of a reface. The room was in need of a good cleaning, the linens were not clean and the pillows were very flat. The bathroom wasn't clean and had to have a crib removed from the small room. Very few electric outlets which made it difficult to charge electronic devices prior to boarding the ship. The two restaurants located adjacent to the hotel are very good.

Stayed here on our way to NY. Nice area to stay in. Shops a 10 minute walk away. Directly opposite the beach. Room a bit out dated but clean and comfortable as really you only need a place to sleep ! Overall would stay there again.

This was the perfect hotel to explore Waikiki for first time - across from lagoon (walled) beaches and easy walks to everywhere. Tiki Grill rooftop bar & restaurant has oceanfront views, music, etc. Towels & chairs provided for beach, and easy walks to stores, groceries, restaurants, super-fancy resorts, etc. Will definitely stay here again and island friends ("locals") were impressed with the view from my room. $32 round trip to/from airport on Speedi Shuttle, so don't fuss with a car (parking $32/night!), just book some tours and enjoy!

Attended a friend's wedding at the Coconut Club on the 21st floor of the hotel and had a great time. The food was pretty good, hotel buffet style but with items that you normally don't find on a typical menu such as bbq ribs, spicy salmon and pineapple fried rice.The room was nice but there was only 1 restroom located in the room (none outside on the floor) so at times we had to wait in line....not a good situation for a private wedding venue.The ceremony and dinner were held outdoors on the balcony and fortunately, the weather was great. The view was amazing and the couple arranged the date to coincide with the Honolulu Festival parade and fireworks display....awesome. The traffic was very jammed because of the street closures due to the parade but all in all it was fine.My biggest gripe was with parking. They only allow valet parking at the hotel and even with validation for the wedding event we paid $12. It was a 4 hour validation for $4 and $8 per hour thereafter....crazy!!

Whilst the hotel is older, it is tastefully presented, with professional staff. Best of all is the location and view. For the price, you'd be flat out finding anything better/cheaper that is on the beach, in the heart of everything, and with amazing views.

Overall a pretty budget experience. If we had planned more than a one night stay I would have made alternative arrangements. Upside the staff were friendly, the room was neat and they gave us a cool welcome gift. The bed was uncomfortable and the linens average. Tiny pokey rooms, you wont fit more than one person in the bathroom at a time. Decor is dated. Brown and bleh sums it up. The balcony had a partial ocean view which was great but the door didn't shut, and therefor it doesn't lock! As for the room door, it looked like someone had tried to pry it open which freaked me out a bit. There was free wifi and DVD rental but overall I felt a bit ripped off considering the cost for the room per night. Money better spent elsewhere.

Staff were super friendly. It was great to have towel and beach chair sign out available! Room was spacious tho a bit older. Great location with lots of shops within walking distance but not soooo busy you feel overwhelmed. Cheap parking at the zoo close by for those that don't want to do the valet thing.

So my family and I recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, It was a nice clean relaxing room, everything went very smoothly from checking in to check out. The staff was very helpful with all are questions and needs. The location was great, we liked walking across the street to the beach. The in room play station was great for watching the free movies they offered. The only problem with this place, was having to leave to go home! Thanks for the memories Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel!!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were especially helpful and friendly. Our balcony overlooked the ocean and the zoo and we had beautiful views. We were able to have drinks by the pool and took advantage of happy hour at the Tiki Bar and Grill. The room was pretty standard, however, the drawback is that there are no chairs (except the ones on the balcony). There is a high table with stools but you can't relax in those. The other drawback (which in no way reflects on this hotel) is the number of homeless people along the beach. We actually observed several relieving themselves right on the sidewalk (bladder and bowels both-eeeww!) I would stay at this hotel again. It was very accommodating.

Nice comfortable bed and although the room was a little outdated it was neat and clean. Great shower spray with nice daily bath amenities were a plus. Nice ocean view room on the 17th floor with outdoor balcony including chairs to enjoy the view. The restaurants downstairs were very nice with good food and drinks. Also live entertainment at the bar. Good location because the hotel was at the end of the street, away from most of the crowds.
user_name:
Nancy B
Port Saint Lucie, Florida

review_body: The quality of the hotel has deteriorated since our last visit 5 years ago, the hotel is showing its age. The furniture is beat up, the bath are really dated along with the carpet. You now pa an amenity fee which I know is common among all hotels now to jack the rate for discounts, but you really need to give something more than what you give in return. The Aston Waikiki Beach used to have a free continental breakfast, which is one reason for staying, plus the location, not in the heart of Waikiki, but conveniently located close to everything and within walking distance of most attractions such as the zoo and aquarium. More likely than not, this will be our last stay at this hotel unless things change drastically. I will not going out of my way any more to give a thumbs up to this hotel for value, although their staff is excellent and I have nothing but praise for them. Think twice and research what you are looking for before choosing this hotel until they upgrade and offer more for the buck.

Stayed 2 nights pre cruise. excellent location with a fabulous view from our oceanfront room. comfortable bed, nice balcony, welcome package with a reusable shopping bag, deck of cards, fan and sun products was a very nice touch. keurig coffee maker also was nice for morning coffee on the balcony. small bar style fridge and an in room safe were also handy. The room was a bit dated but the bed and linens were comfortable and clean. the housekeeping in the bathroom was not very good, lots of old dirt in the corners and hairs on the wall and tub, looked like they just swished a mop through and change the towels from the last visitor. Another couple were upgraded to a partial ocean view mini suite but it was on the side and had a very small balcony with no room to sit on it. we liked our room better for view/balcony.the pool is small but the pool area very nice with ample seating and who needs a pool when the ocean is right there. the beach is right across the street and there is a swimming area with a wall around it creating a natural pool. for more adventure, the left side of the small pier has a lot of rock and many fish to see for snorkelers. I recommend water shoes as it is rocky on that side and we could see many sea urchins in the rocks. the tiki bar had a good breakfast and happy hour and there are many other good restaurants in walking distance. we would stay here again as it had good value for money compared to others we looked at on the beach

Pros: Very Comfy Bed; strong shower; Tiki Bar restaurant (good food, drinks and entertainment). Ate at Wolfgang Puck on level 1 twice during our stay. Quick access to ABC, Starbucks and the beachCons: Elevator system. We've stayed in hotels before where you punch in your floor number and then it tells you which elevator to use. That wasn't a problem. The first issue was that when we arrived (on level 1), the directions on how to get to the elevators to get to the check in (on level 3) were vague. We noticed that every time we used the elevators on level 1, there were always people there who were confused. Also, even though you could use the elevators to go from level 1 to your room floor, you could not go from your room floor to level 1 without stopping on level 3. If you try, you get a message to stop at the front desk (we thought there was a problem with our key) Mixed: Location. Right across from the beach, but clear at the end by the zoo. Our room. We were told we were upgraded from a partial ocean view, but we were at the end of the hallway and actually walked outside on the 18th floor to get to our room. Spectacular view of Diamond Head and the Zoo from our room door and a nice partial ocean view from our lanai, but it was very windy and this created a wind tunnel whistle though our room door to the lanai door.

Stayed here overnight pre cruise and we're glad for staying only 1 night. We were upgraded from partial view to ocean front. Pretty good location considering the beach is right across the street and there's shops and restaurants nearby. 3 stars only because of the location. The room we had wasn't up to our standard of cleanliness though. We saw a lot of dust by the bathroom wall that looks like its been there for months. The bathroom rug...I wouldn't drop anything in there. And the tub is very clogged so we have to wait for it to drain before the next person can shower, definitely don't recommend having a bath here. King bed had two 'potholes' so we kinda sunk into them and difficult to get comfortable. Glad we booked another hotel (one of the best) post cruise.
user_name:
Norm23
New York City, New York

review_body: Too busy and hectic for me. Nice location if your young and free. The Tiki Bar and Grill was interesting. The elevators are very different. To me, too much confusion. Lots of shops and restaurants around the area

I read many of the reviews here and wasn't sure what to expect. I'm on my 3rd week here (for work, rough life, I know), and am very pleased with the hotel, my room, amenities and customer service. The hotel is dated, but so are the majority of hotels in Waikiki. The Aston is at the end of Waikiki near the zoo, which makes it a bit more quiet. My favorite bar is right around the corner. I've walked around the area at all hours and never felt unsafe. The staff at the Aston are amazing. Very friendly and very helpful. The few issues I did have, someone was knocking at my door to fix the problem within a few minutes. Oh, and the hotel is right across the street from the beach! I highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel room was clean and in good condition. Would agree it was a 3 star. Staff was very helpful. The hotel is right across the road from the ocean and within walking distance of many restaurants. One drawback is the $32 a day charge for valet parking. No where on the website does it mention this. This is the highest in the area. My recommendation, if you have a rental park at the pay lot by the zoo. It is $1.00 an hour and you can update the time on your cell, if needed. It is just around the corner from the hotel and you only have to pay for the time the car is parked. Although we are not pool people, the one at this hotel was pretty pathetic, small and right in front of the checking desk. We did not see many people using it.

This hotel is across the street from the beach with beautiful views if ocean view room is chosen. I had requested ocean view but with accessible bathroom When we got there the room had the accessible bathroom but not a ocean view. We spoke to two ladies at the front desk who said they first met the accessible requirement and they don't have accessible rooms with ocean views, which seems strange. Being that our need is basically easy to get into tubs and we were paying for ocean view, we decided the ocean view was more desirable and that we would deal with the tub. The registration clerks were very helpful and changed our room immediately. They are great employees. The rooms have Keurigs which is nice. But they only supply the cups for the machine with coffee. As usual with all hotels I stay in, I have difficulty getting tea. The hotel did not have Keurig cups with tea which do exist. And there are also hot chocolate cups for kids etc. which I assume are also not available at the hotel. I brought my own tea and a apparatus to heat the water it as I always do. I did call down and ask and they said the Keurig made hot water and they would send up tea bags. They did do that but only green caffeine free tea bags with no other selection. Many of us drink black tea so I still supplied my own. I would suggest the hotel purchase the Keurig cups with tea for those that request it. There is a over $25 a day charge for amenities. It could easily pay for tea. I know this is a minor problem but when paying for a hotel of this caliber, my expectation are not unrealistic. 2 restaurants in building, many nearby which is a very nice feature.

Highly Recommend, it's a beautiful hotel overlooking the beach of Waikiki it's central to the Main Street, easy to get to local shops and bus stop is right out side - very convenient! Has its own local shop downstairs and food outlets, has its own reasturant near the pool so cocktails by the pool is a MUST. The beach is literally right across the road & has its own outdoor pool. My service from the hotel staff was very good they are very helpful and friendly, great that they hold your bags and automatically take them to your room when check in is ready, they also give you a beach bag and sun protection goodies in a reusable quality zipped bag this was an awesome bonus!! Would definitely stay here again, my first experience of Hawaii was in this hotel brings back good memories!! Mahalo to the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel ❤️

We stayed here recently for 1 night before our cruise, the hotel is not modern, but was clean & tidy. Most importantly the lifts worked. Was close to transport & shops, the beach was across the road. Would stay here again.

Hotel is well staffed with excellent people, always freindly, helpful in every department, From the front of the house to the back, wonderful courteous service and with big smiles.Accomodations are really nice with an added touch of a complimentary beach bag with goodies.It does have some different ideas, like in the lobby you get to choose from a kiosk free movies and games to play in your room. Also, the elevators on one side only go up one floor and on the other side it goes to the top, there are escaltors for the first floor.The views from our rooms were spectacular overlooking Queens Beach so overwhelming..

Stayed one night, the room was small although it had a great ocean view. Furniture was old and room needed an update. Lobby and Tiki restaurant were very nice. Restaurant had awesome food and great views.

My wife and I stayed here in August of 2011. Our room was on the 17th Floor Ocean Front. The view was spectacular!!! Sleeping at night was wonderful. Several nights we had to close the balcony door because it was very cool. This is a prime location for Waikiki, however be forewarned the beggars and hawkers are immediately outside the hotel waiting to pounce, selling and pan handling. Its an old hotel and well used, however we had no cleanliness and/or service complaints. We basically utilized the hotel for sleeping and not for planning any excursions. We rented a car for that and parking is extra. Overall its a good hotel for a short visit to Honolulu when dining out for all meals and doing the big money tourist thing. Waikiki beach is literally across the street and walking to eat and shop is convenient.

The hotel was ok. Didnt blow me away by any means. Bed was decent, a/c was cold. And right across from the beach. Problem is waikiki in general. What i didnt realize or expect is its a big city. Like a million people that live on the island plus the tourists. Which means the beach is always crowded, so are the side walks. Tons of loud traffic and bums every where asking for cigerettes or money. I dont like seeing a buncha dirty stinky bums the entire time on vacation. The food in waikiki is rather expensive and a 3 outa 10 as far as tastyness. I wouldnt go back. Not because of the hotel, just oahu is over developed and not what i thought it would be

Perfectly nice. Not the fanciest, but clean and well-appointed. Lovely gift bag of expensive sunscreen and such, free beach towels and chairs to use during your stay, free DVDs (like Redbox). The Tiki restaurant is very fun too.

I was not very impressed with this hotel. It is VERY dated and old. This hotel needs a MAJOR renovation and update! The bathrooms have mold in the caulking and rusty screws holding up the fixtures. Parking at this hotel is $32 PER DAY! This is ridiculous! We would not recommend this hotel and I would not stay here again.

We chose this hotel because you were right across the street from the beach and it was close walking distance to basically anything you need and want to go to. The furthest we walked was too Goofy Cafe which was about a 20min walk in beautiful waikiki. Also compared to the price to other hotels this one fit into our budget as we were doing a 3 week honeymoon.With saying that. I called a day ahead to notify it was our honeymoon needing 1 bed and we would be arriving late because of our flight. No biggie. We get there at 11pm check in and we get to our room (which was nice) and we get 2 double beds....I called down and they were nice enough to switch our rooms that night to a room with a king size bed. This room was much more dated, smaller and right next to the cleaning staff's room - as you could imagine was very loud at times. We sucked it up because really we hardly spent any time in there. But not very enjoyable while we were there.Then as we were leaving to catch our next flight 5 days later the housekeeping staff was picketing right in front if the exit of the hotel!!!! We actually had to call our cab back for them to pick us up on the street.

Location is down at the east end of the Waikiki strip, close to the zoo. It is "on the beach" like other hotels on the strip. Very friendly staff and the hotel provides all the "normal/standard" amenities. The rooms, however, are in dire need of renovation. The hotel is showing it's age and could use a fresh coat of paint, new carpets and improved room furnishings. There are much better locations that have invested in a more modern and up to date stay along the strip.

Spent a few days here with my wife on our honeymoon. Our room had a great view of the beach. The room itself was smaller than average but we were very close to the beach. We were able to walk to many good restaurants and shops near our hotel and really only used our car for longer day trips to the north shore, etc. I was not impressed by the $25 per day resort fee and the $30 per day valet parking fee.

This trip was a combined business trip and a family vacation. We had an "Aloha Suite" on the 22nd Floor, with a king bed and a queen-sized pull-out couch for our family of 4 (2 adults, a 12 year old and a 10 year old). The room was plenty large enough for our family and the view was spectacular. The only downside was the bathroom was a bit dated and smallish. The valet parking was easy (call down from the room first), the pool was good, and the towels / beach chairs were easy to secure. The hotel provided folding canvas beach chairs to use on Waikiki beach - just check them out and then bring them back. This was a high-end touch we were not expecting at the hotel. The hotel is an easy walk to lots of businesses up and down Waikiki. If you have a car (we did), there is a Safeway grocery store and a boat-load of good restaurants nearby. The only issue we had was parking around the places we wanted to go (not the hotel's problem though). The hotel elevators took a full 2 days to get used to - you'll see when you get there. They are not like other elevators we have used in the U.S., Europe, nor Asia.The staff at the hotel was perfunctory. Nice enough, but they never really went out of their "swim-lanes". The "Tiki Bar" - the restaurant at the hotel - was good. Their prices for morning coffee and iced tea were in-line with mainland prices, and early a.m. staff was really nice.All in all, we can suggest this hotel for a family stay - especially if you want to be near Waikiki beach.

I stayed in this hotel for two nights for a staycation since I had a friend visiting from out of town. I was checked in by Chris who was very nice and pleasant to talk to even though they were clearly always busy at the front desk! We were upgraded to an ocean view suite and the views were amaazinnnng & the room was super clean! I had the pleasure to talk to the supervisor Stefa during my stay as well and I can't say enough things about how great she is at providing top notch customer service. Also, the valet staff was very organized and always had the biggest smiles on their faces while saying hello.Thanks again Waikiki Beach Hotel! I will recommend to others & will be back to stay.

Came here for an anniversary staycation. Got the kama aina rate but still cost over $200/ night with tax for a partial ocean view room.The walls are thin. Heard conversations of three next room through the wall.The bed was BAD. I slept 4-5 hrs at a time and had to get up and walk around in the middle of the night before getting back to bed. The center of the bed is a peak, two valleys on each side. The room is miatly clean. Did have two cockroaches on our last day. The hotel is old and needs a major renovation. The shower surround inserts out in yrs ago are showing their age, fresh paint doesn't hide imperfections ad's there was a slight musky smell.Staff was nice and the location is great but that doesn't make up for the poor condition of the hotel our bed.

I had high hopes for this hotel since most of the reviews i read were positive. BUT its very average. Rooms are on the smaller side. Could use some grout and cleaning in the bathrooms. Room walls had a few small stains here and there. Front lobby is lackluster and staff are unenthusiastic.But its across the street from the beach!Long and short: if you're there to party, shop, go sight seeing and not spend much time in the hotel, its the place for you.If you plan to relax inside, if you like enjoying hotel deckor and are a stickler for cleanliness, you may need to skip this one.Average hotel, higher price range, on the beach.

In July of 2016 my wife and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki hotel. We reserved the ocean front room Hawaiian saver package. Upon arriving we were charged 30$ a night parking, which was a little steep. But it is reasonable compared to garages in the area. The hotel itself was amazing. Our view was one we will never forget and perfect setting for a honeymoon. We would watch the sun set on the veranda and watch it rise a few times as well. The hotel is directly across from Waikiki beach and a short trip to the zoo where watched a cool luau. The staff is awesome! We had a wifi problem and the maintenance person ( didn't catch his name) was very cordial and did a jig for us to keep us entertained as he worked lol. The downstairs bar has great food and delicious mai tais! While we stayed hawaii 5-0 even shot a scene from our hotel lobby! Overall cool hotel and best rate around!

Pretty spendy for what it is, but that's what you get in Waikiki. Room was clean, but it is outdated. Staff is nice, especially the bell staff. The pool is tiny, and I didn't see a hot tub. Location is good if you are looking for a place on Waikiki. Overall completely mediocre.

Although in a great location, the hotel is in need of an upgrade.Rooms were cleaned daily but not to a very good standard meaning that were was a lot of left over dust and dirt build up in both the room and bathroom.The bathroom is in really in need of updating - our shower head was a bit rusted.Front desk staff was friendly and so was the staff at Tiki's bar but it would have been good if we could charge meals and drinks to the room instead of having to pay separately.Being directly across the road from the beach and a 10 minute walk from the main action was good.

We stayed here after a Hawaiian Cruise, family of 4. We booked an Oceanfront Select room and were lucky enough to be upgraded to the Makai Suite. The room was enormous with lounge, dining, bedroom and 2 full bathrooms. It was a nice room but very dated with poor air conditioning. We selected this hotel because we stayed here after a cruise 11 years prior, sadly not much with the hotel has changed in that time and is in real need of some renovations.The location of this hotel is the real draw card and given the prices in Hawaii, it provides value for money. The views from our balcony were outstanding and it was a great place to relax after a big day. The staff were very friendly and with Waikiki beach directly across the road, an abundance of restaurants close by, and the trolley car stop right out the front, this makes for a great place to stay. Just don't expect a 5 star resort and you will not be disappointed.

We enjoyed 4 nights here prior to a cruise of the islands. The room safe was nice to have and the mini frig was good. Air conditioning worked well but the building could use some up-dating. There is a burger king about a block away and a McDonald's 2 blocks away. We ate at the Tiki lounge twice, i would recommend the calamari and the ribs. There are beach towels you can borrow from the pool area and the beach is easy access rate across the street. We did the Discover Hawaii pearl city tour, would highly recommend,they provide the timed pass for the USS Arizona Memorial, they pick you up at the hotel and return afterwards. Also did Germaine's Luau, they also will provide transportation. We also snorkeled Hanauma Bay with Fun Hawaii, great deal snorkel gear and transportation $12.50/pp. Lots to do in the area, would shop around for better deal. JMO.

We stayed in an oceanfront room for 8 days. Upon arrival, check in was quick and pleasant. The room we received had two double beds instead of a king. I called down to the front desk and they said they could move us the following night into a king room. We decided not to just because we didn't want to repack our stuff and move. The room is more dated than the pictures look on the website. It appears a lot of the Waikiki beach hotels are dated, but this one had good prices. The pool was very small and the sun only shined on it after two in the afternoon. The bathroom was VERY dated, and I knew when I saw it the reason it wasn't shown on the website. The beds were very comfortable and the AC worked reasonably well. The mini fridge's handle was broken and one of the trays were too, but it worked. Don't think I would stay here again only because we would book a vacation rental in the North Shore area. Great location though! Plenty of restaurants and places to visit within walking distance.

This tired hotel was booked for us by our travel agent - a disappointing experience.Dated in every way with no redeeming features except for the location. Appallingly slow check in service - unbelievable!! All guests had to stand in line and wait for at least 30 minutes before being served - only to find the checkin process itself was equally slow. Woeful! We were advised that we had been given an upgrade - but I would suggest that this is said to all guests to stop them complaining about the standard of the hotel rooms. Bed linen and towels of very average quality and size. Small awkward bathroom. The Oceanside view room (which we had booked) overlooked the pool deck and Waikiki beach - nice view. Very small balconies with 2 chairs. No security on balcony door - easy for balcony-hoppers (thieves) to gain access to your room. Balcony door locks showed signs of having been tampered with. A safe in the room.Nicely located close to beachfront, parkland and outdoor shopping strips. A nice free gift pack of sunscreen and after sun lotion in a small makeup bag.We did not eat any meals at this hotel.Very confusing lifts in this hotel - weird!A long and busy drive from the airport.An expensive very-dated hotel - with prices that don't match the standard of accommodation. ABC shops nearby to pick up all the tourist essentials, water, food items etc.

This hotel is bare minimum but the location is amazing right across from the beach they provide with beach towels and chairs and an amity for sun protection. Location location and location is perfect with this hotel. Check in is slow a lot of customers and even though they have adequate staff check in is still slow. Rooms are not modern so be aware of that. Nice place to stay on a budget.

Directly across the street from Waikiki Beach (Waikiki Wall area). Easy to locate as building is circular. Hotel provides beach towels on request. Two elevators so not too much waiting time. Rooms could do with an upgrade, but are OK size and clean. Good supply of towels. Good water pressure and hot water. Plenty of drawer space for clothes. Daily cleaning service and polite friendly staff.Walking distance to everything in Waikiki. Eggs 'n Things just outside reception and elevators. Easy walk (3-4 minutes) to bus stop, Zoo and aquarium.Easy access from airport (bus 19/20 Waikiki Beach Hotels - $2.50 OW) and to Ala Moana Center.**** Be aware of the daily amenity fee. It provides 'free' WIFI and DVD rental. It's overpriced, but almost all of them are******I recommend this hotel if you want to spend the day at the beach and walk to your room in a matter of minutes. Not a lot of frills, but the basics are there, it's clean and it's reasonably priced (for Honolulu).

The location is right across the street from the beach and near a traffic light to help with crossing. Room is clean. Elevator is fast and efficient. Located close to site for car rental and also has trolley stop in front.

The location, we had a room with ocean view, the view, the staff, pool, and restaurant were all great. However the room furnishing were old and tired, the bed however was very comfortable. The bath needs a total renovation. If the room and bath were updated this would be a 5. The hotel is just across the street from the beach and close to many restaurants stores and things to do

This hotel is right across the street from beautiful Waikiki beach. It has a nice pool area, a small gift shop, coffee shop, and restaurant. We had our breakfast at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant and it was very good. Within walking distance to all Waikiki attractions and restaurants.

The location is great - right across Waikiki Beach and walking distance to most restaurants... very short walk to the zoo. The hotel however i very old and and tired, for the money I paid for it, about $280 per day plus $25 per day "amenities fee" is too expensive for a hotel with very old rooms, tiny swimming pool and a gym no bigger than a standard room with not much machines in it. You could hear the room above you flushing their toilets. Also in the foyer on street level on most days you could smell the sewer. Yuck! Will I recommend this hotel? No.

The hotels location was great, super close to Waikiki Beach and a wide variety of good restaurants and cafes. The view was also really great (can definitely recommend sitting on the balcony and relax).Though the location was great, i was not all too happy about the hotel. The hotel cleaning personal was often late (sometimes as late as 5:30 PM). The Wi-Fi not to good either, only 4 elevators to a 30-storage building (with no acces to stairs at all). The pool was fine, but a little small and not deep enough to swim probably. The hotel also felt a little old and not super-well maintained, i would have liked it to be a little bit more modern (this also includes the need for a dishwasher in the kitchen).I would say it is a fine hotel, can also recommend it, but if you want a more luxury hotel, this is not the way to go.

If you enjoy loud whistling wind noise, this is the place to be. Wind was so noisy on the 24th floor, we asked to be moved. They moved us to the 10th. On the way there, the elevator got stuck. Once settled in our room, we could hear the noise from the Tiki bar below. Then the wind noise started and continued all night. Even my earplugs didn't help. The suite is in need of updating. Tiles are mismatched and the grout is dirty. The shower aso whistles during a shower. I complained on checkout and sent the management an email asking for compensation since this was the most expensive hotel we've ever paid for and we had high expectations. We've heard nothing. We have advised our travel agent who will advise Norwegian Cruise Lines since this is the hotel they book you into upon arrival to Honolulu. Hawaii is so beautiful but the aston Whistler Hotel detracted from our visit.

Awesome place to say, hotel has all the amenities but some rooms are a little oldGreat location right on Waikiki beach with a good pool and bar/restaurant on siteFriendly staff, very helpful and from our experience reasonably priced

Uncomfortably small room. There was so little room that one of the double beds was pushed against the wall. That meant that one person had to crawl over the other to get out of bed. We were supposed to have an ocean view but the only way to see the beach was to go out on the balcony and look between two buildings. The balcony was so small it only had room for one small chair. Everything in the room was very outdated and not very clean. The air conditioning didn't work.Customer service was terrible. I paid for 3 adults in the room. We only got 2 pods of coffee. I asked for more since we had 3 people and the desk clerk told me only 2 coffee per day. How cheap can they get.The food at the Tiki was terrible. We had 3 different meals and not one of us finished our meal because it was so bad. Remember to add $32 a day for parking and a $25 resort fee per day to the cost of the hotel.

First time to Hawaii and we stayed at the Aston - location was great as it was directly across the road from the beach and a short walk to the centre of town. The room was not very big but we only really used it for sleeping so it didn't make a difference. Staff was very helpful with anything we asked or needed. Room was clean and had a view to the beach was great. Would recommend others to stay here,

I loved the layout of our room, very spacious. We faced the mountain side and the whole back of our hotel and bedroom faced it. Beautiful view of the mountains at night. The kitchenette was perfect for what we wanted. The carpet in our room and the hallway seemed rather worn. Ideally located, 2 blocks from the beach. Kind of windy though, especially near the and pool which was cold. Because of the wind, not very much protection for BBQ'ing. But other than that, staff were nice and helpful.

I think the thing that was the best about this hotel was the location. It is just a walk across the road from the beach, and a short walk from the centre of Waikiki. We had a partial ocean view room and the view was great. The rooms are clean, though not very spacious, but the only time we were in it was when we were sleeping so it didn't matter. The pool is not very big, but there is no need for it when the beach is right across the road. Tikis bar and grill was great, we especially liked the live entertainment. Overall a good hotel to stay in if you plan on spending your days getting out and about.

Let me be honest at first I was not that impressed with the Aston. It has a beautiful location right across from the beach and even the rooms furthest from the beach have some view of the beach. The pool on the elevated deck was nice, but seemed small for so many rooms. The truth is with the beach across the street nobody uses the pool. It has a very nice restaurant that needs a better menu. The room seemed average and the parking fees seemed high and the amenity fee seems high and worthless unless your going to spend your time in the room watching movies and playing video games. However, every hotel in Honolulu has pretty much the same fees. Here is what rates them very good they have a great staff that is geared to making your stay the best experience possible and when they fail at some point the go to great lengths to correct it and make it right. After you're stay they have a survey that doesn't just pay lip service but takes corrective action. If they continue to improve I hope my next stay deserves an excellent, but for now., like MacArthur said "I shall return".

All in all the hotel was nice enough. And of course the location can't be beat. But our room was two doors down from the Coconut Room (party room on 21st floor) and there was a wedding reception going on! Their door to the hallway was propped open and it was very loud with music and people talking and cheering! We closed the door several times but they kept opening it. People also gathered loudly in the hallway outside our door. Certainly no bad feelings toward the partiers.....it was a wedding and they deserved to party. But these rooms should never be just steps away from rooms where hotel guests are trying to sleep!

This hotel was good. Not great. Not bad. But pretty good. Especially when you account for the price. Rooms are clean and have nice TVs and PlayStation 3s in them, but who comes to Hawaii to look at television screens? The hotel offers free DVD and game rentals in the lobby. Location right on the beach and walking distance from the shopping district is awesome! The pool is medium sized and there are lots of nice beach chairs but with the ocean and beach so close why wouldn't you go there? No hot tub. The staff is friendly and the hotel restaurant serves good food and drinks (although a bit spendy) and sometimes has live music. Note that there is no self parking. You can have your car valet parked for $32 in the hotel parking garage or you can drive a couple blocks away from the beach and park for yourself in a garage for $20 for 24 hours, which is what we did. Overall a good hotel to stay at.

The hotel was rated a 3 1/2 star property on Priceline, but it was closer to a 2 1/2 to 3 at best. The rooms, I stayed in two, are dated and in need of renovation. The first room had a slow drain, and a sagging shower curtain rod that caused the shower curtain to slide open. The second room had a faucet that was tricky to get into the off position. Both rooms had relatively comfortable beds, always a plus, but the entire decor was drab and looked like a throwback to the 1980's. The lighting didn't help brighten up the place because it was too dim.It had a small refrigerator, and a Keurig one cup coffee maker, which is nice, but you only got 2 coffee pods per day, no tea. There's also a game/DVD player and you can get free rentals from machines in the lobby.The location directly across from the beach is fabulous. Their "Tiki" rooftop lounge is a wonderful place to watch the sunset. The drinks are expensive, as is the bar food menu, but not too bad. You don't feel gouged, and it's the price you pay for the lovely show that is Waikiki Beach.I would give this property a higher rating if I thought it was a good value for the price I paid, but they also charge a $25 per day resort fee, and if you don't want to have to scramble to look for parking, the valet-only parking is $32 a day, plus a tip for the attendant. So, it ends up being fairly pricey for a pretty drab property.

Location is terrific. Service is slow but the staff are all very nice. The whole place is outdated and could stand refurbishing.There are no chairs in the room. there are two outdoor chairs on the balcony .The bed is comfortable and the room was clean with lots of towels.One of the very few hotels right on the beach with this kind of view that you can afford.If you need fancy this is not your place .Restaurants,shops and ABC store close by .Great beach and people watching from balcony

Loved this location. The rooms and bathroom was Clean room. We got a king sized bed and it's was thankfully very clean and comfy. We didn't eat here; instead walked around Waikiki for food. The hotel Staff was super friendly. The pool is only meh. So we just walked across the street to the beach and it's one of the best beach spots on the island for little kids. We had a side back room and still had nice view of the ocean. Price was good for the location. I would stay here again.

We spent a week here over Christmas. Although I was not blown away, we had a great experience. The location is literally across from Waikiki on the main drag. Our rooms were clean and spacious, beds were super comfortable and they managed to get us adjoined rooms. They have beach towels that you check out and even a few beach chairs. We were within walking distance of all pickups for our excursions. They had a complimentary christmas trolley to see the honolulu lights which was so greatly appreciated - what a great time! Cons: the elevators were slow and you have to pay for valet to park there ($30 per day) and of course there is a resort fee, but that is to be expected. If you want a great place to eat - Tiki's is it - we ate all 3 meals on 3 different days. I would stay again!

Great hotel with amazingly friendly staff... they all god out of their way to help you. TJ TJ at reception was amazing, Kaena from the tour section was FANTASTIC!!! Both true locals that know what they are talking about and always gave honest advice! Kaena made amazing suggestions that we loved and anytime we had a question or anything he was more than happy to help! Thank you for making our trip so amazing!!!

Good service and friendly staff . Rooms on the small side. First room had a leak from the ceiling . Moved to second room which had a locked adjoining door to another room , but it was very thin and you could hear other couples conversations !! I think there was a blocked drain on garage level as there was a constant sewage smell at the elevators . Don't think we will visit this hotel again.

Just as in past years, we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for the Honolulu Marathon. We sorely miss the breakfast at poolside where we can gather with our friends also staying here to commiserate or congratulate each other. The free paper is a plus because it's so easy to forget to keep up with what's going on around you. Look for the Kamaaina Package for savings.
