The front desk staff were very efficient and helpful - yes, there was the dreaded check in line in the afternoon. Beds were comfortable and we got great sleep before and after the marathon. Having a pasta restaurant in the hotel was great for pre-marathon meals too. Having a HagenDaaz makes for super post marathon treats. Definitely looking forward to staying here again.

Oceanfront room is awesome and has a great view. Tikis is always fun with good food and live music. Wolfgang Pucks is also great for a quick bite. The hotel also gives a free beach bag filled with some great products! The only downfall was that the air conditioning did not work and when we told the hotel staff about it, nothing was done. Overall though it was a very pleasant stay.

We stayed here for six nights. The hotel staff was very welcoming and friendly throughout our stay. The Restaurant Tiki serves delicious food but is rather on theexpensive side.The room was exactly as shown in the pictures and we received a welcome gift! I mean you cannot go worng with a welcome gift right? Free very fast Wifi, free movie rental and ps3 games! The location was absolutely perfect! you hear the waves when you get up in the morning. We had a ocean view room and asked at check - in if we could have one with balcony. He said he couldn't say for sure but would try to get us one. We got a balcony and I think that was very nice. We didn't have breakfast, so I can't say anything about that.The bathroom wasn't fancy but well equipped and clean.

First of all I'd like to thank them for not giving our room away with 2 nights deposit as the Aston monarch did in January 2011 when I had advised them we were arriving late and put it into their system. They then put us into the banyan which looks like it hasn't been updated since 1988 when we first came as kids. Same goes for the Aston Maui Lu that cancelled our reservation and never sent any notification they'd done so. We got to Maui for 6 days and found out we had no room. This was in February 2011. The location is right across from the beach. Service at the desk was very friendly. When I had trouble returning a DVD rental, the staff was very helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Tiki bar is located on property and is a good place to dine. Trolley pick up is located here and same goes for shuttle to the outlets. Good location to shops and restaurants too. Very helpful booking a spot on the shuttle for the outlets too. Let us take towels for the beach and snorkelling too. Close to the zoo, other shops and restaurants down the street, and aquarium. Computer stations are on the second floor as well as activities concierge booths. Very nice stay and great staff and very good location.

I'll start with what's good about this hotel- the location is good and it's walking distance to all the shopping. although not on the beach, it's across the main street from the beach. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is very dated and has not had any recent updates. The rooms are not the cleanest, the bathroom tile floor is dirty in the corners probably never been deep cleaned. The pool is very small and is located in a very strange location almost part of the main lobby and pathways. The rooms that are advertised as "ocean View" many of them are not really, you have to go out on the small balcony and look sideways to see the ocean. Otherwise all you see is the hotel next door.

We stayed here 1 night when we flew in before we drove to the North Shore. The room was really nice (more modern than the photos shown on here). The view we had from the balcony was amazing. We looked down Waikiki Beach. The gentlemen down the bottom of the hotel were very helpful with dealing with our bags and holding them. The only issue we had with the hotel was the fact we were double charged for the room. We had booked online through a 3rd party and when we gave our CC over for the security deposit we were charged again for the room by the hotel rather than them charging the 3rd party. It took awhile to clear the matter but they eventually refunded the money to us. Would stay here again. The location was amazing.

We were in Maui just last year and our stay was at the Sheraton Maui on Black Rock with an oceanfront room so our standards may have been a little high to begin with but we planned our trip around hiking the Haiku Stairs in Oahu after finding out that the Sheraton was completely booked up. I unfortunately didn't do as much research as I did for our last trip and I booked during Black Friday weekend in a rush since everything seemed to be booked. So Aston Waikiki is what we decided on which looked fine online for the price but definitely was a change from our last hotel stay. The hotel is old with a small pool. Valet fee is pretty high but they are very quick to get your car out. You're not really ocean front as the main road is in front of you with the tiki bar below. It starts to get quiet around midnight where all you'll hear are the homeless people randomly yelling and smoking what appeared to be crack? Meth? Who knows...my husband got it on video when he was positioning his camera to do a couple time lapses late one night on the balcony. Check in was easy, the elevator system is a bit annoying as there's no direct way from your floor to the first level so we'd have to get off at the lobby then walk through the wet areas by the pool and then down the stairs. There are elevators but every time we'd swipe our cards it would keep saying to see front desk. The room and bathroom felt dirty to me, outlets are non existent or hidden behind the curtain and dresser which are then covered in dust. There's no microwave nor is there room service which I feel should be one or the other. The walls felt paper thin where we could hear everyone next to us. What really set me off was their printer being down for days, I needed a voucher printed and one front desk woman had me send it to her email to print out, perfect. 2 days later I ask another front desk person to print another voucher and apparently they had a meeting where it's not protocol to do that. BUT apparently it's totally normal and protocol to have a damn broken printer for multiple days with no damn solution in sight. Slow cleaning service as well. Came back in the afternoon and our room hadn't been touched yet, we just grabbed towels and toilet paper from the cart down the hall. Will I ever stay here again? Hell no. Would I recommend this place to my friends or family? Hell no. I'm here until Saturday and the experience has been below average. If you want to be in the heart of busy Waikiki with ocean views but not really being ocean front and don't plan on being in a dirty room/bathroom for long periods of time and don't mind having any amenities stay here. If not pay a little more and go somewhere else. I didn't think having access to your own little strip of beach was so important until we came here and saw how busy it is everywhere. Countdown to Maui next year starts now.

Good hotel. Pool is cold, music playing down by pool goes until late into the night, so ocean view rooms will hear this. Service was great. Secure as you need room key to use the elevators to go to rooms. Parking is available as valet only for $30/day

The hotel has a great location with spectacularly views. All the staff went out of their way to help make our stay fantastic. We had one instance with the room that could have been a big problem (the bathtub in the room above was left on and overflowed which ended up flooding in our room) The maintenance and front desk staff took great care of us and got us moved to new rooms with even bettrr views! We can't wait til our next visit!

We booked this hotel last minute so many hotels I would have normally selected were not available over the holidays (I typically stay in 4 or 5 star hotels). Similar to other reviewers, this hotel is conveniently located on Waikiki Beach (towards the end next to zoo) and right across the street from the beach. It's clean and basic. Dated and tired. It's like one of the Las Vegas hotels that get high use/turnover - and you can tell. Pool area was okay; meets basic needs. But it really didn't matter because the beach was right across the street. The $25 daily resort fee covered the towels and chairs to use on the beach; another feature that my kids enjoyed was the ability to check out DVD movies to play in room. For people with families, this is a convenient feature for bedtime. The hotel staff were nice but not as friendly as other Hawaii hotels I've stayed in. There's a balcony but no chairs to sit on.All in all, for the price point, it met our needs and we had a great time enjoying Hawaii. Who stays in their hotel anyway?

The Aston is by no means a luxury hotel, but if you want clean accomodation right in the heart of Waikiki, then the Aston will suit you. It is clean, but the decor is quite dated. The overall feel is quite 1970s, which we really liked. However the bed was extremely comfortable, which is the most important. We had a balcony with sea view. So awesome and high up that we both had vertigo! The pool doesn't get a lot of sun, but you don't need a pool when Waikiki beach is a few steps away from the hotel. A Starbucks and an ABC convenience store are located directly below. No room service - but Lulus next door has good food. We also walked to Diamond ahead for spectacular views of Waikiki (some fitness required) plus a short walk to Leonard's, the best bakery in Oahu. We hired a convertible Jeep and drive around the island. I highly recommend a meal at the Cheesecake Factory. You will have a long wait, but it is the best food I've ever had! The cheeseburger place is also a very good feed. Give Dukes a miss - overrated tourist crap.

The staff were friendly in a great spot opposite the Duke statue and Waikiki beach but the hotel is very tired. Needs new furniture and carpets. Very expensive considering how old it was! The location was the best part about this hotel, beds were ok, linen adequate.

Traveled from London in September, read good and bad reviews but we had a great time here , great location , fantastic views over Waikiki beach from our 16th floor balcony, paid for partial view room but it was an awesome view !Clean and well run hotel , friendly and polite staff,, could do with a refurb as a bit dated but did nt spoil what was a fantastic holiday on a wonderful Island .would recommend at this budget

Great location, great hotel, lovely lovely staff, really helpful, friendly and happy. Room was comfortable, clean and convenient, we only stayed 2 night but could have stayed longer. We were on 6th floor which was 3 floors above the bar/Restaurant but this wasn't too loud at all. Hotel is opposite beach and a good position for the Diamond Head walk, also lots of shops near by, very close to the main shopping malls.

My family and I stayed here for 6 days over Christmas. The rooms were clean and the hotel staff was friendly and attentive. Just be aware that at the end of your stay you will be given a bill aside from your room bill. This bill is for amenities. It does not matter if you used any amenities or not. We were given a bill of $144.00 for the available use of free movies, towels for the pool and beach and a few other things. I feel this charge was absolutely ridiculous but what can you do? Aside from that the location was nice but the beach was overcrowded and it is in a very busy part of the city. If you want to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki then this is the place for you. If you want to relax on the beach and feel like you are in the Hawaii they show in the commercials find another hotel. Honestly I'm not sure I would stay there again. I expected much more for the price we paid to stay there.

We had a "partial ocean view" room so I guess we should have realised in advance, but it really is only a thin sliver of an ocean view as long as you lean out from the balcony and look to the right - otherwise your view is of the very close hotel next door and the car park below, and the noise of all the aircon units does not entice you to stay outside for more than a few minutes.The room we had (on the 12th floor) was a little tired but a good size.Apart from that, it is a fantastic location right across the road from the beach.Way too expensive though for what it is - $309/night base price which rises to over $400 once you add on taxes and amenity fee(!) - and that doesn't even include breakfast!!! Actually turned out to be a good thing seeing as Lulu's restaurant is just next door which is fantastic!Luckily we only stayed one night and moved on to the north shore!But still, location is damn good!!

We stayed two nights at this hotel and really loved the location. Close to restaurants, shopping, tour bus pickup stops and the beach. The staff was very helpful. They provide beach chairs and nice beach towels. The rooms are not large but adequate. Having a Keurig coffee machine in the room was great. The welcome gift was an unexpected and very nice gift. The restaurant attached was very convenient and had great live music. Would definitely stay again.

$300 plus a night for room looking at roof. Non smoking hotel......guests smoking on decks beside and above us. Resort fees for what 1coffee per person aday pay extra $2 each for bottled water. housekeeping knocking on door @ 8:15 in the morning or not having room cleaned by the time we returned to our room in afternoon. The elevator system is very inconvenient waited at times over 5 minutes to get to lobby. Front desk did not ask about our stay when we checked out and when I voiced my displeasure . Did nothing but hand me a card to write to them. The only positive is the location will never stay here again.

We stayed here right before Christmas. Very clean nice hotel. Directly across from the beach. We had a partial ocean view and it's exactly what you get. The good- directly across from beach, great staff, cleanly, affordable The not so great- the restaurant tiki's we didn't really like the food so much. The happy hour was good from 2-5 every day. Was very expensive for everything else and some of the staff were really bad. The one night the waitress was so bad we were there for 2 hours and saw her twice. She forgot our drinks and ignored our table. The manager brought our drinks as he could see we were annoyed but the rest were great. Maybe she was overworked and busy but she sucked badly. It is an EXTREMELY busy place. Maybe because it was over Christmas but it was soooooo busy so if you want a quiet place to go. I somewhere else besides Waikiki beach haha. There were homeless people everywhere begging for anything And everything. Most were pleasant but some were aggressive. They think because you're on vacation you're loaded. Everything is very expensive. There's a quiet small little place around the corner in an alley that is super cheap for breakfast. Can't eat in there but it's cheap and pretty good. If you want shopping this is the place for you. There are SO MANY places to shop. I've never walked so much on vacation. But it was good! It's very beautiful as well The very badBeach vendors!!! They're in your face ALL THE TIME. You'd think going to Hawaii you'd be free of them but you are not. They yell at you in the street and one even said "I'm not Isis you can talk to me" because we ignored him. Because we'd seen him 50 times and said no thank you. There are daily resort fees of $23 as well on the hotel but we were told about these before. The safe costs money to use it each day. We didn't use it. A tip- buy booze at corner store, the hotel gives you towels and beach chairs just ask at pool, you can actually get drinks at tikis and take them pool side we didnt know this until the last day. There's a sign that says no drinking or eating poolside but this isn't the case It did suck that the pool only got sun after 3pm. But over all great stay!

I stayed here on my birthday for two nights before we left for our cruise. the hotel is really nice and my room was upgraded to a beachfront which was really awesome. I was able to watch the sunrise and sunset and the location was a great place with plenty of things to do. Was in walking distance to the zoo which was right outside of Diamondhead so the view was wonderful. I would recommend this hotel for couples and families.

Pros:Overall, staff were friendly and professional, particularly Mr Tony who responded to calls on maintenance issues in my room (aircond and safe). Housekeeping staff were also very friendly. Kettle was provided upon request.Cons:The carpet in the room felt a bit damped. Aircond wasn't working very well. Would be more comfortable if bedroom slippers were provided. Also, shower cap was not part of bathroom amenities (I noticed that was the case with other hotels as well). Room size was rather small. More table surface space would be nice.

My son and I have been going to Hawaii for the last few years and we stay at this hotel every time because of the location. We stayed at the 25th floor and we had a excellent view of the beach. The rooms as always are nice and clean and cold of course due to the air conditioner. However, the one new thing they had tis time is that the restaurant down stairs now sells breakfast instead of the complimentary breakfast they used to have for free . We ate breakfast and it was good as well. I would recommend anyone to stay here. nice place over all.

I stayed here with a friend and it was my first vist to Hawaii. Check in was easy and the tricky elevators mentioned by some were explained well so not hard at all. Welcome pack was a lovely bonus. The location was awesome. Far enough to be out of the hussle and bussle (our room was super quiet and lovely view of diamond head) but an easy flat walk to be in the heart of it. Heaps of shopping (ABC shop a couple of door down - very handy and the personalised xmas decoration/souvenir shop - a must) and dining options nearby but make sure you go and have a couple of meals and cocktails- (pay a bit extra for the souvenir tiki mug) in Tiki's- yummo! Beach right across the road too. Service tour desks were very helpful and pretty much every tour picks up and drops off right out the front (very handy after going to the factory outlets). Would definately recommend to anyone wanting to stay at Waikiki. Am planning to go back to Hawaii next year and will be staying here again. ☺

Have stayed here a number of times and am happy to recommend this hotel to friends. This is not a fancy/high end hotel but is perfect in many ways ... the location is great (beach is across the street, zoo is around the corner, lots of restaurants and ABC stores close by, easy access to The Bus, the Waikiki Trolley, Kapiolani Park, the aquarium, Diamond Head, etc.), staff are friendly and helpful (front desk, room attendents, maintenance, bell desk), rooms are simple and clean, and the food and atmosphere at Tiki's is great (good live music)! Have stayed at other hotels in Waikiki over the years but definitely prefer the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel :)

The Hotel & the staff were fantastic, the only negative was the daily $30.00 valet fee, Adjoined to the Hotel was Tiki's Grill "Awesome" service & food, Wolfgang Puck Express, "poor food" & LuLu's "bad service", got seated and after 25 minutes and asking 3 times if we had a server coming we left.

It was our first visit to Hawaii and we came to this resort. Great location close to the beach and access to the ABC store (convenience store) , Starbucks, burger king and etc. They have free blu-ray/dvd rentals, free breakfast. However, check-in time took longer than expected and it was tricky to use the key card at first to get in the elevator and to your room but we figured it out. Hotel is clean and room service is everyday. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed for 2 days went to Maui for 5 days then came back for 3 more days.There was quite a delay initially as our rooms weren't ready. Our early morning flight meant we arrived late morning and we waited on the pool patio for probably 1 1/2 hours, tired and wanting to get settled.The 2 rooms were clsan but pretty dated but we had everything we expected, having read reviews before booking.The highlights were: Tiki Restaurant, proximity to the beach and shops, the view on tbe latter part of our stay, good service of our rooms.There are tour booking desks on the 3rd floor and Carmen on the Expedia desk was the most helpful, charming and knowledgeable person we came across. It was a good experience for our first visit to Hawaii.
user_name:
Tina M
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed this hotel with 6 persons.Theroom has 2 bedrooms and bathrooms.And a sofa in living room is able to transform to a bed.This Hotel is located at almost central of Waikiki. There is a Waikiki beach at front of the hotel, you can get there just across a street. McDonald and EggsnThings are neighbors. When we went to the beach, we borrowed towels at the entrance.However, in a day, the elevator had been stopped by electrical matter.we had to climb the stair. It was a hard job :)

Nice view from the balcony easy walk to shops beach good pool area. Helpful staff easy check in & check out. Good bar & cafe at the Aston with plenty awesome options closeby. Good spot to get shuttles for day trips . Good rooms probably needs renovating still very easy to stay here & quiet end of the street.
user_name:
ToniC379
Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The amenity fees were extremely high, and unreasonable, and pretty much covered nothing. A real rip. The rooms had no microwave, a tiny little refrigerator that froze everything you put in it. Not one single chair to sit down and relax in to watch a totally limited amount of stations on the TV. In order to watch TV you have to sit or lie on the bed. They only allowed two coffees per day, when three or four would have been much better. They offered two very small water bottles to use for your coffee, which cost $2 a piece. Rented a motorcycle for 3 days, and they wouldn't allow me to park it. A huge inconvenience, and they rudely said no motorcycles when there were plenty of places out of the way of car parking, and kept asking me what room # I was in, as if they didn't believe I was staying there, or God know what reason for that. A bizarrely high amenity fee of $168 on top of everything. I will never go to this Hotel ever again, it totally was designed to suck every cent of money they could out of you!

Spent 2 days at this hotel. Upon check in we were given a free upgraded room and a free gift basket was waiting for us in the room. Booked Pearl Harbor tour at through the hotel for convenience. Everyone was very nice and the room was extremely clean with a great view overlooking Waikiki beach.

My friend and I were here in November 2016. I had stayed at the hotel next door during my previous visit, and since I wouldn't be returning there, I decided to try Aston Waikiki beach. It is so conveniently close to the ocean, all the shopping and Waikiki life. The lobby is on the 2nd floor, I had made a reservation with a payment to partial ocean view, non smoking room and a request the room to be away from the elevators. There were 3 people working at the front desk and I belive it was David who assisted us to check in and he confirmed my request for a room away from the elevators. We got checked in and took the most confusing yet convenient elevator to our room. The room was literally 7 steps away from the elevator. We got in and all we saw was the next hotel. You had to reach out and peek over to the right to see the ocean at a distance. What a disappointment. We made a call back to the front desk saying that this was unacceptable, as I had requested a room away from the elevator and it is exactly what they gave us. We closed the balcony door to leave the room and all you can hear is wind whistling. No way is anyone able to sleep in a room like that! So the gal at the front desk had prepared the second room for us and we got the keys exchanged and continued to the confusing elevators. Now this room was like an ashtray, it reeked of cigarettes. I had to sign a non smoking waiver threatening fees for smoking in the room, no way were we going to stay here and get second hand smoking cancer and fines for smoking which we didn't do.  November in Hawaii is a slow season, the hotel was no where near full, I didn't understand why they had to play this kind of a game with us. Upon returning to the front desk for the 3rd time, I wanted someone competent to assist us. This time I believe it was a supervisor Michelle, who attempted to show us where the available rooms were at. She suggested a room with a nicer view but again it was next to the elevators. Finally she got an approval to get us into a room, not facing the ocean but with an amazing view to the beach. The rooms are renovated but you can see it is a old building, the balcony doors, bathroom tiles and paint were old, as was the faucet and the shower. Supervisor Michelle called to check in if everything was ok with this room, which was a nice gesture. We stayed for two nights, the bar had a happy hour special for every day. Pool was small and mostly in the shade all day long, but it was clean. The Wolfgang Pucks restaurant had decent breakfast and lunch. And of course there are ABC stores in every corner.Would I stay here again? Most likely not. But it is a good hotel for someone on a budget.

First time we stayed at the Aston. The staff were wonderful, very friendly and helpful. Onsite restaurants had great food and service. Beautiful view of the Ocean from our hotel patio. We will definitely be back,

The hotel's location could not be any more convenient. There is easy access to the beach and to all of the exciting tourist attractions, shopping, and dining. The key card elevator procedure was a little confusing at first. The front desk did not explain how it worked. The rooms were comfortable but a little small. The bathroom is tiny and needed some cosmetic improvements such as paint, tile, etc. The bed was fairly comfortable, a bit on the firm side. However, the pillows were pretty bad. The staff was friendly, except the valet staff wasn't all that friendly. One time it was obvious two men were fighting over who would not go get our car, and once we called 30 minutes ahead, and they didn't have our car out. It was not busy and we were delayed on our way to the airport because of it. The resort fee is pretty ridiculous, but most hotels charge it. It's still a huge waste, in my opinion. Overall, it's a nice place to stay, and I would stay here again. You can find faults most anywhere.

Despite it being the busiest time of year just before hallowe'en, we enjoyed the accomodation after they moved us to a room with a larger balcony and street beach view. We are not used to how the hotels add a service charge to the already charged room cost but I guess when in Rome you do what the romans do, as the saying goes.

I booked this hotel last minute (within 24 hours of staying there) so I was happy to confirm the room at the price I did.The hotel is in a great location, which is the best thing about the hotel!!! You can walk across the street to the beach and are so close to all kinds of shops an restaurants.The room (I was on the 9th floor) was a decent size. The tv was fine and I really enjoyed the fact that there was a coffee maker and mini fridge in the room, these are both great additions to a room.The hotel itself is trying to seem upgraded and modern with fancy elevators, but the room itself could use an upgrade and I'm not talking about new furnishings. The paint was discolored and the bathroom could use an overall makeover as the tiles were dingy and the shower head was very low, about chest height and I am 5'6".Overall, I would stay here again, because the location and convenience of getting in and out.What you need to know:If you really want a view ask for a balcony over the pool, but ask for a higher room to avoid pool noise.Know that you are paying for location and not a fancy new looking room.If you uber to/from this hotel, make sure you enter the address as there is another Aston down the street an it can get confusing.

This hotel might have a good location but it lacks in cleanliness, comfort, and staff friendliness. There is dirt and grime throughout. They also won't guarantee you your bed preference so you might get here expecting a king bed and end up with something much smaller.

Can't complain at all about our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.Me and the wife had an Ocean View Select room on the 25th floor. The view was perfect.This is the second time staying here.We liked it the first time so we decided to go back again. The zoo and aquarium is close by as lots of eating and shopping places also. The wife shopped til I dropped.The room was cleaned every day. Over all had a great time. I recommend this hotel .

We had 2 rooms and we stayed here for 2 weeks. Accommodation was clean and comfortable. We had an ocean front room. Can't fault it. Staff were helpful with any queries we had. Would surely stay here again.

Stayed two nights. Black dirt circle around the entry light switch, the old creaky metal window/slider door howls all day and night from the wind hitting it. The wind under the entry door also howls as window passes through it. Turned on the shower and what looked like dirty water came pouring out at first. The pillow cases look old. The rooms and hotel are old and need a major renovation. I would not stay here again.

We usually stay at the Grand Hyatt, but decided to give Aston Waikiki Beach a try. It was a great overall experience for the money. Our room had an awesome oceanfront view, and was comfortable for two people. The manager left us a nice welcome gift package, with thoughtful things like sunscreen, a beach bag, and snacks. We definitely appreciated it! I was also impressed by the friendliness of the staff - everyone from the valets to the housekeeping staff always smiled and said hello, and seemed to be genuinely warm and welcoming. It was quite a bit less expensive than our usual hotel option in Waikiki.The only downsides were that the AC/fan was very loud and worked inconsistently, the lanai door only opened halfway (not sure why), and there was no table on the lanai for holding drinks/food. Other than that, I'd recommend this hotel as a good budget beach option.
user_name:
Joshua Z
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: My second time in three years at this hotel. It's well located (stroll across the road to the beach) and adequate but looks very tired. Staff were friendly. Tour desk really helpful. Good eating out options very close by.

The hotel is nicely located with ocean view rooms. Our experience was way better expected. Kind and friend employees. In addition there is an amazing restaurant bar near to the swimming pool with awesome singers. Those guys sing any song you wish. Totally great!!! As my daughter said: I wish I could live here.

The location was great. Good access to transport. Just across the road from Waikiki Beach. View from the room was great but the room and cleaning had some issues.As soon as I walked in there was a large wet patch of carpet outside the bathroom door. I complained about it and was told that all they could do was treat the spot with the wet vac and that it would only make it wetter than it was when we complained.The air conditioning wasn't working properly. It was pumping cold air but, the control panel was broken (the screen was completely blank) and couldn't be adjusted. It must have been set to igloo and after putting up with it for 2 days we finally complained. We reported it to the front desk and then went out for several hours only to find that nothing had been done when we come back at 9pm. When we went back to the front desk to complain again we were told that someone would be there in 10 minutes. I told the lady at the desk that a 9 pm I don't want to wait for a technician. At 9 pm I want to go to bed. We waited up for the technician who at 9 pm couldn't do anything anyway. He told as he would replace the control panel the next day. He came back the next day with a control panel he had acquired from another room only to find that it didn't work either and told us that if we were desperate and needed to switch it off that we should rip the control panel off the wall. He organised an electrician for the following day to come and replace the control panel yet again but this time with a new one.I also had to go to reception and request that the waste baskets be emptied when the room was serviced. It wasn't the only cleaning issue we found. I dropped something on the floor and while we were down on the carpet looking for it we found a penny, something that looked like a Malteser and a bottle cap. Also when I went to look out the window the sheer curtain had what looked like a dried booger on it. The bed head had a large black looking stain that appeared to be from someone's greasy head. The room appears tired and outdated perhaps the staff are too.It's such a shame as this place has outstanding potential to be amazing!

We stayed at the Aston for 3 nights while on Oahau. The hotel is older, bu well maintained. It sits directly across the street from the beach. Walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. Since nothing is on the beach side of the street, you have a great view. The Tiki restaurant on sight is also a good. A free gift is in your room and includes a handfan for beach, sunscreen, chapstick, aftersun lotion and a recycle bag for your towel. Downsides: the $30 valet parking, and there is no other choice in parking; very thin towels, low lighing in rooms. For our purpose (staying in Waikiki to tour sights), I would highly recommend.

The Aston hotel was a perfect place to stay very clean all mod cons free wi fi, just across the road from the beach,trolley bus stop outside,good entertainment in the bar e very evening. Well pleased.

We requested an ocean front room and woke up daily to an awesome view! Beautiful! Just a few steps to the beach..A gift of sun products and a beach bag was waiting for us upon checkin. Having fresh beach towels whenever we needed was great. Very friendly housekeeping staff. We have stayed here twice now and would definitely stay again.

We were holding our wedding at the Coconut Club (on level 21) of the hotel so decided to stay at the hotel a few days before the wedding and the night of our wedding. We arrived into Honolulu on an early morning flight and dropped by the front desk to see if any rooms were available. Not expecting anything much. A gentleman by the name of Sean was condescending and rude to my partner as he refused to even listen to him or even answer any questions. He just bluntly told him "I already told you there are no rooms until check in at 2pm". My partner hadn't even opened his mouth at this point. When we finally waited in line at 2pm we tried to ensure that we were not served by Sean. The lady who did check us in was lovely and offered us a complimentary photo frame to commemorate our wedding. Although, while we were waiting in line to be checked in we watched Sean be his same rude self to other guests. We'd highly recommend bringing this to Sean's attention.Our first room was nice and spacious with a partial ocean view (very partial). Then our second suite was large and spacious with stunning ocean views, and a separate living area, perfect for getting ready on our wedding day.The pool is nicely located next to the front desk. Nice way to wind down.James who looks after the front desk overnight was amazing, answering all our queries and accommodating all our requests. He is a superstar and a true asset to the business.FYI, the hotel and Tiki's Bar and Grill (who look after the Coconut Club) are separate entities operating in the same space.They are located on the edge of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. A fair walk to the centre of it all but ideally located right across the road from the beach.Would I stay here again? Probably not due to the location, price (isn't great value compared to what's around Waikiki), and a certain bad taste a staff member has left.

The location and view was great however the room itself was very obviously outdated. I understand the area is fairly humid but I found mold in the closet top shelves about halfway into our stay and was immediately turned off but did not want to ruin my honeymoon by making a huge deal about it since more than likely there was nothing that could be done and we were already unpacked and settled in. The restroom mat that was used to place into the bathtub had black marks which looked like mold and was never changed out. The shower curtain was dirty I saw residue from last users on the rings that keep it onto the shower rod.The walls had random hairs stuck on it in the bathroom which I ended up just leaving alone because I didn't want to touch it. I'm just so happy that I bought disinfectant wipes with me, literally wiped down the entire room. Some of the towels we were given were dirty. The a/c maxed out at 65 which normally is great but it felt muggy and humid in the room thourghout the night so I feel like it would never reach the actual temperature which was extremely annoying. Smell was a little off but I guess that's normal for the age. Paint job for the room mediocrely completed. The 18th floor hallways was never air conditioned but I'm not sure if that applies to all the floors of the hotel. Our very first encounter with an employee at the front desk was immediately underwhelming. I forgot his name, I think it may have been Chris I'm not sure but he seemed very uninterested in being there. I even commented to my husband that I was very surprised how unfriendly the staff was already and I expected an experience way different . So he offered us a "better room" if we waited until 4:30 to check in instead of the original 2pm, so we said sure and went to grab a quick lunch. It might have just been him because when we returned to do our check in later on at 430 and Michelle was so much friendlier and helpful Even though our room wasn't ready until a little past 5. Housekeeping, bell, and valet staff were all great and friendly from the start. Honestly I probably would not stay here again just because overall I had more negative than good to say. I didn't want to be THAT guest who raised hell for every little problem and I also didn't want to ruin my honeymoon and first time ever coming to Hawaii. Basically When it was good it was really good but when it was bad it was really bad. I'm dumb because I didn't take any photos of everything I mentioned except for the view which was amazing.

Hotel looks older in person than pictures in magazines or online. The hallways don't have airconditioning. The rooms are very small even what they call deluxe or upgraded rooms. Don't accept their breakfast offer because they shuttle you to another so called hotel in another part of the city and the breakfast Is not good. They bring you there to offer you activity packages and the prices are shocking they are so expensive. The good part of the breakfast is they have a photographer take your picture for a small fee of $20. Also, the cleaning crew are very nice.This hotel is by any means a luxury hotel.

Great location, friendly staff, clean but dated, close to everything and 50 metres to beach. One of the hotels that look after military from all countries. You also have. Numerous places to eat at reasonable prices Tikis would be the more expensive but great atmosphere, Lulus is really good and well priced unless you book a table of eight where you get slugged 20% minimum do book two tables of four- plus they have approx 15 sports screens, Wolfgang a is also well priced , there is a subway and teds burgers. All of these are either on or underneath or within 50 metres of the hotel. The zoo is approx 200 metres and the aquarium about 500 metres.

We arrived to our hotel room to a malfunctioning air conditioning unit with a max low of 69? How is that true AC? After calling the front desk repeatedly we were able to have a very pleasant and kind engineer help us with that issue.The room size itself is microscopic and similar to another review the bathroom floors and shower have is old and stained.There are dust bunnies everywhere and I found some nice blonde hairs in our bed (husband and I are brunette) and there's dings all over the walls and closets.After calling to ask about an upgrade it seems there was nothing available and were now looking for another hotel to replace the rest of our stay.I should have read more reviews before booking this hotel, that won't happen again.

I have read so many of the reviews on trip advisor , I just don't get it , this hotel may be old and a little out dated but so are most hotels in Hawaii , our room was clean and the location was perfection . The cleaning staff were impeccable, and honest , I left money on my dresser in the envelope twice and it was for the maids , to my surprise the money was still there , my opinion is some people just feel the need to complain about something , we loved our stay at Aston !! Definitely will be going back !!!!

This was probably the 6th time I've come to Oahu and stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach. This time around I was really disappointed in the rooms as I recalled them to be a bit more up to date. I'm not sure if they are in the process of remodeling some and haven't gotten through everything yet but my particular dislike was the bathroom. The floor specifically, it just looked incredibly dirty. I have no doubt it was being cleaned but I think it's just so old that there's nothing you can do really short of replacing it. The bathroom as a whole was small and very out dated. Other than that I was happy with the room, while it is on the smaller side, the bed is very comfortable. I may stay somewhere else next time around unless I hear that they have remodeled.What I DO like about this hotel is the location, it's on the far side of Waikiki Beach (towards Diamond Head) which results in slightly less people to fight with for a spot on the beach. It has the Tiki Bar and Grill which serves decent food but I particularly like their appetizers from the bar menu. The Chicken wings were amazing and the quesadilla was very good as well. The staff is very nice and friendly no matter where you run into them (restaurant, bar, front desk, phone, etc) I do hope they are considering a face lift or that they are underway!

This hotel was pretty decent on a budget. Staying in Hawaii is extremely expensive so this was a pretty good deal for us. The room was nice but not romantic or over the top and there was daily house cleaning and free wifi. If you're renting a car you'll have to pay 30 dollars a day on top of the 24 dollar resort fees. We'll probably go to a much nicer hotel if we decide to vacation in Hawaii again. Anyways it's rated a three star hotel which is pretty much what you'll get.

The Aston Waikiki Beach is an incredible option for our clients seeking a property close to the beach, at value pricing. Staff is incredibly accommodating, making for wonderful trips in the heart of Waikiki. We recommend it for many of our clients

After reading some reviews was hesitant but this place is great, close to the beach, rooms are good thought try to get a decent balcony room eg 2201 first room great balcony after Cruise , room 2426 not so great balcony, room size good. Amenities good. A short walk to mid strip and not fat from the cheesecake Factory (yum). Trolley bus right outside to shops. All up good service, friendly staff always helpful. Our initial deposit and resort fee was mixed up with the 2nd stay though and i think we paid too much but cant complain. Will def stay there again. There is Wolfgang Puks, subway and of course an ABC shop handy.

This is my 7th trip to oahu and 3rd time at this hotel. I give this hotel 4 stars based on its location at the quiet end of the tourist strip, kuhio beach across the street (quieter than waikiki beach) and its friendly and helpful staff. It is a basic hotel (bathrooms are small and water not the hottest) but i do love the location. It os cheaper than other hotels with ocean views. We got a partial ocean but was more like an ocean view (compared with last time). I would recommend this hotel based on the staff and location.

This is our first time at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Past reviews had us a little concerned but it really is up there with Pacific Beach and Queen Kapiolani.A special mention to Sean at Reception for managing three really weary travellers at check in.

Spent 6 nights and had two adjoining rooms. We were fortunate to be on the 21st floor, with a partial ocean view. The rooms were clean, beds clean and comfortable, bathrooms are dated and in need of updates, but it did suffice for our time there. Our room had a very small balcony facing Diamond Head, wish it was slightly larger in order to enjoy a morning cup of coffee, but I guess that is with the full ocean views. Housekeeping friendly and quick. Front desk staff was not that impressive. As for the elevators, once you get used to them, it is nice to go directly to your floor. We did have a wheelchair and figured out on the last day that if you push that button the elevator will take you directly to the first floor. We spent a lot of time going from floor three to floor one due to the wheelchair. This portion of the elevator was not explained to us. Did not partake in Tiki's restaurant as the music was too loud, but did eat at Wolfgang Puck Express several times, hit and miss. Probably our biggest complaint would have to do with the fact that we were one room down from the Coconut Club on floor 21. There were several events there while we stayed, no fault to the hotels, but one night the DJ was so loud with bass that our room just hummed, another night there was so much laughter out in the hallway, not sure why they moved to the hallway. Overall all we were pleased with the room and amenities (K-cups, lotions, shampoos, soaps, gift bag, etc). I do not agree with the $23 daily resort fee, but I guess all hotels do , so can't really complain there either.

My wife and myself spent 8 nights here on the 5th floor, nothing spectacular about the place and I guess you get what you pay for...rooms are dated and not even a soft seat to on to have a quick read or do the emails. Bed was very comfortable and pillows as well, always a good point...the coffee machine, what can I say except from Australia we don't find the coffee that great in The U.S. thought the coffee from the pod machine was awful.Staff were fantastic...the cleaners did have a noisy early morning demonstration while we were there...woke us up however not a problem I do hope they are heard and get a better deal they were terrific as well

Our room on the 23rd floor closest to Kalakaua Ave.; looking towards Honolulu, gave us a view that was spectacular. The best vista possible in Waikiki for sure.As always we were really impressed with the cleanliness of the suite as well as that of all other areas on this property. Friendliness and service were next to none.The front office supervisor, Lillian M. is, in our opinion "one in a million", attending to a diligent staff in a warm and professional manner at the same time lending a soft ear to the concerns of any travelier'sA great restaurant on the same property is a favorite of locals as well as guests. Proximity to the Zoo/Aquarium and all of Kalakaua Ave and of course the beach directly out front of this hotel, makes this the place to spend a night or a month to be pampered.

This hotel was booked for us by the agent who booked our Norwegian Pride of America Cruise for the night we arrived before the cruise began. Great location on Waikiki Beach, just across the street from the famous beach! The hotel needs to be updated! Pealing wallpaper, bathroom needs upgrade, etc. The restaurant was very good and had a great view. We had a beautiful view of Diamond Head from our room. The elevator system was interesting as you had to be on the 3rd floor to access room elevators and use your room key for elevator. I guess this prevents non-paying folks from accessing floors with rooms. T

My girlfriend and I chose this hotel because of the proximity to the beach and price for what they offered. Our first impression was not good. Our reservation was set up by Expedia and was for a king bed with a partial ocean view. Upon arrival we were told all they had available was a two full with a partial ocean view. We ended up getting the room we booked after I put up a bit of an argument so it didn't ruin our stay totally but we definitely got off on the wrong foot. We didn't spend much time in our room except for sleep. The only complaint about the room itself is that it needed to be updated. The pool are was nice and the bar/restaurant had good food and drinks and servers. The other reason for the three stars was the protest we woke up to on the last day of our stay. Not sure if they were protesting the hotel or not. Signs just said no respect. Overall I would probably stay again but for the price difference I would tell my past self to choose a resort style hotel instead.

First time to stay at this hotel and I must say our visit for 11 days was great! Their way of getting to your room is by swiping your room card and it tells you to push your floor number and then tells you which elevator to take and it takes right to your floor. The elevator is super fast, not scary fast but definitely not slow. You go to the 3rd floor to register and they explain everything to you! On the 3rd floor there is also a bar, inside and outside eating places and the food is reasonable and very good in the casual seating. We never ate on the inside so can't say about this, but after the 1st time we went to the casual eating we went there at least 5 more times to eat! All employees and the Housekeeping are very friendly and make sure you have everything you need. The other thing I liked about it was no one could get to your floor without a card and the restrooms on the 3rd floor where the bar, swimming pool and restaurants are has combination locks and unless you are supposed to be there you can't get into the restrooms! If and when we go again I am sure we will make this our place to stay!!

The front desk was nothing but great... Housekeeping was great.. The location is a good location and the view from our room was fantastic. Only issue we had was when we drove up, we were going to park at my brothers so we didn't valet. The guy tells us we have to find a park on the street to check in, when was crazy. After asking you don't allow time for your guest to check in, he directed us where to park and said we have 15 minutes. Well check in is at 3:00 pm and we were in a LONG LONG LINE and it took us close to 45 minutes to check in. I didn't have a problem with the length of time because its expected but for the valet to tell me we have 15 minutes is crazy. our car was fine when we returned and all is well. I really have no complaints. ONLY PRAISE TO THE FRONT DESK STAFF...

This is the hotel we always stay at, close to beach with a swimming cove. Next to zoo. Easy check in. Walking distance to stores and restaurants. They have swimming pool, rent dvd's, lots of tv channels. Updated rooms. Nice lobby area. My only complaint is this hotel stopped the free continental breakfast. They do not have a restaurant that offers breakfast. Bring back the continental breakfast!

First time I went to the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was great, the second time was even better! What I love about this place is that it's on the main drag of Waikiki Beach, but being one of the last hotels along the line of properties; it provides a little more of a quieter atmosphere which is appreciated when you are in you're room. So you have the choice of being in the mix on the street, or having the peace and quiet from your room. The only improvement I could see is the quality and choices of their breakfast, I think they are better than the provisions that are offered; Although it's basic, I much prefer eating at Lulus for Breakfast, or even Cheeseburger in Paradise or the almighty Cheesecake Factory (best place in the world, truly).All in all Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, and the Aston properties at that, live up to their ratings and price tag. I highly recommend upgrading upon check-in to an Ocean Front room too, great way to save money from initial booking.

I have been staying here many times, both business and pleasure. I have always stayed in a corner room with ocean view. It is much larger than the regular rooms with excellent views. And in an excellent location, walkable to everything in Waikiki.

One of the things I like most about the Aston Waikiki is they will check out for free for your stay-nice beach chairs with cup holders and beach towels (you can exchange each day or keep for visit). They have a great restaurant on pool deck that overlooks the beach, tour desks available to assist travelers. Be advised, most rooms do not have chairs to sit in but a high top small table and also they do not have microwaves in the rooms.

Perfect location on the Waikiki beach, with many shops and restaurants around. Early check in was unfortunately not possible. Got a room with 2 queens, though was looking for one King size bed. Great view on the mountain and also the beach. Bad is clean and modern. The pool was smaller than I expected and for any reason but the water was cold. Fitness room is not even worth to mention. Hotel had free DVDs and palystation available, not sure who wants to watch movies on Hawaii :-)

Perfect location for my group. Directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. Shopping malls within walking distance. $2.00 bus ride will take you to all the shopping areas in Waikiki. Flea market available; new International Mall; lots of eating establishments in the area. Pickup point for tours all over the Island of Oahu! Loved it!

We stayed in ocean front room.bit small but very clean. old and noisy aircon..comfortable bed. Dvd player didn't play all movies from rental machine. Probably need upgrade..lot of noise from the street but thats probably everywhere in waikiki.good position very close to the shops and beach is just across the road..good beach for kids protected with big wall..nice snorkeling on the other side of the wall..the best thing was amazing view with sunset.

The hotel is conveniently located along Waikiki Beach. A short walk to the Hawaiian Village shopping mall, food hall, Food Pantry. ABC convenience store are everywhere.Check-in is on the 3 floor by the poolside. Access to the room is by swiping your room card only to access your floor. The room is reasonable sized with a small balcony. There is TV, free wi-fi, in roomSafe, iron, fridge and PlayStation. The toilet consists of a shower bath and toilet. A little bit cramped but functional. The toiletries were of a decent quality. There is a coffee machine with 2 coffee pods daily.Down stairs is a Wolfgang Puck restaurant and along the next street Burger King. Further down Big Mac.The beach is across the road.

Each year we stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and every time we go home (Vancouver Canada) wishing we were back at the hotel. We have stayed in ocean front (1830) several times and also 521 (one floor up and overlooking pool) - love it each time. The Aston Waikiki may be an older hotel, but it's got such charm and it's décor speaks of Hawaii! The Tiki Bar and Grill is a great added feature as it's nice to sit around the pool in the afternoon with a drink and/or appie. Lots of room around the pool to relax. The music that flows from the Tiki Bar is great at night - we love music so we enjoy and appreciate. The staff (cleaning ladies, valet staff, check-in, management) are fantastic and so very helpful. The rooms are 'average' in size and very clean. Supplies in the bathroom are great and if you run out, staff will bring you what you need. We have always been super pleased and happy with the Aston Waikiki Beach - that's why we always return to the hotel. We're not looking for something upscale and LA or New York (ish) - we're in Hawaii and want to feel we're in the Islands. Aloha and Mahalo for your wonderful hospitality each time Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. See you in May 2017.
user_name:
christineb35
White Rock, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Where do I start? Good points: fantastic location on the water, had a partial ocean view for 2 nights and a beach front for 2 nights, awesome view of the beach, palm trees, main road into downtown and sunsets, front desk supervisor was commendable others average, rooms were comfy although beds quite bouncy (everytime my husband moved the whole bed jiggled), good sized pool, efficient bellboys, some food outlets underneath and some fast foods close by :) Not so good points: we arrived early (6am) but normal checkin time is 3pm!! So tired but could only leave luggage and go to the beach to collapse and swim till about 1pm, checked and room was ready then, yay! Some traffic noise as it's on the main road along the beach but windows were thick which helped, all front desk staff need to be better informed to assist with inquiries as one led me on a bum steer to the post office 2 miles away that wasn't even open on Sat. and I discover that there is a postal service just 2 doors away in the ABC store! Can't really understand what the daily amenities fee of $24 is for. All in all a great place to stay, lots of weddings booked due to the huge deck overlooking the beach, I would consider staying again :)

Loved the ocean view room the Aston had to offer. Only thing I would recommend is that the hotel upgrade the bathrooms. The bathrooms are outdated and the tile grout does not have a pleasant appearance. Other than that, the room was great. Down on the street level there are several places to choose from for eat and drink which was very convenient.

Firstly I would like to thank this hotel for truly making our stay extra special. We had pre warned them that in the time we stayed here we were getting married, having our honeymoon and it was both myself and my (now) husbands birthdays.When we arrived we we're pleased to see that although the hotel is at the quieter end of the beach, it was an easy 10 minute stroll to the busier section of Waikiki (there is still LOTS near the hotel so no need to worry!).We were greeted by a lovely woman on the reception who congratulated us on our upcoming celebrations, presented us with a gift for the occasion and as I had requested a high floor away from the elevators was given the keys to room 2527. This room is on the top floor and I'm almost certain is the room the hotel took its pictures in for the website. (Aloha suite ocean view)The view was breathtaking and although the rooms/bathrooms are slightly dated I felt it was more than adequate for what we had payed for and most importantly it was clean and the bed was one of the comfiest I have ever slept on! Although we had an ocean view room we also had a balcony on our floor which faced out to diamond head which I have included a picture of and I know from when the cleaner had one of the doors open on that side of the hotel the view from those rooms was just as amazing.My slight grumble would be the amenity fee although I know this is something all hotels make you pay here, an addition £249 is steep! All in all though I would come back to this hotel tomorrow if I could and hope to persuade my husband to take me back for an anniversary or 2!

My wife and I recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel and had a great time. It is at the zoo end of town and close to some nice parks and the enclosed swimming area just metres away from the hotel. We were on the 6th floor, 2 above the pool area and the Tiki bar, at first I thought this might be noisy but I was pleasantly surprised. Only one lot of late night revellers. The room had 2 double beds, lcd tv with cable, small fridge and was cleaned daily. The room that we had was getting a little tired, tiles missing of the bathroom floor near the wall, but we didn't go to Waikiki to sit in a room!!! Bed was comfortable and the partial ocean view was great especially at sunset.Lots of ABC stores close by for the essentials and non essentials. The tours we booked on site worked out well and the staff were very friendly at all times. We would definitely go back and stay at this hotel again.

Stayed here for 7 nights starting Oct. 3. Very friendly staff, convenient location, and clean rooms. We really enjoyed our stay. Try the Snickerdoodle cookie at the cookie store downstairs. Wolf Gang Puck Express is also downstairs and the food was very good. For parking try the Waikiki Banyan for $20 per night. Its right around the corner. Also skip the mini mart inside the hotel and visit the ABC store right out front next to Subway also attached to the hotel. Walking distance to everything. I love Aston Waikiki.

This hotel is in an excellent location and our Ocean Front Select room had magnificent views up and down the coast. Check in was easy and we had no surprises on checkout. We found the music from the restaurant below was too loud, so, on our first night there, the hotel was able to move us to the 15th floor and to the side further away from the restaurant. Much appreciated! Housekeeping was very good and when we changed rooms, they found a "lost" dress from our first room and returned it. We made use of the happy hour at the restaurant and spent many nights by the pool with our cheap cocktails. The lifts were really quick and the system to use them was really efficient. While this is not a new hotel, it suited our needs perfectly and we would be happy to recommend it. (By the way, it was cheaper to book directly through the hotel)

We stayed here Oct 13-15, 2016. The location was great, 20 yards from Waikiki Beach. There were partial views of Diamondhead from our balcony but the beach was directly in front of our ocean view room. The same price to upgrade was definitely worth it. The room was bright and adequately sized. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very nice and the kids loved the pool and the beach. This is a great stay, close to shopping and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again.

Let me just start by saying there is nothing fancy about this hotel. The rooms are simple and the bathrooms are small so if you want extravagance this place isn't for you. However, I feel it serves true to the Hawaiian vibe. Kicked back and relaxing. We didn't wanna spend too much time in the room anyways but we were comfortable when we did. Upon arrival, I told the front desk girl that I was on my honeymoon and she immediately asked her manager if she could give us a better room. We were moved to the 21st floor on the diamond head side and the view from the balcony was gorgeous. She also gave us a cute picture frame. We truly appreciated the hospitality. All of the staff were great and both restaurants had great food that appeased a meat eater, a vegetarian, and a toddler. The one problem we had was the walls are super thin and we had some partiers next door but the staff addressed the problem immediately. Yes, there is a valet fee and a resort fee but I felt every penny was worth the great time in paradise we had. We hope to be back soon!

Was very disappointed with room was a deluxe sea view very small room, sea view was side view and when compared with web page exactly same view as partial view. Room very basic no glasses in bathroom to rinse after bushing teeth. Very cramped for two people yet room was upto 4 people. Also lanai only had one chair and footstool!!!

This hotel is directly on the beach,clean room and well locate in Waikiki beach.Staff is professional and welcoming,trolley stop in front so very easy to go around Honolulu.Pool and resort facility are easy to use.

My family and I stayed here for our "staycation" for my birthday weekend. Let me start off by saying that we enjoyed our stay, nothing was so unpleasent that it ruined our stay. With that said, I would more than likely never stay at this hotel again just because it was not really worth what we paid. When we arrived at the hotel checking in to our rooms went smoothly and the people at the front desk was friendly enough. I told them that I was there for my birthday and they offered us a free upgrade for our seconded nights stay. I'm not really sure why it was for only one night. That was great and all, but not really worth the trouble of checking out the next day, then waiting until 3 to check back in to the new room. The hotel on the out side and in the lobby was a lot nicer than the rooms themselves. Also the elevators, although small, were quite nice. I also want to say that the restaurants at the hotel were nice also. The pool was on the small side and closed very early, that was a big let down. There was also no hot tub. All in all the pool was just OK for us. The first room was a partial ocean view room with a very small walk out balcony. The view room the room was blocked mostly by another hotel, we latterly cold carry on a conversation with the hotel next to use with no problem at all, you are that close. The views that you could see were nice though. The room it self was ok in size, but the bathroom was quite small. The room and the bathroom were both very dated. The furniture was also old and worn looking. For the most part the room was pretty clean as well as the bathroom. The next day we moved to a deluxe partial ocean view and the ONLY thing deluxe about this room was the balcony was big enough for a small table and chair. The room itself was smaller, I guess to make room for the bigger balcony. Again the room and bathroom were both on the smaller size. We had 3 adults and I child in this room and it was quite cramped in there. The day of check out we were able to get an hour longer check out time which was nice. However when I went down to check out my fees that I was charged on my card were about a 80 dollars more than what was on my receipt itself. The man at the desk said that the charges would be changed that they always charge more then refund the rest. He said that it was just a hold, but it is day 2 and the charges have yet to change. Also we are a military family and we go a military rate that also refunded the resort charges, we were to get this as a visa gift card at check out, well they were out of gift cards so I was told that they would be mailed to me as soon as they come in. I asked if they could just take the 100 dollars off of our totally bill and we were told no. I then said that I would like a supervisors written instructions and signed stating what he had said about them mailing us our gift cards. I didn't want to get home call and check on them and then someone try and tell me that we already received them at checkout. This in itself took a few times me asking to get it. The man at the front desk stayed kind, but you could tell he was getting annoyed with me. So to this day I still am owed about 180 dollars from this hotel. Like I said in the before we will not stay here again, there are a lot better hotels around this same location for the same price and with nicer rooms and more amenities. Oh yes I almost forgot on the website that I viewed it said that the Aston offered a free " breakfast on the beach" meal, but when I asked about it at check in they said they no longer offer it, but yet they are still advertising it. You are paying for the location only at this hotel, and although it is an awesome location there are more hotels with just as good of location with more to offer for your money.

We stayed here for two nights in September, 2016. The location is great. It's just across the street from the beach. We had a partial ocean view with a view of Diamondhead from our small lanai. The room itself was small but clean. The bathroom was also small and dated. The air conditioner struggled to keep the room cool so it was somewhat uncomfortable to sleep at night.

Loved this place, stayed on the 23rd floor beach front, amazing. The resort fee is a bit of a take but it's everywhere so what can you do. Great bar downstairs, overall absolutely enjoyed every minute. Planning on staying again next year!

We just came back from Waikiki after our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 10 days. We believe that for the money spent for the room it was well worth it. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful when needed. We thought it was going to be a bad choice but they proved us wrong when the room that we booked was not the room we originally got. But we went right down to the lobby and we received a upgraded room the following day and after that everything was fantastic. Bus and trolley stops were right at our doorstep. Restaurants were close by no matter what you want to eat. Even the staff for excursions was extremely helpful when our booking through Viator when haywire. They got us another excursion booked for the following day and it was cheaper than what we had paid originally. Kudo's to them. We would recommend this hotel to anyone if the beach and shopping are what you want most, even if you just want to sit back and relax this is a great place to stay. If we return to Waikiki in the future we will be staying here again.

Would give 3.5 stars if I could which I don't see as a bad rating think this is around how they're officially rated & think that's fair.Pros: location right across from the beach. Friendly staff. Interconnecting rooms : We had requested interconnecting rooms & double checked prior as had 2 young kids. Yes this is on request but also chose on basis they had interconnecting. When we checked in they weren't interconnecting. they were able to sort for us by taking a room on a lower level even though we paid for a higher level but we were fine with that. The interconnecting door didn't open but maintenance promptly fixed. Maintenance were always prompt & really friendly.We liked the live music from tiki's could sit on balcony & listen while kids were sleeping.Elevator system was great avoided long waits. Free DVD rental (incl in resort fee)Cons: air conditioning is average, struggles in the hot afternoons, maintenance checked it for us but not a lot they can do were told some rooms just needed upgrades. We didn't mind the noise of the aircon - good white noise for the kids. Decor a bit tired but expect this in a 3 star. Definitely had the hot/cold shower thing the second morning which some other reviews have mentioned. Strange as first morning was fine. Not pleasant been blasted with cold then hot, cold then hot. Even in a 3* you want a hot shower. Can be really long cues at reception definitely recommend express check out. Tip for families: After hearing that many Hawaii hotels aren't into early check ins we were arriving at 7am so opted to pay for 1 room the night before to guarantee it. after an all night flight with 2 young children we were glad we went for that option despite the added expense. Then we added an interconnecting room for the night we were actually sleeping there. Was really hot so good not to be waiting around all day with check in not until 3.

A fantastic experience. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, modern and well set up with a good view. Easy access to the beach which is just across the road. The restaurant/bar was really good, friendly staff and great atmosphere with a view of the beach. Free parking by the zoo made parking affordable to rent a car and have a short walk to the hotel.

I booked the ocean front select room. the view from the balcony was unbelievable. the only bad thing..the noise from the bar/lounge below carried up as well as the street noise, and I was on the 18th floor. oh, and my balcony was not really private, the balcony next door was right there with no divider. the room was very clean, bed very comfortable, though the AC didn't cool all that great. too much window for the ac. I would stay here again, it was incredible. the noise is the only reason I didn't give it a 5 star.

At first was hesitant because the reviews were so mixed. Requested a king room months ago and was not accommodated but was given 2 double beds which was fine got the bigger balcony & partial ocean view no problem. Was clean on first impression but here is the second night and I see 3 roaches...called the front desk and they were not very concerned at all but told me oh that's common in Hawaii. After a second they sent house keeping and he states he didn't see anything. Rooms are small & dated, needs some heavy renovation, there's no lobby but is an outside under pavilion like sitting area which does no good when it's 80 something degrees outside, the elevator system is different swip ur room key push ur number button and it gives u a letter which is the letter of the elevator you will go to. I give 1 star because I hate bugs hotel is tolerable until I seen the bugs it makes you feel as if something is crawling on you. Who wants to sleep thinking a bug may get in the bed or on them at anytime

This is a spectacular place right across from the beach. Excellent t location close to everything. Staff is attentive and the rooms are super comfy and nicely decorated. If you stay here visit Tomis bar and grill downstairs and try the steak poke. It is to die for. Fantastic. Can't wait to go back

Aston Waikiki is a great all round Hotel, straight across the road from the beach. There's actually two beaches to choose from, both uncrowded compared to central Waikiki. Pricing is mid range and definitely value for money. If you want 4.5-5-star, then there are other choices but for a well priced hotel and great location, go no further. The Zoo and Aquarium just metres away. Like all hotels at some point in time, there's some need of soft refurbishment but overall, more than sufficient. The Tiki Bar would be one of the best bars in Waikiki, food quality and entertainment (every night) would be hard to beat. (and we have been to a lot of them) Add a 2pm-5pm happy hour, you can't go wrong.The overall service provided by the Hotel is great, very friendly and professional staff. After 17 nights, we can't provide a single complaint, just compliments.A very short, leisurely walk and you're in the heart of Waikiki, with plenty to see (and shopping) on the way.We're definitely going back to Aston Waikiki because it ticks all the boxes for us.

Good hotel to stay in. Ask the receptionist if I could have a kettle for my morning cuppa & within minutes one arrived. Room very clean. Restaurant & bar service excellent. Most definitely would come again.

This hotel is wonderful, right on the beach with gorgeous views.Staff members are friendly and helpful. Very comfortable beds, beautiful balcony, plus an in room safe.It was the perfect place to stay.

We stayed for 3 nights on the 15th floor in an Ocean Front Select room. So glad we did...well above the trees, great view of the beach, & park across the street. Starbucks right around the corner, for breakfast coffee & pastries. Dinner at Wolfgang Puck's Express on the street level, good pizzas! King size bed was very comfortable, shower pressure was great and abundant hot water. We had requested a room fan which was promptly delivered. Had a wonderful goody bag full of Sun care products, used them all, very nice touch! Plus two bottles of Vanilla Cream sodas chilling in the mini fridge, yummy! Entire staff was so helpful and accommodating! Yes would recommend staying to anyone, but do spring for the Ocean Front Select rooms they are the best bang for the buck! Well done Aston Waikiki & Mahalo!

The room we were in was OK. It was small but was very clean. The bathroom needed an overhall and there needed to be more storage space for suitcases etc. Our balcony was big enough w 2 chairs to see the beach n the views were breathtaking.The Amentity fee is very expensive n not worth it.Staff were friendly n helpful which was nice... The pool was very small for such a big hotel regardless of having a beach across the road..Overall i wouldnt stay here again, it was overpriced for wat you got ..

Our room was very clean and had everything we needed. A centrally located to a lot of things to do and see. Walking distance to a ton of places. The staff was always prompt if you needed anything. The Tiki Bar was fun, had a fabulous view and the food and drinks were Awesome.

Bathrooms are dingy and old. Rooms are extremely small. Furniture is VERY outdated. Small balconies. House keeping is awesome. Employees are very willing to assist with whatever is needed. Pool area (blah)

We were in Hawaii to visit our son, active duty Marine. If you do not plan on spending a lot of time in the room, then this is not a bad place. We had a problem with the front desk and the charges. They put a hold for our amenities fees, on our credit card, which was not an issue. Then they put a note on our car, to see service desk, that was parked there. Once at service desk, they put a hold on our credit card, which was not an issue. When we got back, we parked our car and my son and his friend parked their cars. They called the room and said we needed to come down to service desk. We were told that they need to put another charge on our CC. We asked for what and they said because we had 3 cars parked there. But yet 2 of them were parked over night. The cost is $30 a day valet parking. $150 was what we were expecting, but they said that we needed to come up with $450 to cover the 3 cars, or we would be locked out of our room. After the manager got evolved, my sons parking was free, for the night. The trip was good until this point and it was aggravating and embarrassing, as we were on a budget and only put money on the card when needed. So, this billing fiasco could have caused major issues had we had all of the money in one place, as surprise charges are never fun.

We stayed here for two nights in Sept 2016. This place is right across the road from the beach. A couple blocks easy walk to The Cheesecake Factory. Room was a double with two queen beds. Tidy hotel. Lobby was open air facing out to the pool, good quick service. Elevators were super speedy. Pool wasn't too big but never seemed crowded. Great view from the pool deck out to the beach. We loved it here and would have no hesitation staying here again.

The hotel is showing its age, but it was clean and comfortable. It was pricey for what you get, but that's Waikiki in general. We arrived at 8am and where ready just to drop our bags and come back for the 3pm check in, but the concierge was fantastic and was able to get us straight into our room. The views from the balcony where spectacular. The hotel staff couldn't do enough for you and the overall service was really good.Overall we where very happy with our stay.

Well I can say that this hotel was clean, But they need to update a few things.The sink and tub has has no shine to it , but it was clean. The tile in the floor needed to be replaced, but it was clean. The bathroom door was painted and whomever painted let a few drops on paint on the floor. That tells me no professional did this.
