They could not get the air right, either it was freezing or not cool enough. I look it the prices they on back of the door, There is no way I would pay those and the price I paid never again.

The Aston Waikike Beach Hotel is in a great location, just across the street from the beach and park, nearly plenty of shopping and restaurants. Very suitable for couples, young families, and older couples like us. Transportation and tours come directly to the hotel, the resturant is quite nice with a varied menu. Good pool and sun deck ... Would easily return.

It was a very nice hotel, very clean and a good atmosphere. It had location, two places to grab a bite and good service The room was comfy and the bed and fabrics were very nice,I slept very well. I liked the TV and liked that my room looked the same as an episode of Hawaii 5-0. Thhigher floors were pretty windy and I wouldn't (not couldnt) sit out on the balcony. I should have got a lower room the balcony wasnt to big either. I really enjoyed the restaurant Tiki's on top. The menu is great and the views and feelings you get are the best. The snack shop was small.The restaurant beside it was Wolfgang Pucks, kind of like a grab and go...But an original and chef inspired menu and was still good but not magical or something :-) Always pretty busy. The hotel location was great for a Wakiki beach stay.

From the days I have stayed at this property formally known as ResortQuest Waikiki Beach Hotel, I must say under the new name and perhaps management, there has been SOME improvements. Rooms overall are small. But hey, aren't they all small in Waikiki. The interior is decorated adequately. The washroom however, could use a MAJOR upgrade. Bed is comfy but last I checked, it's 2016. Most hotels have depleted the use of the nasty 1990 wool blanket and replaced it with a nice thin duvet. Aston believes in recycling and reusing I guess. Was booked in a ocean view room on the 25th floor. Views from the balcony are breathtaking. Fitness Centre is one of the better ones compared to the other hotels I've stayed at in Waikiki. Offers newer machines and free weights. Pool area is okay, not spectacular or bad. Could upgrade and install a hot tub since most hotels offer that amenity. The week went by great until our last day. We had a 630am flight and had arranged our transfer to pick us up at 445am. After retiring in our room at 115am, I plopped on the bed and started checking emails. In the corner of my eye, I saw something moving on the pillow. Sure enough, the fear in many travelers was happening right before my eyes. I had a bed bug on the pillow!!!!I sprang into action and called front desk. He apologized to me for and said that he could NOT do anything because no manager was on site, but could only change my room until I check out. He instructed me that housekeeping and security will be coming to my room to investigate. I waited 15 minutes and no one came. By this time my husband took the bedbug and went to front desk himself to complain. Housekeeping later came and took apart our whole room. We were later moved to another room until checkout. By this time it was 215am. At checkout, they credited my portfolio $50 for the inconvenience caused and was told a manager from the property would contact me as soon as possible regarding this matter. It's been 8 days at the time of writing this review since I've been back from my trip and still NO ONE has contacted me. I'm truly appalled by how my incident was handled, as I'm sure all hotels have a protocol they must follow when bedbugs are found. I wish the front desk personal was a tad more professional and more EMPATHETIC to our situation. We solely feel because of our checkout time, not a lot was done because in a few hours we'd be out of their hair. I was planning to write a great review about this stay. Sadly because of the last few traumatizing hours at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, I will not remember the lovely ocean views, or the gorgeous sunset views from my balcony. My husband and I will only think of the nasty blood sucking bug crawling on our pillow. Aston, step up your game. If you want to be respected like other major hotel chains, make sure your guests are treated properly! I do not recommend this hotel nor will I be staying here again.

the location of this hotel is great, right across the road from the beautiful beach but the rooms are quite dated. rooms have a tv, coffee machine and playstation 3 but are overall basic considering the price. there is also an addition $23 per day resort fee on top of the price of the room but location is what you are paying for.

I stayed there for one night and upon check in the line was horrendously long. finally got to front desk and the agent tells us that our room wouldn't be ready til 5pm. thought that was ridiculous as all the guests in front of us were able to check in to their rooms, no problem. I guess it was because we were booked under a Kama`aina rate, because the other local couple checking in next to us experienced the same problem. Room was clean and functional. Hskpg was friendly.Can't say the same for the valet services when it was time to get our car. I gave the ticket to the valet clerk, Dely. She was completed disorganized in handling her duties. She dumped my keys in the basket and it was sitting there for 30 min before one of the valet guys picked it up. The thing is, Dely knew we had been waiting for awhile and provided no further assistance to speed up the process. There were people who came after us who had gotten their cars before us. Unacceptable Dely!

Perhaps this was a nice hotel several decades ago. Although located directly across the street from Waikiki Beach, the hotel and surrounding area leaves a lot to be desired. There is a 6 block area surrounding the hotel that has a severe homeless problem. My wife and I were continually barraged by bums that have taken over the area. We're not sure where the police are, but discussed this situation with several other hotel guests during are stay that shared the same opinion. I think the cops ignore the problem hoping it will go away.Regarding the Aston itself: no A/C in the hotel lobby. Inconvenient elevator service; broken hair dryer, a Kurieg coffee maker that exploded twice in the room, and room room A/C for the 1st couple of nights that would not drop the room temp below 83 degrees. Hotel explained there was. "Chiller" problem and provided us with a fan.We did have a very nice ocean view on the22 no floor but could still hear traffic and road noise at night.The rooms are small and definitely for couples only. The rooms are clean but dated except for the LCD TV. NOTE: the Aston charges an additional $23 daily as a resort fee. This includes internet and unlimited DVD movies. If you rent a car, parking is $30/ nt.When all things are considered I think there are nicer resorts in Waikiki that offer a better bang for your buck!

Stayed in Ocean Front Select Room 1731. Fantastic view of the beach and Waikiki. We got used to the height from the 17th floor. Any ocean front room above the 10th floor offers great views. Balcony was a little small, but we still relaxed and enjoyed the view. High speed elevators meant very little waiting. Never waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator during our stay. You use your room key to activate the elevator, then enter your desired destination floor.Waikiki was a lot more crowded with people and traffic when compared to Maui, but reasonable crosswalk wait times. Dozens of ABC stores within 1/2 mile, plenty of other shops and eating places too.Staff very friendly and helpful. Just have to cross the street to get to the beach. Breakwater right across the street with an enormous no-wave swimming area. Just outside that is plenty of places for surfers and boogie-boarders to enjoy the waves.Military rate available
user_name:
Dave H
Laingsburg, Michigan, United States

review_body: This hotel is just steps from Waikiki beach! The room was small and for ocean view, I was on the side with view of ocean and diamond head. Very small lanai- not sure if you could call it this, but for the amount of time we spent in room, it didn't matter too much. We were happy to be close to beach. Just a heads up- $30/day to park, $10/ day room fee and $23 per room resort fee not included in sites to book hotels. Offer free dvd rental, wifi. Tiki bar and grill located just next to pool which is convenient. Line ups for check in can get long. Valet service only but they store bags for you if you need to check out of room before leaving or store bags before being able to check into room

Staff are friendly at check-in and helpful with any information you need, our room is on the 17th floor oceanfront. We are a family of four and as the room is small it's comfortable as I'm not living in the room all day.The balcony is small....I guess everything is small including the bathroom, but again I'm not living in this room all day and as I've been to Hawaii a number of times in different oceanfront rooms and it's what you would expect unless you are willing to pay the big money for something larger. It's neat, it's clean and the views are to die for so don't expect 5 stars. The room comes with free WiFi, games console, coffee maker and a beach package of goodies, fridge and flat screen TV, access to the gym and the beach at your feet. I'm happy, what more could you ask for.

Perfect hotel for being close to everything - beach across the road, bus stops right outside door, swimming pool even though quite small was never full. We stayed for 4 nights and it was really great - we had an ocean view room and a small deck - watched the sunsets every night from our room - for little kids the zoo is about 5 mins walk away.
user_name:
Raewyn H
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed here for 2 weeks from the end of August . Arrived after 8pm (from the Uk after 26hrs travelling) and check in was smooth and simple. We had booked an OceanFront Select Room and were on the 18th floor.The lifts are operated by your room card , simple to use and secure as you can only access your floor (Reception on Flr 3 and Ground/Valet on Flr 1)The room was clean , more than big enough with two double beds that were extremely comfortable, coffee machine, safe, hairdryer, PS3, Tv . Theair conditioning worked well and the views from the lanai were simply stunning, AMAZING SUNSETS Maids kept the room immaculate throughout our stay as were all parts of the hotel that we saw.Yes the hotel is a little tierd in places but the actual location more than makes up for this. The daily amenity fee does bump the prices up but you have to pay this wherever you stay . The pool is small but you have a bigger one across the road - the sea !The restaurant on site, TIKIs Bar & Grill, serves good food from breakfast time and there is live music in the eveningsThere is parking available at the hotel for a fee, or as we did on the days we had a car you can park up around the park (free from 6pm untill the morning) The hotel is at the end of a strip of hotels, it is opposite a beautiful beach and a stones throw from the Zoo, the Park and in 20/25minutes you can walk to Diamond Head. Travelling by bus is fairly simply , just $2.50 each for a journey but you must have the exact money as the drivers dont carry change, or the local ABC stores sell bus cards We had a fantastic stay at this hotel, their staff are a credit to them as everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful I would defnitely stay here again and wouldnt hesitate in recommending it to anyone Thank you Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for making our first trip to Waikiki so memorable

I recently stayed here for 4 night on my way to NY, I was on the 7th floor with the most amazing views but I was over the bar & grill and it was very noisy, only other problem is the amount of homeless hanging around.

We went on 05/2015 for our honeymoon. It was right in front of the waikiki beach, watching the beach with people surfing out there and litening some crowdy musics was awsome. Strength : wonderful location, reasonable priceWeakness : Too long time to wait for our car moved(There are some guys who care the parking lot but there should be more because the customers wait for about 30 minutes in the morning for their cars.) Breakfirst was soso.

Stayed here for 6 nights in August 2016 and had a very pleasant stay. Check-in was quick and our request for a room on a higher floor was accommodated. The elevators are accessed using your room key and punching in your floor level for security reasons. Little confusing at first but easy to use once you get the hang of it. We were thrilled with the view of Waikiki and spent much time out on the lanai. The room was on the smaller side with one of the double beds pushed up against the bathroom wall. Bathroom is dated but we didn't mind. Beds were comfortable but sleeping was occasionally disrupted by some late night partiers below at Tiki's restaurant. Also the sliding glass doors can be hard to open/close and you hear everyone around you using theirs. City noise (trash/recycling trucks and emergency sirens) also easily come right through the sliders. Valet was efficient as we usually called down before we left our room to have our car pulled up. Bell/Valet were very helpful also with our needs. We were staying there to move our daughter into the dorms at University of Hawaii. They quickly brought our boxes and supplies purchased to our room and were very helpful in bringing it all back down and packing everything into our car for move in day. We enjoyed our stay so much I just booked another stay for October to visit our daughter.

This is located next to the zoo and the very end of the beach. Great views of the beach and diamond head. The hotel is older and in need of an update. The rooms are clean. Great hotel for just sleeping. Great bar.

We booked this hotel for 10 days back in May 2016 (Sept 5-15, 2016). We indicated we want a king bed and that this trip is for our wedding anniversary. Upon arrival at reception, we weren't even greeted with the usual "Aloha / welcome". There were 2 of them and 1 of them just told us "she will be right with you" (referring to the other girl who was on the phone). The person who told us this wasn't even helping someone else at the time so I don't know why she couldn't help us herself. Finally after a few minutes the girl got off the phone and helped us (no Aloha /welcome greeting still). She told us that they are really busy and they don't guarantee the type of bed and thus they don't have a king bed for us. They gave us a room with what they claim has 2 queen beds but when we got there it was more like 2 twin size beds. The earliest we can get what we paid for which was a partial ocean view room with a king bed was the next day. So this was a waste of time for us because instead of us unpacking and settling in that night we had to wait the next day which messed up our plans for the next day. This is not a good way to run a business. How can you say you don't guarantee the type of bed, this is the first time I have heard of this. Every time we go on a vacation we get a king size bed. These hotels are busy too but they are able to work with our requests. This makes Aston seem incompetent by telling us they are busy so they cant accomodate requests. We paid for the room, it should have already been reserved for us regardless of how busy you are or tell us that we cant have what we paid for so we could have moved to a different hotel. Not impressed with this and taking into consideration as well that we indicated it is for our wedding anniversary and Aston gave us 2 twin beds??? It doesnt even end here, when we got transferred to a king bed the next day, the room safe was not working so we had to call it in at around 3 pm. We got back at around 7 pm and still not fixed so we had to call it in again. Finally when we came back at 10 pm it was fixed. The room was mediocre which we expected as it is an older hotel. It was clean though. But with the nightly rate we paid and the daily amenity fee they charge you, we expected better service which we did not get (other than the housekeeping which was great). On our first night there we did not feel welcome and we felt insulted because they gave us 2 twin beds for our wedding anniv. Not happy with Aston at all.

We just got back from a trip to Waikiki, we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Resort Hotel again. Always get great service. Love the views from their rooms, rooms are spacious and clean. Right across the street from Waikikik beach. Close to restaurants and shopping

Paid for direct ocean view large room. They certainly did not deliver on their promises.We face the pool and the other side of the hotel, in order to see ocean we need to turn left on the balcony. This is the smallest room I have been in since the fleabag at the jersey shore. while the room is clean the furniture is dated and beaten up. Your money would be better spent elsewhere. After spending 10 hours on a plane getting here I am extremely disappointed.Do not bother with this place.

We spent my 40th birthday in Hawaii and had a wonderful time at this hotel. The hotel is in a great location and it's right across the street from the beach. The hotel restaurant, Tiki's, has amazing food.

We stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of our travel agent. It was nearest to Diamond Head, and at the end of the strip. It was a very nice hotel. We had 2 rooms and one on each side of the hotel. Both views were really good. The beach was literally right across the street. There was a Wolfgang Puck on the street level for breakfast, which had awesome breakfast choices. You could walk from one end of the strip to the other in about 30 minutes. Good accommodations, great choices, right on the strip....so it was good!

This is was our 1st trip to Hawaii, and were not sure what to expect, but this place really did live up to our expectations! Right across from the beach, and just far enough away from the main hotels (alot of congestion). The rooms were clean and bright. We had a "partial ocean view" room, and it was fabulous. The pool was big and spacious. i totally enjoyed swimming in it, and the hotel provides chairs/towels that you can check out and take across the street to the beach if you want. NOTE* they do charge for parking if you will have a rental car, you should check with them on the daily rate

An older hotel could do with an overhaul but it was very good overall, we upgraded to a ocean view well worth it that made the holiday, lets face it you cant go to Waikiki Beach and not have a sea view. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was very clean

Upon arrival, after asking for a King Size Bed room (as we were traveling as a couple) we were assigned a 2 double bed room. Guest services upgraded and found us a great King Size room. I'm not sure how they did it but it was much appreciated. I def wish there was a way to guarantee a King room as sleeping on a double bed with two adults would not be all that comfortable. But that's my only complaint and they fixed that so! No complaints we will def stay again. Love the location and the free parking down the street is super convenient when renting a car.

Not impressed by this hotel. Other then being located right next to the beach and the Tiki Grill I do not have anything good to say. The building is run down and poorly maintained. I had a simple issue with the toilet in my room that was looked at four different times but was never fixed. If you have a car you will be forced to use there Valet parking and the Valets like to hang out in your car in the AC and listen to the radio. It cost to much for what it is and I will not stay here again. Even if you don't stay here I would still recommend eating at the Tiki Grill. The food is very good and is reasonably priced for what you get. They also have live music on the bar side with local island groups that are very entertaining. The group that I saw there was called Vaihi. They were awesome and I would go back there just to see them perform again.

We had a great stay here, staff were friendly and very responsive to any requests. Location worked well for us, the kids loved the pool which was a great way to end busy days. Our room was clean and tidy and well maintained.

Good location for the beach, the park stores and restaurants. The staff was very freindly and helpful. House keeping did a good of keeping the room clean. And it was quiet. We had a ocean front veiw, so every morning we could step out and look out over the beach and ocean. We really enjoyed our stay. There was nothing real special about it and the pool is a little small, but I would recommend staying here to others.

The best years of the hotel are possible behind as the room looks outdated but the location is great. It's only steps away from wakiki beach and near all the shops. Another notice was that the rooms were a little bit noisy due that a lot families with children were staying there. But overall is was not excellent, not bad.

We have now been to the Aston on four occasions and every time I am convinced we are in the best location on Waikiki beach . It is directly across from the best swimming pool on the beach . There is a trolley stop right out the side of the hotel and you are well surounded by ABC ammenity shops. Tiki's bar and grill , Puks and Subway are some of the food outlets in close proximity that offer a wide selection in food . The. Hotel is clean , reasonably priced and if you ask for a room with a view of the sea you get to witness magnificent sunsets each night . Ask for a room above the 10 th floor so you don't get the noise from the live band each night . We have found the service at this hotel to be excellent and intend to return again .

Loved loved loved the location. Directly across the street to a gorgeous beach... Probably 100 steps from my room to the water- amazing. Great bar on the 2nd floor. Friendly staff, super helpful. My biggest beef was the AC. It never felt as cool as we wanted, even with the AC turned as cold as it would go. Also, the rooms were on the smallish side but honestly there's tons to do so you don't spend much time in there.

This hotel has seen better days years ago. We have changed rooms and it's only marginally better than the first. We had booked for an ocean front room, and believe me the only redeeming thing is the view. Both rooms are worn and shabby. Our current room doesn't even have sliders over the wardrobe leaving the safe, ironing board and hangers exposed. Everything is chipped and scuffed. The bathroom is awful - it would have been awful 20 years ago. It is unbelievable for what they charge they can't get this hotel up to scratch given the occupancy of Waikiki. I do hot recommend.

I had booked this hotel for one night post cruise. I must say I was alarmed by some of the reviews posted immediately before our stay but we did not encounter those specific issues. Our biggest dissatisfier was retrieving our car when it was time to leave for the airport. We called down as instructed and when we got to the valet station they had not yet retrieved our keys from the lockbox. It took another 29 minutes for the car to be brought around. We were lucky to have plenty of time...this hotel has an innovative elevator setup - there are not buttons for the floors inside the elevators - instead one holds their keycard to a keypad in the elevator lobby and enters the floor number. Their system dispatched the next available elevator. Imo it's a good safety feature and seemed to work very well with respect toManaging lots of guests using the elevator. Final opinion - fine for the price but we stayed at the aqua park shore on our first night (right next door - same management) and much preferred that property. Equivalent price point for oceanfront room.

We booked this room through Costco travel as part of our vacation package. This was most definitely the best decision we made. There are so many hotels to choose from but in my opinion this is the best one for us at least. We had a ocean view select room. We ended up on the top floor which is 25. Facing the Waikiki Beach. The view is simply amazing. The other side of the hotel faces toward Diamond Head if you prefer that view. The room had a King size bed a small table two chairs and on the Lanai... Balcony has two chairs to sit back and enjoy the views. You have an in room safe. Bathroom was in my opinion small and the shower head was at a low height compared to most. The bed was very comfy pillows were a little flat. In room fridge got real cold no worried there. The key card you get is also a type of hotel security you can go directly to your floor as there are no buttons to push in the elevator. scan card and the display tells you which elevator to take. NICE. The TIKI bar restaurant and lounge on the same floor as the pool is great. Great drinks and food with views of the beach across the street. The Air condition worked well as the daytime temps were upper 80's nighttime temps were upper 70's. They do offer underground car parking for a fee of $30 per day. Wifi in room is free and worked well. Our built in hair dryer did not work but, there was a regular hair dyer in the closet not sure if someone left it behind or the hotel provided it. Overall this stay at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel was outstanding. There is a hotel amenities fee and a tax that we paid when we checked out because we had prepaid our room. It amounts to about $25 per day. This hotel is within walking distance to the Honolulu Zoo, and Diamond Head is a short bus ride or walk away about 2 miles or so. So much shopping is nearby you can buy almost anything for the beach or clothing.The sunset views from the Lani are the best thing ever just incredible. The beach is a mere few feet away life guards on duty. Bring plenty of sunscreen as it's very hot here. If you stay within the wall the water temp if very comfortable I would not recommend going outside the wall unless your snorkeling or .

My problem with this hotel began when we called to confirm our reservation and requested a crib in our room for our child. I was told they would add that to the reservation and all seemed well. When we were in the airport I called AGAIN to confirm our reservation was an oceanfront view (which it was and it was pretty phenomenal) and asked again about the crib. The representative said there were no notes about a crib but that she would add them. Then when we arrived at the hotel (which by the way you have to pay a mandatory 30 dollar per day valet fee) we asked at check in AGAIN for the crib. The front desk rep that checked us in was very nice and even offered us a late check out for an additional fee of 50.00 but said there was NO crib listed in the reservation.I gave this hotel several phone calls prior and not a single one of those people made that note about the crib. When we went to our room, we waited for an hour (it was almost 8:30 by this point) and STILL no crib. I have no idea why getting a crib was this hard. We called down to front desk and asked for it AGAIN and then it arrived 15 minutes later. The crib was dirty, the sheets as well, and my daughter woke up with bites on her face from which I can only assume are bed bugs or something else in the room. The room itself was literally a Motel 6 style which was clearly never renovated from the 60's except for artificial thick brown gloss paint on the doors and new furniture, which looked worse then second hand. Honestly, it was gross. HOWEVER, the view was phenomenal as long as you don't mind your neighbors literally staring at you from your balcony. No privacy and awkward. We will not stay here again. If you're planning to celebrate something special or traveling with family, there are better places out there. I would ONLY stay here if I was young and looking to simply party in Waikiki and then crash at night in a drunken stupor where I didn't care about having nice surroundings.

This is a very nice hotel. Comfortable, Quiet and convenient. Located close to all the action of Waikiki beach. And the beach directly across from the hotel is a protected beach behind a retainer wall. I would definitely recommend the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.

Well where do I start. It's been five weeks since we stayed at this hotel and to date we are still waiting for our $300US roomBond to be refunded. I have been in contact with at least 5 different reservation staff and nobody can tell me where my $300 room bond is. On check in we were not advised we should NOT use our Travel Money Card as funds from a hotel can not be refunded onto these types of cards. I have issued my bank details in full to David Kim & Ian who are yet to reply to our help. This is inexcusable and I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anybody to stay at. Hopefully I may get some help and my money back soon fingers avens toes crossed

Thank you Aston Waikiki Hotel for your wonderful hospitality. Our Travel Agent, highly recommended your hotel to suit our needs and budget. You totally exceeded our expectations!Seamless transfers, check in, welcoming staff. The most comfortable bed and linen, I have ever slept in... Sun care gift pack, was lovely touch. Abc stores everywhere we went, for added convenience. Family friendly beach across the road, away from the busy end of Waikiki. Trolley stop outside hotel going to Ala Moana Mall. The Tiki Bar and restaurant, has very friendly staff and had great live music. We loved the ribs for dinner. Yummy and satisfying. After a busy day, we always came back to a well-made up room, by our Housekeeper- Helen and team. She always greeted us each morning. She took good care of us and made us feel welcome. We travelled to Hawaii from NZ to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and we definitely experienced, the warm Hawaiian hospitality. We are planning a trip back, with our family.. Mahalo,

Expensive, average & ammenity fee is rip off. As we needed adjoining rooms we also got a double ammenity fee of $44 US per night. It's a total con & includes DVDs & beach towels...so what!!In $NZ the two rooms cost over $600 per night so why rip you off with this extra?To give some good points the Tiki Bar attached to the hotel is great & the location is nice. Hotel pretty average inside & the Aston we stayed on Maui was even worse.I love Hawaii but hotels need to stop ripping people off !!!

Great afternoon drinks and service at the Tiki Bar - very friendly staff, and really interesting conversation at the bar. Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was a good place to stop for a couple of refreshing holiday beverages before making our way back down Kalakaua Ave.

I wanted to surprise my husband, and 12 year old, with an ocean front view. The trip to Honolulu was not a surprise, but the ocean front view was. Well, my husband and daughter were so happy. We sat in the balcony, and you could hear the ocean waves. The staff was so friendly, and always said "aloha!" Housekeeping went in and picked up everyday. Anytime, we needed our car, they brought it to us fast. The Aston Waikiki is conveniently located by the ocean, restaurants, stores and transportation. There is also a ABC Store located the main entrance. Important if you want to enjoy milk or ice cream with the love of your life, while hearing the ocean views on the balcony.I definitely recommend.

Our stay at the Aston was amazing!! Check in was quick and easy. Our room was a bit small for the deluxe but the ocean front view made up for it. The room isn't fancy but it was comfortable and clean, just the way we like it. The staff is amazing, they are quick to help and keep everything running nicely. The convenience of having the bus stop right near valet made our excursions easy. I believe every bus and trolly stops there. Enjoyed the Tiki bar and grill and Wolfgang Pucks, again convenient. Overall we had a great first vacation in Oahu at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel. We'll definitely be back!! Mahalo!! Pics are all from our room on the 10th floor.

The location is perfect, at the end of Waikiki, you can actually find parking on the street within a few hundred feet. For a one week stay that can save you easily over $100. The rooms are large and clean, the staff friendly and adequate. Free breakfast by the pool is a nice touch, as are the cooling bags they provide for "breakfast to go". Towels and chairs are also available for free to pick up on your way to the beach. Plenty of options for food on the premises and all around as well as ABC stores. I find this to be the best value hotel in Waikiki.

We spent 6 nights here and loved it the rooms were great for what we wanted comfy bed and clean only negative was the air conditioning was at its limit but wasn't uncomfortable ( it was very hot outside ) . Location is fantastic for food , bars , restaurants and an amazing diversity of shops and just cross the street and u are on the beach which has a sea wall which provides calm , protected waters , awesome for children .Staff were very friendly and helpful .

It's okay. But not for what you pay. Get the ocean front room if you Can afford it. That's the only plus is the view, which I'll include a photo of. The room is nothing special. Bathrooms could use updating.This is not a resort. You have tikis bar and grill on site by the pool. Let's be honest the restaurant is not that great. Good for drinks that's about it.What really kills it is the $25 daily resort fee, and the $30 per day parking fee. If your here for a week, that's a good chunk of change. No they don't tell you about this ahead of time. A sneaky hotel charge. You only hear about the parking fee when you pull up to the valet. Elevator system is funky. Takes some time to get use to. Your right on Waikiki beach so that's about all this place has going for it. I would never stay here in a non ocean view room. I would only stay in an ocean view room again if it were one of the last options in town. I've stayed at many other nice places here. This was a last minute trip so it had to do.

Great Location across Waikiki Beach and Good View of Diamond Head and very close to Honolulu Zoo. We booked an oceanview with great view of Waikiki Beach from our Balcony. Coming out from our door is the great view of Diamond Head. Our room is located in 24 Floor in quiet location. The room has Keurig coffee maker, and playstation, wifi internet, and welcome beauty kit upon arrival in the room which included on the hotel fee. The only thing i dont like is the set up of this hotel. When you arrive on the ground floor, is the hotel lobby and where Valet is located. Ive noticed while i was sitting on the lobby, a lot of their Guests when they arrive at the hotel are confused where the Check In located. We had to go up to the 3rd floor to check in and you can take elevator or escalator and this is also where the Pool and the Tiki Bar and Grill are located. Once you're done checking in, you will be given a card key that you can use for the elevator and your room. Although, a bit pricey but it was great. We've checked out the next day but they have free storage for your luggage all day if you have late flights at night. They also can arrange shuttle to the airport for $12 per person at Valet. One tip I can share also is NOT to take TAXI from the Airport to any Waikiki Hotel as they cost a lot for USD$45 + $3 for luggage handling. If you can arrange your shuttle from the airport to Waikiki will be much better i.e. Roberts Hawaii cost $15 per person or other shuttle only cost $12 pp. The Parking is $30 a day but if you park near Honolulu Zoo is $1 per hour.

Hotel is in a great spot... close to beach & shopping. Nice pools deck & bar! The downside is the rooms were a bit small & on the worn side. Worst was the A/C was marginal. I like to be cool when I sleep. Valet service was prompt & helpful!Lots of public transportation! We rented a car but should not have. With the exception of a north shore excursion (which they would have transported as well) plenty of options to get around.If you rent a car... Don't go to Enterprise... They are out of the way to return, took forever to pick up (over an hour there were full busses driving by). Worst car experience ever!

My first time in Hawaii and I was aghast at the cost of our room at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel... And then we went into the room!!!The view was nothing short of spectacular.Gorgeous all day - stunning at sunset.The room was clean super clean and tidy and had everything you expect of a hotel of this caliber (safe/ coffee machine/ nice linen etc) but it wasn't anything out of this world but everything you want and need - including, and note this: really happy helpful staff who seem to value your patronage. We had booked another hotel after a venture out to Hilo but after our stay here we changed it to return to this lovely place. Close to everything and close to the trees and views at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. You will not be disappointed. We stayed in Oceanfront Select rooms but I would have stayed in any room even without a view rather than stating at the other end of Waikiki.You will not be disappointed if you stay in this hotel. Happy hour every day downstairs at Tikis from 3-5 doesn't hurt either!!

If you have an adventurous crew, and just need a nice clean convenient place to crash, this is it! Hot showers, beautiful views, comfy beds! Close to ice cream and the beach. The only weak point was breakfast, not very good, but who eats at the hotel in this food paradise?

We chose the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel as we wanted to be on the 'quieter' end of Waikiki Beach. The hotel is well situated across the road from the beach, and surrounded by shops, with plenty of places to eat nearby. Better value and variety can be had if you walk to the street one block back from the beach. We had a room on the 9th floor, towards the beach end of the building. Room size was good, although the bathroom is quite snug. Both bedroom and bathroom were clean, and the king size bed was comfortable. A small balcony offered good views of Waikiki, but soundproofing wasn't great. We heard loud live music from the bar restaurant six floors below, even with the door closed. Free wifi, and a nice travel bag with sunscreen, a fan, pack of cards etc was provided. The American government charges a daily 'amenity fee' - i.e. another form of tax, which is listed in fine print. There is nothing you can do about this. Check in was efficient and staff were pleasant.

Can't knock this place if you get a Superior Ocean View room. The sweeping interrupted view is magnificent. And given that the extra charge for that room is negligible in context; don't stay here if you can't afford the upgrade or unless you don't need a view. The location is awesome; at the lower end of Waikiki you are within a few blocks of all the glitter yet across the road from peaceful parks, the zoo and aquarium. Staff are friendly. Rooms are well kept. Despite what I'm about to post; we rebooked here for our return to Waikiki after visiting the Big Island (and dumped our other hotel - luckily without charge). Things to watch out for;Be aware lower level rooms are noisy. All of the walls are definitely designed to transmit noise. Budget for the $23.00 per day surcharge for the 'free' internet and the room safe and access to the gym (wherever that is??!).

We went here for our stay in Oahu. It was a convenient location being right across the street from the beach as well as in the middle of lots of shops and restaurants. On the downside we were charged over $50 a night for resort fees basically for nothing. The fees were mentioned when booked but were less with fine print saying they could be changed without notice. Kind of a downer to check out with almost $300 in fees for nothing.

The hotel staff are friendly, the room is good size and the king size bed was comfortable. This hotel is near the zoo and is walking distance to everything. With the balcony door closed we could still hear the person next door talking/coughing on their balcony in the early morning. Also our room 604 was directly opposite the ice machine in the corridor so you could hear it and people collecting ice. Be aware that there is a daily amenity fee of $23.00 plus tax which was not mentioned or included when we booked online.

We booked this hotel for the Hibiscus Half Marathon because it was close to the starting line instead of driving across the island on race day. While it was a large room with a fridge and microwave, it was not very clean by any means. The beds were not comfortable at all. Our room was next to the elevator which provided loud noise ALL NIGHT LONG! There was a lovely sewage and human excrement stench that surrounded the lobby making it for an even nor unpleasant environment. Parking is valet only so be prepared for that too. The only positive is the welcome bag that was actually useful with playing cards, a fan and a cute travel bag filled with COOLA brand lotions and sunscreens making the $25 "amenity fee" acceptable. There were far too many negatives that outweighed the positives to recommend this hotel and I would not opt to stay here again.

We stayed on the 22nd floor with an ocean view- and what a view!!!!! Perfect location, right near the beach, close to Waikiki trolley and TheBus stops, plenty of shops nearby. The room attendants were fantastic, the room itself very clean. All staff happy to help with directions, suggestions on places to visit and travel arrangements. No complaints here, would definitely recommend to anyone staying in Waikiki!

The hotel is closer to the end of the Waikiki strip but still walk able to every where in Waikiki...unless you are paying for ocean view more then likely you will be looking at the mountain and other hotels...but that kind of normal for Waikiki...there is a Wolfgang Puck Express, Jamba Juice, Subway and a Cookie place on the bottom floor of the hotel...the rooms are just 2 beds and a table pretty typical of a normal Waikiki room...it did have a single serve Kurig coffee maker and I thought that was a nice touch also had a small frig and in room safe...now for some of the things that went wrong...I had the bellman bring up my bags so I was in the room for a little while and I noticed the A/C was a little weak so when he came up I asked if there was a higher setting on the A/C he looked at it and said no...he then asked if I would like a fan sent to the room...I said yes and he said he would send one up...guess what never saw the fan...I waited for 3 hours in the room before we went to dinner so it wasn't like I missed the fan...why even offer to have it sent up if you are not going to do it??? next big fail at this hotel is the Valet not sure if they are staffed correctly there, but even after I called from my room to have the car brought up it still takes like 20 to 30 mins so please call like 30 mins before you go down to the valet...ok last thing the elevators you need a room key to program the floor you want..it then tells you what elevator to get in...nice touch keeps waits way down...no comes the odd part from your room you cant get to the parking lot...you have to go back to the lobby and either change elevator or us the escalator??? but from the parking you can go straight to your floor...not sure what the thinking is there unless it is meant to drive foot traffic to the business selling tour packages?other then that the hotel worked for fine for us as we were going in and out and the beach is right across the street.. the hotel room was clean and they had a little care package with a small bag with sun screen and a hand fan...maybe the fan was all ready in the room...hahahaha

When I booked the room online it was stated as an "Ocean View"but it turned out to be a view of the Hotel across the street.The street noise from below is unbearable in the early morning with all the Busses and delivery vehicles with their "Back-up Beepers" screaming for hours enough to wake you up.Our room was drafty with the wind blowing through the room due to "No" door seals.The old sliding door was difficult to open for my wife and kids.Our AC could not cool the room during the day any lower than 77-76 deg.You can hear the other rooms doors slamming as the other guest would come and go.We did not have an Icemaker on our floor.Plastic trash liners were not used in the rooms trash cans of which is disgusting. The Biggest Issue I have is when arriving early before check-in and after a long flight, that there is no escape from the heat and humidity. You do not have an Air Conditioned lobby or anywhere to be comfortable before waiting 3 hours to get to your room. I find it interesting that there were not a single room ready until 3pm, no chance of an earlier check-in.Last, the beds were very uncomfortable and how this place has a "Four Star" Hotel is beyond me.

We spent 3 great nights at the Aston. The rooms were nice, all have balconies with a table and chairs. The Ocean view was spectacular with at least 5 surf breaks clearly visible and a birds eye view of the constant activities on the beach, in the sea and on the street. Also great for viewing the fireworks shows in the bay on weekends.The In-house Tiki bar offers good food, cocktails and nightly entertainment, attracting a lively crowd after sunset. Also children friendly.The property, in some areas is very "dated", but, in retrospect, that was part of the charm.The staff are polite and efficient. We had a trainee in housekeeping on our floor - could use a bit more training...Within a couple of blocks there's Starbucks, LuLu's for drinks and sports bar/surfer dude type food, a Harley shop and stores, stores, stores...I recommend the Aston to couples and families on vacation and would happily return!

This was our first visit to the island! The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and manageable for 2 people. We were on the 14th floor and could see Waikiki beach. It was great with the ocean view. This hotel is near the zoo and if you are doing any of the tours ( pearl harbor, etc) you get picked up right out side the lobby. There is shopping everywhere within walking distance. The only suggestion I have is to update the rooms to make them brighter. It is an older hotel that needs updated. For the location and the cost I think its a great place to stay! If I ever get to go to Honolulu again I would definitely stay here!

This hotel is worst hoel in my life.I check in this hotel on 03rd-AUG-2016.And I found bathroom was not clean up. (Room #629) I called to front desk for changing my room. But As common sense, first of all, they sould apologize to me about this disgusting happening. But They didn't.And My room was ocean view. I paid for that. But other ocean view room was sold out. So they can not change ocean view room. I understand about that. But they should change my room as same value room. But although I yield ocen view, they gave me more small and city view. I didn't ask compensation such as money or room upgrade. But at least they should provide me same value room.I can not believe they are professionals. In this reason, This hotel is worst hotel in my life. They completely break my family summer vacation.I never recommend to my friends.

Amazing location right across the street from Waikiki Beach. Extreme winds stopped us from enjoying the balcony and it always seemed to be windy. Weird thing is it wasn't windy in front of the hotel, just around the hotel, constantly. The hotel is clean, rooms are small, staff is friendly. Don't expect anything extravagant.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is literally steps across the famous Waikiki Beach. The hotel is very nice and clean, the service is excellent, and you are literally just minutes away from everything. It is right next to Hotels such as the Marriott, the Sheraton, etc. but is much more affordable. Places to eat range from the Wolfgang Puck Express that is located in the hotel to a Burger King that is a block away. You are also located withing walking distance to Waikiki's famous Luxury Row with stores/shops such as those found on Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills. The Aston Waikiki is affordable, but like other hotels on the island, the resort fees and valet parking fees can add up. Nonetheless, if you are looking for a good, comfortable place to stay at a reasonable price and at an excellent location....this is the place to stay. Very family oriented with a wonderful staff that is waiting to make your stay a wonderful one.

We stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach for 4 nights in the Ocean Front Select Room, which was located on the 18th floor. The views were breathtaking of Waikiki Beach and views all the way past Royal Hawaiian. The beds were so comfortable and slept very well.The Tiki bar downstairs do beautiful meals and has a great atmosphere.Highly recommended this hotel and would definitely stay here on my next visit to Hawaii

Staying here now. Air conditioning is very very weak and does not cool room. Room lacks a comfortable chair to use instead of the bed and a high top table and chairs. Tiki restaurant food is good. Great location to the beach and shopping. Has a refrigerator.

You can't beat the location at all! It is front and center to Waikiki which was what we wanted. Our interactions with the staff were pleasant. If you are a stickler for rooms, this might not be your cup of tea. We stayed on the 8th floor and our room had seen much better days. There was a tear in the comforter, the pillows were worn and the general cleanliness left a little to be desired, there was a prescription pill on the floor from a previous patron. The bathroom was like a shoebox for me, a 6' 230 pound guy. The toilet was extremely low and slanted. The shower head was at chin level and the wear and tear was obvious here. The pool is small and gets crowded easy but hey, the beach is right across the street. You check out towels for use if you don't have your own, this was nice. We did not eat on site but the restaurant was always full.Again, our stay was fine as we did not spend much time in the room. Location is what mattered for us and we were there only three nights. If our duration were the same we might consider them again.

What a great place to stay in Waikiki. Just across the street from the beach in the quiet end of Waikiki, the staff are very professional and full of Aloha. There are great amenities in the lobby and nearby, like Wolfgang Puck, Lulu's Surf Ba, Tiki's Bar and Grill etc. Nice clean rooms.

We spent only one enjoyable night on Waikiki but the Aston had everything we look for in a resort hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious. The balcony was a great spot from which to enjoy the sights and sounds of Waikiki (from the other side of the hotel you get a great view of Diamond Head State Monument). The location is right in the heart of downtown Waikiki within walking distance of tons or restaurants and shops. Wolfgang Puck's restaurant is basically in the lobby. The pool was a bit small for the size of the hotel but other than that everything was great!

Second visit again after 5 years . Hotel was clean , they upgraded us to a 3/4 ocean view room. Service was good. Though one issue I kept facing was that the Air conditioner didnt work properly or was not cold enough. When pointed out they told us that it shuts off when open the slider. With the slider closed it still wouldn't cool enough and we did feel hot so we stopped complaining as we were there for only 3 nights.. Other than that it was what we had expected. And yes they did away with their breakfast which used to be fun.Hotel is right across the waikiki beach and it is an easy walk to the beach even while carrying the Towels and chairs which they offer for free to hotel guests.Also if you have a car parked their , please make sure you let the valet know 15- 20 mins before you are heading down . It does take that much time during the day.Overall a good stay and nice family hotel.A few pointers to prospective guest: Tiki grill ( restaurant on site) is greatPool is a tad bit smaller .Elevators - fun after you get used to them Plenty of food joints under the hotel . Close to ABC stores

We stayed at this hotel from July 16-23. We arrived early and were glad to have a room available for us upon our arrival. We were on the 21 st floor and had a great partial ocean view overlooking Waikiki and Diamond Head. The only thing I would have changed was to maybe be up one floor so we didn't look right into the hotel next to us.The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom may be a little dated, but it served our needs well.It was great to have access to towels and chairs. This was great for our time on the beach. It is conveniently located right across the road from Waikiki Beach and there are tons of restaurants and stores close by. We loved going to Tiki's for Happy Hour and we really enjoyed Sansei across the road at the Marriot for some really great sushi. We really appreciated the late check out. We found the cost reasonable ar $50 to be able to check out at 4 pm.Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Stayed for 10 nights in May 2013 (app doesn't allow me to select an earlier date). Check in was quick and straightforward, room was easy to find and nicely Hawaiian decorated. Like other reviewers I did find the bathroom to be quite dated but a lot of Hawaii felt dated and it had the basic amenities so I see no reason to complain about it. The shower head was quite low but it was manageable. Our room overlooked queens beach, disappointed it was the wrong time of year for the Hawaii 5-0 premier as we would have had an amazing view. As it was our honeymoon we received a small gift from the hotel and our bridesmaid had called in advance to arrange a gift basket of wine, fruit and macadamia nuts. Breakfast was basic and to be honest we only used it twice as we preferred to go out and have a larger breakfast to set us up for the day. The pool we only used on our last day as we had to check out a good few hours before our flight. Location was perfect, option of two different beaches across from the hotel, one with a rock edge to make it more pool like the other a typical beach with waves crashing to the shore. Next door to the zoo and only a short walk from the shops and restaurants of Waikiki and the aquarium. Dined in tikis a couple of times and loved how convenient the hotel was to other options with a Wolfgang puck express, subway and cold stone creamery on the ground floor. Ideally located for abc but I think everywhere in Waikiki is. Word of advice is to use the abc store down the side of the hotel as the one on kalakau is dearer with it being so close to the beach.

Nice room. Amenities always available. Location was ideal on Waikiki Beach. There was an excellent Wofgang Puck restaurant downstairs that served delicious mid-priced breakfasts. Located next to the zoo at the end of the Waikiki Beach strip.

The hotel was nice, the staff and room was great. They provided a nice gift bag assist when you go to the beach. My only complaint was that the bathroom needs to be updated and deep cleaned. Everything else to include the staff, the onsite restaurant/bar was great. Additionally a great location on the strip!

This is a nice hotel good service but the rooms are dated tho they are clean good facilities such as free did rentals and a PS3 in ur room with flat screenThe hotel is well staffed and clean and offers free beach towels by the pool The bar and grill is very good

When we first arrived at the hotel, our room was ready to go. We had a excellent view of Waikiki beach ( make sure to book a room with a ocean view) There is a petite balcony area ( perfect for viewing the sunset/sunrise of the beach).  Overall, the room was nice . Other reviews complained about the room. I thought it was nice . Plus, you won't spend your day in the room because you will be sightseeing the entire day. In every room ,the hotel provides a complimentary/ welcome package that consists of sunscreen lotion, a fan, and some other moisturizing products.  They have a great restaurant/bar called Tiki bar. They always feature live music performances. Nearby, you will find other restaurants and a starbucks.  If you have children, there is small pool . Its nice but you are going to spend more time at the beach than the pool. The hotel provides towels but be sure to sign the checkout-list for the towels you use.  Overall, Aston beach is a very nice hotel to stay at. No major problems checking in or checking out. Very courteous staff! I will definitely return to this hotel!

This was the first time we visited Waikiki, HI and all I can say is that I'm sad to come back to my routine. My family (daughter & husband) stayed at the Aston and we had a great time! check in: Fast and efficient. We did not have any trouble checking in and the room given to us is what we had asked for "BREATHTAKING VIEW".. 16 floor.. Room: Was of reasonable size, not too large - two Queen beds, very comfortable to sleep in and the pillows were soft and had a great night sleep. NOT FANCY! Only CON in the room was the missing remote control; which guest services took care of it right away. Also, the air conditioner had problems because it was outdated. We didn't want to move rooms so we left the air running all day and the problem was fixed. The room came with a refrigerator; which made it very convenient for us; I would recommend they had a microwave also, just to warm up any leftovers (specially when traveling with kids). The housekeeper made the beds every day and organized the room- always smelling clean and refreshed (note: we left a tip every day; because of the great service). Overall was nice room, not too fancy; but, worth your money. Location of the Hotel: Perfect!! Close to all the shopping stores, food, beach, local eateries and the zoo (one block distance). Loved the convenience.. Also, If you would like to snorkel you can take a day to visit Hanauma Bay - the bus that takes you there is (line 22) drops you off right at the site for $2.50 each way. You also have the convenience to take the trolley right in front of the lobby.. Great location.Ambiance: Had breakfast and Lunch at the Tiki Grill - loved their food & service ***** five stars!! The ambiance was great throughout the day, live music playing, great cocktails and the people there are so nice, polite and know how to have fun.. Very safe for kids, they have hotel personnel always walking around to make sure everything is in order.. Pool: Clean, not too big 6 feet I think was the dept. Lots of families with their children. No lifeguard on site (parent discretion). They had lots of chairs and they provide towels and beach chairs. You can take them to the beach across the street; but you do have to return them by the end of the day. Overall: Nice, clean, and convenient Hotel. They have a little market on the lobby with all the essentials (soda, milk, cereal etc..) ATM on site, Tour booths available on site if you would like to book tours throughout the day. I recommend you do not get tours before hand unless you visit Paradise Cov

So here's the thing... We stayed here 4 years ago and noticed some maintenance that needed carrying out ( bathrooms especially )and forgive it as the location is amazing, the staff are 5 star ( you cannot fault the staff, they are amazing ) and thought those issues would start to be addressed, however the bathrooms dont look to have had any care and are starting to look very tired indeed, in our room the soap dish was coming away from the wall and shower head attachment from the wall is moving at its own will, the tiles need some attention, a lick of paint would make all the difference and some very simple maintenance fixes. The staff make this place and it's fabulous location and I would implore management to start putting some money into the place. Also it's a bit of shame that employment relations have broken down to the point that there are a small but determined number of demonstrators outside waving placards, also a shame thatA4 flyers from both disgruntled employees and responses from management are posted under people's doors, each revoking the others claims. So here's the thing, sit down, sort out your Maintenance issues and start an open dialogue with those demonstrators ( although to be fair you may have tried to do this already). I am still giving a 4 star review as I believe those staff we met deserve that and more, house keeping, good job, front desk, Jono, good job. Lastly the room sizes are a little smaller than say over the road at The Marriott but the views from the balcony are fabulous.

We arrived here quite late at night on the 28th June, after a long trip from the UK.The checkin staff were, quick, efficient and friendly. We were so tired we didn't really notice anything about the room but we both had a good nights sleep.The next morning we were disappointed with the room,although it was very large it overlooked a car park, some of the lights wouldn't turn on, the bathroom was very old and the air driyer fell off the wall. I went down to reception and had a chat with a very friendly member of staff, he apologised and said that he would look into it. I asked if their were any other rooms available and he had a look on his computer. He upgraded us to an ocean view room and we moved in almost straight away. I am sorry to say that I have forgotten the name of the person but he was brilliant, our thanks to him.After that the hotel was execelent, friendy staff, wonderfull views of Waikiki beach, watching the surfers etc. The hotel is conveniently situated for the Zoo, Diamond Head, local buses and not forgetting the ABC store. We ate in the Tiki Bar, I had fish and chips and being fromthe North of England, I know good fish and chips and these were the best I had in the USA. I would thorough recommend this hotel

My husband and I just spent six nights here while on our honeymoon and had a very pleasant stay. The king size bed was super comfortable. The staff was great. We were close to shopping and right across the street from the beach. The onsite restaurants were delicious. So many people complain about the "hidden" daily fee. It's by no means hidden. It clearly states the fees on the hotel's website. Also, good luck finding a hotel in Honolulu that doesn't charge a daily or parking fee. If we were to stay in Waikiki again, we'd definitely stay here!

Clean, great staff, awesome Tiki Bar and everything you need can be found on the 3rd floor! If you're looking for adventure go to the Expedia desk and request Carmen! Carmen went above and beyond to get us into every attraction and adventure on our 7 day getaway! The Aston is the best place to stay and I can't reiterate enough how helpful the hotel staff and Expedia was! Would recommend Aston Beach Hotel to everyone

Aston is a perfect place to stay while in Honolulu. Celebrated our 20yr. anniversary. We had a Beach Front View on the 10th floor which was fantastic to wake up to and see the sunset. The room was clean, comfortable and the bath was the same. No major signs of being worn out. This is a good hotel at a fair price, this is not a place for someone that is looking for 4 star service. Amenities were good, used the pool and gym. We were very close to any pickups for the tours and walked all of Wakiki the 4 days we stayed. Uber also services the area whcih we used for our Special dinner evening. Highly recommend!!Originally I was going to stay at the Pacific Beach till I read some reviews here about the construction, not that I don't mind improvements, just not while I am vacationing.

We stayed here for three nights while we finished up our trip to Hawaii. The location of this hotel is excellent, right across the street from Waikiki beach. It is near diamond head and a public park so it wasn't as busy on that end of the beach. We had an ocean view room and had a great view of Waikiki beach! Pic attachedI rated it average because the actual rooms are very dated and small. It seems it had not been updated in 20 years. Bathrooms were small, no more then one person could be in there at a time, faucet wouldn't shut off unless it was in an exact position. The shower head was low so my husband had to swat down underneath it to get fully covered, he is 5'11". The air conditioner was loud when it was on. We had a king bed and it took up the entire room. On our first day there, we heard some people shouting out in front of the hotel and banging on drums. Come to find out, it was workers from this hotel protesting. It started as a few people then gradually more and more workers joined in. It went on for at least 2 hours. Luckily it was only that one day, July 14, but still felt uncomfortable during this time as a guest at the hotel. Overall, stay was good. Front desk staff and pool staff were nice and helpful. Location was great as we could walk to all the restaurants on the main drag of Waikiki beach.

The hotel needs a complete renovation and a contracted pest control company for their roach problem!Tiki's Bar and Grill is honestly the only good thing at the Aston.This should be a last resort hotel and it is definitely overpriced. Cheers-Ken

Across the street from the beach, makes it convenient and attractive, but housekeeping service not so good they denied us a second cup of coffee, one a day they said, at four o'clock the room was still not cleaned, very rude, housekeeping, the bathroom outlet didn't work, on the fourth day drilling woke us up, they were fixing electrical problems outside our door, someone got stuck in the elevator, when we asked a question about anything during our 5 day stay, no one could answer anything.

Travel agent booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. Pictures on website totally inaccurate and misleading. The hotel is depressing. Corridors had old fashioned floral carpet with old brown wallpaper and bright red doors. Looked like an institution. Our room (319) had old dirty brown wallpaper, desk lamp had water stains. Bathroom at least 40 years old (my mother has same fittings). Bathroom had warn tiles and mildew. No where to put toiletries and toilet directly under part of the basin so if toilet seat was left up there was a chance the toiletries would end up I. The toilet bowl! Check in was efficient but the lady looked as if her face would crack if she smiled. Pool area drab and only 4 umbrellas for about 50 deck chairs. Our balcony only had 1 chair but the clincher was the coffee. We had a coffee maker and 2 coffee pods. I rang housekeeping to ask for tea as my husband drinks coffee but I drink tea and was told that when they delivered the tea I would have to give back one of the coffee pods!!!!! no complimentary water, had to pay $2 for a small bottle. A nice touch were the complimentary sunscreen and aftersun cream, but I suppose with only 4 umbrellas people would need them. On the plus side, air conditioning worked well and shower head was strong and efficient Luckily, we were only there 2 nights and went to other hotels for meals etc. the hotel is promoted due to its proximity across the road from the beach, but the previous week we had stayed at another hotel on the beach side for less.

I gave this hotel a 4 because of its location and the friendly staff. It is across from the beach with lots of places to eat nearby. The hotel does need some renovation though especially in the bathroom. We ate at the restaurant at the hotel and it was good. The beds were comfortable but they only have double beds. Two queen beds would have been nicer.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. We really enjoyed the hotel, especially the view! This hotel is right across the street from Wakiki Beach, and it is surrounded by shopping stores and restaurants. The staff was very nice, and the hotel itself is very nice. I would definitely book here again.

The location of the Waikiki Beach Hotel can't be beat, however it does need some sprucing up. The bathroom tiles are in need of repair and the shower was not as warm as expected. Also of note, the only chairs in the room are very small wooden bench like seating. If guests stop by there is literally no room for them to sit other than the bed. Over all it's a fine hotel though and we would certainly stay here again. The pool was great, perfect for families. It's a nice touch that they offer towels from the cabana so you don't have to bring beach towels from home! Staff is very gracious and helpful, especially the housekeeping staff---really great ladies! I'm still trying to figure out the elevator/escalator system though :)

My family and I (2 adults/2 teens) had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The customer service was EXCELLENT. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was very roomy but could use some updating of the carpet and furniture. Otherwise I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Great location we stayed in the hotel for 2 nights staff very helpful, tour desk very helpful, rooms ordinary, bathroom while clean power points did not work, Shower over bath over filled with every shower, only one other power point in the rest of the hotel worked.

We stayed on this Hotel from June 20 through July 4th...we loved it great location everything is walking distance...the beach is beautiful...all the employees were nice specially Gabby from the front desk...we stayed in the 16th floor beach front room excellent view...room was clean .

We liked the location. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and the elevator was fairly efficient. Great place to stay if you are riding the bus, trolley or picking up tours as they all seem to stop outside the Hotel. So close to shops, restaurants and the beach. We did not rent a car & explored the island by tours, using Uber & the trolley with no problem. The Tikki Bar located on the property is a great place to watch the sunset.

We were on island for only one night - this was a great location since the Zoo was on our to-do list this trip. If you're a runner, this is also a great starting point to head out towards Diamond Head - lots of tree-shaded streets. It was a quick visit, but we appreciated the in-room Coola amenity, in-room coffee maker, and the unlimited DVD/PS rentals. We also LOVED our ocean view. Fun time. We'll be back.

Location is everything...hotel is very ordinary otherwise.....a lot of better properties than this....the little shop in the hotel is excellent for things you run out of...and plenty of shops nearby for tourist items.Concierge services good....staff in general fine and attentive.The lift system takes a little getting used to.It is just a little old.it is Honolulu!

It's our first time here in Hawaii and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Here are some of our takes:PROS: Just a few steps from Waikiki beach / Free movies and PS3 games from a kiosk / Close to a lot of shops, the zoo, aquarium and restaurants / Friendly staff / In room WiFi had strong connection / We arrived at 2pm and they accommodated us with an early check-in (rooms were ready) / Can borrow towels at the pool area to use for the beach!CONS: Rooms are nothing special - outdated decor / bathroom floors are worn / AC didn't work for the last 2 days of our stay / PS3 couldn't read the blurays that we rented from the kiosks (PS3 needed firmware update) / remote on the TV worked half the timeMISC: Valet parking for $30/daily with in and out privileges / $23 per day resort fee / the check-in lobby is on the 3rd floor (?) / tiny pool (but we didn't got there for the pool)TIPS: There's a little place behind the hotel where you can get breakfast for $3.50! (eggs/spam/sausage etc) - not the best but will sure fill your tummy / You can park by the Zoo parking lot across the street and pay $1 per hour instead of the valet parking (it's packed most of the time though)We won't mind coming back :)

We stayed here for 6 nights in June....such a nice view from the patio.It's on the far end near the Honolulu Zoo. WE walked to most places we wanted to eat...there are plenty to choose from nearby.Best part is the hotel is right across the street from the beach, you can't beat that.Room was a nice size, but it (like the others) is and old hotel, our air conditioner was EXTREMELY LOUD and I'm sure they knew this when they gave us the room.There is a high daily amenities charge and a high daily valet charge for parking. With those extra charges you'd think they would ask how your stay is and more. We asked if there was a place where we could print our boarding passes for our return trip and they said they would print them for us. For the high amenity charge you would think they would have a computer and printer available like most hotels.Overall...the place is nice, but only average.

Pro -It was a great experience... Staff were friendly. con- the pool is tiny but theres the beach in front if you... Also the check in, we encountered a long line and we were so tired from the travel. Not to mention the homeless people loitering outside screaming and yelling disturbing the guests.

This hotel is closer to the zoo end of Waikiki. The center of Waikiki is a short walk.This hotel offers a nice swimming pool and just across the street is Waikiki beach. The rooms are nice. Very friendly and helpful staff.Be aware that this hotel charges a $23/day resort fee that is usually not mentioned when making a booking, especially when this hotel is part of a package.

Let me start with this. The hotel is old, like most of the hotels in that part of Waikiki. But it's well maintained by the stuff. They are friendly and always ready to help. If you stay here and don't plan to visit other parts of Oahu do not rent a car. The hotel charge for parking, but from where you at you dont need a car. You are walking distance from the Zoo, shopping areas and across the street is the Waikiki Beach. Then you can always book a trip to wherever you want to go. The pool is nice, and Tiki Bar is OK, the Hotel offers free PS games and free movies if you even want to stay in the room.Overall the place is nice and not very expensive.

Did i like it at all? I can't say no, i had a really beautiful view from my balcony, clean room and cool bar downstairs with tasty food and nice music everynight! Would i come here again? No! And i wouldn't recommend you to choose this hotel, they have hidden charges of 24$ daily for amenities as your wifi tv fitness center and no matter did you use it or no... Charges everywhere that makes your stay uncomfortable, so YES for location and housekeeping and biiiig NO for costumer service!

We stayed in this hotel for 14 days. A few years ago we have also stayed here for a weekend. According to the pictures it looked like the same rooms. However we got a room which looked 25 years older then the other rooms. After checking in we went to our room and we like to put out the air conditining. Strange enough I could't. So I called for maintenance. He was not able to fix it. All night the A-C was blowing cold wind from Alaska over our bodies...After a few hours, the ice machine was also making lost of noise, I demanded another room and got that. Terrible rooms, for to much money never again!!

I stay here for work...the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and its in a fantastic location. Beds are comfortable and the rooms are average size. There are restaurants located everywhere and the beach is steps away! I would definitely suggest this restaurant for a family or a work stay.

I've stayed at numerous hotels during my many business travels to Honolulu Hawaii. The Astin Waikiki Hotel is in the heart of the downtown hustle and bustle. If you're into shopping and eating, there are plenty of shops and eateries at decent prices and good food. The hotel is across the street from Waikiki beach were there are many activities at the beach. There are shuttle buses that will take you to numerous sight seeing places.

I stayed here on my honeymoon. The rooms are nothing special but are clean. Friendly service. The views are amazing from your hotel room and you have access to everything. Many great restaurants, beautiful beaches, etc.

A lot went wrong with my first trip to Hawaii in 45 years. Thank goodness one of the things that went right was booking this hotel!I wanted to stay away from the large crowds and the Waikiki nightlife and noise. I researched all the hotels and all their services and reviews. I looked at every photo and checked every room option. I should have booked sooner to be able to stay longer but...I discovered that the humidity in Oahu is higher than I had remembered and June was probably best kept as a short visit.The best part of this hotel is not just it's view but the staff itself. Also a very unique origin story. Kinda cool. I like the location a lot and would stay at this hotel again in a heart beat.

My family and I just stayed here for a week. Upon arrival (around 1.30pm) we were greeted with a quite a long line at reception, and waited about 20 minutes before we were served. We were served by a young man who didn't seem confident with the check-in system and it took him around 20 minutes to sort out our rooms. Then when we reached our rooms, our keys (cards) for both did not work. We then had to line up again in reception to receive new keys. The next attendant we had was swift in resolving our problem, offering sincere apologies for the inconvenience. This admittedly was the only hiccup we had staying at this hotel. Our rooms were amazing and were serviced daily by our room attendant, Rosanna. Who was always lovely and chatted to us when we ran into her in the corridor. We had a slight problem with our Wi-Fi connection, which was attended to within ten minutes of calling reception. The gentlemen who fixed it was wonderful, also very talkative.The location of this hotel is brilliant, Towards the left end of Waikiki beach. Surrounded by numerous restaurants, and ABC stores (of course!) But because it is one of the last hotels along the Waikiki strip it is out of the way of all the hustle and bustle. It's a ten minute stroll down to the main part of Waikiki beach, just a little further up are all the retail shops and it is less than a two minute walk to the Zoo!A trolley bus (USD$2 each way) stops/picks up from outside the hotel which takes you to Ala Moana shopping centre. Tikis Bar and Grill is attached to the hotel on the same floor as reception, which is a happening and popular place to go, Meals are a little expensive as are drinks, but the atmosphere and view makes up for it. Definitely recommend making a booking for the restaurant area on weekends.Overall it is a brilliant place to stay, would definitely recommend it to anyone travelling to Waikiki.

the views of waikiki beach are breathtaking from the patio of your room at the aston. the location is perfect, close to shopping, restaurants, the zoo, and of course the beach! my only complaint was the lack of coffee pods to go with the keurig machine conveniently placed in your room. (we had to go to the front desk EVERYDAY and ask for them). the pool and restaurant at the hotel were nice, the facility clean and well kept.

My mother took my daughter to Hawaii as a high school graduation gift and they stayed at this property. I contacted the hotel ahead of time and asked if they could do anything special since it was a graduation gift. They went above and beyond to make the trip special.
