The views were amazing, the room was nice, and the hotel was well located to food and shopping.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We lashed out and stayed in an ocean front room and we were glad we did pay the extra. The view from our room and balcony was sensational. We spent quite some time sitting on the balcony enjoying a coffee or a drink and enjoying the view. Tikis Bar was also a great place to have a meal or a drink. The prices during happy hour, which runs daily from 2.00pm to 5.00pm, are very reasonable. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the elevator system is great. The rooms are a little tired but still comfortable. Location is great with the hotel being directly across the road from the beach and it is virtually the last hotel along the strip and away from the hustle and bustle.

Very nice hotel with easy access to beach. Room is clean and staffs are very generous . The view of room is very beautiful. Free blu-ray and DVD rental. Walking distance to many stores and restaurants. I would definitely like to stay again

I stayed here a couple of years ago and had a awesome time (September 2014 sorry nooption for that so put the oldest option). Can't beat the view being that the hotel is across the street from the beach, near the zoo, near restaurants , shopping, etc. One of the best features of this hotel is the Tiki Grill that has awespecially live music and pretty great food. I hope the poisson cru dish is still there (amazingly delicious). We ate and had drinks there almost every night of our stay listening to music. Most of the tours stop right at the hotel so very easy to take a bus tour. The staff was very helpful. Even changing our room after telling the front desk of some minor issues in the bathroom. At the time breakfast was included but have been reading that in lieu of breakfast there have been updates made and waiting to see all of the amenities that have been added to the resort fee ( Excited about the WiFi and tote bag with goodies). One con I remember and still see is an issue is the parking fee. I just found out sone of the other hotels have begun including parking in the resort fee. Not too happy about that.Well I still went ahead and just booked my stay again at the Aston for October 2016 due to all the aforementioned reasons. I have stayed at various other hotels there over the years but the Aston helped make my trip pretty great. So here is hoping for another memorable trip!

This is a unique place. It's designed to be fun and casual, as one would expect for the moderate price range. The location is great, right across from the beach, and oceanfront rooms have gorgeous views from the lanais. The rooms are decorated in modern tiki theme and bold colors. We found some complimentary snacks in our fridge, some Hawaiian sodas and cookies. The "breakfast on the beach" is somewhat chaotic in the mornings, everyone gets into line at the same time and the options are somewhat limited. However, take it for what it's worth, a solid continental breakfast plus a few hot items. Take advantage of the portable nature and get out of the craziness by taking the food to the beach or back to your room. The attached (but separately owned) Tikis' restaurant is also pretty good, featuring local classics and comfort food, with excellent tropical tiki drinks and happy hour specials. The pool area is small, but when we were there, it was never too crowded after breakfast died down. They offer rental of videos and video games to entertain you at night, but you could just sit on your lanai and listen to the live music from the restaurant.

We stayed here for 1 night so wanted a decent / clean room but nothing too expensive. I will make it simple. PROS: great location just steps away from the beach, staff was friendly and helpful, hotel is close to many shops restaurants. zoo yet it is on the end of the beach to it is not quite as much hustle & bustle on this end. We ate at the pool bar & food was good but very expensive. CONS: Our room was dated & a little worn out. I did not expect anything fancy, but the bathroom had paint missing & holes in the wall from where it looked like they removed a vanity mirror. The hotel also had no hot water on the morning we were checking out from 8AM - 12PM. Seriously, who does that at that time to work on the boiler? How about in the middle of the night?!I personally would not stay here for an extended vacation stay, but for just a night or 2 it is a clean bed to sleep in.

Still at this godforsaken place, wish I could go home. I am not a complainer usually but as soon as we arrived the toilet was not flushing properly. We called for assistance and twice a man came with a plunger and said the problem was fixed and he was tipped accordingly. Then it blocked really really badly to the point it was overflowing and my husband complained so we were moved to another room. KEEP AWAY FROM ROOM 807 the toilet is faulty. As well we'd rung several times to work out how the PS3 worked, needn't have worried there were only 3 discs to borrow anyway. So my husband and 2 young children and I moved to another room in our pyjamas, no assistance from anyone. Now finally in another new room, can't work the dvd/PS3 AGAIN as the remote is completely different plus the a/c isn't working! To top it all off the room is two rooms back from the ocean, we had a partial ocean view but now even though we are higher we are further back so can only see about half the ocean we could see. As well the rooms are TINY, it took us ages to strategically place 4 suitcases around the room, 1 on top of the safe in the cupboard.

At the beginning of our trip we were having trouble at one of their sister hotels.....not to be named because i don’t want to bash them, but the manager Jackie took care of me and my wife. She took on the task immediately of ensuring our stay began well. Jackie called up the Aston and garnered us an upgrade for the same price we paid for the current hotel. Not only did she do this but Jackie (the manager) actually hand walked our luggage to the Aston and followed us up to the room to ensure it was suitable. Our upgrade included a plush king size bed with lovely ocean view. I was astonished by the service that we received that night. This is not all……on days 2, 5, and 7 of our 10 day trip Jackie and Michelle (the clerk who checked us in) called to check on our stay to make sure we were being taken care of. In my 13 years of traveling around the world and staying in a lot of 5 star hotels I have NEVER received such personalized service. For anyone that has bad comments about this place I say, “Go see or ask for Jackie she will get your stay right.”

Fantastic hotel, it has a pool but just over the road (bear a crossing) is the beach. Staff are friendly. Lovely breakfasts. Got hooked on the iced coffee (macadamia nut coffee) The zoo is close by. Close to great shops.The rooms are beautifully decorated in Hawaiian print. A fridge was in the room which was very handy. Had a partial sea view. Great view of diamond head.Would love to go back

The hotel is across the street from the ocean with a good beach. It is beautiful to watch the sunset. It has secured elevators. Our room faced Diamond Head and the ocean. The room was clean, quiet and big. The pool is right next to the front desk area. The staff was friendly. The concierge helped with a taxi when we went to Diamond Head. I was surprised by the pigeons that would join you for a meal but they were harmless. So many choices for food in this area. Within walking distance of this hotel are tons of high end shopping stores. Before you take off, stop off at the cookie shop and get one for your walk. So yummy!

I've read some other reviews and will say; if you're used to 5 star hotel, Hilton or Marriott, keep looking. The Ashton is practical, clean, affordable, perfect location, great staff & overall a cool spot. Our check I was on time/ early, all of the tours pickup at this hotel, it's right across from the beach, we had no problems with the TV, fridge or nothing else. Perfect location from the beach (across the street) Lulu's around the corner (try it) cheap hole in the wall spot around other corner, walking distance from ALL major food restaurants, & shopping (Macy's, Ross & Coach Store) within a mile or less. If you are a bargain fashionista this is the place for you, however buogie snotty types look elsewhere. The staff is too nice to be treated rudely by high maintenance folks. I would definitely stay at the Ashton again.

I rarely put a blanket statement of negativity on a chain and most of the times any issues I have are specific to an individual hotel. However here, I am just tired of Aston. Too many issues last time and this time as well. TV was almost falling on me, toilet flush very hard, bathroom door quite beat up, refrigerator not working, crappy coffee and on and off wifi. Most of these got addressed quickly but it was getting to the point for me that no matter how nice (and they were) or quick the staff is, I just should not be having this many issues with my hotel on vacation. The best they did is give me 2 nights credit for the daily service fee. I know all hotels at least in Waikiki charge such fees, but still when you charge fees for things that normally other hotels don't charge fees for, I expect working quality. I just don't feel Aston puts any effort into preventive hotel maintenance like other hotels, especially chain ones. If I go to Choice hotel or best western, I would be pressed to find a place with so many problems. Maybe Motel 6 could have some thing like that, but I thought Aston is a bit higher than motel 6 and they certainly don't price their rooms like motel 6:) $30 / day parking fee - takes forever to get it from valet, sometimes over 15-20 min. Anyways, in future I will really think twice about going to Aston and perhaps will be happy to pay more for some peace of mind.

We stayed here for 3 days, on arrival was upgraded to a ocean front room at no cost. The Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very small and dated but the view made up for it. Location was fantastic too with the beach right across the road. The elevator in the lobby is tiny and at times had to wait as it was full. To sum it up, good cheap accommodation, great location but it's no Hilton

We are currently staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, we received early check in as we arrived early for AUS and the hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. We are on floor 20 with ocean view so great! across from the beach and lots of food walking distant and a trolley stop right out the front. Highly recommended.

the hotel was central to anything you wanted, we sat on our balcony overlooking the beach and the strip , rooms were clean , staff were very friendly and helpful with anything required. Yes we would definitely stay here again

Literally steps across the street from Waikiki beach. We had a view of Diamond Head and we could see the beach if we looked to the right. Front desk and valet staff were nice. The bathroom is a hot mess. Toilet super short and floor tiles disgusting. Room was fine.

We stayed 9 nights in an Ocean front corner room and were really happy with the room and hotel location. Hotel was very clean, staff were really helpful. After an all night flight we arrived early and managed to get an early check in at 11 am which was very appreciated.Would stay here again.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a partial ocean view room. The staff were excellent, location fantastic (trolley stops right out the front door & beach across the road). The bar downstairs was good & there are lots of peace close by to eat.The free gift bag in the rooms with Coola products is excellent & a nice surprise. Whilst the rooms were clean, they needed to be updated. My bed wasn't great (too soft & uneven), the bathroom lacked ventilation, so you needed to open the door after having a shower to clear the steam, plus it was very dated. The most disappointing thing about the room was the balcony, it was only wide enough to stand on & frankly what's the point of that! The decor in the halls & elevators were an assault on the senses.I suggest if you are staying here, book the ocean view then you'll probably get a proper balcony.

We picked here to stay 2 nights on our way home from Maui. It's just across the road from the beach with great ocean views. Very nice lady at check in and the room was a nice size and clean. Only problem we had was the people next door to us. The children where LOUD. Not the hotels fault for sure just parents not teaching the kids to not scream when out in public. Would stay again when in town. Also the bar filled up and we could not get in. This was in the afternoon.

Stayed here as a family for 5 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel has a great location on the "quieter" side of the beach near the zoo and away from the pricey shops (Developed high end retail) on the other end of the beach. We were right across the street from the beach and there was a breakwall right in front of the hotel so our 2 year old go go in without waves. We had an ocean view and could take in sunset and watch the ocean from our balcony.There were lots of eating options nearby and the hotel had a desk to assist with any tours you wanted... we turned in early as we had a child so the video checkout (new movies) at the hotel came in handy. I think the hotel is in a good location and was a 5 minute walk from the busier shops etc. but in a quiet sweet spot.Two thumbs up!

When we arrived at the hotel we were given a free upgrade from a partial ocean view room to a full ocean view room which was lovely. The rooms are exactly what you need , they are comfortable with coffee making facilities but if you are like my husband & love your coffee be aware that they only give you two coffee pots per day & if you want anymore you need to pay for them. Don't buy them at the hotel go to one of the many ABC stores & buy them from there.The pool is lovely & the sun deck gets incredibly hot.The best thing is the location which is just across the road from Waikiki beach.

Very friendly staff. Close to everything.We had a super view of the beach and Diamond Head. Park and zoo directly across the street. Tiki restaurant has $3 Gin and tonics during Happy hour. Elevator system a bit tricky at first....don't get on the elevator without your key!!! Aloha

My husband and I checked into this hotel to celebrate our honeymoon. The first night there we found small bug bites on our bodies. We thought nothing of it since we thought being on the beach we might have got bit my bugs while on the beach. When we woke up on our last day at this disgusting hotel to find that we were covered in bites from head to toe. We found the bugs in the bed. I have worked in hotels for many years and I know the signs of bed bugs and the age. This room had very mature bug which means they have been there for an extended amount of time. The hotel did nothing for our inconvenience even knowing that I had an allergic reaction to the bites and ended up hospitalized. I urge you to reconsider staying at this hotel or any hotels in this chain.

Loved it this time around. They no longer have their breakfast included and the amenity fee did not change to compensate this. Apart from that, great views, close to everything, staff are so polite and helpful.

I loved this hotel and had a GREAT time during my stay.  The hotel is in great location, just across Kuhio Beach.  The staff was very friendly and efficient, the check-in was mega fast.  The valet parking guys were very friendly.  I reserved an Ocean View Deluxe room and for my surprise the hotel upgrade it to an Ocean View Suite which I LOVED <3, great size room with two balconies one of them with two chairs where my husband and I spent most of the time looking the beautiful view towards Waikiki Beach, a very comfortable king size bed, TV, sofa and a center table, a desk with a chair and a two people dining table.  The bathroom like the whole room was very clean.  The Tiki's Grill and Bar was amazing, I tried the Lava Flow drink at Duke's and Cheesecake Factory and I have to say that the Five-0- Lava flow at the Tiki's bar was the bomb. .

The Housekeeping is one of the worst we've experienced. The service at the front desk is slow and the guy the sits at pleasant Hawaiian desk it's helpful he was looking at his personal cell the whole time we were asking him questions. The fact that the hotel is out dated leaves a lot to be desired. The room isn't as nice as they show on the website. The bathroom tolit is so low to the floor it feels as thought you are going to fall, I have a bad knee and this was murder on me, the bathroom tiles are old and should be power washed if not changed altogether. The reason they have two stars is for the view, we had a Delux Ocean View room.

The location of the hotel was great. Although it was a good 10 minutes walk from the main action areas, it meant there were less people around, and the beach area was less crowded. We stayed in an Ocean View Room, with a very small balcony, opt for the deluxe or oceanfront to get a bigger balcony if you want to fit more than one person on it.. View was amazing from our room, and it made for some very nice photos to bring back home. The view offset how unimpressed we were with the room. The beds were ok, however the pillows were very flat. If you are after a gorgeous new bathroom, this is not the place to stay. The Bathroom was very small and in need of an update.On a positive note about the hotel, the staff were a refreshing welcome to every morning with their friendly aloha's flowing through the corridor.While we were there, we were woken up before 6am by people picketing/striking outside the hotel, in direct relation to the hotel itself. This was not the pleasant wake up call we were after.

The hotel is on the older side but is still comfortable Ana clean. Great location across the street form the beach. The Tiki bar restaurant is good but a little pricey live music every night so, if you get an ocean view room request something high up. I staid on the tenth floor, an could hear the music and the drunks screaming.

Just spent 4 nights here for a wedding and was pleased overall. This is not a fancy hotel by any means, but it was very clean and all of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The walls are on the thinner side, we definitely heard our neighbors using the hairdryer at 3am. The pool is on the smaller side, but the beach is right across the street. Location is very convenient; Starbucks is on the corner, Diamond Head is a short walk away, easy walk to restaurants and bars in Waikiki. Tiki's restaurant is very convenient and has a good (strong) mai tai.

The room was very nice and had an excellent view right up Waikiki Beach Lovely sitting on the balcony at night sipping wine and nibbles. Staff were very helpful and staff at Qantas holiday desk in hotel gave us great advice on things to do on Oahu Great bar downstairs where you could also obtain a light meal and wonderful cocktails

We stayed in an oceanfront select room, with a very small balcony. View was amazing, room was not. Bed was ok, pillows flat. Bathroom was gross, small, in dire need of a remodel, though our housekeeper, Vilma, kept it as clean as possible. Never would have stayed here if I'd seen pics of the bathroom. Staff could be better informed as well. We had a couple of issues with their lack of knowledge regarding common information. Had a problem with the DVD player, maintenance came. Lastly, wi-fi was horrible. Never again. Obviously paying for location and ocean view, but in the future I'd rather stay in a lesser room type at a nicer resort.

The staff was friendly in the old Aloha Spirit style and very efficient. They upgrade my room as I had booked on Expedia and gave me exactly what suited me. One of the beds was so broken down that I woke up every morning in pain however the handsome maintenance did their best to get a board under the bed. They had to make two tries and then shift my mattresses to a slightly firmer one. The view was great from the 6th floor and I enjoyed hearing the sounds of music, people and fun being right above Tiki's grill and bar.

This is a fun hotel. Easy walk to the best shopping and dining. The beach is just across the street. Incredible views from most rooms. Friendly staff. Very accommodating. Several restaurants available. We enjoyed Wolfgang puck express. The tiki bar and restaurant is perfect. We just had a great time. Not super fancy. You will feel comfortable. Close to the zoo. Family fun, but quiet enough for a romantic get away.

We recently stayed for 5 nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We stayed on the 19th Floor and had an absolute beach front room with Lani. The view was spectacular. The room was very clean and quite spacious with a refrigerator and coffee pod machine. The bathroom although a little small was sufficient. The cleaning staff (ours was Nora) were very friendly and sufficient. We always had a lot of towels and plenty of products . Our check in was very easy and didn't take to long at all . We arrived and hour and a half before check in and although they weren't able to give us our allocated room next to our friends, they did accommodate us by putting us both on another floor but not next to each other, which really wasn't a problem. This way we were able to check in earlier. The pool although not huge was very clean and there were plenty of chairs and lounges around it. They supplied good towels for both the pool and the beach. The Hotel is right opposite the 'pool' areas of the beach which was great to learn how to paddle board , swim & snorkel. Also the Hotel is 'at the end of the strip' near the zoo so away from a lot of hustle & bustle. The only thing really that bothered us was at night we got a lot of noise from the Tiki bar and restaurant downstairs as we were right over the top of it. I guess thats what we have to put up with if we want an absolute ocean view. All in all very happy with our stay.

It’s nice to have an ocean view, and the on-line photos may make you think you will face the ocean, but don’t expect too much, or you might be disappointed. The ocean view from most of the rooms is at about an 80 degree angle, so it is awesome only if you go out on your tiny balcony and sit sideways (we looked many times and never saw anyone out on their balcony on our entire side of the hotel or the side of the hotel facing us during entire week we were there) or if you stand in one spot in the room. You can move the table and tall chairs to that spot, but then only one person really has the view.The location on the Diamond Head side of Waikiki is good because it is less crowded. Also, you are closer to the following attractions on that side: Diamond Head (of course), a good sushi restaurant on the way to Diamond Head, outdoor volleyball courts, a pier/jetty people jump off to boogie board, a beach next to the jetty with lots of fish in clear water, and a real farmers market in the park on the way to Diamond Head (the other farmers’ market, on the opposite side of Waikiki, is mostly for tourists, with overpriced items and mangos from Mexico).The mandatory “resort fee” is only worth it if you want to see a lot of new release DVDs in your hotel room instead of exploring the island or walking through Waikiki. Similarly, the small pool, with no slide, diving board, nor enough length for laps, is not fun or interesting enough to justify swimming there instead of in the ocean.Tip: The front desk staff are very helpful, for example, providing good directions to farmers markets and explaining where to catch the bus.On the same level as the front desk, there are a series of independently operated desks labeled as “concierge” services. These are really just private contractors selling tour packages and rental cars. One, the Budget Car Rental, provided a rate better than we would have gotten if we had gone directly to Budget. We went to Budget to pick up the car, and they had our reservation and rate we had negotiated at the Aston “concierge”/contractor.

I was a little worried about this hotel prior to arriving because some of the negative reviews on this website. That being said, I would definitely recommend this hotel. I've stayed at several hotels on the Waikiki strip. I LOVE that this is NOT centrally located because it is at the end of the "strip", which is much quieter and the beach is calmer too. I would definitely recommend upgrading to an ocean view room, SO worth it. I found that the room and linens were very comfortable, the FIRST hotel that I actually LOVED the pillow. I slept so well here. The bathrooms are a little dated, but for all intents and purposes are fine. You did not come to Hawaii to hang out in the bathroom. Resort fees are everywhere, add to that daily valet only parking fees, that can be kind of an unexpected surprise at checkout. That being said, this resort fee included a very handy beach tote and pouch with helpful sunscreen toiletries, playing cards, and fans. I used the beach tote as my "purse" the whole time in Hawaii. The resort fee also included free DVD rentals and beach chair rentals. I loved having the mini-fridge in the room because you can never get too have too much cold water in Hawaii. I found that the staff were very helpful and friendly. Getting your car from the valet can take some time, but just call ahead 15 minutes before. Overall, I recommend this hotel over any of the others that I have stayed in the Waikiki area, including the Sheraton and Hyatt.

This hotel was the best I've stayed. I had the partial ocean view with two doubles a couch that pulls out it felt like I had a suite. The views were breath taking. The room was remarkable I loved the customer service an it felt like I was staying at four seasons. I highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is right on the beach at the quieter, Diamond Head, end of Waikiki. All tour buses, trolley buses stop right outside the hotel. The city bus is just a block away. It is an extremely handy spot for everything. The rooms are a good size and if you choose an oceanfront room, as we do, the view is breathtaking. Room service is good and if you require anything, the response is almost immediate and your request attended to with a smile.

While not "on the beach" like many of Aston's "luxury" counterparts, you only have to carry the comfortable beach chairs the hotel loans to its guests across the street. The hotel is on the quieter end of the beach, and truth be told, is afforded the clearest swimming water due to the protective sea wall. Add the fact that the hotel's price is similar to some of the accommodations more than a block away, and you have a great value in Aston Waikiki Beach. My one gripe with the hotel is that when I booked, they were still offering Breakfast on the Beach, and had I not read TA reviews from this past winter, would not have known that it was discontinued. Instead, based on the date of my booking, I was offered breakfast vouchers to be used at Tiki's. While I only took advantage of breakfast at the hotel restaurant on one morning, the high cost of food in Honolulu makes the vouchers a great value. Other than that, the staff were all very pleasant and welcoming to my husband and I, and I would not hesitate to stay at another Aston hotel in the future!

Hotel is alright .the bathroom is quite old style Beach is just like 1min away .shops are close byWeird thing is the pool is in the centre of the restaurant and where you check in and out Staffs are friendly.there is a bar in grill restaurant in the Hotel called Taki bar and grill .good time to drink when it's happy hour from 2pm to 5pm Other wise beers are cheaper in the ABC storesTake the pink line bus to take you around and if you wana go mall or othe place .its $2 one way .must visit cheese cake shop which is like 10min walk and there is other good bars and restaurants around it Also visit the outlet mall which was $15 pp and it was about 20min bus drive which they pick you up from ur hotel.over all hotel is 3.5 star

They claimed to upgrade us to a better room but the rooms floor was wet from the fridge leaking. I was not happy at all. I asked for a different room and was told one would not be available for the same type of room. They told me they would send someone to look at the leak, and that never happened, so I had to call again. When the maintenance guy came he said everything was ok and would have housekeeping come. That never happened so I called again and asked for a rug to put over the wet spot. When housekeeping came they brought in a huge loud fan instead and left it blowing. This stank up the whole room with a wet moldy smell which was horrible so we just turned off the fan and gave up. We just use towels instead to put over the wet carpet. On top of that, every Friday morning the workers protest the bad management in the morning. The housekeepers and valet are quite friendly, which was a pro, so it gets me thinking that none of my actual problems I encountered could've been resolved by the actual staff. This is our first time to Hawaii, and we plan on coming back but NOT to this hotel. You'd think that charging you for amenities, valet and parking totaling an extra 390.00, we'd have a better stay. We will not be coming back to this hotel.Also there's no microwaves and faucet was dripping constantly.

this hotel is in a nice location, nice ocean front view, really nice staff, it is close to shops and food, good coffee, good room space, nice safe elevator technology. No microwave for left over food =(

if you want to be as close as possible to Waikiki beach then this is the hotel for you, it's not the Hilton and I would say it's a 3 star hotel, however the rooms are clean the beds are great and the view is outstanding. On the ground floor is one of if not the most popular egg and bacon restaurants you will find, there is always a queue and you often need to wait for a table, but it's worth it.The hotel was one of the first to be built along the strip, and you simply cross the road and you are on the most famous beach in the world.

We stayed here as part of a wedding celebration. After a slight hiccup with our first room, the remaining stay was great. Management remedied the issue with our room immediately. Awesome....Valet was on spot and on time, always.Staff that supported wedding was great. Highly recommended

From the friendly staff to the Quiet Waikiki location it was wonderful for walks down the beach hiking Diamond head or strolling down KuhihoBlvd to the shops n Restaurants!! An older Medium priced hotel with a happy staff it was Wonderful! Sprinks

My family was here in 2013, it was our first visit to Hawaii. We had a very pleasant stay here. Nice selection for breakfast, great resturant and music. House keeping was amazing. When I return, I will use this hotel. I have recommended this place to several friends since 2013. Everyone had positive comments. Keep up the good work.

Great location! Friendly Staff!!! and all around perfect place for families and couples.The hotel is located directly across the street from the beach... a section of the beach that is protected by a reef wall.If you want to do any excursions, the hotel is located (or less than a block from) where majority of the excursion buses pick up!The breakfast is a really nice feature... perfect morning start!

We had a fantastic stay in Hawaii. The hotel helped to make it perfect. The location was in the best location as it was quiet and only a short walk to the shops. The staff were all amazing at their attention to detail. The room was spotless and cleaned daily. All public areas and around the pool was spotless. Towels and beach chairs were provided for around the poor or to take to the beach. There was plenty of beds and chairs around the pool. Will defintley return!

My wife and I and our 2 daughters (18 and 22) stayed here in Early Feb 2016. We stayed in an Aloha Suite (Partial Ocean View) which gives you beach/ocean views towards Diamond Head (but not Diamond Head itself). While not as stunning as the other side of the building it was very pleasant and the room more than made up for the lesser view. The suite is very large and comfortable and has a nice modern décor. The facilities are quite adequate and there are 2 good sized double beds plus a sofa bed. The great things about this property are the location (directly across the road is the beach) and the fact that it is very affordable. Food and beverage wise; the hotel itself does not have any offerings but at the front on pool level is the Tiki Bar which is a great place to eat or just have a drink. There seemed to be live entertainment every night and the place was always humming. Downstairs there is a Wolfgang (something or other) which has good affordable food for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The staff at the Aston were consistently very friendly and very helpful and all got a 10/10 from us. The hotel is probably a 15-20min walk to the heart of the shopping strip but nothing that deters from it's location. This was our second stay in Waikiki and I would rate this hotel much better than the previous one used (beachfront only a 100 or so metres away. I would definitely recommend the Aston Waikiki Beach and would stay there again

We stayed in an ocean view room on the 8th floor and it was incredible! From the balcony you could see diamond head to the left and the main street of Waikiki to the right. Straight ahead was amazing beaches. Walking distance from great restaurants. Very clean room, comfy beds. Would recommend to everyone, and would love to return and stay in the same room :D

He stayed at the Aston for 2 weeks, the hotel atmosphere was great the staff friendly and very helpful. The pool area was neat and all the kids had a great deal of fun.The location was superb with the beach directly across from the beach and the concrete breakwater. We were also across from the Honolulu and a leisurely stroll along Kalakaua from everywhere else.Opportunities for improvement was the room all though very functional was a little dated and with a spruce up would perfect. Also the TV system was difficult to understand as there were many channels but no accessible to guide.Additionally there wasn't a restaurant, but tiki's was part of the hotel and had an outstanding eggs benedict.Overall a really cool place to stay and well within everyone's budget, we will definitely be back

Book an "Ocean Front" room (not expensive) and you will wake up every morning with the best view ever and you will watch the sunset every night. Just beautiful. The pink trolley stops at the front door, the rooms are very clean & have all one needs. You are so central to restaurants, cafes, pubs and you can just walk across the road for a swim. Staff were friendly & very accommodating. Will go back there again on my next trip. Love it!

This is a 3 star hotel that could use a facelift. However, it is in a perfect location and is clean along with friendly staff. The rooms are a good size and have a balcony. They also have a great happy hour in the bar. A Wolfgang Puck fast food restaurant is on the first floor which is terrific.

Stayed here before a cruise. The beach breakfast was quite enjoyable and came with a wide assortment of food to choose from. Staff was quite attentive in the entire hotel. Can't wait to go back for another stay.

Great value beachside hotel right across from beautiful Waikiki Beach and near the Honolulu zoo. Most rooms have views of the beach and the hotel has a poolside area overlooking the beach with a bar and grill offering great, reasonably priced meals and regular happy hour with $5 cocktails. Upon arrival, I was greeted with a welcome "beach bag" complete with an assortment of sunscreen and after sun care products, fans and a souvenir bag to take to the beach. A hotel that gives you something for your resort fee is very nice to see!! In addition to being a stones throw from the beach, the hotel offers a state of the art fitness centre and is located next to all the shops and conveniences of Waikiki. The hotel staff are friendly and welcoming and the room I had was clean and spacious with an extremely comfortable bed and a small dining table as well as a view of the beach from my balcony (pictures). Will definitely come back.

What a great place we only had a one night stop over the staff were great the beds r so comfy what a great place wish we could of stayed longer. Next trip will stay longer. I would highly recommend anyone that wants a great location fantastic

Great rooms with a fantastic view of the beach. Fantastic facilities with restaurants, bars etc within complex and heaps nearby to choose from. Staff and locals very friendly. Most enjoyable stay and would highly recommend this hotel

Great location opposite Kuhio beach & walking distance to all Waikiki has to offer.Rooms were great a bit small but we were mainly only there to sleep,bathroom was great plenty of toiletries & towels,cleaning staff were efficient & friendly minimal wait on lifts.Overall a enjoyable stay

We spent three nights here at the beginning of April. The location is convenient to Waikiki Beach and that truly congested area. It's within walking distance to all services which made it convenient. We had trouble with the A/C which engineering jumped right on but it was never cool enough. The room was very dusty; especially the tops of things like the hair dryer, TV, lamps, mirror, yuck. I hope each day that would be taken care of but it wasn't.Staff as very nice. Very busy place. Convenient location was the best part.

Great location surrounded by the beach on one side and the zoo and aquarium on the other with beautiful views of Diamond Head and Queens Beach.Nice pool deck with bar to watch the magical Waikiki sunsets.This hotel is just far enough from the busy shopping area that you don't get the craziness, but still walking distance from it all.
user_name:
Terri H
San Juan Capistrano, California

review_body: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I know or ever stay here again. Most of the staff were rude and our room never got cleaned and we never got clean towels or anything unless we called down and asked for them to come clean it which was frustrating. One day while sitting pool side a man rudely asked us for our room key to make sure we were staying at the hotel he said he was doing "a random key check" once we showed him ours he left and didn't ask anyone else sitting by the pool. So disappointed with our stay.

A friend and I recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and had a wonderful time. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was excellent. We chose to have an Oceanfront Select room, which was well worth the extra money, for we had a spectacular view of the ocean and entire beachfront from our room balcony, a perfect spot from which to watch the swimmers and surfers and see beautiful sunsets. We enjoyed having breakfast at the Wolfgang Puck Express downstairs in the mornings before setting out to explore the area.  The protected swimming area just across the road from the hotel was a wonderful place to relax and swim and enjoy the sun, and it was great to have it available so close by! We would recommend the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for sure! Thanks to the staff for making our stay so pleasant!

Check-in was easy. The nice friendly staff explained everything clearly and we were quickly settled into our room on the 25th floor.The bed was comfortable, not too hard like some hotels.Bathroom was good as was the shower, no complaints.The air con was ok, not noisy or anything.The wide screen TV was easy to use as was the X-box and FREE DVDs.Wifi was free too, although some degree of congestion during the evenings made it a bit slow and hard to connect sometimes. Pretty good though considering it is free.Our balcony overlooked the North western side which provided a beautiful view of Waikiki beach, sunsets were a real treat. The front door balcony also had wonderful views of Diamond Head crater.The pool is nice and cool with the area very relaxing. The bar nearby was good for take-away beer and cocktails as well.The staff were always smiling and happy to answer any queries we had. Tours were easily organised through several tour desks conveniently located near the front desk.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Aston on Waikiki beach. It's a top hotel in a top spot.

We have stayed in more expensive hotels at the other end of the beach that weren't for us (didn't want to eat at 5* restaurants every night), but the Aston is much more down to earth. It's close to a range of food options, with really good access to a kid friendly beach. The staff were very accommodating, moving our 2 separate rooms together (travel agent stuffed this up), happy to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Valet service downstairs had answers to all questions. During the morning of our 2nd last night, there was protest on the street (picket signs, and mega phones) demanding fair pay for Aston employees. Police keeping everyone civil but not sure of more details. Was surprised by it is all. The restaurant (Lulu's) and bar (Tiki Bar) had great options for formal dining, or casual eats. Great to get a table near the edge and watch the sunset. Staff made this a great experience. Sat by the bar one night and was well looked after, being offered samples of local beers before trying a pint. And recommended an epic cherry infused bourbon not available in Australia. Others have said that the Pool isn't big enough, but maybe it just wasn't as busy when we were there. Virtually had the pool to ourselves when we were there, but why swim in the pool when the kid friendly end of Waikiki beach is straight across the road. The hotel is situated on the best end of Waikiki Beach, with the break wall making swimming great for kids with no waves. Visit an ABC shop, spend $2 on an inflatable lounge, and laze about floating on the most iconic beach in hawaiiShopping is easily accessible via the pink line trolley (tram bus thing) stops outside the hotel, $2 to get on and follow a circle that stops at the best shopping spots (let the wife go crazy will you enjoy a mai tai by the pool). Had a great stay at the Aston, and I highly recommend it to anyone travelling with kids, who wants to experience the best of Waikiki!

I came and stayed with my mother. We were really happy with the surface and view a little small but we weren't there to stay in our hotel. Comfortable for sure I didn't want to get out of bed. Free Breakfast!

We had a mix up in reservation. So we ended up in a penthouse. That was cool. We had a view of Diamond Head right out of our window. The service was good and Waikiki beach was right across the street. Location- Location. :). The roof top bar and restaurant were nice. This hotel was older when I was there and was in need a make over. But I would still stay there.

Customer service excellent, rooms are clean and tidy although dated depending on what your budget allows the views for partial ocean up are worth the additional dollars. Corner rooms or close to the corner i.e ending in 19-21-23-25 are preferable. You can request when booking on line and we keep in contact with AWBH staff who have replied.

Stayed here for four nights recently and it was a very good experience. Check in quick and easy and we used the quick check out without a problem. The staff were very helpful and obliging. The hotel has a pool, cafe, bar and tourist desks. The room was awesome, we were upgraded to a full ocean view room which had a little balcony and beautiful sweeping views of the coast and hinterland. We had a double/double room which was a little tight on space but that was our fault. During our stay the ancillary staff had a protest march one morning at 6.30am, which woke us all up but after reading their reasoning behind this action it appears to be reasonable when comparing their rates of pay to other staff at nearby hotels. The hotel also has a mini market downstairs that is open from 7am to 11pm, the beach and rock pool is straight across the road and the numerous cafes, restaurants, shopping and laundromat are all in close proximity. A very good experience , enjoyed by the four of us immensely.

The hotel location is the best in Waikiki. Cross the road to the beach, good restaurants nearby and most tour companies pick up from right outside the hotel. There are also 4 ABC stores in the same block. The room was clean, had fresh bed sheets... Well, that's all the basic good things you need if you are in Waikiki. I was ok with the resort fee and wifiThe annoyances: There is a mini-fridge but no microwave. Fridge, but no microwave! The coffeemaker is the Keurig one. Basically, forget about making hot water or tea. I really don't know what they are thinking. Our room was on level 5 and had to suffer through a lot of party noise one of the nights from the tiki bar.Tips: -Wolfgang Puck express has great food-Expedia Local desk on 3rd floor is great for booking activities

Needs serious upgrading. Room was ok but nothing to get excited about. Water leaked. Not the bedding we expected. And it was suppose to be an ocean view. It was direct view of the hotel across the street with a side view of the ocean. Supposed upgrade but not really. The restaurant was good. Service good. Nice view from the deck.

Tiny room with two double beds. Wifi wouldn't work, even after someone "fixed" it. Housekeeping left our door OPEN one day, and we were out from 7am-4pm. Anyone could have gone in and taken everything. Bathroom small, very dated, and not clean. Hair stuck to the walls and even the ceiling. Air con stopped working, (technician fixed it promptly). No laundry service, despite the Aston information book in the room stating there was. Sliding door onto lanai was very difficult to open and close. It took two of us to lock it: one to pull on the door with all our strength while the other tried to slide the bolt in. The noise of the constant wind HOWLED through the gaps around the door, I would guess it needed new seals. Hotel staff protests on the street outside from 6am one morning was awful. The room smelled like a wet dog. Nowhere to hang wet clothes to dry. Noise from street and neighbouring units was excessive.Positives: location directly across from the beach, and close to Zoo and Diamond Head; view from ocean view lanai; nice pool and pool area; free access to towels in pool area; short wait times for elevators.We are so disappointed, as this holiday was a once in a lifetime opportunity for us. Definitely the lowlight of our trip.

My favorite thing about this hotel is the location. The beach across the street is perfect for younger kids since it's more like a lagoon, so no big waves. Also, it's closer to Diamond Head if you want to hike it, and just a block away is the Honolulu zoo for cheaper parking. Plenty of restaurants all around, convenience stores for anything you need. The heart of Waikiki for more shopping is a 5-10 min walk. Jon at the front desk was great checking us in and we were able to go in our room much earlier than the check in time. Also, if budget allows, splurge and get the oceanfront rooms because the views are to die for! Downside: only one small pool, but who needs a pool when you have a beautiful beach out front. Also the rooms are a little older, but still clean and comfortable. Towels, beach chairs and beach mats are available to borrow for free which was great. Nice indoor gym and although we didn't go to the hotel restaurant, they had a live band and the views are great if you can get good seating. We would definitely not hesitate to stay here again.

Hawaiian style rooms with ocean view. The beach, the zoo, and many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Service might be better. Nice thing is -- TIKI'S, polynesian cuisine restaurant located on the 3rd floor of the hotel. A great place to enjoy a dinner, music and the sunset.

We booked this hotel thru our RBC rewards as a start of our trip. This is a nice hotel, with a great pool. Very close to the beach and all the fun! It was difficult to check in with the 3rd floor lobby, but nice place! We would visit again for sure. Aloha

Spent a full week of spring break based in an oceanfront room on 19th floor...enjoyed spectacular sunsets over the ocean from the balcony every night...and amazing full moons setting over the ocean some very early mornings as well...has to be one of the very best views in all of Waikiki ...and one of the best prices for the view...Free beach chairs and towels are a plus...as is friendly gift bag of sunscreen supplies...Wolfgang Puck offers delicious nutritious very reasonably priced food onsite and Tikis is very fun tropical atmosphere as well...Excellent onsite travel and sightseeing staff pointed us to some wonderful tours of the island...all very worthwhile...plenty of ABC stores nearby with anything/everything you would need...at giveaway prices...so best advice is to hardly pack a thing except your bathing suit and flip flops...and buy the rest at ABC after you arrive...Unusual elevator security system took a bit of getting used to on first try...but once we figured it out elevators turned out to be extremely efficient and state of the art...almost always enjoyed an express ride to our floor or down to the lobby with no other passengers...saving lots of travel time in the hotel...Only minor shortcomings...bathroom was rather basic and could use some sprucing up...and a long long line to check in on a Sunday afternoon...but otherwise overall an excellent place to stay and one that I would not hesitate to recommend...location can not be beat!

I stay the weekend using the K Pass and it was great. The staff was very attentive and the housekeepers were all very professional and did a great job. It's nice to have the Tiki Grill close but they were a bit unorganized with walk in customers. I will definitely be back! Great location!

I've stayed in better hotels for less money. Overall a decent stay. Nice friendly stay. Might be able to use a renovation. Elevators take some getting used to. Even after a week we were still trying to use buttons inside the car where there were none.

Had a great time at this hotel, it is a little dated but nice nonetheless. The location is great and the view from our room on the 22nd floor was just perfect!They have expedia on sight to arrange any tours as well as a nice bar/restaurant. Many other nearby places to eat all within walking distance

The hotel is located at the end of the strip and is quieter than most of the area. The hotel reception is nicely situated and the staff are very friendly. The security to access the floors is very good. The rooms are a little tired in decor but nothing a lick of paint wouldn't sort. The equipment in the room is very good however it would be nice to have tea or green tea available as appose to just coffee. The room was satisfying after a busy day. The pool was cold and refreshing and the Free dvd service was a nice touch. Overall it was a good hotel and we enjoyed ourselves.

What an excellent location! You walk across the street you are on the beach, walk west on Kalakua Avenue you have all the activity, restaurants, & shopping, or walk east you have the quiet of the Kapiolani Park with the Zoo, Aquarium and band shell.Since our last stay we have seen substantial changes. The registration, tour, and pool area have undergone a sprucing-up making the area very fresh and comfortable. With the buffet breakfast eliminated from the program, the pool area is now very well laid out and attractive to the guests. Our room was very clean, well laid out, and comfortable. The view from our lanai was outstanding. The in-room safe is great for travel documents and other important items. The bathrooms are very clean, well-stocked and well maintained. The king bed was exceedingly comfortable which is a real bonus after a busy day of sightseeing. The hotel staff members are excellent. Every staff member we encountered during our stay performed their duties with skill and a very friendly manner. Front desk, hospitality, pool, housekeeping, engineering and security personnel made our stay comfortable and pleasant. Each and every concern we have had was dealt with quickly and in a very positive manner. Observing the challenges the staff encounter every day and the positive manner with which they handle them is truly amazing.We felt that we received excellent value for our dollar. The resort fee covers a lot of value features. With our reservation we received breakfast coupons at Tiki’s Restaurant and Grill (on site). The cooked to order breakfast was reasonably priced and a real saving with the coupons. The towel and beach chairs are an excellent value included in the resort fee. We didn’t use some of the things covered by the fee (e.g. entertainment center), but that’s the real world, other people do use them.I have to say the elevator system is the most efficient we have experienced. Swipe your card, enter your floor number, and one of five elevators will be assigned to you.The hotel provides a very secure environment. Their security staff are present but not obtrusive. We have never felt uncertain of our safety.Over the last few years we have often chosen the Aston as our home for our holidays. The hotel continues to provide holiday comfort while evolving to meet changing demands. Our vacation needs have consistently been met by the Aston and we expect it to continue in the future.

Could not fault the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel ! We had a 5 night stay last month and we're delighted to be informed on our arrival we had been upgraded. Our room was magnificent - oceanfront on the 16th floor - the most amazing views and beautiful sunsets. Housekeeping was fabulous with our rooms made up and cleaned to perfection each day. The Tiki Restaurant and bar was great for a drink and live music. The travel desk was brilliant for recommendations and booking day trips and attractions.For a beachfront accommodation this hotel is definitely worth serious consideration.Thank you AWBH for a wonderful stay

We stayed at 1511 which had view partial of the sea and overlooked the pool. It was high enough not to hear the music from the bar below. The area was child friendly and helpful. The pool area was good and staff were nice. Area is towards the aquarium end and perhaps 20 minute walk to Hilton area and lavish shops. Plenty of beach in between. The room was nice but bit small if you have a baby like we did and for the price of $aud 240 we would have expected more. It just needs a touch of modernisation.

This was my first visit to Waikiki and we stayed her for a sports competition. The hotel was nice, clean, had nice ammenities, and was close to all. I wouldn't change anything.The only reason i am not giving it a higher rating is that after walking the strip, i would have preferred to stay farther north where the hotels are right on the beach vs across the street. The water was nicer there too. Do check your bill though. They put a $175 pending hold on my card for parking when i didnt have a car. I spoke to them and they said it was removed. At final checkout there was still 3 days of 6 with parking charged. I still never got a car! They were great and removed it easily, but i am glad that i checked the bill closely.

We stayed at the aulani resort for one week, couldn't afford more, $750 a night. Got a really good deal off of hotels.com for an additional weeks stay here. The room was spacious and clean. Dated, could use a remodel, hotel may be starting to get old. Staff was friendly, location is great, downtown honalulu right on the beach. Best feature is the free breakfast. They supply lunch boxes, fill them up with all you want then go eat right on the beach. Very nice, would return.

I'm still currently staying at the hotel as I write this review. It can still change. On the outside this place looks really nice. The exterior is polished every morning and looks spotless. People working outside are very friendly. Staff is nice and welcoming. Awesome view, nice pool, and free rentals of beach towels, chairs and mats. The inside Is a whole different. Looks like they really let go of the rooms and the hallways. Our room was extremely worn. Carpet was old and run down. One of the drawers was out of its tracks and the shower curtain had a hole and looked like it was burned, maybe by the dryer. Maybe they're going green, but our sheets were not changed. The sheets Im laying on as I write this has a tear on it. I don't know if this has anything to do with it, but their staff were protesting in the morning and might have something to do with our room cleanliness. A little professional renovation is necessary. Needless to say because of the location, we would stay again. Just can't have the bougie attitude.

Found it nice and interesting . Best location and security is very good. It's always lively and just generally has a good vibe.had a little problem at first with the Wifi but they sent someone to sort it immediately. Loved the ocean view and pool view we had. Only thing I didn't like was the bathroom too ordinary and I found it weird there's no room service but there's a store downstairs you can go to use their microwave.

We stayed in an Ocean front room on the 8th floor, the view was wonderful and we watched the sunset over the ocean almost everynight before going out for dinner. The pool is a little small for the size of the hotel, but we preferred to be at the beach. Pool towels were freely available to take to beach or bus trips. Plenty of grocery stores, restaurants nearby Hotel room was dated but comfortable, beds were soft and cosy. Would stay again. Lovely atmosphere in the evenings at Tiki restaurant. Also there was a cheap shuttle arranged for us to get to the airport $12 each.

So close to the beach and great water views with the partial ocean view room. Super Friendly staff. Plan on staying here again in the future!!! Tikis bar and grill is literally downstairs and we went there every day at least once. Awesome and friendly staff there aswell. Highly recommend both the hotel and bar.

Our Family of four absolutely loves the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We like the location because it has the proximity to the best surf and boogie board breaks on Waikiki. The staff from the moment we check in at the Front Desk to housekeeping, Valet and management are world class!! The rooms are super clean and comfortable. We will be back again and again.

They were an okay hotel, not the best and not the worst. They do offer free breakfast which was a plus. It is the last hotel on the block so there are a lot of homeless people roaming around right outside the hotel on sidewalks. One thing that really brought me down was that check out was at 1pm. Our flight was at 8pm. We asked if we can sit in the lobby with our luggage while we wait for our taxi at 3pm. They said it was okay. While we were siting in the area with couches by the pick up area, the security would come up to us periodically saying we shouldn't be there, because we checked out, so we have to leave. He said other people don't feel comfortable around us. What? What was his problem I don't know but that really got on my nerves. I would rather stay at the Marriott across the street.

We stayed here about 18 months ago and decided that we enjoyed it so much, we'd stay again.We stayed on the 5th floor right opposite the pool which was not as noisy as we expected, in a partial ocean view room. The room attendants were all very friendly as were most of the check-in staff (one gentleman was lacking in any customer service or personality).On our previous trip there was a complimentary breakfast but that has since been cancelled which was disappointing, but not of huge concern.Overall, we'd happily stay here again.

Loved the view of the ocean- Waikiki and Honolulu downtown from our room. Price per night is very reasonable for Hawaiian standard compared to some other hotels with similar amenities. The location of the hotel is one of the most important feature since its in Waikiki where almost everything is accessible through walking. Enjoy.

We were happy with our stay at the Aston Waikiki. We ended up with a great view (Room 1207) and although we were right next to the elevators, noise was not a problem. The room was small but sufficient and for the price, I'd recommend it based on location (close to everything), view and amenities. Plus the staff were all very friendly and helpful. This would be a great place for families with young children as the beach out front has a break wall which means swimming is always calm, there are places to eat on the ground level and the zoo and aquarium are next door in the park.

Greeted well, very pleasant staff all around. They fixed a number of things not exactly to our likely, acceptable; just that we wanted a bit more. We had a wonderful ocean view delux, the sunsets and moon sets were spectacular. Bed very comfortable, wished the bathroom had a fan for provably. Pool attendant handed out free beach towels and chairs, first class, highly recommended.
user_name:
Mt_Max
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here last May on the recommendation of our travel agent, and she steered us right!Before we arrived, our room had been upgraded to a partial ocean view room. We had a fantastic view of the ocean and Diamond Head. We were on the 25th floor, and I could see the War Memorial from our room. I didn't know what it was when I first saw it, but my curiosity got the best of me and I had to walk over to it. It's very interesting and has a great (but sad) history.The room wasn't luxurious, but it fit our needs just fine. We were rarely in the room, except to sleep and shower anyway. There was plenty of room and the beds were comfortable. The housekeeping ladies were fantastic, and we always came back to a freshly cleaned room every night.The staff at the hotel always made us feel welcome. We had a slight issue with our door lock, and they had a maintenance man there within 10 minutes to fix it. I tried to give him a tip, but he wouldn't accept it, which I thought was very professional of him.We enjoyed the breakfast on the beach featured at the time we were there. We always took our muffins to the beach. My granddaughter really enjoyed this because she got to feed the birds. She literally had birds sitting on her hands waiting to be fed.I would recommend this hotel to families in particular. It's a family friendly place, nothing luxurious or particularly romantic, but I think just about anyone would have a great experience here.We liked it so much, we've reserved another room for June 7 to June 15 of this year. We're sure our stay this time will be as great as last year!

Here is why i give this Hotel a higher rating than many of the upscale resorts on Waikiki Beach,.First of all location is as great, across the street from the sand, end of the strip so its great for driving access when you leave and arrive back from your excursions, Close to the park and if you run or jog its a great location. Food is fantastic and priced well, live music at the bar, Ocean View.....blah, blah , blah..... But that's not why.Upon a visit here to see my daughter at University of Hawaii and staying at the Aston I had an issue with my room key not working upon arrival,.....prior to this moment in time I had been on a week long countrywide travel for business and sleep deprived would be an understatement.The staff handled my hothead with expertise and that is a true test of the characters whom you are dealing with. General Manager Mark and his staff was superb. I would hire this guy in an instant. Handled like a champ. Well Done!.....and thats Hospitality!I'll be back

On arrival we were checked in a few hours before check in. We were upgraded to a great room with amazing views of the beach, experiencing the best sunsets and views of the main strip. Very clean room, great service and friendly and helpful staff.

We arrived at the hotel for our 7 night stay only to be informed by Chris that if we wanted a room with a king bed it most likely won't be available and the only option is to upgrade. We had no choice but to upgrade to an Ocean view room which was $17.1 USD per night including tax. Being jetlagged and quite tired we turned on air con (which didn't work) and slept. I complained about the air con as it didn't work only the fan did. The technician came to fix it and although it did work it would be so cold even if you raised the temperature to 30 degrees. The technician was called again to fix the bathroom as the water wasn't receding when we had a shower. On the second night there our WIFI stopped working and no one could assist us, I complained the next day and was offered a $5 USD discount, this happened a second time 2 nights later and I was offered a $12 USD discount who the person processed as a charge and I only found out when I checked out. One of the nights we had a fire alarm go off at 1230am and no one bothered to tell us that it was a false alarm even though we stayed in our room for at least 20mins after the alarm went off (thinking it was a false alarm) before leaving our room. We only got told of it when we asked the front reception. It also happened a night before we had to visit Pearl Harbour and we had to wake up at 5am the next day. On one of the days we arrived back to our room at 3pm and our room wasn’t even serviced. We had to request for it to be done and all they did was replenish the bathroom amenities. Housekeeping was slow to deliver anything you ask for and I had to make a second call on most occasion to find out when I would get things delivered like bath towels. Overall it was a very disappointing stay, I mentioned this to Chris upon checkout and he had refunded 3 days of amenity fees. Not worth the upgrade we paid for to be honest. The only good thing about this hotel is that it’s located near the main strip opposite the beach.

We've stayed several times at the Aston Waikiki - it's been our family favorite for over a decade. So, it's hard to give it 3 stars; there's SO much to appreciate about this property. Let's get the negatives out of the way: the room we had was worn and out-dated. We requested a Deluxe Partial Ocean View - and the view was amazing from our lanai (but had only 1 chair, which seemed odd) but "deluxe" didn't apply to the accommodations. While the beds were comfy, the water pressure adequate, the coffee maker, refrigerator and TV all worked as promised, there was just a worn-out feeling to our room. Furniture is dated, bathroom needs complete updating and thorough cleaning and the AC a bit tricky to regulate. Now the positives: location, location, location. On the Diamondhead end of Waikiki, the Aston sits on Kalakaua Ave and across from a quiet, protected beach. This area is less congested, with the park, zoo and aquarium less than a block away. There are several eateries on the property (independent of the hotel) that offer quick sandwiches, pizza, burgers etc. Two ABC stores are steps away as is a Starbucks and a Jamba Juice.Can't say enough about the staff, especially housekeeping. The ALOHA spirit is evident and our requests were met quickly and with a smile. Our room was serviced every day and any issues were quickly resolved.The amenity charge receives quite a few negative comments from guests but it's clearly stated in the reservation info so shouldn't be a surprise. We didn't miss BOB (Breakfast on Beach) and appreciated the extra sunscreen products etc in the amenity bag (although a $90 value seems inflated). WiFi service was spotty throughout our stay but we were able to stay connected as needed. Beach towels and chairs are available at no additional cost at pool-side. Overall, the Aston is still a good value offering a wonderful location in Honolulu. Pay for the ocean view room, accept a little wear and tear, and enjoy incredible sunsets over Waikiki - you won't be disappointed.

We stayed here for a week in February and loved our partial ocean view room with a view of the pool and beach. The balcony was one with a chair and ottoman and it would have been nice to have another chair, as opposed to the Diamond Head side where you just get a walk out balcony that you can just stand on. We visited friends that were staying in a partial Oceanview room on that side and definitely would've been disappointed if we had gotten one of those.The location was excellent and we loved walking home at night and seeing the tikis burning at Tikis, so pretty. The room was small but clean and had everything we needed. We knew about the Keurigs so brought some pods so we could have more than one cup of coffee. The pool area was great and they were always cleaning and rearranging the furniture as soon as people would leave. We appreciated the availability of the beach towels and chairs although the chairs weren't very comfortable so we only took them once. All the staff we interacted with were super friendly. I would not hesitate to return and stay here again.

This hotel is very well located, near the south end of Waikiki Beach. You only need to cross the streat and your on the beach. You are close to everything, the rooms are very clean and the staff is very nice and helpful.

The hotel had a beautiful view and had everything we needed within walking distance. We enjoyed taking our breakfast to the beach and walking easily to restaurants and shopping. And if we didn't want to walk, it was super easy to catch a cab. The staff was friendly and helpful and I thought the room was well maintained. Some rooms have balconies with chairs and if I had to do it over again, I would have upgraded to one of those rooms. Each room has a balcony and a view - but most of the balconies are only large enough to stand out on. The one issue a member of our party experienced is we were there during high winds and their balcony door whistled at night, keeping them up. We, luckily, did no have that problem in our room.

this hotel is awesome with a great location, and everyone on the staff is amazing...fromthe front desk personnel to the pool staff, the housekeeping staff and the restaurant servers, they went out of their way to say aloha, good morning, can i get anything for you?? Stepha went above and beyond to make my 50th birthday a celebration and vacation that myself, my daughter and granddaughter will never forget..i will definitely be back again and i look forward to our next visit and stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.

Our room was clean and acceptable. But when I received my bill, I was dismayed to see over $20 per day for "amenity fees". Are you kidding me? We didn't use any of the amenities, except for the room. I complained to the front desk, but they said that I should have carefully read the contract when I booked the room. Right.

I wanted a room with a view of both Diamond Head & the beach & the Aloha Suite Partial Ocean View (room 2428) was outstanding!! Diamond Head filled our window & the beach was steps across the street. Far enough down Waikiki Beach that it wasn't too terribly busy, which also made the view even better. As others have said, the hotel is a bit older, but very clean & we had no issues with our room. The staff was very polite & helpful. The only thing I'd say was a drawback was the mandatory room fee - we didn't use any of the amenities except for the room fridge - not a big deal though. We had to check out early to catch a tour & they happily stored our bags for the day. Excellent stay.

Returned to this hotel from last year and the prices had gone up and they had discontinued the continental breakfast. Nice pool area and security controlled elevators. Restaurant on mail floor with OK prices given it is in Waikiki.

Arrived on an early morning flight, reception were very helpful in getting me checked in as early as possible. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The tiki bar/restaurant was very good too! Ideally located at one end of Waikiki Beach. Would definitely stay again in the future.

My best vacation so far and a lot of credit goes to Aston Waikiki and its management!1. Best location in Waikiki. 2. It was my marriage anniversary and they gave us a free room upgrade to full ocean view with some really cool gifts!. that really set the mood from start!3. The Valet parking guys and the porters are very swift and paying for the parking charges are totally worth it. Once you're in the hotel parking lot, no need to worry about anything. 4. Rooms are spacious and toilets are clean with extra 2 towels provided already. 5. Wifi is pretty strong.6. Beach towels and chairs are available free of cost.7. bars and several other restaurants are available in and around the hotel.Mahalo and 100% recommended!

We arrived at the hotel at about 8am after flying in from Australia. Of course we didn't expect our room to be ready. We were able to leave our luggage in the secure luggage lock up room. We were advised to check back at 11 which we did and to our surprise our room was to be ready just after 11.30am, and it was. Usual check in time is 3pm. The hotel is a little dated. However it is very clean and the bed is very comfortable. The location is great. So far we are very happy with our choice. The Tiki Bar is great, with a fantastic view and super friendly staff.

Positives: The room was clean and the beds were amazingly comfortable. As we were only staying 2 nights we declined to have room cleaning service. The check-in was easy to find on floor 2. The restaurants they had were nice, they will also keep your luggage if you arrive early or need to checkout but keep it there for awhile. Their elevators were interesting but very fast and prompt, staying on the 21st floor in this case took a mere 30 seconds to ever get down or up. The location is excellent. Right across from the beach, on the right is a breakwall to allow for calm relaxing water and it's divided by a wall on which the other side is totally wave unobstructed. They also allowed us to check in 30 min early. They also gave us the highest room with 2 dbl beds and their partial ocean view was spot on.Negatvies: The special fee they collected was definitely not worth it, whatever it was a resort fee or whatever. They give you a tiny thing of sunscreen, all in all worth maybe $15, a few dvd rentals, and ps3 access in your room. I found this charge to be too high, at most it should have been $10 additionally a day if that. The lanea was incredibly small, you could maybe fit 2 adults on it standing, no room to sit down with a chair.All in all I would stay here again for sure. If you are on a romantic getaway or expecting a 5star treatment, go elsewhere, It's disappoints me to hear those complain about this resort when it;s been made clear what it is. You want a butler and 1000 thread count sheets, go to a 5 star hotel, don't choose a solid place like this, ignore all the reviews, and then rate it badly. It's ignorant for those who do this. If you need a good place to sleep, a good location, and still a quality place, here ya go.

If you want great service, super staff and one of best locations in Waikiki, you need to stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. No kidding... And all at an affordable price! Super value for a super place!

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for a kama'aina getaway and we were really impressed. Everything was special. The property is on the quiet(er) end of Waikiki with amazing beach access and beautiful sunset views. Rooms are spacious, quiet, and comfortable. The amenities are first-class.Most impressive is the staff. From front desk to housekeeping, everybody was really amazingly accommodating. David and the team at the front desk were efficiently getting everybody checked in on a busy afternoon. We even bumped into Mark, the general manager, who was in the lobby area talking with guests and making sure everyone was taken care of. Frankly, I didn't think that hotel managers did that kind of one-on-one any more. Nice touch!

Very disappointing stay. If you are traveling to waikiki for a romantic getaway do not stay at the Aston. The location is great and staff are helpful when there's an issue, but there were way too many issues for a short 3 night stay. Had to move rooms the first night at 1:00 AM, one day there was no hot water in the morning and the water that did come out was a rust brown color. Toilet leaked on the floor every time you flushed it. The a/c didn't have an auto setting it was either on or off manually making the room too cold or too hot. Overall seems they need a remodel, it's a great location, but wasn't up to even 3 star standards.

Daily parking and amenity fees and their tax will add significantly to the cost of staying here, so consider that part of the room rate. Parking is valet only, so there's tipping to consider as well as the fee. When we've stayed here in the past, a complimentary breakfast was provided. They stopped doing that a few years ago, so don't expect it and be disappointed like we were. They will give you a nice bag of pricey suncare products that really work - instead of breakfast, I guess. There was a loud worker protest (drums, noisemakers, yelling and chanting songs) very early one morning. I thought it was cheerleaders at first. Apparently, Aston/Xenia housekeepers make quite a bit less than Marriott workers next door. We were given a flyer about it under the door that asked us to mention that on Tripadvisor and yelp. It only happened once during our stay or I probably would have looked for a quieter place. The beds are soft, too soft for us, but some people may like that. The AC was really cold and we could not get it to turn off for any length of time. There is a Keurig, but you only get 2 pods per day. Sometimes someone will knock on the door in the morning and offer you two more. There is convenient shopping and beach activities within walking distance. We enjoyed the nearby Tiki Bar several times. We've stayed here several times since it was so convenient before, but we might try somewhere else next time.

We booked the most expensive room option for six days in Waikiki but would have been happier in a cheaper room at a luxury hotel. The view was excellent but the lobby smelled of sweat, the elevator system stymied my husband, the bathroom was tiny and truly worse than most American chain budget motels. No room service, and mezzanine restaurant unable to charge our meals to the room, probably independently operated. Pool ugly cement, without view of ocean. Loud live music at night made Tiki Bar option unpleasant. Protesters woke entire hotel up at 6 am with bullhorns due to ongoing labor union dispute. Location near Honolulu Zoo is good, but most fine dining options are a half mile away. Many guests we saw were from Asia, including some tour groups.
user_name:
Francine C
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights in Feb/Mar on business. This place is just ok. Check in easily took 45 mins even with 3 staff working...they were just incredibly slow. The rooms (and the hotel for that matter) need a remodel. Everything in my bathroom was old, rusted, and malfunctioning. My air conditioning was stuck on 90.
