There is tons of noise...I learned this when my next door neighbor threw a 2am party. This hotel seems to be a cheap option in an otherwise expensive area. If I came here to stay for vacation, I would be livid. Don't waste money on this place unless you expect very little. I'd rather stay anywhere else next time I visit.

Being in an electric wheelchair for over 30 years has always made planning a vacation a daunting task.When calling the 4th Waikiki Beach hotel, The Aston, I finally felt they could meet all my handicapped accessible needs (elevated bed for patient lift, a truly accessible bathroom with roll in shower and a lift by the pool). I followed up before placing the reservation with a phone call through to the manager and she, Lillian, confirmed my needs would be met based on two prior staff calls during my inquiry.When I arrived at the Aston, I was met by the staff and manager, Lillian stating everything should be ready as I expected. If anything wasn't as needed to just ask. Everything did work out without any hitches. My accessibility needs were met!With our full beach-view, the comfort of the bed, the room-size (compared to other hotels I made inquiries at), our vacation was relaxing without the usual worry! A special Thank You to the Staff and Manager of "Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel".As a side note for others thinking about visiting Hawaii in an electric wheelchair. Check out Super Shuttle (all mercedes vans) for their inexpensive accessible vans with a 24 hour notification and Ace Medical if you are in need of a patient lift. We used Roberts Hawaii 54 foot tour bus in our "Circle the Island Tour" on land. The bus has a lift in the back and really made the 9 hour ride comfortable. We also did the Blue Hawaii helicopter ride around Ohau. They had a special lift to make the transfer from my electric wheelchair to an outside seat relatively easy.

Although the room was classified as ocean view, only had partial view of sea as the room was facing a completely different direction. Small rooms are sufficient enough, however, quite pricey as on top of the room fee was $23 extra per night to supply coffee machine (was horrible anyway) and other room features. Nothing special about the hotel otherwise. Staff were very friendly and helpful, but definitely not luxury in any sort. Also located at the end of the beach so prepare to walk at least 20 minutes to get to nice restaurants/shops. Lovely pool area though, average size.

The room was very small for the price, we were required to pay for everything on top of the room rate. Had to pay for amenities whether wanted or not, including daily newspaper, Kurig coffee, wifi, safe in room etc. Had to pay for Valet parking, it was the only place to park - they did do a good job. Had a brochure promising free coffee in the lobby, that didn't happen, also promising daily complimentary breakfast poolside, didn't happen. The outside pool is supposed to be heated, unless it was heated by the sun I don't think it was heated. We had problems with the refrigerator and A/C, they did replace the fridge and the maintenance man was good and came fast (all three times). We had a labor union picket at 7AM one morning which was quite loud. There was no place to store ou,r bags, only a small closet, so we basically lived out of our bags for over two weeks. Wifi was not that great, it was in and out. There were places along the beach you could get free wifi. After my review I did get a rebate from the hotel, but not nearly enough to cover the extra costs or inconvienences . Would I stay here again, not likely. Would I recommend it, not likely.

Decent price for the location. Only the road separates this hotel from the beach, unfortunately the road is very noisy. Also there are some spectacular unobstructed views of Diamond Head and a large park east of the hotel. Pool area was not great, next to a restaurant and the check in desk but with the beach just steps away who wants to sit at the pool anyway. When we booked they offered free breakfast but when we wandered around lost the next morning they told us that they did away with that. I explained to them that was one one of the reasons I booked this hotel and they suddenly provided me with $60 worth of vouchers for the onsite restaurant which was probably worth more than the free breakfast they had been serving. Rooms are average, we didn't spend a lot of time there. The TV was horrible, kept cutting out and freezing up. Wasn't planning on watching much TV anyway but it was frustrating when trying to watch the local news. Ended up watching the news on my laptop, wifi seemed to work just fine. Guests get free DVD rentals which was nice since the TV reception was awful, the selection was good with many new releases. Even though the hotel is at the end of the "strip" we had no problem with traffic, only a couple turns and in no time we would be on the H1. We would definitely stay here again for the location and the price.

I have stayed in Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for last 4 days and we have another 2 days to go. I have to say first, location is fantastic. Service and staff were good and helpful!One thing, they gave us room 504 at the beginning which I noticed a strong smell of gas coming in from the corridor when I chased it up it was a generator from next building and it would come in straight in to the hotel. The smell was bad and the gas is poisonous.I discussed the matter with customer service and they offered a room swap. Which helped.I believe they knew about the problem and just try to rent the room despite the danger and harm it could have on guests helth and wellbeing. I feel I have lost my trust and feel cheated.Not happy!

Have stayed in many hotels but this one disappointed. The location and price and pictures etc, I expected clean, modern and kind of funky. But it was not, it was an old hotel, with half a face lift. Only thing the reception was keeping in theme. The bathroom was old and broken, towel rack falling off and shower tap broken. Despite reporting both to reception they remained broken throughout our 7 night stay. Also cleaners only come every other day and replace coffee pods etc. we asked fora kettle for our room so we're able to make our own tea and coffee.The location is great , far enough down the main strip to avoid most of the noise but on the beach and trolley route.This hotel is fine but I just expected better. Will stay at Hawaiian village or Westin next time.

To be honest we are quite disappointed. There's definitely some great things about this hotel but the bad outweigh the good. To start positive the housekeeping staff were lovely and always happy to help. The check in staff that helped us when our flight was cancelled and we needed to book another night- sorry I didn't catch your name you were very helpful. The view was fantastic- we booked ocean views and for the price thank god we had side ocean views. The downside- the first room we were in had two beds instead of the requested king bed which may have been who we booked through. The amenities tax? The DVD player (PlayStation) didn't work and every time we rented movies they never worked. We used the wifi out of the whole amenities tax. Quite expensive. Housekeeping would knock at our door anytime from 730 am onwards- even this time is early without considering the time difference where were from. Our room was cleaned and towels and cups were taken and not replaced and when we called they either wouldn't come or if have to call again there was long black and red hair on our beds. Both of us are blonde. The bathrooms were dirty in the corners and dusty with mould in the shower. The check in process was horrible. After being in transit for 20 hours we had to wait in line for 30 minutes as there was only two people on check in with a large crowd awaiting to check in. Overall the room was quite expensive. I understand I booked later than I should have but I've stayed at better and cheaper hotels in Waikiki. The rest of the staff didn't seem like they wanted to be there let alone want to interact with us.

Excellent hotel with great sea views. Staff very friendly.Tiki's Bar and Grill very good with a good choice of meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Some good entertainment in the evening too.Only downside, why only one chair on the balcony?

Stayed at this hotel for 5 days in 2 different rooms. One room was ocean view and one was partial ocean (pay the extra money and get ocean front). In my opinion there's nothing better than a terrace facing the ocean with chairs!!The hotel is located across the street from the beach (hotel offers chairs and towels to pickup at the pool and carry over if you wish). Staff was very friendly, there are several activity desks which were useful for booking excursions.Room was clean and I was very pleased with the hotel for the price I paid. It's at the end of Waikiki beach close to diamond head (25 minute walk). I thought the location was great because it was at the end of the Waikiki hustle and bustle madness! Would definitely recommend this hotel!

great resort. all the employees very friendly and helpful and located directlyacross the beach where the pro bowl experience was going on prior to thegame. loved it very much and would definitely recommend it and return thereagain!

This hotel is at the end of the hotel strip on Waikiki Beach so you are walking the farthest but the beach at that end is also lass crowded. The hotel has the most inconvenient check in. it is on the second floor. there is no sign or indication of where that is. You will haul your own luggage up the escalator to the desk. the elevator system is very aggravating. you have to use your room key to get on the elevator to go to your room then also need it to go back down to the lobby level. We paid for ocean view but could only see a very small sliver of ocean. All rooms had a balcony but ours had a 1 foot wide balcony with no chairs to sit and enjoy a little time outside, there was barely room for one person to step outside. we had a view of the roof and the building next door. Total disappointment. Rooms were small and old. We were told there would be a continental breakfast but were told it was discontinued over a year ago, (that may be AAA fault who i booked through), we went to grocery store and got some items for breakfast and put in fridge, but the refrigerator in our room was only working to the bare minimum it didnt keep food or water very cold. all in all i would not recommend this hotel or go back myself.

Only worth considering if you're willing to spend the extra dollars to get an oceanfront room above the 10th floor. The views from the balcony are the same as much more expensive hotels, and the hotel is directly across the street from the beach. Great, comfortable king-size bed. Daily room serving, towels, etc. Bathroom was small and the facility was dated. Had to have maintenance repair the room safe. Elevators were broken one morning - thank goodness we were going down - and were operable by the time we returned late in the day. Slow to retrieve our rental car. Towards the end of our stay, someone identifying themselves as maintenance was knocking on, and attempting to open, our door late at night. The front desk was notified, and I asked for a return call from the manager, which never came. Tikki bar / restaurant was convenient, but the elevator pass seems to be the only layer of security between the public and guest areas. If you're not planning to spend much time in your room, this could be an option, otherwise select a nicer hotel. Would only recommend this hotel for seasoned travelers looking for a bargain.

This hotel has a good location. The rooms are ok, and the view from the top floors are impeccable. However, there is a mandatory "Amenities package" - 23USD per day. You get some sunscreen and 10USD tickets to the cafe. We had bought our sunscreen and only had time for one breakfast at the hotel. When we asked to use the tickets for dinner instead, we could not.Another small issue that shows the inflexible policy; we had been offered a welcoming drink on our booking reservation. When we asked in the reception, they told us "we have never heard about this" - even when we showed the reservation. No big deal for us, but a good hotel would have said "of course, please enjoy a drink on our account".

Planned a Hawaii vacation with my partner and wanted to stay on Waikiki. Had no idea how to pick a hotel so went with one on the beach that looked like a good value. We had such a great time at this hotel that we cut our trip to another island short to stay an extra day here. This is what makes the hotel special - first it's a bargain. Basically a hundred bucks less a night then other ones right around it. It has beautiful views. It's literally across the street from the beach. Not a few blocks away like some of the pricier hotels that don't have direct beach access. It has a great sit down restaurant and deck restaurant, accessible from the pool deck, both of which have great food and beach views. The staff were without exception, very friendly and helpful, even when they were obviously slammed with check ins and check outs and people from all over the world speaking different languages. They were very patient and efficient. The rooms are not fancy, but we found them to be very clean and comfortable. Bed was great. Room was a very nice place to relax after a day out, especially the balcony. I cannot overstate how beautiful the views are from this hotel (some of the rooms may not have views but looking at it from the street, it appeared most or all do; we had a deluxe ocean view; not sure what standard rooms have). There's a little store on the street level and lots of other stores and restaurants right around the hotel. No need to have a car. In fact, skip a rental car and just take trolleys and shuttles (like the shuttle to Hanauma bay or the airport shuttle for which you can buy round trip tix at the airport at baggage claim). They all stop at the hotel. The pool deck also has a great view of the beach and the sunset. Basically, you can have a great time just going from your room, to the pool, to the beach, to the hotel restaurants, to the little store, etc. (not sure if the restaurants are part of the hotel but it's all connected so very convenient). Sort of like a resort, but not super expensive and isolated (and boring) like other resorts. It just has a great vibe to it. And it's at what I consider the best location on the beach. Toward the zoo end rather than the marina end. So you can walk to any part of the beach in just a few minutes - the more crowded parts or the less crowded. I highly recommend this hotel and we will be returning as soon as we can.

Our room was tiny and very run down. The ceiling had paint peeling off. The bathroom tile had mold growing on it and the door to the bathroom was rotting on the bottom. The room did not have two queen beds as advertised. Overall the rooms was very disgusting and I would never stay here again. Service was OK. Do not recommend this place if you prefer a nice place. The location is close to the beach and the view is great of the sunset. They did move us to a Junior suite that was clearer and much roomier after we pointed out the flaws. Staff was very polite about the move.

My wife and i stayed here for five nights in late January. Previously we had stayed at the other end of Waikiki beach, but enjoyed the east end of the beach more due to less traffic and fewer people on the beach. The hotel seems older, but our room was nice for the price level. the few minor issues we had were quickly addressed by the efficient staff. Really nice to have Tiki's bar and grill right in the hotel. The Bus stops were within short walking distance also. There was a resort fee that needed to be paid seperately from our booking, but was expected and covered wifi, movies and a gift bag of sunblock. Towels for the beach as well as chairs were easily obtained next to the pool. Our room had a nice ocean view which was unexpected. It was really nice to be able to walk across the street and be on the beach. Overall, we will definitely consider staying here again in the future.

We stayed there four nights and enjoyed the fantastic ocean views especially the stunningly beautiful sunset. The beach is just levels-downstairs away, swimming in the shallow near beach sea water is wonderful. However, the service there could be better. The first morning we were waken up by knocks on the door, which was the coffee capsule refill service. We didn't hang the 'privacy please ' card since there was no one in our room. So I had to creat one with the hotel envelope and my handwriting and hung it on the door handle when we left. The most unbelievable thing occurred on the morning of the day we checked out. We received bill but no any notice of the broken-down of the elevators. We had to call front desk asking what had happened and told them we were heading to the airport and don't want to miss our international flight. After couple of calls, we were able to get down with assistance from some staff. We were lucky that day because we wanted to leave earlier than catching-flight needed to do some last stop shopping at the airport, otherwise, it would be very likely that we have to stay longer at Hawaii.They knew we were checking out that morning and they knew the elevators were out of order, but they didn't inform guests and didn't provide assistance with a timely manner.

Very close to the beach , shopping & restaurants . There is a Starbucks just around the corner from this hotel, subway, Wolfgang pucks & a Lulu's above the Starbucks that is great for sunrises & sunsets. They have great happy hours & great food too we had fantastic service from the great staff. Then just down the street a few blocks is a place called Burgers in Paradise & it's another great happy hour & food place with fantastic staff & great music. You can see the beach from where your sitting because it's all open & that's the same with Lulu's. The Aston also has its own restaurant called Tikis but quit expensive & had a very bad experience with one waitress.

I've been to Honolulu a few times and this is my fav hotel so far. I wouldn't hesitate in booking here again. The room was a little small but great decor and the bag of goodies they give you for the beach is lovely. I didn't choose the expensive beachfront rooms but I was happy with my choice and budget. The pool is nice and the property has easy access to the street from the pool area. Good amenities all round!!!

If you want true beach front living, this is the place. Don't settle for a partial ocean view. You've come along way; so go for the best. Ask for a beach front room. They used to do "Breakfast On The Beach" but too many picky guests spoiled it for the rest of us that loved the adventure. They were wonderful in helping us plan our tour of Pearl Harbor. Housekeeping was very easy to work with. Can't wait to go back!!

There were so many things wrong with this place. Ranging from run down to disgusting. Wifi wouldn't connect, Broken drawers, fixtures, mold on the walls, patchwork tiles, torn sheets, hair on the toilet and all over the restroom. Cockroaches were emerging from the Keurig and running around. The staff was very nice and changed our room. We had three different rooms and there were problems in each of them. Everywhere else was booked so we couldn't leave. If we could have, we would have needed to carry our luggage down 22 floors because the elevator was broken. Horrible, horrible place. Location is the only thing going for it.

The hotel is perfect for friends, family or couples who are not on a honeymoon vacation. The hotel is at the beginning or end of Waikiki, closest to Kapiolani park. The hotel is not directly on the ocean, but is across the street. It's nice because you can walk the park and escape some of the touristy parts of Waikiki. The rooms are clean and features a game box with free game and DVD rentals. They offer free beach towel and beach chair rentals.I did not go in the pool but there is a rooftop pool and a basic fitness center.There is an excellent rooftop bar and restaurant called Tiki's. I've been there many times. Great ambiance, live local Hawaiian music and the food is delicious and decently priced. It's not a luxury hotel but a perfect hotel for a stay in Waikiki.. especially because when visiting Oahu- please also go to the North Shore (Waimea Bay, Waimea Falls, Turtle Bay) and the East Coast (Lanikai, Hanauma Bay etc.)Kapiolani park is at the east end of Waikiki. It's a nice place to walk or run or relax under a Banyan tree.

I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel on 2570 Kalakaua Avenue, January 1 to 7, 2016. It took me a while to write a review but it's amazing how time flies. Pros: Proximity to beach -- you cross the street and you're there as well as shops, places to eat and drink, and ABC Stores (which is actually everywhere). The ground floor lobby is cool with the surfboards displayed on the wall. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The Tiki Bar and Restaurant has a great view of the beach front, the food was good not spectacular, and they have a live band playing although not everyday. The room was ocean view, not ocean front but when you sit in the balcony it didn't matter. I watched the surfers from sunrise to sunset and the people walking up and down Kalakaua. On New Year's Day, one of the hotels had fireworks which was quite enjoyable. It was a comfortable room, with a small fridge and nice flat screen tv. The wi-fi was decent. They have a gaming system (a PS3 I think) which you can also use to play DVDs. They give you a Video card for the kiosk to rent movies and presumably games (I don't play video games so I didn't notice) for free. The disks are returned at the same place. Unreturned items are charged to your room. Cons: The air conditioner was not working properly. The thermostat could not be set by the guest. It was set at 62 which is 10 degrees colder than I prefer so it was very difficult to sleep for 3 nights in a row. I didn't spend that much time in the room so it was by the 4th day I finally called housekeeping to make it warmer. The doors to the balcony opens but being on the lower floors, the street noise was loud but quieted down by 10pm.

Room was good refrig. flat screen TV, shower powerful. View was great, 5th floor east side, could see hotel pool ,bar resterant, & WAIKKI Beach right across the street! . Nice break water< great swimming & wadding sunbathing. tour guides are great in the hotel George, got us all the info & times to get moving, beat the crowds! (he works far right both)We had great Valet service for the car very handy. We ate at the hotel bar resterant several times, always great food, great waiters, great view of Waikki beach. great place to stay in Honolulu THANK YOU PS we never used TV

Had the pleasure of staying here for a week. The staff were exceptional and friendly. Tiki's bar off to the side offered great place to catch up and have a drink. Bathrooms were a little dated, however not enough to worry about.Very relaxing location, great for families as the beach across the road has a breakwater protecting it. It is also at the quieter end of town however there are plenty of opportunities for food and shopping.If you are looking for a user friendly hotel with amenities nearby this is great. The guests varied in age from early 20's to retirees and families.

We paid to stay in this hotel for 2 weeks to have a nice New Year vacations but what we got was a nightmare! The 31 of December after the fireworks finished we sat in the chairs in front of the Puck's Restaurant which was already closed and what we found was 2 very unprofessional security guys from our Aston hotel that literally screamed at us:" GET OUT OF HERE!" We clarify to them nicely that we are guests at this Aston Hotel and they didn't really care.Most of all they threatened us to call the police if we don't leave immediately.They said: "IF YOU DON'T LEAVE RIGHT NOW, WE ARE GOING TO CALL THE POLICE".We were shocked by the lack of manners and rudeness of these guys! A few days after one of these guys came in a different spot and did the same thing! We complained to the manager and she only said that she would talk to the head of security,but our 2 week vacation were already destroyed! Our experience here was kind of harrasment and we will NEVER EVER go to this hotel again. Hawaii is a beautiful island but now we have a bitter memory of it.If you want to a have a nightmare,stay here.

My A/C did not work. Maintenance worked on it several times but it would stop working 36 hours later. The staff offered to change my room but I had a lot of stuff to move. There was a protest outside.

For a four star hotel, it was a bit out dated and average service. The only benefit that has a big plus is its location within Waikiki. The Tikki club was also good for a relaxing drink and a great place to socialise, friendly bar staff. The morning breakfast was a bit pathetic and you lined up like a group of school kids in a lunch line, and the food wasn't really great.

We spent 6 days here in late January. Really loved the location toward the east end of Waikiki Beach where the traffic and beachgoers were lighter.The beach was less than 100 feet away and the hotel provided towels and beach chairs for guests. Also enjoyed the free movie kiosks in the lobby, watched a movie almost everyday. The room was acceptable, the lanai and beach views were good even from the 6th floor. Staff were terrific, filling any request quickly. Having Tiki's bar and grill so accessible and with great food was a plus. I will definitely consider staying here again.

Aston is in a great lcoation and right opposite the beach, so full marks for that. The hotel looks like it was built in the 60's or 70's and is very dated. The rooms were cumfortable and the service was good. probably a bit spoilt !! Not very good value for money i'm afraid. The bar at the pool level was awesome, great live music.

right on the beach,nice room, they have smart elevators,but you pay for parking $30.00 per day plus resort fee.no breakfast incl.easy walk to the shopping center andto the red line.is good to take it for $20.00, it goes aroundinteresting places and is hop on/off

The hotel was nice and very close to the beach. However, if you choose to stay at this hotel, DO NOT BRING ANY VALUABLES WITH YOU! Just because there is a safe in the room does not mean your valuables are safe! Potential hotel guests - you have been forewarned!!In light of the hotel's dismissal of our theft complaint and minimizing the situation that arose during our stay, I am bringing my rating down from 3 stars to 1 star. We did not spend over $2,000 for the hotel room during our stay to be treated like this and blown off by Management.Next time my family is in Hawaii, we will never stay at another hotel affiliated with Aston!

My wife and I just returned from our trip to Hawaii we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel as we have several previous trips.This hotel offers a ocean front view as good as any I have see on Waikiki beach, the hotel is very clean and comfortable there is a very nice pool deck with a great view of Waikiki beach , shopping is very short walking distance , staff is very friendly and helpful on this past stay my wife and I accidentally booked the wrong room type on the website the front desk manager ( Joanne) was so kind to us, she was able to move us to our usually ocean front room we so much love, it's great service like this that will keep us coming back to this hotel year after year . This is a older hotel building but most of the hotels in Hawaii are and they have done a very good job keeping this building maintained it is very clean and comfortable we would recommend it.  Anita Lancello Joe Bydlon

Hotel is located at the south end Waikiki beach with plenty of restaurants and stores.Staff was very attentive and helpful.But, room was large but know furniture other than a king bed. No lounge chair to sit and watch TV.Doors always slammed shut noisily. This occurred at all hours of the day and night.Amenity Charge was steep: $23 (plus tax) per day for so-so WIFI, Two Kurig Coffee Kups and newspaper.Tiki Restaurant very nice with a range of food offerings.

Location is definitely a plus! Just cross the street and you're already at the beach! A lot of good restaurants nearby. Service is great. I had to move to another room since the first on got a little musty smell on the 2nd day and it was a breeze when they transferred us to another room. The view from the balcony was awesome. There's free buffet breakfast and I just love their purple bread (forgot what it's called). I really enjoyed my stay here. I will definitely come back! Highly recommended.

This is a very nice hotel on the far Diamondhead edge of Waikiki. The rooms were very clean and the beds are very comfortable. One odd thing was that there was a stop on the sliding glass door balcony making it difficult to get in and out. The pool area was small but adequate for the users that were there. The one large criticism that I have is that when the pool deck gets any water on it it is very slippery and dangerous. They really need to do something about that. The Tiki restaurant was very nice and the happy hour from 2 to 5 was also good.

Clean room, nothing special, had to change rooms next day for bed preference; front desk played dumb first day we arrived and did not mention completing a card for preference type so they could call us next day. Housekeeping staff was exceptional. I had to go to desk and ask if there was a room change even available. Tiki Bar food was good but pricey and make sure you go at happy hour otherwise like all other establishments the drinks are expensive.

Stay at this Hotel!Front and center to the amazing Waikiki! This hotel has it all! Great concierge and hospitality team, comfortable rooms, convenient to everything Waikiki has to offer! My only negative comment is in regards to the bathrooms-this hotel has been renovated-it has advanced elevators with security, the front desk, lanai, pool and hallways are very nice. Our hotel room was clean, updated furnishings and bedding-and then you step into the bathroom with gringu old tile flooring, grout that was crumbled, caulking around the tub that was moldy. It was a stark difference to the rest of the grounds-not sure why they neglected to update the bathrooms! The room we stayed in faced Diamond Head-beautiful sunrise views in the morning! The rooms have a small refrigerator for you to keep drinks or snacks, a keurig for coffee, a nice small breakfast table and plenty of storage space for clothing. The beds were very clean and comfortable. We had a small balcony that I would sit on (had to use the breakfast table chair-there are no chairs on the balcony due to the size and shape). It is a beautiful place to stay and despite the bathroom, we will return again.Go to the attached Tiki Bar and grill for breakfast, lunch, dinner and/or drinks! Surprisingly great food and drinks! We loved it!

It is with mixed feelings that I write this review .When we arrived we where told that breakfast on the beach has been stopped and was given $10 vouchers to be used in the tikki bar every morning .When we looked at the menu you could not get anything without spending more money .Its just a way of getting you to spend more .The breakfast on the beach was one of the things that we came back for it was great to get up in the morning and listen Hawaiian music and eat breakfast in your room before going out for the day. The first morning we where woken by very loud unions from the hotel at about 06.30am protesting about pay. I did contact the hotel to complain and did receive a $50 credit back on my account thankfully it didn't happen again . The rooms are getting very tired especially the bath rooms but the maids where great and very friendly .The view is still fantastic if you have pool side room .I needed to print a voucher off from my emails and phoned reception up to ask if there was a pc and printer that I could use and was told very bluntly no. No help at all ,I remember that there use to be one in the hotel but obviously no longer . I done a bit of googeling and found an internet café just down the road. Little things like that where they could have been a bit more helpful would go a long way. I did love the hotel but with all the changes i am to sure now. There is a resort fee which gives you free Wi Fi and a cup off coffee in the morning plus dvd and play station rentals .The other thing that I found strange is the toilets pool side have codes on them which we where not told on our arrival . The first night I needed to use the toilet I had to go asking for the code not great when I needed the rest room over all disappointed .Would I go back not sure !!

Room were decent. Great location. One street away from the Waikiki beach action. Pool located in the most odd place. The restaurant has a cute theme, but the food was terrible. Front desk girls are sweet but takes way too long to check in. Stay here if you get a deal.

We stayed 2 nights here on a stopover to Vegas. The staff were friendly, had a great view of the beach from our Delux room and a great spot to be able to walk to the great shopping and restaurants . The room was a little dated but clean and the position of the hotel really great.

We stay for 8 nights. We loved the experience. The bell people are very friendly and helpful. The location is the best. The restaurant is good. The receptionists at the bar are wonderful. Everyone is friendly in the hotel except the cleaning people.

My husband and I stay for two weeks I love this hotel. Great place, comfortable beds, clean rooms, great location and we had a partial ocean view and it was fabulous. We will return next year. We also rent a jeep and park at the Banyun which is only one block away at a monthly discount rate. Awesome great friendly service. Thank you for making my vacation such a happy one

Wow what an awesome experience we had my adult daughter & I stayed 8 nights at the Aston we had a deluxe suite on the 10th floor with amazing views . The room was clean & spacious loved the super efficient elevator system never had to wait long for a lift straight to our floor. If I was to find a small fault it would be there was no breakfast or vouchers as we were told there would be. Can't wait to come again wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else.

At the end of the Waikiki strip, near the park, with some amazing views all the way up the beach. Rooms have balconies. A nice 15min walk along the beach to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Centre area. Front ocean, or partial ocean view rooms are really worth it. Front office staff were very helpful and friendly when my flight arrived very early into HNL airport.

When my wife and I made our first trip to Hawaii to drop our daughter of for collage we stayed here, the only downside we experienced was the cost of the parking and Valet not to mention the tipping on top of that, not that I mind tipping but it just seemed that i had to wait and tip all the time 3 or 4 times a day but in their defense with all the tourist and people dropping there kids off for collage it was very hectic during our time there. Later I found out later on that Waikiki and parking do not go hand in hand it will be an adventure at most places you stay if you rent a car.The restaurant and bar there was fun and great but try to get a room up high if you are on the side of the bar and pool it does get loud. Oh i did see a lot of celebrities there I thought that was pretty cool.

What a gr8 start to our holiday Aston waikik beach hotel was our 1st stop 7 days gr8 room on the 21st floor ocean views 2106 clean rooms beds comfortable we loved it close to everything we'd stay here again for sure staff fantastic helpful pleasent alway happy 10 out of 10 from us

The was our first trip to Hawaii. This is my 2nd trip adviser ever. Will definitely stay here again. Beach access and views could not have been better. Happy hours watching the sunset to Hawaiian music was a plus A plus.Front desk extremely helpful. Clean, safe and wonderful beds!!! Sue Camp Kentucky

Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel has one thing going for it...location. Perhaps that's enough for some visitors. It is located near the east end of Kalakaua Ave., right across the beach from Waikiki. There are no hotels on the beach at this end of Waikiki, so beach access is wonderful. The hotel, however, is a dog, which is surprising due to Aston's reputation. Rooms are old, crowded, and in need of TOTAL makeovers. The check-in process involves waiting in a queue. Heaven help if you need to use the restroom near the front counter; it's key-card entry only. You can't get your card, however, until you've made it through the queue. Next, the elevators involve a unique, key-card process of calling an elevator to your specific floor. Strange, to say the least. Most rooms have an ocean view from small, private balconies. Our slider worked fine. Our friends, in room 811, couldn't get their slider open and had to call for maintenance. Thankfully, we only stayed one night as we were returning to the US from an international vacation. Any more and we'd have felt really cheated.Checkout: Don't be shocked by a $23 (plus tax) daily "resort fee". I asked what it covered and the desk clerk slid a sheet in front of me...access to in-room telephone, the resort swimming pool, pool towels, $10 breakfast coupon, etc. Think what you'd be paying if you stayed here a week. Do the math...ouch! Final injustice: $2.00 charge for each plastic key-card you don't return. I've never, never heard of this charge. Aston is really looking under the rug for every possible revenue stream. Overall, there are over 70 other hotels in Waikiki. Aston Waikiki Beach is near the bottom of the list, from our experience.

Beautiful Island, Amazing Hotel ocean view. Relaxing, site seeing and delicious food. Fell asleep to the sounds of the waves so tranquil. This has only been my first night here and first time visiting Honolulu. I'll have more to write before the trip is over.Aloha

We stayed here for one night before going to another island then next day…The first issue was the door keycard, it didn’t work and after a 15 hour flying day the last thing a person wants to do is leave the family stranded in a hot hallway and return to the check-in desk for another keycard. The desk gave us the key and called out building maintenance, I returned to the door the second keycard did not work so we waited for the maintenance guy who of course go the card to work on the first try. The my wife tried the card and again it would not work so we had to spend the next 15 minutes getting checked out on the proper way to slide a keycard into the door in order to get the thing to work (and yes there is a specific way to do this for the Astons old locks). I also had booked an ocean view that turned into a partial ocean/ mountain / top of a building view but for one night I let it go. Once we got all that sorted out the kids wanted to head to the pool for swimming that was closed and roped off when we got there (the sun wasn’t even down yet) and already exhausted from the door fiasco we just moved on to the beach. We stayed one night, enjoyed Tikis Grill, the easy beach access but am glad we did not book for the second part of our stay in Honolulu.

We have spent 3 nights here on this trip and 1 on an earlier part of the trip. The location is great with the beach and shops right there. The Tiki Bar is on the pool level and Wolfgang Puck at ground level. Staff are friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself is really getting tired, with 70s style red decor in the halls and the rooms are in need of an upgrade. They have this bizarre dvd lending system which is old technology. Today you would have the movies accessible via your in-room entertainment system. The lift system is also antiquated. I thought is was a security feature at first, but no, you can go to any floor. We ended up on the wrong floor a number of times as it gets over ridden by another request sometimes. Somewhat over priced as well.

We stayed here for three nights from the 10th to 13th, although the Hotel is in need of a little TLC, the location and the Staff made up for this.The Rooms were clean and a decent size and the bed was unbelievably comfortable as I am over 6ft.The staff were always accommodating to all our request and provided a service with a Smile.One down side of the stay was apparently the breakfast was no longer included although it was still advertised on the Web. No big deal as there was an ABC shop in the same complex. These ABC shops were amazing catered for everything

This Hotel is just across the street from the Beach. We stayed on the 25th floor. Room had two beds and a great view of the ocean. Check in was fast. Close to shopping, bars and restaurants. Room was very clean and the maids were in every day, they took care of our room very well. First time I have stayed here, I really like the location.

We lucked out and got a corner room on the 15th floor, so we had a ocean front view as well as a view of Diamond Head. Front desk and housekeeping was great. Elevators were unusual. You scanned your room key on a screen, plugged in your floor, and it told you what elevator to get on. A little weird at first, but we quickly got used to it. You can't beat the location. Tiki's Grill and Bar right next door was a great stop for us several times for cocktails and dinner. We even saw the New Year's Eve fireworks from our balcony. Overall, we had a great time here.

Travelled as family so had 2 adjoining rooms, rooms are clean and reasonably modern, beds are very comfortable, all tours/trams at side of motel, but note this is a motel, no room service or laundry facilities. Small pool but deck area large and great view of gorgeous afternoon sunsets. Tiki restaurant bar located on pool deck has great music from lunch til late. Staff friendly and tour booking guides helpful. Walk across street to Waikiki main beach area, and stroll straight up street to great shopping is a plus for the location. If looking for a resort holiday this is not it, but for price and location a great motel.

I stayed at Aston Waikiki on January 4-12, 2016 for a Business trip. My wife came too. We stayed in room 1630, an Oceanfront Select room. This was our third time staying at the Aston. For the price, you cannot beat the Oceanfront Select room views of the beach, Diamond Head and Waikiki. Other hotels this close to the beach, with this view would be much more expensive. The hotel is within easy walking distance of everything - the beach, restaurants, the zoo, the aquarium, all of Waikiki. The staff is friendly and professional. The room was good, two clean, comfortable double beds, a refrigerator with complementary drinks, an adequate bathroom, free Wi-Fi. The bathroom showed the wear from the many guests and was in need of some minor maintenance. The A/C kept the room comfortable, but the thermostat was not functional. Initially it would not work at all. Upon notifying the front desk, a maintenance person quickly arrived and replaced the thermostat. After replacement, it would go on or off manually, but not automatically, which was a slight annoyance, but no big deal. Valet parking is mandatory and adds $30 a day to the cost. The once complimentary continental breakfast has been discontinued, so we had to switch to the Starbucks and Jamba Juice located on the ground level just outside the hotel. Overall, we were both happy staying at the Aston and would stay there again.

Really enjoyed our stay on Waikiki at the Aston. Located near the end of the Waikiki strip, you're close to shopping & restaurants, without being in the middle of the "busyness" of it. The hotel is located across the street from the beach, with excellent unobstructed views of the ocean. Check in was a little slow, due to a large group ahead of us, but otherwise the staff was very accommodating. It is an older hotel, but it is kept clean & is well attended.Any needs were quickly taken care of by the hotel staff. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Older hotel, but very well kept. Customer service was great. Ideal location to beaches, shopping, restaurants and public transportation.We had an ocean view and enjoyed the su rising and setting daily.The room included small patio which was wonderful watching surfers and listening to the waves.

Spend 8 nights travelling as family plus 2 kids. Room on the 15th facing away from Diamond Head. Huge king size bed very comfy and pull out sofa for kids. Breakfast included. Each person receives a little cooler bag to fill up with pastries, cereals, youghurts fruits juices tea and cofee. You cam only go through the buffet with your cooler bag once. Can get eggs or waffles for extra cost. Unlimited dvd or ps4 game rentals also included. Free wifi worked well in rooms. Located right accross the road from the beach - pretty much almost the last hotel on the strip looking towards Diamond Head. There are several ABC Stores (mini marts that sell pretty much anything) nearby. Also Starbucks is just round the corner. There are 4 tour desks downstairs (the most helpful was the lovely lady at the last one closest to the beach side). Also taxis available at the front of hotel as well as a trolley stop right outside. Staff were lovely and helpful. The lifts need your room card to be activated and you can only request to stop on your floor. Hotel is at one end of Kalakaua Avenue but nice and easy to walk down the street and explore lots of restaurants. Shops opened until 11pm every night. Bargain hunters - check out a shop called Ross (behind H&M ) doesn't look like much from the outside but has loads of well known branded fashion items at ridiculously reduced prices. Also take a cab to Diamond Head or Manoa Falls much cheaper than a paid tour.

We were at this hotel in late December 2015. First the hotel is in great location. You are literally across the street from surfing, snorkeling, sun bathing at the world famous Waikiki Beach! The rooms are quaint and had undergone some recent paint and some new touch-ups. My guess is that you won't be spending too much time in your room anyhow, right? The beds are super comfy and each morning awoke refreshed! There is a gift shop on the lower floor where you can get anything from snacks to soft drinks to souvenirs to liquor. We didn't see if the hotel offered room service, however don't fret there are dozens upon dozens of places to eat right on the main street which the hotel is located on. Everything from fast food to upscale dining; you're covered. The hotel has a bar "Tiki's"which is often loud, crowded and fun, a great place to unwind, listen to live music and have a great mai tai! The hotel pool is nice, clean, kid friendly and you'll get pool towels too. Interested in watching a DVD in your room, you'll get access to free DVD and PS4 game rentals in the lobby; a great touch! Plus, when you arrive you receive a care package that includes assorted sun tan lotions and hand fans; a nice touch. There are numerous "tour operators" downstairs that offer hundreds of things to do while in Oahu. They will even pick you up at the hotel! Note; some attractions are actually "free", so what you're paying for is the bus transportation and the driver telling you about interesting details on your way to that location. Example, The USS Arizona Memorial is free. If you have a car, drive there early yourself as they give away approx 2,000-2,500 tickets away for free. We paid $100 each and took the bus, go figure. In conclusion, the hotel is great, would stay there again, when we go back next December! If you have any questions, just ask! Mahalo!

Everyone at the hotel was always helpful and pleasant. The Aston hotel was at beginning of the main strip and it made it a lot less crazy as to be in the middle of the strip. This is a big time vacation spot, so don't expect it to be quite as a mouse. People are there to have fun and enjoy themselves. I would stay here again on our next visit.

The hotel is well located at the end of the Waikiki strip and the beach is right across the road. Try to get a room overlooking the pool area as these have the best overall views. The elevators are a bit confusing at first especially getting from the lobby to the rooms but once you figure them out they are actually efficient and avoid people all trying to crowd into one. Access to reception is via elevator or escalator with stairs near the Tiki bar.

Although we have been to Honolulu several times before, this was our first stay at a hotel on Waikiki beach. It was very convenient to walk across the street to the beach. Wolfgang Puck's, Jamba Juice, McDonalds, Burger King and several ABC stores are very close by. This hotel is on the edge of Waikiki so it is a bit of a walk to the other side of Waikiki (we were travelling with a young child). We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the use of the fridge and the complimentary DVD rentals. Valet parking only is available and we opted to do self parking at another location which was a block away, for less money. Valet and front desk staff were very helpful. Overall we had a pleasant stay at this hotel and I would consider staying here again.

Perfect location if you're visiting Ohana and want to avoid the traffic. Location is across from beach, out of the middle of the Waikiki strip so getting car and taking off quickly is a plus. However, the location isn't out of walking distance from all the touristy shops and restaurants for first time visitors. There's a Starbucks next door, a Wolfgang Pucks express and several quick eating places. Rainbows, for local food is right down the street. Valet attendants are always friendly and helpful. The front desk will assist people with anything they need. Housekeeping is quick and efficient. If you're looking for a resort type place, then this is not for you. If you're looking for a nice, clean hotel with wonderful Aloha service and would rather spend your money helping their economy on other fun things, then this is a good choice.

This is an older hotel, but is well maintained. Our room was clean and the staff at the hotel was friendly. Right in the Waikiki area, so close walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants, etc. We were only there overnight waiting to catch the cruise ship, so not a lot of details. For the Waikiki area, we felt the price was reasonable. There is a charge for parking, but this is probably the case in all hotels in this area. Overall, a good stay.

This hotel is superbly located - just across from the beach & close to convenience stores & cafes. It has a bar & grill onsite next to the pool for casual dining which served good food at reasonable prices. A restaurant option is also available for romantics. The beds were extremely comfortable and inviting. However the most memorable aspect of this hotel for me was the very welcoming and friendly staff - congratulations thank you.

We stayed here during Halloween, which gets crazy in Waikiki. We were so impressed with this hotel. The amenities are great, free dvd rental, welcome bag with goodies and suncare products. Staff are so friendly and very customer oriented. The location is the best. The beach is right across the street. There are eateries and stores downstairs. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are clean. We can't wait to stay at the Aston again.

Excellent place to stay. I go to HI every year. This is now my favorite place to stay. My wife and I do the Honolulu Marathon every year. Geri and Chris at the front desk were especially helpful. Rooms were perfect. The valet parking people were really efficient. The elevators made me feel secure. Nobody can go to a floor without a key.

It's 6:30am and staff are protesting very loudly at the top of there collective lungs to wake all on this side of the Aston and all others around. it appears the chant is for more pay. As for the room;The air cond has no control other than off and on.The bathroom room leaks from the room above. At first we thought this condensation form our showers.The phone doesn't work (if you want to complain you need to go downstairs to face reception)The bathroom hairdryer has failed with a big blue flash and smokeThe in room coffee machine doesn't workWe keep needing to request more towels although four staying in the room they only re-supply three.Now it's 7am and the protesters have introduced a megaphone and instruments (drums)The rooms are nothing more than a very dated bedroom and bathroom. If you want to sit anywhere your choices are the bed, the one balcony chair or the toilet. The table and uncomfortable stools need to be used to hold your bags as there is no floor space and the cupboard holds only one.The northern side have balconies for one chair only, southern side have one standing space only -no room for a chair.There is a smell of sewerage in the valet entrance that wafts up to lower floors when the wind is lightBy the way this is our upgraded room after being originally assigned a southern room right above the neighbouring hotel's massive air cond unit that droned continuously and clearly heard with door closed.. No drainage in the bathroom floor means any shower water runs off to soak the carpetRooms are very dated decor and tilingWe are paying a "mandatory" $24 per day!! service fee apparently for a daily paper I didn't want and I need to collect from the vestibule, poor wifi that doesn't work on the balcony, a coffee machine facility that doesn't work and another few things that should be standard as part of accommodating guests.Owners need to:1. Fix situation with staff2. Renovate and repair/upgrade entire rooms and amenities3. Stop relying on the location as the main feature of the hotelWe it's now 7:30am and the protesting staff have moved off. Other options should be sought for the premium rate this location attracts

My husband and I stayed here for a week on our honeymoon, it was great! Right on the beach, short walk to shops, and they have the best restaurant and bar right down stairs! The rooms have the island feel and are very clean. They also have wifi which is a great connection but who needs that when you have a beautiful beach just outside your balcony!

I have reviewed this hotel positively twice, but now I have to revise my reviews downward because the hotel has eliminated one of its best features ---breakfast on the beach. We have stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel every year since 2008 and always enjoyed the buffet breakfast served by the pool, accompanied by live Hawaiian music and a hula dancer. But on our last stay (November, 2015) we found they have discontinued the breakfast. Tiki's restaurant at the hotel now serves breakfast, but the prices are high ($15 - $22) and there is no music. We still recommend the location, and the views from the oceanfront rooms, but there may be better hotel values on Waikiki. Next year we will check out some of them before booking.

Like many businesses in USA this hotel has suprise charges, like on our check out we discoovered that where all of a sudden charging us some sort of tax for $24US, which i paid cash. Only to discover that they had also put a hold on my credit card for the money also. The hold came off after i returned to the hotel 12 days later to complain. I have since discovered that putting a hold on your credit cards for non existant debt is common in the USA, perhaps so they can verify your card is valid, it would be to bad if had a small limit on your card. I think the mini bar is free, but not sure, as a Staff member knocked a few minutes after we checked in and wanted to fill the bar fridge and we declined, Then the next day on check out i was told by the desk staff that it was free any way. Clean room, but didn't get the 2 beds i paid for, got a king in stead. Great view, and Tiki resturant is great. Location is just fab.

Very good service, specially check in and valet. The location is wonderful, right across Waikiki Beach! Friendly atmosphere. We really enjoyed our stay and our ocean view room. We will come back soon and stay longer.

i wasnt happy the pool are was getting renovated & we weren't told & it smelt like tar & very noisy and i didnt like the idea of the the breakfast on the beach you get a little bag fill it up cereal & etc & carry it out your room or where ever you want to take it

The room is clean, but the bathroom is small and needed upgrade. A/C has no adjustment for blowing direction and blowing right to the head of the bed making sleep very difficult, too cold when is on and too hot when off.Don't know why they provide the expired date of Mar 2015 chocolate for December staying guest like us. The location definitely a plus, just walk right out to the Waikiki beach.

Nice hotel accross from wikiwiki beach. Although we ran a little problem in the begining, we did the room we booked. But they upgraded us to a ocean front room. it was great.Sservice was great. very friendly staff. We will stay there again.
user_name:
Siddhartha B
White Plains, New York

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for the holidays. Of course, we were prepared for the high prices, however this hotel is so run down, it wasn't worth the price. The rooms need to be torn down and rebuilt. Front desk staff were worthless. Housekeeping staff were very considerate and kind..they go out of their way to assist guests. There are so many hotels along the beach...you may want to consider one of the them for a more pampering stay. The Aston doesn't offer much. Tiki's Grill on the lobby floor has delicious food and good happy hour drinks but be aware it seems that they water down the happy hour drinks because they seemed stronger after happy hours ended.

A good yet slightly aged hotel. Reasonably located at the edge of the Waikiki strip, the hotel provided ready access to much of what Waikiki had to offer - the beach, shuttles and tours, Diamond Head, multiple ABC stores... Most importantly, the rooms were clean and well kept, and there was free wifi for guests.Unfortunately I cannot really comment on the breakfast available at Tiki's Grill down on level 3, but there are enough convenience stores and fast food outlets along the nearby streets to keep the low maintenance guests happy. If youre after something more, hopefully Tiki's meets your standards.

The lady who entertained us when we checked in Geri or Gerti (?) was very accommodating and friendly. As to accessibility, the hotel is right across the beach where everything happens.I expected more...thinking the lobby was enclosed and all but it actually was cool. Open aair lobby. Maybe check in should also be in the lobby. The use of their elevator ...younhad to get used to it. The rroms were small. I Wish they were brighter. Needs to be repainted. Even the bathroom was small. Small would be okay if it was cleaner and sturdier looking.It would really be a very nice place or nicer place if they fixed up more things. Maybe think about bring breakfast back again. It was christmas but decors were very minimal. Maybe its just me but it be nice to have a more festive look.,Staff.... Most of those i encountered were courteous and helpful.

Its hard to find a hotel where the rooms are this small and depressing to be in. Think virtually no furniture, a TV as small as a computer monitor, walls in olive green and doors brown. Don't think modern think badly done. This is the hotel. The people however are quite nice and happy to help out. Free movies and free local phone calls. Still not what you expect from the websites and still not worth the money. It's the last hotel on Waikiki. That not all bad as further down the road is real beach and parkland. Good to get away from all the frantic activity of the main drag. down stairs is a reasonable dinner called Wolfgang Puck. We did not get a water view. We got a roof top and walls fro a non- existing balcony. We were given an upgrade. More room but again just depressing to be in. Actually the TV was the same size, the couch was a hard as a rock - but we got space. If we had not got the upgrade we would have moved out. Next time I will not stay on the beach. One or two streets way is better value and access to everything is easy. Sorry Mr Aston.

Hotel is in the perfect location! Right across street from beach....very visible & beautiful view of beach & pool area from our balcony on the 7th floor. Hotel reception area is beautiful.....taxis & all other modes of transportation available right at reception area. Valet personnel eager & ready to get a taxi for you. Bell service very nice & easy to hold luggage. Travel & activity desks located near registration desk very nice & helpful to arrange ANY activity you would like to take. Elevator que system very nice...never a wait! Tiki bar/restaurant right in hotel very good!Nothing but wonderful memories of our stay,,

Spent a week at The Aston WBH with my family and in-laws. It is one of the more reasonably priced hotels on Waikiki that does not sacrifice location (on the beach). Clean rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff, perfectly located, great restaurant on site. Easy walking to most shops and restaurants. Tours pick up right outside. Bathrooms and pool could use some updating, but this was not an issue considering we were not there for 5-star luxury. I highly recommend this hotel for families!

I was initially a bit worried when we booked here over the Christmas holiday due to some reviews and due to it still having vacancy. We absolutely LOVED this hotel. The location is perfect, the staff is lovely, the Tiki Bar is a blast and I can't say enough good things about our experience!!! It is also incredibly handy to have three different tour/information desks in the lobby area. We will be back and will stay here again without a second thought.

we stayed at room 2215 ithink ( it was a room almost at the end of the hallway on the 22nd floor). the room was clean with an amazing view! we actually switched to this hotel from another really crappy one..queen kapliolani. Geri at the Aston really helped us out with a great room deal and even managed to get our room ready in time for us to move over. The customer service here is amazing!! the location is ideal. The restaurant there is ok..a bit over priced, but the food was decent. The pool is small, but the beach is right there..so that didn't bother us. the key is to get a room high up and away from the elevator. The walls were a little thin (we could hear next door people once in a while), but i think that's because our room had an adjoining door to the next room (which was locked of course). So maybe look for one without this option and it will be quieter. Overall we loved it, and we will be returning here on our next trip! Thank you Geri for helping us out and saving our baby moon !!!

We stayed here for our belated honeymoon in Dec. 2015 for over 1 week. We did a LOT of research for where to stay and not have to pay $500/ night on Waikiki. This hotel appealed to us for its AMAZING location towards to lower end of Waikiki (towards Diamond Head & the zoo). PRO: amazing location literally right ACROSS the Main Street to the beach.. Footsteps from WaikikiCONS: there were ANTS in our bathroom & all over our bathroom sink EVERY morning. The "amenity fee" was a JOKE...$23/day + tax for SLOW wifi, and who knows what else it was for?! Their pool is blocked by their neighboring sky-scraper hotel so it only gets 2-3 hrs of sun/ day... No hot tub... So unless you like windy shady beach chairs by the pool, I would plan on soaking up sun on the warm BEACH not the hotel pool. No continental breakfast. It IS attached to a restaurant "TIKIs" if you want an $18 OMLET!!!! Outrageously priced food, bad coffee ($3.50 / cup)...yuck!It was an OK stay.... But I expected more I guess for what we payed. We will not be staying here again. Good location, not the best quality of hotel in general.

This is one of the less glamours hotels in Waikiki but we found it to be affordable, clean, comfortable and convenient. The staff was friendly, bed was comfortable and the location is right across from the beach. We booked a partial ocean view room and found it to be a nice beach and ocean view. We would stay here again.

We stayed over the week of Christmas.I like this place. It was clean, the amenities were very reasonable, and the staff was very nice.The ocean view room we initially paid for, ended up being way too small. I informed the front desk, Chris, and he let me look at two other rooms. Ultimately the room we choose was more expensive, but he was able to get the price down to where it was affordable. He did this for us even though the desk was slammed with checkins. You pay a daily resort fee, but I was impressed with what you get. Unlimited movie and video game check out privileges. The movie selections are similar to what Red Box will have. There is a PlayStation 3 in the room, along with a Keurig. You get coupons for $10 off breakfast for each person in your room, at Tiki's, the hotel restaurant. They also have beach chairs and towels for check out.The hotel is located directly across the street from the beach. The beach has a wall to keep the surf out and has a sandy bottom. Nice place to let the kids go free and not worry about them getting sucked out to sea. There is an equipment rental place on the south side of the beach, you can get boogie boards, SUP's, umbrellas, etc.There is a Wolfgang Pucks and Subway on the street level. On the zoo side there is a Teddy's Bigger Burgers. Well worth the try.It is at the end of the strip so there aren't as many people in the general vicinity unlike the hotels further north.Parking... You will pay $27 a day for valet. There is no where else to park nearby. The valet named Bartz, is a heck of a nice guy and very helpful. The local trolley's stop by the front along with taxis. The Expedia concierge was a great resource as usual. I have really grown to like those folks. Carmen was very helpful and knowledgeable about excursions and local nearby places to eat. I would stay here again.

We had a great stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach. We had a family of 4 with plenty of room. Our room wasn't an ocean view, but we had a partial view which was fine and had a great view of diamond head and the zoo (Your not in your room much, so we didn't care) The staff is great, friendly and personable. Room was always clean and had plenty of towels and extras. If you needed anything, we had great service within a 2-5 minute time frame. We used the workout facility on the premises, kind of small but we got what we needed out of it. Elevator system is different, but you get used to it, security I believe is the key. You need a room key for a lot around the hotel to use the amenities. Tiki's bar/grill was great, kind of expensive but conveniently located. Gets busy on the weekends, but with closing time at midnight the noise isnt anything to worry about. There is no laundry facility on the premises, so you will need to walk about 3 blocks from the hotel to the laundry mat. They do offer beach towels and beach chairs at no extra charge, which is nice. Location is right across from the beach, which is great. Alot of restaurants and ABC stores in close proximity (Downstairs of the hotel: Wolfgang Puck Express Awesome!, Subway, Jamba Juice, Cookie Corner, Lulu's right around the corner) We will stay again, just because they were so hospitable and clean.

This was the WORST experience I have ever had, the rooms look like a prison cell, the pool is tiny and old, the service is terrible and full of attitude!!! We had no hot water for 5 days, the TV didn't work, coffee machine didn't work, there is horrible noise from the street in the morning, non smoking is not enforced, everybody smokes on the balcony. The front desk staff is super rude (the manager Stephen was the only nice person). STAY AWAY if you want a relaxing vacation!!! I would give it no stars if there was an option!!!

The only good thing about this hotel is the location, right across from Waikiki Beach, with forward facing rooms having a beautiful view. I would rate this 2 and 1/2 not 4 stars. Check-in is right next to the pool with the queue under a canopy. So we got splashed on and rained on while waiting. We dutifully waited until after check-in time, but of course our room wasn't ready. The restrooms in the lobby require a key card to enter. So, you need to go to the restroom but first have to wait in line to check in, then can't get a key because your room is not ready, so you have to wait more time for your keys and still can't get into restroom. The front desk staff was a very nice lady but completely unhelpful. She told us we could enjoy the hotel amenities while we waited (except the restroom, which requires a key). When I asked what amenities, she said the pool or we could rent a DVD or PS3 game or go to their bar/grill "Tiki's". (We had already eaten at Tiki's, where I ordered strawberry pancakes for $16 that had absolutely NO strawberries.)When I asked if there was a changing room for the pool, she told me no, you have to use the restroom. That would be adequate if I had a key to get into it!! And a DVD does me no good if I don't have anything to play it on. The TV/DVD player being in the room I can't get into. There is absolutely NO seating in the lobby. You can sit by the pool with your luggage (in the rain, in our case) while you wait for your room to be made up. The elevator system is so screwed up I will not try to describe it. The rooms are small. Decor is outdated. The bathroom tile is old and cracked. The tub looked dirty. There were two sets of towels for a family of four. We called for more and they were never delivered. There were no glasses in the bathroom, only two coffee mugs in the entire room. The mini bar contained no alcohol, just an assortment of bizarre snacks. Beds were comfortable. The only seating was a bar-high small table with two stools. We were lucky to have a small lanai with two chairs and an amazing view of the beach. I put out the "do not disturb" sign and the maid knocked THREE separate times!! On checking out, we stored our luggage as we had a night flight. The bell captain opened the door for us and made us go in back and stack our own luggage. He then LIED to me and told me there was no public transportation when I asked where to get a bus. It was an all round bad experience and I won't go back or recommend this particular hotel to others.

This hotel is reasonably priced for being so close to waikiki beach. The rooms are basic - not fancy, but the bed was comfy .The best thing about this hotel us it's location - across the street from the beach L

i recently reviewed a hotel but i put the wrong aston beach hotel this one is the one i should off being review ing we had an ocean view deluxe room with a fantastic view the room was always clean and well stocked would recommend this hotel for anyone

The amenities are poor at such a price level. The furnish is old and there's no laundry inside the building when you have to walk three blocks away. The valet parking is forced and on a $27/day base (without tips). The breakfast was changed into vouchers with limitations from buffet by the hotel itself two months before my vacation starts. The vouchers can only cover part of your breakfast and you have to pay $5-10/person for breakfast.The most terrible thing is the room. They claim the "ocean view deluxe room" which is actually just partial ocean view and the tiniest "deluxe" room I've ever been in. If you want the real ocean view, you have to choose "ocean front". The only good thing is the convenient location to Wakiki beach.

This was the third stay at this Hotel for us Aussies. The views we had from our room and the Hotel's location were fantastic. The Hotel is obviously not a 5 star resort and people should take that into account. We were fortunate enough and appreciative to receive an upgrade to a Level 25 Ocean View Select room. The rooms are not huge, those with 2 children [like us] may find it a tad squashy. They are clean and neat but sadly are probably in need of few little touch-ups. Its a tricky scenario trying to renovate a hotel that is in reasonable condition. We did have a few minor issues with TV, Air-Con and Phone that management did their best to address. We really did not spend much time in our rooms as the beach opposite is amazing. The pool on site is not the biggest, but is always clean and tidy [but was sadly in the shade for most of the day on this visit]  The Resort Fees don't have much to offer besides the Wi-Fi [which wasn't too bad] and the DVD/Games hire. Sadly, the mad rush for breakfast has been replaced by a sun-care pack which we didn't even open. This is one area that maybe management could add more value to? Tiki's Grill isn't one of our favourites and we ate most meals elsewhere. Wolfgang Puck's Express on Ground floor is quite good for a quick quality casual meal.The Expedia Travel office in the Lobby is fantastic with helping with your Holiday needs. We found a great car-hire deal through them [A convertible car is a must for all other Aussies] Its tricky to recommend this Hotel. Yes it is quite good [IF you get it at a good rate and an Upgrade] otherwise you will most probably find better options in that price range. We have seen the standard drop a little but that has nothing to do with the efforts of the staff and management. There were so many more positives than negatives in this most recent stay and its tricky trying to just point out the smaller bad points. Its not as far away from the centre of Waikiki as some people might think and the Kuhio breakwall Beach opposite is probably the best in the area. Fingers crossed that we are back here again next year [and that there are no loud 6am protests outside]

We stayed here for 4 days while on vacations through the islands. We had a room with a wonderful view to Waikiki Beach. There is an access to the beach right across the street. This is an old hotel and you notice it is old from the moment you step into the elevator and the corridors. Average room quality, nothing fancy...since it is old maybe a little renovation (specially to the bathroom and corridors) could be helpful. The hotel has an excelent location, right in Kalakahua Av. and it is walking distance from most of the shops and malls in the area. I would try another hotel in the area in another visit to Honolulu but would not completely discard the option. The only thing I didn't like at all is the pool...it is right in between the checking in area and Tiki's Grill and Bar, also there are some stairs with access from the street so a lot of people would pass by while you are in the pool area. We borrowed some chairs and took them to the beach -no umbrella!!- so it was a little difficult to find a spot in the beach. They charge a resort fee that practically is a charge for WiFi in your room. Valet Parking is $27/day and there is no self-parking. Good experience

Seriously hideous dexor, filthy room, dreadful lift operation and the worst front counter service ever. The windows in the room are rusting out, there was a yellow toilet seat that came out of the ark and hair all over the old shower curtain. Everything is at a cost, even the bottled water and coffee refills for the coffee machine. The ranch slider to the desk rattled and whistled and you could hear all the noise from outside and other rooms. The 'supplied by manager' welcome kit is also not free , even though it is supposed to be part of your additional daily charge. Their lobby is a joke, once you figure out how to get in there and thr valet service is short staffed. Would not stay here again. I left feeling like i needed a good shower and a de-lousing. Even the showerhead was filthy.

This was my first visit to Oahu..and probably my last-just wanted to see Pearl Harbor and hike Diamond Head, as I prefer the solace of the other islands. But...since this was my only visit, my requirement was to be as close to the beach as possible and the Aston met that. The room was essential, nothing special. We had a partial ocean view which is hard to come by near Waikiki Beach. We were right across the street from the beach and could walk directly from there to Diamond Head (2 miles). The hotel restaurant Tiki's, was excellent and we dined there most of the time along with quick lunches at Wolfgang Pucks which is located on the ground floor of the hotel. Overall for the price, the location and basic amenities were all we needed as we spend little time in our rooms while on the islands.

I spent my honeymoon in this hotel. The staff was nice enough to upgrade us to an ocean view deluxe from a partial ocean view deluxe. The hotel room was nice and bigger than we had expected. Very comfortable beds. The view was out of this world! By far the nicest view I have had from any hotel. Waikiki Beach is RIGHT there and we could also see Diamond Head from our room. We were at the far end of the beach so it was a bit quieter but still walking distance from everything. All of the staff that we dealt with were very friendly. I would not have changed it. The elevators operate a little strange in that you have to go to the lobby (floor 3) before you can leave the hotel (floor 1). I mean you actually have to get out and switch elevators...it was a bit weird (hopefully not just a user error) but I wouldn't stay anywhere else now. Love this hotel.
user_name:
Amanda C
Sault Ste. Marie, Canada

review_body: Great family place to stay. Accommodations were fabulous and service superb!!! Breakfast each morning at poolside was incredible and the singing and dancing during breakfast was beautiful to watch. Would go back in a heartbeat if had another opportunity to go to Hawaii. Location is awesome; not in the hubbub of the crazy traffic and a birds eye view of Diamond Head. Hotel room was facing the ocean and we could hear the ocean. Take the family and go; you'll love it!!!

This hotel has a fantastic location. There are two major places all the tours stop for pick up. The Hilton and this hotel. You are right across the street from the beach. Our room on the 22nd floor had a phenomenal ocean view. Staff were friendly and helpful. The Tiki restaurant was outstanding and we ate breakfast overlooking the ocean every morning. The rooms were dated but clean. Service was great. Really enjoyed our stay here.

A group of 8 of us stayed for 10 days to celebrate a 50th birthday.Those that were lucky enough to be upgraded to deluxe ocean view rooms had fantastic views from the balcony. Those on the other side had a dark room that faced a wall.
