As the location and views are the best thing going for this hotel, don't waste your money staying here unless you get a room with a view.The rooms were a good size with two double beds - big enough for us all to gather in one room each night for drinks before going out.The pool area was nice enough to cool down at sunset and get a drink from Tikis Bar, but not to spend all day at.Tikis was a fantastic place to have on your doorstep for those nights when you don't want to venture too far - good food and live music.Wolfgang Pucks (downstairs) was also great for a takeaway pizza/ snacks.The breakfast buffet was great for those health freaks who loved the fresh fruit, but not good for hangovers in need of hot carbs. I hear the breakfast has now been cancelled which will probably improve reviews.Location at the end of the beach is great. The beach opposite is good for swimming, and a nice stroll along the strip to the shops. You can also get the tram to the mall.This was an expensive hotel for a European who is used to getting good value package deals, but real ably priced compared to the other hotels.I have previously stayed at the Moana Surfrider and the difference in quality is massive. Worth paying the extra if you're looking for a romantic Holiday, but the Aston was just what a group of girls needed!

I was here with my daughter on a birthday trip for 5 nights before moving to the Westin. The staff were very friendly and accommodated our early arrival. We had a partial ocean view deluxe on the 8th floor. (Note from what we could determine there is no difference between a step out lanai and a balcony in this hotel - they are all the same size) Overall we very much enjoyed our stay with housekeeping very attentive. It is, however, very noisy down on the 8th floor particularly because the A/C only worked at 65farenheit so we had to turn it off and leave the lanai door open. (We are from Queensland so were used to the heat and humidity.) All of Waikiki is noisy though, so be prepared. The beds were excellent! Great pillows. The room very comfy with full cable tv and a high stool dining table. The bathroom however was more than a little disappointing. It was clean but it really was worn - 1970's tiles and grout still abound with worn timber banjo surround. This really should be upgraded. The view was superb. I will cherish and use (i'm 50) our fans that were a gift in the beach bag - this was a nice touch.Overall a good stay and I love this end of Waikiki - will only stay this end again. (the water is clearer)

First of all, this isn't a luxury hotel or anything near it. It is however a good value in a good location on Waikiki Beach. We chose this hotel because of the affordability of the ocean front rooms. We stayed in an ocean front select room on the 11th floor with a private balcony. The room is a little worn and dated but it didn't bother us because we were only in it to sleep. Our only complaint was the music from Tiki's located on the second floor of the property. We were able to hear it from our room late into the night. The location on the beach is fantastic and is at the "quiet" end of Waikiki. We were able to walk from our hotel down to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and back no problem. There are many stores and restaurants of all price ranges within a one block radius of this hotel. Check in and valet parking were very easy. I would definitely stay here again.

Nothing is inexpensive on Waikiki Beach, but this hotel was a good value. The staff was helpful in getting us registered quickly. The wifi was OK, and the support number for the wifi was quick and efficient. (One tip: it appears that there is a router in each room. Ours was hanging on the back of the bureau, so when ite needed to reset, I could reach and do that, which I did while on the phone with the support team.) The location for this hotel was perfect for us -- not right in the middle of the Waikiki beach strip, but instead, at the edge of it. This is not a luxury hotel, which you'll notice in the towel quality and a few ragged edges such as old tile in the bathroom. But it is clean, beautifully situated, and nicely maintained. I'd book there again just for the view from my balcony. Spectacular.

Great hotel and nice location on Waikiki beach,my wife and I stayed here twice for our trip to Sydney.We loved everything about it room was ok but had a nice view of the ocean .The only downfall is you get this rude awaking at 6:30 in the morning by protesters which only last about an hour .My wife and I joke they stop when they smell the pancakes and spam cooking lol .

We stayed for two nights after our cruise around the islands. 16th floor room, clean, quiet, nice staff. Met our needs very well. Within walking distance of zoo, aquarium, shopping, dining, directly across street from Waikiki Beach. Free use of beach chairs, beach mats and towels were a nice amenity.

The rooms are quite outdated and tiny. The bathroom although clean was just too small. Balcony is right next too the neighbours so no privacy at all, but need to be outside to enjoy the view and not feel cluttered. Great location across from beach and close to restaurants. Would only take a top floor as lower floors would be too noisy.

Shocking hotel. Way too expensive. The bedrooms are tiny, bathrooms are really outdated and in need of a revamp. THe rooms are separated by a door (ours was locked as we booked a 1 bed) so you can hear the people in the next room clearly. Service was poor. Upon arrival we noticed the pool was empty of water and roped off. We found out from the front desk that it would be out of action for 1 week, we were only staying for 3 days. I asked if they had any form of compensation as we had booked and paid under the impression there was a pool to access. They're response was to use a pool in a different hotel. Completely pathetic and inconvenient. Really unhappy with the stay and the prices we paid for such a below par hotel. Really regretted booking.

I was so looking forward to relaxing on Waikiki after a walking trip to New Zealand, but the weather didn't permit me to spend much time on the beach. The hotel is right across the street from the famous beach. It is somewhat old and could use some updates, but is very comfortable and convenient to stores and shopping. The staff couldn't have been nicer. From the man with the pool towels and beach chairs to the the bell boys, everyone was pleasant and friendly. Joanne at reception gave me info on the trolleys and malls. I was the weather had been nicer, but I still enjoyed my stay. It was nice to relax after a long trip.

The staff and location was unbelievable! The hotel was clean but not up to date. We were all very comfortable but if your looking for a luxury hotel you might not approve. Cost was great so service, location, staff, cleanliness all good for me.

This is my 1st stay at the hotel. Relative to those bigger brands within the same proximity, I think Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel gave a good value for what was charged. The hotel is right in front of the beach and you get a great view of the sea/beach from the room's balcony. Room is decently maintained even though the toilet fixtures are kind of dated. A few of the staff whom I have came across were really friendly and did their best to assist me. Would not hesitate to be back to stay in this hotel if I am back in Hawaii. Cheers.

The staff was friendly and helpful. I loved the openness of the lobby. The location was great right across from the beach. The view from our room was just wonderful for sun sets and to watch the waves hit the shore. Up the street was the zoo, a great park and shops near by. Down stairs there were shops and food. Every time I looked around someone was cleaning the front sidewalk which made the place look wonderful. They seem to care about hotel looks not only from the inside but also from the outside. I loved their elevator system it was different from any that I have ever used really made you feel safe!!! I do wish that they would have had more coffee in the room and more outlets to plug your phones into or any electronic devise.

We arrived at the Hotel after nearly a day of air travel and it was quite disappointing to have wait for an hour before we could check in. That was a poor first impression. We booked under the Mahalo for Memories rate which came with partial ocean views and choice of opting for the resort fee which came with some amenities. We decided to skip the amenities for a fee and were glad we did. The next troubling experience was that reception did not have the rate conditions and we had to prove it by producing a printout of the email confirmation. We were glad we did but you would think a hotel of this reputation would have a handle on this. We were extremely disappointed that the Hotel offerred WiFi at the rooms for a charge, in this day and age, you would think WiFi is a given. Nevertheless we could access free WiFi around the reception area. The room was quite clean and had a very decent view of the Waikiki beach. The washroom was clean but quite dated, the tub did not drain properly. They kept a pouch with sunscreen spray and body lotions which I thought was a very good touch but then they spoilt that when I saw a charge for using the bottled water and coffee machine. Housekeeping was quite friendly and provided excellent service. The other shortcoming was that the Hotel did not provide for a public tea/coffee station so that customers could get their morning cup before going out for some of the early tours. We did couple of the inter island tours and had to leave early by around 5am. At this time, no cafes were open nearby and we ended up having breakfast at the airport, which was not too bad. Check-out was nice and easy. Overall we had a good stay at the hotel, they just need to iron out a few kinks. I would definitely recommend this hotel since it is located right across the beach with easy access to dining, shopping and of course the beach. They also provide free beach chairs and towels for a dip in the ocean!

Loved our room, it was like a small apartment and was very convenient. Our room was on one of the top floors facing the ocean and Diamond Head. There is onsite parking and local food and shops throughout the surrounding area. Quick walk to the beach and to Dukes. Highly Recommended.

The Aston on Waikiki Beach has lovely staff who are very helpful. We particularly liked the valet parking guys who looked after our hire car. The lovely lady who cleaned our room did an excellent job of keeping our room and the tired bathroom attached to it in as clean a shape as she possibly good. The King size bed was very comfortable and our room on level 23 was far away from most of the city noise below. The security system re the elevators makes sense. Unfortunately at US$225 a night the room was a little undersized, and as mentioned, the bathroom was tired, and really in serious need of a renovation. We found the multiple powerpoints which were helpful when using the iron etc. The video system is pretty good and once you can work out how to use the machines downstairs all will be well. We had an free ice machine just outside our room which was very welcomed. Shops and bars, and of course Waikiki Beach are close which is nice but we preferred Lulus down the road to the Tiki Bar downstairs. If you have to stay on Waikiki Beach then stay here; if not get a larger room further away from the beach

The hotel room was great - clean, a view that was great as I could see all of the beach and ocean.The location was the best in Waikiki near shopping and excellent swimming.The staff was fiendly and very experienced.Amenities were excellent, but missed the breakfast at the pool.

We arrived on a Monday and waited to check in, to be told that our room was not ready just yet and to come back at 3. We filled out all the paperwork and I asked if the desk could text us (as many hotels have a system for) when the room was ready and the person at the desk said they could but "to be honest, I usually forget to do that" so our best bet was to come back after 3. We went, had lunch, came back and had to wait in line all over again to get our room keys. It would be helpful if there was some sort of express line for guests/circumstances like this where we didn't need to go through the full check in. Geri helped us the second go-round and was very nice and helpful. Heads up - because I didn't realize this - they do charge not only a resort fee of $23 a day, which I knew, but also a parking fee of $27 a day and the only option is valet. I don't mind a valet but to only have that as an option, and to have it an additional $27 a day I feel is a bit much. Our room was fine, a bit small, but we got a king room as requested with a great view. The $23 a day gives you $10 vouchers toward Tiki's for breakfast. You can only use 1 per person per day, so no holding them over. Breakfast options start around $14-$16 each so you will still have to pay out of pocket for breakfast. There were protesters on our last full day there. We were on the 21st floor and heard them loud and clear with the door closed -- we were attempting a nap. From a google search, it appears this has been going on for a few months now. Again, just something to keep in mind. They have the right to do so, and it went on for over an hour. Loudly.The wi-fi was spotty and I kept dropping a connection so I ended up having to use my cellular data and create a hotspot. Again, it's an annoyance to pay a resort fee that includes free wi-fi when it doesn't work well.Overall, the hotel is showing age. Our room, the outlets were quite loose on the outlet strip under the coffee maker. There was only 1 other wall outlet in the bathroom. It was clean, and mostly quiet (except the protest) and it was in a good location, however it likely wouldn't be my first choice again due to the parking fees on top of the resort fees, and the age of the hotel.

This hotel is in a great location and you get lots with the amenity fee. $10 daily voucher towards breakfast, unlimited DVD rental (good current selection) unlimited PS3 games, daily newspaper, in room wifi and fitness centre. The rooms are clean and comfy. I had a partial sea view (which is lovely) room with a large king size bed. Great bed, very comfy and I slept well. However the rooms are small with the bathroom only just big enough for a sink, toilet and shower (over bath). The rooms are old looking as well, but you're on the beach so why are you hanging around the room!

The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed Tiki's Grill and Bar. The $10 breakfast vouchers did not cover the cost of breakfast, but it was better than paying the full price for breakfast. Our room had a king size bed with an ocean view. "Free" WiFi was included in the $23.00 per day Resort Fee. We would have liked for the room temperature to have been a bit cooler (no matter how we tried to adjust the thermostat, the room did not get very cool), but all in all it was an enjoyable stay. I would definitely consider staying here again.

This has to be the worst hotel experience I've ever had. As a matter of fact, i'm actually laying in bed at this hotel right so eager to write a bad review. First off, the line to check in to the hotel was very long and took well over 30 minutes. Secondly, the key card they gave me along with 20 other guests got demagnetized all at the same time for no apparent reason. We all had to wait once again in that long checkin line to get issued new cards. Third, Front desk called my wife on our 3rd day here and told us we got upgraded to a partial ocean view room. We were pretty happy at first but soon realized that night of that our room seemed like more of a downgrade than an upgrade. The room they "upgraded" us to was next to the pool, bar, and behind the elevator shaft (room 511). This room is so horrible that im hearing loud music outside my balcony and vibrating walls due to the elevator shaft behind us. I'm thinking they "upgraded" us because some other guests complained about this room and we were the next suckers in line that took the "upgrade"bait. The vibrating walls was the tipping point for me and this is why I'm writing this review.

I will say the hotel itself was good, clean rooms good location etcHowever they charge a resort fee of $27/ day for free wifi and breakfast, the wifi then tends not to work to well, and the $10 per person brekfast voucher given for each day barely cover the cost of a cup of coffee and toast at the predetermined restaurant they must be used at. Resort fee is a scam overall can get a much better breakfast almost anywhere in Honolulu for less than the extra having to be paid for at Aston.Aston Waikiki charges a fair whack before the resort fee and despite having many workers around most are earning there wage in tips from the tourists a protest highlighted the fact that the workers $4.hour less than the hotel across the roadASTON RESPECT YOUR WORKERSPEOPLE ARE NOT $ SIGNS.

My husband and I stayed here the first two nights of our two week trip to Hawai'i. We arrived on Saturday afternoon on Halloween. There was a line at check-in, it was very busy I'm guessing because it was Halloween weekend. Expect to pay for Wi-Fi, they include it in the "Resort Fee". We had a room that looked at the hotel next door but you could also see the beach. Our room had a king size bed, refrigerator, balcony and a good size bathroom. There was a flat screen TV and a safe in the room. It was very basic but the bed was nice and comfortable. The hotel itself is clean and is located right across the street from the Waikiki wall. There is a convenience store located on the ground floor and a Wolfgang Puck fast food restaurant. Around the corner is a Starbucks as well. On the main floor where you check in, there is a pool and Tiki's Grill & Bar. The food at Tiki's is good and it overlooks the beach and Aston's pool. You are walking distance to all the high-end stores on Kalakaua avenue and also the Honolulu Zoo. Also, you are walking distance to Diamond Head. Overall, the Aston was really comfortable and centrally located to a lot of Honolulu's sites and beautiful beaches.

Those views and those sunsets stay in the memory for ever. The staff were without exception friendly and welcoming, no matter what. Service in the restaurant and bar area was lightning fast,which did not, on the other hand, preclude a leisurely lunch.Unforgettable, the whole experience. Mahalo.Trevpr Gamson

The rates are reasonable for Waikiki and you are paying for the location, not the property. It is dated and our bathroom had black mold in the shower. I told the front desk and she said she would send someone up to look at it, but it seems all they did was look at it. They did empty the trash in the bathroom, but I was hoping they would use a little bleach to remove it. Breakfast was not included as many reviews stated, and I was told by the front desk that when Tiki's did not have breakfast they included it in the rate, but now it does and is no longer included. We never had breakfast at Tiki's, but it is a great place for a cocktail and the old fashioned mai tai was awesome. All in all the location is right across the street from the beach so you can't beat that. They also gave me a complimentary bag of Coola sunscreen products which was more than enough to help me get through the mold and weathered look of the rooms, although I still think there is more they can do to avoid these issues. There also was no open outlet in the entire room. There was one behind the curtains with the alarm clock and lamp both plugged in. We charged our phones in the bathroom, not ideal but doable when traveling for vacation not work. The view from our balcony was great, value is good because the rates are reasonable, the location is awesome, and all staff we encountered were very pleasant.

Great staff and lovely hotel. Right across from the beach, beautiful views and they offer a delicious buffet breakfast. They give you a carry bag and chairs to eat on the beach every morning. The Tiki Bar was a little pricey but worth it for the atmosphere and food was delicious. Great location, within walking distance to shops, beach and lots of places to eat. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

We booked a suite with ocean views. Room was on 25th floor with perfect views of waikiki beach. Room was clean and tidy and bed clean and comfortable. Reception staff (particularly Geri) were helpful and attentive. Room was cleaned each day and even caught the cleaner vacuuming the carpet. Tiki bar food and drink are average value and quality. Breakfast is expensive there: we paid $70 for 3 breakfasts. To save money go to Dukes for buffet breakfast: $18 for adults and $8 for kids.pool is clean and has ample sun bathing recliners. I would definitely stay again.

The Aston is a good hotel. Clean and the employees are very pleasant and helpful. the rooms do require upgrading..painting a bit dingy. I love the security elevator feature for this hotel. The proximity to everything in Waikiki beach is super. The hotel has limited restaurants...but there are several really good ones in the area. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Oceanview room has a spectacular view of the ocean and the mountains....!!!

We picked Aston Waikiki Beach after narrowing from 5 other hotels. We chose this because of location to everything...Check in was painless and and breeze. However we booked a King room with ocean view but once we got there, they only had doubles available which was no big deal after a long 10 hr flight. The room was just as nice. Decor fit the room. The room we were given on the 24th floor. We were able to see everything. The ocean, zoo and Diamond Head which was just breathtaking... I don't have any complaints about this hotel.

We stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach last winter. The room was very good comparing to the price we payed. We had one of the middle floors. The view was spectacular. It was a 270 degrees view from balcony, including sea and forest on the left without any building blocking the view. The included breakfast didn't have many options. Overall, I absolutely enjoyed our stay.

Overall I would recommend this hotel. The location is fantastic, Waikiki Beach is directly across the street. Fully worth the extra cost to have a Ocean View Room. I stayed here with my husband, brother and sister-in-law and parents. We had booked three rooms, but apparently they do not guarantee room types (just view), so my husband and I ended up in a room with two double beds. After calling down to the desk and waiting a VERY long time and speaking with multiple people, they did offer to move my husband and I, but we would have been away from the rest of our family, so we declined.Other reviews recommended requesting high floor to avoid street/traffic noise. We were in the top third of the hotel, and had no issue with noise.The daily breakfast was fine, and it was nice that they give you insulated lunch bags in your room, so you can stock up from breakfast. Our one issue with breakfast was the day we had an early morning tour pick up. Our pick up was before breakfast started, so we asked at the desk the day before - they told us, no problem, someone will be here, just ask, they can probably give you a muffin or yogurt to go. That was NOT the case the following morning - and we ended up rushing around to find food before our tour.The restaurant on site is good, has a great drinks menu and is nice for a late-night cocktail.After our stay we received an email survey, which I filled out. I outlined some of the issues we experienced, and someone from the hotel not only got back to me (I was shocked) but also offered to refund some of the upgrade fee (for the Ocean View Room). I was so surprised, and very, very pleased - I didn't think anyone actually followed up on those surveys.

The hotel is very convenient to all of the action within walking distance. An easy walk to Waikiki Beach across the street. A bit dated but overall a great deal. Ocean view rooms have a decent view. The hotel is near the end of the "strip" on Waikiki closer to Diamondhead.

This hotel is well located, not far from Honolulu Zoo. However you make this booking, let me be clear - this is not a 4 or 5 star hotel as some websites portray. Definitely older style accommodation, however the rooms are great and very clean and the staff couldn't be more friendlier.Breakfast is included in your tariff but I would strongly suggest have breakfast elsewhere. The Aston's version of breakfast is a little cooler bag which you collect in the morning. It contains a sugar coated, syrupy doughnut, a chocolate bar and a piece of fruit. If you don't visit a dentist, then avoid this nasty concoction.Apart from that, it's reasonably priced and you have access to great in-house movies and the Tiki Bar and Grill is located on the 3rd floor, with live entertainment every day.

From the friendly staff (Gina at the front desk) , clean rooms with great views (Room 1923), private elevator system, and fun Tiki's bar and restaurant - this is the place to stay when in Waikiki. Our room overlooked the wonderful relaxing beach and we miss it!! We will come back and also recommend friends and family to visit this location.

Would like to give a very good however while very clean the rooms are dated which is the only thing that detracts from the overall rating - we have stayed there 12 times. The customer service is very good as is the location with the beach right across the road and many places to eat. From Tikis in the hotel to Wolfgang Puck, Subway, LULUs sports bar, Starbucks, a juice shop, a burger establishment as well as an ABC shop where you can purchase anything. These are basically under the hotel and no more than say 80 metres from when you walk out. Main part of Waikiki is a 10 minute wander. Wifi is free in the room, breakfast is basic and beach towels and beach chairs are free. Like all hotels valet parking is dear around $30 so we usually book a car daily as Hertz is in the Hyatt Regency about a five minute walk away - if an Aussie book online and pay before you go as it saves approx. $60-$90. There is a zoo around the corner and a great aquarium about a 10 min walk away and reasonably priced. No indoor pool but has an outdoor one and a large seating area.

My first contact was with Ema at the Front Desk check-in. She welcomed us with a big smile and warm Aloha greeting. After taking our information, she wished me a happy birthday (my daughter left a note on our reservation) and surprised us with an oceanfront room upgrade. The furniture was a little dated but everything was clean, the matresses and pillows quite comfortable with crisp white sheets and the view of Waikiki Beach well, what can I say? The room had a large flatscreen TV, Playstation, coffeemaker and small refrigerator. The fridge wasn't working properly but they replaced it within a half hour of our call. They offer free movie rentals in the Lobby. Our stay included a "Breakfast on the Beach" insulated bag with fruit, danish, granola bar and coffee/juice that could be picked up from 6-9am each morning. I understand that they are phasing this service out. There are numerous places to eat all within walking distance. Location was great. Beach across the street, the Park and Zoo a block over and views of Diamond Head. Bus and trolley service is available right in front of the hotel. Unless you want to drive yourself around the island, no car is necessary and can be costly not just in rental fees but parking availability.There is a casual restaurant, The Tiki Bar, on the second floor next to the pool. They serve lunch, happy hour specials, and dinner. Open to the public. Food was tasty and not over priced. Note-this is not run by the hotel so you won't be able to charge your meals to the room. Talented evening entertainment. My balcony was a few stories up from the open bar area so I could enjoy the music from there also. We had no noise issues to disturb our sleep. I would definitely stay here again.If anyone from the hotel is reading this, my special thanks goes to Mia who greeted me every morning with a smile and kind word when picking up my breakfast bag. She was professional, organized and even remembered my name by day 3! Special people like that are worth their weight in gold. Thank you for starting each day of my trip with a blessing.

2 adults in late 20s/early 30s. Stayed here during a conference at the Ala Moana Conference Center. Booked it for their much cheaper prices as compared to all of the other beach-front hotels. Expected less because of the price, but we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was extremely clean and the maids were very polite and did an excellent job of cleaning it daily. Room came with a keurig, coffee, free wifi, flat screen tv with dvd movie rentals (which we never used)… the pool was nice, the beach was close (and beautiful) with great swimming (sea wall out front) and great surf just a short walk away. The bar by the pool had decent drinks and great happy hour specials. They provided you with beach towels by the pool (a pleasant surprise). Staff was very friendly. All in all - we had an excellent stay and would recommend it to friends. Not giving it 5 stars because it wasn't a 5-star hotel (some things, such as the bath tubs, were mildly out of date but still very clean), but overall we enjoyed it & would stay here again if we were in Waikiki.

Great view, clean comfortable room with a great view, a few feet from the ocean. Enjoyed the safety of the elevator system and the valet's always had my car ready when I wanted it and answered other questions too. The snack, gift shop also was handy for those little extras when you needed them.

Right on the beach! Great staff! Bus/trolley stop right there. The only reason not giving them a 5, is that the rooms need a serious updating. Looking rundown, and maybe not as clean as before. Would still recommend this place!

This was our second trip to Hawaii, this time with Air Canada Vacations (the other was with Allegiant Travel two years previous). In both cases we requested accommodation with the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. This request was because of the prior experience. The hotel was very positive, the flight on Allegiant, not so much. The flight on Air Canada was much better, although the flight departure times could have been better. Now about the hotel, very clean very nice beds (for a relaxing sleep) and the housekeeping is very good indeed. You are supplied with the usual toiletries and plenty of clean towels. The room has a number niceties, such as a safe, small fridge, iron & ironing board, and a Keuriq coffee maker. The is a flat screen TV and the usual radio/clock combo. A room with the ocean view is nice, but there are so many combinations that are not explained that it is difficult to decide what may suit you.We requested the same room we had on our previous visit, and were told that this was a higher class and required an additional fee. When we stalled at that, we were told that if we called back before we arrived they may be able to offer and upgrade, due the fact we were previous guests. When we checked we were told that the request for the particular room was on file. When we arrived we were told the room “was not available” and we were given a room on a lower floor, still with an ocean view, but a considerably smaller balcony, with no chairs. (Hint: if booking a room try to get a higher floor - less street noise). You are not likely to spend a lot of time on the balcony, but it would be nice to have somewhere to sit.Speaking of seating, you do not have any chairs, so to speak. There is a table with two, very uncomfortable wooden benches. You may use the table for whatever but you won’t sit there too long. Should you wish to watch the TV, you’ll have to do that from the bed. Its not as if there isn’t any space for chairs, they just don’t supply them. I will admit you don’t spend a lot of time in your room, but having a reasonably comfortable chair would be nice. Replacing the benches with regular chairs would solve the problem (it would likely necessitate changing the table which is rather high).One of the main reasons for choosing the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was something called a Breakfast on the Beach. This was a very positive feature of our previous visit. There isn’t much sense in describing it because it was cancelled prior to our arrival. There was no refund for the change, because it was replaced with something called “Grab & Go”. This certainly was nothing like “breakfast on the beach”, it consisted of an orange, a fibre bar and a pastry, coffee, tea and juice. Two days before we were to leave, the “Grab & Go” was cancelled, and replaced with a $10.00 voucher at Tiki’s Pub in the hotel. That actually turned out to be better than the Grab & Go. I would wonder how the hotel is going to handle future guests. Is there a plan to just cut out anything as a breakfast option?One truly annoying action, by many of the hotels in Hawaii, and we have found in Nevada (called a resort fee there) is the addition of an “amenity” fee. This is to pay for the items normally free at hotels throughout the US & Canada, items such as WiFi (which incidentally is spotty and generally a weak signal), in room coffee maker, in room safe, newspaper, unlimited movies and PS3 games, local and 800 calls and the fitness center. They don’t mention the hotel swimming pool and the loan of towels for the beach, but that may be then next addition to the amenity listing. When you pay for a package deal for a holiday, you don’t really plan on the fact the day you leave, you get a bill under the door, for the amenity fee of $23.00 a day plus tax. Wouldn’t you think they could just jack the room price up by $23.00 a day, plus tax?If you are in the habit of forgetting to turn your key in, that will be $10.00 each please. Also a nice hotel feature is glass glasses and coffee mugs. But don’t think about taking a mug with you, that will be added to your credit card ($10.00 each).  If you rent a car, where do you park it? The hotel will charge you $27.00 a day parking, which includes valet service(you can’t park yourself). There is an excellent bus system throughout the Island, and plenty of alternatives to renting a car. It is rush hour for most of the day and evening, something else to think about.What’s the bottom line here - the hotel is probably in the best location in Waikiki. Across from the beach, close to everything within walking distance. The bus stops are very close to connect to just about anyplace you might want to visit on the Island. If the hotel were to straighten out their problems with the addition of a breakfast option as part of the hotel charges, we think this would be a very good choice when choosing accommodation in Waikiki. Otherwise you might want to check out other hotels in TripAdvisor. Yes I would recommend this hotel.

A warm, welcoming "aloha" from the friendly staff at the book in counter, a clean and comfortable room ... and a wonderful view! The Waikiki Beach Hotel has a lot to offer. There is an onsite restaurant (reviewed separately) plus a Wolfgang Puck Express and other eating options not too far away. The biggest positive is the beach - directly across the road (and towels are readily available from the pool deck for you to take). Staff were always friendly and helpful (with the exception of one of the bellhops and/or parking attendants). The room was clean and comfortable - and fairly spacious for beach front Waikiki!The biggest negative is that the lanai is tiny!! Not even big enough for two chairs!! And then there's that ridiculous "Resort Fee". It could be a little too noisy at night to sleep with the lanai door open but the air con was quiet

Great location on Waikiki Beach. Pool is small but offers a great sunset view. The elevator situation although offers a lot of security to guests, it makes it very inconvenient that u can come down from your room floor straight to the ground floor versus the 3rd floor. Housekeeping was very nice and quick to clean room. The glass doors wouldn't fully secure insulation latch which makes the room temperature and air conditioning very energy inefficient. I would stay here again due to the value of the room and price paid but I wouldn't rule out looking at other properties in the surrounding area. Good points: location, friendly staff, beach towels and chair. Cons: small pool, balcony doors don't completely seal and lock, elevators are very slippery and no rewards program for frequent stayers that I know of to recognize frequent guests.Thanks

I do like the idea of being on the quiet end of Waikiki Beach with great access to the beach just across the street and all of Waikiki just a short walk away. Our partial ocean view king was actually nice and overlooked the pool and the beach. The staff at the front desk and our housekeeper were very attentive and helped make our stay pleasant. However, the pics on their site do not show the worn condition of this property. The bathroom was small and had missing or broken tiles and initially the tub was not draining well (however once we alerted the front desk, it was fixed immediately). The room also had no available power outlets next to the bedside tables, meaning we had to charge our electronics on the drawers/hidden minibar/fridge. Another quirk is the AC always was set at 65, but we knew it was nowhere near even 70 -- thankfully it was still cooler than outside. But my biggest pet peeve was the mandatory valet parking. Two different occasions we called down for the car to be brought up, only to have to go to the valet stand to ask for the car 15min later to see that they didn't even retrieve the keys to get the car. At one point, we were getting so late for a dinner, we had to ride in another valeted care to where our car was parked and we drove our car from the valet garage ourselves!!! I'm sure that was against the rules, but it seemed ridiculous especially since it wasn't a busy time and there didn't seem to me many people waiting for cars or dropping cars off. This hotel will continue to be popular mainly because of the position of being across the beach. My hope is that if they want to increase their prices to be almost the same as the international chain next door, it had better be reflected in the upgrades.

Let me begin by saying that the Waikiki Beach experience is amazing. The beach itself will mesmerize you. If you are there with a partner, you may fall in love all over again. It is just that amazing! As for this hotel, the pool attendant on our first day (Thursday 10-15)had the attitude of a poorly paid office temp worker. He really should find other employment, because frankly, customer service is not his thing. On the other hand, the front desk staff was helpful and assisted us with a room change after the first day ( our shower overflowed incessantly due to a design flaw, thus necessitating a room change so as not to flood us out of the room).The central air conditioning in our room did not seem to cool at times- not sure what the cause was or if it was pre set by staff. Lastly, the pool did not look inviting at all. It had a lime green hue to it ( not to mention it was full of kids- um no thanks! )I would say that you can find a better option in the area. If you get this hotel for a good price, by all means consider it. I just think that for a bit more you can have a much better experience elsewhere. PS: there is no breakfast buffet. That sucks considering you pay a daily resort fee !! Management - bring back a breakfast buffet!! Coffee and tea in the morning does not cut it!!

We stayed at this hotel before in 2012. So we were really excited to come back 3 years later expecting this hotel to be just as good as it was before. NOT THE CASE! This hotel has really gone downhill! It was beyond disappointing. The number one thing that was most disappointing was the current state of the rooms. Our bathroom was awful and our balcony door handle broke off. While the staff was willing to let us switch rooms, we looked at 4 other rooms that were no better in comparison and not worth the hassle of re-packing all of our stuff and moving. Plus, while looking at other rooms we could hear the neighbors next door, so, at least where we were it was quiet. But the bathroom and balcony were literally falling apart. The second most disappointing thing was to find out about the discontinuation of the free breakfast. What they did give us was very mediocre. Apparently it is going away entirely. So we will be taking our business elsewhere from now on. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone right now, but I would recommend tikis restaurant. That is at least still as good as it has always been.

From check in, you are charged a $23 per day for a "convenience fee" which covers WiFi and breakfast and all other normal hotel things that are always included...SO when you see free WiFi, the actual cost is $23 per day. Breakfast is the most disappointing thing i have ever seen, which is included in the $23 per day, you get an assortment of juices, 2 Quaker granola bars, 2 non ripe fruits, (apple or orange), and some questionable pastry in a lunch box which you get to keep. You can not get more food, this is it for the day. So for $23 that's it. Location of hotel is not great either, a few blocks up towards the Maona Surfrider is much nicer. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Rooms were out dated to say the least, bathroom looks like it was from the 80's, and the ceiling in bathroom was leaking on first day. The king bed we reserved was not available and apparently is only a request, so we got 2 double beds. In addition the balcony was not even big enough for 2 people to stand on.. It also didn't help that the employees were on strike in front of the hotel at 6am. Overall The hotel room is worth about $100 per night, well maybe 75 since there is a mandatory $23 fee you have to pay.

We've stayed at the Aston 3 times and on the last occasion (last week) with other family. It will likely be our last time as the "bang for buck" is no longer there.The good:- location, location, location - the views and access to everything.- They are slowly upgrading the hotel but only on the outside (watch out for those slippery tiles around the pool)- the staff do a great job- the tiki bar is niceThe bad:- it's expensive for what you get- one of our favourite things, which is an intangible, was waking to the sound of the ukulele player with the sound wafting up to the rooms each morning from the pool area... It gave you the real aloha spirit, but this has GONE along with the hula dancer to watch while you received your breakfast.- ALSO GONE, the brekky buffet! Now you are just handed your brekky which is 1x pastry, 1 x piece of fruit and 1 musilee bar... (Remember your $23 per day per room to cover brekky) I asked why the buffet was cut and the staff member said they had complaints about people's dietary requirements, so they cut it... I sad better to have some food then no food...- the daily room service fee of approx $23 covers room wifi (good but there are plenty of free wifi spots around and we just got a data card for of phone, so not required). The gym - just go for a walk/run on the beach (and its small anyway), breakky now gone, free local paper (there are literally 5 on each level available and each level has like 30 rooms... So the daily service charge mounts up over the week and for us only meant a piece of fruit and a museli bar... Expensive, we were prepared to pay the fee, based on our past experiance, for the breakfast buffet and morning entertainment but now that's gone. I'd say BUDGET CUTBACKS, and the daily fee hasn't dropped with the drop in services either!- the suits/rooms have had the wall behind the bed heads painted but as other have mentioned, the air conditioners struggle (we couldn't alter the temperature of our last couple rooms) and the plumbing was blocking in our room, so agreed with others, the rooms need a revamp but again they have a lovely view.... The staff did move us to a new room after we asked after our noisy air conditioning unit this last trip.... But in Australia this would be a 3.5 star hotel.I hope this fairly impartial summary helps as we have a soft spot for the place but it is waning.

The room was average, could use updating. A/C does not cool well, quit working twice. Nice light breakfast items included. The pool area was comfortable. Tiki Bar area very convienient with good food. Other food areas close by. Nice beach area across the street.

We stayed here for four nights prior to going on a cruise and probably wouldn't stay there again. The hotel is just across the road from the beach and easy walking distance to all the shops, but is in need of a complete refurb. I would rate it to be the equivalent of a hotel you would pay around $100 in Australia for. We were shown four different rooms before we found a room which we were happy with and I have to say that Geri in Reception who assisted us, was very obliging and helpful, couldn't have been nicer.There was a coffee machine in the room, no milk and no instructions! The bed was very comfortable, but the rooms are very small and dated.All properties in Honolulu are completely smoke-free so for those who want to smoke, the area allocated at this hotel is out on the side-walk where people are walking past all the time waving the smoke away, in the hot sun or rain whatever the case may be, much easier not to smoke!The one great thing about this property is the elevator system, there is absolutely no waiting time. You just swipe your room card and key in the floor you are going to and a display tells you which lift to take (there are six lifts from memory,) and usually the lift is there almost immediately, it's a great system.This hotel didn't meet our expectations, for $300+ per night we felt it was over-priced and over-rated.

I was terrified of our stay here after reading more recent reviews of the hotel, including descriptions of bugs, dirtiness, nonworking AC. I knew not to expect anything for breakfast, so that wasn't a surprise (it does sort of suck to have to pay the same amenities fee that there was when we booked our reservation that included a great hot breakfast buffet- now you get a muffin (not fresh), banana or apple, and a granola bar. Juices and coffee as well.The good: Location, of course. 5 min walk to the beach, surrounded by popular shops and restaurants/bars. I was actually pleasantly surprised with some of the room, small yes, no chair (there are 2 bar stools) to sit on, but the beds and linens are new (read some horror stories about hairs/stains/bugs in the bed). The pool was small, but perfect for our 5 year old after being tossed around all day at the beach. We enjoyed the free movie rentals, though sparse, there were some good titles. Full cable was nice too. Beach chair and towel rental was great for the pool area and beach. Our rooms had absolutely no cooling issues- in fact we froze and had to request additional blankets. Not a problem in my book :) I enjoyed having the Keurig in the room, and Starbucks downstairs of course.The bad: I will say that the bathrooms are pretty gross- we had connecting rooms and both were really bad. Broken tiles, dozens of random different hairs not only on the floor, but mostly the walls and countertops. I requested that the bathroom be cleaned again upon my arrival and they maybe got 2 of the god knows how many other hairs. The carpet is very dark and boldly patterned, so I have no idea about the cleanliness of that. There were tiny bugs crawling in the bathroom on the floor and coming out of the drain in the sink. The blowdryers are useless, only blow very lightly and very cool air. The lanai was a small maybe 2 ft by 4 ft space, no chairs or room for them. Not that we'd spend much time in the room anyways, but unless you're planning to just be gone all the time, you're not going to find a chair to relax in. I suppose you could sit on the bed.We check out in a few days- I will not book this hotel again, nor will I recommend it. While it's a screamin' deal based on location, I would very happily pay more to stay elsewhere, or stay a bit further off the beach for something that is actually clean..buyer beware of course.

This place is all about location. The beach is across the street and you can easily walk to all of Waikiki. The rooms are good size and most have excellent views. Restaurants are nearby as well as shopping. I found he staff helpful and friendly.

The staff here is really friendly and the hotel is in a great location with the beach literally right across the street. Plus a Waikiki Trolley stop for the red and pink lines is also nearby. I recommend a room with a Balcony if you plan on being in your room a bit ,as we really enjoyed ours.

For the price, this hotel is excellent. We've stayed in Waikiki many times at the top hotels. Thought we'd try the Aston Waikiki Beach for our short stay. Located at the end of the beach near the zoo, it feels slightly quieter here but still easily accessible to all in Waikiki. Directly across the road from the beach. A lovely relaxed feeling in this old style hotel. We chose an oceanfront room. Room area a fair size, small balcony, slightly dated but comfortable, bathroom small and in need of renovation but totally fine. Best thing about the room was the heart stopping incredible view. The best we've had of Waikiki. The pool and restaurant area are nice and a good place to watch the sunset. Strange elevator system where you have to change at lobby level to get to the rooms. Wolfgang Puck quick service restaurant at lower level was fantastic. Breakfast to go was super sweet and not to our taste but it's easy enough to hit one of the breakfast places around. We'd certainly stay again.

This hotel was more than I could imagine. Right on the main stretch of Waikiki Beach, located next to the Honolulu Zoo. Starbucks and Wolf Gang Puck resturant located downstairs. Only 1 elevator from the parking lot into hotel. Be warned that if you are slow in anyway, that someone holds the elevator for you. Being in a wheelchair this was my only complaint. The resort & parking fee is well worth the price. ALL HOTELS have a fee, but I found this hotel resonable for the price I paid. Had everything we needed.The free breakfast was good, but you could get a hot breakfast for $5 more. The resturant in the hotel was great. Here you had great views of the beach, sunset & fireworks (on the weekend). Had a partial view & paid under $150 which contained a view of the ocean & diamond head. The balcony is very small, but i was able to have coffee every morning and watch the sunrise (located on the diamond head side). Lots of shopping to be had.Note there are a lot of homeless in Hawaii, but remember they are people too! I saw homeless on every Island I was on. Treat them like you would anyone else. I found them the kindness, heart warming people. DO NOT BE afraid, but as you would do normally be careful.

Nice situation, 50 metres to the beach, near the zoo and Diamond Head. 20 minute walk to major restaurants. Easy access to public transport. Friendly (but understaffed) reception. Great rooms and service. Four helpful tour offices, good concierge. Great view from balconies (make sure you are at least 5 levels up, as the bars and street are noisy). Nice pool, but the "new tiles" were very slippery and dangerous when wet. My wife went down, as well as at least another 3 or 4 while we were there. Breakfast (we were warned) was sad. A paper bag with a muffin, muesli bar and an orange. Coffee and juice were OK. The hotel claim they are doing a deal with the attached bar/restaurant to provide a real breakfast, but the local Burger King does a good trade in the mornings.

This hotel was a nice option for our stay in Waikiki. The room was fairly small, but it was clean. We had an "ocean view" room - which means we could see the ocean over the roof of the hotel next door. But, we also had a lovely view of Diamond Head. You don't spend your time in the room at Waikiki, anyway.The signature amenity - "breakfast on the beach" - means that you can take your hotel-issued cooler down to the lobby/pool area and pick up a cold continental breakfast (pastry, fruit & beverage), which can then be carried wherever you'd like to eat it: back to your room, at a table by the pool, across the street to the beach, or wherever. We always just left the cooler in our room and ate breakfast by the pool, since we were hopping on a shuttle for some excursion or another. The staff were friendly and helpful. There are kiosks off the lobby staffed by local tour companies to help you book any kind of excursion you'd care to try. We booked a dinner cruise to celebrate our anniversary, and it was a nice experience. We appreciated the second-floor lobby and keycard access to the elevators. We also enjoyed having drinks in the Tiki Bar.Overall, this hotel is a great value - you don't have to pay top dollar in pricey Waikiki, but you are literally across the street from one of the most beautiful beaches in the world and the zoo, and walking distance from any kind of shopping or dining you could want.

We checked in around noon. The room was a decent size and clean though the bathroom could use a decent update. Got back to the room about nine that night and it was sweltering inside. Opened the balcony door and it was cooler outside. Called the front desk and they sent up a maintenance man and he said the AC was working. After a long conversation with my husband, he admitted it didn't work. There was no other rooms available for us to check into that night so they brought us the FAN FROM THE FRONT DESK. The next day we went downstairs to get our new keys to change rooms and the front desk clerk said to us, "Oh you are the ones that took our fan." Really? You only have one fan in the whole hotel.The free breakfast is a joke. Pool area is small. Bar is decent. That's the only thing good about the place. DONT STAY HERE.

The hotel staff was top notch, very helpful and very friendly.Location, Location, Location one of the best views of Waikiki Beach. Close (walking distance) to all of the major shops and restaurants. The room although dated was cozy with nice amenities. The Lanai was nice especially with the ocean view. You are not looking between other hotels but have a direct view seeing that the hotel is literally just across the street from the beach.

We stayed here last year and absolutely loved it, that's why we booked again this year. Disappointingly so, we will not be returning to the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for our next visit to Honolulu. A significant reason we liked this hotel was because of the "breakfast on the beach", which was not incredible, but enough food to last us until a late morning snack or lunch. This time around, we found out not through the hotel itself, advising us that they had eliminated "breakfast on the beach", but instead through TripAdvisor that they switched over to a grab and go style breakfast which consisted of a piece of fruit, a small pastry and a Quaker's chewy chocolate chip granola bar. As a young couple, we saved and budgeted for this vacation but having to tack on an extra meal to pay for (as the grab and go is not nearly satisfying) for the entirety of the trip is a significant expense… in addition to the $24 amenity fee that includes the 'breakfast'. One morning we even woke up (at 6 AM) to the hotel employees loudly protesting. A silent protest would have been equally as effective and much less bothersome to guests who paid $145+/night to stay there. Throughout the duration of our stay, we found 2 cockroaches in our room, which was also unpleasant. Just small features they offered last year that weren't offered this year were missed - live entertainment at breakfast hour by the pool, or coffee/tea available at all hours, neither of which are available now. I'm so disappointed to say that I was less than pleased during my stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Unfortunately I will not be booking my next stay with them.

We had an ocean front room on 9th floor.....amazing!!! The rooms themselves are a little tired and could do with a revamp but all in all a great stay and I would stay there again. Just be prepared that even if you have prepaid through a travel agent that you will still be hit with amenities fees when you check out.....that was the first time we experienced this on our journey throughout the U.S. and it was our last stop....

The hotel is just a few steps from the beach, the trolley stops in front of the entrance and you Kapiolani park is just a few minutes walk. A bit far from Alamoana but a great location indeed.The staff is very kind and hard-working. I asked for a screwdriver at the reception to change the battery for my kid's toy and they provided it in a bit. Geri at the reception is not the best in smiles but she sure can work. She made all the possible to allow us use the room before usual 3PM checkin time since the baby and the mother were exausted from the long flight. The management staff has also been very helpful in many occasions.The view from the 14th floor, Ocean view room is simply amazing. You could see fireworks on Friday night. We were also welcomed by a huge double rainbow crossing all Waikiki which was astonishing.Cons: The rooms are not big and sometimes cleaning is not enough. I found rasor packs from previous guest under the bed. The shower is build-in type, which is very difficult to handle when you bath a baby. A/C was also old build-in type, and you couldnt switch air strength or swing movement. Had to call maintanance a few times because air was hitting my bed at first, but janitor was very fast and helpful.Breakfast on the beach was a disappointment, though it was as expected by reading the comments here. They only give you a cereal bar, a muffin and a fruit. Good that you could bring it to the beach though. Anyway, the facility is quite old but given the location is a good deal. They try to take every penny out of you, but you are in Waikiki after all.

Enjoyed staying here with my teenage daughters.We had an oceanview room & it was great.Breakfast in the morning was easy to pack up and take to the beach or enjoy back in the room. Hotel is in a good location within easy walking distance to most desired spots along the beachfront.

If you're looking for a home away from home, this is the place! The friendly staff goes above and beyond to take care of you, the rooms and hotel are clean, it is extremely SAFE (the staff makes sure of that!) and in a perfect location! The Aston is absolutely child friendly, family friendly! There is perfect snorkeling right across the road as well!! My daughter looks forward to going back this next Easter! It will be our third trip and I'm just as excited as she is! Can't wait to see you!!

Going to Waikiki? Look no further. We paid the higher rate for a room facing the ocean. The view is amazing. Great location to beach and walking to other parts of Waikiki. The beach in front if the hotel is full of fish, there is also a kiddie beach on the right of the pier. Rooms are ok, pool is ok. I would definetly stay here again.Staff was friendly and accomodating.

We stayed on the 19th floor with an ocean view this was a great view my parents had thier room right next to ours they both were clean and tidy the; beds were very comfortable ;bathrooms was well lit and clean as well .my only complaints would be that my a.c. was not very cool and my parents safe was broken also don't go in thinking you will find anything on the TV because we never found much of anything that interested us. Even though we did not go into the pool it was very clean the breakfast was fine but we did not eat with the hotel often but we always found something close by.the staff was friendly including house keeping.

5 years ago the breakfast was great, lots of choices. Now the give you a brown bag with a piece of fruit, a cereal bar, and a muffin. Their $23 room fee is for things people typically wouldn't use on vacation like Playstation and dvd's.

This hotel is in a great location with a bar and restaurant that is very good. The service at the hotel is also very good. The beds are comfortable but the rooms are extremely warm with no ability to change that which makes sleeping difficult. When it is hot outside there is no way to take a break and cool off without getting in the pool, ocean or a cold shower. Also the amenity fee is ridiculous because you get nothing for it but a doughnut a day and coffee. You get one chance to get juice so don't make the mistake I did by bypassing that because my hands were full. I could not get back in line to get orange juice or creamer for my coffee. They also offer wifi but it is terrible service so not worth it either.

We stayed here 2 years before and really enjoyed our stay. Based on our previous experience we booked again, but this time upgraded to an Ocean Front Room. Last time we stayed the breakfast included a beautiful buffet with a great selection, which was another reason why we booked there. On arriving we checked into our room - to find that it was 2 x seperate double beds. Apparently you have to request a king bed?? We booked as a married couple, so found that odd. The room's air conditioning unit pipes were rattling so loud that i don't know how anyone could sleep through it! The bathroom was very sub-standard - i would expect that in a 1 star, certainly not in a 4 star. We voiced our disappointment to the front desk, and they handled it very well. We were given a room with what we would have expected in the first instance. I would honestly expect that nobody should be given that room. Back to the breakfast, one of the reasons why we re-booked there. They now "serve" breakfast in a brown paper bag, which consisted of (the first day) an apple, a muesli bar and a very small muffin. To say we were disappointed is an undersatement. I would recommend you scrap breakfasts as being "included" as everybody i spoke to did not go back for the breakfast and had to purchase it off site.Aside from those issues, it was a very enjoyable stay, though when we go back we will book elsewhere.

What a great hotel. Fantastic staff, clean & spacious rooms, amazing views. Could not have asked for a better hotel for a relaxing holiday. Across the road from the beach, close to some amazing restaurants and to everything else we could need. Would highly recommend.

Lovely views from the room right up the beach. The room was very clean and the bed was small but comfortable.The air conditioning was not cool at all and unable to adjust it.The breakfast was very disappointing as we were told by other visitors that there had been a lovely buffet previously. Our breakfast consisted of a pastry, piece of fruit and a chocolate muesli bar, and the juice was cordial,very unhealthy.We didn't really go to Hawaii to watch DVDs however used them as we were paying for them, but the second one we hired didn't work and we were in our pajamas before we realised it.Definitely don't feel we got our $23 per day worth.The pool area was also so slippery that it was dangerous.

We stayed here for 10 nights and found the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel to be clean and comfortable. The staff was very willing to provide information about the area and friendly.While it did take a little bit to get used to the elevator, I thought that it was really a security issue with having to scan your room card, enter your floor number before the elevator would open. Price wise this was a fit for us. Only down side would be the breakfast, the breakfast bag worked okay for a couple of days then we went to a restaurant when we wanted a hot breakfast.

My husband and I recently visited the Aston Waikiki for a second visit. We really enjoy staying at this hotel. The staff is always very nice and welcoming. We had a wonderful partial ocean view room for the first half of our stay before leaving for another island. When we returned to the hotel for our last half of our stay we were surprised with a free upgrade to a junior suite. It had more than enough room for the two of us and was very comfortable. The breakfast has changed somewhat since our visit two years ago. It is now a bagged breakfast that includes a pastry, granola bar, and a piece of fruit. It was much more enjoyable having the buffet style breakfast with the variety of food. The location is great since it's within walking distance to many stores and places to eat. It is also just a brief walk across the street and you are at the beach. We enjoyed spending our anniversary here.

The lifts in this place take a couple of days to master. The rooms are comfortable and clean, thou a little tired. Location is at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki but an easy enough walk to the many restaurants and shops in the area. There is a trolley stop outside the hotel for travellers wishing to travel further. Pool area is small and on the same deck as the bar and restaurant.Nice hotel in the mid budget range.

Last minute planning put us at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel. The air conditioner wouldn't cool in the first room and they were happy to move us. Second room was comfortable and cool. The room is a bit dated and could use an update. But for last minute planning, it worked for us.

When I booked I was not expecting a 4 star hotel however this did not even rate a 2.The decor was hideous and outdated, like something out of "The Shining." My bed had the remains of what resembled a condom in it. The aircon did not work nor did the digital clock radio. There was dust in the coffee maker and grease in the hair dryer. The bathroom had a tiny bath and no room to store toiletries. There is no restaurant and the pool is very unappealing. The staff were friendly enough and the location was great but I will never be staying there again.

We got a room here on short notice after other lodging plans fell through. The registration staffer gave me a better rate than anything I saw online, and much better than our original “not on Waikiki beach” place. For having stayed on Waikiki Beach, in Hawaii, viewing the beach, on a holiday weekend, I feel like I got a great deal. The room was very nice and comfortable, and more than adequate as a base of operations for everything we did on Oahu. All the staff were great; special thanks to the valet staff, who were extra busy because of a local event/festival, and still always came through for us quickly. Great view of the beach. BE AWARE – after seeing sites that were east of Waikiki (Hanauma Bay, etc.), Google Maps would plot a return path to the hotel through residential areas, including a horrible left turn (no light) across 4 lanes of busy traffic, with poor visibility. Instead of exiting at 26, go down another mile to 25. A few minutes longer, but safer and less aggravating.

Stayed here for 3 days and had a great time. Front door overlooked Diamondhead and back patio overlooked the ocean and pool area. Room was very clean and comfortable. Pool bar was awesome and the bartenders were the best. Right across the street from the ocean and plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. I would most definitely stay here again if I go back to Honolulu.

Our room is quite spacious compared with what I've read about the typical hotel room here in Honolulu. It's well equipped, king size bed (one of the most comfortable I've slept in), bath in the bathroom, a room looking right over the beach and the main drag. Check in was easy, the lifts very efficient, the pool area very good albeit a death trap for people slipping over each day, a bar and restaurant downstairs which was first rate with live music each night. I don't think you can go wrong with this hotel. Our tariff included breakfast was however was not one we expected. A pastry, muesli bar and an orange with tea/coffee and drinks. Giving our breakfast package to the homeless people who frequent the strip was a good move.

Having never ventured to Hawaii our search for a hotel, one that would provide a platform from which to explore the beauty and majesty of the island, was trying at best. Having paged through countless reviews, photographs, maps, and any bit of information that could possibly be provided, we finally decided upon the Aston Waikiki Beach. We had chosen a partial ocean view suite, not only because the photographs on the web site made the room look perfect, though also because the price was completely within our price range. After a very long flight, a very long taxi ride from the airport and checking in (which too was long, though we had arrived just as a bus load of guest did also, so the wait was to be expected), we entered our room and were greeted by the most spectacular view of Waikiki Beach that I would imagine is possible. Our suite, situated on the 24th floor, was spacious, immaculately clean, and very up to date. In addition to a king size bed, the room also boasted a spacious living-room complete with a large couch, coffee table, end tables, 42 inch flat screen television, bar table with 2 stools and refrigerator. Leading out to the dual balconies are 2 large sliding glass doors, and each balcony is furnished with a chair, ottoman and small table. A large closet near the door provides ample space for anything you might bring and need to hang, as well as an ironing board, iron, two kimono’s and a safe. The king size bed and pillows were more than comfortable and provided perfect sleep for our entire visit. The staff was overly accommodating in every aspect of our stay, in fact there was not one question that was not answered immediately, nor one request not met with the full enthusiasm of the hotel staff. In addition to the hotel is Tiki’s, a full service restaurant and bar with a perfect ocean view, small gift store with everything one might need during a stay, Wolfgang Pucks, a full valet service and local travel agents to assist in making arrangements for tours and transportation. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the public beaches (simply crossing the road) and many shops and restaurants. Our stay at the Aston was as perfect as we could have ever hoped for and this is one of the true hotel gems I have come across.

This was my first trip to Waikiki. Even though the hotel location is not sitting literally on the beach, it is just steps away and the street is pedestrian friendly. I still felt like I could run to my room and grab snacks or use the restroom while enjoying the surf, much like a hotel on the beach. I saved hundreds per night over the other hotels, some of which were not as well located or as well appointed. The view from our room was wonderful. You have to pay daily fees for parking and in room features, but I found that true of pretty much everywhere I checked. The fee charges seemed standard. My daughter and I enjoyed dinner at the bar. The food was tasty and well priced. The bartender was super friendly. Bottom line, I was not there to hang out at the hotel. I wanted my hotel to be safe, clean, have good service and a good location for the price I was paying. This hotel far exceeded that.

This hotel is in a great location; right across the street from the beach! A great amenity is being able to check out beach chairs and towels each day!We were underwhelmed with the "breakfast on the beach". It was basically a piece of fruit, a pastry, and a granola bar each day. With the fabulous breakfast choices in the area, this really just became a snack for us.We selected a king suite with an ocean view. We were in the very first room on the 24th floor, so we had a completely unobstructed view of the ocean! I would definitely recommend this hotel, both for location and price.

I am very glad that we stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. The location was great, easy access to the beach, lovely view, and in the middle of all shops and restaurants. I would go there anytime I get a chance to.

Firstly, the location doesn't get ANY better than this. If you were to walk 100m from the hotel lobby your feet would be covered in sand and probably be up to your waist in water!For our 10 days in Hawaii we spent the first 4 nights at the Aston before heading up the north shore. I purposely booked a different hotel for the nights remaining on our return to Waikiki incase the Aston didn't meet our needs, but now I wish we had stayed there the whole time, the value for money was amazing!-On our day of arrival, we arrived at the hotel at around 1000 (well aware that check in wasn't until 1500 but we wanted to drop our bags off anyway. The staff informed us that our room had already been vacated so they would have it made up straight away and if we were happy to return in an hour they could check us in then.-We also received a gift pack of sunscreen, water, snacks, etc on our arrival which was a nice touch.-Staff were extremely helpful, rooms were cleaned to a high standard and always done before lunch time.-The pool has a nice shady deck in the forenoon and plenty of umbrellas for shade in the afternoon-Included in the resort fee is a picnic style breakfast. The hotel supply you with a cooler bag on arrival, then each morning they have tables set up at the pool area to supply you with a goody bag (usually a piece of fruit, museli bar and some sort of pastry, per person) as well as coffee/tea/juice.Other points to note...-Weird thing about the balcony was that there was only one chair and one footrest, even though it was a 2 person room, plenty of room on the balcony if they got rid of the foot rest and just put two chairs.-The pool isn't key card protected at all, and given it's close proximity to the beach, it could mean that non hotel guests could also be using the pool.-We had a 'partial ocean view room' but it was a lot more than partial, pretty much full view up Waikiki beach to the west.-The elevator system is a bit strange (have to pre select level, no buttons inside to select multiple levels) and at 1500 check-in time, they get extremely busy and you could be waiting a while, but I guess this is the case at any hotel at that time of day.

Our rental car was damaged by the valet ON BOTH SIDES of the car. We had checked the car out of valet, driven straight to the military base, and noticed the damage on the car at that time. I called the hotel immediately to inform them of the damage and had to take the vehicle all the way back across Honolulu back to the hotel. The security manager was extremely rude and condescending to me and insinuated we damaged the car after we left the hotel. I asked the hotel to contact the police so that we could get a report for our insurance. The security manager was obviously a glorified rent-a-cop who fancied himself as much, much more. Nothing makes me madder than being treated rudely by an establishment I am giving my money to for 4-5 nights.The bathroom was ragged and needed repairs. There was nowhere to sit at breakfast. The location was excellent, and we enjoyed the Tiki Bar very much. The front desk staff were extremely nice.

This is our second time here in three years,this time we have invited friends to stay here too. Great location close to everything,across the road from the beach.the pool has been re-tiled which is great. But stop the so called breakfast ,it's not that any more ...two years ago it was great... But now just give it away better of going down the street.apart from that staff very helpful.

Our experience with Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was a relationship with mixed feelings. To start things off - the location of the hotel was great. The beach was a street cross away and scenery was a view to die for. Convenience was a huge plus, with all the food and shopping options nearby. The main concern that arose during our stay was the amenity charge, which includes: Breakfast, WIFI, television channels, and movies. The charge alone was the only real gripe we had with our stay with Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Half the channels were skipping, most of the movies were not working, and the WIFI connection was horrid. We called for the tv connection to be serviced and was told by the engineer it was the channels that was causing the issue and that was that. We did not want to spend too much time trying to re-mediate these issues during our stay. We totally understand that a vacation in Hawaii should be spent out and about, but if we are charged to pay that amount for amenities, I expect the quality to reflect the price. We voiced our concerns at checkout and our rep Geri was very helpful, but not much could be done with the daily amenity charges. I do not believe our expectations for the amenities to be unreasonable. With that said, I would still recommend Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel if you find the amenity charge to be a trivial thing.

Booked several months in advance. Price was $211.97 for a Saturday night stay. Paid in advance. There was mold in the room on ceiling and in bathroom. When we checked out the bill was $$236.05. When checked out with no aditional charges the bill was $236.00 $24.08 higher than amount we were told and paid in advance, $186.00 room, 8.76 GE tax, 17.71 TA tax, 23.00 Amenity Fee, 1.08 GE tax on Amenity fee, The Amenity fee and tax equal the additional $24.08, but if you make a reservation and pay the price quoted thjen that should be the price charged. Breakfast consisted of juice, coffee, one apple, one muffin, and a Nature Valley Granola bar. Any plus would be view from balcony abd close to ocean.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for our first time in Hawaii. We waited in line quite a bit to check in but once we got to our room were so mesmerized by the view from our balcony. It was beautiful! This hotel is in the perfect location. We had a oceanview room and it was worth the extra money. The hotel is also RIGHT across the street from the beach so super easy access. These were the best two things about the hotel, the view and the distance to the beach. It is also a convenient location for tour pick ups. We went on several tours and pick was always right outside. They also have a DVD rental system which was neat as well. We went to Tiki's a few times. The food was okay and drinks were good. Everything is super expensive but that's just Hawaii in general.On the other hand, they didn't have any kind of business center with access to computers to print or anything. They charge a ridiculous resort fee that covers in-room wifi and breakfast. Breakfast is always just a granola bar, a piece of fruit, and a muffin. The room itself was outdated and had some water stains on the ceiling. It was also a very small room. There was nowhere to put any of our luggage so everything was on the floor. I was hoping there was a sofa or a chair of some sorts to put things. The balcony was very small and only has one chair so we both couldn't sit outside, hoped it would have been a bit larger. Our room was also extremely hot when we got there. Someone came up to look at it and said the air was working fine and provided us with a fan.All in all, our stay was good. I just wished our room would have been a bit more updated and had a little more space.

We booked a four night stay at the hotel it is in a great location but some of the features detract from the location.
