The AC did not work well, Hawaii was going through an unusually hot spell so we put up with it. Our next door occupants were a little noisy at times. We did appreciated the very small bagged breakfast and the location of Tiki Bar and Restaurant on the property. For those into Ala Moana shopping the Pink Trolley stops directly outside the hotel - the fare is US$2. Given the poor AC the resort fees didn't seen justified. Would we go back - probably.

This is my 2nd stay at the Aston in 4 months.This hotel has the best location from access to the beach, to tour buses, and the shopping trolley buses. Whilst the decor of the rooms does need some TLC, the housekeeping staff take pride in their work to provide a clean room. The reception, concierge staff are all so very helpful and r always up for a general chat to make you feel welcome.I shall return again and will not consider staying anywhere else in Waikiki.

Great location & great staff. Free wifi & movies were very handy to have! Right on the beach and a short walk to restaraunts & shops. Pickup for all your tours is also quite close and Tikis Grill & Bar was amazing! Would definitely go back here.

in hawaii you ned to be close to the beach and be friendlythe hotels are not as ellegant like chicago or new york, paris, londonit is hawaii so enjoy it and have fun and everything is close by you can walk and eat anywhere

This was definitely not what I expected from the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. When we arrived on our honeymoon we were immediately taken aback but how out of date our room seemed.The room itself was very ordinary and had some mould in the shower that was in desperate need of a renovation. The sheets made me itch at times and the air conditioning was pretty useless.One thing that I actually enjoyed about the hotel was the lovely staff, from the front desk to the house keeping staff they were all extremely happy to help and went above and beyond to accommodate us during our stay.The daily amenities fee is an absolute joke considering the wifi signal is terribly weak and drops and the breakfast consists of a paper bag with a tiny snack. Don't think I'd be able to stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel after recommendations from friends who had only visited 6 months prior. After reading some of the reviews on trip advisor I wasn't entirely convinced we had made a good decision. But we did! We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Aston. If I had to pick something to complain about it would be that the one night we decided to rent a movie, it took 3 discs until we found one that wasn't scratched..... but really, we didn't go there to watch movies and when you are relying on other people to treat DVD's correctly...they are always going to end up ruined. If you are looking for somewhere that is right on the beach, within walking distance to everything and is comfortable, then look no further. If you want 5 star, go and stay in 5 star.

Stayed there as airline crew member many times. Now I came back fore a wacation and was still happy. Ate at the hotel restaurant, great food and good service, and at Wolfgang Puck for lighter meals. Can't go wrong at either place. I'do it again.

This hotel is very well located. We could see Diamond Head from our room and a little bit of ocean. It's just a short walk across the road to the beach, and Waikiki Beach is a wonderful place to be. The hotel is very large and one of the things that struck us at first was the number of tourists coming and going. The staff were helpful, the rooms were fine, not over large with two beds in them, but we expected that. There were so many people lining up for the free breakfast that we went elsewhere, but later when I saw what people were eating thought we should have stayed. We ate dinner near the pool and the service and food were excellent. I would return to this hotel

The beach is across the street! I paid extra for a room with a view and I got it. Staff was very helpful and friendly, very accommodating. Breakfast is poolside along with Hawaiian music and singing and a lovely hula dancer. Hotel gives you little cooler to pack the continental breakfast, which also included ramen noodles and miso. Fresh fruit was awesome, purple taro rolls and donuts - fabulous and the yogurt came in many island flavors. Amenity fee is definitely worth it and also included BIG beach towels (no problem giving you two per person), beach chairs and DVD rental. Restaurants served great food, but Subway is also just below and there is a small restaurant behind for those on a budget. Everything was very convienent to shopping, transport and good eats. Zoo is very close by as well as Diamond Head. Would love to go back!

We'd stayed here before and were very happy. This time we upgraded to delux ocean view and had a wonderful view all down the famous Waikiki Beach. There is a good bar/restaurant at pool level (floor 3) although not associated with the hotel. It's popular with locals and tourists. The rooms were clean and reasonably quiet (lower floors near the pool maybe not so much). Our only disappointment was the breakfast. Last time we enjoyed the included breakfast, they even gave you a little insulated bag to take it to the beach. This time it was a doughnut in a bag with a piece of fruit - we didn't even bother the second day. The desk says they company is planning to eliminate this. I'd rather pick up a yogurt at ABC ro Starbucks for a light breakfast that what they were servings. All in in we like the location and would probably stay again. Prices are reasonable considering where they are.

I loved the location of this hotel and the bar! It was a great location, in the middle of everything but at the same time the end of the strip and so not so busy! Would definitely recommend and hope to go back soon!

The room we had overlooked The Beach and was very comfortable. The best part are the staff. Absolutely wonderful friendly, having the Ohana spirit. Always a treat staying there.The Tiki Lounge on the 3rd floor, has live music and the food is awesome. Even accommodating me a vegetarian. The veggie burger and salads were delicious.I would recommend staying at this hotel. It's close to everything.

We returned for second visit, Partial Ocean View Deluxe room overlooking Waikiki Beach. Breakfasts are different and put you in the Hawaii mode with Guitar Player and lovely Girl dancing the Hula around the Pool, after Breakfast a quick dip at the Beach across the Road you are ready for the day. Food and entertainment on the verandah overlooking Waikiki late afternoon, trams and buses stop out the front very convenient, can't wait to go again, from Australia...
user_name:
Beverley G
Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel (AWB) was suggested by the New Student Orientation Department at the University of Hawaii - Manoa. As a result, we received a nice discount on our room costs but nothing in Honolulu is cheap, even with a discount. Plus the AWB is an easy and convenient drive to the UHM campus. The AWB staff was friendly, polite, attentive and welcoming. I noticed many guests with an AWB tote bag and when I inquired about them, the front desk staff handed me one. The valet parking staff was courteous and offered some good local suggestions for places to eat. The valet staff was quite accommodating, but the parking area is crazy hectic in the early morning and at dinner time. Thankfully, there are comfortable sofas and a TV to watch while you wait for your car. Breakfast is served beginning at 6:30am; however, coffee was out when I came down about 6:00am. Coffee and breakfast are served on the pool deck. Breakfast is a brown bag that includes a muffin/pastry, fruit, and a protein snack. Quick and simple but not necessarily filling. AWB has two dining options: Wolfgang Puck and the Tiki Grill and we ate at both several times. The Tiki Grill offers a seafood based menu and the purple dinner rolls were a novelty. Strange looking but they tasted like a regular dinner roll. The wait staff advised the rolls were made with taro root which is considered a sacred food on the island. After a hot, humid day of moving my student into the dorm at UH, my dinner consisted of a basket of purple rolls and a most delicious and refreshing watermelon/feta salad. The Wolfgang Puck option was not a fancy, white-table cloth restaurant. It was a quick dine-in or take-out that offered pizza, salads, pasta, etc. Waikiki Beach was across the street from the AWB. We had an ocean front room and the view was breathtaking. The balconies was very close and you could have easily shaken the hand of your neighbor on the next balcony. Our rooms was clean and adequate but not luxurious. There were sufficient reading lamps for both beds. The room refrigerator was stocked with gratis items but the items were not typical for mainland tastes - coconut water, agave juice, etc. The bathroom was small but it was clean and offered appropriate amenities. There was an in-room safe. The AWB did not have a business center, so if I needed to use a computer (a screen bigger than my smartphone), the AWB staff suggested I visit the Marriott Hotel Business Center. However, the AWB staff did say they could print airline boarding passes for me; however, I was not inclined to give them my login information. The room provided an in-room safe and WiFi was free. The elevators in the AWB were unique. You placed your room card in front of the reader and then the screen told you which lettered elevator to catch. If you caught the wrong elevator, it did not stop at your floor. There were no buttons inside the elevator to select the floor on which you wished to stop. This approach certainly added a strong security component; however, it took some adjusting to. Most of my time was spent on the UH campus; however, I had no complaints about the AWB. It was a good value for the money; it was across from the beach with awesome views; and it was within walking distance of many restaurants and stores; and the staff was professional and friendly. I will likely be back at the AWB when my student graduates from UH in May 2019 (hopefully).

This is a very large hotel. There are something like 26 stories of rooms. Our room was decently spaced, had a nice soft bed and clean bathroom. There is a balcony that overlooks the pool and part of the Pacific. I found staff at the hotel to be very nice and accommodating. The grab and go breakfast usually consisted of a muffin, a snack bar, and a piece of fruit. Fortunately, they did have self serve coffee and juices as well. They give you a cooler that you can pack with your breakfast and then dash across the street to the beach. By weeks end we were quite tired of the muffins. I think that it would have been better to serve other things. I would've liked yogurt or eggs or peanut butter added to the grab and go breakfast. When I got to Hawaii, I had already paid for my airfare and hotel or so I thought. Another thing that I was not expecting was the $27 a day parking fee as well as a $23 a day amenity fee. Included in this amenity fee, was Wi-Fi and movies to rent as well as "complementary" coffee in the rooms. I suppose that somewhere in the fine print it was mentioned, but it was not apparent until I was signing in for my room. Overall, I probably would not book in the Ashton Waikiki Beach Hotel again. I probably would look for something with a kitchenette so that I can make my own breakfast and save $23 a day in amenity fees. If you do book here, make sure you know how much it cost to park per day as well as other hidden fees. I wouldn't have minded them so much had I known about them beforehand.

We were soooooooo disappointed as well, photos on the net are nothing like the real thing. After travelling all through USA and Canada this was by far the worst hotel and most expensive. Breakfast was included, what a joke. Rubbish in a paper bag, what a joke. Room was very small, and out dated. (we had the deluxe room). Lights did not work, sliding door to balcony was jammed, and safe in room did not work. We are well travelled and easily pleased, yet I found this the worst hotel in our holidays. There are no laundry facilities, and staff look sad and hated being in this place. Restaurant was very overpriced, but good. Generally, hotel needed a good clean. We will never stay here again or recommend. Pool was not suitable for children, and needs a good clean.

I was sooooo disappointed. From having to stand outside for almost an hour at the pool Lanai to check in (honestly that is where the check in is) and it was HOT and HUMID!!The room was awful, it wasn't what I would call clean AND the tub was horrible with mold/mildew like they don't scrub it. The towels were soaked because the bath above us leaked in to our room. Then the trap door to the bath above fell and almost hit my husband in the head. One night was all I could take and off we went.... p.s. food at their restaurant was average tasting and VERY overpriced.

Room was small but comfortable and clean. I had a partial oceanview that was just amazing! Although it was classified partial, I still had an amazing view from my balcony. I appreciated the added security with the way the elevators were operated. Valet area very busy and very hot, no comfy air conditioned lobby to wait. Location is perfect, Waikiki beach directly across the street from hotel, lots of eateries in walking distance and a great bar with nightly entertainment located in the hotel.

My wife and i spent ten memorable nights here and would recommend it to anyone looking for location and value for money. The room we had on the eighth floor had a king bed as requested and was very clean and serviced daily. The view overlooking the pool and beach was great and the lift service was very efficient. The only down side was the bathroom which was clean but very out dated. We found the staff friendly and ready to help with our enquiries such as confirming our activities for the next day. The breakfasts were very basic with your choice being cereal,yoghurt,fruit, pastries etc and seating was very basic and you had to be early to reserve a table. This was a minor fault as most people decided to go back to their room or go over the road and eat on the beach as guests were supplied with cooler bags to transport their meal. Talking to some people who stayed in other hotels we feel we made the right choice as one couple paid the same price as us but did not even have air conditioning and did not have the room serviced while they were there. One week. I guess if we decided to stay at the Hilton or other up market hotels we would have better meals etc.but for the money difference i would rather spend it on tours or shopping but we were totally happy with the choice we made and if we go back to Hawaii we would stay at the same hotel. Brian & Sandy

We got off on a bad foot to start. We arrived the same time as a bus load of JAL air crew. We couldn't see the fancy lift system for all the people standing in front of the panels and ended up going on a wild goose chase trying to find reception and stuck in a lift with no buttons. We are a family of 4 so we asked for 2 double beds on booking. On check-in we were informed there were no rooms with double beds available and the best they could do was offer one rollaway (2 kids). So one kid ended up sleeping on the floor with a towel for a blanket cos he was getting frustrated sharing a single with his bed hog brother. There is no additional bedding in the room. The room itself was nice. It was clean, spacious and we had spectacular views from the 10th floor oceanfront. The bathroom is old and basic but it was clean. WIFI didn't work. Signal strength was too poor. I mentioned it at check-out and was refunded the amenities fee. The kids enjoyed swimming in the pool although basic and it was easy to get a lounger. The tiles around the pool area/reception are extremely slippery when wet. I saw 3 ladies fall over in the one day we were there.The kids were stoked with their gift bags with bucket and spade and colouring in book. In the morning we headed down to Breakfast on the Beach only to discover we didn't get the ticket for it. I'm not sure if that wasn't included in our room rate or was an oversight. Either way I didn't bother following up as it didn't look very impressive. Muffin and a banana by the looks of it. Upon leaving we waited about 45 minutes for our car to be brought around. It was bedlam. In the end the valet gave us our keys and lead us out the back to where the car was parked surrounded by giant piles of old mattresses. That must be where all the double beds went. I would possibly stay here again given the great location. I'm not sure. While helpful, none of the staff seemed very happy and I think that says a lot. If this place was run a little better it would make a great value hotel.

Let's start this review with, everything in Honolulu is quite expensive, with that said: the hotel is very good for the price we payed. Breakfast: Included (yogurt, cereal, muffins and different other breads, miso soup,fruit, juices, milk and coffe). You have other options available for more money not sure but it was about 5 extra dlls. There are not enough tables at the pool area to enjoy your open air breakfast, so you may want to go bac to your room or eat at the beach. DO NOT FORGET TO GET YOUR COMPLIMENTARY COOLER since you are definitely going to need it to carry anything you want to eat.The room was absolutely clean, I really enjoyed mi stay there for 6 nights. The rooms are in good shape, we asked for a king size bed and we got it. Small fridge was available but no microwave. You have a keurig coffee maker but coffee and water are not for free.The location was great. You can walk to Diamond Head, a lot of different restaurants around for any budget. As a tip, we enjoyed several dinners at Lulu's bar & Grill.The beach is just accross the street and is really good for families with children since there is seawall that allow young kids to be at the beach snorkeling and playing.Only downside was the reception, the guy was on the phone and he ignored us for about 10 mins while we wait in line for check in.

So the views are amazing from the rooms. $27 for parking is a bit rich and the breakfast on beach made me laugh. It's a banana and muffin in Brown paper bag. Really appreciated the staff protest on the street at 6.30am demanding higher pay. The drums really helped me want to come back and stay.

My three adult children and I stayed in two separate rooms from August 25 - 31, 2015. We were on the 25th floor with a beautiful view of Diamond Head.We had double beds. The room size was adequate. The bathroom and shower was fine.We didn't get to use the Fitness Center.We love the fact that the hotel is located across from Waikiki beach. Unfortunately, the beach was off limit due to sewage spillage. The city reopened the beach after a day or two. However, we weren't going to take any chances.We had dinner one night at Tiki's. The food and drinks were fine.Housekeeping services were great. The rooms were cleaned by the time we got back to the hotel.We used the in house safe.. We were disappointed that the rooms didn't have a microwave.It would have been nice if the lanai had room for a table and chairs.Be aware that the parking fees ($27.00 a night), and hotel amenities are additional cost when you check out.This was our time we used this hotel. We stayed here in December 2009, and we will stay here again.

With a balcony looking straight up Waikiki Beach, the location and view were what brought us to this hotel and made us happy. Loved the daily breakfast (included) with live entertainment... singer with THE SMOOTHEST VOICE, loved him! With 2 teenagers, the king and sofabed room gave us plenty of space. And the beach is right out front... that's why we're here, right?Only problem, which management handled promptly, was smokers on balcony above us. Honestly smokers... do you really not realize your smoke seeps into every vent and fills other rooms?... disgusting! Thank you to security for responding quickly and bringing us a fan to help clear the smoky smell.

I stayed in a partial ocean view room. The room was very spacious and comfortable for this solo traveler. The hotel staff were so cheerful and helpful. I couldn't fault anything about the hotel. It is directly across from Waikiki beach (the quieter end). It was great place to go snorkeling. Everything is within a short walking distance. Each morning I loved getting my grab n go breakfast and sitting on beach to eat it. There are plenty of dining options around the hotel. I enjoyed a number of meals at William Puck which is located on the ground floor. I would definitely stay here again.

This was a disappointed vacation hotel. The room was spacious but the air conditioning was not working properly. So disgusted but the kids wanted to keep the warm room. Two thumbs down. We had a partial view of the beach but nothing to brag about. Front desk personnel was not as helpful as expected. I will not recommend friends to stay in this hotel however, the location was across the street walk to the Waikiki beach.

We stayed here in July this year for my wife's birthday and were pleasantly surprised by this place. The rooms were nice enough, location was great and we were fortunate enough to have an amazing view down Waikiki beach. Also the breakfast which was designed to be taken away and eaten on the beach which was a good idea.

The hotel staff is very nice. If you book a room with the free breakfast, don't get too excited as its just a little snack breakfast. The views are very nice. Rooms are good size and the beds are comfortable.

I'm not going to bash anyone just going to be fair and honest....ok, location was great,breakfast could have been better, i like hot breakfast in the morning not cold,the view and the beach was super since i had ocean front view.Very good waking up early in the morning feeling very good and smelling the fresh sea air blowing thru my window every morning...priceless :),The first day my room wasn't that clean,but after i complain about it no problem afterwards during my stay..so folks if you see a problem say something these people are not mind readers.Other than that my stay was very pleasant i would come back to the same hotel even thou i think parking should have been free plus the extra charge for the amenities should have been fair cause i didn't use there internet and the extra things they charge for i only watch some tv not alot since i was on vacation but they charge me anyway thats what i meant for not fair.Beautiful island,people,beach,views,food,thats what makes this vacation worthwhile even thou again they charge too much for something that should've been free.I hope this review help those going on there next vacation ALOOOOHA!:) PEACE be with you all

I had the pleasure of staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel this past week. I loved it and will be back for sure. Although it was a business trip, the location made me feel like I was on vacation. All employees were very gracious and helpful. Kudos! Keep up the good job. See you soon!

I've spent a week here with my family and while we had a great time in Hawaii, it was not due to the efforts of Aston Waikiki Beach.I'm giving it a "poor" rating mostly because of that $23 amenity fee scam; maybe it's normal in Hawaii resorts, but it still leaves a sour taste. Had it been disclosed earlier, I'd have given hotel a 3. Were there an option to decline the fee, the hotel would get a 4.Now for the good: * This hotel has a great location, with an awesome view from all rooms; its architecture is really convenient * The package deal that we got was not that expensive, considering the neighborhood.* Valet parking is $27 a day, which is - believe it or not - quite OK, given the location and traffic* Beach towels for free - this is a big thing, very important to know ahead of time, so you don't pack your own, these things can be bulky.The bad: * $23 amenity fee - not sure if this is normal, but it feels like a total scam. It was only disclosed to us at check-in, and of course I had no options other than to agree to it. Let me mention some of the "amenities" that you get for that: local and 800 calls (normally free), in-room safe, use of coffee maker, daily paper ... see where I'm going?* we are a family of 4, we paid for 4, I disclosed there were 4 of us - yet somehow we always got 2 towels in the bathroom, so I had to call them up every day to bring 2 more. Is it that hard to have a note about the number of people in the room? * even when service lady did the room service while we were there, and saw there are 4 people in the room, she managed to give us only 2 towels. She did not speak English, so it wasn't enough to say "may I have 2 more towels, please", because she did not get it.* as I said, we were 4, and we dutifully paid the amenity fee, yet we always got 2 coffees (I know, the management would now say it's hotel policy to give you 2 coffees, but it's my policy to give reviews when I'm nickel and dimed)* breakfast - note to hotel management - please do not call this "breakfast". Call it "complimentary poolside morning snack with watered-down fruit juice" and I'll accept it. I wonder if hotel managers have such "breakfast" at home before they come to work.The ugly:* smoke detector went off the first night, right when we were totally asleep. There was no smoke, of course. We called 3 times before anyone showed up and turned it off. No prob during the day, but really a vacation killer at night.

The only thing good about this hotel is that it's right across the street from beach! The breakfast to go was a joke! Thought we would have a hot breakfast ! The first day we had to pay for hard waffles and strawberry syrup! The elevators didn't work correctly! The food at the tiki bar was delicious ! Best Tuna! There were also picketing for union workers one day! Deluxe room was very very small ! Bathroom outdated! The out door porch could only fit one chair!

Great location, friendly staff, nice breakfast and great ocean front view at a reasonable price (for Waikiki) made our stay enjoyable.The front desk staff found us a good deal when we suddenly moved hotels and really saved the day.

Do not use this hotel! Although it is conveniently located, the $23 amenity fee they say you'll receive a $25 Visa card on check-out is a SCAM! It has been 2 months, 10 phone calls, and over 5 emails to chase down the money they owe me. I've received one rebate card for $200, but they owe me another $200 or so. They figure you'll forget to follow up, or get frustrated if it's only a few nights. How many others have been tricked by this. They are VERY nice every time I call. They always have a reason why I didn't receive the rebate. I sure hope I get the other rebate card soon. Easy for them to invest my money and make me chase it down.

We spent four days in this hotel and really enjoyed it. We had an ocean view from our balcony and a beautiful diamond head view when we opened our door. Beds were comfortable, rooms clean and the breakfast, though the same every day, was good. Yogurt, fresh fruit, muffins, Hawaiin donuts. Only surprise was a $4 charge if you wanted omelets or waffles. Nice property (not over priced) in a prime location. I would definately stay here again! Restaurant has excellent food and service.

Stayed two nights at Aston, went on cruise, stayed two nights at Aston. Not a luxury hotel. Needs updating. Room needs painting and some repairs. Was part of our package because we wanted to stay on the beach. Next visit we will pick a different hotel even if more expensive. If you don't care about fancy it's fine. I don't care about fancy but no.

So we stayed here from 10-18th August And the only redeeming thing was its location. I was quite surprised when I arrived and was told we had to pay a amenities fee.. Ok cool, it said it included buffet breakfast which WAS good for the first few days we were there and had amazing variety, Then one morning with no notice they started giving out brown paper bags with barely any food in them! We got a ugly looking orange, a tiny muesli bar and a muffin each! And they added a knife and fork each to help fill up the bag! Hahaha what? Am I supposed to use it to cut my orange or my muesli bar? I usually wouldn't care but since we are paying a amenities fee I would expect MUCH better! They offered no compensation aswell.Room was a standard hotel room.. Only the bathroom facilities really needed a desperate upgrade some of those shower heads are probably as old as meI will be returning to Hawaii and will not be returning to this mess! Thanks for taking my money for nothing!

What a disappointment this hotel is the bathrooms need a total overhaul. The advertised breakfast on the beach and when we turned up it was grab and go, brown paperbag with a sugary croissant piece of fruit and a breakfast bar($27 amenity charge) each day for that. It was crap. Being double charge on final bill and being question as to whether I was correct as if I was making it up was not good on behalf of the staff. I felt that as an Aussie we were not treat the same as other nationalities. The view was great and tikis bar is fantastic but the rest of this hotel was an unpleasant experience.

We have stayed here 4 times on trips to Waikiki and enjoyed each stay. Staff was friendly and rooms were fine for the price paid. We had deluxe ocean view and really loved the lanai and the view up Kalakaua Ave. The best thing we thought was the cooler in your room for each guest and the buffet breakfast with entertainment. I am so sad to hear of the downturn of the quality of the rooms and hotel itself and the disappearance of the breakfast on the beach. This will really hurt the hotel and I feel they need to spend money upgrading and bring back the breakfast. I will probably go elsewhere due to the reviews that I have just read. Still love Hawaii and Waikiki Beach. Will just have to find another place to stay.

The rooms are a little outdated. It seems as if something always needed to be fixed. Our shower head fell off at one point. The ice machine which was directly in front of a room next to us leaked for the first 3 days we were here. The breakfast consisted of a brown paper bag with one fruit, a granola bar, and a pastry for each person in your room. Thankfully it was located on the beach and was in walking distance of a lot of shopping and dining. The sidewalks can get a little congested at times so if you don't like constantly being bumped into by people, some with no manners, then stay elsewhere. Also upon returning from a day of activities there was a huge mob outside the hotel that was protesting something about the ownership of hotel. Which at the least was a very loud distraction from the bus and cab drivers with the worst road rage I've ever witnessed. The street vendors are relentless its almost like walking in a car dealership and a rookie salesman trying to force you to buy a car you really don't want.

We stayed in their beach front room, very nice view of the ocean. The people were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean with all of the ammenities we needed. Movie rentals was a nice bonus. Breakfast was ok, mainly cereal and pastries (had to pay extra for waffles) until they switched this up to grab and go. Hopefully they will go back to buffet style! They are probably due for a PIP, but all in all it was a good stay and I would recommend to others.

We just stayed at Aston Waikiki beach hotel. And I would have to say it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The only good thing was the view. At check in we had a nice lady named Geri who was very helpful, after that it went downhill. The rooms are average, the sheets were dirty & the toilet was leaking water on the floor. The lifts are so slow & have the weirdest system to get up to your room, we got free breakfast but the first morning we went we worked out why it was free because it wasn't good at all. The guys downstairs at velvet were alright the first day after that they became rude, didn't talk & hung up when we called in the morning to get our car out, they never helped us when we asked. & if your looking for a cab it's very hard to find one outside that hotel. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone. Not to singles, family's or couples on a romantic getaway.

Long story short... courtesy of Balinese volcanoes we arrived in Waikiki from Sydney with no USD and no accom, Aston was recommended by folk on the plane and John(?) on the front desk at the Aston was great and sorted all sorts of things for us. Room was fine, a bit snug for 2 adults and 2 grown teenagers (but where wouldn't be) and close to beach and being at the end of the promenade far enough away from the madness of central Waikiki.Pool was good, breakfast is mayhem so go early or go elsewhere and as I said John on the front desk was fab.

One of the reasons we decided to stay in this hotel was that it advertised "Breakfast on the Beach". Sounded really good, they gave us a little cooler bag, we went down to the pool deck and had the choice of yoghurt, cereals, fruit salad, muffins, pastries, juice, tea and coffee. It was lovely, for 3 days, then suddenly, with no explanation we get a brown paper bag with a pastry, a very tiny muesli bar & a rather terrible looking orange in it! Oh you can still have a cup of very watered down juice but it's in a smaller cup now. What this hotel has done to its guests is just rude! If this change was made because some people were helping themselves to too much, then why not have a staff member supervising. The action the hotel has taken as regards breakfast, shows complete contempt to those who chose in good faith, to stay in this establishment.

This Aston hotel is on the south side of Waikiki, near the zoo, away from the canyon of upscale and luxurious hotels farther north on the main Waikiki strip (that part of Waikiki is overrun with tourists and not enjoyable, IMHO). This hotel's greatest asset is that it's right across the street from the beach, a feature that not a lot of Waikiki hotels have. There are not a ton of amenities here, but that's not what I came for. Skip the small bag breakfast and go around the corner to the Starbucks (I don't care for hotel breakfasts in general, so I don't feel like I'm missing anything). Check out some free towels and set yourself up on the beach for a few hours. It's not a pricey hotel, so don't expect pricey amenities. The bed is very comfortable and I wake up refreshed. The wifi is just fine. The service staff are all friendly and very responsive.

Rooms need upgrading & repairs badly. One elevator broke down during the busiest time of the day. Housekeeping needs to be more efficient as I woke up one morning staring @ 2 large roaches on the ceiling. Had to keep calling housekeeping for T/P & Kleenex. Will not be staying @ this hotel again.

The Hotel was exactly what we expected when we booked the trip. We thought the hotel was nice based on the price we paid. Our room was kept clean. The only thing that could have been better was the bathroom. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean. The wifi was great and my children enjoyed the free movie rentals.The continental breakfast fit our needs. We are not big breakfast eaters so the fruit and donuts were perfect. Saved us a bunch not having to buy breakfast.The valet service was great. I would recommend calling in advance to have them retrieve your vehicle.Keep in mind this hotel is at the end of Waikiki. You do have to walk a while to get to the heart of Waikiki.

We are currently staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel with a few days left in our trip.The location is good - right across the street from great beaches and plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. The area is very busy and aimed toward tourists (with an alarming number of homeless people along the way) so if you're looking for something more peaceful and less hectic/populated, this is not the place for you. The staff have been good. Polite, helpful, etc. Exactly how good hotel staff should be.The rooms are small and outdated. The bathroom walls and ceilings have many long hairs painted into them permanently. That kind of stuff really grosses me out.The added fees are pretty ridiculous. Be aware of this before booking - the fees will definitely put you over what you thought you would be spending on this trip. The breakfast is not a breakfast at all. It is a snack that is picked out for you. We laughed because even the oats and honey granola bars that typically come with two bars per package have only one per package. Do not pay any attention to the reviews talking about a cooler left in the room for you to fill up - that no longer exists as of yesterday. It would have been nice to know that this would be changing during our stay prior to booking. Wifi is frustrating. You have to continuously reconnect and it's not always easy but it is always slow. The valet service has been great - as it should be since it's the only option and you're paying out of your @$$ for it:-)I had this image in my mind of Hawaii being beautiful, serene, like no place I'd ever been. We have only found that that to be true when leaving the hotel and this area. When I'm in the hotel room, all I want is to be back in my home. When I'm out walking around, all I want is to be away from all of the people. Not the feeling I was hoping to have on our trip to Hawaii, however I am aware that we probably should have stayed elsewhere - a different area, a different hotel, and maybe even on a different island.

This hotel is kind of joke...For example for breakfast you got a bag with one banana, one cookie and small protein bar. Nothing else...Internet is so slow and I was downloading tripadvisor app for 30 minutes (U pay about 20$/day fee for all media in room)

During out stay here they have change their breakfast system from bad to... Well, a joke.From today the lucky guest of Aston hotel get for a breakfast a brown bag that has less in it than any breakfast on a go you have ever gotten while leaving for a plane at 5 in a morning. Your included breakfast in this hotel contains :One muffin, not if your choice ;)One banana and one bar.That's it.

We recently stayed and had a great time. Rooms are not large -- space is a premium so close to the beach -- but are comfy. We were on the 8th floor and our only complaint was that you could hear street noises (and a very loud drunk guy!) throughout the night. Request a room on a higher floor if you want quiet. :)Their "Breakfast on the Beach" program is a fantastic idea -- they give you a fold-up cooler and you go through the continental breakfast area and bag up your food to take with you. Great idea!

I really do not think that others are giving a proper review . The Haole's are always down grading our hotels because they are not as luxjurious as mainland hotels . I stayed there once in 1999 on my Honey moon and have been back several times as I am from Honolulu raised all my life . Although I am currently on the mainland due to a related war wound , Tripler Medical Hospital could not handle the type of surgery I needed I am in Cal at a VA Hospital . When ever I go home to visit family I will continue to stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach . The thing that is the best and # 1 in the Islands and even the visitors come to stay there is the TIKI lounge and Bar in the Aston Waikiki the best food , the best atmosphere , great staff . You will even see occasionally the Astons Executive Vice President in the TIKI lounge relaxing , go up to him and let him know you found the hotel on Trip Advisor his name is "GARY"

BEWARE BED BUGS!!My family stayed at this hotel for 11 days in June 2015 and we were all bitten severely at this hotel by bed bugs. By the time all the bites had come out, I had approximately 500 bites all over my body, even on my eyelids! Many of my bites turned into huge welts and blisters (really revolting and sore). With the number of bites we received there must have be an infestation.Read about bed bugs it is revolting!!!! You do not want to stay in a hotel that has an infestation like this. As soon as we got back home from our trip to Hawaii, before even going inside my house I had to take my family to the doctors, I was very sick for over two weeks after returning from my trip, I had to have a double round of antibiotics, creams and antihistamines to fix the bites I received.I have been back home for five weeks now and the hotel have not sent an apology or contacted us at all, I have sent a couple of emails and they have just ignored me. This hotel knew we were bitten before we left and they knew what was in our room, I believe they had an obligation to let us know what was in our room and never did.For the amount of money you pay to stay you should not be exposed to such filth! BEWARE! I had previously posted a week ago on Trip Advisor the hotel responded back saying ”We were pleased to learn that our insurance company has been in contact with you since July 9”. Their hotels insurance company has once emailed me to ask only for my medicare number and have never recontacted me again, this insurance company would have verified all claims but still no response from them. We have still had no contact from the hotel either. The only thing they reply to, is replying to comments on this site. They try to down play the problem that exists in their hotel, if you read other travellers comments it wasn’t just my room other levels also had problems. The number of bites my family and I received wasn’t a small problem of a few bugs coming in by previous travellers as they stated previously, these bugs must have been there a while and constantly multiplying to receive the bites we did. An external company should have been in this hotel far sooner than it did or even if they have been called in at all.

This hotel has a great view, and the staff are helpful and friendly. But the hotel itself is old, small pool and breakfast was very ordinary. We only stayed for two nights and moved to another hotel up the other end of Waikiki beach, where I prefer.

We have stayed in this hotel during the last 4 visits to Waikiki, and it would probably be needing some upgrading in the next few years. But it would still be a go-to hotel for us because of its location and amenities: one street crossing away to the beach and Kuhio Beach park; a block away from St. Augustine Catholic Church...and the complimentary breakfast each morning was a convenient amenity. Our first room - 1930 - had a terrific ocean view, but the air conditioning was not working. We transferred to a suite - 1528 - and also had a view of the ocean and Diamond Head. We had kids with us so the hotel was perfect as right across was a walled portion of the beach, making it ideal for young children. There were several restaurants on the ground level including Wolfgang Puck. Parking was a hit and miss. It could be very busy and so bring a lot of patience when you have a rental car. We usually called 15 minutes ahead of time for the attendant to retrieve our car. The other quirky thing was the way the elevators worked. The lifts would go all the way to all the floors, but from the top floors, they would stop at the 3rd floor and guests needed to use the escalator or Elevator F to go down to the ground floor. Overall, our stay was quite satisfactory.

Love this hotel...staff was awesome and we couldn't ask for more! My wife has fallen in love with the hotel. ..and guess what my wife is Polonisian. But besides that it's really about location, location and location!

Great location across from beach ( beach here is very calm and terrific for youngsters). Rooms ok - no drawers for clothes ( one big cupboard with shelves). We got a one bedroom which was handy with kids who may want to watch tv etc... Only downside was we were next to elevators which woke us early each morning.

A busy but friendly hotel located at the end of the busy Waikiki strip. Clean & tidy room with all necessary amenities. Perfect spot with the trolley stops close by and beach swimming area directly across the road.

The only positive was the staff and location. The hotel needs many improvements. We arrived and went to our room, we paid for parcial ocean views and got a view of the generator next door. We upgraded for a fee and this is what we got!. We would not recommended this hotel to anyone. The breakfast was dissapointing, the food was poor quality and we only went once, there's an additional fee of $6.00 for waffles or eggs. We also saw huge roches by the elevator on the first floor!.

I wanted to have a nice hotel to rest in after our 10.5 hour flight from Washington D.C.'s Dulles International Airport as we would be going on to Maui two days later. From start to finish the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was a class act. When we arrived the staff was super friendly and helpful and gave us all the information we needed for our stay. Let me tell you, the beds were outstanding and we slept like babies! The following morning, we took advantage of their unique "Breakfast on the Beach" program which features individual thermal lunch sacks and an all-you-can eat buffet which you can eat poolside or take to the beach with you! The very best part....live Hawaiian music with a wonderful Hula dancer while you eat your breakfast! I was thoroughly enchanted by this on my first mornings in Hawaii. Of course the other advantages of the hotel are: Waikiki Beach (at the furthest Eastern end, away from most of the crowds), It's right next to the ZOO which is fantastic! Amenities are very nice with wifi in the rooms and bathrobes! Can you tell I liked this hotel? Well, you will too!

I stayed 2 weeks with family and friends at this hotel. I enjoyed my stay. The staff were helpful and friendly. There was free wifi and we had a free daily breakfast. We had a nice view of the beach. We were on the 27th floor so it was really quiet. The hotel is close to stores and good chains. Great stay! I'd go back again.

Hotel is easy access on anything and everything .. Beach is just few yards away. Superb ocean view room .. Friendly staff ,, easy checking in and out... Clean rooms, Breakfast by the beach every morning with a lunch bag for every guest , fresh fruits, fresh baked breads, croissants, fresh coffee.. We will never go any hotel but this one .. definitely we will return ..

reasonably priced with a perfect location. the pool is pretty small and worthless. The gym is good for what it is. The Tiki Bar is awesome. good happy hour 2pm-5pm and music almost every night. the breakfast is pretty sad. The rooms are clean and nice with a nice view of the ocean. One WARNING is that they will charge a $27 a day charge for ballet services and a $23 daily charge for "Hotel Fee". The beach is literally right across the street and is a common spot for tour pick ups which is nice.

Let me start by saying that I feel like I got super value for what I paid. I overnighted here on a trip to New Zealand to work for a month. I paid a little more than $200. The hotel is situated right on the beach next to the Marriott. Excuse the expression, but the Aston surely would get my "first impression rose." I was immediately greeted when I drove up. The bell stand took my luggage and delivered it directly to my room shortly after I checked in. The front office was very efficient and also very, very friendly! I had asked for a quiet room on a high floor and the room was perfect. The grounds and the room were impeccably clean. There were two things that I don't like.... One the way that the breakfast is organized... Many people complain that people in front of them in the breakfast line took all of the food. This is because you are only allowed to through the line once. You can't come back when the food is replaced. I would rather be able to graze a little bit at a time. That being said the selection was quite good. I especially liked the local donuts. Secondly there were several things broken in my room... The refrigerator was leaking, one of the lights was not working and the paint was peeling. All in all though, this hotel is a winner and I would stay here in again.

We ended up on the top/25th floor overlooking the beach. AMAZING view! The room was small and with the double beds, we knew our family of 4 with two teenagers would be "close" for the night. We appreciated the 6 pack soft sided souvenir coolers to have "breakfast on the beach" which we did as the seating by the music and pool was completely full. One of the few Waikiki hotels that offers a Continental breakfast - fruits, muffins/rolls, juices, yogurt, cereals, etc. We left our luggage and paid to park at the zoo overnight - a few blocks walk as it was crazy at check in. Swam, saw the fireworks, and walked along the waterfront. Only stayed one night because we boarded the cruise ship the next day. I do like the elevator system that designates which one you will use and then just stops at 2 or 3 floors. Kids cannot push all the buttons to stop at every floor. Quick and easy ride to all floors.

We stayed here in July 2010 for a week and decided that since we enjoyed it so much the first time, we would stay here again. And what a good decision that was. I booked about 10 months ahead, ocean front select room and requested a high floor, which we received. Arrived at HNL around 1pm, we were at the hotel by 2pm and our room was ready by 2:45. Very nice staff at the front desk. The view is amazing. Loved seeing the sun set over the ocean every day of our vacation. The room was nice and clean. Two double beds and standard hotel bathroom that was clean and stocked with toiletries daily. The housekeeping staff was always friendly. The elevator system is easy to use and very efficient. I have to say the only time there was any wait, i.e. more than 3 minutes, was during the breakfast rush hours. Ok, so about the breakfast on the beach deal that is included with the amenity fee. There was plenty to choose from, mainly carbs in the form of pastries, fruit, yogurt, various juices and coffee/tea. It was a great way to start the day in a convenient location. We also brought the breakfast up to our room to enjoy the view and avoid the crowds. The hotel's location is superb. Across from the beach and close to the park/zoo, restaurants, public transportation, etc.It was great to be able to walk from the pool area to the beach and vice-versa in about 2 minutes. Ok, so this might not be a fancy enough hotel for many, but for us it had everything we needed and the price was good. I'm looking forward to returning to Waikiki and this hotel. I just hope it won't be another 5 years before that happens.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 10 days. The Hotel itself was nice and clean. The staff were quite indifferent. No real customer service that stood out. They did what was expected of their job and nothing more. Our towel rack in the bathroom was damaged from the moment we checked into our room and by the time we left, we weren't able to hang our towels, as housekeeping constantly hung new towels on it until it nearly collapsed. The hotel is located at the end of the main strip, near the zoo. This wasn't really a problem, but we had to walk to get to the main part of Waikiki, where all the designer shops were and where there was more variety for dining. What lets this hotel down and really turned my family and I off was the breakfast. Breakfast is included in your daily charges that you have to pay. We didn't do breakfast every day and following is the reason why. You were supplied in your room with 2 small soft eskis. I thought they were to store your cold drinks for your use at the beach. No - they were for your breakfast. You would go downstairs to level 3 for breakfast near the pool. Breakfast consisted of yogurt in little containers, 4 types of cereals in little boxes, miso soup, pastries, fruit, tea, coffee and juices. This was the problem - you needed to pack all this in your Eski. Lots of rubbish - paper bags for pastries and styrofoam cups for your milk for your cereal, for your juice and your coffee/tea and styrofoam bowls for cereal and fruit. Plus plastic spoons, knives and forks. Lots of rubbish for breakfast. I kept thinking how much rubbish is thrown out at this hotel every morning? Not very eco friendly. It was also very hard to find tables to sit down and eat. And there was no toast. Can't believe they didn't supply toast! Too bad if you didn't want anything sweet to eat. I felt it was a very 'tacky' breakfast. Aside from the issue of breakfast and the distance, it was a reasonable hotel. The dvd hire was a hit with the kids. Having the beach across the road was a bonus too. I'm sure the views would be great if you had ocean views.

Just returned from a week long stay in Waikiki. The Aston Waikiki is in a great location, literally right across the street from the beach. The rooms (or our room at least) are not very updated but we did not spend much time there. The room was very spacious and clean and had a decent view of the ocean, but a spectacular view of Diamond Head and overlooked the Honolulu Zoo. The wi-fi was not reliable. We had maintenance come and re-set it, but that did not last more than one day. The morning breakfast is served poolside and consists of very basic items. No plates or utensils are provided and if you want to take something out of the pool area a small soft-sided cooler is provided. We skipped the offered breakfast most mornings. The one MAJOR complaint would be the parking situation. ALL parking is valet. There is no problem with that, however, we did not learn of the $27 PER DAY valet parking fee until we received the check out bill under our door the morning we were leaving. Not a single word was said the day we arrived with the car and there was no sign in the drive-thru area indicating there would be a fee. The hotel already charges a $23 per day amenity fee and if there is going to be a valet parking fee it really should be included in the amenity fee. Street parking in the area is nearly impossible to find, so you are forced to have the car valeted even if you are just briefly returning to the hotel and want to quickly get ready to go out for dinner then leave again. We tipped the valets every single time they brought the car. Some days that was three or four times, and some times it was quite a long wait for the car even though we called ahead. The Concierge was very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. The front desk staff was helpful enough but definitely not over the top friendly. All in all I would say it was a very adequate place to stay. Just be aware of the parking situation and $27 per day valet fee. That, combined with the daily amenity fee, is an additional $50 per day.

Checked in last night and still love this place! The staff is friendly and welcoming, beautiful view from our room, the beds are comfortable and the valet parking guys are sweet. Would highly recommend this to anyone wanting to visit the island.

The hotel is old and you can tell when you get into your room. The staff is nice the but I hate the fact they don't use silverware and plates during breakfast, it's all you can carry. The valet service is very slow.

We stayed here for 4 days. The location is great across the street from Waikiki beach. The room was clean, had a small mini fridge and bathroom was ok. You have to request ice from the front desk for your cooler. The front desk guys are very friendly. The rooms only offer 2 twins 1 queen or 1 king.

Nice hotel, but needs update,great ! Very close to center, restaurants,beaches. They provaded towels and chairs. the breakfast was in american style, but you could order a wafers, scrambled eggs for $7.

Location, services, food, rooms, staff, our stay here was perfect. We only stayed 2 nights and I wished I had chosen this hotel earlier!! I've stayed at the Hilton resorts, Moana Surf Rider, Otani, Outrigger, Sheraton, and many other hotels in Waikiki in the past, but Aston delivers more than you pay for, and the staff is just amazing. The pizza at the ground level Wolfgang is a must try, breakfast in the mornings by the pool is all you can eat and my kid went crazy with the sweet breads :) Loved the lunch bags they provide us with so we can eat down at the beach. Buses/trolleys stop right infront of the Hotel so perfect for sightseers and shoppers.Pool small but enough fun for the kids, but why swim in a pool where theres a beautiful beach right infront!! Located at the corner of Waikiki beach so doesn't get loud at night, slept plenty with the lanai window open.Super family friendly. Will definetely stay there again!!

I have been in Honolulu 8 times just this this year. I have stayed in many different hotels. ALL were better than this for the money. The rooms are small, dingy....they have a nice Keurig Coffee maker in the room BUT if you want the coffee you have to pay extra. Save your money and stay someplace else.

Just across the steet from the beach and close to all the shopping and amenities of waikiki. Hotel room had all the basics, breakfast was ok but after a couple days you didn't want to look at it. There is plenty of other F&B options nearby. Service was pretty good, housekeeping was great. Can't beat the location.

Much of my frustration about this place is the location. Waikiki has been developed to death. It is a long line of overpriced survivor shops and big name restaurants. The hotel's focus seems to be quantity over quality. The breakfast was a weird continental breakfast where you just stood in a long line to get basics. Anything beyond pastries and yogurt came with a price tag. The room was fine, but basic. They did have some nice family friendly touches, such as free daily DVD rentals.

As much as this hotel was hyped, we expected better. Dirty bathroom, a/c didnt work great so they sent maintenance to change filter which helped. Continental breakfast at the pool was always packed and never anywhere to sit. Disappointed

Thought this hotel had great service and staff.The breakfast eating arrangement was an eye opening- had to hold back from being greedy.The valet service was also very helpful.We were on the 21 st floor with a great view down the beach.Our room was a bit shabby and the air conditioner struggled to cope in the heat.I feel this would be a great hotel for families.We were an older couple and enjoyed the location - close to the beach and parks.

The hotel rooms are a good size, comfy beds, clean towels and excellent wifi. What I don't understand was I thought I paid for bed and breakfast but had a daily room charge for the breakfast safe and wifi (whether I wanted them or not).The staff were very helpful and friendly and the two problems; my safe broke and the airconditioner wouldn't work.The view from my balcony was of Waikiki beach.Breakfast was a puzzle. I thought I'd paid for it as above but seemed to pay again in the room charge and if you wanted something hot and more substantial I had to pay a gain for either a omelette or waffles.The breakfast 'on the beach' consisted of a small cool bag for you to fill from a cold buffet of you gate, fruit, cereal boxes, pastries, fruit juices and coffee. Great if you live morning carb with your carb!Overall the hotel was very well located on the beach a short walk or bus ride to Diamond Head and the city centre, bars and restaurants. Bed was very very comfortable and room service daily made the bed and changed the towels.Great for families.

Stayed at this hotel with 30 other people. We loved it. The valet was the best!! And the location is amazing!! No complaints, need extra towels, they deliver, have a mini ref in room. Bathrooms outdated, beds comfortable! I would recommend!

It was ok. Staff friendly and helpful. Did have a toilet issue but they came and fixed right away. A bit noisy because right across from beach but beautiful view! It was very convenient to shopping and beach.

Location wise very good with the sheltered beach directly across the road, so good for families with small kids or people who want to paddle in calm water. Our view on the 16th floor was awesome, would recommend getting an ocean front room. Service was a bit lacking with sometimes towels getting missed, coffee not getting replaced etc but overall okay.

My wife and I celebrated our 20 Year Wedding Anniversary the week of July 10th through 20th. What a way to start your dream vacation by staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel!!! Hawaii is all about location, location, location. Walk outside the hotel and you're on the sands of Waikiki Beach!! First impressions are lasting ones. The stay began with being greeted by the friendliest front desk personnel I've ever encountered. The rooms were ready upon arrival, and the elevators were state of the art. No waiting or traveling in overcrowded cars. All of the rooms have amazing views. You're either overlooking Waikiki Beach or witnessing the beauty of the Diamond Head Mountains. Did I mention there was a Wolfgang Puck restaurant in the lobby? The pool deck and the complimentary breakfast were amazing. Don't know where you're going? Ask the valet staff for directions or the best mode of transportation and you're there. The price is right, and the accessibility to shopping, dinning, site seeing and the beach is a few feet away. What more could you ask for in the state of Hawaii? Oh, I forgot to mention the rooms. We had a King Suite that offered free movie rental, video game system, and cleanliness!!! Take it from someone who travels quite often, book accommodations at the Aston Waikiki Beach and you'll be hooked!!!

I did not stay in the Aston Waikiki beach hotel, although I did eat lunch here. The outdoor lunch is on the second floor of the hotel. There is a great view of the beach from here, with a great atmosphere. There was a live band here, who was very talented. The food was Hawaiian and very good.

We stayed here for the last 3 days of our holiday thinking it would be a great ending - wrong!!!The location is reasonable - away from the main shopping and nightlife but not so far you cannot walk to it. Trolley cat stops at the door - so all very handy.We arrived and found the layout confusing. Reception is on the 3rd floor beside the pool. Very barren. All concrete - no plants or much shade. Guests checking in people watch the sunbathers to fill in time.Finally got our room. We found we had a twin when we had asked for a queen. We were told they would get back to us. After half an hour we rang again and was told they had rung but our phone was out of order. Rather strange since we were in one of their rooms and we had just used it to ring them?We were shown to another room which was a twin however, the Tv did not work nor did the internet. We were told it would take about an hour to get someone to fix it. After being checked into a room/rooms for two and a half hours we finally had a TV and internet. The rooms are very small and breakfast is an "adventure"For breakfast you are given a cooler bag and you need to go down to the pool sometime after 6.30am and fill it up with cereals or pastries. Be warned it is configured so you only get one shot at it so you see people filling their cooler bag to overflowing. If you want a proper breakfast then you will need to go elsewhere. The other downside is that if you do not feel like lining up with your cooler bag you do not escape the noise from the pool side dinners from 6.30am onwards which rules out sleeping in.This hotel is good value if you want a cheap holiday and somewhere to stay near the beach. On both accounts it ticks the box for probably a good 3 star hotel. If you want a bit of peace and quiet in reasonable surrounding then consider another hotel.Also remember the bar and night club are on level three so if you get say the 5th floor you are just two above the noise of the pool and night club It has its place - just as a good family orientated hotel where atmosphere is not required and you want to be able to let your children run free around the pool -ni room in the hotel room itself. You can also convince yourself that you have a hotel on the beach with great views and stayed at Waikiki Beach - but on a budget.

I stayed here with my husband in June 2014, and it was absolutely amazing. The location, right across the road from the beach and just up the road from the shops. Impeccable service and housekeeping. Breakfast by the pool, always delicious & quality food. What more could you want.. Highly recommended and will definitely be staying here again!

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was what we expected. The bathroom could have been updated but it wasn't a deal breaker. The best feature - according to my kids - was the Breakfast on the Beach. We would definitely stay there again if we ever go back.

Have stayed at Aston twice. Will stay again. Great location, Great value, Great staff. If traveling with kids i would suggest a upgrade to suite. Well worth the $. Had one issue in the room and they were there and had fixed in 10 minutes.

Positives - If you are looking for a great location near the beach, this hotel has it. Also, the beds were comfortable. Housekeeping was fairly quick when asked for things. Movie rental included in your amenity fee (but the movies we got all stalled and skipped.) Beach chairs and towels are available for daily use. Cons - $27/day parking; $25/amenities fee; also they do have a very continental breakfast but if you want a waffle add $4 and if you want eggs add $7. And be ready to fight off the rude guests who try to take all the papaya and malasadas. Also, when we booked we asked for a roll-away and were told this wouldn't be a problem. Then when we showed up to check-in, we were told it would be $45 a day for the roll-away. Never, in all my travels - other trips to Waikiki included - have we been charged for a roll-away. Also, we had some very large roaches in our room.Bottom line - we probably won't choose to stay here again next summer. While the location is great, there are other hotels that are in the same price range that are more updated and don't nickel and dime you.

Both my husband and I have stayed at this hotel two previous times many years ago. It's been a few years since our last stay and it appears they haven't updated/fixed anything. Here are more details...Rooms - they smelled. Odd musty smell that wouldn't go away. Bed and pillows were uncomfortable. Bathroom needed a full renovation. Carpet needs changing (felt nasty to take my shoes off in the room. Breakfast - it's from 6:30 - 9am each morning. But don't get there at 8:45am and expect there to be food left. While you wait in line waiting for your turn at the pastries, guests in front would take multiples of everything and complete disregard of others waiting on line. Pool - did not look inviting. When we would get pool towels to go to the beach, they were generic white towels like bathroom towels. Our last morning there, while we were on the pool deck looking to get more towels, we asked for help as it was the middle of breakfast time. An employee worker just threw up her arm to signal for us to turn around and kept walking. No words. Just plain rude.Wifi - very poor connection. Bottom line, after this being are third time in this hotel, it will be our last.

This hotel is in a great location and the staff was very friendly and helpful! They made you feel welcome! The hotel was very clean and the bed was comfortable! We enjoyed having breakfast by the pool every morning and listening to music and watching hula dancing!

Cost was very fair for this hotel's proximity to the beach and epicenter of Waikiki. The breakfast bar, and giving patrons a cooler bag and beach toys was an awesome idea. Customer service was great throughout: tour bookings, restaurant/bar, housekeeping, etc...This hotel is within walking distance to the zoo and a short drive from Diamondhead.

We spent nearly a week in this hotel at the end of june 2015 and I was happy to see the last of it. Our room was small; cleaned late afternoon which meant one could not return for a nap without being disturbed by the cleaners; the internet sucked; the management staff was totally inflexible even in an emergency that required a change in arrangements; I did not appreciate the breakfast system ... Bref! it was not what I was led to believe it was. Two good things. The regular staff was well trained and quite pleasant...And, it was almost on the beach. However, Never again. Never to be recommended

This place is a hop-skip-jump from the beach, and has a trolley stop right outside and an ABC store close too.The décor here is straight Miami Vice 80's, don't know if they're going for the retro look but bang! it's there. I loved it. The rooms are really small, though we apparently got a free upgrade?This place also has an accommodation charge of USD$24 per day which gets you the 'free' WiFi, but the good thing is that they have breakfast laid on. Its pastries and various and assorted stodge, in the usual combination of too much sugar, fat and salt. You have the option to buying an omelet, but that's out of a box.But hey, it Waikiki, so we had plenty of options.

We loved this hotel. The king sized bed was luxuriously sumptuous. We slept deeply and peacefully every night. Truly one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in.The in-room Keurig coffee maker came with two Kona coffee pods daily.The 32" flat screen TV didn't see much use by us but it comes with a PlayStation 3 attached for DVDs, Blurays, and games. All three of which can be "rented" for free in the lobby.The view from this beach front property is stunning. Daily breakfast of fresh fruit, cereals, breads, etc. served for free daily from 630-9. Smart elevators help manage and control congestion.Check out towels and portable beach chairs for free near the pool and take em down to the beach. On site Expedia tourism "experts" (as they call themselves) available to help you book day excursions. Really couldn't ask for a better stay, but be aware that this hotel is not brand new. And while they are renovating some things still feel a bit dated. The shower stall is small and uninspired. The rest of the bathroom is similarly small. This is a minor complaint and barely worth mentioning but with noting. We're loved staying here and would definitely stay here again.

It was great for our needs. Friendly staff. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. We had a partial ocean view which was fine. I rather be standing on the beach than looking at it. The breakfast did have quite a selection for just being continental. The location is good too. You are at the end of the main strip so it isn't as busy. I was worried about my youngest who is a picky eater but there were plenty of places to choose from. Tiki's was fun the grown-ups too. Even though I didn't use them, I did like how there were so many shuttles to take tourists all over. The pool is ok but when you are across the street from the ocean, why bother?The one con I did have was that being a beach hotel, I wish there was somewhere (bathroom/balcony) that we could hang our towels and swim suits. Instead it was getting all musty in the bathrooms. I saw a few towels go flying by our window if you hung it on the balcony.

Seven of us stayed at this hotel 25 and 26 June and 4 - 6 July 2015. We all found it to be a rather down at heel, old fashioned place not worth the money. The rooms were all dingy and badly in need of updating. Air cons were very noisy and ours (room 2203) had to have a maintenance man come three times before we could get the temp up from a low 65 to a more comfortable 72. No tea kettle or tea bags but a kettle was provided on request. bathroom old and small with a shower over the bath and a very low set lavatory bowl. Tiles and walls marked and dirty. Servicing was haphazard with bins not always emptied and servicing not done until late in afternoon.Breakfasts were simply vile - a great queue for admission to the "buffet" - three or four varieties of cereal, plenty of fattening sweet cakes and buns and buns with bits of sausage peering out from them - all sitting uncovered in the blazing sun. Insufficient chairs and tables and very little shade. Breakfast stops at 9 am!!! No lounges or coffee bars except for an open to the sides lounge right next to the car and taxi driveway with so much smell from fumes. A horrible hotel not worth the three and half star rating in the Qantas Holiday Brochure.

This was my first experience with this property, and I was very pleased. I had a nice view from the 20th floor, right across from the beach. This is a perfect location for walking to many things. The staff was responsive to any needs. One of my few suggestions is to please provide larger coffee cups for the breakfast (felt as if we were drinking from a Dixie cup) and consider including the omelet station rather than charging extra. Must give a shout out to Geri at the front desk who helped me resolve some things at check out. Very customer focused and pleasant to talk with. Parking is an additional charge but that's the norm in Hawaii. And, thanks to Edgar from valet for the customer service and compensating me for not just the one night, but two additional nights for the inconvenience experienced with the parking/valet wait at check in. One last complement to Christine who was the housekeeper on my floor. My room was always nice and clean. And, she was such a delight. Always smiling, always friendly and pleasant. Hope to see you all when I return.

Please turn down the volume on the amp for the breakfast entertainment. Blaring music, even Hawaiian style, at 7:30 a.m. isn't my idea of paradise! Between the songs I could hear the sound of surf from the beach across the street, now that is what I consider awesome!

We opted for the Ocean Front Select Room 18th flr and it did not disappoint! We had room 1830 and had full view of Waikiki strip, partial Diamond Head when on the Lanai and a fantastic Birdseye view to watch the surfers because the beachfront was directly across the street with no view obstruction. Comfortable room, clean bath, unlimited free movie & Xbox games to check out in lobby. The free breakfast buffet was nice with variety of cereal, sweet rolls, miso soup, yogurt, cut fruit, juices, coffee, but if you want an omelet, waffles or French toast you have to pay $4-$7. The breakfast on the beach option was nice. They leave to cooler lunch bags in your room and you go to the buffet and take what you want in to-go containers and you can cross the street and eat on the beach, take a table by the pool, or bring it back to your room. They were generous size lunch bags so you could easily take extra rolls or container of fruit for an afternoon snack. Breakfast ends at 9am and not being early risers on vacation we would literally hit the buffet in the last 10 minutes and never felt anything was lacking in selection. The onsite restaurant Tiki Bar & Grill was fantastic. It doesn't do breakfast but has a great menu for lunch & Dinner, or just drinks (Definitely try the Five-O Lava Flow or Shark Bait drinks!) with live music at times and awesome beach view! The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because the pool wasn't as big as I expected but you are right across from a beautiful sandy beach with a breakwater wall so it's like a natural huge clear blue pool. We were within a comfortable walking distance of so much for even someone with limited mobility. There is more than one "Aston" hotel so be sure it has this exact name or you may be looking at another. Also lots on construction on the strip and some hotels, and I was fortunate to have family living there tell me which hotels have lots of construction going. We were blissfully away from all construction so we could hear the waves in our room instead of jackhammers! I would definitely return to this hotel.

We had an awesome stay at the Aston. The room was clean which was a must for me. Upon arrival we were upgraded to an ocean view (so nice of them to just upgrade for no extra cost). The hotel was in the perfect location, in my opinion. We loved tikis and lulu next door!! Enjoyed the free dvd rental onsite. My only complaint was that 2 different mornings at 6:30 am , large groups were picketing in front of the hotel. We stayed on the 17th floor and they still woke us. Obviously not in the hotels control but still a total bummer. I also wish breakfast could have been restocked until it was removed. Getting there 20 minutes before it ends to see everything completely picked over was a bit of a bummer as well. Regardless this hotel was clean and very modern!!! My husband and I would definitely choose to stay here again in the future, given the chance.

Overall, our stay was good. The room could use some touch up. Looks old, but they are clean. I love the free breakfast and I love that they give you a lunch bag so you can take it to the beach if you like to eat by the beach. Again, it was a good stay.

You really can't beat the location of this hotel. We were able to easily walk to the beach, surrounding restaurants, the Honolulu zoo, and meeting areas for the different tours we took. Included in the stay are unlimited DVD and PS3 game rentals (somewhat misleading, because there are only four different games to rent) and a continental breakfast. Offered at breakfast were items you'd see anywhere, but also some interesting items like taro donuts (loved these, not what I was expecting at all, much like a regular donut minus the blue color) and Japanese style noodles. You can also purchase other items, such as a custom made omelet for eight dollars. We did this one day in addition to our regular food and split it. The omelet was large and more than enough for the two of us. The downside to this delicious, continental breakfast? The SEATING. Most seats are around the pool and directly in the sun, and if you go anytime past seven AM, you'll be fighting for a seat. After we'd recovered from jet lag and woke up later than we had been, we chose on our last day to go back to the room and eat. Overall, we found the rooms to be spacious and clean. However, our bathroom had numerous tiny bugs crawling around. The other two couples traveling with us reported none in their rooms. Also, I found the elevators to be a hassle. In order to take the elevator, you MUST have your key, which then is scanned for going up or down. One day, we were trying to go down to leave and kept receiving the message, "See front desk." To make the matter worse, staircases are NOT easily located, in fact this may be the only hotel where I haven't seen a map on the back of the door or near the elevator bank listing the locations in case of emergency. We did eventually find the stairs thanks to another guest who knew of their location.

The highlight of this hotel was the tiki bar. The bartenders were awesome. Loved Hunter! They had great prime rib Poke and apple dessert. The hotel itself was not great. The room was loud and hot. Actually, the room and hallways were like saunas. They brought us a fan that didn't even work properly. We would have been OK with this average hotel if it hadn't felt like we were entering the "bowels of hell" (according to my roommate).
