The poolside breakfast buffet that was included in our package was just OK. The lines were very long. They give you little coolers to pack the food into to take to the beach. Our coolers were missing but the check-in person gave us replacements. The partial ocean view was just that, partial. It means you are facing the hotel next door and have to crane your neck to the side to see the ocean. Waikiki in general has too many people for me. Eat breakfast at LuLu's instead. The corned beef hash was delicious!!

Beautiful hotel in front of the popular waikiki beach. Get a sea view room and you are going to have a great view while waking up. Great location. Close to restaurants and retail stores. The staff was very friendly as well. I recommend this hotel for family vacations! Mahalo

Very acomidating for me and my family. They had a nice clean crib waiting in our room when we arrived. Cold water all day at front desk and coffee during morning and night. Breakfast on the beach was more like breakfast poolside. Lots of selection for pastries and fruit. If you wanted any type of protein you had to pay for it but price was good and so was food. Rooms were small but clean. Great location with everything at our finger tips.
user_name:
Michelle W
Otis, Oregon, United States

review_body: If I was reviewing Waikiki I'd have negative results. But I'm reviewing the accommodations. The rooms were large. Clean. Staff was great. Good location. Found the price to be worth the stay. Easy to say. You don't need a five star in this area. You need a clean room with helpful staff at a good price. You found it.

We have been to Hawaii many times and normally stay at another hotel. This time for a change we chose the Aston waikiki beach hotel. I have to say after reading the reviews I was a little skeptical on staying here. However we only checked in yesterday and have to say we are absolutely rapped with what the hotel has to offer. The included breakfast this morning was amazing, the views are incredible and exactly the same that we got from other hotels which we paid almost triple the price for. The rooms are modern, clean and spacious. My room was cleaned this morning to an impeccable level and best of all the kids get free movies and play station games for any days we want to stay in! The check in was flawless, the beds are very comfortable and anytime we have needed anything it has been supplied in a matter of minutes. We are here for three weeks and are very happy with our change of accomodation. Only suggestion I would add to the hotel would be as you are a family hotel if you could somehow incorporate a laundry you hotel would get 100% rating from me. (Only because we are here for three weeks it would be handy). However they do offer a laundry mat close by onsite would be more convenient. Rebecca Moffrey

We spent 4 days here before heading back home to Sydney. Whilst the room was clean, it was very noisy which was too be expected being right on the main road. The staff were lovely and helpful and the beds were definitely comfortable. The wifi wasn't the best but it wasn't the end of the world. Definitely would return.

No words can describe the experience I had in hawaii this is my second visit with the same hotel.. wonderful and friendly staff..amazing atmosphere across the street from the beach.. lots of shops and restaurants near by. Will be visiting again soon.
user_name:
mis325
New York City, New York

review_body: Great service and nice room set up and close to the city and I love the hotel service. I will encourage my friends and families to check in the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. My stay was a wonderful and memorable one.

Was a bit nervous being rated a 2 star hotel but on arrival wow. The staff are very friendly the rooms are clean and the location is so conveniently located. Far away from the busy end of town but close enough to walk to great restaurants and shopping. We were located in room 301 and I would say the best view, I could watch my husband surf from the balcony and the traditional luau held 3 times a week. Would definitely stay again.

When arriving in Honolulu for the very first time I expected a wonderful welcoming with the lais and cocktail . Did not happen, but to give them credit we arrived late and I'm sure all were home sleeping. The hotel was very clean in appearance, but you could so tell it was dated. We had asked for a king non smoking with a view, ended up with two doubles , and a side view of another building :0(. The pool and outdoor areas of the hotel were beautiful and relaxing , the bar service excellent. If I ever have the privilege of going back there, I will shop around.

The hotel is old and run down. They advertise complimentary breakfast on the beach which 1 is included in your daily room fee2 means you take the free cooler they give you go to the buffet on the third floor and take your breakfast to the beach. 3 there breakfast is very basic, yogurt, pastries and fruit. If you want eggs it's another $8. Our room key didn't work and after numerous times asking we gave up and would enter our room through our kids adjoining one.

I just returned from 4 nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and unfortunately, I have more negative then positive things to report.We were looking to stay at a moderately priced hotel for the first 4 nights of our trip as we were moving onto the St. Regis on Kaua'i next and were splurging there. My expectations weren't over the top, I simply wanted a well located, clean, comfortable room.On the positive end of the spectrum, the hotel is in a great location in terms of beach access and convenience to the local shops and restaurants. Two steps out the front valet area and you on are the main drag in Waikiki. The room we had originally booked (king bed) was unavailable when we checked in, so we were upgraded to a room with a full ocean view on the 14th floor. And, MAN, what a view it was! The view was absolutely stunning and hands down, the highlight of the trip. We had a full 180 degree panoramic view from Diamond Head on the left, all the way down the beach to the right. Wow!The staff was very friendly and helpful, there's a free continental breakfast included in your room price, which was nice, and they had live music in the pool area morning and evening. Unfortunately, other than these points, the hotel was a huge let down.To start, the rooms are very, very worn and outdated. Even our, "superior view" room was thread bear. There's no pictures on the wall, etc. The beds are insufferably uncomfortable...mine had a divot in the middle as if the mattress were 10 years old. The sheets were scratchy to the point of being uncomfortable on my face, and there are only two thin sheets with a thin blanket in between to cover yourself....no comforter, no duvet, no blanket. The thermostat in our room was broken, so the only way to achieve much needed AC was to allow it to blast on non-stop at a mind numbing 65 degrees. Again, with no blanket to cover up, we froze all night. Opening the balcony door wasn't an option at night because you can hear EVERYTHING coming up from the street...all night long. Music, laughter, sirens, traffic. It's a busy, loud street late into the night, and the position of the hotel, while beautiful for ocean viewing, is horrible for peace and quiet.The bathroom was tiny, especially the sink area...there wasn't room for 2 people's toiletries. The towels were tiny, thin, and scratchy. The showerhead itself was positioned so low that even at my fairly normal height of 5'7, I had to bend down to get the top of my head wet.While we did have free wifi in our room, it didn't work out on the balcony (ummm, what)? So, it was limiting.Overall, I would pass on this hotel and spend a few more dollars and stay at one of the other newer, nicer resorts along this road.

We stayed at the Aston before and after our hawaii cruise. Rooms are pretty worn and need some updating, especially the bathrooms. However, the beds were super comfortable. This makes yp for it. The hotel does offer a free breakfast (pretty good) and a pool. Both good perks. Also, there are numerous restaurants, like Tiki's, that have good food and service, and shopping close by. Waikiki Beach is right across the street. If you can tolerate a bit of wear this is a good downtown hotel. Beware -- it is very busy in this area!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was booked through a travel agent. We could not have been happier! The location is amazing and the rooms were fabulous! Our room had a spectacular view of the sunset! Several reviews comment on the bathrooms and room size, however they were not an issue for us. We did not spend much time in the room so they were more than adequate. The hotel is literally steps from the beach. Staff is very friendly and someone is always cleaning something. Even the walkways were cleaned very early in the morning. The only issue we had was with the WiFi, but management took care of the issue. The breakfast by the pool was nice and we took it to the beach a time or two. It is mostly pastries, cereal, yogurt and fruit, but we liked having the option on the days we didn't have time to go out for breakfast.We hope to return soon to Hawaii and this will definitely be where we stay!!

Had an amazing trip & great stay at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Location was ideal...right across from the beach and at the Diamond Head side of Waikiki which we liked. Rooms were nice but as most people have said, the place is older and bathrooms could do for renovations. Not a big deal though. We were on our honeymoon and inquired about upgrading when we arrived. We arrived on a sunday night and the place was packed. The said we could upgrade on Wednesday free of charge to a ocean view. Our first room was nice but no balcony (a small one not big enough for a chair) and not much of a view. Second room, the view was amazing and we had a bigger balcony which was great! Breakfast was good for continental. Its difficult to find a place to sit during this time so we usually would have to bring it back to the room. We ate on the beach one morning which was nice as well. Didn't usually have any issues finding space near the pool during the day. Staff were VERY friendly and the place had a pretty chill/relaxed atmoshepere. Tiki's is right in the hotel which is great. Lots of close restaurants nearby! The amenities fee also includes wifi in the rooms and movie rentals. Wifi always worked well for us. Overall, we had a great vacation here. The only negative would be that there were a couple of days that we did not receive housekeeping service. It was obvious that they were super busy so the first day we just asked for clean towels, coffee (2 a day included in amenities fee) and toilet paper (we were out). it wasn't a big deal. The second day, they came around 430 pm just as we came back to the room to shower and get ready for supper (we had a sunset cruise booked and were getting picked up at 530) but our room was done early the following day so it wasn't a huge deal! Thank you to all the staff at this hotel! Can't wait to return some day!

This is the WORST hotel experience I have ever had. BED BUGS! DO NOT STAY HERE! Aside from checking out of the hotel with 4 bed bug bites, 9 bed bug bites for one of my other friends, and 3 for the third friend staying in the same room, hotel management did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to accommodate us! First, we checked into our hotel room, and the a/c was broken. Then we find out the refrigerator was on, but didn't even keep our foods/bottled waters cold. Everything placed into the refrigerator was stored at room temperature hours and days later. Then, the hair dryer doesn't work. Next, we pull the pull out bed from the couch and there is a huge disgusting brown stain on the mattress. Then comes the worse of all, bed bugs. Three out of five guests in the room woke up with itchy bed bug bites. We go downstairs to the front desk clerk, Geri, to tell her about the awful situation. She calls a third party contracted company and has the 3/5 of us fill out a claim informing us that the hotel's insurance company would be reaching out to us in a few days. In addition, they had us pack all of our belongings, and the hotel moves us into a different room. This process took over an hour, and it was the most inconvenient experience for a vacation. In this new room, the sink was broken. We had to turn it a specific way in order for it to turn off and not waste water. Great... We were already behind schedule for our day activities, but made it back in time to get ready for dinner. One of the guests in our room sat on the couch for about an hour while waiting for the bathroom to be free so that she could have her turn to shower. She gets off the couch, and finds 3 new bed bug bites. At this point, we are disgusted and do NOT want to stay here. We call the front desk, and the same process occurs. Third party contracted company comes up to our room, the guest that got bit fills out a claim, and they want to move us AGAIN. We do NOT want to pack all our things again. We want to check out of this disgusting hotel. Both the night shift supervisor, Steph and hotel manager, Adam, advised that they could not offer any refund, waive any hotel resort or parking fees, or do anything to accommodate us except move us to a different room. WHY ON EARTH WOULD WE WANT TO MOVE ROOMS AGAIN when the same situation occurred. The risk of moving rooms is the same as staying in the bug infested room. We even asked, "what would you want the hotel to do for you if you were in our situation?" And they both responded with "we would want to be compensated." Exactly. We wanted our refunds or ANYTHING to better the situation, but neither did NOTHING!! We clearly did not want to pack all of our belongings and move rooms AGAIN. Adam repeatedly said everything is dealt through the hotel's insurance, and it would be against hotel policy to waive the approximate $25 resort fees per night and $27 parking per night. This totaled to $209 in fees that we had to pay. We figured this situation would be an exception, but they made no effort to better the situation. We were furious. WE ARE NEVER STAYING HERE AGAIN, and this is a warning to all guests. This hotel needs to be thoroughly inspected, and the priority of the hotel needs to be shifted to care more for their customers because that was clearly lacking.

The hotel is right on the beach!!!!! The view from our room was spectacular! Loved their "breakfast on the beach" concept! Geri at the front desk was so friendly and made sure we had a great stay. She really made us feel like we were special guests! This is a great hotel to stay at for all ages! Can't wait to go back!!!!!

In oct 2011 we went to Hawaii for the first time for my partners 50th birthday. We stayed at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel. We had a great stay - check out my review back then. So this year was my 50th birthday and there was no where else I wanted to be than Hawaii. I did some research for a few other hotels thinking we might want to try something else. But I kept coming back to Astons website and remembering how great it was to stay there. So I booked it again. We arrived about 4:00 pm on a Saturday. The valets were right there and ready to help us unload the car and get me set up for parking. They explained the process that I remembered from before. Up to the third floor to check in and was greeted with a warm aloha and a welcome back. They got us checked in right away, explained the elevator system and sent us to our room. This time on the 12th floor looking right out over Waikiki beach. The room was clean, bed comfortable, bathroom well equipped and a view to die for. On the second night we had taken a free movie from the box downstairs to watch in the room. For some reason we were not able to get it working. We called for maintenance and they were there within 5 minutes. He fixed the machine (operator error on my part) and showed us how to work it properly. We enjoyed our movie and had a nice evening. Every time we needed the car we would call down and it was always there waiting for us. The valets were all friendly and helpful and always asked how our day was or what excursions we had done and always seemed genuinely interested. Just a great group of people down there. We had breakfast at the pool all but 2 mornings. One morning we took our bag of food and 2 chairs supplied by the hotel and sat on the beach eating breakfast. The other morning we are at a Lu lus for my birthday breakfast. (But that's another great review to come) the breakfast at Aston is good. They offer a good mix of regular and local items, donuts, bagels, pastries, sushi, soup, cereal etc. coffee, tea, juices, milk. All included in the room charge. You can also get a custom omelet or waffle for a small additional fee. For added enjoyment there is a singer and hula dancer that are great performers and welcome audience participation. It's just a really nice way to start every day. Sadly after 8 days it was time to go home. The checkout process was easy and painless. No surprise charges or anything in the bill. Very straightforward. However, since we had a 10pm flight I asked if there was any way we could have a late checkout. They asked how late and I answered 6:00 pm with a laugh knowing no hotel lets you stay that late. She looked in the screen and said that wouldn't be a problem and would only be $75.00. WOW! Seriously! I've asked other hotels in New England for a 1:00 pm checkout and am always told that I would have to pay for a full night.Well here is Aston stepping it up. We loved having the room until it was time to go the airport. It allowed us to see the pride parade, go to the pride festival, do some last minute shopping and have our last Hawaiian meal. Then take a nice shower before heading home. I guess since I've only stayed at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel the 2 times I went to Hawaii I don't have much to compare it to. But I will say just walking through some other hotel areas I can tell I made the right choice with Aston. Really hope I can come back in 2 years and stay at the best hotel on Waikiki beach. Thank you to all at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel!

This was our first time staying at the resort. The building is older and do for an upgrade. Our view was great and you could walk across the road to reach the beach. The staff was professional, awesome and very helpful! My aunt lost something personal and Ed went out his way to help her locate it and returned it back to her. What a great guy! The staff even printed our flight tickets at the front desk. Customer Service with a Smile. I would recommend this resort.

My husband and I just returned from Hawaii and we stayed at the Aston for 9 nights, the hotel was probably the most oldish looking one but our room was better than I imagined from reading other reviews, (booked a delux ocean view but not sure we got it) we had an ocean view from the side of the hotel - floor 14, from looking at the hotel set up in pretty sure we should of had a room on the front, the balcony was very small but overall it was clean and spacious enough for us everything worked and we didn't need to ask the hotel staff for anything. The wifi was good but would have been great if it worked around the hotel and not just in the room, it didn't work on the balcony either.I didn't rate the breakfast - I mean pastries and cereal got a tad boring after day 3 so we decided to venture out the rest of the mornings. The pool area is small but welcoming and the tiki bar was great - cheap food and drinks.We didn't use the valet but it seemed to be very hectic and I heard a lot of people complaining. The trolley/bus stop out the front was really convenient to get about and the beach over the road was perfect. The activity/tour desk gave us very misleading information and after spending almost $2000aud we were a little disappointed with the outcomes of the tours/activities having not been told the correct information when booking.I would visit Hawaii again but id stay somewhere that offered a little more than what the Aston did but mahalo for making our trip one to remember.

We stayed in a Partial Oceanview Room, the view was great! It's on the quieter end of Waikiki, while at the same, within walking distance from everything!! I loved the beachfront location and the "Breakfast on the Beach" bags that we used to pack breakfast in. Overall, it was a great place to stay!! Very friendly staff as well!

We stayed here for 15 nights in room 707 with a great view of Waikiki beach. The room was fine a little outdated but it done the job. This hotel is situated in a great spot down the Diamond head end of Waikiki close to shops restaurants and beach. Thanks to all the friendly staff nothing was a problem to them Cheers Andrew

at first they did not tell us the pool was out of order, i think they should of had that up on the website to let people know, breakfast is less then average, with sour fruit and sugary pastries every day, got a bit boring . loved the access to free DVDs perfect for a rainy day, location is fantastic right where you want to be. comfy bed but small room

We had a wonderful 7 day vacation in Waikiki celebrating our 15 year anniversary. We traveled with family of 14 people. I prepared myself after reading countless review about this hotel, some good some not so good. I knew before hand of all the amenity and valet parking fees so no surprises there. We had a 15 passenger Van and when we first pulled up the valet looked frightened but they accommodated us and we had a good experience with the valet staff. Never waited more than 10 mins. Check in was fast and easy. We had four standard rooms on the 5th floor. I tried to get us moved up to higher floors but they were unable to accommodate our request, no biggie we were still had a slight partial view of the ocean. Besides we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room anyway as we were out exploring the island. All of our rooms were clean and comfortable with the exception one that we had problems with. The bathroom had a strong odor of wet mildew, the hairdryer was not working, there was something disgusting on the balcony, and the room door paint was peeling off. Once brought to the staffs attention they quickly did a thorough cleaning of the room and replaced the hairdryer. Breakfast was nice, Kiosk for movies and games was great to have. Loved that we were able to check out towels and beach chairs. Elevator system worked good. Overall we enjoyed our stay and hope to visit again soon. Mahalo!

This trip was a special surprise birthday present for my daughter and the staff at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel made it even more special with their excellent customer service. We were checked in by Emma, who cheerfully upgraded us (without being asked) from partial ocean view to full ocean view deluxe on the 10th floor. The room had two queen beds and an absolutely perfect view of Waikiki Beach. Yes, as many have said, this is an older hotel and it did show in places, but it was clean and provided us with everything we needed. (After all, we were in Hawaii and who would want to spend excess time in the hotel?!) We rented a car and the bell staff were very accommodating and friendly (sorry, I didn't get names!). Yes, it did cost $27/day, but to us it was worth it so we could travel the island at our leisure. The "beach breakfasts" were satisfactory. My daughter loved the pastries and fruit, I'm more of a bacon & eggs person. One down-side, there are very few tables by the pool, so we had to sit on chaise lounges to eat - a bit uncomfortable. We didn't see too many people carrying chairs to the beach - and we didn't opt for that either.We did not eat at the Tiki Bar/Restaurant as neither of us saw anything on the menu that really appealed, but it did seem full each evening. We could hear the partying in our room, which disturbed my daughter more than me, because I was asleep the moment I hit the pillow!The walls are a bit "thin" and we could hear movement in the next room, i.e. toilet flushing, doors opening/closing - but not bothersome to me.A special thank you to the front desk staff: Geri, Glenn (who checked us out and printed our boarding passes), and of course to sweet Emma. I have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone wanting to stay on Waikiki and I will stay there again - someday soon, I hope.

Aston Waikiki beach hotel, a great place to stay, close to every thing, you can walk to most places, Honolulu zoo just across the road,walk across the road and you are on the beach, Staff very friendly rooms comfortable. all in all would have no hesitation staying there again.

The look of the hotel is beautiful but there were a few flaws. Free Wi-Fi in rooms - Twice I had to get someone to check the connections as it kept disappearing. After that there was quite often "limited access" which meant sometimes it went and sometimes it didn't. The biggest problem was they would not re-stock the toilet paper. Twice I had to ask for some. I had to resort to the tissues and even supplied my own at one stage. And it wasn't just our room - we heard some other people down the corridor asking the hotel cleaners for some more as well. The hair dryer never went. But I never complained about that since I`d already complained about the Wi-Fi and toilet paper enough times. There was no laundry at the hotel and we never had a laundry bag or form to have our laundry sent out. This wasn't a major issue as it was a good excuse to buy more clothes. And the other issue was the air conditioning was cold. It wouldn't turn up, only down. I could turn it off but this just gave me the choice of hot and stuffy or bloody freezing. The breakfasts were a good idea, the staff were friendly, the beds were comfy and the beach was right over the road. But if I`m going to be staying anywhere for a couple of weeks, it will be somewhere that at least has toilet paper!

Firstly staff lack enthusiasm, if you don't want to work don't, happy faces would have been nice and polite to see. We were originally in a ocean view select room and found out roof to be leaking water, tried to say it was moisture it was like a mini waterfall! Have video footage. Ended up being moved to an ocean front view which was nice of them! The amenities fee is crap! Ate breakfast on the beach once because it was crappy food! So we spent $700+ Aus dollars for nothing what a waste! Website says "indulge with an arrival amenity of Hawaii-made treats personally selected by the hotel’s general manager" this didn't happen! Over priced, unpleasant staff! And breakfast on the beach is terrible way to rip people off!

This was my 4th visit to this hotel & experience was as good as I remember. My last visit was in 2011, and they have done some upgrades since then. The pool deck is completely new & quite nice! I read some previous reviews about he old pool deck furniture, but they have added all new furniture. Pro's: LOCATION! Gorgeous views of the beach & all amenities close by. Views from our room were fabulous! We chose the partial ocean view deluxe room & it was perfect. We have always stayed in the oceanfront rooms, but we were on a tighter budget this go round. I was still quite happy with our view from the 7th floor! Staff was wonderful from the front desk down to the cleaning staff. I asked for an additional chair & it was brought right up. We had the "do not disturb" sign on our door as I was leaving one morning & the maid saw me & quickly asked if she could at least refresh my towels, soaps, coffee, etc. We had a late flight home, and even though they were sold out, the front desk clerk (wish I remembered his name) was able to work some magic & allow us to check out an hour later, which gave us a place for a quick shower after an a.m. beach visit. This was a huge help! As mentioned before, pool deck was very nice! We never had a problem finding a lounger during the late afternoon. They also have a small drink/snack area by the pool where you can purchase drinks, hot dogs, etc., & they have frozen mocha's that are delicious! Breakfast was great. As others said it is carb laced which isn't too great, but they do at least offer yogurt and milk to get a little protein. I would say it is a step above a continental breakfast in that there was a larger variety, i.e. cereals, oatmeal, fresh fruit, several juices, etc. What I did was go to ABC & buy a hardboiled egg in their deli to go with my breakfast each morning & all was well! You can also buy the "extra" omlet or waffles, but I found that to be overpriced for what you got. Cons: I've seen comments about the rooms being dated. I don't feel this is an issue, & in fact the rooms were remodeled just before my first stay in 2007. I've noticed since then they've done some refreshing, with new paint, headbords, & dinette sets. What I did have a problem with was the bathroom & I will absolutely support this complaint! My particular issue was the floor. It was absolutely disgusting. It wasn't a lack of cleaning, but more permenant filth from being just plain old & guessing the original tile. Note to management, please make your next "project" a bathroom refresh. I personally wouldn't have a problem if you left the dated fixtures (vanity/tub) as they were in perfect condition, but the floor & ceiling where they repainted over mold has got to be replaced. This is the main reason I wasn't quite ready to give this a 5 star rating. We went to use the safe & there was a sign advising of a charge to use it? It is absurd that this would not be included in the lovely "resort fee" that is mandatory to stay here. I was disappointed at this. As many have complained, the "resort fee". Management can defend it anyway they want to, but if you have a MANDATORY fee that is not optional then you need to include it in the listing price of the room. It is beyond annoying when you see a room price of say $150/night only to push forward to the final booking screen to see your rate is now $200+ with taxes and resort fees. Put the higher price up front so there is no misinterpretation, bait & switch, etc. I saw management reply to an earlier comment with something to the effect of "resort fees are common in Waikiki", I ask does this excuse work with your kids? i.e. "everyone else is doing it....". Two wrongs don't make a right. I appreciate management taking the time to reply to reviewers, however you have a loyal customer in me, so please do not ruin that with a condescending reply attempting to justify the "resort fee". Nothing you can say is gong to change my view & condescending comments will only push me away from your facility for future visits. Overall, for the price we paid the return of investment was great. Our price with all fees & taxes ended up just over $180/night, and unless you want to go a block or two off beach you really can't find anything better I will stay here again if I can get a similar deal.

We went for our honeymoon and couldn't have been more pleased. This was my 3rd time to the island and was eager to get back. After a long flight we were surprised at check in with a 25th floor room and were blown away by the views. In Honolulu resort fees are the norm but unlike other properties these folks give you a continental breakfast (I suggest going to Lulu's if want a hot meal- they charge a LOT for waffles or eggs) along with cooler to store your "snacks" to pick on all day, beach towels and chairs. You just don't get that anywhere else. True there isn't enough seating poolside to accommodate all guests for breakfast but why would you want to eat by a pool when the beach is across the street anyway? The parking fees are a bit high, if you don't want to pay the absurd $27 a day then park at the lot on the corner down a way for $18. The room was clean, the bed was OK (I sleep on memory foam at home so am spoiled) and yes the bathrooms need an upgrade but is convenient, staff is amazing and you do get more for your $$ here. Mahalo, A hui hou kakou!

Great location walk to the beach. Make sure you take the provided cooler to breakfast as there is no plates to carry everything on and get what you want because you can only go through once. Rooms are ok balcony only had one chair so you cannot sit outside with anyone. Bathroom could of been cleaner.

An awesome location just a pedestrian crossing away from spectacular Waikiki Beach. The room itself was a good size and very comfortable with partial ocean view. Nothing to complain about. The access to the lifts was interesting, the pool a little small for the amount of guests. The free DVD kiosks are a good idea but unfortunately the PS3 player provided was faulty so didn't get to watch my movie )-: Valet parking was extremely efficient and helpful. Check in was efficient though the gentleman at reception was somewhat less than enthusiastic though this may have been due to the amount of people checking in at 3pm check in time. Checking out was easy and the lady was very helpful and cheery. Though free WIFI was offered in room the signal was very weak and ultimately useless.Overall the hotel was exactly what was needed for a one night stay, close to everything, clean and comfortable though fixing the WIFI would be good.

It was an average family hotel that we wanted and booked through Travelocity. The service is average but that what we paid for and expected. A couple of the parking attendants were unfriendly and slightly rude at times however the rest of staff were friendly and courteous. At registration, we were told of the $23 daily amenity fee but I declined saying we come to enjoy Waikiki beach and not the hotel. They rebutted that breakfast was part of the amenity. When we booked Trevelocity presented breakfast as inclusive. Next came the $27 daily valet parking fee. I asked for self parking as I did not want to pay extra for this ego boosting service. They told me I have no choice. Overall the stay would have been pleasant except for the valet parking which turned out to be time wasting and frustrating rather than a service. At peak times after breakfast and before dinner, there were only two valets fetching for more than a dozen guests and the waiting time could be 30 to 45 mins just go to dinner. It would have been much faster for me to walk to my car and drive away than sitting there watching the minutes ticks away. My advice, factor the amenity and valet parking fees into the price offered by Travelocity.

This was our second time staying here and again had a wonderful stay. When we first arrived they had been kind enough to upgrade us but it was to a room on the 20th floor and I am very afraid of heights. But when I called down they moved us to a room on a lower floor right away. Everyone we came in contact with there was wonderful. Front desk, valet and our housekeeper Marilyn was wonderful. The bed and pillows were so comfortable there that when we got home we were forced to buy a new mattress. Already looking forward to our next stay. Thank you!!

Aston Waikiki on the BeachThe reason we chose this hotel was primarily because of it fantastic location, good price and the resort fee that seemed to be compulsory everywhere I looked actually included breakfast. I spent a long time searching the net on all the hotel booking sites only to find the best price was to book direct. We prepaid everything before going including our resort fee.We taxied from the Airport probably our first mistake $50USD including tip and took about 30 minutes. On returning to the airport we used the hotel shuttle $12USD plus tip per person and took only 45 minutes as it was filled primarily with our hotels guests it only had one other stop so there was very little time difference to the airport when comparing to the cab. Obviously if there are more people then by all means for convenient to jump in a cab.We arrived at the hotel about 1pm and although we could check in, our room was not ready until 2.30pm and guaranteed by 3pm. Over the next few days it did seem from what I observed that the rooms weren't available for early check in very often.We booked a room with a partial ocean front view and a balcony with a chair ( some were only walkout balconies not for siting out on). We were on the 8th floor and had no problems with noise from either the music or traffic.We had beautiful views of Waikiki Beach and also overlooked the pool. On the down side was that we faced west making our room quite warm and by lunchtime way to hot to sit on the balcony, but the mornings and evening especially sunset were stunning.The rooms were average decor but certainly comfortable as was the king size bed,a FRIDGE, coffee maker and we requested a kettle for making tea. There was plenty of drawer and hanging space for our clothes.We had a DVD player in our room and on checkin you are given a card that allows you to go to a self serve machine and select DVDs to watch all of which were complimentary, great for night time or a bit of timeout.Our bathroom had a shower over the bath.It also had a bar and 2 stools to sit on inside the room which was a little bizarre as the curtains and door didn't pull back far enough to enjoy the view and as soon as you opened the door the air con stopped anyway, but it was still nice to have somewhere for both of us to sit and enjoy a drink. We had to call room service for a corkscrew and couldn't get a wine glass which I thought was wrong they should have been in our room to start with.There was a ice machine on our floor.The resort fee included breakfast and on checkin we were told that we had little cooler bags in our rooms that were for our use at breakfast and that we were welcome to fill these up from the buffet and use them throughout the day or even go across and sit on the beach for breakfast. A bit confusing until the first breakfast experience and we walked around the buffet filling up our little cooler bag, with cut up fruit, muffins, pastries, yoghurts, bagels, spreads. Tea and coffee was also available as much as you wanted but the buffet was not able to returned too, so get everything you want in one go. Also available for purchase were Belgian Waffles, omelettes, juice and toast. A lovely touch was the live Hawaiian music and dancers a beautiful way to wake up and start your day in Hawaii.The hotel has a great little bar restaurant on site called Tiki's that has a great atmosphere, good food at reasonable prices and stunning views especially at a Sunset and there is live music everyday.The pool area was nothing special and there was no spa but the biggest downer for me was that there was not a self serve laundry on site. The fitness area was adequate. Another plus for this hotel was the Elevator system a little strange to work out at first but it works really well and we had very little wait on lifts.I would give this hotel a solid 8/10 it wasn't luxury in fact nowhere near it but it's personal touches, breakfast, atmosphere, and location more then made up for it.We really enjoyed staying here and would definitely book in again on our next visit.

simply horrible1. breakfast is motel 6 quality. el cheapo. no eggs. no meat.2. not enough seating for breakfast so their marketing department invented a clever "breakfast on the beach" bag to FORCE YOU to eat offsite. i repeat: BREAKFAST ON THE BEACH IS A SCAM. prior to arrival i was tricked into thinking it was be some nice special thing, the reality is it is a trick to make you box up your bagel & toast to eat offsite since they only have 6 tables so good luck fighting for a space on those with hundreds of guests.NOTE: "BREAKFAST ON THE BEACH" IS A SCAM. 3. slot key sensor in room doors read card 30% of time which means you generally need to swipe key 3 or more times.4. elevators. it is necessary to go thru 2 elevators to go to your room. each elevator is in different format. push 1 to get to ground floor. push * to get to lobby. to return to room hold room card over sensor, wait for "?" prompt, enter first 2 digits of your room number. confused? your not alone.5. bathrooms at the restaurant/pool require a key code combination that is only available from bartender or waitress if you manage to hunt them down. feels like a mcdonalds in NYC where everything is on full lock down. 6. pillows. pillows are cheap quality and to guarantee a bad night sleep.7. many/most rooms have adjoining doors so you hear your neighbors partying until late hours.

We almost booked our room here initially. My husband was really interested in the breakfast on the beach every morning. Of course we would have booked an ocean view or an oceanfront room, but as it turned out I found a great deal on a condo and talked him into having breakfast there every morning. We ended up at Aston Waikiki beach for one night and really only for a few hours because United had some flight issues and they were gracious enough to put us up for the night. So it could be that because we had a voucher from an airline we ended up with the nastiest room in the resort, or it could be that any room that isn't ocean view or oceanfront is just a dive. And that's pretty much how I would describe our room. It was run down. The tile in the bath was in need of repair. The bath wasn't even clean, there were a couple of hairs that had been missed by housekeeping. The room was dark. No brightly colored tropical prints on the bed or the walls. The elevators have no buttons. You scan your room key in the outside of the elevator and put in the floor before you get on the elevator. Just a little bizarre. I was grateful we hadn't booked and stayed here. And the coffee maker was a kuerig which was fantastic but the room had no to go cups and no decaf pods and sadly for me I have to have decaf. It was room 2012 which had a view of other hotels. It was also a double queen and the darling at the front desk, she really was a dear, said it was a mini-suite. There was nothing suite-ish about it.

If you want to stay at a nice hotel in Waikiki with prime location, great prices, and great service, then the Aston Waikiki is your best bet. Everything was wonderful. No problems whatsoever. Comfy bed in a nice ocean view room. Very nice hotel. We will be back.

This is one of the many 3 star hotels located in Waikiki. If you're looking for luxury accommodations, this is not your hotel. Pricing is typical for Waikiki accommodations but this hotel does sit beach front on Kalakaua Avenue. It is located at the very end of the Waikiki strip closest to the Honolulu Zoo. Parking is Valet only and will cost you $27 per day with poor service at best. Expect to wait 15 minutes just to drop your vehicle off and longer for pickup. We paid extra for the "Beach View" room which was 10 floors below our friends and a smaller room. Definitely not worth the expense, save your money for parking. Rooms allow in a significant amount of street noise. Facilities are dated and cramped. Check in can be an uncomfortable experience if you show up mid afternoon and are forced to stand in line (and the sun) for 20 minutes. There is a daily continental type breakfast offered with the price of the room, it begins promptly at 6:30am. Omelets, eggs, bacon, etc are offered at an additional charge.

Cannot fault this place at all. Great location beautiful staff ...Couldn't work out why all these people had the little green cooler bags, when it was my turn the lady kindly gave me a spare bag n explained the breakfast system, which was awesome

There was a power failure the night we arrived however, we were checked in, luggage stowed and encouraged to go have dinner until the power came on and the elevators were operating again. Staff were very pleasant and the hotel was clean and well maintained. Our room was on the 21st floor, and as my daughter observed, looked exactly like the photo in the brochure. We had the perfect view of the Zoo, Diamond Head and when we looked to the right, the beautiful beach/ocean and breakwater/pier. The only downfall to the room was its proximity to the elevator cars which were quite noisy and took a couple days to get used to. The elevators themselves were easy to use - I read many reviews stating that they were confusing and difficult to use but we found them easy to work with. The complimentary buffet breakfast each morning was also quite nice. Yes, the offerings were the same every day but it was free, why complain about something free??! We picked up extra fruit and yogurts, muffins and pastries which helped tide the kids over on car rides around the island in addition to eating breakfast three days out of our week. The pool area was clean and tidy, throughout my stay and the restaurants and bars on site were all great. We dined at the Wolfgang Pucks on three occasions, once getting take out and every time, everything was perfect.

Had an awesome vacation @ the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Did a little research before I booked the property and so I pretty much knew what to expect and what not. We booked through a third-party website and got a pretty sweet deal. Location, location, location...it's perfect! The ocean is right in front of you as well as the amazing view of the diamond head. The rooms are not as bad they describe it to be. Yes, they can use some remodeling and updating. But hey, when we were in Hawaii, we were hardly in the bathrooms! It serves its purpose. The only two things I would recommend management to take a second look into are the ridiculous parking charges. I know it's Waikiki but it's totally impractical. Second, breakfast food. It's very generous of them, really. And I totally thank them that I dont have to worry about where I'm going to get food early in the morning. My suggestion is, to add a little bit more variety. On the 4th morning, I had to go to the nearest mcdonalds. But overall, it was nice. They also have little baskets in each room for you to take whatever you want from the breakfast buffet and take it to the beach or wherever you want to. That was awesome.A few days before our arrival, I sent an email to their office for some requests. Not only did I get a prompt response, we also got what we requested for and more! Our rooms were pre-assigned before check in and on both rooms we found cards with our names on it and a box of chocolates! A very sweet touch! Will definitely stay with them again next time I visit Oahu and will recommend to friends!

What a pleasant surprise this Hotel was. I had never stayed at this end of Waikiki Beach, but with its position opposite the Kuhio Beach breakwall, its a MUST!!The Hotel itself is typical Waikiki. Neat and clean but obviously needing a few touch-ups. The OceanView rooms we had were superb [Level 21] and i highly recommend. The rooms aren't huge but are adequate and well set-up. Bathrooms are more than capable.The resort fees offer good Wi-fi coverage, free DVD movies and Games. The free breakfast is quite good. I didnt expect a hot-cooked meal and understood that the supply of pastries and fruit all came down to timing.The beach opposite is the best. Perfect for families and very clean and safe. Obviously the evergrowing problem of the homeless in Honolulu is an issue, but I found them to be quite relaxed in the area around the Hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and I really recommend to other families and especially other Australians. The only bummer was that staff never addressed the fact that our air-con didnt work and that our freezer component of fridge was faulty. Minor hiccups on an otherwise great value Hawaiian vacation. Mahalo

Told 1 price to upgrade and it cost me twice as much,she quoted me a price on a piece of paper i said ok signed the paper then saw the charge and price was added afterwards to the document OW the extra charges came to $1200.00 alittle bit to much for what they have to offer next time the Marriot or Sheraton Thank you

Stayed here for our 25th anniversary. Location is primo. The beach is right outside the door. Check in was smooth and the team at the "attractions" desk very very helpful. Internet is quite slow compared to other hotels we have stayed at. Breakfast by the pool is nice.
user_name:
nick k
Palmerston North, New Zealand

review_body: I did a half marathon back in April and this hotel was the perfect spot to stay because it was in close proximity to the start an finish line, right across the beach, and walking distance to just about everything in Waikiki. Everyone on the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. Rooms were comfortable and clean. We had an excellent view looking toward diamond head. Breakfast on the beach (at the pool) was better than any continental breakfast I've ever experienced and its everyday included with your resort fees. Lots of choices, hot miso soup was perfect, coconut flavored coffee, Hawaiian music and hula dancing. I sound like a tourist but I'm a local or kamaaina and yes some of us locals love that stuff too. Thanks Aston Waikiki beach for a pleasurable stay there. I will definitely be back. P.s everyday happy hour at Tiki's too!

We stayed at the Aston for 7 nights. When we checked in we were told our allocated room was not ready but a room on the floor second from the top and corner overlooking the main strip and beach was ready and we could have that......thank you very much!!!The staff are welcoming and friendly. The rooms are relatively basic, but our view made us forget that very quickly. A simple complimentary continental breakfast is provided and you can take it to the beach to eat is you prefer. The hotel is located at the zoo end of Kalakaua Ave. The pool area is basic. Bar area next to the pool. WiFi was available in the lobby area but not in the rooms. As other reviewers have mentioned, try and get a a room with a view of the beach. Restaurants were nothing amazing but with so many nearby it is hardly a problem. Overall an enjoyable stay.

Stayed at the Aston Wikiki Beach hotel from May 9, 2015 to May 16, 2015 with my wife for our 20 the anniversary. Although the hotel is older and dated, upgrades have been made to the pool / breakfast area. The customer service was excellent and the views of Diamond head and the beach were awesome. All the shuttle and tour bus services pick up right in front of the hotel. The beach is right across the street. Although the rooms are kind of small, they are very comfortable. Will definitely stay there on our next trip back.

Low key vibe, relaxing, great location. Get an ocean view on a higher floor! Tiki's Bar and Grill (in the hotel, but not affiliated) is just okay. We actually really liked LuLu's which is right next door. Some great restaurants are close by - d.k. steakhouse, Hula Grill, and Arancino Di Mare to name a few. The beach across the street is lovely, but beware of cutting yourself on the coral! We tried the beach in front of the Moana Surfrider which was amazing! I'd totally stay at the Aston Waikiki again and recommend it for families.

My brother and I were flying to Honolulu...just to stay there for 2 nights (kind of a long lay over). It was both of our first time ever in Hawaii, and after looking over expedia and trip advisor I chose the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and I couldn't have been more happy with my choice! The location was absolutely amazing!! Right across the street from the beautiful Waikiki Beach! When we went to go check in, the front desk staff were very nice and extremely helpful! They upgraded our room for us for free, which was such a nice surprise! We were given an ocean view room and it was beautiful. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable! They had a morning breakfast which I wish we were able to try out. In your room they even provide a little lunch bag type of thing that you can fill w/the breakfast food and take to the beach across the street to enjoy your breakfast on the beach. The staff was very helpful! we had a package coming via UPS and they informed us right away when it had arrived and signed for us (since we were out exploring as much as we could).Overall we absolutely loved this hotel and location. I will definitely be coming back. Staying for just two nights was definitely not enough time! Cant wait to come back and stay longer!

Nicely positioned hotel, easy walk to most popular places, right across the road from the beach. Try to get an ocean view (full or partial) it's worth it to watch the sunsets. Well equipped, nice rooms, cafes and restaurants with in easy reach. Staff were good.

I travelled with my husband and children and stayed at this property for 7 days. The positives would be the location, family friendly beach area across the road, trolley stop at door, variety of food outlets down stairs, Teddys' Subway' Wolfgang and a few more, convenience shop on site and 3 ABC shops very close by. Tikkis was very nice, enjoyed happy hour drinks in the arvos and food prices in line with other similar local restaurants. Good pool area and the breakfast, BOB as they call it, is exactly as advised. Take your allocated esky bag, loads of pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, juices and for a little extra omelettes if you like - great for us as food expensive in Waikiki and this helped. Loved the DVD / Game consoles in foyer, kids used these heaps and we had no problems with the Wifi, worked fast and reliably. Negatives, we paid for a full ocean facing room in a suite and was given the next level of room category down when we checked in. Room was nicely appointed, bathroom older but very clean and functioning and did the job. We had a great view of diamond head and the beach that side, but not what we had booked (couldn't help but think that was because we booked on one of their 20% off web specials). Staff have emailed to apologise but not the point. Overall though, we had a wonderful stay here, staff very polite, hotel very clean, lifts great and we would recommend to others and would return to stay there again.

The Aston Hotel is a great place to stay if your are willing to pay the price to stay on Waikiki Beach. Our family was on the 18th and 19th floor with an ocean view. From this vantage point, you can watch surfers, sunsets and see the night lights of Waikiki Beach. The rooms were clean when we checked in and were cleaned each day with clean towels daily and bed linen changed ever other day. The hotel staff was friendly and the valet service worked without a glitch. There is an amenity ($23) charge that covers internet service, complimentary breakfast, beach lunch bags, etc. The breakfast is really fruit, juices, coffee, yogurt, pastries and some kind of Asian soup. You have to pay extra for a real breakfast like omelets, eggs, etc. Security people were friendly and worked hard to keep unauthorized street traffic out of the lobby and third level where the pool is located. All other areas of the hotel require a room access card to enter (like the elevators). The pool area on the third level serves as the catering and eating area for the complimentary breakfast. The Aston is in a great location for visits to the beach, shopping and driving to other parts of Oahu. Beware of the amenities charge and valet parking charge added to your room rate.
user_name:
Steve K
Edisto Island, South Carolina

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Aston for two nights during our honeymoon. We booked the special newlywed package at a reduced rate. We received a souvenir frame and a bottle of sparkling wine as a congratulations. All the staff members we interacted with — from the front desk to housekeeping — were very friendly and accommodating. The resort fee pays for your breakfast, free DVD rentals (which we did not take advantage of), and towels at the pool (which is pretty small, but with the beach right across the street, who cares?).We got a partial ocean view room with a full-size lanai. It provided a great view of the ocean and sunset, so a full ocean view would have probably been overkill. They were able to accommodate our request for a high-floor room, which I had hoped would be less noisy. Having been up since 3 a.m. EST, we just wanted a little peace and quiet for our first night. We could still hear the festivities from the pool and bar from our 20th-floor room, however. I would recommend asking for a room on the Diamond Head side of the hotel if you want quiet (though I don't know how good the ocean view was from that side).The room was clean but definitely needs updated. The bathroom was tiny and didn't have a fan, so it got really hot during showers. We had trouble working the air conditioner (once we got it on, we couldn't get it to turn off) and the TV only had sound and no picture. But, you don't come to Hawaii to watch TV, so that didn't really bother us. The bed and pillows were pretty comfy, but there was no extra blanket provided. We appreciated the complimentary breakfast, though we wish there were more protein options instead of just fruit and pastries. Get there early, as there was a line before they opened at 6:30.... and beware – there are some greedy people who will take as many items as they can, even though there are signs (and common sense) that politely request not to do that.We mentioned these things (both good and bad) in the survey we got via email after we checked out and almost immediately received a response from the guest services coordinator. She apologized that our stay was not up to our expectations and offered a partial refund as a gesture of goodwill. Unnecessary — we really did have a nice time, and only wanted to let them know if the issues in our room so they could get them fixed — but appreciated all the same. Very impressed with the Aston's good customer service!
user_name:
Krysten B
Powell, Ohio, United States

review_body: Overall, the hotel is excellent. Staff go out of there way to help you. Morning breakfast is good. Enjoy starting the day with Hawaiian music. Transportation is convenient. Only downfall was housekeeping needs to pay a little more attention to cleaning the bathroom. Once this was mentioned, there were no more issues for the rest of our stay.

From the moment we stepped into this hotel, we had problems. I reserved 2 rooms ahead of time, about 3 months before our trip. My family and I arrived at the hotel to check into our rooms. We have requested ahead of time to either have our rooms next to each other or on the same floor. Front desk told us that our rooms were not ready. No problem, we understand we were 1 hour early to our check in time anyways so we left our luggage's with the Bell desk and went to explore. We ate and explored the nearby area for about 2 1/2 hours and then returned to the hotel to proceed to check in. The front desk girl told us that 1 of our rooms was ready, but the other one was having maintenance issues and so they would need to relocate us to another floor. We stood at the front desk for a good 20 mins while the front desk girl was still trying to check us in. After seeing that I was getting impatient and the people behind us were getting checked in to their rooms fairly quickly, she proceeded to instruct my family and I to go up to the 1 room and wait for her. She mentioned something about her computer having glitches and that she would personally come up and hand us our new room location and keys once she gets that fixed. So we did as told and went up to the room to wait. My family and I waited in the room for a good 15-20 mins, no word. Finally, we got restless and called the front desk from the room to see what was going on. The front desk continues to tell us that they cannot get us our rooms, and quickly passed us along to their supervisor. The supervisor (Stephen) was also not helpful and proceeded to tell me that our rooms would not be ready for another hour! I was getting pretty irritated and angry, the fact that (1) they sent us all up here to wait with the promise that we would get our room, (2) then they don't even bother to give us a courtesy call to let us know what was happening (whether we would get rooms or not), and last, (3) the supervisor tells us that we have to wait again. The bell guy also showed up at the room with our luggage's and I had to send him back down and explain to him that we were not staying in that room. So my family and I had to go back to the front desk. By that time, I was very furious as it has been 4 hours now since we arrived and still we don't have rooms. We did not agree with them making us wait another hour, they gave us sorry excuses about glitches with their computer system and that they couldn't switch rooms around in their system. But we refused to wait another hour for our rooms and stood firm until they gave us the rooms we were promised. Miraculously, after not giving in for about 15 mins, they were able to shuffle things around and got us our 2 rooms. To compensate for the hassle we had to go through with them, they promised that our valet parking would be compensated for the "WHOLE STAY" (note the bold). When they initially told us, they tried to be as vague as possible, but I recall specifically asking if the valet will be compensated for the whole stay, and the supervisor said YES. But when we checked out and got our bill, well,...disappointed again! We were charged for the valet for the whole stay. When we brought it up to them, they said No, they were only going to compensate us the valet parking for 1 day. Furious again, we had to backtrack and remind them what they promised us. Then they have the nerve to tell us that they can't waive the valet since it's on another system. Then how were they able to comp the 1 day valet that they were going to give us? We did not give in to their excuses and stood firm on getting what we were promised. Finally, after 15-20 mins, another miracle happened, they were able to credit us for the whole valet stay as promised. Again, they blamed it all on their computer/system glitch that the bill was incorrect. So overall, this hotel needs to really work on providing good customer service and to deliver on what is promised. It seems like the people employed by this hotel have been working on perfecting excuses and misleading their guests. A few other things to note about this hotel:1. Valet parking - HORRIBLE valet parking service. We would call 10-15 min ahead before going out to ensure our car is ready, and we always end up waiting. One time, we ended up waiting for 30 mins. I would NOT pay the $27 daily valet parking. 2. Complimentary Breakfast - Ok, just a bunch of pastries. They have a breakfast station that will serve waffles, pancakes, sausages, eggs, etc...for $8. 3. Rooms - pretty old and outdated. 4. Elevators - SMALL, you can barely fit 8 people in there. And when people are coming in and out with luggage's....good luck trying to squeeze in there. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, the beach is right across the street and there are some shops and restaurants nearby. We will never come back to this hotel! My family and I are not picky, all we wanted was our rooms. But they continue to mislead us and in the end, they lost future guests. Word of advise if you plan to stay at this hotel - ask specific questions and do not give in to their excuses. They make it appear like they can't do certain things and will give you their #1 response - computer/system glitch.

There were some scary reviews of this place so I was nervous but it turned out OK. The hotel is across the street from the enclosed swimming beach which is nice since there is no coral in the protected area. However you're not really in the ocean with some surf. Breakfast is included from 630 AM to 9 AM which is too early for us night owls. Be sure and take the small "cooler" type bag in your room to breakfast so you can load up on food for the day. They don't supply trays so this is the only way to carry your food to the chairs around the pool. There are never enough tables for breakfast so either share, eat in your room, or use the lounge chairs with small low side tables to eat breakfast. You can take as much food as you like which is mainly pastry, fruit, yogurt, etc and they have a good selection of drinks. It often rains in the morning so either eat in your room or take a towel to dry off the chairs and tables. The reception area is on the "third" floor which as far as I can tell is actually the second floor. The elevator system is bizarre, unique, and good for security. You "scan" your room card in front of the elevator control buttons, punch in your floor on the keypad, and then the elevator number (the letters A through E) you are to board will flash on the screen. There are no floor buttons in the elevator so you must board the elevator designated. The elevators worked very well. The room was smallish for a $180 a night room but it was clean with a nice balcony with oblique ocean view. The hotel is perpendicular to the beach so rooms on all sides seem to have a decent though "oblique" view. I wouldn't advise paying extra for an "ocean" view. Supposedly they did upgrade us for free at check in. There is plenty of counter space in the bathroom with single sink. There was a free in-room safe as well as a frig that was empty and not a mini-bar - a nice touch IMHO. No bugs in the room even though Hawaii is famous for them. (I've even had roaches in some rental cars there!) The AC worked fine. The balconies are set up so your neighbor can peak into your room if they choose. Only one chair on the balcony although there was room for two. It's $27 a day to park your car, plus tip. Resort fee is $23 so the room price was actually over $200 per day. Forgot to mention that they do have live entertainment at breakfast. Nothing much but a nice touch. The hotel is the last hotel on Kalakaua before the park and zoo on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. But it's a convenient location. The pool is OK but nothing special. If you feel lucky you could park your car along the Ala Wai Canal and walk to the hotel and save $27 a day for valet parking which is the only way you can park your car. No problem with the valet parking. It was timely and courteous. The included Wi-Fi worked well in the room.

I met some dear friends at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel in April. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel with its friendly staff, great location and so many amenities at the ready. It's directly across the street from the beach, they offer a free breakfast with wonderful Hawaiian entertainment while you eat Plus the Tiki Bar and Grill restaurant is right on the premises for daily live music and good food I will definitely stay here again on my next visit !!

Location, location, location!Aston is the perfect location to base your self in Waikiki. Trolley stops at this motel and the beach is across the road.Be aware of the additional "$23 amenities levy per night"You can't get out of paying this and considering the high nightly rates you pay I think this is a bit of a scam. Having said that, you get a light breakfast by the pool, free movie hire. Service at check in is a bit chaotic as this is a very busy hotel.  Overall, I still think this is a great place to stay if you want to be in Waikiki beach
user_name:
Paullj66
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: This hotel was fairly average. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean. The views were fairly nice too. When looking at this hotel from a map's point of view, it looks like a great location. It's right by the water, the price was decent. But you couldn't access the beach from where the hotel was. I don't know if that was temporary or not. Plus it was by a lot of youth hostels and there were a lot of seedy characters walking around that area quite a bit. I didn't feel comfortable there. I ended up spending a lot of time with friends that were staying at outriggers on the reef which was an amazing hotel. That place was very posh, the rooms were amazing and there was shopping everywhere and lead straight out to the beach. I would stay there next time!

herre now . great loc. xcross from protected beach and zoo. Special TA rate was same as most but INCL. the 23 dollar amenity cost. Room decent . clean and well maintained. Free cont. bkst a big cost saver and is plenty for all. cereal. baked goods. fruit. yog., etc. Very large pool area for waikiki . lots of walkable. food and shopping. Best overall place of all the ones been to here

Great hotel, great location for getting in/out of the waikiki area, we had an oceanfront room that you cant beat for the price, one of the more reasonably-priced rooms on waikiki. Tikis located on the 2nd floor has good food, a good crowd and good live music. I didnt care for the extra $27 mandatory per day for valet...should be covered in the $29 per day aminity fee. Basic rooms nothing too fancy but was exactly what we needed with an amazing view. This is the actual view from our room!

Had two minor problems on arrival and both were addressed by the maintenance in five minutes each time. Great Service. Centrally located almost on the beach just cross the street. Safe area for sea bathing and snorkelling. Lots of restaurants around but would suggest The Cheese Factory which was wonderful.

we are here now. ..best overall overall place weve stayed in Waikiki ..great loc. xcross street from protected beach and zoo next door. Booked the TA discounted rate .. same price as other. rates and INCLUDED the 23 dollar amenity fee. Rooms nothing special but clean and well maintained. Free bkst saves a bunch of money and is plenty for adults and kids . cereal, yog., baked goods, fruit plus. plenty of food choices here and nxt door

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights prior to our cruise. The hotel staff were amazing and so was our room. We had dinner one night in the Tiki restaurant and we amazed how good it was . We would definitely stay here again close to shopping and beach. Loved it!!!

Stayed here for four nights from the 2nd may 2015 before we went on a cruise I broke my foot before I left home the found my a disabled room which was great  Free light brekkie in the morning by the pool area very helpful staff  We then came back and stayed a extra night on our way back from our cruise Again nice rooms friendly staff will came back again Great location straight across the road from the beach

If you want great views of Wakiki Beach, this is the perfect place to stay. We were on the 19th floor & had the perfect view. Our room was clean with no issues. The breakfast that comes with your room has a good selection, just expect to wait in line. The only downside for me was the street noise that could be heard even with balcony doors closed, but that is a compromise for the view.

We always love visiting Hawaii. This is our second time staying at this hotel and we always have a great stay. The only complaint we could have is the pool needs to stay open longer than 9pm. After being in the ocean or on the beach all day it's nice to have the evening in the pool.If you have a car be prepared to pay for daily valet, this is all they offer and I believe it's $20 or more a day. If you are military I think there's a discount. We stayed in a suite again with partial ocean view and a direct view of Diamond Head. The further down the hall you go the better the view so this view was better than last time!The hotel is very convenient to everything in walking distance it's also easy to escape out of Waikiki if you rent a car (which is highly recommended) to get out of the city.Hope this was helpful and can't wait to go back as always!

We arrived around noon and spent 3 days here before we boarded our cruise ship to tour the islands fir seven days. Our room was on the 11th floor overlooking the Pool and a great view of the beach. the room was clean and fresh smelling. It didn't look or feel like it had been used for the many years the Aston has been here.There was an tote bag in the room to use if you wanted to take your breakfast or lunch to the beach. We ate at the hot breakfast Buffet. The Waffles where made to order and they where very taste. they were served in a Styrofoam box that was a little smaller than the Waffle. this made it difficult to carry it to a table with getting syrup all over everything, but we managed.The staff at the hotel are really friendly and helpful. The Hotel felt very secure.

Stayed 4 nights from April 15th thru the 19th. My husband and I and another couple ALSO celebtrating their 50th anniversary, had a wonderful time at the Aston before moving onto 2 other islands.! We're active and young at heart seniors who love to joke and laugh a lot. So we loved the location, the great front desk staff (thanks Geri, Naomi, and Jon), the friendly maids, and the funky breakfasts with the provided coolers. Sure breakfast was different and fairly satisfying, but it was fun! Our children sent us to Hawaii (3 Islands) 20 years ago (30th anniversary)and we stayed at 5 star resorts. We honestly had more fun staying at this simple hotel! Ocean view sunsets were awesome! Short walk to The Bus where you can catch a ride for a $1.00 by showing your Medicare card. Went to the infamous Swap Meet that way! We'd stay again. Tiki bar - great!

The location is terrific... it's right at the end of the strip of stuff on Waikiki Beach so there are tons of restaurants and shops. The zoo is nearby and it's a short trip to Diamond Head. And the public bus is just a block away. The rooms are big, comfortable and nicely decorated. It really has everything you need. Tiki's Grill and Bar on the ground floor is also really good and not overly expensive. My only gripe is that the room, especially the bathroom, could use a fresh coat of paint and deep cleaning. Nothing was dirty... it was just showing its age a bit. But I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. The staff are really amazingly helpful. The hotel is in a great location, beach access directly across the road and walking distance to resturants and shopping. The hotel rooms are a little on the old side, things appear dirty but they are actually just old (bath tub, flooding etc). The beach towel service is really handy. The pool is pretty small and awkwardly placed directly in front of the reception area, it's not very inviting. The free breakfast consists of cereal (cows milk only), pastries, a Japanese side dish and fresh fruit. The fruit is really good. You can pay extra for an egg omlette ($8.00), but it's not really that good. personally I don't think it's worth it, especially when Wolfgang Puck is downstairs (which has excellent food). I would stay here again. Not spectacular but nothing really wrong either, and the service staff were extremely accommodating and pleasant.

I think this hotel has got it's 4 star rating just for the position it is in. The pros: the lift system is fantastic. Just swipe your key, type in your floor and you are taken directly to your floor not stops saves time. The bed was absolutely amazing. The room for us was a reasonable size because we spent most of our time exploring not sitting watching TV. It is a little dated though with the bathroom having "obvious" patch up jobs. The cons: THE BREAKFAST!!! Unless you like to eat pastries and cakes then it is a bit dismal. They do have nice fresh fruit and cereals but no toast, not eggs, no hot anything unless you want to pay for waffles!!The check in area was slightly confusing. Arriving on the ground floor with bags then advised to go to first level where there are check ins, check outs and the pool positioned right near the check in, makes for a slightly muddled check in.The ice machine was near our room which constantly went "off" during the night. Our travelling companions needed to attend to some business but there was no business centre. Having to go elsewhere to have things photocopied then paying $1.00 for each page to have it faxed off to Australia!!!We found the housekeeping very good. The ladies we came into contact with occasionally were very friendly and always had an "aloha" for us.The Tiki bar was handy and had very good bar meals and the staff were very tentative.We didn't use the pool as it was in prime position of people coming and going and was very dangerous to walk around. We witnessed at least one lady slipping and having to be taken away by ambulance!Overall you pay for the position which is why you go to Waikiki.

Spent five days here with some friends and had a wonderful time. The staff at this hotel are fantastic. Very helpful and friendly. The view from our room on the Diamond Head side was stunning from the 24th floor. Great location, very close to the beach and lots of shopping. The room was very clean and the beds were quite comfortable. Lots of extras like beach towels and chairs, movies, etc. Loved every minute and can't wait to go back! Mahalo Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.

I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 2 nights in April 2015. Once night before sailing on the Pride of America cruiseship and then one night at the end of the cruise.The checkin process both times was very very quick and easy. Great staff at the desk!The rooms that we had both nights were large, very clean and VERY comfortable. We had a great view of the ocean when we looked to the right from the "Lanai"Lots of dining options in the hotel and in the nearby area. Some good shopping in very close proximity.We did not get a chance to use the pool but it looked nice!The hotel has tour operators just off the lobby and we booked a tour of Pearl Harbour thru one of them.We will DEFINITELY be using this hotel as our base for our next Oahu vacation!

We stayed here one night pre cruise and were upgraded to a partial ocean view suite. The room was nice. The staff was great and the location superb. The only negative I have is that my sheets were not changed prior to our arrival. They were covered in sand, but after 18 hours of traveling didn't have the energy to get them changed. Overall recommend.

This hotel was wonderful. The service was gracious and the rooms comfortable, especially the bed after a long day of sightseeing. The free DVDs were a bonus we truly enjoyed and the breakfast by the pool was filling and had many choices along with fresh fruit.

Great location for this hotel. The rooms are clean but nothing spectacular. Breakfast is a nice touch and the hula dancer and music during breakfast is great. Tiki's restaurant is also very hany. I would stay again.

Probably one of the best experiences we've ever had at a hotel on any of the Hawaiian islands we've been to. The people that work here are exceptional and are willing to help in any way. The setup of the hotel is perfect! We had a room that overlooked the pool area and we also had a gorgeous Oceanview. The location of this hotel is perfect. Lots of stuff to walk to and right across the street from the beach! They have breakfast in the morning and you can get it included in your stay. I would recommend this hotel to families with young children as welll as to couples looking for a romantic getaway. Another cool thing they have is a Redbox-like movie rental kiosk by the elevators to rent all kinds of newer movies at no cost! I am counting the days until we get to go back!

Very nice hotel. My fiancé and I stayed here over the weekend and had a room on the 5th floor that had a partial view of the ocean. It is conveniently located on the strip of waikiki and has a restaurant over looking the beach. They give you a free hot/cold bag that you can fill up with complimentary breakfast served from 6-10am.
