Very comfortable bed and pillows. Very nice staff. The elevator system was a little tricky at first but I think it comes in handy for security. They have a nice gift shop in the lobby for snacks, etc as well as another restaurant. I didn't like that they only offer valet parking. I could see that getting a little expensive if you have a week or two week stay. Also, you pay $24 in amenities fees everyday. All we used out of the amenities was our coffee. You get a lot for the fee; free movies, free PS3 games, WIFI, phone service, a safe, and coffee so def take advantage of it otherwise you will be like us paying $24 for one cup of coffee per day.All in all it was a nice place to stay for the overall experience of a hotel in Hawaii.

If you are into classic, funky Waikiki properties, this is the place for you. From the surfboards on the wall on the entrance level to the Hawaiian singer (and hula dancer) who entertain next to the pool during breakfast, this hotel is what many people picture as Hawaii. In addition, the staff is very helpful and the ocean view rooms have an actual ocean view, not a small strip of blue off on the horizon that you have to crane your neck to see.Location wise, you are across the street from the beach as well as being within walking distance of several good restaurants and attractions. Plus, the trolley stops right in front of the hotel making it easy to tour the island(make sure you get a week's pass!).On the negative side, the rooms are a little small and the bathrooms could use some updating. But, who goes to Hawaii to spend time in their hotel room??????

I thought this was a great hotel for the price. I have no complaints about this place at all. Staff were all very nice. I had a ocean view room and it was an amazing view of the beach and diamond head on the other side, so beautiful! The free breakfast was great and location worked for us.

I am a travel agent who has clients there right now, they have sent picture of duck tape holding up numbers on the door, paper stuffed in towel holders to keep them up, poor housekeeping, slow drains causing overflow of water on the floors, bubbles in the ceiling that smells of mold. I had not used this hotel in some time, and will not again

We stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 4 nights and were very happy there. The staff were exceptional and were more than happy for us to change rooms when the wind howling at night kept us awake. The on site restaurant Is great for a drink to watch the sun go down and once again the staff there were fantastic. Would definitely stay there again. Best lift system we have ever experienced.

This was our first stop during our honeymoon trip to Hawaii. The hotel left us champagne and a sweet card when we arrived at our room. We had a room with a pretty good partial ocean view. The rooms were a little small for my liking, but Honolulu is pretty much a small city, so it is to be expected. Breakfast was great because the hotel gives you a small cooler to pack for day trips around the island. I would have liked if there was some more protein and less pastries offered, but it was delicious! The valet service was great, you could even call down before so they would have your car ready for you. The hotel is in a great location!! Great first stop!

It really is all about location and a good clean hotel and staff. At the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel you have both. From the great service from checking at the front desk to the parking staff and the maid service. There is a very nice pool & pool deck to hang out at or just go across the street to a great swimming area for kids. Walk to shopping just steps away and great places to eat. I stay here many times a year for work and vacation.

If I had a problem the maintenance were there right away. Room was cleaned and the breakfast on the beach was great. Was near all sites wanted to see and was picked up right at the hotel. Our stay was very enjoyable and will return again in the future.

We stayed 3 nights in the oceanfront room, and so made the most of the awesome views over Waikiki Beach, town and watching everyone enjoying swimming, snorkelling and sailing. We loved the location here being near the zoo so nice leafy outlook and a stroll across the road to the beach. It is only a short stroll up the street to the centre of town, and so got to see all the shops etc on our walk up. The pink line tram also stops right outside the hotel so very easy to get Ala Mauna shopping outlet. The only downside was the breakfast, we would recommend eating out. The Hotel is clean, friendly staff and we enjoyed our stay.

I was looking for a room near Waikiki for a few nights while I was traveling in Hawaii and a good friend of mine recommended this hotel. It's a nice clean hotel with a very helpful and friendly staff and it is just across the street from the world famous Waikiki Beach. You get free continental breakfast every morning and for a slight fee they will make you eggs or an omelet to go with all the free stuff. It's got shops of all manners and kinds within walking distance of the hotel and it offers all of the amenities you could need to be happy. It can get a little loud at night with bands playing at bars close by, but it's not that bad at all. It takes some getting used to the elevator system as you must use a key to access the elevator and it only let's you pick one floor as your destination. So if you need to meet friends you have to meet them in the lobby they can't just come up to see you at your room. From a security standpoint it's great! But it can also be a little more work as well. I really enjoyed my stay here and I feel it's a good value for the location. I would stay here again without question.

Staff is friendly very accommodating close to everything close to the zoo feet from the ocean close the city buses shopping The beaches are clean the rooms are clean great breakfast buffet included 6 AM till nine with music they have a great bar the tiki bar on the second floor good food and great happy hour also has music every evening Hawaiian type music

Pros- Good location, free breakfast, smile-y staff, Cons-70's furniture; 70's bathroom;sloppy paint jobs attempting to hide the flaws; Sloppy cleaning staff (eg. used coffee pods still in the coffee maker); EXTREMELY sloppy cleaning staff: Cleaning lady left chunks of of long, black and frizzy hair strands in in the bathroom sink, on the bathroom floor and possibly all over the carpet 'after' cleaning. None of us have dark or long hair...Thank goodness we were leaving that day!

Great spot in waikkiki just across from beach convenient to all shops and eateries thought breakfast was poor and if you don't drink the 1 cup of coffee they allow each day then no tea and coffee facilities in the room only hot water available at night so you need to grab t bags and milk if you want a cuppa at night from breakfast . lucky Starbucks is close we bought coffee from there.rooms are a generous size and well maintained but bathroom needs an update quite old and tired looking. Found staff friendly and very helpful

This hotel really allowed us to completely enjoy our vacation. My wife and I are seasoned travelers and this property met all of our expectations so we could focus on enjoying our holiday. Our room was clean, well laid out, and very comfortable. The view from our lanai was outstanding. The in-room safe is great for travel documents and other important items. The bathrooms are very clean, well-stocked and well maintained. The king bed was exceedingly comfortable which is a real bonus after a busy day of sightseeing. The hotel is in an excellent location; walk across the street you are on the beach, walk west on Kalakua Avenue you have all the activity, restaurants, & shopping, or walk east you have the quiet of the Kapiolani Park with the Zoo, Aquarium and band shell.The hotel staff members are excellent. Every staff member we encountered during our stay performed their duties with skill and a very friendly manner. Front desk, hospitality, pool, housekeeping, engineering and security personnel made our stay comfortable and pleasant. Observing the challenges the staff encounter every day and the positive manner with which they handle them is truly amazing.We felt that we received excellent value for our dollar. The resort fee covers a lot of value features. We really like the breakfast, filling our bags and enjoying it on our lanai. The music and hula dancer at the breakfast is truly first rate and truly Hawaiian. We didn’t use some of the things covered by the resort fee, but that’s the real world, other people do use them.I have to say the elevator system is the most efficient we have experienced. Swipe your room card at a kiosk and enter your floor number and one of 5 elevators will be assigned to you. Then, it’s get on and go. To go to the registration/pool level press the star key on your floor. There are no rushes for the elevators at high traffic times and you don’t get on an elevator with all the floors selected by a previous prankster.Renovations were being made to the pool deck and the registration area. The results are very light and fresh. We did not experience any inconvenience as a result of the renovations being done. The times we have stayed have continued to reinforce that the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is definitely our hotel of choice.

Rooms at back were a bit run down so we upgraded to a room with a view. Great room with view of the beach and sunsets.Liked the variety at breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful.Its a shame that management pay their workers less than at the other Waikiki hotels and they have to work under worse conditions. We totally supported their rally for justice outside of the hotel. We support the workers having a fair process and deciding for themselves whether or not they want a union. We will spread the word in Australia about their fight for justice. David and Lilian

Stayed here april 26-30 and we weren't very pleased. The room was tight for a king sized bed, the lanai only had one chair, and the washroom needs a serious upgrade! The floor in washroom needs to be replaced, the paint was chipping from the door, and the water would drain very slowly from the tub. The complimentary breakfast they offer consists of lots of pastries and muffins, fruits, cereal, and the usual coffee, tea, juice. There was an omelette and waffle station but you had to pay for those and considering that the hotel charges a daily fee for such things as the breakfast, that should be included in the breakfast instead of paying for it. It was super noisy at night which was hard to block out. The only good thing was the beach was right across the street.

On my most recent visit back to the islands I chose to stay at Aston's Waikiki Beach Hotel and was greeted by ultra friendly staff (they actually remembered me and gave me a free upgrade!). The room was clean and comfortable and I had a great view of Waikiki beach. In the morning I filled my to-go bag with food from the breakfast station and ate it out on the beach with my toes in the sand! Great location at the end of Waikiki near Diamond head and the park and the zoo. Lots of great restaurants surrounding the hotel with one at the hotel itself, Tiki's Bar and Grill, which is a great spot as well. Highly recommend :)

We recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for a family holiday.The rooms were a good size and well finished.The location of the hotel was great with the beach right across the street and most venues within walking distance.The hotel had good facilities and the staff were friendly.

Excellent hotel of this class, kept extremely clean. Front desk staff is very friendly and welcoming. Breakfast area is spacious and one of the best in Waikiki. I have experienced, Fresh fruit (strawberries, blueberries, oranges, apples, and bananas) in addition to all the other hot and cold items.Room was clean and comfortable, felt just like. View is amazing. I'll be back to this place and highly recommend to others when in the area.

The Aston is a great hotel, fantastic staff and amenities. Just a 30 second walk across the street to the beach and with plenty of dining and shopping on the property you don't need to go too far to find what you need. Tiki's bar was great and the complimentary breakfast was really really good. Take your breakfast to the beach with the cooler you find in your room and eat on the beach! or....around the pool. Want more options? Wolfgang Puck's, Subway, and jamba juice are on the ground floor. Around the corner is LuLu's Restaurant, another great option for any meal or for a beverage. You are so close to the beach there's no need for a car. If you want to travel the city, go to Ala Moana Mall, all you need to do is put $2 in the box on the "Pink Line" Trolley and away you go.....you don't even need to get off the bus, just ride the loop. I'd definitely stay at the Aston again. Convenient, well priced and comfortable!

great location close to the beach and view of diamond head-perfect!!!friendly staff-very efficient. lovely music and delightful breakfast at the pool. pool very clean and warm. felt safe because of the secure elevators. oceanfront room was spacious.i will only stay at this hotel on my many vacations there,and i will recommend it highly to everyone with confidence. everything perfect-nothing missing.

My partner and myself have recently visited Hawaii and decided to stay at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel . On arrival we were warmly greeted and as we arrived earlier then the 3pm check in the staff were more then happy to store our luggage so we could go explore . Glenn at the front desk was amazing he provided us with a free upgrade to a full ocean veiw room and was there every morning to say hello and help us with any questions we had , as my partner is a surfer he provided him with the best spots every morning and made us feel right at home . I have no negatives to say about the Aston and we will definitely be visiting again and recommending to all of our family and friends back home in Australia .

This hotel has a top notch view of both diamond head and the beach. It's at the very end of the strip but nonetheless it's still a great location. Reason I gave it only three stars is the $23. a day amenity fee is definitely not worth what you receive. The so called breakfast consists of cereal tiny bagels muffins and fruits.. when your there for more than 2 days it gets a bit old. Plus you can get a hot breakfast for two at any restaurant for that price. The parking fee also seems a bit outrageous. They have an entire parking lot for their hotel bit guests that have rentals are only allowed to valet for 27. Per day..At the end of the day it feels like you are being nickle and dimed. Overall though the location people and cleanliness was great.

Location, Location. Love this spot being and the end of the strip. For the best view of Diamond Head and the ocean go as high a floor as possible on the Diamond Head side. My wife and I run around Diamond Head each morning so this is a great spot to take off from. We love the uncrowded family beach across the street using the Hotel provided beach chairs. Starbucks is right there on the corner next to the Hotel which is nice but the Hotel coffee at the Breakfast by the pool is good also. The room does have a Kurig coffee make with provided K cups. The rooms are in need of a makeover especially the bathrooms.The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I don't really care for the poolside breakfast provided, carb carbs carbs, need protein!! You can park over by the Zoo at night for free, lots of people do this. It is really fun to watch people try to figure out the elevator, you must use your key card and then punch in floor number. I like that system for security and crowd control.

Being our first time to Hawaii, our AAA travel agent recommended this hotel located on Waikiki beach on the island of O'ahu. We were greeted warmly by the desk staff and given a free, ocean view upgrade. Of course you had to go out on the very narrow balcony and crane your neck sideways to see the ocean. The room was nice and very clean but staring to show some wear. Beware of the $23.00 dollar-a-day charge that covers such items as the "free" wi-fi, continental breakfast every morning, newspaper, safe, etc. we were not made aware of this fee until we arrived. There are a plethora of gift shops and dining options within easy walking distance. Overall, the experience was a good one. But again beware of the Waikiki beach area as it attracts a large number of the city's homeless who loiter and in several witnessed occasions, were doing drugs out in the open as well as arguing with each other. This occurred in broad daylight and made my wife and I feel unsafe at times when when out shopping.

We stayed at the Aston for only one night on our way from the U.S. to Tahiti. We chose this hotel due to the location and for the view and we were not disappointed. Our room on the 18th floor provided us with one of the best views we have ever had anywhere. Check in was fast, friendly and we received instructions about using our card for the elevator which was a little awkward at first, but makes sense after using the card prior to getting in the elevator. It provides a great level of safety and makes the elevators run more efficiently. The check in on the 3rd floor rather than on ground level makes it somewhat burdensome if juggling several pieces of luggage which was a negative. We had a problem with the air conditioner after checking in as it simply was not cooling the room, but one call to have maintenance check in out was enough to get quick efficient service. It was a very easy fix and the repairman was very friendly and glad to help. Our room was not terribly outdated; however the bath area could use some upgrading. We didn't participate in the breakfast provided using the cooler; rather we opted for breakfast elsewhere so we can't comment on this feature which seems to have both positive and negative comments. If the rooms and air conditioning were more updated I could have given this a 4 star; however they have a little work to do to get that rating. I would stay here again for the location and the view.

This is a good hotel to stay in but beware, they don't tell you there's no parking if you have a rental car, you will be paying for valet service (a daily charge) and they track on daily amenity fees that all adds about $50 US per day. The pictures do it justice but it is still a nice hotel and walking distance to the beach is a plus! I would stay here again and would recommend it to people with small families.

We normally stay there every year. the staff is very friendly and always willing to help. The rooms are o.k. , but need a little sprucing up in the bathroom area. it looks a little dated guy's. The breakfast is ok , but need's a more selection . Valet service is adequate, although a bit expensive. And that resort fee, Loose that Puppy. Nobody need's to get fleeced for more money when the service doesn't warrant using every day to reflect the cost assumed. it ain't worth it. I've been staying there for the most of 10-years every year so I can see how it's evolved. For the most part , keep up the good work.

If you've ever had the unfortunate experience of Butlin's, this is it Waikiki style.Most expensive hotel on our USA trip, very poor quality hotel. The cleaning staff were thorough but the tiles and fittings were so old and cracked (cracked bathroom tiles, grout in varying shades of grey, sealant by the tubeful keeping the sink in place) maintenance is shoddy.Breakfast.. well, take your cool bag and queue up for the chance to take it to the beach, there's no-where to sit in the breakfast area to eat so good luck. Breakfast (free for all) should be optional. I'd rather choose to sit and eat with something I want to eat, not sample weak coffee or watered down 'juice' with donuts, warm yoghurts and other dry cakes.This 'Breakfast' is a must pay 'Resort Fee' which includes the 'pool' use.The 'pool' with probably fit 6 people for a cool down dip, we didn't wan't to queue for this either.The toilet flush from other rooms could be heard in one corner of our room, lovely, at all times of the night.Totally horrendous experience.GO ELSEWHERE!

Right on the end of Waikiki Beach next to the park with Diamond Head clearly visible from my balcony, I thought this would be at least a 4 star stay. The ocean front room was large and nicely furnished. Upon closer inspection I noticed the bathroom floor tiles were very old and seemed dingy but of course I didn't mention it. The shower didn't drain and the clock didn't work. There is a great hi-def tv but the channel selector didn't respond when you turned it on. All of these problems were taken care of in a timely manner and they left a note saying there was a clog in the drain which they removed. The breakfast by the pool was nice. There is a $23/night charge for tax and whatever but I think all of the hotels have to charge a fee for that. I would still stay there again but it would be great if they paid more attention to details.

The rooms were clean but tiny. Had us walking on each other. But open up the patio door and take a look....the beach is right there. Who spends time in the room when you are in Hawaii!! Great restaurants and shopping all around. The staff was very friendly.

Loved location. Close to beach. Visited it almost every day. Convenience/souvenir stores at every turn. Many restaurants nearby. Walked to aquarium, zoo. Like elevator setup as only hotel patrons can use elevators with room key. Hotel staff very courteous. Whenever we needed something we received it immediately and with a smile. Had only one incident where a woman at front desk (red hair) was short with us. Asked for directions. She handed us a map, circled the areas and pushed it towards us. When we asked to point out which way to go she made a face and then obliged. I was born in a big tourist city, and tourists are your city's livelihood. Staff should always be courteous. We had an ocean view room and could see the ocean while laying on our bed and when sitting on balcony looking to the left. Balconies small. Had to take a stool from the room as only one chair and small table on balcony. Do away with the amenity fee. People don't like to pay extra fees. Add it to the room price. Didn't use most of the amenities that are supposed to be covered by the fee anyway. Used the breakfast often. Good selection of foods. Need better setup. Should flow more easily. People bumped into one another. Exit confusing. Should be set up in long rows to allow for easy movement and better flow of traffic, perhaps along the railing on right of pool. Need more tables for breakfast seating. Lounge chairs should be removed or stacked and more tables and chairs should be available as it would be nice to eat by the pool. We took our food back to the room and ate on our balcony most days. Maid service was good. Rooms clean. A little more attention to cleaning bath as ring around tub noticed on our first day there. Beds very comfortable. Clean towels every day. Beach towels/chairs available to sign out which was great. Like availability of tour desk. Used it to book 4 tours. All great! Hotel rooms are older and have been updated but served our purpose. Ice and pop machines on our floor and used them often. Anything in room should be gratis. Don't put water in the room if it isn't free. Overall our stay was very enjoyable. Hawaii is a wonderful place to visit. People are friendly and would definitely stay here again.

We would definitely stay here again! The hotel has a great location - across the road from the beach (no obstructed view) and walking distance to shops and restaurants. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had two small issues with the internet and safe, but each time the front desk sent someone immediately. The rooms are older, but very clean and and a small refrigerator. The continental breakfast (included) provides a good selection - mostly sweets. You can purchase a made-to-order omelette. You are also provided a small cooler to take your breakfast to the beach. There are benches and tables on the beach walkway as well as tables on the street in front of the hotel. We enjoyed breakfast on the beach each morning. The restaurant on property - Tiiki's - is a great place to view the sunset or just enjoy the beach view. Live music and dancers were excellent. The hotel has valet parking - super guys!

While this hotel is in a good location (across from beach and one block from the zoo) it needs some improvements. The bathrooms are old and need renovation. We had a partial ocean view and the room was smaller than other hotels we have stayed at on the beach in Honolulu. We wanted to sit on the balcony, but there was only one chair. The hotel could use a fresh coat of paint here and there. There is a complimentary breakfast, but was just ok if you just want cereal and muffins. We are surprised that other reviews were so great. There was a workers' protest while we were there due to low wages. The protest lasted only an hour and was outside in front of the hotel. Hopefully they will come to some agreement.

This hotel is very good for family & business trip, beach is accessible, shopping, restaurant, & Catholic Church is adjacent . If you like me who want to do worship my faith and do vacation this is the place for you.

We stayed here for three nights and planned to spend rest of our vacation at other properties. After a very disappointing experience at another property we canceled and came back to the Aston. Location is great, staff wonderful, had live music every night. We will always come back to this property.

My wife and I just finished staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach for over a week. We found the staff to be very accommodating and helpful. The room was clean, the air conditioning worked just fine and the location was perfect. The Tikki Bar and Grill serve awesome food, drinks and live entertainment. The continental breakfast could consist of more protein foods and less carbs but it was still ok. I have no problem recommending this hotel to my friends and family and my wife will stay there again when we return next year.

We first stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach about 4 or 5 years ago and really enjoyed it. So, when we needed a couple days away from our family group after our wedding, we booked the newlywed special for a weekend. Some of it was still great, other parts, not so much. Since I had to go to the wedding venue before the check in time, I went to the hotel for the bell service to hold my luggage and do the check in paperwork so we could check in upon our arrival late in the evening after the wedding. Luckily, a room was ready and they gave it to us, which was great customer service. First, the view from the Oceanfront Select is truly gorgeous, can't complain about that at all. The balconies however are very close to each other, so no real privacy when sitting out there (also to note: there is only space for one chair and footstool on the balcony, not a big deal). Also, the door was a bit difficult to open for some reason. Unfortunately, the hallway and room decor is beginning to look a little dated and worn. Also, there was a stain of some type on the pillow case that we saw right when we arrived. Opening the bed, the sheets looked a bit dingy. Not appealing for a honeymoon stay. However, the hotel did provide a lovely bottle of champagne when we arrived at the room in the evening. The ceiling panel in the bathroom that I think must provide access to the A/C kept coming down at one corner. The provided bath amenities were fine. The water pressure in the shower was good. The best things about this hotel, the location, the breakfast (along with the little cooler to take it to go), and the customer service. The rooms being a little worn and in need of a little more attention being the cons. It's just me perhaps, but for the price, I'd expect just a little more from the condition of the rooms.

Flew in my family from Montana and cancelled a previous hotel reservation to stay at the Aston to be closer to the beach. Had a great three day stay except for the valet service. Waited at times up to 45 minutes to get our van. They ask us to call 15 minutes before we plan to leave. Still waited for more than 30 minutes. Walked us a couple of time to the loading dock to get our van quicker. Very dangerous with little children in our party. Ask them why it took so long, They said that they parked over 200 cars. Been at other hotels with over 400 parked cars and never waited more than 5 minutes. Thanks to the manager on duty who responded to my complaint and cancelled the parking fee.

After all, we were in Hawaii. I would have stayed in a birds nest in Hawaii. But this hotel is very nice. The staff was great. We had everything we needed. People lamenting about the pool not being opened due to construction and other construction going on, that is all taken care of now. The pool is open, no construction. We had a room with a partial ocean view, but when we stepped out on the (very tiny) balcony, we had a glorious view of Waikiki Beach. It is burned into my memory forever. The only thing I would do differently, and that would depend on the cost, would be to get a room with a bigger balcony. But while you are in Hawaii, who wants to be stuck in a hotel anyway? If you are a smoker, you cannot smoke anywhere but on the sidewalk. If you smoke in the room, or the balcony, it could cost you an extra $450. But that's for all hotels. Great stay, amazing time!

We stayed ones nght before leaving on NCL Pride Of America. The hotel was a $40 cab ride from the airport, and is across the street from Wakiki beach. We were on the 14th floor with an ocean view, which was lovely. We booked a room for 4 and ended up with one king bed. After travelling for 21 hrs, we didn't have the energy to go back down to the lobby to get it changed so we made it work. The hotel is family friendly, with a PS3 in the room and free rentals for games and DVDs. The selection is small, but my boys were thrilled to find Minecraft! They also so gave the boys a small beach bag with a colouring book, sand shovels and pail, which was very thoughtful.Breakfast was included, we were offered fresh leis which was a nice touch. Hot items were extra, we found the selection of pastries, cereal and fruit adequate for our needs. If we ever return to Waikiki, I would book this hotel again.

I have a mixed review. Pros: The location was great. The amenities were great. Loved being able to check out beach mats & chairs. It was nice that you were given a cooler to take breakfast to the beach. Pool was nice. Cons: rooms were below expectations. Beds were very soft. Pillows very flat. Our balcony door did not shut properly so you could hear the wind howling through. My sister's room had a tv that didn't work. Bathrooms were small and dated. Breakfast food left you wanting more. Would I stay here again? Possibly-but I'm not running off and booking it yet.

For the price, this location has generally always been cheaper considering Waikiki prices. Wife and I stayed here in 2005 and enjoyed it so much we brought the whole family back a few years later. I'd stay there again, no complaints. Staff is helpful and genuinely seem to be in a good mood.

We booked oceanfront with AstonWaikiki Beach Hotel and boy did they deliver!!! We had the most awesome view of the ocean, sunrise and sunset for the whole week that we were there and for a lot cheaper price than the other hotels! The whole staff, housekeeping, and valet service were very friendly and happy people! The breakfast by the pool every morning overlooking the beach across the street while listening live Hawaiian music is absolutely exceptional! We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and Families and we will definitely book our room with them again next year! Mahalo Aston Famiy for ensuring that we had a wonderful stay in your hotel!!!

I admit that this was our second visit to Waikiki and our second stay at the Aston Waikiki. Upon arrival at 5am, they were able to put us into a semi oceanfront room at a minimal cost upgrade within 5 minutes. The hotel is constantly being cleaned..it is spotless..They have a wonderful breakfast buffet included in your stay with these wonderful hawaiian donuts and coffee! They are professional, polite and are always there to help you in any way they can! Great sized pool towels which can also be used at the beach. A great value and on the strip so you can walk everywhere! And an added bonus of a daily morning hula dancer with music as you eat breakfast poolside! a lovely and relaxing experience!

We had a great king room with a balcony ocean front ,and breakfast daily by the pool or beach. We used the cooler provided and ate in our room. Friendly staff in all areas. Nice pool and lots of tables with chairs and lounge chairs for sun bathing.We ate dinner at Tikis grill and Bar. Reasonable price and really good meal. Lots to do nearby ,including seeing the zoo and walking everywhere. All kinds of stores. We had a wonderful time and would go back to this hotel.

We booked the newlywed special here predominately because it offered late check out so we could visit the beach and still shower before our flight home. We were first given a room with two double beds. Thankfully they were able and willing to switch us to a king room. We were supposed to get a bottle of champagne upon arrival. We were told it would be delivered to our room and waiting for us when we got back from our sunset cruise. Instead, we had to call and were told the kitchen was closed for the evening. I ended up speaking to the manager who arranged for the champagne to be delivered with some chocolates as compensation for the trouble. The chocolates were sea salted bars smaller than a Hershey bar that said "we're sorry!" on the label. Not really a good sign if you have "I"m sorry" bars already on hand. In terms of the hotel itself, it was a little dated, could use a fresh coat of paint and some updating.The breakfast buffet was decent. They offer small coolers to pack your breakfast in to take to the beach or wherever you'd like to eat. Location is great - right across from Waikiki and maybe 30 minutes from Hanauma Bay. Lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance.

Stayed here as part of a larger Hawaii trip. Room was good though a bit dated. Service was fine. Had to pay quite a bit for valet parking(plus tip). Didn't like the parking cost but that is how it goes in Waikiki. Had a nice little ocean swimming area across the street. Decent pool.They charge a mandatory fee for "Breakfast by the Beach"... I wish they would have just included that in the total room price from the start rather than tacking it on later. The breakfast was a pretty decent continental breakfast with a good selection. Good coffee!I would probably stay again.

Came here for support for my company. The valet parking service was good had no issues there. The breakfast was okay but it really doesn't fill me up. They give you a card for your room plus to use on the elevator which was a first for me but very cool. The room provided to me by my company was good size. It wasn't enough for me to workout but I forgot that they offer a gym place but did not have time to check out. The bed was good and there was a HDTV with cable. I was on the 12th floor so it wasn't bad with noise and great view. Now the wifi internet....sucked. Every room is offer their own wifi but it seemed that I could get better speed and signal if I connected to another room. At majority of times when trying to upload documents and download files the Internet lagged badly. At my stay in Napili in Maui the room had the modem and router right next to the TV which I really liked if you needed to power cycle the wifi just in case it wouldn't work well. I'm not much of a cable person and like to watch everything from my laptop online so this made me give it a 4 star. Everything else was awesome about this stay since it was mostly for business but when I need to work using the wifi....I had to resort to going back to another place that offered better wifi.

Rooms are clean, views are exceptional (even the partial ocean view rooms!), staff is friendly and welcoming, resort fee (which kills me to pay...just charge more for the room as it feels like being nickled and dimed. However, they offer a great breakfast buffet and offer to go bags to take extra food with if going on a days adventure. Was much appreciated for a nice snack while snorkeling. My only complaint with room is the bathrooms could be updated, but it's minor and they are clean. Their location can't be beat being across the street from the beach. Though for any group tours arranged it seems to be the last pick up and last drop off (not the hotel's issue, but frustrating). All in all I'll certainly pick this place to stay at again.

We stayed at the Aston for three nights and were generally satisfied. The rooms are nice and clean. When we checked in, we asked if we could have an ocean view, and we were upgraded without an increase in price, which was very nice. My only complaint is the rather high resort fee that was charged. We were told this was for the amenities, including the breakfast. The breakfast was by no means anything special, and not worth the resort fee. Having said that, it was a nice, clean hotel in a very good location at a fair price. I would stay again.

The location is great! The free breakfast is pretty good and we loved Tiki's. We ate there 3 times during our stay. Only complaint was the maid service was a little lacking. Room had an issue with the AC and they immediately sent someone up to fix it. That was good. Staff was all friendly. I'd stay there again for the price for sure. :)

My husband and I stayed at Aston Waikiki for the third time for our 2 week vacation. We very much enjoy this hotel for the staff and the location. When we arrived on a Wednesday evening we were able to get an upgrade to our ocean front room to a higher floor corner room if we didn't mind doing it on Friday. That was fine with us and took our assigned room for two nights. When we arrived in our room the bathroom had not been cleaned, in fact it was filthy. I called the desk and spoke with Chris who had checked us in, housekeeping arrived in less then 5 minutes and cleaned our bath. On Friday we moved to our new room that was fabulous. They staff, especially housekeeping, was professional and friendly.I have read reviews here that the rooms were noisy from Tiki's and the street. Our first room was on the 12th floor on front and the next was the 16th and had no problem with noise at all.  The downside to our stay was that it was during spring break and the number of adolescence/ teenagers in school groups staying at this hotel was overwhelming. They clogged the elevators, breakfast and lobby. I don't mind children when accompanied by parents. However these children seemed to travel in packs and with no adult supervision that I observed. I don't know that this is fault of the hotel, however it did change the feel from our previous two visits. I do believe this will be a deciding factor as to if we select Aston Waikiki Beach for future stays.

We stayed at the Aston for five nights. From check-in to check-out it was overall a positive experience. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathrooms seemed a little outdated and could probably use a deep clean but we can't complain since we were only a few steps from the beach. The breakfast wasn't really anything fancy but it was nice for probably being the only hotel in Waikiki to include it with your room. The only downside was that our room was directly in the elevator area so we could hear that every time someone got on or off of an elevator. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for something comfortable at a decent price on Waikiki.

This review is for the Aston Waikiki Beach for our recent wedding we had there on 3/21/15. I don’t normally do reviews but felt like I had to so that no one has to go through what me and my wife went through. If you are ever planning on a wedding at the Aston Waikiki Beach don’t do it!!!! Especially in the Coconut room on the 21st floor. My wife and I had a really bad experience from planning to the wedding day.1. I will not say any names but whoever is in charge of coordinating the venue has very poor communication skills and does not get back to you in a timely matter. If she feels that something needs attention in a timely matter she will email you back and expect a response ASAP but still ignores your question from the previous email. But if you decide to ditch the email route and call her directly she does not pick up her phone and won’t get back to you for a couple days. We figured that maybe she was busy for the first week or so but not over Six Month duration of dealing with her. This is what we dealt with the entire time.2. Since we are not from the islands and this was a destination wedding it was very difficult for us to know any better on the venue location. The thing that sold me and my wife on the venue was the view. There was an awesome view of the beach and the ocean. Because the venue was on a lanai we were exposed to the elements which were okay because we were in Hawaii. We figured hey lets have some fun in the sun and maybe if it rains we can put up umbrellas. We asked the venue coordinator and of course it took another week to find this out that no umbrellas would be provided so we accepted that if it rained it rained. However on the wedding it did not rain and the sun was out. We had 8 tables setup outside and all the guests on those tables were burning hot. Most of them were not prepared for this and left the ceremony early due to the extreme heat and sunburn. When we asked about umbrellas the coordinator said that we could not do anything about it. It was explained that during the time of our reception the sun will be beaming on the lanai, so if you plan to have a daytime wedding don’t do it. Again if would have known this before and in a timely manner it would’ve helped us decide whether or not go with the venue.3. A couple weeks before the wedding while we are trying to finalize items in the contract we go over the DJ information and she says that we never discussed having a DJ and that they could not have any DJ music. Who has a wedding without a DJ? There was no line in the contract stating that we could not have a DJ. Because I had already booked/paid my DJ he was cool enough to call her and straighten things out. Again if these were things we would’ve known ahead of time we wouldn’t have had the venue at this location. 4. Once we arrived on the island and met with the coordinator she kind of just handed us over to another coordinator. Which was fine but it was like the new coordinator knew nothing at all and this was her first time hearing about everything. So spend about half an hour going over details and what needs to happen. Come to the day of the event. Nothing was setup on time. They were an hour late and fortunately some of our family that was there early setup the tables and settings. Nothing was setup at all but 3 tables out of 10. When we asked the new coordinator about this she said the thought the event started at 1:00PM even though the contracts states that we had the venue from 12:30-5:00PM and we went over the start time 2 days before meeting her. Poor planning and attention to detail.5. If you are going to staff people to serve/bus at a wedding party make sure they want to be there and don’t make my guests feel uncomfortable. We heard from a couple of our guests that some of the servers were complaining about even being there and couldn’t wait to leave. 6. If I can say a couple things positive it would only be the great attitude of the Bartenders and the great tasting food. The overall experience we had with this wedding venue was horrible!!!!! If I could give this place negative starts I would. I’m writing this review so that you won’t have to deal with this before or during your wedding and I hope it helps people that are considering this place for a destination wedding.

We spent 9 great nights in an ocean view room on the 18th floor at this hotel.Great location and all staff very friendly and helpful particulary Frances at the tour desk who recommended an excellent Luau at "Chiefs"Luau and a dinner cruise on The Star of Honolulu.All hotel renovations seemed nearly complete and caused no disruption to our stay.I would have to say the hotel lifts are the quickest and most efficient at any hotel we have stayed due to there smart numbering system.The breakfast was good for a continental style and the WIFI was very fast.The only negative was our room was not made-up until 400 pm one day after it was forgotten.This was rectified immediately after contacting housekeeping.The bedding was quality and the room newly renovated except the bathroom which was a little tired.

My Husband and I attended our Grandson's Wedding in September 2014 the reception was held at the Aston a truly wonderful night held on the verandah overlooking Waikiki Beach .We had an Ocean View Deluxe room on 20th floor with fabulous views of the Beach. The Breakfasts around the pool were enjoyable with entertainment from a lovely couple a guitar player and a beautiful girl dancing the Hula to Somewhere Over the Rainbow.We loved it so much we are returning this June....
user_name:
Beverley G
Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: we stayed here for 3 days before getting on our cruise trip.excellent choice by our travel agent. rooms were a good size , clean and beds were comfortable.located right on the beach close to shopping restaurants etc.

In our unfortunate trip back home to reality from the Big Island. We had the good fortune to stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Found the hotel from a web special several months earlier. My wife and I were extremely pleased with not only the location but the overall hotel. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly. The rooms were more then adequate. The hotel is located just across the street from Waikiki Beach. The view from our room was outstanding. The restaurant at the hotel was also very good.

This hotel is in a great location and that's all it really has going for it. Our partial ocean view roo. Was quite dirty......when I lifted up the tap in bathroom to run water all this Black "scum" came out from under the tap handle. The breakfast that's provided with the room costs is horrible. We only had this once. It consists of cereal and yogurt. We are from new Zealand and are quite spoilt with yogurt so thought this here was disgusting. There is a selection on pastries which were all stale. The pool is very small for the size of the hotel. But I must say all the pool area etc. Is very clean. The tikis bar located by the pool is great. But this is separate to the hotel. No room charge or anything.The staff are all quite rude. We were so shocked. When we Checked in which was very early but worth a try the front desk girl was very inconsiderate and kept talking over us. No idea about customer service. We also asked for some advise on transport down to other end of waikiki and was given a very cold response without any eye contact.That's ok though.....know one gets tips when they provide such poor service. We have hardly tipped anyone due to the down right rudeness.Make sure when booking your room you avoid one with an ice machine outside your door. They are very noisey.All in all for the price you are probably getting what you paid for.

This hotel was very accommodating. The room had a lot of space and the view of the ocean was perfect. Check-in and out was long but the hotel was busy. Valet parking is a must. I didn't think it would be as useful as it was until I got to the hotel. There is no street parking. The food at Tikis (Tiki Bar) is fantastic! Great Happy Hour and best Mai Tai's on the island (in my opinion). There's a coupon book in your room that the hotel provides. If you look in there, there's a coupon for $1 Mai Tai between certain hours. I never used the pool. No need when the beautiful warm ocean was steps away. Great hotel!

My wife and I had our wedding at the Tiki Bar (appropriately named Tiki's) in the hotel. And we had a lot of friends staying at the hotel as well. (Destination wedding) We chose to stay at the Aston due to its location near the beach, diamond head, and the very end of Waikiki. It was damned near perfect. Staff was as pleasant as could be, room was clean and cool, and the 30 second walk to the beach ensured daily swims in Waikiki's beautiful water. The only issues... were that on our wedding day, the elevator went on the fritz. Thankfully, I made no promise to carry my betrothed to the room... on the 21st floor. Other than that, I imagined the hotel might give us a bit of a break on the bill with filling 10+ other rooms with a week worth of tourists. Oh well.

This large hotel is located almost at the beach and within short walking distance of the nicest shopping street of Waikiki. The rooms are roomy and well equipped, breakfast is served buffet style, and can be taken to the pool area to eat. The resort fee, and valet parking fee do add up to the price of the rooms, that seem a loot cheaper if you don't add the extras to it.

Great location!!! The "Breakfast on the Beach" is an amazing feature. They had fresh fruit, yogurt, a great selection of pastries, many different juices, coffee, teas, milk and cereal. Also amazing omelets and waffles (for a small cost). Our boys (12 and 14) made use of the movie and video game rental kiosks in the lobby. We've stayed in other hotels in the area but this is by far the most family friendly. Happy hour in the restaurant was also really nice. Our housekeeper Nora (19th floor) was very friendly and efficient. Right across the street from the beach and close to many affordable dinning options. The room was clean but basic. "Partial ocean view" is an amazing beach view.

Would I stay there again? Maybe. It is located on the quiet end waikiki beach, Was able to walk to a car rental. Harley rental even closer. A taxi service located on the main floor. Lobby is the 3rd floor. confusing. Pool is on that level. nice, didn't use. elevators. No problems, confusing. Staff at the desk was wonderful. Room appeared clean. T.V. didn't work, so had that replaced. The control box for air, not working properly. very cold that night,so 2nd night had maintenance up again. I'm certain he had no clue how to run that box. So he opened a vent in the wall and turned the fan down. Too much, next evening it was very stuffy in there. Had him back. Glad to leave next morning.

My husband , sister and I were in Honolulu, Hawaii in March 2015. We were a 5 min walk from Waikiki Beach and a 5 min walk from the Ali Wai canal . Our circle tour of Ohahu was awesome. My husband 's tour of Pearl Harbor and the Missouri battle ships were also awesome. Our restaurant experiences were all great. The weather was sunny and warm every day but one and that was a tour day. Had a wonderful holiday on the beautiful island of Ohahu.

This is not luxurious or pumpering resort, just a regular, slightly worn out, but comfi hotel. Located few steps away from the beach, just opposite fully enclosed part of lagoon, perfect for kids. We had an Aloha suite with separate sitting area - adequate space for two, but might be tight fit for four people, if sleeper sofa was unfolded. Modest bathroom and small closet, lots of furniture without storage space, only four very shallow drawers in the TV console. Connecting doors and front door very thin, so you can hear every word and every sneeze in the corridor and adjoining rooms on both sides. Gorgeous views of ocean, Kalakaua avenue and/or Diamond Head crater. Lots of street noise since hotel is located on the main thoroughfare where every tour bus and trolley, and Harley Davidsons too, makes left turn and stops to unload passengers. Two tiny lanais, more like step-out balconies facing similar wall of balconies in Marriott. Continental breakfasts served by the pool were very welcome addition to morning routine. Breakfast was very generous: cold and hot cereals, variety of Meadow Gold yogurts with exotic fruit, trays of fresh cut fruit, such as pineapple, watermelon, melon, mango, and sprinkle of grapes and kiwi slices, hot broth every other day, variety of asian salads and sushi rice, fruit drinks, teas and coffee, and huge selection of tasty pastries, pigs in the blanket included for meat lovers. Our hotel lunch boxes packed, served us both for breakfast and lunch. Plenty of eateries around, and a shrimp bus three blocks down Kuhio, within 10 minutes walk. Hotel staff is reasonably friendly, looks like they are in the process of struggling for better labor arrangements, which adds to the street noises in the mornings. Elevators have no buttons inside, you push your floor numbers outside, and wait for assigned elevator: A, B, C, D or E. Never took us too long to wait for it. Very decent place to stay, close to everything, we watched parade from the balcony, fireworks in the Hilton Village, morning surfboarders and sailboats, etc. Just surved our purpose for being in Waikiki.

This is the second time we stayed here and loved it. Free in-room wifi and a nice full continental breakfast. I'd love to tell you about the pool but who goes to Hawaii and sits by a pool? However, it did look nice as we walked by it on our way to the ocean :0) The hotel is within walking distance of anything you'd need and literally, right across the street from Waikiki Beach. We rented a car both times we went because we love to explore but it's really not necessary with this hotel's location. They've recently started charging an amenity fee (valet parking) but this appears to be the norm. Room was clean with a stunning ocean front view. The staff is very attentive, incredibly professional and friendly. And, check out is 12pm! If you're looking for quiet time though, Waikiki strip is not the place to find it. It's busy and noisy constantly but this is not anything the hotel has any control over. I talked to a local who said Oahu is known as the 'gathering place' where 90% of the state's population lives. Aloha!
user_name:
Rich D
Indianapolis, Indiana, United States

review_body: This is the forth time we have stayed its very handy the trolley stops a the door staff are very obliging.Refurbished pool area and a free breakfast every morning The only downfall is that it does not have a laundry.

my daughter and I stayed here for a week. We arrived at hotel at 9am and were offered a upgrade, with room available immediately. Nice to have after a long flight. The room was lovely and clean, a view to die for. Straight across the road from Waikiki beach , And looking down the beach and the up to diamond head. Free wifi in room, complimentary drinks. Breakfast included, fresh fruit, cereals,yoghurt and pastrys.nice Hawaiian singing and dancing to entertain you while you have breakfast. We also could have complimentary dvd's to watch in our room. Staff friendly and very helpful. Bus stop outside the hotel. Tour desk in the hotel and 2 restaurants on the site of hotel. Easy and quick 10 minute walk into the centre of Waikiki , for all the shops . Would definitely stay here again if I'm lucky to return to Waikiki. Mulhalo.

I just checked in yesterday and so far I am very happy. I love the free breakfast and the Wi-Fi, I do wish the Wi-Fi was a bit faster because I like to play video games in my downtime and it was a little to slow but I spend less time on the beach and other places rather then the hotel so It doesn't matter that much. It is also very close to restaurants and the beach. I am looking forward to the rest of my trip. By the way I am 12 so kids would love this hotel.

I booked this hotel through Priceline, so I wasn't sure what I was going to get. Turns out, the hotel was quite good. It's not frilly or fancy, and the rooms are small and old, but everything works. When I asked if we could be in a non-adjoining room, they made the switch right away, and in fact upgraded us to an ocean-view room. The staff were friendly and accommodating, and definitely helped make the stay comfortable. The location was wonderful; right across from an incredible beach with breakers so you could swim for as long as you wanted, and the hotel is at one end of a crazy strip of hotels and shops that goes on and on.. It's fun to walk the strip, but it was nice to be in an area that wasn't quite as busy, it was more laid back and restful. We booked our excursions through Pleasant Activities at the hotel, and they were pleasant to deal with. When one of our trips got cancelled due to weather, we had no issues getting our money refunded. The only things I would say were not good were the "breakfast on the beach (the food was sparse and not very good), the pool (which was CLOSED during our stay!) and Tiki's Bar and Grill (we went one night and had to send our food back, it was so greasy). Other than that, I'm very glad we stayed at the Astin Waikiki and would definitely stay there again.

What a wonderful experience! We had arrived early for check in after a very long flight but were allowed to check in as our room was ready!! Wonderful staff! Gorgeous room! Free breakfast with Breakfast bag that you can take on the beach! Free beach mats and free towels to take on the beach. Fast and easy checkout. Wonderful, comfortable beds! We had trouble figuring out the safe in the room---called and had a staff person come us immediately---didn't make us feel stupid about the issue!!

I've read the other reviews and I have to admit that I was really apprehensive about what we would fine when we arrived at our Expedia-booked package, which included this hotel. So it is possible that my expectations were so low that I was pleasantly surprised. It is NOT a plush, luxury hotel. So if you tend to spend a lot of time lounging in your room on a vacation, then this probably isn't the right place for you. But if you just need a "base-camp," then this is just fine.The room was nicely decorated with warm colors, and the furniture was nice. The bed was comfortable. The room was clean. It had a fridge, a safe, ironing board, and a coffee maker (single serve) with k-cups provided. The tv was also just fine. I had wireless coverage at all times with excellent connectivity. The breakfast is a buffet of fruit and pastries, cereal. Hot breakfast is available for a fee. If you do go, bring the small lunch bag with you and load it up. Even if you don't eat it all in the morning, put it in the fridge for a late night snack. Seating is limited around the pool. Yes, you can take it to the beach, but it's a bit of a hassle.The bathroom, on the other hand, did reflect the hotel's age. Upgrades have clearly been limited in the bathrooms. It did have broken tiles and a color that didn't match the rest of the bathroom. BUT it was clean, served our needs, provided a hot shower with good water pressure and a newer "throne." Fancy? No. Acceptable? Yes.There are no chairs in the room. So when we DID spend any time in the room, our option was a small high table with 2 benches, a lawn chair on the balcony, or the bed. Not a huge deal, but one level of discomfort.Valet parking only is dumb. But you will find that everywhere in the Waikiki area... Parking is very limited Ina condensed, busy tourist area. Go to the Aston Banyon, about 2 blocks from hotel entrance and pay for a week of parking at $80. Cash. That worked great. Ideal? No, but we would leave in the morning, walk our 2 blocks, and be gone to other areas of the silane all day. So,my ou learn to adjust. At least you're not waiting for someone to bring your car for you.The lobby is pleasant. Again,if you want luxury, go somewhere else and pay for it.Our only disappointment was even on 9th floor,new heard the constant traffic noise below us well into the night. It is a crowded, busy, tourist-heavy area, and the noise is a by-product of that. The beach is across the street. Nice beach area and great swimming in a protected area from the big surf. Be prepared, however, for the homeless who take over the picnic areas. This is a problem in the entire area, not just here.  The zoo is nearby. Many restaurants in the area. The location of this hotel is it's best feature. It is 2 blocks from the bus, and if you do drive, finding and getting to roads out of town are easy. They were customer service oriented, except for the bell staff/valet group who were friendly until they realized we didn't use valet parking.... My biggest complaint is the resort fee. Yes, I had good wireless internet. But the pool was under construction for our entire visit, and our fee should have been reduced fir that reason. And we were charged a fee to use the safe! So, be aware, as you compare hotel costs, be sure to include whatever their resort fees are in your comparison. We felt this was a total ripoff. So don't expect total luxury. But this is a satisfactory hotel for the cost, compared to other options. So don't stay away just because of a few cosmetic issues. Overall, except for the fee, we thought it was just fine as a home-base. And we were there 2 weeks.Here's a tip: if you bring your floaties to the ABC store, they will blow it up for you for 60-cents.

This was our first trip to Oahu - and we stayed here - enjoyed the convenience of being where the action was - plenty of ways to get around town without a car - they were in the middle of remodeling but it did not interrupt our plans or in any way distract us. loved the morning breakfast offered - with the free music.
user_name:
Cindy F
Friendsville, Maryland, United States

review_body: First the bad. They say parking is available and it is but valet only for and extra $27.00 /day you are extra billed another $23.00 a day fort breakfast, Internet, newspaper and movie/ Xbox whether you use them or not. There are no hot items in the breakfast except extremely horrible coffee in a place that is famous for it's good coffee! We went to happy hour at the Tiki lounge (2-5 PM) $3 beer $5 Mai tai etc. On your receipt it says you get a free mai tai if you come back the next day. We ordered 3 mai tai s and they tried to charge us $7.25 each for the 2 we had to pay for even though they were ordered during happy hour! When we told the waitress she said that's what we are told to charge. I said but happy hour they are $5. She said not if you use your free one!!!! so they basically tried to charge us $4.50 for our FREE $5 drink. We said it is misleading and wanted to talk to the manager. He did not come to the table but did adjust the bill, Tacky!!!! The apps were good.The hotel is dated. They are doing renos which is an inconvenience. The stuff they used to cover the mold doesn't work and it is coming back through. You are downtown so traffic noise, sirens and big trucks are constant.On the plus side, staff are friendly and helpful, location is great. Definitely NOT a 4 star hotel

I recently visited Oahu on a business trip and stayed in 5 hotels in 11 days, and this Aston was one of the best. The room was a very good size and the staff very friendly. I like the idea of the continental breakfast buffet with the little cooler bag. Also a great location.....right across the road from the beach and also where a lot of tours pick up from. Make sure you go to Teddy's Burgers just around the corner!

My family stayed at Aston Waikiki for a family members wedding. THis place has some of the nicest views, and this is an awesome location. I could spend all day just looking out of our ocean view suite. The staff were very friendly, and we had a nice kitchen in our suite, where we cooked since OAHU is very expensive when it comes to food. I would love to go back again!
user_name:
Jeremiah P
Elk Grove, California, United States

review_body: Stayed at the Aston from February 8 to 13. We were in a "partial ocean view" room 2009 on the 20 th floor. With all the construction and lack of a pool I was expecting an upgrade but disappointed none was offered. Overall it is very difficult to pick a hotel in Honolulu from 5000 miles away. Do not rely on the pretty professional pictures they show on the Aston website alone.Do not rely on tripadvisor photos I looked at, most of 2009 vintage. Do use Google map street view to get a better idea of the hotel and its location.PLUS: Room clean and beds comfortable. Had an older fridge and nice flat screen tv.Beautiful view out tiny balcony of Diamondhead and if you lean way out a view of ocean.Fun place with Tiki bar a great place for a Mai Tai for $5 at happy hour and live music in evening.Excellent location right next to Kapiolani Park and the zoo. Right across from Kuhio beach and a short walk to action on Waikiki.You can catch the Pink line trolley for $2 right on side street to get to AlaMona shopping center.Other bus stops nearby -For 2.50 catch Bus2 to downtown or Bus 23 to Diamondhead for hikeWifi worked well and free movies a treat from machines in lobby.Continental breakfast okay but I am a donuts and coffee kinda guy.A/C worked well.MINUS: Room very tired and retro...suspect an Elvis groupie stayed here for the 1972 concert.Bathroom very dated but clean.The balcony was super small and only one person could stand on it. Only 30 inch wide at one end and 16 inch at other. Bathroom claustrophobic for a tall guy with 7 foot ceiling.Interesting: Always talk to people on elevator. Some had discouraging words.Heard "I'll never stay here again", "bathroom small and gross" , " no one told us the pool would be closed", "only 2 stars for this place", "mattress lumpy"Not a lot of happy campers.Undecided if I would stay here again as after this hotel, I moved to a condo rental at Hilton Hawaiian Village...a much better alternative with same cost as split rent with daughter and family.Aston was great for location, nice enough room and party atmosphere

My wife and I went to Hawaii to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Upon arrival the hotel staff treated us very friendly and had a smile with every question we had . Housekeeping staff were great and would be very friendly and say hello everyday with a smile. Rooms were clean . we loved our stay there we plan to stay there again..

We've stayed at this hotel on several earlier trips to Oahu. The location is ideal for us and we like the continental breakfast to start the day. On this visit, the hotel was going through a significant renovation in the reception and pool areas and that did present some inconvenience. But we weren't too put off by that. Our room was lovely, very comfortable and clean. As usual, the staff was helpful and friendly. I'm sure we'll stay here again on a future trip to the area.

Located at the "quiet" end of Waikiki. Short 10 minute walk puts you in heart of Waikiki hustle & bustle. Right across the street from Honolulu Zoo & Kapiolani Park, great for run/walks & picnics.Kuhio Beach is steps away and there is a long portion of the beach that has a sea wall & makes for calm water. Great for kids and lap swimming. Many restaurants to choose from. Tiki's, the Astons restaurant is very DELISH, original and fun. We enjoyed the live music and beach front views. Love the korean taco's, poke , fish tacos, and lilikoi Creme Burlee and fabulous tropical cocktails. Our rm was Oceanview on the 16th flr. The view has to be one the best sunset views in Waikiki. The lanai was small but fit 2 chairs and a small table. Our bed was comfortable and linens were soft & new. We had a bath tub, nice towels. My only complaint is the bathroom tile was old and should be replaced but was clean. The room decor was inviting and relaxing. The pool was open, pool water was chilly tho. There was construction going (replacing tile on the pool deck) but we were not inconvenienced. The staff was friendly, helpful & professional. Would stay again and would recommend to friends and family.

While the location of the hotel is excellent, directly across from the beach and within walking distance of many other points of interest, we were overall quite disappointed with our experience. This disappoint went well beyond the renovations taking place, which included closing the pool deck. The “breakfast on the beach” is entirely misleading (it’s certainly not on the beach), disappointing, and poorly executed. We have never seen a hotel provide breakfast but then provide no plates, instead expecting their guests to place the items in a small paper bag and then into a provided cooler. Four tables are then provided for a full hotel that is 19 plus floors. Not surprisingly, we were never able to sit at the tables or enjoy the entertainment we saw one morning. The entertainment was for about a dozen people who were lucky enough to sit and eat. Instead we had little option but to return to our room and eat. The hotels suggestion to go across the street and eat at the beach is just not practical. You would need to carry the food, hot drinks, then sign out and carry chairs and eat out of your lap. Not surprisingly, we say nobody doing that. Most upsetting is that the hotel charges for this as part of the “resort” fee. Although it seems that there has been an attempt to update the rooms, that could not hide the chipped front door, stained bathtub and peeling paint. Our sheets were stained and the room was never fully cleaned, with the garbage not being emptied and waste just left behind. Upon review of our account at the end of our stay, we were taken aback to see a deposit fee of $2.00 per a room key card. While we returned the cards and received the $4.00 back, this is something we were never told about it at check-in. We have never seen a hotel require a deposit for plastic room card keys that are usually treated as disposable. After paying decent sum, plus tax each night, in addition to the "resort" fee, charging an additional $2.00 for a room key is a little insulting. The newspapers, also part of the “resort” fee, disappeared quickly. Why would they not be left out for the day? Or perhaps there just weren’t enough. In summary, we found this hotel to be a rather unwelcoming place to stay. The staff seemed largely disinterested, not even asking how our stay was upon leaving. No response was received to our feedback, sent after our stay. There are many other hotels to choose from in Waikiki and next time we would look to stay elsewhere.

My wife and I and another couple spent 8 nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach between Feb. 10-18th. We all made our reservations May 2014 because this was the best vacation package for the buck at that time. Prior to our arrival I discovered there were going to be some renovations taking place during our stay and the pool was going to be closed during that time. I communicated my disappointment and concerns directly by phone and emails with guest services and was advised they may be able to make some changes to our accommodations upon our arrival if the work was still going on. When we arrived, both couples were upgraded to better rooms with ocean views on upper floors and we were given permission to use a pool at another Aston property nearby if we desired to do so. These considerations were appreciated and we thank the Aston guest services for their assistance in this matter. Special thanks go to Stepha and Jon at the reception desk for all of their help. Your attention and service made it all work.Check-in went quickly in our case, but it was during a slow period as we saw other times that there were long lines of guests arriving and waiting for their chance to check-in. This I'm sure is due to various airline arrival time issues.The breakfast on the beach service went very well and the food was adequate for a simple breakfast, best described as a "Continental style Breakfast" nothing served hot as others have related.The rooms we were in were fine. Nothing extravagant, but clean and fully meeting our needs for the little time we spent in them. The beds were comfortable and the bedding was changed every 2 days. Not unusual and if requested, it would be changed sooner.The location was absolutely perfect for our needs. The beach was right across the street and all our transportation drop off and pickup stops were either right out front or within 50 yards away. This included local trolleys and bus stops.Numerous restaurants are nearby and even the best restaurants, shops and hotels are all within a 5-10 minute walk away. All in our party are in our 60's and found our walks in the area easy as well as safe. We did notice the sidewalks and all restaurants were somewhat crowded after 6PM. For shopping, a helpful hint is to go to the Flea market at the Aloha Bowl Stadium for all of your souvenir needs on Wednesdays and weekends for the absolute best deals anywhere. only $1.00 entry and 47 acres of sellers/stands selling everything at better prices than anywhere on the Waikiki beach strip.Would we select the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel again? Best answer is, if we were staying in Oahu, Absolutely Yes! It met our needs fine and we were treated very well. Thank you again to management and staff.

If what you want is the view, the Aston is perfect. We were in room 1419 and had a beautiful view of Waikiki Beach, including the fireworks on Friday night. The room was quiet even though it was directly over the pool except for the morning the housekeeping staff was marching in a demonstration with drums.The king-bed room was comfortable. (The Aston honored our request which was a major relief when we checked in. Thank you!) The housekeeping service was great, despite whatever their complaints are. They were friendly and accommodating, bringing extra hangers and even a feather pillow when I asked. The bed was comfortable and tv choices were adequate.On the other hand, the room is in bad need of renovation. Perhaps the renovation of the pool area is a sign of good things to come for the rest of the Aston, but I couldn't help but be put off by cracked tiles and the dingy tub in the bathroom which had an overall tired and worn out atmosphere.You can't get away from the resort fee so there's no use complaining about it. The Wi-Fi was adequate (it was a working vacation) and the breakfast was ok for a few days but we tired of it on Day 4 and started going out after that. Eating on the beach was fun once, but the rest of the time I took our yogurt and pastries back to the room where we ate on the lanai or at the hightop in the room. I would rather have two chairs on the lanai than a bench and chair, but we made do. We also took advantage of the beach towels.Should management decide on renovation, I do recommend taking some of the paint off the door. Whereas most hotel doors close automatically, our door was so heavy with old paint that we had to forcibly shut it and I was always afraid we'd be disturbing others with the loud bang.Tiki's downstairs was a great place to grab a Mai Tai in the afternoon and they give you a free Mai tai the next day every time you dine there so we took advantage of that. My husband said they had the best Poke of the whole trip and their drinks were all very good. There is also a Japanese Restaurant in the hotel around the corner which is excellent. Lots of choices nearby.

After researching and taking a chance we decided to try this Aston location versus the usual Aston Waikiki circle. WOW was it the best decision we ever made! The price, the room, the services, the view, ALL wee exceptional. We were complementary upgraded due to renovations going on .The room was top shelf clean, the bathroom , 100% clean, the shower had nice high pressure.The staff exceptional, and I do mean top notch! The morning breakfast a true value for the 23$ amenity charge, was a real money saver as was the choices of items available. From cereals to pastries to fresh fruits to yogurts to coffee choices tea choices orange juice milk a real treat!!! Breakfast also includes a daily hula show. The views from the room and the pool deck were all great! The fact the beach was across the street awesome. Another great detail, Wolfgang puck downstairs with everything from breakfast to dinners available, subway right there and my favorite Lu Lu's right next door an awesome eatery with awesome views. Without a doubt one of the cleanest, nicest hotels to stay at in Oahu. We are looking into booking there for next year now. My recommendation is STAY HERE you wont be disappointed!

Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is the fourth hotel we have stayed at in the Waikiki area.This trip it was chosen mainly because of price and location.Like all Waikiki hotels check in is 2-3pm and its rare that a room is available when your flight lands at 6am and you get to the hotel around 7.30am. Therefore the arrival check in process was as expected.Instead of wasting time waiting around for 4-5+ hours we go to plan B which is, freshen up and change in the pool facility area and catch the 10am shuttle ($5 each way) outside the DFS shop to the Waikele outlets. This gets a shopping trip out of the way. On returning at 3.30pm our room is ready.The main room is a reasonable size and you do not feel cramped for space.It has a bench near the balcony and two wooden stools. The stools are not overly comfortable to use for any length of time, and you can only fit one on the small balcony. The balcony in our room (SE side) overlooks part of Kuhio Beach and the small jetty at the end of Kapahulu ave. This was perfect for me as this is the boogie board area and I was able to check out the waves from our room. As I have now found out, the surf at Waikiki at this time of year is not as good as other times of the year. The bathroom is clean and functional, but the fittings are starting to date and the last paint job to smarten up the room lacks a quality finish. The toilet has a loud flush and as a result you can hear the plumbing in the adjacent rooms especially in the early hours of the morning. Like many Waikiki hotels the Aston charges an additional daily Amenity fee on top of the room rate. Currently it is $23+tax. It supposedly covers (1) Breakfast (see below), (2) In-room WiFi, (3) In room coffee maker, (4) Unlimited movies and PS3 games, (5) Local calls, (6) Daily newspaper, (7) Fitness centre, (8) In room safe.The inclusion of a couple of these items in an additional fee is a bit dubious. Eg 2,3 & 8 are standard expectations in a 3-4 star hotel. We did find the available movies (4) to include some recently new releases and a reasonable selection was available. My wife said the Fitness centre was smallish and a bit claustrophobic so she didn’t use it much.There has been a fair bit written in reviews about breakfast. Breakfast consists of 4 types of Kellogs cereals, a large selection of pastries and cakes, yoghurt, sometimes there is some sort of packaged noodle, a fruit salad (same 4-5 fruits every day), orange fruit juice? (more like orange cordial), tea and coffee. Its Ok but as we were staying 15 nights we found you need to break it up by eating elsewhere a couple of times.Staying opposite the beach at Waikiki is not cheap, and its not hard to find nearby hotels significantly more expensive than the Aston.
