Whilst there were a couple of minor annoyances I would still consider returning based on location and price.Note: 90% of the total cost was billed to my credit card within days of making the booking. I then found the small print that said that they reserve the right to pre-authorize your card prior to arrival.

To start with the staff were helpful and nothing was a bother. That seemed to be the service you got around all Waikiki.If you needed anything just ask. We needed a kettle which is not provided as they provide coffee only.The hotel it self was being refurbished around the pool area. We were in room 1415 right above the pool and the noise wasn't to much of an issue.Tiki restaurant served nice meals and the band was good. We could hear them from our room but it wasn't till all hours.Out the front you could get a bus around to the shopping mall. It was $2 a trip on the pink line. The rooms are drab but we didn't spend much time in it. The staff kept the room clean. We had a bath in our room with a king size bed.We upgraded and got the view of Waikiki beach. Well worth it.I would stay there again.

Booked directly trough hotel website and got the Hawaii 5-0 rate which is for people aged 50 and up. Was to be a select ocean view room which I believe is on the higher floors which will have the best views of the beach. Was pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a suite on the 20th floor with 2 ocean front balconies. Spectacular views of the beach and the strip. Wish we were there for more than just the 1 night. Check- in was fairly quick and was able to get alate check- out at 1 pm. Room was huge, crazy for just 2 people really we only used half of it. Had some trouble with the key cards, had to wiggle and finesse them to work. Two twin beds, 2 bathrooms, 2 TV's, some complimentary beverages and snacks in the mini fridge. Wi-fi was very weak. $27 for valet parking with in-out privileges. Kept our luggage stored until after dinner as we had avery late flight. The breakfast was typical sweets, cold cereal, yogurt a little fruit but enough. To keep us going until lunch. There is a small fitness room but didn't use it. Staff were polite and helpful. Not a luxury hotel but pretty good value for location. Would stay again if the price was right.

We just got back from a great vacation and this hotel may not be perfect but the location can't be beat. Prices for hotels close to the beach can be high so this was in the middle range and served our purpose. 3- 3.5 stars is about right.Pros:Location!! the beach is literally across the street. You can get free towels and chairs to take to the beach!Around the corner is Subway, Jamba Juice, Cookie Corner and some clothing/trinket stores. Go around that corner and there is an ABC store, a Tucker and Bev where you can get drinks and sandwiches. Then the Zoo is there too. very close. Wolfgang Puck Express is also downstairs if you want to grab salad or sandwich. Walk north and you'll hit the other hotels, plenty of restaurants and stores. 15 mins or so we hit the Royal Hawaiian Center - more stores and restaurants. the street behind the hotel I think is Kuhio st? is where we got the bus to Diamond Head - only 10 min bus ride at $2.50 so that was cool!The tours I scheduled also came to the hotel to pick us up so it's a good location.We got a room with partial view of the ocean room so the view was great on my right side, I got another hotel in front of me and the mountain behind that, it was ok. Also saw the storm on Valentine Day wknd, was awesome watching the winds and waves getting higher. thankfully wasn't stuck in the elevator like some other guests.The bedrm itself was fine. beds comfy and pillows good too. TV worked fine though my sister had a tv that was missing some channels in her room, weird. Her AC also wasn't working but ours were so bit inconsistent.DVD kiosks also great. got movies almost every night.Free bkfst (not really free since it's included in the "resort fee") which includes cereal, mini bagels and muffins, assorted pastries - some hawaiian pastries if you get there early enough. yogurt and fruit. Outside the room where they had the food, you can get coffee, tea, OJ and milk. You get a mini cooler bag so you can take your food outside to the poolside (when it was open) or to the beach or we took it back to our room.Hotel Staff were great and friendly. Maintenance came quickly to fix my sister's AC. When I dropped some foundation powder all over the floor, housekeeping was quick to come back to the room and vacuum my mess. =)Cons:The lanai is thin and can't put a chair and sit there to look at the ocean. Bathroom definitely needs a renovation. this "resort fee" bugged me but hard to avoid on Waikiki. Typically the fitness center is included in your room charge but it was part of the "resort fee". Granted the fee covered for the wi-fi, beach towels and chairs if you get them before they disappeared. Newspaper, bkfst and DVDs so it's going to show up on your bill - be prepared. Didn't have a car so I think they charge a separate fee for that. I read a lot of complaints about the new elevator. I have seen this system in another building so wasn't surprised but many people were bewildered. Just have to pass your card on the panels and punch in your room number then go to the elevator it tells you to. Security is the reason I hear for this system. It doesn't handle the rush of bkfst time though so was always waiting for it and once or twice it passed my floor. Probably because it was full but can't tell since I was just standing there and eventually figured out I have to hit that damn panel again. 8am-9am is the busy time and also when the good pastries are gone, go earlier! Also pool was out of order when we were there. was fixed couple of days before we left, oh well.... there is renovation going on so be aware. oh and no computer and/or printer to use so I can print vouchers for my tour! what??? the front desk offered but sorry didn't want to give them my password and user ID.Lastly, we arrived late and check in took forever! ok may have felt like forever but there were 2 people working and looked like they had guests with issues to deal with. Someone wanted to analyze their bill right there and the other couple were being moved to another room for some reason so it just made our check in process soooo long...Overall we had a great vacation. It's the perfect location!!!

Felt a bit cheated when checking in already. Our booking rate was approximately 180 usd per night however they charge you an extra 23 usd per night as 'resort fee' which includes compulsory breakfast and wifi. The breakfast food itself was not horrible, but getting to it was. It was chaotic.Multiple lifts broke down during our stay, took our family 10 minutes to get downstairs. Poor renovation.However, the room itself isn't bad if you just want to spend the night there. The bed was comfortable and the room is spacious and clean.

Just home from a 7 night stay,we were in an oceanview room on 11th floor.Views are stunning,balconies very tiny only for 1 which was disappointing.Room was average,large enough and comfy bed but the rooms could do with a spruce up.Bathrooms very tiny.Breakfast is very average,basic food,cereal,bread,fruit.The pool was being renovated but was up and running 2 days before we left.Quite noisy from road noise and the bar Tiki's underneath.The bar is very good with great food,but if you want a quiet place maybe this hotel isn't for you.This hotel is right down one end of the main drag,so is a 10 min walk to lots more shops.I would rate this hotel 3.5 star but mainly for the view,if you are after some luxury,nice brekkie's and room service this isn't the right place for you.The other end of town has the more luxurious hotels but I dare say would have been more expensive.If I go back to Hawaii I would probably pay abit more and get more of a resort style.All in all for the price and the view not a bad hotel by any means but just not for me again.

Poor renovation attempts. Breakfast reminiscent of a food bank. Lobby and most of hotel lacks ambiance. Elevators are tedious. Room had poor sound insulation, broken slider and topped off with a crusty booger on the deco pillow. They should at least offer free parking to justify the overpriced ONE STAR waste.

An appropriate rating is actually 3.5. We stayed 5 nights at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel. It is at the end of Waikiki beach and right next to the beach. There is a street separating the hotel from the beach but it is a very short walk across the street and you are on the beach. We had a great lower (9th floor) beach front room which I would recommend for a few dollars more. We just kept the balcony door open and listed to the waves and the live music they offer by the pool. It was a very relaxing stay and we could just sit on the bed and look out at the beautiful waters. Pros - beach close, good size rooms, clean rooms, loved the beach front balcony.Cons - there is a lot of construction so the hotel is a bit messy and there are unpainted walls, and wood panels, etc. The hotel does need some work and it not in the best shape (you can see it's age) but most of that is in the common areas (the rooms were good). The free breakfast was not too great. They give you a small lunch box and you take it down in the morning to an assembly line of good and you get some muffins, danish, fruit and yogurt. I have never seen anything like it and we did not eat there again after the first day. No one really could figure out how it works and it does need some explaining to know what they want you to do with the lunch box they leave in the room. But, it's free. The elevator situation is also not great. The are slow and they have a computerized elevator system (you push your floor number on a main panel in the hall and it tells you what elevator to go to.)Most guests had a hard time figuring out how to use them and were surprised to get in the elevator and see there were not buttons to push for the floor. Overall I would say it is a good place to stay - great value for the price and the rooms were nice.

I stayed at the AWBH from Feb. 14 - 20, 2015 with my dear granddaughter. I was able to get a great rate because of the construction that was in progress so I was not distressed when we got there and they told us the pool was unavailable. Here are the high points and low points -- High points - location, location, location. Being right across the street from the beach was great. Also, we could easily walk to San Souci Beach to the left or the beach in front of the Royal Hawaiian to the right. The included breakfast was also nice since I don't like to have to get up and get out and hunt for breakfast each morning. The DVD kiosk that is included was great. Each afternoon, my dg and I would pick out a movie to watch that night. There was lots to choose from. Another high point was that, even though I reserved the cheapest room, we had a view of the ocean (Room 824.) Several times, while sitting on the bed in the room, I could see whales spouting in the bay. Fabulous.- Low points - the elevators were not working very well the first day because of the high winds. I got very familiar with the inside of the service elevator. Once the winds cleared up the next day, the elevators worked fine. Our room had a super skinny lanai and no chairs for sitting on the lanai. I dragged a stool out there each morning and crammed myself in a corner to sit on while drinking my coffee. The fact that I had an oceanview room at a standard room price made up for it.I make a trip to Oahu each year with one of my grandkids (4 down, 3 to go) and would stay at the AWBH again for the location, the breakfast, and the DVDs (especially if I am able to get a good deal like I did this year.)

I was concerned when I heard that they had renovations going on prior to my departure, however, it turned out to be a great family holiday. II highly recommend it to families. While not having a pool sounded dissapointing at first the pool did reopen half way through our stay last week, plus who needs a pool when you are this close to the pacific!!! I recommend you also get a family zoo membership for around 55 buck and breeze over there (very close) once a day for an hour or two prior to hitting the beach. Diamond head and the park are right there next door, public transport within feet of hotel to airport, mall etc.. Breakfast on the beach will save you money each day and may stretch until noon ;) Plenty of food eaterys near by too. Sunset on the beach 100 yards from the hotel. Great service, our patio window had issues and I reported this at 6.45 am and the technician was up to promptly fix it by 7am. While some bemoan the resort fee it's pretty cheap (23 bucks per room per day I think) clean towels and deck chairs for beach each day, endless free dvd rental which is great for the kids. The staff were very friendly shoutout to Brezey, mahalo! Will definitely stay there again.

I have stayed here before and usually LOVE it. This trip however was really something else. I booked my room 6 months in advance, paying full rates for a delux room, week of travel though I found out they had work going on at the hotel which would cause a lot of noise and disruption and no use of the pool. Due to this, I requested a higher floor as I usually stay on the 20th, despite this I was placed on the 12th floor, directly above the pool that was being renovated and woke up to the sound of jack hammers every morning. On a couple of occassions I had to ask the front desk for bath towels as by 3 in the afternoon, house keeping still had not come round, and being in Hawaii, my friend and I had been doing beach activities and hiking, so a shower was really necessary by 3pm. For the most part, staff was very friendly. Some staff went above and beyond to be friendly and helpful to guests, and some also went a little too far by becoming flirtacious and hitting on guests. Based on this trip, I wouldnt recommend staying here for anything other than its location and Tikis Bar and Grill. Previous trips I would have recommended highly. Am not sure if I would stay here again.

We stayed in 1 br suite. Living room with a pull out queen size bed. Additional single bed is foldable. Plus two single beds in the bedroom. Very clean hotel. Super helpful front desk. we had an ocean view room. It was great! We just wish there was a gym in the hotel. The closest option was 24/7 fitness with a $25 drop in

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights last week and I had mixed feeling about this experience.Pros: convenient location (just right across from the beach),Okay price, breakfast includes in the price of room, staffs are friendly.Cons: bathroom is old, small and a little dirty. you can see the cracks on the walls and white tiles turns a little yellow on a few areas. Drain in the bathtub does not work well, the water goes down very slowly. Bed is uncomfortable and only comes in either one king size bed or two full size beds. The elevator they have is not the most ideal for people, sometimes it takes a while to wait for one to come. The hotel itself and pool is under renovation.

Hotel is in a great location just across the street from the beach. The hotel is undergoing renovations but I did not experience any problems. My room was clean & comfortable. I found the elevator setup interesting & working just fine while I was there. I liked the continental breakfast. Saved me some money. They give you a small cooler which you can fill & take your breakfast to the beach, your room, or any other location you would like. Their restaurant was good (a bit pricey) and has an adjoining open air bar. It is an easy walk to the center of Waikiki. The price is good compared to others located near the water. I would go back if I'm lucky enough to get back to Waikiki.

Room is good atmosphere and lanai was great view if you stay more than ten level. Staff was very helpful. One thing hotel should be improved is elevator. The system was little confusing and kind a annoying to wait. We need to wait 10min to get out from hotel every morning... because it was really busy for breakfast...

I go back and forth to Honolulu but this was my first stay at the Aston, despite being very familiar with it. Just back from a fresh visit there this weekend. Let's just go with simple pros and cons on this one:CONS- Parking, valet service and entry/exit. Total system failure here. Wait times just for pulling into this valet only guest parking area are totally mismanaged and unacceptable. They've been doing this a while now, you'd think they'd have a system figured out, but they don't. Just waiting to pull in at peak times is a nightmare. You will have to drive around the block several times because of their one way entrance if you can't pull in. Attendants rarely, if ever come out and offer help or info about what's going on when it's backed up. If you need to leave, call down at least 30-45 minutes in advance, that's how long some of the wait times were just to get the car out. If you have dinner or show reservations, factor it in. Not to mention, the tourist trolleys and buses also stop directly on the curb at their driveway entrance. Again, peak morning and evening times are very bad with all the congestion.- The pool and deck are under rehab construction, so don't plan on swimming or laying out on the lanai there anytime soon. The 3rd floor reception area and elevators are also undergoing renovation, so it's not pretty.- And yes, that whole 3rd floor check in and elevator jam is just a mess. Elevators are automated to be more efficient, but with the volume of people moving through there at peak hours, be prepared to huddle with the masses until your elevator opens. This will continue even without the renovations going on because it's just a bad set up. Keep in mind this is also the same area where the complimentary breakfast is served, so it's like feeding time at the zoo especially between 8-9AM when everyone is grabbing to go to the beach. PROS- If you get a room with a beach view, good for you. But be prepared to have any of dozens of denizens from the Marriott across the street staring back at you. - Rooms are extremely average. But kudos to the housekeeping staff. The mostly Filipino staff are always friendly, accommodating and smiling. They should train the parking staff on customer service. - Location is great, if you like being in the middle (or actually the end) of everything Waikiki. You can jump on trolleys and buses without walking and the zoo and beach are right out the doors. You can stroll the whole length of Kalakaua in both directions. Just note that large portions of Waikiki are undergoing major commercial construction, including the classic International Marketplace which is completely gone and encircled by construction walls. The street has lost a lot of flavor and charm because of this I think. The Aston Waikiki is your average tourist churn hotel. They could do so much better by just improving their guest systems a bit.

Normally I am quite forgiving with hotels as I know there are usually A LOT of rooms and a lot of space that can't always be attended to. Honestly I had higher hopes of our hotel. When we first arrived my mom was ready to storm down to the front desk and raise noise. The bathroom floors were scary, the bathroom didn't have a proper fan, the beds were quite small, the pool wasn't available, our wifi didn't even work in our room (we used my moms room number instead), the parking that was suggested to me for $10 a night difference (at a sister hotel) was jacked up a few days before, and when we had asked about a room upgrade we felt a little laughed at. That being said, we calmed down. My mom's room was adjacent to diamond head with views through the alley to the beach. We however weren't quite as lucky with the room next door as we were directly across from someone else's lanai. Breakfast isn't really as bad as everyone makes it out to be. There was a good selection of pastries, yogurts, fruits, coffee, oatmeal, cereals and a few other things. You can take everything up to your room with the cooler bag they provide you with. They have hot water in the lobby at night which we used for cups of noodles from the store downstairs and for hot chocolate we have saved which was from breakfast. They also have lemon and orange water during the day which was always nice in passing. The biggest perk we found about our trip was being directly across from the beach and having Subway, Wolfgang Puck Express, Starbucks, ABC, and the small store in the downstairs lobby all at our fingertips. The biggest con about this hotel was quite possibly the elevators which decided to start to quit when there was a very windy day. It was a little nerve racking seeing a elevator door wide open and dark on the bottom floor and getting into elevator B only to have it go no where. There were a few times when they took us up from the lobby in the service elevator and then decided to open the stairway doors so we could freely get from our room floor to the lobby floor. I'm scared about elevators as it is so I took the stairs as much as possible after that. Another con which we luckily didn't have to deal with was how crazy busy the valet area gets. Right around 7ish it always seemed to get packed. A few times our car was either forgotten but another the valet was extra helpful to us. Most of the time they all seemed quite grumpy.

the resort fee of 23 dollars a day I don't mind paying, if I can actually use the amenities. continental breakfast was a big hassle, big line of people, no protein, just sugary things, no apples to take, no bananas. Taking an elevator was a big headache so many people trying to get in. The room is clean but outdated, no counter space at all. Dirty bath mat. Next time I will stay at the Outrigger, no resort fees and breakfast that I can actually eat.

We weren't sure what to expect with some of the reviews we read prior to our trip however we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed overnight prior to a cruise and would have to say it was equally as good as our stay at a higher rated property at the other end of the road, on the beach and double the price, a few years earlier. Geri on reception was fantastic and really knows great customer service. The hotel room, bed, bathroom and view were all great along with Tiki's Bar & Grill downstairs. Location was fantastic being just across the road to the beach and walking distance to everything you need. We would definitely stay here again.

I visited this hotel when I was 24, single. It was great then. This time around I'm 30 -traveling with my husband and 2 daughters. Not as ideal as my previous visit.The hotel is NICE. The location is amazing. (Beachfront) Directly across from Kuhio park which offers a safe calm beach protected by a break wall. The only thing I did not like about my stay at Aston is the rooms although we paid for oceanfront (the view is worth the extra money) the room itself was not satisfying the rooms level of cleanliness was not fair. I had to request extra towels, shampoo and conditioner daily. I don't understand why they wouldn't stock the room appropriately?!? 3 large towels for 4 guests? Of which 3 are girls, and yes they do know. All guests are disclosed at check in. We had an oceanfront room so the smudged sliding glass door is just unacceptable. The hotel staff in every area (including housekeeping) were always friendly and very helpful. The hotel is clean and smells fine.☺️The pool was under construction. The Tiki Bar and Grill is spectacular. Pricy (then again so is everything else in HI) but well worth it!Wolfgang Puck also very tasty and quick.Conveniently there is a subway, Jamba Juice, cookie factory within steps of the hotel! Directly next door you can find LuLu's also excellent food.
user_name:
Dennise G
Moreno Valley, California, United States

review_body: I came to the Aston Waikiki beach hotel with high expectations. But when I got here the place is all renovations! When we pulled up the valet guy told us to take the elevator to the 3rd floor, when we got to the elevator there was a crowd of people trying to go to the 3rd floor to check in. The elevator you need a class just to use it, we had other guess teach us how to use it. The girl at the front desk was great (local girl from Kahalu'u) very friendly and helpful. Upon getting to the elevator we end up waiting again because of the complicated elevator system. The room was very small for a $280 a night room with a partial ocean view. Room was outdated, but clean! Beds are comfortable and clean. We had come for a stay cation and dinner in Waikiki. We went to Hy's steakhouse for dinner, it was great. It was a very peaceful night sleep. Upon getting up we found a bill was slid under the door for $93.75. The bill consisted of fees and taxes. $42.50 in taxes and $50 in fees and if you can believe it $2 for use of the room keys. We went down to the front desk to talk about this untold bill, and we're told that this is standard. I travel a lot and have never had to pay almost $100 like that. Usually the taxes are in the bill not a separate bill. Upon checking in we were told parking was free because the type of reservation we had. Then this morning we were told it wasn't. A $23 resort fee is not bad, when you tack on another $27 for parking it is a lot. Over all not a good experience, me and my wife will never come back!

Nice hotel and very convenient location!Clean and nice size for rooms.Able to walk to the beach.Disappointed that the Pool was under construction though.Tiki Bar was good.Breakfast on the Beach was a wonderful idea!Tea, coffee, fruit, yogurt, donuts and muffins. Satisfied us. But if you want a hot breakfast there were places close.Travelled there from the airport with a one day rental.Parked at the Honolulu Zoo for a few hours. $1 per hour but prepay.

Based on the mixed reviews for this hotel, we were pleasantly surprised on arrival. - The rooms are dated but were clean, comfortable and we had a fabulous view- Hotel is located at the end of the strip but it was a pleasant enough walk - Was disappointed by the pool but it seems it is now being renovated- The DVD hire machine was a great amenity - The takeaway breakfast worked well for us - we were able to pack it and take it on the road with us, much better than sitting in a stuffy dining hall. The variety of food was very goodAs we travelled with family and didn't book the hotel, we can't comment on the value but would recommend you consider this hotel. (Actually stayed January 2014)

nice location as the hotel is situated infront of the waikiki beach. Tiki bar is a must try for tourists as they have live bands that are really good. If you travelling to oahu and do not have plans of driving everyday, do not rent a car as parking is pretty expensive on top of the resort fee.rooms are ok but choose a room with ocean view.

I'm surprised at some of the reviews, and was pleasantly surprised to walk into a clean room that was to me a very nice room. There were critiques about this room that were negative; 704.Alright we are facing construction below our Lanei, and the pool at this time is drained. We have an ice machine and vending machine for drinks outside our door as well. Despite all these seemingly negatives. Construction was over each night we came into our room to sleep and/or We could sit on the lanei and enjoy the sound of the surf and the stars of night. Most often we were up and off before construction started. There is so much to see and do in Oahu. Now let me tell you about the beach out front, its gorgeous and within walking distance to fo so many shops and the bus-line if you care to explore like we do. Just on the 3rd floor is a wonderful Tiki bar on a rooftop overlooking the ocean including wonderful food and drinks. From the checkin to service at the Tiki to the cleaning staff, customer service has been amazing. We travel enough to know when we found a gem! The breakfast is a nice bonus and there are indeed healthy choices, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, and some wonderful sugary concoctions. To the room again, we found the beds and pillows very comfortable and had no problems sleeping. Every day we came into a meticulously cleaned room. Must appreciation to the staff. We are still here not looking forward to leaving this friendly island, and Aston made it better

My partner and I arrived at the Aston beach via cab. When we got out of the cab we were absolutely swamped by about 3 men from the hotel. My partner was trying to sort out money from the cab driver which was proving to be difficult because the men were kept asking our name, booking dates and kept trying to grab our bags. We were really confused and didn't know what was going on. One of the men took our bags and told us to go upstairs to the front counter. He insisted that we were too early and wouldn't be able to check in (an hour early) and we would have to leave our bags with them downstairs and when our room was ready they would bring it up. We went upstairs and were advised that we could check in in 45 minutes. At this point I went back down and got my bag back off the man. He seemed resistant and stated that when we found out our room number we could just come back down, advise him and he would bring them up. I thought this was a little confusing because if I was going to come back down to tell him my room number, I might as well just get my bag. My partner and I assumed he was just very desperate for the tip which was not a good look for the hotel. Throughout this whole time we felt the man was quite rude and I didn't actually feel he was doing it to be helpful. The room we were assigned had a nice view but was pretty run down and needed a revamp. The bed sheets and towels had stains on them and hairs that weren't ours. The bedding was clearly old and didn't fit the bed properly anymore. The doors had paint peeling off and we're all chipped down the bottom. Overall I wouldn't stay here again. We got a discounted rate due to renovations (which we soon discovered meant the pool was shut). If we had to pay full price for this hotel I would have been really disappointed.

If this hotel wasn't part of a package deal with our airfare booked on Expedia, we would have left day one and never come back. The only reason it get's the second "star" is because of the location. It is literally right across the street from the ocean and we had AWESOME views from both the balcony (gorgeous ocean) and the back door (open air walkway that looked directly at Diamondhead.) That is it. We stayed 8 days, 7 nights, for our honeymoon. Upon arrival, we DID get an "upgrade" to an upper level, which gave us those awesome views. We had to pay an additional $28/night for a "resort (laughable) fee" and an additional $25/day for valet. The resort fee covered 2 coffees/day, unlimited redbox (their version) the pool (which was under construction and unusable) and breakfast (one walk through with a cooler - eggs, waffles, anything hot cost EXTRA!). The room we had was just run down and crappy. It was NOT a nice bed, the sheets were scratchy, and the mattress didn't have that nice luxury feel that you want when you stay in a hotel. The bathroom was dingy, had chipped tiles, and reminded me of a middle school for some reason. The shower head was too short for my husband and he had to scoot down to shower. At one point, there was a tile in the bathroom ceiling that fell down. This WAS NOT a quiet hotel. We heard literally every police car, construction vehicle, and trash pickup. The carpet was worn out, and the bathtub was grimy.Maid service was just bad. Twice, we were interrupted in our room by the maid who just came in and started cleaning. At one point, we had come back to the room and she had obviously been by and started cleaning earlier, and left our balcony door wide open. We were pretty high up, but the balconies touch and someone could easily climb in. I was on the phone with my father, who was scheduled to go in to major back surgery the next day, when the maid knocked on the door. We asked for 5 minutes while we wrapped up and got ready to leave. Instead, she told us she had things to do and just came in and started to clean anyways. I was trying to see how my dad was doing, and she's running the vacuum next to me. BEWARE: She DID NOT wash the glasses or coffee mugs, she only rinsed them and put them back. Gross. They didn't change the sheets while we were there - whatever, that's not a huge deal, but we're told it happens every three days. Not so. The construction was a complete distraction. I get that a hotel needs to update now and then - and this one especially - but we paid hundreds of dollars for this resort fee, and weren't able to use the pool or the downstairs area at all because it was so loud and dusty. I felt bad for the front desk people, it was SO LOUD. The elevators were brought down to only two for the whole hotel, and it took 10 minutes sometimes waiting for one to come up to us on the 23rd floor. We eventually said something after 5 or 6 days and they did give us half of our resort fee back, which counts for something but it felt like we still paid an extra $150 for nothing.The only people that we felt did a good job during our stay was the valet. They were prompt, friendly and took care of us. We never had to wait for our car, and we took it out more than once a day, every day.I would NOT recommend this hotel, 100 times over. We are usually pretty forgiving of hotels considering we didn't really even spend time in the room other than to sleep, and read a bit. This hotel, though, was a nightmare...especially if you want something a little more romantic.

Used the hotel as a departure/return point for three nights separated by about 5 nights in between each. Had three different rooms, all of the same type. The rooms are reasonably spacious. Capacious room safe. Good showers. Serviceable air conditioning (which wasn't needed all the time because it was the Hawaiian winter). The balcony is a nice touch and most rooms have a view of some sort of Waikiki Beach. They do a basic Western continental breakfast which extends to Japanese/Korean selections (ramen noodles, onigiri, kimchi - yum). The nice touch is your room has a 'breakfast bag' which you can load up and take over to the beach. The hotel is right across from Waikiki beach and right in the thick of downtown Waikiki. The hotel has a reasonably good vibe about it despite the obvious renovations which are impinging on the daily routine. The hotel is very close to Honolulu Zoo and Diamond Head. Overall, it's a good place to stay if you want to be in the hubbub of Waikiki. Pretty comfortable, clean rooms, free and reliable wifi, and reasonable value for money. Approximate cost of taxi between Honolulu Airport and the hotel was US$42 (excluding gratuity) and the trip takes 20-30mins

We absolutely loved the location of this hotel...across the street from the beach and many people used the public transportation stops at the hotel. Within walking distance of " the strip". Despite awful construction noise and disruption, we found the staff to be great. Many homeless people in the general vicinity but not due to the hotel.However, guests were never notified ahead of time of any changes to the physical arrangements of the layout due to the renovations occurring at that time. You would wake up or return to the hotel only to find no direction that the escalator for example was closed. No signs on where to go to access the elevator. It was obvious that the management of this establishment had NEVER had any experience with dealing with the customer or their own staff in times of such disarray. The hotel lost many guests, both loyal and new to such ignorance. We know this from standing in line at the breakfast buffet for 30 mins when the location was changed (yet again without notice to guests!!!!!) and there was only access to one side of the buffet table to guests. People of all cultures were astonished at such disorganization!!The hotel would have greatly benefited if they had determined the length of time of construction and closed to complete the work in a more efficient manner. Yet again a sign of inexperience. Also, please update all rooms in every manner (electronically, etc) so we don't feel like we are participating in a 1960s episode of Mad Men. Once completed, we would stay here in a heartbeat. Till then...aloha!

I'm sure staying anywhere in Hawaii is as close to paradise as one can get, but the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel really goes above and beyond in providing great customer service, and is located in a central location right on Waikiki, in walking distance to nearly everything. I was upgraded to a room on the 25th floor which had breathtaking views. From my balcony I could see almost all of Waikiki beach and all the other beautiful landmark hotels which surround the area. The bed was enormous and comfortable, and the room could not have been more quiet. Although there were a lot of families staying at this hotel, I never heard any noises while trying to sleep, or otherwise throughout the day. In the minifridge the hotel offers some complimentary tastes of the island, try them!! I had some kind of mango soda the first day and it was so nice to come to my hotel to relax and be able to try some local flavors. Every morning the hotel offers breakfast by the pool complete with a ukelele player who sings and takes requests. The hotel provides a lunchbox in every room so you can take your breakfast to the beach to eat, or so you can stock up on some yogurt or fruit for later. Get to breakfast early or risk being left with few options. Don't plan on being able to find some chairs by the pool to eat either, sometimes just eating on your balcony is a better option because you can still hear the music but are not around all the people trying to eat. The hotel is located right by the zoo (highly recommend), and is within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants. It is a great home base for anywhere you may want to travel on the island, and is not too far from anywhere. I chose this hotel because I had heard great things about the location and I'm glad I did. The property is clean, quiet, and well-situated;the beach is literally right across the street. Unless you want to shell out tons of cash, you cannot do better than the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.

The pool is under construction and the noise and dust is everywhere. It made the lobby anunpleasant place to be. The rooms were average. A little rundown but serviceable. I had an issue with the frig and they fixed it immediately. I would rate this a solid three star. No restaurant, room service or business center. They feature "breakfast on the beach", buffet tables of baked goods, some cereal, mixed fruit and beverages. Too many starches and the fruit was mostly melon, I did find a few pieces of papaya and pineapple but I was very early that morning.My biggest issue-I reserved a partial ocean view and had none. The front desk explained that because you can stand on the balcony and lean over and see the ocean this qualified. (not in my book) They did move me to a room with a view and an ice machine in hallway in front of the door. Luckily the machine was very quiet. The Wolfgang Puck Express in the lobby was a good place to eat.The front desk was very helpful and printed some documents for me without charge. The valet staff was funny and fast. Although $27 a night was excessive. The resort fee was too high covered wifi (which was very fast) breakfast, safe in room and free DVD rentals. All my requests were fulfilled but I will not be staying here again.

We picked the hotel based on location and cost. It is definitely one of the more reasonable hotels in the area, although the price we paid online didn't include the additional $23 'amenity fee' and $27 parking...per night. Hotel is under construction, and the pool is not available at all. We were right above the bar, so we had to use a white noise app to get to sleep (was still loud after midnight). Street noise is also a factor.Breakfast is continental - not worth $23, but generally not horrible. There is a Wolfgang Puck downstairs and a Starbucks around the corner, which came in handy.Bed was pretty comfortable, rooms were clean. The beach is about 500 feet from the hotel - very convenient.We wouldn't plan an extended stay, but it was a decent lower cost option for a day or two.

The hotel was great...it is in a very busy area...lots to see and do; however, there is lots of space for quiet time! We suggest renting a car for the day...drive the entire island! This was the best part of our trip.The room was "nice" and overlooked the water. The staff were nice but very busy...lots of vacationers!

The last two reviewers must be related to the hotel owners. This hotel is construction hell, and how anyone can sell this hotel without explaining in detail the issues with construction is immoral. The pool is out of service (no pool in Hawaii...you have got to be kidding) The lobby and hallways are torn up, Jackhammering going on during the day. Stay in NYC or LA if you want these kind of noisy conditions.The rooms did have new carpet but are old with old bathrooms. The rooms are small. This is a two star hotel if there was no construction.Stay elsewhere if you are interested in a paradisiacal room in paradise.

I have just stayed at The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. I recommend to all Australians to stay on their Hawaiian adventure and say a warm Gidday to the Concierge, Dina. The hotel was great, Dina sensational, her commitment and welcoming personality ensured that my Japanese friends and I had the time of our lives. Dina always had time for a smile, a laugh and a warm Hi each time we walked past her desk. Nothing was too much trouble for Dina as she re planed our activities to ensure that we did experience all that we wished too, and all within our budget and timeline. Guys when you stay at The Aston please say a warm Aussie Hi to Dina from Deb, Sachi and Junko. We are already planning our next trip, are of course staying at The Aston, our first trip will be straight to Dina's desk! Deb C-H

We stayed January 20 - 27, 2015. We had no idea when we arrived that the hotel was under construction with the pool deck renovation. The noise was a problem, but the hotel manager was wonderful and worked with us, upgrading our room to a front ocean view and much more quieter. We found the staff very friendly and very willing to help all the guests through the construction. All you had to do was ask and the staff was there to help make the stay great. The rooms and beds do need a little updating, but they're not all that bad, and I'm sure the hotel will be doing this in the future. The beautiful ocean view rooms priced affordably make up for that! If we could take off tomorrow for Waikiki Beach, we would certainly stay at this hotel. Its location is great and having Wolfgang Puck Express was super, as was the amazing Tiki Restaurant.

Great location, Awesome staff, looking forward to my next trip hopefully in April..Breakfast was great- rooms are clean and comfortable!! Wonderful views, has awesome restaurant Tiki's Bar and Grill. Enjoyed my stay! Have nothing bad to say.

While I know that the Aston used to be a great place to stay (I was here 7 or 8 years ago), it's clearly fallen on some rough times since then. We were very disappointed to learn upon arriving that the pool is closed and under heavy construction (which is very very loud and continues all day). The lobby area is partially closed off and the escalator was closed on and off during our visit. Additionally, our telephone didn't work, the PS3 in the room didn't work (until we fixed it ourselves), and the bathroom was desperately needing an update. Breakfast left a lot to be desired (just some sweet buns and fruits) and we found the additional resort fee pretty high (it covers the amenities that they apparently provide, but which seem like they should just be included with a 3-star hotel). The one redeeming feature was the view,which we did really enjoy, as it has a fantastic view over the entire beach if you have an ocean view room. But again, it was mostly interrupted by heavy and loud construction throughout our stay, which was very disruptive. This was a very special trip for us, anniversary and birthday, and we specifically chose this hotel because we wanted a pool and some peace & quiet, so we were really disappointed to know that we had no pool and were woken up each day by the construction noise. The hotel does offer a complimentary access to their sister hotel's pool around the corner, but I felt that we should have been notified somehow before booking that the hotel was undergoing construction. Service from hotel staff was very good throughout our stay and location was perfect (right across from the beach!) but it was not enough to make up for the disruption and inconvenience. I don't think we'll be staying here again and we'd recommend to guests considering the hotel to stay elsewhere at least until they complete construction, especially considering the price.

Really lovely front desk staff (thank you Geri and others) made us welcome with our early start. The room (ocean view) had a great view from the balcony (lanai) over all of Waikiki.The room itself was comfortable, with shower and bath and refrigerator. An electric kettle was provided on request. The balcony sat two (we just used the luggage rack with a towel over it as an outside table). The bed was nice and pillows nice. There was enough room. It was definitely set up for leisure rather than work and I could see the table provided might be an issue for older people (but the staff really went out of their way to try to make any request happen).The hotel is currently undergoing some major renovations - jack hammers at 9am daily kept us from sleeping in. There was no pool access whilst they re-tile this area. The breakfast location changed and there was some variety in the pastries provided. We also enjoyed the cold soba noodles on some days for variety. Why would you stay there? Lovely staff (Really Lovely Staff), good room, good views, great location, snorkelling steps away from the front of the hotel, good swimming for families at the beach in front of the hotel, easy access to public buses, quieter end of Waikiki. We had good wifi access in our room.Why might you hesitate? You want a full-service cooked breakfast delivered to your door, you need a huge pool to be happy, the renovations can be noisy (the staff are apologetic, but jackhammers are jackhammers!) re the Resort fee - it's not unique to this hotel and we thought that unlimited DVDs, great wifi, ok beach towels (no taking soggy towels home!) and an OK breakfast was not a high price to pay for $12.50 per person per day in a not unreasonably priced hotel in its location.We hope to return to the hotel another time.

Stayed on the 24th floor facing the beach.Nice room and balcony.The bed was crummy and was like sleeping on a hot water bottle.Each time wife moved I got up.Slept like crap the whole time.Breakfast poolside was good and Wolfgang Puck Express on the main floor was amazing!Cross the street to get to beach and walking distance to shopping and food was easy.

When I booked this hotel in May it showed all the amenities. When we got here I know where of the construction going on that goodThe pool was under construction. Now very very noisey. My stay here left much to bedesired. At one point only one elevator was working stuffed with People. It was a nice hotel back in its day. The location is perfect. The staff excellent. Especially jerry at the front desk.

Very average rooms. Only stayed two nights. Hotel itself was pretty average but the price wasn't average at all over the Christmas period but quite the opposite. Breakfast is included and served outside by the pool. Not too good in the rain which is was on our last morning and not really worth bothering with to be honest.. Everyone was scrambling in the Lobby to get the lifts back up to there rooms. It was crazy so we actually checked out early. Located on the Southern side if Waikiki beach but across the road from the beach so good view if you pay for an Ocean View Room. We did go back to Waikiki a few weeks later but stayed more centrally but still frequented the Tiki Bar at the Aston for Happy Hour as they had great priced drinks.

The hotel is old, terrible beds, terrible pillows. They say it is free breakfast, but it is 23.00 dollars charge per day for breakfast, beach chairs, beach towels, movie rentals, etc. That means it is not free. Also breakfast is not good. Sweet breads, fruits, yogurt, juice, coffee and milk and they charge 7.00 dollars for an omelet, and other amounts for pancakes, french toast, etc. The communication from the staff at the hotel is terrible. The pool is under renovation and we were not notified at all that they were giving passes to use another hotel pool. I heard, my last day, in the elevator that we could use an other hotel pool. Nobody told us that we could use the other hotel pool. When they started pool renovations, the clients who checked in were told about the pool passes, but we checked in before the renovation started, and they didn't tell us. This hotel is one or maximum two stars at most, being very generous.

We were upgraded to a great room. The hotel is in a great location and we felt safe coming home late at night. The customer service was excellent and they really went above and beyond to accommodate our needs. When the DVD player didn't work it was fixed immediately, the people next door were very loud in the middle of the night and security was sent up to deal with this. The pool was being renovated at the time but there was an alternative provided! We had a great stay and loved the hotel. It was good value for money!

I want to start by saying that we (2 adults 3 children) checked in here on 26 Dec so it was a busy day for changeover and I am not sure they were fully staffed. Having said that they knew we (and many others) were coming and what time we would arrive and we had been advised that an early check in was OK. Unfortunately we had to wait for hours before we could check in and even after the 'Guaranteed check in time' had passed. The staff did their best and as I said it was a busy day but not the start we wanted to our holiday as we had flown all night to get there. We were only staying for 1 night before our cruise departure and were just glad to have a shower etc after flying all night. Hotel is centrally located with a short walk to beach and shops. Rooms need some work as they are getting a bit tired but were OK for one night. Its possible we were given one of the less attractive rooms due to our short stay. The people in our party who had the separate room were kept up all night by someone busking/singing in the street across the road until 4am. Again not the hotels fault but would recommend a room higher up and not facing Kalakaua Ave.Personally I would not want to have an extended stay here if you can afford something better - no pool or other amenities.

Where do we start .. Do not book here if you want to relax !!!! Rooms are small and very outdated but clean .The pillows are so worn out that your head lies flat on the mattress and are very uncomfortable , The location is awesome as it's across the road from the beach As for the breakfast well it is discusting !!!!AND NOT FREE as some other reviewers have stated The Fruit is slimmy and tasteless and there is not much of varieties, As for the coffee well it's made me give up caffeine ,everyday they serve up the same breakfast consisting of donuts ,chocolate muffins and some other full of sugar pastries , And if you want eggs you need to pay an extra 8.99 USD for ,which is a joke as you can get a full breakfast down the road for less than that .. My suggestion to the hotel manager would be to ease off on all those pastries And add eggs and other healthier options to the breakfast maybe even some toast after all we are paying an amenity fee . Parking is a real joke seriously 28USD a night ... This is my first time at this hotel and I wouldn't recommend it ,especially families with small children

This was my first stay at this hotel. I knew going in that there was construction. We were in room 1007 a delux room, however I wouldn't call it that. The view was great, but that was the only postive thing about the room, it faces the front of the hotel which also happened to be where all the tour buses and trolleys pick up passengers, the sliding door does not keep the noise out, so very early you hear the noise of traffic and trash trucks and every other noisey vehicle it's non stop. It's also over the Tiki restaurant which has nightly music and a loud crowd. There were lots of inconveniences due to the construction. The breakfast on the beach was just continental breakfast nothing great, not enough seating for sure.Back to our room, it was smaller than the average room, the sliding door didn't slide correctly or close correctly. The bathroom was very, very small and very run down. They didn't clean our room our first day and the next day, all they did was make the beds. The fact that their rooms avg the same as the four star hotels, made me expect much more. Luckily we were only there 3 sleepless nights before moving to a much better hotel. This side of Waikiki is also not as nice as the Beach Walk side. I would never recommend this hotel, with the noise of the room there is really no place to sit and get way from all the noise anywhere on the property. I like a peaceful place to come to after a day out and about. If you want any quiet time this is not the place for you.

The location, staff were great but I did feel that room was overpriced for what we got. It's at the far end of Waikiki Beach which has less action so if you want to be in the heart of it all, this isn't the hotel for you. It's a 20 minute walk to the action or a $10 cab ride. Overall it was slightly above average.

This was a surprise trip by my hubby for the whole family (our sons are 10 and 12) and he was sold on this being an affordable and wonderful hotel we were both extremely disappointed when we got there.We stayed here for 9 nights from the 15th of Jan 2015 to the 24th of Jan. We arrived early in the morning and was told that our room was ready and there was another room available which was an upgrade and being a bigger room was better for having the kids as the room that was booked by flight centre was only 2 twin beds. You have to pay $25US a day which is a total rip off. My hubby hadn't really gone over all the paperwork because he trusted the travel agent when she said this was a affordable hotel. Anyway by the time we added in the 25 a day and the upgrade we had lost 1000AUD before we even got to the "upgraded room".The room it self was ordinany - would have spent the extra money to stay in a nicer place. I don't mind bad/outdated decor but to have to pay 25 a day as well?? The hotel was being renovated at the imd of our stay and to hear jack hammers every day was annoying to say the least and to top it off they closed 3 lifts so during peak hour it was stopping at every level when it was already packed to the max. The "breakfast" they serve up is disgusting. It's basically donuts every morning. We ate out most mornings or we were on excisions so we missed out on it which was good. If you are going to try it - GET IN EARLY. The queues are long and heaps of people load up their little coolers/esky's with whatever they can grab.Also forgot to add that at night you get a lot of "people" who decide its great to scream in the street in the middle of the night.This basically ruined the first few days of our trip and to say I'm going to have a few words with our travel agent is to say the least.

Semi ocean view was a good sized room, clean and quiet. Employees were polite and helpful. Liked the breakfast and cooler that came with it and the Internet worked fine. Attended a company event and the staff on the 21st Flr. was excellent.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel provided me good value in comparison to what other resorts on Waikiki Beach were offering during my peak season visit. I had a king bed which was super comfortable, the room was clean, and was cleaned properly. I had one interruption during the day for construction in my room and there was construction in the pool area but they are trying to improve their resort so what do you do! The only thing I was disappointed with was because of travelling from Australia, I was jet-lagged and slept in quite late for the first couple of mornings. When I would arrive 45 minutes before the breakfast was to close, most of the food was gone and not replenished for us guests that were arriving late. The hotel is in a great location, just a short walk away from everything you need and across the street from the beach. We even had Hawaii Five-O filming on location on the last day of my stay. I used the gym facilities, which were very small, but it has a juice bar downstairs in the same building which was great for getting protein shakes after a workout. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for travellers who want location at a decent price.

Aston is a very good place for people, who do not want to seat in the hotel, and would like to explore the island. This is not a criticism, but a fair assessment. The building is quite old, but reasonably well maintained. Rooms are clean, but basic. The pool is there, but rather small. Breakfast is included, but is limited (if you wanted to get "descent stuff", it is a good idea to be there early), and designed for people, who would like to lose weight. Hotel is basically on the beach, but the rock free area is rather shallow and small, which is good for families with small children. Hotel's staff is very friendly and helpful, but at times there might be some communications issues.

We stayed here on our way home to Sydney after a 7 week trip to Canada/USA and Alaska. It is in an amazing location. Just across the road from Waikiki beach and close enough to all the night life without being right in the middle. So you can get away from all the excitement if you want to. Transport is right at the door. The hotel itself is great. Beautiful breakfasts on the pool deck each morning with live Hawaiian music and dancer. Our room was a mini suite with partial (although we thought more like full) views of the beach. Very clean and roomy and bathroom of good size. The ladies on the tour desk were most helpful and aided us in booking the tours we wanted at the price we wanted. We were very very happy with every aspect of this great hotel.

It is our second time with the hotel. The location was very good, very convenient for all outdoor shopping and activities. The room was very clean and the bed was just comfortable. We had an ocean front room, and the view of the ocean is perfect without any obstacle...Of course, it is not a luxury hotel however considering the price paid, really excellent!

Park at the Banyan Hotel around the corner at the Banyan. Parking is $27 at the Aston plus an additional $23 per room for "resort fees". The breakfast that is included is sparse at best.The staff is very nice, rooms are clean and the location is great, but not worth an additional $50 per day over your room rate.

Compared to all the other places this one was a good buy for the price you can't beat the location directly across from the beach. The only thing I didn't like was the mattress they definitely need to replace asap.

The Aston was very clean, the free breakfast was very cool as they gave you a small cooler to fill and take to the beach, pool or your room! The beds were comfortable and rooms were nice. They also give you a card to rent free movies to take back to your room! Excellent hotel and good value for your $$$.

Traveling inter island with my older parents we needed a place to stay for the weekend. Picked this place based on price and reviews. Easy enough to find, upon arrival met by courteous valet that explained that the front desk is actually not on the level you park your car. So up an elevator to the front desk. Our two rooms had been on separate floors; with a request to move to a room closer to my parents, they accommodated without hesitation and got us two neighboring rooms. Rooms were clean and bright. The elevator is a little confusing, but once you understand it, it's fine. Bed was comfortable and road noise was minimal (Waikiki is known for its road noise - late night parties and early morning deliveries to hotels make it potentially hard to rest) Breakfast is free, but very minimal. Beach is literally right across the street. An evening walk to dinner and one of the greatest sunsets I have ever seen. I would recommend this place to others.

We stayed at this resort for 8 days thus month and we had an amazing time. Not only were the staff friendly and helpful, but our room was clean and comfy with all that we needed. We Loved the breakfasts poolside with the live entertainment. We loved the towels and chairs to use at the beach, we really loved it all. Great value. Amazing location...close to Zoo, Diamond HeD, right on the beach, churches, resturants, and on the strip! We will definitely be returning...honestly, we didn't want to leave! Thanks for accommodating our family so nicely.

We found this hotel to be a great place to stay in Waikiki. Free breakfast at poolside is offered every morning along with free towels and chairs for the beach. A free daily newspaper is provided. We had a deluxe room with a great view of the ocean and beach and received a room upgrade because we were repeat customers. Their Tiki Restaurant is rated 5 stars and also has a perfect view of the ocean. I fully recommend this hotel. You will love it!
user_name:
Lane C
Reno, Nevada, United States

review_body: We had booked 3 Ocean front rooms from Australia for a 50th birthday holiday and couldn't have been happier. The location is fantastic and the views of Waikiki beach are amazing, especially at sunset. It is only a short walk across the road to the beach and because it is a little away from the main beach area the beach and foreshore are not as busy. Staff were wonderful and the hotel was always lovely and clean. Our room was great and having a balcony to sit and enjoy the view was fantastic. The trolleys all stop right in front of the hotel and the bus stop is at the end of the street although it is an easy walk to all the shops and restaurants so couldn't be easier to get around Waikiki from here. All in all a wonderful hotel we couldn't recommend enough. Won't disappoint.

I came back to Hawaii after 23 years and I am dissapointed, because it looks like a time stopped over there. After spending few days in Kona in Aston, we were expecting much more for the price. Hotel is outdated, needs renovation. Is located ACROSS the street from the public beach. There is no way to get any beach chairs in the hotel because they are gone at 7 AM (huge hotel and maybe 20 chairs...unbelivable). Chairs by the pool falling apart. Breakfast on the beach - it is a joke - this is terrible continental breakfast with processed foods, horrible coffee and sometimes eggs, but we have to pay for them. Everyday one Korean "dish" like small portion of kimchi o rice noodle. There is no place to eat for hotel guests - just few tables by the pool, so people are sitting on the cancrite... Rooms are small, only one chair on the balcony. Public beach very narrow and crowded like hell. A beach chair with umbrella costs 50 $ everywhere - outreagous! Homeless people are everywhere, they sleeping on the beach. Concluding - it was my second and last trip to Hawaii - very costly, very exhausting, especially in Waikiki not relaxing at all.

This was my very first time vacationing in Hawaii and staying at the Aston, for eight days. The staff was extremely friendly and always had smiles on their faces. I used to train adults on Customer Service, so I'm always paying close attention to detail. I would highly recommend this hotel. Also, it's very close to the Honolulu Zoo, the Aqarium and the beach. My only negative, there is no room service.

Booked in for Six nights to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary - stayed for Two as we had a two night non-refundable deposit.As we were celebrating our anniversary, the hotel gave us a complimentary 'upgrade'. The 'upgrade' was to a small room with an outside corridor which had a concrete floor, and a partial ocean view from the 3 foot wide balcony!!! The view was mostly of the hotel next door.The pool was closed for resurfacing of the surrounding floor area. 'Breakfast on the Beach' was served adjacent to this area, at a few small tables. With hundreds of guests vying for these tables, it quickly became obvious why the hotel was providing complimentary cool bags to take breakfast back to your room - it was almost impossible to get a table to eat at. In addition, breakfast was accompanied by the smell of burning rubber/asphalt as the repair crew was working about 30 feet away.The elevators have been renovated internally with a 60's retro, bright neon look, which is not the best way to start your day! It felt like Las Vegas without the casino!!We moved to the Hilton Hawaiian Village for the rest of our vacation - our room was only slightly more expensive there.
user_name:
Bill E
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Upon checking in, asked about room upgrade, was offered a delightful ocean beach view by front desk Geri, who was very friendly and accommodating, took us to the pool area and showed us where the room would be located and explained the extra cost. The room was great, on the 20th floor, what a view! Stopped at desk later; Geri offered advice on things to see & do in the area. Very helpful. Second time we have stayed at this hotel. Breakfast by the pool with entertainment. Good location, everything you need is close by. Will stay again. Thanks to Geri

This is one of the more reasonable hotels on Waikiki Beach. Is one of the closest to the beach - just across the street. Many convenience stores, fast food and nicer restaurants in easy walking distance - it felt like being in NYC on a beach. Surf lessons, rentals 100 yards up the beach. The daily breakfast is convenient and nice with live acoustic music and a hula dancer; it is true that the food is repetitive ( lots of bread items, fruit, some type of Asian noodle selection, and beverages, but never any protein during our 5 days there).

From the moment we arrived the wow this is nice factor took over. Then opening the door to our room and taking in the view we knew we had made the rite choice. Breakfast poolside or at the beach, what better way to start the day.

Just returned from a 3 week stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. It's a great location but there are a few things that may be a bit irritating to some. Check-in was excellent. We had booked an Ocean Front Room (highly recommended) and requested a shower chair be placed in the room. The check in was quick, efficient and friendly and to our surprise, the shower chair was waiting in the room (many hotels where one is requested, often result in several reminders!) We found the room to be VERY clean. Bed linens were immaculate and the carpet was obviously quite new. The air conditioner worked well, although the WIFI was a bit spotty. I found a better connection by logging into the WIFI from the neighbouring room! The hotel, however, is a victim of when it was built. The hotel was probably built over 40 years ago and although it is obvious that upgrades (a relatively new shower stall for example) have been made, it is still a product of the 1970's. The rooms are relatively small; there is no room for a couch or even a chair. The balcony only has room for one chair and a foot stool. The bathroom is frustratingly small. The pool area was poorly designed and beginning to look shabby, although as we left, a massive construction area was being prepared to replace the pool deck. The pool was placed in an area where it only gets the late afternoon sun; but then again, the beach is literally across the street. Those looking for a "quiet retreat" should look at other places as the Tiki Bar and Grill is literally outside and underneath many rooms. The music from the bar is very loud but DOES end at midnight. That being said, TIKI's is a GREAT restaurant; a bit pricey but well worth the cost. I am NOT a fan of RESORT fees (aka Amenity fees). The Aston charges $23/day + tax. It included a "Breakfast on the Beach", which is basically a continental breakfast that you pick up pool side and take to your room, the beach or eat on a lounge chair next to the pool. It also includes room WIFI, use of a coffee maker in the room, unlimited DVD rentals, local calls, use of a very small fitness centre, a daily newspaper and the use of an in-room safe. All we used was the WIFI (spotty in our room) and the safe. Not great value for our $23. Free beach towels and beach chairs are also available, but more often than not, the chairs were gone early in the morning so I ended up buying my own. Beach Towels were always available but somedays, they "ran out" but promised they would be replenished in "20 minutes". True to their word, they were. All interactions with the staff was extremely pleasant. The cleaning staff acknowledged us in the hallway EVERY time we passed them. Once at the pool, a staff member who identified herself as a customer relations representative inquired as to our impressions of the hotel and if there was anything she could do. Our TV stopped working after the first night, but was replaced very quickly. Overall, we were quite happy with the hotel. Very clean, friendly staff, excellent location but a product of the decade in which it was built. Would we stay here again?? Most probably.

My wife and I were here the first week in January with a friend and we and the friend had adjoining rooms on the 16th floor with a view of Diamond Head.Our rooms were very small with no chair for sitting - just two high chairs at a high top table. My wife has a hip issue and could not get in the chairs so there was nowhere she could sit in the room except on the bed. Our balcony had an ocean view but only one chair so we could not sit out there together, Whose bright idea was that?There is a mandatory "resort fee" which includes Wifi. But the Wifi connect was spotty at best. I had to do some work and during one session of an hour or so was kicked off more than five times, which made my work much harder. The fee also includes breakfast, which wasn't bad - adequate for me, but they limit you to one trip through the line so you better make sure you have what you want the first time. The breakfast includes boxed cereal, some fruit, average quality muffins and scones, coffee, tea and juice. Eggs and the like are an extra charge. There are no plates or trays so you need to be able to carry everything or stuff it in the little lunch bag they give you. The worst part of breakfast is finding a place to sit - there are not enough tables around the pool. On the plus side, a guitar player/singer and a hula dancer were a pleasant touch. Parking is valet only and is another added cost. I had no problem with the fitness center - it is relatively small but both days I used it no one else was there at the time. The pool is rather small but who would want to hang out there with Waikiki Beach across the street?No complaints about service. We did not experience the check-in delay described by other recent reviews and the people at the front desk were helpful.I know Honolulu is expensive but this place seems overpriced for the size of the rooms and overall quality. The resort fee and valet parking add an extra $50+ to the quoted price.We had dinner both nights at the Tiki Bar and ordered from the bar menu rather than the indoor restaurant which has a more extensive menu. We had good service both nights and enjoyed both the food and drinks. (Recommend the pork quesadillas.) There is a Wolfgang Puck Express down on the ground floor.Overall, if we ever go back top Honolulu we will probably look for a better place.

We stayed at Aston waikiki through New Years recently and we arrived from sydney at 7am in the morning. The concierge assured us he will try to get our room available ASAP as check in was at 3pm- we were extremely exhausted!! We ended up sleeping in the hot sun near the pool as our room wasn't ready untill 3pm exactly. This wasn't a great start to our holiday we were so excited about. This was my least favourite thing about our stay here, but there isn't much you can do if a room isn't ready for you. I did try to contact the hotel in advance to work out a plan for the times, however I didn't recieve a reply. When we first walked into our room we were pleased with the size and beautiful view out the window ! My partner was extremely happy about the PS3 ! The bathroom could Deffinately do with an upgrade, as the shower leaked onto the floor after you finished, as it was only a shower curtain that didn't do it's job, so our towels were constantly on the floor so we didn't flood the bathroom ! The movie machine is fantastic!!!! We absolutely loved watching a movie before bed every night, it was a great way to end our busy days. The breakfast was very basic, cereals, fruit and juice were all we ate, which isn't worth the 23 fee. But I think the cooler idea is great! Be prepared to pay for hot food- eggs and waffles. As recommendation, the hotel should look into adding bacon and eggs onto the menu to please a lot more of their customers!! I know it would of made my partner a lot more Excited to wake up for the breakfast, as there would of been something he liked there. The staff are extremely friendly and always willing to help you out!! The aloha vip tour desk was so helpful, and helped us get the most out of our holiday so thank you!! The location of the hotel is fantastic ! You get to have a lovely stroll of the Main Street before you get to all the restraunts and shops. Most shops are open untill 10pm which made nightlife incredible as you roam the streetsOverall we were really happy with the service at the hotel, and the location, the beach across the road is beautiful. We are extremely happy that we checked out when we did though as renovations had just started, and at 9am it was so so noisy and I don't think we would of enjoyed staying here during that renovation time. Thank you for.a great stay !!

We planed this vacation mouths in advance when we arrived there were only two people working the front desk an had to wait till 3:00 to chk in it was not cool. Pool area looked really shabby an poorly layed out room's looked out dated just like the bathrooms beds were hella small we had to upgrade too ocean view side view all you get a view of Diemond head an side of a building we were told that's considered ocean view so had to fork out $239.00 more for the real ocean view. An then there was construction going on not cool. The free brkfst over rated all you get is a stupid lunch bag pastries fruit coffee juice an if you want egg's or pancakes that will cost you extra an only have one person cocking an not much of a sitting area!! One of the worst brkfst ever avoid this mess...!

This was our fifth and final stay here. First few times it was great. A few years has passed since last time and the service went way due as did the cleanliness and upkeep. Too bad because its a great location. Breakfast on the Beach was a great thing BOB for short. This time same one flavor of yogurt each day, no variety. No gluten free options. Pretty run down.We got the wrong rooms and complained, but told no rooms available for what we booked. The bathrooms and bed areas very run down and dirty. My daughter discovered a very large cockroach walking up the wall in our room. We complained and told by front desk person no big deal, happens all the time. Very common!! Sent someone up to catch the roach.YUCK!! Would not stay here ever again. Over priced for the condition.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach over Christmas and the location is phenomenal. I like the beach being right across the street, also close to the Zoo, shopping, restaurants, etc. The breakfast was good but very crowded. The coconut coffee at breakfast is the best!! We went to Tiki's for dinner one evening and the food & drink were great.The rooms (especially the bathrooms) are starting to get a little dated, and the balconies are a little small, but overall I was happy with the room. The bed & pillows were very comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Good value for the money and I would definitely stay here again.

Great value for money hotel. Views are sensational although balconies a little small. Rooms are a bit tired and bathrooms very small but views, staff and location excellent. Right opposite good safe family beach. Tiki bar goes off so try and get room on high level as noise can be a problem if you're not joining in! Staff were amazing

We got an ocean view room with breakfast package. I got to thank reviewers on trip advisor...This hotel is worth the buck if your purpose is to go around oahu during the day and walk to the beach in the evening. You are in the heart of waikiki downtown. All this, still on a budget. However not a place for romantic/anniversary or luxury style vacation.

We have stayed at this property 2 years ago, and it was rather basic, rooms very small, but we liked the location and free breakfast. We just booked there again, however I noticed there website mentioned renovations. I called the property directly and learned the poll was to be totally shut down through Feb. 2015, and they also were not offering free breakfast (they were calling breakfast free granola bars during renovation). I mentioned to the gal at the reservation desk that I felt their website did not make this information clear, and with the loss of amenities, they should not be charging the resort fee-- she didn't seem to care what I thought , and had an "oh well" attitude. I promptly cancelled my reservation!!!!!

Let me start with the positives: good location, nice size rooms, overall a clean hotel, room attendants are especially thorough and do a wonderful job at turning the room. Be aware the hotel includes a mandatory "resort fee" at check-in! I can justify a resort fee if the hotel is an actual resort but I don't think the Aston Waikiki is anywhere close to being a resort!! The resort fee includes: breakfast, wifi, gym. Please be warned, the breakfast is not great, box cereal, cut fruit and a few pastries which usual run if you're not down by 7am. The wifi is spotty better off using your data plan. And I've seen bigger and better gym facilities at some apartment buildings. Check-in is painfully slow, be prepared to wait in very Long lines!! Either they need to schedule more check-in agents especially during high season or need to provide efficient check-in training to staff. And check-in is 3pm, whether they have available rooms or not!! Be prepared to wait till after 3pm for a room. You will see families hanging around the small pool in the lobby with luggage waiting for rooms for most of the day.Worst of all, for a hotel that categorizes itself as a resort, the Aston Waikiki does NOT provide hospitality rooms for their guests to use after check-out.
