Clearly they need to take a tip from other 4-star resorts/hotels in the Waikiki area on providing hospitality amenities for their customers with late night outbound flights. You would think this would be included in the "resort fee". I even spoke with the manager on duty who could not even give me a clear explanation as to why this is the case for a supposed 4 star resort!! So I asked where I could freshen up and she pointed me to the outdoor showers by the pool with no running hot/warm water!! I asked if maybe I could shower in the gym, in private, with warm water? But guess what...the gym does NOT have showers! Really..and this is suppose to be a 4 star resort?? Do yourself and your family a favor and book somewhere else with better amenities and much better customer service. I was expecting a little more from Aston Waikiki but I was disappointed.

I stayed in this hotel between 27 Dec 2014 - 4 Jan 2015 sharing a room with two other girls ( 2 double beds). The cost was $3221.20 in total, that's $1073 each for 7 nights, daily amenities fee not included (has to be paid directly to the hotel AT TIME OF CHECK IN).Whilst there was technically nothing wrong with the room, that seems to be the only good thing I have to say. We arrived around midday and asked concierge to hold our bags (check in was at 3pm). Concierge did hold our bags but they were otherwise not very helpful or hospitable. We went upstairs to check-in which consisted of waiting in a long line of other like minded people who thought they would check get in early and beat the rush, only to be told that we would have to come back at 3 to be handed our room key which again consisted of waiting in a long line. When we got to our room it had 1 king size bed in it, for 3 girls. We had requested 2 double bed from the time we had booked the room 3 months ago AND we had told the staff at check-in that we needed 2 double beds. This was eventually sorted but not until various calls were made to reception. The room was far from modern, the shower is one of those annoying ones where you turn on the water and it goes straight into the bathtub until you pull the pin and get it to stream water to the shower head. There was a shower curtain, i thought these died long ago when some genius created shower screens. The carpet in the hallway was dated and smelt, moreover you could smell the Asian cuisine ( i hope it was cuisine and not the people) coming from some of the rooms. We stayed on level 12, ocean front room, the most expensive rooms in the hotel - only to realize that we had the longest commute from our room all the way down the smelly hall to the elevators (located near the garden view rooms). And not to mention the lift would require you to get out at Level 3 (Lobby) and get into another lift to go to Level 1 which was the level which you exited onto the street. The hotel is one of the last on the main strip of Waikiki beach, yes its waterfront but every time you exit your hotel there is still the usual homeless or beggars or drunks right in front of your doorstep. We had to be mindful walking home. The balcony had one chair on it. The bed was standard (nothing luxurious) and we did not once use the pool (small and uninviting). Tiki's bar & grill was popular for dining but we did not have the opportunity to eat there. The staff (excluding maids) were unhelpful. I needed to use the bathroom on NYE so I rushed to the lobby (instead of taking two lifts to our room and running down the hallway) and I was told that they are closed by 10pm, so my room key would not allow me to use the bathrooms in our own hotel, again the staff were rude and inconsiderate of this.Overall, it was very very average to say the least. I am struggling to find a highlight or even good thing to say. Perhaps the breakfast (included in your daily service fee) would be it. A selection of fresh baked goods, cereals and fresh fruits is available between 6am-9am, but that's not helpful to anyone who doesn't want to wake up early. A hot breakfast will cost you extra, plain omelette was around 6-8US$. And last but not least, smokers - don't bother. In general in Hawaii you can't smoke on your balcony or within 20 ft (6metres) of any door to a shop/hotel etc. You would think they had a smoking section at least, but no such luck. I can't count the number of times we were asked to move whilst smoking in the carpark/drive in area of the hotel. It was the only spot where you were able to sit to have a cigarette and enjoy it until concierge moved you onto the street (which was about 3 metres further out in front of the area which families and other tourists were waiting for their tour buses. Wi-fi, we all know how important that is when travelling. Wi-fi was good inside your room but the second you stepped outside YOUR ROOM (not the hotel) it would disconnect. You could get average connection in lobby and on level 1 (street level) by entering your email address each and every time you wanted to connect but it was not full strength. This is just unacceptable given that wi-fi is part of the service included in your daily amenities fee (a MANDATORY $25-28US a day). Overall just exceptionally poor in all respects. Would not stay there again, even if it was the only hotel available.

The hotel could use a bit of a facelift, but this is Hawaii! I believe this location is undergoing some renovations, so every room could be a bit different. Ours was spectacular. The hotel staff was incredibly accommodating and helpful. There is no fitness center and only a tiny pool, but we joined the 24-hour fitness across the street. There are many food options minutes from this location, and this area is a shopping mecca.

I was pretty disappointed with my stay here. Our friends had stayed here last year but apparently they had a remodeled room. On this trip we had 3 rooms reserved and none of them were remodeled according to what my friends said they experienced when they went last year. So, they too were disappointed and I could tell they felt badly about recommending that we all stay here over Christmas vacation. Our room was dirty, especially the bathroom, bugs and all. Our a/c did not work for the first 2 days and was finally fixed on the 3rd trip from maintenance. Two of the rooms we had booked were inside as soon as you came off the elevators on the 7th floor so those rooms stayed cooler but our room was located on an outside hallway and the full sun was on the room most of the day so it didn't really cool down until later in the evening once the sun set. I was also not crazy about having a room that was outside, it felt very old school motel to me and I was not paying an old school motel price. I will not stay here again on any future visits.

I am from Sydney and recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel over Christmas until New Years Eve. The hotel is pretty much like most other hotels in the area and you get what you pay for, similar to the Jetstar flight coming into Honolulu. I travel light and was permitted only 7 kgs of carry on luggage however there was always room for my favourite movie No Retreat No Surrender, which you may have seen. No Retreat No Surrender is a classic made in 1986 which is about a Bruce Lee fan called Jason Stillwell played by Kurt McKinney, who trains martial arts at his fathers dojo in Los Angeles called Sherman Oaks Karate. A crime syndicate (Van Damme) is trying to take over the dojo and although Jason's father is a black belt, he's not a huge fan of fighting so the Stillwells decide to leave LA. They move to Seattle where they encounter the same problems and Jason is continually being beaten up, similar to Daniel Laruso in the Karate Kid. Like Daniel, Jason seeks help to become a better fighter and one night, the ghost of Bruce Lee appears and teaches Jason everything he needs to know, for self defence only of course hihihihihihi. Jason takes on the Van Damme in the final scene to finish off not only the greatest martial arts movie ever made, but arguably one of the greatest movies ever made (Followed by Kickboxer 1, Wrong Bet/Lion Heart, Bloodsport and Kickboxer 2, Best of the Best and King of Kickboxers). I was extremely excited when I discovered the Aston provided DVD capabilities in the room. We landed in Honolulu at 6:30am and arrived at the Aston an hour later. I was hopeful and had my fingers crossed a room would be available so we could watch No Retreat No Surrender, however this wasn't the case. I was disappointed that there wasn't a movie room where you could play your movie whilst waiting for the room to be made. This could be an area of improvement for the hotel.Our room was finally ready somewhere around 10am which was a relief and the excitement levels were back! Not long after entering the room, I noticed there was no DVD player, rather a PlayStation which could play DVD/Blu-ray. I wasn't quite sure how I felt about this, I was actually beginning to be a little nervous. Although I am 32 years of age and have watched No Retreat No Surrender on average once a week, usually Monday nights or if I'm on a date, I started to ask myself - What if the movie doesn't work? What if the region settings are locked? What if I don't get to watch my favourite movie? There was only one way to find out. I placed the disc into the PlayStation and after a few flashing lights and selecting the right input mode on the TV, the NRNS logo appeared. What a relief. Soon I was on my double bed with my feet up watching one of the greatest stories ever told in one of the most beautiful locations in the world. What more can a person ask for? However, things were far from perfect.I started having trouble with the various functions such as pause, fast forward and rewind as I had to use the PlayStation gaming controller. The controls for the movie were not exactly straightforward which caused some frustration when wanting to pause or return to particular scenes. So another suggestion for the hotel would be to install proper DVD/Blu-ray players in each of the rooms, which would not only make watching your favourite movie a lot more enjoyable, but the overall trip to Hawaii also.

Although this is a more "basic" hotel in terms of accommodations (rooms could use a facelift and they need to soundproof walls, doors and windows. This hotel has a fantastic location, offers wifi in all the rooms, unlimited movie ands game rentals but the main difference was the staff!! We have stayed 5 days and another 2 and we have been accommodated in the most amazing ways. Upgrades, room amenities, early check in and late check out. All I can say is this is service worthy of a 5 star resort.

We stayed here from December 26 to December 29. We were fortunate enough to stay in a suite, 3 balconies, living room, 2 bathrooms and a spectacular view!!!! The staff at the hotel were all so friendly and accommodating! This is a great hotel if you have children. There was a playstation in our room and the boys loved to rent a movie or video game after a long fun day out! Did I mention, there is no additional charge for this? I loved the hotels small touches like the cooler for breakfast on the beach and kids totes including shovel and pail for each kid. Great hotel! Great location!

We are here now. The location can't be beat. If you closed your eyes when in the room and then opened them you would know you are in a tired lookin hotel. Clean but tired. Old furnishings, old wallpaper, a bathroom from the 80's, etc. a bit disappointed as there does not appear to be a concierge. There is a long line of people selling tours but they did not want to help us wih directions in our car as we were not taking a tour. They also told us that a restaurant (Dukes) does not take reservations.The included breakfast, billed as breakfast on the beach, is a disappointment. This is provided on the pool deck and each room is given a small insulated bag. The premise is to take your breakfast and eat it on the beach, or anyplace for that matter. There is limited seating around the pool so the takeaway idea is probable to encourage people to leave as the hotel is pretty large. Food options are really, really, crappy. Cold cereal, Danish options, some fresh fruit, coffee, tea, juice, miso soup and that is about it. They have an omelet station and waffle station but they charge $7 for the eggs and $5 for a waffle. Location is good, the place is clean, and if the price works for you then it is OK. BTW, our room is very large with a separate sitting area. Breakfast and wifi are free but they charge. Mandatory $23 daily fee for the free stuff.

Granted, it may not be the newest hotel on Waikiki beach, but all of that is made up for by a fantastic staff. they are always ready to help and contagiously friendly.My room was cleaned and arranged as well as I've ever experienced in a 5 star hotel.The cost is very affordable and the views are fantastic not to mention the convenient location.I highly recommend this hotel.

Very good Waikiki location across the beach, close shopping & restaurants. Room is good. Hotel service is below average. Some staffs are little rude; very few were more courteous. Car parking is $27/day & takes 15mins for them to bring it down; best to avoid car. Amenity fee $23/day for internet & break-fast, both are joke; Break fast only pastries, not even toast. Internet is so slow, you can forget streaming anything. They over charged upgrade fees, but refused to take it out, not even accepting it's their mistake. it took 30mins to resolve the billing.

We stayed 4 nights at this Aston hotel before our 7 day NCL cruise and 10 day stay on Maui. The location is excellent, right across from the beach and only steps away from restaurants, shopping and the park. It is close to the city bus routes if you don't have a car. (you really don't need one if you are staying in Honolulu. We rented one for the one day we went to the north shore) Our 23rd floor room was clean and comfortable. The lanai was too small to sit on but the view was simply spectacular. We enjoyed the breakfast the first morning but it was quite boring by the fourth. Several alternatives are close by so no problem. The Hawaiian singer and dancer were a pleasant way to start our day. There are many suitable rental accommodations alternatives; but few offer the comfort, service, and location as this Aston hotel. We will stay again on our next visit to Oahu.

We spent 2 nights at the Waikiki Beach Hotel. When we checked in the gave us a little bag with a bucket and shovel and colouring for each of our kids. The room was your typical traditional small hotel room. The location was great though being right across from a great stretch of Waikiki beach. The breakfast was great, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, coffee and juice. In the rooms were insulated lunch bags that you could bring down and fill up. They didn't seem to care how much your took so you could bring some for a snack later. As well there was muSic and dancing which was a nice way to start the mining. Considering that it was included it was not to bad. We had a great view of the pool and Waikiki Beach. There is resort fee so be prepared for that. As well, parking is expensive. Better to park in another lot. We will definitely stay here again. We found it to be great value, awesome location, and loved its friendly staff, and Hawaiian feel.

We were pleasantly surprised with the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We stayed four nights at a great rate. The property is on the slightly less hectic end of waikiki beach. Rooms are comfortable. The furnishings were newer but the bathrooms are in need of an update--but still functional enough. Breakfast was kind of lame and mobbed so we only took advantage of it on the first morning. Didn't care much for their beach chair/towel policy (return everything by 7)-- why not just hand them out and have guests return them at the end of their stay if they choose to keep overnight? But these are minor gripes for an otherwise great stay. Tip: Banyan tree parking is a good cheaper alternative to the hotel valet parking and only about a five minute walk away. The carport at the hotel gets insanely busy so we were so glad we did our homework. Cheaper and no hassle for a little bit of walking? Yes, please.

We spent a week at the Aston Waikiki right before Christmas. The hotel is located directly across from Waikiki Beach. Check in was a breeze and pay attention how the elevators work as they are designed to keep people who don't belong there out. Our room was a standard room with a view of the pool and the beach. I thought about upgrading but it's not necessary as the view is good. The room comes with a small fridge and ample storage space for luggage and clothes.There's a couple extra's you need to be aware.Breakfast is included and you can get omelets or waffles for an additional charge, usually $7.Space is limited so the provide a bag so you can take your breakfast back to your room or to the beach.Breakfast starts at 6:30am and goes to 9:00am. Live music and dancing are provided during breakfast. This is the only hotel in Honolulu with entertainment at breakfast 7 days per week.Towels for the beach are available near the check in desk, the same place as breakfast.Chairs are available to take to the beach, too. They need to be returned by 7pm.All of the popular tourist buses stop at the hotel and for $2 you can take the pink line around the beach area and to popular shopping centers.Starbucks, Wolfgang Puck, Jamba Juice, Subway, and ABC are located on the property.In closing, I believe the Aston Waikiki is a bargain. The hotel is well maintained and staff friendly.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel - the location is wonderful for the beach and views. A relaxed atmosphere and easy stay in a hotel that has the Hawaiian feel - Mahalo to all the staff who looked after us and and gave us a great stay in an ADA wheelchair accessible room with a great view.

The only positive thing about this hotel is the incredible view it has, if you are lucky to have a room that faces Waikiki beach. The hotel badly needs a huge renovation. Decoration in the rooms is very old, not very clean, AC are old and noisy. The location is great but it was the only hotel that had beggars in front of the hotel (people living between a tree an a trash can, others eating from the trash can).

We got a "kama'aina" rate as we live in Hawaii, and were attending a party near Waikiki. As we live 40 miles away, decided to stay over rather than drive home. While I can accept an "amenity Fee", I was not informed that with a kama'aina rate, if you stay MORE than one night, this fee of $23.00 AND the parking fee of $27.00 is waived. So while we got a good rate on the room of $161.00, the additional fees plus the GE taxes and the TA tax, we paid $235.00. That's a little high for checking in at 6 p.m., checking out at noon. In addition, this is the first bad experience at an Aston hotel. We have stayed often at the Aston Waikiki Beach and the Aston Waikiki Sunset over the past 20 years.Our room was advertised as "partial ocean view." That's ocean if you can see it over the palm trees. (Request tenth floor and above for good 'partial' view.) Also, was over pool so was noisy, and we also got noise from restaurant with live music till late at night. That can be acceptable if one is getting a deal. What was not acceptable was: 1) hair on bathroom counter, 2) hair in bathroom sink, 3) hair on bathroom floor, 4) dirt specks on bedspread, 5) TV that kept turning off, 6) hairdryer that did not work, 7) little bar stool table with glass top that kept sliding all over the place, 8) no other type of guest chair but bar stools, 9) only one chair on lanai, 10) Keurig coffee maker with NO decaf available, 11) skimpy bedclothes and lousy pillows.We have stayed often at the Waikiki Beach Hotel and always had excellent rooms and service.This time the reception clerk, Chris, was outstanding. The man running the valet parking, Wayne, was rude, short, interrupted me, was impatient and just so lacking in Aloha Spirit. The driveway was packed full of cars so I had jumped out to go register us and then back to front to see what to do about our car, which was still in street. I can still hear Wayne's impatient Heavy Sigh as I asked for help. I understood that it was very busy, the the valets were shouting out "aloha" as they busted their buns parking cars. He was even very rude and condescending to a non-English speaking couple.At checkout I stated my complaints about the room (cleanliness, things not working properly, lack of decaf coffee) and how kama'aina should not have to pay the full amenity fee, or at least have parking fee waived. That's when I found out that staying 2 or more nights will get both those fees waived. (Now I know.) But as far as the other complaints, all I could get was $5.00 off the amenity fee. And the gentleman at checkout was not very gracious about it, nor did he seem too concerned about my cleanliness complaint.So, as customers of Aston for over 20 years, I have to complain. The room should have been cleaner (it had been too long of a day for us to complain at the time...we just wanted to shower, and go to bed) and all amenities should have worked, and the bedding of a higher quality. This was not Aston's standard that we are used to.I am glad our hotels are full and our tourist economy doing well. But don't forget the locals. They support hotels here in Hawaii also.

My wife & I did a staycation locally and upon check in we got a room upgrade. The hotel is located steps from the world famous Waikiki beach, and walking distance to a lot of great dining restaurants. Parking is valet only and since everything is in walking distance, we never used our car. There's a ABC store (large shoppette) downstairs and on every block. Starbucks is also around the corner. Honolulu Zoo, Waikiki Shell and Kapiolani park are all in walking distance. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Let me know if this helped with making your decision. Aloha...

This was our 7th year staying at this hotel. WOW - what does that say. I don't think you can get a better endorsement than return Kamaaina stays. If you register closer to 3:00 p.m., the registration line is pretty short. The front desk is very helpful and resourceful if your room is not quite ready. They are also very accommodating if once you see your room and you can't stay in that arrangement - i.e. single king bed versus 2 doubles. During the late afternoon / early evening, call about 30 minutes ahead of your time to have the valet retrieve your car. Really nice to have the local newspaper available. Hot water was plentiful. Had difficulty figuring out the air conditioning system. Never quite got the hang of it. Oh well, just put on more clothes and it was fine. Check out was accurate and a breeze. Would definitely stay here again next year.

TLA look no further. Awesome beachfront hotel. I am in the military and relocated our family to HI for a three year assignment. While waiting on our housing to be ready we stayed at this hotel. I am only halfway through my 32 day stay here but wanted to write about this hotel during this busy PCS season to inform everyone how military and family friendly this hotel is. Up front they offer you free breakfast, free Valet parking, free wifi and $25 per day you stay with them (the put the total balance in a visa check card when you check out). The resort fee and majority of taxes also are waived. If you are married w a family check your TLA rates and your meal rates. Some folks don't know their total entitlement. The meals rate is a flat standard and you are paid it regardless. Some of their rooms are bigger than others so when you make your reservation keep that in mind. I maxed my TLA option and we are staying in a large suite (big family). They gave us two free upgrades to a partial ocean view with a lanai which is super cool. My wife and kids love doing spending some morning time out there and settling down at night too. The beach is 25 feet across the street and this side of Waikiki is a little calmer, so it's perfect for smaller children. The beach has a small wall to allow calmer waters for young kids swimming w/o strong currents. You can walk a quarter mile down the strip and it picks up so you won't have to walk far at all if that's what you prefer. There is a nice pool on the main floor (3d floor) with a restaurant (Tiki's) adjacent to it that has beautiful live music played every night. In the mornings Mon-Fri there is a guitar player and Hula dancer who perform during breakfast hours (really nice). During the weekends you can watch parades from your room lanai, the pool area, from the beach or by the street! Restaurants all close by with plenty of shopping and things to do during the day/night/weekends. When I go to work my wife is able to enjoy the hotel amenities and Waikiki beach. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Room service comes through daily and the Valet is always on time with the car. You get exempt from some taxes if you're in orders. I haven't stayed at any other hotel in HI so I don't have anything to compare it to. But I will say it beats staying at the Best Western or Tripler Hotel...just makes sense to stay here the drive is NOT bad. And it is a great hotel, not as great as or Sandals Resort experience but it's the best hotel I've ever stayed at while on a per diem rate!!

Common area decor is dated and touristy. However, the room was very comfortable. The staff was extremely polite and responsive. The Tiki Bar is undergoing renovations but offered decent fare for a hotel restaurant. The beach is 150 feet away. Room offered views of beach and mountains. Breakfast is mostly baked pastries.

We stayed for a week at this hotel. This hotel has a great location, and is across the street from the beach. The area from the beach to the hotel is very clean. Starbucks is at the front of the hotel, and a decent restaurant next to it. The sea view is quite nice. Staff was friendly. We had a room on the 23 floor. It was a sea view room with king bed and pull out sofa bed with a small washroom. It had a small fridge, and older style Kurge coffee maker. The bed was good, and room was kept clean. A/C worked fine. The good:- location - across from beach - clean for old hotel - friendly staff- great view from sea view room - well side view but called sea view. - safe to lock up passports. Few things to consider:- washroom should have been gutted a long time ago - old sliding doors to balcony - noise level even on upper 23 floor. Music from bar, and road - parking $27 per night not included - amenities fee $23 no included - should be included in a hotel like this. Includes wi-Fi , Kurge coffe maker, safe, breakfast, and movies. - wi-Fi is useless too slow for anything. Go to Starbucks. - parking is very hard to find - park at the zoo for half the cost of hotel parking. - washroom small , and towel had holes in it. Old shower curtain style. This was a good hotel for the week, but factor in the extra fees and you start to re consider. This hotel would not be here if not for the location. They have worked well in keeping it up to standard considering its age.Would I stay there again. Yes, as they have tried to do the best with what they have. Still parking should be included along with any other lock and load amenite fees which include item the are standard at most hotels these days. Adam.B

I booked this hotel via an Expedia sale / offer. I must say that if you are a family or an individual on a budget and looking to go to Hawaii but don't want to cost yourself an arm or a leg this Hotel will definitely do~! There are too many other hotels in Waikiki ripping people off. My favorite part about this hotel is the morning breakfast buffet. Upon arrival you get a complimentary lunch box. Just fill it up with the breakfast goodies and you are good to go all day! I would usually head out to different parts of Oahu thus, these snack and breakfast would come in handy in the car. However, if you are looking more than just a place to sleep perhaps you should look elsewhere. Besides did you come to Hawaii to stay in your room or to explore the island and its beautiful coast? Safe Travels!

We spent 8 nights at this hotel with friends for my birthday. The location is perfect. You can walk everywhere in Waikiki,and easily catch the bus to get everywhere else. We had a deluxe ocean view room on the 19th floor. The room was small and basic, but very clean and the view is one you see on post cards! Housekeeping was wonderful. There are chairs to take to the beach right across the street. You can snorkel right over the breaker wall. The music can be noisy if you leave the door open, but it ends early enough. Breakfast was continental, but a nice option to just get the day started. Would definitely stay again. Value is excellent.

Reserved a double bedroom for a trip I was taking with my mother. When we arrived we were told that our room was given away due to them overbooking. I was appalled considering that's not my problem, but the hotel's mistake. After refusing to be moved to a single bedroom, they gave us a double bedroom instantly, that they had had all along. Seems very sketchy to tell me that there are no rooms available, and then instantly produce one.The hotel also brags about amenities and the option of valet parking on their website. The amenities are an additional 23$ + tax a night which is not mentioned on the website. You have the option of finding your own parking, but good luck in downtown Honolulu, so you are basically forced to use their valet parking for $27 a night for valet parking. Basically, you'll be paying an extra $50 every night that they don't mention until you arrive.The only reason I'm rating poor is that the front desk staff was friendly, and the location is great. However, I could have gotten more for my money's worth. If I had known about having to deal with the hotel attempting to downgrade my room, and the extra fees, I would've just stayed somewhere else.Would not recommend.

I began my trip to the USA in Honolulu for a sister's 50th (Hawaii 5-O), after which I had a five week tour of visiting family in various U.S States. I had a night over in Honolulu from Seattle on my way back to Australia. My sister booked me in to the Aston. What a great girl! I found this hotel to be one of the best! The staff were courteous, informative and, generally lovely people.My room had a great ocean view, was comfortable and covered all my needs.A great little supermarket next door filled my dietary requirements as well as souvenirs for family members. If I should go back to Honolulu, this hotel would be top choice for a return stay.

We stayed at the Aston for our first three nights in Hawaii and were very pleased. It is a high-rise but didn't feel like it. The hotel was clean, the staff very friendly and helpful and the room was nice. It was an older hotel but had been well maintained and in good condition. We ate at Tiki's several times and the food was good. There are awesome sunsets from the outside bar area at Tiki's and we sat there most nights and enjoyed the view. All-in-all I would stay there again if we were to return to the area.

My wife and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel from 10-19 November 2014 for my 40th birthday. Because this was our fourth time at this hotel in the last four years (2011-2014) and it was for my 40th birthday I emailed them to see if they could cut me a deal and they did. We booked a standard room and the hotel gave us complimentary upgrade to a partial ocean view room and 20% off which saved us around $300, not bad eh. Our flight got into Honolulu at 7am so we tried to pay a little extra to check in early but they wouldn't do it because they couldn't guarantee that our room would be ready before the normal 3pm check in time and sadly this was the case, the previous guests were still using the room when we arrived. So after wandering up and down Kalakaua Avenue like a zombie, or someone who didn't sleep at all on a nine and a half hour flight from Sydney, we asked if we could check in at 2pm and thankfully we could. Our room was on the 17th floor, now a lot of people complain about the hotel's lift (elevator) system, that it's confusing, complex and stupid but it is simple, easy and brilliant. All you have to do is swipe your room key card, press which floor you are on and the lift system will allocate one of the five lifts for you, A to E. This saves a lot of time for everyone since the lift goes straight to your floor or only a few guest's floors depending on whether you are sharing a lift or not and when you think about it, it's great security wise. We finally got to our room, it was at the end of the hall which was great because the lifts can be pretty noisy and that's where the standard rooms are, score! Our room had a very comfortable king sized bed, The room was very clean and in a good condition, and this year they have a Keurig coffee machine in each room which was awesome! One bad thing about the Keurig though, you only get two K-CUP coffee pods a day (unless you hassle a housekeeper for more) and they weren't very nice, we ended up buying our own from Walmart. We had a small table with two stools which came in handy when we ate in our room and/or used my notebook. The bathroom is small but manageable with a small tub and a shower with excellent water pressure though the hot water took a little while to kick in. Being a partial ocean view room we were located on the left hand side of the hotel towards Kapahula Avenue and the Honolulu Zoo. Our balcony was a small "step-out" balcony but you still had a great view of Queen's Surf Beach, the Waikiki Pier and the start of Kuhio Beach Park. The room also had a good sized tv which I think was about 32 inch (LG I think) as well as a PlayStation 3. When you check in you get a dvd rental card which allows you to rent free dvd and games from down in the lobby, it's great! Okay there were some negatives here I will admit. I wasn't happy that this year our room's wifi dropped out several times a day, one day it took half an hour before I got back online which was very frustrating. There were times when my notebook and iphone couldn't even find our room's wifi so we used the room next door and even the Park Shore hotel next door's free lobby wifi, shhh! The air con could get very cold which was great but it was very noisy and the on/off switch was a pain to use, you would stand there pressing or holding the button with your finger waiting for the air con to turn on or off which was annoying. I don't know what the go is with those bathroom basins with the pull up push down plugs but there were days when I couldn't get the plug to stay closed so I could shave. But all in all, the staff are very warm and friendly from the reception staff, lower lobby car parking staff, housekeeping staff, pool kiosk staff though the market store staff always looked unhappy and bored. I loved the housekeeping staff, they are always happy, do a great job, say aloha and good morning every time you walk past them so I was more than happy to leave a tip for them every time we needed our room serviced. We were very pleased to see that the hotel is finally renovating the surface around the pool, it was getting pretty bad and looking rather tatty. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel has an amazing location, great staff, awesome service, great views and all at a great price especially for that area of Waikiki. Although the next time we are on Oahu we may stay somewhere else for something different I highly recommend people, couples, families and groups to say here. Mahalo Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and a special mahalo to Stephanie and her team.

I recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel during the bad storm weather on October 18, 2014. I have to say that 3 of the front desk people were exceptional and I would give them the highest rating available. I had an unfortunate accident during my stay. On the day of my daughters wedding (10/18/14) there was a horrible storm - it was supposed to be a hurricane, but was downgraded. The hotel is all open area's where rain could come in and saturate their slate rock floors. I tripped on their wet carpet - flying across the pool deck and dislocated my shoulder. Three people at this hotel deserve my ultimate respect and gratitude. Geri, Jeremy and John all witnessed my accident and came to my rescue. Soon after my fall, the bad area's were roped off with warning signs posted. I had hoped that I would have been offered some sort of discount to compensate for my pain, however, I was unable to speak with the General Manager about anything that happened. The hotel is lovely and convenient to the beach, but I feel that they let me down - not even offering to comp my amenities fees. If you stay here - try to stay during really good weather - I was not the only person that fell - there were 4 other falls that I personally witnessed before any warning signs were posted. My personal Thanks to Geri, Jeremy and John for your kind hearted wishes and for checking on me daily before I checked out.
user_name:
Kathy D
Spokane, Washington, United States

review_body: I recently travelled to Hawaii all by myself following an intense year work-wise. This was the perfect place. I was worried I would feel strange being alone but actually it was the best 9 days.The hotel is perfectly situated and you can get any tours around the island from it. The staff were great, the price really reasonable for the location and my room was big and clean and I was just in a standard room. The Tikis bar is also a fun atmosphere and breakfast was good - although it only goes until 9am so I slept through and missed a few!I loved my stay at the hotel and Hawaii. Would come again for sure.

Super location just across from the beach and next to the zoo. Pieces and parts of the hotel have been updated, but they didn't go 100%. The bed was comfy and soft goods were new and fresh. The bathroom floor had mildew and loose tile, and the tub and sink were old old old. The bathroom mirror and light fixtures were new and trendy as was the furniture in the room. But the balcony sliding door was falling apart. The public areas were lovely.It felt as tho we were nickeled and dimed for upgrades (like most Waikiki hotels). Every courtesy came with a price. We did upgrade and had a lovely view on a mini-balcony.The restaurant was great, the nicest in the vicinity. Super service and good food. While I wouldn't recommend Aston Waikiki, it's probably one of the best values for the area.

Pay to get the FULL ocean view. It's totally worth it. You're not on the beach but just across the street from beach. Very convenient, especially if you like to boogie board. Also very near is the walled off beach area for small kiddies.Morning breakfast around the pool or use the provided lunch bag to have your breakfast on the beach. Downsides: little or no parking. But if you stay in Waikiki, you really don't need a car anyway.

The staff at this hotel is really exemplary. Their can-do attitude is refreshing! The rooms are clean, the location excellent, the convenience of restaurants and easy access to shopping is perfect!~I have stayed here many times within this past year, and have enjoyed every trip.

We stayed only one night here on a stopover en route to New Zealand. The hotel is in a great location right across from the beach, has a restaurant, and courteous staff.The rooms are very small. When we got to the room the bathroom was not clean. There were hairs in the bathtub and the floor had not been mopped. The staff very quickly sent somone to remedy the situation.The included breakfast is not good. There is a nice fruit buffet, but the quality was lacking. If you want eggs or anything hot, you have to pay extra. They charge and extra "resort fee" which is not mentioned when you reserve online. This is a joke. This place is not a resort, it's a hotel, and the ammenities are minimal, at best. WiFi in the hotel was not working when we were there. Corridor carpets are wearing out.We ate dinner in the onsite restaurant - Tiki Bar, or something like that. The service was wonderful but the food just mediocre.All in all, not a bad place, but not great either. If we had been there for more than just the one night, I would not have been happy.

My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights before traveling on to Maui. This hotel was in a perfect location and we had the most amazing view. We got on Ocean Front room which included a lanai overlooking the ocean. Absolutely beautiful! Worth the extra money! Beds were very comfortable. Nice lighting set up also. Room was clean, staff friendly. A bit dated but we did not mind as we spent little time in our room. Room key is also used for calling an elevator- and they were quick. It was nice not having to wait or stop on multiple floors. The Tiki Lounge had great live music and more nice views, great food. We took two tours, and both came directly to our hotel for pick up. This hotel is located across the street from the beach, which had both direct access with the ocean, and another side with a breaker for much calmer waters. The amenity fee is at nearly all the hotels on Waikiki. We only used the coffee provided through the fee (our tours were earlier than breakfast), but I think if you are staying longer, having breakfast available is a nice feature and would be worth the amenity fee.

My wife and I stayed here for 9 days. We were very happy with the service and the staff. And we were blown away by the incredible view. The employees were so friendly and prompt. Our vacation was incredible. To the management and the staff we say Mahalo.

Just across the street from the beach, the Aston is in a good location. However, it is the very last hotel on the main drag, Kalakaua Ave. My favorite thing about it is the programmable elevators - without a room key, you can't access any floor other than the lobby. My least favorite thing about it is the amenity fee. It could be justifiable considering the free beach towels and free wifi, but the "Breakfast on the Beach", which is also "included" in the amenity fee, is far less than 4-star. The rooms are comfortably large, and the bathroom adequate for one person. Overall, I would rate the hotel a strong 3.5* rather than a 4*.

Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is very clean and comfortable. It is located across the street from the beach. It has free continental breakfast which was quite good. You can borrow chairs for the beach, limited supply so get them early in the morning. Beach towels are also available.We were on the 24 floor with an ocean view. We found the hotel quiet. The beds were very comfortable. Free DVD movies available. Free wi-fi which was pretty fast. Close to zoo. Lounge and restaurant on site. Would highly recommend this hotel as an affordable, clean hotel on the beach (across the street).

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is located on the east end of the Waikiki strip. It is located close by hundreds of shops and restaurants, and the beach is directly across the street. Unless you want to be a little closer to downtown Honolulu, the location is hard to beat.The rooms are just average, and could use updating. The decor follows a Japanese aesthetic: simple, straightforward, unfussy. Think also Sofitel. The room I used had a clogged tub drain that remained plugged even after housekeeping left a message indicating that the clog had been cleared. The bathroom was clean, though, even if the floor was particularly dingy. The beds were comfortable, but certainly not luxurious. My balcony had something of an ocean view once you were outside. It was not the sort of room that you'd linger in, but then you're in Waikiki so why would you do that?The elevators took some getting used to, but I liked the concept. By badging in and adding your room number, the elevator bank identifies an available elevator, which then automatically takes you to your floor. A combination of security and efficiency.I didn't use it, but there is a pool, and a poolside bar, which I did avail myself of. In the morning, also by the pool, there is a breakfast buffet that is included in your room charge. It is a substantial continental buffet, with additional foods to cater to Asian guests. You can order egg dishes at additional cost.In sum, this is a decent hotel, but nothing special.
user_name:
dc888traveller
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The front desk staff was amazing, patient, and sincere. We especially appreciated Geri! The elevators in this hotel are optimized for security. If you don't have a room key, you cannot board the elevators. There is a safe in the rooms also, and you, the customer can choose YOUR combination to it while you are there. This also gave us peace of mind. The location of this hotel is not only excellent because it is RIGHT across the street from the beach, but it's also where many of the bus transportation, and tours pick up. So, if you plan on doing any tours, they will pick up right in front of this hotel. It's within walking distance of the zoo, and a great park, in addition to many eateries and shopping, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!! Mahalo!

We stayed in Maui for the first week of our honeymoon and on the second we were doing a cruise, but we needed somewhere to stay the nights before and after the cruise. We started looking last minute for a good place to stay and found the Aston Waikiki. It was perfect so we booked it for both nights. They gave us the honeymoon package both times with champagne and a late checkout, which worked perfectly for us. The staff was extremely friendly and they upgraded our room both nights. The free movie rentals, luggage hold area, and pool were all very nice, as was the breakfast on the beach with complimentary cooler served in the morning. A few spots in the room were showing wear and tear, like the bathroom, but they said they'll be undergoing upgrades soon now that the hurricanes have passed. The bed was comfortable, the AC was cold, and the water pressure in the bathroom was nice and strong.Overall, it was a very good hotel. It was in a great location close to shops and restaurants and directly across from a beautiful beach. The views were beautiful, breakfast was delicious, and the staff were all friendly. We'd definitely stay again.

My friend and I stayed in Aston Waikiki Beach hotel during the Tropical storm. Unfortuntealy, we were unable to enjoy the weather at the pool but they had a DVD rental service by the lobby so we were able to rent out couple of movies to watch while the storm was passing. Location was great. The hotel was right by the Waikiki beach and fairly close to the shopping area. The hotel gave us a free upgrade to the suite and the room was extremely spacious and clean. Absolutely enjoyed the stay there even more if the weather was nicer. Definitely recommend my friends if they are looking for an afforable yet nice hotel to stay in.

My sister and I spent 2 weeks in January 2014. This was our second time at this hotel and it was just as enjoyable as the first time. We stayed in an Ocean View Select room on the 25th floor and LOVED IT! The first year we were upgraded to a deluxe and LOVED having the balcony. A BALCONY IS A MUST! Sitting out and watching the sunrise/sunsets was amazing. The first year we stayed the bathroom in the room needed to be updated but the second year it was much better. The breakfast on the beach was nice. We often took advantage of the beach towels and chairs. Having those to take across the street was awesome. The hotel staff was friendly. I would recommend this hotel again and again Thank you Aston! And I cant wait to come back for 2 weeks January 2015!

We checked in at the Aston beach hotel but alas we were there a day early. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. Gerri was exceptionally good in sorting through our reservation with expedia, giving us an upgrade room, and some fruit and yogurt to have in the am since we had to leave at 5 am.The location was great and the price reasonable.

My wife and I stayed here in October 2014 with two friends from England. The ideal was to stay here a few days then travel to the Big Island. Then Hurricane Ana came along which, by the time it finally swooped by the islands was a tropical storm. Not wanting to fly during that kind of weather we opted to stay longer at the Aston Waikiki than planned and the hotel accommodated us. We were on the 14th floor facing the ocean and our friends were on the 17th floor.We were all pleased with the rooms and the view was fantastic of course, especially with storm clouds to look at from afar. The staff were very busy all the time, no doubt due to the storm, but with some persistence we managed well. Breakfast is provided on the first floor every morning in a buffet style but as mentioned elsewhere it offers the same selections every day.We found the location to be very much preferable to the busier area where most of the designer shops were located and the restaurant at the hotel was very good if a little pricey.The hotel is showing its age a bit with such things as sliding doors facing the ocean sticking and not locking. To be fair they were fixed in both rooms after a few days .All in all were were pleased with our stay and would stay there again.

Our family stayed in a junior suite, with a great ocean view on the 14th floor, free breakfast and great location. The hotel is literally 10 minutes walk from all the main shops in Kalakaua Avenue (Bally's, Forever 21, Oakley, BOSS...etc). Our family got a got a free complimentary breakfast, but there are plenty of eating places nearby if you get tired of the same stuff (cheeskcake factory, resturants, Tiki's, Subway) and a Wolfgang directly below the hotel. There is a police station near there too, if you ever have any trouble. We did not have any issues with the staff, or rooms as they were prompt, and the rooms were well made, not a stain or speck of dust to be found. The rooms were also spacey, and easily had plenty of space for the entire family, at a reasonable price (considering the location and time of year we traveled). All in all its a great hotel, with a perfect location, and great rooms.

Stayed at this property for a business trip. Ending the work day walking across to Waikiki Beach was amazing. The breakfast was convenient, but expect the same selections everyday - eggs/omelettes are an extra cost. $27/day to park and the valets were very busy (& pleasant), so even when you call down you still will wait. The room was very clean and very quiet, the restaurant attached is good with friendly service. Needed to access the H1, and while there was traffic, which wasn't unexpected, the hotel is easy to get in and out of. The staff were very friendly. I would stay here again.

We had a negative experience at this hotel. The first night we check in and they put us in a room with double beds(we booked a king room online) so we said we wanted a room with a king bed. The supervisor said they are all full. We were quit upset and said we should have gotten the room we booked. He then tells us the policy of 'No guaranteed rooms' and that he can switch our room the next day. (its 10:45pm at night when we check in) He gave us the option rudely saying he can kick other guests out of there room to accommodate us. He then finds a room for us with a king bed, we sleep there but couldn't sleep because of the strong smell of food. In the morning realize the room was directly over a restaurant. And there was a yellow stain on the sheets ! so gross! So we talk to the manager, she then switches our room but we had to wait till 3pm (wasting half a day to check in all over again) we get the room and the sheets are dirty! brown stain (we have pictures to prove it)at this point we are so fed up we get the maid to come change the sheets and we just stay in that room for the 3 nights. Not to mention concierge took 45 min to bring us our luggage, we call and find out they put our suitcases in anther persons room ! so frustrating when we want to enjoy our vacation. At check out we asked them about compensating us for all the hassle we went through at this hotel and the front desk said there is nothing they could do When we got back from our vacation i wrote to the head customer service and no reply... I would not recomend this hotel to anyone! waste of money!! terrible customer service! I suggest going next door to the marriot where they have hotel standards and the price is close to the same.

This hotel is right on Kalakaua Avenue which is one of the main streets in Honolulu. It is also right next to the Kuhio Beach! We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a full ocean view from a partial ocean view for free! Our room had a fantastic view on the 16th floor. The elevator system was very sophisticated; all you have to do is tap your room key and enter your floor and it will tell you which elevator to take. The rooms are very clean. The only complaint I have is the beds are a little small for 2 people. Each morning, we brought the free cooler bag down to get breakfast. There was a large selection of breakfast items including some local Hawaiian donuts which were very delicious. With the cooler bag, it was easy to take your breakfast to the beach or to your room to enjoy. There is also restaurants downstairs (Wolfgang, Tiki's, Subway) to choose from as well. There are also ample ABC stores around the block to buy souvenirs! There is also a small gift shop downstairs which is opened until 11 p.m. in case you were too lazy to leave the hotel. Transportation was convenient as there were taxis outside the lobby and the trolleys also stop right outside the hotel. Our stay here was very pleasant. The only two minor complaint I had was that we do not have our own personal beach area like the other hotels and the $23 resort fee which includes the use of the gym, wi-fi and free movie rentals. Other than that, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki!
user_name:
Angel C
Richmond, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Excellent place to stay right on the beach! Had a room on the 19th floor with an excellent view of the ocean. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very attentive. There was an issue with the Playstation, but it was fixed right away. Breakfast served every morning at the pool was very convenient. My only wish is that we had a full kitchen. Other than this, our stay was very nice. I would stay here again.

It is located at the best place at Waikiki, clost everywhere, Kapiolani park, Diamond head, shops, beach at front. Hospitality is, needless to say, very much fantastic, quick on times. You never feel any uncomfortable during your stay. Every time we vist Oafu Hawaii, we would prefer staying this hotel, compare with others.

This hotel is the essence of Aloha and Ohana, the very spirit of the islands is to be found at this hotel. The staff are consistently kind, caring and will do everything to make your stay awesome and memorable. The location is perfect, so close to a very safe beach and a safe surfing beach, the zoo is around the corner, Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head are within a short walk and yet you are in the heart of Waikiki. The rooms are great with stunning views; housekeeping makes sure the rooms are clean in keeping with Aloha. I have stayed at this hotel for many years and I am very ‘picky’; it is like coming home, from when I arrive to when I leave. I am always sad to leave Aloha; my memories carry me through the dark and dismal winter on the mainland. Mahalo to everyone at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, hope to see you in 2015.

Great views, service and location. Directly opposite the beach, a great pool area with breakfast in the mornings and tiki bar and restaurant which had great live music. The rooms are a little dated but well appointed and a definite Hawaiian vibe. Loved it here.

I travel for a living and this hotel is substandard in every category. This property offers tiny rooms, bedding that is almost non-existent (should have brought a sleeping bag), horrible pillows, AND terrific noise levels from outside the hotel.There is nothing here folks! Spend your money elsewhere.

We went for the ocean view and were not disappointed. Hotel a little tired but staff and views make up for this. Convenient for walking to shops and restaurants as well as buses and trolleys. Tightnon the beach which is a big plus

What a surprise. The reception staff was wonderful and professional when we booked in. As we arrived early we only had to wait 15 minutes to move into our room. We were surprised by the magnificent view of our beach front 15th floor room as well as the cleanliness of the room. We experienced not one problem during our stay and compliment all staff and cleaners we came upon. 100% Recommended. Thank you Aston.

We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary and had 2 nights in Waikiki before heading to Maui. We wanted a room with a view. The hotel we had booked did not deliver and could not move us as it was full. We checked out 5 minutes after checking in and started looking for alternatives. The Aston seemed to be in a good location and looked ok so we walked in off the street and asked what was available. Jeremy on the front desk was amazing. He gave us all the options and prices and carefully explained the differences. We decided on a partial ocean view and while he was making the booking we told him about the room we had declined at the hotel we had just left ( to see the view you had to stand on the bed and it was on the 4th floor so it wasn't great when you did see it). Jeremy continued with the booking and when he gave us our keys he had upgraded us to an ocean view room. The view was amazing. We loved the location of the hotel and the "breakfast on the beach" . We have stayed in a lot of hotels and never come across an elevator system that is so efficient. Why does every hotel not have it. We never waited for more than a minute for a car and were then whisked to our floor with no stops on the way. Well done Aston and thank you Jeremy. Although we did not tell you we were celebrating our 40th you managed to make it very special indeed.

we have just spent 7 glorious days staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and found it a very good place to stay. The location was great very friendly helpful staff in all areas of the hotel.The breakfast by the pool was a great idea very pleasant way to start the day.We would certainly stay there again all our requests were met and the everything was great thankyou Aston Waikiki

If you want location then this is your hotel. The staff was kind and the location was wonderful..rooms however are rather dated and we're a tad unclean for my wife and I liking. This hotel is just your average hotel.

I originally booked this hotel for myself and three girlfriends (all in our 60's) based on location and our budget. I always book my accommodation based on the overall Trip Advisor rating but in this case went to a lower overall rated hotel because of the location. I read all the reviews some of which were negative and rated the hotel quite poorly. However, my concerns and worries (based on some of the reviews )turned out to be unwarranted! The checkin was quick and professional with a very friendly staff member and all my requests were granted. We had requested interconnecting rooms, with two double beds in each, a late check-out and rooms from the 15th up. Three days before our arrival I had rung the hotel to reiterate my requests. Also 4 days before arrival, the hotel sent me an email where I could request upgrades - I did this for double beds at $5.00 per room and a late check-out for $45.00 (this would cost $75.00 at the hotel). We had booked partial ocean view rooms, which from checking with the hotel, I knew would only have standing room terraces. To get a full terrace you would have to pay more for a full ocean view room. We were more than happy with our rooms and we got our partial ocean view combined with a lovely view of Diamond Head. The rooms were a little tired but neat and tidy, quiet, of a reasonable size and well serviced every day. The bathroom was on the small side but more than adequate with good shower pressure and a great hair dryer. The only negative would be that the air-conditioning was on the noisy side although very efficient. The elevator system was excellent and rather than everyone squeezing into one elevator you were allocated a lift when you swiped your room card. We never waited for more than a few seconds and the lifts were never very full. The "breakfast on the beach" suited us perfectly, with a range of pastries, some bread rolls, yoghurt, cereal, fresh fruit, fruit juice, coffee and tea etc. All of which we would put in our complimentary chilly bags that were in our rooms. We never had to queue for long and always found somewhere to sit where we could watch the dancer and listen to the Hawaiian music. You could also hire (no charge) towels and chairs and take over to the beach. The Tiki Bar was always busy and popular with a good selection of food and cocktails. We had a quick late meal one night at the Wolfgang Express and this was great value with the fish and chips being actually nicer than we had at more upmarket and expensive restaurants. At check-out we were told our rooms were not available for late check-out but they could move us into a large bedroom with a big bathroom and plenty of space for four women and 8 bags. This was done efficiently with no fuss and mean't we could stay until 6.00 pm. Our check-out was a bit complicated with us wanting the bill divided 4 ways but Geri was outstanding, nothing was too difficult and she was so helpful and friendly.I would most definitely stay here again, the location was perfect (22 steps across the road to the beach), close to shops, restaurants, bars, the trolley bus right outside the door and Lulu's a great little restaurant just a few steps from the hotel. I would however pay a bit more and book a full ocean view room with a terrace you could sit out on.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel in October 2014 for 10 days, and I ahve to say it was the most amazing trip ever. We stayed in room 1929 in the Ocean View Select style room and it was fabulous. View was out of this world and the bed was extremely comfy bathroom was fine too. Breakfast around the pool was so good, lovely fresh fruit, creamy yoghurt and daily pastries. We loved this part of our day and the coffee is amazing too, lovely fresh juices. The location is great, if you like to walk a little bit on your holidays this is perfect as the shops are about 15 minutes down the road, but beaches, what can I say they are at your doorstep and just magical. The lifts were great, loved the system they have there, and the staff were devine! This includes the bell boys, reception, tour desk everyone. We would love to stay again, and to be honest would request the same room again!! Thank you so much for allowing us to have a beautiful amazing special holiday Aston xx

The Hotel is directly across the road from the Kuhio Beach, which is ideal for lounging around or swimming.The trolley stop is also directly outside the hotel which is very convenient, especially when your loaded up with shopping.and most of the major restaurants and shops are a within walking distance. The hotel rooms are nice but a little small, we had standard room 2 double beds which was adequate for 2ad/2ch, as you don't spend that much time in the room anyway.Beds comfy and all facilities worked fine. shower pressure was also strong.The amenity fee of USD23.00 per day, is good value and offers a variety of amenities to suit all, such as beach towel and beach chair hire, Gym facilities, WiFi, DVD & PS3 rentals and daily light breakfast, (breakfast by the beach) set around the pool deck area where Hawaiian Hula dancer and live music is played every morning.Tiki's Bar & Gril is a great location looking out over the beach & happy hour is available for most of the afternoon,Staff were all friendly and helpful with Check in / out very easy..Would stay again.

I wasn't impressed with this hotel -1. There were 7 of us in our party and it took almost 30minutes to check in - you would think we didn't have reservations - check in process was way too long2. Room keys will only give you access to your floor from the elevators, this created a problem for us because we were assigned rooms on different floors - We were there for work, so we couldn't just run to each other's room3. Limited restaurants with in walking distance - and the breakfast that was a joke. My colleagues and i grabbed food at the airport - 4. The only thing that I loved was the fact that i had a great view of the ocean and Diamond Head - the room was clean, and linens were very fresh! 5. We normally stay at the mariott courtyard and we should've gone back, The price was not comparable to the service provided.

The stayed 2 nights with my wife and 3 kids. We booked a parital ocean view room with 2 queens. The front desk staff were very friendly and greeted my family with smiles. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The balcony was tiny, not meant for anyone to stand out there. The kids loved the pool. Tiki's bar and restuarant is right next to the pool area. There's always a lot going on there and the atmosphere is great. Food is average and spendy for what you get, but this is Waikiki. The draw of this hotel is the location. Waikiki beach is just across the street. You're practically on the beach but you don't have to pay the premium rates of beachfront hotels. Overall, this is a moderately priced hotel without much flare, but the "almost" beach-front location makes it worth the stay. We'd book again. Final note, be aware of the parking and ammenities fee. Seems all hotels in the area charge this fee and it can't be neogotiated unless you're with the military or government.

Stayed here for 5 nights, chose the hotel because of price and location. The location was great right across from the beach and walking distance to all the shops in the center of Waikiki. The room itself wasn't to the best standard with the bathroom not being 100% clean and bits of paint missing here and there, but the view of the beach was nice to have. The Lanai (Balcony) was very small and only had one seat on it which makes it a little hard for more than one person to enjoy it.Breakfast was also pretty average but was exactly what was described so can't complain too much! The idea of being able to take your breakfast away with you is really great, just a little more variety and healthy options would have been nice. The Tiki Bar and Grill on site is worth a miss, there are many other bars and restaurants further into Waikiki that have amazingly better service and food.One thing that I did notice was that people checking in and out at peak times had to wait in ridiculous queues, so super glad we were able to avoid this!

We stayed for 3 nights starting sept 29th on the 17th floor in a 2bed 2 bath plus full kitchen with a partial ocean view the only problem we had was that the kitchen was very tired really needs a update and was not up to standard of cleanliness that I would have liked. I would recommend this hotel if they improved the kitchen

I feel that I should make you aware of a few things I experienced during my stay at the Aston Waikiki Hotel on Kalakawa Avenue which definitely left a bad impression and that you may want to take into consideration the next time you are booking a hotel in Waikiki. I stayed there for 9 nights and had enough time there to give you my critique and recommendations.The breakfast included with the vacation package was a Continental breakfast. I was told that if it doesn’t say “Continental Breakfast,” then it is an American breakfast. Well, to my dismay and embarrassment, it was a Continental breakfast including cold cereal, yogurt, mini muffins and greasy scones and croissant, miso soup and ramen, mixed fruit, coffee and juice. There were few healthy choices to eat, all the food except the coffee was cold and nothing was cooked from a kitchen. There was little seating for this breakfast around the pool and we were forced to either sit in our room during the times it rained or on a banana lounger sharing a tiny table to eat breakfast, if there was even a table available. I heard other guests complaining about this not being a real breakfast and the lack of variety.The room was dirty, including:1. the bathroom floor had dust bunnies;2. the white bath mat was dirty from shoes having walked on it many times before I stayed in the room;3. there was mold in the shower and on the floor around the baseboards in the bathroom; 4. there were paint spatters on the floor tile from the last time it was painted; 5. chunks of paint were scratched off the back of the door leading to the hallway; and6. there was dirt on the room’s walls, door framss and baseboards. I have pictures to prove it.Finally, the hotel put our room across from the maid’s service room and the ice machine on the 6th floor, which made ice all night long and the maids were noisy at all hours of the day. Also, the noise from guests in the hallway in the middle of the night woke us up several times. Needless to say, I would never stay in the hotel again nor recommend it to anyone. Several guests complained about the breakfast, cleanliness, and the general condition of the rooms. I find it ironic that the Aston website says it has gone through a renovation. I shudder to think what the rooms looked like previously because they still aren’t, in my opinion, and I suspect from the conversations I overheard in the hotel, not acceptable for most people’s standards. I am surprised by some of the favorable reviews . . . I have pictures to prove every statement I have made. Aloha

This is our 5th time at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, we stayed for 18 nights.Carol on reception was very friendly and the guys used to greet us every morning when we went down for coffee at 6.00am, even at that early hour they had a smile for us.At breakfast Thelma, Mia, Karren and Breezy all very welcoming.Breakfast was well organised and my dad always made a beeline for the doughnuts! Coffee, juices,milk, hot water, porridge, cereal, pastries,fresf fruit, yoghurts etc all a very welcome start to the day.We stayed in room 1731 ocean front and it was brilliant.Our maid Rosanna was lovely always smiling and we were fortunate that she always serviced our room early.No problems at all with the lifts or cleanliness of the room/hotel. I hear the Aston will be undergoing a renovation which would be very welcome. On previous holidays the bedrooms have had lovely red and white Hawaiian bed canopies/throws which gave the Aston a real Hawaiian feel to it, sadly they have gone as have the cane table and chairs, they have been replaced with solid wood high bar stools (no backs to them) with table to match no good to me as i have a spinal problem or anyone with a bad back.It would'nt stop us going back though.Thank you to everyone at the Aston for making our holiday so wonderful.

We stayed here for I night while stopping over and wish we had stayed more. The view from our room was magical and straight across the road from the beach. Check in was very slow and could be improved. Breakfast was fantastic and included in the room price, even had poolside entertainment during breakfast.Recommend.

I go to Honolulu twice a year. On this trip I booked this hotel through Expedia. This hotel was given a 3 1/2 star rating. One of the things I have learned through my travels is the hidden costs that are not optional and not included as the room rate. That is the "Resort or Amenities" fee. This not an optional fee. At this hotel, it is $23 a day. Valet parking is $27 a day. Then there is a $1 GE Tax per day. Hence, my room rate was quoted as $219 + $61.16 in taxes and fees which comes to $270.16.On arrival, the valet advised me to call from my room to cut down the wait to get my car. I still had to wait even after giving a 15 minute lead time.Now for my thoughts on the accommodation. The room was okay. The furniture looked worn..the wood had very visible wear. The table was okay, but instead of chairs, there were two Asian style stools. They were not comfortable and probably not safe for older people. The bathroom tile floor was visibly in need of serious cleaning. The grout was almost black in some places. So, as far as cleanliness it was sorely lacking.On the positive side the staff was excellent.Would I stay here again? Probably not.

The location at the southern end of Kalakaua Ave. (the last hotel) Being at this end of the avenue was nice and quiet even though there is alot going on well into the evening. my room was on floor 15 (1512) southern side facing (a good view of) Diamond Head Crater and wee snip of a ocean view. The has two double beds but i would say for me would be abit crampt with four people staying. The space for clothing is only 4 drawers (ave size) and hanging space is plenty but hangers not enough for one yes. In the room there is a tv/playstation which also played dvds/radio alarm clock and coffee maker. There is also a fridge which is good but it didn't seem to be keeping things cold enough. Know what can isay about the free breakfast. Good job it was free because it was not worth paying for. You got a choice cereals/yogarts/several baked goods (purple rolls/muffins etc.) plus your tea coffee milk fruit juices. if you wanted anything cooked like eggs or toast you have to pay for. (boiled egg $1) The only thing that i found which was annoying was the lifts you scan your key card and lift is allocated to you and they seemed to take forever. The small onsite shop is not cheap better going to one of the very many ABC shops there four within a couple minutes walk. There is also a subway and a wolfgang puck express.

Aloha from Syria to Honolulu. Wonderful location, wonderful beach, wonderful rooms, reasonable price, good service. On Waikiki street you can got what ever you need. My kids enjoyed so much. has a grill restaurant front of ocean with wonderful panoramic view.

It was a great move to upgrade to the ocean view. We were awed by picturesque sunsets over Waikiki and a prime view of the surfers tearing it up. For not having a formal dining area, Aston was very creative with their space. They offer buffet-style breakfast out at the pool and creatively suggest patrons utilize the beach across the street for additional seating. Of course it is included in the mandatory $24/night amenity fee. The Tiki was superb both the restaurant and the bar side(s). And the "1944 Mai Tai" was epic, best on the island. The menu is pricey, but the bar food is reasonable. Everything we had was great.By the way, there's also a mandatory $27/day valet fee for those with a car.So, if you're a driver, you can count on an additional $50+ day in fees and parking.All in all, a great experience. Amenities were great and the view outstanding.

The Aston is in a perfect spot if you want to be close to the beach but not pay the prices of staying on the beach side of Kalakaua Ave. The room was clean and comfortable.Really convenient location, most of the trolleys to go shopping and things stop outside the Aston and it is also a pick up point for a lot of the tours.We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Aston and would recommend it to others.

I am so pleased my Grandson chose Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for the family to stay and to have his wedding reception at the Tiki Bar overlooking Waikiki Beach.I could not be more happy with all services, reception, entertainment, we were on the 22nd floor Partial Ocean View Deluxe room the view was amazing....Thank you
user_name:
Beverley G
Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We have just concluded a 4 night stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach. We stayed in a deluxe ocean view room on the 19th floor with a spectacular view down the beach towards the airport. The room was quite large with two double beds and was kept nice and clean by housekeeping. Like many of the reviewers I agree that the hotel is in need of an upgrade - to me it looks stuck in the 1970s. Some air conditioning in the hallways would be nice too. You come out of the cool rooms and the hallways and lift lobbys are like saunas. The pool area looks very tired and dated, but with the beach across the road there were never too many in it. I've never been a fan of combining food and styrofoam, but that said the breakfast pastries and fruits were always fresh and tasty. We had one dinner in Tiki's Grill and Bar and it was delicious.Overall we had a pleasant stay at the Aston.

Aloha and good morning Mrs. Ferguson .... that's the way I was greeted this morning by Mia at the poolside breakfast....I was amazed that a hotel of this size she was able to know my name...a very personal touch that I appreciate. My husband and I are here to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary and are having the time of our life (and still have 6 days to spend here) in Paradise!!The oceanfront room we have is with a spectacular view of the beach and Diamond Head...We will be truly sad on the day we have to leave Paradise behind to return home to the Toronto area.....Mahalo!

Good:Hotel is in a great location across from Waikiki beach. Pool is decent, but due to the location there is no morning sun. $23 per day resort fee is added when checking in. Tiki bar by pool is a good place for drinks and live music at night. Bad:The rooms are old and the bathrooms are in desperate need of updating. Looks like the carpet is newer, but that's about it. My tub didn't drain and the bathroom tile floor and molding was nasty! I mean nasty!! Also, like other reviewers have mentioned, the bed pillows are flat and uncomfortable. I was put in a east side room and the balcony (if that's what you want to call it), was much smaller than the west side pool side rooms.

We love this hotel. I was a travel consultant for 25+ years and we've had the opportunity to experience most of the properties in Waikiki. The reason I highly recommend the Aston Waikiki Beach is the warm sincere Aloha welcome we received from all the staff and the effort everyone makes to guarantee the most pleasurable vacation. Geri was wonderful at check in and made us feel like we came back home for a visit with old friends. After watching the other staff it was quite evident that everyone was trying very hard to make visitors feel at home. Enough can't be said for Christina our housekeeper. She was friendly and cheerful no matter how busy she was and our room was always spotless. We love the Breakfast On the Beach concept because it's fast and easy with so many choices. We stopped and chatted with the tour desk people and they offered ideas on things to do and the easiest way to do activities. The Tiki bar was friendly and we enjoyed a beer every afternoon at Happy Hour after being at the beach all day. The Concierges desk was also very informative and able to give great directions for walking around Waikiki or which bus to catch to get somewhere. The nice lady that sells jewelry during breakfast was so much fun. I bought a beautiful necklace to wear on the plane and by the time I got home I'd had five strangers remark on how pretty it was and wanted to know where had I purchased it.
