I should have gotten a few more of her business cards. Really, the only thing we missed was a coin-op laundry on site. We purposely packed light but worked around that by just buying a few new things. Unfortunately we had to leave 5 days early because of a medical emergency but both my husband and I agreed that for the ten days we stayed at the Aston we had a wonderful vacation. Thank you and your expert staff for everything, we look forward to staying with you again and will high recommend you to others. Sincerely, Barbara Harris

After arriving here from Maui we where a bit underwhelmed. Was a impersonal and bland check in. The staff are ok, no real hello or anything. The room is good, a bit out dated but clean. The daily fee of $20 something dollars gives you free continental breakfast, WiFi in room, movie rentals and other things. The breakfast is basic but good. The pool area isn't great, no atmosphere what so ever. The Tiki bar has a good happy hour. Don't swim in the protected beach directly infront, walk left out the hotel n head right down the end to the last beach next to the war memorial and the last hotel. The protected beach is gross.

Loved loved loved Hawaii and had a brilliant time at Aston. We had booked a Ocean View room with 2 queen beds, really disappointed in the size of this room, was the smallest we had come across in whole U.S trip. No way was this going to work with 2 teenage girls and all there extra luggage from the shopping. Could have cried as this was the one place we had splashed out on accomodation. However check in staff were brilliant and we were able to upgrade to a Aloha Suite for not much more a night. Now this suite was gorgeous and huge! We were warned that it did not have a ocean view but we didn't mind.....the view was gorgeous and we classed it as ocean view!Had 7 perfect nights here, staff were so friendly and helpful, the tour desk ladies were absolutely brilliant!! The service staff always said Aloha and wished you a happy day. Can't say enough about the staff.Then there is Tiki's, Tiki's is excellent, the best bar / restaurant we came across. Hardly ate anywhere else. Great service, great vibe, great music. The bar staff were really hardcase and always had a laugh with us. SharkBait Cocktail is a must. Pool is great when you've had enough of the beach - cooller than the ocean. Location is perfect, amenities are perfect, staff are perfect.....what can I say. Love Love Love Hawaii and we will be back and this will be our Hotel of choice. Thanks sooooo much

The rooms were average. The breakfast is garbage, thought I was staying in a Day's Inn with styrofoam plates and plastic forks. The TIKI bar was good, stayed there most days. The place is tired and needs a refresh badly. Good position on the beach. Need better food and service all round. The pool even looked pretty ordinary.

Stayed here 3 nights in Waikiki .. great position, right on the beach and had great view of the ocean. Short stroll to everything in Waikiki that we needed. Downside was that the room was so tiny there wasn't enough room for our suitcases and the old tired air-conditioner rattled continuously to such an extent we ended up stuffing all sorts of stuff into it to stop the noise.Certainly not a room to spend any time in, but was good value if you just wanted to sleep !

arrived for 3 nights after cruise,what a shock to the system.the only thing going for the Aston is the location.Discusting continental breakfast,got a bag to take down to pool area(more like a puddle)stale muffins,paper plates,plasitic knives and forks,asked for tea,like asking for the moon.Room was below my standard,tiny balcony had partial view of ocean,had to ask for jug to make a cup of tea.reception staff were not helpful when I asked where I could use the internet,was told to go out on the street.the tour desk peson said look behind you and there were the computors to use for guests,location was the best thing.I booked thru travel agent that informed me it was 4star hotel.Never will book with that agent again.

Was just okay, got the impression that they never wanted you to ask for help from any of the staff, most didn't seem to understand english anyway. Being across from the beach is ok, but if I go back, would probably stay somewhere else.

Was totally impressed with Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Front desk was very friendly, prompt and informative at check in. Room had an awesome view overlooking the ocean on 22nd floor. Breakfast was great eventhough it was a cold breakfast with no hot items (with the exception of some Japanese dishes) Was such a wide variety to choose from that it really didn't matter that it wasn't hot. Was so nice being able to take your breakfast down to the beach eventhough we chose to listen to the musician and watch the hula dancer poolside instead. Was really nice having WIFI in room and to be able to rent movies for free. When I asked for more blankets they were at my door within 2 minutes and when I didn't know how to use my DVD player the serviceman was there in 2 minutes as well. Loved the security elevator feature as we usually had our own elevator since there were 6 elevators and you swiped your card to make it only go to your floor. Excellent location to walk to everything in Waikiki Beach. I can't see how anyone could possibly complain about this hotel. Depending on when you arrive the front desk at any hotel might get swamped but if they are doing their best to serve each customer in a friendly manner with 100% of their attention then that should be forgiven and not held against them. Also, just about every hotel in Waikiki Beach has a resort fee so that shouldn't be a shocker either or be held against them as it's becoming a normal occurance even in Vegas. I give this place 4.99 stars. The only small thing that wasn't perfect was that the room was smaller than most rooms I've stayed in before. That really didn't bother the 2 of us much though as we aren't there to spend 100% of our time in the room so it was good enough for 2 people and the balcony and view definately made up for the less space inside the room. I highly recommend this place.

My partner and I spent a week at this property at the end of a holiday exploring a range of places across the USA. For our last week we had wanted a quiet and relaxing experience, and our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel helped us achieve that.The hotel is located in a great spot, right opposite Waikiki Beach and in walking distance to bars, restaurants and other attractions. We had an Ocean View Select room on the 22nd floor and had great views of Waikiki beach and the ocean.The room was spacious and comfortable, and even with 3 open suitcases and bags of shopping everywhere we never felt cramped. The 'Select' rooms also offered a complimentary set of drinks and snacks on arrival, as well as free wifi (good speed and strength) and free use of the in-room safe. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The free breakfast, which I believe is the only one offered by any hotel in Waikiki, had enough variety to meet the needs of all types of eaters. Cereal, pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurt and oriental options were available at a buffet by the pool, and all rooms receive a souvenir cooler bag so you can pack it up and eat your meal by the pool, in your room or on he beach.The pool was nothing special, especially since the beach was right across the street. The only nuissance was the resort fee that was debited daily from our credit card, however I believe this is a fee that all hotels charge when you're in-house and there's no avoiding it. The Tiki Bar was good, but food at their restaurant was average.Overall it was a great place to stay and we would stay here again.

I made a reservation for oceanfront room when I checked in and I was told there was none available. I made this reservation six months prior to check in date. So they put me in a suite which was okay. At check-in I requested a late checkout and I was told no problem I'll add it to your bill. Check out morning came and there was a bill slid underneath my door with no late checkout I called the front desk and they told me sorry the rooms are all full there's nothing we can do!! Which really sucks because I had a late fight and I just wanted to play in the ocean all day come back to my room shower and head towards the airport which I could not do because I had to be out by 12 o'clock. I work for a so I know all about reservations and overbooking but to lie to a customer is an absolute no-no. Other than that the hotel was great I found the breakfast was okay rooms are clean bathrooms need renovation location is great!!!

After waiting over an hour in line, approached to guest service desk. paid reservation took 20+ minutes to check in, booked ocean front room got side room with partial view. charges $25.00 resort fee. Breakfast terrible. Cold pastries. Location is great. You get bill under the door. at checkout counter asked for zero balance receipt. as our bus was waiting. The guest service was posting charges and informed me that key card is $2.10. I gave him one and told him that second one we left in room. He insisted that I have to pay for the card or get it from the room. I stayed 11 nights on this trip, as company CEO I stay about 100+ nights in hotel. This is the first hotel I have known charges money for a 10cent plastic card. Other hotels give it to you for souvenir. Our company staff stays there often. My first and last time so do my company staff.I recommend to stay at next door Marriot. You may pay little more but it's worth it. Guarantee you that you will not charged $2.10 for a piece of plastic.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is a great location to stay at Waikiki Beach. Plenty of different types restaurants located in the area, and a six block walk to the downtown shopping or even more restaurants. There is a trolley stop right along the street. Right across the street is Waikiki Beach with lifeguard station. You can check out free beach towels and beach chairs for the day. Very convenient! Hotel pool and pool area is very nice. The hotel room was clean and their king size bed's comfort was excellent. The only thing I didn't care for the daily amenity fee of $ 23. This fee includes free internet, access to fitness center, newspaper, local telephone calls, free breakfast, etc. The only thing my wife and I took advantage of was the breakfast a couple of the days. It was a cold breakfast of fruit, cereal, yogurt and pastries plenty of variety, but nothing warm unless you wanted to pay additional for an egg. You could only go through the breakfast line once, but they did provide a cooler bag you could pack extra to take with you. It could be very good if they added warm breakfast items too. Overall, it is a great location, staff was excellent, and the rooms are good. I wish visitors had a choice of accepting or not accepting amenity items. Also, I appreciated the Aston's communication response from my survey.

There is such a diverse selection of hotels to choose from in Waikiki. I have never stayed at an Aston hotel before so I thought I'd give it a try. At first glance it looked great. I thought I made a great choice. Well after 14 hours on a plane I wanted to get to my room ASAP. Had my hopes up since there were 2 people in line. For some reason it took close to an hour. Part of there problem is the backwards checkin system. The elevator has to be explained to every guest. Then the forms and explanation of the resort. I just wanted to go to bed.I have to say that the staff...all the staff were excellent. They would have so much less stress with better systems. Then I get to my room. I thought I would relax and turn on a movie. No such luck. You have to go to the lobby to get your movies. They are free but it is a pain.In the morning I went to grab their continental breakfast. This is simply terrible. A few muffins, pastries, cereal...Normally that would be fine but the pastries was tasteless. Everything tasted the same. I tried it 2 or 3 times and I had the same result.Once again, the staff was excellent but here is an issue Iran into 2 or 3 times. I like coffee. They give you 2 individual cups. I wanted 4. I usually left a note. If they did not leave 4 I would try to find one of the house keeping staff. I guess the supervisor is pretty strict. I had to negotiate at times. Not hard core. I think it's their policies.OK so there are negatives but the view is incredible. You are where the action is. It's the perfect location. You will have a great time and you are surrounded by great restaurants.Would I go back? Probably, I know what to expect, loved the view, and they provided excellent customer service. A definite plus would be a better check in system. Fingers crossed.

I went to the Aston Waikiki Beach for my birthday weekend and it was amazing! The price for two nights and three days was affordable! The staff was friendly! My friend and I missed housekeeping, so we went down stairs to borrow more free movies from the kiosk and asked them for towels, in less than 5 minutes of getting back to the room our towels had arrived! I absolutely loved my stay there and I can't wait to go back!!! Thanks for making my birthday weekend even more epic!

This was our first time at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and it definitely won’t be our last. At check-in a full working staff meant no long lines and minimal wait.I discovered I misplaced my photo ID and the gentlemen at the front desk sensing my frustration put me at ease by simply asking me to verify the information I provided on my online reservation. Within minutes he processed my paperwork. He was efficient, quick, and made the my check-in transaction stress free. Exceptional service delivered with a smile and the aloha spirit. We booked a standard room and were upgraded to a partial ocean view. From our balcony we marveled at the tranquil blue pacific and watched surfers ride the waves. I could have easily sat there all day to admire the awe inspiring vistas. And the room amenities did not disappoint. Fast WiFi connection, A/C, flat screen HD tv, comfy pillows/beds, and a decent sized mini refrigerator. The décor reflected a tropical chic, modern theme without compromising the Hawaiian flair. In my opinion the hotels designers succeeded in providing an authentic island atmosphere. Lobby furniture decorated in native tapa print, lime greens, and teals with a backdrop of surfboards cleverly spelling out the hotel’s name. Verdant walls with bamboo added to the visual appeal. The hotel’s location is idea, just across the street from a gorgeous stretch of golden sand beach perfect for families who appreciate calm pool-like waters. There are no shortages of places to eat in the area and Tiki’s Grill & Bar and Wolfgang Pucks are on the hotel grounds. For those who use public transportation, buses are a short block away on Kuhio Street.I have to mention the hotel’s elevator system. At the lobby I simply entered in my room floor, swiped my room key card, and automatically was directed to the next available elevator. With six operating elevators, we rode directly up to my floor, most of the time without other guests. An ingenious system which is the first I’ve seen at any hotel.A plus was “Breakfast on the Beach”. The concept is simple: fill a plastic portable cooler (which the hotel provides and you can keep as a souvenir) with breakfast food items and choose to eat in room, picnic on world famous Waikiki beach across the street or lounge and dine in the pool area with Hawaiian themed live entertainment. The continental breakfast consisted of the familiar selections and also included delightful Hawaiian choices. Macadamia/vanilla, coconut Kona coffee and passion fruit juice. Pastries also featured traditional local favorites: poi glazed donuts, okinawan andagi donuts, taro sweet rolls. Available choices of mango, guava, lychee, haupia yogurts. Tropical fruit included island pineapple and papaya. Also Asian guests appreciated the Japanese miso soup, furikake musubi, Korean kimchee, cold soba noodles. It was a generous selection and an energizing start to our day. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel met our expectations and our overall experience was positive. The hotel emailed me a short survey a day after we checked out. Upon completion, I received an email from local management acknowledging my input and an invitation to return. It wasreassuring to know my opinion was valued and my business appreciated. The hotel’s desire for feedback demonstrates their willingness to analyze guest reviews and recognize the importance of online social media reputation. What would I do differently if I stay there again? Not a thing, it was close to perfect. Well, maybe request a room facing iconic Diamond Head and definitely book a longer stay.

If it says anything... It only took my first time at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel to instantly turn me into a loyal guest. The staff was consistent with a charismatic Aloha attitude, and you can see the smiles a mile away. I was surprised because when I stay at a hotel I usually base my experience on the room layout, amenities, and view. At the Aston it wasn't the case, I was more in tuned with staff.Mahalo,Trisha

This hotel was exactly what my husband and I were looking for. It was directly across from a beautiful section of Waikiki beach. We had a great room on the 24th floor that overlooked the beach as well as a gorgeous view of Diamond Head.The breakfast was a continental breakfast....make sure to bring the "cooler" bag that is provided in every room. You can only go through the long line once so you better stock up!Also, like other reviewers, we did not have the easiest time checking in. It was a very long waiting process in the 85 degree Hawaiian weather.Overall, my husband and I were very happy with our choice for the 2 nights we spent on Oahu.

Great location on Waikiki. Gorgeous ocean views. Wonderful, friendly service. Have stayed here about 6 times during visits to Honolulu. Close walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. Very near Diamond Head.

Make sure when you book you specify your room type as a couple we were given twin beds and had to wait a day before getting a double room- bathrooms very cramped. Beware when you arrive there will be a check in queue esp at the weekend of up to an hour. Breakfast again a queue- there is a small bag in your room for your 'continental breakfast buffet' you collect all of your breakfast buffet items and put it in the bag- if you are lucky you can get a table (not many to sit at for the number of guests). Plastic cups/cutlery to eat with. No sunshades at all in the pool area.there is a coffee machine in the room but if you want more than one cup per day you have to pay for extra coffee! Beware there is a daily resort tax to add to your bill. Good location at the quieter end of town.

We stayed at Aston Waikiki in February 2013. It was a good price when we booked and the location of the resort was great. We didn't rent a car so location was important to us. You just have to cross a street to get to the Waikiki beach and it is the closest hotel to the Honolulu Zoo and Waikiki Aquarium. You receive complementary breakfast, which was great for backpack travellers like us who were on excursions every day. Overall this hotel is good because of its price given its location. If the price stays like this against its competitors, we will book it again when we go to Honolulu.

Stayed here for 16 days. The loctaion is excellent and convenient to the beach across the road and the shops of the main Waikiki area. This beach area is a lot less crowded than the beach down the road. The hotel itself is a bit dated, although attempts have been made to spruce it up. The taxes and resort fees associated with hotel make staying there a bit pricey. We asked for a Partial Ocean View room and that is what we got. The view was great. I did find that one of the reception staff was very unhelpful and abrupt. As we had a broken stay (we went to the mainland and returned), we enquired about leaving some luggage in storage. The receptionist told us to go ask the bell desk down stairs. I felt she should have known the answer was "no" or phoned to find out. The Tikki Bar was a great place to unwind. The food was excellent and the Happy Hours and drink specials were welcomed.The pool received plenty of sun and it had a great view to the beach but more umbrellas were needed.It was good to get a breakfast but I did not like the concept of Breakfast on the Beach. The room itself was clean and well-serviced. Wireless reception was also good. Overall my wife and I enjoyed our stay but should I return, I would look for a place nearby that did not have a resort fee.

Stayed here for 2 weeks. We checked in early in the morning 8am were exhausted travelling from Sydney. We didn't expect the room to be ready but at least a key to the rest room to freshen up should have been offered. The room was nice and big. Beautiful view. Tikka bar was great. I did not however like:Resort fee $23/dayDVDs didn't workRoom wasn't clean until late everydayBreakfast was terrible (huge line, lack of choice)They won't store your bags more than a day (hard if your visiting an island)Ran out of towels twice Laundry expensive: $9.50 for 1x shortsI did however enjoy my stay in Hawaii but I think the Aston was average. Did like:Friendly staffViewLocation

Reserved through expedia, which made it a little difficult to work with the hotel on reservations, but that's what you get for using a third party. The hotel was AWESOME. We had a high floor, lanai and amazing ocean view. The room was pretty small, but we weren't ever in our room! Had a fridge, that's all that we cared about! The bar downstairs had some yummy food and drinks, but the night we went they happened to be having a private party which interfered with our service. The location is great, it's at the end of the "Strip," so you are still in all of the hoopla, but far enough away to still feel like you are in a quiet tropical paradise. Valet wasn't priced too bad so we used it the first couple of nights, then moved on to the free street parking down the road. Exploring hawaii via rental car is one thousand times more convenient then public transportation. Worth the extra bucks to not have to cram on and off a bus and not go where you want to go, or stay longer somewhere to swim/explore. Did I mention this hotel offers included breakfast!?? It's SO great. They give you a little cooler, so we would stock up on fruits and pastries before hitting the road for the day. GET UP EARLY! haha Personally, I loved the elevator process of putting your room key in. We rode with a stranger ONE time... nice and private. And I definitely felt more safe. The cement walls outside in the ocean are great for people with families. No waves, you can float on a raft or board. However if you want to boogie or play in the waves, it's a short walk down the beach.

We made reservations last April. Arrived on 9/23. They did not have the roomwe requested, gave us one over looking the air condioner units, and associated noise. By standing in the corner of the balcony, we could see a corner of the beach. The room itself was comfortable and clean. The balcony is maybe 24 inches wide. We notified our travel agent about the room. She called, They did offer to change rooms, if we would check out at noon the necxt day, leave ourbags with the bell hop, and check back in later. We had plans to be gone the whole day, so we could not do that. Stayed in the room. Much of the hotel is being remodeled. Older place but nice. Across from the beach. Good restruant. This area is crowded so would suggest that if you want a quiet place to relax you look else where.

Aston Waikiki Beach HotelWe were thoroughly thrilled with our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We stayed in an ocean view suite on the 17th floor, and the view was amazing. We were upgraded to this room thanks to Glenn from Reception, which was a terrific start to our vacation. The location of the hotel was also fantastic, within walking distance to all the major attractions, restaurants, and shops within the Waikiki Beach area. The staff that we dealt with were very friendly, and we have to again give special mention to Glenn at Reception, who was always smiling, went above and beyond in his service, and gave us advice about local attractions, including the walk to Diamond Head. Thank you for having us.Kind regards,Steve and Lisa from Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia (stayed August 2014)

I travel to Hawaii every few months on business and absolutely LOVE this hotel. I have stayed at several other hotels in Waikiki but none (not even the Hilton) match the friendliness of the staff here. Breakfast on the Beach, wonderful views, clean, comfortable rooms, and incredible location are just a few of the things that make this property so great. Tiki's Bar & Grill has the BEST butterfish I have ever eaten and the drinks are generous. I always look forward to my next visit.

Just got back from Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. The location is awesome, the rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and air conditioned and to top it off the view is breath taking, the free breakfast was also more than expected. Looking at reviews before we left I was not expecting much but we were very happy with all aspects of the hotel and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone who wished to visit Hawaii.

I took a chance booking this hotel and I'm glad I did. Just a minor hassle during check-in but every thing went smoothly after. Beach is overlooking from our room and just across the street, staff were great, tourist buses, shuttle services stops in front and very convenient to all. Starbucks at the corner, Honolulu zoo and Aquarium are just few blocks away. We had a great time watching the beautiful sunset along Waikiki, swimming with the fish along Waikiki walls, walking the Waikiki strip and more. We had a memorable vacation.

We stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. We have two toddlers and they enjoyed every minute. Conveniences such as the daily continental breakfast and short walk across to the beach saved us time and money. The hotel was right next to the Honolulu Zoo and a few minutes to the Aquarium so the kids had a great time. The bathrooms could use some updating. We wouldn't recommend walking in the alley behind the hotel.Overall, the hotel and the service were terrific and our family would definitely go back again.

We stayed here three nights and enjoyed it very much. The front desk person, Geri, was so nice at check-in. We were stressed because my monther-in-law was in the hospital and we were worried and had missed celebrating our anniversary a few days before. Geri upgraded us when our original room wasn't ready and was kind and empathetic. Our room, an ocean view on the 22nd floor, had a gorgeous view of Waikiki beach from the balcony. (It would have been nice to have more than one chair on the balcony.) The room, while not overly large, had a nice, comfy bed, and small, very clean bathroom. Having a refrigerator was a plus - we walked to a grocery store and bought sandwich makings and drinks so we could fix our own lunches. Hotel service was excellent - when we arrived, we noticed a running toilet and also the air conditioning was stuck at 67 degrees. A friendly maintenance man arrived quickly and all was well!One of the things we loved was the "Breakfast on the Beach" program. We were provided a small cooler bag which we could fill each morning by the pool with individual cereal packages, yogurt, a great assortment of pastries (excellent scones!) and even malasadas, fruit salad, and miso soup. There were also various juices and coffee. All can be taken to go across the street to the beach. We stayed by the pool, though, and started our morning listening to the excellent live Hawaiian music and watching the lovely hula dancer. Great! We ate dinner at Tiki's restaurant on site twice because we liked it so much - be sure to reserve a table by the outside railing and enjoy the sunset! There is also a Wolfgang Puck's Express on the first floor, as well as many nearby restaurants.This hotel is at the quiet end of the beach (near the zoo), but you can easily walk to the other end, either along Kalakaua Avenue or along the beach itself. We walked to Diamond Head along nearby Monserrat Avenue and hiked up to the top of the crater for awesome views (the whole thing was about a five-mile round trip from the hotel). We also took The Bus out to Hanauma Bay for a day of snorkeling. The bus stops almost across the street from the hotel - so easy! We also rented a car one day (good price from the on-site tour desk) and drove around the island, with our favorite stop being gorgeous Wailua Bay.All in all, this hotel is perfectly situated and a good value for its location and views, and we would definitely stay here again.

A group of 7 of us stayed here for 5 nights !! A very convenient hotel, comfy bed, hot shower and very pleasant helpful staff right across the road from the beautiful warm water of WAIKIKI beach !!! As there is no restaurant or room service we walked to the outrigger for breakfast each morning, great value at $20 a head for a full buffet right on the beach! Loved the TIKI BAR for dinner with live music and the Rum Fire Bar for happy hour at the Sheraton has a great vibe !!! SPENT most afternoons under the BUNYAN tree at the Beach Bar in the WESTIN !!!

Just got back from our 5th trip to Oahu. We love staying here......it's sooooo close to everything we need. Upon checking in front desk found an upgrade for us....with a better view, I didn't ask for it.Our rooms were always cleaned in a timely matter. Tikis is a must! Right there on Waikiki with a gorgeous view! Speaking of views our room had both......Diamond head from the door and Waikiki from the lanai. If you want quiet during the day this isn't the place for you. It's downtown with trolley cars and delivery trucks, fire engines.....it's a city with lots of stuff going on. At night is slows down. Breakfast is ok......yogurt, cereal, muffins,fresh fruit,coffee,tea,milk,juice.Pool was clean and sparkling.....deck was clean. Pool staff with chairs and towels were friendly. Another great stay!! We hope to see you guys again in a few months!!

the hotel was great for our holiday, for the price i think its definitely worth it. rooms are clean, bathroom is small but it did the job. balcony was tiny as it only overlooked the carpark but the balconies that faced the beach were a good size, honestly you hardly spend any time in the room so as long as its clean thats all that matters. breakfast is included and they have a nice range, cereals, muffins and pastries, different fruit cut up- watermelon, honey dew melon, papaya, grapes, pineapple.u can pay extra for boiled eggs but the breakfast was more than adequate if you dont want to pay. there is a wolfgang puck express , subway and different eateries all within walking distance.

Room and bathroom was smaller than I liked but I think that goes for most hotels in Waikiki. Parking was valet.. and can get busy sometimes. But the location is walking distance to the beach, shopping, and restaurants.

I've stayed here 3 times already. If you love being in the city this hotels is great for you. It's located at right at the end of the Waikiki strip next to the zoo. Everything is walking distance from this hotel.Rooms: Rooms were OKay. they did have great views. Also room cleaning was good. always cleaned when we got back to our rooms. Daily bfest. Every morning the hotel had food waiting for you. If you're an early bird, you'll have no problem getting the freshest food. if you stroll in after 9. good luck fighting with the crowd.

We stayed from September 5-9th and were very pleased with the location. We asked for an ocean view room. We stayed on the 20th floor and our view was breathtaking! We enjoyed the daily "Breakfast on the Beach", however, I would have liked to have more gluten free options. As it was, my breakfasts consisted of yogurt and Miso Soup. Unfortunately, we had to pay extra for an egg. Our room with a king-size bed was much smaller than we expected, although in looking back on the on-line photos, it is pretty much exactly what the photos portray. We enjoyed our balcony, however, we couldn't both sit comfortably outside together as there was only one chair and footstool. Still, at the price we received through booking online, we would return to this hotel because of it's location and friendly staff as well as the live entertainment throughout breakfast time and later in the day as well.

This hotel is set yards from the beach in a brilliant location in Waikiki, Honolulu. We had room 1204 which had spectacular views of the ocean. It was a good size, with a safe, coffee machine, tv with play station and fridge. All rooms had a balcony. 5 express lifts. You have to pay a resort tax but this gives you unlimited dvd/game rentals, news paper, safe access, breakfast which you can take on the beach. Tikis grill is attach to the hotel and does good Amercican food. Would we go back here, you betcha

We stayed in Hawaii for about 7 days. The Waikiki is well run, the rooms are quite large I could not fault the room cleaners, they did an excellent job.The breakfast could be improved. There are just not enough tables or chairs to go around.Most guests do not take there breakfast across the road to the beach.The location is adequate. About a 10 minute walk to the centre of Waikiki and close to the buses etc.All in all I consider this hotel very good value for money

Amazing ! fabulous ! best view !paid extra to upgrade was worth it! staff amazing & helpful, my friend & I satid for 8 nightsThe travel desks on level 3 were so helpful organising our shopping trips & tours but the "cocktail catamaran sunset sail" is a must !also the "Big Kahuna " The food is excellent in the both the Tiki Bar for a cocktail & share plates but we also loved the food in the restaurant ,",Loui" our waiter was so helpful in food & wine,Right across the road from the beach what else do you need !Love this hotel !

I was a bit disappointed. we got an upgrade but it was actually for a view. rooms were very small would have perferred a queen or king rather than tow double size beds. room was not very vlean. pool very small but staff were very nice.

Check in was pretty basic, besides the $27 per day for valet parking, and $23 per day for room amenities this hotel is well worth the price. The room service is excellent, we asked for clean towels at various times of the day and night and always received them quickly. When we first got in our bodies hadn't adjusted to the temperatures so I called down to ask how to adjust the thermostat, and the sent someone up to fix it quickly. Room was always clean when we returned at the end of the day, bathroom especially which when your in and out to the beach gets quite dirty with sand. Our view of the beach was beautiful, every morning was a delight to wake up with such an amazing view. The elevators took a bit to get used to, but once you do its all fine. This location is close to everything, restaurants, shopping, the beach, etc. The majority of tours will pick you up at your hotel, but there is so much to do when the day is done, and this location is fantastic if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki (Honolulu). Ask for Ron at the Expedia desk when your booking your activities, he is knowledgeable and sets everything up fairly quickly and easily. The best part of staying here was the complimentary breakfast, be it pastries, cereal, hot tea, coffee, juice, fruits etc. it helped save money. Trust me it was so nice to wake up and go downstairs to have a nice breakfast.

Stayed here for my 50th. Staff were very friendly, front desk was a little slow, even for a laidback place as Hawaii. Rooms were nice, loved the view from our balcony. Location is great, at beach and great shopping. This hotel is a great value, look for specials. Breakfast was good. There was a water main break while here. The city fixed it promptly and staff was great about giving us as much free bottled water as we wanted. After 24 hours we still had no water. Some floors had water by then. I asked for a new room with water and got one. Front desk was overwhelmed and did not answer the phone. Emailed guest services.. no response. Problem was taken care of, but not quickly. Despite this we enjoyed the hotel. Valet/bell staff was great.

We stayed for four nights before heading to Kauai. It was just the two of us. Room on the 20th floor. View alone was worth the price. Tiki's on site was awful. Not sure if the hotel is affiliated with that place or not. Went there the first night for a light dinner. Don't care for spicy food, waitress said what I ordered was not spicy. Came and was not edible. Don't recommend that restaurant.Loved the elevator system. Felt very safe and secure.Downside.....air did not work very good. Froze every night and had to have an extra blanket brought up. Did not call down cause thought maybe it was just me. After reading other reviews I realized this is an ongoing issue with this place.Slow check in. When we checked in only 1 person at the desk and about 3 people in front of us. Geri was amazing however.Not the hotels fault but boy is there a lot of homeless camped out up and down the beach.In the big scheme of things we spent more time out and about so really the room was just used for sleeping. Go into this with no expectations and you won't be disappointed.

My sister & I recently stayed here in July 2014 for 2 weeks. We loved it! The hotel staff were so friendly, and a special shout out to Carol on the front desk who was always willing to help with anything! She originally checked us in and found a room for us at 8am straight off our flight from Australia, so we didn't have to wait until the 3pm checkin! We had booked a partical ocean view room & got the most incredible room that was more than a 'partial' ocean view, it was more like a 'whole' ocean view!! Our room was directly above Tiki's & we never heard a peep to keep us awake. The bathroom was not the flashest bathroom ever but when you consider the price, the incredible view & how much time is actually spent in there, it was no big deal! Most importantly it was clean & tidy.The breakfast service was nothing special but lovely nonetheless, and we made good use of the cooler bag by stocking up for two breakfasts, allowing us to sleep in every second day! We didn't use the pool, only because the ocean is literally 50 steps away so why bother!! We both loved this place & my sister had already started planning her return trip before we'd even left!!! Mahalo Aston & a big mahalo to Carol! xAlso a big kudos to the hardest working housekeepers ever!!!

The good:*Affordable.*Good location near the beach.*Tikis is on the premises. *Nice view of Diamond Head from out room. The bad:*What is up with the elevators? Why cant I take the elevator from my floor to the ground floor without stopping at the lobby?*The tub handle was broke, the sink handle was broke, my ice bucket was broke, the cooler bag they give you leaked.*The hotel room seemed pretty dirty, but it was clean enough to get through the two nights we were staying.

This hotel allowed us to wander around Waikiki Beach at our leisure with plenty of buses and trolleys going by the front door or the ability to just walk to everywhere we wanted to go. It was quite well appointed, breakfast was interesting to navigate but not impossible and all services at the hotel were easily accessible. It also has a good tour desk that are very willing and happy to supply any information required.

We arrived at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel on the 28th Aug 2014 full of expectations of a great place to stay following recommendations from friends at home. First impression of room was great, nice view to beach and Diamond Head, although balcony was a bit squeezy. After the first "breakfast" which was a novelty to take to the beach, we couldn't face cakes, pastries and miso soup plus huge chunks of pineapple and very watery watermelon, so opted to go elsewhere, to have a decent breakfast. Breakfast was included but very ordinary. We then found our bathroom had not been cleaned very well, and the bedmaking skills need to be upgraded. The bed had just been pulled up and smoothed out. We had a problem with the air con emitting a very bad smell and on reporting it was told it would be looked at. Still wasn't fixed so we didn't have it working. Fairly warm in our room!! On the whole we were disappointed as this was THE hotel we had to stay in, location wise it is perfect for the trolley etc and the beach. Just the housekeeping and breakfast lets it done. Needs a good paint job as well.

We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our 40th Wedding Aniversary. You cannot beat this hotel for the price and view (which was priceless). We had indicated that we were celebrating our anniversary during the reservation process, upon arrival and check in, we were given a nice Hawaii picture frame as a token for our celebration.When we had got to the room and seen the view (I believe were on the north/ west side, looking to the west along the coastline), it was just amazing . . . not to mention the sunsets! We sat on the balcony for a few minutes in awe.  On our return from our cruize, we stayed for another night. This room was even more amazing (just when you thought it couldn't get any better) as it faced such that you could look from south to west. Another awe moment! The people here treat you like family. The room was nice and up to date. The hotel is like right across from the beach where we walked over and strolled along the seashore, mornings and evenings. They even worked with us on our last day as we had a late flight, and for a slight up charge, let us stay till 6:00pm. This was so nice as we could enjoy the beach on our last day knowing we had a place to clean up, and had a nice dinner at the Tiki's restaurant at the hotel. It too was very nice and the food was excellent.Thank you for such a memorable time that created a lifetime of memories.

We previously stayed at the Aston around eight years ago, and recently returned for 7 nights. The location is still excellent, right on the beach and at the quieter end of Waikiki. The staff were very helpful, friendly and the facilities are what you would expect, considering the price.The only down side is, the rooms are looking tired, especially the bathrooms, which are in need of renovation. Other than that, a good stay and we would return again, subject to the price.

I had the pleasure of visiting the Aston Waikiki in 2011, and had a great 3 day stay. I had already been on the island for 9 days and staying with friends and had rented a car. We wanted to spend our last few days on the island on the beaten track doing the touristy things such as nightlife, Waikiki beach, Diamond Head etc... great rooms and decor, and very good bargain! We had an ocean view room with breathtaking sunset views. The pool bar area was nice at night and had live music but it wasn't so loud that we could hear it in our room.

We come to the Hawaiian islands often and this was our first stay here.  The good: LOCATION is what sets this place apart. The hotel is located right across from the lagoon and is a much quieter portion of the beach when compared to the center of Waikiki beach which is jam packed in the busy season. There were people around but not so much that we couldn't enjoy ourselves. Starbucks is right downstairs which was a huge bonus for me. Our ocean view room had a terrific view of the water and the Waikiki strip. We had a problem with our air conditioning twice during our stay and the front desk staff and maintenance responded quickly and were very nice.The not so hot: The resort fee. The complimentary breakfast is pretty much worthless. We only went down once. Its all sugary pastries. Pool area is just so-so but this is true of almost all of Waikiki. After all, the fabulous ocean is RIGHT THERE. Be prepared to wait for your car. We were here planning our destination wedding and had appointments to get to so waiting for the car for upwards of 20 minutes became really frustrating. As people that are experienced in what hotels in Waikiki had to offer this place was great and we would stay again.

We stayed here for 9 nights in August this was our second stay at the Aston. Disappointed to find on our return visit we had to pay an extra $225 amenity resort fee as a extra cost on top of our room charge. This was ridiculous as we had booked three rooms for all our family. The cost 'covered' a coffee machine in our room (which two did not work) a newspaper (that was never delivered to our room) WIFI that did not work, after numerous complaints to the front desk it never got fixed. TV and play station that we never used.We booked and paid for a 'full ocean view room' which apparently means a view from the side of the building with a balcony you could not fit one chair on.In one room we booked a King side bed, instead we received two very small double beds instead. Breakfast was very average. Tour buses pick you up right out the front, although we are one of the last stops to be picked up and dropped off. At the Tiki Bar it has a beautiful beach view, fabulous cheap meals and great cocktails. We will go back to Hawaii but not at the Aston.

We wanted a nice Staycation over Labor Day (2014) so we decided on Aston due to it's K-Pass which is advertised with a free room up-grade, free parking and late check-out. I don't know if they have a room in the basement, because that is the only room we could have been upgraded from. It over-looked the air-conditioners, on the first floor of their rooms, with a view of the hotel next to theirs. The Wi-Fi didn't work, breakfast on the beach consists of a mad dash to fill a tiny cooler with yogart, the restaurant staff ignores you (after all you are local - so why are you sitting there).To get a late check-out you get to call the front desk and argue with them that the "K-Pass" actually includes this. As for the hotel itself, it is dated, we had to go up 3 floors to get ice.

Stayed for 9 nights in August 2014. Room was cleaned every day and beds made.Staff were friendly and breakfast was ok.Next time I would want a larger balcony as there was only enough room for 2 people standing.Other rooms had room for a table and chairs. I would stay there again.

My family stayed at the Aston Beach Hotel in Waikiki. I had just moved into our room with my 2 year old and husband. I was barefoot in the room and stepped on broken glass. I called the front desk and they sent up security with a first aid kit and house keeping. My foot was bleeding. House keeping vacuumed the area and security gave me antiseptic and bandaids. I removed the shard of glass from my my foot and security also found glass on the ground. I filled out a report and was told management would be in touch with me. I was told Management would be in the office two days later. Management did not contact me that day, the day after, or two days after. On the third day before check out- I contacted the management myself. I explained what had happened and the manager said she was doing all that she could. I asked her what she was doing about the situation and she mentioned that she had apologized and would contact the insurance company that handles all claims. She also 'offered' me to sign a form saying that I am not looking for compensation. I, at that point, was very offended and did not trust that anyone would contact me to offer an explanation and try to make my stay more pleasurable. The manager had told me that the insurance would now deal with any of my complaints. I told her I don't need medical insurance since I'm from Canada and can go to the doctor without being charged. I was left with more questions than answers. I do not understand why I wasn't treated with more respect and why I wasn't contacted earlier. Why was my room not vacuumed? Why was there no follow up? Why was this ignored? I have, since returning back home, received an email from the hotel manager who has offered me a refund for one night. I do not think it is worth saving money in order to risk safety of my child and myself. I do not know if the glass has Hep. A or could cause an infection. I feel it is my responsibility to inform families who respect and trust customer service, safety and hygiene to avoid staying here. The breakfast is subpar, there is a sewer like odour on the first floor upon entering the premises. This is not a 4 star which Flight Centre still maintains it is.

Had a great arrival nice and smooth booking in. Awesome view looking over the pool and beach. Everyone who works there are helpful, room service was wonderful and breakfast free by the pool and some days I took to the beach was amazing idea..I was on my own first 4 days and always felt safe. Family arrived and the following 6 days we ate at the restaurant on premises Tiki Restaurant. Aston is in a great position and I recommend this Hotel to everyone. Going back next year and I will be stayng there again.. Waikiki strip outside walks up to all the restaurants and beach across the road amazing to swim in and watch sunsets. A trolley (bus) stop outside resort to take you to outlets, tours and run every few minutes.Also free wifi helped me stay in touch with Australia familiey Love this place :)

Where do we begin? AAA recommended this hotel...said they have even stayed here. Stayed here 3 days in May 2014. Room was not cleaned. We returned to our room after 3:30 pm each day and had to call Housekeeping. 1st night filthy bathroom. Rug stains all over it and sheets had what looked like dried feces on them. Called housekeeping to get new rug and sheets. Guy finally came, just handed to us! Room never vacuumed, floor never mopped or swept. Thermostat broken. Fan stayed on all day/night. Maid didn't empty coffee grounds or pot. No bathroom cups, only 1 chair on patio. Unable to set clock. Pillows flat. Stuff in refrigerator when we checked in from previous guests. No chair in room to sit on. The Beach Breakfast is a joke!! They didn't have enough chairs for everyone and not enough clean, dry towels to take with you to the beach. Standing room only at breakfast by pool and not enough tables so you stood holding your drink and food. Unfriendly staff. Elevators not air conditioned and smell terrible. Had to ask for a ballpoint pen. $18/day amenity fee for what? All-in-all this place should be leveled!

Stayed in hotel from 31July- 12 August which was a Awesome Hotel experience. View was amazing and having the beach across the street was awesome. Enjoyed walks on the beach and strip and loved my time there. Hope to stay again for vacation this time. Only improve was breakfast choices.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 9 days recently and loved every minute. Perfectly located on Kalakaua Ave right across from Waikiki Beach. Close to the Waikiki strip and Honolulu Zoo plus a trolley stop right at the front door. And then there's the view . . . . MAGNIFICENT SUNSETS ON YOUR OWN PRIVATE BALCONY.
user_name:
Peter K
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: If you're looking for a nice and affordable place to stay the Aston is the place for you! I stayed there with 3 other people and we were very comfortable in the apartment/ condo style room. The room had 2 beds, a sofa bed, balcony, kitchen with pans/pots, dishes (everything you need to feel at home!). The hotel even has a BBQ area next to the pool!Location wise it was a short 5 minute walk to the beach and local restaurants and shops. A 10 minute drive to Safeway for your grocery need. The staff is very friendly and tends to your needs. Will definitely plan on staying there on my next visit to Hawaii.

Just spent a week at this hotel. Had booked accommodation through bookings.com as accommodation only but was told on arrival that it was compulsory to pay $25 per day for their amenity package which included breakfast. The breakfast consisted of pre packed & processed cereal, pastries & buns which all tasted the same & fruit chunks of melons only (no berries, strawberries - nothing to make it inviting. Then you have a small cooler bag to put it into (their take on this is if you would like to take to beach you can. Next you have to try & find somewhere to sit - few chairs and table so you sit on a sun lounge with a drink table next to it. Only had breakfast the first day and from then on went elsewhere. Was told on checkout we still had to pay. Since arriving home have heard from fellow travellers who have also stayed there once they would not return because of terrible breakfast - you live & learn for next time

Great location - valet, taxis, etc are right there an convenient. Waikiki Beach is right across the street and you can check out a towel at the hotel so you don't have to bother with packing your own. There is a litle protected swimming area there that is great for kicking back and children. Actual waves to boogie board are to the left but still very close by. Check in was longer than expected and outdoors, so it's HOT and there isn't a place to sit while waiting. There is a great station to rent DVD's for free and use the Playstation to play them on a low key night. Some have mentioned problems, but we didn't have any. Our TV remote was fickle, but still worked.Our room (#1204) was small, but very functional. Lots of drawers and little places to put clothes - and lots of hangers. It wasn't necessarily "dirty", but wasn't clean either. Lots of caked on dirt in the bathroom and around deck. Deck was nice and had a view. Small, with one chair and ottoman. Big enough for two people to relax for a wee bit. The air conditioning was okay and definitely cooler than it was outside, but not that blast of cold air I've grown to appreciate after a hot day in the sun. It did the job, just not as well as I'd hoped. As many have mentioned, the breakfast really is disappointing. Pre-made pastries that aren't very appealing, fruit that was cut way too early for serving so it looks 'recycled' and not much else to speak of. Oh - the cold cereal with milk was the food highlight, along with the vanilla macadamia nut coffee (only one by the soda machine) was really good and a welcome improvement to the rest of the hotel coffee. They did have daily music at breakfast with a singer and hula dancer which was a nice touch, but I'd still rather spend the automatic $23 at Tiki's or Lulu's for a hot breakfast.Housekeeping missed our room twice and was quickly remedied once notified, but it was just frustrating to have to do it. There was no consistency as to when we would see them either - sometimes at 9am, sometimes not until 4.30pm, once the majority of your day was done.Overall, I'm not amazed with my experience, but not bummed out either. It did it's job, though I'd look into another hotel the next time I stayed in Waikiki before booking the Aston again.

location great, staff and people great, very close to a lot of different shopping malls, different places, and beach was lovely. We traveled during end of May/June 2013 for 6days/5 nights. Would love to go back.

The hotel is ok. My bathroom did have some mold, but other than that everything was good. You will need your room key at all times in order to use the elevator. It was a bit tricky at first. The location of the hotel is good too, walking distance from beach, shops and restaurants.

This hotel was said to be a 4 star but after doing more research online and seeing the hotel ourselves, it is definitely a 3 star at most. I guess this hotel USED to be nice but it has not been renovated in years and you can tell. The washroom is disgusting and old looking. The rooms are ok... My boyfriend's sister found broken glass on the floor of her room and she has a 2 year old child. When they complained they had to wait a few days for the manager to come in and even then, the manager never replied to their emails nor made an effort to contact them. The free daily breakfast is alright if you like eating sugary pastries every morning. The pool is really small. The only good thing about this place is the location as it's near the beach. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Love this hotel location is perfect view is absolutely gorgeous staff is wonderful every thing you need for the stay is short walking distance , I have been to this hotel many time strongly recommend this hotel for so many reasons

Located across the street from the beach (with no buildings on the beach side), our oceanfront room had the most spectacular view! The room was small but more than adequate for the2 of us. We will definitely stay there again on our next visit!

The hotel is in a great location and the service is very good. It is clean but could use some updating. Nice place to stay for a decent value. We had ac problems that were never really fixed. Would probably look around for a different hotel on our next stay. The on site restaurant is great, give it a try.

Great location, right on the beach with plenty of good restaurants all within walking distance great shopping , excellent atmosphere in the whole area, value for money. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Second visit in 5 years. Just as good as the first. The room was clean, and the in room coffee has been upgraded to the K-cup ( nice touch)No room service, but you can't expect everything. Don't miss the Tiki bar and grill Great food and spirits. Great beer selection. I suggest you start at one tap, and work your way down.Staff is friendly and helpful. The only drawback is the "homeless" that camp out on the sidewalk. But the whole aria is that way so you can't blame the hotel.  The beach is right across the street, the zoo is on the East side. Don't miss that either.We will stay there again on our next trip.Heck! Even Hawaii 5-0 shot some scenes there.Morning chow isn't bad either. Family friendly.

Great value, spectacular views over Waikiki Beach, excellent location - walk everywhere and trolley stop out front. Staff are friendly and helpful without being in your face. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Could do with a little refurbish, esp bathroom. Balcony with seats to enjoy the wonderful sunset over ocean. There is a $23 per day amenity fee which we were not aware of until check in. It covers wifi, breakfast, beach towels and beach chairs as well as fitness centre, unlimited movies, PS3 games and daily news paper. In room safe and coffee maker and coffee is a nice and welcome inclusion.Also, there is a little cooler bag provided in the room so you can fill it with breakfast items and take it to the beach to eat. Great idea!We both loved it here and will be coming back as guests again. Thank you Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel!

I came to visit some friends who live in Hawaii and booked this hotel bc the photos online looked really good and the price was great. However, I was hesitant on the location bc it's at the end of Waikiki and the beach in front of hotel has this "rock wall" making it not ideal to play in the water. This made us walk about 5 blocks up to find better beach areas (near Moana Surfrider hotel). I didn't like being at the end of Waikiki bc it was "far" from everything. The valet is extremely slow and there's no self parking. It's always busy in the lobby area bc there are a couple of casual restaurants in the building, which is great, but crowded. Pool is mediocre and doesn't overlook the ocean (there's a restaurant in front of it). Although the room is cheaper than most in Waikiki, you have to pay for wifi, bfast (normal), use of the safe, in-room coffee, and use of fitness center. Check in took forever. Rooms are TINY and not that great. Pillows are thin and the sheets have that foam blanket in between vs a real comforter (indication of cheap hotel). Furniture is old and dark; not cheery like the photos online. Bathroom is tiny and shower has curtain (another trait of cheaper hotels). Beds were fine since I slept alone and my friend in the other, but if was traveling with my bf I would not want to get too cozy in these beds. Air conditioning is old and horrible. I set the thermostat to 65F and it's probably about 74 in here. It's VERY noisy at night. U can hear people in the next room, outside on the street, and in the hallways. I was in room 1805 and upgraded to an ocean view room which is not a true ocean view and if this is an upgraded room, it's not that great. Noise is really a problem in this hotel. Bad sound insulation. I will never choose this hotel again. Id rather pay just a bit more and stay at a nicer hotel like a Marriott, Hyatt, Westin, or Starwood property.

Fabulous hotel. We were able to check in early, coming from Australia we do not pay a separate 'amenity fee' so was a little surprised as we were charged extra for items we barely used. Anyway, we were 'upgraded' to an undisclosed room, we walked in and had a partial beach view, which was absolutely breathtaking when you get to step out on the miniature balcony. GREAT! Thanks so much for an upgrade to a room you cannot even enjoy the balcony and weather and the view as there's nowhere to sit, can stand two people max on there. Really annoyed, as every other balcony had a chair and big enough to enjoy and was functional. Was upset at that. Breakfast, well, perhaps front desk should have disclosed you needed the provided freezer bag for breakfast, as the first morning we struggled to hold our food, find a spot to sit I mean we coulda used our balcony but DAMN can't really use it hahah! Ridiculous. The pool area needs revamping, it's also awkward that it is right where the lobby is..where front desk is. Didn't like that, so didn't use the pool at all. Beach it was! Staff are lovely, concierge not so much helpful, housekeeping were absolutely wonderful and the lifts are fabulous!!!! The Aston is so close to the beach, the shopping, Starbucks and just fabulously situated! I would defiantly stay here again, provided we get a functional balcony.

Check in system need a upgrade. We lined up with 10+ other groups waiting to check in.Only 2 staff taking check in while 3rd person was on computer for first 20 mins then started taking bookings and speed up process.Room was adequate great view from Balcony.Tour booking desks were very help especially GeorgeGreat spot for kids to swim right across the road

I have recently returned from spending 7 nights at this property on a girls trip. The location of the hotel is perfect if you love the beach. The hotel is situated directly opposite the main hawaii beach strip and offers breathtaking views from the upper balcony rooms. The Tiki Bar & Grill is a great bar located on level 3. All the staff are friendly, it has a great atmosphere and the cocktails are to die for. The pool could use an upgrade in comparison to similar priced hotels in the area. Check in takes quite a while as it seems to be quite a popular spot. The rooms were comfortable and fitted with everything you need. Free wifi was also a bonus. All in all I will definitely be staying at the Aston upon my next visit!

Recently moved to Oahu and Aston Waikiki was my temporary home for 3 weeks. At first I was a little set back by the small room size of the "deluxe ocean view" room, but after a short while I soon realized that most living spaces on the island are either small or expensive. I dug a little deeper in the wallet and upgraded to an "Aloha Suite" which afforded the needed space at a reasonable price. Service was excellent and prompt when needed, chamber maids were thorough and generous with towels and bed changes, and the complimentary breakfast each morning was enough to start my day right and set me on the way to the beach right across he street! It was a stay to remember, with restaurants and shops all around, a beautiful view and easily accessed location. I will be back, if not to this Aston property, I will definitely try others. Thank you for the wonderful say!

We checked in (or waited) in the lobby for about 15 minutes before a counter was free to check-in. I could tell that people behind me were getting irritated but as a manager in a hotel I know how these things work. Check-in clerk was not much talkative and gave the impression that he did not enjoy his job. No smile nor welcome to Aston Hotel speech was given. Took 10 minutes to check-in as he did not have the type of bedroom that we had requested. Ended up by upgrading us to the Club floor, which turned out to be great. The functionality of the Elevator is most impressive! Kuddos for that! Room was nice but the high note was the VIEW! INCREDIBLE and BREATHTAKING! Never have I seen a more beautiful Ocean View. My partner and I were most impressed. Breakfast in the morning was good, but there were several days that they ran out of pastries and employees by the deck were not very attentive about it. Felt like we were disturbing them. Stayed here for a total of 3 nights and I would stay here again. The hotel is very well located across from the beach!

Have only just returned from 10 days at the Aston. Perfect location straight across beach, tikis bar and grill has an amazing atmosphere, beautiful food and service. The rooms are in need of an upgrade but overall the view and the service is worth staying at the aston. I will be stayjng again and i would recommend to my friends. Loved it

The facilities, location and staff at this hotel are great but the rooms are well and truly in need of renovation. Our room looked out over a concrete roof on to another building - 5th floor and the room had a funky smell which only passed after 3 days. The room is generally just a bit rough and I would recommend paying a little more for a better room or if you can afford it a nicer hotel.

My husband and I stayed here a couple days before a cruise and I was pleasantly surprised with the room and the view. It was well worth what we paid. The hotel can use some refurbishing though. Their idea of giving guests a cooler for breakfast is a great one as you can pack up breakfast and walk across to the beach or poolside and enjoy the live music or wherever you'd like. All of their staff was very pleasant and vey helpful. All in all it was worth it, if I could go back to Hawaii I would stay there again.

I stayed here for 8 nights of which was during the approaching threat of 2 hurricanes. The management did leave flyers in the rooms keeping guest informed. Great elevator access and control for those of us who have had to deal with kids pushing all the buttons, you won't experience that here!I had a standard king room which I would consider average. Photos look a lot nicer than the actual room. Would have been nice to have a microwave in the room and a balcony I could sit on. The larger suite rooms have a seating balcony. The free continental breakfast at the pool is reasonable and Tiki's the restaurant is located at the hotel is not managed by the hotel. They elected to close for the threat of the first hurricane Friday and did not reopen until Saturday afternoon, while the Wolfgang Puck also located at the hotel remained open.

We have currently been here for 3 nights & still have 3 to go.. We started off on level 10 in a 1 double bed room, it stunk like smoke and the balcony door would not lock properly... Unfortunate the previous people had to break the rules & ruin it for the next person. BUT I spoke to a lady at the front desk and let her know which then she put me onto the supervisor and they asked if I would like to move rooms and we agreed, we were out on a shuttle all day so we couldn't move straight away, when we arrived at 4:30pm we went to the front desk and our new room had already been organised and ready for us to move... Little did we know until we walked up but they upgraded us to a massive room with not only 2x beds! But it also had a couch this time with 2 balconies instead of 1 & up to level 19 with a beautiful ocean view we could not be happier with the service and the room they moved us in. They did not hesitate and fixed the problem straight away. The rooms are clean, the staff are all so lovely and very helpful!! Would most definitely recommend to others. Breaks from 6-9 and is very handy. Thanks everyone.

PROS:Location - close to public transportation, across the street from the quieter end of the beach, a short walk to the busier end of the beach, close to restaurants, parks and the Waikiki Aquarium, there's a Wolfgang Puck Express practically on site and their food is good.The Property - Clean.Valet Parking - If you call 10-15 minutes before you have to leave they are johnny-on-the-spot.Elevator System - Too hard to explain, but it's creative and efficient.Service - Joy at the front desk - The highlight of the staff. The parking staff is also very good.The view - We had 'partial ocean view' and it was great.CONS:Food - The free breakfast is so bad I stopped eating it after day 2. Bad coffee. No one expects bad coffee in the land of Kona coffee. Low quality, tasteless fruit. No one expects bad fruit in the land of pineapple. Low quality, tasteless muffins and pastries. The only good thing... tofu and pickled cucumber one day and possibly noodles and veggies another day. I don't know if the noodles and veggies were good or not because they ran out of them before 8 a.m.Service - Nonchalant. There were two incidences of things missing from our room. Security was sent to the room for the first one and a report was written. They were concerned and helpful but no one else was. The second incident I was sure was just a matter of a white shirt being left on a bed getting accidentally scooped up with the sheets. I asked at the front desk about a lost and found, a physical place where lost things were kept. I was told there was such a place and connected to housekeeping. Later that evening housekeeping calls back to say the person who cleaned my room didn't find anything. Well, of course not, but that's not what I asked for. I didn't pursue it because I didn't want to ruin my vacation, but I certainly didn't appreciate the handling of it.The property - Old and worn. Needs renovation.NEUTRAL:Price - Too much for what I got, but reasonable for Hawaii.Unfortunately, I can't recommend this hotel and I probably wouldn't stay there again despite the pros and the price.

This is a great hotel at a great location. Our room was clean and spacious, they kids had a little room to expend energy while in the room.We went to the beach and just walked back to our room across the street. We had a fun time in Waikiki. The only reason I didn't give them a 5 rating is that I thought we would get actual breakfast food (eggs, sausages etc ); they had juices, fruit, coffee and pastries etc

Yes, this hotel is not the Ritz, but the location and the ocean view room we had was amazing. We heard the waves crashing at night. The beach in front of the hotel is not crowded like it is in the center of town, but you can walk there in 15 minutes. We only ate the fruit for breakfast because it was the only healthy option. I would stay here again. Visit the restaurant at the hotel "Tiki's" order the garlic edaname and the mai tais are amazing. They put this yummy lime foam on top.

Extremely disappointed with the old and outdated hotel. We paid extra for an ocean view room which we got but at the back of the hotel the furtherest from the ocean which was very average considering a couple who checked into the hotel a minute before us staying on the same floor paid for partial room view and was given an upgrade to ocean view and was closer to ocean than us paying more. The room was very small and in the bathroom the shower was over the bath tub. There was no hotel directory in the room. All the light fittings, vents and air conditioner was so old they were yellow-brown colour.Each morning for breakfast we had to take it back to our room to eat as there was not enough seating around the pool as there is no dining room. The pool was not inviting as the concrete paving paint around the pool was chipped and lifting.There was also a plumbing issue with a light near reception as it had water pouring out of it.All in all I would never stay at this hotel again and will never recommend it, especially for the price. The only positive thing I could say was it was clean.

Hotel offered great location, lovely decor, and day breakfast with entertainment!! Family enjoyed being there. Views were wonderful and location puts one close to all the excitement, restaurants, beach and transportation. Wish the pool was larger, but would return.

I was a little disappointed. I had a room with an ocean view. Yes, the view was nice, but the room was just average, nothing special for $300 a night. The Tiki bar below my room played loud music every night until early hours in the morning. (One night was until around 1:30 am, the other night around 3:00 am.) I wish the hotel had warned us when booking an ocean front room. Breakfast is listed on the web site as “On the Beach.” It was near the pool. It included four cold cereals, donut’s, noodle’s, fruit, Danishes, coffee, Coke, tea and water.You also pay for it in your $23 amenity fees. Parking…they have valet parking for $27 a day. There isn't any parking close by. The cleaning staff made the room up and gave us clean towels everyday. I just wish we had a blanket. I don’t know if it was just my room, but our rooms’ thermostat was set at 65 degree’s and we couldn’t change it up or down. You either turn it off or leave it on. Freeze or roast. ???You have to cross the street to get to the beach. Which means you have to pass several homeless people to get there.Your call.

We spent nine nights here. A perfect location with fantastic staff. We were there for Hurricane iselle, and were kept fully in the loop as to what we could expect. Our room was serviced daily. The staff were all incredibly courteous and greeted us daily. We booked a partial ocean view. It gave us a great view of the ocean and also gave us a view of the zoo which was fantastic.

We stayed the last 2 nights of our holiday at this hotel.We had booked an oceanview room originally and paid $50 to upgrade to a oceanfront room. Wish I had've kept my money and stayed in the original room I booked. As far as I could tell there wasn't really much of a difference. The view is amazing however. As it is right down the end of the strip it is a bit of a walk up to the other end. The zoo is next door however and the the beach in front of the hotel across the road is quiet compared to further up!The swipe cards were ridiculous. You have to swipe the card on the lift first and then punch in the floor number and it tells you which lift to get into. It never let us go from the 11th floor to the ground floor. We always had to go to level 3 and take the escalators down. The rooms are a bit dated although clean. I think 8am is a little early for housekeeping to come by tho! Customer service was good, except for the man in charge of the valet parking. He looked so annoyed when I walked up to the valet desk instead of calling from the room. I understand it takes about 10-15mins to bring the car around and I was happy to wait!I'd probably stay somewhere else next time I visit Oahu.

We have stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel as a couple many times and loved it, but this time was the best ever. Eight family members stayed a week for a family wedding. We had two suites and one room, all ocean view with balconies overlooking gorgeous Waikiki Beach. The calm swimming area right across the street is perfect for little ones, while the area on the other side of the pier has great waves for the boogie boarders. The hotel's location at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki is one of its main attractions. In one direction, we were right next to the park and the zoo, close to the aquarium, and in the other direction we could walk along Waikiki either on the beach or sidewalk. We started each day gathering by the pool for the "breakfast on the beach" the hotel provides complete with live Hawaiian music and a hula dancer. The many restaurants nearby offered a good variety of choices. All of us agreed that this hotel was perfect for our family.

I travelled to Hawaii 2 weeks ago on a solo holiday purposely to relax.I choose the Aston Waikiki on recommendation of a travel agent however out of the options I picked this hotel because it had a swimming pool and it was so close to the beach.The swimming pool unfortunately was not very big and utilised by children daily so I didn't make any use of it , I found having a swimming pool important on a solo holiday just so I didn't have to worry about my personal belongings 24/7 like you would on the beach so I was a little bit gutted when the pool didn't look as large as it does on the photos however this wasn't a massive issue.I had a nice room with a dated bathroom however the shower was extremely powerful which was really nice. I also had a small balcony which could only really squeeze 2 people on if you were sitting straight up and not stretched out so if you see them advertising the room has a balcony do not think that this is a luxury, for me on my own however it was a perfect size. Check in isn't until 3pm which is really un realistic when guests arrive at all times of the day there were a lot of tired travellers always lingering on poolside waiting to check in so be aware if your arriving early on your stay, however the hotel did try their best to have to room ready quicker but they will not come tell you, I had many repeat trips to reception. There are toilets in the lobby to partly freshen up after your travels.Tiki bar is part of the hotel complex which is a very very popular bar on the strip the food, entertainment and drinks deals were amazing the whole week, bar staff a little distracted and a bit slow for service but they made amazing cocktails, so if your looking for a holiday where you don't want to travel far from the hotel for fun Aston is definitely a good option by having Tiki bar.The key card service for the hotel was a bit of a nightmare they don't work fluently and sometimes could take up to 9 10 attempts for the card to open the door I had to replace several during my stay.A good facility is the free poolside and in room wifi. The complex is perfectly clean which is a must for me. The breakfast on the beach is an amazing attribute to the hotel you get given a cooler and they open the buffet at 630 and you can fill up with as much as you like, which was also perfect for early morning tour transfers, I could grab the food and run for the bus. Be prepared to queue though I got caught out a couple of times, when getting early morning buses, the queue goes down fairly quickly but people do like to be there at 630.The hotel is at the further end of Waikiki strip I would suggest staying somewhere a bit further up the line if you don't want to walk far as it is also one way roads so if your mobility is limited this could be an issue.The walk to the beach took 2 minutes which was amazing it almost felt like the beach was a part of the hotel this really brought my opinion of the hotel up. There is absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel its clean and the staff are extremely friendly.
