You are on the main strip of Waikiki and a 2 minute walk to the beach and most tour transfers do pick up from the Aston. I just felt like for the money I spent the hotel didn't live up to what I would of expected for the price.

great location. Rooms were quite big and comfortable. the trolleys picked up from out the front of the hotel. Whilst it is at the end of the main strip, it is well within walking distance the the centre of town. Good restaurants surrounding the motel. staff were helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again

we stayed at the Aston Waikiki beach for the weekend. excellent location on kalakaua. we had an ocean view room with a great view of the sunset. room was clean and bed was very comfortable. loved the DVD kiosks. breakfast on the beach is a perfect way to start the day. they have chairs & towels for the beach which is right across the street. you can come back & enjoy the pool. tikis has good food, drinks & entertainment. staff was very friendly. can't wait to go back!

The Aston Waikiki Beach is superbly located. Bathroom adequate. Air con noisy. Front desk were cold and unfriendly which was disappointing. Great views from Lanai. Rooms a bit dated and drab.Pool small and dominated by kids. Restaurant/bar on level 1 meant it was very noisy most nights.No early check in which was disappointing.Free breakfast, adequate but a but boring after a while.

We lined up for 15 minutes to check in (after a 10 hour flight) and then waited 40 minutes for the staff to locate a room with two beds. When I complained about the delay they upgraded me from a room with a "Stand-up" Ocean view to a room with a "Sit-down" Ocean view. The room itself was small, it could hardly have been smaller. The view was amazing. Outside the room the decor was well past it's renovation due date. Our room was next to a door leading to the service elevator, which was always left open and from which there were frequently bad odors. There was always a long line to get to the front desk.

We had two rooms here so they gave us a free upgrade to an ocean view room so we could be close together. Views were amazing. Beach is directly across the street. Surf lessons right down the street. Free breakfast. If you do it early enough you can check out beach chairs and towels. Rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Only had one problem. The A/C didn't work in one of the rooms. Sleeping was miserable even after they changed the motor. They tried to get it working but didn't.

We just stayed here last week. 6 nights and 7 days. The hotel was clean, the staff was kind and it was located next to everything. The beach is literally right across the street. The zoo is directly to your left and the shell stadium where we saw Jack Johnson was down the road! Our room was a partial ocean view. I don't know why they call it that.. We had a full blown ocean view from our room on the 21st floor. We were even able to hear the ocean at night. There is a fun restaurant right downstairs that has live local bands every night. The breakfast was pretty good too. Cereals, bagels, sweets, fruits, miso soup, juices, sodas. Some days even had glass noodles. In the resort fee DVD and video game rentals are included. Which is great when you head back to your room at night and just want to relax. They offer beach chairs and towels. My 8 yr old son and I loved it our stay here and had a great time.

The room is average but we've an amazing view from our balcony. All the staff are eager to pleased. But not happy w the pool, too small n always busy. Especially, it doesn't look clean to me. So it's ok if u only want to swim in the ocean .
user_name:
Lia S
Palmerston North, New Zealand

review_body: The hotel is located right across the street from the beach. The rooms are very roomy, clean, and comfortable. The morning breakfast was convenient for us to grab and go. They loan you beach chairs and beach towels. The Tiki Restaurant was right by the pool so we could get food and a drink without going far. There is music in the bar nightly. You are sure to enjoy your stay.

We booked this hotel as part of a package deal and I was sure sorry we did. The other hotels we wanted were booked, so we picked this one due to the location. Sadly, the location was the only good part of our stay as it was right across the street to the beach. Our first room was very small, with a tiny bathroom looking like it had not been refurbished in 30 years. Old, cracked tile on the floor, very dirty grout to the point I did not want to even walk on it. Our shower had moldy grout. The bottom of the tub was worn and stained and also grubby looking like you would not want to stand on it. We got in so late that night, and were too exhausted to change rooms. Bed was uncomfortable. We changed rooms the next day, and got "upgraded" to an full ocean view. The down side was we had to check out of the first room, and had no room till after 3; when I went to check in I had to wait 30 minutes in the sun (so hot) to get the new keycard. Not the way I wanted to spend the little time we had... The next room was marginally better, somewhat cleaner, but very tired and worn out looking. Same uncomfortable bed. That night we could not sleep, as we were above the nightclub on the 12th floor. Crazy loud even though we were so high up. Great view from the room though. We stayed at the Hilton many years ago, and it was so nice- very disappointed as we paid just as much for this room and had such a bad experience, and this was supposed to be a trip for our anniversary. Parking was not free- cost $27 a night to have your car jammed into a space- also you could not leave when you wanted as it was so busy at valet. Pick another hotel.

Although we had several problems with the room, such as the A/C wasn't cooling, and safe wouldn't work, our requests from the service desk were quickly answered and the problems resolved. This hotel is less expensive than many in the area so you get what you pay for. It is in a good location, with a great beach across the street, great restaurant in Tiki's and the Zoo is practically next door.

We stayed here one night prior to our Norwegian Hawaiian cruise and it was fantastic!The rooms are clean and updated. Breakfast buffet is free. You receive a free thermal tote, fill it with what you want and eat there OR you can bring it to the beach just across the street.

Arrived at 11 am. Attempted to pre check in (understanding rooms aren't ready until 3). All paperwork signed and told come back at 3 to get key. We explained that we have a luau reservation and bus leaves at 3:30 and we were assured this wouldn't be a problem. Got to check-in at 2:45 and line had 4-5 people ahead of us. Took 30-35 minutes only to be told that person in room hadn't checked out and our room wasn't ready. They couldn't tell us when the person was checking out. The poor guy at the desk had nothing to offer us, except that he "would talk to his boss" we couldn't wait --didn't want to lose our $400 luau reservation. We changed in the valet/luggage room and barely made bus. At the moment we are on the way to the luau with no room, hoping everything ok in luggage room until we return. I pray we aren't placed in a lousy room because our original room wasn't ready. This is a tough start to a family vacation.

I was a bit disappointed to find at first the hotel was about 500 yards up the road from what I call "the heart" of Waikiki Beach, but this turned out to be a terrific hotel opposite its own beautiful stretch of beach (with a protected part for kids). It's opposite the Honolulu Zoo, has a great restaurant/bar on the first floor, and a great idea for breakfast. At full capacity there usually aren't enough tables on the sundeck near the pool, so people are given a complimentary plastic cooler to fill with breakfast and take across the road to have on the beach! Great idea. We arrived off an early morning flight and had to wait a couple of hours to access the room - checkin staff were courteous and the room had a great outlook across Waikiki Beach and the city. I would stay here again in a blink - all tourist trolleys etc come past the front door and the entertainment at breakfast and sunset is terrific. Well worth the recommendation!

After 5 1/2 hours of flying, check in and the room is not cool at all! The bathroom is nasty with dirty towels still in the room. A/C is not working well. Left it on for 4 hours, come back to the hotel, and it's still not cool. Call guest service desk, no one answer. I can't believe this is our worst vacation ever! We've been to Hawaii seven times and this is the worst! The owner should be ashame of himself. He should be on Under Cover Boss to find out how the employees, the service, and the old dirty rooms are. How embarrassing!

I loved that you can walk out of your room in your bikini and onto the sand in 2 minutes. The highlight of this hotel was the performance of the Hawaiian version of "somewhere over the rainbow" by Brandon No'eau Serrano on vocals and Celeste Mosqueda putting on a beautiful performance at the breakfast buffet every morning, it conveyed a beautiful old school Hawaiian vibe and set a nice tone in such a touristy place. The hotel was good and the room servicing staff were lovely.

This hotel has a nice location right across the street from a lovely beach. There are restaurants and shops in walking distance. The Tiki bar/restaurant on the grounds is also nice. We used one of the meeting rooms with a lovely balcony overlooking the ocean- wonderful sunset! Be aware that there are added fees for your stay including a breakfast fee and for the price they charge you could easily eat at other places for less. They do provide you with a small cooler that you can fill with breakfast food and walk over to the beach or go up to your room- It was very interesting to see people stuffing this bag with all sorts of food- thank goodness there is a frig in the room! For the price of my room it would have been easy to get a comparable updated room, in a similar location. Not overly impressed- staff was nice.

Just reading a few reviews and i had to share mine. It was a couple years ago but i thought it was a great hotel. Ive stayed at Turtle bay and thought this was better then turtle. i loved this hotel, The bar had a wonderful pulled pork sandwich. My husband and i loved the room, we were up graded to a part view of the ocean. It was above the pool and bar area but no problems with noise id love to come back and have that same room. All employees seem very nice to us, it was clean and i loved the bar soap they used in the bathroom, lol. I keep trying to find a reason to go back and we will soon i hope. Mahalo

We stayed in one of the partial ocean view rooms with 2 queen beds and separate sitting area. Room was wonderful! Very comfortable, beds were like heaven and the view was incredible (looks exactly like it does on the website). Bathroom was pretty small but served its purpose. Breakfast was ok if you want something quick but there aren't a lot of choices. There's a Wolfgang Puck restaurant downstairs that serves an awesome breakfast and we ended up eating there most days. Had dinner one night in the Tiki restaurant and the food was phenomenal. I was a little skeptical going in because its right on the pool and I figured it wouldn't be that good, I was wrong! Had a steak that would rival Ruth Chris and a s'more dessert that was out of this world! Hotel is located across the street from the beach and practically next door to the honolulu zoo. Great walking distance to lots of shops and other hotels. Overall very pleased with our stay and would visit again.
good location , convenient breakfast lunchbox to go, friendly services , good rom condition, little presents to young children. can't complain .

Great centrally located hotel, all amenities for family entertainment. Safe swimming beach across the road, swimming pool, gym and other facilities. Large rooms, comfortable beds. Staff are very friendly and helpful, I will definitely stay here again when I return.

If you are not particular this is your place. It is old and in need of refurbishment. When walking around Waikiki I was thinking I was staying in the wrong place. We did get a great ocean view, which we would have check out when we arrived. Rooms are small, bathroom is outdated. Breakfast was routine, and it never changed same pastries and cold cereal every day. Tiki's overpriced for food that tastes like a tiki torch fuel. Service was poor, 2 1/2 hr for dinner each night -tried twice (Monday at 5:30 and Tuesday at 8:30). Even with reservations. This is a family discount hotel. It is close to the beach -

This hotel is located right across the street from the beach and next to the Honolulu zoo. Breakfast was good, they have it buffet style around the pool. You need to get there early if you want a table. They serve pastries, muffins, cereal, and fresh fruit in addition to juices and coffees.

My family of 5 stayed here for 6 nights in 2 rooms. We did not get the rooms we thought we had reserved, but our rooms were fine. We were on the 16th floor facing west & had lovely views of Waikiki beach. Everything is quite convenient to this location - the beach is literally right across the street & there's lots of shopping within walking distance. There seems to be an ABC mini market on almost every block, which is great to get sun tan lotion & cheap souvenirs. The swimming pool down on the 3rd floor (13 floors below our balcony) was surprisingly noisy in the evenings until quite late. The rooms were acceptably clean - nice white bedding, firm mattresses, lousy pillows. Our air conditioning did not keep the room cool & we were not able to adjust it. It always read 65 degrees, even when I'm sure the room was 80 degrees. We requested servicing of the A/C, which didn't really help. The bathroom could have been cleaner - we kept a towel on the floor, as it was stained & did not appear clean. The tub had a bit of mildew, which wasn't surprising, considering the humidity. The hair dryer blew only lukewarm air (fortunately I brought my own). Our maid service was hit & miss - we spilled a bit coffee on the bathroom floor the first day, & it never got cleaned up during the 6 days we were there. The maid would also often forget to leave toiletries & would never leave refill k-cup coffees for the coffee maker, unless we left a note requesting it (we left a generous tip each day for housekeeping anyway). There were no washer/dryer facilities, which I would have expected in this price range. We liked that we could sign for towels at the pool & take them across the street to the beach (you are charged for them if not returned). Expect to be charged $27/day if you have a rental car, as there is no other parking besides valet. Each room is also charged a $23/day amenity fee, presumably for the continental breakfast. The "breakfast" was the one thing we were very disappointed with. We are a very easy to please family, but this "breakfast" was the worst ever! There was almost no protein - we were hoping for at least some hard boiled eggs. What we got were strange purple donuts, cold cereal, super sweet yogurt, overly strong coffee & strange little noodle containers (possibly for the hundreds of Asian tourists we saw). The life saver for us was the Starbucks right around the corner, where we got excellent coffee & breakfast sandwiches.Overall, it was pretty nice & I might stay there again.

Stayed at this hotel over the 4th of July. We were in unit 1704 & the view of the beach was fantastic. We had a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit which was perfect for our group. Just walk out the front entrance & across the street & you are at the beach. Lots of upscale shopping & dining within walking distance. Would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for 2 weeks. The room was clean and comfortable but the balcony door whistled all night the last week and no one came to fix it. We had an ocean view that was to die for so we didn't care about the door. We were walking distance to restaurants, shopping, right across the street from the beach and the Honolulu Zoo. We had views of Diamond Head as well. The breakfast was an assortment of store bought pastries and kim chi. The coffee was amazing, Macadamia nut or you could get coconut. I would stay here again. It was a beautiful hotel with nice staff that helped us arrange for a car and even let us know where we could get cheaper than the hotel pricing. :-)

This hotel is strange-Nothing terrble or wrong happened to us in this hotel-the room is good, standard hotel room, no complaints, except that the blow dryer is very weak. But everything esle-it just does not exist. No washer and dryer (travelling with 3 kids, and have to go to the laundry mat every day-not fun, not my idea of vacation), no mats for yoga/pilates in so-called fitness center, which consists of couple of treadmills and some free weitghts. The breakfast by the pool-it is a joke, all they have is some pastries and they charge for boiled eggs, you have to stay in a very long line to get some danishes and basic cereals, and there is even no place to sit and eat. Again, we are with 3 kids-we need to feed them. I specifically called the hotel before we booked, and they assured me that the breakfast was fantastic. I feel like I am wasting my entire vacation on doing laundry and looking for places to feed my kids breakfast and buying workout mats. There is no hot tub and the pool is very small and crouded. THERE IS NO ROOM SERVICE AT THIS HOTEL. You arrive jet lagged and tired-you cant call room service, have to go look for food. You cant order breakfast to the room-it is a huge bummer for us. This is the first hotel we've stayed at without a washer and dryer and without basic workout equipment, without room service. The location is great, the rooms are good, the houskeeping is good. So if you just need a room to sleep in and explore Oahu-it is a good choice, if you actually want a nice vaction where you can relax by the pool, order room service, have laundry and room service-this hotel just does not have it.

Booked in today. Rooms not ready had to wait 2 hours. Then rooms not what booked, twin doubles instead of king. 3 rooms book in january one room key doesnt work. They fix half the rooms but separated family Daughters new room light flickers. Not impressed so far.

This was our fifth trip to hawaii and second stay at the aston. My husband and I thought we would splurge and book a select ocean view room (the last stay was partial ocean) and was pleasantly surprised when we were told at check in that we received a double upgrade to ocean front select...we were so grateful for the upgrade... when we saw the view we were blown away!!! The room itself is stock standard and had 2 doubles instead of the king (bed to myself yay!!!) and the beds were so comfortable!! The bathroom i have to say was pretty ordinary and wouldnt normally care but you are paying premium prices so for this you are basically paying for the view...I love that the hotel is endorsing the eco route with using recycled packaging and having the option of using the same towels 2 days running but would be good if taken a step further as i noticed on the bottles of the toiletries that they are made i china...i just wanted to bring up this small point as everything that is put into those toiletries are actually tested on animals (a chinese requirement) it would be good if you could source something local that is a little more ethical :) overall though i love this place (hence staying the last 2 visits)

The Aston is in the east end of Waikiki beach. The benefit is that there is much less foot traffic at that end of the beach. Plus we were directly across the street from the beach. Great location. Room was large and kept clean by staff. The bathroom was a little dated. Breakfast, while included, was a little skimpy. Yogurt,fruit and cereals. The muffins were institutional. We ended up at the Starbucks around the corner most days. I get irritated at the add on costs of 'resort hotels'. Why do travelers let them say the rate is $x but then they add on a "resort fee". Just quote the REAL price! All the hotels seem to do it and it is not right. The pool area was clean. Tikis restaurant served good food at a reasonable price.

Aston provides hospitality with breakfast, friendly staff, and clean rooms. Activities, tours, sights are available to all without waiting. Very safe and organized hotel with convenient stores, eateries and shopping. Trolleys stop in front of the hotel. So lucky to experience all this whenever we stay in Waikiki.

I've stayed at the Aston a few times and overall it never disappoints. Every room has at least a partial ocean view. My only complaints are 1. The check in process is slow. I was in line for nearly an hour and there was only one employee checking vacationers in 2. The parking has something to be desired. Most nights the line was out on the street and took over 45 minutes to get into the garage.The free breakfast is always fresh and the rooms are clean. Overall a great value if you have handle the front desk and the parking.

We stayed for ten days and had a ball. Loved Hawaii and the Aston was a great place to stay. Nice tidy rooms, excellent position and view. Loved the Tiki Bar down stairs. Breakfast on the deck was fine although a few too many pastries. Sometimes struggled to get downstairs by the 9.00am finish but that was our fault. We booked trips at the tourist booking booth in the hotel but found later there are cheaper options available just by talking to people on the streets. Very friendly and helpful staff. Will stay here again.

The pool was less than average size, nothing "resort" about it but they make you wait long times (usually with only 1 person at front desk), they don't answer front desk phone, and also they charge you resort rates with an average hotel.

...and it only took one time to figure out the elevators! Don't worry, other hotel guests show you how if you get confused. We were surprised it didn't take that long to get our car from valet parking when we wanted to go sight-seeing. The free breakfast every morning has regular American fare, but also miso soup, noodles and ginger--lovely change of pace. We got a kick out of the (well-made) cotton Japanese robes, so we bought two ($25 ea) to pack for our trip over to a condo on the Big Island. This hotel also has the Tiki Bar which overlooks Kalakaua Avenue--great place for people watching & a sunset drink or two; good prices too. Close to shopping, Starbucks and probably 50 steps (we counted) to the beach. That Friday night, we got to enjoy fireworks from the Sheraton down the beach (either it's a Friday thing or a wedding).

We recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and were very impressed with the hotel and amenities. The location, room and amenities were great! We really enjoyed the complimentary morning breakfast by the pool each morning with Hawaiian entertainment. Tiki's located by the pool had great food and drinks at a reasonable price. The next time we come back, we plan to stay here again.

We stayed here from July 7th through July 14th, 2014. "We" are a family of four: 2 adults, one 18-year-old male, and one 13-year-old female. This hotel is located on the easternmost end of Waikiki, closest to the Diamond Head end of the beach. This, therefore, is a "pretty good" location, though it is a good walk from the most expensive and posh end of the shopping and beach complex. If you're going to Honolulu to hit the most expensive and high end of the shops, then this hotel is not conveniently located for you. Also, the hotel is about average in condition, etc. Let's face it, Honolulu in general, and Waikiki in particular, has lost a lot of its shine. Much of it is rundown and not well maintained. While this hotel is definitely not in the "rundown and not well maintained" category, it is showing its age and getting a bit shopworn. While our room was clean, there were soiled areas on the couch arms, chipped paint on the doors, old and worn bathroom fixtures, etc. Staff was very nice but the front desk needs more folks on it. I frequently observed lines of 5 or 6 or more waiting to check in or otherwise interact with the front desk folks. The view from our room was quite nice. We faced west, so we looked right out toward Waikiki Beach and the center of the tourist and shopping maelstrom. The "Breakfast on the Beach" is not on the beach. Here's how they work it: In your room there will be a couple of small six-pack type cooler bags with shoulder straps. You take this down to the pool area and each person gets to go through the buffet food line once and only once. You can take all you can carry in your hands and your little cooler bag. There's no hot food to speak of. Bread, cereal, fruit, that kind of stuff. Not bad, but not extensive or fancy and the only way it's "Breakfast on the Beach" is if you decide to carry it downstairs to street level, go out of the hotel, cross the road, and get over the to the beach on your own. Staff was nice and friendly and helpful but busy. Tour booking is convenient. I recommend Ron at Expedia. He helped us a lot and didn't steer us wrong. He worked hard to get our tours scheduled and juggled around so we could do everything we wanted to. But, I strongly suggest you make your bookings and reservations in advance, before you arrive in Hawaii. First, it's cheaper; and, second, you won't miss out on anything. We had two tours we almost couldn't do because everything was booked up on some days. If you stay at this hotel, there's a Starbucks and a Subway and a Wolfgang Puck in the same building complex and block. It's a block from the Honolulu Zoo, which is a nice stroll some afternoon when you're tired of touring and would just enjoy some quiet time in a beautiful setting. Diamond Head is just east of the hotel but you don't want to walk to it. The entrance is a long way uphill and around the back side of the crater. Take the #23 bus or a cab. The bus was $2.50 per person and a cab will run you maybe $5 per person. Or, sign up with Uber and go that way. If you do go to Diamond Head, take the hike up to the observation post at the top rim of the crater. It's a strenuous hike and it was hot the day we did it but it was fun.

We stayed here 7/11/14-7/13/14. Hotel was great stayed in ocean view select room and it was perfect. Ask for higher floor rooms to avoid the loud noise from the Tiki grill restaurant downstairs. Been in other hotels in Waikiki and so far this was the best. The elevators were a tad bit confusing at first but after the first night it was easy. The location is perfect, literally right across the street from the beach. Breakfast was nice they serve cereal, donuts, fruit. No meat though. I would definitely recommend.

Excellent location. Across from Waikiki beach with easy access in/out of the Waikiki area. Within waking distance to the many restaurants and shops on Kauakaua Blvd. Staff is very friendly. Definitely took advantage of the free daily breakfast, cooler bag, and DVD rentals.

We stayed here for two nights before our cruise. Check in was not too long. When we checked in, they upgraded us to a larger room which was great after getting off a 9 hour flight. Our room was ready and with the extra space, our luggage was out of the way. We had a partial ocean view room on the 7th floor which still gave us a beautiful view. The hotel was relatively quiet and the beds were comfortable. The room was starting to show a little wear, but overall it was a nice room. The breakfast was good with a nice assortment of continental breakfast items plus items like fresh fruit and fountain soda (which made my husband happy). We ate breakfast on the pool deck where they had someone playing Hawaiian music. It was nice. While we did find a seat, the pool area is relatively small and I saw a lot of people taking their breakfast to their rooms (did not see many going to the beach). On our last day, we asked for a late check out. The Aston may do this, but with a $25 fee to check out by 2:00. My only real complaint about the hotel was how they handled the cars in the valet area and the space to pick up tour buses. Downtown Waikiki is busy and I get that, but for 3 days, we had to weave in and out of cars that were coming in or to be valeted. The entire front entrance way was chaotic. Also, when we called to ask the bellman to get us a cab, we came down and he had not called a cab. (Not a huge deal as you can usually flag down a cab.) The hotel is across the street from Waikiki beach and next to the zoo. The are several decent restaurants in the area. The "main" shopping and dining areas of Waikiki is about a 6-8 block walk (or a $10 cab ride for 3). One nice touch the hotel had was lemon and orange water all day in the lobby. There was also a convenience store to buy sodas and snacks. Would stay here again.

We had 3 rooms reserved for our family and upon check-in one of the rooms was a king bed for 3 adults even though the reservation was for 2 beds. The desk clerk quickly remedied the problem and we were very pleased with the rooms and the wonderful view of the beach. One of our 3 rooms was not cleaned. It was at the end of the hall and I guess it just got missed. Towels were delivered promptly when we called. The lunchbox provided in the room is a wonderful idea to pack breakfast for the beach. All the appropriate containers were by the food in the buffet so it is easy to pack your picnic breakfast. Many restaurants and shops are within walking distance but if you choose to stay close the Tiki Restaurant serves great food. The inconveniences we experienced were minor and the staff quickly responded. We would stay at the Aston again.

Well here we are back at the Aston again. My last review that you might have read had a couple of problems. They replied and asked for a second chance to put thinks right.I had an excellent rate second time around.When we arrived the staff where great all that i had requested i had. The rooms are not the most modern but they are clean and comfortably and the view from the pool side room is to die for, but please keep in mind that you dont pay Marriott or Hilton prices either. You still get breakfast dvd and playstaion rental and Wi Fi for a fee i think it was about $22 a day its called a resort fee and i noticed that the coffee is free in the room unlike last time when after the first 2 cups it was $2 a cup. The Tiki bar still serves excellent food and drink and is very reasonably about $5 a beer and bar meals about $14 .Mike who looked after us all week was fantastic.He remembered us from the last time we visted .Hes the one with the pony tail got to say that he is one of the best waiters i have had the pleasure to meet.Look out for him.We did have a couple of issues with A/C and the Wi Fi but they where put right straight away, you cant ask for more than that. We wiil be definitely go back

Aston Hotels & Resorts, a Waikiki Beach side Hotel, has a smoke free ambiance & is a great place to stay. The staffs are friendly and the hotel is at the heart of the town where the beach is at a walking distance! It has free Wifi. We took a suite. The room was nice and it had a breathtaking view from the balcony...a very neat view of the Diamond Head Crater! There are quite a lot of shops and restaurants around. A great place to hang out in the evening..take a stroll by the beach. The parking is however not inside the hotel,but around the corner and is not free. Also if u have kids, the Honolulu zoo is walking distance from the hotel.

We arrived and after only a short wait were shown our room. Generous in size and great in location, opposite Waikiki beach. Breakfast was included as was Wifi. You could either enjoy your breakfast around the pool or take it away in the handy cooler bag included in your room. We were able to walk up and down Waikiki Beach, taking in the shops and the sights. As first time visitors it was fantastic to discover that our tours left from right outside our hotel (or 100m up the road), even though at times it was a bit crowded and chaotic. Access to food was simple, with Subway, Wolfgang Express and other restaurants close by. On a rare day off, we were also pleased to discover the Honolulu Zoo a short walk away. (Apparently the aquarium is too, but we couldn't find it). There are more expensive hotels I'm sure, with more to offer. However the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel more than adequately met our needs.

The Aston - Now you may look at it and say its not the nicest looking place, looks over 10 years old and is away from the main shopping area in Waikiki... However we have stayed many times in Waikiki at The Hyatt and the Outrigger - both over priced, rude and crowded locations.The Aston Beach Hotel however is situated approx 9mins down the beach from the main shopping and dinning area...only 9mins - thats nothing :). Its located near the Zoo with perfect views of Diamond Head and Wakiki Beach as it is the tallest Hotel down that end. The staff are really friendly - example being i stated when we arrived that this trip was a special one - those they not only upgraded us for free but also put us on the highest floor in the ocean side corner so the views were amazing. The breakfast is good and you get a free carry bag. The parking is also a good price at $27 a day and it is on the beach front - perfect position and fewer people meaning more room to move around and get a great tan.We will be back in a few months again and this time i dont think we will change hotels like before - Aston will be just fine for us again :)

The room was clean and comfortable and convenient walking distance to a lot in the Waikiki area. There are a ton of rooms in the hotel but the public spaces are small and very, very crowded! Breakfast was next to impossible to get anything, as there were so many people. Definitely not a good place if you're looking for a intimate, quiet setting. The front desk is a story above the lobby, so at check in and check out you have to lug all of your luggage up and down the escalators because you can't use the elevator without a room key; this wasn't really a big deal, but we were in the midst of a two week trip and had a lot of luggage! Overall it was a pleasant stay, the rooms were nice, and the staff was friendly.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 10 nights with our 3 and 5 year old. Yes, there are better hotels in Waikiki, but they also cost a fair bit more. We arrived at 830am and are room was ready by 1215pm. The location of this hotel is excellent. The stretch of beach in front is less crowded and perfect for children. The views from the room were superb (deluxe partial ocean view, 19th floor). The room was cosy but clean and the decor was pleasant. Water pressure in shower was intense, but hey, better than no pressure! The staff at the hotel were lovely. The tour desk was extremely helpful. The pool was not glamerous, but it was clean and we found it big enough and certainly sunny from lunch onwards and has a lovely outlook to the beach and Tiki's and the pool drck kn general is a nice environment. Tiki's is great for drinks and lunch, great staff and again, beautiful outlook. The breakfast was nice, handy to have and if we got a little sick of the options we paid $7 for a large omelette and toast (good value). The music and dancing was a nice touch too. The hotel is great value for money, no complaints, only fond memories! Oh and Express downstairs has great food at great prices if youre looking for a casual dinner or take away to eat on your balcony.

perfect choice for first time Oahu visitor. the hotel is perfectly located for easy access to Waikiki beach, the entire Waikiki area, and quick access to roads traveling south east. Access in and out of the valet was quick and easy. Continental breakfast by the pool, while not great, was good enough for a quick bite in the morning. Rooms were big enough and clean. Views were great. Tiki restaurant was quite good too.

This was our second trip to Waikiki for my family and both times we have stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We stayed in an ocean view select room which was very clean and tidy and had fantastic views of Waikiki Beach which were absolutely amazing. Clearly customer service is something they pride themselves on at this hotel as the staff were very friendly and helpful from the reception staff to the housekeeping cleaners. Nothing was a problem for them and we always received a warm and friendly " aloha" from the staff. The hotel is in a great location on the main street and it is right across the road from a great swimming spot and a short stroll to Waikiki Beach. Restaurants and shops start from under the hotel and the trolley stops right outside the hotel which is a plus. The Aston Waikiki Beach hotel has everything you need for a great holiday and is definitely value for money, we will definitely be staying there again.Thank you to Geri and all the staff at the hotel for another fantastic stay. CheersK Bryant

Hotel rooms were average in size. Bathroom was small. Nice continental breakfast. Tiki Bar good food and service. Busy intersection. Kind of far from the shoppes. Across street from Waikiki Beach! Not many restuarants near by though

After reading review on TripAdvisor, I chose this hotel for it's location (at the end of Waikiki) and for the reports of ocean views. I requested a room above the 20th floor to avoid the reported street noise. Our family of 4 stayed in Room 2521 and the view was fantastic!!! We even enjoyed a view of Diamond Head when we went to get ice around the corner of our room!!! There was street noise, but it was blocked out as soon as we shut the sliding glass door. The elevator system was unique and cut down on crowded elevators; was no big deal to use it. The room and hotel itself though could stand to use some polish. The room itself was not spacious; I would like to see an added shelf under the sink in the bathroom; there was a safe & refrigerator, but no microwave. There was minor damage to the bathroom door, but did not impact our stay. Beds were comfortable. The beautiful view made up for the deficits. We took advantage of the breakfast deal; packed our cooler with pastries, juice, milk & coffee. Then went downstairs to Wolfgang Puck Express for omelets to round out our breakfast. The location was great; dined at the onsite restaurant Tiki's Bar & Grill the first night (delicious meal!); walked across to Kuhio Beach & shopped at local ABC stores for souvenirs; down the street from Leonard's for malasadas and nearby plate dinners at Zippy's and Rainbow Cafe. The staff were all friendly and pleasant; provided us with extra towels & pillows as requested. A special "mahalo" to valet attendant Bartz as I thought I had lost my SLR camera; he walked me down to our parked car & we found the camera just where I thought I left it. But he went above & beyond to calm me down & attended to my concerns. He was even kind enough to have our car ready by check-out so we didn't have to wait long, to risk being late to the airport. All in all, the room was worth if for the view. Yes the porch was small, but big enough to enjoy the views & spectacular sunsets.

We stayed in unit 726. The hotel room was fine and would say overall the hotel is average and worth its price.Here are the pros:-location of the hotel: Waikiki beach is across the street, also a lot of shop, walking distance of main strip-breakfast by the pool: is included with the stay, they give you a cooler bag you can fill it up and take snacks with you to go. -DVD rental box: you can rent DVDs from the machines in the main floor near the lobby-PS3 is also available for those who may care to use it-hotel bed was super comfy Here are the cons:- unit itself was outdated, we had issues with the toilet. It clogged easily .. We had it clog twice :(- shower head water pressure wasn't greatProbably will not matter to many but smoking is a bit of a hassle there ... This is probably applicable to most places in Waikiki

This was our second time at the Aston Waikiki Beach and it was just as good as when we visited in 2012. This time my wife and I stayed there for 5 nights. We were upgraded to an Ocean View Deluxe room which was a bonus and yes, the view was amazing - all across the length of Waikiki Beach! The room was fairly small but it was big enough for our needs and we were out for most of the time. The Lanai/balcony was also small but still it was fine for sitting out and relaxing.We really like the location of this hotel. It is so close to the beach - just cross the street and you're there! It is at the quiet end of Waikiki but still with easy access to everything. We loved watching the sunset from the beach and then strolling into the main part of Waikiki. However, if you want to be closer to the big resorts and shopping areas you might prefer to stay somewhere more central. The breakfast was good. It seemed better organised than the last time we stayed. There was a good choice and it was better laid out. It does get busy and there is not enough seating around the pool area but you can always take your selection down to the beach.It is not the most modern hotel but it is very good value compared to others that we had considered in Waikiki. We would definitely stay here again if (when hopefully!) we return to Hawaii.

I have been coming to Waikiki for over 30 years so I have stayed at several different hotels. They have ranged from 2 stars up to 5 stars. So I have a pretty good idea of what lodging in Waikiki is like. As for our last visit which was in May of this year, we chose to try the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. The location is had to bet for the price! I have to admit that I too was surprised at the $23 per day “resort fee” that was not included in my prepaid package booked through Hawaiian Airlines. I asked about it at the desk and was told that it was a mandatory fee. The desk clerk was very apologetic about any misunderstanding and pointed out to be that it was in fact spelled out in itinerary. As they say, read the fine print! Just as a note, I did some investigation on some of the other hotels and their resort fees and it turns out this Aston has one of the lowest. Sheratons were anywhere from $30 to $35 per day! It seems to be the last way to stick it to the tourists! As for the Breakfast on the Beach; I have to agree that it was less that wonderful. You are stuck in a long line of folks whom I am sure had never eaten before! It was obvious by the way the stuffed insulated lunch bags (provided by the hotel and are in each room) with as many pastries, yogurt and dinks. This was in addition to the heaping plates they managed to carry off. The coffee was fine, but not worth the trouble of dealing with the cattle calls. Use the Keurig coffee maker in your room! This hotel has been around for a long time. It shows some wear but it is undergoing some updating. We found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. As an example when we checked in I politely asked if it would be possible to have a room on an upper floor with one of the nicer views in our partial ocean view category since we would be there for 9 nights. She checked and said that if we didn’t mind changing rooms after the second night she had a very nice room that she would move us too. That sounded great so we accepted the offer. When we got to our first room it was very apparent that it had not been renovated. (Tip here is to make sure you ask for one of the newly renovated rooms) The bathroom needed some work and the carpet was worn, etc., but we have stayed in far worse and paid a lot more. The view of the park and Diamond Head were incredible! One the third morning I checked in at the front desk and asked about our room change. The clerk found the note and said that we would be moved and asked for my cell number so she could notify us when the new room was ready. Again great customer service! Within a few hours I got the call. As it turned out the new room was on the same floor but just across the hall from the first room. The big difference was that this room had been completely re-done and had a fantastic view of the ocean and the beach! The view continued all the way to the Royal Hawaiian! One of the best views I have had for these prices. Tiki’s Bar and Grill is located on the second floor of the property. It offers one of the best beach views in the area. The prices are about average for Waikiki and the food is good. The bar has a great happy hour with beer and mixed drink specials. Overall I would recommend the Waikiki Beach Hotel to anyone who wants a reasonably priced hotel with a great beach side location. I know we will stay here again!

We stayed there for 3 days before we left on a cruise. It was very nice and close to shops and restaurants. The restaurant on property was great! The beach was right across the street. We had a partial ocean view and it wasn't worth the money. I would either spring for an oceanview or nothing at all.

What a friendly place to stay! It's across the street from the beach, which is very handy. The rooms were pretty dated, but we went to Hawaii for the beach, not to spend time in our room. I would recommend, especially for a family, we had a two bedroom unit and easily fit five.

I recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki . My sister and I had a beautiful ocen views and the location was perfect. The TIKI bar and Grill that was located on the second floor was an added plus, as they had outside seating at and around the bar and inside seating. They served lunch and dinner here and had live music all of the three days we were here. The food choices were excellent. A few things note worthy about the Aston was the checkout on second floor was open air, the staff very friendly, however there was always a line and it took us 30 minutes to check in ? Then comes the crazy elevators . You wave your key in front of a pad and it tells you elevator abcde ? Took forever. Then where's breakfast ? Well if you call it that , it's continental no hot anything served by the checkin and pool . Pitiful for a hotel of this size. That's ok, we found some really nice places to eat. LULUS out front and to left is a great place for breakfast and reasonable. We had dinner and lunch at a DUKES CANOE , do not miss this place , rite on the beach and always busy. Worth the wait . Across the street from Dukes is the Jimmy Buffett ,Margaritaville, The nicest I have visited. We ate here also. One of the big attractions of our trip was the Luau on the roof top at the Hilton hotel . It was a big hit. Visited Pearl Harbor and Climbed Diamondhead. Sun was hot and the water was warm. Perfect.

We stayed at this nice hotel immediately across the street from Waikiki Beach in Honolulu. Very nice hotel among all the action of the beach and Kalakaua Ave. surprisingly nice continental breakfast BUT remember to bring the "Beach in a Bag" container in your room as they don't have plates. The group did have a problem with a malfunctioning elevator on the last night that the hotel should have closed. Rooms did not look like they do on this sight (at least ours) room didn't cool during the day well. Rooms are starting to look dated for at least one on this end of the price range

Staff pleasant. Across the street from beach. On the main drag. A decent breakfast included. Rooms spacious and clean. Priced right. Perfect for a 2-3 night stay on Oahu. Great hotel, not beach resort. Would recommend.

I had my doubts about staying at this hotel but I couldn't have been more surprised and happy. I loved the morning breakfast. Yogurt, fruit, many Danish choices. You can listen to the wonderful live music and watch the amazing hula dancer or you can take your breakfast to go where ever you wish. The beach is steps away and there are lots of ABS stores if you didn't find what you wanted for breakfast there are plenty of choices. The staff at the hotel was excellent and friendly. The location of the hotel was great it's right on the end of the strip and very close to Diamond Head. We walked all over. Very safe. The Tiki Bar is also attached to the hotel. They have great happy hour specials and it's a great place to watch the sun go down. The only turn off which isn't the hotels fault is there are A LOT of homeless people on the beach and from time to time it tends to smell funky. There is a pier across from the hotel on which is a gathering place to watch the evening sunset.

We stayed here for three nights.Friendly service from the front desk when we checked in. Our room was ready pretty quickly. The rooms were very small and not very comfortable as they were quite cramped. Our balcony looked over the pool. It was ok. Handy location to the beach and Tikis bar and grill. I don't think its very modern, like most hotels in Oahu, the décor is brown coloured and out of the 70's style. It didn't bother me too much but a lick of paint would do the place wonders.Pros: Close to beachCons: A lot of homeless hang out around the entrance and on the main street.

This is the best hotel in Waikiki for location, service, it has it all. The staff are super friendly and helpful, the pool is lovely and clean, rooms are amazing, the views are amazing. Get the rooms that have the ocean view, they are by far spectacular and worth the money. We love this hotel.

Travelled with the family in June to Hawaii. We travel often and like the Aston. Upon arrival informed that the facility was under construction as they were repairing the balconies etc. We were told we could use the rooms, but could not use the balconies. The purpose of an Ocean front view is to use the balcony to view the Ocean !Very disappointing. Before going, call. Find out the details. In the past our stay has been okay. The hotel is located in the center of Waikiki, an easy trek across the street with a paddle or surf board. Can watch the children from the balcony.

The Aston is a lovely modern hotel with a view to die for. The room is comfortably sized and includes a small fridge for snack storage, bar table along with a Lanai deck with chair and foot stool. The amenities are excellent including a great breakfast and free wifi. I also enjoyed the Tiki Resturant that shares the pool deck. They play live music most evenings.

The palce charged a little mich for a "Resort" fee which is pretty much for internet and breakfast I think. It was nice but not a resort by any means. If you get a good deal take it but there are other places you can find a better deal.

We stayed here just over 2 years ago for 8 nights & had no hesitation in returning this time for another 7. Stayed on both trips in an Ocean Front room & they are worth every cent, an entertainment centre in themselves if you like activity this location is great, from a constant array of aircraft passing by to tourist submarines doing their thing & many other activities in between going on right in front of you. The rooms have had a bit of a facelift it would seem & they are nice, quite a good size & with a huge comfortable bed. The bathroom performed all required duties flawlessly but it was a little tired in appearance & if you have come to admire the bathroom rather than the room view you may well be a little disappointed, this to us was of no concern.Once again the lift system impressed us, we found that often we had a lift to ourselves. The extra level of security afforded by this system is laudable & well worth the 10 seconds or so you have to initially invest working out how to use it.As with our last stay we found all staff we encounted a pleasure to deal with.The breakfasts we also enjoy & as part of your amenities fee which so many hotels charge now actually offers something material you get for your money. We felt there was possibly a little less variety than 2 years ago but not a huge difference, standard cereal packs yougurt fruit salad quite a large range of muffins pastries etc various juices & pretty decent coffee, not bad really & always enough to provide a little lightweight lunch as well.Last but not least must mention Tikis Bar & Grill which we liked already and on this holiday they also provided the best meal I had while on the Waikiki leg of our stay.
user_name:
Melnp
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach in May 2014. We had a partial ocean view room which gave us a beautiful overlook over the beach. The location of this hotel is ideal! It is located down the quieter end of Kalakaua Avenue (if there is such a thing! HA!) right on the beach - what is great about this hotel is you are within walking distance of all the shops and restuarants and it is a main hotel pick up area for all of the tour companies in Waikiki. The hotel itself was lovely, our room was spacious, the beds were comfortable and rooms were serviced to a high standard. The hotel also offers a complimentary breakfast and provides its guests with a 'cooler bag' which you can go down to the breakfast bar and pack full of fruit, yoghurt, crossaints, cereal, muffins, juice, water, tea and coffee etc - the hotel also provides bags and containers for the food to go inside your cooler bag. We really thought the breakfast bar and cooler bag idea was fantastic. We saved a tonne of money not having to go out for breakfast every day (which can get very pricey after a week or two). This hotel is family friendly, couples friendly and the Tiki bar and grill does amazing food and cocktails and live entertainment each night. I will definately be going to stay again at this hotel next time I am in Oahu.

I am in the military and relocated out family to HI for a three year assignment. While waiting on our housing to be ready we stayed at this hotel. I am only halfway through my 32 day stay here but wanted to write about this hotel during this busy PCS season to inform everyone how military and family friendly this hotel is. Up front the offer you free breakfast, free Valet parking, free wifi and $25 per day you stay with them (the put the total balance in a visa check card when you check out). If you are married w a family check your TLA rates and your meal rates. Some folks don't know their total entitlement. The meals rate is a flat standard and you are paid it regardless. Some of their rooms are bigger than others so when you make your reservation keep that in mind. I maxed my TLA option and we are staying in a large suite (big family). They gave us two free upgrades to a partial ocean view with a lanai which is super cool. My wife and kids love doing spending some morning time out there and settling down at night too. The beach is 25 feet across the street and this side of Waikiki is a little calmer, so it's perfect for smaller children. The beach has a small wall to allow calmer waters for young kids swimming w/o strong currents. You can walk a quarter mile down the strip and it picks up so you won't have to walk far at all if that's what you prefer. There is a nice pool on the main floor (3d floor) with a restaurant adjacent to it that has beautiful live music played every night. In the mornings Mon-Fri there is a guitar player and Hula dancer who perform during breakfast hours (really nice). During the weekends you can watch parades from your room lanai, the pool area, from the beach or by the street! Restaurants all close by with plenty of shopping and things to do during the day/night/weekends. When I go to work my wife is able to enjoy the hotel amenities and Waikiki beach. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Room service comes through daily and the Valet is always on time with the car. You get exempt from some taxes if you're in orders. I haven't stayed at any other hotel in HI so I don't have anything to compare it to. But I will say it beats staying at the Best Western or Tripler Hotel...just makes sense to stay here the drive is NOT that bad. And it is a great hotel, not as great as or Sandals Resort experience but it's the best hotel I've ever stayed at while on a per diem rate!!

We booked through Priceline and had a non-refundable reservation otherwise we would have gone to a different hotel. You can't check-in until you pay $23/day in "amenities fees" that are not mentioned on the reservation or the hotel website. They told me that my priceline reservation only paid for the room but now I needed to pay the hotel for their amenities. I told them I've never heard of such a bogus charge. Their reply was that a lot of hotels charge this fee and I'm was very unsatisfied with that justification. The elevators were very crowded and slow. They have a new system that is supposed to make the elevators more efficient but it led to 5-10 minute waits for a overfilled elevator every time.The check-in attendant told us that he would give us a complimentary room upgrade which we were excited about until we saw the room. It looked newer but there was barely enough room to walk around the bed, the bathroom was old and yellow, and it was very loud due to street noise even though we were on the 6th floor. They advertise "Breakfast on the Beach" as a fun idea but the breakfast was pathetic. A few bowls of cereal, yogurt, and milk were your only choices. Very disappointing, especially with the $23'day "amenities fee."The only good thing about this hotel, as other reviewers mention, is that is right across the road from the beach. But there are a lot of beach front hotels and we are never going back.

We celebrated our 40th anniversary in Hawaii. We stayed in Room 1129--a large, oceanfront room. Waikiki Beach is just across the street from the hotel. The property is very clean and most of the staff were very friendly. The breakfast buffet is good but should not be advertised as free since there is a $23/day charge for the breakfast, Wi-Fi, movie and game rentals and daily newspaper. There are very few parking spots--ten or less so I would not rent a car if staying there. The room had no sitting area--only the bed, dresser, nightstands and a pub table with two stools. This is the only time I have ever stayed in a hotel that had a wall-mounted lavatory in the bathroom--no vanity or counter space. I used one of the bar stools to hold our toiletries. Our room had an adjoining door which presented some privacy issues.The homeless situation in Waikiki is very troubling especially in the area surrounding the Aston. The room was adequate. I guess I was just expecting more in paradise.

We stayed here as an overnight layover. I had picked the room online based on just the location (beach is across the street) and the low rate. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised. The room was beautiful and very large. The morning breakfast was well-organized - you file through the line and fill up your souvenir cooler. We took ours over to the beach. Do be aware the pigeons are quite aggressive so don't feed them.

Excellent buffett in the morning! Every single aspect of this hotel is impeccably clean, and there are fabulous shops throughout the concourse. Staff was very friendly and the afternoon swimming pool atmosphere is a great time! Can't find anything bad here at all!

The staff was helpful and upgraded our room to a higher floor and partial ocean view, however overall it is evident that the hotel was redone rather inexpensively. The bathroom tiles were tinted a yellowish color, and not very nice. Rooms were quite small as well as the pool. Also, the elevators are extremely confusing. Besides these downsides, I would only recommend staying at his hotel if you get a really good deal on it, otherwise it is not worth spending over $140. Although the location is great, breakfast is included (!), the rooms are finely decorated and updated, and the Tiki bar by the pool looked pretty fun, although I did not eat/drink there.

First time to Hawaii and loved it - the hotel was great value, loved the breakfast idea of cooler bag which you fill with the goodies by the pool. Spacious room and a great view. Definantely would stay here again (Hopefully December this year)

I loved the modern Hawaiian beach theme in the lobby and surfboards. This hotel has a lot to offer and the staff is great. With that being said I never met the management. There are a lot of great features to this property, so let’s focus on those for the moment. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The views were awesome and so was the balcony! We loved the bar/grill where you could wind down at the end of the day. There was close access to beach and the staff was very helpful. We came back from our cruise on December 7th 2013 and there were many things going on. The anniversary of Pearl Harbor which was sold out… (I vowed that I would someday return to pay my respects to the veterans who perished). They had the Waikiki Holiday Parade which commemorates Pearl Harbor by honoring survivors and veterans that perished in the attacks from December 7, 1941. Local Hawaiian bands, marching bands from the mainland, military units, local officials and dignitaries march down torch-lit Kalakaua Avenue along Waikiki Beach. It is held annually the Friday following Thanksgiving Day and hosts thousands of spectators, residents and visitors alike. The Honolulu Marathon woke us up the next

This was our first time to Hawaii. I would stay here again. Pros: Great location, literally across the street from Waikiki Beach. Tiki Grill & Bar and Wolfgang Puck is attached to the hotel, both of which had delicious food. Lots of places within a short walk. Staff was curteous and attentive. Our tv went out at 8:30pm and the front desk sent a maintenance man right up who replaced the tv in about 15 minutes. Partial ocean view faced Diamond Head. Large breakfast choices - cereal, yogurt, numerous pastries, fresh fruit, oatmeal, hot Hawaiin cuisine, breads, mini & regular size muffins, juices, coffee, milk, hot water for tea, and soft drinks. You can eat breakfast then load the cooler up with (breakfast) food for lunch or snacks to cut down on food costs. The five elevators were easy to use. Cons: Lanai was super tiny. Just large enough for 2 people to stand on. Not even large enough for a chair, but there weren't any chairs in the room anyway. Only 2 small bench seats with a very small raised table. Room was small, but we didn't spend much time there so it was okay. Bathroom was outdated and shower head was too low. The daily amenity fee stinks, but most hotels have it or are more expensive to make up for it. Overall, thumbs up for an active vacation. We weren't in the room much except to sleep, so the location was important to us so we could be close to the beach and the action.

We stayed here for our honeymoon and were recommended this hotel via AAA. The location was phenomenal and there is parking attached to the hotel which is a plus. The hotel it's self was a little rundown. The paint needed touched up, the carpets had stains, and the room was never quiet clean enough. There was always hair that wasn't ours all over and the towels never looked 100% clean. It was a good price, maybe we just hit at the wrong time. We had a wonderful view from our balcony!

Travel period was April 2013. We stayed here as part of a vacation package by AAA. This hotel has a great location on Waikiki beach. Unfortunately, that is all that is great about it. This property is outdated. Front desk staff did not appear happy being at work -- it shows with the lukewarm welcome you will constantly receive anytime of the day. To be fair, this was observed during our week stay alone. The staff may be happy and welcoming on other times, who knows?Worst thing, my wife suffered a back injury during our stay at this property. Their front desk is on an upper floor level accessible by an escalator or an elevator. An elevator which needs instructions to which floor level to go. Due to this, most people prefer to use the escalator even with their vacation luggages. On our way down to walk on Waikiki beach, a group of teens had checked out and decided to take the escalator. One of them had accidentally lost handle on her large, heavy suitcase. My wife and I were about halfway on escalator going down when we heard a scream from higher up from us and helplessly saw a careening luggage. My wife was hit square on her back and was violently shoved down the escalator stairs until she reached the bottom. Needless to say, it was a horrifying experience for us at this property. Other than the paramedics being called by the management, there was no offer of any consolation or compensation for cancelled tours nor a hotel compliment except for approved late check out on our last day. We had suggested for the hotel to have a bigger sign (much bigger than the current 5"x8" placard) to say luggages not allowed on escalator or maybe an attendant that watches the area to prevent future accidents. Future hotel guests are welcome to update us if our plea was even heard by management.

Nice hotel. Great view. Great location. Very friendly staff. Would stay there again. Just walk across the street and you are on Waikiki beach!! Tikki's was great for a quick bite. Nice complimentary breakfast at hotel each morning.

We spent 7 nights here and totally enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean and well kept. We had a partial ocean view which was great because we were on the Diamond Head side so we got to view both. The room had a small lanai, comfortable bed and was clean. It's right across the street from the beach and close to everything. The breakfast on the beach thing was cool. Lots of pastries, fruit, yogurt, coffee and some Asian goodies as well. The rooms are equipped with PlayStation and you can check out games and movies downstairs in the lobby. The wi-fi in the room worked well. The hotel also has a free beach chair and towel service. We ate at Tiki's Bar and Grill by the pool once. The meal and service were both good. Overall, we had an awesome experience at this property and in Oahu.

Got offered an upgrade to oceanfront select and accepted to then be told it would be an extra $40 a night. Couldn't use the balcony as there was a wasp nest somewhere nearby and I was stung. The amenities fee is a rip, breakfast was terrible, DVDs unwatchable due to scratches, wifi so slow. Shouldn't be forced to pay the amenities fee, especially if you don't or cant use any of it.

We had 2 rooms. Oceanfront on 14th floor and ocean view room.Beautiful view from oceanfront. Tiki's was delicious!!The atmosphere is very relaxing. Breakfast bar was well stocked. Thank you for the great staff. Everyone there was very accomadating, courteous and very helpful from housekeeping to valet to checking in to leaving!

We spent 7 nights here and totally enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean and well kept. We had a partial ocean view which was great because we were on the Diamond Head side so we got to view both. The room had a small lanai, comfortable bed and was clean. It's right across the street from the beach and close to everything. The breakfast on the beach thing was cool. Lots of pastries, fruit, yogurt, coffee and some Asian goodies as well. The rooms are equipped with PlayStation and you can check out games and movies downstairs in the lobby. The wi-fi in the room worked well. The hotel also has a free beach chair and towel service. We ate at Tiki's Bar and Grill by the pool once. The meal and service were both good. Overall, we had an awesome experience at this property and in Oahu.

Spent two nights at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel recently after 12 days in Maui. The hotel was very busy and quite adequate. It is located right along Waikiki Beach and a very busy tourist area. Buses & tourist trolleys stopped right outside of the lobby. Our room had a small lani with a beautiful view of the ocean along Waikiki Beach. They provide an continental breakfast included with room costs. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. My selection for this hotel was due to its reviews on Trip Advisor, the cost which included continental breakfast, its location across from the beach and along the main street within this district, but primarily the fact that it was within one block of St Augustine by-the-sea Catholic Church. I had made other reservations elsewhere but cancelled due to the distance of walk to the church for Sunday mass.

We thoroughly enjoyed our 3-night stay! Beautiful ocean front location! Fabulous view from our spacious, clean room. The express elevator was a new concept for us. We quickly learned to appreciate them! Why don't more hotels use them?! Breakfast selection was good although the line was often long. Breakfast on the beach is a good thought although actually eating on the beach probably wasn't practical due to birds. The live music was a nice touch. Check in and out was smooth and easy. Staff was friendly and helpful. Loved Tiki's Restaurant!! Food was excellent as was the service!

This was our first trip to Hawaii so we booked our trip through AAA. The agent suggested this hotel since she had stayed here on her vacation. Glad we did, the location of the hotel is at the end of Waikiki Beach, so close enough to walk to the restaurants and shopping on Kalakaua Ave. Check in was fast and staff very helpful when we had a question about the area. Room was average with a great view, bathroom could be updated . We had breakfast at the pool nothing special but it was good . Tiki Bar and Grill Restaurant was just a couple of steps from the pool so it was nice to walk over to happy hour after swimming to enjoy drink before going back to your room. Does seem to be a lot of homeless people in the area,Honolulu is just another big city like New York or LA. lots of traffic and very busy.

This was my wife and my first overseas holiday for 23 years and we will be back next year. Couldn't ask for a better location, the food in Tiki's was first class and reasonable rates overlooking Waikiki beach. The hotel staff are super friendly and the hotel amenities are great. It is also a main pickup point for tour buses and local trolleys to get you around town. My only suggestion would be flexible checking time as flights from Australia get in early. All in all highly recommended beautiful place in paradise

We had an ocean view room on the 24th floor. The room was clean, perhaps a little small, but the million dollar view made up for this. The cost was very reasonable for a hotel just a few steps from the beach. The outside breakfast was very good. Lots of places to eat within the hotel and nearby. There are better hotels along the beach but are twice the price. Truly a great value and glad we found this place. We will stay here again next time.A tip on the air conditioning. We discovered the thermostat was set for 75 which is a little warm for our taste and could not be adjusted. Fortunately, the maid showed us a little work around. Grasp the thermostat with both hands and it pulls off the wall. Then give it a few seconds to reset and push it back in place. Now you can set it as low as 65 and it works well. It will revert back to us and you will have to do the procedure again a least every 8 hours. I suspect it was set up this way to conserve energy.

We chose the Aston because of the centralized Wakiki Beachfront Location and ease of access to shopping, restaurants and the beach. We stayed in an Aloha Suite which had two Full beds and nice size living area with a sleeper sofa. This is perfect for us as the two full beds do not generally allow us good night sleeping for all 4 of us. Our kids are 13 & 17. The room was clean and well appointed and our balcony view towards Diamondhead was beautiful. The hotel breakfast was OK but nothing great, consisting of cereals, breads, coffee , juice & milk. There are several restaurants within 2 -3 blocks of the hotel and we would go and get some sausage & egg biscuits to add to our poolside breakfast. The walk down to teh main strip is about 5-6 blocks and we walked down several times daily. You will notice an abundance of homeless people along the sidewalk, but this is everywhere, not just the Aston. The hotel bar nice as well and a good atmosphere there. The staff was nice and accommodating, check in was easy, and the elevators very fast. If you have never been to Waikiki Beach, the sand is very difficult to walk in and there is coral under the breaks. It is pretty to see, but there are much better beaches on the island. I canb say that if you are averse to Buttocks, then the beach is not for you. The Dental Floss Bikinis are very popular, whether large or small butts.  The Zoo is across the street and it is worth the $$. Spend about 4 hours there. My brother lives in Oahu, so we will return to the Aston again. It is an excellent value and I recommend it for families.

Don't get me wrong, the hotel is okay. The only complaint I have is that the walls are super thin and my wife couldn't get to sleep a few nights due to the people next door staying up all night talking and watching TV. The facilities are decent and the rooms are okay, nothing to rave about however. The hotel did it's job, we needed somewhere with a shower and beds to sleep and that's what we received.

There are pros and cons to any hotel but the pros outweigh the cons on this one. For starters, the hotel is priced very well considering its on Waikiki beach, where everything is more expensive. Its located near plenty of shopping and eateries. It’s the last hotel on a strip of hotels near the beach so it’s closer to the less crowded area than most of the hotels on the strip. The absolute best feature of this hotel is the elevators. You simply scan your card, type in the floor number, and a specific elevator will take you where you need to go. This is great because you won’t be waiting for an elevator forever, just to find it too crowded to get inside. I rarely waited for an elevator for more than two minutes, and I was on the twentieth floor. I read reviews that the rooms were small, I do not understand that. My wife and I had more than enough space and our king sized bed was very comfy. I guess if you have kids you may want to get a suite, but otherwise there is no need. The breakfast was very nice. I like the fact that they give you a nice cooler to fill up with breakfast food and you can take it on the beach. The hotel also gives you beach towels and beach chairs that you can check out. A small con I would say was the front desk was always busy. The staff was friendly and helpful but I think they were understaffed. The only major con I would say is I’m not a fan of Waikiki beach, it was just too crowded and it was more like a busy city area than a relaxing beach area. If you like places like New York City or Chicago you will like Waikiki, if you want something quieter, go somewhere else. I’m not going to downgrade a hotel just because I don’t like the city it’s in though. We did a cruise of the islands and I liked Maui much better than Ohau, if I go back I’ll just go to Maui, maybe Kauai also. If Aston has a Maui location I would definitely consider staying there.

Great location on Waikiki beach near tons of restaurants and shopping. Hotel rooms where a little small but clean. Staff was friendly. Hotel and parking fees where a bit speedy. Breakfast was pretty good.

My husband and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel May 12-15th for the beginning of our honeymoon. We were warmly greeted at the front guest and given a picture frame as a gift for our honeymoon as well as room upgrade to an ocean front room! The room was updated, clean and had a GORGEOUS view! The staff was friendly throughout the stay, we loved the food and drinks at the tiki bar and the complimentary breakfast was great! There was plenty of food and a variety of choices from fruit, donuts, yogurt, cereal etc. We were beyond pleased with our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Waikiki area!!

This has been our go-to Waikiki hotel for the past several years. It is located at the east end of Waikiki, directly across the street from Kuhio Beach. It is very close to Kapiolani Park, the Honolulu Zoo, and the Waikiki Aquarium. The oceanfront rooms provide a panoramic view of the Pacific Ocean and those gorgeous Hawaiian sunsets. If you're lucky to be here on New Year's Eve, you'll be treated to an offshore fireworks show. The hotel is a little dated but it is clean, comfortable, and the staff exudes the Aloha Spirit. We've stayed at higher-end properties and we feel this hotel provides the best overall value. We like to start our day with breakfast at Cheeseburger in Paradise, beachcomb all the way down to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and then make our way back thru the shops on Kalakaua Avenue. Lunch is at Teddy's Burgers (right around the corner) and dinner and drinks at Tiki's.Grill. Not a bad way to spend the day in paradise.

I stayed there 4 years ago and enjoyed my time and all aspects of the hotel. Our recent stay was less than spectacular due to the following changes:- breakfast buffet was less spectacular as the offerings were reduced. They now charge for eggs and toast. They did have some good masadas - but not the healthiest choice daily.- condition of pool and deck. Let's face it, just remove the pool from the upper deck - it was not used the week we were there, and I had a good view from my deck. The pool gets filled with breakfast remnants each day, and just did not look like a place I would want to swim.- overall hotel condition: there was a leak in the ceiling down the hall - I looked up and saw soggy ceilings in our unit too, bathrooms need updating. Our patio doors whistled all night as the seal was gone.The hotel staff were very pleasant, and the music at breakfast is still a nice touch. I would opt next time for a larger hotel room a block off the beach to try to get better value.

Recently I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and would have to say the customer service is not ideal. The front desk customer service was about the worst I've experienced. Also, if you book a stay at this hotel via booking.com be careful, the price I booked was different than the confirmation I received from the hotel (there are issues with taxes and fees in fine print that make the totals in-congruent be sure to read the fine print) and then the final outcome. Also the hotel charges you an extra $23/day "amenities fee" - this is NOT included in the daily rate you are quoted so be sure to add that to the daily rate you are quoted and add tax too.If you stay here, ask for a room on the 25th floor with an ocean view. However, know that what you request is not guaranteed on arrival. You may request a king bed and end up with a room that has double beds. To change rooms, you will be required to check out before noon and then check back in again at 3pm... which means you need to re-pack, leave your bags at the front desk and then check-in again and unpack again... they won't just transfer you to another room (or at least did not give me the option to do so considering I stayed there an entire week - it never happened...) not ideal if you are travelling long distances and just want to relax. Also, the rooms don't a have desk/table with proper sitting chairs - so no chance to sit down and get any work done if needed. Hit the Starbucks next door you will be better off there.The Hotel is not located on the beach - it is across the street from the beach.
