If you want a beachfront resort where there is access to the beach from the property then I would recommend: Outrigger on the Beach - Waikiki, Westin Moana Hotel on the beach, Royal Hawaiian, Sheraton Waikiki on the Beach. There are a lot of shops and restaurants close to these hotels too. Plus they have restaurant/lounges on their property which are beachfront and have access to the beach. So depending what ambiance you are looking for make your choice.There is a 24hr Fitness a couple blocks from the Aston that has beachfront views and charges $69 for a week pass. It was a great gym - super inspiring and perfect for working out.Near the Aston is a Starbucks :-) Wolfgang Pucks, and Subway, plus a good breakfast place located above the Starbucks called "Lulu's". The hotel breakfast is weak and the line-ups are not worth it... You are better off going to LuLu's next door above the Starbucks and get a view of the Ocean plus full service - the eggs Benedict, omelettes and traditional breakfast were all great there!The beaches across the street are good. One has a wave barrier which keeps the water calm which would be great for kids who want to play in the water. To the left is a regular beach and great to hang out if you want to experience some waves and good crowds. The Honolulu Zoo is also near - if you have kids it might be good - I did not visit but it was very close walk.

small rooms .get balcony with ocean view higher floors. good free continental breakfast.valet parking but cost 40 dollars a day to park rental there.parking cost more than rental.best beach #1 rated in USA next to hotel.good bar downstairs and onsite activities agents.good pool
user_location: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica
user_name:
Cornell F
La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica

review_body: Great for a stay in Waikiki for all ages. Elevators, escalators all good for those less mobile.Convenient for Trolley and other Pickup services. Variety of eateries within walking distance.At the not so crowded end of Waikiki. Breakfast included is more than adequate. Accommodating staff at taxi/parking area and handy trip/info. booking area.Would definitely stay again, but would get a room with full ocean view. Beds are really comfortable.

We stayed here in April for 2 nights in the ocean front room. The view of Waikiki Beach was amazing!! Our room was also nice and a good size and cleaned to a high standard. I did not like the breakfast arrangement, as the food is average at best - fruit yoghurt and pastries. I also did not enjoy collecting it as it was very crowded and hard to carry coffee along with the provided cooler bag. We ate on our balcony which was nice as there is limited seats around the rather sad looking pool. Tikis is a great restaurant and the food and service there was great. I probably wouldn't stay here again as I preferred the other end of the strip away from the many homeless people, I found some staff to be very helpful and others not so much, overall we did enjoy our stay and have fond memories of our time at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel

We spent 5 nights here and loved it. We had a great ocean view room and enjoyed sitting on the balcony overlooking the beach. The breakfast was great and we enjoyed the daily music and hula dancer. The Tikki Bar and Grill was excellent and so convenient. We would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I spent a couple of days here.Room was nice and very clean.Great view of ocean,ect.Geri at the front desk was very nice and VERY helpful with a couple of small problems we had in the room.She even gave us a free picture frame since we were enjoying our 40th wedding anniversary there.The only issues with the room was the toilet height and shower head was very short,unless your 4 foot tall ;).Would recommend this hotel!!

1st time staying - was excellent hotel. Great customer service, rooms were outstanding - we had a room with a view of the ocean....only drawback was the roof off our balcony spoiled the view and hence the atmosphere....The buffet breakfast is outstanding - fresh fruit, yogurts of all kinds, pastries, coffee, juices etc....the hotel is conveniently located for excellent sidewalk shopping or the mall nearby....the only drawback I can say is the 24.00 a day valet parking fee....my brother and I were there on a BUCKET LIST trip for the nearby military venues (USS Arizona, USS Missouri,etc) and after 3 days gave up the auto and used local transportation....We negotiated with a cabbie and made a flat deal rate for his services....Would stay again BUT this time use local transportation....

First time at this hotel - great place. wonderful staff, fantastic location. We had an ocean view room and spent great evenings and mornings watching the ever changing scenery.Cannot fault this hotel or it's wonderful staff - thanks a million Lillian!Will be back.

Had a great view of the Zoo and mountain peak, this hotel was perfect for my first time to Hawaii. The location was next to the Waikiki beach and they had a great breakfast that you could eat out on the beach. The staff was very helpful, thank you!

It was good overall...but the facility fees are too high...even though we didn't spend much time in the hotel. and the parking not worth it. we did have good breakfast...and the services were great..from front desk to the breakfast area. thank you

Everything about this hotel is great. I stayed in this hotel the past 3 of the 4 years. The breakfast is good and the hospitality is excellent. The plus the beach and the bar downstairs. I would go back.

My husband and I were in Hawaii for a wedding. We spent most of our time on the Big Island, but took 24 hours to check out O'ahu. The package we booked included our flight and accommodations at the Aston Waikiki Beach. I loved that the hotel was RIGHT on Waikiki Beach and within walking distance to so many shops on the strip.We didn't spend much time in the room, but it was comfortable. We did appreciate the free movies that come with your stay. It was nice to unwind from a long day in the sun with something relaxing in the room. The one down side was the size of the bathroom. I felt a bit cramped. Since we were only staying one night, this wasn't a big deal, but if we would have been staying for longer, I know it would have gotten challenging. Staff was great and wish we could have stuck around for the poolside breakfast; however, we wanted to get to Pearl Harbor and we checked out by 6am.

Stayed there for a few nights with my family. Our room had a spectacular ocean view, equipped with a little fridge, a coffee maker, and a small cooler. Continental breakfast was also included. Swimming pool was a bit small, but the beach was steps away. They rented beach towels and beach chairs for free. Restaurants, shops, Honolulu Zoo, 24 Hour Fitness, and ABC stores were within walking distance, so we didn't drive at all. Only difficulty we had was trying to figure out the TV set, combined with game console. Overall, it was a nice visit, and we'll stay again if we return to Waikiki.

The Aston was a nice hotel. It is right on the strip of Waikiki and everything was in walking distance. It was clean but the rooms were dated. It was a good value and the staff was very friendly. You don't spend much time in your room when you are at Waikiki, so it worked out great.

10 years later & I still love this hotel. I 1st stayed here in 2004 & going back in 2014 everything was just about the same. As always I check out the reviews to see what may have changed & see what other people had to complain. But, like my last stay I was impressed with my room as well as view. Except this time I was on a higher floor Room 2501 booked an Oceanview Room (the view I had was consider partial ocean view back in 2004 because Oceanview back then was room right along Kalakua Ave which is now consider Oceanfront Rooms) it was a corner room so I had the best of both worlds....open the room door to see Diamond Head...Aston Waikiki best value is location and amendaties. They serve daily breakfast but you can pay a small fee for Omlettes made to order....This time they tact on Resort Fees $168 & some change with taxes. Make use of the DVD/Video game kiosk since it is included in the resort fee. We usually did when we came in for the night, but the movie always ended up watching us....lolThe location is excellent, plenty of places to eat and the hotel bar are restaurant were very good with a good Hawaiian automosphere. They provide valet parking service at $27 per day but instead of renting a car consider the public transportation as the hotel is on the main stop for shuttles to get around. The check in was fast & friendly...even though we weren't on our Honeymoon he gave us the gift since it was my boyfriend's 1st time there he treated us like Honeymooners. The elevator key system, seems pretty confusing at first, but it actually keeps the elevator from being over crowded. I think a little clearer signage is needed coming from the guest floors back to the lobby or street level as there really isn't a "1st or 2nd" floor and if I'm not mistaken I don't think you need you room key to come down. All and all I think with just a little clearer instructions inside the elevators or on the guest floors would help. Also a better indication of what elevator you need to take to the "lobby" that doesn't require a key cardOtherwise, everything else on the property was just how it was in 2004 but I am sure they remodeled since then.Although, I feel Waikiki Beach isn;t the same as it was 10 years ago. There more commercialized stores that now is taking over. You don't get the Hawaiian feel anymore. They have taken alot of local shops & restuarants out to make it more high end. I felt like I was in Beverly Hills instead of Hawaii. So, when booking tours take advantage of the island tour as you will see what the City of Honolulu is like besides the resort area.So, I am sure if I visit again it'll be a major change in the area as well....

Stayed: January 2013.2 double beds. This is a basic beach hotel & the prices reflect that.Pros:- In room safe ($3 + tax per day).- Shampoo, conditioner, bath gel & moisturiser provided.- Close to ABC Stores, Wolfgang Puck Express & the gym.- Short walk to fast food & beach.- Concierge desk very helpful in booking day tours etc.- Complimentary cooler bag for you to use to collect the complimentary breakfast in the morning.Cons:- Lines at front desk move very slowly. More staff may be required.- Complimentary breakfast is basic. There is not enough space around the pool to be able to actually sit & eat it. We ate back in our room.- Nothing to do with the hotel. There was a jellyfish outbreak during our stay so we were unable to go to the beach.

Only my second stay at a Aston property and I was pleasantly surprised. Like my last review I usually stay at the bigger chain properties and I have have been finding out that hotels like Aston and Aqua have really made me always now seriously consider staying at their hotels. No Four Season but the value I feel is considerable considering location and amendaties.I do quite a bit of traveling and have racked up a bit of expedia points which I never really considered to be that much of a value but more of a marketing gimmick. Not the reason I book travel or hotels but decided to use them here anyway. I was upgraded to a Ocean front room on a high floor. I have stayed at a few hotels in Honolulu and this room by far is one of the best I have had in regards to a balcony view. Couldn't ask for a better view of Waikiki beach. I probably wouldn't have paid for the room upgrade because you never really know exactly what your going to get but I don't think you could ask for a better room view anywhere else.The location is excellent, plenty of places to eat and the hotel bar are restaurant were very good with a good hawaiian automosphere.Valet parking service was good and always timely. Someone mentioned in a previous post that with a AAA card you get free parking, well you have to book that package and the rate is exactly that much higher per day, so it's really not a discount. I do not think there is any self parking on the property which is one downside to this property. But with the crazy traffic there it's one thing I didn't mind not having to deal with.The check in is kind of odd being on the upper floor and right by the pool. But It seems to work. The other odd thing that I have never seen before is the elevator key system. At first I thought wow what a confusing mess, but it actually moves pretty many people very quickly through the hotel. I think a little clearer signage is needed coming from the guest floors back to the lobby or street level as there really isn't a "1st or 2nd" floor and if I'm not mistaken I don't think you need you room key to come down. All and all I think with just a little clearer instructions inside the elevators or on the guest floors would help. Also a better indication of what elevator you need to take to the "lobby" that doesn't require a key cardIn summary I would highly recommend this hotel and seriously compare the Ocean front room rates to any other hotel in Waikiki, You won't be disappointed

Stayed in an oceanfront room for 5 nights on our honeymoon on our way from Australia to mainland USA. Our flight arrived in the morning and the staff downstairs looked after our bags while we waited for our room to be ready...the beach is directly across the road and shops and restaurants and bars within metres so that so no problems. We were on the 11th floor and the view was breathtaking! Plenty of chairs available at the pool and chairs and towels available for the beach if you want to. Nice basic breakfast included in your fee that you can take in your bag to your room or beach...whichever you would rather! Tiki's Bar and Grill was great! Great food, great drinks specials every afternoon and night and 3 different times of live music each day. After finding out it was our honeymoon the manager came over and congratulated us and we were brought out and large dessert plate with cake and 'congratulations' in chocolate syrup and without charge....great hospitality! Would recommend Aston Waikiki Beach to anyone...in fact we already have and 7 of us are coming over in October for my mums 60th birthday!

This is a nice hotel in a good location! The rooms are a bit dated but the location and bar make up for it. Tiki Bar is a great place to have a drink and something to each with a great view of Waikiki Beach!

My husband and I just came home from 7 nights at the Aston and were very happy with our stay, although I have to say I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews on here. I think people need to be a little more realistic with their expectations given the nightly rate. The hotel is a little older, but we felt it looked updated quite a bit! Our room was very clean, the bed super comfortable and the balcony had a perfect partial ocean view! The included breakfast isn't anything special, so don't expect bacon, eggs and pancakes. It's more like cereal, muffins,fresh fruit and doughnuts. Oh and sushi or miso soup if you like that sort of thing in the morning?Halfway through our stay the city experience a main water pipe break which left us without any water and when it did return it was scotching hot - for 2 nights. It wasn't the fault of the hotel, but they were more than helpful and willing to move guests to their sister hotel or around the hotel to other rooms once the situation slowly started to resolve. So given that experience, I am still giving it 5 stars because the staff, rooms and location really are great!!! If I had to say anything bad about the hotel, it would be the fact that their main desk is on the 3rd floor instead of in the lobby on the first and the elevator system is a little annoying - you have to flash your card and select your floor to call it. We would definitely stay here again!

This hotel has a very nice location, close to beach and restaurants. Nice breakfast buffet with a good selection of fruit and pastries. The room was clean and maid service was very good. Staff was very nice and helpful. It was easy to find.

I picked this hotel for the oceanfront room. It was great. I especially liked the elevator/security system. And the flexible breakfast is awesome. Staff was proficient and pleasant. Maintenance was Johnny on the spot! Overall feel was comfortable. Felt like one of the ohana.

Loved the location, our view was amazing! Enjoyed the nightly entertainment in the Tiki Grill & lounge. The majority of the staff were accommodating and friendly and having breakfast available every morning was such a convenience and cost saving. They had a small cooler in the room to take items back to room for those that chose to sleep in :) It was also nice too have drinks by the pool! The room was a standard hotel room, comfortable beds and we did have to access the maintenance person because of the air conditioner but they we're prompt and alleviated the issue immediately. When we compared the amenities to the hotels some of the other family had booked there was no comparison ours totally was the best! Aloha!!!!!!

For a vacation with a ten year old, the location of this hotel is excellent, over the road from a safe part of the beach, and quiet at night (we were on the 25th floor with a great view). It was easy to walk into the main part of Waikiki. The room was on the small side, but good value and clean. Pool/beach towels were welcome. The breakfast is basic, and all in disposable containers, the coffee is awful, so paying for it daily regardless of having it is a bit annoying, as is the bizarre system of operating the lift. No laundry is a negative as well.The staff are good, especially the guys on the ground floor who look after luggage and shuttles.
user_name:
LilibetMelbourne
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: Stayed for two nights in a selected deluxe oceanfront room. The sunsets were amazing. The room itself is spacious and comfy. the location is easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and is across the road from Waikiki Beach. Breakfast is a great concept, in your room you'll find a green esky. Bring it down to breakfast fill it up with pasties, yogurt, and fruit. Then grab your coffee and take it across the road for Breakfast on Waikiki Beach. Brilliant! The hotel is home to the famous Tiki Bar. Live bands play and you pay a bit extra to get your Mai Tai in a take away tiki cup which is a great souvenir.

Great location, great breakfast set upThe staff were fantastic. On our last night the people in the next room were extremely loud into the small hours of the morning. We rung the lobby & they sent security up. They were so prompt. Very satisfied as we had to be up early for our flight.Only thing to mention I think is that it's a very family orientated hotel so lots of kids. We didn't mind but maybe some might?Free DVD rentals which is one of a kind I think, we loved itWish we could have stayed longer!

The room was spacious and clean. Breakfast is a buffet style and free with your amenities fee. The Tiki Bar on site is wonderful, great drinks and music. Nice beach directly across the street (free chair and beach towels can be signed out/returned). The hotel is next to the zoo, and with the easy access to beach yoga at the park that is just caddy corner to the hotel. Rental services are available all up and down Waikiki. The beach directly in front of the hotel ended up being my favorite spot. Good restaurants with reasonable prices abound. But don't buy anything from the lobby store, sunscreen was 15.99 while at the ABC store is was 8.99. The prices were very reasonable and you are only a half mile or so from the high end shops and tourist centric stalls, if that is your thing.

After a long early flight, all we wanted to do was lie down and get some rest but found out check-in doesn't start till 3 pm. Anyway, we tried to see if we can check in earlier than that and Geri was so friendly and helpful in getting us our room. We told her we were celebrating my birthday and anniversary that week and she upgraded us to an ocean view room. Awesome! I also got a free picture frame gift! What a way to start our double celebration vacation! Our room has a beautiful view of the beach and it has small balcony with a chair to enjoy the wonderful view! Thank you Geri for making our day! That was so AWESOME!The valet parking was efficient and the staff friendly and accomodating!The hotel has a great location - across the beach and near the Zoo, shopping and restaurants. I find the elevator interesting. I think it makes the hotel and its occupants secure and safe. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends and will definitely come back and stay here on our next trip!I suggestion though - hope they'll extend breakfast time to 10:30 am instead of 9:30 am to accomodate late risers like I am :)!

Dear AllI have just experienced the most horrific lack of Corporate Responsibility in all areas of marketing communications, health and safety and quality. I and my partner arrived at the Aston Beach Waikiki on Friday 25th April. That night, the hotel, purportedly through no fault of their own experienced a MAJOR water problem. I have photos of the damage to the road outside the hotel etc. Anyway, three days paying for a hotel room with little or no communication from the Management is totally unacceptable in anyone's terms. Not only did they not communicate but we had to ask on the second night if we "could have a shower somewhere", then on the third night they were just waiting for us to check out, presumably so that the "problem would by away".

We live on Oahu and just stayed here for one night as a convenience for staying in Waikiki. We normally stay at other places. I think this is an OK hotel. I didn't experience any problems with staff, but we didn't have to deal with anybody really except for check in. The morning of check out, the car/valet area was a giant mess so one of the valets took us a different area to bring out car out of a back exit which we appreciated. The pool here is probably the smallest hotel pool I've ever seen and in a very strange place. It's right in between the main lobby/check in area and the restaurant. The floor in this main walk area is wet and slippery from pool water which seems like a safety hazard since it's a main walk-though. I wouldn't want to swim there, really strange choice of location. I was pleasantly surprised by breakfast. The trays of pastries were constantly refilled and there were big trays of fresh fruit which was nice to see. I had one main problem with my room - the pillows. There were four of us, two kids and two adults. We each had one super flat pillow. Really uncomfortable trying to watch a movie, had to try and fold it in half so we weren't just laying flat. Invest in some new and additional pillows! Our balcony was about a foot and a half wide. Just wide enough to stand in and look around. We had a view of the zoo. Again, no major issues, next time I would just pay a bit more for one of the nicer places. We love the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I will add that the food at the Tiki Grill is exceptional. I would come back to the restaurant!

We decided to go to Hawaii with my brother and sister-in-law. We needed a hotel for 2 nights because we were taking the cruise ship Pride of America to each island.We checked different hotels and they were so expensive. We came across the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, and were surprised at the price and it looked looked like a nice place. It did not disappoint us. The room was a good size and the king bed was very comfortable, it was very clean and was across the street from the beach. We had a great view and could sit on the balcony and relax with a drink and enjoy. Later we all decided to go to the hotel bar called TIKI GRILL & BAR. The food was very good and they also had great MiTi' s. In the morning they had coolers in the room that you take out by the pool and fill with a great variety of fruit, pastries & other breakfast goodies.First we had our coffee by the pool then we went across to the beach to eat. So relaxing..You can take the cooler as a gift from the hotel.We had a wonderful stay, even though it was only 2 nights, and would Highly Recommend this hotel when staying on Waikiki. We plan on going there the next time we're in Waikiki.

We stayed for 3 days In September 2013. The location was the best. We were right across the street from the Beach, and right within walking distance of tons of restaurants and shops. The free breakfast on the beach was a nice touch. They give you an insulated lunch bag to take food to go. Muffins, fresh fruit, cereal, etc... were free and plentiful. Also an option to pay at egg station, all while listening to a live band. The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I loved the bar on premises. There was a band playing popular covers with electric ukuleles. The drinks very very good. My only issue was a problem with the air conditioning. It cut out and it got quite stuffy in the room. We called and it took a while but they did fix it with no further problems. I really liked this hotel. If I go back to Oahu I will stay again, and have recommended to others.

Was disappointed with this hotel as "breakfast" was collecting your chooses in a cool bag! Unless you like Asian food you have to pay extra for omelette, eggs or toast! Majority of staff at reception were rude and not that helpful. Room was lovely though I had a narrow balcony which was unable to have any chair on it.Beach is just across the road and the hotel is located in a quieter part of the resort.

I stayed here as part of a school group and I enjoyed my stay with some mini issues.I stayed in Room 829 and it had a gorgeous view of the ocean. Unfortunately, during the day and part of the evening, there is a high-pitched noise that is to deter the pigeons, which is very annoying if you happened to be in the room during those times.The breakfast option was good especially since they give you a bag to fill up and you can take it to go to the beach etc. It's a continental breakfast with hot items available for sale and the options were actually quite varied and delicious.The front desk staff had both really helpful staff and some not-so-helpful staff. The bell desk were very good at accommodating the school band's instruments.The prices are mid-range and if you can grab a room at a sale, it would be good value.I would stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to others.

We have never been to Oahu. We had planned on staying at Holiday Inn at Waikiki, but after using google street view we saw it really did not have good view. I heard about the Aston and started looking at reviews.The reviews varied and the biggest thing seemed to be that the rooms were dated. After looking atthe street view, it looked like great location and boy was I right. Yes the rooms were dated but you do not spend a lot of time there. The breakfast on the beach was excellent. Nothing real fancy but they had great selection to choose from. Great staff there. Very helpful for any needs we had.Again, the location was probably the best. The beach is right across the street for real. Some hotels say that, but were a block away, without a view of the beach. Out our room window,we could see the beach and Diamond Head Mountain. We had a cheap room so the review is not about a high price suite. Well worth the price and would stay there again.

I have stayed in a lot of hotels/resorts and even though this place wasn't the worst place it definitely wasn't the best. We booked this place for 2 nights in April 2014. Upon arrival we were not greeted at all in fact we had to ask where to go to check in as there were no signs stating where to go. The Bellman acted as though we were bothering him when we approached him asking where to go. As we were checking in I asked the cost to upgrade to a ocean view room and asked if they had some available. $45/night. I agreed and we were on our way to our room. Like most vacationers we were too excited so we drop the bags and headed to the beach. We had a wonderful stroll on the beach and took in some supper at the Aston on our return. Our room was very small and next to an elevator that was so noisy that even being extremely tired made it hard to sleep through. Our room was freezing and we had to shut the thermostat off cuz it wasn't letting us change the temp. 2days later we were headed to Maui and upon checkout I explained to the desk clerk about the room temp and the noisy elevator. She was actually upset at me for not calling them right away. They did adjust a little bit of the money off of my bill, but not much. The Aston is in a good location, but it felt like a place that was just housing tons of people. The staff were rude and unfriendly. They always acted as though we were asking too much of them. Their breakfast is the biggest joke of all. Besides no seating...... Other than fruit and muffins you will pay extra. They also don't know how to keep anything full and yet they have only had it open for an hour. Hate to see what a couple of hours brings. I always read reviews of places I stay and I always have thought man people you are so picky.... You are on vacation. But after being at the Aston I couldn't help but write a review to tell others to shop a different place to stay. You are in Hawaii and everything is so expensive to begin with, however, when there is no customer service with what you are paying I am sure you can find a better hotel to stay at.

We stayed in a partial ocean view room with views of the ocean and diamond head. I wish the balcony had been large enough to sit on and enjoy the views. 2 people good barely stand out there together. It was a great view though!The hotel location was great as well. We walked to shopping and restaurants, caught a quick bus trip to Hanamanua Bayand Diamond Head. Diamond Head is even so close that we walked back to the hotel after the hike was over.Breakfast was included and it was nice, could have had a few more options, but something was better than nothing. I enjoyed just grtabbing a breakfast sandwich from the Subway right on the ground floor better. I would definitely stay here again.

As experienced travelers we would say that our stay at the Aston Waikiki on the Beach was one of our top holidays.The Aston location is excellent. Across the street is Waikiki Beach, how do you do better than that. To the east is Kapiolani Park. You can go for a quiet walk along the beach, you can visit the Aquarium or the Zoo. Head west and you are in the heart of Waikiki with all its sights, sounds, and activity. The westward view of the beach from our room was nothing short of spectacular Their staff is outstanding. Everyone in all departments from housekeeping, to guest services, to bellmen, to maintenance, to reception, and security supported our holiday in a very friendly, efficient, and professional manner. We were always greeted with a smile and “aloha”. Thank you to Thelma, Liza, Mia, Pilar, Nora, Justin, and all whose names we cannot immediately bring to mind. We must also mention the excellent room. The king size bed and pillows provided us a wonderful night’s sleep from day one of our holiday. Relaxation is a big part of what we want on a holiday and the comfort the room provided was right on the money. We were fortunate to have the same room we had had before and were very impressed with the renovations. The room was updated and bright without losing any of its comfort or character.Breakfast-on-the-Beach has continued to be a great feature for us. It was our treat to bag our breakfast and take it to our room so we could enjoy it on the lanai overlooking the bay. The musician and hula dancer added such a beautiful ambiance.Have to say the elevator system is a real bonus. Another great idea! Easy to use: swipe your room card, enter your floor, and the system assigns you one of five elevators. There were no mobs cramming into any available elevator or entering an elevator that had all the floors pushed. It didn’t take very long to learn and after that it was a piece of cake.The free towel and chair service deserves mention as it makes a day at the beach so relaxing. There are plenty of restaurants and take out places within a short distance. At the Aston, Tiki’s Restaurant & Bar provides superb food, service, atmosphere, and live music daily. Teddy’s Burgers, Wolfgang Puck Express, Fursato, Seafood Village, and many more are within a short walk.

We received a nice aloha from everyone of the staff members every day. The view from our room on the 23rd floor crazy great, city and ocean views. The rates where very good for the location. There are other fees ,no different than the other hotels. Thanks Aston for making our stay nice. My folks loved their stay, also. P.S. Nice elevator system.

This would be my second visit here within the past decade. The property is most secure despite walking over the homeless bodies to gain entrance. A good homebase for many attractions in the Waikiki area. You can catch many helpful buses from here and beach access is easy. Accommodations are good, but basic. I had a sense that the hotel is keeping in line with the bottomline, but doing their best to provide a pleasant experience. Missed a larger pool area, hot tub, hot breakfast items at the "complimentary breakfast", and complete quiet. Ah, it's either the constant sound of the adjacent hotel's AC or Tiki's loud music....but it is Waikiki afteral. Rooms are very clean and full of the amenities you need. Friendly staff and wonderful Hawaiian singer/dancers at breakfast. The $23 "Resort Fee" is mandatory whether you utilize the accommodations or not. Com'mon, just include it in the total room cost and be up front. A bit deceiving. This is NOT the Royal Hawaiian Hotel, but this is definitely not a low budget inn that you will regret.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki for our honeymoon of 10 days and were very happy with the choice. Down at the zoo end of Waikiki Beach, it was still an easy stroll to the restaurants and shops. A main hotel, tours and shopping trolleys pick/drop off travellers from right out the front of the hotel. Our room was clean even through the decor was a little dated. Breakfast was a simple affair, get to the buffet early to get everything fresh.

My friend and I just spent 6 days at the Aston, its a good hotel overall, we stayed on the 20th floor so we had a great view of the ocean. There was a gap under the door so there was alot of air coming in. There is a $23.00 a day anemity fee, this fee is what they call breakfast on the beach, they give you a small cooler you can fill with pastries and fruit and take to the beach. A little pricey, there is also a $27.00 a day fee for valet parking. There is no self parking. Besides those 2 fees they are very resonably priced. I would recommend this hotel

Stayed at this hotel for 7 days in March. The location is excellent across from the beach. Go for the rooms with an ocean view. Partial or side view is great for watching the surfers and the bustle on the street. Also take a room with the fuller balcony not the Juliet balcony. The rooms are okay. They are not spacious and are sparingly furnished. A Keurig coffee maker is provided and they are supposed to provide you with two free coffee pods each day. Our bathroom was quite tired and could do with a thorough scrub down.....needs up dating. We had quite a few housekeeping problems and it seems housekeeping generally is lax and not well monitored or managed. They provide a morning breakfast of mixed fruit which mostly ends up being melon, yogurt, cereal and various pastries. The pool looks nice although did not use it. Towel service is provided which is convenient. The Tiki Bar and Grill on the property is very nice with an interesting menu and fresh salads, good drinks and a great spot to watch the gorgeous sunsets.

Friends and I stayed at the Aston for 4 nights at the start of our 2-week Hawaii trip. The location was great for walking to the beach and any of the many restaurants and shops, plus landmark hotels like the Moana Surfrider and the Royal Hawaiian where we went for high tea and cocktails, respectively. The hotel elevators were a bit confusing--you need your room key to call one--but also quicker since the system appeared to be designed to take you straight to your floor. I was most impressed with the beds--very comfortable, no back pain in the morning, which is often an issue for me--and with the number of outlets--there was a strip along the right side of the dresser, which was great for 2 people in the same room with several electronic devices to charge. One complaint: total lack of hot water in the shower the first morning we were there, about 7 am local time.

Right next to a beautiful park and across the street from Wakiki Beach. Kalakaua Blvd reminded me of Las Vegas BLVD Lots of shopping and People. Great places to eat as well.The free breakfast isn't bad. Take your little cooler to prove you are a guest. The rooms aren't bad. The staff is helpful. We got alot of good advice from the tour adviser in the hotel. Wolfgang Pucks cafe downstairs is really good. On sunday morning of our stay, they closed the Blvd. in front of our hotel to do some filming of Hawaii 50. That was fun to watch. You might want to check and see if they'll be doing any filming while you're there. I guess it happens quite frequently. Tip: Take advantage of the your internal clock. Ours was 5 hours ahead so it was no problem getting our of bed and on our way somewhere at 7:00 in the morning. Now coming home was a different story. SOOO TIRED.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Hotel for one night on our way back to Sydney from NYC in January 2014.We drove our rental car from the airport and used the hotel's valet parking. From memory it was about $25 for the night. On previous trips we had sometimes used the Roberts shuttle. but we learned that it would take ages if you were staying at a property towards the end of Waikiki (as opposed to HHV or Ilikai where it would probably be a good option).We had booked an Ocean View room with balcony and it was very nice. The property was a little older, like many in Waikiki, but everything was good in our room, We had a balcony with a great view over Waikiki. The room also had one of those Keurig coffee machines that are popular in the US - they make a decent coffee or hot chocolate from the 'pods' the hotel provides.We had never stayed at Waikiki Beach Hotel before, but had been to Tikis Bar and Grill several times on previous trips to Hawaii. Tikis has great service and a nice atmosphere. We have enjoyed Mai-Tais and Lava Flows on their terrace bar and had hoped to do the same on this trip. Unfortunately we had picked up some kind of bug in New York and were too sick to enjoy Tikis on this trip.The hotel provides a breakfast that you can eat by the pool or take over to the beach in a cooler bag the hotel provides. We enjoyed the breakfast by the pool, which had plenty of decent choices.We would definitely stay here again, There are ABC stores across the road which sell beer and wine and practically everything else you might need.. If you are heading to the airport the next day, being at the end of Waikiki means that you just need to go one block to Kapahulu, turn left then head up to the H-1 freeway..

We spent 3 nights at the Aston. We were on a budget and a little doubtful on what were booking but at the end of our stay we were very very pleased with everything.The Hotel is one of the older ones but has had a makeover at some stage, a bit of paint and new furniture. Nice flat screen tv, a table and 2 stools plus a good sized cupboard and safe.Bathroom was clean and adequate. LOVED the King Sized bed! Sooooo comfy!!! Linen was clean and crisp.We stayed on the 23rd floor and looked down Waikiki Beach. I think when your booking accommodation in Waikiki and your on a budget you have to decide whether an older place on the beachfront with views or a newer Hotel but a couple of blocks back with no views. We choose the views and glad we did. Spectacular!Tikis bar on the ground floor was awesome, a really nice vibe all the time.Breakfast served next to the pool was great. Plenty of choice and plenty of food. You can take the chilly bag from your room and fill it with food and then take it to the beach to eat. Liked it.On the ground floor there are cafes and shops and around the corner a Starbucks.On the 1st floor you can book tours and trips, really handy.The Hotel is located right at the end of Waikiki but really wasn't a problem, plenty of shopping and food places around you.For the money we paid we were more than happy with this Hotel!

Excellent value. Spacious room, ocean view. Clean, quiet. Balcony is for views only, very tiny.We needed an overnight accommodation which provided easy access to Waikiki Beach. We had just completed the Norwegian 7-day Hawaii cruise and wanted to visit Pearl Harbor before our return flight the next day. The Bell Desk arranged shuttle service to Pearl Harbor and the next morning to the airport. Both shuttles were prompt, courteous, and efficient for us. The Shuttle to Pearl Harbor was Round Trip and gave us flexibility for the return trip when the launch to the Arizona Memorial closed due to high afternoon winds. Disappointing, but we met our primary goal of catching the local shuttle bus over to the new Oklahoma Memorial, right beside the Missouri Battleship entrance. Our daughter-in-law's great uncle died on the Oklahoma during the attack, so this visit was crucial. (Get local shuttle bus ticket at the Arizona Visitor Center windows and catch the shuttle just a few yards/meters to the right).The Bell Desk also has a reasonably secure luggage storage area next to the Bell Desk. Since we were very early arrivals for check-in, this was very important and appreciated. On site restaurant provided a great meal. Noisy and very busy, as expected, but part of our overnight experience. The wait time was about 30 minutes, not bad for a busy Saturday evening. Chilly and breezy weather meant outside seating was less desirable, probably contributing to the wait time.The complimentary breakfast at the pool on Sunday morning provided expected pastries, coffee/juices, cereals, and cut fruits (melons). Suggest getting to the buffet early, as the cut fruits were scarce by the time we arrived there. As advertised, you can take stuff over to the beach in the provided cooler bag. Just be sure to leave the bag when checking out or a fee will be charged.Elevator system was efficient but a bit confusing at first. Specific elevators are for service between the arrival level (1) and the desk/pool/restaurant level (3). Escalators also nearby. For service to room floors, wave your room key by the call panel, enter your desired floor, and WATCH FOR YOUR ASSIGNED elevator. Once in the elevator there are NO buttons for floors.Bottom line: This was an excellent choice and a great value for our vacation.

We found the rooms very small and the water pressure extremely low at certain times,however, we highly recommend this hotel due to the excellent location,right across the street from the beach and value pricing. There is lots of shops and eateries close by, Our room was on the 10th floor looking down on the pool, it was quite loud and the tour buses line up very early on the street below, but we were fine with that,as it was only a 2 night stay. The free breakfast is simple and the line up is long at times but we found it to be an added bonus, there was also addition food (omelettes..ect.) for purchase).

My husband and I have been to Hawaii 3 times, staying a few days at the Sheraton Waikiki then over to beautiful Maui. BUT I have to say, if you are going with children (from 2 to 21) they will WANTto be on WAIKIKI! We have just returned from 2 weeks in March 2014 at the Aston Waikiki Beach with our daughter and her boys (5 & 8). The Hotel was the BEST we could have hoped for. The Reception Desk was pleasant. The pool on the 3rd floor was beside Tiki’s Grill – the BEST casual restaurant on Waikiki where EVERYTHING was good, and it overlooks the ocean! The hotel offers FREE – DVD’S (NEW!), FREE Nintendo Games, a FREE full continental buffet breakfast, and FREE towels and beach chairs. They have a lunch snack bar for minimal cost with sandwiches and hotdogs. Below the hotel is a Subway, a Coldstone Creamery, and a Wolfgang Pucks Pizza Place! It is a great place to walk down Kalakaua Avenue and see the Duke and many other statues, beautiful plants and Banyan trees. An ABC convenience Store is on every corner and many shops and stores to see. The Hotel is across the street from the Honolulu Zoo, and is the main Trolley and Bus Stop for most transportation. The beach is beautiful at that end. For small children there is one side with a break wall where they can play in shallow water, and on the other side of the pier, there is more undertow and waves for older kids that want to try their surfing and snorkelling. We stayed in a “partial ocean view” for $145. A night, which gave us a room with doors that opened onto a 2 foot balcony. Not enough to sit on, but had the beautiful ocean breeze, great view, and could dry our bathing suits and shoes out! Our King Bed was SO comfortable, and our daughter’s adjoining room had 2 double beds and was great for her. There was plenty of dresser and closet space, and a mini fridge and hairdryer. TA people say there is a musty smell, we didn’t have it, just bring some Bounce Sheets and keep the AC on low! The hotel is PERFECT for families, good restaurants, great beach, and lots of activity!

To start it's good to say that we stayed at this same hotel for ten days in 2004 and we enjoyed our stay. Thus when it was time to stay on Waikiki again we chose the Aston. This time around they have a mandatory 'resort fee' that you get to pay upon arrival. $23 per day. I'd be okay with this if it were not mandatory but where it is mandatory it really should be included in the room rate since you can't have a room without paying this 'fee'. It is to be noted that other hotels in the area do not charge a similar fee, they just charge a rate and offer similar resort amenities. Myself, I think they do this to get a lower room rate on internet sites. That said, factor this into your plans when you book and you may find a better deal at a better hotel. On to the review!The room was clean. No fooling. VERY clean! No dust anywhere to be found, the bathroom was spotless and it stayed that way, the beds were comfy and the linens smelled fresh. The tile in the bathroom is old and needs to be replaced and some attention is needed to some peeling paint in the bathroom (room 1612 in case anyone cares) but everything else was pretty good. The view from this room was of Diamond Head and was great! The noise from an air conditioning system from the next hotel was loud enough to make us keep the door closed all night so we missed the night breezes but still enjoyed the view. The balcony is large enough for two people to stand on it but there's not enough room for a chair. Leaning out on this balcony you get an ocean view. The breakfast (NOT complimentary but part of that 'resort fee') is okay. Yogurt with tropical fruit flavors, local donuts and simple pastries, along with cereal and freshly prepared fruits make for a passable continental breakfast. For an additional $7 you can have an omelet - but we never tried that and instead opted to just have the light breakfast. Japanese breakfast items are also available for a change if you want. Ten years ago the breakfast was more substantial with egg sandwiches included but times change. Juices, tea, coffee, and milk are also options. The live music by the pool at breakfast is probably one of the better features of the breakfast and even if you get bored with the breakfast offerings I'd recommend getting a cup of coffee and staying to enjoy the music. It really sets the mood for a Hawaiian vacation! The location right across from the beach affords awesome opportunities during the day. Some of the best snorkeling we did on this trip was across from the hotel in the lagoon where we saw trigger fish, a five-foot long moray eel, a four foot long coronet, thousands of schooling goat fish, a huge puffer fish and more. A few hundred yards east near the Natatorium we saw innumerable game fish and we even saw turtles in the water. Easy access to Diamond Head, Waikiki shopping, Kapiolani Park, the Honolulu Zoo, and the Honolulu Aquarium are all major benefits of staying here. The Wolfgang Puck Express restaurant downstairs is excellent and well-priced for a quick service place that serves upscale food. The downside of the location are the numerous homeless people who've staked out claims to territories on the sidewalks, planters, and at the picnic table areas across the street from the hotel. The begging is non-stop, the smell of urine in places is extremely distracting, and a general feeling that you're not very safe after sundown is a bit disquieting. Not that the Aston can really do anything about the homeless people and the other rough types that come out after sundown, but you need to consider this if you plan on any night time activities on the beach. Me, I'd recommend against that idea and tell you to stay in the crowded and well-lighted areas of Waikiki after sundown. I'd also say that I'd keep my small children close after sundown. Oh, and by 'after sundown' I mean IMMEDIATELY after the sun sets! No kidding, you can watch the families melt away from the beach and watch the unsavory types filter in not ten minutes after the famous and fabulous sun sets. As we walked around on this trip we checked out some of the other properties along Waikiki and the generosity and ohana (look it up!) of the hoteliers along the way was pretty amazing. We were welcomed and treated as guests at the Wyndham Waikiki Beach Walk where they welcomed us with fresh leis! We were also welcomed at the Royal Hawaiian, the Moana Surfrider, the Hilton Hawaiian, and the Hyatt where the hotel staff was most helpful with our rental car. We'll absolutely consider these hotels (and the Wyndham which is a condo hotel) for a future stay. In closing the question I leave with is what would make me come back to the Aston over all these other places? 1. Ditch the 'resort fee' and just make it part of the room rate instead of playing some silly game with me. 2. Improve the breakfast just a bit. Raise the room rate if needed, but make me happy about it in return! 3. It really is time to update the tile in the bathroom. 4. Nag the local politicians to get the homeless and their urine off of the beach! Otherwise it makes sense for me to stay at a resort that fronts on the beach and makes the homeless unwelcome. Disclaimer to the 'sensitive types': Yes, I know the homeless need to be somewhere. That's true. But when I pay good money for my only vacation of the year I don't want to spend it on having to deal with aggressive panhandlers, urine smells permeating a beach area, and having to step over people flopping on the sidewalk 24 hours a day. I can see that in California for free.

This hotel is right across the street from the beach, and has unobstructed views of the ocean. It's also located at the end of Waikiki which is a little quieter area. You can easily escape the crowds by walking a block to the zoo and park area. It's also right on the route of many shuttles and tour buses, which we found very convenient. The hotel is an older building which has some updates and is generally clean, bright and pleasant. Unlike a previous reviewer I liked the "Breakfast on the beach". They give you a small cooler to pack up your complimentary breakfast, and have beach chairs available to take across the street to the beach. Coming from -15 degree weather in Minnesota, eating breakfast on Waikiki beach was pretty hard to beat! Besides, the hotel doesn't really have room for everyone who wants free breakfast. It's a very creative solution to a lack of breakfast space, I think. The hotel has a strange elevator setup; you scan your key card and punch in the floor you're going to from outside the elevator and a display tells you which elevator to get on for your floor. At first I was put off by this arrangement, but over the course of our stay it seemed like this system really reduced elevator traffic and wait times. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a good Waikiki location at a good price.

This was the perfect choice for price and location. Amazing view if you get a high floor (15 and up) facing the front or on the side close to the front. The TiKi restaurant is on hotel property and offers a wonderful happy hour starting at 2-3pm! Overall prices are in the average for the island.The beach is right across the street. Very safe for kids, and protected from waves and surfers.. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. Kids friendly and decent choice for food in the neighborhood. The breakfast (complimentary)... Well.. They should stop offering this Breakfast on beach concept, and just organize tables for everybody.. I have seen nobody literally taking their breakfast to the beach..Then, only negative note.. They were systematically forgetting to vacuum the carpet in the room... But we reported the issue, they immediately came to vacuum, and discounted the 75$ for the late checkout. So.. Good deal!At night you can walk along the main strip and do a lot of things.. Watch out for the people sitting on the walkways...

First off I have stayed at some of the finest hotels in Hawaii, so I am a little spoiled. That being said this hotel is very average. Rooms are super small, elevators are a joke, no hot tub, and the morning breakfast was donuts and three kinds of fruit. The plus side was the location by far, right across from a beautiful and protected part of Waikiki beach! Would I stay again? No. To many other hotels close by that were far more nice.

I have been reading reviews all weeks prior to my flight to Waikiki. And was kinda nervous hoping the hotel was not as bad as people on here writing. The hotel is in a great location right across from the beach. The hotel it's self needs some tender care and love. They have tried to "refresh" the rooms but in my opinion did not do a great job. Paint was un even the a/c vent was black from the dust inside what it seemed. The balcony sliding door was very flimsy and had rust on them. The bathroom is where I think the refresh should of happened. Very outdated. Other than all that. We had an okay stay clean room and comfy. Friendly staff and the little breakfast was nice. I would probably pay a little more next time and stay elsewhere like outrigger or the mariot.

We stayed here 4 nights. We had an oceanview room of Wakiki Beach with a small balcony. The room was fine for the two of us but I think it would be crowded if you have children with you. They did provide a free continental breakfast which consisted of sweet rolls, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, breads, coffee, & juices. I think some kind of soup. They are limited on space, so they give you an insulated small cooler to put your food in, in case you want to take it back to your room or the beach. This was located by the pool so seating was kind of difficult. They provided towels & chairs for the beach. The in room coffee pots were weird. On the internet, they provided keurig coffeepots and they did deliver one to our room when asked. They only provide 4 free pods, and any more are $2.00 each and we stayed 4 nights. That was pretty cheap but otherwise I have no complaints. The location is great at the end of Wakiki Beach. Wolfgang Puck Express, Cold Stone Creamery, Subway and Cookie Corner are also located on-site. They are within walking distance of the Hula Grill and Duke's.

I was initially disappointed on first arriving at the hotel. It's a little dated compared to the photos on the Internet. By the end of the trip I could appreciate that this hotel was fantastic for the price and the location was second to none. Loved: - the movie kiosks which was included in the room fee. Perfect as we have a toddler and are stuck in the hotel room after 7pm. - Tiki's, the attached restaurant, went almost every night! - the shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, stops right outside the hotel, it's so convenient and only $2 each to ride- right on the beach - Tucker & Bevy and Lulu's right around the cornerAfter leaving Aston Waikiki we went to Aulani, the Disney resort - much much nicer and much much more pricey. My main gripe with Aston Waikiki was the average breakfast fare with no free seating around the pool (nightmare with a toddler) and the room decor was very tired. Didn't like the scene at night time, loads of homeless people wandering around. It's a busy hotel too!

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 days for vacation and could not have been happier. The rooms were amazing, we had a ocean view on the top floor that had great views of Diamond head and the water. The breakfast in the morning is good and its nice they give you a lunchbox so you can take food back to your room. The also had a DVD rental kiosk kind of like Redbox but you just use your room key to get DVDs great for a relaxing night in. Its in a great part of Waikiki, on the strip but away from the area that is more congested. Also, it is a pick up spot for a lot of Luaus and tours so that is very convenient. If you come here expecting a luxurious hotel with spas and room service you will be disappointed. But, otherwise its wonderful hotel with a laidback atmosphere.

We arrived at 9am so we knew we were unlikely to be able to check in and we couldn't. So we left our bags with the concierge and the team there were very helpful, also sorting out transport to Pearl Harbor for us. When we checked in at 4pm, we found we had a beach view, albeit not a perfect one due to the angle of the building. Still, it was nice to look out from the bed across to the beach. We were on the fifth floor, so in terms of noise it wasn't ideal as the partying on the pool level is right below you. I'd ask for a higher up room next time. The breakfast buffet is casual but comprehensive, and the best but is they provide cooler bags so you can take your breakfast down to the beach (or in our case, to our balcony). We didn't really use any other amenities as we were only there one night, but overall I'd recommend this one if you're looking for an economical option that's right on the beach.

35 years ago , spent our honeymoon at this hotel (then the Holiday Inn Waikiki) so we actually stopped for two days in Oahu on our week long Kauai trip just to stay here again, yes.. It has changed. But the view is still great, the people are still wonderful and the addition of the breakfast on the beach was a pleasant surprise. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to an ocean view suite with congratulations!! The rooms are not brand new but full of aloha spirit. Sitting on the balcony, looking out at the lights of Waikiki and listening to the ocean brought back great memories. Found the breakfast with the Hawaiian music and hula dancer lovely, with more food in our souvenir coolers than we could eat, and a nice selection too. Lots of free Keurig coffee in the room. Have a beautiful pic in our fun souvenir picture frame we received. My only disappointment was how Waikiki itself has changed, which has nothing to do with the hotel. Thanks again to the staff for being so helpful, especially our valet guys, mahalo for the directions!! Glad we got to return after all this time.

Hotel staff are excellent. No complaints here.The breakfast buffet (free) is great. Lots of fruit, pastries, cereal, juices, coffee, tea, yogurts, & an Asian food selection as well. For a $1.00 -$2.00 charge, you can upgrade to hard boiled eggs or waffles.Beach Towels & beach chairs are free to use.Buses & trollies stop right outside the hotel which is awesome. If you rent a car, parking per day at the hotel is $27.00. There is no street parking so you'll have to suck it up & pay it. The valet service is very good.Location of this hotel is excellent, Right on Waikiki Beach. Everything you need is within walking distance or can be easily accessed with a trolly or The Bus. Trollies are $2.00 per person & The Bus is $2.50 for a two hour pass.The hotel restaurant is called Tiki's & overlooks the beach. Food is very good, but I don't recommend the bar section as service is very slow & only offers a limited menu. The inside is a full service restaurant with faster service & excellent meal options. Downstairs at street level, there is a Wolfgang Puck's Express which has very good food. Ice cream, Subway & a cookie store are also in the hotel main floor. Prices are a little high for my liking, but that is the cost of convenience.The hotel is very clean. She is an old bird, but that really only shows in the rooms, as updating should have been done 10 years ago. Frankly if they renovated the bathrooms in the rooms, I would have nothing to criticize. This is where the age of the hotel really shows.My pet peeves about this hotel is that they do not have a central laundry service, only dry cleaning. We were there for two weeks & had to tote 20lbs of our laundry to the Waikiki Laundromat at 2450 Prince Edward St, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA (808) 351-5331 about 4 city blocks away. It cost $46.00 to do 20lbs, taxes included. Also, if you are a smoker, expect to stand out on the street corner & bugged constantly by those looking to bum a smoke from you. I think I gave away more cigarettes than I smoked, & frankly felt a little unsafe there especially in the evenings. This hotel could easily place a bench & ashtray in the entrance of the parking area 40 feet from any business activity to accommodate their smoking guests & offer them a little security from the street. I carried a portable ashtray so I didn't have to litter by butting my cigarettes on the sidewalk.

This was our first stop on a 2 week Island hopping trip. The busy street to get into the Aston was difficult and two many one ways. I felt unsafe in this area and so we valeted the rental car daily for $27 with a resort fee of $18, this hotel is not worth the extra costs. The room was very small, not enough room for 2 people and luggage, although the bed was nice...We had a daily breakfast included, but you had to pick the right time or stand in a long line. The offerings were unusual, soups and sushi for breakfast?? They did have cereal and pastries and a fruit station. Also you could pay extra for an omelet, really? I would have traded the Asian station for an omelet.....They did have a nice bar/grill that we stopped in on the 1st day, friendly service. The area is too busy for a vacation, the traffic getting in and out is crazy and compared to the other islands, I would skip this one....

Aston beach Waikiki is a great hotel we had 4 nights over the New Year's Eve Staff were very helpful we arrived early from Australia (around 8.30am) was unable to book in until after lunch so we went for a walk around Waikiki for a few hours But once we got back we had a early lunch at the Tiki's Bar & Grill - food was excellent & view was great looking out over Waikiki beach & Pacific Ocean By now it was 2pm very tried but this time our room was ready it was well worth the wait we had booked a Ocean Front room select hotel room views right across Waikiki beach - it was well worth the extra amount we had paid New Year's Eve was fabulous looking straight across Waikiki beach fires works was one of the best we have seen & great sunsets and each morning watching the surfers & all the action on Waikiki beach all we had to do was sit on our balcony to watch it all We did not use the hotel pool as the ocean was right in front of the hotel Walking distance to all the restaurants & shops from the Aston hotel & Waikiki trolley stop was right outside the hotel which made it so easy for the hop on hop off trolley We will stay at Aston Waikiki again

We booked a room at the Aston Waikiki (unfortunately through Priceline) to complete the last three days of a ten day Hawaiian trip to both Maui and Oahu. We had spent our money in mom and pop bed and breakfasts, expansive and luxurious resorts and then.... the Aston. We checked in after realizing there were no other parking options except for paying $27. The young woman who checked us in was pleasant enough, but did not really go above and beyond for us. She did mention, however, 'Oh....you booked through priceline.' We were given keys to room 601 and went right to the room immediately. As we crossed the threshold, the strong scent of mildew permeated through the whole hotel room, not just the bathroom - where it was so strong you couldn't walk in. There were stains all over the credenza and table and chairs, and the barely there balcony looked out over the ghetto buildings behind the hotel.It just was not an acceptable room for us being that it was a romantic vacation and had come at the worst part - the end. I immediately called the house supervisor, Geri, who was very pleasant and said she would do what she could to get me into a different room. She personally walked us up to room 1926, an upgrade, and told us she just started recently as general manager and, unfortunately, not all rooms get the attention to detail they should. You could tell she was trying to do the right thing. Our new room was slightly bigger, did not have as much of a moldy stench as 601 (but it was there, do not be confused) but the bathroom was severely old and had mold all around it. Housekeeping never replenished new coffee or glasses (despite my written request with tip for them to do so.) The room had a view of waikiki but there was no way two people could sit on it and enjoy the view comfortably- partly because it is on the 19th floor and the bigger reason is the balcony is just too damn small. My rental car even came back from Valet with a dent and scratch in the driver side door.Really disappointed. Pool water was cool, too crowded to take advantage of the Breakfast on the Beach (ran out of food)..... so probably wouldn't go back. Would rather pay more for quality accomodations.,

Room was a little small but clean and we got the exact view I wanted when booking the hotel. The hotel is a little dated but very reasonably priced and the location was perfect as you could cross one street and be on the beach. Free breakfast was real basic and seating was limited but it all worked out. Very friendly staff and our short stay was a pleasant one. I would definitely stay here again if we were to come back.

The Aston was clean but a little dated. The bed was comfortable. The breakfast at the pool was nice, but unfortunately, it was difficult to find a seat. It was centrally located. Nice views from the restaurant and room. Would stay here again.

Spent 7 nights at the Aston Waikiki and found it to be very average. We had a partial ocean view on the 14th floor with a King Bed. The view was unobstructed to the left, which was great! The balcony a little small for two people to sit on one chair and relax, but we made do. Had a great encounter with a member of the cleaning team, which resulted in having a very clean room and additional hand lotion / toilet paper / towels - as we requested. Thank-fully how we booked via the website had the amenity fee already included within the quote - which was nice to know what we were quoted on the website was included in the full fee.Here was a brief pro/con list from our visit:Pro's:- Great location- BYOB bag to pack snacks for a Breakfast on the beach- Nice ambiance with musician and dancer playing while breakfast is served/good music in the evening playing from the Tiki Bar- Paid option for paid for Valet service.Con's: - The hotel needs a facelift (holes in the wall, water damage on the ceiling, shower draining problems, paint faded, cracks in cement outdoor corridor)- Customer service was a bit of a con when dealing with a concern we brought up during our stay in regards to our key card/door lock not working / location of our room and having an ice machine right across from our door... literally 2 and a half feet away. (it was a little annoying trying to sleep as it would generate ice / guests needing ice at 3 am?...)- The hotel requires some new sound proofing for outside noise (dumpster, walking traffic, ice machine and other hotel guests)- Not a ton of variety for the Breakfast options for Gluten-free (fruit only), tons of cake and muffins though (so ok if you have kids) If you're looking for a budget-friendly hotel on Waikiki Beach, the Aston Waikiki Beach is probably a really good option. The pool / breakfast area would be great for people with kids. However, we found ourselves wanting to leave Waikiki for the slower more local experience of the North Shore, and other parts of the island. Reality is, who travels to somewhere like Hawaii and stays in the Hotel the ENTIRE time??... all in all - I would rate our experience as Average. It was a place to leave our clothes and lay our heads after a great day in Honolulu.

At first I was thrilled at the location and upon check-in we got upgraded (to Ocean view)... From there it went downhill.The "high tech" elevators are terrible and seem to leave people waiting longer than it should really take. The first day "breakfast" was the worst selection of food I have every seen. The rooms are small and shower is meant for little people (at 5'-8 I had to bend down).If all you care about is location and a bed then this is your choice...If not I would look elsewhere.

This is a pretty decent property in the heart of the action of Waikiki. It's very busy because all the "transfers" for your excursions will depart from this hotel. It's across the street from the beach, which is nice. The homeless are everywhere, sleeping on the street, on the benches at the beach......it made it difficult and very sad to have to see day after day. The rooms are small as are the "patios". Barely enough room for 2 ppl.! We couldn't leave the patio door open (with our ocean view room) because the traffic was so very loud and the smell of the exhaust would travel all the way up to our room!The tiki bar was always fun and the service was great! We only had the "free breakfast" once because whatever time of the morning it happened to be....there were always long lines of people. So we chose to eat breakfast elsewhere. You can still get a good breakfast for $6 if you walk down the street a couple of blocks!The pool area is pretty decent although a lot of our time in Waikiki....it rained! :( so there wasn't a lot of "pool time"! While in Waikiki we always take the sunset cruise on the Mai Tai. The crew is fantastic and the views are spectacular! I always book my excursions with LORI JAY at www.tombarefoots.com She's the best and can answer any possible question you might have!!Although the International Market Place has closed, there is still "Dukes Place" which is a small market that has some pretty good stuff at decent prices, BUT if you happen to be able to get to the flea market....go! Lots and lots of good deals on great stuff! Pearls, pearls, pearls! You can get a great string of pearls at a great price.This was my 6th trip to Waikiki and not sure I will go back. The traffic and the noise are so intense. It reminds me a lot of Vegas....only it's surrounded by water!

The location is ideal to this hotel - across the street from the ocean. However, a waste of your money. The restaurant, Tiki, played loud music until 11pm and even with slider shut, we could hear it. They only had 1 roll of toilet paper, ran out while there. No replacement. Bathrooms are equivilant to a Motel 6. Bedding uncomfortable, only 3 pillows for a king bed and they were flat as a pancake. We had the "upgrade" ocean front room...nothing to write home about. Staff at breakfast was rude, not helpful. Even to use the computer to print business paperwork, it cost $5.00! At first, the computer wouldn't take my payment and I couldn't get on the internet at all. I asked the front desk for help, but it's a 3rd party company that runs the computers and I had to use a courtesy phone to ask for help. Nothing at all spectacular about this property.

Wonderful establishment. This is my second trip to hawaii, my mothers first. We booked this hotel for the great price and location. We loved it! We had an ocean view room, with a great view to diamond head and of the beach. The rooms were very spacious, with two double beds, television, bar fridge and plenty of cupboard space for luggage. Bathroom was comfortable and roomy, with a bath!We love the breakfast each morning- you get supplied with a little cooler bag to fill with items such as fruit, yoghurt, baked goods, cereals and can eat around the pool or go across to the beach (a literally 30 second walk). All the staff were helpful and attentive and we would definantly recommend the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel!

I ponied up for the Beachfront room which was nice. Location of hotel is down on the zoo side of Waikiki, right across the street from the beach where the "wall" is that breaks the waves. Great for those of you with little kids to swim in. A few yards beyond is a different beach either direction where you can boogie board, surf, watch kids jump off the pier and beach volleyball. Tons going on along the main street along the beach in Waikiki. Choose Honolulu knowing it is a city with noise and homeless people but lots of people and things to do. Hotel pool has no sun until the afternoon, but the beach is so close.... Breakfast is by the pool each morning, no charge with lots of standard carbs and fruit. Omletes ($7), waffles for an extra charge made on the spot. They give you a clever little six pack type cooler to fill up to eat in your room or on the beach since seating is scarce by the pool. Cleaning staff was good, most all staff was friendly. Room was fine but seemed to be an all or nothing affair with the AC. A bit loud with no AC and the patio door open if the random emergency vehicle goes by. Wish they had two chairs on our lanai, seemed most had one. A couple of annoying smokers next door on their lanai and they were loud, too.Over-all good place for the price. You can walk everywhere around Waikiki and shuttles stop right there to go elsewhere.I'd stay there again.

Everything you want in Waikiki is in walking distance and the Hyatt is 100 feet away from the front door. The location of this hotel makes up for average quality of the rooms. My room was clean, although stuffy untill I open the patio door. This hotel is located as close to the beach as is physically possible without being a resort on the beach. Our room was just over $100 a night as we upgraded to an ocean view room with a balcony. It was arguably the best view I have ever had in a hotel and was worth the $20 increase in price. The room itself was average if not below. The beds are Asian style which means they are stiff in nature. At first I was impressed as it looked as if the room and bathroom had been modernized, especially the bathroom with artificially stressed furniture. It was only after closer inspection that I realized it was old distressed furniture. The big giveaway was the rusted hinges on the bathroom door. This room was also very small. There was no desk and the chair had to double as a stand for my suitcase. The room itself is done in the Asian motif and has tiled floors. I am glad I brought slippers. There is no microwave but does have a fridge. Wifi is extra unless you are in the cramped lobby. The fitness room is an extra $15, (in this day and age who charges for wifi and fitness rooms). It has old school air conditioning that was noisy. It is located on the main drag so traffic is loud, however you can walk everywhere at anytime of the day and night.All the being said the front desk staff was awesome and the view was killer. Free newspapers are always a nice treat. In the middle of the night I turned off the air conditioner and listened to the surf. It was awesome. Only the birds in the tree across the road o the beach broke the tranquility. The view itself was worth the money. On an overcast rainy day I sat, drank wine and watched the beach and surfers, it was awesome. I had a great stay in an average room because of the location. My money was well spent.From the airport take the shuttle, return for two people is about $55. If you have more than two take a cab. Ask for a room on floor nine or above because there is a huge tree in front of the hotel and you will not have a view unless you are above the tree. Rooms at the back with a balcony face another hotel’s back wall so be aware. You are not allowed to smoke on the property but sometimes people will smoke on their balcony…..bad people. I would stay there again.Randy

Great little hotel right in the thick of Waikiki! Great atmosphere in and around the hotel, very good restaurant on the first floor of the hotel 'Tikki's' really really good food and cocktails, great vibe at night too!As for the rooms I had no complaints sweet little rooms, exactly what you needed. Comfortable beds and I liked the Hawaiian theme throughout all kept very very clean. I have no complaints about this hotel. A great price to be right on the front, I enjoyed every minute of being here! A dream come true... also honestly one of the nicest zoos I have been to just around the corner, well worth a visit!

Upon arrival, we thought we'd arrived at a holiday camp (a rather British institution). The hotel is in need of reviving being very tired in appearance. Our room was on the 24th floor, with a splendid view of the beach, and contained 2 large beds, a small (precarious?) balcony and fridge. So well equipped.ANNOYINGLY, we had to pay an extra $18 "amenity" fee for wifi, dvd rental and continental breakfast, which was set out around the pool and for which we needed (supplied) cool bags. Seating was limited & uncomfortable. Car parking was an amazing $27 per day.Why can't these Hawaiian hotels just charge a rate for a room which includes everything?

When my husband and I checked in to this hotel for a one-week stay, the line to check in took a long time. Once at the counter, we had our id's/receipt in hand when it was our turn to check in. We pre-paid for a standard room with a king-sized bed. I asked the woman if our room was considered ocean view, to which she smiled and said, "Actually you've been upgraded to a partial ocean view!" We said thank you and were given a key and headed to the our room on the 8th floor. When we entered the room, it was nothing like the rooms advertised on the website, was entirely outdated and out the window was literally NO VIEW of the ocean. All we could see was the back of another building, a big dumpster and no view of anything remotely nice and there were two double beds. I was shocked they can call it a partial-ocean view. While we already waited to check in, I now had to go downstairs and get back in the long line, to wait to speak with any desk staff to try and get a room with one bed as was promised and written on the receipt. A nice young man at the desk was much more helpful.
