He listened to my reasons for being upset with the room and explained the following: a "standard" room really means any room from the 5-8th floor that does not have any remodeling, which is only on upstairs floors; he changed our room to a true partial-ocean view on the 5th floor right in-between the restaurant and the pool. It was a beautiful view of the part of the ocean we could see and was much better than the first room. Credit should be given to the cleaning staff as the room was very clean, and would look kind of icky no matter what because of it's age. Housekeeping was excellent and there were many painter's working throughout the day on other rooms on the floor. They tell you that you get 3 free Keurig K-cups with your room, but they don't give you the K-cups, just the machine. You get your little breakfast tote and breakfast between 0630 and 0900. If you get there too early, you will likely get the left over fruit from the day before and the fruit is mostly the same daily. You get yogurt, pre-packaged dry cereal if left, thankfully there's oatmeal, extremely greasy and cheap muffins/doughnuts and pastries daily and literally plain, wheat or purple sweet potato dinner buns. Yes, cheap dinner buns. There is a juice machine, good coffee-but always empty and people are searching for a somewhat-full pot, and miso (tofu) hot soup as an Asian breakfast staple a few times during the week. You pay extra if you want an omelet or a waffle. There is a solo musician who plays his guitar every morning during the breakfast hours while a young lady dances as he plays. The dancer would teach young children to dance and they looked like they love it. This was enjoyable, but extremely loud as the speakers were very near our room. It was enjoyable the first two days until we realized the exact same songs were played for all 8 breakfasts. The Tiki restaurant had great food (a little spendy-but normal for the Waikiki area), great staff and great managers that we met. The down side is that if your hotel room is on the restaurant side of the hotel, the music is so loud, it is loudly heard until late at night every night. Our room had a locked adjoining room which was very thin-walled and could hear regular talking voices next door. The two men that were assigned to the hotel towel and beach chair station were very kind and professional. The problem with the beach chairs is that they were all out by 10:00 a.m. most days - which obviously isn't the fault of the employees. The workout facility is small but has nice, working and clean equipment and clean towels. Check out was easy, but be ready for the additional daily fee that is almost equivalent to paying an additional night's stay. I wouldn't recommend this hotel other than the location of this hotel is great if your goal is to sit on the sands of Waikiki Beach most of the time. Wolfgang Puck's was very good and reasonably priced and there are many convenience stores nearby.

Staid here with my husband for 4 nights after a 7 day trip in Kona. This place is right on Waikiki. The location is perfect. Starbucks directly underneath :). Rooms were older, but remodeled and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Moved us to oceanfront on the 16th floor, even though I bought cheapest rate on Priceline. The pool is small, but who really cares if you are at waikiki? Overall, had a great stay. Don't be alarmed by negative comments on here. I was hesitant after reading them, but went ahead and booked it. BEYOND pleasantly surprised. Mahalo.

We stayed at this property Feb 1/82014. Our floor 25 was under renovation and contractors were all over during the day making noise. One call to the GM Mark all was corrected. Out AC died twice but was repaired very fast. The breakfast was nice but only Asian hot food. The pool was nice but does not get sun until 2. The location is perfect for the beach as the area in front of hotel is very nice. Valet parking worked very well as well. We eat three times at the Tiki bar and enjoyed that as well. Overall the hotel was fine but could use a general update. Thanks to Mark and all the staff for making our week enjoyable..

The location of this hotel just can't be beat. It is convenient to everything you might want to see in Waikiki and close to transit for travelling further afield. Yes, the rooms are dated, but ours was spotless and they were painting rooms on the floor we were on (20). The breakfast had a decent variety of cereal and fruit, but tended to be heavy on the sweet doughnut type pastries and cakey muffins. We had no real problem finding a place to sit around the pool and only once had to sit on lounge chairs. The bar and grill downstairs had great deals for happy hour and the food was good. The Wolfgang Puck restaurant down on the ground level had awesome food, huge portions and was definitely the best bang for your buck. The one thing I found very unsettling (though nothing to do with the hotel), was the vast number of homeless people sleeping on the cement sidewalks and road edges in the main tourist area of Waikiki.

Had a beautiful ocean view on floor 22. Room was just OK (bathroom was a little dinghy I thought). But, bed and pillows were very comfortable and nice size flat screen TV. Also, a good location, close to lots of shops and the beach. Pool was a little small, and the breakfast by the pool was a little odd...they give you lunch bags you take down for breakfast and put your food in (b/c they don't provide trays!). We didn't know the first morning, so we juggled the food around. But, they did have nice Hawaiian music and dancing during breakfast. Restaurants were good and workout room was adequate. Though this wasn't bad, I prefer Hilton Hawaiian Village (similar price point).

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days we stayed on the 17th floor and had an awesome view of the ocean. It is located right across the street from the beach. The staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was perfect, loved the Hawaiian donuts and the singer and hula dancer. Would definitely stay there again!

Over all a very nice hotel.Just across the road from the beach.We had a little trouble when we booked in at reception they said they had upgraded us to a bigger room with a sunset view.When we got to the room we found it was on the diamond head side which hasnt got a sunset view, the balcony was tiny and not enough room to even sit out side which i found a bit strange because we had booked a deluxe room which came with a large balcony .A little tip the other side of the hotel has a much better view, although diamond head is nice we where overlooking the A/C unit from the hotel next door.Rooms where quite good a little dated but clean and tidy. We complained and was told they would get back to us that evening which they didnt,so i went down in the morning and eventually got a room on the other side although we had to wait untill the afternoon.On the plus side we had free breakfast in the morning free wi fi in the room and free dvd and game rental also there is ps3 in the room which is great for the kids .All of which does,nt come with the Hilton or the Marriott which are just across the road and more expensive. They where redecorating when we where there but it did,nt impact on the stay at all.Its just one of those things that has to done.Parking is expensive but all valet parking in waikiki is. A little tip drop your cases off and head down the block just to the left of you at the end is the Waikiki Banyan they offer parking for $80 a week or $15 a day much cheaper.Breakfast was great a very nice cold selection and much as you want with live music and Hawaii dancing every morning. Tikkis bar and grill was great look out for Mike with the pony tail he was a fantastic waiter. live music every night there is a full restuarant and a bar .Didnt eat in the restuarant side it seemed a little expensive to me. We stayed in the bar and the food was fantastic.Try the lettuce wraps most meals where around $12. All in all a great place to stay.We did complain to the manager about the service at the beginning of the holiday and was told they would give us special rate the next time we stayed but we could have done without all the hasle after nearly 24 hrs on a plain.

Vacation at the Aston waikiki beach hotel was nice and relaxing. The beach is located so close to the hotel which makes it easily accessible. Must not forget to mention the view from the lanai. It was spectacular. Me and my wife stayed in the 8th floor in a deluxe ocean view room and the view was awesome. We can see the entire Waikiki strip. I would gladly stay in this hotel again if i visit Oahu in the future.

This hotel has a great spot on the beach. Right out in front is the most famous beach in the world with everything in walking distance. Hotel needs a little updating but it has all the right amenities to enjoy what you came for.

Yes as reviews mention, this is an older hotel and while the rooms themselves might not be 5star material the location and the view were worth every penny spent. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and the rooms were clean. Cleaning staff did an excellent job each day when making up the room. We booked an Ocean view select room and were on the 22 floor with spectacular views. We spent the majority of the time in the room out on the balcony. the location is absolutely perfect being at the quieter end of waikiki beach you could walk towards the zoo/diamondhead and it was quiet and peacful or walk towards the center of waikiki for shopping and nightlife. beach is directly across the street, it doesn't get much better than that. Will definitely go back to the Aston when we go back to Hawaii.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel with a group of friends in February. During our three night stay, the weather was fantastic, so we were able to really enjoy the full ocean view from the balcony of our 15th floor room. The location of this hotel is first class: right across the road from Waikiki Beach and within a short stroll of Waikiki shops, restaurants, cafes and bars.The room itself was cosy but clean, and tastefully redecorated. The bathroom was a little dated but immaculately clean. Service at the front desk was great. When we arrived, we were informed that we couldn't have the king bed we requested but instead they offered us two queen beds and a full ocean view instead of the partial ocean view we had booked. A fair deal. The breakfast offered a great assortment of fruit, yoghurt, juice, coffee and baked goods.I took advantage of the fitness centre and was very pleased to note that although small, it contained modern equipment and the air conditioning was set at an appropriate temperature. Finally, a few words about Tiki's Bar, which is probably the best hotel bar I have ever encountered. What a great spot. My friends and I took full advantage of the sweeping patio taking in great views of the beach and surrounding area alongside the daily drink specials. The food was fantastic, as well. Alongside Duke's, it would have to rate as one of the best watering holes in the area.The only facto preventing a five star rating for me is the price, which reflects the location and the price of other hotels in the area. It's not inexpensive, and for value for money rates 4/5 stars. I'd stay there again.

Great location with very nice view from room,very friendly and helpful stuff. we got our room upgrade to Ocean front. This hotel is actually at the end of Waikiki main street,next to Kapiolani Park,so need a bit walk to go shopping, but less people at the beach in front of hotel,

this is a bolder hotel but it was still clean and the security was very good. the staff was friendly and very helpful. the location was fantastic.....right across the street from the beach and close to eateries.

Hotel is well located, just across the street from Waikiki beach. Room was OK, but nothing special. Balcony had great view from upper floor(25), but it was always too windy to be out there.On site restaurants were good and not outrageously priced. Breakfast included, but limited to fruits and pastries.

Located over the road and onto the main Waikiki beach! Great beach location but a long walk (25 mins) or short bus /trolley to the huge shopping centre. Plenty of shops out on the street for groceries, takeaway, souvenirs ect . Hotel was a bit 'tired' but still good value. Pool smallish and basic. Small Fitness centre. Our ocean view room and balcony on 19 Floor, was good and a perfect place to watch the stunning sunsets. Room small to average size with x2 Dbl beds. NO Tea or Coffee making facilities but there was a Bar fridge. Ice machine we discovered near the lifts was a bonus. Breakfast included was basic, but fresh. AC worked well and not noisy.

We stayed at the Aston for 5 nights, we loved the hotel! Don't listen to the others, the breakfast and the elevators are great! Very friendly staff and great rooms! Location was awesome within walking distance of everything! We only had one problem and that was the buy one get one luau we were promised at booking and then didn't get it at check in.

The rooms facing diamond head have a standing balcony only. Rooms facing the other way look at another hotel , the pool & the beach. Their balcony could accommodate 2 chairs but there is only 1. The folks at the desk think that the pool side is better which is why they will tend to put you there. They convinced me to go poolside but I woke in the night and it was very noisy with the deliveries to the loading docks crashing below & the party noises. Plus you are staring into a zillion other hotel rooms. I couldn't take it and in the morning we changed rooms to the diamond head side with the standing balcony only. I think the view is hands down 100 times better, looking at the zoo, diamond head and the ocean. And the room is larger, accommodating a table & chairs in front of the slider. Much happier in this room. I think the view is higher than the neighboring hotel only on the top 2 or 3 floors. Beds were very comfy. No drawers or enclosed cabinetry in the bathroom or bedside tables. Makes it hard to keep neat & tidy. Other posters have said regarding breakfast that 1. you can only have one cup of coffee & 2. roommates have to go at the same time. Neither is true.

Just spent 7 days at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel. We had an ocean view. The rooms was nicely decorated. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast at the beach was nice would have like a couple more choices. Taro baked goods is a must! The hotel is nicely decorated and very clean. Tiki bar had a nice selection of food. It is located at the far end of Kalakaua ave. Walking distance to any shop or location you would want to be at. I lost my gold necklace at the hotel. Staff found it and got it back in my possession. I also became sick while there and staff provided me with information about medical care. I can't say enough about how nice this hotel is. The bath does need a little updating but over all excellent value for the price. The staff at the activities desk were very helpful answering questions and assisting in our vacationing needs. I will be returning to this hotel very soon.

This was my first time in Hawaii and I was super happy with the location and property. Loved the ability in the morning to take the breakfast cooler and a beach chair and head across to the beach to eat. Really loved the view every morning and ate on the balcony once just watching the ocean. The beds are comfortable, everything works, and ac outlets are readily accessible. Bathroom clean and good water pressure. I really didn't spend too much time in the rooms, but I definitely would not pass up the ocean view..... Pool area for the size is a bit small but geesh, who needs the pool, hello, the ocean is your perfect pool! Breakfast was perfect in my opinion with pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit...I love my bacon and eggs, but just doesn't fit when you are lounging island style.

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice. The first time was in Dec of 2011. We stayed for 8 nights, had an ocean front room and fell in love with the island. We ate our breakfast on our balcony every morning. The staff was always helpful and friendly. The views were spectacular and the close proximity to Waikiki beach made for a great beach vacation. We actually got engaged on the pier at Queen's surf beach. We came back in Feb 2013 for our honeymoon and we made a point to spend time at the Aston. Just like our first trip we stayed in an ocean front room. Again we encountered wonderful customer service. One of my favorite perks is the orange water that was put out every afternoon, sometimes it's the little things. We did notice that the rooms on the side of diamond head were much quieter than the rooms on the city side. We didn't hear any of the trolley bells the second time when we were on the corner near diamond head. I can't wait until we can come back for more visits!

This hotel was advertised as having breakfast buffet by the pool. It was prepackaged and Styrofoam. Doughnuts, bad coffee and a little bit of fruit is not breakfast. We were appalled by the amount of garbage it generated and the poor quality. Had it been optional ($23 per day) we might have considered staying there again and eating breakfast out but we won't be back.

I've been in Oahu twice and both times I stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Very good price for the quality and location. It's across the street from the beach and should check out Tiki's Grill & Bar for dinner. Highly recommended.

We stayed in a beachfront room. The view was outstanding! We would stay here again! We stayed here for 8 nights.The room was great, till we heard neighbors arrive. The rooms were all a joining rooms and the doors in between were paper thin. We could hear them talking, & giggling, & ?... And the hotel needs to adjust the room doors in hallways. They would slam all over place. I was being woken up all differ times in night by the doors. I know I'm a light sleeper, but really! but other people don't care about anyone else enjoying vacations but themselves.

We stayed here recently for a couple of nights. The hotel is big with the lobby on the ground floor and then reception on a floor above it with the pool and tour operators desks nearby. The lounge setup in the lobby is great and comfortable, but it was so busy that it was not a place you could go to for relaxing. Similarly, the pool area is quite small for the number of guests and seemed to be always crowded and busy. The hotel is in a great location opposite the beach and we found it easy to get around.The rooms were smaller than I had expected, but clean and comfortable.I was very disappointed to find out about the amenity fee when we arrived, but had breakfast been of any decent quality I guess I wouldn't have minded so much. As it was, breakfast is minimal, and we lined up each morning along with every other guest to get our allocation. Never did find anywhere to sit, so took it back to the room each day.It was also disappointing to find that we would have to pay a fee each day to use the safe in our room. I have never encountered this before.Overall, the hotel is fine, but has too much of a big concern for me. I would prefer a smaller more friendlty and personal experience.

Our ocean front room on the 15 th. floor was fabulous. Diamond Head to the left , Ocean in front and downtown Waikiki to the right. Fabulous views. We couldn't have asked for anything more beautiful. Tiki bar and grill was a great value, considering import pricing. Breakfast was lovely and convenient for those on the go with guided tours awaiting. Hotel staff very considerate and Knowlagable. With any question we had. From finding a certain church for services to how and where to catch public transportation to get to church and other places. They even knew the bus numbers to watch for. Looking forward to our next trip, hopefully next year,(2015). The neat touch was all the ABC stores. If you forgot anything they had it,( right around the corner). Every Where you looked.

l stayed for a week on vacation with my son.The location is great & across the road from the beach.Rooms were clean (Not large) & facilities were good & price to stay at hotel was very reasonable.My only minor disappointment was the hotel didn't have an outdoor spa next to pool.Breakfast was included & the room we had partial ocean views.l would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Nicely presented hotel in a good location if you love the beach!Some of the facilities are great such as the DVD machines which are included in your amenity fee as well as the WiFi.The breakfast is a little quirky and certainly doesn't offer a wide variety! It's essentially like taking a packed lunch but as a buffet breakfast which you are given a small bag to try and stuff as much in as you can, as you only get one chance each morning! Tiki bar and grill is expensive but it's not like there aren't plenty of other options; just go one street back from the beach and it's half the price :)We had a deluxe ocean view double room which was ok, the view was more of the next hotel than the beach, but you can get a good view from the balcony.Everyone from the hotel staff were all very helpful and the service overall was excellent!

We had room 1803, which gave us a west view from our balcony, and open air outside our front door (not a hallway) that gave a great view of Diamond Head. We didn't pay extra for the full ocean view, but that was just fine. The line for the free breakfasts was crazy, and it was the same stuff every day, which got old after a couple of days.

We paid for a partial ocean view room and ended up with a 3/4 view of the ocean! We were on the 21st floor and it was beautiful!The hotel is clean, the beds were reasonably comfortable and the access to the beach is great. The rooms and beds are very small however and some of the rooms have shower "issues". Broken shower heads, tub won't drain, stuff like that. We felt the price was reasonable and had a pleasant time.

There's not much new I can say about this property since we always stay here, but I want to make sure to mention the always fantastic service. Prices are consistently going up all over Waikiki beach. We were here over 5 nights/6 days during Pro Bowl (hence the prices). The stay was as to be expected, no issues and the one thing we thought may be a slight issue (at Tiki's) was handled in a way that left me feeling valued as a guest and customer.Thanks again Aston & Tiki's from Eric, Sandy and the Las Vegas gang!

Good sized rooms, very clean with friendly and helpful staff. Slightly confusing elevator set up but you manage! Was really disappointed with the breakfast as it only runs from 6.30am till 9am and the lines are huge. Plus there is very limited seating available which meant we sat on the ground beside the pool to eat. The pool itself is average - an uninspiring concrete hole, again with very few day beds, we didn't use it once. Gym is tiny and dingy. I feel like the hotel's facilities can't really cater for the huge amount of people it sleeps. Great location opposite the beach and right near shops and restaurants though. All up, it's an average hotel, but we did enjoy ourselves. Probably would increase my budget next time to stay somewhere a little nicer though.

Only stayed one night at this hotel (last night on the island) and upgraded to an oceanfront room. Recently updated decor in the bedroom, cute table and chairs (stool type) set by the sliding glass door to the lanai. This room had a Keurig coffee maker and a mini-fridge which was very nice. The bathroom could really use a makeover. Shower head was very low, even for me...I'm 5'3", can't imagine a 6' person taking a shower in there. The breakfast, included in the "resort fee" of $25 was ok. Not much protein, but you can add an omelette for an additional $8. Make sure you check your bill at the end of the stay. They overcharged me $40, but were great about clearing it up.The view on the oceanfront was worth the extra $$$$.

This was our second time staying at this hotel. We booked an ocean front--same as last time--and it was a wonderful view of Diamondhead and the beach. We really like the location of this property.What we don't like is the inconvenience of the room itself. A previous reviewer put it well--the room is large enough, but there is nothing to make you comfortable in the room. Shallow drawers, no chair or sofa, no drawers in the nightstand, bizarre hanging beads serving as closet doors. The bathroom is terribly inconvenient. A previous reviewer said there wasn't enough shelf space--our bathroom had zero shelf space. You had to keep your toiletries in the other room. Why not put some kind of shelf in there? They even put the hairdryer in the closet because there is no place for it in the bathroom.We had booked in October and the resort fee was only $18 then, so that is what we paid, but it is now $23 per day. The breakfast is okay, but I would prefer they stop the breakfast and lower the resort fee.We like the elevator system very much. No stopping at every floor!Ate once at Tiki's on the property--great views, but a weird menu IMO. There is a Wolfgang Puck Express downstairs that we thought was very good.

Great location, but hotel is old and needs a lot of updates. Parking is valet at a nearby hotel, and they charge $22 per night not including tip. Be sure to get your parking ticket before going to the valet (good luck, no parking near the hotel), when we pulled into the parking garage, they informed us we were at the wrong hotel, and directed us back our hotel only to have to return 15 minutes later to park. Huge hassle based on the traffic. Hotel is convenient for touring Waikiki on foot, but being located on the main is very loud and difficult to navigate at times.

Small rooms and the pool is in the shade most of the day in winter which detracts from a great location and a clean and secure property. Took a little while longer to get the car from the valet than I would like, 20-25 minutes once. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms clean but a little dated. Walk across the street to Waikiki beach, or go downstairs to Wolfgang Puck Express for a meal. Everything is nearby, and many tour companies stop at this location for easy travel around the city. Beware of music beginning at 7AM from the patio area, the soundproofing in the room is not sufficient to keep you from waking up to the music.

I have been to Waikiki several times on business and have found the entire place very overpriced. We found a reasonable (for Waikiki) rate at the Aston and decided to stay for five nights. The good.....I liked the location of the property. It is directly across the street from a mellow beach with a protected swimming area. Great for small children or early morning lap swimmers. This hotel is at the end of the madness on Kalakaua Ave. (main beachfront street in Waikiki) I liked taking my morning run past the park, towards Diamond Head without having having to weave through crowds of people. The not so good.....Very unimpressed with the condition of the room. Stains on the ceilings, spots on the walls, beat up tiles and doors in the bathroom, and old fixtures did not lend itself to feeling as if the room was clean. The mildew smell in the bathroom from the lack ventilation was very unappealing. The pillows were flat. I could live with a small room if the space was utilized better however I found the bathroom did not have adequate counter space. The room itself was NOISY! We were on the 19th floor, facing the ocean. Every morning, on top of the street noise there was a man crooning Hawaiian tunes and a crowd of people clapping away. Forget sleeping past 7:30. At night you could hear people whooping it up at the bar. Sorry if I sound grumpy but I haven't slept well in five days.The continental breakfast was average but swarms of pushy people was a turn off. You can pay too much for cooked eggs if you so desire. The take away cooler was nice but we didn't use it for breakfast on the beach. There is a Starbucks around the corner if you prefer better coffee and oatmeal or an egg sandwich. Just past Starbucks is another little place that makes wraps and other healthier options. Overall, I would not choose to stay here again. I really liked being on the end of Waikiki so I would stay in the neighborhood. We are longtime Hyatt and Marriott patrons. The Hyatt Place is one block away and Marriott next door. I would have much preferred one of those properties if we were not traveling on a work budget.

Literally a walk of a few seconds to the beachBreakfast service was great.Standard Quad Room was average, though lacking coffee facilities, which was disappointing.Staff were polite. They even gave us a room upgrade to partial ocean view.Though it is definitely not worth 340+ dollars a night

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki beach in a room with two double beds. The beds felt smaller than a UK double and it was a very tight fit in the room. Difficult for families with children to fit you all in and your suitcases.We stayed on the 14th floor, the view from the balcony was lovely over Waikiki. I would definitely recommend booking a high floor room for that. Before flying to the island of O'ahu we had been staying on Maui, which in my opinion is a much nicer island. This probably unfairly marred our opinion of the Aston and surrounding area as they are very much different.The hotel has a good location, the beach is across the road and on the main stretch of shops and restaurants. We were surprised by the amount of homeless people in very close proximity to the hotel, although they don't pester you for money and keep themselves to themselves.The breakfasts in our opinion were extremely disappointing, however I would recommend a visit to the Tiki restaurant for dinner, the food there was lovely and a great atmosphere.

Husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. While the location and views were outstanding, the hotel rates just average on everything else.Check-in went smoothly. While the service was not bad, it definitely felt like this place does a TON of business and we were just another reservation. I had done a lot of research and was expecting the extra resort fee and advanced elevator system, so no surprises there. I had reserved an oceanfront room and requested a king bed in a quiet location. We were given a corner room on the 8th floor, with a view from Diamond Head to the other end of Waikiki Beach. It was fabulous.What was not fabulous was the room itself. It was not small, but definitely lacked creature comforts. The only place to sit was on the bed itself or two little barstools. There was no chair, no recliner, no couch, but room for any of them. For an oceanfront room, I also felt the lanai was very small. There was only one chair and footstool provided. The first day in the room I ended up taking a beach chair (your typical camping-style chair) and putting it on the lanai. The other days we moved the bar stools out and sat on them. We rented the oceanfront room because we're not really water-people, but wanted to enjoy the beach. There was a noisy refrigerator and a dresser with four small drawers. A safe was located in the closet. There was no coffee maker, no laundry bags, no folder outlining the services at the hotel (like TV channels, etc.) or transportation options. It almost felt as if they were forcing us to go outside and spend money. Luckily, there was not much noise from the neighbors, but the street outside the room was very noisy, as was the constant group of homeless people loitering on the street in front. (At least they were good entertainment!) The paint was chipping in places and the bathroom was very dated, but we expected an older hotel so weren't bothered by it. Housekeeping was okay. We found quite a bit of dust and lots of handprints on the sliding door. Another oddity was that the sliding door did not open completely--only about halfway due to a stopper. We weren't sure if it was a safety issue, but it was definitely annoying.We never used the pool, but didn't really see the need. There were a lot of rules--no water toys, no splashing, no jumping, no yelling. I get it, especially since the check-in desk was right next to the pool and the kids' beach just across the street. But, it simply looked like a gigantic soaking pool--quite boring. During our 4-day stay, I saw maybe a handful of people actually using it.Breakfast was adequate. We enjoyed the fruit, yogurt, and local-made Hawaiian donuts. The pastries were definitely stale the first day we tried it, so I'm not sure what their delivery schedule was. The donuts always seemed fresh, though. Never tried the pancakes or omelets because we didn't want to pay extra. We did bring our own travel mugs for coffee--the cups they provided were itty-bitty. I'm an early-riser when I'm on vacation, so made it down while things were relatively quiet. However, at about 8:30am, the area was pretty frenetic.Location was great. It was within walking distance of all major Waikiki attractions. We walked to Ala Moana Center one day--about 2.5 miles, but an easy stroll with lots of fun people to watch. The Honolulu Zoo was right next door. There are quite a few restaurants within a few blocks. (Tiki's and Lulu's were alright--their premium prices are likely for the location and popularity with locals.) Luxury row was just a few blocks down. Note that Honolulu is currently having issues with the scores of homeless people sleeping on the streets. The corner of Kalakaua and Kapahulu is a gathering place for the vagrants. While I can't fault the hotel or restaurants for this, the aggressiveness and drunkenness of these people made us feel very uncomfortable. I found myself avoiding the businesses located on that corner--which is bad! Tucker and Bevvy's had great healthy options! Also note that many transportation options stop at this hotel, including the Hilo Hattie's shuttle (free wheels to Ala Moana!), Japanese tour companies, and city bus.All in all, it was not our favorite spot to stay in Honolulu, but can see how it may be more popular with families, young, single travelers, or foreign visitors. We prefer the quieter, opposite end of Waikiki.

We enjoyed our stay. It was our honeymoon.Our only feedback would be to improve on the breakfast and some minor maintenance in the room.Other feedback that I would add would not be related to the hotel is that the homeless population is a problem, begging for alcohol and drug money, sleeping in the parks on the streets and beach.I even noticed someone defecating on the beach early one morning - We did not visit that section of the beach again!!

I have been to Hawaii 4 times and stayed at the Sheraton and Moana Surfrider but found the Aston Waikiki Beach to be great value for money. the resort fees that you pay at all hotels do not always include breakfast and unlimited free dvd to watch in your room but this is included at the Aston. the rooms are clean and well maintained and the bed was very comfortable not to mention the view from my room was breathtaking. the staff were all very helpful and were happy to answer any questions that i had. the beach is easy to access directly across the road and is not that crowded. i will be recommending the Aston Waikiki Beach to all my friends and family in the future... Anna d...

Stayed in a standard room with two full size bed. If they only spent $200 that would be an improvement. The bed sheets had holes, shower curtain and grout lines were dirty. There was also a leak in the shower. It currently looks like they hired a bum off the streets and let him fix the bathroom.Breakfast is just ok for the daily amenity fee of $23.Next time I will spend a little more to stay somewhere else.

With breakfast included this place was a bargin, even if we ate most breakfasts at the nearby Lulu's instead. The room was small but the location was walking distance to so much. I usually stay in a more secluded hotel in Oahu but this hotel worked out fine.

My family of 4 stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel from January 11 to January 17. We arrived late at night and had no problem with check-in. We left early morning and had no problems with check-outWe booked through Travelocity and were aware of the amenity fee of 18$ before we booked. We did notice that the fee had increased after we booked but we were still honored the original fee price. The hotel is located on the East end of Waikiki Beach, very close to the zoo(across the street) and also directly across the street from the lagoon (walled off) portion of the beach, which is much nicer for our small kids to swim. We did not rent a car for this trip. There are trolley and city bus stops right outside or within a block of the hotel that can take you everywhere. We prebooked a taxi to take us to and from the airport for a flat rate fee of 29 each way. We stayed in a deluxe ocean view room #1823. The view from our balcony had some of everything. We could see the ocean, beach, city, and even glimpses of the mountains between hotels to the north. We were very happy with the view. The balcony is not huge, and only had one lounge chair to sit in. The rooms themselves are not very big but when we go on vacation we are not there to spend time in the rooms! We all found the beds to be really comfortable. Even my daughter slept thru the night which she never does at home! Our room did not have a coffee maker which was fine as Starbucks is just a few steps from the hotel. There was a little table with 2 barstool style chairs. Also a nice sized TV for the room and a playstation 3. There was a dresser which was big enough to fit my clothes, as well as both my kids clothes, but not my wife's, so she was the parent who lived out of a suitcase for this trip. There is also a closet and in-room safe. One downside to the room was that some of the outlets did not work, but we just took turns charging our devices. There was a small fridge in our room that was perfect for holding any breakfast items that we wanted to save for a snack. There was also 4 drinking glasses that were changed as we used them by the cleaning staff. The bathroom was not huge but served its purpose. Tub/shower combo and the water pressure was absolutely awesome! I miss it! There was lots of hot water. One thing about the hot showers was the steam would make everything in the bathroom damp, and the fan was or did not seem to be existent or working very well in there. Our room was cleaned daily by very friendly room staff. We would come back from our daily adventures to nicely made beds. Our towels were changed daily even if we hung them up( a card asked us to hang them up to save them so as to conserve energy). Fine by us, but what's the point of the card? Our bathroom soaps, shampoo etc were restocked as we used them up, which was nice. We did bring our own just in case. The breakfasts included daily with your amenity fee were decent. There was muffins, danishes, pastries, cookies, fruit salad, juice, pop(for breakfast!) and coffee and tea. Also included which we ate a lot of was yoghurt of different varieties, some were not sealed properly when I opened them and had to be tossed, which was too bad. Everyday there was also a different Asian type of breakfast, either noodles or rice balls with a side of either kimchee(yummy) beans, or greens. I think our favorite breakfast item was the malasadas. 3-4 different varieties that were actually pretty good. We started calling my son Mr Malasada because he ate so many. We were given one bag to fill up with breakfast items. Seeing as we had 4 in our group this didn't seem enough. We just had to ask the breakfast supervisor at entry to the station and we were given an extra bag, no hassle. Instead of jockeying for a limited table we just ate up in our room. A note, breakfast opens at 630AM. If you want to be one of the first thri the line you should get there at least 10 mins early. The line got long otherwise but did move quickly. Items (especially the malasadas!) were restocked pretty quick which was nice. The elevators were NOT a problem at all. Pass your room key in front of the sensor. Type in your floor. Done. I think the longest we waited for one of the 5 elevators was 30 seconds. The DVD rentals included in the amenity few were a nice touch. However, a lot of the discs are scratched up and the movies would skip on the Playstation 3 BlueRay player. Other times the movies would not even work, such as The Hobbit. I think thought this was due to the movie being a DVD and not a BlueRay but other DVDs worked fine. The game rentals only worked if it was a PS3 game. If all the rentals were PS3 or BlueRays this problem could be averted in the future. Wifi (also included in the fee) worked well as long as you were in your room. If you went onto your balcony it stopped working. There was wifi available in the lobby area but I never used it. The pool was located next to the lobby. It is in a shady part of the hotel during the morning and early afternoon. The sun shines after that. The water is cool which is nice during the sunny afternoon but not so nice before that! You can borrow beach towels and beach chairs (number of chairs is limited) which is included in the amenity fee. All in all I was extremely happy with my families stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We all agreed it was a great location and the room was perfect for our needs. Should we make our way to Waikiki again we would definitely consider this Hotel.

It's not worth the value I paid. The rooms are not soundproof - you can clearly hear neighbours TVs and slamming of doors. Bathrooms are extremely small and the shower is in a bathtub with outdated handheld shower head. There is a mandatory charge of approx $20 per room for breakfast. The breakfast consists of basic continental cereal breakfast. It is very crowded as there is no seating area. So the hotel provides a brekafast bag, only one per room, for you to grab your breakfast to place in your bag to eat elsewhere. There is music playing all day from 7:30am - 11pm. So if your room is withinf several floors of the 3rd floor (pool area /band) you will be hearing music non stop all day long, which was the case for us. We have stayed just down the street at Hyatt Place for less and it is modern, extremely clean, variety of breakfast choices and seating, rooms are nice and clean and sound proof. Will not be coming back to Aston.

Our previous Hawaii trips included accommodation at The Hilton and The Marriott. These were more expensive hotels and we discovered The Aston Waikiki Beach was better value for money. It has a brilliant location, wifi and breakfast daily were included in the resort fee. Great location, we booked an ocean view room but were upgraded to a beachfront room - Cheers for that :) The beach is directly across the road, Honolulu zoo is metres away, Tiki's is a great restaurant and the bar area is fun and friendly. There is always entertainment in the pool/bar area, even at breakfast. Public transport close. We have definitely found a great value for money hotel. Older style but clean and sufficient. Will stay again. Thankyou from 3 happy Aussies, Heidi, Joe and Debi.

We made the reservations at the Aston Waikiki Beach through Priceline. On checkin we were surprised to find that there is a compulsory $18 Amenity Fee covering "Buffet Breakfast" and video rentals. Despite the fact that we had not planned to eat breakfast at the hotel nor any intention to rent dvd's, it sounded reasonable. That is, until we saw what the Aston calls Buffet Breakfast. This is what I imagine a breakfast at a correctional institution looks like. As poor as the food was, worse was the fact that there is no place to eat it. Grotesque! Everywhere in Hawaii you see great concern for the environment. Not at the Aston! The "breakfast" is served in numerous small styrofoam containers that will stay around long after we are gone.The rooms are dated but ok. The front desk staff was not very friendly. The room safe did not work and the air conditioning could be turned on or off. I couldn't control the temperature or fan. The ice machine outside the room added excitement to the noises of the night. The two good things are the location right on Waikiki Beach and the cleaning staff that were very friendly and did a great job. If you decide to book the Aston Waikiki Beach because of the price, make sure to come with no expectations! And oh yes, add $18 to the price you thought you were going to pay.

Just returned from four nights at the Aston Beach. Here's our thoughts on the hotel and the area:LOCATION:The hotel is nicely situated toward the end of the Waikiki resort corridor. It's right next to the zoo and within a long walk to Diamond Head. We liked that it was directly across from the beach with only a short walk across the street to get there. You can check out towels and folding chairs to take to the beach at the hotel pool. FOOD:The breakfast is better than most hotel free breakfasts. It's just the basics - cereal, fruit, coffee, juice, yogurt and some very good doughnuts and pastries. There is also some Asian fare for those who want something different. They also make fresh omelets and french toast for $7.00 and $5.00. We never had the french toast but the omelets were great and the large enough for my wife and I to split. It came with toast too. It thought it was a bargain considering the area. They give you a small cooler bag to take your breakfast to go.The food at the Tiki's was very good as well. Be sure to go to happy hour. They have a good selection of well drinks and beers for $3.00! Again, a bargain for Waikiki!We also ate at the Wolfgang Puck Express on the ground floor. Also very good with restaurant quality food and big portions.There are lots of other choices within walking distance. We ate at the Farmer's Market at King's Village. It is on Mon. Wed. Fri. & Sat.ROOM:It's an older hotel that had a remodel some time ago. It's a basic hotel room. It is not the Four Seasons but for the price point it was fine. Clean, good towels, good water pressure, lots of hot water and a beautiful view. Didn't need much more!! Hint: There's a small table and stools in the room. They just fit through the sliding door for meals on the balcony overlooking the ocean!STAFF:We had an issue with our reservation upon arrival. They said the company we had booked with had booked two rooms instead of one. We were initially told we would have to resolve the problem ourselves or we could be double charged. It's not really what I wanted to here at the beginning of our vacation. However, the supervisor Nicole took the reigns and got it straightened out within an hour. Also, the first room we were assigned was too cold and the thermostat wouldn't work. We let Nicole know while she was solving our first problem and she quickly moved us to another room. Kudos to Nicole for stepping up and making sure we were happy! The rest of the staff was always friendly, helpful and smiling.Not sure where all of the unsatisfactory reviews are coming from. The hotel met or exceeded our every expectation for a hotel in a reasonable price range. We would definitely recommend and stay there again!

The service was great and the hotel was in nice condition. Security is great at this hotel. The staff is great and willing to answer any questions you may have. Thr breakfast is the best I have had at a hotel. The views from the ocean view rooms are great.

I am so sorry and I understand it may be for the safety of their guests but I found the elevator system horrendous.Now the day I checked it I asked the front desk Jon I think was his name “what are my nightly fees”? he said $28.00 day of checkout I get my bill and in addition to $28.00 I was charged $18.00 plus. I called the front desk who can’t speak since “manager is not on sight” I was upset. Please understand the $18.00 a night is not the problem, besides I know I am in Hawaii is the FACT that I specifically asked and was deceived. That’s what bothers me. Other than that I can’t tell you anything about the breakfast never even went downstairs saw the pool only at check in, that morning I got my checkout bill I left before 8:00 a.m. did not want to be there one more minute, and no I was not leaving the island. I had reservations at another location. Will I recommend this place, not even to those I don’t like. Besides location not much going for this place.

Front desk employees were cold and rude both upon arrival and departure. The room was acceptable but the service was the worst imaginable. We had two paper cups for coffee on Day 1. On day 2 when we asked for new cups, we had to pay for them, even though we paid the $18 day amenities fees. Beware of the hidden costs of this hotel. The same went for soap or shampoo. You get on crack at breakfast and if two people occupy the room, then both must appear at the same time. This hotel should be renamed, Nickel and Dime Hotel, because that's what they tried to do to us. There are so many other hotels on Waikiki that if you choose this hotel then I would have to assume that you do not know the difference between getting services that you paid for and lousy service. I would guess that the only people who would want to stay at this hotel would be those who do not ready English. If you want a rotten hotel experience, pick this one.

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a 11 day hawaii trip. We moved over here due to other hotel (aston waikiki circle) being booked up. We got a full ocean front room on 19th floor. Ended up being a corner room with an amazing view. Room was huge. Only downside that the mini fridge is not restocked daily. We really enjoyed our stay here. Snorkeled right off beach in front of hotel. Tiki's was very enjoyable for a bite to eat with a cocktail. Hotel staff was very helpful and was within walking distance of everything. Ocean front is a must here!!!!

Arrived after 9pm and my ocean view room booking was disappointing. I instead had a full view of the next building as can be seen from the attached pictures. I didnt book a 'partial ocean view' room as I thought my wife would want the full thing. Management told me what I had was an ocean view. My uncle arrived at 6am before me and had a similar arguement for an hour. My dad's room... similar story. They both paid $75 and got an upgrade and somehow the hotel was full when I arrived??I booked through the Aston website and all attached pictures are from today (Jan 11, 2014) The pool area is nice, room is clean, yada yada, my Japanese wife likes the rice balls, miso soup at breakfastMy booking from last month shows a $18 amenity fee and I'm being charged $23. Tip: I avoided the valet parking fee and got parking at the Waikiki Banyan for $80 a week (cash only). They have a website, but basically, turn right out of the hotel lobby area, first left onto Kuhio Ave, & right away turn right into the parking lot. About a 5 minute walking detour as most free parking spots are on the 4th level.

We had a great time at our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach. The view of the beach is amazing and the service was really friendly and charming. There are a number of restaurants and bars in the area, and the hotel bar (Tiki's) turned out to be really good. There is live music with breakfast and in the evening. Also it is on the south side of Waikiki beach which is much less crowded.
user_name:
mrharb
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel room itself was ok, but the bathroom was too small and I'm not a fan of the "shower in the bat-tub" solution with shower curtain. The breakfast is not recommended - give it a miss. The hotel encourages you to enjoy your breakfast at the beach, and small wonder as there is no designated breakfast area and everyone has to eat in the pool area. There are not enough tables and chairs there so most people eat their breakfast on the sun chairs. All cutlery are plastic one-off and all plates/cups are styrofoam. All in all the hotel is ok, but not better than average.

The hotel is an average 3 star hotel. It was priced right and in a good location. It is at the end of the Waikiki beach strip directly across the crowded city beach. Good for shopping and going on tours in Honolulu. Our family of 4 had a room with 2 double beds. We found that the double beds are too small for 2 average people. The elevator system activated by the room card was incredible. The hotel staff members were nice. A small pool is right next to the check in desk, so there was a lot of traffic and noise at the pool. “Breakfast on the beach” is good. If you are looking for a nice relaxing beach vacation, avoid Waikiki and go to Maui. You will not regret it.

We do alot of traveling on vacations. I never wrote a reveiw an any place we have everstayed.I read a lot of reveiws before I stayed here and we almost did not stay here because of some of the reveiws. we just left there 01/06/2014 with a 6 day stay.we stayed on the 8th floor with a water front room we loved it great location for the beach,food and shopping.the hotel has been newly redone. looks great. great service and rooms.would highly recomend this hotel and I am a picky person of where we stay.

The Aston is a lovely hotel in a beautiful location. We booked our flights and hotel through Expedia. After we had booked and paid for the trip I accidentally stumbled on some fine print explaining that there is a mandatory $23 per room, per day amenity fee plus tax.This meant that we had to find an extra $650.00 for the two rooms we had booked. I cannot understand why on earth this 'fee' would not simply be added to the room fee and paid for upfront. I felt that this was misleading and a nasty surprise.The hotel however, was just fine!

my 14yo son and I stayed here from Xmas Eve thru to New Yrs Eve and I'd happily stay there again..we had a room on the 19th floor with deck facing the water and the view itself made the stay worthwhile. Room facilities however were basic in terms of having anything in the room- no electric jug or even cups.. 2 glasses only...coffee machine but after 2 drinks, have to purchase more from downstairs.. the breakfast which was included in the extra facility charge daily that also allowed wifi access in the bedrooms was same each day and altho included nice fruit salad, the same cereals, and muffins greeted you every day..and my son not liking fruit, meant regular extra chrges for him to eat a good breakfast. Tiki Restaurant and Bar in the same building provide excellent meals. basic gym there but at least did have swiss balls. Pool very basic but then the Beach just across the road and I was standup paddling every day... and on xmas day that included being inside a pod of dolphins and turtle right next to me for half hour! magic!!

Made a stop in Hawaii on our return trip to Ohio from Australia. Stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel and after all the great Hotels our agent had booked for us down under, we were very disappointed. Room was small and the area in general needed a good updating. The advertised breakfast on the beach was some raisin bran and fruit with a good deal of bread on the side. None of it was very good and the seating, which was poolside, was limited to most by sitting on lounges with your breakfast in your lap. Honolulu also needed to do something about the homeless sleeping on the sidewalks around the hotel and parks. Pool did not get sun until 2:30 in the afternoon this time year. I'm not a snob and I know I sound a bit harsh, but I just am calling it as we experienced it.

Selected from previous tripadvisor reviews (in future only credit the bad ones) and with an internet booking showing. "Final" price only to have the confirmation disclose an extra $18 "service" charge (jacked up to $23 on non-cancel label check in). Third level reception area offered no apparent kerbside baggage assistance with poor signage to reception. Understaffed desk caused extended check in wait amidst the chaos of a shabby and noisy pool area. Malfunctioning door locks required three changes of keys in the first three hours. The room was at the end of a corridor modelled on cell block H but for the carpet which was clearly patterned to both induce nausea and conceal the consequential stains. The corridor smelled of stale fast food. The "upgraded" room was small; no room to manage two long haul suitcases. No amenities. No ice. No in-room tea or coffee facilities; shabby and a little grubby, not to mention very outdated. The air con was wholly ineffective, which was ok because it's noise would anyway have precluded sleep. The necessary open window allowed the raucous street noise to drown the soothing surf- but only until 4.00 am and after 5.00 am. Get me out of here!

This is hands down the best place to stay on Waikiki Beach. My family and I had a room on the 18th floor. Free breakfast, tiki bar/restaurant, large deck by pool with beverage service. I could go on and on. Right next to the zoo, across the street from the beach, outdoor free movies, view of Diamond Head. Reasonable rates, great service, decent rooms, and just close...close....close to almost everything Waikiki.

Good location at Waikiki Beach with restaurants and stores close by. Front desk staff are helpful and knowledgeable and friendly. Ask them for a "walking map" and information about riding the bus. Wish I had been told that I could get a discount to ride the bus if I had brought my SS card. Who cares their SS card? They won't accept proof of age by looking at your DL!!

My son lives in Honolulu and we like to visit over the Thanksgiving holiday, so we've stayed at this hotel for a week every November for the past six years. We love the location at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. Gorgeous views, right across from the beach, and away from some of the hustle farther up on Waikiki Beach. You can walk all over Waikiki from here as well as to Kapiolani Park, the zoo, and the aquarium. We've always gotten an ocean front room and while it's true that the rooms aren't large, the balcony overlooking the ocean is wonderful in the morning, at sunset and at night. Otherwise who wants to be in their room in Honolulu?We've never stayed at the pool breakfast area to eat breakfast, so can't speak to difficulty finding seating there. We take our breakfast up to our room to eat on our balcony and enjoy the view. As far as fitting the food into the bag they give you, they used to put two bags in each room, but if they don't give you two, just ask at the breakfast area and they'll give you another.All our rooms have been clean and well cared for and the staff has been pleasant and helpful. The pool area is immaculate and, in our experience, never crowded. You can also get towels and beach chairs to take across the street to the beach. We recommend this hotel and plan to return soon.

I do admit that the hotel does have a great location but its very tired and they've have tried to upgrade furnishings but just looks tacky. The bathroom is small and very old the doors to the balcony don't close resulting in the wind being blown into your room. As other reviews have said this is nothing luxury.

My family stayed at the Aston Waikiki over Christmas. I just wanted to express my appreciation to the Security Manager "Mike" for going above and beyond to help us during our stay. I asked at the front desk how to express our appreciation to him and they said to leave a positive comment on this site. So Here it is! While at the beach, my son cut his foot badly on the coral. There are no first aid facilities on the beach (Why is that Honolulu Mayor ?) so we went back to the hotel. The front desk called security to help us. Mike showed up with a well-stocked first aid kit and proceeded to clean out the wound and apply antiseptic gel to it before bandaging it. He even gave us enough bandages to last our stay. Mike is ex-Army and certainly knew emergency first aid. Mike, thank you for your care and attention to our son. Your help was really appreciated. I hope the hotel director sees this and gives you a big raise. You deserve it!!

For $225 a night, we were expecting a much nicer hotel. This place was relatively clean and safe, but that's about all the good I could report. The pool is small and crowded and plopped down in between the front desk and two busy restaurants. There is a huge amount of foot traffic that surrounds you if you want to relax by the poolside. The staff was very nice, but the rooms are tiny. Our two rooms were located between the ice maker and the vending machine and across from the elevator. The ceiling panel in the bathroom leaked from the air conditioner. The lighting was horrible. Our view was nonexistent. There is a mandatory $18 per room "resort fee" that is not mentioned when booking. It covers internet, breakfast on the beach and movies. When I explained that we were not using any of these services, we were told it was non-negotiable. If you are looking for a basic, no frills hotel across from the beach, this is it. However, if you are looking for any level of luxury, forget about it.

The first night, when I turned back the sheets, I was horrified. It was full of hairs (and not just the ones that come from your scalp), dirt & dried up stains of white & yellow (don't know what that was). I immediately called housekeeping & my husband went to front desk. Yes, front desk offered to move us but our friends were in the room next to us and it was 10pm & would have taken an hour to move (my hubby had to get up at 5am for a tour). When housekeeping showed up, they brought two sheets & I explained that the mattress cover, blanket & all bedding was full of hairs,dried up crud & dirt. The housekeeper started picking off the hairs & throwing on floor. I said, "No way, that is NOT acceptable. I want all clean bedding!" He left to get housekeeping supervisor. So they returned an hour later with new bedding and proceeded to make the bed. No place to sit except the two bar stools in room. Anyhow, at front desk, they said they would report this to management. Well, we never heard a word. No apology or contact from management. They had an opportunity to try to appease us with at least a sincere apology but none was given. I still can't believe housekeeping did this....just made a bed without putting clean bedding on it. I have stayed in many hotels...low cost to high cost & never experienced this with the bed. Even Motel 6 has clean beds. We stayed 5 nights............I didn't have housekeeping do anything except empty my trash & get clean towels. I am appalled at how this was handled. The room is dated. The bathroom needs some work. The most enjoyable part of our stay at this hotel was the Tiki Bar. Staff was very nice & live music every night. But you can stay at any other resort & still enjoy the Tiki Bar. I would recommend any other hotel over this one.
user_name:
Linda J
Tacoma, Washington, United States

review_body: Perfect location,... amenities,... service... and family fun! The convenience of having Wolfgang Puck, The Tiki Bar, Starbucks on the corner and "Breakfast on the Beach" makes grabbing a meal easy and delicious. The atmosphere is cheerful and the staff, always smiling.

This hotel is located on the east side of Waikiki right on Kalakaua Street. We liked it for three reasons: 1) right across from the beach which meant easy access but affordable, 2) next to the zoo and aquarium, 3) a little removed from all the shopping/stores which is really what Waikiki is about for a lot of tourists (we are not into shopping). We found the hotel to be clean with attentive staff. They offered us a room upgrade at no extra charge. The upgrade was from an standard room to an ocean view. I must say it was really nice to wake up and drink my coffee on the balcony watching the waves roll in. The hotel also offers free breakfast with lots of fruit and live music at breakfast. The pool is small, but with the ocean across the street it doesn't get much use; there is however, a lot of poolside seating to relax in. Tiki's restaurant is also in the hotel which is convenient, but pricey like everything else in Waikiki. If ever back in Waikiki we would stay here again.

Stayed here for 3days before a cruise. Loved the location! Close to shopping and right across the street from the beach. The room is a bit small, and the lighting wasn't the best. However the room was clean. Staff were all very helpful. Breakfast was a zoo--we took our food to our room to avoid the crush!

It really is right across the street from the beach, and the beach is beautiful. We could see Diamond Head from our room. However, there is a lot of foot and car traffic, so the setting is actually quite urban. On the plus side, it is easy to catch the city bus to other locations and attractions in Honolulu. Poolside breakfast is quite hectic. There are only a handful of tables and chairs. Most people must resort to searching for an empty lounge chair and tiny little table meant to hold a drink by the pool. It is not relaxing, comfortable, or adequate for a meal. Guests are encouraged to take their breakfast across the street to the beach. However, there are no trays and two people can't possibly put their breakfast into the complimentary mini bag. On the plus side, the breakfast offerings are varied and plentiful and include items for Asian and Western tastes. Miso soup was part of the complimentary offerings, but the only other hot offering (cooked to order omlet) carried a $7 charge. I thought having live music and hula dancing during the early morning was going to be hokey and annoying, but the guitarist/vocalist and his dancing wife were very good. They added a soothing presence to the bustling, jostling breakfast scene.

We stayed in February 2013 for a week to get married. We chose the hotel after reviewing many hotels on trip advisor. The hotel was perfect for us, great location, great staff, great free breakfast, great room. Could not of asked for better. We will definitely go back!

We used this hotel to meet up with our daughter and her family who live in Australia (we live in the UK). We had rooms over-looking the beach. The staff were especially kind and helpful - a special praise to Glenn on the reception who could not do any more to make our stay pleasant. If I return to Honolulu (and I hope to one day) I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is in a great location stayed at this hotel back in 2006 had a great time, the staff was great helped with everything they well go out of there way to help you . Waikiki beach just on the other side of the street in front of the hotel. you well love having breakfast great choices. or take a walk up or down the street for a better breakfast the hotel food is ok but you may like a change . Tiki bar/restaurant is ok the view is good if you pay more for the ocean view if not Diamond Head is a great view also , this is also a non-smoking hotel, I had a lot of fun just riding the buses to see Hawaii I will be coming back in a year or two so look for me aloha

we stayed here for 4 nights in room 828. huge room for 3 people. they have free continental breakfast every morning with lots of choices. I love the hawaiin donuts every morning. their elevator is neat, it's like a fast lane to your floor and never crowded, I love that new technology! They are right across from waikiki beach, the snorkle and swimming area which is the best for kids. I love the location and the cleanliness of the hotel. they also have free dvd and ps4 rentals. they also let us stay till 6pm bec our flight home is not till 9pm. Tiki's also has good food and just right by the pool.

We loved it. The staff is incredibly friendly. It's AUTHENTIC Hawaiian. At the poolside breakfast they have a guitar/uke player and hula dancer. The Tiki bar/restaurant has great food and drink. It's clean! The entire hotel is non-smoking so your room doesn't smell like cigarettes. They have free movies, a PS3 in your room, they will go out of their way to do whatever it takes to make you happy short of changing the weather...we LOVED IT AND WE WILL BE GOING BACK!

Aston WBH is kind of tired, albeit they mask it with Bedroom drapery and Large TV.extremely tiny balcony, so-so bathroom. We had an oceanfront room, 14th floor, incredible view, Diamond Head to the left, the heart of Waikiki to our right. Kind of balances the preceding negatives. The Tiiki Bar and Restaurant with live entertainment aresuper as they are above street views. Enjoyed the continental breakfast, sitting around the pool with entertainment, all good. ( don't forget to take your breakfast on the beach box)The Bad: AWBH is near to the Honolulu Zoo, the quiet end of the strip, across from the breakwater beach pool. This is where the homeless and vagrants and other people of less means gather. At all times you can find people sleeping on the beach, lawns, sidewalks in front of the shops, leaving their garbage and who knows what behind, disgusting for such a popular tourist destination. Well we never felt in any danger, but this area is becoming if not already a seedy and disturbing area. We paid big bucks to have an oceanfront, perhaps a few dollars more elsewhere would have left us with better memories.

We recently traveled to this hotel in September for our honeymoon. The hotel was amazing and the hotel staff was always very nice. This was our first trip to Hawaii and we can not wait to visit the Aston again. It is a great location and close to alot of shops, also has easy access to the beach just across the street. We were able to sit on our balcony and enjoy the Hawaii 5-0 Preview. We were excited to find some treats complimentary of the hotel in our room fridge when we arrived. They also gave us a picture frame when we arrived so that we could remember this special time...The nice thing was that we did not have to rent a car because all the activites we wanted to enjoy picked us up in the downstairs of the hotel...We can not wait to visit again!!

Location is great! We stayed on the 8th floor oceanfront and loved the view. The rooms are just right for a couple. Loved Tikis and all that they offer. Breakfast is basic and is a nice extra. We will be returning next week for our 4th visit!

Great location, simply walk across the street to beach. Swimming area is protected by a wall which provides a calm beach. Walkout pier is nice also. Breakfast was more than adequate, yes seating was limited but always found a place to sit or better yet take it back to your room. Deck with partial view was great. Close to shopping. Found the front desk crew on all shifts to be very accommodating, always ready to help.

We were guest there last week during the week of Thanksgiving. Aston Waikiki went above and beyond our expectations. We had reviewed the goods and the bads and felt good about our choice in hotel but WOW.. the hospitality was a 10 out of 10!!! Front desk - Joy and Jon along with Alton(supervisor) and maintanance Todd were all superior in our book. EVERYONE IN THE ENTIRE HOTEL we came in contact with was amazing!!! Thank you for making this vacation one of the best for our family. I highly recommend this hotel!

Do yourself a favor and stay where you have access to everything in Waikiki and beyond. First and foremost, this was one of the most unique hotels I have stayed in. From the open air lower and upper "lobbies" to the way to access your hotel floor to the amazing views of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head, this hotel had everything necessary for a wonderful experience on an extended vacation. The hotel is directly across the street from Waikiki and within a block of the Honolulu Zoo. Every tour bus, trolley, cab company and transport van had a stop in front of the lower lobby which made accessing the rest of Honolulu, Pearl Harbor and the rest of O'ahu a snap. The staff was very professional and courteous. There was not a time that I was in need of anything. They are attached to Tiki's Bar & Grill that has some of the best food I have ever eaten and a life band most evenings. Each day at breakfast the hotel had a Hawaiian singer and Hula dancer; which made each day have a great start. The only minor drawback is that the breakfast is continental only, unless you wish to pay extra for an omelet (etc.). Thank you for a wonderful experience. I will be back.

I am taking this opportunity to pre rate this property & will do another upon our return. I have read the reviews by others but make up my own mind as everyone is different. . We have booked in for 16 days from the 19th December 2013 which will include our wedding anniversary/my birthday, on Xmas Eve/ Xmas Day and New Year. We are both looking forward to our stay and have another great look at Hawaii as it has been 25 years since we have been here., on the last occasion we had an ocean view and again we have booked the same. Our friends have recommended this hotel to us so can't wait..Regards,Ian & Wendy Benbow, Horsham, Victoria, Australia.

This was our second stay at this hotel and were overall pleased both times. Rooms only have a small fridge, no microwave and no coffee pot. As far as I could find there is not a guest microwave available (but I didn't ask someone I only looked). Hotel is nice and secure that not anyone could be go up in the elevators to the upper floors. The Breakfast on the Beach that they offer is okay. Basic contential breakfast, but you do have the option of paying for omlets or waffles. Bed was as comfortable as any hotel bed. The hotel is basically at the end of Waikiki Beach and it is just a quick hop across the street to the beach. The kids got bags, buckets and shovels to play with when we checked in. You can easily walk to the park or zoo or aquarium.

I stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel at the end of November 2013 for 5 nights. I was very happy that I booked to stay at this hotel. I was greeted on arrival and directed to the lobby. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. You are given a card which you use for your room and also to use the elevator. Although my room did not look like the rooms on the website, it was pleasant and clean and everything was in good working order. I stayed in an ocean deluxe room on floor 19 and I was very happy with the view; beautiful, overlooking the ocean with a balcony and chair so I could sit out. Breakfast was good; a selection of food and you are supplied with a bag so you can take your breakfast and eat it elsewhere if you do not want to sit by the pool. Every day there was a singer at breakfast time which is lovely to hear while having your breakfast and creates a lovely relaxing atmosphere.The location is good; directly opposite the beach and if you walk 10 minutes up the road you will find a good selection of well known shops and shopping malls/markets. Closer by the hotel is a selection of smaller shops and restaurants. You can also dine at Tiki's Grill within the hotel which is great. There are quite a few homeless people near the hotel but this wasn't a problem. Most of the people I met in Honolulu were friendly and I felt quite safe walking around even on the evening. Waikiki itself is quite busy and the road the hotel is situated on is always busy but I found there to be no problem with the noise level and with the balcony door closed I could hardly hear any sound at all from outside.Amenities also included unlimited DVD's where I was given a swipe card and you can use this at the machines near the front desk to choose your DVD'S however I think some improvements could be made on the DVD options.Overall I am very happy I decided to stay here and would recommend this hotel to anyone. If you are looking for a lovely hotel which is clean, safe and has friendly and helpful staff, located near the beach with beautiful views then this is the hotel for you. If I ever go to Honolulu again I would definitely stay at this hotel.

Spent a week at this hotel in November 2013. 4th Hawaii trip and first time down the Kuhio beach end of Waikiki. We enjoyed the stay very much. Great location with everything you need nearby and the waiki trolly stopping at the door.Really friendly and helpful staff, efficient service and clean well appointed rooms. We had a small balcony that you could sit with a drink and see all the way along Waikiki beach. The location is great - just across from the beach and the ocean baths. The breakfast was fantastic. More than you would expect from a continental breakfast. Lots of variety and entertainment to boot!Tikis bars is awesome. We ate in the bar lanai and in the restaurant. Views over the beach and an Interesting variety of good food. $2 beers in happy hour.This is a great hotel.

My sister and I stayed at the Aston in January for a week and are really excited because we are coming again for 2 weeks. The hotel staff was very friendly. We were upgraded from Ocean View to a deluxe and loved sitting on the balcony watching the water and sunrise/sunsets. The breakfast on the beach was nice but VERY busy! Our room was nice but the bathroom felt like it really needed to be undated. I would recommend this hotel again and again. Thank you Aston! And I cant wait to come back this January 2014!!

The Aston beach hotel is at the Zoo end of Waikiki. Cross the road to the beach. The rooms are very pretty and comfortable with good size bathrooms. We were a party of five with adjoining rooms which were perfect for us. The Aston has a great bar, the tiki, which was great for a pre or post dinner cocktail. Our only gripe was the breakfast which was included on our tarrif. It was served by the pool, which is a lovely area but could not cope with the volume of people wanting to eat between 7.30 and 9.00am. Getting a table was almost impossible and juggling cereal, juice and pastries on your lap was not enjoyable. It was a very basic breaky and a few times we opted for a nearby cafe. I would recommend this hotel for those on a medium budget and would stay there again.

Everything was within walking distance! There were tons of shops and restaurants within walking distance, as well as right on the property. It was also right across the street from the beach. The resort had a very upbeat Hawaiian feel. I had a room with the bright red Hawaiian decor, while another person in my party had a more modern room with a red accent wall (not quite as in-your-face). All the rooms were very clean and well kept. They weren't luxurious, but very comfortable and decently priced. The breakfast in the morning is a GREAT deal, you get the complimentary cooler to take down and they have a wide variety of foods, cereals pastries, miso soup, fruits, you name it. We also had dinner and drinks down at Tiki's which was good. The menu didn't seem to have too many choices, but it had a lot of different foods. The Kalua pig quesadillas were a great appetizer. Overall I think the property was a gr4eat vale and a truly enjoyed my stay!

Friendly front desk, nice pool, great location to beach, just across the street. The front desk and housekeeping responded promptly to our requests. Plenty of restaurants near by free breakfast was good, would have liked a little more variety, but quality was ok. Rooms were decorated nicely. I would definitely refer a friend and return. It was at somewhat far from the airport, but super shuttle service was great.
