As a party of 5 we had 3 different room types - standard king, standard twin and queen suite. All were clean and comfortable - not luxurious but very good value for the price we paid. Bathrooms are the same in all - old but clean and functional. The twin room was a bit compact, the suite was very spacious and the king was somewhere in-between! The ocean could be seen from all rooms and the suite had an amazing view across Waikiki beach. The only thing missing in the rooms was a kettle.There were mixed opinions about the 'breakfast on the beach' concept - I quite liked it as it meant I had snacks to munch on all morning, but others would have preferred a more traditional sit-down hot/cold buffet breakfast. It also finishes way too early so there's no chance of a lie-in!The mandatory amenity fee is annoying (although I realise this applies to a lot of Waikiki hotels) - I'd prefer the room rate to be a bit higher and have it all included, or only have to pay for the things you actually want to use. Having said that you do get quite a lot - breakfast, wifi, gym, DVDs and games, safe, newspaper and free local calls.All the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful and they got me checked-in before 11am as I arrived early from an overnight flight. The tour desk was also good and found us an awesome 'open-door' helicopter flight around the island.The pool area is a bit uninspiring - too much concrete and not enough greenery, but we really enjoyed the relaxing afternoon happy hour cocktails in Tiki's bar and also ate there a few times - excellent food and service.Location is perfect - right across the road from the beach and plenty of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance.Some friends stayed at the Hilton previously but said the value for money is better at the Aston. It's not 6 star luxury and it is an older building, but if you want great value and a decent standard of accommodation in a location where hotels are quite expensive then this place is perfect.

We stayed here as 4 groups for 8 days in November. We had a ocean view suite on an upper floor while our friends had king and double rooms throughout other parts of the hotel. There is a noticeable difference between the renovated and non-renovated rooms, especially the bathrooms. Only let down for us was I found the bed to be as hard as a rock and the included breakfast offerings are a very poor selection of sugary treats, muffins etc and some fruit which is 90% cantaloupe. We enjoyed the location, being close to the main strip of Waikiki and having easy access to the freeway. Tiki's is a great restaurant and happy hour provides some of the cheapest drinks around.

Great location, stringent on book in times and very busy. Small room and on end of complex (from beach) , so a lot of wind tunnel and street noise. Very comfortable beds, partial ocean view was nice. The pool & facilities well maintained and breakfast continental only. Busy atmosphere, however Tikis Bar and Grill grt drinks and meals.

I stayed at re Aston for four nights with some friends . It's a really busy motel and service at reception was really slow. Our rooms were lovely but small and beds really comfy -- the views were spectacular from the 17th floor. Breakfast was my least favourite thing of our stay ... Really busy and by the pool with table seating for 30-40 and everyone else sat on a lounger and ate on their knee. We had one cooler to collect our breakfast for three people and it was just really awkward and not enjoyable at all.I would stay at the Aston again as location trumped the negatives ... But maybe head out for breakfast

It really was perfect for the price. Rooms was clean and the view was lovely. The building is rather old but well maintained. Exercise room was clean and I never had to wait for a machine. The breakfast consists of pastries, cereal, fruit and miso soup and they give you a lunch bag to fill up and take across the street to the beach. Staff was super friendly and helpful, including the tour desks. Honestly, I was in Honolulu for work and wanted to stay on the beach. The area is VERY touristy, it was nice that the hotel is on the end of the strip bc I could easily turn left and be away from the flood of tourists when I wanted toI'll stay there again next time I am in Honolulu

I booked a night at Aston Waikiki beach prior to cruise. I booked a less expensive room that didn't quite have the oceanview, but the big windows had great view of diamond head mountain and sort of a side view of Waikiki beach. The view didn't matter much since we got there late at night and checked out at noon after a hiking trip to Diamond head and couple hours at Waikiki beach. First night we had dinner at Aston's Tiki Bar/Restaurant. Their food is great, service tends to be a bit slow though. For morning breakfast, they have quite a large selection and they provide a container you can take to the beach and have breakfast there instead. Hotel's seating around pool for breakfast is quite limited. After check-out, we left our bags in the hotel's free bag-holding service (near valet), and strolled to the beach. Overall a great location and highly recommended for Waikiki area. For children, they gave a welcome package with backpack, sand castle kit (bucket, shovel), activity books etc. Service is great.

We stayed here for 6 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. We landed in Honolulu at 7am and the hotel got us in to our room by 9am. Room was comfortable, not very big but good for a base while seeing Waikiki. Didn't bother with the breakfast as it was always very busy and we didn't really like the idea of a buffet breakfast around the pool. It was very close to everything while also being a little out of the busiest party of Waikiki beach. Had a great view from our balcony and also when we walked out our room we had an unobstructed view of diamond head. Housekeeping was good, came at the same time everyday and always did a great job. Will stay here again.

My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying here this last week. The location was great! We walked to diamond head and to the international market. Great food was all around and the staff suggestions were great. The valet was helpful as well, on more than one occation they grabbed something we left in our car for us. Having the breakfast on the beach cooler was also helpful we got to eat our breakfast on the way to scuba diving for the day. We got an upgrade as the room we booked was sold out. the upgraded room was nice, only small complaint was that it was right above the bar and we could hear the music in our room. also kind of annoying that we couldnt get from our floor directly to the valet floor. We had to get off at the main lobby and either get on another elevator or take the stairs/escelator.

First time I've stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, and no complaints! Upon arrival, greeted by valet (even though did no use their service), they took my luggage right away and when I got checked into my room, no more than 5 minutes later was my luggage delivered. I also checked in early, and my room was available. Bonus. The room was clean and comfortable. Everything worked. Besides a minor paint job, the hotel itself was a block away from the beach and shopping. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay here in the future. Did not make it to the Tiki Bar or use the pool or free breakfast, so can't speak to those amenities. But highly recommend!

We stayed here recently for 8 nights and were really pleased we chose this hotel. The location is fantastic - just over the road from the beach. It is also really handy to the shops and all the tour buses stop here. Had a super king bed which was huge with daily servicing.The first night we arrived the fridge was humming really loudly and when we rang to ask for it to be fixed, they simply put a new fridge in. We asked for a room high up and quiet and that is what we got.They also had travel desks in the hotel which you could book excursions through. We booked a snorkelling trip and were pleased with the price we paid and what we got for the money. Well worth taking the time to stop and talk to the lady.We would definitely go back here but would ask for a room on the swimming pool side, not the Diamond Head side, as the balconies were bigger on that side.

My new husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as the first part of our honeymoon. His parents had stayed at this location 35 years ago during their honeymoon so it was the only hotel we looked at. We booked a regular "partial ocean view" but were upgraded to a deluxe partial ocean view upon check in. Staff was very friendly.Our room was decently sized but in need of an update. Years of wear and tear were very clear. It didn't feel "unclean" per say but needed a fresh coat of paint and a new mattress badly. Pros: The breakfast and movies that fall under the amenity fee were very nice. We enjoyed picking out our food nice and early for the best selection and taking it up to our room and packing the cooler they provide for later on (By early I mean 7am at the latest!).Cons: It seems they spent more on the elevator system than anything else. Too complicated and wasted too much time. This is a very busy hotel. Our first and only experience in Waikiki so I don't know if its the case everywhere but relaxing is not the atmosphere you get. Luckily we only needed a place to lay our heads down before moving on. Do not pay for valet ($27 a day!). Park next door at the zoo for a dollar an hour.

The location of this hotel is ideal. Got a partial ocean view and it was excellent. We had a great view to the west along Waikiki Beach. Quick check in at the front desk. Elevators required a card key to get to any floor above the main lobby which was great for security. Staff was excellent in cleaning the room daily. It was a great choice by my son who took me to Hawaii as a birthday present. I would stay at this hotel any time I was in Waikiki. Also, the Expedia concierge desk did an excellent job of helping us plan our activities for the week. Well done to all the staff at this hotel.

Room was clean and well furnished. Suite has small fridge with complimentary snacks and drinks which was nice. We were greeted at the front desk by Kathy who was very polite and courteous in true hawaian form. Breakfast on the beach was a perfect way to start our morning exploring the International Marketplace. Which by the way will be closing December 31st and a Saks Fifth Avenue will be built. We thought the elevator system worked well and allowed us to get to our room more quickly without having to stop at other people's floor. Location was perfect with easy beach access, park access, and most all tour buses stopped in front of the hotel to pick up passengers. We highly reccommend this hotel for families and adventurers.

Location, location, location. If you want to be in Honolulu, you may as well be in the heart of it all & this definitely meets that requirement. Great bar on the 3rd floor with food available until 11:30pm. Calamari steak was delish! Cool security in the elevators doesn't let anyone get past the 3rd floor without a room key & the elevators knew your floor once you competed the security process to get on - kinda cool! Room is basic (no mini frig, no coffee maker) but the water pressure in the shower was amazing & the water was hot. Coffee maker isn't a huge deal as coffee is available at the pool around dawn. And there is a Starbucks 175 ft from our 16th floor room. Partial oceanview room was just as pictured online, but I think we should have sprung for oceanfront or not bothered. Beach is directly across the street (close and convenient) without the beachfront resort price tag. Resort fee is $18/nt & covers free DVD rentals, free wifi in the room and free breakfast. Could include other items, but those are the ones that I can remember!

4 night stay at the Aston Waikiki. Breakfast on the Beach was one of the reasons we booked this hotel but is disappointing. You have to go to the beach because there's not enough tables or sun loungers to sit on to eat breakfast! Cereals, muffins, donuts and similar is sufficient but you have to put it in the little cooler bag (including disposal cups of milk for your cereal) so is not very practical. Some rooms are on an open landing (numbers 1-8 approx). Rooms are well equipped but could do with some sprucing up - bath and sink very slow to drain, balcony doors hard to open). We had a room with a good ocean view but the hotel I s in quite a noisy area with seemingly every tour/trolley bus going down the side road. Breakfast singer starts at about 7am so if you want a sleep-in, use earplugs! Aston Waikiki Beach is at the far end of the beachfront so if you don't like walking, you may want to select something a bit more central.

We spent 6 nights in an ocean view room and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was excellent and friendly. Hotel is in a great location and transportation is easily available . We were a little concerned because of some negative reviews but the Aston meet or exceeded our expectations. The pool is fine and was never crowded and if you find it too small there is an ocean across the street . They have beach chairs and towels for guest use. The breakfast can be a bit hectic, but it's an easy way to start the day and we always found a place to sit. The elevator system is different from any I've seen and is really efficient . Just don't get on one that is'nt selected for you or you could be in for a ride. Lots of places to eat at within an easy walk and there are several tour desks and car rental spots in the hotel.

This is our second time at this hotel. Were here in 2008 and enjoyed it so much we were keen to return. This time we travelled with our two adult sons who had not been to Hawaii previously.If anything, had an even better time than last time. Saff were most helpful and got us into one of our rooms very quickly (we had arrived at around 8.30 am afer a long flight from Australia).Both rooms had wonderful views of Waikiki Beach, loved having our breakfast on the beach every morning of our five day stay. Enjoyed being able to dine on site at Tiki's. It was great with lovely food and very reasonable prices. Will be back again for sure.

We had a nice 4-night stay here. The room is starting to show its age in design and cleanliness (similar to the other places we have stayed in Waikiki). The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great if you like the quieter waters inside the break wall (which is why we chose this location). We had a great view of Diamond Head from our 15th floor room. The balcony was too narrow to do anything other than stand on. It was nice to have a variety of foods for breakfast (yogurt, doughnuts, croissants and lots of fresh fruit). I think they even made omelets for you for a fee - we didn't do that. Beach chairs and towels are available if you want to walk across the road to sit on the beach. Watch out for the amenity fee which we didn't find out about until after it was booked online.
user_name:
Deekster125
Taylors, South Carolina, United States

review_body: We stayed here while on business in Honolulu. The location was fantastic as we could walk every where (except to the outlet shopping!). The bar on the second floor had a band on different nights and was relaxing. You could see the whole beach from our room, and around to Diamond Head. We were there during the Hawaii Marathon and it was fantastic to see all the runners in the early morning.The room was beautiful with two double beds with beautiful red decor. The breakfast was ok, but not great. Lots of terribly sweet food. The day it rained there was very little undercover places to enjoy the breakfast around the pool. The hotel staff were not particularly helpful and our room wasn't ready on time and we had to wait.

I can't compare with other hotels in Waikiki, It was good hotel. Hotel staff was very kind, it took 5 or 10 min solving any problems like adjusting air conditioner, bring extra blaket... I liked breakfast service - they serve various bread and fruit, tea, coffee, juice and fresh milk.you can enjoy your meal near pool bar, your room or beach!There are DVD service but it was useless...Room was small as I expected, it was not so clean. I found out a bottle of juice when I entered the room. T.T Fortuneatly I stayed 19th floor, partial ocean view. It was wonderful. I'd like to pay more if I stay near Waikiki beach next time.

We booked a superior room with beach views on line and paid top price. We were allocated a room, that was a shock. You got to the room from an open air corridor, the room did not even have space for two suitcases and the bathroom was minute. When I queried this with staff we were told that we booked on line and it was not there problem, if we wanted a better room we had to pay extra. We paid. the better room was above the bar area and the band played until 1am AND the air conditioning did not work very well so you could not open the minute balcony door for fresh air because of the noise. The hotel needed some work to bring it up to 3 star. The say the least not a very good experience for paying top dollar.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was a good hotel. My room was clean & comfortable. I wanted for nothing while staying there. It was across the road from one end of Waikiki Beach which was very convenient. The hotel provided insulated bags so you could have breakfast on the beach, a nice touch. Breakfast was a help-yourself arrangement with lots of choice although cooked eggs were an extra. It was situated around the pool with limited seating that created some issues if you turned up in busy time. An upside to breakfast was the Hawaiian dancer who entertained us while we ate. Honolulu Zoo and Diamond Head were just next door but downtown Waikiki was some distance away. This was not a problem given the excellent bus service. I took in Honolulu Zoo. A beautiful place with lots of animals, but go in the evening. The animals tend to hide in the heat of the day.

Our two days at this hotel were not so great. On arrival we had a very dirty room and broken tv. Took an hour to get a new room. Breakfast staff refused to assist us and no manager was available to issue us gift cards we were supposed to receive for our stay. They had beach towels to borrow but had to be returned by 7p or charged a rediculous fee. Same with the cheap key card return fee. We were also ignored at the hotel bar/restaraunt. Free DVD rental was nice...but again...tv was fuzzy. We were dissapointed we splurged for a "nice" room at this hotel.

Arriving late in the evening after a long flight it was not easy to locate the lobby on the 3rd floor with the luggage.The hotel is dated and the red décor on the 17th floor reminded me of a pay by the hour, the room was adequate in size but needed work and the balcony was only big enough for standing.On arrival my wife wanted ice water to drink and after getting ice there was not a single glass in the room and it took over an hour for housekeeping to deliver the glasses, a coffee maker would have been nice as in most hotels and the closet doors need to be put back on the tracks.The elevator system is amazing activated by the room card and works well until the software crashes and 23 floors have to use the service elevator.On check out I was informed of the $18 a day resort fee plus tax I was not impressed oh well next time I will read the fine print.

Clean rooms, and the morning breakfast was great! The room was on the smaller side, but we were always on the go so it didn't really matter. Staff was also very nice. We stayed in the partial ocean view, and the view was spectacular!

This is the second time my wife and I have stayed here and we find it great. The staff are really good and go out of their way to ensure your stay is a memorable one.Naomi looked after us and she was outstanding. We will be back next year for sure.

I dont think I would of wanted to say anywhere else on our trip. It was so nice and it was quite. It was so wonderful to have the beach right there just out our door. The breakfast was not bad but after a while (and we were there a week) the carbs just got to be a little much.

I stayed here last year (never thought to do a review) and had an amazing time.The staff are so helpful and friendly and helped me through a really frustrating experience that I had (nothing to do with the hotel)The rooms are bright and colourful-not standard old boring ones that you see everywhere! THis hotel is Hawaii wrapped up in a neat package

We were excited to stay at the Aston Waikiki for a weekend. Our family was on a 14 adventure trip in the south pacific and we decided to end it with a nice hotel after being in huts and in the jungle. Well, when we arrived at the Aston, it was 2pm. Our check-in time was 3pm. We decided to see if maybe there was chance the rooms might already be ready. The front desk advised that it was not, no big deal, we're early. 3pm came around, room wasn't ready. 3:15pm, room not ready. 3:30, room not ready. We asked if there were another rooms available, since is past our check-in. The guy at the front desk say that they are fully booked unless we wanted to upgrade. Im sorry, what? You're fully booked but we can pay more $$$ and you're magically not fully booked anymore?4 o'clock rolls around and we finally got into our room. When we entered the room, it looked ok but then that made a turn for the worst as we tried to settle in. One of the lights had a burned out bulb (called to have it fixed, never happened), the bathroom had NO toilet paper. there are these white blobs on the bathroom walls, wires exposed at the outlets, no child locks on the bedroom sliding glass, water dripping down the walls from the vent, no dressers and mold on the walls. I took pictures of it because I was in shock on how run down the room was for how much we paid.I really don't like giving a negative review but we just had a very bad experience. Don't know if I'd ever stay here again. It would have major incentives.

Our room was very tight/small. The balcony was also small, however the view was very nice. This hotel is directly across the street from the beach. The hotel is surrounded by other hotels and shops. It is within easy walking distance from numerous restaurants. It is one block away from a city bus stop and the trolleys stop in front of the hotel. Parking is very expensive at the hotel. There is street parking that is less expensive. The most interesting item at this property (for me) was the elevators. The system is that you press the floor that you want to go to and then swipe your room key on a pad OUTSIDE the elevator. The system then lets you know which elevator (A-F) is coming for you. Once you get inside the elevator, there is no way for you to go to any other floor then the one that you choose. If you want to be in the middle of highrise buildings and busy people-filled streets, this is the place for you.

My friends (3 and myself) stayed here for 3 nights in early September - we had side by side rooms overlooking the ocean and we all enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Have you tried staying at any hotels in Las Vegas lately? The hotel fee charged by this hotel gives you free wifi, free movies and free breakfast - Vegas gives you nothing and charges a fee!!!!! We especially enjoyed our oceanfront views in the mornings watching the rainbows and on the Friday night when the fireworks show began we were so glad we had picked this hotel. We stayed here before going on a Hawaiian cruise but would definitely stay here again. By the way we did try the breakfast one morning and it was ok but the next morning we went to Wolfgang Puck's right at the hotel and had a wonderful breakfast. I should also mention that we got used to the elevator system right away and thought it was a very safe system because you got on and it went right to your floor without many stops along the way with people getting on!!!!!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and our first trip of any kind in the past 10 years. We arrived after a ten hour flight from Atlanta and an hour wait for the "Speedyshuttle". Check in was a breeze. The wife and I were in 502 (I believe the first floor with guest rooms). We had a exterior hallway from the elevator to the room that overlooked what looked like a small apartment building, it was not the beautiful beach, but it wasn't disgusting. Quick trip from room to beach/lobby and back.Inside, the room was nice enough with a king bed. I do have to say the air conditioner, didn't work well when you came in hot and sweaty and stayed that way. They sent a service man in and said it was fine, but it only cooled down during the night. I asked at the desk in the morning, and they offered another room, but not a king bed and it would be on the other side of the building. We opted not to move because we might get something worse.The balcony overlooked the remodeling dumpster and it was noisy, but it was peaceful enough to ready the paper and be in the shade of the building with a light breeze. AND if you could look past the roof of the parking structure, you could see the ocean. I'd say there weren't that many rooms worse than ours as far as the view.We spent much of the day on tours, so it really didn't matter about the view. We went to the beach, went for walks and saw the scenery. For the most part, everything was great.Breakfast on the beach? Well kinda, we ate in the room after the first day of fighting for sitting space and shooing away the birds that were about as bad as flies. The pastries and cereal were the best of the lot. The yogurt, although kept on ice were as thin as milk. Yuk!I paid attention this time, so next time (if there is one) I know where I want to stay and what I want to know. My expectations at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel were met. By the way, ALL of the staff members that I had interaction with were very understanding and attentive.Thanks for the stay.

Great location with views of Diamond Head & the beach. Rooms to a good standard but externals need repair. Typical Hawaii time frame for mediocre service. Priced right for a holiday but 10 minute walk to shop.

I was a little concerned about the hotel based on a couple of reviews I read, but when I emailed the hotel directly in advance of our stay, I received a prompt response that eased my concerns entirely.The hotel is perfectly located at the south end of the strip where it's a bit more quiet, a bit less busy and yet still right ON the beach. Unfortunately, we were there when the jellyfish invaded the water, but that's nobody's fault, we'll just have to plan a bit more around the full moon next time. The breakfast was easy to get through with plenty of variety if you like pastries and fruit. We loaded up our cooler every morning, ate in our room and it was more than enough for all of us to last until our normally very early lunch. The valet parking was $27/day (ouch) but as there really weren't other options and I didn't want to risk the rental being damaged if we parked down at the zoo. Plus, with the unpredictable rain, we would've been soaked at least once getting to the car. The valet was quick and courteous. When we'd call ahead from our room, the car was already there by the time we got downstairs.It also had very easy access to H-1 for when we went to Diamond Head and Koko Head craters. Two turns, 7 or 8 blocks down and you were to the highway.The elevators were very efficient. Scan your card, hit your floor # and it tells you which lettered elevator to get in. You often went direct to your floor, but at most only 1-2 other stops first. I love that system. There was never a crowd and we never missed an elevator because it was too full.The amenity fee was $18/day. We never used the movies or games, but we did use the safe and had breakfast. At other places, it would've been $40 for our breakfast, so it worked out well. Wolfgang Puck's pizza on the lower level was wonderful, as was its Caesar salad, plus Cold Stone Creamery also next to that. We'll stay here again, most certainly!
user_name:
christinehX621MD
Saint Louis, Missouri, United States

review_body: My husband and just returned from our second stay at the hotel. This time we upgraded to a bigger room which was much nicer on the top floor, again with those amazing uninterrupted ocean views. On registering in we had a few hassles as the computers on the front desk wouldn't accept our credit cards, we noted that other guests signing in at the same time were experiencing the same problems, so maybe management should look closely at this.Other than that all the staff are very friendly, the rooms clean and well maintained and the breakfast very handy, although we usually preferred to eat it on our lovely balcony. My only other suggestion would be for the hotel to install a laundry. As this is a family orientated hotel, with most guests staying a few nights,this can become a nightmare. Other hotels we have stayed at have them and they are a very welcome addition,especially if you are on a long trip away for home .

It was our first time staying at this hotel last December and we loved it. Great location, super friendly staff, the breakfast at the pool was super. Rooms were awesome, (we had an ocean front room). We can't say enough good things about this hotel. We are going back to stay this December and we can't wait to get back to this hotel again.

We stayed at the Aston in February 2010. My husband booked everything and I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived in Hawaii. There was a van waiting for us to take us to the hotel when we landed. We got there fast and was checked in quickly and right up to our room. We had a room with a balcony on the sunset side. It was just amazing. Waking up to the sound of the waves, couldn't have been better. The hotel was very clean and very safe. I loved how they gave us little mini coolers to pack a breakfast in so we could head over the street to eat breakfast on the beach. It was like a dream! We didn't use the pool cause hello, we were right on the beach. It was perfect to just walk out of the room and head down to the shops. They also helped us book a convertible for the day. Had a bus stop right in front of the hotel and was super easy to get anywhere. This hotel was just amazing and I don't have one complaint!

We visited July 2013, and had an unremarkable stay. Check-in was not nice. IE: WAIT until your rooms ready at 4pm! (3pm check-in). I picked this place because the reviews said the breakfast was amazing. I wouldn't know. They say it's open until 9:30am. It's NOT. More like 8:45am. We DID SEE the dancer and singer, but we NEVER heard them. They concerned themselves with various children during our stay. Two visits, both breakfast, both -----the same. We got coffee, juice, and basic rolls at the breakfast. This is NOT worth the $20 they charge you!!!!!! Stay off the beach, and save your money!!!!! You could order a "Caramel, Macchiato, Tall" somewhere else. Also, housekeeping left a BUNCH of sand outside our elevator door for 4 days. And call for your car a half hour before you actually need it!!!! Valet workers are n NO hurry!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Very nice overall,but the elevators took some getting used to,only real issue was the crowds and traffic but not hotels fault,plenty to do and see and very easy to get around with shuttles coming right to the hotel.Sadly because of Gov. stupidity the Arizona was shutdown.

As soon as we got there we found out parking was an issue. The service for the valet parking was poor and they had no parking onsite. The room check in was quick but she wasn't very friendly. She could have told us about the elevator system there. You had to use your room key to access the elevators which only gave you access to your floor and back to the 3rd floor. Don't know why you couldn't get access to the first floor. The complimentary breakfast was ok but not worth the $20 resort fee they charge everyday for it. The access to the beach and shopping was the best perk for our stay. I would not recommend this hotel.

Except for the double beds, this hotel is awesome. Its across the street from the beach and walking distance to all the shopping you need. My wife and I also walked to Diamond Head from here. The morning breakfast and entertainment by the pool was most enjoyable.

My 2 friends and I had a wonderful stay in this great hotel. The room pricing would've been prohibitive if I had been staying alone, but sharing with my 2 friends made it an excellent deal! There is a daily tax that they tell you about when you check in, but it's not a huge amount, and it's worth it because it covers the daily breakfast buffet. The highlight of this hotel for me is definitely the breakfast buffet! In every room, there is a small cooler you can bring with you, and at the buffet, you can fill it up with juice, yogurt, cereal, pastries...all of the breakfast items they offer, which is great! Then, you can either spread out on the chairs by the pool and enjoy the daily singer and hula dancer, or take everything back to your room (hey, if that's what you like!), but my friends and I would check out some beach towels and chairs and walk across the street to picnic on the beach! Such a wonderful, relaxing way to begin your day in Hawaii!I would skip the buffet breakfast at least once, though, and walk around the corner to Lulu's for breakfast. They make this Stuffed French Toast dish that's out of this world!This hotel is in a great location, with attractions in walking distance, or a short trolley ride away! The room was in good condition, with signs of wear on some in-room objects, but with no dirty feel to it. I like that they've got a conservation policy in effect. The view from the balcony was great!I would be happy to stay at this hotel again!

This hotel is AWSOME we've been there 3 times and they always treat us like we are family,and all you have to do is walk across the street and your on the beach. They also serve breakfast by the pool with a hula dancer and a musician playing soft Hawaiian music while breakfast is being served.

We arrived WAY before check in and they had no rooms available at that time. The lady at the front desk had us check our bags with the concierge and said she would call my cell phone as soon as a room was ready. Less than half an hour later we were comfortably in our room and were able to enjoy the beautiful ocean view. The room was very comfortable, especially the bed.No issues with cleanliness, and "Breakfast on the Beach" was nice. Everything was convenient and the Honolulu Trolley stopped out front. We did not try the on-site restaurant, but did go to Wolfgang Puck 's Express restaurant next door, which was very good. If we do a return visit we'll stay here again.

We stayed here for the third time in a row, this time from 29 Sept to 9 Oct and it was awesome as always. Usually you can only check in after 3pm but this time we were able to check into our room as soon as we gor there which was about 0930, a total relief after a long 9 hour flight from Sydney. The ladies at reception were lovely, the suite was great with a king size bed for my wife and I, a sofa bed for my daughter and an extra bed for my son at no extra cost. The room was neat and clean with great air con and two small balconies with great views of Waikiki Beach. Loved the big LG flat screen tvs, great channels and the Sony PS3 was excellent what with the free dvd and game hire in the lobby. Although around the pool is looking a bit rough the pool itself was lovely. All the staff from reception, security, valet, snack bar, tour desk and house cleaning were so welcoming and friendly. The location of this hotel gets us everytime, it can't be beat being straight across the road from the beach and so close to some great stores. Sure the $27 a day parking is a bit harsh but when you call ahead to collect your car and it's right there waiting for you I think it's worth it. All in all we had a great vacation here and a lovely time. Mahalo!

We just returned from a 7 day stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel in Honolulu. Our room was clean and comfortable. We were in room 2103 which had a small balcony with a great view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Breakfast was everyday by the pool. We were entertained everyday with Hawaiian music and a hula dancer. Breakfast was the same everyday - Hawaiian breads, muffins, donuts, fruit, yogurt, cereals, etc. You could also get an omelet for an extra $5. The hotel was convenient to everything we wanted to do.

I would like to start with a poitive. Great view of the beach. Great check in service. But that was when it stops. Housekeeping average. Our table was never cleaned, bath tub cleaned once in our stay. If you have any problems dont expect them resolved. We paid the hotel in full a few days early, only to find that the hotel put a hold on an extra 50% of the costs. This left my girl friend with no money for food,taxi money to get to the airport. The hotel staff advise that this is not there problem and the matter was left unresolved. They also denied this occurred and blamed the bank. It took over an hour for the hotel supervisor to decide to cover the cab fair home. However she would not allow my froend to eat. The amount of stress this hotel caused was unbelievable. My girlfriend almost fainted due to stress and the hotel again showed no concern, i had to get her water and also a chair. The matter was resolved the next day when we were back home and the hotel confirmed with no apology that they held onto the cash not that this helped. I would not stay here again. The situation needed to be handled better.

We had 2 suites and stayed for 5 nights. The rooms were large and very clean. The Free breakfast every morning was Great. They give you a thermal bag to put your food in and you can take it to your room or go down to the beach to eat. The kids loved the pool, you can sit and have a drink at the bar while you watch them. Thank god for the nice cold airconditioner, because the weather was very hot and humid. You can walk to the Zoo and the Aquarium which was fun. There are also lots of restaurants to walk to. The staff is friendly and helpful. They also have a mini market in the hotel. Which is handy. Can't wait to go Back! A GREAT place to stay!

This was recommended by our travel agent and the location turned out to be very good. Diamond Head was right behind the hotel and after bussing to the trail head and walking up the last 561 feet we walked all the way back to the hotel (basically all downhill) for a 2.5 mile walk. It is located across the street from Waikiki Beach and within easy walking distance to the restaurants and shops. The pool area and Tiki Bar area are run by two separate organizations so you cannot either be served at you poolside seat nor charge you purchase at the Tiki Bar to your room.  The staff did a great job and the rooms were cleaned each day in a quiet and confident manner. The concierge did a good job of helping us. The rooms are beginning to look like they could use some updating, but the location trumps that. I would return, but check out other options first. They did have a breakfast each day including cold cereal, a variety of rolls, yogurt, coffee all included in the price of the room. For a nominal fee you could get an omelet.

My wife and I chose this hotel to stay for our destination wedding. It was close to the beach (across the street) and close to the shops that line Waikiki. Also, the Honolulu Zoo is a five minute walk from the hotel. Our friends and family could enjoy the attractions in the area while staying in town for out wedding. The valet staff was super friendly. We stayed a week, and they learned our names very quickly. The valets always asked us if we had any questions or needed directions before we headed out. The front desk staff was very accommodating. They learned we were honeymooning, and went out of their way to upgrade our room. They also said hello everytime they saw us and greeted us by name. The hotel itself was a bit dated, and the rooms are a bit small. Our rooms had a small fridge but no microwave. If you needed one, you had to us one downstairs. There is a selection relatively inexpensive restaurants in the hotel as well. I would definitely consider staying here again because of the value and the friendliness of the staff. They made our wedding week so memorable.

I first stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel last year and found it lovely. I have been reading some of the reviews on this site as I am just about to return for my second visit there. We had a couple of hiccups when we first checked in - the card reader on the door was a bit sticky, so you had to jiggle the card a little to get in, but it worked. The air con didn't work, but you know what, we didn't need it - a lovely ocean breeze coming in the window was enough! The breakfasts had a lot of pastries, but also had a wonderful fresh fruit salad every day which was just divine! As well as wonderful entertainment every morning. The beach was right across the road, and the trolley cars and tour buses stopped right outside the hotel. We were away from the middle of the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua Ave on the edge of it, right next to the zoo! The staff were all lovely and helpful, and the tour desk staff were so friendly. That is one thing I love about Hawaii - the friendliness of everyone there. Truly, some people will see the bad in everything, but there are others that will do the opposite and see the good. The staff at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel made the stay a comfortable and enjoyable one. Even the homeless on the street didn't detract from that - there's homeless everywhere, including many in my home city of Sydney! I am happy that wi-fi is now more widely available than the last time I was there, but even then it was a good excuse to go and sit down by the pool.....Looking forward to my return early November!

You pay a resort fee and this includes breakfast which has lots of pastries, muffins, cereal, fruit, doughnuts, bagels, juices and coffees. One of the best breakfasts I came across.The room itself was a little dated but they have a PS3 so you can get games or movies, which worked out well as my son was sick for a couple of days. This is also part of the resort fee as well as local calls.Location was good but would not eat at Tikis again.

From our room being downgraded to the $45 in additional REQUIRED fees, to our TV that didnt work, this hotel SUCKS. We slept in our car. Full oceanview means a view of the dumpster and the breakfast consists of cold cereal. Pass on this hotel, we will next time

This place was the most beautiful and relaxing place ever.The staff are so friendly and helpful making you feel welcome.The wifi is super quick and everything is so close to the hotel. It is a major stop for the buses and cable buses and within a stones throw to the gorgeous Waikiki beach.The security is top notch and the decor of the rooms are lovely.Breakfast is included each day and you're able to fill up your cooler bag if you would like to eat back in your room or take for later. The hawaiian singer by the pool at breakfast was wonderful.I recommend this place for anyone to stay as it's so relaxing and pretty.

Stayed here for 5 days in April. Check in/check out were pleasant and the staff was friendly. The rooms were rather small, but appeared and smelled clean. We had a lovely view of both Diamond Head and the beach. People say you pay for the location not the hotel, and it's true.. For the price it could have been much nicer.. BUT not in Hawaii, so I wasn't totally shocked/disappointed. The breakfast is not entirely complimentary as they do charge you an additional fee for it.. it was ok. Bagels, fruit, cereal, and pastries with a variety of drinks. They do offer omelettes for a couple of dollars, which were not bad(although they were egg beaters). The hotel provides each room with a small lunch bag to pack your breakfast in, which was convenient for us to take on our road trip to the North Shore.

We arrived at 2.30am after a 12 hr delay in SFO thanks to Hawaiian Airlines & were greeted kindly with an upgrade so that was a good start. Beds comfortable! Breakfast a disaster! You are supposed to either pack all the highly packaged stuff into a bag & fight for the very limited chairs around the crowded pool or go & eat it on the beach! Very unpleasant scenario & the end result is packaging floating in the pool & pissed off guests cause no one can find a place to sit. The sadest part of it all is the environmental damage all that packaging is doing - it is totally unnecessary-the hotel needs to smarten up! Don't bother with it avoid the grief & eat elsewhere & the hotel should give u the choice to opt out, don't charge the guest the tax! I'm surprised that such a big hotel thinks this is smart business practice?

The beach is directly across the street. It's so close, you can actually walk barefoot. The breakfast is mostly Hawaiian pastries, but the pineapple is to die for. The pool is also relaxing after a day at the beach. Word of advice: don't use the computers downstairs, if they don't print, you will not be refunded any money. Instead of purchasing the excursions with the different kiosks, I suggest you look into purchasing an Oahu Card!

I had a wonderful stay on my honeymoon. The room was upgraded for free once they found out I was on my honeymoon. There were also free DVDs to check out, with our hotel stay. The hotel had a wonderful breakfast that you could bring anywhere with the lunch boxes provided. The only downside is the location. The location is full of homeless people. I walked across the street to the beach to see a man showering (with shorts) in the rinse off section. I also went for a romantic midnight swim with my husband, but to our surprise we found a turd floating in the water. Needless to say the homeless is a issue in the area. Every five feet it seemed as if someone was asking for money. But the hotel was wonderful. It's just the fact that the beach is a prime location for homeless people. Though the big island is said to have less of this issue.

Unfortunately I (and my young son) ended up confronting a burglar in our room. Fortunately, after I screamed at him and snatched my valuables out of his arms, he took off down the hall and no one was hurt. ( I am not a big woman but apparently I can really holler!) The hotel security was very nice in the way they handled the situation and cops were called, etc. As I was traveling on my own with my son, this attention was appreciated and needed.We especially appreciated Vivinne's attentiveness. Such things can and do happen in hotels. In this case, my beach bag (containing shorts, sun screen and my room key) was stolen from the beach. So there was no mystery as to how someone got the key. I went directly to the hotel to report this and also mentioned my concern about returning to my room knowing that my key had been taken. But the receptionist did not take my fears seriously and said there was no way anyone could find out which room we were in. Wrong.After the incident, we were moved to an "upgraded" room...which appeared to be just like the one we were in before with the exception that the tv didn't work (had to call maintenance) and the fact that BOTH beds had sheets with huge holes. GAH! On check out we were told that Nicole from the hotel would be calling to speak with me about the burglary incident. No call received. I ended up calling a month later, leaving a message, received a call back a week later, only to have Nicole inform me know that the hotel's insurance wouldn't cover my stolen property. Um, what stolen property.....I retrieved it myself supermom style. I explained that I simply wanted them to review their security policy, let the front desk know that guests concerns regarding security should be taken seriously, and that they needed to revisit their idea (which she repeated countess times) that there is no way a burglar can find their way to the correct room with the room key. Nicole said the hotel would be in touch. That was three months ago. Apparently these issues are not a great concern. Pity.Burglary and holes aside: Would I stay here again? No....the place seemed tired and a bit grotty. I like the previous reviewer's comment about the Aston being an "aging Motel Six, but a high-rise." That pretty much sums it up.

The best thing about this hotel it its location. You are just a few steps from Waikiki, around the corner from the Honolulu Zoo, and the Waikiki Trolley stops right at the door so you can get around Downtown pretty easily on that without a car. The view of Waikiki was almost perfect from the 24th floor, and I could clearly see the fireworks let off at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on the Friday night I was there. I didn't have any issues with noise from other rooms or from the street, and as a solo female traveller I felt safe and secure in my room. I couldn't get the wi-fi to work in my room, but there was a wired connection for my laptop. I didn't have the breakfast on offer, so can't comment on that. The hotel staff I came into contact with were all friendly. They checked me in and out quickly and without any incident. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. The beds were comfortable. It was clearly an old hotel, but they've put enough work into it so that you don't feel like you're stuck in 80s hell. It's nothing flash--not particularly 'Hawaiian', not contemporary or glamorous or chic--but it's fine. It does the job its meant to do.The only issue I had was the shower. The shower head was so low that I had to bend over to wash my hair (I'm 5'7, hardly a giant), and there's no way of raising it. And as for the flow, you know that episode of Seinfeld where Kramer discovers they're putting low flow shower heads into the building, so he buys something that's used to clean elephants on the black market? I think Aston Waikiki Beach did the same thing. I was practically pinned against the opposite wall from the spray every morning. Try as I might, I couldn't fix that either. On the plus side, it sure does blast away all the errant grains of sand stuck on you from the beach.Overall, the hotel is totally fine for a few days while you explore the island. You're paying for the location, not the hotel. Keep that in mind. For the price you pay you'd normally expect a better hotel, but this is Waikiki. A three-star hotel for a 4-star and above price.

Stay was 9/22-25/2013. Honolulu hotels are very expensive. So to get on Waikiki on a budget, this maybe an answer, but don't expect much. I had read the reviews and was concerned going into this hotel, so I did not have high expectations. Think of an aging Motel Six, but a high-rise. Don't drag your bags up to the second floor unless you know you can check in as an early check in is unlikely. You may need to leave your bags with a porter that's on the 1st floor arrival area. Morning breakfast is a waste of time. Better breakfast options are nearby. Pool is tiny. In the shade until afternoon, smaller than most backyard pools and not deep. Its on the second floor. Ten man homeless troupe on the corner, creepy. Beach conveniently across the street, but other than the seawall protected area, it is not too good for casual swimming. Underwater rocks will bang up your feet or worse. Strong pull of the waves. Plenty of HPD walking the beach. Short walk to restaurants and luxury row of shops. Nice sunset views. Starbucks and Subway on the corner and close by. Room decor is quite dated, but reasonably clean. In room safe is handy. Room is very small, especially with four bags for a lengthy stay. One chair balcony and is very small. Bathroom pretty small and unvented, steams up easily. Beds soft and ok. Not likely to get an early check in as cleaning staff is short and slow. Late check out is about $20/two hours up to six hours ($75) IF you can get it, but bell hops will hold your bags if you have a late flight out. Maybe a 2.5 star hotel. Tip: Stay on another island like Maui and do a day trip in into Honolulu/Oahu for sightseeing. Did not care for the big city feel nor for the rude/entitled Asians that make up 80% of the tourists in Honolulu. Did not see much of this on Maui. Honolulu is not a relaxing place for a vacation. You can get by here, but would not want to stay more than two days.

The rooms were clean and quiet, not big, but ok just for sleeping in and enjoy the view. The breakfast, once you got used to the little lunch box idea was ok, just a bit difficult to find a place to sit with your breky, BUT the Hawaiian singers and the dancer in the mornings were lovely to listen to. Sure you don't get greeted with a lei, but the services and cleanliness just a short walk to enjoy the beach, the Waikiki ocean pools, the ZOO or the main strip of attractions and shops make up for it. We would go again.

We arrived at the Hotel at 08.30 am, the shuttle dropped us off outside where we had to struggle with our bags, no porter to meet us. We then had to find our own way to reception which was on the first floor.No directions, no help from porters.Upon checking in we were told that check in is not until after 1.30 pm and that if we wanted to check in now we could upgrade our rooms for an extra $60 a night! we were here for two weeks so declined the offer. When asked what we were to do for 5 hours the receptionist just shrugged his shoulders.We asked a guest at the hotel what to do and she told us we can leave our bags downstairs with the bell hop if we wanted to have a walk around Waikiki. So we struggled down stairs with our bags again, once more no help from the Hotel.After a 9 hour flight and no sleep in 28 hours we were not impressed.When we finally got in our rooms we were even more disappointed. Small,dirty, the verandah was so small you could not put a chair on it. The bathroom was old looking with a bath tub and shower screen and a small dirty shower head.The silicone around the bath tub was missing and the water pressure was very weak.There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, i expect this from a 3 star room let alone a 4.5 star. The ceiling was stained the carpet thread bare in places.I asked for a kettle which was brought up an hour later but most mornings the cleaning staff removed it.The swimming pool area was a disappointment, the painted concrete around the pool was old and sections had been repaired but not painted.The toilet in the pool area was disgusting, ceiling panels falling down, urinals dirty and falling off the wall, tiles broken and smelled.The so called "Breakfast on the Beach" every morning that was advertised and was one of the deciding factors in us booking this Hotel was a joke!. You got a small cooler bag in your room and you were supposed to fill it with the continental break fast and take it across the street to the beach ha ha, most people sat around the pool on the few tables and chairs and sun beds, if none were left which was most of the time then you took it back to your room.On the positive the location of the hotel was not to bad. Its the last hotel on the strip and is next to the Zoo. Tikis bar and grill which is on the pool deck is very good and has live music most nights, the food is excellent as is the service. There is also a Pizza cafe on the ground floor as well as a Starbucks around the corner.All in all i would not recommend this hotel if you are expecting a 4.5 star rating. Expect a 2 or 3 star and you will not be disappointed.

My husband and I stayed here for 1 night so that we could see Pearl Harbor. This hotel is absolutely disgusting. I cannot believe we paid this much for such a dump. The concrete around the pool is severely cracked and the pool area is swarming with gross birds. The so called breakfast is awful and so overcrowded there is no where to sit. This place is not relaxing or comfortable. The room was okay but the grout and floor were gross. I will not only never stay here or in Waikiki again. The smell of sewage is awful and this poor island has become bum central.

This was just another hotel that you would find on the mainland. No fancy greeting-no flower leis and expect to carry your own luggage UP to check in, to the room and to the STREET for airport pickup. Not on the beach-across the very busy street was the beach. Never asked why we were in Hawaii or made us feel special. The pool was right next to check in so that was awkward. And the 'breakfast on the beach or poolside' was a tiny lunch bag to fill with donuts. After two coffees and two donuts the souvenir bag was full. When you have a family of four and only allowed one trip through the donuts line it just was not enough for a family. Waikiki just like California-shops are too expensive and very crowded. This is not the dream Hawaii you think of. Also note that there are a huge number of homeless people in Waikiki-they do not bother you but they are everywhere. The elevators were the only fun part of this hotel! And the tour guides were very fun and friendly!

We had our high school cross country team stay here for 4 nights. We couldn't have asked for better service. Candace Yeun the group sales manager was awesome! She took care of everything for us. We had a partial ocean view, clean rooms, great breakfast, great location, good price for Waikiki Beach, aloha spirit from all the employees except one valet parking attendant, and so much more. I will say that I would not want a room next an ice machine. We didn't but while getting ice one night it dawned on me that the people in the room across from it must be going crazy if they are trying to sleep. The elevator system was not confusing for us. The hotel had been renovated since our first stay 11 years ago. It was clean and made the Hawaii experience special for our team. Thank you Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel!

The hotel staff was very friendly andd helpful. We Stayed for our 15 year wedding anniversary and had a great time. When we arrived, the room we were given did not have a good view so I asked if I could pay for an upgraded room. When I mentioned that we were there for our anniversary we were upgraded for free. The view from the new room was beautiful. Location of this hotel is great. We loved the music and hula dancer at breakfast, and Tiki's is one of the best bars on the strip. Room was a little dated and in need of an upgrade, but it was clean and included WiFi. Definitely recommend parking by the zoo for free vice $27 per night. It's worth the 5 min walk to the car. Also recommend reserving an ocean view room because the standard room view is not that great. Overall very happy and I would recommend this place to friends.

Purchased an ocean front room for a sleep over night for my daughter and her friends. I've stayed at this property at least 5 tines in the past but this one was a bit more disappointing than the others. In fact each stay has been less memorable than the last. So this visit- upon check in, advised "system was down" so we needed to wait by the pool (which was cordoned off in a very tacky rope fencing until system was back up again. - upon check in I was made to sign a document stating that any smoking in the room or on the lanai (balcony) would result in a $275 cleaning fee. To our surprise the room already smelled like it had been smoked in for several months upon our opening the door. The cigarette smell was in the AC and was with us the entire time. Disappointing for a $300/nite room. - valet parking is$27 / day plus tips ! Why? How do you justify this charge Aston?! Ridiculous IMO - fees are confusing. Breakfast was covered in check in briefing as being included. But documents provided say its part of a $18 a night resort amenity fee. Is that fee per person? Need to clay spell out what is included and what is an additional charge. Aston brand is not Marriott, Hyatt, Hilton etc but at this tine and after this recent experience mid suggest an Aqua or Doubletree hotel before the Aston Waikiki Beach.

We loved the location of this hotel. It's on the far end, near the zoo. It's a perfect place for families. The beach is calm and perfect for relaxing. We bought mats at the ABC Store for $3.60, they inflate them for you, and floated in the water just relaxing.In the morning they serve a continental breakfast by the pool. We packed ours up, got some towels and chairs from the pool attendant and ate our breakfast on the beach... What a great way to start the day. Waikiki is a long beach so be prepared to do some walking to see all of the shops and various places on the beach for swimming, surfing and relaxing. The staff were very nice and helpful, they helped make our stay very comfortable.Our room was fairly small but clean and a perfect place to sleep. This hotel is set up for those travelers that don't spend time in their room, but prefer to go to the beach, pool or go for a walk.We got a room with a view of Waikiki, it's worth it to pay a little more and see the sunset from the balcony. We also woke up to a beautiful rainbow. So cool.This is a great location for families with the calm water at the beach, the pool and easy access to the zoo. Also lots of places to get kid friendly fast food. Hope this helps, enjoy!

It's got a great location opposite the beach with a swimming pool overlooking the beachfront.However the breakfast is ok if you like everything sugary. You pay for hot food like an omelette. There's free wifi at the poolside but realistically if you ant wifi in your room it's approx $20/ day and about $3.50/day for the in room safe. There's no facility to make a coffee or tea in your room either. It could all be so much better........

My husband and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel in Oct of 2012. Our stay was perfect. The room was an Oceanview Select room and it was big enough for us. The decor was very pretty and very colorful. Our view was so nice and we were just in awe of all that we could see from our lanai. The service was awesome and everyone at the hotel was so friendly and polite. The breakfast on the beach was delicious. They had a great variety of pastries, yogurts, cereals, muffins, croissants and also made to order omelettes for a minimal price. They even had miso soup and kimchi for breakfast among several beverage options. They also had a hula dancer dancing along to some beautiful hawaiian music that was played live by a very nice man( wish I could remember his name :/)  The hotel charges an amenity fee of $18.00 per day. You can watch movies and use the facilities. They offer beach towels among other services. The hotel is well kept and they also have a little gift shop by the valet parking area. They have several food options downstairs and near by the hotel. Parking was an issue but we parked at the Honolulu Zoo for $1.00 per hour. Just make sure to lock your doors and keep your belongings out of sight when parked at the zoo. Over all I was very pleased with our stay and looking forward to returning soon:) Aloha!!

Amazing beachfront view room. And the room was very spacious. Breakfast was great - we would just get our food and head back to our room. Gym was well set up. . Tikis Restaurant had fantastic and reasonably priced food.

It's at the one end if Waikiki opposit the beach, right by the pier going out to the surf. We wee up on the 21st floor away from all the traffic and bar entertainment noise. Staff we fantastic and helpful.

2 adults and 2 young kids. The location of the hotel was right across the beach. We rented a car and the parking was an extra cost like other hotels in this area. Tip. Park the car in front of the zoo for free. We did that as the free parking was right near the hotel. Safe. That made this hotel the best location to me. Breakfast buffet at the poolside was good. Few otemssuch as onigiri rice runs out half way Iinto the breakfast hour and, for unkniwn reason, they don't make enough to last the whole breakfast hour. The staffs were amazing and helpful and the facility had everything our family could think of. I recommend this hotel.

The hotel has a free breakfast every morning with Hawian entertainment. It's a very nice hotel and staff. It is right across from the beach. I would reccomened this hotel to my family and friends. It is a little expensive but so are all the hotels in Waikiki.

We took a very last-minute trip to Honolulu over Labor Day weekend. We found a great deal with AWB through Expedia. At first, I was hesitant to book with AWB because I read reviews that said the hotel was very outdated and dirty. I agree that the hotel rooms can do with refurbishment- esp the bathrooms- but the overall hotel premises were very well kept and we saw employees constantly cleaning, dusting, and picking up after guests.PROS:1. GREAT location & amazing balcony views2. All the employees were so helpful and nice3. Free breakfast (although, it would be nice to have a little bit of variety every few days- but this is being nitpicky. lol)4. Free beach chairs (as long as you bring it back before 6pm)5. Kid friendly poolCONS:1. Rooms need some refurbishment, esp the bathrooms. Our toilet leaked whenever we would flush. The bathtubs were very slow to drain (important when you have little kids)2. Rooms were on the small side. Even with just two normal-sized suitcases and a fold-up umbrella stroller, we had no room to really walk around.3. Beach towels & beach chairs must be returned by 6pm; otherwise, you get charged a fee. I get that they need to take inventory, but sundown wasn't until past 7pm. Our child still wanted to swim in the ocean and play on the beach, but because of the towel rule, we had to scamper back to the hotel by 6pm. Inconvenient.Overall, I would rate this property as 3.5 stars. Despite the cons, my family & I would definitely return.

we got put into a double bed room requested to be king size bed. Also, we paid for ocean view and we got a back yard view instead. we walked into our room, washroom light didnt want to turn on. This is more like a 1 star hotel not 4.5 stars hotel when i did research before booking. Terrible experience. It probably be our last time staying at any aston hotel.

Check in was long. As mentioned previously by others the hotel does need a revamp but our room was very clean. The breakfast is ok for a few days but after 5 days all I was longing for a piece of toast! I would have liked tea making facilities in my room.Location was the quieter end of the strip and a fair walk to the popular restaurants and shops. We would probably prefer to stay at the busier end as we have done previously.

Loved the decor of the hotel and the location for the time that we stayed in Waikiki. The room was clean, wifi worked fine and the beach was right there. The "free" breakfast was a celebration of carbohydrates and sugar (and most likely sweeteners) unless you paid extra for some eggs. Kona coffee was a plus. The staff that we met at the front desk were generally helpful but just be aware that they might not know everything ref. hotel policy. We called from the room to ask if all the local calls were free and got the answer "Yes.". When the payment time came we found out that the local calls we'd made were charged. I.e. conflicting information from the staff vs. the information written on the phone. Would like to extend an extra thanks to the cleaning staff that greeted us with great "aloha" every morning we left the room. :-) Still puts a smile on my face. Hotel valet parking is expensive. Would recommend to look into other parking facilities just around the corner for almost half priced options.

Just a room very clean very nice has fridge and coffee maker.clean and tidy very comfortable Really liked it and would recommend to anyone nothing else only a reception behind glass Location was perfect

Overall this was a wonderful hotel to stay at. You get breakfast, wifi, unlimited movies everyday for an extra $18. Parking costs around $27 a day as well. With parking you can take it in and out as much as you wish. The great thing about this hotel is the treats they give you in the room. It's free and they are delicious. The room is also very comfortable with an i player and a wonderful view!!! We stayed on the 24th floor - the 25th floor is the last floor. The elevator is interesting you swipe your card, type in your room number and it directs you to the elevator to hop in and it takes you directly there. One thing that I found a little disappointing was the breakfast. They do a wonderful job of offering a cooler and encouraging you to have breakfast on the beach - but they do this as the breakfast area has very limited seating. Also the breakfast is very unhealthy. You are only offered cereal, pastries, fruit and drinks (juice, tea, coffee etc.) and you have to put it in the cooler you are given in your room. There is no tray so if you decide to eat around the pool (with the limited seating); it's a balancing act. The added annoyance is that you are only allowed to go and get breakfast once. If you want to have anything more you are welcome to omlettes and french toast - but they are an extra $5 each. Overall expect to pay a lot in Hawaii - everything costs something. The beach is just across the road and it is fantastic. The Aston is in a really good spot and you can walk everywhere. It's great!

We stayed here for only 2 nights, had a partial ocean view which was fantastic! The room was clean and welcoming. The elevators have a unusual system which gets you to your floor quickly, we really enjoyed the breakfast buffet, lots of local flavours to try, fresh fruit, and good variety of things. We found all the staff we encountered very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

My family and I went to Hawaii for vacation this summer and we stayed here the first night after arrived Honolulu. The hotel is beautiful and new. Staffs were very friendly and welcoming. We even got free drinks from the bar before we checked-in. We lived in a ocean-view room; it was big and clean. And because we got to live in the highest floor of the hotel, the view was amazing! There were also free breakfast in the morning near the pool and wifi in the hotel. My family and I had a great time over here and we will definitely come back and visit again!

I haven't even left yet and yet I feel a need to write this review. I stayed 8 nights here and had an issue for several of the days. Upon check in we were given the wrong room and had to drag all our stuff back downstairs in order to get the room corrected after having to wait 15 minutes to see if they had the room I paid for "available". I had a car for 3 days and was charged for 4. Had to have them remove a day. Which getting a hold of the front desk is pretty difficult as no one answers the continuously ringing phone. I called to find out about a late check out to which the front desk person put me on hold for 5 minutes before rudely picking it up and saying "I'm checking people in right now & don't have time to check. I'll call you back." Then called me back 10 minutes later to tell me I'd have to ask again the day before I checked out or he morning of. The next day we had no hot water! My boyfriend called down, he was told by a woman she would check with maintenance and then call back and never did. I got up the next morning to take a shower and AGAIN no hot water. I called down the manager Nicole told me she would check with maintenance and call me back to which I informed her I expected a call back unlike yesterday when they didn't feel a need to return the call. Waited 30 minutes for her call back to be told I had to wait another 30-45 minutes for the boiler to turn on. But as an "accommodation" she would let me check out at 2pm for free. Sorry but that's not equivalent to the problem, but I told her I would accept that for a start. I went downstairs this morning to talk to a manager (I didn't know it was her the day before) and instead of getting me a manager he proceeds to spew out he can only do 2pm. I again repeated when does the manager arrive to which he told me 7am. I returned at 7:30 am to be told I already spoke with the manager yesterday. I politely told him I wanted to speak with her again and he told me well she's in at 8 am I'll have her call you. I'm in Hawaii, I'm not sitting around on my last day waiting for a call. So I informed him of that. So now I'm waiting for a cell phone call. I hope we can come to a better "accommodation" because it will truly define whether or not I return to this hotel. However, if you don't have issues the rooms are clean and the hotel is right across from the beach. We didn't like the breakfast, every time we ate it we seemed to be sick for the day. It's continental unless you want to pay $5 for an omelet, $3 for a waffle (plus tax of course because the tax you ridiculous here).

We stayed here for 7 nights last week. It has mixed reviews but our stay was great. The room was standard size and a great view of the ocean. The balcony size has been commented on previous reviews but was pretty standard for a hotel room for 2 to sit and watch the amazing sunsets. Staff were nice and welcoming. The room could definitely do with a coffee machine though. Breakfast was quirky down by the pool and a bit of a free for all but it was different!Tikis bar was great and staff really friendly, food was really nice with good cocktails. The pool is a little small and could do with some freshening up.I can imagine how busy that will get however with the beach directly across the road it's not too big a deal. Waikiki was amazing we had a great time and I would definitely recommend the hotel but recommend you book ocean view rooms.

I reserved the two rooms for my family from Aug. 21 to Aug. 24, 2013. The staff arrange two rooms that located in different floor. Besides, both of these room have ice maker just right in front of our door. There were always have people take ice cubes during midnight. We asked them to change our room, they did changed, but their attitude is very bad. My father doubted that the staff have discrimination to the Asian people for arrange those bad rooms for us.Here are some reminders for the people who want to stay here: 1. They only provide the valet parking which charge $27. I suggest you can park in the zoo's parking lot. It also very close to this hotel, one hour only charge $1.2. You will be require to pay $ 18 per night/room for your breakfast and Wifi. They will provide a small bag for you to pick up your breakfast. If you want to eat at the poolside, that will be very hard to find a place to sit.Anyway, This hotel only worth for their good location. They provide the worst service that I never seen. We won't stay and recommend this hotel again.這次的家庭出遊，我負責訂房，8/21-8/24的兩間雙人房，結果櫃台故意安排不同樓層，且兩間都門一打開就看到製冰機的房間。到凌晨四點多都有房客拿冰塊，加上房間隔音又不好，一直聽到門外和隔壁的嬉鬧聲。家人也質疑是否該旅館歧視亞洲人？故意安排沒人要的房間給我們？總之，服務極差，只有地點好還算不錯。建議考慮本旅館的人：1.他們停車只提供代客泊車，要價一天27美金，不如考慮就停在附近的動物園停車場，一小時只要1美元，還可自由進出。2.很多旅客在訂房時沒注意，一個房間一晚還要額外收取設備服務費18美元，可以使用wifi和早餐。房間會提供一個小袋子讓你在泳池邊領取食物帶走。但如果要坐在泳池邊享用的話，可能很難搶到座位。

Hotel checked us in earlier which was great as our overseas long flight arrived early in the morning and check in isn't until 3pm.Room was a little smaller and a bit older than I had expected.it was neat but bathroom could definitely do with an update, tiles are old and whole room in general is not inviting.The biggest problem with our trip was items that went "missing". On the last day when we were packing up we realised that during our 4 night stay, to which we only had our room serviced once, the following went missing. Iphone 5, my fiance's deodorant and my daughters body board which we had only just purchased at the beginning of the trip. Iphone 5, i only noticed on the last day was missing as it was my "australian" phone so wasn't using it, I had been using my "US" phone. The Iphone 5 eventually turned up between the mattresses of the king size bed. How it got there none of us can work out as my fiance and I both saw it in my handbag and neither of us would "hide" something between the mattress.As for the deodorant and the body board, they never turned up!!!If it wasn't for the missing items I would give the hotel a rating of average as it is in a great location, the breakfast each morning was good for a continental style breakfast. unfortunately due to the missing items I won't be going back nor will I recommend to friends.The other negative on the last day we needed to print out our boarding documents, there is no business centre or 'free' service. We were directed to a VERY expensive computer and printer where we had to pay for internet and the printer. It cost us $20 to print out 4 boarding passes. Not a great way to end the trip.

This was a great find. Comfortable rooms. Ours had a balcony with a great view. The breakfast setup was a little chaotic but it worked for us. Great restaurant/bar attached to the hotel if we didn't want to walk too far. Altogether magical, sun, sea, warmth and a comfortable hotel on the beach. What more could we want?
user_name:
Juliet J
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: My husband and I stayed here at the end of July. We were looking for a hotel that had a great location (somewhere close to Waikiki Beach) that wouldn't break the bank. The Aston was definitely what we were looking for. The hotel is located right across the street from Waikiki Beach! We had a great view without having to spend a fortune.While the hotel was great, there were always long lines at the front desk. We probably waited thirty minutes to an hour just to check in. Another downside was the "breakfast on the beach". Sadly, they advertise that breakfast is on the beach, but it is actually served around their pool and they offer a cooler to take your breakfast over to the beach. Definitely a bummer when we found out about that. The breakfast was ridiculously crowded, especially for the small offering they had. On the bright side, we used the valet parking daily as it was so convenient and the valets were very friendly! The movie rental was also a bonus as we could stay in and watch a movie if we wanted for free. Overall, we liked the hotel and would definitely recommend for the great location!

Stayed four times at this hotel that seems like a resort rather than an average hotel. Complimentary buffet breakfast every morning by the pool with hotel issued totes to take over on beach if you prefer. Excellent service by staff. No request too small. Within short e\walking distance of Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium. One half block to second story open restaurant with seating facing the ocean just across street. Will be back for a fifth stay before I see the Grim reaper.

I know, it's not the newest hotel, rooms a little bit small, but it's right at the center of Waikiki beach, what do you want more? Compared to their neighbours, its so inexpensive that you can book 10 days instead of 7...

The hotel is located directly across from Waikiki beach. The views are fantastic. The breakfast every morning were very good, but it was a little bit of a mad house when we would go. There is not enough seating for everyone. Tiki's was on site, and we eat a lot of our evening meals there. The food was excellent, and I still think of the appetizer that I got there every once in a while. If I am ever blessed enough to be able to go back, I will definitely stay there again.
