We stayed at the Aston Waikiki for six nights, we will be back. The Aston was welcoming and its a great location at the Diamond Head end of the strip. The rooms were clean, bathrooms a bit dated but it certainly did the job, you dont spend much time in the room - you are in Honolulu there are better things to be doing. Our 12 year old son enjoyed the pool and the beach over the road and would be back on the plane tomorrow to go back.The brekkie is great, its a good way to start the day and there is plenty to choose from.
user_name:
Kaye F
Wellington, Wellington, New Zealand

review_body: My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary at Waikiki Beach. I wanted a hotel where we could see the ocean from our room and easily get to the beach. This hotel is across the street from a beautiful beach park and very close to the zoo and aquarium. The staff were friendly, the rooms were nicely decorated and clean, the free breakfast was just enough (assorted cereals; yogurt with local flavors such as mango, papaya, and coconut; assorted pastries; fresh fruit salad, and coffee/tea/juice. You could also purchase omelets and waffles at a reasonable price. Seating around the pool was very limited but we didn't mind taking the food to our room. We also had a refrigerator and a coffee maker in the room. The coffee was perfectly fine for my husband but I was thrilled that there was a Starbucks next to the hotel on the street level. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was small but had everything we needed. The room was plenty of space for two people. We had two queen beds, a large dresser, a table and two chairs, a desk, and a soft chair. We really only used the room to sleep as we spent most of our time touring, walking along Kalakaua Avenue, or at the beach. Even though we didn't have a car except for one day, public transportation was very accessible. There were many island tours available for a fee and the trolley lines and the free shopping vans all stopped at the hotel. The elevators were amazingly efficient. By scanning your room card and entering your floor, you were directed to one of six elevators. You never had to wait more than a minute and you never stopped at more than two other floors. The International Market Place was only six blocks away with lots of shops and restaurants in between. Our favorite restaurant was the Chinese seafood restaurant in the lower level of the Hyatt Regency Waikiki. Not only was the food excellent but the early bird specials were very reasonably priced. I will definitely return to the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel.

We were fortunate enough to have a balcony on the 14th floor overlooking Waikiki beach. Rooms a bit small but decorated lovely and the views!!. Not mad about the breakfast set up but fine, can take a packed breakky and enjoy the beautiful beach.

Best location for sure! Walk to the beach right across the street. Restaurants all over the place! We walked to the Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium too! Great location, rooms were nice! Pool deck needed a little love. But, with the ocean right across the street we never went in it any way. B.O.B Was awesome! Breakfast On the Beach! They give you a little ice chest to fill up for free every morning to take to the beach! That was great!!! Enjoy!

Rooms were excellent and the service was even better. Great check in personnel and friendly valet service made vacation a vacation. Located at the center of the beach area and near most tof the best restaurants put most necessities at walking distance.

Would recommend to other people, and would stay there if we visit there again. The location was nice and away from other hotels, yet the transportation to the attractions were still available. We were able to switch rooms easily when we weren't happy with a room that shares a wall with the elevators (which was loud). The rooms were clean and very modern.

You just can't beat the location of the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel - it's literally opposite the beach, just cross the road and you are on white sand, at the quieter (better, in my opinion) end of the beach.We had a lovely stay here recently- our warm welcome started before we'd even arrived when Rebecca in Guest Services responded promptly to my email regarding our room request. Upon arriving, check-in was friendly and swift - and our room was as we requested.This hotel is spotlessly clean - housekeeping do a fabulous job - in fact, all the staff do a fabulous job. Our room was on the 17th floor with a lovely view of the ocean. As mentioned in other reviews, this hotel is not ultra modern - but I liked the quirky charm of the traditional decor - and the room was spotless. The bathrooms are not modern - but as I didn't go to Hawaii to look at granite countertops in my hotel bathroom, this did not bother me in the slightest - the bathrooms are clean, well stocked, and the shower had good water pressure with plenty of hot water ( not that you really need it in Hawaii!)I thought that the $18 per day per room resort fee was well worth it - my 11 year old took full advantage of the Playstation 3 and free games when the sun got too much for him. We also watched several dvd movies when we returned to the room after dinner. Included in the resort fee is the DVD/games rentals / wifi / breakfast / in-room safe / towels for pool + beach.The breakfast is around the pool every morning - yes it can get a bit monotonous but it is perfectly adequate with variety and it is well stocked - we probably had the breakfast 3 times in the 7 days we were there.The pool area is lovely - spotless pool, plenty of sun beds and not too busy.Would I recommend this hotel - absolutely! I think this is a perfect family hotel. Would I return to this hotel - you bet! I've travelled to a lot of places around the world and stayed in many hotels and there was something very warm and welcoming about the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.

Hotel was ok Amazing Ocean front View However no room service, outdated rooms We loved the Tiki Bar and GrillFun Times . Hawaii is just a Gorgeous Place Would try a newer upscale Hotel .............You live and you learn :-)))GT

First of all Thank You Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel!! I stayed here for 4 days with my family and we loved this hotel. I was blessed with a beautiful view of Diamond head and watched the sunrise every morning. The staff here are easy going and very friendly. Truly nice people who really care,we received warm family like service from everyone. True aloha spirit here. unlike some other places we visited.The staff here is top notch. We loved the free breakfast. Yes free breakfast. We must have saved $200 on breakfast and hours of time. we sat on the pool cabanas every morning amused by the birds who will keep the area crumb free. I loved the macadamia nut muffins mmmmmmm! I had a fresh waffle every morning for only $3.00. you heard it right $3.00 for a fresh hot waffle with whipped cream and strawberries. I wish I was having one now! I loved the room it was decorated nicely and had plenty of room for the four of us. We really like the attention to detail like pillows with different firmness. nice touch. Don't believe the negative revues this hotel is fantastic and I would stay here again and again! Thanks again Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Mahalo! From Bill Davis and family

We stayed in the Marriott for 3 days prior to moving to the Aston Waikiki Beach. We have gone to the Tiki Bar and Grill many times over the past 5 years that we wanted to try the hotel to see if it warranted a greater stay in the future. We had room 603, it was slightly larger than a closet. they was only 3 feet of space around the entire bed. Very confining and my wife who is slightly clastraphobic had a problem with it. Love the location to the beach, great perk was the beach chairs that were given to guests to use on the beach. Pool is used very little. Tiki's is great, spent many days there.They have a $18 per day resort fee for a very basic continental breakfast. I would have much rather gone to many of the other breakfast places for the same price or less. Starbucks is better and cheaper. Free DVD's, who cares.....I'm in Hawaii, not to view movies in my tiny box room.The in room products are very good and the water temp and pressure extremely good, much better than the Marriott. Probably won't return, unless we got a suite.

At first we had some glitches with reservation/billing because we were promised one thing & when I called to confirm, it appears they were not supposed to have promised us that. A couple of conversations later, it became clear that they intended to uphold their promise. It took some effort, but their intentions seemed honest. Arlyn saw to it that our billing was happily uneventful. :) We had some mixed feelings about the breakfast set-up, but, it grew on us, and compared to other available local options, it was really pretty innovative overall. They give you a cooler bag to keep that you fill every morning with an extended continental breakfast & some fancier prepared extras for a very low price. My husband had the great idea of actually bringing breakfast up to the balcony, so that was nice. The staff is very upbeat and ready to serve. The rooms are clean. We had an oceanfront room on the 9th floor-excellent view! I wanted more seating on the balcony, but when we tried to manage that, it became obvious why there wasn't more. (small) The room was sort of tight, but we had the room we needed. Wi-Fi was touch & go, but mostly good--better than we had been warned about with that area's hotel wifi. Great big TV. The a/c turns off while the balcony door is open--I didn't like this feature, but frankly, if I were them, I might've arranged that, too. On a similar budget, we may go back to the same place and type of room. Waikiki was very city-like ( like a cross between NYC without the shows & a super gorgeous beach ) , so, the biggest reason we are not likely to go back there is simply because we'd seek out a different atmosphere next time for variety, maybe on another island. (but Waikiki was indeed absolutely stunning!)

LOCATION 1: Directly across the street from Waikiki. The oceanfront view room is impressive. In fact, the beach area in front of the hotel has a concrete barrier such that the water is calmer and has much less rocks than adjacent area. Perfect for kids.LOCATION 2: This hotel is near the Diamond Head side. If you want that iconic picture of you sunbathing with Diamond Head & Waikiki backdrop, you would need to walk to the other side of the beach.ROOM CONDITION: The door lock doesn't lock well. Bathroom sink leaks profusely. Very clean and comfy otherwise in a relatively small room.BREAKFAST ON THE BEACH: Included in the $19 daily fee is a purple bag which you may use to collect continental breakfast once between 6:30am - 9:00am. Hot items are extra (egg / hot noodle / Belgian Waffles etc). STAFF: Friendly overall. The valet parking is very prompt. The housekeeping is rather pathetic. Front-desk could be slow but that's because they are very attentive ti each guest. CONVENIENCE: Easy for *everything*.....except those weird elevators. Once you park your car, you could press *STAR* to reach the check-in lobby on the 3rd floor. But to reach any other floor, you must swipe your own card key then enter your floor on the keypad to be assigned to one of the 5 or 6 elevators to use. Now, going down is more weird. You could press *STAR* to reach the lobby on the 3rd floor, but you CANNOT get to the ground floor directly. You must exit on the 3rd floor, press 1 on the elevator key pads, then be assigned one of the other elevators to reach the street level.VALUE: Should have been 5 stars if that damn sink doesn't leak.

Check-in on a Saturday afternoon was a bad surprise. The lobby is on the 3rd floor and the line for check-in was backed up through the lobby to the elevators. We stood in line with our luggage for about 45 minutes.Expect to pay an excessive, daily "gratuity fee" for features and services you won't use and don't care about.The only restaurant attached to the hotel is casual, but it has comfortable outdoor tables overlooking the beach.The included breakfast is a poolside buffet. You're given a bag in which to collect sweet rolls, coffee, miso soup and fruit. (lots of plastic containers) Carry your juice in your free hand and try to find a table. There's a hula dancer and a guitarist-singer for entertainment during breakfast.We had a couple of unpleasant experiences with housekeeping oversights, but once these were brought to the attention of the desk clerk in the lobby, a credit (for the gratuity fee) was issued.

Staff was nice, but rooms we had were not what we paid/requested, they ended up upgrading the room for us which was generous.PS3 in the room which kept me happy for couple of hours.Found bugs in our bedroom. A bit moist but I guess because of the location. Expedia counter was quite helpful. We only stayed for one night though.Breakfast wasn't the best as people had to push in to grab the foods.Overall was quite nice and I don't mind going back there again.

Having booked the hotel through Priceline where you don't see the hotel you've got until you've paid, I read the reviews for the hotel and was a little disappointed by the comments I read. The trip was a special 20th wedding anniversary celebration together with some friends getting married on the island. I contacted the hotel with my concerns and was really pleased to get an immediate reply promising that I would like the hotel and my stay there. On arrival the hotel looked really nice and the staff were very friendly. We had a great week at the hotel and I would definitely return if I was going back to Waikiki. The only thing I would say is that the breakfast is a little basic but compared to the high prices of the local restaurants for breakfast I couldn't complain. Maybe I went with lower expectations than some of the other reviewers so the standard was high. Give it a go you might be pleasantly surprised as I was.

I traveled to Oahu for my first time with my best friend this past June and we had an incredible time! We were nervous to book this hotel due to mixed reviews we had come across online, but we took a leap of faith and we're so glad we did! The staff was incredibly courteous, the room was adorably decorated and though our view wasn't "incredible" we really didn't mind since we were rarely inside during the day (and if you're camped out in your hotel room while you're in Hawaii, you're doing Hawaii wrong!). The hotel is LITERALLY across the street from Waikiki Beach. There are so many places that are walking distance from the hotel (including a zoo!) and that was a big plus for us, it was fun to go exploring. The pool/bar area was fun, there was live music, delicious drinks and great food! There was a free breakfast buffet included which was your standard continental breakfast, nothing special. Though they do offer a "Breakfast on the Beach" service, which we sadly didn't take advantage of (we were too busy!). The only thing knocking this down from an excellent to a very good is the bathroom was a tad bit old and had a slightly mildewy smell, but honestly it was worth it.
user_name:
LBShelby
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Just got back from first trip to Hawaii and stayed here for 6 nights, 17-23 August. After finalising and paying for the booking, I read several bad reviews and so was not sure what to expect. We arrived at noon and were advised that there was a room available straight away if we wanted to upgrade to an ocean front room (1731) which we did. The room had a panoramic view of Waikiki and was well worth the price for the upgrade. The continental breakfast was good and there was plenty of cereal, fruit, yoghurt, croissants, coffee, etc. There were also hot breakfast options for an additional price but we were quite happy with the healthy options available. We found this hotel was well located, had great dining options whatever your budget and the staff were efficient and friendly. We were more than happy with the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and Its a property that we would have no problems in recommending. Luckily we didn't ready the "bad"reviews until after we paid for the booking. Suffice to say that unfortuantely, certain people will always find something negative to say, even if they stay at a 5 star hotel with nothing to complain about.

Yes, this was our FOURTH time staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, and we are already looking forward to our fifth time. We really like this hotel, and we feel very much at home here.When staying at a beach hotel, wherever it is, we feel that the three most important things are cleanliness, comfort, and convenience, and this hotel has all three! Our room was spotlessly clean, the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable, and there was great and responsive maid service as well as plenty of hot water in the shower! From room 1932, we had an incredible view of the ocean. The Aston Waikiki Beach hotel has a very nice pool and is located right across the street from the beach, and within walking distance from Honolulu Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium, and plenty of stores and restaurants. This is the perfect place to stay, especially for families and very active people.The section of the beach that is right across from the hotel has a wall in the water that makes that portion of the beach almost like a swimming pool. Walk several yards in either direction, and you are on a beach with waves and surfers and all kinds of lessons and rentals for watersports. You can buy a floaty and inflate it right downstairs in the convenience store (and you can refill it when it deflates). Probably any shuttle that you want to take to any activity that you want to do will pick you up at this hotel. You can arrange things on your own or at any of the activity desks downstairs. The continental breakfast is still a good deal, even with the new "amenities fee" that is charged separately from the room charge. And, really, what could be nicer than sitting by the pool, sipping delicious coffee, and listening to beautiful live music while watching a lovely hula dancer?There is valet parking at an additional charge, which we did not use this time. Instead, we rented a car for a day to drive around the island and up to the north shore. We have used the valet service in the past and found it to be excellent. The bell services are also wonderful--we checked out and left our suitcases there for the day, and then the bell captain arranged for a cab for us to return to the airport. We noticed that traffic was horrendous at any time of the day, so I would expect that the valet service would seem slow considering that the car has to be driven around to the waiting area--even a drive around the block would take quite awhile with that traffic!Waikiki was incredibly crowded, and there were long, long lines EVERYWHERE we went! So, we were not upset about the check-in line, which moved quickly, or the breakfast line. In fact, the only place we didn't see long lines was on the north shore.I personally was very happy about the fact that there was complimentary coffee in the evenings, right near the check-in desk. The coffee was so good, and really hit the spot at the end of a long and busy day. I have said this in previous reviews: if you are the kind of person who is looking for a stuffy and formal resort where you don't ever leave the property, where drinks are served to you at the pool, and where you would feel uncomfortable walking into the lobby in your bathing suit and flip flops, this is not the place for you. This is absolutely a more fun and casual place, where you can easily run from your room to the beach to the pool and back, and it is a springboard for anything you could possibly want to do on the island.On the pool level of the hotel is Tiki's Grill and Bar, which is still one of our favorite restaurants in the entire area. The food is great, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is really nice. We did not go to any of the Happy Hours there, but it was always busy, and we enjoyed hearing the live music in the evenings.On the street level, there is a convenience store, a Wolfgang Puck's Express, a Coldstone Creamery, a Subway sandwich shop, the Cookie Corner, and two gift shops. Right nearby is LuLu's Waikiki restaurant (also great), an ABC convenience store, and a Starbucks.I know that other reviewers talked about the size of the room and the size of the lanai. We have traveled a lot, and there are many places, like Waikiki, in which space is at a premium. I have stayed in hotels in New York City as well as other popular places where the rooms are smaller and the prices are higher. Also, having traveled to the Jersey Shore a lot, we know a good beach hotel when we see one!I would make some suggestions to management, however.  I think that the rule that a guest can go into the breakfast line only once causes people to "stock up" and probably take a lot more stuff than they would otherwise take. It is much, much nicer to pick up a couple of things and then just go back if you are still hungry. I don't know why this change was made, but I actually think it is to the detriment of the service. Honestly, it was shocking to see people stockpiling food, and I am sure it is because of the "one time only" rule. Also, the pool hours are kind of short ( I am still thinking about our first time there, when the pool was open later in the evenings). Sometimes when you come back from a long and busy day, it would be really nice to take a dip in the pool. 8 PM seems kind of early to close. There might be a good reason for this--perhaps because of insurance--so I don't know if this can change. And, while I fully understand how commonplace an amenity fee is, I would still rather just see it built into the room rate. This is more a general statement on charging an amenity fee separately rather than a criticism of this particular hotel. The amenity fee here covers the continental breakfast, beach/pool towels, folding chairs, a daily newspaper, and unlimited DVD and game rentals (which we did not use, but guests with younger kids used the DVD and game rental a lot).We know that this hotel listens to its guests and we have seen changes (such as the improved elevator service) attesting to this fact. After our fourth stay, I can still say that we highly recommend the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.

We stayed @ this hotel for a week and we just came back yesterday. The hotel is in a great location and definitely going back very soon. Breakfast is great, you can take it anywhere you like. The staff are friendly and helpful.We stayed in a partial ocean view room on the 21st floor,room 2126 which was great.The only drawbacks I would say, is that the adjoining room is separated by two wooden doors and you can hear your neighbors too easily.hmmm.Not too sure if all the rooms are like this.Sometimes the coconut club gathering area,which was located close to our room (at the end of the hallway) got a little noisy,but that was all over by 10 pm,which was all good.Overall we loved staying here and will recommend to our friends to stay here.A big thank you to all the lovely staff and special mention to Mia, at the breakfast station.you are a star!To you all,keep up the great work,Mahalo and see ya soon! From Marcel and Pearl,from New Zealand
user_name:
Pearl H
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: So many things wrong here I don't where to start. First, from the pictures the hotel looks on par with something like the W. Alas, in person it's quite different. The bathrooms were pretty gross. Mold, mildew, and completely substandard linens. It's time for an update for sure. While we were aware of the extra fees at check-in, it was clear that other guests were not. There seem to be lots of arguments happening. Breakfast is a disaster - it's like the hunger games in there. One time entrance so people fill their little coolers like its their last meal. We wouldn't stay here again.....

My first trip to Hawaii( Stayed August 10-14) and my instructions to my travel agent were to find me a good hotel with a breakfast that was on the beach. I didn't need 5 stars because I am here to see Hawaii not stay in my room. My room was a typical hotel room, good view, not overly large but enough for 2 people and most important it was clean. Yes there was some wind noise, but I have that at my house when it is very windy, but it didn't keep me up at night.Breakfast was typical of some smaller hotel chains continental breakfast, but I was certainly able to fill up on fresh fruit, cereal, donuts and yogurt each morning. At a busy hotel breakfast around the pool was full up so we would take our food to the tables outside the street level restaurants and there was always a table. Check in check out was a breeze. and the elevator system is different but once we got the hang of it is much better than the typical elevator that stops on every floor. We appreciated the free towel and chair service that lets you take them to the beach across the street.This hotel is at one end of the strip, but there is convience stores, fast food and ice cream very close. Also the hotel has tour bus and trolley stops out front. This is also very convient when we wanted to go to shopping or on our island tours. If you are facing that side of the hotel you can hear them and they do start early in the morning, but Honolulu is a big city and it is no different than what I have heard from my hotels in Chicago or New York.I found this hotel to be very satisfactory and met my criteria and would stay here again because of its location and value. You won't find a better hotel right on Waikiki beach without paying significantly more per night.

Having stayed in this hotel 3 times already we have booked to go back in November 2013. I am a Travel Agent in the UK so have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world but comparing price, location, value for money and standard of accommodation you cant beat this hotel. No its not 5* but it doesn't advertise itself as being either, compare the price to other properties in Waikiki, which I do every year, I have to say that this hotel still comes out top.We have been coming to Hawaii since 1990 so we have stayed it other properties to be able to compare them but so far we are more than happy with the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and Its a property that I have no problems in recommending to my customers. The breakfast is an added bonus, we find it more that adequate, the bags provided are big enough to fill with cereal, fruit, bagels and pastry's to keep you going all day, no there aren't a lot of chairs to sit in around the pool on busy days but every single person has a room/ balcony with plenty of space to sit and eat breakfast or the beach is no more than a minutes walk away. The views are amazing from this hotel, we choose an ocean view. My only one concern is that the hotel doesn't out price itself. A special mention to Melissa in reservations who will try to accommodate any requests or needs a customer has, we have never been disappointed, fingers crossed for this year!

We spent 10 days in this hotel. The breakfast is pretty disappointing. Too much sweet cakes,but they did offer eggs and bacon at an additional cost. Location is fantastic, right acrossfrom the beach, but its a long way from the main shopping area, so quite a walk. But you cangrab a trolley out front for $2!! which is awesome. Rooms were clean, but very small. Balconys are not advertised well, they state they are large, but its like being in a cardboard box!!!.The Tiki bar is awesome for food and drinks, staff cannot do enough for you. Overall we werehappy at this hotel. The check-in system needs to be addressed better though. We arrived at10.00 am, very tired from the flight, and could not check-in until 3.00pm, room was late being ready, so we were pretty exhausted the first day. Good for families.

We were there for 6 nights in July. Overall the room was comfortable, but it was very small. The balcony only had one chair and the bathroom didn't have a big enough vanity to hold our cosmetics--had to put them on the safe in the closet. As for refilling our toiletries, we had to ask for new soap everyday! I guess the housekeepers think one tiny little bar of soap will last several days! As for the breakfast in the morning, it wasn't very desirable. All sugary pastries and nothing too healthy, other than some fruit. If you wanted a good breakfast, you had to pay extra (after paying $18 a day Amenity fee!) The pool was a JOKE! Too tiny for the size of the hotel. Next time we go to Hawaii, we will definitely stay somewhere nicer. Even the Mariott Beach Hotel was nicer than the Aston.

First, valet parking is a mess. Plan 15 min. Minimun. We stayed at the Royal Hawaiian for US$150,00 more and was worth for the breakfast (food and time of operation) kindness of staff (The maid made the bed and forgot to replace the towels). Lack of communication of staff with clients. Lots of extra fees that are incompreensible. The only good thing is the location. Wouldnt come back.

We stayed here for 3 weeks, my husband, myself, a teenager, and a 7 yr. old. We stayed on the 15th floor in room 1534. The view was amazing! Our room was small with 2 double beds, and had a handicap accessible bathroom. It was well worth the price! The only negative was that we had endless problems with the air conditioning & the wi-fi in our room. We had to call the service desk several times during our stay. They always responded promptly and fixed the problem, but it was a nuisance. The hotel is located at the east end of Waikiki beach next to the zoo, and across from the beach. It is a lot quieter at this end, but a further walk to many of the fun restaurants & shops. It was really convenient to have a mini-mart in the hotel, 2 ABC stores down below us, a Coldstone Creamery, a Subway, a Cookie store, and a Wolfgang Puck Express right below our hotel! And I can't forget Tiki's, the restaurant in our hotel! They had the best Pina Colada in town! And Lulu's next door for breakfast - the best banana macadamia nut pancakes with coconut syrup! And even the Barefoot Beachside Cafe down the beach across from the zoo had amazing breakfasts and lunches! Their coconut smoothie was to die for!The employees were very helpful & friendly - from Kathy at check-in, to Edmund the service guy, to Zeny our housekeeper (a sweetie!), to the valets. Our little girl was in a wheelchair and everyone went out of their way to be kind and helpful to her.The only possible negative was that the "Breakfast on the Beach" that they provide requires you to get down to it early if you want anything! They advertise that it is from 6:30-9:00. However, when I went down to it one morning at 6:30, there was already a line of about 75 people! One day I went down to it at 8:20 only to find that the staff had already put away all of the food/tables - nothing was left but coffee & juices! On vacation I hate to have to set the alarm to get up early enough to go get breakfast for free, but every penny saved helps! Needless to say, we only did this a few times, rather than pass up sleeping in!

We stayed there after cruising on the Pride of America for 3 nights. Was most disappointed at the check in - it was assumed that we had been told about the amenities fees (the agents fault, not theirs- another issue). The staff were definately not friendly. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, but the wind whistled through the sliding door. When the whistling stopped, the doors rattled. The small fridge was being defrosted and was left open & switched on with a towel in the bottom to catch the water. We actually switched the unit off to enable it to defrost a little quicker so wwe could put drinks in it. There were holes in the bed linen. We also assumed that we would find a kettle & cups in the room to enable us to make coffee/tea, but there were none. At breakfast, I had to "shoo" the birds off the food as there were no covers over the food to keep the birds away. After watching the birds pecking at the pastries, we refused to eat them. Could not get seating at breakfast. The range of free DVDs was not good. Definately not worth the daily amenities fee.Overall a most disappointing stay and would not stay there again!

Stayed at the Hotel last week and was really happy with it. The hotel was centrally located and directly across from Waikiki Beach. The rooms were vary spacious and the views were absolutely stunning! If you have a room on a floor above floor 18, you will be rewarded with an astonishing view of Diamond Head! The shower head was a little bit low for my taste (5'10) I had to duck under the water to wash my hair. The breakfast was also a let down; it is a continental breakfast (pastries, donuts, yogurts and fruits) but no hot items (eggs, bacon, pancake, ham) unless you pay an extra fee for them. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and professional and had great recommendations on where to go and what do do in Honolulu! Their Tiki bar was awesome at night with live music and decent prices. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip!

Our family went to Hawaii to celebrate a special birthday. The hotel was kind enough to give us an ocean view room, breathtaking, as i had booked a partial ocean view. The room was very nice, the staff friendly. The location of the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel is great, as we were rightacross from the beach, and the ocean is more calm than if you were staying in the middle of thestrip. Tiki bar was also great, try the Ahi Tuna. Thank you Aston, we had a great vacation, will definately will stay with you again.

Stayed for a week with my family & was very pleased with our overall stay. Visited during early August, the 5th to the 10th, & was honored with an upgraded room for free because my husband & I presented our marriage certificate. We had a decent view of the beach & the city leading to the zoo. Our room was kept very cold the entire time; our balcony was just enough space other than you really shouldn't think privacy when using the balcony because the adjacent hotels will be able to see you too. We were given a king sized bed, right by the exit stairs which was rarely used, plenty of room inside the room, with a slide door closet, a safe, a good size LED tv, a mini fridge, several sets of plugin outlets; the bathroom wasn't huge but large enough to use. It was decently cleaned although I found some areas dirty around the bottom of the toilet but hey it wasn't my bathroom! They provide an iron, board, & blow dryer & an up close mirror which was handy. The only thing missing was a microwave so avoid things needing to be warmed up. When we came, we rented a vehicle for 5 ppl, but at the end they tried billing us for 3 vehicles. They were quick to change the billing but only if we showed proof to bell man. Valet parking is pricey at $27 a day, but there are several garages nerby that will charge $15 for a full day& allow for you to come & go as often as necessary. Now for the free breakfast, I personally thought it was plentiful enough providing several choices of coffee, cereals, yogurts, variety of breads including Hawaiian malasdas (delicious), juices, a bar to order waffles and omelettes for a price, miso soup, seaweed, steamed rice patty, milk, fresh fruit. In order to get thru the line with choice fruit & such plan on getting down there about 7-730 am. Seating can be challenging because its around the pool but you can always take your stuff to your room using their caddie. They offer free DVD rentals, & fitness room s pretty decent too.

Based on the reviews written up here in TA, we got the ocean view select room (2425), and it was well worth it. Beautiful view, and we were separated from the noise of the pool and restaurant and street below. We loved the location towards the end of the waikiki hustle and bustle, and parked every day on Montserrat, saving on parking fees. Thanks Trip Advisor!

We stayed two nights and found the room to be on the small side, but clean and comfortable with a nice ocean view. The resort fee includes free dvd rentals and breakfast daily which was nice. The location was great within walking distance of most things in the area but there were also free trollies roaming the beach area if you wanted to go a bit further. The staff was pleasant and we would definitely stay again. The pool is small, but the beach is perfect across the street.

We booked and ocean front select room as this trip we wanted just a relaxing holiday been here a couple of times before so we have seen everything, we decided to splurge a little, but when we enquired at the front desk they told us it was only an ocean front and that we would have to go back to travel agent (confirmation on booking said ocean front select but hotel argued with us saying it is only ocean front... NOT SELECT.... Arrived at 10.00 am was told room be ready at 2.00pm went to front desk at 2.00 said room still wasnt ready they will check with housekeeping come back in 20 mins come back 30mins later said still mot ready they will check with housekeeping which apparently they didn't said come back in 15 mins room should be ready then went back just before normal checkin time of 3.00pm and still got told room wasnt ready come back in10-15mins by this stage we were a little ticked off as we had been awake for nearly 36hours straight and wanted to shower and rest so we managed to get our room key about 4.00 as room was finally ready yay.... Still wasnt happy that we had to wait so long i know it is a big hotel and the turn over is high but this was ridiculous. So when we finally got into our room it sort of made up for the unhelpful front desk staff and was the only highlight of the hotel. we had a king size bed which was great. view of diamond head from balcony aswell as down to the other end of waikiki beach bathroom was a fair size and clean been in smaller bathrooms at least with this one you could turn around and not hit a wall or toilet or shower only this missing is somewhere to put toiletries. The balconys are ok yeah they only have one chair on them but we just took one from inside out when we sat out there, there is plenty of room for 2 people. Breakfast well i would look elsewhere wolfgangs express is downstairs alot better all that they had was sugary foods and as i am pregnant i had to watch how much sugar i eat so breakfast was out for me. Tiki's i would not eat there only for drinks as both my husband and i got sick from eating there so was scary being pregnant and getting food poisoning. The only other good thing about staying here was the trolley pull up outside hotel so you dont have to carry your shopping very far. For the price i would stay elsewhere. we have previously stayed at the circle so we dont always do 4 or 5 star hotels so we dont expect room service and all the jazz just somewhere pleasant to stay as you are on holiday and hotels are only to sleep in....

It's directly in front of the beach, every morning was spent on the balcony enjoying the fantastic morning view and listening to waves crashing. The breakfast is simple but very satisfying, we took it back up to our room each day to sit and enjoy privately, since the pool deck does get crowded. I would definitely stay here again, the room was great and couldn't ask for better location if you want to beach it up in Waikiki.

Across the rd from the beach at the quiter end of kalakaua ave. room was cute and tidy with a smashing ocean view. Close to all the main Waikiki action & the trolley stopped outside for shopping at ala moana. Perfect for our stay, staff very helpful & tiki was a great eat as well. Sad to leave!

Be careful which room you stay in, we were right over the pool and music payed until 10 almost every night. It was much better when we requested a move. Also all rooms that say they can sleep 4 only have double beds, this to me is a misrepresentation by the hotel, it was disappointing. Also some rooms are very small, so again, be carful... The pool deck was also terrible, very dirty and required maintenance, also one of the pool showers was broken for the entire time we were there... Definite lack of attention to properly maintaining their property..

I travel a ton....and this place is one of the worst I've ever stayed. Generally disgusting place. The BK was a joke, a line around the pool deck to get some continental bk that you had to carry out. No places to sit, no hot food. The pool was dirty and the pool deck was worse! Elevators complicated and crowded all the time. Lav faucet leaked and was broken, Sewer smell in bathroom all the time. Bathroom was old and dirty. The only decent part of this place was the views of Waikiki beach.Not worth the money.....never coming back!

For my daughters sweet 16, I decided to load up the family for a trip to Hawaii. Myself, my son and daughter arrived to this beautiful and very affordable hotel literally on Waikiki Beach and we were instantly in awe! The grounds are very well kept, the restaurants were plentiful and the view - breathtaking. The front desk was very prompt and extremely courteous, and made our check in process easy. We couldn't wait to see our room and when we opened the door, it was gorgeous! We just sat there for a few and took it all in. The bedding and upkeep of the room was perfect and more than we had expected. The view wasn't great from the balcony, but there were many, many rooms where the view was spectacular...we just didn't care about that. Everything was clean and functional. The hotel itself was amazing and everyone was courteous. There was a fair sized pool but it was usually occupied by small children so we opted to walk the 100 feet to the beachfront instead and enjoy the warm ocean and dreamy sands of Waikiki beach. The convenience of staying so close to the beach is more than I can explain. There are many hotels nearby but some are a little ways away from the beachfront and most are much more expensive. During our stay, there was an announcement back home that family had notified me about regarding the recall of eggs due to some sort of contamination. This concerned me as I had been eating eggs every morning during our stay, so I approached the front desk and they thoroughly researched it, then reassured me it did not affect Hawaii. The options for food on the hotel premises were great and decent priced. Anyone who's traveled to Hawaii knows how dreadfully expensive everything is there, so having some affordable and good food nearby was good. The beach offered surfing very close by, the zoo was only a short walk away, and there are tons of stores, restaurants and events happening in the area. The only downside to staying near the beach were the homeless and intoxicated people at night and early morning. This is definitely not a reflection of the hotel but it's worth mentioning. The reside in the pavillion areas of the beachfront and although they are not really threatening, I wouldn't suggest spending any time close to that particular area.

Great location with the beach directly across the road and down the quieter end of Kalakaua Avenue. We had a partial ocean view room, so if you stuck your head out far enough on the very small balcony you could see the ocean. The room was clean and comfortable enough, but the major issue we had was that every time we had a shower and I must state it is a very small shower our bathroom flooded, so hence we went through a lot of towels. The breakfast on the beach idea was fine, but after a few days I really wanted a piece of toast with vegemite as all the sugary breakfast treats don't really appeal to me and I was purchasing my own breakfast somewhere else. The one thing that I would recommend to the hotel is to please have a kettle or tea or coffee facilities in the room, as after a long day all you want is to sit in your room and enjoy a cuppa. Overall the hotel was fine, it is what it is!

Nice location and the beach directly across from the hotel is great. We had an oceanfront room and fantastic views, albeit from the tiniest balcony I've ever seen. The room was clean, and adequately appointed, but a few minor things caused some inconvenience. The stopper in our sink would not stay closed (making it hard to soak and wash swimsuits), and the stopper in the tub would not stay open while showering resulting in the tub filling each time you showered. The air conditioning in the room was useless. We were there during some unseasonably warm and humid weather in mid-July and there was NO relief by turning on the A/C. I was a sticky hot mess the entire vacation! The blow dryer in the bathroom did not work which would have been a major inconvenience (I didn't bring my own) had I not found an extra one in the closet. How difficult is it to replace a wall-mounted blow dryer though really? Another suggestion I would make is to PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE put a $15 coffee maker in the room for pete's sake! The hotel doesn't even need to provide the coffee, but being able to have a cup before heading out for the day would have been nice. Sure there is coffee to go downstairs, but you need to ask for a cup, and are allotted ONE 6oz. styrofoam cup! If I wanted a refill, I would have had to stay by the pool area, drink it, and refill or hike back and forth from my room. The ice machine on our floor never worked the 6 days we were there and we had to go down 4 floors before finding one that worked. I am aware that most of the hotels in Waikiki charge an amenity fee, but the $18/day fee here is pretty much a rip-off. On vacation I don't really read a newspaper. I don't really want to spend my time in Waikiki renting and watching movies in my room, and the complimentary breakfast is hardly worth $18/day. I could not eat $18 worth of pastries and yogurt daily to make it worthwhile! Lastly, having our privacy invaded one afternoon for a room search by "Security" because some whacko in the room next to us said we were smoking in our room (WHICH WE WERE NOT) was irritating to say the least. Housekeeping cleans your room daily. If we were smoking, wouldn't they have known and reported it? Upon speaking with the front desk, we were told if there was evidence of smoking in our room we would be charged $425 after checkout. I certainly didn't like the idea that they could tack on that kind of charge after we were long gone, but there was no charge, so I guess our neighbor was wrong, huh? An okay hotel, but we wouldn't return.

Situated at the end of Waikiki Beach. Close to the zoo and park. The beaches are wider and less crowded at this end of the beach. Still conveniently located for the shopping and nightlife of Waikiki. The hotel staff are helpful very nice.

Stayed here with my daughter ... We came to see Hawaii, not a hotel. We had been travelling in North America for six weeks ( San Fran, Niagara, New York, Pennsylvania , Asheville, North & South Carolina , Florida, British Colombia in Canada etc) so have seen and experienced a lot of hotels.Pro's - beds comfy; hotel is in great location; service in hotel was fine, breakfast was nice and ample in terms of types and amount of food.Cons - there are hidden costs associated (at least $50 per day) which I found offensive and misleading, and did not experience elsewhere; the pool is very small, with heavy restrictions on use and hours of opening .. I also found it laughable that the hotel was gloating about the complimentary pool towels and chairs ... Where else to sit, and how do you dry yourself !! ( what's next .... Gloating about complimentary toilet paper !! ). My daughter berated the hotel because of the tacky/kitschy beach bag, colouring book, bucket and spade that fell apart when you merely looked at it !! (I had to agree - if you are going to go to that effort, make the experience pleasant) Despite being told we had a partial ocean view room, we only looked at the neighbouring hotel (about 15 metres away) .. If you dared lean over the balcony you could see the ocean however.The room, but particularly the bathroom, was not properly cleaned before we moved into it .... There was hair in the bath, hand basin, and on the floor. The bathroom needs an overhaul ... Very tired, dated and dirty.The breakfast arrangements are weird, and born of a hotel that is trying to offer a service it was never designed for - there are very few tables available, they give you a cooler bag and 'prompt' you to try breakfast on the beach, and you are fighting the masses to get fed (we were there at 6.30 when it starts due to jet lag, and it was already packed out) . My advice - take the fed bag down to the pool where the food is, fill it up, then go back to your room to eat !!

My friend and I came here for a 10 day vacation in June. First impression was great right from the gentleman at the valet right to the front desk. The room was spacious and clean. The only complaint I have about the room is some pipe in the bathroom kept making squeaking noises that sounded somewhat like a mouse but of course wasn't. Probably because it's an older hotel. The "breakfast on the beach" was really just a buffet style grab your own and go, which would be great but the options aren't very good so we skipped breakfast there pretty much the entire time. I love the playstation in the room with the unlimited rentals, after a long day on the beach (hard day I know) it's nice to just relax and enjoy a good movie! So all in all I really enjoyed it here and will definitely be staying here again.

My wife and I and my brother and his wife travelled to Hawaii to find and experience some of the places our Dad wrote about in his journal when he was stationed at Schofield Barracks. What a pleasant time staying at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Friendly staff, clean comfortable (albeit small) room and we never waited more than five minutes for the valet service. Directly across the street from the Waikiki Beach, Breakfast on the Beach was a real treat every day. Fresh fruit, pastries, etc. with all the ocean and clean air you could want. We'll be going back to Hawaii someday, and when we do, we'll stay at Aston Waikiki.

25th anniversary so my husband, me and our two teens decided to head to Oahu then Maui. Stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for three nights. What a lovely, fun hotel. Open, airy, tropical, bright themed hotel. Location was right across the street from the beach, with lots of activity in the streets and on the beach. Could not have asked for a more prime location. We loved the hotel and the full ocean view from the 11th floor. The breakfast by the beach offered each morning at the hotel is second to none for a quick, convenient and tasty start to the day. Even the iced down, fruit filled water dispensers were welcoming, refreshing, and helped make you feel at home, in a tropical environment. The kids (13, 16) thoroughly loved the hotel's location and close to the "hubbub" of activities. Will definitely recommend this hotel to others, and will stay there again.

We are here now. The rooms are totally disgusting. The tile in the shower appears to have been here since the day the hotel,was built. The partial Ocean View upgraded Aloha Suite with stunning views of Diamond Head do not exist. The only view we have is the run down hotel next door. Air conditioning does not work properly. Furniture is very poor. If you are accustomed to Marriott and Hilton franchises go there! We booked through American Airlines and they do not care about our predicament of being stuck here for a week paying thousands of dollars. I will never book through them again. Use a trusted travel,agent. We will be checking out in a couple of hours and paying for a $259/night room at the Marriott. Never again will we trust American Airlines Vacations with important travel. Their customer service is a joke.

I took my wife here for our honeymoon as we both had not been to Hawai'i. We found the staff to be helpful, the rooms were always clean. We had the continental breakfast most mornings then went exploring throughout Hawai'i each day. The only thing that let us down was the cost per night once I worked out the sums, for the price we paid we didn't get alot in return, other than that we loved it! We're going back to Hawai'i every year.

Me, my wife and 2 sons stayed on this hotel. Waikiki beach is across the street. This hotel is at the end of the hotel rows so if you are ok with walking to the different shops then this is a good value hotel in a good location. There is an amenities fee of 15/day, they give you wi-fi as well as use of towels and chairs when you go to the beach. I think this is reasonable enough as the chair rental on the beach is $20/day. So make sure to get your folding chairs and towels at the lobby before you go to the beach. You don't need to return so you can have it as long as your stay. The room is ok with 2 beds, we are at room 1408 and it's a corner room so it's not as small as others described. Food is ok because we don't eat that much breakfast anyway, but will keep you full when you start your day. Valet is almost $30 (incl. tax), so walk a block and park at banyan public parking for $15/day. I actually saw the valet parked the cars in the same parking building. Overall it's a good stay. It's not as great as the others but you also don't pay that much. Recommended.

Stayed for 7 nights in July. Very convenient location with the major tourist bus stop right outside the hotel. Upgraded to a full ocean view room at the front of the hotel. The view was amazing. Staff were attentive and helpful. The breakfast by the beach was a great idea. Make sure you take your cooler bag with you to pack your breakfast. It gets extremely busy later in the morning, go early. Beach chairs are available but go very quickly. Get them when you pick up your breakfast. Kids loved the free movies. Had a couple of meals in the Tiki bar. Good value meals without being outstanding. Make sure you book as it gets very busy. Great views of the sunset from the tables on the balcony.

My mum and I are currently in our 6th day of 8 at this hotel. We've been decently satisfied with the quality. Breakfast is a bit crowded but we just bring our food back up to our hotel room. I like the idea of taking breakfast onto the beach. However, I don't like how there is only one entry per room and how there is limited selection and omelettes must be paid for on top of the resort fee. The beds are nice and big but the bathroom is on the small side. I don't mind the decor or think that the hotel is particularly outdated. It is older than most but if you are coming to Hawaii to stay in your hotel room, you should probably go to the Hilton or something (and maybe rethink your holiday). The view was spectacular and the location was great. We have had no quarrels with service, everyone is friendly. Improvements that I can think of are a broader breakfast selection - maybe increase resort fee by a dollar and include omelettes, larger bathrooms, more pool chairs and tables and tea and coffee making facilities in hotel rooms. The elevator system was confusing but not impossible and was similar to the other nearby hotels. One personal issue we had was the annoyance of arriving at 9am and having to wait until after 3pm to check in. We were new to the country and tired from a 10 hour flight with no sleep overnight. We tried to sit next to the pool for a bit...walked down the streets...then came back up to the pool and waited until 3. It was a long wait and our hotel room was VERY inviting when we got there! We could not check in because our room was not ready. Cleaners should prioritise those who are waiting and do those rooms first. I was impressed with the quality of the wifi, the beds, the view, the pool, tv channel selection, location and service.

This hotel was very practical. Continental breakfast in the morning with all the basics, excellent location and the Tikki bar restaurant at the hotel was great. Best coconut shrimp! I like that this hotel is on the end of the main strip. It's a little more quiet at this end. Great to watch sunsets here, there's a starbucks right around the corner and I never had a problem finding a parking space for my rental car. Sunset swims here were amazing!!! I definitely liked the low key vibe. The room was a little small but definitely did the job as you shouldn't spend much time in a room while you're in Hawaii! I was here the end of March 2011.

My family have 7 stayed here for 5 days. We had 2 rooms both we lanais with partial ocean views. It was a nice and pleasant stay. The rooms were just enough space. We had a complimentary continental breakfast everyday that came with all types of juices and milk and for a few bucks more you could order belgian waffles or omelettes. they even provide you with a lil tote to take it on the go and eat it across the street on the beach. The staff was friendly and the concierge was funny and helpful. We were able to get to do all the activities we wanted to do without any problems. if you dont want to walk around to find somewhere to eat they have restaurants on site. We tried the Wolfgang Puck express restaurant and it was great! Everything is so near by this hotel, ABC Stores, beach, restaurants, Cold Stone creamery..it was definitely an ideal location. You can also rent free movies every nite to wind down. It was an overall great experience. We would stay there again!

we stayed for 4 nights in a beach front room on the eighth floor - the view was exceptional and the room was very spacious - bathroom on the small side but comfortable. The staff overall were friendly, even under the extreme pressure that is put on them. Breakfast was very limited for gluten intolerant people with only fresh fruit and yogurt, juice and coffee. Optional extras at extra cost was boiled eggs or omelette. We didn't understand the 18 dollar resort fee which was non optional.- Our booking included room with breakfast and was prepaid. We then had to pay the additional 18 dollars for breakfast (already prepaid), use of the in room safe and a free newspaper. Breakfast was chaotic but once your esky was full you could retire to your room, not necessarily poolside or the beach and enjoy your food and the view in air conditioned comfort.

Great location, good breakfast and excellent wifi in the rooms. We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it was a great hotel, the staff were friendly and the rooms were nice. We asked for a partial ocean view and still got a good view of the beach from our balcony. Would definetley recommend this hotel to others. The concierge desk were very helpful in organising things to do around the island.

We stayed at this hotel for few nights and it was a pretty good hotel. We got there early morning so the desk held our luggage for us until check in (they also held them when we checked out as we had a cruise at 5pm). The location is fantastic, right across from Waikiki beach. At breakfast they give you complimentary cooler bags which you can fill up with food and take it away. We stayed in oceanview room and the view was amazing from the balcony!The staff were very polite and friendly and they also have a complimentary dvd hiring system if you want to just relax in the room and stick a movie on.Rooms were nice, not the most modern but has a nice hawaiian feel to them, and bars and restaurants are in close proximity of the hotel, including the ones down the bottom of it.We really enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it.

We stayed here and in was a great view from our top floor room (beachfront).Right across the road was the beach.It is close to everything, zoo,international market,shopping and bus/trolley.they had free breakfast in the common area.( juice,milk,coffee,tea,fruit rolls pastries and fruit yum.i don't know if the hotel has new owners.it is great for its location location location.
user_name:
Jeff G
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: What really is-Breakfast in the beach: they give you a little basket. Then you go in a long line (see picture) to grab food like a dog. You must get as much as you can because you are alowed to entry o ly once. Then as they dont have breakfast room, you must fight for a chair poolside or go to the beach eat your breakfast in the ground with sand taste... The food remains exposed in the sun (see pictures) and the pigeons and birds are everywhere bombing...- Beautiful suites: its a very small room. They offer with 2 double beds and say that 3 people can stay there. Yes, its true as they never mentioned in the description that you could put luggage there at the same time lol. Don't be fooled.The hotel is in a good location and the staff is very polite but for sure there are much better options for the same high price.Did I mention that they charge extra USD 18 for the amenities ? This includes the breakfast but theory charge you USD 5 for a scrambled egg in the wonderful breakfast.The parking price is abusive also.

There's nothing really wrong with the Aston per se, but it just wasn't a good fit for us. The rooms were small, too small for just two people. Forget it if you have a baby or toddler. The bathrooms were outdated and made constant noises. The elevator system was very frustrating. The valet service was nice at first, until it took them 30 minutes to retrieve the car. On the plus side the breakfast included with the resort fee was good, the location is very good, and our room had a nice view. Unfortunately for this hotel the rooms detriments outweighed the positives.

Check in was easy & friendly.Amenities for getting a car was simple.Breakfast had no class no healthy choices & was tasteless & terrible. Cereals, donuts, no proteins (unless you paid extra) styrofoam everything & no where to sit plus the long lines. It's an old & tired hotel of old ideas and nothing promising; it had seen better days.

After spending 3 weeks traveling the west coast of the states we were looking forward to our week in Hawaii as being relaxing before returning to Australia.We were happy with the location when we arrived, beautiful outlook opposite the the ocean however upon entering the building it was evident it was dated and needed an update. We arrived an hour early and was told we could not check in so had to sit around the pool area with all our luggage, not pleasant considering all we wanted to do was relax and get changed into cooler clothing. When we were finally able to check in we were then told there was a daily surcharge of $12 per day which we thought was already paid for within our booking, apparently not. The room was so small, 2 double beds with less than a metre between them and we had to use one of the beds to put our luggage on because had we used the floor space we would not have had any room to walk around. The bathroom was just as tiny and very dated. The only plus to the room was the view to the ocean. Breakfast was a disappointment, mostly sugared pastries and cakes, there was no cooked breakfast unless you wanted to pay more. What was the $12 a day for???? Certainly not the breakfast as after day 3 we didn't bother with breakfast at all. Once you got your breakfast there was nowhere to sit to eat it unless you wanted to sit around on the pool deck chairs while balancing your food on your lap. There was only approximately 6 outdoor tables and chairs which were always taken up so the only other alternative is to go back to the room or across the road to the park to eat. Not satisfactory at all, catering for all guests in a breakfast room as well as around the pool would be a better alternative. The entertainment at breakfast was lovely to listen to with the Hawaiian music and singing but that's about it. This hotel is located well for use of the street trolley cars as the stop is right out the front and the free DVD's were good when you don't feel like going out for the evening. The tour booking desks are also a great addition to this hotel with the staff being very helpful. We would not stay at this hotel again instead would pay a little more to receive a better room and a few decent options for breakfast as well as at least somewhere to eat it. Rod & Crystal

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is a great hotel to stay at when in Honolulu. It's just a stone's throw away from the blue waters of Waikiki Beach and has great views of the beach and the rest of Honolulu. Also, it has wonderful and stylish accommodation. The only minor problem there is is that the service always seemed a bit disorganized and many of the employees just seemed flustered and confused.

Before I chose an hotel in Waikiki, I checked the reviews of some hotels and finally I selected this for its location: beach is across the street. The hotel rooms are comfortable for two people and clean. Although we enjoyed the hula show only once during breakfast cause our tours, its a great option the availability to pack up breakfast and get it to your room (there are few seats). We did not have problems with elevators nor electric stairs, the lobby is comfortable, and they have security personnel looking through the area. There is a daily amenity fee of $18 (Wi-FI, gym, etc.). There is a storage room to bring your bags until the transfer to the airport. We enjoyed our stay in Hotel, Tours, and Waikiki Beach. We might consider the Aston again if we go to Hawaii in the future.

Stayed here for a business trip that lasted 4 days.Driving in, the valet guys were rude and not helpful. Waited next to my car for 15 minutes until someone came by and took my information and keys. Check-in was fast and efficient. The room, however, was average. The carpet was dirty (looked un-vacuumed), frayed at the edges, and I felt inclined to wear socks to protect myself. All of the light switches had grime and dirt on them. The toilet handle was flimsy. The showerhead had a lot of calcium buildup. ...maybe I just got stuck with a bad room...The pool was small and packed with kids. Their "Breakfast at the Beach" gimmick was a failure -- had to bring a small cooler downstairs, fill it up with pastries and cereal from the continental breakfast, but had no where to sit!!! Egg and bacon was extra.All-in-all, a disappointment. Definitely not a "4.5 Star" hotel as advertised!

If you are wondering whether you should book the Aston, here area couple of questions to ask yourself?1. What is your standard “norm” for staying at hotels? Do you normally stay at Quality Inn and other 3 star hotels? Or do you frequent Sheratons, Marriotts and Hiltons?If three star, the Aston Waikiki fits into that category. There are many great things about this hotel especially if you have children. For a couple, it may not be as ideal. We were not looking to splurge on the hotel for this trip and knew this wouldn’t be a four-star, but was hoping for the best. If you are unsure whether to lower your standard, my advice is to spend the extra few hundred dollars and book the nicer hotel.This hotel is not modern and since it is dated and in need of major updates – it did not come across as clean to me. There are a lot of positives about it, but not the rooms. We knew we wouldn’t spend a lot of time in the room, but after a long day, there is nothing better on vacation then coming back to relax in your room. I didn’t find the room inviting to relax. Too dated, in need of updates. Walls were dirty, bathroom worn down, very small overall in size.2. Do you have kids/family that you are traveling with?For a family, I think this hotel is much more ideal. It’s close to everything that most families may want. Across from beach, restaurants and hotel that are kid friendly are all around, a small pool, free DVDs, etc. For couples looking for a low-key, quiet getaway – the hotel is very busy and bustling.3. How important is hotel view to you?The view at the Aston is just incredible (we did ocean view). It was amazing to wake up to the view of the beach every morning. All in all, not a bad place – just check your expectations/standards before you book and the rooms are definitely not the highlight. Good locale, some nice perks, nice views, Tiki’s is great and live music is nice. All depends on what you are looking for.

Our family stayed here for a week and truly enjoyed our experience. The hotel rooms are a little older but very comfortable and clean. The staff was very pleasant and the beds were particularly comfortable. We enjoyed loading up our breakfast on the beach pack most mornings and sitting on the first floor veranda and people watching every morning. The singer and hula dancer at breakfast was also very nice. We enjoyed eating dinner at Tiki's and lunch at Wolfgang Puck's. Thanks so much for a wonderful time! :)

We just spent four nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach, and we were all very impressed with the value and quality of the hotel. We stayed in a junior suite, which was perfect for four. We had a beautiful view of the beach from our partial view room. The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were comfortable, and it was nice and quiet at night on the 19th floor. The free breakfast had a nice variety of continental breakfast items (pastries, yogurts, fruits, juices, coffee). We particularly liked the Hawaiian pastries. It was busy on the pool deck, so we usually took our breakfast to tables on the street level and had a quiet place to eat. We had an excellent dinner at Tiki's, and we found the small hotel store's prices were usually better than the prices at the ABC Stores. The location was perfect...right across the street from the beach, but at the quiet end a bit away from the busiest section. We never used the pool, but it looked pleasant. We were in Hawaii to enjoy the beaches and unique Hawaiian experiences, and this was a great home base and a great value for a Waikiki hotel. We will gladly stay there again.

First the good. Good value, good location, great view (we had a room high up on the beachside), 'breakfast on the beach' is fun and Tiki's restaurant is convenient and very good (I'd give it a TripAdvisor '4'). Now the 'not so', the decor is tired especially noticeable in the bathroom, likewise the pool area is in need of updating, the valet parking charges are pretty steep (especially because the sign wasn't very visible and so were an unpleasant surprise) and the front desk staff while professional weren't particularly friendly given this is a vacation spot.

This hotel right across Waikiki beach towards one end of Kalakaua ave. is well situated for enjoying the Waikiki Beach area. Hotel charges $27 a day for parking but there is metered parking nearby specially near the Zoo which is a block away. The Tourist Trolley bus and other tour busses has a stop right at the hotel. High end shopping, low end ABC stores, restaurants, bars, Starbucks and fast food places abound within 15 minute walking distance. I can recommend it for those satisfied with mid range accommodations. It has a small pool overlooking the beach but it is not a relaxing pool area as it is choked with sun loungers and hotel guests. The rooms are on the small side but with adequate space around the beds. As I was on vacation, I requested an upgrade to a junior suite, which has nice views and sitting area. We paid $100 more per day for the upgrade. The beddings were of good quality, water pressure strong, free wifi, free very poor quality basic breakfast. The room was clean and tasteful. Took nearly an hour to check in 5 parties! This is a very busy hotel, there is not enough space for its many, many guests to feel rested except in their own rooms. I have returned to this hotel a number of times when I find a good deal because I like its location. But this is likely the last time because it just feels too busy. Tip: For excellent Hawaiian food, check out James Beard awardee Helena's restaurant near the airport. You can thank me later.

This is a great hotel to stay at. The rooms are clean and spacious. The breakfast was not what I like as a breakfast but thats just me. There is no other place that you can feed your family a meal for 18 dollars in Waikiki. The beach is directly across the street and the hotel will provide you with towels for the beach. Great beach area for everyone even the young ones. Back to the hotel, the view we had was amazing it was partial ocean view room. I can see where some of the rooms would not have an amazing view like we did ( I lucked out) but Iam sure they are great views from the majority of the rooms. Staff was freindly and helpful, I left my wifes I pad at the bell desk one morning and they had it when came back in the afternoon in housekeeping. I will stay here again when we return to Waikiki.

Location is perfect, right across the street from the beach. They have free breakfast, which you can carry to beach (breakfast on the beach). The valet staff is friendly. Definitely would stay here again.

Checked into this hotel on July 3rd for 5 relaxing nights. We had a deluxe king room and it was not small by any means. I was scared about booking here after seeing the reviews but my stay was nothing but wonderful. The room is spacious, the king size bed is huge! The lanai outside is big enough for 2 chairs and our view was magical. The daily breakfast is nice, a lot of options. The pool is basically open all day but the beach is literally across the street. I would defiantly return to this hotel and recommend it to my friends and family. Also the elevator system is not confusing. It's set up so that everyone gets to their floor in a timely matter. There are also unlimited DVD rentals for you to use included in your amenity fee. And all the staff is really nice and helpful. This hotel is a great value for your money!!! And the tiki bar downstairs has a really good happy hour.

Beautiful hotel and great service! The Breakfast on the Beach is wonderful! You will find a lunch box in your room - each morning you go down to the pool area and fill it up with wonderful food! Very convenient location - everything within walking distance. Would absoolutely go back!

Great staffs, clean rooms, location... and more.With a 5 yr and 12 yr kids, 4 of us had a great time here. Only negative, they ran out of breakfast items (asian particularly) prematurely every morning before 8 AM.

The hotel is located in a very busy area across from the beach. I had a beach view room which was great. The hotel has a pool, the GYM is very small, breakfast and computer access. The elevator is key controlled which made it very much safer. Valet parking, at about $28 daily. It is very close to many shops and restaurants, most important, about a minute walk to the beach. The prices vary greatly between weekday and weekend. Room service was excellent, they took care of my room on a daily basis, they even called to schedule room cleaning after hours. The down side, nothing to do for the kids, except play videos games or watch movies, my one year old was very bored in the room. Of course we did spend the majority of the day out and about.

At $300 dollars a day they should at least clean the rooms. I've left a bigger review on Yelp, so I'll just say, stay away from this place. Very small room, very unhelpful staff, and the only reason we stayed in this hotel is that we had our own wedding here, and the staff were very unhelpful with that too.

Very well organised hotel, they have booking in and service down to a tee. So whats good:$18 amenity fee that covered a family of 4 breakfasts, dvd movies and games (which the kids liked at the end of the day) beach chairs and beach towels plus free wifi and a safe- Great value. The rooms are clean and secure but could do with a bit of modernisation. They have a handy fridge but no kettle. We stayed twice in 2 weeks as we went island hopping and the first room 2005 on the west side had a good partial view of the beach but was noisy from the pool area below and the ice machine outside but had a lanai that 2 of you could sit on. The second room 2418 east side get a much better view of the beach and diamond head mountain and is a bigger room but the lanai is standing room only. However its pretty quiet and my preference would be on this side either on floor 24 or 25 as below this your view would be obstructed by a lower hotel next door. All the staff are very friendly and the hotel itself is a main pick up point fortours and local buses/ trolley which is very convenient. From all the activity in town this is the better end to be located , its opposite the beach and you can see great sunsets. Book your hire car before you go as you'll get better deals and more options- cars tend to be booked out 3 days in advance. Hotel atm only gives you $200 plus $2.75 charge, its better to go to the first Hawaiian Banks ATM's where you can access $500 at one time for the same charge.

I loved the contemporary and colorful feel to this hotel. At only $169 a night, it had amenities and location far beyond the price. Although we didn't do this, you can take your breakfast to the beach-they provide the cooler, chairs and towels. The standard rooms are small, but very clean and decorative. Their bar-Tiki's Bar and Grill seemed to be a happening place with live music, not just for hotel guests, but for many people walking up and down the strip.Tips: As with most Waikiki hotels, be prepared to pay about $25/night in valet fees. Also, do not expect an early check in, as this place seems to stay packed. They will store your luggage for you if you arrive early.

A huge and bustling hotel at the quieter end of Waikiki beach - but still close enough to the action. Check-in is late at 3pm and for international travellers that almost always means your room won't be ready on arrival. We stayed here for six days initially then travelled around other islands and came back for a final night. On both occasions as we wanted a room immediately we paid to upgrade to an ocean front room. The views from these rooms is sensational and immediately in front of the hotel is a safe swimming area. Most buses stop at the hotel so it's very easy to get around - once you find someone who explains how it all works. That in itself took a while. I thought the rooms were lovely - yes dated in part, but they were bright and colourful. The one thing I found very strange was there was no kettle in the room. There is a small fridge though which was great for keeping water and wine in! Breakfast is bizarre - a bring your own cold bag (provided in the room) and fill it with fruit, cereal boxes and sugary treats - then take it to the beach or your balcony - we found the latter the best option. After our first breakfast when we had fruit juice, fruit, fruit yoghurt and muffins we felt sugar overload. From then on we stuck to coffee, croissants, fresh fruit and plain yoghurt if we could find one. You pay more for omelettes. There is an $18 a day resort fee which gives you this 'continental' breakfast, access to DVDs, free local phone calls and wi-fi access - the only useful thing about it. There are booking agents on the lobby level who all charge you more than if you book direct with the tour operators. Decide what you want to do and book it direct. Avoid all the hawkers on the streets who try to sell you trips - but are really selling time-share. Waikiki has a terrible homeless problem - don't be surprised to see groups of people sleeping on the sidewalk directly outside the hotel.
