Getting to the next floor up to check in was a bit confusing, but we did it in a few minutes. We were on the 18th floor and facing the ocean. Surfers were in the water when we woke early and still there after it was too dark to see them! "Breakfast-on-the-beach" is different. A little cooler is provided for you to gather what you want at breakfast - one pass through the line is what is expected. Most don't go to the beach, but there are not enough tables by the pool for all to eat. We learned it was best to go back to the room and eat at the nice table or on the balcony overlooking the surfers! Save your coffee cup. One can get coffee @ 6am, but then they remove the cups sometime after 6:30 am & you can get a refill only if you have kept your cup. Had plenty of decafe which was great for me! Eggs and waffles cost extra. Breads of all kinds and fruits were fabulous. Definitely try the purple bread & donuts made with taro root!! Lots of wonderful juices. The elevators are unique. To go down enter any floor number or star to get to the check-in floor. To go up, swipe your door key and enter the floor - look at that display for info on which elevator will take you there. I believe there were 5 elevators so waits were never long. There is an open area on each floor that faces Diamond Head - so walk to that area near the ice machine and get your pictures.Both restaurants were good for their purpose. Wolfgang Puck is fast - take out or eat right there.A zoo is between the hotel and Diamond Head. If we'd had a free morning I would have liked to hike Diamond Head. That is definitely an early in the day activity!! The ABC stores on every block & in the hotel are an all inclusive convenience store - certainly nothing like in my home state! We got to watch the 97th Kamehameha Parade from our balcony. Hawaii has lots of festivals. Be patient!

Great location...across the street from Waikiki beach but at the end of the strip away from the riff raff. Rooms were clean . Our room had an AC that was a bit noisy. After reporting it to the front desk they quickly changed our room. Had someone move all of our luggage and gave us an ocean front room with an amazing view. The staff here really is the best. Janine who worked in guest services was the best. 4 hours before my wedding I discovered that FTD was not able to provide me with the wedding bouquet that I ordered. Janine took care of it and had a beautiful bouquet delivered to me just in time. She really went out of her way for me and I was so grateful. The entire staff is very kind and you could feel the Aloha spirit.The morning breakfast buffet and entertainment was excellent as well.The price was great and I would stay there again without a doubt.

This place was like a cheap youth hostel. I was so disappointed, you never know what you're going to get when going to a new place and booking it on the Internet. This was pretty bad. The room was ugly and very dated. It is in the middle of the action but still felt poor and like I was a sheep in a herd. The breakfast was awful. Again, people with little complimentary coolers lined up like cattle at a feeding trough to fill their faces and coolers with cheap yogurt and breads. There were too many people lined up at the trough and nowhere to sit once holding your plastic plate and cup. Cheesy Hawaiian performers sang to a disinterested crowd sitting around a microscopic pool surrounded by concrete rooms and half dressed teenagers. All the fat ugly tourists gorging on banana bread made me physically sick. If you have $20 more to spend, go stay at a nice place, not here.

We stayed at this hotel 2 years ago (Aug 2011) and really enjoyed our stay, so when we planned our return trip, the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was the only place we wanted to stay. The staff is always friendly and helpful, so this was not an issue. Our flight arrived early, but we we were able to leave our bags and go explore; we were able to check-in about an hour early. The first problem was our room- a king bed room had been reserved but we were given a room w/two full beds and it was also a handicap accessible room which we didn't need. There was no bathroom counter to speak of. The staff was friendly, but we were advised that we couldn't get another room until the next day. So we had to be out by 12:00 pm, check-in our luggage downstairs, re-check in at 3pm, lug our bags back up and try to get settled in again. The room had a nice view of Diamond Head and the beach, but the bathroom was kind of gross- not as clean as it could have been and the tiles were broken. Overall, a very shabby bathroom. The room was comfortable for the rest of the week, but during this time a very large group of teenagers on a school trip checked in and proceeded to disrupt the whole floor (9th). They were drinking and partying in the hallway and slamming doors every couple of minutes or so. This went on for approx 5-6 hrs, late into the night. I called the front desk 3 times and was assured it would be taken care of, but it wasn't. I even had the privilege of listening to a very angry Australian woman (another guest) finally lose her temper with these very inconsiderate young people. I really feel like the hotel dropped the ball; security came up several times but never got things under control. The hotel did offer us another room on another floor (the next day), but I did not want to go through the whole check-in/check-out, get settled in thing again. Why should I have to? The morning breakfast was nice, not the best food, but nice atmosphere with the ukelele, singing, and hula dancing. And the bar is nice to relax and have a drink. Overall, it was not a horrible experience, but it wasn't as positive as our first experience. I'm not sure I'd stay again... I'd have to really think about it.

After reading some of the reviews here, I was worried about making a reservation for my husband and I for an overnight in Honolulu before an early flight to the Big Island. This was my first trip to Hawaii so I sprung for an ocean view. The room (king size bed) was spacious for two people and nicely decorated. The hotel staff members were quite helpful starting with someone who gave directions when we got off the shuttle. After a short wait at check-in, someone else assisted us with directions on how to use the keycard operated elevator. The view was absolutely amazing. The location was convenient to lots of hotels and shops. Some reviewers commented on poor air conditioning--we could have refrigerated our room. We left the next morning at 3:30am and the desk staff was helpful and cheerful (with coffee) when we checked out. If I have an opportunity to visit Honolulu again, I will definitely consider this hotel when we return if we want to be on Waikiki. It is not the newest hotel on the block and some of the fixtures are dated, but the floor where our room was happened to be clean and inviting. Our bathroom was spotless (albeit with older tile and fixtures).Reviewers have commented on the $18 resort amenity fee. The hotel website was clear and upfront about this charge. I do quite a bit of traveling and while I don't like these extra charges, it is not unusual to pay extra fees in resort areas, even in places much less exotic than Waikiki.  I recommend the Aston Waikiki Beach very highly.

The hotel was well located, just a road width from the beach. However it is showing its age. It was ok, probably best suited to kids and family holidays.Included breakfast was a little too much on the muffin and pastry side.The $US18 / day resort tax is a killer. But this applies to all hotels in Hawaii

After reading many reviews of this property we were concerned about our choice to stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach. We were pleasantly surprised when we checked in. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We arrived several hours before check in, our room was not ready, but they did finish it and get us in at 1:30 PM. Our room was clean, quiet, and had an awesome view (ocean front). The bathroom was dated and the room is small, but we found it met our needs for the 4 nights we stayed. Breakfast was a wonderful treat and was constantly being restocked. The hotel is busy, but we never had any trouble moving about. The new elevator system worked to perfection!

We chose this hotel because it was overlooking Waikiki Beach and promised much on its website. It is cheaper than most others with ocean frontage, so we weren't disappointed as it was just a place to sleep. Our room was on the front southern corner of the building and offered spectacular views of the beach, Diamond Head and the zoo. We found it dated but clean. We were high enough to not be affected by the noise of the traffic or the bistro/bar and restaurant.The idea of breakfast on the beach is very nice but not very practical from our viewpoint. The staff were always friendly and helpful.

I stayed here earlier this month with my family for 5 nights. We had the Aloha Suite with partial ocean view--2 double beds with living room area and sofa bed. The extra space was much needed. The room was "worn" and there was a spot on the carpet that was sticky. I had to put a towel on it the entire time. The hotel is right across from the beach and next to the Zoo. We were able to check in a little early. It takes a little getting used to the elevator system. From our floor, we could only get downstairs by pressing 3 (reception area) then take the escalator or another elevator to get to the lobby. Odd. To get our car, valet recommended that we call them before we head down because it takes about 15 minutes for our car to come around. Wireless internet was SLOWWW (Oceanic Time Warner). I gave up and ended up using my mobile broadband the entire time. My 2-year-old baby nephew got his finger caught in the sliding glass door, which bled and he screamed bloody murder. (Sister gave brother-in-law death stare.) I called reception and they sent up security with a first aid kit. He bandaged up my nephew and he stopped crying. Staff overall were nice.I didn't care much for the continental breakfast, but I did take it once to the beach in the morning. Luckily, it's close to many restaurants. The free DVD rental was also a nice bonus and good selections. We used it twice.

Unless you can afford two rooms - one for your brood of children, and one for you and your spouse - look elsewhere. These rooms are SO SMALL for the money. My husband is 6'2", I am 5'2", and we shared a glorified twin bed, while our two daughters shared the same size next to us. Yes, it is close to the beach, eateries and shops, but the amenities don't make up for it in my opinion. The "breakfast on the beach" option is kinda' neat, but it is sugared-up yogurts, donuts and pre-packed cereals. Coffee is medicore and 6 ounces only.Starbucks is near by, and is a saving grace.Some positive things are that every morning there is live ukelele (or equivalent) with a graceful island/hula dancer. Very beautiful and we were appreciative of this while starting our day poolside.The balconies SUCK. I'm sorry to use such strong language, but they are unliveable. They are too small to use a chair - standing room only - two adults maximum. I used it almost exclusively to dry wet swim suits. I sat one morning with my Starbucks and pastry, contortionist style while looking at the turquoise water of the Pacific Ocean.Bottom line - if you have money in the bank, stay elsewhere.

Excellent location at end of Waikiki Beach and oceanfront rooms have great view but in our opinion this hotel has gone down in quality in a couple of years. Chipped paint, poorly decorated and equipped suites, mattresses that have seen better days, nice housekeepers, valets/porters but otherwise devoid of service and desk staff not interested. Rooms can be noisy from rooms on either side. Worn but great views from oceanfront rooms. Disapointment with 20th floor suite

After travelling around the USA for 8 weeks staying in many and varied hotels at prices much lower than this hotel with no complaints about them at all - this hotel was the most disappointing hotel we have ever stayed in.This hotel is nothing like how it portrays itself on its website. It is very dated, dirty, smelly and in need of a big overhaul. There was no welcome on arrival - just “what's your name” and told the lobby was on the next floor up. Reception was no better. We were asked our name, told there was a compulsory amenities fee charge of US$18.00 per night to cover breakfast, internet and DVD movies - even if we didn't want any of those services. We were given our room keys and no explanation about the hotel lift system to your room (nothing like a normal lift system). Our first room was in the "back blocks" on the 15th floor. We paid for a full ocean view - that we didn’t get (we did go back to reception and advise that we had paid for an ocean view and were told that this was classed as an ocean view). The room was very smelly and in need of a good clean, paint and refit. Outside our door we had the drinks vending machine, ice machine and housekeeping supply room - the first night we had no sleep from the noise. My partner complained in the middle of the night and was told that they would move us up to the 20th floor away from the machines. When come time to move in the morning – we were told “no the room wasn't ready, it needed some maintenance”. After requesting to see the manager on duty to complain about the service and room we had been given, we were advised that would be moved, not to the room on the 20th floor, but further round to the main part of the hotel and it would be an upgrade to "one of their deluxe rooms at no extra charge". We had to wait until after 3.00pm to access the room. When we finally got to the room - the only upgrade was one extra bedside table and a little better view (although you also looked into the next hotel’s rooms as part of the view). The room was still dirty (even though they said it had been cleaned), in need of a paint, a refit and noisy. We wanted to leave, but we had paid nearly AUS$2,000 for the week’s accommodation and there were defiantly no refunds!Breakfast was the next little surprise - they gave you a little cooler bag to take with you to have "breakfast by the pool or take it to the beach". The breakfast was very basic, some of the food was stale and you had foam cups with lids that didn't fit, paper bags, and plastic knives, spoons and forks to eat with. Finding somewhere to site to eat was a joke - a hotel with about 600 rooms provides approximately 50 chairs!!! They had a guitar player and one girl dancing while you ate the breakfast - great, except people sat there all morning and occupied the chairs - everyone else missed out on sitting down. Not many people took their breakfast to the beach, they all took the food up to their room - thus spilling milk, hot water and food everywhere on the walking areas and in the lifts. On many occasions this was not cleaned up for ages. From what we could see there were very few housekeeping staff employed.If you wanted to swim in the small pool, you had to put up with floating bits of food and rubbish from the morning’s breakfast (all the mornings we were there were windy) . The pool surrounds – the concrete around it was very uneven, parts of it missing and the paint flaking off in most areas. The only things you are provided with in your room as one glass each - no provisions for tea and coffee. The air-conditioner is aimed right at the sleeping area (you cannot change this) and you can't open the window/sliding door as there are no flyscreens and it is far too noisy.The hotel was over the road from the beach and we are guessing this is what the hotel sells itself on – after chatting to other people, there are much, much better hotels with similar locations.We are not sure how this hotel has received such good reviews on Trip Advisor. We will never stay again and we have advised our Travel Agent not to book anyone else at the hotel.

If able I would've given the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel a 3.5 rating but opted to round up to 4 instead of down to 3 as the staff and location helped make the overall stay a good one despite a few issues with the rooms.To start, the hotel location across from a really nice swimming beach with sandy bottom enclosed by a sea wall makes it good for families with kids, seniors or those like me who want to have a dip without battling the waves. It's within a few short block walk of the Honolulu Zoo and Kapiʻolani Park one direction as well as the International Marketplace the other so very central within Waikiki. I opted for my 2 night stay an ocean view room and was on the 16th floor with an excellent unobstructed view along Waikiki toward the Royal Hawai'ian Hotel (Pink Palace). The balcony was a little smaller than expected but you got used to it after a while, though those with height issues take note. There wasn't direct sun in the morning so really liked having my breakfast on the balcony in the shade while watching the stunning scenery below. The BOB (Breakfast on Beach) is a continental breakfast the hotel offers that comes with a small cooler bag in your room which you fill up at food stations on the pool deck and can then take to either the beach, your room or consume on the chairs around the pool. There were pastries, donuts, cereals, fruit, yogurt and juices included and should you want made to order omelettes there is an extra $5 charge for that.Staying solo my room was plenty big enough for one but can imagine a family of 4 finding it a tighter fit, especially given the bathroom is smaller than others I'd seen on O'ahu. The bathroom also comes without a fan and besides being smaller is also showing it's age with discolored tiles covered by a matt. There was good water pressure and the hot water took only a few seconds to arrive so was happy with that. I did hear from some staff that room renovations are coming later this year so hope they do spruce up the room fittings as I feel they could use it. One other thing I had to consciously remember to do each time I went out was to firmly shut the door as it wouldn't always close by itself as most hotel room doors do. Everything in the room was in working order and nothing was very obviously broken or damaged but you could see the wear & tear over the years in places.I didn't check out Tiki's Grill & bar which is next to the pool as most nights it seemed full or almost full. It has a retro vintage Hawai'i theme with big tiki statues, fishnets and a volcano and has live music though luckily doesn't play too loud or too late into the night. There is a $18/night "daily amenity fee" that covers the breakfast on beach, in-room Wi-Fi, free local & toll-free calls, in-room safe, newspaper & PS3 PlayStation so factor that in when making hotel comparisons. I understand these costs were previously charged separately and could add up for some guests but for those like me who don't need a newspaper, play video games, use in-room Wi-Fi or make calls what used to cost a few dollars a day in misc. charges is now $18 and is mandatory so has an impact. Sadly Aston isn't the only hotel chain adding these resort fees but think the cost is too high.The staff were warm & welcoming and so helped make for a pleasant stay and this along with a good location helped balance off a few small drawbacks about the room. I'd be curious to visit again after some upcoming renovations as it will hopefully make what is a good hotel better.

I stayed for 1 night at this hotel with my family, went to Big Island and came back for 2 nights cause I already had a reservation.Location is great, staff is friendly, rooms are big enough.1st night: - amazing room, balcony with ocean view.- good facilities.- BUT: found a dead BUG in my sheets. Looking for bed bugs yielded in a negative result though, but I had two red bites the next day.2nd and 3rd night:- upgrade to ocean view room.- this time the sheets were very clean.

Having stayed here with 2 friends in 2009 I thought it would be great to come back...then, we had an elevated room with views of Diamond Head and partial ocean views, it was freshly renovated and the room was large and airy. This time around, I thought of lashing out on a complete ocean view room for the other half and I. Check-in was effortless and friendly and ahead of the 3pm check in time. The room though was very dated. With no disrespect to the staff, this hotel is a bit of a dive. The hotel is clearly a 60s or 70s refurb, the ocean front rooms are tiny and the balconies awful. We were on L8. The bed was hard, the bathroom paint job dated...overall a massive miss. The breakfast is okay if you like lots of sugary donuts, bread and muffins. The fruit is hard and unripe. Expect lots of drunk under 25s and families. For the second visit running I couldn't stomach a swim in the pool, it is too small and too crowded. With a bevy of homeless people to greet you on the street, I couldn't recommend this unless you have very low expectations. The Marriott across the road, or even Astons boutique looking Hotel Renew next door might be an option. Hate to be the bearer of bad news, but this one needs an overhaul. As for the daily amenity fee, it's a bit rich, when the local taxes added on will take your extras to more than $50 a day!

My husband and I stayed here at the end of a one month usa trip, we stayed four nights.On arrival we were met by staff who spoke limited English and not very friendly. However they upgraded us to a partial delux ocean view room.The room was very cramped and outdated. The place smelt damp.We were kept awake until 2am every night due to load music from the tiki bar down stairs.At 6.30am we were awoken by singing (terrible) at the pool area.The view from our room was very beautiful with the pool and ocean. The breakfast was very average, you have to grab your food and put it in a little bag then, eat it around the pool. My husband felt like we were a group of seals camped out on the beach. The breakfast is very high carb and sugar. Not a lot of fruits and healthy options.They say its a free complimentary breakfast however they charge you about $18 a day plus tax for resort fee. Positives of the hotel was the free DVD rentals and the proximity to the beautiful beach.I would say definitely not a hotel for couples who want to relax. There were children and teenagers everywhere.

I checked out 15 minutes after checking in. The rooms were super small. The bathroom was old with a dripping faucet and stool that wouldn't stop running. The A/C was set at 65 and it felt like luke warm room temp. I laid on the bed, which was firm and comfortable, but couldn't even begin to take a nap with the noise coming from the sliding glass doors. I don't think they were sealed very well because the whistle from the wind was the deciding factor that I couldn't stay here. Our room was at the end of a hallway which actually turns into a motel feel with the door being outside versus inside a covered hallway, so I think the wind literally went in one door and out the other, even with both of them being shut.Location seemed wonderful right in the heart of Waikiki and the staff was very accommodating. They didn't even charge me any sort of cancelation fee. The two ladies I worked with during check-in and check-out were both very gracious.Ended up staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for only $15 more per night and 5 times the ammenities.

We stayed in an ocean view room on the 21st floor. View of Waikiki was exceptional. Room size small but manageable with two kids. Staff were always friendly, and exceeded expectations. The free breakfast is best left sitting on the tables for the birds. Should you chose to eat it, expect the same pastries, cereals, and fruit every day. Kids loved getting in the pool as a change of pace from the beach, and mom and dad loved having a drink on the pool deck while they swam. We had an enjoyable stay, and would stay here again if the price is right.

There really isn't a lot this hotel has going for it.Our first encounter with reception was very unprofessional upon booking last year in July there were no amenity fees when we got there, there was an $18 per day amenity fee which she was very hostile in telling us that we had to pay it now cause it is what they charge . this is suppossed to cover continental breakfast,(which we had pre paid so were charged again in this fee), wifi, chairs to take to the beach (which we never used and daily newspaper ( which we never saw) and DVD's (cause you go on holiday to watch the telly) there was a group of us and we had 5 rooms Breakfast is a combination of high carb, fatty, sugary bakery items, some fruit & yoghurt which you have to cram into a tiny cooler bag then try to find somewhere around the pool to eat it on the sunbeds, any hot option of an omelette was and extra charge of $5 there were no toast making facilities and coffee served in paper cups. Breakfast goes from 6.30am till 9am and a Hawaiian man starts singing at 7am so don't expect to sleep in as he is using a microphone, our one and only time there was enough so that we skipped breakfast everyday day which is very disappointing.My husband & I requested some wine glasses so we could sit on our balcony in the evening and have a drink, we were told by reception they don't have wine glasses and weren't they able to get any and we should try the ABC shops. in the compendium it says there are laundry facilities as we had been on a cruise the week before we needed to do washing, there was supposed to be a laundry bag and an item slip for it to be sent out, our room didn't have one, I asked the house keeper for one she said they don't have the laundry facility anymore and we might find a laundromat somewhere down the street House keeping starts to vacuuming the hallway and knocking on rooms at 8am we had to say we were still in bed a few morning (could have been embarrassing had we been in the bathroom) but she still continued to vacuum the hallway. When they do come into the room they seem to just make the beds not with clean linen so we had the same sheets all week , bathroom seemed to be just given the once over and fresh towels put in there were still hair and makeup on the sink.The only power point we could find available was the one in the bathroom right next to the sink so charging phones, cameras, electric razors, ipod, ipad & PC seemed a little dangerous all in all this hotel does not reach anywhere near the 4star rating that it has been givenif all you want is a bed for the night look else where would not recommene this hotel to anyonewas a great disappointment to end off my birthday "Hawaii 50" experience for my friends and family I just hope they can learn and retrain there staff in customer service Working in 4.5 star property myself I know what standards are expected from our guests and this is not up to Australian standard and I rate this hotel as a 3 star property

Right across from the beach on the main drag. Staff very friendly. Rooms are small - pretty crowded for 3 adults w/luggage. Partial ocean view -very nice. Balcony small -1 chair. Bathroom very small. Continental breakfast inc with resort fee of $18/ day. Lots of carbs/hi cal stuff. Omelets are xtra. Beware most tours take off @ 0600. Food doesn't start until 0630. Would be nice if hotel adjusted their breakfast time before you take off for the day. I do like the elevator security - need your key card to access your floor. Noisy in the early morning but I'm sure all hotels in the area are. Also be aware, the a/c turns off when you open the balcony door. Pleasant Hawaii Tours very helpful. One day our room was not cleaned & ready until 2pm.

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is really nice. It is near most everything you want to do, including the beach, the Honolulu Zoo (both right across the street from it). Tiki's Bar & Grill, although pricey, the food and service were excellent and with a nice view when the sunsets over Waikiki. It is just a couple blocks from Cheeseburger in Paradise and many other restaurants. The staff were excellent. Especially the ladies and gentlemen who were doing bellhop and valet parking.The rooms are kind of small compared to other hotels we've stayed, and the free breakfast was just Okay. Internet is free, however, for wireless internet you have to go down to the pool/lobby area to access it. Otherwise, you have to plug in using a network cable, which is provided for free.

The rooms, location, pool area and breakfast on the beach are all great. the only thing that lets the hotel down is the reception. We arrived after flying all night to find we couldn't check into our room until 3pm, all we wanted to do was get settled into our room as we were exhausted. I was hoping they'd at least prioritise the room service for our room since we were waiting but they didn't. The other issue was I had to come back to reception on three separate occasions for small things and each time I had to line up for over half an hour. I would really recommend having more staff on at reception at one time! The last thing travellers feel like doing when they get to a hotel after long flights is waiting in a long cue to check in. We did have to change rooms after around 20 American teenagers checked into our floor and partied loudly but the hotel was very accommodating about this and arranged another room quickly. Also the Tiki's Bar & Grill downstairs is fantastic!!

I stayed at the Aston for one night en route to Vancouver. As the flight arrived early, I was at the mercy of the Hotel to let me check in early....which they did. FOR $75 EXTRA! Upon departure I requested a late check out as my flight wasn't until late in the evening. They granted me this too. FOR $75 MORE. I found this to be greedy. Whilst I appreciate that they deal with this often, it would have been kind of them to have waived one of the late fees, ie/ the early or late charge. My room rate ended up being $300-ish for one night which caused me to make a note to never return. The hotel was busy, the staff were pleasant enough but this is not a warm, intimate Hawaiian haven. This is a large property that pumps them in and out every day. Based on my experience with early and late fees, the hotel is doing just fine financially, thank you very much. The pool is located just off of the lobby and was extremely busy and full of kids. The location was indeed great, mere steps to the beach and completely surrounded by shops, bars and restaurants. The room was just 'ok'. It smelled very musty, the furnishings, etc were very 70's era and the property in general was quite tacky and cold. The balcony was small and lacked any privacy at all. I won't be back.

This hotel is in the perfect location, across the road from the beach and at the begining of the busy hustle and bustle strip. The rooms are a bit outdated, the pool is simple . There is a restaurant that has a singer singing in the evenings. Breakfast is served by the pool each morning with a hula dancer and hawaiin singer every morning. You are given a cooler bag and can help yourself to breakfast and may eat by the pool, on beach or take back to your room. Breakfast consists of various pastries, krispy cream donuts, cereal, fruit, cofee, tea, juices.Hawaii is beautiful, especially shopping!!!!!!!

We booked this last minute, & I did not research as well as usual.We stayed at Sheraton for business 3 days, then moved to Aston.Booked a partial ocean view room - don't bother. Could not sit on the balcony - would have paid for full ocean view room if I had known. Room was spacious and beds comfy.Bathroom on checking in was dirty.Breakfast was my biggest complaint. Lots of fatty, sugary, carbohydrate loaded options, but little healthy food. After filling your cooler bag, you then had to find a seat - good luck with that! Not really my idea of breakfast on a holiday. Only ate there once.Small pool and lots of families with children....Great location with an easy walk to the busier end of the beach strip. Lovely beach area opposite.Next trip I will research with vigour, & read more reviews, prior to booking anything.

I booked this hotel on priceline and had read all the mixed reviews about it. The rooms do look a bit dated but me and my husband could look beyond that as we didn't spend much time in the room as we were always out and about. The pool area is small, so with children its not great but again you have the wonderful beach in front so why would you want to stay by the pool. They do charge $18 for chairs, wifi and pool towels and breakfast. breakfast is continental and nice however not really needed everyday.The wifi isn't great. however I found taking the chairs with us every day to the beach and any beach was great.the location is a bit noisy but I think all of that strip is noisy, however if you have a car, then its free parking literally outside the zoo so its great for that.its not a four star hotel, but I would book it again as it suited my needs come in get changed and go out sleep and shower and go out again.

Not only could we not check in on arrival ( after a 16 hr trip) but we were then offered a room which had two double beds, but for an added $500!!!!! Then they threw in a $18.00 per day charge to use the safe and Internet... I also think the pictures taken for this site and every other site I've seen we taken a good 10 years ago, the pool is so old and horrible, the bathrooms haven't been cleaned or updated in... Ever. To really top off the worst service ever.. We get a knock at the door at 11pm to tell us that we've had a 'noise complaint' hmmm interesting that the person who complained about us would be able to hear us over the noise from the street given that none of the sliding doors close and you can hear EVERY NOISE EVER ALL NIGHT?!! Wouldn't stay here again EVER and won't be recommending it to anyone I know. Going to give my travel agent to hot tip too!

Picked the Partial Ocean Front View Room which was absolutely fine because we barely spent any time in the room. The room was a little dated to what it appeared to be in the photos, but very clean, and the view was just stunning! It was a fantastic stay, the only thing I was disappointed about was that the Breakfast on the Beach was actually an esky bag, which we could then fill from the breakfast buffet and walk across the road to the beach. I splashed out on the nicer hotel for the Buffet on the Beach, but just have to read the fine print I guess! Still a beautiful location, and there was so much to do!! I needed more than 6 nights in Honolulu!!

We spent three nights on Oahu for our first HI experience and wanted to stay in the heart of things - this hotel certainly is! Be aware that this is a high traffic area so if you want peace and quiet book elsewhere. But if you want to be close to the excitement of Waikiki this place is a good value.Our rooms were comfortable but the bathrooms, while adequate, require updating. We slept well on their comfortable beds and had plenty of room for what we needed, which was not much as we were out most of the time. On arrival the bellhops directed us to the front desk and we quickly became familiar with getting around (Hint: The escalators make it easy to get up and down, while the elevators key to your floor for a quick ride.)The first two days were had booked early AM excursions and missed the breakfasts to the amenity fee was burned for those days. We made the breakfast the last day but if we could have opted out we would have. I would say the amenity fee was not a good value for us. The supplied food was average and I've had better continental breakfasts at Hampton for no additional fee (with hot eggs, meat and waffles.) We had no interest in the games and used little of the wifi and television. They need tables and chairs for dining otherwise use the supplied picnic bag from your room and eat either on the beach or in your room.We did enjoy the food and drink at the Tiki restaurant on the front-desk level. Pricing was on-par for Waikiki but quality was very good. Our bartender even looked up and made my favorite island drink - the Goombay Smash!Our rooms had a direct view of Waikiki beach and I recommend that option. It was a great view and wish we could have spent more time enjoying it. We were able to get chairs for the beach but they were short on beach towels and we had to settle for bath towels at times.Their pool is nice but morning sun is limited and it crowds quickly. We were lucky enough to be there during the International Hula Conference and got an awesome free hula show - fantastic!Compared to other hotels in the area I think this is the best value. If you want to spend more money you may find nicer hotels in the same area but you will need to decide if it's worth it to you.

This hotel HAS to be the noisiest hotel on Waikiki Beach! It seems like every single truck, bus, trolley, and tour van makes its circle in front of the hotel EVERY single morning starting at 6:00 a.m. I wish I'd done better research on location before I booked.The hotel also charges an "amenity fee" of $18.00 per day, which we did not notice until our arrival. This fee covers their breakfast by the pool (the usual "continental" type) and wi-fi access fees of $9.95 per day. Really? $9.95 for wi-fi?

Rooms average, baths a bit outdated, front desk service average, needs training. I would ask 4 different people the same question and get 4 different answers. The beach breakfast is okay for continental. The doughnuts were tummy, however, not needed everyday. You could get an omelette for $5 and nothing else. Hotel ran out of beach chairs almost everyday.Hotel restaurant okay, tiki bar not worth it. They should serve the regular menu in the bar. Wolfgang puck style. The express kitchen on the watershed was very good. Their is a fantastic sushi bar next door at the Marriott.Overall, okay stay.

I booked this on a recommendation from our Travel agent and a friend of the family who recently stayed here and from the moment I arrive I had issues with this hotel.Firstly the lobby isn't on the ground floor, you have to figure out where it is and how to get there- lift or escalators. Though the lifts are confusing (press 3)Secondly the room I stayed in and am still in (last night thankfully) has 2 double bed (yep doubles not queens) for a couple and the bathroom barely fits 1 person in it.Thirdly - How the hell do I exit without having to go to lobby every time? That's right I haven''t figured out how to go to the ground floor from my level.So that's the bad, here's the good1) Location is right across the road from the swimming beach that's separated from the main surf for safety.2) Continental Breakfast included, though its hard to find a seat.3) Dvd's and games as well as wi-fi access are included in the 'resort' fee.. wouldn't really call it a resort though.I wont stay here again unless I got a super good deal.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. We wanted an ocean front room but didnt want to pay the price of some of the other hotels. We were plesently surprised. The hallways were a little dated but the rooms were nice and modern, the bathroom was ok as well. The balcony was only small but could fit both of us and had great views of the beach and waikiki. We really liked the location as its at the end of the strip. This made it quieter, there was more beach and it was less crowded. The free breakfast was pretty average but it does the job of giving you a quick bite to eat before you head off for the day. What we really enjoyed were the free DVD's - great to relax with after a big day exploring. We would easily stay here again & would reccomend it to others.

Second time staying here. Love the breakfast & "Breakfast on the Beach""BOB". Love the fact you have to use your keycard to get to your floor, very fast. Jon was very helpful in getting us an upgrade from 7th floor to 22nd floor. View was of Zoo and Diamond Head. Unfortunately room was handicap room - no bathtub and did not like the fact that there was no counter at all in the bathroom, had to put items on toilet tank. Rooms are looking dated. Loved the free DVD's. Rooms on Diamond head side have only standing balconies, Waikiki side have sitting balconies. Pool was never usually crowded. Towels & chairs can be signed out to go to beach. Unfortunately didn't have housekeeping one day, had to ask for more towels and toilet paper. Suggestion to hotel - need more hooks or racks to hang items especially in bathroom. More drawers would be good too. Rooms could use an upgrade.All in all the location is great, right on Kalalaua across from jetty. Not too noisy. Can walk to everything. Loved it!

Truely this hotel is not 4 stars..... the service was appalling with rude check in staff......The rooms are very small and don't get me started on the bathrooms..... they were outdated, two people could not fit in there at the same time. Thank god breakfast was part of our package because there was no way it was worth the price..... plastic cutlery, no bowls and plates, coffee out of plastic cups..... and if you wanted eggs for breakie it cost you an extra $5.00.I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, it is old, outdated and unapeeling.There are plenty of other lovely hotels around for you to choose.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and had dinner at Tikis (restaurant attached to hotel). The food was amazing. There were so many options to choose from and the location is just stunning (overlooking the beach). The service was exceptional. Ken (our waiter) and Daniel Vinci (our bus boy) were polite, friendly and super helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed their service and will definitely be back. Well done boys!!

We just got back from Oahu & Maui Vacation. We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach. It was a great week spent there. We were accommodated late the first night but I called the desk to ask for a room with a better balcony & view of the ocean. Joanne said leave it with me & she came through the next day with a fantastic room. We ate breakfast there & spent late night with a drink there.When we needed help with a tour that didn't come the desk downstairs made phone calls & we were one our way the day later.The Tiki Bar was fun too. Great food! Thanks Aston for being the best hotel on Oahu. We will be back.

The Tiki Grill and Bar which is located on the outdoor first floor of the Aston Wakiki Hotel is a great venue for a semi chill out night, very cool and ambiet atmosphere with great food which is very reasonably priced.The house bands that play there are very profesional and incoparate the crowd to get involved in a very entertaining experience.Our waiter for the night CJ was very hospitible and friendly and made sure that we were comfortable throughout our dining experience.We are definatly going back in our remaining time.
user_name:
Victoria V
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: This hotel charges $27 valet fee (no optionto park yourself) and you often have a 15 minute wait toget your car. You can't just go grab your car and run. Way too pricey for this hotel. The rooms are quite old and the bathroom floor was dirty in the corners and the waslls were chipped and needed painting. Also, they also charged an $18 resort fee for services that you really never used. They also advertise "breakfast on the beach" which is nisleading because they serve it pool side and give you a small plastic cooler to take your food across the road to the beach if you want. This is our 4th time to Waikiki and of all the hotels we have stayed in, this is the one we would NOT return to. The Tiki Bar & Grill is good and the poolside breakfast is mostly carbs but plentiful. If you want protein, you have to order eggs and pay an additional $5. We have stayed in much nicer places for less without the extra valet and resort fees!

I stayed here for four nights with a friend for a vacation before we hightailed it to the North Shore. This was not my first trip to Waikiki and I've stayed at numerous other hotels (Moana Surfrider, Holiday Inn, Hyatt Regency, Marriott, Sheraton). I decided on the Aston because of its location and price. I don't regret staying there but I'm not sure I would stay there again.the good: the location is tremendous. just about the last hotel on the strip closest to Diamond Head. Which means you have all the access to the bars and restaurants yet it's quiet. the elevators are efficient, fast, and pretty cool (no one tries to stick their hand in to catch the elevator at the last second). the breakfast buffet looked popular, but we didn't try it. easy to grab beach chairs and towels and walk across the street - or take to your rental car for the day. Tiki's was a good place to grab a drink and some appetizers - we met some great servers there and would recommend it for the view and the ambiance (the food was just OK too!). there are two mai tai's there - the regular one (which is just eh) and the 1944 mai tai (which is awesome). the view was great from our premium oceanfront room. they have a neat movie system there where you can pick out a dvd movie to watch for free...kind of like a red box in the lobby. but the selection wasn't stellar -- plus what are we doing watching movies in Hawaii anyway? the bad: you know you're in a 3 star hotel because it feels like it. It's a bit outdated and a bit worn, and you feel like you might not eat off the night stands (but then again, that's why you're staying there - to get a break..if you're there for your honeymoon, spring for the Marriott next door or one of the swanky places down the strip). the room was ok - there were some weird stains on the ceiling and door, but I wasn't grossed our or anything. the bathroom is small and outdated, but the water pressure is stellar. the balconies are tiny - only a chair and ottoman. we used the ottoman as a second chair and it was fine. prepare to get to know your neighbors - the balconies are not only small, but they are very close. as in inches apart. We saw the same people on their balconies all the time and you have to acknowledge them because it's kind of awkward if you don't ("oh, good morning...beautiful day, isn't it?"). way too uncomfortable. the hallways are kind of dark and not very beachy (I think it's all the red and browns). the gym is really awful. I'm OK with tiny, but there is no view and, more importantly, the equipment is old and didn't work properly. here's a pro tip - if you drive past the hotel onto Montserrat St you can park there and overnight. we did and saved $$$. Overall: I don't think I'd stay here again because there are nicer budget hotels in Waikiki - and better budget hotels with the same, gorgeous view (minus the awkward encounters with the neighbors). but the hotel tries and everyone is really nice - and you're in Hawaii, so get out of your hotel anyway!

My family and I stayed here for 5 nights it was a great location right across the street from the beach and trolley pickups was right in front of the hotel.The rooms were a bit too small our ac kept making noises but it didnt really bothered us. Their continental breakfast was just OK wish they change up the menus a bit, they tend to run out of stuff by 8am so try to get there earlier it kinda threw me off because the breakfast ends at 9am but the staff told me they ran out of certain stuff when i got there at 8am, overall hotel staff was friendly would stay here again.

During our trip to Hawaii, we stayed at the Aston Waikiki. For me it had been over 30 years since I had left Hawaii that I returned to tour Oahu. We rented a car to travel round the idea. We easily found the hotel even though Honolulu and Waikiki and definitely changed since I had left. The hotel is located across the street from the beach. A short walk of a couple of minutes and we were on the beach. Every morning there was a buffet breakfast served by the pool. We were provided a lunch bag that was your ticket to the breakfast. The buffet was well stocked with fruit, cereal, breads, juices, milk, and coffee. For $5 you can order an omelet made to order. As you ate your breakfast by the pool, there was local entertainment of Hawaiian music and dancing. Very pleasant atmosphere. If you the option of packing your breakfast and taking it to the beach, but don't forget to check out a chair and towel for the beach. If you do rent a car, parking is a little tricky. You can self-park in the sister hotel a block away for about $80 a week. It worked well for us. The staff was very helpful. Our room was on the 23rd floor with a good partial view of the beach. When you make reservations, check into the full beach view rooms. Also, the hotel chain is located throughout the islands, it might behoove you to join their loyalty program if you plan on future trips to Hawaii.

We stayed 14 nights at the Aston Beach Hotel. Sitting at the small table in the room, we had an ocean view (east towards Diamond Head) but I didn't go to Honolulu to stay in my room and look at the ocean. The beach was right across the street., excellent swimming areas and clean sand. Trolley buses stopped out the front. Restaurants and attractions were just a few minutes away, walking distance of everything. The location was superb, the staff was friendly and accommodating. The bed was large comfortable, the mini fridge in the room was a big plus for leftover and breakfast beverages, the room was clean and nicely appointed. The shower was a real rain shower, not one of those trickle downs, but the blue growth on the shower head shouldn’t be there. (Room 2322) I would stay here again and I highly recommend it. It was right in the heart of Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed at Aston Waikiki for four nights before moving on to Maui for the rest of our vacation. I would say it has one of the best locations on Waikiki strip due to the fact that the beach is across the street. We also noticed this section of the beach was a little quieter than further down which was nice. The other big plus was that the trolley's and busses all made stops right at Aston Waikiki. We used them to go to Ala Moana mall and also arranged a shuttle through PG Plover for the Premium Outlets which was very easy, cheap and convenient. I would agree that the hotel could use some updates but I must say that it was very CLEAN at all times. The bathrooms are quite small and most in need of the updates but otherwise we had no complaints about our room. The breakfast was nice, a decent selection. We enjoyed it for the 4 days we stayed- may get boring after a longer stay but nice to have the option of saving money on one meal a day.Tiki's bar and restaurant was great, we had 2 meals there, both delicious. We also liked that Wolfgang Puck Express, Coldstone, Starbucks etc was right there. And again, the location was so great- a nice stroll down the strip will take you to many nice restaurants and lots of great shopping. We would definitely stay again if returning to Waikiki!

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki for 3 nights on our family vacation. There were 5 adults in our party so we needed the 2bd/2br space the hotel offered. Our room on the 20th floor was clean and comfortable. It fit the group well. The room could use a bit of an update but the unbelievable view from the patio made us forget all about the outdated room. The washer/dryer in the unit was a big help with wet bathing suits and stinky Diamond Head hiking clothes. The staff was so kind. The valet especially was prompt and knowledgable about the area hot spots. The hotel was in walking distance to/from bustling "downtown" area. We easily walked to lunch and/or dinner. I would recommend the Aston Waikiki to friends and family. I would stay there again.

I stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 6 nights during the end of January in 2013. The view from the 'Ocean Front Room' was worth every cent. You looked over the whole Waikiki Beach.The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the busiest area of Waikiki. This was not a problem for us as we don't mind walking and there's stil looks to do/see on the walk. However if I was only staying in Waikiki for 3 or 4 nights I'd prefer to be closer to the action. The breakfast was awesome, we filled up the lunchbox and took it up to our balcony. Just basic ceral, crossiants, muffins etc. The rooms and bathrooms were quite old and a big downgrade from our other 4 star hotels during our USA trip, but still very very clean. We knew we wouldn't spend much time in the room as we'd be outside or on the balcony so wasn't a problem.My advice is if you can get this hotel for a good price for the 'Ocean Front Room' go for it!

Stayed here when it was a Resort Quest Hotel and my brother stayed here 2 years ago. Everyone was pleased both times. We are coming back this week and hope that our experience is as good as it was previously. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was fine. LOved the Tiki bar. It was a great place to finish the day. Looking forward to coming back.

Room was clean & had all we needed, room ready when we checked in, ocean front is the room to choose, spectacular view, room was big enough, elevators are different but worked great, no w ifi in room, hey we are on holiday, leave the computer at home, the resort fee is well know before you book, if you don't want to pay it don't choose to stay, pool was fine as beach is across road, no more needed, loved the breakfast cooler, yes it got busy by the pool so we enjoyed ours on the balcony or on the beach, better views anyway, food offered at breakfast was fine, yes continental but I don't need a hot breakfast every day, we stayed 2 weeks in September 2012, when you are on holidays you don't spend much time in your room, you are out and about enjoying this beautiful spot, so long as it's clean and nice, which Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was a perfect choice for myself and 3 sisters, we enjoyed this hotel and Hawaii so much we plan to go back and stay at this hotel again, only negative I found was with the reception staff, they were helpful but could have been more friendly like we found Hawaiian people to be, if they can work at this it would be an almost perfect hotel, our house maid was wonderful I must add, never had anything not cleaned, cleaning was to a high standard, outside was quiet noisy at night with music and traffic, but Waikiki is a busy place,thanks Aston Hotel for a great place to stay, perfect hotel, perfect holiday.

l booked this hotel because it included breakfast. breakfast actually consisted of muffins and bagels, cold cereal, yogurt and fruit. people waited for the food to be brought out and decended on it like vultures. one guy and his wife worked as a tag team getting all the blackberries and pineapple. oh, and they also had miso soup, rice and spicy cabbage. catering to the japanese clientele l guess. they didnt replenish after 8am even though breakfast finished at 9am. they also sold omelettes for $5.00. the rooms were ghetto and there was no outlet for laptop. l had to unplug the lamp. staff werent the friendliest either.

We recently spent 3 days at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Our room was clean and well appointed. We were able to get in without delay. Our rooms balcony overlooked the pool and had a view of the beach. I loved the computerized elevator system they have. Never had to wait for over several minutes for a lift. The Breakfast on the Beach concept is brilliant. Staff were very helpful. We would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Thought this to be a very good hotel. Rooms are decent with good view of beach. Convenient location. On the down side, there's no wifi in the room. You need to pay extra for internet and it's a cable to plug into the laptop. Wifi is available at the pool area

If I leaned out my window I had an ocean view but I didn't go to Honolulu to stay in my room and look at the ocean. The beach was right across the street. Restaurants and attractions were just a few minutes away, walking distance of everything. The location was superb, the price was excellent, the staff was friendly and accomadating. The bed was comfortable, the mini fridge in the room was a big plus for leftover and breakfast beverages, the bathroom, as well as the room, were pristine and nicely appointed. The shower was a real rain shower, not one of those trickle downs. I would stay here again and I highly recommend it. It was right in the heart of Waikiki.

Great hotel to stay in. I was on the 24th floor with a ocean view room and it was quiet, comfortable and clean. Don't be put off by the $18 resort fee (most of the hotels in Waikiki Beach has a resort fee) and this one includes a complimentary continental buffet, daily newspaper,etc. It's worth it (pastries, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, etc). The hotel is right across the street from the beach (beach towels available by hotel pool). Easy access to everything. Walking distance to Waikiki Beach attractions and stores. Also Waikiki Trolley stops right in front of hotel. You can also book tours downstairs and the Tiki Bar has good food and happy hour specials.

What a great place to stay, right across from Waikiki Beach. A top floor room with a partial view but I could still see Diamond Head and the beach from my balcony. The breakfast was inexpensive and had so many choices, plus you get a lunch bag that you bring with you and fill it up with food from the buffet and stroll a short distance across the street and enjoy your meal on the beach. I loved it. There is someone singing Hawaiian music and a hula dancer too for your enjoyment. I could have stayed there all day except there is so much to see in Honolulu. The staff is wonderful, the gift store has just what you need if you forgot something at home. There lobby is the best I've seen, beautifully decorated and comfortable seating while you wait for the valet to bring your car. We will stay here again.

Very good location, clean rooms, staff ok, although some dont have a lot of answers on transport, laundries etc. and werent too keen to find out for me. The resort fee thing is here $18 a day. Some members of our group were elderly and not interested in wi fi , gym, videos etc, but still had to pay,,,if its obligatory why dont hey add it to the price of rooms maybe its an american thing to do a little bit of a con for the elderly or a tax thing...but it does stink. Apart from this the hotel is ok..the "free" breakfast is a bit of a mixed bag....give special menu items for asians...but no toast for the aussies etc.I will look for somewhere else with free wifi and no resort fee. But if you have booked already its ok

Pros: Close to the beach. Complimentary beach towels. Continental breakfast. Mini-fridge. Ocean view (if you can afford it).Cons: Everything else. They make you pay dearly for the breakfast and the unsecured internet in your room (a daily fee of $18). I guess if they had a coffeemaker or microwave in the room you'd have to dish out another 20. It is kinda obsolete to have a fridge if you can't heat up what you keep in there. Also, the view. If it's not ocean front, it's either a parking lot, or somebody else's hotel room or - the worst of all - a rundown building occupied by anarchist with banners hanging of the side.So if you don't get upper floors ocean view, you better skip this place altogether.

I spent 3 nights at the Aston and had a great time. The continental breakfast in the morning is much bigger than expected. Unless you really want that big breakfast with hashbrowns, gravy, meat, and eggs, the buffet at the pool is just fine. Not only is there plenty of choice, but you get an insulated bag to carry your food in. The room was big and the bed comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The 3rd day, I noticed that the toilet was leaking a little. And the balcony is small. Yet, this hotel is reasonable, is right on the beach, and cose to everything Waikiki. I would stay here again.

Have just spent 9 nights at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We had a fantastic time. The great points were: Close to the beach, most things within walking distance, plenty to do if you choose, rooms are ok...Our room had an awesome view down Waikiki Beach..never got sick of looking at it! I was initially a bit nervous about this place after reading the reviews but we had a GREAT time! For the price, we had no problems at all. Staff were friendly, always willing to help out and never intrusive. I would go back there again anytime.

We stayed here for 6 nights. The good points are: close to the beach, close to the shopping, continental breakfast included, great ocean view from 25th floor, staff were somewhat friendly and helpful.Bad points: Valet parking a ripoff $27 we ended up parking on the street for most our time there, rooms very tiny really there is no room for 2 double beds, balcony really small and no where to hang swimmers, no seats available for breakfast.... that is why it is called breakfast on the beach to encourage you to go to the beach to free up the seats. The amenity fee is pretty pointless they should just include it in the room price, we didn't borrow the DVD's we had seen most of the movies. Housekeeping didn't replenish all the towels had to call reception/housekeeping to bring more towels this happened twice. I don't recommend having 2 adults and 2 children in the 1 room to squashy but I couldn't justify paying just over $2,000 for 7 days when we were spending most of our days out. We normally stay in apartments (timeshare) but were unable to get into an apartment so thought this one looked ok.

Arrived on 4/19/13 for 4 nights the entrance is confusing but ok, the front desk staff were nice, room is New York size small, we stayed in room 824 partial ocean front view, balcony is tiny, small room safe, ironing board, iron, tiny refrigerator, no micro, bathroom small with no ceiling vent, beds are comfortable with 32 inch flat screen. Room has ps 3 console with free rentals. But hotel is a great spot for everything trolley bus,tour pick point, taxi, public transportation and beach is 50 yards across the street with malls, high end shopping within walking distance. Dislike the amount of homeless sleeping nearby, hustlers everywhere. But I always felt safe carrying a large amounts of cash no matter were I went not hotel fault but island problem.

Stayed at the Aston for four nights--first time in Hawaii so wasn't sure what to expect. Let's start with the positives first: Flight got in early, so planned to check in and just stow our bags when we got to the Aston at noon. At that point they said that our partial view room was ready so we can go on ahead. Score! +5 for convenienceHotel: hip and trendy decorations. +1. Friendly staff, interesting "high tech" elevators. +1. No little kids pressing every button before you get to your floor! Location: absolutely superb. Walking distance to all major shopping areas, literally across the street from the beach. Moped rental place right behind the hotel, and car rental place less than a mile walk away. +5. Also one of the best bar + bar staff + drinks IN hotel +5Room: cute decor. View upgrade is totally worth it, even at partial view. Waikiki Beach at sunset and sunrise on the balcony while having a glass of wine or FREE orange juice was just wonderful (free breakfast is provided every day). +5Though I enjoyed staying here, and wouldn't mind staying again, a few complaints:- my bedsheet had a hole in it -3- parking at $27 per night is highway robbery. Price was comparable to other hotels in the area, and I didn't rent for the entire duration of my trip so was able to save a few bucks, but still, expensive -3- the elevators are cool, except when what seemed like 100 HS kids were checking in and kept scanning their cards over and over and kept getting reassigned, causing delays. And there's no "take the stairs to your floor" option. -5- I had a couple ants on the table due to a fresh lei--do hotels get ants? I wiped away the "lei juice" and they disappeared by the time I left for the beach and came back -5- housekeeping did not replace my shampoo/conditioner/etc., had to special request these. -3So, using my own method of scoring (with more points for really important things and less for not so important), I put the Aston at a 4. :)

We booked 10 days at this hotel and did so directly from the hotel website because bookers (like booking.com and such) do not have all the deals the hotel offers, notably the reduced rate if you stay at least 7 nights. I had read a lot of the reviews from TA beforehand so I decided to send them a direct email right after booking online in which I stated the purpose of our trip and what we were expecting. The hotel replied the same day saying that all my points were well noted and that they would do their best to fulfill our requests. Upon arrival I was not disappointed at all and felt they had actually taken my points into consideration to give us a great room.After 10 days there here are what I can say to help you decide:- If you want to see the ocean well, book an "Ocean view select" room. While it is a bit more expensive than a "partial ocean view" or "ocean view", the "select" guarantees you are on a higher floor (20 to 25). We ended up on the 25th floor and very close to the sea side so our view was an unobstructed view of the entire Waikiki bay. We could see the Friday Hilton fireworks from the balcony. Fabulous for the price I think.Also, floors higher up are more quiet and it was one of our requirement so it was perfect. - Our room had 1 door separating us from the next one, and they seem to all go in pairs like this. It must be to be able to reunite families who book 2 rooms. I had no complaint about it but if our neighbors had been noisy or partying in their room it would have been a problem I think. I guess it's like at home: there's always a bit of luck with whom you get as neighbors.- Some reviews complain about the $18 resort fee per day but I do think that fee is not outrageous at all compared to other hotels which ALL charge one (and if they don't this means you have nothing). We used the room safe, the breakfast, the towels, the DVD (rain on a couple of days), the wi-fi and everything worked as advertised. We did not go to the gym room and forgot to check it out.- Breakfast every day with the little tote bag is great. I ended up going downstairs to get it and bringing it back to the room as our balcony had a great view. It's true that the pool area gets filled up quickly but if you go early you might be able to get a spot. The musician and the dancer are such a peaceful addition to the scene. The breakfast selection was truly good for us: a selection of cereals, yoghourt, cut fruits, danishes (including croissants, doughnuts, muffins), coffee, and even miso soup and onigiri. If you want an omelet you must pay extra but I can understand that since it's made upon order.- We used the included towel service to get some to go to the beach and return them at the end of the day. And for days when you return late (after 7pm) you can leave them at the reception and there's no fee. I saw other hotels not even including that while their resort fee was much higher. - Cleaning service was really good and efficient during our stay. Very discreet, no loud noise and so courteous when we saw them in the hallway. Definitely happy with their daily service for our room.- The location is, in my opinion, very very good because it is at the end of the stretch, next to a very green park that makes you feel you're not in the urban jungle that Waikiki is, yet you are literally less than 10 minutes by foot from the Moana Surfrider, which represents a sort of center point. If you want to hike Diamond head you are next to it, you have the volleyball courts right there and surf concession on the beach. - Parking is expensive since you have to valet but the private shuttle service we used to go from the airport (hawaii23.com, I recommend them. Mark is a very nice person) to the hotel told us that there's free street parking on Monsarrat Ave and that is 1 block from the hotel using the sea side. We used that for 3 nights and did not have a problem. Many cars park there and there are always empty spots scattered. Since it is recommended to leave the doors unlocked wherever you park (even Budget told me that) we did just that and everything was fine. Just don't leave anything in the car.- Plenty of convenience stores at every corner. Good Wolfgang Puck express downstairs that actually has very decent pizza and dishes. Starbucks on the corner and if you are tired of stbx just take a 200 yards walk sea side in front of the park and there's a little coffee/snack place that serves good Illy coffee with tables in front of the ocean for less than what stbx charges. Summary: I'd stay again at that hotel because it gives very good value for the price. It is right there on the ocean and the staff is very professional.Hope that will help you !

We arrived at the Aston on Sunday, April 7th around 7P. Upon arrival we went up the escalator to the hotel desk. It was awkward to find if you didn't know where to go. We checked in and the receptionist informed us that there was an $18 a day fee for internet, DVD rental, towels, newspaper and more. That added another $100 to our trip the moment we arrived. The room was clean. We got a king size room. The bride and groom got a room with two double beds becasue they have a 5 year old as well. You could barely walk around the beds once the luggage was in there. Our room wasn't like that at all. The one bed definitely had its perks. The view wasn't too great. There was a hotel right next to us and we could SEE IN the other hotel. A little creepy. We overlooked warehouse looking rooftops. We did have a view of the ocean looking to our right off the balcony.The room was simple with a dresser, TV, table, two chairs, and night stands. The bathroom was simple as well with three sets of towels. We did have to call on a daily basis and ask for new towels. It didn't ever take very long. Room service didn't come until very late in the afternoon on the 10th floor.We didn't spend a ton of time in the hotel, so for us it was just fine. Nothing to write home about. We did enjoy the fact that we were on the end of the commercialized strip. Waikiki Beach was literally across the street and wasn't ever packed like it was in the middle of the strip. We always found room and didn't feel like we were on top of the people next to us. You can check out towels and bring them to the beach, so no need to rbing your own like we did. They also check out chairs you can bring there as well. We didn't utlize the hotel. We're from MN and wanted to be on the beach!They had a continental breakfast each morning from 630a-9a. We ate here twice because we wanted to experience the food on the island. They do provide you a cooler to bring down to breakfast to take food back up to your hotel room/ Refridgerators are in each room. There is yogurt, cereal, pastries and you can buy an omelet for $5.All in all for simple purposes I would recommend this hotel if you like to explore and don't plan to be in your room a ton. It wasn't five star, but had just what we needed.

I've read a lot of negative reviews about the Aston Waikiki Beach, none of them were true. This hotel is located in the perfect stop; across the street from the beach. the lobby is open aired by the pool, lovely breakfast spread every morning with live music and dancer. the rooms were comfortable. the staff friendly. Coffee/cold water available daily near check-in. you never feel as though your near a busy street until you're on the street. Yes there is a serious homely problem there, what city doesn't have one? the streets & beaches are cleaned daily, there's a visible police present but you never feel you need to watch your every step. this is a very laid back area but very family friendly.

Had a great time at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, we stayed there in October 2012. It was in a great location, right near the zoo and at the part of Waikiki Beach where there is a break wall in the ocean so the waves are not too big and you can easily swim there without worrying about a surfer hitting you! The hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful. Would definitely stay there again, especially since it was one of the more reasonably priced hotels right on the water. Really liked the breakfast by the pool as well, helped keep things affordable, was very surprised one morning when there was live music and Miss Hawaii entertained during breakfast with Hula dancing!

My family liked this hotel! The decor was Hawaiian themed which my kids really enjoyed. I liked the "breakfast on the beach" well enough but honestly it's just a continental breakfast that they don't have enough room or a designated place (besides the limited tables around the pool) to hold so they give you a lunch bag and you can take your breakfast to go. I wouldn't suggest eating on the beach. We were swarmed with birds in front of the hotel. They have probably come to know that people are bringing breakfast there. We didn't use the pool but it seemed on the smaller side for such a large hotel. All in all, we really didn't have any problems which is a great start. The staff were friendly and the place was clean. Not exceptional but not no real problems either

My 2 friends and I stayed here for 9 nights while in Waikiki. The hotel is in a great location, right across from waikiki beach. The breakfast is beautiful, although when it rains it can get a bit tricky. The pool area is well maintained and the room itself was very comfortable. We were on level 22 in a partial ocean view. We had troubled with a blocked drain but one call to reception and it was fixed that day while we were out. Movies are included in your amenity fee. I would recommend staying at this hotel

Rooms where nice with ocean view balcony. Not bad for the price. A bit outdated old Hotel. Breakfast on the beach was a marketing Idea. It was breakfast by the busy pool with no real tables to use and they give you a small tote cooler in your room to haul it to the beach. Restaurant on the 2nd floor not affiliated with the hotel was nice dinners where expensive and in very small portions. Waikiki beach across the street is trampled and stagnant and includes many homeless people waiting with open arms for your quarters. Take your quarters if you have enough, and stay at the beach house hotel instead. Its expensive but awesome. This is a good family hotel,lower in quality for the cheap traveler who just needs to be close to the beach. Starbucks is very closeby.

Brought my teenage daughter and 8 yr old daughter on a "girls weekend" excursion. I needed something that felt safe, accomodating for the vast ages represented in our group, and priced right for our budget (heck, we flew standby just to get here!) Aston fitted the bill. The room was great, beds very comfy. I really appreciated the complimentary DVD/GAME rental by way of the "redbox" style kiosks in the hotel lobby complete with PS3 to watch/play them in our room. Breathtaking views of the beach to our right, Diamond Head straight on and the cityscape to our left. The complimentary coolers to pack up a continental breakfast and take them beachside was a big hit for us too. When we come back and YES that will happen, I will gladly bring my family back here.

We booked the Aston through Costco travel and really weren't expecting much since it was one of the lesser expensive places on the beach. We were pleasantly surprised with what we got! The location is great! Right across the street from the beach, next to a lot of restaurants, and right next to the zoo. The room was clean and the view was spectacular (we got a partial ocean view room). The bathroom might have been a little outdated, but from what I hear about Waikiki, that's normal. I'm not usually picky about my bed and pillow, but it was a bit uncomfortable. You get breakfast with the room (fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereal - the basic continental options) with live music and they include a lunchbox in the room in case you want to pack some things for later. They also have a really neat DVD rental system that's included in the room price. Great idea for families! Their pool is not much to speak of, but who goes to Hawaii to stay by the pool? The best part was their tiki bar. We'd go every night to enjoy a drink and watch the sunset over the beach. Live music was a nice touch. If we ever to to Waikiki again, we'd definitely stay at the Aston!

Our recent stay at the hotel truly helped make our vacation excellent. The hotel is in an excellent location; across the street is the beach, walk west on Kalakua Avenue you have all the activity & shopping and walk east you have the quiet of the park with the Zoo, Aquarium and band shell.The rooms are superb. The view from our lanai was outstanding. Rooms are clean and have plenty of room. The bathrooms are also very clean and well maintained. The king bed was exceedingly comfortable. The sheets must have a very high thread count as they are so soft, and are excellent for cleaning eyeglasses ;-). Some reviewers have a problem with the “dated décor.” The décor is not highly polished and glitzy, it is colourful with floral themes, very fitting for Hawaii. Most of the properties we have seen have rather similar décor even the newer properties.We felt that we received excellent value for our dollar. The resort fee covers a lot of value features. We really like the breakfast, filling our bags and enjoying it on our lanai. The music and hula dancer at the breakfast is truly first rate and truly Hawaiian. We didn’t use some of the things covered by the resort fee, but that’s the real world, other people do use them.The staff at this hotel is excellent. Every staff member we encountered on our stay performed their role with skill and a very friendly manner. Front desk, hospitality, pool, housekeeping, engineering and security personnel made our stay comfortable and pleasant. Observing the challenges the staff encounter every day and the positive manner with which they handle them is truly amazing.At the hotel, Tiki’s Grill and Bar is fantastic. The dining lounge cuisine is superb and the service is A1. Our meals were very well executed and the flavour was spot on. Try the butterfish or mahi mahi. The bar is also a very welcoming and relaxing place to spend time overlooking the beach. The service and drink selection are top notch. The bar menu is first rate (coconut shrimp & prime poke, yum yum). Entertainment is also exceptionally good, Vaihi rules. Wolfgang Puck’s Express, Subway, and Cold Stone Ice Cream are several nibbles spots on the street front of the hotel. The three times we have stayed have continued to reinforce that the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is definitely our hotel of choice.

Was a bit nervous booking Aston as some reviews were less then complimentary and I even described the hotel to the family as probably "not that great", but we were in for a lovely surprise. This is a really nice hotel! It's clean, looks newly renovated and the staff were all wonderful, friendly and helpful. I booked an ocean view room and it was nice. The beds were fairly squishy for two, but comfy, with good donnas and pillows. View was great and overall the room was everything we needed (would of loved a kettle, but I guess that's not the American way). Now let's address the amenity fee.
