Yes, it's a pain and I don't understand why they don't just add it to the price. We all pay it, it's compulsory, why even mention it. However, we fully got our $18 a day. The breakfast was great. Again, not sure what other people are complaining about. Plenty of food and we ate there 6 mornings in a row at all different times. Yes, cereal and donuts get boring, but then so does spending $50 for breakfast! (what we spent on our first morning pre-checkin). We also hired a DVD each day (2 tired kids), which is included, so we were happy with the $18! They also advertise it everywhere, when you check in and again in your room, so no excuse not to be aware of it. Tiki's was also a nice place for a drink or meal. We enjoyed the $2 tacos and free beer on a Tuesday! Also had the best Kalua pig taco cups I have ever tasted!Service was also great, except for one lady at the tour desk, but I think she might have been about to leave and so wanted to get rid of me as quick as she could. I have to make special note of Lakai at the reception desk. I needed to scan and email an urgent document home and she happily scanned it for me and emailed it to me from her account. Location wise, I'm not sure you could ask for a better spot. Right on the water front and close to everything. I was actually surprised that most of the hotels are not on the beach but a couple of blocks away. The Aston made going to the beach really easy as it was only a couple of meters from the pool, so no carrying bags etc. Also the pink trolley that goes to Ala Moana the big shopping centre stops right outside the hotel. I guess if there was one thing it was that the hotel was packed and seemed to have numbers of groups of students (we saw a water polo team, cheerleading team and music group). But they were all great and so yes it was packed but I guess that's just life!Other reviewers have made comment on the homeless outside the hotel. Just wanted to point out the homeless are all along the main road and in fact we saw them all around Waikiki, so this is not particularly a problem for the Aston. These people are just down on their luck, are polite and certainly not threatening in anyway. A polite "No thanks/sorry" seemed to do the trick. All in all, had a great stay and would definitely stay here again if we return to Waikiki!

This hotel is across the road from the Waikiki Beach, in an extremely convenient location just at the start of the most popular stretch of Waikiki's magnificent shops and restaurants. The rooms are above average which included breakfast by the pool each morning. The rooms are well serviced each day by happy co-operative staff. The best thing about this Waikiki hotel is the 'Tiki Bar Restaurant and Bar' offering great food at reasonable price and where you can 'chill' for drink after a great day out sightseeing on this wonderful and beautiful island. Price was very competitive and I would stay here if I was to return to Waikiki without hesitation. I would also like to praise 'Roberts Hawaii Tours' which we used for all transfers and tours - friendly, informative, reliable, affordable and safe.

The Aston was a nice place. We had a partial ocean view room that was just enough. Bed was comfy, bathrooms were out dated just like I had read from others, but that was not a vacation killer. The Tiki bar downstairs was awesome. Right across from the beach so great location. I agree with other posters about the resort fee. For the cost I would have rather picked out my own daily breakfast (if we even got up early enough) and we used hot spots on our phones so we didn't need wifi. NOR did we need the "included" DvD rentals or unlimited play station. Resort fee with "inclusions" would have been good if we needed a baby sitter. We got hung up in SF due to united not being on time, i didnt call the hotel because i paid our entire stay up front. while we were on our way to hotel i got a call saying they gave up our room because we no showed. i snapped! The front desk was kinda snobby, but we weren't about to let anyone get us down. Good thing they "found" us a room!!! It was paid IN FULL, who gives up a room? Really! There were ALOT of kids, clearly traveling with schools or for sporting, again, we weren't about to let it ruin our trip! Our stay at The Trump the last 4 days made up for any of our complaints to begin with
user_name:
Jenn E
Spring Creek, Nevada, United States

review_body: This hotel is quite dated and looks like a converted Holiday Inn from the 70's or early 80's. Rooms were just average. Breakfast is included but it's a mad rush to get food or a table, so just bring it back to your room. View of Waikiki Beach is great if you get an ocean-front room above the 4th or 5th floor. Staff acts like they're doing you a favor.

My wife and I are currently in our 7th day of a 10 day stay. This is our 5th stay at the hotel. For an older property the hotel in well kept. For us the big plus is the location. A quieter part of Waikiki and we particularly enjoy the walk toward Diamond Head. Across the street from the hotel is beautiful Waikiki beach. The hotel includes a Subway and Wolfgang Puck Express. By the pool is the Tiki Restaurant and Bar which provides moderately priced food and nightly entertainment. The flow at the continental breakfast by the pool is much better organized than on previous visits.In my opinion there is not $18 value in the 'resort fee'. While it is nice to have wi-fi in our room it can be very slow at times and only works within a few feet from the router (not even on the lanai!).Free DVD rentals are included but really not much interest to us as we would much rather be out and about. The breakfast used to be part of the basic room rate. Certainly not worth $180 in our case. Will this be the tipping point in our decision to return is hard to say; but it certainly will be a factor.

This hotel is so well situated on the bustling Waikiki Beach that I can't help but give it five stars! The hotel is just across the street from the beach. What I love most about it is the location. Out the door, to your right is the busy, action-packed Waikiki beach. To your left is the peaceful, gorgeous Kapiolani Park. It's the best of both worlds. We've stayed here twice now. We enjoy the local decor, the live local music morning and evenings, and the decent continental breakfast. Other neat features are the DVD kiosk and the Tiki Bar. This hotel is welcoming to families, but I think it would also be nice for adult groups as well. There are many places to eat, shop and play walkable right from this spot. Enjoy!

My wife and I recently spent 2 pleasant nights at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Because we were celebrating an anniversary they upgraded us to an Ocean Front Room with a great view of the Beach, Ocean and Diamond Head. The strip in front of the hotel is busy but you are in a great location to enjoy the beach and nearby shopping and restaurants. The room was comfortable and the staff was helpful and friendly. The Tiki Bar in the hotel is quite lively with a good menu. I would recommend to others looking for a solid, if not extravagant hotel with a great location on Waikiki beach.

This hotel has everything you could need. A great location right across from Waikiki beach and a tremendous view of Diamond Head . The included breakfast was basic but a unique idea with the byob bag. It was nice having a restaurant and live music on site and we enjoyed both the dining room and the lighter fare in the bar. It is also very convenient to walk to eat at other places if so desired. There is shopping, restaurants all around this area. The rooms were basic but the beds were comfortable and it was clean. The staff were very nice and helpful in meeting our needs. The only negative was the excursion counter...one if particular did not tell the truth and were not good to deal with. There are 3 so check out all of them and also online for more info. The pool was nice but very cold when we were there. They also give you beach chairs with your towels which was very nice for going to the beach. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

This is a lovely, very tiki style, Hawaiian hotel! The front desk, concierge's, and housekeeping were wonderful and helpful, and breakfast is served every morning from 6:30am-9am with music and hula dancing. It was wonderful! Something I looked forward to every morning! The singing and guitar music was beautiful, and the hula dancing was incredible, especially if you get to see Celeste! I would recommend this hotel to a couple or family! The partial views of the ocean and Diamond Head are gorgeous and the location to the beach and main street are fantastic! Also, Tiki's Grill and Bar are located in this hotel, and it is a fantastic restaurant for couples and families.

We got a great rate on the Aston, it is directly across the street from the beach and our room had a great view of Diamond Head. Breakfast was included in our package and was good, if not pretty similar menu for the week we were there - but included is always good. Staff were pretty friendly, the rooms were pretty standard but certainly the hotel is a good value. It is also fairly central and close to the park, shopping and lounges!

The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Rooms were well kept, bed was very comfrotable. Waikiki beach right outside, what more could you ask for. Enough food options to choose from if you want to eat close, or have a snack like a sub, ice cream or cookies. Very nice Hotel would recommend to any one.

After reading a lot of reviews, I choose the Aston Hotel because it was rated 4 stars. The hotel claimed the rooms had been updated, that must have been several years ago. If contractors updated my house like this, I would be sick to my stomach. While we were there we switched rooms. Our first room was suppose to be a full ocean view, we were on the 25th floor (top floor). To get the ocean view you had to step out on the very small balcony and lean over the rail to see the ocean. An accurate room description would be the diamond head, zoo view. The room was Very Small! We decided to pay an extra $90 per night for the suite, great view and double the size of the room. We had a king bed with a pull out couch for teenage boys. The room had a great ocean view with 2 balconies. Our bathroom was handicap accessible. Needless to say there was a lot of rust on the shower wall, also our shower curtain had mold on it. On the second night we noticed that the pull out couch had a very soiled mattress! They changed the mattress but then it didn't fit the bed. So the next night we decided to move back to a small room with double beds. The free breakfast in the morning was the best! The location of the hotel was at the end of Waikiki so it wasn't as crowded. The con about that was that when you crossed the street to go to the beach, it was more of the public beach so you saw a lot of homeless people. Most of the homeless people do not bother you, but some of them yell profanities or insults. Homeless population is really bad in Honolulu. You will notice it more at this end not so much at the more expensive hotel end. I will not stay at this hotel again. I will look for a hotel that is on the beach not across the street from a beach. It is hard to know what kind of accommodations to stay at when you haven't been there. I hope this helps!

We had four nights here while taking in the sights of Oahu. Convenient location on Waikiki Beach. You really can get around without a car and parking is a tough and expensive. It's moderately priced, we chose the partial ocean view and were surprised that we could actually see the ocean , everything was clean and well-kept. Surprised that it was fairly quiet inside the hotel as there is so much hustle and bustle in this area. I agree with others that an upper floor is probably quieter. They have a secure elevator system which is important because there is such open access from the street. Lots of people. Everything you need for dining, entertainment, shopping is within walking distance. The "free" breakfast is included in the resort fee, but resort fees seem to be the norm in Hawaii. The breakfast is just your basic continental fare , but it was convenient having it available rather than having to take up more of your time to go out. Friendly staff and smooth check-in.

Had a week here over the Honolulu Festival week in early March. Used Interval International and got a good price and good room. Hotel is a fun place - has Tiki's bar for great cocktails and reasonable meals overlooking Waikiki, especially at sunset, and has a breakfast hula and music show around the ppol area which is fun too. Rooms were clean, reasonably sized, and some have a nice view of the beach. Travel providers on level 3 were helpful and all told had a great time, with no hassles or annoyances. The breakfast on the beach concept is novel, and allows the hotel to get away with having no real breakfast room - the do it youself take away pre-packaged buffet worked for us, and allowed us to sit down and enjoy the live music show. Good value for money, and good fun.

This is a great hotel and we would definitely recommend it further! The rooms are excellent, with Hawaiian flair and great view. We booked "partial ocean view" and had an amazing view of the Diamond Head and the ocean. Honolulu may be rather noisy, so it is probably better to take higher floors. We lived on the 21st floor. The hotel serves some nice breakfast with morning Hawaiian songs and hula dancing. The breakfast is included in price, but if you want to have an omelette (which is by the way absolutely delicious!) you have to pay 2$ extra for it. Breakfast is buffet, take away. You can take it with you to the beach. The location of the hotel is rather nice, at the end of the touristic Kalakaua Av. close to the Diamond head, though the beach right across the hotel has a dike. There is a great Zoo 3 min. away from the hotel.

We go to this hotel every other year , great hotel ,great location, great service.Room was always clean, breakfast was great, we took it to our room, got extra for snacks on the beach. Only thing was we like the side of the hotel were the pool is on, and were told that side only had double beds, so went to Diamond head side, not a good view and had no balcony. Next time I'll take the double beds, we like the music from Tiki's downstairs. Starbucks, ABC store, ice cream, subway , and Tiki' right down stairs. Get a car for at least 1day got to go to north shore , shave ice at Matsmotos a must !!!!Dole worth a stop, teds bakery best cookies ever.Beach right across the street, get there early, and hotel has beach towels and chairs you can take.All in all great hotel and we will be going back next year, miss Hawaii , only place we can relax

** Every room is different and taken care differently, so I can only speak of the two rooms I experienced on this trip! Also compare how thing have decline through the years and that they are better option at Waikiki for accommodations. Our trip was for a surprise birthday trip for my husband for 3 days and with the intention of extending our stay one more day on our "favorite" hotel. We checked in around 1030pm-11pm and the front desk was quiet with two staff member. The young gentlemen help us check in and was quick at talking too! Maybe he was on a hurry to send us off! Room booked and paid for was Ocean View and put in a request if it could be accommodated ( highest room & one bed). Finally our room was #2311 and since we have stayed here before we knew it was one of the highest floor. Once we got there come to find out that this room are the rooms that are right behind the elevators... You know, up and down noises? Swishhhh up swishhhh down! Oh yeah and the beeping doing of the elevators. If your a light sleeper or after a 5-14 hr trip this is not what you need. The room had NO beach coolers and the view was amazing of Waikiki! Called the front dest to see if they could relocate the room or even downgrade to room to Partial Ocean View Room but after being on hold with the guy and him explaining that they are booked full no spare room and that he couldn't switch my room! Then he put me on hold to speak to the manager to see what he could do. After 3 minutes on the phone they told me to go downstairs and that they will relocate us to the Aloha Suite... I guess there was rooms available after all!!! Formally known as the Junior Suites now they switched it to Aloha Suites, mind that i have stayed a few times paying for that room and are quiet nice! We were impressed of the new room but it seem likes a quick reaction so something wasn't right! Went to pick up our new keys (heaven forbid you loose them cause it will cost you $2 per key! Before they would tell you take them as souvenirs not that I want them!). So our new room is now #928. So if you get the numeration the first digits are the floor number and the last 2 are the location of the room. Even numbers have Diamond Head and Odd have the Waikiki view. Also I just went from good view to a huge downgrade! But keep in mind is a suite so when we went in it was a total disappointment and after having to speak to the Front Desk earlier and this is what I ended up with it seem like I wanted to switch my countdown on this getaway trip to fast speed to get out of here!!! Tip: if your room number ends on #11 your very close to elevators! I took pictures of the condition on the room #928 and will post. The bathroom was in terrible condition, tiles of different color, toilet with mildew and licking water when you flush, bathtub yellow stain on wall, walls patch up, wall edges pain coming off, tissue holder broken, desk plug not working and balcony sliding door didn't close. Yes the flat screen tv is nice but the options of tv channels aren't many and quality isn't that great, no HD tv here. We were tired so off to shower and bed but... Turn on the water and it seem like no one has used that bathroom cause the water that first came out was dirty brown... Let it run for a little and off to bed. I didn't bother to look for bed bugs cause heaven forbid I would find any! Next day, bright and early ready for their free breakfast! FRIENDLY STAFF!!! Mind that I have stayed here for the past 6 years and I thought that even with the cross over from ResortQuest to Aston might not make any difference in the quality, it sure has now! Yes the lines are long and it can be a little bothersome for some of the people who just jump in or overly excited people but the food has change. Coffee, 4 options of plain cereals, yogurt, doughnuts, danish and pastries, mini muffin, mini bagels, some sort of soup ( catering to the Asian crowd), juice, milk, hot cocoa, and hot tea. Now they used to offer warm sandwich, French toast stick and burrito before for "Free" cause it was included in your final bill for amenities. Now the option for a warm meal can cause $4 additional on top of an amenities fee. You can save money by going to another hotel and buy breakfast at other places with options. The "free breakfast " has gone down hill from what it use to but again I'm stuck in this hotel for the next day. Music and hula dancer still there which is very nice Aloha touch and very slow wifi available at pool or you can use their business center for a few dollars and printing is extra. On check out day and i see the bill I see the prices have gone up on taxes but most importantly the amenities fee. Total extra on top of the room cost is $49.57. There's $18 that goes to amenities fee which includes, newspaper, "breakfast", gym, movie/games rental which includes a lot of Asian movies (at the time I looked at it) and who knows what else they'll like to call amenities fee. With $18 I could have ate at Egg&Thing or somewhere, I'm on vacation so i don't need news paper, movies are okay on a rainy day if yonrather stay indoor but Tip: Subway does offer a $3 breakfast combo make it your way downstairs but I don't know how long the promotion goes for... Didn't try it cause I felt Aston already took my money and run with it. Since we were so disappointed we walked less than a block towards the Hyatt Place and ask them about their price and availability. Guess what? We were sold and our extra night went with the Hyatt Place (room and experience will be posted shortly- Amazing! And amenities fee plus taxes total $30.58 with real breakfast! Free wifi in your room, free computer and free printer) So since we couldn't drag our bags around Waikiki we used the bell/bag storage service at the Aston waikiki beach hotel. When we went to pick up our bags, to our surprise the young guy told my husband to come with him, showed him to the room, open the door and had my husband grab his own bag out the door. YES! What a liability to have anyone go into the room with other customer bag. Well it was $3 in tip we saved! Remember we have stayed here before and even recommended and booked additional room in the past cause we thought it was a good hotel to recommend. We even got a postcard in our room from the "manager" appreciating my business and this time was the worst. REMEMBER, the staff is very friendly and full of Aloha at this hotel. At the time I booked this room I had options from Hilton Village for $175 and other hotels but I went with the only hotel I have stayed and thought I knew but this one was the last time will book them. Some one else got my business and glad I did! I seen reviews and how the Aston management team over and over try to justify the amenities fee to be justifiable but I took simple math elementary school and I think it's another way to nickel and dime during tough economy for struggling hotels.

This hotel was very clean and had a free breakfast on the beach which is awesome so we can use the money for another excursion. The hotel staff was very professional and we enjoyed our room with a partial oceanview. We had a safe,clean rooms,and comfortable beds. The hotel is directly across Wakiki Beach and has access to all transportation, so you don't even need a rental car. They have an office (we used Expedia) to help with all excursions and every excursion was top-notch and no problems to get to or come back from. The hotel has a Tiki restaurant which was some of the best food we ate. We felt like we were on a 4 or 5 star restaurant. There is an awesome Hawaiian DJ and a wonderful dancer for your entertainment while you eat breakfast. They also provide a small breakfast bag in case you want to take your breakfast with you which is sooooo cool. This was one of our coolest vacations. The only small bummer we experienced was seeing the "homelessness" in the city. This is everywhere you go and it made my husband and I realize, since we are "country mice" what a problem it is around the world. We have been very sheltered in our area so this was an eye-opener for us. Other than that, this was an awesome experience and all the accomadations were the best and our hotel experience,restaurants,excursions, were the best.

I would recommend staying at Ashton hotel located a perfect spot right across from the beach staff was very helpful I was ready to accommodate our needsand we always enjoy the entertainment during breakfast thank you for making your life richer with a great experience. Duane &Angela

I stayed at the Aston Waikiki June 2012. There was a little confusion upon check in as I was to receive a room with 2 double beds, not a king. After an 11 hour flight and having booked this trip almost 7 months ahead of time, I was not pleased. However the staff apologized and even though my sister and I were not in the correct room, they supplied us with a roll away bed and were able to switch our room the next day. The staff were courteous and accommodating. The room they moved us to was beautiful with a balcony and a stunning view of the ocean. Breakfast was great! I don't always eat a big breakfast so this was perfect, and the one time I did there was the opportunity to have a hot breakfast for a small fee and a hula dancer and ukulele player for entertainment! Everything was at your disposal, tours, restaurants, shops! Loved it! Can't wait to be able to go back!

Great location with stunning views. There is room for improvement though! They just had wireless broadband installed while we were there in February, yeah! The bathrooms were a bit tired and they are the next to get a revamp. I wasn't a fan of the breakfast system, mainly because there was not enough seating around the pool area and it was all in the shade, nice in Summer but cool in Winter. The lifts were great and easy to use.It was expensive considering the services on offer but it was nice and clean. There are better/ more affordable options a block back from the beach.

We needed a place to finish our vacation off, Due to our airline schedule we had to stay an extra day more than our timeshare had available. We were able to book a room at the last minute which was nice. We were on the eastern side of the building on the 25th floor with a great view of the beach, Diamondhead and the zoo. The check in was quick and easy. The few downsides to this hotel are 1st $27 valet only parking fee, and of course they want a tip to retreive your car. At the Aston Beachside 10 days earlier I only paid $22, and they use the same garage. a few hundred feet down the street. 2nd Is their AMMENITY FEE ?? This is the first time in 30 years of traveling I have ever been charged an ammentiyty fee. Basically they charge you $18.00 plus $ 3.00 tax ( ON A DAILY BASIS ) to have the continental breakfast, and use the high speed interent and DVD rentals. The breakfast consist of cold cereal, yogurt,pastries, and coffee But hey for another additional fee of $2 you can get french toast, or for $5 you can get an omlet. Since we were just a one night stay, We got 2 cups of week coffee and cold cereal for the $ 18.00. I think they should just add the $20.00 to the advertised room rate rather than the bait and switch tactic that they are using. If you book through Travelocity of other online travel sites these ammenity fees are not told to you. So you would need to add $21.00 a day to the cost of your room. If you have a rental car you can add $ 48.00 to your daily room expense. For anyone staying for 5 days you can round that out to an extra $200.

Our first time visiting Hawaii and couldn't have been nicer. The staff is very helpful from bottom to top. The suite was huge and the views from the balconies were gorgeous. The only noise was the wind. Some of the best sleep I've ever gotten at a hotel. We will absolutely stay there again when we return to Oahu.

When we arrived at our hotel, we were so tired from the 10 hour flight. We got to our room and were somewhat disappointed in the size . . . very tight BUT very clean and comfortable. In fact, at check in we were upgraded since it was our anniversary. The view from the balcony was amazing. You could see down on the pool area but the best part was the view of Waikiki Beach just across the street. This hotel sits at the end of what I would call the hotel area of Waikiki Beach. The next block down is a beautiful, spacious park area and a zoo. The hotel provides a continental breakfast each morning along with live hawaiian music and entertainment. The hotel calls it "Breakfast on the Beach" as they provide a cooler for your food and you can just walk across the street and eat on the beach if you wish. Also, most tour companies pick up at this hotel. It was very convenient. You could literally see most of the Waikiki Beach area, i.e, surfers, paddle boarders, swimmers, etc. The child friendly beach (protected area by a retaining wall) was just across the street from the Aston. We saw rainbows from our balcony every day. The food in the bar area was very good as well. Other than the room size, this was truly a great place to stay.

No this is not the newest of hotels but it was clean, quiet, and the staff was great. The location is very convenient. The breakfast was great and there was plenty to each with great coffee. The staff was great and very helpful. I would stay here again. Also the restaurant that is by the pool area is outstanding!!!!

The views from our ocean front room were gorgeous (1731). Balcony pretty small. The hotel is at the eastern end of Waikiki but it really didn't take long to walk back toward the centre of Waikiki beach toward the market place, maybe five minutes, so we were happy with the location The rooms were roomy enough, bathrooms a little tired, but everything worked well. The hotel was upgrading their wifi so that there was wifi in all rooms on the second last day we were there. It was really windy the week we were there (mid Feb 2013) so we didn't use the pool. My husband and I didn't mind the continental style breakfast but we did go elsewhere a couple of times. The bed was really comfortable, it was best nights sleep I've had for ages.The lift system is fantastic, you just need to listen as to how it works, some people seemed to have difficulty with working it out. My husband and I would stay there again, friendly staff, clean rooms great location and price was reasonable for the view/ room we had, although you don't really spend a great deal of time in your room.

We were looking for a mid-ranged hotel in the Waikiki area for a few nights. We booked into the Aston Waikiki Beach which is located nearer the Zoo end of Kalakaua Ave. It fronts onto Kalakaua and many rooms have a beach view. Upon arriving, we had to take an elevator to the third floor where the registration was located. After getting squared away, we were given our room keys (credit card type) and told to use the elevators to get to our floor. Here was the beginning of our adventure. You have to swipe an area of the elevator key. When it rings, then you can enter your floor number. Finding the right place to swipe took getting used to and everyone seemed to be having the same issue. Once we got used to it (I think it took two days), we were okay. Then we got to our room. Here we had to insert our key into a slot and pull it our. Some times it took over a dozen swipes. We even had our keys re-keyed and still had the same problem. After three days we found out that you had to jam the key right back in the slot before pulling it our at medium speed.Our room was quite small. This hotel was built in the sixties and had been renovated. The decor had an odd retro feel about it and the two double beds really made the room close in on us. There was a small patio that had one chair and one small foot stool... that's it. The bathroom was just okay in size, with a shower/bathtub combo, sink and toilet... pretty standard hotel fare. Besides the beds, there was a small table and two chairs, a chest of drawers,.a flat screen tv and a Playstation where you could play DVDs as well as games. There was also a small closet that held a floor safe. Along with our room costs,. there was an additional $18 a day for 'amenities' which included the use of the safe, wireless internet, and free breakfasts (a la continental style). Although we used the hotel room mainly for sleeping, it would have been nice to have had a little more room. The morning breakfasts were okay. They consisted of juices, cereals, yogurts, pastries, miso soup, coffees, milk and fresh fruit. This is basically all you needed to get your day going. The views were good from our 18th floor room and the noise was acceptable. All in all, I think this was an okay place to stay. If you were on a budget, it would seem good. For a few more bucks, you could get a better room across the street at the Marriott. But for four nights, we felt it was accdeptable.

A hotel from the 70's which is not 4 star as advertised but 2. Breakfast is a joke with plastic forks and plates eating around the pool breakfast cereals and fruit while Hawanian singers and dancers encourage guests to join in. Hotel is full of overweight, older Americans happily eating cheeseburgers. We only did one breakfast after seeing food swimming in the pool. The rooms are clean but tired. Better to spend a bit more money at the other end of the beach hotels. The Tikas bar food is also to be avoided although the service and rinks are fine.

Waikiki is definitely one for the tourists, mostly north americans desperate to see some sun. The Aston is well situated across from the beautiful coloured water and close to the main touristy attractions. However, the hotel is old and needs a complete overhaul. It was sold to us as a 4 star when it's really a 3. It's not terrible but it has its problems. We got annoyed by the extra $18 daily fee to access things that should have been included in the tariff, wifi, beach towel hire and breakfast. And speaking of breakfast, it's laughable. The hotel cheats by giving you a plastic carry case to go down to the pool area to collect a basic array of foods. Yet many people sit and eat on the pool furniture while a singer and a hula dancer 'entertain' them. Hula was the last thing I wanted to hear at 7am as a watched the wind blow the breakfast detritus into the pool. It was as grim as I imagine a UK holiday camp to be. But, on the upside, the staff are really lovely and the genuinely try to make your stay a good one. We stayed for 4 nights and ended up enjoying our time there...as long as we went somewhere else for breakfast.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for our anniversary. The location is great, right across from Waikiki Beach and close to many shops. The decor in the room and throughout the hotel was nice, but the room was a bit small and the bathroom was dated. We enjoyed the Breakfast on the Beach ("BOB") as we took our little esky filled with fruit and pastries from the buffet, and sat in a park by Waikiki Beach, which was just a short walk from the hotel. We also took advantage of the DVD rentals that were included in the resort fee. The main disappointment for us was the band at the Tiki Bar playing late into the night, which made it difficult for us to fall asleep, especially when we had early pick ups the next morning for tours. If we were on the other side of the hotel, it may have been better.

We stayed here for a week. The hotel has a good location and was close to the beach, shopping, dining and the zoo. I was worried about the room being small after reading some reviews but it honestly wasn't that bad (and we were 3 adults & 1 child). The bathroom could have used a little work but was still okay. We had a oceanview room on the 22nd floor so the view of waikiki beach was fantastic. We could hear the music from Tiki's bar & grill but it always ended at 11 so it didn't bother us. The breakfast was good although some mornings it was challenging to find a seat. There was always plenty of food and the music and hula dancing were fun to watch. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

I agree with the previous reviewer. I had also read some terrible reviews about this hotel and we were a little worried before arriving. I am happy to say that we enjoyed our stay here. We had a great view of the beach and the Waikiki main strip (get an ocean front room). We could watch the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village from our balcony. Tiki's restaurant had great, reasonably priced food and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Ranelle at the expedia desk was fantastic in arranging our activities. The rooms are perhaps a little dated, but I found them nicer than some of the cold, sterile looking rooms that I have stayed in before. Hotels are often the same all over the world, but this one had a Hawaiian feel and it's nice to stay somewhere a little different for a change. The hotel does not claim 5 star status and for the rating, price and location the rooms and service were more than enough. And we have stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels. The breakfast on the beach is a great idea and there was entertainment for those who wanted to enjoy their breakfast at the poolside. There was a beautiful hula dancer from Molokai one morning. I would stay there again.

Not too bad. The staff was friendly and the beds were cozy. All the tour buses will pick you up at or near your hotel. They do need to offer free shuttle service to and from the hotel though. Also in room microwaves would have been nice. The pool was freezing couldn't even get in it the ocean was actually warmer. No in room wifi while we were there but they will have it by mid march so we used the park shores free wifi lol. We only ate at their subway (no $5 footlongs here ) we didn't try any of their other restaurants. You get a playstation 3 to play games and movies from their kiosks which is included in the $18 a day + tax resort fee and free continental breakfast by the pool ( watch out for the birds they are everywhere and beg for food like dogs). All in all we did enjoy our hotel stay and will hopefully return someday.

I was scared to stay at this hotel by some of the reviews, But We loved it here and Im so glad we didn't change our reservations. Everything was wonderful, from the room to breakfast to staff!!! I can not say enough good things about it.Our room was very clean and had an amazing view, breakfast was perfect just enough to get you going for the day. Downstairs there was every kind of tours to book and all of the staff here was awesome!!!
user_name:
Heather J
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: Room are clean but small and dated,need a fresh cote of paint. Breakfast are a desaster , they give you a kind of lunch box , to go and fill it up for breakfast at the poolside in the morning and goback and eat it in your room because there is a very few place at the pool, acomplete chaos.

My husband and I stayed Feb 1st and 9th at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and took a 7 night cruise in between. We arrived tired from our long trip from the east coast and were relieved to find a clean, comfortable room. Tiki's Bar onsite provided good food, drinks and live music. The staff at both the bar and hotel were friendly and helpful. This is not a luxury hotel but a perfect choice for pre cruise or a great home base for exploring Oahu. There are tour operators onsite who were able to book a tour to the North Shore and a Paradise Cove Luau for us. They do offer a free breakfast poolside which was sort of a continental breakfast with a few extras that most of the guests seemed to enjoy but tables were limited so we found Lili's nearby and ate breakfast there.I would say this hotel was a good choice and would return.

Great staff-- I was upgraded from a partial ocean view to a ocean view-- Room was nothing like people had mentioned, about it being outdated//etc...yes bathroom could use some work--but room and bed was great. Noise was not a factor at all, and the breafast was just fine. I would definetly choose to stay here again, location was perfect!! Mahalo!

Hi, my husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and it is just lovely. The pool wasn't the biggest but to be honest we were always swimming in the sea which is a minute away! We had a fantastic view of the ocean and the beach. We stayed for 10 nights bed and breakfast. The breakfast is amazing and it had a massive selection. We went for the 'take away picnic' option in the mornings. The hotel provide cool bags where you can pack as much food and drinks as you like, give you towels and we ate our breakfast picnic on the beach. How romantic! Hawaii is an amazing place with so much to do. We did lots of trips. We went swimming with sharks (in a cage), went swimming with dolphins in the wild, went on a movie safari for the day in a hummer, went on a trip to see the 'lost' locations and flew to the big island and went on a volcano tour up one of the most active volcanoes in the world. I love Hawaii and can't wait to return with it's amazing places to eat (cheesecake factory for one!) gorgeous beaches, lovely weather and breathtaking beauty!!!

The staff of the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel provided a most friendly and cordial backdrop to our family vacation this past summer. The "Spirit Of Aloha" was very much evident in all of our exchanges with the employees of this facility. One special highlight was the musical duo which performed daily for breakfast around the pool: guitarist/vocalist Eric Lee and hula dancer Pono Fernandez. Eric knew virtually every request, from traditional Hawaiian favorites to popular standards from a variety of eras. Pono Fernandez was the epitome of hospitality, alternating between her own heartfelt hula performances and visiting with members of the audience. We enjoyed the Hawaiian scenery immensely, but will most remember our trip because of the great experiences we had with the people of Hawaii, beginning with the Aston's staff.

The Aston Waikiki was a clean, comfortable hotel across the street from Waikiki beach. It's gotten a recent facelift but is still an older hotel. While there is a fresh coat of paint and new furniture, the bathroom was dated. Our room, 611, was west facing with a view primarily of the pool but we could see the ocean. Sunsets were amazing as always. On the downside, right next to the pool is Tiki's which has live music nightly and the poolside breakfast is served beginning at 6:30 AM. We were also right next to the elevators which woke us up at all hours of the night as there is no sound barrier in the wall between the elevators and the rooms.Overall, we'd stay here again if it weren't for the $18 per day amenity charge and $27 per day parking fee. The $18 includes breakfast and the pool but I'm not sure what else. At the time we were there (Feb 2013) there was no wireless internet in rooms.

Great location, close to everything. Room was very clean, it does have some age, but, that doesn't matter to me, it is very clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet is a lot of bread products, out by the pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Bri at the front desk. Helped us with activities and places to eat. Absolutely beautiful view from the room. Bottom line, I would definitely stay there again.

Plusses: Right across the street from Waikiki Beach. Decent breakfast included; rooms have insulated bags so you can take your food and eat it wherever--we ate on the beach. Minuses: Rooms are old. The front and side of the hotel are noisy, with the tiki bar and the busy streets and the side and front. We were assured our room was quiet and had an ocean view. It was neither--it was right above the bar and with a sliver of ocean from the walk-out deck. Plus, the hallway was not even carpeted all the way to our room--the carpet stopped a few doors before us. We easily got the room changed to the other side, which had a view of Diamond Head and of the ocean, plus it was quieter. It did not have a walk-out deck, though. The staff was good. I would not stay here again, though, until they update. Plus Waikiki Beach itself is incredibly touristy and packed with people.

We stayed in the Aston for one night to break up our trip from Canada to Australia. We previously spent 5 nights at the Embassy Suites and loved it. While the Aston was cheaper, the room was clean and the beds and pillows very comfortable so it served our purpose. The bathroom could easily have done with a major makeover as it was very outdated. The hotel promotes "Breakfast on the Beach" by providing each room with a cooler bag to place breakfast items in and then guests can either sit by the pool and eat breakfast or walk across the road to the beach. While this sounds like it could work, it fails abysmally! There are no tables set up for guests to sit down and enjoy breakfast, instead guests are made to line up to collect breakfast in styrofoam cups and bowls and then try and find a lounge chair around the pool to eat - it was the worst breakfast experience I have ever had in a hotel!! The morning we had breakfast was very crowded - we ended up having to sit on a small concrete wall and literally try and eat our breakfast before the birds grabbed it first. The amount of wastage is incredible - foam cups and bowls and plastic cutlery everywhere - surely a hotel of this calibre could do a whole lot better than this. A hot breakfast was an extra cost, after we were made to pay an amenity fee on top of our room rate of $18 to cover Breakfast on the Beach and internet access (which is non-existent). A woeful experience. This hotel is definitely not on my list for a return trip to Oahu.

My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay here! Great location, friendly staff, good places to eat, free breakfast, free DVD rentals, and good security. Live music at breakfast poolside and at the Tiki bar. Everything was great!

Aston Waikiki beach was right across street from beach. Not sure why people say hotel is run down. It was clean nicely decorated and views were amazing. Breakfast was great everyday. The bell staff were so helpful and friendly. Beds were comfortable and room was kept very clean by housekeeping staff. Everything about the stay was great! My only complaint would be no wifi in the room. There is wifi in public locations like lobby etc. not really a big deal as there is so much to do in Hawaii who needs Internet! Would absolutely return to this hotel and would recommend for family and friends! Mahalo Aston Waikiki!

upon my arrival to the hotel walking up the stairs to see the pool area that is over a parking structure i believe... you see the front desk right away. i booked the hotel because it offered breakfast on the beach. i"m thinking the hotel will b on the beach, it is across the street from the beach for down side to this place. the only good thing that i can say i loved about the place was the elevator system. you press your key to a pad and it tells you which elevator to go too. i get to the room and it is rather smaller then i was hoping for. the room it self was a bit muggy and had an odd oder to it. i attempted to adjust the A/C and that did not make a difference at all. the small view from the balcony was nice. i went to go take a shower and the tub looks like one of those bath fitter tubs where they just put this piece over everything instead of replacing it all. there was a long black hair on the handle for the shower, as well as the handle was not mounted in the wall it had come loose and would go in when trying to turn on the water. i pulled the shower curtain to find another long black hair there as well. the water was going down very slowly as i showered so it looked more like i was trying to take a bath instead. the towels were not that great when i was drying my self off.the temp in the room still not had changed after my shower. i could no longer stay there so i went to the front desk to check out. my friends had stayed the night before and had a bad experience as well. i went to the modern honolulu instead, and that was an amazing hotel and cost less then the aston.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Nicholas B
New York, New York, United States

review_body: Great location but severely run down.When we finally got the room, bathroom wasn't clean, toilet had a pube dangling from it and all corners were covered in dirt that hasn't been properly clean in months.Staff were very friendly but also lied to my face. Once I went to pick up some 'complimentary beach towels' and the guy told me 'these are fresh from the laundry'... I didn't know why he said that, I didn't ask anything but when I tried to dry myself and my daughter in those I found lots of yellow stains and an awful smell of cheese. It was disgusting and the worst was that it started to rain (like it does in February in Honolulu) and my daughter was shivering so I had to wrap her in that.. And of course there was no one minding the towel kiosk.The cleaning lady was very sweet, very friendly and smily but she managed to not clean the room in 4 out of seven days we stayed there. She apologized but why do I have to beg her to do her job?Breakfast was another let down. First of all, you have to fight to find a chair to seat down. it's all happening at the swimming pool area which obviously hasn't been prepared for this type of event. Everything is pre-packed in tons and tons of paper and plastic. They were constantly emptying massive rubbish bins just to get them filled up again in a matter of minutes. So wasteful, the worst I've ever seen. Fresh fruit was ok, the greasy pastries were from some discount store, not really nice. Coffee didn't even taste like coffee, in fact, I'm not sure what that was. And I know dairy is expensive in Hawaii (it's all imported) but they watered the milk too much, yuck!Show at the swimming pool was really great. Unappreciated by a bunch of rude guests stuffing their already stuffed faces with cheap food, too busy with their fatty doughnuts to applaud the two great artists they had in front of them. The rooms looked too DIY and outdated. Balls of fluff and dirt under the beds and behind the furniture. Good tv but poor signal. I asked twice for someone to have a look but no one came. As much as I love Waikiki I was happy to be out of that hotel.

I just returned from a two week trip to Hawaii with my boyfriend, we stayed at the Aston, and were very pleasantly surprised! If you can outlook a few small things, this hotel is just wonderful. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and housekeeping came by everyday but were not too invasive and worked around our schedule. The breakfasts are awesome, the coconut coffee is awesome too. A little noisy at points, and the only thing to prevent me from giving a 5 star rating is the lack of upgrades in the bathrooms. Still very clean and a very comfortable stay, highly recommended!! Also located downstairs is perhaps the perfect lunch place, and the best burgers I've ever tried about a block away at Teddy's. close to zoo, beach, and shopping!!

It was my first visit to Honolulu and I wanted a room with a view!Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel provided me with a wonderful room with a view and the price was managable (a bit too expensive for my taste - but the view of the beach was worth it)Location is the best thing about this hotel. You just need to cross a road and you can have your feet wet by the Waikiki beach.The DVD dispensing machine was a great excuse not to sleep along with the Playstation 3 inside the room.Breakfast was adequate. You are provided with a bag where you can stash the bread, yogurt, fruits, cereals and soup (and cups of coffee, juice, milk or tea) from the breakfast area. You can bring your bag to the beach, swimming pool or back to your room (an innovative idea as there was not much seats to accommodate the guests). You can only line up for breakfast picking once, it think. My breakfast the next day at the hotel was made more challenging with the cold rain (not much shelter was available)There is no complimentary transfer from honolulu airport to the hotel. I booked an airport shuttleI am not sure if I will book this hotel again if my travel leads me back to Honolulu, but I will surely book this hotel and this view if my family comes with me and I want to show them the great view. Otherwise I will book to a hotel near the International Market and just walk to the beach (I think that would be more economical and the breakfast might be a better experience)At checkout I was informed that I can earn Hawaiin Airline Miles - this made me smile a bit.

This was our 2nd time staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel Jan. 31 - Feb.10 2013...we previously stayed 5yrs ago Feb. 2008. We enjoyed our 2nd stay just as much as the 1st & would return to this hotel again if ever back in the area. For value & location this place can't be beat. Though they do charge a daily resort/amenity fee what you get is well worth it...daily newspaper, free sign out of beach towels & beach chairs, dvds/ps3 games, Breakfast on the Beach is still excellent! In recent reviews I've read people complain about the breakfast, we were here for 10 nites and only had positives: only one day was there a longish line, but it moved very quickly & we had our food within a few minutes. Huge selection of continential items; cold cereals, cut up fruit, lots of mufffins, & pastries, 8 types of juice, pop, hot choc, good selection of teas, instant oatmeal, great selection of yougurts, asian items, 2 flavoured coffees, plus reg. & decafe. If this didn't cover your needs there is the hot items station which has omelettes every day & either french toast or waffles to buy for $3-$5. Honestly great selection, always replentished quickly...my husband can't eat wheat, so every day for $5 he bought an omelette, & was more than satisfied with fruit, yougurt & juice, milk, coffee, etc...so for those who complain about the breakfast not sure what they are acustomed to but I would say its plentiful. Its called Breakfast on The Beach, for a reason...fill cooler bag provided & take to the beach!! Don't crowd around the pool & then complain not enough chairs!! We enjoyed breaky on the beach several times..great experience, as well as some days took breaky up stairs on room balcony enjoyed the awesome view as the Hawaiian singer/music floated up to our room. Its never over powering or too loud. A couple days when breakfast area was slow we did stay by the pool to watch the hula & singer. Thx Celeste the hula dancer, for even making a traditional bracelet for our daughter! The 2 ladies who keep breakfast running smooth are awesome & friendly...as are ALL the Aston staff. Even those you just pass in the halls! All of our requests, though few were met & handled in a pleasant postive way. I just can't comprehend the things people have complained about or given negative feedback about. House keeping does a great job, in the rooms & through out all the common areas & grounds. The only time we needed to contact housekeeping was one day our maid missed leaving a bath mat, quick call & we had one in 5 min. Plenty of clean towels everyday. Rooms made up by 3 or 3:30pm at latest...people must realize this is a popular, busy hotel...rooms being checked out must be clean 1st, so new guests can check in. They say each room is inspected after being made up...yup its true I saw 1st hand housekeeper, being called back to a room to re-touch some thing the "inspector" noticed!! In a previous reveiw some one complained there's a tiny sign in bathroom saying if you remove the soaps, its a $25 charge...hello that notice is reffering to the surfboard stand the soaps are on!! as in if you like it so much ask to buy one from housekeeping for $25, don't steal it from the room!!! Great selection of soaps & tolietries too! Much more than many hotels offer these days. One day we had an early tour, 5am pick up...while most guests slept, the staff were busy scrubbing down the comon areas, pool, lobbies, washrooms, etc. We spent most of our last day hanging out by the pool, etc...since we had checked out we had to use the pool area washrooms most of the day...these were cleaned numerous times through out day....when you have several hundred people using these common areas, there will be times when you hit it & its a bit of a mess, but the staff were on top of this all the time. Great staff!! Its an older hotel...as nearly all in Waikiki...but is well maintained, while we were there a portion of the lower street level lobby flooring was replaced within a day, with minimal disruption to guests. Also this lobby is one of the BEST waiting areas I have ever seen in a hotel...abundant space & seating for those waiting for cabs, tours, or their cars. Also the way its set-up you can see right out to the street, to where your tour bus will be stopping. The valet/bell desk were AWESOME, we never had to wait long for our car, they said just call down 10 minutes before you need the car & it was always ready when we needed. They reserved us a cab & made sure it was there for our return to the airport, stored our luggage after check out, hassle free! Tiki's has great food, great staff, great views/ atmosphere, great music every nite...it only ever went to about 11 or midnight at latest & if you close your black out drapes it blocks out the music well. Most nights they only played until 10. We were on 10th floor, over pool & noise was never an issue. This is a great hotel. It looks exactly like the pictures...yes even the pool...take a look at some of the other hotels in area & some of their pools are way smaller. Parking is a premium in all of Waikiki...ALL the hotels charge for parking..even self parking, which at some is very limited. We had family stay at another hotel 2 blocks from beach, block behind Int. Market Place...they paid about the same for way less hotel, no amenities, no breakfast, no beach front, no view & not nearly as nice of a property. Nearly all rooms on Waikiki are small compared to other cities. Our Ocean view room with 2 double beds, was fine space wise for myself, husband & teen daughter. For value, location, hotel features, amenities, helpful staff, & the price you pay the Aston Waikiki Beach is hard too beat. Its great for families & those on a moderate/mid level budget. About the only thing we noticed since our last visit in 2008, the red bed coverings/ shams aren't quite as vibrant as they were 5 yrs ago...washing does that! We found this room on 10th just as comfortable as previous room on 8th. Bathroom floor tile begining to show age, but not awful & otherwise clean. No peeling paint, overall clean room, clean bedding, furniture fine & in keeping with the "hip retro" theme of 50's 60's Hawaii, as done in the 2006 renovation. Lastly the tour desks are aweome...Peggy at Pleasant Holidays was exceptional...we had booked an inter island day tour with her 2 weeks before coming. She told us to call her back when we got confirmation email, should have came within a few minutes...when we didn't call & no email was coming Peggy called us back a few times until it all was sorted out (error in email address). So we were happy to meet Peggy in person & have her book further excursions for us while in hotel. If we ever visit Honolulu again (and we will!) we will stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach again,no hesitations!

The hotel location across from the beach is perfect.The fact that you can sign out beach chairs and towels and take them to the beach with you is nice.Waikiki beach is very busy and from what I could see not a lot of sunbeds.The singing in the morning at the pool was nice and breakfast was adequate but crowded. didn't like all the styrofoam waste..We asked for a room on higher floor and they did not disapoint. We were on the 25th floor with beach/ocean view.The room was a bit small for husband me and 17 year old son.But we got along ok and didn't spend a lot of time there.Water was hot pressure was good and room was clean.Also the cleaning staff did not bother us in the mornings by banging on the door.I like that.Staff was courteous.I especially like the tours desk.Expedia was wonderful in helping us plan our vacation. Wifi in the room would of been nice but having it by the pool was ok.We did not use the pool to swim. Although we did not eat at Tikis grill we did have drinks there and found the atmosphere favorable with nice views of the ocean.The wait for the elevators was long and the property was dated.We did not enjoy the noise and crowded waikiki area but found the Aston waikiki beach hotel met our needs for this area.Heres a tip if you rent a car leave it at the car rental place and pick it up in the mornings< not far from hotel>it saves you 30 a night on parking.!

We had another restful and fun week in Waikiki. The Aston Beach is efficiently run and very safe. Close to everything by foot. We like being at the quiet end of the beach. It makes for less noise and hustle and bustle. We could walk down to the International Market and all the high end shops.Diamond head is outside your window and again a nice walk away. The beach outside the hotel has everything. Turtles and all the fish are there.The body boarding is also good for beginners.

Stayed here for 4 days during the booked up Pro-Bowl week. Was very satisfied with the overall experience. The room on the 8th floor was clean with a nice partial ocean view off the small balcony. The staff was friendly and courteous. The breakfast buffet by the pool, covered under the $18/day resort fee, was excellent, and loading up those free coolers was fun. Especially nice was Stephanie (the breakfast host), keeping the breakfast running smoothly every day, and actually remembering us after our first day (amazing in that we're just ordinary folks not making a fuss). That's the kind of thing that makes a hotel guest feel special, instead of just another tourist. The poolside entertainment at breakfast was also excellent, with the Hawaiian opera singing guitarist and hula dancer Celeste both genuinely happy to be entertaining us.The PS3 in the room is included in the resort fee, as are movies from a DVD kiosk in the lobby. Didn't use either but still a nice extra. The only downside to this place is the parking arrangement, valet only, for $27 a day. We refused to pay that, eventually finding free street parking (2-3 blocks away).

I love the "breakfast on the beach". The ambiance is very Hawaiian. Staffs are extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms Are a little old but tolerable. Location is super convenience to everywhere! Highly recommended.

The best thing was the man singing Hawaiian songs by the pool in the morning -- great voice and setting. Breakfast was better than average and the inclusion of the insulated bag for food is a great touch. We had Internet problems that the people tried to fix -- but never succeeded. Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The music in the bar goes on loud until 11 pm so dont plan on sleeping before then if you are a light sleeper. Really annoying is the delivery trucks in the morning with the loud "in reverse" bell -- woke me up very early each morning, but in fairness I am a light sleeper. The rooms were clean with recently updated decor (the bed was excellent). The city needs to put forth more effort in keeping the south part of Waikiki a bit more orderly in the evening -- it will impact tourism. Overall, a decent value for the money.

I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel during the Honolulu Marathon in December 2011. All in all it was a great experience. The location is amazing - right next door to the zoo, walking distance to Diamond Head and right across the street from the beach. It is also within walking distance of many great shops and restaurants. Rooms are updated and clean, although quite small but who stays in their room when you're in Hawaii? The free breakfast in the morning is a great perk and they always had live music and a hula dancer during breakfast. One issue is the lack of seating - the breakfast buffet is served at the pool and there just isn't enough seating for everyone. The pool is also small and we didn't use it during our visit as the beach is right across the street and much nicer. Halfway through our stay we upgraded to an ocean view and could see the whole zoo from our balcony, it was beautiful!The ABC stores are great for souveniers and there is one on every block! You can get the same souveniers cheaper at Wal-mart but I found the ABC stores very reasonably priced and super convenient. Do Diamond Head if you can, there is a beautiful view from the top. We also visited Hanauma Bay which is gorgeous and great for snorkelling. Overall I had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again next time I visit Honolulu.

This hotel is very good, across the road from the beach and at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. The resort fee here is good value as it includes a breakfast buffet and unlimited DVD rentals, amongst other things. However I really want to commend the staff here. I arrived a little early but they checked me in and had a room ready for me within one hour. I also had problems with the key card for my room and the staff were courteous and went out of their way to resolve the problem (which turned out to be me: I wasn't pushing the card all the way in). I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Research & Booking:We booked a room here mostly because they offered free breakfast and the beach was right across the road.Room:The rooms were not too bad, for the price that we paid and for the location but don’t expect much.Food:The breakfast was good for me as I had plenty of fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee etc. But if you like only hot breakfast it comes at an extra price. There are other food places downstairs and restaurants close by.Service:The service was OK at the best and all the staff was adequate. They were busy most of the time but helped us find a room with a better view from our second night. Location, Beaches and pool:The location is good as it is less than 2-minute walk to the beach. But unfortunately we did not spend any time at the beach here, as it was crowded. We spent more time at other beaches such a lanikai that are more secluded with fewer people and clearer, prettier waters. I would recommend staying closer to the lanikai although there are not too many hotels/resorts there. Waikiki was too touristy and crowded for my taste. The reason I am giving it only 3 stars is because, I did not use the pool or beach of this property. The room was definitely a 3star at best. I would rather have stayed at a better hotel, a little further away from the beach.

This was our fifth time visiting the island and we wanted to stay on the beach, so I found this hotel to be reasonably priced considering location and high travel season, Christmas. I would say that the hotel looked exactly liked the pictures show, however . . . we reserved an oceanview standard room. It was very, very, very small. I was told that rooms with two beds come with full beds only. For the three of us (husband and 21 teenage son) it was very cramped. There wasn't much room to even walk around the beds to get out to the lania. The room we had in this hotel had a small lania with one chair. We would take a small chair from in the room out onto lanai when more than one of us wanted to enjoy the views. This was slightly inconvenient I thought. The view from the room however was breathtaking! See photo. Unfortunately when we first checked in, we had to request a room change because as I was sitting on one of the beds, I felt a bug crawling on my shoulder from the headboard of the bed. I caught it and was quite alarmed. See photo. I called down to the front desk and within minutes security and housekeeping were in my room asking me questions, telling me they were going to move us to another room, taking pictures of the bug and then recommended that we allow them to spray our luggage with a bug spray. They would bring our bags over (which we hadn't unpacked yet) to our new room after approximately 30 minutes. Which they did do. I was very nervous about spending the rest of the week in the hotel, but just tried to forget what happend and make the beset of it. The rest of thet stay went fine. We especially enjoyed the free morning continental breakfast which is buffet style. They even provide little plastic lunch bags they call "Breakfast on the Beach" bags that you can bring with you to fill up to your hearts content with food and then take it to the beach and ear or where ever you want to go. Something very cool is that during breakfast time, they have live music/hawaiian dancing going on poolside sort of like entertainment while you eat. The hotel offers free towels and beach chairs you can check out each day to easily take across the street to the beach. We even took them to Hunauma Bay with us one day. Another great feature is their free DVD rental kiosks in the lobby. Each room is equipped with a gaming system/DVD player so you can get up to two DVDS at a time from the lobby kiosk. The selection of movies wasn't bad either. We ate at the hotel restaurant which was good and they have live entertainment on certain nights. Although there were many FREE things the hotel offers, it really isn't FREE because each day you stay in the hotel you are charged a "resort fee" which covers Internet, DVD movies, Daily Breakfast Buffet and access to towel/chair use. Be mindful when booking this hotel as far as the daily rate you get. You will be spending more when you include the daily resort fee and mutiple taxes on top of the room rate. It can add up really fast and surprise you when you check out.Although I loved the location and all the conveniences the hotel offered, I felt the rooms were just too small for our taste. Although we do spend a lot of time outside, we don't want to feel cramped in our room either and for the price of the week long stay, I would have liked more space for our money.

We stayed here for 8 nights - was pleased with location since its right across from Waikiki beach. However, the room was small, not very clean- very old, poolside was always busy, was charged an additional 400.00 for parking, amenity fees, etc. Everything was over priced. Also, if you mind the touristy feel - do not stay here. It was very touristy. This was my 17th time visiting Oahu - my first time at this particular Aston location.

Stayed here one night after getting off of our cruise ship and the place is nice. Room was beautiful and clean although they did not leave any towels for us. Very quiet, nice view, reasonable price. Desk staff was friendly as were the bell staff. Our flight did not leave for several hours after check out but it was nice to sit pool side and enjoy the service and atmoshpere. Tiki's Bar was nice w/ friendly service. Breakfast was marginal but they did offer complimentary cooler bags and loaner chairs and beach towels to enjoy eating breakfast on Waikiki Beach across the street. Be prepared to pay approx. $18/night/room fee for the 'extras'.

We chose the Aston because it is across the street from Waikiki Beach. We would choose it again. The hotel is a bit dated with some maintenance needs, but very clean, with a very friendly and outgoing staff. Rooms were clean, with a view of the ocean and beach. Be aware there is no wifi in the rooms, only hi speed connection. Valet parking staff did a great job. The location is great, although not in the middle of Waikiki, it is within walking distance, and quiet.

My husband and I went here in August to get married (late review, but had to make a new account..)! We stayed here for two awesome weeks. We booked a partial ocean view which was upgraded to a Jr. suite (because we were on our honeymoon). The room was roomy, clean and looked great. It had a tiny lanai that fitted two people, but I never went out there.. Afraid of heights.. We were on the 23rd floor. But the view was AWESOME!! You could see the ocean and all of Waikiki. Before the trip we had booked Coconut Club on the 21. floor. That's a room with a huge lanai were we were going to have the reception (the ceremony was at Waimanalo Beach). The view took our breaths away! The food and the service - EXCELLENT! We paid the staff extra so we could get 4 meals served instead of a buffet. The food (from Tiki's Bar And Grill at the hotel) tasted heavenly and all in all it was a PERFECT weddingday! If you are thinking about getting married in Hawaii, this is the place to stay!I read that some people had problems with the elevators.. If you have an IQ above 50, the elevators are no problem,hehe ;) The breakfast was good, but the hot meals could be free too.. The breakfast-at-the beach-deal was supersmart! The location was really AWESOME too! Right at Waikiki beach! At the end of Kalekaua avenue! Can't get any better that that ;) Never used the pool.. Why would we? The ocean is right next to it ;)

We stayed here for a few days. The hotel has a great location perfect views friendly staff. You can even see the sunset from your hotel balcony. The elevators are a little tricky. The restaurant that's attached to that hotel has great food. For the coffee lovers Starbucks is right around the corner. I would definitely stay here again.

This was my first trip to Hawaii. We were there from January 23 - 26. After reading the reviews, I was so anxious about the Aston Waikiki. I am so glad I didn't change my reservations. I loved it. The staff was great. Everyone was friendly --from the maids to the pool people. The breakfast was good and yes, it was what they listed. But, my husband and I enjoyed the breakfast and it took away the stress of going out early to eat. We loved the location. When our door was shut, we didn't hear the street noise. We were on the 12th floor. IT WAS CLEAN. It did show its age but we still enjoyed it. I was so surprised because my husband and I had only a positive experience the entire stay. It is also convenient to the shuttle which you should really take just for the scenic value. We loved this place and would not hesitate to stay again.

I took my wife and 3 kids under the age of 9 to this hotel for a week and we had a great time. The breakfast every morning was pretty basic but it was complimentary and have the to-go lunch bags was great. We loved how close the hotel was to the beach and to downtown Waikiki. My kids enjoyed the pool and I liked having access to a Wifi signal by the pool. I thought it was a little silly that the safe wasn't complimentary, but other than that, the rooms were comfortable and clean.

We booked an ocean view room and that is what we got, a good view of the ocean, but our balcony was on the same level as the roof of the shops and restaurants below, meaning that it would be quite easy to access the room via the balcony door as the lock was not that secure. We made sure to take precautions that our items were in the safe or on our person when we went out.As I had a deal from expedia, the resort fees were included as was the breakfast on the beach - what a joke! The breakfast was awful, there were tiny muffins and mini bagels thrown in baskets and all the guests pawed over the items, the coffee was weak (dish water), cereal was pre packed with sugar, don't even think about the "fresh fruit". We gave up and went down the street to a coffee house.Dinner at the Tiki Restaurant in the hotel was good and the food tasted really fresh. It is expensive but then so is everything on Hawaii. Good authentic flavours.The room was small and of average grade for the age of the hotel, it could definately do with a bit of a refurb, especially the coridors which seemed dimly lit.

We visited again this January and we had a fantastic time as usual. Everyone was great and friendly from the maid in the hallway on up. We were in a Junior Suite (1927) and it was bigger than the usual rooms and worth the extra expense.We visit Honolulu every year for the Pro Bowl with lots of friends and we always stay here. Nice (if not "fancy") hotel, Tiki's the hotel's restaurant/bar has great food, drinks and entertainment and it is close to everything.We'll be baaaaack, Pro Bowl or no Pro Bowl.Mahalo!

Hotel front desk didn't offered our choice of 1 queen bed..instead we got 2 double...the room was terribly small, spotted a roach in the balcony, concierge staff was not helpful at all...not sure if they are part of the hotel...room wasn't ready 3 hrs after we were made to wait and offered to check in...elevator technology is terrible, you have to pay a mandatory fee (not shown in room charges during reservation) for daily breakfast that is terrible if you can manage a spot to eat by the pool!...no room wifi and slow internet at the lobby...old hotel with outdated beds, furniture...only good thing was the unobstructed ocean view from the balcony, city noise if you are in the lower floors....we will never go back....

The hotel is located across Waikiki Beach, very convenience. Staff is very friendly, always smiling and looking to assist at any time. The hotel has a resort fee, $18 per night, which include free dvd's rental, internet and free continental breakfast (not a big deal) however very appreciate it.If you looking for luxury, this is not a boutique hotel, more as a family hotel.

Stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for 4 days. It exceeded my expectations. Because of the price, I was expecting an old run-down hotel, but it proved me wrong. While the hotel shows signs of aging, management tries its best to maintain it by being clean. No smell whatsoever. The no-smoking policy (they will make you sign a waiver), really works. The breakfast buffet was pretty good. Although it was the same everyday, it was ample. Proximity to the beach is a plus. The hotel also loans towels and chairs to take to the beach (included in the resort fee). Right next to the zoo (although, we did not have a chance to check it out, we were just mesmerized by the ocean view).

Great location right on street across from beach and at end by Park/Zoo. Had to wait until 3 pm check in to get room (not so good) but check out not until noon (good). I have a historic aversion to Resort Fees ($18/day) but in this case you get something you might need/use: Ethernet only room access, breakfast items with cooler to fill and keep, and free DVD's.Was upgraded to an 'ocean view room' which was nice even though the view of the hotel next door was the primary view and the ocean a 'sliver'. Balcony big enough for only 1 chair! Rooms have been updated but on the small side and tile in bathroom old and gross (not good). No coffee pot in room (not good); free downstairs (somewhat good). Had lunch in Tiki Bar and food and service good and prices competitive to area (meaning high). Mixed Plate very good choice. Nightly Happy Hour and Live Entertainment (very good). 'Breakfast on/for the Beach' with provided free cooler to helpful (part of Resort Fee)Car Parking of $27/day valet only pretty efficient. Heard about $10/day Parking at Waikiki Banyan 2 blocks away but did not check out.

I love the "breakfast on the beach". The ambiance is very Hawaiian. Staffs are extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms Are a little old but tolerable. Location is super convenience to everywhere! Highly recommended.

We were a party of 5, 3 adults and two teenagers and we stayed for four nights at the Aston. They actually upgraded our room to the 38th floor and boy, was that view impressive. Our room (rooms actually) were clean and very comfortable. The staff could not have been more helpful. Great location for whereever you wanted to go. We would absolutely stay there again.

We stayed here for our honeymoon and the rooms were really cute Hawaiian themes. The housekeeper was very helpful, bringing extra pillows for my bad back. We were excited about the free breakfast but after the first day it was nothing to write home about. They had some french toast sticks that were really good but the rest was just average. We did opt to book a few excursions at the desk since we were there a week and two of the four we booked were changed by desk without our knowledge when we went to get on the pick up bus those respective days. Luckily both check-in ladies on the bus said to go ahead and get on and she would deal with them later. Its a great location but be aware you do have to walk across the street to have access to the beach. We didn't find it to be a problem because the walk was really short.

I was hesitant at first to book this hotel after reading some of the reviews. It is amazing what little trivia things bother some people.
