The rooms might be a little small but we spent very little time in the room. We had an ocean view room which I highly recommend. We traveled in August. The rooms could use a fan, but you can open the sliders. We watched great sunsets and we had the beach right across the road from us. You can have the best of both worlds. Some complained that the beach across the street was not great because of the man made breaker wall which closed in the beach. Yes, you don't get the waves, but you have a very protected beach if you have young children, It was also easy to swim laps since there were not any waves. Beach was great. If you want the waves, just go 50 yards to the left of the pier and you can be surfing or body boarding just like the fancy hotels at the other end of the beach. The pier was also a good place to walk out on and watch surfers and jumpers off the pier. The continental breakfas was satisfying for my wife, daughter and me. Plenty of fruit, pastries, coffee and juices. I found the elevators to be fast and not as confusing as some have complained. The hotel is at a great location at the Diamond head end of Waikiki Beach. It is easy to get to the freeway and you don't have to go all the way through downtown like some of the other hotels. All of the bus lines turn right at this hotel so it is easy to catch a bus. The zoo is just a couple of blocks. When I booked, this hotel, it was half the cost of fancy ones that you don't spend much time in. The car rental shop is just 3 easy blocks away. Like most of Honolulu, it costs $20 a night to rent a car but the hotel has great valet parking. We only rented for two days because most of everything else had great bus service or was within walking distance. We will book here again on the next trip. The sixth floor or higher are best for views and less noise which you will have at all of the hotels.
user_name:
Doug K
Yakima, Washington, United States

review_body: We stop over in Waikiki to/from the way to the US mainland every year, and tend to stay in a new hotel each time. This Aston is not the most flash hotel by any means, but was great for the kids. It's right across the beach (2 actual, one with waves and one without), and across the zoo and aquarium. Cold, but plentiful, breakfast included, as well as free movies and playstation games. Only a few blocks from the action in Waikiki, but far enough to avoid it as well. Rooms have new furnishing and staff were very friendly and efficient. We stayed at the Hilton resort back in Aug (6 months previous) and the kids were unanimous they liked this Aston better. So at half the price, and a better location - we won't hesitate to stay here again.

This hotel was a great bargain, had a wonderful staff and was located right on the beach. The free breakfast every morning was more than adequate, offering oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, miso soup, and fresh pastries. The coffee was delicious! The rooms were pretty small, albeit clean and cutely decorated, but who goes to Hawaii to spend time in the room? The only thing I would say to do is request a room on a higher floor because breakfast is served around the pool every morning where they also have live music and a hula dancer. It can get a little loud early in the morning. However, what better way to wake up than to beautiful sunshine and peaceful Hawaiin music. The hotel offers free videos for rent, which is great after a long day of hiking, swimming and sight seeing. The location is perfect if you have a rental car. It's an easy, quick trip in and out of Waikiki if you are going to do any exploring of the island, which I highly recommend. I would stay here again.

We stayed here Jan. 12-19, 2013, and had a great experience. As noted in other users' reviews, the hotel could use a bit of updating, but the rooms and facilities in general were very clean, and well maintained. All of the staff we encountered, especially the housekeeping staff, were very friendly, and always willing to help.The location of the hotel can't be beat. At the quieter end of Waikiki, and literally steps from the beach. The zoo is the next block over, and there is a bus stop (for trolleys and tour buses) right at the side of the hotel. I have seen a lot of complaints about the daily resort fee. We travel quite often, and this is commonplace almost everywhere now. I don't see $18 as being unreasonable, compared to the daily fees that are charged elsewhere.We were traveling with our family, and had requested three rooms relatively close together, all with king beds, away from the elevators, facing away from Tiki's (after reading other reviews), with a partial ocean view. Absolutely all of our requests were fulfilled, and we had more than a partial ocean view...it was fantastic!Tiki's was great for appetizers and drinks, and had great happy hour specials every day. Wolfgang Puck's Express had amazing food and really reasonable prices. Also a Subway, Starbucks and Cold Stone Creamery all located in the same block. Very convenient!Bonus: you could hear the live music from Tiki's while swimming in the ocean across from the hotel!

I booked this hotel for a last minute trip to Hawaii... The room was very small, but enough for me to get some sleep and shower. The location is great, but definitely not a 4 or 5 star hotel. If you aren't crazy about a luxurious hotel, this will work. If you are looking for a fabulous resort, this is not the hotel for you.

We we're not impressed with this hotel, considering the price. They 'upgraded' our room but it had 2 double beds instead of the king we requested. We went with 3 couples and called ahead to request our rooms together and we all ended up on completely different floors. The pictures on the website make it look like a beautiful place, but it is very dated. They charge a $18/day ammenity fee, which includes a breakfast on the beach. This sounds much better than it is, it requires you to wait in line for a half poor buffet food, and take it down to the beach yourself. Not impressed.

Stayed at Aston Waikiki for a week with my partner. Our room had a fantastic beach view from the balcony side and from the entry we had a beautiful view of Diamond Head. The hotel is very well located near a quieter section of the beach but an easy walk to the main part of the strip. The room was a little small and it looks like the hotel has partially made these rooms over - bright linens and wall hangings to spruce up what looks to be an older room. With that said our room was clean and comfortable and we enjoyed our stay. Be aware that check in is not until 3pm (not ideal when you're arriving from an overnight flight), however you can leave your bags with the valets. We either slept in or were booked on early tours so we didn't experience the free breakfast. If you're expecting a luxury stay then this won't be for you but if you're looking for a well located, safe and clean base to explore Honolulu this is a great choice.

We recently stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach for 11 nights. Aside from some needed renovations - like the bathroom tile, guest room doors, etc, - this was a great place to stay! All you had to do was cross the street and you were at the beach!I've read several complaints about the breakfast, but I think the problem maybe was expectations... if you are looking for a full hot breakfast, go out for one. If looking for a quick, but yummy breakfast the hotel provided that. We ate there probably 6-7 of our mornings there and found no issues. Very short lines, food was always stocked and available, the cooler was nice to transport food over to the beach or to our room. Liked the tropical yogurt flavors and the donuts were amazing! C'mon we were on vacation! :)We had no issues with the elevators either although I had read several complaints about those too. To go up you had to swipe your room card and then it would tell you what elevator to get on. Never did have to wait long.Other positives were beach towels and chairs available for check out. Three DVD rental machines (Free... kind of... see resort fee commentary). Daily newspaper. In-room safe. Internet is available in the room, but currently not wi-fi. My main complaint was the daily resort fee. Ours was $10/day when we booked thru Priceline. Current signs stated it was $18/day.This is supposedly to cover breakfast, safe, DVD rental, internet. Those sorts of things... now unless this is actually optional (we were never asked if we wanted these things or were given an opportunity to turn it down), why isn't it just added into room cost? Why separate charges? Just seems like they are really nickel and diming us. We were aware of it and it was a minor annoyance, but at $18/day it could be quite an unfortunate surprise at check out if you weren't prepared for it.Overall we were very happy with the service and location. If ever back in Honolulu we would stay here again.

Upon entering I was struck by how 1970's this place looked, and I'm not talking retro- just old. Very out-dated, unimpressive reception/pool area. Staff were very friendly even when a member of our party got a bit cranky. Elevators require a swipe of your room key, great for security, bad for convenience, especially when carrying food or coming from the pool. Elevators were jammed with people so often that they were over-loaded and would not move until people got off. The room appeared what I would describe as "Tiki-tacky", with odd color choices and beat-up furniture/out-dated carpeting. I am very picky about cleanliness and check for dirt where others wouldn't look, so I was was pleased to find the room to be especially clean. However, the bath tiles are beat up and grout/caulk looks discolored/dirty. Due to a goof-up on the part of the travel agent, we got a pool-side room (instead of the ocean-view we asked for). That meant we had to listen to crappy music pounding until 11 PM from the bar next to the pool and we had to listen to the Hawaiian ballad singer singing the same songs every morning 7A-9A. The Hula dancer was hot, so I didn't mind that much.The one really great thing about this place was the food and service at the Tiki Lounge restaurant and bar. Great menu with unique items. All members in our group enjoyed the meals they had there.

For the price excellent location, I felt secure inside the hotel, and the views were magnificent. I had the very top right corner room (street side) and for that I got a marvelous view of the ocean and out of the front door a fantastic look at diamond head. The breakfasts really helped with the food budget. (I'd freeze the yogurt for a frozen snack later that day complements of the mini fridge/freezer.I enjoyed the Asian influence to the breakfasts with kimchi, pickled seaweed, rice and miso soup. Couple of complaints might include no coffee pot so I couldn't brew up my favorite AM coffee and no microwave to further stretch my food budget. I hope management reads this post because I fell in love with their hair conditioner and those mini donuts that look like chocolate but when you bite into them, they are purple inside and the most tender delicious doughnut I've ever had. I hope they can help me find a similar doughnut and more importantly the hair conditioner. Oh also, I extended my stay and they put me in another room with the even smaller small balcony that pigeons are discouraged to land on unless they have a few flight hours under their beaks. This room was on the diamond head side of the hotel.

We were staying with family in a beach rental and wanted to stay one night on Waikiki beach just me and my husband. Since we were only staying one night I wanted something reasonably priced. Wow, is that hard to find on Waikiki. I chose this hotel cause the price was cheaper than many other hotels, and it was directly across the road from the beach. It is located on the end of Waikiki beach near the zoo. I actually liked the location, as it was across the road from the less busier sections of the beach. The room was small but wouldn't want to share it with more than one person. I really enjoyed the lanai, which faced the ocean. We stayed on a Sunday night the noise of the band playing at Tiki's was very loud, but thankfully they didn't play late.There were lots of casual places to eat nearby, I really enjoyed Wolf Gang Puck express, and Cold Stone Creamery. Nothing fancy here if that is what your looking for.Only one major complaint, if you wanted to use internet in your room, you had to have a cord to plug it to your computer. Really should update their hotel should have wifi available in the rooms, but if you went down to the pool area you could get wifi.

We have stayed in Waikiki before. This trip we decided to stay closer to Diamond-Head. We also enjoy many nice boutique hotels in NY so we decided to try one in Waikiki. I agree with the reviews about the view, but can't agree with the review of the Aston. The rooms are so small we had to set our chairs on our ocean view balcony to have room for our suitcases. Trust me, rooms in NY are small too and cost more, but you wont see such neglected hotels in NY as this one.The rooms look very tired paint has been slapped on the walls and are peeling off. No pillowcases on the pillows. The bathroom walls are filthy. The ceramic floors in the bathroom are the original flooring which needs to be updated. I'm sure it wouldn't cost that much to update the bathroom because literally only one small person can fit into the room. I'm 5'7" 130lbs and my husband is a lean 185 lbs and we both cannot fit in the bathroom together! When the room reaches its temperature and the AC fan kicks off, you can smell the exhaust from the buses and other vehicles on the street below. We are on the 16th floor so my guess is it's coming up from the HVAC system that sets next to the street. Breakfast, forget about it! We were up at 730 huge huge line! And check in well that's another story. Pool lacks chairs and the chairs that are there are at a premium! This hotel needs a much needed face lift! Spend a little bit more and you will get by far better accommodations.

I booked this hotel on a recommendation from a friend, that said, I was a little surprised when I arrived at the hotel. First off we were put in a room that was next to the elevator and it was very very noisy. It was on the 5th level, (the pool was on the 3rd level) and they had a guy singing below our window every morning from 7am. Also, breakfast was in this area and everyone congregated around our window from 6:30 (when breakfast started). The DVD player didnt play the DVD's suppliedWhen we arrived we were told that there was an amenities tax for daily services in the hotel. This wasn’t stated on the price. It wasn’t much but it would have been nice to know if this was included in the price of the room. ($18 a day). The restaurant downstairs played music late at night and again this noise travelled up to our room. The décor was a bit outdated. Our room was dirty and was never really cleaned, although we did get our bed made up. The staff were fine, but because of the huge numbers of people in the hotel and the limited staff, they were always rushed and didn’t really have time for anything. The pool is not hit by the sun until late evening so it is essentially not useable, and there was some painting work being done also which meant it couldn’t really be used anyways. Plus it is a lot smaller than it looked on the website. Luckily it was close to the beach. I am not a happy customer after this experience

We came to Hawaii for our Honeymoon and thought the Aston was VERY nice. Yes the rooms could use some updating especially the bathroom, but overall it was fantastic!! The outdated bathroom didn't bother us at all, as we were not in the room very often, basically to sleep...The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful with whatever we needed! When we checked in we received a gift (picture frame) for choosing them to stay for our honeymoon.. The breakfast was good, we didn't eat there very often maybe 2 days out of the 6 we were there. The view from our room was outstanding and beautiful!!! We had an ocean view. I liked how you could just walk across the street and you were on the beach, very nice! I would definately recommend this hotel to couples and/or families!!

My wife and I were celebrating our 45th anniversary and picked the Aston by shear chance. We had a wonderful view of waikiki with our room choice. Check in and out was easy and the free breakfast was ok and would have been better if it had not been so crowded every morning when they opened. All things considered it was a nice room for the price considering other beachside hotels prices. Only complaint was the value of the amenity fee(movie selection from the free dvd rentals was extremely limited). We can't blame the hotel for all the homeless people that camp out on the streets at night but the City of Honolulu needs to address this problem. We will not return to Honolulu because of this problem.

This was a nice hotel stay, and is in between a best western hotel and a marriott. There is an open air lobby with a front desk that overlooks the swimming pool and deck chairs which is located on the 2nd floor. There are ample towels available in the pool area, and you can walk down 1 flight of stairs, cross the street, and you are on Waikiki Beach ! Great location, as it is located on the southern part of waikiki beach. Walking distance to Queen's beach, right around the corner from Hula's club, and you can walk to the aquarium and the less busy Queen's beach (the gay area). Check in was friendly and effortless. The young gentleman gave us 3 hotel keys and had us check out each room to see which view and layout we liked the most. I really liked having a choice, and after we chose a room, we just let him know which one we picked and it was all set up for us.The hotel floors are part indoors and part open air, so there was no air conditioning in the hotel hallways. Room was nice with bright vivid colors, and the partial ocean view was adequate with step-off balcony. There really is no need to oceanfront room since the property is literally right across the street from the beach. Literally. Breakfast on the beach was a nice touch. You are provided a small cooler/tote bag and you bring it downstairs with you and there was a nice selection of cereals, haupia (coconut) pudding, orange and guava juice, miso soup (for the japanese tourists), rice, hash browns, and mini cinnamon rolls. This did not get boring, and I loved it. Some days I had my spouse go down and bring breakfast back up to the room, and any leftover such as yogurt we just put in our hotel refrigerator in case we wanted a late night snack. Overall the property is very tall. there isn't much room to spread out, and so everything just goes upwards. There was valet parking on the main floor, and front desk is located on 2nd floor and the front desk area shares space with the swimming pool. There was also a small store that sold sundries, but with the abundance of ABC stores on waikiki I don't see why this was completely necessary to have a convenience store. We walked a block to the pacific beach hotel and had their buffet dinner, where they have a huge aquarium in the center of the restaurant and this was delightful. The location of the hotel is in a quieter area of waikiki, but you can still walk to the International Marketplace and the busier side of Waikiki, but we preferred this quieter area. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation if I was on a budget, but next trip to waikiki I am thinking of trying one of the higher end resorts just to try something different.

Stayed twice at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel (February & December 2012).Can't get enough of the wonderful view from the oceanfront rooms. (1034). So worth it.The hotel staff were ALL wonderful. Very nice & helpful.New Years Eve, everyone sat by the balcony and just watched 2 firework parties (one right in front of us and the other just to the right behind Hilton Hawaiian Village) going on at midnight for 10 minutes each. Thousand of people below us lined the beach. It was amazing!Although the style and colour theme is like the 'Brady Bunch era', I don't mind.Furniture should be upgraded hopefully soon.The free breakfast could rotate different menu for a bit of variety. Overall, I can't wait to go back... Extremely convenient for: Actual drop off point.- Speedi Shuttle pick up & drop off to airport $25 round trip - Pink Line tram shopping to Ala Moana $2- Free Hilo Hattie shuttle to their souvenir store. After visiting the store, they will drop you off anywhere on the strip.Did not rent a car until I moved to the other end of the strip to Hawaiian Village.

This was our first time to Hawaii and we are very pleased with our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Our room was always clean with a great view of Diamond Head. Breakfast 'on the beach' was enjoyable with lots of fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereals, coffee etc. We especially loved the entertainment of singer Tino Jacob (T. J.) and the hula dancing of Celeste and Ryelee (would love to see more of them); such a great way to start the day!!! I also must mention how helpful and friendly Jovanie was at poolside with beach towels and chairs.I can't say enough about how much we loved our two week stay. We met so many wonderful people and found all staff to be very helpful and kind.We look forward to returning next year and staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach, again!Sharon and Wayne from British Columbia,Aloha and Mahalo

Our first visit to Hawaii and I don't think we could have picked a better spot . The hotel was awesome,which included breakfast on the beach. What a treat this was with coffee ready every morning by 545 am and food by 630 am. Fresh fruit,cereal,yogurt and donuts were included. If you wanted eggs it was a minimal charge.Also there are a few restaurants attached - like Wolfgang Pucks(soups,pizza,sandwiches,entrees)subway,stone creamery and the best one Tiki's bar and grill with daily specials and ocean view seating at dinner(sunset)We had a partial ocean view room which was very nice.The pool was very small but never used by us as we all went to the beach(14 of us)Transportation was always easy to find right by the hotel.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel during our recent visit to oahu for our anniversary. I had heard great reviews of their oceanfront select rooms hence decided to pay the premium .. oceanfront rooms are the most expensive in waikiki and it really does not make financial sense to pay such a big premium for it especially if you are not going to be spending that much time in the room .. since we were celebrating a special occasion we went for the splurge this time around .. we were booked on the 19th floor with a great panoramic view of the waikiki beach strip. I personally think the best view is from the sheraton hotel but that was way out of our budget range.. the room itself was quite spacious .. my only quibble was that the lanai was too close to our neighbors which compromises privacy .. We also found free parking on monserrat ave next to the zoo although it was a bit of a walk at times depending on how far our car was parked .. they charge $18 for resort fee which includes breakfast on the beach (not bad) and wired internet in the room (no, they don't have wifi yet :)) .. their parking is ridiculously expensive hence we decided to skip it in favor of bit of inconvenience to have access to our car .. also their is no coffee maker in the room but luckily starbucks is just around the corner so we got our caffeine fix in the morning w/o any problems .. When we checked in we were a little inconvenienced carrying our luggage up the escalator to the hotel reception area .. their elevator system is a bit of an overkill where you punch in the floor first and then an elevator gets assigned to you .. overall a very clean property right on the beach with great views from oceanfront select rooms .. definitely a winner from a price point if views are important to you !!!

We stayed here last summer and it was perfect. We had an easy check in and check out, valet was quick to grab our vehicle, and the free breakfast was good as well. The one thing that I really wanted to share is that my boyfriend hid my jewerly (over $1000.00 in all pieces) in a drawer and never told me. We left to go to the Big Island and I realized my jewery was missing at which he stated oops, I hid it in the last hotel room. I was a wreck when I realized this. I called the Aston and they transferred me to housekeeping and the maid in my room found it all, placed it in a box and they were awaiting an address to mail my belongings to. I feel like that in itself is a reason to come back and stay there again. It is nice to know that there are honest people doing the right thing.

We stayed here a few nights while wanting to be in the Waikiki beach area. It was a great choice for us as we wanted easy access to the beach area but did not want to be right in the thick of it. The hotel was a bit dated but in good repair, clean and we thought quite nice for the price. The hotel was noisy (our room was right across from the ice maker) but you should expect noise when staying in this area (road noise was also an issue). The breakfast was worth eating - which isn't always true of the free breakfasts. The staff was pleasant and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We will return when in the Waikiki area.

We found this hotel through Costco travel and would not recommend it as a great place to stay. Be sure you investigate the little "extras" that get charged...$30 a day for parking and $20 a day resort fee with taxes. For a six night stay this added almost $300 to our stay. The rooms were nice and clean and the bed and bedding was excellent. The room was small, but we did not spend much time there. We paid extra for a ocean view which was great but the small lanai only had one chair so we moved one out from the room. Breakfast was adequate, cereal, tropical yogurt, lots of pastries and rolls, coffee, juices, and delicious fruit each day. If you wanted, you could order an omelet for $5 or waffles for $4. There is a Hawaiian singer and hula dancer to welcome you each morning, but we could hear it on the 20th floor, so I can only imagine what it was like for the rooms closest to the pool. Seating is dicey, but if we could not get a seat it was a short wait for one to come available or we took the food to the room. The small coolers were a bonus. I do not understand the problems with the elevators...to get down to the main floor you hit the star key and you did not need your room key for this, but you did need it to get back upstairs. All you had to do was scan the card and choose the floor and the system told you which elevator would take you there. Very efficient with a minimum wait time. The location is great if you enjoy the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. There is a wonderful beach right across a busy street, which means you get a lot of street noise, but that is to be expected. There are many ABC stores all around and numerous places to eat. The International Marketplace is very close with shopping and food. The zoo is right around the corner. At night, the restaurant "Tiki's" plays loud music until late in the evening so beware. The valet is very efficient, we usually did not have to wait more than a few minutes for the jeep, and it was great that we could check out beach chairs and towels to take with us. Beware of Honolulu traffic...it is the worst I have ever seen.All in all, we enjoyed our stay, but next time would probably book out of the city for a quieter stay and less traffic!

Reading recent Tripadvisor reviews after purchasing an affordable travel package ($614 for three nights at this hotel, roundtrip transfers, lei greeting, etc) on-line through Costco Travel almost prompted us to cancel our reservation at this hotel. We are glad we didn't! The package guaranteed a partial-ocean view room and for whatever reason we ended up on the 14th floor in an ocean-view room with full sweeping view of Waikiki. Our deck chair and its foot rest became a viewing stand from which we ate breakfasts, dinners (take out is nearby) and sipped morning Kona coffee (served at the hotel buffet) and sunset wine.This 645-room hotel is one of Waikiki's older properties. It underwent renovations in 2002 and again in 2006. Some of the common areas, such as the decking around the pool, as mentioned by others, is in need of replacement. Our room with two double beds didn't have a lot of extra space but it was decked out in bright Hawaii colors, the sheets were as luxurious as those we've had at higher end properties, the carpet new and of bamboo design and the towels were thick. The room was very clean; the maids were there every morning, bright and early.The hotel also has some nice touches. IWe were provided two cotton kimono robes and newspapers were available every morning at the elevators on each floor. We are puzzled by some of the complaints we read in earlier reviews of the food provided each morning. The whole concept is to serve breakfast on/in disposable flatware so that you can put it in the insulated bag (a gift from the hotel to keep) and take it, along with hotel-provided beach chairs and towels to the beach just across the street - the hotel's Breakfast on the Beach program. Most guests seemed to want to cluster themselves around the pool however and for that reason hotel management told us they have ordered more tables and chairs to accomodate the morning diners. The food selection included yogurt, cereals, miso soup, rice cakes, fresh pastries, and fresh fruit. Hot items were available for a nominal cost. Kona coffee as well as two additional special blends were also available.The only 'negatives' we would note were: the lack of wi-fi in the guest rooms (supposed to be installed in February 2013), and, a frustrating room key lock system that required several tries before the door opened. The elevator required the room key to be swiped both at the lobby level and on the floor before it would appear. (If you locked your key in your room you would have been unable to take the elevator to the lobby to get another one).While others seemed to have negative check-in experiences, we had five people manning the check in computers when we arrived; we stood in line for less than 20 minutes and our wait for our room wasn't more than another 20 (our flight was early - we were at at the hotel before the 3 p.m. check-in). All the staff members we encountered from check in to check out were friendly and efficient.The location was perfect: across from the famed beach, within a couple of blocks of high end shopping at the Royal Hawaiian shopping center, a block from the Honolulu Zoo and just a bit further to Queen Kapiolani Park and the Aquarium. Bus stops for buses going into Honolulu or away from it were within a block of the hotel. A Starbucks next door provided the free internet access we needed and for those with a sweet tooth, Coldstone Creamery was off the lobby. Tourism is on the upswing in Waikiki and so are the hotel prices. We found this hotel to be well worth what we paid for it and wouldn't hesitate to buy another package from Costco or to make a return visit here.

I stayed here for the 2nd time in October & I still love the hotel. It has changed ownership since 2008 when I last stayed, but it is basically the same. The location is the best part of this hotel! Ocean front is a must! Get the select rooms if possible, the views are spectacular. The swimming lagoon is great for those who are not strong swimmers & it is usually not too crowded. There are also many more corals and fish by the wall than there was in 2008, so you can snorkle as well. Its not like snorkleing Hanauma Bay or anything, but it is nice to see some fish, etc...The breakfast line is long, even if you get there when it first starts, it gets very crowded fast! The food is more basic than it was previously. You only get 1 breakfast bag now, which is OK because the choices are more limited. There are some pastries, some fruits, yogurt, cereal & juices. They don't have eggs anymore, which i was disappointed in,but it is free, so..... If you want anything beyond pastries and fruits, you will have to go out, but there are lots of places close by. I found cheeseburger in paradise has a decent priced breakfast & the lines arent as long as others.The room itself isnt huge, but you dont need a big room with so much else to do! The balcony is by far the best part! Small, but it does the trick! The bathrooms are outdated however. They are kinda run down & need an upgrade. The floor was kinda dirty as were the walls. the sink & toilet were clean. Showers are old. The shower head actually started spraying everywhere uncontrollably when I first arrived. Maintenance had to come replace it. They also had to replace the light in the room which was making sparks at the base of the plug. They were nice tho & replaced everything that needed to be replaced. I would like to see the whole bathroom just remodeled though, it would really make a big difference for this hotel! The staff is all friendly. The only issue I had was the room key not being activated properly. Had to go back to the front desk 3 times which was a pain with luggage & super long check in lines. I saw a few other guests having the same issue with the same staff member. He was nice, but I think he just didnt know how to operate the key thing. Once I realized, I went to a different guy & he was able to give me a key that worked with no problem. The cleaning staff were all very very nice & friendly & made sure everything was re stocked in the bathroom; towels, rags, soaps, etc...Parking is another issue..while valet parking is nice, it is very expensive! It would be nicer to have a self parking option. They are pretty fast at getting your car when you call though. Only once had to wait more than 10 minutes. I could also do without the resort fee, I think they should apply that toward the price of parking, as most other Aston hotels include free parking or list free parking as an ammenity included in the resort fee. The check out was nice being able to just drop the room key in a box in the lobby and not have to wait in a line! Feel free to contact me if you have any questions!

We stayed as part of a large group and from what we saw all the motels were the same in Waikiki, high rises. It was clean and comfortable and is directly across the road from the beach which has a wall around it to shelter you from the waves. Rooms were nice and bed was very comfortable. Small balcony but the view was lovely,terrific sunsets over the water. In your room as a cooler bag ready for you to fill at breakfast time and take to the beach if you wish. We recommend not to eat their breakfast if you would prefer a healthy option as the food supplied was all sweet pastries, muffins and cakes. The Tiki bar is a great place for resoinably priced meals and drinks and there is a small shop downstairs for essentials and across the road is and ABC shop. The zoo is across the road and it is a short walk to shopping centres and markets. Our stay was enjoyable and we would go back there. There is free wifi by the pool but you have to pay in the rooms. The activities centre staff were very helpful and you can book any activity you wish to right at the hotel.

Besides of other people said above, I was very impress by the view of the apartment that I stayed for lovely and shorty 5 nights (ask for the Ocean View for a few extra dollars). The breakfast time was funny for the first time with their BOB (bring your own breakfast) basket but the next times was kind of stressing experience, perhaps if they open the TIKI restaurant for those who would like to have a seat and a nice talk at morning will be more relaxing. Very well located, and the most - it is in Hawaii !!! Not a minimum chance to change Hawaii to any place in Mexico or even in Brazil - perhaps you will find hotels better in those places - but I dare you to find other hotel in those places with a better cost benefit !!! NOT A SINGLE CHANCE. So If you are reading this review - I would say that this hotel is perfect if you would like to visit Hawaii !!! Stay at the hotel only to take a shower, appreciate the view (if you get the ocean view), get some sleep and grab a fast breakfast - otherwise there are other hotels 2-3 blocks from Aston that you will be glad to know (not so glad to pay).
user_name:
Rodrigo X
São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

review_body: My husband and I booked through Expedia for a 5 night stay in August 2012. We payed about 2800 for flight/hotel package for both of us with an oceanfront room. The views was amazing, especially for the price!! Its only a few dollars more for an ocean FRONT room and well worth the money. We stayed on the 14th floor which was perfect. The bathrooms were outdated, but I loved the Hawaiian feel of the room and the decor. The staff was very friendly. Tikis rooftop bar/restaurant was nice and "happening" at night. The drinks were great, the food was NOT my favorite. Fish Tacos on the lunch menu were yummy. Ran into Chuck Liddell in the lobby which was cool! Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I were to go back. Also, the location is perfect! On the 1st floor there is a Subway, ice cream shop, Wolfgang Pucks (which is gourmet to-go food, good prices). If you are anything like my husband and I, you will aPpreciate these places. Nearly all of the restaurants we ate at were unimpressive and we are not picky eaters.

This was our 2nd time staying at this hotel. The last time we stayed, the hotel was a Resortquest property & was much better maintained. This trip the hotel seemed "tired" & in need of updates. The "Breakfast on the Beach" has also gone downhill & is a gong show. The breakfast times of 6:30-9 are not user friendly hours for vacationing guests, & thebofferings have really declined in the past 4 years. Now if you want eggs, you have to pay extra money...that's a disappointment. The staff are still very friendly & the Tiki Bar makes exceptional Mai tai's. The hotel's location is wonderful; right across the street from the beach, but I'm not sure we would stay there again, as we felt it was now overpriced for the current condition of the hotel.

We booked this resort for 10 nights because of all the reviews and the 4 star rating. We arrived at 2 a.m. (our back home time) so we were all very tired. First...this was not an accident of receiving a bad room. We were three couples and booked three rooms. All rooms were on different floors and same side of building. All three rooms were equally bad. They were dirty, wall paper very old and torn, air conditioner dirty, sliding doors allowed wind to whistle through like a freight train. We all booked partial ocean views. The view could only be seen when stepping onto the tiny balcony (no chair would fit) and leaning over, peering past your neighbours unit. Otherwise, the view was of roofs of other poor condition hotels The hotel says "recently remodelled". The photo of the red bedboard is the absolute only part of the room that was remodelled. EVERYTHING is very tired and old. I refused to walk barefoot in the room. The painted doors have probably 40 or more coats and resemble your fathers garage door to his 40's house or an entry to a cellar. The moment we entered the lobby booking in area we kind of knew we were in trouble. The pool deck has huge blister paint bubbles peeling from the deck floor. The breakfast included offers a food bank feel...and if raining there is no shelter with appropriated seating. If you have ever stayed in Mexico, at a resort, this would not even rate a 2 star. We left the next morning after scouting other hotels on the beach. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for slightly LESS. I do have to say that the staff at the Aston were very friendly and apologetic and we had no problems with refunds.

This was the second time we've stayed at the Aston Waikiki beach hotel. The location is awesome. The rooms while just a little outdated are roomy and clean. The beachfront rooms have a fantastic view. We stayed on the 18th floor and while we could hear the Tiki Bar it was just a hum and not loud enough to stop you from sleeping. That being said I don't think I'd want a room directly above it. The only things that needed improving are:1) I think the reception staff need to get upgraded check-in systems. Each check in took SO long. Clearly things could be more productive. (Or at least add more staff, even with 3 check-in staff I waited in line for over 40mins and there weren't many people ahead of me)2) I asked for an early check-in because my toddler desperately needed a nap (normal check-in is 3pm). We were sent away twice being told to check back later, but never given a timeframe as they didn't want to promise anything they could not deliver. In the end we checked in at 2:30pm. Barely early. Again I think this could be easily improved if things were more organized. Aside from the items above, both which could be improved, I'd happily stay here again.

We found our room to be in need or repairs - water stains on ceiling, wall paper peeling off walls, bathroom floor grout lines were very dirty, unfriendly staff.Our room with partial ocean view really gave us a view of the hotel next door under construction. Had to keep curtains pulled due to workers able to look straight into our room. Was willing to pay for an upgrade on our room - never even got a call back from the staff on our request. Bell staff only wanted to book tours or get you a taxi, did not want to help with directions for walking or using bus service - guess they did not get kick backs!Avoid this hotel - location may be good, but our room and experience with staff was poor!

Staff was very helpful. Great location for activities to suit anybody. Rooms are decent sizes, but clean. If you are able to get an oceanfront view it's amazing! Cons: Internet connection is terrible and staff does not offer support. The bathroom needs a little work. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel.

Traveled 1/2-1/8 for a family reunion with the outlaws. Got very lucky and booked a room @$235, free breakfast,parking, resort fee & room. * room was clean, yes a bit small but shoot its HA during the new year and unless you want to pay $500-1k a night this is considered a deal.* location - can't really beat unless your actually on the beach- again $500-1k a night* you need to understand that HA is a expensive location on this planet to live- 85% of your needs is imported in, food, clothing, materials etc, etc,etc.* we stay on Waikiki once a year just to be a tourist but couldn't find a deal because of the time of year.* over all was a clean efficient hotel with most of the staff full of Aloha - really don't know how as this location is definitely a turn and burn hotel, the owners make plenty $$$.** Stay Again?? - yes if the rate was better, probably off season we usually stay at ParcWaikiki

Visited the Aston Beach Hotel for a week during the holidays in Dec 2012. This is a relatively standard beach hotel with a great location on Waikiki Beach. Located at the end of the commercial area it offers almost everything within walking distance (great stores, outdoor activity, restaurants, and fast food)The rooms are somewhat basic - I guess that's expected from a beach hotel.Breakfast usually comes with the room and served around the pool area. Breakfast starts around 6:30am and consists of fruits, cereals, and light snacks. The only problem is, if you want breakfast you have to be there early, otherwise there's long line lines and breakfast is gone before you know it.Customer service is basic and no out of the ordinary treatment.Alot depends on you to make your stay enjoyable. Aston just offers the location.

Don't look too closely at the hotel - it's old with cracked tiles around the pool, popcorn ceilings and badly painted rooms directly across the street from the beach. A beach stocked aplenty with derelects pushing their shopping carts and harassing the tourists. A friendly staff can't make up for the secret "amenities charge" of $18 over and above your expected daily room rate that you weren't bargaining for and have no choice about. If you like an overcrowded dump surrounded by bums that sneakily rob you of your money, look no further.

We stayed there during Christmas and New Years.The people at the front desk we very slow.... but nice. The maid we had was very sweet, but sometimes the room was not cleaned until 3 or 4pm... Our view was a partial ocean view. That was ok, but the balcony was so tiny, I couldn't even fit a chair out there to enjoy the little bit of ocean we could see. We were right across from another hotel( or the same hotel, not sure) and could see the people very clearly. ( Not always a pretty sight~ Im sure for them too). =) We were on the 17th floor, the big A/C units were pretty loud, drowned out the ocean. And for the first 3 days our AC did not work, neither did the AC in the other room our family was in. They fixed it quickly though. It was busy there but not too bad. Great location ~ right across from the beaches !! Loved that !!! The free breakfast was ok.Get there early, they did run out of food. It would have been nice to have some healthier choices. They had fresh fruit yogurt, cereal, plain mini bagels, mini muffins, and many different pastries and muffins ... too many if you ask me. Don't get me wrong, they were yummy.But maybe they could have changed it up a bit. They did have a waffle station, but it cost a little. Juice was good, Coffee was disappointing. I was told they serve Kona. Had to go to Starbucks and have Some Pikes Peek a few days. Luckily it was very close. The people at the information desk didn't know squat. Almost everything we asked them was wrong, maybe not completely wrong but it would have been nice to get some correct information. . They had free DVD movies and playstation games available.. The internet was down quit a bit.  The Tiki Bar/Restaurant was awesome !!!! Had the best food and great service. There were 14 of us at times and not one of us had a complaint about our meals! The Hawaii 5-0 Lava Flow is my favorite drink now. So good ! Delicious every time.The Wolf Gang Puck express restaurant was very good, but the bathroom in there was gross and dirty every time we went in.Good pizza,good salad & good breakfast pizza but they didn't serve Wolf Gang Puck coffee.. I was bummed about that. But all in all ~ We were in beautiful Hawaii !! Would I stay at the Aston again?? I guess so, but would definitely get a room with a view !!!!!!!! So my complaints aren't major ones. Ive heard much worse. My first time there, loved it so much !!! I hated leaving, but will be going back, soon I hope!

We enjoyed our stay at the Aston. The location is right across from the beach, which was a huge advantage. The only thing I did not like about the location was the fact that the homeless hang out at this side of Waikiki.The hotel itself was fine, for the price you paid. I had requested a high floor and when we arrived at 10:00 p.m., they upgraded our room for no charge to accomodate my request, giving us a room on the 25th floor. The lanai was nice with room to sit and watch the sun go down into the ocean. The room and bathroom are small, but again, for the price, satisfactory. The elevator system is neat and works very well at getting you to your floor quickly. It was nice to have breakfast included in the price, as that saved us at least $30/day.The week that we were there, they had a Santa's workshop. The people that work at the Aston are wonderful. My 8 year old daughter enjoyed the morning workshop. Candace even came out looking for us at breakfast to make sure we knew about the workshop. It was nice getting some personal attention.The Aston is a tour bus stop, which made catching the bus a breeze. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel and would recommend it to others.

This hotel would have been fine if the rate was between $150 to $200 [they do include breakfast which is nice]. Unfortunately it was New Year and we paid through the nose - $500 plus plus.It's the most expensive run down hotel I have ever been to in my life - my fault for going there over New Year. Staff were just over it - it started by not having access to room because previous guest could not be bothered getting out in time and was followed by staff who really didn't want to be there. For some strange reason the bar/restaurant staff were fantastic? Maybe it's not run by the hotel??

When we arrived after a week of peace and solitude, we knew it would be a wake up call tocome into the city. The computers were new, so we had over half an hour wait to check in.The room was small, but comfy, and very colorful! Breakfast is included, with a little picnic bagto fill up between 7-9 a.m. every morning. However, a singer and hula dancer also starts atthat time of the morning, so if you want to sleep in, forget that one! Lots of families, and thepool seemed to get lots of use. One day we came home at 3p.m. and our room hadn't beencleaned. It is central to everything, and the Tiki Restaurant never disappointed us once.Just beware that besides the ocean view, you'll have microphoned Elvis singing Blue Hawaii...at 7 a.m. For the amount of $ it cost, I'd prefer to have been a few streets over. This is my7th time to Waikiki and everytime I go, I learn something, and hopefully you have from thisreview! Best part was watching the fireworks and sunsets from our balcony!

I stay at the Aston quite often, the staff has always gone out of thier way to treat thier customers with Aloha, as we say in the islands. Its no wonder why this hotel is packed year around with tourists, and locals as well. If you compare the price to some of the other hotels it might all seem the same..but..this hotel really goes out of its way to make its guests comfortable.Also it has undergone a renovation recently which has added some comfort features. The beds are very comfortable, and the Tiki's bar downstairs is the place to be. They feature live music most nights and i go to Tiki's even when im not staying at the hotel. Also it is within walking distance of the Honolulu Zoo, the Aquarium, the Natatorium, and Kapiolani Park. The best stretch of Waikiki Beach is right out front. I dont think you can find a better value for your dollars in Waikiki.

We had one night pre-cruise and 2 nights post-cruise here. The staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly and we were pleased that our room was already available when we first arrived as we'd had a very long day flying from Australia.The hotel is in a great location right opposite the beach, walking distance to many eateries, shops and the International Market Place and a stop on the Ala Moana shuttle. Very convenient.This had been advertised as providing a small carry pack for breakfast so that you could easily take it away. By the time we go there this had been replaced with flimsy cardboard trays that were difficult to manage. Breakfast itself was below acceptable. There was very little variety. Fruit was not ripe and was tasteless. Coffee wasn't worth the name. If you don't get there early you won't get a seat or may have to balance your flimsy cardboard tray on your lap. Breakfast probably wasn't a deal breaker but next time I would stay somewhere that didn't include it and eat out. There's plenty of places nearby.The rooms were adequate and clean but very very basic and tired. They badly need updating. Don't be fooled by any talk of a "balcony" or lanai. At best, this will be a ledge that you can fit a couple of chairs on - just. At worst, the door won't even open, like our first room. Perhaps the more expensive rooms are better, but if you're here on a budget, you'll get what you pay for room-wise. Not much.Wifi internet was only available by the pool and was very, very slow.I have hovered over the ratings 2 and 3. I have settled for a 3 based on the staff and location. I would have given it a 2.5 rating if I could have.Honestly, I would recommend looking elsewhere. I was very disappointed.

This was my first time to Hawaii & when we first arrived at the hotel it was nicely decorated and was right across from the beach, so I figured I picked a good hotel. Then we went to check in and that's where the nightmare began. You can't check in or check out until a specific time, so you're forced to walk around with your luggage until your room is ready, and when it's finally time, you have to wait in a long line for an hour because they only have one person working at any given time. They also screwed up our room requirements giving us a room with 2 beds and a resort view when we asked for one bed (hello, we're a couple!) and a beach front view. But I decided not to complain. The breakfast is cheap and gross and even though its "free" we never ate their breakfast because it was cheap cereal and bagels. Housekeeping was always late and we didn't get our room cleaned until 3 or 4 pm. The wifi never worked and the DVD rental kiosk was always out of order. All in all bad bad bad.

The location is great and very convenient. The staff was very helpful and happy. We loved the early morning breakfast and watching the hula girl and singer. They even sang Happy Birthday to my daughter and got all the guest to sing along.

Pros: Location. East end of Waikiki Beach, easy walking to zoo & aquarium, and of course, the beach, which was just across the street. Our room had a great view of Diamond Head and if you stuck your own head out far enough & craned it to the right, you could see the ocean. Starbucks is around the corner to your left, Seattle's Best is one block over to your right. Free to take with you to the beach: towels & beach chairs.Cons: Service. Maid service never showed until well into the afternoon, 330PM, then 4PM, then 430PM, and this even after complaining the first day. The concierge didn't seem to understand his job; when I asked for transportation to the airport, he gave me the phone number of a taxi service--he did not call & make the arrangement himself. And FYI, the EcoCab is a great company, with no thanks to the Aston Waikiki Beach Concierge, because that was not the number of the taxi service he gave me. (Those people did not even answer their phone.) Oh, and let's not forget the 'mandatory' $10/day fee for, uh, what was it--'free' video rental & I'm not sure what else. Basically, it was a weaselly add-on charge that you do not know of until you check in, too jet-lagged to complain & find another hotel. So-so: the breakfast. Yeah, sure it was 'free', and they supply you with a little case so you can take it with you to the beach, but the juices come out of a machine; the fruit is your standard American grocery store fruit (pineapple, cantaloupe, grapes, honeydew melon) that could be had anywhere--where was the papaya, the mango?; boxed cereals; mass-produced pastries; can't comment on the coffee & I missed the tea--it was by the juices instead of the coffee. That's the 'American' breakfast. For Asians, the food is on the other side: fish, rice, soup, that's what I remember. I didn't try any of this, though I meant to. General: no fan in the bathroom; huge gap under the door & terrific whistling cross-wind as a result when combined with an open balcony door

This was actually my fourth stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Even though the hotel isn't the flashest, in terms of location and price for a beach-front room, I always thought it couldn't be beaten. However, after this last trip, I'm afraid to say, we won't return - the prices have gone up but the room quality and service have dropped.We had booked our usual, high-floor, ocean-front room, but on check in, we were told we needed to pay extra for a high floor room - a policy which was brought in AFTER we had booked and paid. So we ended up with a lower floor room, which wasn't a huge problem but disappointing. Overall, customer service was pretty appalling, starting with check in and continuing throughout our trip. Staff seem disinterested in helping anyone and communication between staff members was terrible. We asked for a bottle opener to be delivered to our room and waited 90 minutes....we called downstairs to find out what was going on and someone told us they don't deliver items to rooms! So I then went downstairs to collect it and when I got there, was told someone was bringing it up! We had a free lunch included in our package and pre-booked it but it never turned up. We also had general issues with local attraction information provided by staff being inaccurate.In terms of the hotel itself, a revamp is well overdue. The beds are comfortable and rooms are relatively clean, but we had torn sheets and doona cover, broken lock on balcony door, peeling paint everywhere, and a hole in the wall in the bathroom. Bathrooms are very, very dated as is the furniture and carpet. The breakfast, as other reviewers have commented, is average at best. You also have to get down there relatively early, especially for holiday-makers (I think it's only between 6 and 9am and by 9am everything is pretty much gone). We actually skipped it a few days and ate elsewhere, which was a welcome change. Lulu's downstairs, past Subway and above the ABC store, was pretty good for breakfast. Overall, we will not return to this hotel, which is disappointing given we were almost 'regulars'! The Aston Waikiki Beach hotel need to either drop their prices significantly, or update their rooms and train their staff in the art of customer service.

Firstly the cons: We stayed here for about a week and the experience was less than par. (1) They charge you $10 a day for services you don't use ie phone, wired internet (no wifi), DVD rentals. (2) Valet was $26 per day and it took over 40 Minutes to retrieve your vehicle. Plus they always an accuse instead of apologizing. (3) All of the representatives here are very lazy and they never show a sense of urgency, even when it is apparent that they've made a mistake. (4) Check-in took over an hour because of slow front desk employees. 3 parties in line and it took 30 mins for each party to check in. (5) ALL THE DOORS HERE DO NOT LOCK SECURELY. IF YOU KICK THE DOOR A BIT, IT'LL OPEN SESAME so it forces you to rent the in-room safe for $3 per day. (6) Everything advertised here is a gimmick. And I mean everything.Pros: Right next to the beach. Perfect location.

Location is great and the views from the oceanfront rooms are perfect. We stayed on the 10th floor and we had wonderful unobstructed ocean views. The Lanai is very small, the bathroom is a 2 star at best, the decor is typical Hawaiian but the carpet in the rooms needs to be changed. The beds were very comfortable but we would not stay here again as we appreciate a higher standard. Due to a surprise Christmas present we booked this room with a couple hours of research and so we didn't have much time to look around. If you're on a budget and you don't really care about the room but still want something clean with a great view you will not be disappointed. The breakfast on the beach promo is NOT worth booking the room for if you're thinking of the cost saving on breakfast. If you like kiwi yogurt, heavy stale pastries, sugary cereals, and melons...then it's ok but if you want something healthy you'll end up buying breakfast anyways. We did not try the pool, we are ocean people. We did eat one night at the hotel restaurant, Tiki's bar and grill I think it's called. The food was good but not great, the service was good. Just a side note the hotel left a baby crib in our room the entire week...used it as storage space I believe...the youngest in our room was 18 years old. Also we booked online and were told there would be a welcome "gift" in our room...the only surprise was the crib. We would not recommend.The Royal Hawaiian Village hotel looked good as did the Hyatt and I believe they were similarly priced.

Check in was very slow. Rooms are much smaller than the appear in the photos, the decor is very dated. Overpriced for the amenities offered. Best thing going for this hotel is its location being right on the beach.
user_name:
NewDiver_12
Raleigh, North Carolina, United States

review_body: You can't beat the location right on Waikiki Beach, but otherwise the room was very disappointing. Small, lumpy double bed, very few amenities. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and there was WiFi, but it was a very depressing hotel room

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is in an excellent location with excellent service, reasonable rates, and a fantastic staff! The staff went out of their way to insure everything was just right. The free breakfast was good with many choices, especially with food prices so high in Honolulu.

The location is perfect if you want to get to the open spaces near Diamond Head and the beach. There are shops all nearby and within the building as well. We had an ocean select room, which means a higher floor on the side facing down Waikiki beach to downtown. We had a great view of the ocean from the balcony. The place was packed for the holiday season, but this is magnified by the lack of common space anywhere. There's a pool area that also serves as a breakfast room...there are no tables and chairs, just beach loungers. Breakfast is included and it's served on this outdoor level, so everyone is wandering around like zombies with their picnic bag provided. Breakfast isn't a healthy spread...lots of donuts, muffins, etc., though there is fresh fruit and a station with miso soup, sushi rice, and kimchee. It's a shame they serve everything with styrofoam...a bad choice for such high volume every day.There's a small gym but with the location where it is, it's much nicer to run in the park and along the beach. The circuit around Diamond Head crater is 5 miles from the front of the hotel.

i stayed here in 2011 for my first solo visit. i really enjoyed the hotel - i had planned on returning in 2012 but they started charging 10/day fee for the things u dont use - i am on vacation and do not use telephone,internet,movies etc. now i was planning another trip to ohau in march of 2013 and started checking out hotels. i noticed they now charge 18.00 per day - it great if u need those things. the room rate is high and they u put on tax and then extra 18.00 - it makes u want to consider another hotel....

Booked here for my honeymoon. Great views and location. Was disappointed that there was no wifi in the rooms as I was using an iPad and trying to get in contact with family. Was very shocked when we arrived to find out it was $27 per night for valet parking. Also the extra amenities fee we had to pay per day was $10 which included safe, DVD and games hire which I never used. Breakfast was alright but too many pastry and you had to pay extra for hit foods. Some days was over crowed. Bedroom was so tiny I had nowhere to put my luggage without tripping over it.Overall it was good location as it wasn't too bus and great view. But wouldn't booked for honeymoon.

I really enjoyed our stay. I was very concerned about the size of the rooms due to previous reviews I had read, however the room size was fine. It was not nearly as small and cramped as I feared. The view was wonderful. Two complaints, one of which the hotel cannot do anything about but light sleepers may want to consider. We were on the 23 rd floor and between the balcony and the fact that the front of the room was not buffered by a wall meant the sound of the wind was like a freight train. It was literally so loud it woke me up several times. Another complaint I think the hotel should address is the housekeeping departments efficiency. Three days in a row we left the room before 8 a.m., when we returned, after 2 p.m. Twice and after 3 p.m. Once, the room still had not been cleaned. As we wanted to catch a nap before dinner, we had to settle for asking for more towels. When we informed the front desk person of this on our 2nd to last night , although he did apologize, he didn't offer any compensation for our inconvenience. I also think the 10 dollar resort fee is ridiculous. It basically negates the free breakfast. We didn't use the safe, gym or movies and f.y.i, most hotels provide the first two at no charge. All in all I would recommend the hotel.

Nice hotel, not the newest of buildings however compared the the somewhat dated feel of Waikiki, the Aston is by far not the oldest place on the strip. Right towards the Diamond Head end of the bay, so slightly down from the main hustle and bustle, yet still within walking distance to all the restaurants, bars, shops and cafes. Quite a nice hub of shops underneath it on street level, starbucks, ABC store, souvenir shop aswell as wolfgang pucks, subway, cold stone creamery and a cookie shop to eat at. On the second floor the pool area has free wifi which is handy and you can walk from reception, through the banana lounges straight into Tiki's Bar and Grill which does great meals day and night with a laid back, hawaiian atmosphere. All in all, very happy with the hotel, would definitely recommend for your stay in Waikiki.

We booked this hotel last minute while standing in front of it, the location of the hotel is excellent (right in front of the beach) and the atmosphere felt great. The rates were lower than average. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly and the little extras the hotel offers are fantastic. They did everything to make their clients feel at home!

Loved the Aston, we stayed in an Oceanfront room - for the difference in price it was worth it... we were not going to go to Hawaii to not have views of the amazing beach :) Hotel itself is pretty dated, pool area not so flash. Although it seemed most other hotels along the strip were pretty similar. They had a nice breakfast deal, nothing too over the top but enough to get your started for the day. Staff were all really really lovely. The Tiki bar is great for a drink and plenty of variety on the menu too. A few different options down below the hotel for food also.Perfect location to head over to the beach to hit the shops! also the trolley stops right outside the hotel too. Loved the Aston, and would stay here again.

We are currently staying here in the 2 bedroom family rooms and you couldn't ask for more. It is neat, clean, perfectly located and the staff are amongst the friendliest I have ever encountered.We are returning here on the way home late in Jan 2013 and can't wait! If you want Honolulu at it's Aloha best, stay here!Tim Parker

We had a great time here! We walked to the Honolulu Zoo which is right next door. We liked that we could check in at 9am! After getting off a 9 hour flight with our toddler we needed a rest! Room for improvement: breakfast is too early!! And a bit random.

My stay at the Aston Waikiki was average at best. The guest rooms are outdated and not very spacious, but clean. I stayed in a room with two full-size beds overlooking the pool area. The view was a partial-ocean view, which was nice. Upon check-in, I was provided a code for complimentary internet access which worked very well. There is a charge for using the in-room safe, which I found very annoying. Although, I was on the 8th floor, I could still hear the band playing poolside until very late at night. I had planned to partake in the complimentary buffet breakfast, but when I arrived at the breakfast area, there was a long line already formed and it was only 6:45 a.m.! I opted out of standing in line and ate off property. The hotel's location is very good, within easy walking distance to most areas on Waikiki Beach.

This hotel was average. It was in a good location a 15minute bike ride away from the Diamond head walking track, straight across the road from the beach & not far from the shops. the hotel was a bit out dated, when we arrived we had no towels in our room and it took them a while to bring them to the room & when they brought them they only brought bath towels no hand towels or face washes. The breakfast was horrible & don't just book this hotel because "breakfast is included" it is not worth it. it starts from 6am - 9am which most people like to sleep in on there holidays and they had a band playing from 6am which was very loud and annoying from your hotel room at 6am! The breakfast was cereal, pastries, donuts & fruit which wasn't all that fresh. this hotel isn't a bit over priced for what you get but that is just my opinion. They had an awesome TIKI bar and restaurant joined to the hotel which was good food, drinks and view but they had a band playing until late which was disturbing when trying to goto sleep as well. so a band playing late at night and then early in the morning isn't the greatest mix. i wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are honey mooning or have kids that need to goto sleep early. but it's good for a hawaiian feel. The hotel also was very strict about bring towels back on time otherwise you get a fine & the wifi was crap you only got in near reception and pool area which sucked because you pay an extra $10 fee per night to use this and couldn't use it in your room. i wouldn't stay at this hotel again but other than that it was a great holiday and we didn't have any major issues.
user_name:
GenevieveFordham
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: This hotel is setback from the beach and is old, thus "leftover from 60's"...The rooms are tight, bathrooms small, inadequate dresser with only 4 small drawers!Carpets and bending has been upgraded but air conditioning and windows have not been.We stayed 8 days and ate in restaurant once and never again. The food is higher price than outrigger Hotel or Sheraton Waikiki Hotel and low quality. Food quality at other hotels was outstanding quality and services. Wifi is not in guest room and limited only to pool area which makes life difficult. Don't expect much from partial ocean view! It is facing adjoining hotel and has railing balcony and limited standing room only...no space for a chair. Would only consider staying at the Outrigger or Sheraton Waikiki on the ocean and enjoy full services, quality and great foods selection. Pluse central location and no homeless outside your hotel stairway to beach!

Went for my honeymoon and this hotel was well mantain with beautiful rooms. Its across the beach and Diamond Head is right the hotel. Breakfast was included with the rate. Hotel concierge was very helpful planning our outing everyday. We got front view of the beach, very nice to wake up everymorning and listening the waves of the ocean....romantic!

Our trip to Hawaii was a mix of business and pleasure. It was our first time to the islands and we couldn't have been more pleased with the Aston Waikiki. The proximity to the beach (across the street) was excellent. Our room was clean with a wonderful view of the beach front and skyline. The breakfast by the pool provided a good mix of fruit, pastries and cereals. Hot meals could also be purchased for a very reasonable cost. To be able to sit by the hotel pool or walk to nearby shops and restaurants made the location very convenient. We hope to visit Honolulu and the Aston properties in the near future.

The famous Waikiki beach is on the other side of the street. All buses stop right in front of the hotel, so it is very easy to drive anywhere by bus or trolleys. We took the hop-on hop-off bus and enjoyed. The breakfast by the pool listening to ukulele-music and seeing hula-dancing was a very nice way to start one's day. We liked the hotel very much.

This place has a terrific location and that's where the compliments end. Truth be told for any newbies to Waikiki, it is not a big area and at that end of the beach other hotels 1 block off the beach still have wonderful views of beach and Diamond Head. The rooms are small and tacky. And overpriced! The whole hotel is tackily decorated and furnished. Whoever oversaw its decorating should be examined. Elevator Security system difficultto understand- almost comedy watching other guests also failing to get it working.Pool area unattractive and breakfast mediocre. Luckily we stayed one night- a family vacation multinights would be simply depressing. Do yourself a favor and try one of the other establishments. $200+/night for this monstrosity is madness.

this hotel is right across the street from waikiki beach--the views from the rooms are beautiful. it's a quick walk to shops and restaurants and the hotel bar/restaurant is a lot of fun (most nights there was live music). breakfast is included down by the pool, which was very convenient. only issue was that we were originally in a room beside the elevator and it was unbearably loud but we had no trouble switching rooms. our second room was farther away from the elevator and quieter.

This is a great value for money hotel. WiFi is only available in the pool area and can not be accessed in the room. The trolley stops at the front of the hotel and can get you to most places for $2. Breakfast is served near the pool and offers a range of options. The hotel also gives you a cooler bag so that you can pack breakfast and take it across the road to the beach.
user_name:
Kerry S
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: Very worn room (old worn tiles and paint in bathroom and frightening tiny balcony)and not overly clean. Black hair on the bathroom floor and neither my husband or I have black hair. The Blow dryer stuck on the bathroom wall didn't work and didn't realize that there was another on the closet shelf until later but I was puzzled as to why the hotel wouldn't remove the one that didn't work? The hotel charged a $10.00 resort fee for internet and dvds but there was no internet in the room, just by the very small pool so I'm not sure what the resort fee was for. I booked this room for one night because we needed a room while passing through Honolulu and did book the cheapest available which clearly stated no view and I probably wouldn't have found it to be so wanting if it had been $100.00/night but we paid $220.00 and this was apparently a deal. This hotel appears to be a tour hotel and I would not recommend staying here. One good thing-location.

I wasn't sure what to expec but I was happy with my overall exp here, except for the first night when we got there and we discovered that we had two double beds, my fiance/husband (we married during our stay) is 6'7 and his feet hang off double beds. We called the front desk and they couldn't change our room that night but they did get us into a room the next night that had a king bed in it. The bathroom is small but the showerhead had great waterpressure and that is more what I look for in a room. The bed was great and the room was clean. Tikki's was good if you wanted convient but expensive, and i was NOT impressed with Wolfgang on the first floor. We didn't use the pool so I can't comment on that. We did the free breakfast every morning and I alwasy had a seat, but we always ate by 7-8 so I don't know if the last hour got crazy of not. Overall we decided that we liked Kauai much better than Oahu so although I will not be back to this Island I would recomend this hotel to anyone who wanted to visit waikiki but not be right in the middle of it :)

Stayed for 2 nights while we toured Pearl Harbor. Rooms are small, but since it was just two of us, we weren't concerned. Needs a serious update. Black marks on the walls, spots where it was peeling, bathroom was very dingy, poorly lit. Toilet kept making noise all night long. Housekeeping showed up each day around 5 pm when we were back from doing things. They then showed up again asking if we were checking out. They need to get their system straightened out. Had to go down 22 floors to get our key cards fixed twice. When we checked in we thought we were supposed to have a room overlooking the ocean, buyer beware.... They say Ocean View is different from Ocean Front - make sure your travel agent knows the difference. But they consider a partial ocean view an ocean view. Had to stand right at the rail to get a nice view of the ocean. Saw more of the city than the ocean. When we questioned the staff about this, the blame game began. They were more than happy to blame the travel agent and if we wanted the correct type of room they were more than happy to charge more money for it. Breakfast was basic. Ended up going to our room, since there was limited seating. Best thing about the place was the bar and the musical group singing and playing. It was the reedeming factor.. It was nice to listen to them talk and sing while we ate and had a drink. Would not stay here again. Have traveled quite a bit and had to say I expected more from an Aston Hotel. I know there is good and bad, but this wasn't it.

For the price, the location and view is best in Waikiki. Breakfast was ok only, geared toward Asian guests. I would have liked to see some meat and cheese or eggs. Attached bar, Tikis, has best happy hour prices and awesome service. Luis was da Bom. Bathroom had some hair on walls, but otherwise was good. Comfy bed and great service.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The rooms were not as clean as I would have liked, we had to change from our first room because it was still dirty. However, the view from our room was amazing. The elevators are a little bit confusing but move quickly. The hotel itself has a lot to offer. We took advantage of the complimentary breakfast, beach chairs & towels. Each adult gets a small cooler and fills it up with breakfast items to take to the beach. This was awesome! There was tons of selection, hot items cost extra but it was easy to fill up on everything else. Wifi was only offered at the poolside and wired Internet in the rooms which was a bit inconvenient if you need to stay connected. There were lots of places to eat on the bottom level of the hotel and of course, an ABC store. I would certainly stay again!

I stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach hotel for 2 nights, then one night somewhere else on another island, and them one more night at this hotel again. I had all reservations made and paid in advance, but the staff insisted that I pay for 4 nights instead of 3. Apparently it's not their policy to have such gaps in reservations. We were only allowed to leave after one of us became angry, fearing that we would start yelling and scaring other travelers.Moreover, I was forced to pay 50% more for accomodating 4 people in a 2-double room instead of 2 people. And I had to pay a half-page long list of 'extra charges', including a completely random last-minute $10 convenience fee (I was only asked for it one time out of my 2 stays).Don't go here. The hotel doesn't look that good and the staff is unfriendly and greedy.

I appreciate the cleanliness and the great staff, they are always helpful and courteous. Rooms are clean and modern with clean fresh linen. You have to get used to breakfast on the beach you get a bag and its like a huge buffet in the morning with every kind of friut, rolls and yogurt and cereal all kinds of goodies. Load up your bob bag and head to the beach. All services including Expedia are there in house makes it easy. Only drawback is that the few years we have stayed there the price has jumped quite a bit but still and excellent hotel.
