had a nice stay at this hotel, only thing was breakfast is from 6am-9am and they had live music playing every morning from 6am, if you are at least the lower 12 levels on the pool side of the hotel i heard breakfast being set up on the odd occasion and the band every morning. Breakfast had alot of pastries but Wolfgang puck had a nice breakfast below the hotel. Anybody taking surfboards you are not aloud them in the room at all. Bathrooms are a bit outdated, Location is perfect and quieter at this end and just a quick walk up the road to the main area. Beds are comfy and the rooms are clean which is all that matters. Fridge in the room which is good.

Good hotel. Breakfast being included was very handy. We found the breakfast to be quite good, loved the mini bagels. There was an option to purchase hot food such as omelettes and french toast etc which was great, reasonably priced too. Only thing was that you we're allowed to re-enter after you'd stocked up the first time... kinda defeats the purpose of a buffet if you ask me!The room itself was ok. Very dated carpets and bathroom. Probably in need of renovations really. It was just odd to have old carpet and old wallpaper then have a bedhead which was new and bright orange. Clashed something shocking!!

I stayed one night in room 601. The room was dated and could use a huge modernization. The room was clean but the bathroom looked like it had been fixed up from leaks from the ceiling. The view to the ocen not bad. The other views I live with out. See photos. All in all I would not stay at this property again, not at $160.00 a night

its a great hotel very good location nice view walking distance to a lot of shopping and resturants. Right across the street from the beach the breakfast that is included is not all that your better off going to McDonalds we have stayed there 9 times but have never gotten a frequent visitor discount or upgrade.

My wife Joy & I stayed at this hotel & found it to be good value for money.A basic breakfast was available from the pool area & Tiki"s bar & grill done a reasonable meal selection for lunch & dinner,(try their moco loco burger),Although right opposite Waikiki Beach it was not too noisy,our room was a side room that overlooked the hotel next door but as we only use a hotel for "crashing out & a base" that was not a problem !Quirky baggage/patron drop off and pick up area on ground floor with reception/check in desks a floor or two up.Great for shops & restuarants,(try Cheeseburger in Paradise along the road !!)But beware,not all coach & minibus drivers come into the pick up area to see if you"re there,you need to wait on the pavement as we found out to our cost.Still a nice hotel in a great location.

We enjoyed this hotel on Waikiki Beach. Friendly staff, good service; we would recommend it to others. Good restaurants within the hotel, on the pool level and also below at street level. As far as location goes, nice easy access to the beach. Keep in mind it doesn't matter which hotel you stay at in this area you will encounter the homeless on the beach area, basically living in those "gazebo" things on Kuhio beach. So back to the hotel: nice, comfortable. Elevators are great. Don't pay attention to the comments that others have written on the elevators. If you can figure these elevators out, you have no business being on vacation. Don't let the "breakfast on the beach" be a big factor in your decision on choosing this hotel. Helpful hint: the pool area has wifi, the rooms have wired Internet. But.....keep in mind a PS3 connected to LAN can function as a makeshift internet browser. :-)We stayed on the upper floor on the "Diamond Head side" on the hotel. Great view of Diamond Head and the Ocean. The balconies on the Diamond Head side are smaller than the other side, but the rooms are bigger on the Diamond Head side. Thanks to the staff! Very pleasant stay. Mahalo!

I was very impressed with this hotel. I loved the location. I did a lot of research for this trip and I am so glad I picked this hotel. The view was awesome and it was so close to everything. We could walk to the International market. The beach was right across the street. I was pleasantly surprised with the free breakfast. I was thinking like most places they would offer a stale doughnut but not the case, they had a variety of muffins, bagels, doughnuts, cereal, fresh fruit and yogurt to choose from. Juice, coffee, milk and tea were also offered. We had no need to go anywhere else for breakfast and you could eat by the pool too if you chose to. They had offered a workout center that I did not use because we walked so much everyday. They had two onsight places to eat and a store. Several other shops connected to the building. They offered free dvd rentals. We took advantage one night and rented a movie. The pool water was a little cold and I must say I was surprised it was salt water. We always had clean towels and I would stay here again if I ever went back.

It was our first time in Hawai'i and this is the first hotel we stayed at. The Aston Waikiki Beach is great and provides a young atmosphere. The beach views are amazing and of course better as you go higher up on the floors. We were on the 19th floor and it was gorgeous. The porch/Lanai is not very big but nice enough to step out and take in the view. The room was not as upscale but still above par. PS3's are included in the rooms and they offer free movies and video games at a kiosk in the lobby. The elevator system was cool, you have to swipe your room key and put in the floor your on and it tells you which elevator will take you there. The hotel is located right across the street from the beach. On one side of the beach there is a wall to withstand the crash of the strong current and waves, creating an area of ocean water that is very nice to swim and play in. The buffet breakfast is fantastic every morning. They provide a lunch bag in your room, which you can take with you to breakfast and stuff as much as you please then go enjoy the beach or pool area. Breakfast consists of a lot of pastries! However, there is also bagels, fresh fruit, miso soup, cereal, and other things to please your appetite. Everyone usually sits out by the pool where there is a musician/singer and hula dancer performing soft music as you enjoy your morning. The tiki restaurant at the hotel provides live music every night and the food is pretty good. The hotel is situated in a great spot. There are trolleys and transport vans that pass by continuously right in front to take you where you want to go. Small stores and restaurants were close by. Definitely had a great time here!

We have just gotten back from a 2 week holiday staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and it was awesome as always! We arrived in Honolulu at 7am, couldn't check in until 3pm so we left our bags with the parking valet and went next door to Lulu's fir breakfast then went out and about for the day. There was a bit of a line up to check in but that's always expected and it didn't take too long. Reception staff were very friendly. We stayed in an ocean front room with two double beds for myself, my wife and two small kids. The room was a bit small for all of us but very comfortable and had an amazing view of diamond head and waikiki beach which was great to wake up to. The room was clean and tidy, only bad thing was the toilet stopped flushing but after a call to room service a service guy rocked up in about 10 mins which was very impressive and fixed it no worries. Beds were very comfortable especially the pillows and room service was always good, we left a $5 tip each day. The free breakfast was good, not too much on offer but did the trick. All in all our stay here was excellent with no complaints, would stay here again and again.

Truth be told, we did book this hotel through Hotwire, so that might have explained the room disappointment... but it was listed as a 3.5star hotel when I chose it. And I must disagree.We typically book from the 3.5star ratings, and are always pleased. Not this time. 1) Our room was shoved in to the corner, right next to the Coconut Club -- this is where events happen in the evenings, eg. weddings, with drunk people loitering outside my door. Thankfully they try to get them out by 11pm, but then there's the clean up crew. Made for a loud evening.2) The continental breakfast is a bit chaotic, with everyone lining up to grab boat fulls of mediocre food, and then fighting to find a place to eat. 3) For a hotel where you can pay >$250/night, they actually charge you to a mandatory $10 fee to use the safe in your room, and other "ammenities" we didn't even want. 4) Our room was shabby. Our faucet not only leaked but if you lifted the tap wrong, you ended up with water everywhere. The headboard was falling off the wall. The carpets looked old. And the sheets weren't fitted or large enough, so by morning you were touching the mattress (which to me is just gross).5) I always try to put one good thing about the place I stay: location, location, location. Cross the street and you are on the beach.

We spent one night here as a pre cruise hotel. The location is GREAT - at the north end of the hotel zone, with the beach across the street, a park and the zoo immediately north, and Diamond Head just beyond that. There is a Starbucks next door (open at 4am!).The staff is wonderful - everyone is well trained and friendly. The valets are good, and the front desk people (while very busy) were very helpful and friendly.The rooms are OK - the property is older, but well maintained. The room was comfortable, and the bed was really nice. The common areas are fun and busy - the pool deck has WIFI, and it overlooks the beach from a second story. There is a very good lounge and restaurant on premises that overlooks the beach. We got "breakfast on the beach" - there is a continental breakfast and you get a cooler (in your room) to put food in to take to the beach - we watched the early morning beach goers while we had rolls and coffee, then we took a walk through the beautiful park next door. There is an exercise room, but we did not get to use it.For a couple of days stay this hotel is GREAT!

The location of this place is great. Across from the beach a bit up the road but not too far from restaurants, shops, etc. The rooms were meant to be queen rooms however the configuration was two smallish beds, this seemed to be the norm but it took up a lot of space and didn't leave a lot of sleeping space for a couple. The breakfast was pretty basic. Overall a pretty good place to stay.

Stayed here for five years and nothing has been replaced. Same bedspreads. Same used furniture. Crummy bathroom surround tubs. Well :used pillows that smell...come on!!! But worst yet is the New dvd playstation is well hidden cost of $15.00 day they charge at checkout. Everyone has to pay is just pure BS. Front desk tells you any complaints? Go to website....really?

I generally try to avoid negative review, but some aspects of the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel were just too poor not to warn other travelers about. We called upon arrival to see if the hotel would let us check in early at 12pm. The front desk clerk told us to come by in an hour at 1pm. We showed up at 1pm and were told we could not check in yet, but we could take care of all our check in with preregistration and the just pick up our key at 3pm. We were told we would be on the 21st floor and would have an ocean view with a King bed. We came back at 3pm thinking we had preregistered and just needed to pick up our key but were instead greeted with a line that stretched out of the front desk into the pool area. We tried to make the best of it and made friends with some other equally frustrated guests in line. We waited almost 90 minutes and at 4:20pm we reached a front desk person who told us we would be on the 18th floor with a partial ocean view and two double beds... this was understandably frustrating and we asked to speak to a manager. the clerk told us she would get a manager but after being gone for 10 minutes, came back out and simply told us the manager said they would not be able to move us into a king room with view until the next day. Wow, what a disappointment, we had just wasted the past 5-6 hours on check in only to have a lousy room and have to move again the next night to the room we should have gotten in the first place. The whole experience left such a bad taste in our mouth we struggled to find the positives to the hotel. But, the complimentary continental breakfast was very nice. Tiki's bar and grill is tasty and has great view, most of the staff are pleasant and helpful. I might actually consider going back here if I could be sure the checkin process would be better, but for the price, I will probably try someplace else next time and I really wouldn't recommend it when there are some many other places in Waikiki.

The pool was awful I swear it was filled with salt water and NOT heated. There was one girl who stuck her foot and turned around and got out promptly. The partial ocean view is less that partial. My room overlooks the roof. There is no free wifi in the rooms the only wifi is on the pool deck. There is hard wire wifi but that means nothing with a kindle iPod iPad ect. It is so noisy it's in barable. Over all I wouldn't reccomend it.

This was our second stay at this hotel. The location on the beach is excellent, however, we did not feel as safe as we did on our previous stay. The homeless people have set up their homes in front of this hotel, between the beach and the street. They are sleeping under the trees and on the picnic tables during the day and are up and about bothering tourists at sunset and after dark. We were disappointed that the previous pristine beach and sitting areas have now vanished.We were also very disappointed in the Breakfast on the Beach concept. Previously, the breakfast buffet consisted of breakfast sandwiches, lots of fresh fruit, and delicious pastries and breads. All that has changed. Everywhere we looked on the buffet was sugar treats, not what we would want for breakfast. There are omelet stations set up but there is a charge for that. I thought we paid for breakfast with our room! We ended up going out to eat breakfast every morning just to get some healthy food!We will not stay there again unless these complaints are properly addressed.

The Aston wasn't horrible but just a little disappointing. You can tell they've made some updates but the bathrooms could use a little TLC as well, I know it's expensive but it would go a long way with their guests; I read a lot of other reviews that said the same thing. We only stayed at the Aston for a couple of nights after being in Maui for a week, at a really nice place, so maybe my expectations were too high? A lot of my judgement could also be based on the fact that Wakiki beach just wasn't the place for us. I said I "wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend" but maybe it just wasn't the place for us. We were on our honeymoon and as I mentioned, spent a really relaxing week in Maui prior to, so the hustle of Wakiki beach just was a bit of a let down. I will say that the staff at the Aston was great and seemed eager to please. I've NEVER been the one to complain about a hotel room, let alone ask for a different room, but I'm embarrassed to say..we did! The first room was okay, just a little dirty and smelled bad and we just didn't want to spend the last two nights of our honeymoon there. The hotel was so great about upgrading us to a better room and even though I was embarrassed to ask or even complain, I felt like we were paying for way more than we were getting. I also have to say their lobby, check-in, & elevator system was a cluster? In the end, I wouldn't ever stay there again but it might be perfect for someone else?

+ very good location, just across the street is Waikiki beach.+ Tiki's bar and grill. Diner is very good.- old room, especially the badroom was were old.- badroom was not very clean. ( found some hairs)- breakfast was not a good quality and there are no tabels available to sit on only beachchairs.- balcony is so small, that there doesn't even fit a chair. ( half seasight)

We spent 2 nights at this hotel before our cruise on the Pride of America. We had an ocean front room with beautiful views of the sunset and surfers. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. The security for the elevators was great......you had to swipe your key card in order to use the elevator and then the elevator went directly to your floor. "Breakfast on the beach" was the usual continental breakfast fare served poolside. The only bad thing was that there weren't enough tables and chairs to accommodate guests. People sometimes sat reading a newspaper or using a computer after having eaten their breakfast and not vacating the table. All in all, it's a good value for the money and at a quieter end of Waikiki beach.

The Aston Waikiki Beach leaves much to be desired. The hotel has not been updated for some time, rooms are dated, bathrooms are circa 1980 a with the mold on the ceiling to go with it.For the cost there are numerous options around this hotel that would be much better.

This was a really good hotel, we loved the stay on our honeymoon. Also the Grill restaurant in the hotel had a great fillet Mignon. Breakfast on the beach is a great concept. and we loved our stay on hawaii. the rooms are real bright and happy with the red colour in hawaian style.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for a family wedding. My review of this hotel also includes my criticism of Waikiki as a whole. We flew to Waikiki Beach from the Big Island. It was total culture shock. Why people spend thousands of dollars to travel to Hawaii for a super crowded, dirty, loud, traffic jammed beach area and strip of mega hotels I will not understand. I think it would be cheaper for the same experience in South Beach or Vegas. We are in our early 30's and love the night life as well as the next couple but this just seemed out of place if you're trying to retreat to Hawaii for a relaxing, romantic vaca.The Aston is located at almost the end of Waikiki Beach. I guess the hotel has had major upgrades. That being said...I would hate to have seen it before. There have been some cosmetic updates but the bathrooms in the rooms and other areas are still outdated and dirty. Our bathroom tile was dirty and cracked in the corners, ceilings had stains. We ended up having to change our room twice. Our first room was really tiny with only double beds. If one person was standing by the fridge the other would have to climb over the first bed to get past. On top of this the A/C was horrible. We called the front desk who sent an engineer who proceeded to clean out what looked like 20 years of compacted dirt off the coils. The air flow was better but not great. We were able to move to a room with a king bed the next day but the A/C was worse. The room would not cool down below 89 degrees! We called and finally spoke to a manager who upgraded us to a junior suite. At least the air was cool in this room and we had some space. We were assured that our luggage would be moved while we are out at dinner. Of course it wasn't upon our return and we had to call again. This hotel has a decent bar and resto on the 3rd floor. The only down fall is that the live music and club music can be heard all the way up to at least the 16th floor. So if you don't plan on being out partying all night, it's going to be hard to fall asleep over a nightclub.If you have to stay here you can make it work but I would not recommend this hotel or area for a relaxing Hawaii vacation.

My husband and I booked our 20th wedding anniversary trip in February 2012 for September 2012. We thought maybe we would get an upgraded room. We did not. But, the lady at the front desk, who was very friendly, did tell us that an upgraded room would be available in a couple of days. We did get moved to a room with a better view the next day. This hotel is okay. The staff were friendly and the room was clean. The bathrooms need to be updated though and the lanais are very small. We did hear the elevators all night and our room was on the 7th floor right above the pool and Tiki Bar. It was extremely noisy at night and early in the morning when the continental breakfast was being served around the pool. All of the tour buses pick up out front of the hotel, which was very convenient. There are also all types of affordable restaurants, the zoo, and aquarium near the hotel and the beach is literally right across the street. We would probably stay there again but would want to be on a much higher floor to get away from the pool and the bar. This hotel is very affordable and we didn't spend much time in our room anyway.

30 years in the making... Hawaii was meant to be our honeymoon destination but ended up our 30th Wedding Anniversay destination instead,,,, and we were not disappointed. Hotel, ocean front rooms, breakfast and location were all as described on trip advisor. Staff very friendly, rooms well turned out and clean. No mini bar in rooms but with ABC shops on every corner and a fridge in the room there was no need for one. Absolute value for money. Location could not be better, full access to all amenities, shopping and resaurants with the beach right outside your door, what more could you want. In house tour desk very helpful,,,( thanks Ben, you helped make our trip one in a million). Lift system unique but easy to use and added to hotel security. Pool was a refreshing way to keep cool and the morning pool side entertainment was a nice touch. Free internet was restricted to lobby/pool area which was a little inconvenient. Pastries and doughnuts for breakfast became repetative/boring after a few days.. highly recommend MAC 24/7 at the Hilton if you are looking for a bacon and egg breakfast alternative. Our Anniversay was everything we wished for and more, many thanks to my family and Aston Waikki Beach Hotel. We will definately be back,

The hotel is as described by others. Not super nice but reasonable for the price. Breakfast was fine; Morning music fun; Walking distance to whatever you need; and all the staff were nice and helpful etc. However, check this out. My daughter forgot her iPod and didnt realize until we were home in DC (~14 hours later). She said she "left it on the bed." We called the hotel and the staff had turned in the iPod. 4 days later it was back in my daughters hands. Fantastic. Thanks Marcy, Marissa and Marlinda!
user_name:
keith r
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed 2 nights, loved the room, location and breakfast! We had an ocean front room, the decor was tiki, tropical motif. The view, priceless! Parking expensive @ $27 per night! Convenient to everything in Waikiki!

How can they call this hotel a resort and want to charge $10 daily resort fee. I am a frequent resort traveler and this is NO RESORT. My group was able to get the fee waived because we booked prior to March 2012 when they implemented the fee, but we had to fight to do so. Found out they use to charge the fee for internet connection but decided to bundle it. Hotel was ok but needs some remodeling. I was very disappointed that there is no WiFi connection in any of the rooms. You can access internet via a cable modem but that is of no use to me when I am travelling with my iPad and not my laptop. Thank God I could add a hot spot connection to my cell phone while travelling. It was inconvenient to have to go to the lobby area to get the Aston WiFi connection. Sprint charged me $20 for a hot spot for a month usage. Breakfast on the Beach...free every morning....a serious misrepresentation and a total joke! I knew the beach was across the street...no problem but didn't know I had to fight the Japanese for a continental breakfast to put in a cooler bag, get a chair and towel from the hotel and go to the beach for breakfast. I thought it was going to be breakfast served on the beach each day. Waffles and omelets are available but for a fee. If you were later coming to breakfast rather than early, expect to find nothing left and even though it is still in the allotted breakfast time, I was told they would not be replenishing breakfast. Also expect to deal with the numerous homeless when you venture to the beach. I got breakfast only 2 days out of the 5 and was glad to give it to the homeless people hanging around.

The Aston is perfectly satisfactory for what it offers.Its a multi-storied hotel, right on the beach front, its one of the last hotels on the Waikiki beach. The rooms are of reasonable size, en suite, with clean bath tub & shower facility. Although most rooms have tiny balconies, they offer a narrow view of the beach from between buildings. But its simple enough to get out of the hotel, cross the road, and walk on to the beach.The public areas of the hotel tend to be crowded throughout the day. Thankfully they are located on the lowest 3 floors.The reception, swimming pool and outdoor eating area is on the 3rd floor, and usually has a fare share of children and accompanying adults sitting around the pool throughout the day.The Plus points:The best part of the stay was the breakfast, the price of which is included in the room rate. You are provided with a square thermal zip bag in which you can pack your breakfast from the buffet, and take it down to the beach or eat it in your room or anywhere else you like. It is the best way to beat the crowds at the buffet.The tour buses all stop at the hotel's side entrance for pick-up and drop offs. The tour desk offers excellent service and are most helpful even if you are just asking for information without making a booking through them.The minus points:The hotel's internet use service is very expensive.The lifts (they call them elevators in the US of A) need to be accessed only with the room key to be placed against the sensor, and thereafter, the floor number is required to be punched in. The alphabetical identity of the specific lift to be used by you is displayed on the screen, and you take that lift to the floor you want. Once inside the lift, the doors will open only on that floor, and should you wish to get out on another floor, you can only do so after you leave the lift and re-do the whole process of calling for a fresh lift. I found the whole thing a little confusing initially, but got used to it soon enough.The hotel's two restaurants don't look very inviting, and its very easy, and probably much cheaper, to step out of the hotel and go to the dozens of eating places tat abound the area.I recommend the hotel for what it offers, at the price it does .

We had an ocean view room which was small and not comfortable at all. True, you are hardly in the room, but in the evening it would have been nice to have a soft armchair to sit in rather than on the bed or on the wicker chairs they squeezed in with a small round table. The balcony was very small and only held one chair. Watching the surfers in the morning from the balcony was fun. The ocean view we had was on the side of the building which actually faced another hotel. You could see the ocean from that angle. The hotel gives you a small cooler which you can fill to bring across the street to the beach. The hotel boasts "breakfast on the beach" which is a nice idea, however, the amount of homeless people living along the beach and the smell of urine near where you would sit and eat was quite disgusting. So - needless to say, we didn't eat on the beach. There were not many restaurants near the Aston but walking down about 8 blocks they were plentiful. On the plus side...the rate was reasonable and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom could have used an updating but it was clean. Would we stay there again? Probably not.

If you are expecting a 5 star hotel with all the trimmings you will be disappointed.If you are expecting a nice, reasonable priced hotel right across the road from the beach you will be more then happy, as my husband and i were. We arrived at the hotel about 6 hours before check in,(3 pm check in time) but the staff where more then accommodating allowing us to store our bags while we waited, we were also able to register our check in and where told to try back at 1:30 pm to see how it was going. When we went back right on 1:30 pm our room was ready for us and our bags where to be brought up to the room which they where with in 10 mins. The room was nice, not too small with excellent views. The bathroom was a good 2 people and the bed was very comfortable.All staff we dealt with where friendly and helpful. As we were on our honeymoon the front desk gave us a cute hotel frame as a congratulation.. :) We only managed to make it down to the breakfast on one of the 10 day we were there, ( most of the time we were either out on tours or catching up on sleep). But that one day we did make it down to was small but provided us with everything we would want, and being able to take it back to our room was a great bonus. The Tiki Bar and Grill down stair on the pool level was a great place to eat and have a few drinks. Highly recommend a visit there while you stay at this hotel. The ideas of the lifts provided great security and was very easy to use. It may seem strange at first but with in one go you will be used to it. The tour desks located on the lobby level of this hotel where more then helpful and friendly. Even when you decide at the last minute to book an activity, and it requires them to book the day of the activity Eziko (we think) from the pleasant holidays desk went out of her way to help us with this. I would Highly recommend staying at this hotel, and can't wait to be back in Hawaii (one day) so we can too :) :)

We had planned this trip for well over 6 months and kept up on the reviews on this and other websites. We were very impressed with the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We arrived an hour before check in and they were able to get our room ready reasonably quickly. To our surprise, they upgraded us from a double bed ocean view room to an Aloha Suite on the 11th floor with a partial ocean view. It was nice to sit on the balcony at night, listen to the band and sip drinks while the kids watched movies that they rented from the lobby which was part of the $10 a day resort fee and well worth it. The breakfast was a bonus. Lots to choose from and a huge money saver. The staff was all friendly from the check in staff to the valet staff. We even met a nice lady at the Expedia counter who helped us rent a car for the day to drive to the North Shore. To our surprise, she was from Portland too!!My only real complaint was the homeless population at that end of Waikiki Beach. Once you get closer to the Surfrider and the Royal Hawaiian, there are far less homeless. However, they really congregate at the end of the strip where the Aston is located. Because of that, even though there was plenty of beach across from the hotel, we choose to walk down to the other end most days to get away from them.The elevators were simple to figure out and reassuring to have that kind of security. We also frequently saw security walking around the property, especially during the weekend. Tikis and Lulus are close and convenient for lunch however, Tiki's is a little overpriced. We absolutely loved Wolfgang Pucks. Great food. Great prices. Very, very convenient. This hotel really seems to do all they can to accomodate their guests. I have no complaints about the hotel itself, however, if we went to Waikiki again, we'd probably stay a little further away from the homeless.

Good location and very clean surprised to read other review as I found staff very helpful. We were in a large room at the back but like others changed to a sea view. It is worth the trouble to sit on balcony and it is not too noisy. The free breakfast really does safe you a lot and it was very strange but nice to see people dancing to the live music by the pool at breakfast. There is no resort fee either which is another plus. You also get free beach towels and chairs which you can take anywhere useful if you don't need to pack any. Would stay here again thats all I can say.

During our stay at the Aston Waikiki on the Beach, Honolulu in October we were disgusted by the soiled bed linen and lack of follow up by the hotel. The inner linen had a large yellow stain and also another stain that appeared to be lipstick along the edge - it was a revolting find and I am sickened as to what the yellow stain could be..... Hotel Manager's response: NIL. Each day we requested for the manager to contact us and here we are nearly 2 weeks later and no response we have even emailed the Aston chain and yet still no contact.

When you judge this hotel on the merit of a ~3 star hotel (rather than the Halekulani or the Kahala Hilton) it was great, clean, well decorated, and had a nice layout. Staff was friendly and accommodating. We liked the location a bit away from the most congested part of Waikiki Beach. The included breakfast saved us lots of money and was more than adequate despite the online sniping about it on TripAdvisor. Maybe because we were there in mid Sept. at a somewhat slow time, but we never saw the mad rush to get breakfast, that has been described. We originally got a room with 2 dbl beds and a tiny (standing room only) balcony on the 14th floor that faced another building and the back of Diamond Head, in addition to the partial ocean view (very partial). Since it wasn't a great room, I asked for an upgrade when we arrived and they said they didn't have anything. The next morning, I asked again and was offered a room across the hall with a larger balcony and ocean view, overlooking the pool. The only catch, they told us upfront, was it was right next to the elevator and they warned us about the constant noise from the elevators moving up and down (at least they don't 'ding' when the doors open). We took the room and found we quickly acclimated to the elevator noise (like wind blowing or ocean waves). It didn't bother us but I expect that it would bother many people, especially those who paid the full price for ocean view and wound up there. I also suspect that room goes empty at times because they don't want unhappy people. I appreciate that they told us about the noise upfront before we went to the trouble of switching rooms so we could make a fully informed decision. When we realized we left our cell phone charger behind in the first room (after >24 hrs) we contacted housekeeping who actually had it and quickly brought it to us! We also found that they give you free access to their public computers to check in for flights and print boarding passes which was another nice touch (I guess that's one of the percs your $10 daily amenity fee gives you besides the safe, newspaper,..). Bottom line, we would definitely stay there again!

We stayed there first week of October. The hotel location was great, just next to beach and lots of free parking space near by. Room was small but we fit there with our two children. We spend a little extra money for the ocean view, but didn´t spend lot time in the balcony, so that was perhaps money wasted. There was a little noise from the restaurant to our room in floor 15, but it didn´t bother us. Can´t recommend the including breakfast, but the hotels restaurant Tiki´s was excellent. Hotel staff was kind and helpful. Our son get ill during our vacation and they helped us to find a doctor. Very nice place overall.

My husband and I stayed at the Aston on the 2nd and 3rd of October. We checked in around 10 pm and check in was easy and breezy. The only small problem was that my husband requested 1 king and we got 2 doubles instead. They were able to get us the king on the 2nd night. Rooms were clean and typical hotel sized rooms. The headboard was a pretty bright red floral pattern. Our balcony did have a partial ocean view which was nice. The hotel had a wonderful continental breakfast which we took advantage of. They even offered little cooler type bags in your room so one can fill it and take it over to the beach for breakfast on the beach. On top of the very nice breakfast they also made waffles or french toast (depending on the day) for sale at a very reasonable $3-$4. The hotel sits right across the street from beach so no long walk. I'm not a fan of the Waikiki area because of the homeless people that hang around at night and just the crowds but its a great starting point to get to other parts of the islands. We always use Waikiki as our base and if your staying there to do the same then the Aston Waikiki is a perfect place to call home!

The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is a good hotel at a great location … good enough for us to hopefully return next year.This hotel is all about location and view. We stayed in one of the hotel's suites called the Kalakaua Suite on the 20th Floor. It has a separate bedroom (king size bed) with ensuite and in the main area of the suite another full bathroom plus full kitchen, laundry (washer and dryer), sofa-bed lounge and dining room. The room has 3 balconies all facing the ocean. We travelled with our 2 kids (aged 3 and 16 months) and utilised the separate bedroom for them so we could still eat, drink and stay up when they went to bed. It was BRILLIANT!The price we paid for a 14-night stay ended up being cheaper than paying for 2 interconnecting ocean front rooms, so the value was great. The view is AMAZING - we never got sick of it and after our 3rd trip to Waikiki we think it's probably one of the best there is. The part of Waikiki Beach across the road from the hotel is patrolled with life guards and is protected by a rock wall so it’s nice and calm for young kids.Our check in was great, we arrived very early in the morning (I think around 8am) and the hotel was able to get us into our room by 12noon and with 2 young kids we were very grateful after a long flight from Australia.We had read previously their lift system was hard to use - we found it very easy to use. You just swipe your room key and a letter comes up (ABDE or F) and you go to that lift and it takes you to your floor – easy!The suite itself had plenty of storage for your bags, shopping, food, kids beach gear, toys etc - there are cupboards everywhere so for an extended stay you certainly don't live in a mess like you would in a smaller hotel room and the laundry facilities allowed us to keep on top of our washing so there were never a large collection of dirty clothes piling up.The staff everywhere were very eager to help and ready to please. The breakfast on the beach was great but the cooler bag included in our room price wasn’t included any more so we just had to juggle our breakfast to a poolside table or back in our room. It’s included in the room so the ability to have some fresh fruit, cereal pastries, juice and a coffee each morning was nice. On a few mornings we even ordered an omelette which was only $5. Don’t expect reserved tables or full hot and cold breakfast – but expect a pretty well organized buffet to get you through the morning.The hotel also has a Subway, Cold Rock Ice Cream Shop, Wolfgang Puck and a convenience store all on street level, which is very helpful when heading back to the hotel at night for a late night snack.What the hotel offered in great staff, phenomenal view and perfect location it lacked in what I thought would be standard expectations for a hotel. This room was situated directly under a function room with balcony and almost every night we heard the dragging of chairs on the cement flooring until late. It didn’t keep the kids awake but was certainly very annoying while watching a movie. I called reception to talk about this and was told there was nothing she could do as “most nights there are functions there until 10pm”. The hotel doesn’t offer room service, which is a luxury most people look forward to in hotels. There is a great restaurant called Tiki’s Bar and Grill (which I’d highly recommend) in the hotel, however they don’t deliver meals to your room.A few other disappointing things:-On more than 1 occasion our bins (there were 4 in the suite) were not emptied, there were hardly any kitchen supplies to cook with – cutlery, plates etc were fine however there weren't many items to sufficiently cook a meal with, the air conditioning was very temperamental on about 3 or 4 occasions we needed to call reception to send someone to fix it, valet parking is very expensive and the sofa bed is extremely uncomfortable and when folded back into a lounge formation it was missed when housekeeping came around to make the bed. All in all the hotel is great but the location and view is better and that’s what’s taking us back for the 4th time next year.

The hotel is perfect if you wanna check the waikiki surf spots directly on your balcony and be surfing just simply crossing the street. Rooms seem a bit old but they are clean and quite comfortable. The price is reasoable for what you get, hotels in waikiki can be very expensive. The worst I think is not having internet in the room and also the one that is in the lobby is a little slow. If you have a car they have a pay parking lot. They don't have surfboards storage so it's better choose a rental shop with storage close to the hotel (Koa surf shop is where I rented, it's very close to the hotel and they have great selection and prices too).

Stayed from 22nd/29th Sept. Room of a good size with a good view 11th floor no.1113 albeit a little noisey but nothing that kept us awake. We liked the red floral decor made it different from usual hotel rooms. Hotel very busy but everything fell into line nicely. From breakfast through to nighttime. Breakfast a little different eat from a bag or take it to beach with cool bag chairs ect provided (no plates, but not an issue ) If everything was always the same it wouldnt be much fun. Great location beach just over the road which is easily crossed, shops bars park and the zoo all within a couple of minutes walk. Starbucks and subway one minute away. The hotel has it own bar/restaurant with sea views and entertainment each night. All staff very efficient from reception, housekeeping travel advisors ect. Wewould deffinately stay here again. Had a look in other hotels, they may have been abit more upmarket but either out the way or too formal.

we stayed at the aston as part of our honeymoon trip. the hotel is perfect, in a great location for all the shops, restaurants and of course beach. The rooms were extremley clean and comfortable. THe hotel provide you with free towels and chairs to take to the beach, as well as a free breakfast each morning.Or only minor fault was the checked us into a twin room, but swiftly changed it as we were celebrating our honeymoon.We truly enjoyed our stay here. Tikis is a must for dinner also

Even though the rooms were really small they were ok for our family of 4 (travelling with our kids aged 20 &17) as we weren't there a lot of the time. We were given an interconnecting room which was great.This end of Waikiki was perfect for us - close to the local surf away from the inept tourists suited our surfer boy - he could check the waves from our balcony before heading across the road for a surf away from the crowds.Ron from the Expedia desk was extremely helpful, orgainsing a day trip to Hanauma Bay and car rental for us that was really good value.Choice of eateries around the hotel perfect, everything we needed within walking distance.I had some issues with the bill at check out, and additional charges posted to me credit card on return, but these were dealt with quickly and efficiently by staff to fix them.Elevator system was good and secure - its needed in this area as the homeless and stoned people wandering around at night were a bit of a worry.Overall quite good for this visit, but next time I think I would pay more for a bit more luxury.

Wonderful location being just across the road to the beautiful Waikiki beach, just down the road from Honolulu central business district, beside a gorgeous park and one of the best bar and grills on site. What more could you want from a hotel?The beds wonderfully comfortableThe house service kept them wonderfully clean and tidyBreakfast by the beach - just pack your provided carry bag and walk the 50 meters.Tiki Grill and Bar with great wait staff and plenty of live music..... and as part of the Vintage World Rugby carnival where probably 500 rugby players and partners stayed everyone did themselves proud with maintaining great service and a wonderful smile with such a boisterous group.

Was a bit worried driving up but shouldn't have been. Our initial room wasn't that great but they changed it after asking, though did hear some people saying they weren't that lucky in changing or had to pay extra for an ocean view. Fantastic position directly across from beach, best bed ever slept in, excellent powerfull shower, really clean and tidy. Breakfast was repetitive but so is everywhere else and loads of take-aways nearby should you choose, great idea of the cool bag and help yourself , and then they give you towels and chairs to take to the beach what more could you ask for.We paid the extra $10 per day and for this had free wifi, unlimited dvd rental, gym use, newspaper and free local calls. If I had a gripe it would have been the queue to check in, and on the last day we requested a later checkout, they asked us to keep coming back to see if they could accomodate and then it was an extra couple of hours before they could get a room ready, cost to do this was $70 up to 6pm, which suited us. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

My husband and I stayed here while traveling for a research conference. It was a great price and the perfect location, right across the street from the beach. My favorite things included: the outdoor bar with live music, the fresh breakfast with lots of variety, the view, the friendly staff, and the price. My only complaint would be the small size of the room, but really do you go to Hawaii to spend time in your room?! Overall it was a great trip thanks to our choice of hotel.

Me and my new Wife stayed at the aston hotel during our honeymoon 16/09 - 26/09 and could not fault the hotel one bit.We stayed in one of the beach front rooms which offered fantastic views of the pacific and great sunsets every evening.The free breakfast was an absolute bonus and very tasty and varied.Everything we asked of the hotel was dealt with fast and efficiently with all members of staff with smiles on their faces.Cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Stayed four nights, nice room though we got two full beds instead of a queen. Don't arrive on weekend, saw looooong lines at check-in. Same breakfast every morning, but lots of other options near location if you want more than a continental meal. Right across from a nice beach for all types - sunbathers, kids, surfers. All in all, no real problems, but nothing outstanding.

We found the Aston Waikiki beach a relaxing and comfortable place to stay when we vistited Honolulu.The staff were amazing and nothing was ever any trouble at all.The rooms were clean and comfortable and had plenty of space. The view from the Ocean Front room was perfect.We were originally on the 8th floor above Tkiki's Bar and after two nights of interrupted sleep from noise, we requested to be moved. This request was granted and staff were lovely and helpful when we moved. Our next room was fantastic with no noise.Breakfast was a nice inclusion. I have read some negative comments on here about seating for breakfast and we never found it a problem.The only negative I can think of is that the bathrooms are dated and need an upgrade but were clean and practical.I would recommend this motel to anyone thinking of staying in Honolulu and our kids loved it too.

This was our second stay at the hotel in two years and once again we were not disappointed. This time we booked an ocean front room and the view was well worth the extra money. The room we were given was quite large and the three of us had plenty of room. Check in was a little disappointing in that they did not honour our reservation request of a room on a higher floor but after having a chat with staff they quickly changed the room to the floor we had originally requested. Also had to wait three hours for the room but that time was easily filled in by shopping and visiting the beach. When the room was ready our bags were there waiting for us. The only issue we had when we first got to our room was that the previous occupant had spilled something on the bed which had sprayed onto the wall but upon notifying housekeeping they came to our room literally within two minutes to change the bed and clean up for us. You can't really get better than that! The breakfast in the morning was great with plenty of selections and they provided us with a cooler bag - not sure about the previous comments about a cardboard tray as did not see any evidence of this with other guests. Also not sure why so many people comment about the lifts as they are very easy to use and it is quite a smart system would like to see this system in other lifts as it does save waiting. The valet team were brilliant and always had our car ready and waiting when needed. Wolfgang Puck's again was very handy for dinner not to mention Cold Stone Creamery which we visited probably one time too many! Otherwise very happy with this hotel, the service, the staff and particularly the location which is right across from the beach and a short walk to the shops. We will of course stay here again and again. Thank you Aston Waikiki Hotel for another brilliant stay.

We just had 7 nights at this hotel and loved it. The location is great as it is at the quieter end of the beach however only a 5 minute walk if that to where all the action is. The breakfast in the morning is great - admittedly though the first morning was a little daunting as you go down with your little esky and fill it up with breakfast food to take to the beach or sit by the pool or back to the room but you then get used to this of a morning and it is a good start to the day. The rooms are exceptionally clean and the beds are so comfortable and the staff are so obliging. We could not fault this hotel.

The hotel was average, it held a 4 star rating (presumably self rated) and was a real let down in comparisons to other hotels we had stayed while in the USA. The check in was average and the breakfast was something seen to believed. You were literally given a moulded cardboard tray to collect your breakfast goodies on and had to sit on a pool chair or what available tables there were. If there was no seats then you must eat standing up. Our bar tender at Tiki's Bar was a scream, he clearly had no idea what day it was let alone much about cold beer and warm service. Great convenience shop downstairs, sold a variety of bevvies to tickle your fancy at a nice price. The rooms were small, and needed a good refurb. I guess if you were not spending too much time in your room then who cares, I think were spoilt in other hotels so a bit of mental re-adjustment was required. Hawaii is a great place, but next time, we will stay somewhere else.

Would I stay here again, in a word, no! The rooms are old, checkin was average and the free breakfast was ordinary. We went to tiki's bar, our bar tender "Nate" didnt really have a clue and the beer was warm. It seemed to be his home away from home and not a place of work. There was nothing 4 star about it. We were duped. Give me a resort in Fiji and there fantastic hospitality any day. Hawaii has a lot to offer though, just use another hotel.

Have just stayed there for one night, but moved to the Miramar for rest of the week, just as nice hotel, perhaps even a bit nicer. The Aston is just across the road from the beach, but a 10 min walk from the shops and hub of Waikiki, so we liked the Miramar better, even though it is not quite as close to beach.Unusual brekky at the Aston, they give you a small cooler bag, which you load up with pastries, cakes, muffins, fruit, yoghurt, take your juice and coffee, then walk over the road to the beach and eat it there. I guess they do this as the outside area to eat your brekky is very limited. We enjoyed it though, a novelty for one night.

MY husband and I came to Hawaii to get married in Feb, I know this review is a little late but I cant stop thiking about it. We booked a king room with FULL ocean view, upon our arrival after 6+ hour flight. We come into a filthy room, with TWO double beds and a view of a street with a tiny bit of ocean if you leaned over the railing. We went back down to front desk and were spoken to like a bunch of kids, Told we didnt book a king room and there were none left for the rest of our stay.. I did NOT come to hawaii to sleep in separate beds! After all we were getting married. We went back to our filthy room asked for housekeeping to come clean it. Showed them what to clean, left and came back to a room smelling like air freshener but not clean!Next day we went down to see if we could get a king room, and were told to keep checking back every hour till 3pm. What a waste of a day in hawaii! Finally got into a king room, but faced a backally, asked to switch rooms again since that isnt what i paid for. were rudely spoken too and finally asked for a manager which we did get into a decent room, that WAS NOT cleaned during the week we stayed. Our bedding had cocolate (or i hope) on it when we arrived into the new room. Will never stay here agian, rude staff, after all your paying good money if I could I would have got a refund and walked down the street.

This hotel was not a five star hotel but it had everything required to have a nice holiday, good housekeeping done daily,plenty of food for breakfast each morning by the pool, central to most things & part ocena view from room was a bonus. The Tiki bar was also a favourite at happy hour & food served was not expensive & very edible

Just a quick review- I too was a little worried when I read the other reviews for this hotel but lucked out since I had a wonderful stay at the Aston Waikiki.The positives- 1st - my room was clean, smelled fresh, bathroom adequately spacious for two. View was to die for- partial ocean view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. We were on the 22nd floor ( Rm. 2226) - quiet and peaceful. Had a chance to see the Hawaii Five O premier from out hotel balcony.Free Breakfast from 6:30am - 9:00am- assortment of pastries, fresh cut fruits, bagels, juices, flavored/regular coffee, hot chocolate, cold cereal and instant oatmeal. Also- Miso soup, sushi, pickled spiced cabbage. (Note: at the beginning of our stay they gave us trays, later on we received the breakfast on the beach bags). Hope they keep giving the bags, nice feature.Expedia travel consultants on site- Really appreciated their help with planning out excursions around Oahu- all pick ups right in front of hotel except the Midnight Catamaran cruise by the Sheraton.Elevators- unique and secure- swipe your room key and key in your floor number, then the monitor will flash the elevator to board. Great since one only has access to floor where they are staying. One can return to lobby from their floor by pressing " * " on panel. Easy once you get the hang of it.Negatives- Staff seemed very limited around hotel, except for maids. I'm not sure if I ever knew who was the hotel manager. Front desk staff did not seem very knowledgeable about status of Breakfast bags (available/not available?)Check out was very long and tedious- wasn't enough staff to handle patrons checking in or out. No one informed patrons waiting how the wait time could be shortened by using express check out.Staff didn't greet you at times in hotel. Not alot of staff/patron communication going on. Good thing I'm very independent. There seem to be more staff at the valet parking area than anywhere else.Celebrated our 25 wedding anniversary- Hotel gave us a picture frame.

After reading many reviews for this hotel, I was a little nervous and not sure what to expect. I have to say all of my fears were put to rest within hours of checking in. Our room was clean, king size bed and enough storage for a 9 day stay. The bathrooms are in need of updating, but they were clean and functional. Great water pressure, good lighting and we always had hot water and clean towels. I recommend staying in rooms 01-03 on any floor higher then 8, as they have what I thought was the best view of Diamond Head. (Don't take rooms 06 or 07, too close to the elevator and ice machines, you will hear them all night.) The breakfast was set up and ready to go by 6:30 each morning, we did spend the extra $3 for waffles, which were great. I didn't like that they no longer give you the lunch box to take to the beach. The small paper trays made it hard to travel with food. They do offer towels and chairs for the beach (at no charge), I suggest you bring a reusable tote to carry the towels. And water shoes are a must! The pool was a bit small, but never seemed to be over crowded. The Tiki bar right next to the pool area was great. 2pm-5pm happy hour and you can bring your beverage to the pool. Thought their (Tikis) lite fare menu was better and priced more resonable. Music every night!Loved that they had multiple information areas for excrusions and Valet parking. Most of our pickups for excrusions were right out front of the hotel or at the next corner. This Hotel is located at the end of the main street, but across from an area of Waikiki beach perfect for families with small children. It was a 10 minute walk to Lewers Ave, the area we found great resturants and shops. We used the hotel computer center to check in for our departure. That was free, but any other computer service had a charge. What I didn't like, they charged me $3 a day to use the inroom safe, they didn't have the totes for breakfast and the couple we were traveling with had issues with their room. The staff made it right and were very accomadating but it did take 4 different rooms and 2 days. I would stay here again, without question.

This hotel is located at the end of the main Waikiki beachfront area. A 10 min walk from everything Honolulu has the offer. Staff are helpful and friendly. The facilities are tired and the place needs an upgrade but the room raes are cheap the match. One strange part is the breakfast arrangement. There is not breakfast dining room to speak of. The breakfasts are set up outside near the pool on the podium level and its a case of first in best seat. There are only 4 or 5 normal tables to sit onthe rest have to contend with low level pool seats that are useless and not at all comfortable. When it rains everyone has to duck under what little shelter there is.

Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean, didn't need to ask for towel change. Would advise to ask for a high floor room for better views. Very good location, the quieter end of Waikiki. Trolley stop outside hotel for tours and general travelling around Honolulu. Casual breakfasts consisting of fruit, cereals, croissants, muffins and drinks, to eat around the pool while being entertained by the Hawaiin musician and dancer. Tiki's bar and restaurant adjoining hotel for food and drinks with evening entertainment.

The Aston Waikiki Beach hotel was where we had part no 1 of our honeymoon. It was in a great location, right on the beach, which was amazing. Our room looked out onto Diamond head and the beach which was amazing for watching sunrises and sunsets. The room was average and the bathroom badly needs upgrading. The package we opted for was bed and breakfast. The breakfast on offer was really great, with a large variety of food available to eat at the hotel or to take to the beach in a lunch bag the hotel provided. There was also a traditional Hawaiian dance every morning which was also great. Staff were helpful and respectful. The only down point we had was they were not very congratulatory on our honeymoon, no extras. Very central to all great excursions which are available to book at the Expedia desk within the hotel. I can't remember the girls name on the Expedia desk but she was by far the best employee on for the hotel, so friendly.

Just got back from our first trip to Hawaii and stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel for 6 nights. Stayed in room 819 with a fabulous view of the ocean, pool, and could hear the bands at the Tiki Bar every night with the slider door open. You really didn't have to leave your balcony for two for a beautiful view of the sunset and a nice evening listening to Hawaiian style music. Ate the free breakfast for several days which was great as you could take some back to your room for later if you wanted. This hotel is in a great location at the end of the strip with bus and trolley stops right out front, and Waikiki beach (with the breaker wall), a pier to walk out on, the zoo, and the park area right across the street. Did a few tours booked right at the hotel with the highlite being snorkeling at Hanauma Bay which was like snorkeling in an aquarium. When we had to check out by noon and didn't leave until 3:30 pm, the hotel valeted our bags for free until our shuttle arrived. I read the reviews before booking this and was completely satisfied with the hotel and service. If you want a luxurious hotel with spas and pampering this is not the hotel for you.... if you want a family-friendly, relaxed atmosphere with the beach, shopping & good food nearby -- this is a nice hotel and great value.

Just got back from our second stay at the Aston Waikiki Hotel - had a fabulous holiday again - love Hawaii as a holiday destination.Our best experience about the hotel was the view from Room 1129 - totally awesome - very small verandah (lanai) with a panorama from Diamond Head to the Hilton. Ate breakfast on the verandah most mornings watching the world go by and sometimes in the late afternoon took in some sun. After a rough start with a very noisy family in the adjoining room at the rear of our room for 2 nights we finally got some peace and quiet and enjoyed the remainder of our 9 nights there. Tikis is a great little place on pool level - live music and good food and service.I would definitely stay here again as it is good value for money, location is great and the staff are very nice - the hotel is just across the road from the beach. The hotel itself is getting tired and is due a refurbishment.There is nowhere to put toiletry bags in Room 1129 - no bench in the bathroom - you have a choice on the floor or on the toilet lid. Plenty of towels and toiletries but they don't give you much toilet paper - a spare roll would be a good idea. Tip: you need to raise the bath plug to shower or you will end up more than shin deep in water.Lighting in our room was poor in the living/bedroom area - it's very dark - 2 bed lamps and 1 decorative lamp - I left things behind because I didn't see them however a call to housekeeping from the airport saved the day and they mailed the items back to me. Our door presented problems accessing the room but after a couple of days we worked out you had to pull the door towards you then insert the key or it wouldn't unlock.The breakfast can be a bit hit and miss if it rains. Things become chaotic as there is no cover and not enough seats and some of the food gets wet - but it is good value in that you get coffee, tea, pastries, cereal, fruit, yoghurt and some Asian breakfast items. You can pay extra for waffles and other hot food. Tip: Take a small plastic carry bag for your pastries etc - they give you a cardboard tray to put cups in and not easy to manage everything.Something I noticed this trip and this has absolutely nothing to do with the hotel itself or our holiday experience in any way - it's purely my observation of the general area - there were quite a few homeless people living at the Diamond Head (south east) end of Kalakaua (main street along the beach) and in the park over the road at the beach. Some local Hawaiians told us the US government is sending homeless people from the mainland to get them out of the cold. The plight of these people is very sad - many of these people have chairs, umbrellas, bedding and their belongings all set up and have a daily routine where they while away their days in the sunshine as the tourists walk on by - they don't bother anybody ..... it's just my observation.....

I just got home tonight from Hawaii. After we did the 7 night island cruise we had 4 nights at this hotel. It was recommended by friends. I thought it was wonderful. Granted it was quite basic but that was its charm. I liked that it was casual and relaxed and being at the Diamond Head end of the strip meant it was much quieter and out of the circus that was happening a few blocks away. Being a runner I enjoyed walking out of the hotel and running up towards Diamond Head in the lovely tree lined suburban streets away from the main tourist hussle and bussle. The hotel was directly across the from the beach so you could walk across in just your swimmers and towel without feeling underdressed and the freebie breakfast was an added bonus - again basic but more than adequate.
user_location: Cronulla Beach, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Gina T
Cronulla Beach, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: First Impresions of the big open lobby are great, However when going into the room, they are basic very basic, but hey you are in hawaii its not like you are be going to spend the whole time in your room. The staff were vere plesant, very prompt and very attentive.Right outside are a large variety of restraunts and bars, and right outside is the beach.Pool are is large and had plenty of sun.Loved the relaxed atmosphere sitting around in the comfortable lobby.

The location was decent although other hotels on the beach were better. Tiki's was great and decent priced. However rooms were loud (1211- elevator 3 nights) 1223 street noise (oh well). Stood in ankle deep water both rooms when showering. Staff could not be bothered anytime. Always had heads down FRONT DESK especially. No hot tub no room service noPlace for poolside alcohol (you can bring tiki's over but serve yourself)!

We got a good rate with my boyfriend's government ID. Loved the location, right across the street from the beach. The valet drivers were always friendly and provided excellent service. Breakfast was ok, something to get us up and going. Also appreciated how the frontdesk accommodated our discount at checkout. Negatives included the ridiculously tiny balcony for the Partial Ocean View room. We struggled to even fit one chair out there. And the plumbing was just short of awful. The tub did not drain effectively so you sort of stood in your own filth while you showered unless you turned the water off from time to time. Would stay here again for a good rate but upgrade to full Oceanview.

My husband and I just returned from a week in Waikiki. We stayed at the Aston Waikiki and had a great time. This hotel is probably the best buy around. Right across the street from the beach and within walking distance of all the other hotels and resturants on the Waikiki strip (bring your walking shoes!!). The desk staff were friendly and helpful. We arrived around 1:30 and were able to check in early. As indicated, the room was on the small size (we had two double beds) but enough room for the two of us. Yes, the bathroom was also small with very little counter space, but somehow we made it work with all the stuff we brought. It was clean and the view off the balcony was terrific (We had a select ocean view room - 20th floor). The housekeeping staff was great and very accomodating.The elevator system was unlike any we've encountered. Very easy to use and safe (don't understand why people had issues with it). You just swipe your room key and punch in the floor number and takes you right to your floor. The elevators are only busy around check in times (3:00) and even then, not as busy as other hotels we've been to.The breakfast buffet was also very nice. It had the basics.. pastries, yogart, fresh fruit, dry cereal, and eggs and waffels for a slight fee. There is also miso soup and noodles if you like Japanese cuisine. It's just enough to start the morning, but there are other places close by that serve the full breakfast menu if that's your thing. The only down side is that the hotel no longer offers the insulated carrier bags as advertised on the "Breakfast on the Beach" section of their web site.Tours were easy to book and the buses stopped in front of the hotel. If you want to avoid the tour bus thing you can always take public transportation ("The Bus"), but be advised that they run on "island time". It's cheap and good transportation as long as your not in a hurry.Be aware of the homeless people that sleep on the street and across the street at the beach. They never really bothered us and the police are always around to run them off. Just use common sense with your purse and wallets.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to relax and yet be able to enjoy eveything Waikiki has to offer. Would stay there again.

My Wife and I stayed here for 9 nights its a Hotel that caterers for your needs We booked all our tours at the Hotel lobby there's Pleasant Activities Center, Expedia, and V.I.P Tours. We chose. Pearl Harbor Tour, Volcano Big Island Tour, Polynesian Cultural Center Tour/Dinner , Helicopter Tour Of Ohio and Rental a Car for Two Days. The Hotel Staff are Friendly from Check in (Easy). Valet Parking (Trouble Free), Free Breakfast or Five Dollar Omelet Pool Side with Live Singing,(A Good Start to the Day), And an Excellent Restaurant called Tiki's Grill & Bar with Live Music.(To wind down the Day). There's just a couple of Ideas you need to think about when staying at a high rise Building. The Ocean View or Ocean Front. How High your Balcony Is. And most Important Don't Have a Room next to the Elevator, (You'll be Sorry)

I enjoyed the warm hospitality upon check-in. Our Ocean front select room was just as advertised. Wonderful panoramic view of Waikiki beach that was just across the street. An unobstructed view of the ocean, beach and the strip all the way down Waikiki. Elevator system assigns elevator cars by swiping your room key. Can be tricky at first but easy to earn the system. House keeping and front desk staff were always helpful. Heard some complaints prior to our trip about valet service being slow. Saw nothing like that during our stay. Car was always ready promptly after calling for it from our room. Very helpful valets upon return helping to unload our things and cart them to our room for us after outings, shopping, dinner, ect.
user_name:
Scott R
Santa Rosa, California, United States

review_body: This was my first trip to Hawaii and I must say that this hotel was well worth the money. I'm not sure what all the complaints were about because the only negative thing that I can say is that the bathroom does need some more counter space. Other than that, the room was clean. At no time did we find dirty sheets on the bed or filth in the bathroom like some travelers said. Maybe we just lucked out and had a great room. As for the free breakfast- it's free so what's with all the complaints? It's better than having to pay for a meal down the street. Also, we didn't see people acting like it was their only meal as in a previous post. We had an oceanfront room with views of Diamond Head as well. At no time did we have a problem with any of the employees either. Everyone we encountered was friendly and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay here if I am ever in Waikiki again.

Stayed here for four nights. Enjoyed our stay. Room was clean and tidy, helpful staff :). Enjoyed the breakfast (didn't see any shortages and we went at different times each day). Spent a bit of time at Tiki's which was enjoyable!Would stay here again in the future. Took off one star because I feel it is slightly overpriced (but that could just be the NZD to USD!!).

Super nice hotel. Free breakfast by the pool, with entertainment. Fabulous views and right across the street from the beach...all for a very reasonable price! Our whole family stayed here, taking up three rooms and everyone was super happy with the Aston. The staff was very friendly!

I have tried many different hotels in Waikiki during several business trips and after my first visit to this hotel I have made this my first choice every time since then. The valet staff go above and beyond every day on every visit and remember me whenever I return. The front desk staff is friendly, helpful, and very responsive to any need. The cleaning staff greet you with a warm 'aloha' and wide friendly smiles when you pass them in the hallways, and I can't say enough about the level of exceptional customer service provided by hotel management. I have yet to take advantage of the pool but the view from poolside of the sun setting is a definite winner. I recently went back on vacation with my family and we enjoyed the convenience of the beach chairs and towels that we checked out every day to take to the beach. The free breakfast provided is convenient but I have usually just had the coffee and avoided the rolls and pastries. We also took advantage of the DVD rentals but Internet access on my iPad was still a challenge in the room although they do still provide WiFi on the pool level and you can now connect to the Internet on your PC from your room. The cord provided in the room didn't fit my sister's Mac but we didn't ask for an alternative. You can not beat the beautiful views and very convenient location. There is an abundance of restaurant choices within walking distance including the Tikis Bar and Grill connected to the restaurant which features live music and serves wonderful food. This will continue to be my hotel of choice in Waikiki for business and vacation.

In an excellent location across the road from the beach near all the resteraunts etc.The staff were friendly throughout our stay with the exception of Carol on check in who wasnt very welcoming, no smile, just seemed to be going through the routine of check in. We declined the package to pay $10 a day for movies etc, we just used the safe for $3. Hotel is spotless and nice areas to sit and relax. Free wifi around the pool was definately a bonus. Dont know why people have issues with the elavator, system is quick and works well.Only real issue i had was that we ended up with a room with no real balcony, there was an outside space you could stand out on to look at the lovely view but no room for a chair, and im not being picky, there really isnt! Most rooms have good balconys, at the front facing the pool or the beach but the ones at the right side of the hotel have a standing space so make sure you request one of the others.Breakfast was always good, plenty of choice and when items run out they are restocked quickly. I was dissapointed that they had stopped doing their 'breakfast on the beach' cooler bag as i had it in my mind before i got there that i would get one but if your not expecting one then you wouldnt care.We had lunch at tikis and it was great, we had dinner and it was awful so cant really advise on that one!Overall a good hotel and i would definately stay again providing i had a real balcony.

I liked this hotel. The room was a bit small for two adults and two teenage children but was ok. We did not really care of how the room looked like because we only came to spend the night. We had a great view and the service was amazing. Our requests were met as the staff tried to accomodate all guests. The free breakfast was nice. It was a money saver and contained a few varieties. We really enjoyed it during our ten days stay. We also tried the restaurant on site. We used it three times. We liked it because the staff were nice, friendly and helpful. Anyway, we had a marvelous holiday. It is a definite go back again in the near future because the area was safe, fun and friendly, and it was worth the money spent. Cheers

I stayed here in October 2008 & my experience was absolutely wonderful! So great infact, that I plan on returning! The free breakfast is a nice & welcome touch. Stay ocean front if possible, the view is to die for. Staff are all so freindly & helpful. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel!!

My wife and I celebrated our 41st wedding anniversay at this Waikiki Hotel. We were not disappointed as we had a marvelous 7 night stay. Joann, the supervisor for the front desk, is a true asset for Aston. She was consistently professional in her dealings with the hotel guests. She did her best to accomodate even the simplest request from the guests. We were truly impressed with her service. I would have given this hotel a 5 star where it not for the elevators breaking down for hours during our last day. Climbing 17 floors on a stairway is no joke. We could not understand why it took so long for the elevators to work again. Our hearts went out to the bell boys who had to carry luggage that morning. They truly deserved a large bonus from the management. Always request an oceanfront room on the highest available floor as the view of the ocean is superb! The noise in the lower floors can be really loud as this is the main avenue in Waikiki and the rooms are not sound proof. The free breakfast is just OK. It is nothing to rave about and the coffee needs a touch of Starbucks. The location and the everpleasant housekeeping staff makes up for the minor shortcomings of this hotel. Our room was always cleaned and smelled fresh everyday when we returned from our tours. We will definitely stay here again.

Nice, clean hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is at the end of the Waikiki strip, right across from the beach. You get to see wonderful sunsets. There's a $10/day resort fee which I was not aware off. It includes wi-fi and movie rentals. Parking - you have to valet your car - $27/day; a little steep! There's the Waikiki Banyan about 2 blocks away and parking is $12/day. If you stay in Waikiki, you dont really need a car. Street parking is very hard to find and everything is within walking distance. However, if you plan to see the island at your leisure, a car is not a bad idea. Loved, loved, loved Oahu! Will definitely visit again.

I did months of research before booking our hotel in Oahu to make sure we got the best hotel with everything we needed in our budget. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel was perfect. We booked an "Ocean View" room and was not disappointed at all; stayed on the 24th floor with a view of Diamond Head out our door while having a perfect ocean view from out balcony. All the reviews I read about the elevator system scared me a little but it was so easy and made me feel really safe; put your card on the reader enter your floor and there you go! The staff was really nice no issues at all. We did have an issue with our safe the first night however I called the front desk and someone was knocking on our door within a couple minutes, they replaced the battery and we were good to go. The breakfast was good for a contiental; they had cereal, fruit, muffins, bagles, lots of pastry, yogurt and lots of pastry. They do not give you the little cooler bags anymore which was a little disappointing however not really a big deal. If you want a little cooler you can go to the ABC store right next to the hotel and buy one for $5, you also have a fridge in your room to keep things in.
