Over all the room was perfect for the 2 of us with one king size bed, the bathroom was average size and the bed was very comfortable. Overall this hotel was great to stay at with being right accross the street from the beach as well as right down the street from all the shops.

I rarely write reviews but I have to write this one. Think twice before staying here. Yes the location is great and you can walk to the beach. But the rooms are SO small, there is not enough floor space to even open up your luggage. You can only open it up by hauling it onto your bed. Seriously. The bathroom was tiny and the door doesn't close all the way. The grout and tiles were icky. the breakfast and the location are the only assets this place has. Wouldn't stay here again.

We switched to this hotel after staying a night at the excellent Hotel Renew, because once we got to Honolulu we realized wanted an ocean view.I will make this quick. Our room was great—actual ocean view, for a great price. Yes there are other buildings in your view, but if you ask for a ocean view on a high floor and as close to the ocean as possible, the view is magnificent, even with those buildings. The room was clean and cute. TV has limited selection but you can rent DVDs in the lobby for free.Pool and breakfast are pretty good, not great. There is a musician and hula dancer every morning, a nice touch. Coffee is bad (please improve this for our next visit!) and the rest is a typical continental breakfast. You can pay $5 for a decent but not great omelet.The proximity to everything in Waikiki is great.Hotel staff, including cleaning staff, is very friendly and helpful (we had some a/c issues and staff was sent immediately to fix).The valet staff is extremely personable and professional. It costs $27/day to have them park you car but I felt like it was worth it. You just need to call 10 minutes ahead.The hotel is literally across the street from the beach.Things they need to improve:They need more staff at the front desk. Almost every time I went to the front desk or called I had to wait far longer than I should have. I inquired about this and they told me they were training more people. Seems like they should have already done that. Please fully staff the front desk at all times!The elevator system. At first, it seemed genius (there is a computer system that reads your card and assigns you to a specific elevator depending on who else is requesting the elevator in which direction and what floor they are going to). It works VERY well. Unfortunately, on our last day, it completely broke down for 3-4 hours, and all guests in the full hotel could only access the 20+ floors by emergency stairwell, and it seemed to overwhelm the staff as it took them a long time before staff was in place to guide guests to where they needed to go. Considering the professionalism and efficiency that we experienced for most of our stay, this was a surprise.All in all, I would rate this hotel very highly and we will definitely be staying here again if we visit Waikiki.

We stayed at this hotel for our Waikiki portion of our Oahu vacation. The room was adequate- it had a partial ocean view, which also overlooked the pool. When we arrived at noon, they were able to get us in a room right away. There was a problem with one of the (free) movies playing, so someone came in to look at it. He switched out the PS3, but still didn't work. While he was in there, I mentioned the noise coming from the AC. I never called the front desk about it, but about 15 minutes later a maintenance man came to look & repair it. It took him about an hour, but the noise stopped! The room was on the small side, but big enough to walk around and sleep, which is all we needed it for!The breakfast was pretty good considering we knew what to expect. We usually were there between 6:30-8 am, so there was still plenty. There isn't really anywhere to go when it rains, other than your room or a small covered area near the escalators.The pool is a bit small and the water felt kind of slimey, but the beach is right across the street so we used both equally!While we were here we used our Go Oahu card. When making the reservations, the companies had curb side pick up right from the hotel. We went to Pearl Harbor, the Aquarium, the Palace, Manakai Catamaran & a Circle Tour of the island. We also drove to Diamond Head and the Botanical Gardens. Parking is expensive ($27/night), but we parked a block down at the Aston Banyan for $12/night.Lillyan provided great service at the front desk!

Excellent location. We had a "standard " room which faced east . Dearer rooms had balconies with a table and chairs. The room was spacious and comfortable. Very family orientated. Staff professional and helpful. Breakfast by the pool creates some problems as there was not enough seating. This is outweighed by the setting and relaxed atmosphere. Close to attractions including the Zoo.

Our room was pretty good until we had a few issues with the plumbing/toilet. The staff were great in trying to repair. When they couldn't, we were taken to another room with no issues. Breakfast is pretty good. Please note that this is not a restaurant. Continental breakfast in pool area -fruit, small bagels, cereal, muffins, doughnuts, juice, coffee etc. In our opinion it was good to very good. For what you pay for the room it is comparable to others I am sure. Housekeeping was excellent!. Valet parking is expensive but again comparable to others on the beach. All staff were very helpful. Pool was clean. Nice to have local Hawaiian music played during breakfast. Not very impressed with Wolfgang Pucks. Food was okay but restaurant always seemed to have long line ups for meals. Great views of Waikiki beach, bedding was clean, extra pillows etc.

At $260.00 per night this hotel will be our first and last time.Elevators are reliableBreakfast is continental in styroform, one might resemble a cattle call.Most hotels of this catagory would only be $159.00.

tropical type rooms.we were put in older rooms on arrival we complained about smell and cleanliness and were shifted to better rooms next day.seen 2 other people during my stay do the same,should be put in decant rooms to start.location was great as was the sea view,breakfast not really suited to aussies no toast etc.close to the market place.on checking in were had to pay a resort fee so check before you leave home.we were there for our 40th wedding aniversary so was a bit dissapointed with being put in a poor room to start our holiday.

We went with family and spent a week at this property. We had an ocean front room and the view was beautiful. The property is at the tail end of the Waikiki strip and close to Diamond Head and the Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium. You can walk right across to the beach, there is a sandbar and the water is shallow enough for the kids to play in. Wolfgang Puck Express is right downstairs and the food is pretty good. The room was fairly clean, just a little bit tired. There was no wifi and limited cable TV, but you can rent movies downstairs for free. Breakfast was strictly pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, and drinks. You had to pay extra for eggs or special items. There is not enough seating for all the guests, it can be quite hectic. The beds are a bit soft. Overall, a nice stay.

Spent three nights in the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel before starting our cruise, as a part of our Honeymoon. Check in was no big problem, but rooms was not available until 3pm. Also it seems that some booking agencies had included the resort/amenity fee and some not (I had booked both through hotels.com and one other agency).Had two balcony rooms, one with partial ocean view and one with oceanfront view. We had no problem with the partial ocean view, but the ocean front room was on floor 5, which gave us a view of the concreate outbuilding in front and lots of palm trees, but not what you would call ocean front view. So after a quick visit with the reception we got a room on floor 19, which really fitted the name ocean front view much better (and we got a very nice honeymoon gift). Rooms was very nice, good beds to sleep in and fresh bathrooms. (And the service staff was very nice and helpful)Location is great, with good access Waikiki Beach and for a quick snack the Wolf Gang Express location was a great option. Also there are lots of shuttles stopping here, which is good, regardless if it is the free Hilo Hattie or any excursion bus stopping.The pool was very nice for a quick swim (when the beach becomes to salty for you), and also sun chairs etc was very comfortable (even though the sun only arrives somewhat after 10-11 am, but not really a problem for us).The beach style breakfast was a adventure in it self, since the thing presented to carry it in, was a cup holder and small paperbags, and since that was not easy to carry around you wanted somewhere to sit, but that was not really easy, due to lack of space. But all in all it was very good, with yoghurt, small bagels, fresh fruit and different juices and coffee to drink.So all in all, it was very nice stay and I would recommend anyone to stay there.

My Husband and I stayed here last week for 5 days and loved it. The Hotel was close to shops, restaurants and of course the Beach. We were able to check in before 3pm and to our Surprise they had upgraded us to a Jr.Suite (yay) It was our 1 year Wedding Anniversary so they also surprised us with a small Gift. The room was super nice and spacious, bed was comfortable too. It had 2 small Balconies facing the Ocean. The view was absolutely beautiful,best way to wake up in the morning and watch the sunset in the Evening. Our room was on the 8th floor so we did have some live music from the tiki bar and grill every night but it didnt bother us at all we enjoyed it . We didnt take advantage of the Free Breakfast since it always seemed so busy. They also provide beach towels that you can use at their pool or take to the beach which helped a lot. We also didnt use the pool (why use the pool when you have the beach across the street). We also liked the Elevator system, prior to staying at the Aston I was reading complaints about the Elevators but I am not quite sure what everyone found difficult its very easy to use. We would definitely consider the Aston again when we go back to Oahu in a couple of years.

Me and my wife went here for our honeymoon. Our overall experience was great. Check in was very easy and they even gave us a small gift for our honeymoon. It was just a picture frame, but it was a nice gesture. They placed us in an ocean view room with a King Size bed as was our preference and the view was just breathtaking. I think for the first 2 days we were still in awe of how nice the view was. It was overlooking the ocean and you got look down the street and see all the people out an about. The room was a tad bit small but "who comes to Hawaii to spend the day in the room?" Our room was used for storage of our things, showering, dressing, and of course we were on our honeymoon...wink wink!!! One thing I really liked was the elevators. Your key card only gives you access to the floor you are on. So you didnt have to worry about kids playing on your floor, or someone being on your floor who didnt belong there. This Hotel is located at the end of the strip, close to the zoo and Diamond Head. If you are taking any kind of tours, going to see attractions, or whatever you may want to do every tour bus, trolley and public transportation picks up and drops off in front of the hotel. The breakfast was convienent but nice, I only wish they had a bigger selection to choose from. Plus it was nice to be able to save the money on breakfast because eating in Waikiki is expensive. There are plenty of restaurants and shops around. For the women shoppers...Designers Row is right up the street...fellas keep your lady away from this area...haha!!!! This hotel has a nice pool, but I didnt use it. I mean "I'm in Hawaii, and I wanted to go to the beach!!!!" The part of beach in front of the Hotel is great for non swimmers and beginners, because there is a man made wall to block the current from pulling you out and only gets about six feet deep at the most, and there is a lifeguard on duty during the day. The last thing was the service. It was really great. They were upfront about addtional fees. they have a amenity fee of 10 dollars a day, which covers your safe usage, high speed internet, room phone and DVD/blu ray rentals/PS3 game rentals(there is a PS3 in the room), there were a few other things included in that fee but i thought it was a great idea. They did a great job of servicing the room with whatever we needed. Before we left we had decided that when we do our big family trip to Hawaii we were going to probably give The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel first shot at our business again.

Went on family vacation with wife and 2 kids. Positives include good location across beach, great restaurants around hotel, free breakfast, views of beach from room, clean room, beds avg., small fridge. Service was good, no issues at all. They did good job holding our luggage till we flew out. Gift shop in lobby well stocked.Negatives include no self parking(self parked 2 blocks away), small rooms, menu in Tiki Grill too exotic and overpriced.

My husband and i stayed at this hotel...he was here on business and i tagged along. Our overall experience is certainly positive. One pro is the location...somehow tucked away at the end...away from the density of tourists frequenting the shopping establishments. The rooms are a little small so it may not be ideal for families with children in tow. I do love their complimentary breakfast and the carry out bags they provide you to take our breakfast out to the beach -- totally awesome. I found the staff very helpful at all times. But that is Hawaii -- everyone is so hospitable. The dining options at the hotel are ok -- you will find better choices elsewhere. Will defintely come back!

Prior to arriving, I asked for an early check in as I was flying in around 8am and the reservations desk advised me this was available for a fee which was ok. Arrived at the hotel and they said no early checkin available (even for a fee). After being on a plane for >18 hrs I asked if there were any showers to use, and they said only restrooms. Pretty annoyed! Went out and arrived back abt 5pm and the room was still not ready. Safe didn't work and had to be fixed. Finally got into room abt 6pm. They advised room would be ready at 1pm. Breakfast is ok, but there are better brekkys available. Room clean but looks dated. Front desk not very helpful. Very close to Waikiki Beach. Would not recommend to others.

We arrived here early on a wet and misty August morning having flown from Vegas and the Elara Hilton Grand Hotel. My initial impressions were not good and while I appreciate this hotel is not in the same league as the Elara Hilton I was a bit disappointed.I thought the general decor of the hotel and rooms needed a makeover and everything looked a bit tired. We had a room on the 27 floor with a side view of the beach (just) which looked directly across to the next hotel block which was quite close.If our room is the normal standard in the hotel then it needs some money spending on it. Drab paintwork and carpets and a bathroom that was nearing the end of its life. Having said that, it was comfortable and clean and we had no issues with the maid service which always seemed to be done whenever we got back to our room.Breakfast is a bit of a scrum and there's limited seating to eat round the pool area so we took ours back up to the room every day. 'Continental' style breakfast with pastries, cakes, fruit, yoghurt etc which couldn't be faulted - as much as you can carry sensibly back to your room!Tiki's bar and restaurant adjacent to the pool area is excellent with a good atmosphere, food and service. We ate in there two or three times during our week stay and it was all excellent and the place was buzzing every night.Step across the road from the hotel and you are on the beach, which also cannot be faulted for cleanliness - a beautiful stretch of coastline. There are limited sun beds and parasols for hire and tend to be quite expensive ($15 per day sun bed, $20 per day parasol, I think) which could add up over a week. Most people used beach mats/towels. You can use folding chairs which are supplied by the hotel free of charge - get these in the corner of the pool area by the omelette ordering counter at breakfast. We kept ours for the whole week. Pool/beach towels are also provided by the hotel.10 minute walk into the centre of Waikiki where there are restaurants, shops and the usual evening life one finds. I found it to be a bit classier than I imagined with some hi-end shops and very pleasant surroundings.After bad initial impressions I really warmed to the hotel and the place in general and was sorry to go. Would I recommend it? Well yes, as long as your standards in hotel accommodation are not too high but rather around the middle somewhere, then I would recommend for excellent position within easy reach of all other amenities that Waikiki has to offer. And the weather - it couldn't have been better.Dave FarnhamKent UK

We were recommended this hotel by our travel agent and whilst it was a good hotel where breakfast is included, it is nothing special.Main issues that we were disappointed with compared to what we'd expected:- basic room with no coffee facilities but it did have a fridge- bathroom clean but in need of rejuvenation - wifi only available in reception area- Tikis restaurant had great food but was a bit overpriced- pool area is clean but again in need of rejuvenationGood points:- Nice downstairs area to relax in- right opposite the beach- a few pizza/burger restaurants nearby for those with children who might not like local food- lovely free breakfast There was nothing that was awful about this hotel but we just didn't leave feeling like we'd ever want to go back.

Stayed for 5 nights mid-August. We had an ocean view room on the 19th floor, towards the back of the building. The view was great and being at the back of the complex we managed to have sun in the morning (on the balcony) as well as catch the spectacular sunsets each night.Breakfast is provided at the pool deck and while a little hectic at times is tasty and more than sufficient for the morning. Try the fresh pineapple and paw-paw (papaya)!There is good swimming directly adjacent to the hotel and offered some of the better (and certainly less populated) swimming options in Waikiki.The room was a little small but well suited to two of us and our luggage. Being no frills any additional needs usually attracted a small fee. After coming from a hotel that just lumped all these charges into a large "catch-all" and additional surcharge it was nice to have a more user-pays system. The bed was comfortable and rooms were well serviced each morning. Staff were always friendly and helpful. While not the 4 and 5 star standard of some of the other Waikiki hotels I would definitely stay here again.

I was shocked and disgusted at the rooms that were presented to us. The rooms were filthy and had blood on the toilet. The carpet looked worn out and the rooms had a moldy smell. I spent two hours on the phone with front desk and the hotel manager to figure out if I had booked a hotel room or motel room? In the end, we were stuck with this hotel because the other hotels were booked. We had to pay additional to upgrade to a cleaner room. Never coming back here again!!!

The room was fine, it was a handicap room. The problem was that every 24 hours on the nose we had to have maintenance come and "bypass" the AC so it turned back on! For some strange reason it shuts off every 24 hours! HmmmmThe in the bathroom there was one small towel rack to hang your towels would only hold one towel at a time and no place whatsoever to put your makeup, toothbrush or anything! They had a small shelf but it was tiny and everything falls off! To blowdry or curl your hair there is no place to plug in unless you drape the cord OVER the toilet with no seat cover and hope it does not fall in or unplug and fall in! They need to redo the bathroom! Not enough outlets but that is not their fault. The closet door if you want to call it a door is just wood beaded things on a string that attack you when you try to use the closet! It would be best to do away with them! But it was ok as a room.The breakfast was a pain! No place to sit at the pool, they should bring out more chairs! People act like it is their last meal when they go down there....insane! Chill out you little piggys! Location of being next to the zoo was good! The zoo rips you off for everything! 3.00 for a tiny bottle of water, bring your own!!!!!!

Visited July 26th for 8 nights.Arrived late and had a ocean side view.OK but wanted a oceanfront view so upgraded next day.What a fabulous view.Floor 19 room east corner.Could see all of Wakiki beach right and left to Diomand head.Didnt bother with breakfast.bit of a scrum.Found a Dennys which is great breakfast.Oahu is buitifull.Visited Pearl Harbor,island tour,Aquirium(excellant).All in all the Aston is a nice hotel,yes bathroom could do with refirb but how long do you spend in bathroom.Be Warned,there are homeless people everywhere.They sleep on all the benches at night.Kevin.D.Rhoose,South Wales,UK

This hotel is in a great location in Waikiki. Although its at the far end, it is right across from the beach which was never too crowded and a short walk to many great restaurants and shopping. Our rooms were on the 23rd floor with beautiful views of Waikiki and the ocean. We saw amazing sunsets every night! The buffet breakfast in the morning is just okay. Its extra money to get waffles or omelets which leaves you the choice of cereal, muffins, and yogurt for the most part. There was never enough seating either. Overall, my experience at the Aston was wonderful and I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

My expectations may have been a little to high when we booked this place. Opposite Waikiki beach close to shops sounds great. I actually thought this was just an upper level Ibis hotel. For $283 per night we were allocated level 6 which is the second lowest yes we faced Waikiki beach through the trees which is what we paid for really. It was basic clean,the balcony looked like it had not been cleaned for some time and the bathrooms are dated. On 2 occasions we had to wait for them to finish cleaning the room and once at 5pm I had to go and ask him just to empty the bin and give us cleans towels as we could not wait any longer. We left the room each day quite early so they had plenty of time, not sure how the allocate the cleaning staff.Continental Breakfast was included which was a fight everytime we went down stairs, there was never any seat to enjoy it by the pool it did not matter what time we went down there so we took it back to our room. Unless you know where reception is it is a bit hard to find it is up the lift or escalator on the next level.

There are some very pricey, very high-end hotels in Waikiki beach, and this isn't one of them. You cannot expect 5-star amenities from a budget-friendly hotel. Having said that, we have nothing but (mostly) good things to say about this place and would definitely stay there again. The hotel is what I would classify as a large boutique hotel (if there is such a category). It is nicely-decorated, clean, full of activity, easily accessible and, in my opinion, in the best location on Waikiki beach. It is in the less-crowded area of the beach at the end of the strip and you can easily walk either south toward the parks, zoo and aquarium or north to the bustling central hotel/shopping area. (However, there is shopping right across the street, too and plenty to do within just a couple blocks of you are less mobile. There are ABC stores on about every corner, and they are great places to buy affordable Hawaiian souvenirs and snack items.)We did not find merit in any of the complaints we had read about the hotel on this site. The rooms are on the small side, but this is true with any budget-friendly hotel in a popular tourist destination or large city. The breakfast area by the pool was a bit crowded, but we went at all different times and found plenty of food available and a place to sit every time. Sure, the breakfast is mainly donuts, fruit, and yogurt--but it's FREE, so what do you expect? If you get tired of it, there is a McDonald's two blocks away where you can get a full Hawaiian breakfast for $5-6. Breakfast also included live music and hula dancing.We also found the decor to be tasteful. One of the reviews we read said the red and white colors and floral fabrics were "dated." C'mon, people! It's HAWAII. Red and white . . . and floral is everywhere! The furnishings were also clean and in good condition. The bathroom was arguably a bit dated but fully functional, large enough and everything worked as it should have. We found the mattress on the bed to be extremely comfortable. Our balcony on the 22nd floor, overlooking the pool and beach was absolutely delightful. If there is any way to locate yourself on a higher floor and as close to the beach side of the hotel as possible, I think you'll find it worth the extra money. Some of the lower floors right above the pool and on the back side of the hotel lack a good view and are probably quite noisy. We enjoyed Tiki's restaurant and bar at this hotel very much. It was a fun place to have drinks and listen to live music in the evening and the food was very good, as well. There is also a Wolfgang Pucks, ColdStone Creamery, Subway and some sort of cookie store in the same building. The pool is not huge, but it was also not crowded because most people are across the street at the beach. We also liked that it had a true deep end at close to 6', so you could actually swim and not just walk around, like in many hotel pools. The only negative experience we had at this hotel the whole week was with parking. We pulled up to check in during a busy time, and we were not ready to valet check our car yet. We wanted to drive around a bit and get a sense of our surroundings first. The lobby is up on the second floor, and we were told by a parking attendant that we could only leave our car for 10 minutes while we checked in. However, we had no control over how long the check in process would take during this busy time of the afternoon. We moved as quickly as possible through the process and up to our room to drop our bags and returned to our car only to find an angry parking attendant who yelled at us and then said loudly to another attendant as we got into our car not to let us back in when we returned! When we did return, his temper seemed to have simmered. He "allowed" us to park (for $27/day) and did not give us any other problems for the duration of the week. I'm not sure if the parking attendants work for the hotel or if it is a separate business, but this certainly did not make a good first impression on two weary travelers who had flown over 11 hours to get there. All in all, I cannot see why you wouldn't enjoy this hotel, unless you are expecting 5-star amenities for a 2-star price.

Located farther away from the main Waikiki drag has its advantages. Quieter and less crowded but still very accessible. Large comfortable rooms come with comfortable beds. Great views. Good breakfasts and good service too.

My family and I had a very pleasant stay at the Aston Waikiki. We arrived at the hotel early. The front desk was very welcoming and checked us in anyway. They accommodated us by getting a room for us within an hour. The hotel and our room have a nice, trendy Hawaiian decor. The only area that can use an upgrade would be the bathroom. Other than that, we found our room cozy and comfortable. The pool side complimentary breakfast was great! My kids enjoyed the variety of menu items and especially loved the chocolate taro pastry and lychee yogurt. Be sure to get there early like before 8:00am, otherwise everything will be gone. Within a few steps from the hotel is the beach and lots of shops and eateries. We chose the Aston for its location. It's not in the concentrated/crowded area, but is conveniently located to everything within a short walk. If you're renting a car and don't want to spend money parking at the hotel, there is free parking available on the street. It's not hard to find and usually within a block or two of the hotel. Our experience at the Aston Waikiki was more personal. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was just delightful!

I used the reviews of the Aston Waikiki on TA to pick a hotel to send my mom, Aunts and Grandparents on a family vacation over the summer. I worked with the staff to set up the trip before they left, and a few times before they departed when we had some trouble with credit card fraud and had to change the card on the reservation. At every step the staff was wonderful, very helpful and courteous . My mom had the following to say on their return:The Aston Waikiki Beach Tower was a fantastic pick. The staff was pleasant, prompt, always helpful. The condo was well kept and stocked. The location was perfect and the view was breathtaking

Spent just under 2 weeks at Aston , with my 7 year old son, After reading some reviews on here was a little worried what we would find when we arrived. But very easy check in, very friendly hotel staff. The lift system is a doddle to use, Really cant see what the fuss is about ?Room was clean and tidy, bathroom a bit dated, but it was clean , after all how much of your holiday are you going to spend in the bathroom :D ?! Breakfast was ok, nothing flash , can get busy at times around the pool area, but we took ours to the beach , which i think is a much better option, and a better view than the poolside.For the money i was pleased with what we received, plenty of other more expensive hotels on the strip, location was great, away from the busy parts of waikiki. Only gripe is the extra money for use of the safe, and internet whic by the way isnt wifi, so cant use on phone or ipad . which is a little behind the times !! But all in we had a good time and would recommend the hotel

My sister and I travelled to Hawaii 10 days at the end of July 2012. We booked the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel oceanfront room. The view from our room was absolutely spectacular!! What a joy it was to wake up every morning and see a great non obstructed view of the famous Waikiki bech with its boats, and surfers. I never realized how many gorgeous pics I had taken from our balcony until I got home. The location is fantastic, the beach is only 5 steps across the street and shops are all handy.Highly recommend it, and would stay there again in the future. But now I am spoiled and would only go back for an oceanfront room. No hassle with the elevator system, quite easy. Tour buses stop either directly at the hotel or on the same block. Breakfast is always the same, high carb and small selection but the music and dancing makes up for it. Great music to start the day and the small bags they give you are good if you are planning on going to your room for breakfast.Staff was helpful, and checkin and checkout went smoothly. They give you beach towels and chairs to take to the beach if you want. Pool was small, but with having the ocean only a few steps away, who cares.

Currently staying at this hotel and i don't see what people complain about. From the minute we got here the staff have been amazing. My sister was sick when we arrived so after speaking to front desk they prioritized our check in so we could get up to our rooms asap so she could rest. The rooms are average (partial ocean view) size and more than big enough for me and my 2 young ones. Only issue is the white bedding and grubby toddlers don't mix. There is plenty of room on the bathroom counter for toiletries. Yes the mirror fogs up but there is another mirror just out the bathroom anyway. I expected to line up for ages for u kid free to enjoy it that little bit more.

The location of the hotel is fantastic, and so is the breakfast buffet in the morning. For the rest, I thought the hotel and service was just average. WiFi is only available directly around the pool, in the rooms there is a cable (in 2012, a CABLE!).There's only valet parking, no self parking. $27 per night.

Excellent location. My room gave me a view of both the ocean and Diamond Head Park. I could easily walk to almost any type of resturant I could think of and plenty of shopping near by. Breakfast served every morning by the pool and live music most of the time. The pool was a bit small but who goes to HI for the pools? Nice little bar on site and LuLus is a stones throw away which was probably the best bar that I saw during my stay. Parking was high at 27 for valet but unless you know the area well, there are not many other options. I would stay again and I would def recommend.

We booked this hotel through booking.com for 710 $ for three nights to conclud our honeymoon. We stayed at the Miramar at Wikiki the four days before and we regret moving! When we checked in to Aston they told us that we had to pay for a compulsory extra 10 $ per night fee for Intenet and other services. This fee is compulsory but never advertised on Booking.com. Furthermore, we sadly learnt that our room had no wifi connection, no coffee machine or kettle! This is all incredible, especially if you consider that this hotel costs 235$ per night! The rooms are poor and don't worth the money paid. Miramar was half this price and was much better.

I stayed here in an ocean front room with my sons for a week in August. The hotel is located directly across the street from the beach and is on the quieter side of Waikiki. The beach has a break wall so the water is calm for playing and building sand castles but just to the west is a fabulous beach for crazy boogie boarding! Pick up a boogie board and flippers at the ABC stores located everywhere. The hotel offers a free breakfast which is rather unremarkable but has fresh fruit and great coffee. Order a delicious $5 omelet or $3 waffles if you're hungry. Order poke (raw marinated tuna) wherever you go! Tiki's in the hotel and Lulu's next door have the best.

Loved the breakfast, and LOCATION! We chose this hotel because of the price and included breakfast and it was terrific. The rooms are clean. The bathrooms show some wear, but are not bad. We loved the beach towel and beach chair checkout. The room came with a cooler/lunch bag that you can fill with your breakfast items and take to the beach. It was really great!

We stayed here for 4 nights, checking out this morning, we have 10 nights in Waikiki and are spending the next 6 at another hotel, originally planned that way to experience more than one hotel as we haven't been to Hawaii before. The Aston Waikiki is a good 3* hotel and reasonably priced in comparison with other hotels along the beach. We only tried the breakfast once as we slept in and ate breakfast downstairs instead, there are many eateries close by and the hotel is across the road from the beach, very handy! The Tiki Bar does happy hour and gets busy at night with live entertainment, the restaurant area we found to be a bit overpriced and small portions, again not a lot of vegetarian options that are also healthy. We had a partial ocean view room on the 11th floor which was good, our sink blocked and we had to be moved and we were moved to the 25th floor in an ocean view room, this was the better room and the view was excellent, however the room was smaller.For the price paid we did expect more in terms or service and breakfast, however we have found Hawaii in general not cheap if you want a view and to be along the beach. We are in the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach for the remainder of our trip and we are already loving it, review to come!

My husband and I stayed at the Aston for 5 nights recently and it served our needs. Our room had a lovely view (Ocean front) and was cleaned to a decent standard. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom contained what was needed.There is a Tikis restaurant on pool level, overlooking Waikiki beach. The food and service is very good here.Breakfast would be my only quibble. Because the hotel is good value for money, its busy. Breakfast is a buffet, stuck in one corner of the pool area. When you check in, you are given a cooler bag between two which you fill up when you come to breakfast. Often though, the pool area is too full to find a spot to sit down and eat....something to think about...?Overall though, the Aston is a good place to lay your hat whilst filling your days with sightseeing.

The hotel's in a nice location. At the end of the tourist shopping & eating hub, and directly across the road from the beach.Most things are at a lovely walking distance, if not, a cheap trolley ride away.The pool was nice, but not always clean, as breakfast is served poolside & things get blown into the pool, namely napkins that breakdown & aren't easily netted out. For our family of 4, we found our room somewhat cramped, that's about my only major complaint.

The hotel is very clean and has friendly staff.. my husband and i are honeymooning here and we made a great choice with this hotel.. there is a large variety with the free breakfast and the location is excellent!

There were 4 of us in one room. Myself, husband, and two teenage children. They are not big rooms but worked out ok for us. We had an excellent view of the ocean!! They had a good variety for breakfast every morning. If you wanted waffels or an omlete you had to pay $5.00. It is right in the middle of everything. Beach right across the street, shops and resturants everywhere. Nice pool area. Rooms were clean. Staff very friendly. I would stay there again!

The best thing about Aston Waikiki is the location. It's situated in a city (and all that means) but steps from a beautiful Pacific beach (and all that means). The rooms themselves are clean and serviceable -- somewhat dated, but in a charming way. I recommend a higher floor (we stayed on the 22nd) not only for the views but also to distance yourself from the city hubbub. The hotel offers a bountiful free breakfast, providing each room with a vinyl "Breakfast on the Beach" cooler bag (which becomes a nice keepsake after your visit). This is an inspired idea; you can either eat your breakfast poolside (while soothing live music and hula dancing set a placid atmosphere) or you can pack your satchel and enjoy your repast on the beach. The hotel does charge for wireless internet, which is unfortunate. It's minutes from a variety of terrific restaurants and activities.

We didn't know what to expect based on the mixed reviews prior to our stay and were very pleasantly surprised and satisfied with the Aston. The rooms were small but clean. The bathrooms were outdated but functional. Customer service was fantastic and all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was a plus. The only negative was the $27 daily parking charge and valet only. Being located at the end of the Waikiki strip, it was nice and quiet and we only had to walk a few blocks to join in the busy nightlife of Waikiki. Our room was on the 23rd floor with an ocean view and we woke up to a beautiful view of Waikiki Beach every morning. I would definitely stay here again when I visit Hawaii again. Hopefully the bathrooms will be renovated by then. Thank you for a wonderful Hawaiian vacation memory. : )

I picked this hotel for two reasons: 1. It has a continental breakfast.....and 2. its prior reviews. We stayed here for 7 days and it was great. We were on floor 22 facing diamon head and it was nice and quiet. Prior reviews told me to get the highest floor possible to avoid street noise and I agree. The continental breakfast was awesome! They had SO MANY pastries, fruit trays, cereals, and yogurts! They also had milk, juices, coffee AND MISO SOUP! You go down with your cooler bags, fill them up, sit down to eat, finish everything you got, then go back and fill them up again and go back to your room (or wherever). They also had a waffle and eggs to order for five bucks. If you stay downtown, breakfast is gonna cost you alot of money so staying in a hotel with continental breakast helps alot! Only has valet parking and they are great! Parking is free for military with PCS orders (bring a copy of your pcs reservation that says its free). We found pen marks on our front pasenger seat and they cleaned it right off with no hesitation! The beach is right across the street and its perfect for young children because it has a wall that prevents large waves from coming through! The tiki-bar restaurant is good but pricy. Wolfgang downstairs has great food and its decently priced. All the restaurants close by are expensive but good (>$50). No wireless internet sucks but o-well....$40 for a week of internet in the room. You can only use the elevator with a key....I really liked this feature! Goody bags for the kids upon arriving....very cool! Trolly stops at the hotel every half hour. BK and MCd's close by. Live music during breakfast. Pool is small, but who wants to swim in a pool when you got the beach a stone throw away? If you have kids, this is the place to stay.

Stayed here from 07/24-07/29 with my best friend for our annual best friend trip. The room was small, but was big enough to accomodate 2 double beds. Room was clean and had I would say a 32" flat screen tv. Bathroom was also a decent size and the beds were comfy. Best part of the room was our ocean view since we were on the 19th floor. Location is awesome as it is just steps away from the beach and the shops were also in walking distance. Breakfast was free, but we didn't get any since we wake up around 9. Overall, this hotel is awesome and I'd stay here again.

First, Mahalo to those reviewers who led us to the Aston. Also, to those in the forums who knew about where to park. $12 per day at the Banyan is a fair deal and it is less than a block from the Aston. Just drive in to the Aston to check-in and they will park your car there for the time it takes to check-in. Then take your car up the street to the Banyan to park. You just saved $15 per day. Another suggestion is to NOT rent a a car until you want to explore the island. It's a liability in Waikiki. There are trollies and other ways to get around.As for the hotel, the staff is very friendly. They do charge a $10 amenity free but that includes internet in-room(not wifi), free DVDs(current ones, too), and a safe. The breakfast with music and hula is OK. They give you a cold bag to carry the food to the beach. It also aids in portion control, I think. Gets old after 3 days, but so does Waikiki. The things to see I will cover elsewhere in the Waikiki section. Many people mention the elevators, which are different but not a problem. You adapt to them.They are somewhat noisy though, so try for a room away from them. As others have mentioned, staying high( 18th floor and up) up is good, as the street noise is significant.The rooms are small(why king-size beds?) with a small balcony. The ocean view rooms are worth it. We faced west and saw lots of activity, including fireworks, from our room. Sunset was lovely as well.

We typically stay at Comfort Inn or the Holiday Inn and I would say this is comparable. Yes, it is a little pricer but it is location that bumps the price up. When we arrived the bell boys took our luggage and directed us up to the desk. The check in guy was very friendly and the hotel offered water with lemon or oranges! We then used our room key to access the elevators; which is a very secure feeling in the Waikiki area as I personally felt that area has a lot of thefts and crazy people. I say this as I watched two ladies get there purse stolen and the homeless are amusing but scary. However, this is not the hotels problem but they are nice to have a secure elevator system. We booked the junior suite, which is now called another name. It had plenty of room and after reading many reviews here are my thoughts: yes, the bathroom could use an update but ours wasn't the worst bathroom that I have seen. The beds were very comfortable and after touring, sightseeing they were nice to relax ans sleep in. The only complaint I would have on the room is noise. We could hear other vacations and you can hear the Tiki room at night. However, I don't vacation to be in a room - I can do that home. The hotel is across from the beach so that is very nice! The views are breath taking! It had a Wolfgang Express, Subway, and cold stone right downstairs. If you are traveling with kids - Burger King is a block away and McDonalds is two blocks away. We had our 9 year old and 6 year old so they were heaven! The pool is a tad small but who cares when you have a whole ocean to absorb!My only other complaint of the hotel is Peggy, who works at the tour desk - she was unfriendly and messed up a tour. Overall, you could read every bad review and hesitate to stay here but if you are traveling with kids and are an average family wanting to have fun in Hawaii versus a hotel - this is a great place to stay!!! The hotel gives the kids coloring books and crayons as well as a sandbucket and shovel in a tote bag. Beach and rainy day fun - they care about kids!! Also, the breakfast was good. They have the coolers to use which made it nice. You could get cereal, pastries, fruit, and some other things for free. You had to pay extra for waffles, french toast, and eggs but I didn't feel the prices were unfair.

The location; great. Right across from the best part of the beach. The facilities; pretty good. Nice pool deck; on-site tuck shop with decent prices; nice eateries. We stayed in a tenth floor room on the ocean front. Excellent view. The included continental breakfast bar was fine. Eggs cost extra, which is ok, I guess. On-site car rental (tip, you only need to rent a car for a day if you're looking at touring the island.)) We used the city's public transit (stops located within a block) and it worked well to get to just about anywhere. This hotel was also a key tour bus pick-up spot, which is great! Proximity to good restaurants was welcomed. The onsite Tiki's bar and grill had an awesome indoor dining room and menu. Things that need work: the AC wasn't strong when we arrived: managed to make it work properly by keeping curtains closed during the day and propping open hallway door and lanai door for a few minutes to get a chilly air flow the first night. Also, wireless Internet available only on pool deck (it worked well), but only WIRED internet in the room. C'mon guys. No wireless in the rooms? Very inconvenient, and wouldn't have stayed there had I known. Glad I thought to bring my small laptop at the last moment. Cable selection; meagre but adequate. Otherwise, the bed was excellent; location; excellent; overally experience; very good. They have a unique way of getting an elevator, which meant that there was an elevator there within seconds of calling it. Nicely done. Bonus points for allowing patrons to sign out beach chairs and towels to go to beach across the street.

My family & I stayed here in July for four nights and enjoyed the excitement of Waikiki and the location of the hotel was great to take it all in. Close enough to walk to everything but far enough away that it wasn't as noisy. The beach access right across the street was wonderful, especially for families with smaller children.We had a view of Diamond Head & some of the beach. The balcony was too small to have even one chair & the airconditioning on the condo next door was too loud to have the door open through the night so we had to run the airconditioning all night. The bathroom was clean but tired. It was so old that it didn't look clean but as I looked closer it was as clean as it could get. The beds & pillows were very comfortable!Breakfast was fine & we were grateful for it. We didn't have any problem with other people being rude or fighting over the food. The quality of the food was good, no complaints as we knew going in that it was just continental breakfast.We liked the elevator system a lot. Was not confusing at all & it adds a bit of sense of security.The mandatory $27.00 a day valet is irritating and because there is no other place for guests to park their car the hotel can charge whatever they want. All in all I would give this hotel three stars. I might stay here again if I was able to get back to Oahu.
user_name:
Heidi I
Grass Valley, California, United States

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and had an oceanfront room on the 15th floor with a wonderful view over Waikiki Beach and the sea. The room was ok but especially the bathroom seemed very old and tired. There was a balcony where you could enjoy the views, but there was only one chair which I don't understand when it's a double room. Breakfast was nothing special. You could pick it up by the pool and take it to the beach or to your room, but it was very plain and quite boring. There is no wifi in the rooms, so we asked at the front desk where we could go online, and we were told, that the only place in the hotel with wifi was by the pool. We went out there, but after 5 minutes we were asked to leave because the pool area was closing. We asked where to go, but there was no other place - lousy service! They charge $27 per day for valet parking, which in my opinion is too much, but since we didn't know where else to park we ended up using it. The hotel has some good features, but there is definitely room for improvement.

We actually stayed here September 2010 but a bit slow on the review..We had a great stay here, right across the road from the beach, which was lovely for evening walks and within an easy stroll of all the shops. The pool wasnt bad considering its a hotel and not a resort and the bar and grill was fun with event evenings. I would come back here if we were lucky enough to come back to Hawaii, I thought it was great value for money and as usual in Hawaii, the staff are lovely.

I stayed at this hotel during spring break, for a band trip. They had free breakfast which was delicious, the pool deck had free wifi, the room had a view of the beach and the service was great! It was worth paying for.

3 people, ages 65, 39 and 14 stayed at this hotel for a week. We booked a junior suite with 2 double beds and a pull-out sofa. The only rooms with this bedding arrangement are on lower floors. I tried to pay for an upgrade for a better view but nothing was available. The lanai on our room was more of a "french balcony" with no room for a chair. There was a nice angled view of the ocean. The room was comfortable, I would suggest booking a suite if there are more than 2 people staying in the room. The bathroom needed a total renovation. Housekeeping was efficient, we tipped $5 a day, always had extra towels, bottled water, etc. The location of the hotel is excellent. Tiki's was a lot of fun and had excellent food/drinks. The breakfast was chaotic. A lot of the patrons acted like this was their only meal for the day with cutting in line, pushing, etc. It may be better if the hotel just gave everyone one plate instead of a bag to stuff. The hula dancer and singer were good. The breakfast was good for about 2 mornings then it became irritating and monotonous. Hotel staff was okay, depending on the person (check-in person was great, check-out person was rude). Overall I would recommend the Aston. The reasons I would hesitate staying there again is the pool area is rather pathetic, the wii-fi is pretty much non-existent, the "balcony" wasn't usable and the bathrooms need to be modernized.

We had a great stay at the Aston Waikki, which was the start of our honeymoon. Nice clean room, free breakfast, loved Tiki's - the staff were so friendly. Great location, so close to everything! Would def recommend!

We stayed at an ocean front room of this hotel for 8 nights in early July.Good:- Great location: across the street from the beach. This area of the beach is very calm because of the man-made barrier, which is perfect for our 4 and 6 y.o.- Two decent restaurants downstairs: Tiki's and Wolfgang Puck.- Great view. Since we have an ocean front room, we could clearly see the 4th of July fireworks, the parades, and the surfers down at the beach.- Good value. For the location and view, this is the cheapest hotel I could find in expedia.- Staff is friendly and helpful: I requested a quiet room as I am very sensitive to noise and they gave me a room on the 18th floor. Perfect!- Free buffet breakfast: saves time and money from going to a restaurant.- Fast internet.- Unlimited movie rentals. However, the selection is a bit slim. Only about 60 newer Hollywood movies available. Older kid movies like Toy Story and Lion King were not available.Bad:- the rooms overall and especially bathroom could use a major renovation. It was barely acceptable for me and I do have high tolerance. My wife actually wanted to change hotel but I talked her out of it.- No WIFI at the room and the internet cable in he room is not long enough to extend to the desk.

As many reviewers mentioned, this hotel is OLD and decayed (mold, bugs, broken furniture, etc). It needs serious renovations.Upon checkout, the hotel charged us $311 for the wall "damage" that hardly noticeable (see uploaded picture). Seriously, do you see anything that is justified to be charged for?? We said that it was unreasonable charge, but only thing they said was that they couldn't change anything since a manager was not present. After 2 wks long of many many attempts to talk with the "manager," he finally got us back and promised to give us $250 back. Now I see my bank account, the refund was only $60. Now I'm trying to talk with the manager again, nobody has responded my call. Not only that, their valet parking left our car lights' on over many nights, which drained gas significantly. Our brand new car got a huge scratch and chipped paint on the body. The hotel said that they have no responsibility over any damage or lost gas. I will never use any Aston chain hotel in my life. Be aware that such horrible things could happen to you, they take no responsibility!!!

We stayed here for 5 days at the beginning of July 2012.We were on the 25th [top floor] right on the corner and the wind was very noticeable at night. My wife daren't go out on the balcony and there was only one sun chair. Breakfast was a novelty, you were given a cool bag and got your breakfast down by the pool, either eating it there or on the beach using the folding director's chairs they loaned you. Fresh fruit, cereals, crossants and mixed cakes with coffee and fruit juice. A novel idea and clever, they don't have to provide a restaurant. There is one but it is of course a pay restaurant. The hotel is at the end of Waikiki beach near the zoo. The room inside was pleasant and modern. Value for money wise very good. The staff were efficient. A special word of praise for Peggy Garcia. We had pre booked a site seeing trip including Pearl Harbour. She helped us with our pick up point and even phoned for us to make sure our return transfer turned up. [Our pick up at the airport did not turn up and

Miserable visit, for which we paid about $345 a night. We had a giant roach in our room. This place is a filthy dump. My bed had hair in it when we arrived, there was black mold or mildew in the grout in the bathroom, the fake grass wallpaper is stained, probably from previous cockroaches, the furniture is shabby. I woke up the third night to what sounded like a rat chewing on cardboard, hopefully within the walls, not in our room.

Hi,I used the foyer computer to access my email, book a car etc.. When I tried to print the booking confirmation the computer froze. I asked the desk and they told me to use the phone to call support which I did and spoke to a very dodgy sounding Indian man. He asked me to move to a new computer and added some time for me to log in to my email and print the required documents. The computer froze again so I used the phone to call support again. Same dodgy bloke moved me to a new computer, added time, asked me to log into my email, Expedia etc.. So he could see what I was doing. I bought up the document I needed, he took control of the computer and he printed the document. I got the hard copy and he closed off the computer from my access. The next day I went to log in to my email and I was blocked because of suspicious activity. The only way I could unblock my email was though my mobile phone connection which was back in Australia. This incident happened after 4 days of a 2.5 week Hawaii Holiday. We had a cruise for 7 night’s booked, accommodation in Turtle Bay resort and the Sheraton Waikiki, Cars, Activities and dinners – all the details, dates, address and contact numbers were inside my email which I was now blocked. I left a message with the Aston Waikiki Beach General manager for him to urgently call me and briefly explained the issue, I have no returned call.It costed us money, stress and my holiday time to contact friends, family and business in Australia and The USA to try and get some of these details back.When I got back to Australia and finally was able to have my email unblocked, I found hundreds of emails in my sent box to every contact; business, friends, family telling them some ridicules story and how I’ve been making all this money, its easy, sign up here with link to these dodgy web links. The worst thing is some of the people wrote back, they signed up and wanted to know how much I was making etc.. On top of all this they had access to my banking details, bills, photos, address and pretty much my whole life.I sent an email to the Aston Waikiki Beach explaining what had happened and they rejected any responsibility and told me I have to take it up with their contracted IT support company. I wrote 3 emails to Aston Waikiki Beach explaining that the computers are located in their foyer, next to their reception and provided by the hotel to their guests, I got nothing but rude, denying replies with no care of responsibility of what happened.This put a huge damper on our HONEYMOON, we were constantly chasing our tail the whole time trying to remember what we had organised, finding address and phone numbers and not missing booked activity times.I strongly recommend staying somewhere a hotel would take some responsibility of something that happens under their roof; an apology would have been a starting point.The fact the hotel GM didn’t bother to return my call on a serious issue such as computer hacking and email fraud is a good indication of the customer service and staff you will find here.Try the Sheraton up the road, a little more expensive but worth every cent.

During our stay in July we experienced a problem with our room that required us to be moved to another room in the hotel. The front staff lead by Ms Lakai Wolfgramm took quick action to see that we were moved to a better room within one hour. Ms. Wolfgramm coordinated the move with the hotel staff and upgraded our room to a junior suite with king bed and two balconies. She also saw to it that a folding bed was provided for my nephew at no extra charge. Our move was done very efficiently and professionally by the hotel staff. I want to complement Ms. Wolfgramm and all the staff for their efforts in making our stay a memorable experience. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Honolulu as the staff, location and organization is exceptional.

We just returned from a ten day stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. We travelled as a family of three (2.5 year old son, and my husband and I). I would say this an average hotel with decent prices for the location. In the future, I would maybe stay again, but it didn't please us enough to rave about it. I would recommend it to others, but would tell them our pros and cons list for sure. Here goes:Pros:1. Good location, directly across the street from the beach. The beach across the street is great for kids, as it has a wave-breaking wall to make the water calmer. 2. Clean rooms, clean bathroom. Bathroom could use a renovation and they are small, but they are clean and do the trick. Beds were very comfortable. I noticed a bedbug-proof mattress cover on our bed. Lanai was an okay size. Had to bring a chair from inside for my husband and I to both sit on the balcony as only one chair is provided.3. Decent continental breakfast; hotel includes a free cooler bag at check-in. It includes fresh juice and fruit, muffins, pastries, doughnuts, mini bagels, cereal, yogurt, milk, coffee, Japanese breakfast items, instant oatmeal, and for a $5 charge, omelettes and waffles (?) as well. People did hoard food though, as you could only pass through the line once. Hula dancer and singer at the breakfast every morning. 4. Elevator system was a secure, efficient way of transporting people to their rooms and back. It can be confusing for some, but it really is common sense. You just need to take the time to understand how it works. Can be slower in the mornings, but still not that bad.5. Housekeeping was good, very friendly.6. In-room fridge was nice. Your typical bar-sized fridge. No in-room microwaves though.7. Ocean-view room was great! (We were on the 14th floor) More cost-efficient than ocean front, and I’m sure just as good views. Have heard that partial ocean view is not worth it though.8. Free wi-fi on the pool deck.9. On-site restaurants were good. I recommend Wolfgang Puck’s. There is Tiki's (make a reservation), a Subway, Honolulu Cookie Company, and Coldstone Creamery on site as well. ABC store around the corner.10. Hotel provides beach chairs and beach towels for free. They have to be returned by 7 p.m. or there is a $30 charge to your bill. 11. Securely stored luggage after check-out for 7 hours until our shuttle picked us up at the hotel. They have a large scale to use for free to weigh your luggage as well. 12. Located on the Waikiki beach “strip” but far enough away from the busy part of the strip, so it wasn’t as crowded with people.13. Use of a crib for our son for free.14. Only two blocks (on Kuhio Street) to the city bus stop. Very great way to get anywhere (we used it for Walmart, Ala Moana Center, and the Swap Meet by Pearl Harbour). It is $2.50 per adult and it includes as many transfers as you want for free within a 4 hour time frame after you pay. The cost for a youth was $1.25, and children under 6 are free if they sit on your lap. They can have a seat if the bus is not busy.15. Across the street from Honolulu Zoo, and a short walk to the Aquarium.16. There are four tour companies located in the lobby for your convenience. We never booked through them, as we had a referral to Affordable Tours (On Seaside Avenue, Across from Ross). They were GREAT!!!! We dealt with Lee and another woman, the prices were awesome compared to Expedia in the hotel, and all of the tours were unbelieveable. We strongly recommend taking the walk to book through them, but the companies in the hotel are there if need be. Some of our tours through Affordable tours were half the cost as others though. 17. There are double beach chairs located by the pool with a canopy to block the sun. Although we never used them, they would be nice. You must be there early to scoop on up though, as they go quickly. 18. Air conditioning in room worked well, although housekeeping changed the temp warmer when they came in.Cons:1. Unless you pay the $10 Amenity fee per day, you don’t get free LOCAL calling (inconvenient if you are trying to book tours or calling for food delivery), no use of the safe (safe-only cost per day is $3), or no wi-fi in your room. We would have sooner have them hide the fee in our cost per night, and just have full access to these items. 2. We were located in a room directly behind the elevator. VERY ANNOYING! Sounded so loud, like a fighter jet was flying overhead every few minutes. We asked for a new room, but apparently they were booked. No discounts/amenity fee waived. This made us very mad, as we had a 2.5 year old travelling with us and it disturbed his sleep.3. Small rooms. Would be okay if it is only 2 adults, but with one extra person, one extra piece of luggage, and his crib set up, it was quite cramped.4. Bathrooms need updating. No working bathroom fan. Very low showerhead. There were always good water temps and pressure though.5. After five days, the hired breakfast musician by the pool was getting old. Same music, same songs. 6. The Aston is a major stopping point for tour buses, trollies, etc. The sounds of the bells ringing on the trollies late at night god old fast too. I guess this is a positive for transportation; the loudness of it gets to you after a while. The Tiki's bar downstairs has live music every night. This was fairly loud, but didn't really bother us.7. Although the continental breakfast cuts the cost of one meal per day, we were sick of it after a week. Went elsewhere for a few days.8. The birds at breakfast were so tame that it was annoying. They were always by you waiting for a crumb to drop. It seems to be a problem in Waikiki in general though.

If you stay here, be sure to make your reservations for the rooms on the Waikiki beach side and not the side facing Diamond Head. These rooms do not have a good view AT ALL and they have no real balcony AT ALL!. The other side does have a balcony you can sit on it and/or stand on but the views are legit, the higher up you are. In addition, the rooms on the Diamond Head side are just too small to be comfortable. The location is good. The breakfast is very nice and although not hot, certainly enuff good fresh grub to hold you til dinner. The elevator problem of before is now solved and they work very efficiently. Our eating at the Tiki was VERY good indeed and on par with a 5 star. One piece of info; the free check out beach chairs are very nice at the beach area across the street and looking for the moving shade from the palms makes sitting out there makes for a very nice all day experience. I would stay here again if I had a front facing beach room and the price was really good.

We had a great holiday,Service and facilities were very good,great location right on the beach.Breakfast was very good,lunches and diners next door at the Tiki Bar were great too.Good size swimming pool.we would stay here again...

The roooms are very small. Ocean view s a joke, hang out your balcony and maybe you will see water.The free breakfast is a generous continental not hot (available for pay ) but you have toeat it on pool deck on pool chairs. Yes outdoors on pool side furniture.The Internet is not wifi a lot of good that does you in this era of wifi devices.Yes the elevators have a unique entry system.Overall you get the feeling the management operate this property to minimize theft, and so they have us all on crazy processes and policies.It's a great location but or my money I am of confident there is better.

We were in a Jr. Suite and pleased with the accomodation. They did not have our originally requested suite ready when we checked in but provided a room for us to use to change to go on an excursion and we were given the correct room when we returned near bedtime. This hotel has a wonderful location, lots of eating options nearby and is a common pickup/drop-off point if you have chosen transportation for your activities. It is a well kept establishment and provides a wonderful continental breakfast each morning. I felt we got a lot of "bang for our buck" and highly recommend it if you are considering a trip to Oahu and watching your $.

We really enjoyed our four day stay here. We booked through Costco and they reserved an ocean view room, not ocean view where you have to lean over your balcony and look way to the left or right. We had a great sight of surfers and the waves. That said, we had a few disappointments. We got hit with a $42.00 "resort fee" for internet, newspaper, etc. We were not told verbally that this was going to be an extra charge from Costco. The complimentary continental breakfast was a chore. They served it pool side and did not give you a tray to carry your food to a table. You had to make about three trips to carry everything you wanted. The quality of the food was nothing to rave about. Now about the elevators. You have a room key card. You pass it over the push buttons for the floors. You push the floor you want and a window tells you what elevator to take. Once inside, you can not push your floor number, its already programed. Going down you push "star" and it takes you to the third floor where the desk is. Then you have to take an escalator down to the first floor or find the secret elevator that takes you down to the first floor. After a while you adjust, but its a little crazy.

Don't be fooled, the Aston Waikiki Beach is not and never was a luxury hotel. It is one of a few in Waikiki that are in need of renovation. The rooms are cramped and the decor is obnoxious. The walls are paper thin; I could hear normal conversation in the room next door and street noise was noticeable even at night. Partial ocean views aren't worth it; our view was mostly blocked by the hotel tower less than 25 yards away.The staff are friendly but they can't make up for the serious problems at this facility. I can only recommend if you are on a tight budget but really want to be on the beach.

We had a great time in Hawaii and loved this hotel. The location is great - very close to lots of shops and restaurants. The view was fabulous. The staff was friendly and helpful. We liked the free breakfast. I was skeptical about the elevator situation when I read some of these reviews, but we never waited long at all. The system seems to work wonderfully. You do have to go to the pool area for free wifi, which is a litlte inconvenient, but not something I would complain about. At least there was that option. Some hotels charge you, with no option of free wifi at all. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were extremely clean. We liked the decor of the hotel and the rooms. There is no room service, but we never use room service, anyway. The part of the beach directly in front of the hotel has a wall, so there is no danger of venturing out too far. Our flight to come home was at night, so they let us move rooms after checkout so we wouldn't have to hang out on the beach or at the pool all day. There was a charge, but it was only $75, which we didn't think was bad . We would definitely stay here again.

The basics that are important to me: the AC worked, the beds were quite comfortable, there was plenty of hot water and the rooms were kept clean. The swimming pool was fine for a dip but is pretty full of kids. The hotel really deserves better than a 3, but less than a 4. TA should shift to a six star system.Being right across the street from the beach was nice and would be appealing to a family with small children. That particular part of the beach is protected by a sea wall. So, it's like swimming in the ocean that's more like a pool -- no surf to speak of. I thought the breakfast was fine, the shuttle services were convenient and it was a close walk to restaurants and shops. Our room on the 16th floor was a regular room with a king sized bed and I thought it was plenty big enough. The view was great. The bathroom was in need of remodeling. I agree that the extra $10 daily charge for Internet is annoying, and when I was told it would only work for laptops, not iPads, I declined it, then was told that it was a mandatory add-on fee for several services. We only stayed two nights as a stop-over to see Pearl Harbor before our Maui vacation, and it was fine for a short stay. Two weeks in that hotel would not have been a fun, restful vacation, especially by comparison to what we have over here. Maui and Waikiki are like two different worlds.

we had read some mixed views on this hotel. we have been to hawaii seven times and this was the first time at the aston. we had a beachfront room which was on the sixth floor. our view was lovely with views over the beach and looking towards the pink palace. lovely sunset views. our room was clean and comfortable. although we were near the restaurant which has live music the sound did not disturb us. we were not bothered by people occupying other rooms as is the case in some other hotels. the staff were very friendly and helpful. the breakfast was ample choices of fresh tropical fruit, cereal and milk, muffins and danish. you could pay for french toast and something else which I can't remember offhand. they also had miso soup and a dish catering for japanese guests I think the cooked dishes were around $5. you are given a carry bag for your breakfast items so you can eat at the pool in your room or at the beach.location is good it is close to the action and far enough away to escape any noise.on the whole we enjoyed our stay and would go back to the aston on our next visit to hawaii

Celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary in Waikiki before heading on to Maui. Great place to stay, accessible to the beach and shopping. Next to the Zoo and away from the busy section of the Beach so it was nice. The continental breakfast was just enough and they gave you thermal bags to put food in if you were traveling from the hotel. Lovely Hawaiian music every morning. Our two full size bedroom was on the 21st floor and there was a little wind noise from the sliding glass door that bothered us on windy days. That was the only drawback.

Either way, we found this to be a good value for what we received. Primarily like the garishly decorated room that was an eye burning bright red. This was the ocean front suite (or jr. suite, I can't remember) that looked exactly as portrayed on the website and even slightly roomier. We had a pretty nice ocean view and lots of space.Everything else about the hotel kind of reminds you of better times left behind, which is not that unusual in Waikiki unless you are willing to spend the really big bucks. All in all, the location is good, the pool is ok, the food not so hot and the overall atmosphere tacky, but kinda in a fun way. If you go on a weekend that is not packed, definitely get a good AAA rate and it's worth splurging for the suites. I never actually saw a room, but it would feel cramped I am sure and without a view. We had 2 double doors leading to a small balcony and could hear the ocean at night, although the property is across the street from the beach (customary for this section) and the exterior really looks nothing like the pic. It is jammed in with other properties everywhere, not sitting secluded on a sand dune over the ocean as the pic seems to want to portray IMO.

We were very impressed by this hotel. The staff was always willing to help with any questions or requests. A breakfast was complimentary every morning. The hotel even provided a thermal bag to pack your own breakfast and head for the beach which was right across from the hotel. Would stay there again without question.

We stayed here for 2 nights during our honeymoon. We loved the location and that it was right across the street from the beach. It was a little noisy at times but really that is my only beef with this place. We loved that it had a bar that served cheap (at lease for Hawaii) drinks early afternoon and late night. The breakfast was your normal continental style and was free! The valet took longer than they said to get your car but nothing too serious. All employees were super nice and gave great suggestions on where to eat and visit.

The hotel looks amazing online - which is why we booked, but the king size room was too small for a 2 week stay, The buffet breakfast is a great idea - but not something that appealed to us (que of folk stuffing ice cooler bags to the brim). Room was kept clean. Bar was nice, music was fab at night. But just too busy and cramped for such a long stay. If you like being in the heart of the action this is a great location, if your looking for a carb heavy free for all buffet - this is also perfect.

The GOOD:Great view of beach, ocean and sunset (had beach-facing room). Nice on-location restaurant (Tiki Lounge), comfortable beds, prompt maid service (called for towels a couple of times over 3 day stay), clean, free breakfast. The breakfast is served poolside and each occupant get one pass through the line. Pastries, muffins, cereal, fruit, miso soup, coffee, milk, and more are free. For a little extra, waffles and another item (can't recall) are available. In room PS3 plays games or DVD's including bluray. In room mini fridge.The BAD: In room safe costs $3 per day, Internet costs extra too, $10 per day if memory serves. No room service. The front desk had a long line (10 min. wait approx) more than half the time we needed to go there.The AVERAGE: Standard mid-level accomodations like alarm clock radio and flat screen TV with basic cable in room. The only swimming pool was full of kids and didn't smell of chlorine even a little, but was able to get a few good laps in. Free towel service at poolside. Elevators to rooms require a room keycard for access. Room on 9th floor smallish but not cramped. Carpet was more of the indoor-outdoor variety, but this is good for a beach side room. Birds on the balcony were common, and never intrusive. Had to move the credenza to get to a wall outlet to charge camera battery, then on last day found one mounted on the side of the credenza that blended in too well. Ice also was not obvious and didn't find till 2nd day there by chance. They're on the island side (vs.ocean side) near the elevators. $1 per fax received charged was expected but was told no charge when inquiring.I gave an average rating because I'm not taking into account the location but on a different day I might be giving it four out of five.. The location is a given if you're booking this room. I felt that nickle and diming commonly free services like wifi and in room safe is a roundabout way to extract a higher room rate without charging it up front. The experience was better than any motel or budget hotel I've stayed in and not quite to the level of the four star hotels I've stayed in.

The Good: The location of this hotel is great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was nice having free movies. The Bad: The glass door leading to the lanai (not big enough for a chair or table) didn't slide smoothly making it difficult to open and the door rattled with the wind. The sheer curtains wouldn't slide open smoothly and kept sticking. The bathroom had a slight sewer smell to it. The bathroom in general was not maintained well. The A/C worked but the auto on and off was not functioning properly as it would just keep running unless we turned it off. We had to call twice for maintenance, once for the safe that wasn't left open and once for the playstation that wouldn't play movies. The ironing board had a cover but not a pad so when you ironed something it left marks in the clothes which made it useless. The noise level was awful as the walls were thin and you could clearly hear entire conversations from the hall and your next door neighbors. I personally did not want 5:30 am wake up calls every morning but the next room did and it sounded as if the phone was in our room. They don't have in room coffee makers and that was a big issue for me since I was being woke up so early by the neighbors in the next room.
