We stayed 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Beachcomber prior to moving to the Aston as I had free nights there and it was a great room with free internet and it was very well maintained, clean and quiet with a bigger room and a lanai that was big enough for a table and chairs. And a coffee maker! I regretted making the move to the Aston.

Continental breakfast around the pool was offered during reasonable hours and there was a singer and hula dancer that performed during it ,9 out of 10 for ambient . Free Wifi, was only offered around the pool, We were able to get a upgrade to ocean view further towards the front of the hotel near the beach,fantastic to see the sun set over the ocean ,this is worth the money and effort.Had a king size bed and this was great.All tours stop out the front for pick up ,this very convenient,although you are the last to be dropped off,and first to be picked up.You are a little out of the action and it is a good walk to the cheese cake cafe.

The hotel appeared much prominent than we expected it to be. Located in an accessible location to the beach with pleasent rooms. Getting our luggage to the lobby was a little problematic since it is located at level 2, glad we didn't have to move around too much. A couple of staffs were nice to us during our check-in for our honeymoon, but others were very unwilling to assist us to make a quick call to a tour company to confirm on our pick-up location on the following morning. Breakfast wasn't fantastic with muffins, yogurt, cereals, fruits, tasteless instant miso soup and plain sushi with a slice of pickle. Juices tastes like they were made from concentrate.There wasn't any official breakfast area but limited sun-tanning chairs to sit around to have our meal. Hence, we used the 'takeaway-warmers' to pack some food to dine in our own room.

This hotel was incredibly filthy. I have stayed in some pretty dirty places but never for $165 a night. Floors and curtains had huge stains, there were even stains on the ceiling over the bed, I don’t even want to know how that happened. Over all the entire hotel was just completely run down. Staff was nice but that doesn’t count for much considering the rooms are littered with the previous 100 travelers DNA. If you do decide to stay here I would recommend bringing a large pack of Clorox wipes and slippers, just plan on giving the room a good once over wipe down when you arrive. I am not a clean freak by any nature but this was bad!!! Also the pillows were like rocks, the stuffing was literally falling out.

have stayed in this hotel twice and on the second time chose to upgrade to Ocean View. WOW overlooked the Pacific ocean and well worth the money as every morning and evening we got to watch the Humpback Whales swim past absolutely breathe taking. this was in March and the rooms are very spacious and clean and would gladly stay here again
user_name:
Darrell G
Grimsby, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Continental breakfast around the pool was offered during reasonable hours and there was a singer and hula dancer that performed during it. Free Wifi, was only offered around the pool, which was inconvenient when it rained. There was a daily fee for room use and the internet was slow. The cable was not HD which, while not a big deal, would have been nice that first night getting used to the time change. No microwaves in room. Rooms are nothing to write home about, but are clean.

What's good about this hotel?1. Location. Right across the street from the beach with the sea wall. Virtually no waves. Good for families.2. Kid-friendly. We had our two kids (6&9) with us. They each got a small cinch sac, a sand bucket and shovel, and a coloring book and crayons at check-in. This makes them happy.3. Coupon book. I only wish I would have looked at it more carefully before spending over $100 at the gift shop at the USS Missouri only to find out that the Aston's coupon book had a 20% off coupon.4. Pool chairs. These chairs were awesome! Padded and everything. My non-sun loving husband managed to get one with a little roof...like a cabana chair. 5. Chair and towel check-out. They let you check out really nice, fluffy towels and fold-up lawn chairs to take to the beach. Free!! Just return them by 7 p.m.6. Elevator system. Scan your key card and enter your floor number, then you get assigned an elevator. Really nice! Kids also think this is fun.7. Fun, tropical room decor.8. Wolfgang Puck and other restaurants at street level. Good places to eat on way to/from beach.9. Cleanliness. The cleaning services did an exceptional job. They cleaned once while we were at breakfast and the room was spotless! What's not so great?1. Room size. OMG was this place small!! There were four of us and plenty of luggage, but this was probably the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. Maybe 18" between one of the beds and the wall. Put a family of four in here and you're stepping on each other.1.5. Bathroom size. Again, it's small. Toilet fits under the vanity. My husband turned around too fast and his toothbrush fell into the toilet. Next day, I did the same thing with my hairbrush. Thank goodness for ABC stores. 2. Breakfast. People act like they've never seen food before. The free coolers to fill for breakfast is a cute, kitschy idea; but not fun when people are hoarding food and vulturing like this may be their only meal ever. We had one tiny cooler for our entire family while other people were carrying two and three coolers and filling them to the brim. Breakfast begins at 6:30. We were downstairs one morning at 6:15 because of a tour bus and there were probably 50 people in line already. It's survival of the fittest for sure.3. Partial Ocean View? Okay, this is probably my fault. I spent more money on the ocean-front condo in Kona and much less on this place. But the partial ocean view ONLY occurred when I stepped out onto my 18" deep "lanai" and leaned out over the rail. We could see the back end of Diamond Head and directly into the hotel rooms of whatever was across the way. I can see where you could get some outstanding views from the other side of the hotel. Just not in our case. Pros do outweigh the cons, but really, the size of this room was CRAZY SMALL. I had originally wanted to stay in the Embassy Suites to avoid this whole type of thing, but I let my travel agent talk me into this. Beach access was great, kids loved it. Adults just wanted some space.

Great location but grungy hotel... Rooms are small and need a good scrub down. We had an amazing view and the breakfast on the beach option is really nice, but overall I would not recommend. We made the best of it because we were only there for 2 night. Spend the little bit extra and stay somewhere else.

This hotel was just what we expected the staff were friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast that you could take to the beach was just fantastic. The room was brilliant and the view was just amazing. The resurants were good the Tiki grill bar was a regular visit for us. Would definitley stay again

I stayed here June 19-27. I had a Junior suite for only 266.00 per night.They offer a free breakfast buffet every morning also. The hotel was very clean and the employees were very friendly.There were several eating places in the hotel. My favorites were Wolfgang Puck and the tiki Grill and Bar. Would definitely stay there again.

We booked this hotel for our honeymoon. And we got what was expected from this hotel. 10/10. The staff on arrival were great, fast and friendly. We had a sea front room which overlooked the sea, the view was spectacular. Breakfast was a buffet breakfast, which was great to help yourself to what you wanted. The rooms were clean and tidy. The restuarant at the front of the hotel was a great place to eat either for lunch or a early evening meal. There is a free bus (train) that goes to Halo Hatties shoping this is a great drive seeing all the sites of the island on route.

My friends and I booked rooms at this hotel, and we were expecting a view of the ocean! Well, we were not informed that I'd we wanted a full ocean view we had to choose ocean front. Then when we got here they put my bf and I on one floor, and the other couple we came with 10 floors up. I would unfortunately not recommend this hotel. They were very rude, and only asked if we wanted to move rooms after vacation was over half over, and after the travel agent called.
user_name:
Sara H
Grand Island, Nebraska, United States

review_body: Great property with a friendly staff. Awesome location within walking distance of the zoo, shopping, and of course, the beach!

Our stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach was ok... the room was clean and tidy but very small and in need of refurbishment. The bathroom was tiny with a shower over the bath and our room was directly infront of the lift well so we could hear lifts going up and down all night long. We had a great view from our tiny lani. Breakfast was a nice extra and saved us having to eat our for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Reception staff were not very friendly or helpful. Overall ok for the price.

We stayed here for 3 nights during a 13 day trip to 4 Islands In HI. The location is very good, the rooms were good, the pool area was very nice and they had great lounge chairs. The staff was nice and helpful and a continental breakfast is included with the room and that was fairly good. Their elevator system is really awesome once you get used to it. The only complaint I have is that the doors to the rooms close very hard and everyday I was woken up at 5:30 am by the room next to me going out their door. Waikiki beach is right across the street and you can walk to a lot of different shops and places from here. They also have a bar area that serves food. We didn't eat there just drank and that overlooked the beach area as well

Stayed early to mid June 2012 for 5 nights. Family with teenagers. Booking was done through 3rd party website. Location is to the East of Waikiki's Kalakaua Avenue, close to Honolulu Zoo. A Starbucks is just around the corner, and there's plenty of convenience stores and small cafes at the ground floor of the building. The plus of the location is that it is quite a distance away from the crowd, and so the beach right across is not as busy. The delta will be that we have to walk a bit to get to the most hip and happening areas in Waikiki; and walk all the way back to the hotel. However considering all the delicious food in Hawaii that is a good additional cardio to burn off those extra calories (aside from surfing, snorkeling, etc).Check in was more relaxed compared to most mainland hotels. It is quite efficient but the atmosphere is more of a vacationer's leisure time and little to no effort to show a quick service. The elevators have no buttons to push inside, and only honors room key card. Without room key card, people from ground level can only go up to the 3rd level where the check in location is. Probably this is the hotel's way to prevent unauthorized people from going up to the hotel's guestroom floors. Have to say that the elevator programming is very sophisticated and well organized. With a swipe of your room key card at the reading area under the elevator buttons outside, you select which floor you want to go to from the buttons outside, and the system assigned you which elevator to take that will stop at your floor. Brilliant! The hotel has a package that enables you to borrow up to 3 DVD's and 2 PS3 games through the vending machines located at the lobby/check in area. Yes, there is a PS3/DVD player in the room! The room is quite spacious. We opted for a partial beachview room; and from the balcony we can look at the beach across the street. Very nice, with flat screen TV, fridge and powerful centralized AC. However the compensation for having a very advanced elevator system is that there is no wifi internet for your computer! Wifi is only available in the lobby/check in area. Computer have to connect to internet using a cable connection and that is a kiss of death for my iPad! So just be aware of that when you stays here - bring your laptop. The beds are very comfortable and welcoming after a full day of exhausting activities around the island. The bathroom is a bit on the small side and the water pressure is low and at times just trickling down; however it is quite fine if you don't have that much sand to wash off. A critical item that you need to know is that for a hotel with so many rooms, they do not have enough space and arrangements for breakfast! Breakfast is buffet style at the lobby/check-in/pool area. Rolls, muffins, fruits, juices, oatmeals, they even have Japanese/Korean section for miso soup and some sushi and kimchi. You have to pay extra if you want hot omelette or waffle. My son tried their waffle and was really disappointed since it is not to the standard that we used to. There's always a long line of people at the breakfast area, even before breakfast area opens. Everybody wants to grab breakfast before the crowd really rush in! The hotel provides a small plastic picnic bag in the room which you can stuff with all the breakfast food you want to bring out to the beach and have a picnic breakfast there. Quite a good idea, since the remaining people have to find whatever beach chairs is available around the pool to eat their breakfast. Need to be careful with all the birds coming in and peck at any unguarded plates! While having breakfast, there is this duo ukulele player and dancer that performs really good hula song and dance. Alas, most people are either too busy chowing or they are not as culturally educated since we are among the very few who applauded and appreciate their performances!Check out was quick even though the line is long as usual... We got an extension for a few hours for a fee since we are leaving on a late flight, and the hotel holds our bags in the ground floor concierge. All in all the hotel is not too bad and have some very interesting features, but just be prepared to meet long lines for check in/out, breakfast, and other services. Also expect to see relatively unsmiling and tired faces of the overworked employees, and the sour cherry on top will be the lack of wifi in the room.

The hotel was clean, and close to almost everything Waikiki. Frances at the concierge desk was amazing!! She set us up with great excursions. The morning breakfast buffet was a waste though. There were so many people (at one point a woman reached over me and grabbed the last muffin that I was about to take!) This isn't necessarily the hotels fault though, we just found it easier to go downstairs to the Wolfgang Puck express restaurant and get breakfast sandwiches.

Staying at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, I had the most beautiful view Ihave ever seen...There might be nicer Hotels, but not with the view I had from my private lenai...My room was an oceanfront which is that i would encourage you obtaining... Just a short walk across the street brings you to Waikiki beach hotel... A short elevator ride is Tikis a great pool side bar... Another benefit of staying at Aston is a free breakfast, as meals can be expensive... I would also encourage the Ohau card which gives you accssiblity to several tours dinners and much more...

Having never visited Hawaii before and being my first OS trip I researched accommodation in Waikiki for weeks, read hundreds of reviews of countless hotels. There was just something about the Aston that kept coming back to the top. So I sat on that thought and when I was ready to book I discovered a deal on their website and pounced. I could not have been more happy with my choice.Everything was perfect. Every staff member, every day, were polite, friendly, helpful and always had an aloha with a smile.I don’t understand other people’s issue with the elevator, I’ve never seen the system used before but it works perfectly. Swipe the card, press your floor and go to the elevator it displays …. it’s not rocket science people :)The room ? Perfect, we even had the red hibiscus drapes over the beds ala the website photos. Clean and serviced daily by a beautiful woman who also helped us with food choices, local places to eat and visit. We had a full front ocean facing room, views downtown to Waikiki to the right and Diamond Head off to the left. Being from the east coast of Australia I've never seen the sun set over the ocean as it rises over 'our' ocean at the beach. Spectacular !!The bathroom? A little small but had everything we needed, shower over the bath, hand basin and bench space. Oh and a loo. Being out all day it was not an issue at all. Could be if there were more than 2 adults.Breakfast? Ideal. Yes, sometimes it was a little busy and the brekkie food ran low but the staff were on top of that each day. Considering the number of people being served it was well managed. Special mention to Eric the guitar player and the beautiful hula dancer who perform every morning around the pool.Location? Perfect perfect perfect !!!! Being down the zoo end of the street it is on the last block so people and traffic have generally thinned out some what. Local bus stop is just around the corner so not far to walk at all. One good tip to remember is to get off the bus just before the zoo and walk the couple of blocks to the hotel (if coming back to Waikiki from Diamond Head direction) due to the hotel being on a one way street, otherwise the bus will drive all the way along a road behind the hotel to the other end of the Waikiki strip and make every stop on the way to the Aston (which will be the last hotel) it will save you a heap of time.Things to do? All within walking distance or jump on an Aloha bus, a trolley or tour bus from the street level lobby. We spent 8 days there and didn’t use or need a car or taxi at all.Yes the Tiki bar is downstairs on the pool level and yes it is generally busy and has live music but we loved it. Usually the music stopped around 11pm. We were on the 9th floor and it was lovely to sit out on the lanai listening to the world going about it's business below.If I am ever fortunate enough to visit the beautiful city of Honolulu again I wouldn’t even bother looking at any other hotels, I’d be booking with the Aston again without doubt !!Thank you for contributing to my dream come true holiday xo

The Aston was just right for our family. The location was great with a perfect, safe beach right out front, without the insane crowds further towards the bigger resorts just down the road. It was very clean. It is NOT a resort and does not claim to be. The pool area is ok, but nothing special. Much better to just step over to the beautiful beach. The morning breakfast is a continental breakfast. Nothing fancy, but the fresh fruit and pastries are a nice way to start the day.

This hotel is in a great location with a great vibe. You really feel like you're in the heart of it all. What a brillant elevator system! It is well worth getting the beach view or beach front rooms. Swimming pool area is quite small and breakfast time can get quite busy. The music from the Tiki bar on floor 3 was great - but don't expect to sleep before midnight. Reception area was always busy and you can wait for quite a while to be attended to. But overall - a brilliant stay.

We we're told when we booked we has wifi included in our $10 a day amenatie fee... Find out only in the lobby it works with iPhones ... You have to have a laptop to access in the rooms. Got charged for 1800#s we called to our credit card companies... That was supposed to be included in the amenatie fee(the adjusted it only after we complained.). Parking is $27/day which was expensive since everywhere else on the other islands we visited was free. Room taxes are high also.Overall clean but check your bill over before you check out.

They charge $2 if you lose the little plastic key card. There are little labeles taped to all of the items in the hotel telling you how much they will charge you if it's missing when you check out. $30 to park, and it takes them 20 min to get your car. No bottled water in the room. Pool is not very nice, and you have to choose to face that or the ocean. Breakfast goes until 900 am, so don't try to sleep in in your vacation!

Stayed for nights had a great time , only thing that was abit annoying was the check in , because we had a few heaybags , valet desk told us to go up stairs to check in , but since we were early we were told to leave bags downstairs and come back at three , then obviuosly we came back at three along with every body else . But check in was quick enough considering the crowd that was there at least that had 5 staff checking people in., plus one of the bar staff was a little whingy when i did not leave a big enough tip , other than that pleasant experience,we had a partial view room was clean , showers were good , lifts do take a little to get used but only because they are different not bad. breakfast was a bit different with the line up and gab what you can style , food was good , could see how it would get a bit much , was sick of it after 4 days.All the amentiesin the building was awesome , foos places , bar, live music , booking centres makes life easy.We lived in Wolfgang Pucks downstairs , pizza was great and cheap and it truly is express. If you are going to hire snorkel gear go downtown to somewhere like boss frogs , surf shop around corner of aston wants to charge 14 a day , boss frog starts at 9/week but better gear costs 20/week . If you go to the international marketplace , walk all the way down the back to one of the last souviner stands(opp Ross store) there is a hawaiin guy chris , nicest person you will ever meet, if your lucky like us he will mark your map with all the places to see around the island.

And why not, It's right across the street from Waikiki Beach!Like many hotels in Waikiki, the room is smallish, but is very clean and comfy for two.The breakfast deal is pretty cool. Head down to the lanai pool in the morning and fill up your picnic tote that you'll find in your room. Take it across the street and eat on the beach, if you wish. Never tried the restaurant/outdoor bar, but it looked busy. A good sign.For a few bucks, a shuttle pulls right up to the curb in front of the hotel and can whisk you around Waikiki, all the way to the famed Ala Moana Shopping Center and back.This hotel is at the end of the strip, next to the zoo and a short walk to the aquarium with a clear view of Diamond Head.Sure, there are more luxurious places and they will cost you more. For the money, sleep here.Did I mention the Wolfgang Puck's, Subway and fresh cookie shop on the street level?

This is our second time staying at the Aston. This time, there were some glaring changes. The rooms weren't overly clean - the bathroom was actually a little grimy around the walls. The breakfast has really gone downhill - all there was this time was muffins/patries and yogurt everyday,plus a little fruit a couple of days. Not really very satisfying. The views are still spectacular, and the location is awesome (right across the street from the water), but the checkin time was incredibly long, the cleanliness left something to be desired, and the breakfast was a joke. Because of these things, this will probably be my last stay at the Aston.

Could not be better situated, right on Waikiki beach, and even with a partial ocean view room, will get beautiful sunsets... But really this is not enough to justify the price charged. I was expecting a bit more than that. At the reception, you will be better served by male staff (the female staff are often cranky, with a "couldn't give a toot" attitude sometime bordering rudiness!). The breakfast is a farce. Looks more like meal time in a refugees camp than a breakfast buffet in a holiday hotel. Unless you go as soon as they open, you will be hard pressed to get something decent other than just a few pastries or miso soup. And they close fairly early (09:00) so if you had a late night in town.... bad luck. Having say that the rooms are spotless with a very capricious a/c that is hard to set...You don't go to Waikiki to stay in a hotelroom, but if you're there for 12 days or more, then your hotel confort becomes a tiny bit more important.

We stayed here for 8 nights. We had a wonderful time. The complimentary breakfasts were well run and we hardly ever had to wait in line, it would have been nice to have a change on the menu through the week, so if you stay more than 4-5 days we could have something different but overall it was great and the food just kept coming, the last morning we paid for hot waffles and they were divine. The staff were friendly and helpful and always very polite. The housekeepers were wonderful and it was always lovely to come back to a clean room after a full day out on the town or sightseeing. Thank you for a wonderful holiday

I have to say if I had just gone by reviews alone we would not have stayed at the Aston Maikiki Beach, but knowing some people can't be happy with anything and are just looking for faults and maybe an excuse to be comp'ed. I would actually like to see the houses of the people that complain so much about little things while on vacation. We arrived at the hotel in a rental car, after taking a wrong turn and going through all of downtown which took alot longer than the freeway, but hey in Hawaii, relax and take in the sights. At the hotel we were met down stairs by, and I am bad at remembering names, the head of the valets. He took the keys and about broke his hand by the welcoming handshake and "Aloha" he gave us. I attempted to tip him and he shook his head no and said "welcome and whatever I can do, let me know" How cool is this? So the valet service for the week--excellent.Next we went to check in, the front desk people, all smiles--"Aloha, what can we do to help you?" I told them our name and they said "Oh we have been waiting for your arrival, how was your flight? Check-in took of all but 5 minutes. So the front desk service all week--excellent.The dreaded and wicked elevator system- It takes alittle patience but if you just follw the instructions and lose the ergency mode in you brain and think about what the security part of the operation is.....relax, hold the card right next to the scanner and then breathe. You are on vacation so act like it. The elevator takes time to arrive, it does almost every time as it has to travel from floor to floor with "the other guests" I don't know of any hotel that has an elevator for each and every guest.House keeping- Once off the elevatork, we passed by 3 housekeeping women. You would have thought they were our best friend, very friendly and after the first day, each time we passed them they would ask, of course after greeting us with "Aloha", if we needed anything. Knowing that we were not the only guests on the floor, and that I had more time than they did, I went to them and asked for any additional items I need and they were very helpful. I didn't see the need for them to remember to bring what I needed and the walk don the hall 50 feet to them to get what I needed insured me getting them and took the burden off them and reduced the likelyhood of me not getting it and "becoming furious and letting it ruin my vacation(sarcasim). Our room was beyond fantastic. I admit that after reading some of the reviews I was ready to call the front desk, furious and telling tham I wanted a new room. I was already prepared to call another hotel and tell them I was coming there because of how terrible the room was, how small the vanity was, how worn the carpets were....but none of those things were there. None of those things were there. I have NO idea where all these people were at but they were not at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. Yes the Aston that is next to the Zoo and across from the beach. I could not find 1 thing, nor could my wife who loving is a very nit picking and has to have everything perfect. The view was perfect. The bed, although not ours at home that we sleep on every night and are use to, well was not ours that we sleep on at home, I know I repeated myself but to get the point across I have never sleep on a hotel mattress that is broken in and contours like ours at home. Same with the pillows. I don't use one but my wife, knowing this has travelled with her own pillow, taking it around the world with her. She does that so "she doesnt have to complain about a hotel pillow, a trivial, small thing that could otherwise taint a vacation. Prior to adding an exhaust fan in our home we would have to crack open the bathroom door to prevent a fogged mirror. This was usually in the winter time when we would take steaming hot showers. With the warm temps in Hawaii it was never a need to take a very warm shower because it would just keep us warm. Enough said. I found no worn carpets, faded drapes, dirty floors, although in Hawaii I would expect to find sand but didn't. Son the Room---Excellent.The breakfast buffet-On vacation I like to over-indulge in bacon and eggs and other things that I really shouldn't eat. Thankfully the buffet had none of those things. The food they had was very good. I can't see how anyone could complain. The rolls and pastries go fast but with the pack mentally of some people and thinking that this is there one and only meal of the day. I don't thinks the hotel would do it but the should limit the amount of pastries/rolls to maybe 10 per person(again sarcaism). The attendants at breakfast were as quick as they could move to replenish the supplies and were helpful with me. I am sure it helped that I was not loud and demanding and not acting like I was the one and only guest there. Breakfast....ExcellentValue- I did not want a cheap hotel. There are reason why cheap hotels are cheap, that is something people just have to learn. I did not want to stay in an expensive hotel, I have and I didn't like the atmosphere and the mannerism of the people working there. I understand those employees do that because sme guest expect that. Like going into a high dollar car dealership. The Aston Waikiki Beach was a perfect fit for us. Tasteful, friendly, elegent. The hotel is not responsible for the few rude guest we encountered; we were not going to allow them to hamper our Island experience. We did our research on this hotel, we addressed concerns with the management and staff before making our decision, we loved our experieince there and will stay there again. I feel for the person with the broken a/c but I know from my interactions with the GM Mark and the front desk staff that if that person would have requested another room it would have been given. Or at least left the room to the Tiki Bar (the hotel would have probably paid your bill, and as warm blooded I am sunset was pretty nice weather outside) For anyone considering the Aston, I do not normally write reviews but this place has been given bad reviews by, well, just refer back to the title of this review, enough said. Thank you Mark and to your Mngmt and Staff.
user_name:
Terry W
Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, United States

review_body: Only bad thing to say would be that we were travelling in a group and had two rooms. We were told we could not have an adjoining room, the room between our room was almost always empty. Other than that, great experience, definitely go for a beachfront room, the higher the better. View from 19th floor ocean front was Incredible!

Location was great but I was expecting it to be much nicer. We had a standard room which still had a balcony, so that was a plus. But it hadn't been updated which appeared to be since it was built. There were stains on the ceilings and patch work from previous water damage. When we steppedd off of the elevator on our floor, the first room was next to the elevator and the other 3 doors down was halfway in the open outdoors. Felt more like a motel. It was okay since it was close to the beach and less than others that close.

I booked this place because I knew the location was perfect for me, at 45 years old. (if I were 18, I would want to be at the Outrigger down with all the bigger action.) Anyway, this hotel had some really good reviews but mine won't be one of them. The first problem is the horrible double beds and pillows. I never got one good night's sleep. We had sore necks and backs every morning. I tried several of the clothes that we brought folded up as pillows once I realized what I was in for.  The next problem may not be bad for the guys, but for any woman traveling with a husband and sons, the bathroom was a HUGE problem to me. It is so small and is filled with condensation and fogged up mirrors instantly leaving you no way to get ready for anything if the guys have to be ready at the same time. There is no vanity with a good mirror and plugs for your curling iron or blow dryer should you try to get ready out of the bathroom. I hate to say it but at the Marriott next door, the shower and toilet are separated with a door from the bathroom vanity and this is more important than I realized before I made the reservation. The only other thing was that I did keep having to tell the maids to PLEASE leave more than two or three washcloths with four of us in the room. I had to say it every day. Yes, I loved the big breakfast buffet and the fact that they give you a cooler bag to fill up and take to the beach. Yes, the location is great. Yes, I loved going to Lulu's on the very corner upstairs. Yes, I loved the live music and the great singers that they chose for Lulu's and Tiki's Bar and restaurant. Yes, I loved that I could jump on the trolley for $2 and take it 10 blocks up the road or to the mall. BUT I have to say, that next year, I will be at another hotel.

I could not imagine coming to Waikiki and not staying in a hotel on the Ocean. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel gave us a great budget option and let us stay in an Oceanfront room! The property itself does show wear: the bathrooms were a little dirty, and the furniture and walls showed some wear. That said, it was not enough to override the pleasant service we received, the very convenient and cost-efficient big breakfast of donuts, bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit, etc, and the outstanding Ocean View. Like I said, if you stay here, pay for the ocean front, it's outstanding!

The air conditioner did not work for two nights. I was extremely uncomfortable. The maintenance man had to come and clean out the duct, which was filthy, in order for the air conditioner to cool the room. At sunset, the room was ridiculously hot until the air conditioner was fixed. The door lock worked only after repeated attempts with both room keys. An employee stated it probably had a bad battery. It was never fixed. For two days I had only cold water to shower with in the morning...I am not meaning luke-warm...I mean COLD. For all of this, I was credited with $100.00 for my whole stay of five nights! Really? The gesture was insulting. The stay was terrible...one issue after another...and this room was given to me as an "upgrade" when I checked in.... I cannot imagine what a regular room was like.

We are currently staying at the Aston with our 2 young children. We had an ocean view room with 2 doubles. The room is very small but the view is just amazing. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but the hotel does serve coffee after 8pm. The breakfast is lovely and I really like the idea of taking your cooler bag and borrowing a beach chair and eating breakfast on the beach. Our air conditioner rattled all night, we mentioned it to the staff and someone was supposed to fix it. This was the only negative of this hotel. The lift system is very simple. Loved this motel.

Stayed here during my first visit to Oahu, and I loved it! The room was clean and very comfortable, and the decor was perfect for Hawaii. The only thing I thought was a little strange was the bathroom area. There was limited counter space, and the water from the shower leaked onto the bathroom floor but really no huge deal. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. It is right across the street from the beach and within walking distance to everything because it is located right on the main strip. Breakfast is included but if you want hot food, lt is extra. The pool is pretty small but it was nice to lay out and enjoy the sun. Overall, loved this hotel, and I even thought it was better than the Marriot right next to it, which is supposed to be a 4 star hotel (Stayed here by 2nd trip). Will stay here if I come back to the island!

We are staying at the aston right now and have been here for a week. whilst I cannot review on other rooms I can say that ours (1830) is fantastic. From the moment we walked in and saw the beautiful view we were instantly impressed. Room size is fine for two. Breakfast is also very good and we had no trouble getting what we needed if you miss the first rush just wait as they keep the food items topped up often. also never had trouble finding a seat by the pool. The check in was easy after a long flight and our room was ready. the staff are amazing and were all very helpful and the cleaners did a great job. Now the lift system that so many comment about is so easy not hard at all. To go to your room just swipe your card and press your floor number wait to see which lift to use a b c etc get in and up you go. To go back down just go to lift press star and it will take you to the pool deck. If you want to book any tours or get directions for trolley bus to use just go see the fantastic staff at Expedia (pool level) they were all very friendly and helpful - with special mention going to Jing Jing thankyou for making it all so easy to understand. We booked a dolphin swim (unreal) ATV motorbikes (also unreal) and then we did a helicopter tour of the island with blue hawaiian and it was so worth the $$$ you have to do it! So don't bother with all the research just book this one and you won't be disappointed we loved it all.

Stayed 19th...26th May after a weeks Cruise on The Pride Of America around the Hawian Islands. We booked an Ocean Front room and well worth the extra money! Wow what a view, we were on the 14th floor of 19 for the ocean front rooms.Very comfortable beds, good maid service and very clean.We asked for a kettle at reception and got one within minutes.The breakfast was all you could wish for, fresh fruit,cereals, milk, yogurts,bagels, trays of muffins and cakes ,jams, phili cheese, fruit juice, teas coffee and ommelettes made to order at small charge. We prefered to take the food to our room to eat on balcony to enjoy the view, but plenty of seating around pool or because you get given a "cool Bag" for food you can take it to the beach which is just steps from the Hotel across the street. Extra sunbeds and seating were put around the pool during our visit., we never had a problem getting a place to sunbathe in the afternoon, folding chairs are available free of charge at the poolside for your use on the beach.All in all my husband and I thought this to be a very good choice of Hotel, if you just want to "chill" as you could dress as you wanted when you wanted! Plenty of places to eat near Hotel and as the location is at Diamond Head end of the curved beach it was very much less busy and noisy. The other end was all designer shops Etc. if you like that sort of thing! If you want "posh" then you must expect to pay very much higher prices than that of the Very Good Value Aston Waikiki Beach. I would totally recommend this hotel.

My husband and I had a great vacation here and excellent stay at the Aston. Our room had a beautiful view, it was clean and comfortable. Everyone working here were polite and friendly. The location is perfect for a family, next to the zoo, the aquarium is right down the street and the ocean has a reef, or barrier, that makes the ocean into a safe, waveless warm delightful lake! (directly across from the hotel.) It's literally the last major hotel on the Waikiki strip so you don't have all the crowds, but still at a good walking distance to the International Market Place etc. All the trams and tours stop right at the hotel. Don't bother stuffing beach towels into your suitcase, the hotel offers it's guests free beach towels AND beach chairs for all day usage! Tikis is Wonderful, THX Terrie!

We arrived here on May 31st. Bree at the front desk checked us in, well tried to. She told us that Orbitz cancelled our room. Needless to say I was NOT a happy traveler but Bree got it fixed for us, she rocks. We did request a king bed when we booked the room because my husband is 6'4 and a full size bed just does NOT work. We didn't get a King but we got two full sized beds LOL. Oh well :-). Ocean view was awesome, breakfast was very nice. Valet Parking only got a little expensive $27 per day plus gratuity every time you got your car or returned it, valet staff is excellent though. Went to the Tiki Bar on the first night, a guy was running around taking pictures of guests, never asked us if we wanted ours taken (which we did, beautiful sunset). I asked him very nicely if he could please take our picture (you would think since we asked it would be a guarantee purchase of picture), he said he would be right back. He came back but never stopped and took our picture, took pictures of all the couples around our table though. Oh well, saved me probably $50.00 for picture and gratuity. Nicholas a server at the Tiki lounge is AAAAAAA+++++++++. Water problem on Saturday or Sunday so we could not shower in the morning. Monday lost all power on the wall the TV was on, AC didn't work but hotel staff was fast to fix it after we reported it. Check out was fast and easy. We didn't get charged for the safe and we didn't use it nor tell them at check in that we were not planning on using it. Overall experience was awesome location, nice breakfast, pool was nice, staff was amazingly friendly (except for picture guy in Tiki lounge LOL).
user_name:
Sarah P
Pendleton, Oregon, United States

review_body: My husband and I stayed here 7 nights in April for our wedding in Hawaii. We had family staying here also, in 4 other rooms. I decided on this hotel because our travel agent reccommended for the price, it and also because of the free breakfast. We did not have a lot of experience with the staff, so I can't say much about that. Since there is so much to do in Hawaii, we were not in our room that much, but I would not stay here again and saw many other hotels I would have preffered.Pros-Tiki's Bar and grill was a very nice place to eat or get drinks. We spent lots of money there!-Location was very good, with lots of food choices nearbye.-View was very nice from our room. -We definitely used the free breakfast everyday. It was so nice to be able to fill the cooler bag and bring food to our room!Cons-BATHROOM was terrible!!! I expected a lot nicer bathroom for this type of hotel! It was tiny and very outdated! The bathroom was no better than a cheap motel's bathroom. I would have liked to have taken a bath to relax, but I wouldn't even think of taking one in there. There is no way I could have gotten reading in my wedding dress in there either. -Hard to know where we were supposed to go to check in when we first arrived. We were dropped off down below, and you had to go up to I believe the 2nd floor to check in to a very small lobby area. We spent the first 10 minutes in the elevators trying to get to the right floor. The elevators were fine once we figured out how to use them. But with no room card to use right when we got there and being tired from travelling, they were difficult.-Bathroom towels had hairs in them on several occasions! I have never had this happen before!Next time I will definitely do more research. This would be a fine place if you aren't going for a special occasion. I wish I would have stayed at a nicer place for my wedding and honeymoon!

First the Cons;1)My husband and I went for out 5 year anniversary and they gave us a room with two beds but we were like, ok no big deal, and asked if there were any available with a king the next day, there were and we moved all of our stuff to the worst room they had that just happened to be right over the loading doc for big trucks to drop of their supplies. All evening all we heard was slamming doors and the beeping from trucks backing up, BUT to out delight our AC went out!!! We called downstairs and we moved rooms (thank god!) at midnight and they upgraded us!!!2) There are MANY MANY homeless on the streets of Waikiki in the evenings, I told my husband that if we ever took my daughter (3 yrs old) to Hawaii I would choose a different island because I would NOT want my little girl digging in the sand to find who knows what!!3) IF you DO NOT want to use the safe in your room, tell them at check in or you'll pay for it at checkout if you used it or not.The pros;1)Free breakfast!!! make sure you are there during the allotted times, if you are not going to be there plan the morning before and get some extra milk and cereal and put it in your room fridge for the next morning (most tours start before breakfast is open) And if you are going to be there they will not run out of anything!! Take your time and wait for the hordes of people to leave!2) Quiet beach across the road, well, quiet by Waikiki standards anyway!!3)Tikki bar & Grill! Super Yummy!!! here's a tip, if you find them online and sign up for their e-mail club you get a free "appetizer" as it turns out if you sit in their bar area instead of the restaurant anything on that menu is considered an appetizer...I got a burger and French fries for FREE! and while I'm on a roll if you walk down the Waikiki strip they have an amazing Cheesecake factory, go sign up for their e-mail club too and you get a free slice of cheese cake!!4) A very pretty hula dancer is dancing ever morning with some music while you eat your free breakfast.5)The elevator issue is really not as big of a deal as everyone makes it out to be!6) Trolly will pick you up just outside the hotel. Grab a map and this is by far the finest way to get around not to mention the cheapest (other than walking), I think it was $2.00 per person each way. I'll put it this way, take a look at other hotel prices that are in Waikiki directly across from the beach with a cute room (and clean), free breakfast, free entertainment, an awesome restaurant and compare the price. You'll be booking this place for sure!

Would never stay here again. Room was average but bathroom very out-dated- door would not even close properly. When we first entered room they said it was all ready for us but there were not even any towels in bathroom- very annoying when we had just travelled for ten hours to get there. At the end of our stay they charged us for a safe we had not even used and refused to let us leave without paying- really poor service overall and would never go back. Im never one to complain but this was just too ridiculous not to.

Returned yesterday from 5 days at he Aston where we have stayed multiple times in the past. I have never been so disappointed. We were there celebrating our anniversary and were return guests from several occasions. We have other evens here and arrived finding cookies, a card and a sparkling cider in the room saying happy anniversary and clone back. This time zilch nada nothing. I get everyone... in the world is citing back but really you not print a card and sign it, that is virtually free. We arrived and waited for sometime time to have someone great us with our car, several people that arrived after we did were helped prior to our arrival. I have an opinion about that but will not share that here. We should have had an upgrade to the best room available but that did not happen. We had a passport discount, which guaranteed that but again no upgrade. The room was nice and the view nice but in no way was the best out there. Maybe the one night was not available but I found availability on the other nights on the web. We have always had the Aston people display the aloha attitude and always felt welcome, but only the car service people after the first day had us feel this way and the maids the front desk always seemed like we were an inconvenience the beds need some work were very creaky, and kept sliding to the end. But as I mentioned the view it was very nice. The Aston book they give with deals is worthless and totally caters to kids, what about real deals for those of us with no kids. We had looked forward to this for so long and wish I could have said we had the time of our lives but not even close...we left the phone in the car and told the prison exactly where it was, they old not find it, and it was in the open on the obsolete we had to ask a second to go get it...will say for the most part the car people did a great job...but hospitality is in need of some serious work. I know we got a good deal on the room, but you nke it Lund like the passport del is amazing and it is nothing special other than free parking, the rest of the things are nothing special and we added a night o our room and they charged us an extra thirty dollars thy old not give us the same rate. I realize it is only thirty dollars but overall it just added to the less than thrilling experience...so sorry to saySee More

When I booked our hotel for Hawaii, I wasn't aware that Aston charges a $10 "amenity fee" for each day of our stay. The on-line quote was $89/day. Since this fee is fixed, it should have been added to the on-line price, which would have made the honest price $99. If I had known about this stealth fee, I would have chosen another hotel, one without the fee.

Ups: tiki bar (food and music generally very good); close to beach; rate is good. Downs: very dated decor; no privacy border between balconies; breakfast is oversold (really just an average continental breakfast).

I live on O'ahu, so it seems kinda silly to stay at a hotel in Waikiki, but a few times a year we take the kids on a hotel "stay-cation". Our last hotel was the Aston, and we were pleasantly surprised. They offered a great rate for HI residents, which influenced our decision on choosing this hotel. The location can't be beat. The beach is across the street, the Honolulu Zoo, and Waikiki Aquarium are a few blocks away. Breakfast on the beach...they provide you with a lunch sized cooler and you fill it with all the breakfast goodies you want, (continental and more hearty choices) and you can either eat poolside, or take your cooler across the street and have your breakfast on the beach. Check-in was quick, and the hotel staff were very helpful in all ways. Will surely stay here again.

The location at the eastern end of Waikiki is great with possibilities of pleasant walks in the Kapiolani Park and enjoyment of more quiet beaches that in the center of Waikiki. The first room we were given had a disappointing view directly to rooms of closeby highrises, although we had booked a room with ocean view, but the hotel was finally able to find a room as booked, although it was the furthest back towards Kurio Avenue. Later we were moved to a room closer to the oceanside after a bug invasion problem. Problems with the air-condition in the room were taken care of and solved promptly and efficiently. Good housecleaning of room although always late in the afternoon. The breakfast buffet at the pool area with live musical entertainment, hulo songs and dancing, was actually very enjoyable and pleasant although "camp style" and crowded, sitting wherever you could find space. We have never had a more enjoyable stay on Hawaii and can recommend the hotel as a really good tourist-class establishment.

My husband and I were there May 21st to May 29th. We were very happy and comfortable with our stay there. Sometimes we felt we were at home and we live in New York. Everything was close by and convenient. Breakfast was great and we sat on the beach every day. We had a partial oceanview room and it was very clean. Elevator system was great. All hotels should have it. Safe. My husband liked the exercise room and used it every day. Also, free beach chairs and towels. See you guys next year!

We stayed here for 6nights in May and it was the best choice we could have made. We booked an oceanfront room and the view was amazing. We could see Diamond Head to the left and right down Waikiki beach to the right. The staff were very helpful, the room was basic but had everything we needed. I had read other reviews regarding the breakfast but honestly we never found it a problem, we had a choice of fruit, pastries as well as tea, juices etc. for a small fee we could get an omelette made fresh.I would certainly recommend Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and we are certainly looking forward to our next stay.

We stayed 5 nights and were very pleased with everything. The front desk was very helpful, located right across from beach, within walking distance to MANY eateries and shopping. We were on 14th floor, partial ocean view-very nice. Rooms are small, the only noise we heard was in hallway. When people talk and close doors you hear it, but we did not hear much of it. Saw many nice sunsets. Walked to beach and hopped a catamaran sunset ride for $20 each. Hiked Diamond Head. (bring water). The breakfast was fine as far as continental breakfasts go-variety. We did choose to go out for breakfast a couple mornings. They give you a beach towel every day that you can use at pool or beach, as well as a beach chair. Had entertainment at pool during breakfast which was nice. They held out luggage as we had to check out earlier than our flight was. No charge. Even let us weigh one as it's weight was questionable for us. The area is very busy with people clad mostly in bathing suits or shorts and tanks. Don't overpack. Very casual. The ABC stores have the best deals for souvenirs & they are everywhere! Post Office is located upstairs at International Market which is a nice place for shopping, but watch prices. Many booths sell same thing but prices vary-and you can talk them down easily. We went May 22-27, 2012 and the trade winds were daily. Every day was a bad hair day and hang on to your hat!! However, it kept us cool in the mid 80 degree weather and kept the humidity low which was very nice. Crowds start coming mid June.

My girlfriend and I stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach hotel during a recent visit to Oahu. The room itself was impeccable with very comfortable furniture and an understated Hawaiian motif. The free breakfast was wonderfully convenient. While the food was just a mix of danish with some rice, kimchi and soup; the hotel provides a souvenir lunch box so that the breakfast can be taken down to the beach, eaten in the room, etc. Our room also had a refrigerator in it so this breakfast food served as a mid-day snack as well. My only downside to this hotel is that it is located right in front of the wall in the water of Waikiki beach. This means that you will have to walk about 1/2 a mile down the beach to get to a location with any kind of waves. While this could be viewed as a positive by some, I would choose a hotel further down the beach for a future visit.
user_name:
Reijo S
Carmel, Indiana, United States

review_body: Had an ocean view room with 2 double beds. Room was small with the 2 beds in it but we were only there a couple of nights so it was fine. The free breakfast was good and had a little of something for everyone. The hotel was in a great location and provided easy access to everything. I would recommend this hotel and we'd stay there again too.

We stayed at the Aston Waikik from April 30-May 6 and I must say that everything was wonderful from the minute we checked in til the sad moment we checked out. We booked an ocen view room and we were stunned by both the location and view from our room 2525. We had an unobstructed view clear up Waikik Beach and we enjoyed many hours on our lanai just watching the waves. We had a perfect vantage point for some spectacular sunsets. The location is convenient to dining and transportation (we used the bus for our exploring). When we arrived we had a very nice card from the General Manager -- this was a nice touch and characteristic of the service and attitude of the staff. Each and every employee was cordial and pleasant and took the extra effort to make sure we had a nice stay. Our room had plenty of room for the two of us and we slept like babies in our comfy king-sized bed. The maid kept our room in tip top shape and any small requests were taken care of ASAP. (e.g. we had only one chair on our balcony and a note left resulted in a second chair magically appearing!)The front desk were informative and happy to answer any questions we had about touring and how to get from here to there!The internet around the pool was more than adequate for staying in touch with loved ones during our visit. The pool had plenty of chairs that were comfy and cozy. They had shade bonnets if you didn't want to get too much sun -- this was a complimentary feature that other hotels can charge for. We liked the decor and felt like it put us in an Oahu mood from the minute we stepped into our home away from home. The bathroom was immaculate and the shower curtain and mats were fresh and new. The breakfast at the pool was really good -- while my husband pigged out on sweets, I loved the miso soup and sticky rice. There were bagels and cream cheese too. Lots of fresh fruit, cereal, and yogurt. The entertainment was a lovely way to start the day! Lots of days we took our cooler bag back to the room and ate on our lanai so that we could enjoy our magnificent view!I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone and would be glad to answer any specific questions you might have!

Aloha: I would like to take the time to thank all of the staff at the hotel for making us feel so welcomed and cared for during our stay. We stayed at this hotel from May 17 to May 26th. I had booked the room on line and found upon arrival that it exceeded our expectations. The oceanfront view was amazing, the hotel staff went out of their way to be accomodating and helpful, the room was cleaned daily, there was a safe and a mini-fridge, beds were comfortable and critter free. The location was fantastic, breakfast was ideal and we were able to take extra snacks for our day long adventures. It was truly an amazing experience, Mahalo

We had an ocean front room How AMAZING!! is the view, the rooms were rerally clean and serviced daily, great location wise close to the heart of Waikiki's action,Breakfast was an array of variety, The Bar makes the Best Blue Hawaii, we even created a New Drink Called Ricks special!,staff were super friendly and always willing to help were needed. Great for families or couples and a group.

First time to Hawaii and I was a little concerned at first, when I read some of the negative reviews of this place. When we got to the room, I was pleasantly surprised that the "partial ocean view" meant just that. From our 7th floor balcony, we had a glorious view of the beach and looking out at Waikiki beach.The room was clean, although the bathrooms are a little tired and could use a little more work. But there were no real issues with the bathrooms. The cleaning staff did come in to clean it as best they could each day. My only complaint with the cleaning staff is they seem to have an odd order to when they get to each room. Some days they come early and some way late.Initially, we had trouble with the safe. It didn't work and the front desk sent someone up in 10 minutes who fixed it by changing the battery. The dressers in the room have very shallow drawers. There wasn't adequate room for a couple to put away all our clothes, so it was impossible to keep the room tidy.There was only high speed Internet in the room which is wired. This is not useful for most people these days as few carry laptops on vacations. We needed wifi and came prepared. We brought a router and hooked it up in our room. Worked like a dream! We had our own hotspot in the room. Most others with iPads had to use the, by the pool, which had open wifi.A continental breakfast was included each morning by the pool. Mostly carbs there but they did have a nice miso soup and the option to order French toast or omelets for a fee. They provide each guest with an insulated lunch bucket but you are only allowed one entry to get your breakfast. So people loaded up and the containers were difficult to manage. Refills only allowed on coffee.It was lovely though that every morning, there is a young man playing Hawaiian music and a hula dancer. There were a different coupling daily, but all quite good.We are movie lovers. One very different feature in this hotel is the included unlimited play station game rental or DVD movies. We must have taken out 6 movies from their kiosks.  Nice way to relax after a day of hiking. Diamond Head is about a mile away from the hotel, so don't need other transportation to go there. The hotel is situated at the end of the strip, but everything is close by, so a few blocks to walk to the middle of the strip. There is a nice selection of eating establishments right on this block, so if someone doesn't want to walk, they don't have to.The most curious thing with this hotel is their "activity fee" of $10 per day. They say this is to cover the safe, movies, Internet, fitness room, etc. Well,, this fee isn't optional, so why isn't it just included in the room price? I'm not complaining, because we were aware of the charges prior, so it wasn't a surprise. And the front desk did make it very clear on check-in what the charges were covering. Just that I prefer to have one price, and not pay piecemeal. The beach is just across the street from the hotel, which is super. I think it is one of the nicest parts of Waikiki Beach and we did walk the whole beach. It's very nice that the hotel will provide you with chairs for the beach, so that you don't have to rent them for an exorbitant cost. Their pool was quite nice too, but wish it was heated.The little things that I mentioned as negatives, we're just that, little. I don't believe any place is going to be perfect, and none of it marred our vacation in any way. We really had a lovely time there, so that's why I give it 4 stars.

We stayed in Honolulu for a day and a half to see Pearl Harbor and fly back to Chicago. Wow, the city is so crowded and busy, much more than I expected! After being in Kauai for a week it was shocking! Great people watching from our hotel with the beach right in front of us. The room itself had a really bad smell, like a dirty hamper. It was pretty dated, the bathroom was kind of old and nasty, but it looked clean enough. I brough my own pillow cases to cover the pillows on the bed, hotel beds kinda creep me out. After reading some other reviews on other hotels on this strip about having bed bugs, I wasnt feeling to good about it. We ate at Wolfgang Pucks downstairs and had a really good quick meal, although my husband seen a large roach in the kitchen! The Tiki restaurant by the pool was really good, and we went to the happy hour at 2pm-5 and had some good deals on drinks there! Then had a early dinner, very good! The desk helped us arrange for a pick up to Pearl Harbor. Cant review this without saying something good about the breakfast buffet, very good and as much as you want! The strip is pretty busy and crazy at night! Great for walking up and down and taking it all in! 2 days is definetly enough in Honolulu, wish I could have seen more of Ouha, like the North shore! Another trip maybe!!!

The hotel was great. The staff was very polite and helpful. We were on the 12th floor and there was very little noise. The room had a mini fridge and safe. We had plenty of room. The morning breakfast buffett outside was more than enough and you could pay alittle extra if you wanted an omlette or Beligian waffles. The coconut syrup is delicious. The location is convenient to alot of shopping and restuarants. The Tiki Bar and Grill is downstairs and the food is good and they have nightly entertainment. The zoo is within walking distance and so is the International Market. The activities desk is great and the staff is very helpful with tours etc. The rental cars there at the hotel were all booked up..so we went next door to the Pacific Ohana Hostel and rented a car from Mike at a very reasonable rate. They also rent mopeds. The elevator system is really unique and once you get the hang of it , is very easy. The beach is directly across the street and the hotel provides towels and chairs. There is a good swimming, snorkeling area. Close to Diamondhead.
Hotel includes free breakfast at the pool which is delicious. Staff was very courteous, hotel was clean. Not very fancy, but great location and good price. Would stay again.

Had an oceanfront room from May 18 to May 25, 2012. Nice size room (king size bed) and lanai was okay as the two of us could sit there and eat our breakfast. You do want to get down to the pool around 6am to get a place to sit. People will tend to stay there long after they eat breakfast but what can you do. Room was clean too. I know some rooms do have much of a lanai but all the oceanfrom ones do. Spend the extra bucks for it. Nice to sit there when you are up at 3 or 4 in the morning your first day or two there (if you come from the east coast). Not far from the international market place. Think it is closer that if you are at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Compare the rates for oceanfront rooms with the others that are on the beach. If you have the oceanfront you can at least people watch as there is a small park there and not just beachfront. And the breakfast is pastry and fruit and since it is included in your rate a good value. Saves you $10 or $20 a day since food is somewhat expensive. Would stay there again. Elevators are a great system. You don't encounter having to stop on every other floor. Found out the last day of you are on level three and want to go to the street level - just hit the 1 and it will take you down.

This was nice hotel with a great location and nice amenities. The decor is bright, cheerful and playful. We got a double room and the room was a little small but the beds were very comfortable. The pool was nice and in the morning you can grab your complimentary cooler bag and eat the complimentary breakfast by the pool while listening to a musician and hula dancer. Location was awesome. Just a block from the beach and close to tons of restaurants and stores.

My son and I came to stay at this hotel two weeks ago for a Mothers day week! We had an amazing experience. From the check in to check out, the delicious breakfasts to the cozy pool side lounge beds, our time at the Aston Waikiki will forever be in our hearts. If it wasn't for our wonderful experience witht he hotel, staff and all accomadations we could not have enjoyed our time completely. Makana, a valet associate was so entirely helpful, always had a smile on his face, and was willing to assist us with all of our questions, my son really appreciated his outlook and kindness! Thank you Makana! Our serice associate for the 18th floor, I am not certain of her name, was so sweet and kind always smiling and cheery! Thank you all for making our stay so memorable! We already miss Hawaii so much, and we are already planning to return next year.

My husband and I just returned from a week stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel and we were very pleased. We booked our trip then checked opinions on Trip Advisor. There were so many negative reviews I was wondering what we had gotten ourselves into. The hotel is directly across the street from the beach - traffic is not that heavy and there's a pedestrian style traffic light in place which makes it so easy to cross. Breakfast was yummy. Fruit,fruit drinks,muffins large and mini,pastries and my favorite drug-coffee. There was also breakfast favorites for Japanese tourists. A resturant and lounge is on site and there are others in walking distance. The pool is not salt water as one person wrote on Trip Advisor and the elevator system isn't that difficult to understand. The only negative thing is there aren't enough patio style tables and chairs to accomodate everyone, but it was nice sharing space and meeting very nice people. STAY AT THIS HOTEL! You shouldn't be disappointed if you're low mantainance people like us. Otherwise spend your big bucks at the Hilton.

Location was astounding. Located directly across the street from beautiful Waikiki Beach. Even though parking in and around Waikiki can be quite trying, their hotel valet service was absolutely the best and most convenient. The front desk is located directly in front of the hotel pool. Beautiful. The Tiki Bar was so much fun and service was the best. Safety was also a priority. Upon entering the elevator to our room, personal security codes are used so that non-guests would have no access. We loved this feature. For a fast meal, Wolfgang Puck Express is right downstairs at street level. Guest services were tops. We requested extra towels and pillows and someone was at our door with these items within a few short minutes. On our next trip to Honolulu, this hotel will be our home base. Love It!

This was not a 4 star hotel and it's hard to believe it has that rating. For the price paid and the quality of the rooms I've stayed in nicer Best Westen Hotels...this is from someone that has actually lived out of hotels for 2 months last year. The location is great the service is excellent, but the room is questionable. The floor to the bathrooms were compatible to a highschool locker room. The "partial ocean view" was stretching your neck around the corner to see a strip of water - but that was expected. I doubt I'll be visiting again, Marriott is one street away and much nicer.

My 5 th holiday in Hawaii and was pleased with the value of this hotel. Pool area a bit sad but functional . We had a water view room 18th floor , sensational view to the n/w ,amazing sunsets. You are given a small cooler bag ,take to breakfast and load up with all the food you want , great idea and enough to start off your day . The restraurnt and bar on the 3rd floor (tiki bar ) has nice food , reasonably priced and a fantastic viewing spot with the beach opposite . The trolley bus stop is at the front of the Aston which is very handy for any excursions , shopping , etc

We booked and received an oceanfront room on an upper floor. The room rate was very good for Waikiki and was based on one of the hotels promotions. Look closely at the Aston web site to compare every available rate. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and easy to deal with. The room, with two queen beds, as well as the bathroom, were a little tight by today's standards. Everything was very clean. The pool area is ok, a convenient place to sit and have a beer or Mai Tai, as Tiki's Bar and Grill is part of the pool deck. The servers and drinks at Tiki's are awesome. There is free wifi on the pool deck but the service is sketchy. Unless I had a bottomless bag of money, I would stay here again.

We stayed here for seven nights and love it, the staff are great the hotel is very clean and it's at the end of Waikiki beach which is great because there is less people, less traffic and not as many people on the beach as most of them just cross the road in front of there hotel. We will bring the kids with us next time and we will be staying here again :-)

We needed a place to stay for a few nights while island hopping, we weren't going to be in the room at all so we did not want anything super pricy and nice. This hotel fit the bill.The bathroom felt dirty to me, I'm sure the cleaned it but it was very old and the mat on the floor was the type that does not really get clean. I wanted to throw it away. The room was small but comfortable for the two of us. We had a beautfiful view of Waikiki beach from our patio though it was very small. The restaurant was good, pricy but it's hawaii, what isn't? Our room was quiet but we were away from the elevators. Service was great and we were always greeted with a smile and staff were helpful.The breakfast is kind of crazy, we only ate it one day because of our schedule but you will be battling a lot of others. Food was fine and they were good about refilling. The beach is amazing! One morning we came out and there was a monk seal laying out almost right in front of the hotel (we didn't use the pool, why would we? The ocean is right there!)

Me and my family stayed here from may 10th -may 15th 2012 ...the pool was unavailable the whole time we where there and we booked our stay almost 6 months in advance and when we got there we didnt get our adjoining rooms as promised ....actual our family stayed on different floors ...the breakfast was ok but the same thing everyday and you pay extra for hot foods ....the view was wonderful ...housekeeping was great ...on site restaurant was awesome.
user_name:
Brenda A
East Hemet, California, United States

review_body: We booked this room after many hours of research, because one does not want to have a bad experience in paradise.The Good:1. Within walking distance of the "International Marketplace", because that area of town has most of the action.2. Protected beach right across the street, which is not only good to keep unwanted sea creatures out (read: sharks), it keeps the sand in and protects the coral reefs, and acts as a wave break so younger children can enjoy themselves without your constant help.3. Beautiful Establishment, especially considering that its not as shiny and new as some hotels. The grounds are very well maintained, and the motif says "Hawaii" without being too overstated.4. The staff does a nice job, and the expedia local expert office inside is very accommodating. I highly recommend you check them out, either before your trip or at the hotel, for booking any activities (i.e. Polynesian Cultural Center, Pearl Harbor, Atlantis Submarine Tours).5. The pool and pool area is nice looking, although we never used it. We are at the beach for goodness sake.6. Tiki's Grill and Bar was a nice experience for us. Good food, drinks, and service. Fairly priced for Waikiki. The manager also came by for a visit and made us feel as if we were catching up with an old friend; I really appreciate that kind of service.7. Our "Ocean View Room" was great, we has a Single King, which was very comfy. The room was very clean and nicely decorated, and unlike so many other hotels, it actually looked like the pictures from their website.8. Breakfast on the Beach is a nice little bag they provide so that you may take your Continental Breakfast to the beach if you wish. They also gave my daughter a nice little bag of toys to play with at the beach.The So So:1. The balcony furniture should be updated in the near future, as it has yellowed overtime and will likely begin breaking up from sun exposure soon. They should also add a second chair so that you may sit with your loved one and enjoy the sunset if you wish.The Bad:2. Amenity Fees! This is a new thing at ALL HOTELS in Hawaii. $10/day for soap, shampoo, PS3, etc... This is a load of BS, but after I returned home I learned from another reviewer that you can refuse the amenities and not be charged. good to know.Not too shabby overall. We also stayed at the Aston Aloha Beach on Kauai and enjoyed it as well. If I ever return to Waikiki I will stay here again, and will definitely check them out on any other islands we may visit as well.

Not to bad. High turnover on the beach hotel .staff were all very frendly and helpful . as this is a high turnover hotel they seem to maintain the little things that make your'e stay the best that they can.

Husband and I stayed here the last week in April. I was expecting a very average experience but found friendly staff, a lovely view (for a partial ocean it was grand), a happening bar with good food, and lots of Aloha atmosphere (they light torches and blow a conch shell at sunset.) The location was great, within walking distance to about any place on Waikiki. The breakfast was a time saver, as well as a money saver, and the insulated bag came in handy our whole trip. (we went to 2 other islands) And they had hula dancers at breakfast. Nice touch! The only reason I did not give the Aston Waikiki a 5 is some wear showing around the edges in the bathroom. (but it was clean, and fully functioning) Also the beach renourishment going on in front of the hotel was a little disappointing, but they have no control over that, and it is a short walk in either direction to a good beach. I would highly recommend this to anyone wanting an affordable, and fun place in Waikiki.

We stayed 6 nights;location is perfect for walking to most everything . Service was excellent! Rooms were smaller than they appear on website, but comfortable. Fantastic ocean view! Breakfast is free, but super crowded. Be sure your room is away from elevators! Very noisy. Tikis Bar/Grill is awesome! We would certainly stay again( away from elevators!Ha!)

Excellent location, on the edge of Waikiki but away from the madness. Great room and well decorated although bathroom is tiny. Free breakfast is ok but we preferred to eat outside. All the staff were friendly and the restaurant and bar was good for lunch with its fab views. Yes we would come back.

Stayed at the Aston Waikiki 5 nights in Apr/12.Had an oceanfront room so had a fantastic view of Waikiki Beach. Each room comes with a big plastic lunch bag so if you have breakfast included with your room (not sure but maybe all guests get breakfast) you go down to main floor off lobby in the morning and fill up your bag with containers for all kinds of fruit, pastries, yogurt, porridge, cereal and really good Kona coffee.You can eat this by the pool, with a pool-side musician and hula dancer every morning, or take your breakfast to the beach, or do as we did and eat on our balcony while watching the ocean, surfers and bathers.Wish they had wifi in the rooms but they only had it in the lobby area, and it was not that good.Their tiki grill and bar is pretty good, with good deals during happy hour, and pretty half-decent mai-tais. There is an indoor dining room off the grill area, more expensive but excellent food.We did not care much for the air conditioning in the room, it started up too often, waking us up, and blew cold air right across the beds.It's about a $40 taxi ride from the airport but there is a airport shuttle service in the morning which charges $10/person.It's a 1 block walk to city bus service, which will take you anywhere in Honolulu for $2.50/person.

Read all the reviews on tripadvisor but decided aston waikiki beach hotel suited our needs and budget and we were sooooooo right. The location is perfect walking distance to everything but not right in the midst of all the hotels. We have nothing to complain about we had a ocean front room which was great, sat there everynight had drinks watched the surfers and all the action before we went out for dinner. Tiki bar and grill in hotel is just great we had the entree with a salad and that was enough for dinner. Lots of ABC stores to get beer wine or snacks, breakfast at the hotel was free and they encouraged you to take extras in your cooler that they supply for snacks or lunch which we did when we went on tours. If you want to pay big bucks go somewhere else but for a beachfront hotel in waikiki this ones is for us.

I just returned from a weeks stay at this hotel. We were pleased with all aspects of our stay, except for the obvious lack of recycling.
