Overfilled garbage bins stuffed with garbage and many many empty water bottles disgusted me. The staff seemed plentiful, why not instead of an elevator assistant, create a position to collect recycling, take the bottles in for $, then redistribute it as gratuities to the hard working staff.?. Just a thought.

This is my second stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach. I absolutely love the location on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki -- it's quieter and less overwhelming than other spots, plus has easy access to a great park for morning runs, less crowded beaches, etc. I opted for an ocean-front room, which was simply breathtaking and a great place to catch the gorgeous sunset. The morning "breakfast on the beach" is pretty great too -- standard grab 'n go fare, but plentiful and an easy way to get an early start on the day. I also really liked the automated elevator system that was very efficient and made for short wait times.There are two areas where I would like to see the hotel make improvements:(1) In-room Internet service is wired only, so you can't use any wireless-only devices, e.g. iPad or iPhone. The service at least is "free" (included in the $10 daily resort fee). Wireless is available on the pool/lobby/breakfast level, although I constantly had trouble keeping a connection. My tip: Go to the Starbuck's on the corner.(2) Valet service was really spotty. At $27/day, I found this level of service unacceptable. Slow service, constantly complaining, long waits on the phone, forgetting to get my car once requested, etc. After this last instance, I could even hear them badmouthing me after I didn't tip them. My tip: Improve your service level.

I've stayed in several Waikiki hotels and the Aston Waikiki Beach is the best for the price. The location is on the Diamond Head side of Wakiki right across from the beach. It is close to all of the restaurants, shopping and activities in Waikiki and we were able to walk everywhere. Our room was beautifully decorated, clean and spacious and the view was absolutely fantastic. We could see all of Waikiki beach from our room and it was the best room view I've ever had in Waikiki. The service was great. Everyone from the front desk, to housekeeping and the valet were friendly and extremely helpful. In addition to this, there were a couple of innovative things that made the stay even better. One was that they gave us a soft cooler to use for the free breakfast. This allowed us to load up on cereal, fruit, yogurt and pastries to take to the beach and eat later. The other was that we could rent as many free DVDs as we wanted at kiosks in the lobby to play in our room. Both these things, plus the free internet service in our room, saved us a lot of money. Definitely will stay here again and recommend to others.

Aston Waikiki was a great place to stay on our trip to hawaii! right on the strip, only minutes walk to the great restaurants,shops,zoo and beach! Free breakfast was nice ( bit tired of eating pastries and yogurts after 2 weeks ) so had breakfast out for the last couple of days! would highly recommend.

wow....things certainly have changed since the last time i was there ! yikes ! might not be to quick to go back there - perhaps Maui or Kauai. now i understand when people say its expensive there...have you seen the shops that dawn Kalakaua Ave, but i digress. As for the Aston, if i did go back, yes i would stay here. Yes the rooms where small, and needed some TLC, but really - you are not spending much time there. it was clean, and the staff was friendly and sure did do everything to make sure you where enjoying your stay. try to avoid the rooms that back the elevator...very noisy and that's because this hotel is hopping busy and people moving about all the time....the drunks walking thru the pool area at 3am are inconsiderate, so pool view is good,....just maybe try 10th floor or higher. So to the staff i say, "MAHALO NUI LOA and job well done", especially to Bria, who helped us straighen out the reservation that the hotel booking company messed up on. Yup, thats right,...arrived at the hotel about 9pmish, and they did not have our reservation. They put us up for the night as the reservation desk was closed but she was to tenacious to let it go and discovered the hotel booking company had faxed our info to their boutique hotel. WOW!! i could go on...but al in all - it was just apart of the experience. I will be addressing them seperately! you can count on that! Bottom iine, we were there for the sun and the sand...and that we accomplished. Lost the beach area out front as they started beach reconstruction in january and we booked in december :( so that was bad timing,,,,but they were done by the end of our vacation !! and it will be well worth staying there now as they do have a beautiful beachfront and sunset views are spectacular. They had more amenities than i thought....continential breakfast and a cooler bag to fill up and carry across the street to the beach for breakfast on the beach. water station near the front desk, towels for the beach, and the Tiki Bar and restaurant served a great pina colada/chi-chi ! ya! oh and wolfgang puc's at the 1st level near the valet, so convenient and was good food. We got in everything we wan't to do - it was still fantastic to get a chance to go back. oh...dont' rent from Hertz, until you have had a chance to look at what you are paying for!!Aloha

At the Diamond Head end of Waikiki and close to everything the hotel is a bit tired but clean and the staff was very helpful. The various trams stop here and it is on the pick-up list for most tours and activities. I would stay here again because of the price and proximiy to the beach.

We had a nice view of Waikiki Beach from our ocean view room and the location was good. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful, especially the security gentleman. The rooms were pretty small, but it worked for our family of 7. I think it's best for families, but I would choose a different hotel if I was just vacationing with my husband. The continental breakfast was adequate, nothing exciting-yogurts, fruit(disappointingly unsweet), small danishes and small muffins. Convenient Wolfgang Puck express and Coldstone ice cream on the street level below the hotel.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were pleased with this hotel. It was at the beach, the breakfast was great and there are a lot of places to eat such as McDonalds,Burger King and Subway nearby plus the normal upper scale eateries. The waitstaff was very helpful when we needed infro. Noise was low on 19th floor with view to Diamond Head although did have to step out on small patio to see ocean. Walking the streets was easy to the shops but this hotel is not in the congested part of Waikiki that we felt like we where in a big city. Joke was on us that we couldn't find the refrigerator and ice bucket, glasses in the dresser under the big TV first day. Also the security on and off the elevators was good.

After much reading of reviews mostly good we chose the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel. I enjoyed the location and the price compared to the other hotels I have stayed in before. Yes it is not a 5 star but I wasn't looking for one either. We had a partial ocean view room that was small for 3 adults and a 3 yr old so my mom called the desk and asked if they had something bigger. They upgraded us to a JR suite for a small daily fee. We really enjoyed the bigger area for the 4 of us. I didn't have the same feel as some recent reviewers about the loudness and such. I have no complaints about the room except the tub drained slowly and one day it was fixed without contacting anyone. The service folks did a great job working around our napping the little one and so forth and serviced the room when we were away. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for no frills, no room service type stay as a value for your dollar. The breakfast was a pretty good spread compared to some continental breakfast offerings. Plenty to choose from and a hot something if you are in need of that. The staff was very helpful, nice and accommodating. Thank you for a great vacation. I will be back in June for work and hope to find a good deal to stay here again.

Three night stay was reasonably priced-generous breakfast with to-go bag saved us eating out one meal a day. Patio tiny, tiny but looked out at Diamondhead where the sun rose in the morning-beautiful! Could walk out on patio to see the ocean. Valets incredibly helpful and courteous. 22nd floor-no night noise at all and very well maintained. 12 year old very satisfied, too. Would definitely stay again.

I loved staying here. As it was our first trip to Hawaii, we wasn't sure what to expect, what we would really like to do here, what the people would be like- but wow, we was impressed!! The staff here was ever helpful, from helping uscwith the Internet connection at the pool, to the Expedia desk staff constantly helping us plan our day to day activities- they were extremely helpful!!The room had a good view of the beach, (though the beach was under reconstruction-not anyones fault at all). The room was of a good enough size, my only let downs were the hairdryer being extremely weak to what I'm used to- my hair was drying better naturally! And the shower head itself was un adjustable at quite a low hight for my partner, he struggled to stand up straight and shower, though the shower was powerful and good enough.We loved the help yourself breakfast on the beach, especially the fruit that I took full advantage on as fresh pineapple just couldn't taste any better! (definitely not compared to shipped in ones to England were used to) the obey problem we had was there was SO much sweet stuff and not enough savoury, though that may be down to cultural preferences- in England we don't tend to have sweet pastries, like the doughnuts and muffins, for breakfast!I don't understand how people find the lifts hard tovworj? They made complete sense to us!!Overall we loved this hotel, our stay here was just great! We loved Hawaii, and plan on returning again soon. Thankyou!

We stayed here on the back end of our cruise. We got of the cruise ship and was at the hotel by 10 a.m. Check in was at 3 p.m. They would not allow us to check in. I was not feeling well so they were able to find a lesser room ( two double beds) and had it ready for us in 15 minutes. The room was very clean but older. The t.v. was a flat screen tv so that was nice. The room was very small. The safe was on the floor which made it inconvenant to access. The is no closet door, just "things" hanging down in front. The toilet is set lower than most hotels. We were on the 21st floor and the hotel next door's a/c unit was right outside our window. It wasn't too bad though. the view from the room was nice. It was an oceanview. They offer a breakfast in the a.m. but we never did eat there. We did visit the pool bar but found it to be on the expensive side, being that you could walk across the street to the Marriott and get the same for a lot less. Overall, it was a clean hotel and the staff were very nice. I rated the rooms satisfactory only because they were very small.

Our first trip to Hawaii was perfect. The Aston was a pleasant hotel. We had an oceanfront room on the 10th floor. The view was gorgeous! Next time I would like to stay a couple more floors higher but we are still very satisfied. The rooms are small but we did not spend a lot of time there. The location was great for us. It is not in the center of waikiki but down towards the end which made it less busy and still within walking distance to all the shops and resturaunts and of course you cross the street and there is the beach which was awesome. However I do recommend traveling to the North shore and scouting out those beaches they are less busy and gorgeous. My favorite beach was Lanikai towards the end traveling back from the North Shore. The Honolulu zoo is right next door to this hotel which is nice for the kids we have a 5 year old and took him. The breakfast by the pool was nice, although it does get old after a couple days of eating the same fruit and danishes, you get a cooler and can take as much as you like so that helps with snacks throughout the day since food is so expensive, so can't really complain. Wolf gang pucks is right below in the hotel which had good food. All in all I would definately stay again in an oceanfront room thats the only way to go! I hope they do a little renuvating in the future just to spruce it up then maybe I would give it an excellent, the bathrooms were small and blah. The staff was very friendly and the elevator system was great as well. It's a great place to get rested and enjoy the view ! We will defiantely be back and we highley recommend this hotel.

The rooms have not been properly remodeled since the late 90's, and the free breakfast can, at very best, be described by saying, "well, it's better than nothing I suppose."The employees are all very pleasant and extremely helpful, and the overall condition of the hotel is OK, but the rooms are terrible!! The bathroom is appallingly bad, and sport broken floor tiles, moldy caulking around everything, and a sloppy paint job. Our room absolutely screamed, "I don't care", which was a huge disappointment.If you want a cheap bed to sleep on, this is the place for you. If you actually care about a nice looking, clean hotel that takes it's overall appearance into consideration, stay at the Hyatt next door.

We were looking for an affordable hotel with oceans front rooms and this was it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The live music at breakfast was very good and the food selection was good as well. The Tiki Bar restaurant was really good as was the entertainment each night. We will for sure stay here again when visiting Honolulu.

My friend and I were in Honolulu for a week doing the tourist thing. We stayed at the Aston because of its location and the convenience of tour pick ups. We did several tours and the buses came to the hotel to pick us up and bring us back. We caught the trolly there also. The room was a partial ocean view and we felt it was a good room for the money. The beds were comfortable, we had a small balcony and a nice TV. The room was a little small but since we spent little time in it we felt it was o.k. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The restaurants in the hotel were adequate and the servers were attentive. I would recommend this hotel as a good place to stay especially if you are planning to save a little money on your vacation.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel after staying at the Aston Kaanapali Shores Hotel, once again you do get what you pay for. The rooms are extremely small just the bedroom, very small balcony with one chair and small table and a very small bathroom with a shower in the bath. There are no tea making facilities which is typical of American accommodation so we rung housekeeping and they bought us up a Kettle only. We went to a ABC shop bought a couple of mugs at $ 2.49 each and amenities/milk, problem fixed but what a welcome gesture it would have been if they provided this. Breakfast starts at 6.30 so if your on a early tour you will probably miss out, like the Oahu Grand circle island tour, pick up is 6am and no they won't cater for people on early tours. Apart from this, you get a small cooler bag and once they open up its a free for all with people rushing everywhere in a disorderly conduct (incase they miss food), all pastries, yoguat, cereal, sushi, tea/coffee/juice etc and then you are free to eat where ever. We sat over at the beach which was more enjoyable than sitting around a small pool with lots of other people breathing down your neck.The next disappointment is no WI-FI in the room unless you want to pay the $10 per day "amenity fee", what a joke in 2012!!! I overheard a guest ask for the Wi-Fi to be on for just a few days of their holiday and they were told in no uncertain terms, you either pay the $ 10 per day for your entire stay or go without. They do have Wi-fi in the pool area if you like no privacy and they also have a number of computers where you can pay by the minute for internet usage.Then another disappointment, the room safe, yes there is one, but you have to pay $ 3.00 per day to have it operational. Totally disgusted by now and not a good start the the 2nd half of our holiday.At least this room was cleaned daily and the bed was so comfortable and KS at last.Expedia Tours has a desk in the lobby and are very good, would recommend them but you can get cheaper rates for some things along Kalakaua Ave, if you have time check out your options first but we were on limited time and wanted to get our tours booked. We were also happy with Expedia when in Maui.Its also worthwhile walking around and checking out all the various restaurants rather than just staying within the hotelOne good thing about this hotel was the location, at the end of the strip next to Honolulu Zoo but one last whinge the beach was being reclaimed when we got there, but I assume it will be great once works finish. The other end of Waikiki beach is very popular and much more busy so we were happy with the location to shops, restaurants and a great walk.Would we go back to Honolulu definitely, would we stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel again, definitely not, buyer beware. See other review for Aston Kaanapali Shores Hotel and activities.

We spent a week here in April 2012. Absolutely loved the location as it was easy to walk to everywhere in Waikiki. We liked being right across the street from the beach. The hotel rooms are clean. Bathroom is dated and tiny and musty smelling. The beds are super comfy. Didn't notice any bed bugs, although I didn't look too hard. I did have a couple of bites, but easily could have been from being outside. The first room we stayed in had too small double beds. We phoned to see if we could switch to a room with a king size bed (which I requested when I booked). We were able to switch the next day with no trouble. Also wanted to change rooms as the balcony door did not close/lock and the air conditioner does not work unless the balcony door is latched. Our second room was much better and seemed bigger and we had a better view of the ocean (on 20th floor). Our flights left late in the evening so they gave us an extra hour to check out and they stored our luggage for the afternoon.The breakfast worked great for us as we usually have cereal,yogurt and fruit for breakfast anyways. Although it did get kind of boring after a while. Tiki's is fun...good music and drinks. Wolfgang's express was convenient too and had good pizzas.We did not like that you had to pay for internet and room safe and local calls ($1/call even toll free). Housekeeping did not come for two days. We exchanged towels with the maid in the hall while he was cleaning another room (at his request).Although not a fancy hotel by any means, it served its purpose. Safe and clean and great location. We would probably stay here again as the price was good and we saved money by not having to buy breakfast. Lots of homeless people line the street along the main street in Waikiki. None of them seemed to bother anyone, although it seemed a little sketchy at night.Definitely go to Duke's for supper...best meal ever!The expedia desk was very handy for booking tours and most tours picked up right on the corner or down the street. This worked great for us as we did not rent a car.

This was our 5th stay at the Aston in as many years and it needs a refurbishment come on guys update the red and keep ahead of the game. We were on level 14 and the view of the sunsets were great, staff are friendly and always willing to help, the dredging the beach was not good, but totally understand the reason. Breakfast on the Beach (BOB) is not worth the trouble, get with the times and move forward change the menu occassionally... Overall we are looking for something a little more up market next time. Sorry Aston, we have to move on...

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we did a fair amount of tripadvisor research before deciding on this hotel. As usual a bit of balancing of feedback did the trick, most comments on this hotel are positive, mixed with a lesser amount of negative. So we went with the majority and feel we got it right, we were very pleased with our choice.Sure it isn't 5 star but if that's what you want you need to go down the street a bit and spend much more money.We got good value for money in our opinion, we had an oceanfront room on the 14th floor, the room was larger than many hotel rooms we've had, the bed was great and the view was expansive with no shortage of activities and scenery to take in both day and night.The lift system was very good and we were happy with the breakfast experience, and while we never went down early we always got everything we wanted as the choices were constantly being restocked.We walked to and up Diamond Head and back again, and visited the Memorial at Pearl Harbor twice, a very sad and moving experience but so well set out, a great tribute to all those brave souls.We really enjoyed our 8 days here before moving on to Maui and would happily stay here again when we next return to Hawaii.Mahalo to all the staff at the Aston.
user_name:
Melnp
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: The price and location of the hotel right on Waikiki beach it very good. The rooms are not very big but who really spends alot of time in their room while in Hawaii anyways? The room and hotel itself seemed to be clean throughout. If you plan on renting or parking a car at this hotel be prepared to pay $27 a day (plus tax) for their valet ONLY parking. The TIKI bar connected to the hotel was nice. Good food, drinks, and service. Prices high like anywhere there in Waikiki. The pool always seemed to be clean, but no hottub. The breakfast everymornig was nice, but after a couple of days had to go somewhere else because I got tired of pastries and bread. All in all it was a nice place to stay, just be prepared for the crazy parking prices.

The hotel was great. It's at one end of Waikiki and only steps from the beach and the Honolulu zoo. Easy walking distance to shops and restaurants.The hotel room was small but comfortable. Had a fridge which was convenient. The lanai had a great view of the beach. You could watch surfers at surfer school in the distance, beautiful sunsets, and just enjoy the view.The elevators only work with your room key. I never did figure out how to get down to the ground floor from my room. I always had to go to the lobby level and then take the escalator down the last flight. Not a big deal.Breakfast was a normal continental. It's true that you take you blue cooler down, fill it up, and go on your way.I walked to Diamondhead crater from the hotel...about a mile, then walked up the crater, then walked back. I might take a cab one way the next time, but it's really easy. I'd stay here again easily.

Lovely friendly hotel. Loved the lift system! Very safe ! Enjoyed meeting all the different holidaymakers during breakfast . The hotel location was as promised ... Next to the beach . Zoo just a short walk from hotel which was lovely ! Monkey chorus in the morning. Enjoyed free wifi at breakfast .. Kept in touch with family! Staff very friendly , the jewellery stall in the morning a lovely extra. My silver ring is beautiful. The movie service is a great idea with plenty of choice. All in all a perfect first trip to Hawaii.

This was our first long haul trip and from collection by Super Shuttle at the airport to returning to LA for our conecting flight we had a truly fantastic experience. The decor is a bit dated but the rooms are clean and the bed were very comfortable. We were on the 6th floor just above the bar and we were not disturbed by the bar entertainment at night as this finished by midnight anyway, it was much cheaper to sit on the balcony enjoying the entertainment drinking our own drinks. The views were everything we expected and it is really useful to have the various takeaways underneath as eating out can be quite expensive. I was surprised about the amount of homeless along the main Waikiki Beach walk but they didn't trouble us at all. The ABC stores, of which there seems to be at least 1 every 5ooyds, operate a scheme where you save all your till receipts and if you reach a certain total you qualify for a free gift - the more you spend the better the gift!! The bus stop and Trolley stop is outside the hotel and not very expensive, the ding ding of the trolley buses do tend to disturb any mid day siesta's or lay ins but you soon get used to them and who wants to waste a moment in such a fabulous location as this. The hotel provide a cool bag to fill for your breakfast and also have a drinks machine in reception with tea, coffee or juice dependant on the time of day but there are not always cups available, we found it useful to take our own thermos cups so we can take back to the room safely. The lifts are slow at breakfast due to the amount of people taking their food back to the rooms.

The staff were very helpful and kind which went a long way to making our stay a good one.We paid extra for a sea side room but the first room they gave us had black mildew spots on the ceiling. I get that it's sea side and this can happen but my husband has asthma so no way could we stay in this room. They were very courteous and changed our room right away. The new room was great but was on a lower floor so the canopy of the hotel entrance blocked the view, unfortunately there wasn't anything else available and we didn't feel like being very pushy so we just took it. It was just too bad because it wasn't worth it to pay extra in the end for sea side. Word of advice: if you're getting a sea side room make sure it's not on the low floors.Despite this kinda rough start the rest of our stay was fantastic. The breakfast was really good (get there early!) which we often took in our little coolers (provided by the hotel) to eat on the beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful at every opportunity (let us borrow towels after hours sometimes! we returned them I promise :) ). Their hospitality desk helped us book some super fun adventures on the island. The room we ended up with was very clean and comfortable. We were there for just over a week and it began to feel like home. We don't drive and this hotel was also at a really ideal location. There's a bus stop right in front that is serviced by numerous routes to take you anywhere you need to go (we even went to the North Shore). We did visit the zoo across the street which was fun. Despite it being a busy stretch of beach the snorkeling just out front of the hotel was really good. It was at the end of the busy strip so you feel like you're part of the action without being too overwhelmed by it. We also went to a lot of really nice restaurants that were all within easy walking distance. Although word of advice on restaurants: don't just go into one, research it first, all the ones we just checked out at the spur of the moment were real stinkers. The Japanese restaurant right at the hotel, Yoshitsune was amazing, we ate there every day. The Aston's restaurant was really good too actually and we enjoyed the nightly entertainment. The pool was nice but we never bothered with it since the beach was right there! Thanks Aston for making our honeymoon unforgettable.

Spent three nights at the Aston in early April 2012. The location is quite nice with a great body boarding beach right across the street. The hotel was overall quite nice but the room we had was an ocean front room and it was the smallest room I've ever had for 4 people- the view was fabulous though the balcony was tiny. Barely room for two people. The beds were full size beds, not queens. The worst part was the bathroom had no horizontal surface to set anything on other than the back of the toilet. Try putting in contacts or make-up or otherwise. The breakfast in the morning was just okay. Waffles and omelets were extra- just carbs were included- no protein other than yogurt. No wireless except on the second floor pool deck. Pool was very cold but since you are in Hawaii, we spent 95% of our time on the beach! Overall it was a decent value, but we couldn't wait to get to a bigger room. Strange elevators too- you never punch a button for a floor in the vator. You waive your room card in frotnt and tell it what floor and then it schedules and tells you what elevator to get on. Worked great until it got really busy and then it was a mess.

We stayed here for four nights in April 2012 and had a good experience overall.Price: Competitive for the area. We booked a partial oceanview room rather than the full oceanfront and had a great view of the ocean...and of the balconies of the hotel next door. Ask for a room on the pool side for a slightly nicer view! $10 daily resort fee for internet, but we were able to decline.Room: Agree with others that the bathroom is small, but it wasn't a problem for us. The rest of the room was a good size, renovated recently with a newer tv and bedspread. The best part of staying here was the daily free breakfast. You get a blue bag to take it to-go, or if you're like me, aid you in grabbing lots of food. The choices are expansive for a free breakfast, including fresh fruit, pastries, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, and our favorites: miso soup, rice, and kimchee.Location: Located on one end of Waikiki beach, next to the zoo, and directly across the street from the beach. At the time of our trip the stretch of beach in front of the hotel was closed for maintenance. Good restaurants and lots of shopping abound nearby, but this is Waikiki. It is relatively out of the way; good for avoiding some crowds but bad for riding the bus.Transportation: We rode around on the bus for two days and had a rental car for the other two. Diamond Head is about a 5 min bus ride away (45 minutes walking), downtown Honolulu about 30 minutes away, and the airport about 1 hour away (we rode the bus to pick up our rental car at the airport - I don't recommend doing this!). We avoided the hotel parking fee by parking in the zoo ($1/hour, no daily limit) and on Kalakaua street next to the zoo (metered, free at night). These are about a 5-7 minute walk away. The Aston Waikiki Beach, not to be confused with some of the nearby Aston properties, provided us with a great overall experience, though admittedly we weren't in the room much!

During the last week in March 2012 we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach hotel. On the second night of our stay we found 2 bed bugs on one of our beds and when we looked more closely we found 2 more on the bed and 1 on the curtain. We reported this and the hotel staff moved us to another room and guess what...more bed bugs in the pillow cases. Never again! We moved hotels that night.

Spent 8 nights in a junior suite with 3 children. View was fantastic and exactly how it is shown on the website. Location is fantastic with the beach directly across the street. The breakfast to go was great as we sat around the pool a couple mornings and watched the great entertainment, went to the beach for a breakfast picnic a few mornings, and you are also able to take your breakfast with you on excursions if you leave early. Rooms were clean although a bit dated as was the bathroom, but we did not spend very much time in our room at all. We never had any problems with long waits for the elevators. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel which was very convenient especially for the kids when they were too tired to go out. The hotel is located at one end of Kalakaua Ave, which is a great street to walk every evening for shopping and restaurants. Hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating, as were the tour desks. The pool is quite small and was cold, although my kids did swim in it a few times for a short duration. For anyone wondering whether or not to rent a car before they go or last minute while there... you can rent a car at the tour desk and the cars are located right next door at the Marriott. We went during spring break and the price was $30 cheaper there than on hotwire when I left. I would stay here again for the location and hospitality.

We found the Aston Waikiki a good value for money accommodation for the family. The standard room is small and if travelling with a family it maybe wise to upgrade to a suite as it was a tight squeeze for a family of 4. The location is good being at the bottom end of Waikiki close to the zoo (you can see the pink flamingos from the open hallways if you're staying on a high enough floor) and we found no trouble walking to the centre of Waikiki. The breakfast is something we have never experienced before. Again for the cost of the accommodation we can't complain and it was a different experience, maybe not for those who are 'not a morning person' as there are lots of people milling about while waiting to find a vacant pool chair to sit at. The pool is small, but then again you have the beach across the road. We found having Subways and Wolfgang Puck restaurants underneath the Aston very handy and good value. If you can budget it into your holiday, consider renting a holiday house for a couple of days on the North Shore. We did that and totally enjoyed the change of scenery that the North Shore has to offer as it is so different to Waikiki. Mind you we did enjoy Waikiki but it was nice to step back in time and totally relax on the North Shore. Renting a car in Waikiki can be difficult if you are travelling in peak season so it is best to book before you arrive. We did find it easier picking up our car in Waikiki after our stay at the Aston rather that picking it up from the airport. Once you get used to driving on the other side of the road (for us Australians!) and the multi lane highways it wasnt too difficult and definitely a good way to see the island at your own pace. Optional extras to try: Horseriding at Happy Trails especially if you have a smaller child as they have the saddles to hold them. Learning to surf at North shore - there's many different schools out there, we tried North Shore Surf Girls and found them good but a little expensive. Though they did have a professional photographer out there on the day and we were able to get a cd of photos from the lesson for only $30. Dont forget to try Uncle Ted's Chocolate coconut pie, to die for!

My husband and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel at the end of our honeymoon. We were extremely disappointed. The staff was rude at check-in and rude at check-out. The room was very small and the bathroom is the size of a gas station bathroom. The room was dirty when we arrived and the ice machine was directly outside of our door so we heard it making ice all night long. There are many hotels to choose from on the Waikiki strip, this one will not be on our list as a possibility for our next visit.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We asked to change our Jr. Suite so that the view would be better and they gave us a Suite on the 23rd floor with an incredible view. Couldn't have been happier. Diamond Head and the Pacific. Stayed with our teens and it was a perfect location for all of us. Snorkled and surfed across the street. The free breakfast was great every morning and the staff was friendly, especially the security guard, who was very helpful to us. The restaurants nearby were great. We ate at Wolfgang Pucks, The Tiki Bar & Grill and Subway during our stay.

If you get a great rate and an ocean view room of some description, this hotel is ok. We stayed in april 2012 in a Junior Suite, very tired and outdated, the photos look great, the reality is the room was old, chipped worn out furniture, worn out (and broken) sofa bed, small grubby and outdated bathroom. Which seems to match many other reviewers comments. The staff is great, the breakfast a bonus, the locality to the beach great, etc. Unfortunately the age is getting to this hotel. We decided not to stay on our return a week later and checked in to the Marriot at $30 more and the difference was huge. Don't waste your money on a junior suite as they are not much bigger and I would consider them just a bigger hotel room, no privacy from the lounge area etc.I think most people accept this hotel as they are in hoilday mode. For the good rate we had, I found The Aston only just acceptable, if we had paid anywhere near their regular rates we would have been very dissappointed. The booking experience, staff and locality to baech are the saviour but there are better options.

I wasn't expecting much after I saw the comment about bed bugs but the price was right. We got a junior suite and I actually liked the hotel. That person must have been ticked about something. The hotel was clean, it wasn't first class but nice. I would definayely recommend a ocean view or our junior suite which was same price. $200 is great price especially since it includes breakfast. The fresh fruit was yummy with fresh papaya as we'll as pineapple. The beans bread was awesome. We did pay $5 to have an omelette. Food is incredibly expensive in Hawaii so even having to pay extra for omelette I was ok. The beach by hotel was less crowded then by dukes and was nice. Tiki bar was fun for drinks and food was good. We ate buffet at Marriott next door one night that was a great meal for the price. Also had drinks at beach bar twice while kids took surfing lessons.

The Aston Waikiki hotel is great for a family vacation. In all fairness, for those who like a bit more luxury, it isn't a 5 star hotel, but it did offer everything we needed. The location is great! The hotel is at the end of the Waikiki strip, close to the Diamond Head area (great location for a morning run). It is also right across from the beach which is wonderful! Yes, there is a section of the beach area that is currently under construction, but it's not like you have to walk a mile to find the next open beach area...maybe a block (if even). Plus, the fun part of Waikiki is walking down the beach anyway and seeing all the different hotels, etc. So, if you are looking for quiet and remote, you should probably not be staying in Honolulu period (Maui and Kaui are better islands for that). Another nice feature is the breakfast, which offers an assortment of bagels, muffins, doughnuts and fresh fruit. In my opinion, I actually thought they had a generous assortment and they did a good job of keeping it stocked during the breakfast hours. Sure, it is just bagels and pastries, but it's more than what most hotels (even the nicer hotels) offer as part of the hotel stay package. If you want to fill up on eggs, sausage, etc., you may want to find an ihop or a breakfast place for that. We also liked that we could fill up our cooler bag to have snacks the rest of the day. We didn't have any issues with lines or crowds and were there over spring break.There is a Wolfgang Puck and Subway right below the hotel which is nice for a cheaper meal. If you like to do a little exploring, just walk down the street towards the Royal Hawaiian hotel and you will find tons of food options and shopping. Everything is super close together.The only negative feedback I have is that the rooms are indeed small and a bit outdated in style. However, I felt the rooms are clean and the staff does a good job of supplying fresh towels everyday and cleaning the room daily. In all honesty, you are not in your room much anyway and if you plan to be, I would question why when you are in a location as great as Hawaii. Tips:1. Don't rent a car for the entire time - the transportation is very good for getting you around the Honolulu area. It is not worth the daily parking fees that most hotels charge. 2. If you do want to rent a car, I would recommend it only for visiting the north shore and the Kailua beach area. Those are definitely must see areas of Oahu. The shaved ice in the North Shore area is fantastic!3. Bring your walking shoes - everything is pretty close together in Waikiki, but the strip is fairly long and there are lots of things to see, so be prepared to walk.4. The night life is fun for kids and adults. Lots of people doing their little shows on the sidewalks at night time. Yes, there are quite a few homeless people but they won't bother you if you don't bother them. 5. Wear your sunscreen! The sun is intense even if the weather only feels like 75 degrees. Enjoy yourselves! The tradeoff for a less luxurious hotel is worth it if you want to make this a budget trip for you and your family in a place of paradise!

We stayed Mar.23 week and found the hotel ok. Value is good for Waikiki but nothing really stands out about this property. $27 daily parking, ice cold pool that closes at 7pm just a couple of things we didn't care for. The staff we dealt with were friendly enough and no issues there. Our room (2206) was a basis room with a small but functional and clean bathroom. We had a good beach and diamond head view but very dissappointed the lanai's had no room for even a chair. If you want a balcony to sit and relax, make sure you're on the north side, not the south. Tiki's lounge was nice (good deals for happy hour) and supper there was good. Overall a good location, decent value but a busy location.

What a fantastic stay. Room was quiet on 18th floor, nice view of the ocean but balcony a little small to sit out on without lanai door open. Tikis was great typically themed but friendly service and food reasonable. Amenities in hotel good, beds comfy,staff helpful. Pay for film, DVD and PS3 a reasonable cost if needed. Had an amazing stay with my teenage son, Hawaii truly is paradise, friendly and very family friendly.

We loved our stay at the beach hotel. Great buffet breakfast every morning. You get a cooler bag so if you don't feel like eating poolside you can take breakfast back to your room, or to the beach, etc. Breakfast had lots of variety. We had the best views over Waikiki beach, and the beach right out front is the best beach spot in all of Waikiki. And it has shallow areas if you have kiddies. Lots of places to eat, drink and shop all walking distance. Shopping trolleys can take you to all the popular places if you don't want o walk. We did a lot of tours (with many different tour companies) and the Aston beach hotel was ALWAYS a pick up/ drop off location... Not all hotels are! A super convenient and lovely spot, would definitely stay here again!

Stayed here in December/January and loved this hotel. Its not anything majorly flash but its in a perfect location and we ended up with the most awesome view of Waikiki Beach. You couldnt ask for anything better.Stayed in a Junior Suite faced the ocean - room was not overly large by a suite standard but was good for us as we had our son in a cot so we had a bit of room to spread out and he had room to run around. We had a small table and 2 chairs in the room which we used to eat our breakfast while looking at our ocean view - got breakfast every morning from the buffet downstairs. Yes there isnt a hell of a lot of stuff to choose from but really there is cereal & bread & you can get an omelette if you pay $5. Pool not overly huge but never swam in it - choose to swim in the beautiful calm ocean straight across the road which is protected by the rockwall.Staff helpful & nice. The only negative is it is quite a noisy hotel - the area just seems to pickup a lot of outside noise and yes you can hear it from the room. But it didnt ruin our stay - just added to the atmosphere.We loved our stay here - wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to our friends.

We enjoyed our stay here so much. It was central to everything we needed. The view from our Lani was absolutely beautiful. Nothing compares to the water colors in Hawaii. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our trip was booked through Pleasant Holidays and their on site desk was helpful with getting our pickup for the airport. The beds were very comfortable. We had a free breakfast by the pool every morning, which we enjoyed, because food on Waikiki was expensive. A breakfast up the street was $23.00.

This place was NOT the hotel they described. Their version of 'Kids stay, eat and play free' is a coupon book where you have poor choices in restaurants. The 2 for 1 luau is an indoor show. The pool is very small and has a quickly sloping bottom where my son couldn't stand. There were cheerleading teams staying here and many 20 somethings. Rowdy, but the minute my son jumped into pool, he got yelled at by the towel attendant. We checked out early and went to Hilton Hawaiian Village.

The hotel is a winner. Very enjoyable stay. Great location, friendly staff, reasonable price, good housekeeping, lots of food choices, shuttles stop at the door. But we have 2 suggestions to management:(One) Please put someone in charge of the pool who sees it as a guest amenity, not just a backdrop to breakfast. The pool is too cold and closes too early. Please consider raising the temperature of the pool and keeping it open to 11pm or midnight. The pool is shaded by the shadow of the building most of the day and stays quite cold. Ice cold, even on hot days. Yes, the beach is right across the street, but after a long day of shuttling to attractions, walking and shopping, some late evening time in the pool would have been fabulous. But no. It is ice cold and closes at 7pm. Why is this? According to the Front Desk staff, the pool is run by the Food and Beverage Department. (Two) Honor your advertised specials. We got somewhat snookered on the ‘4th night free’. We booked and paid the deposit for a 3 night stay. Then we decided to add the 4th night free. But no. They RAISED the nightly rate to give us the 4th night “free”. It amounted to a decreased rate for the four nights, but certainly was not a free night. Just say the rate is reduced for stays longer than three nights. We are OK with that.

Great hotel for the price/value. Clean, comfortable, large rooms that have been updated over the years. We stayed in a suite with one bedroom and two baths, ocean view. We had a family of five - so we ordered 2 roll away beds that were very comfortable. Small refrig in the room. Hair dryer. Great water pressure in showers. Adjustable thermostat for air conditioning. Two TV's with pay Playstation. Pool - best sun in afternoon. Bfast included free - pastries, yogurt, bagels, cereal, coffee etc. Eggs and waffles cooked on site in pool area for $4-5. For a family, this was a great savings in Waikiki! It is not really bfast on the beach - they just give you cooler bags to fill with food. We put these to great use with our afternoon snacks too. Staff is excellent. Only downside is parking - it is $27 a day. We just parked down Monsarrat Ave for free and walked two blocks. If you park around 5-6p.m. when the beach crowd leaves, you will easily get a spot for the night. Sometimes my husband dropped us off at the hotel with al the beach gear, and went a found a space a few more blocks away. Also, Waikiki is in the middle of the beach restoration project (we were there Mar. 23rd week 2012). Down to the right of our view was construction on the beach. However, the left side of the hotel view is beautiful - so we didn't mind. I was never able to connect to their free Wi-Fi on the 3rd level by the pool. I did not pursue the issue because there were pay per minute internet access on the reception level. I figured we were in paradise and that it wasn't that important to plug in. We would return easily - this was a great experience for my kids - age 9, 13, 17. Also, there is semi fast food below the hotel on street /beach side: Subway, Wolf gang pucks, cookie shop and an ABC shop to get all you snacks and drinks, sunscreen, towels and boggie boards for the beach

This is the most excellent hotel you can stay in Waikiki without having to burn a hole through your wallet. First off, hotels in Waikiki are going to be expensive depending on how comfortable the hotel room is and where it is located. Most of the nice hotels will start at $300/night. I was able to get an Ocean Front hotel room at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for $200/night. My husband and I had a beautiful view of the ocean. That is one thing you cannot miss when you're staying in Waikiki. You came all the way to Hawaii. Why not enjoy the view? Secondly, the location was excellent. The hotel was right across from the beach and only six blocks away from the International Marketplace. There were plenty of nearby shops and restaurants. You can pretty much find almost whatever you needed. Thirdly, our hotel room was beautiful and comfortable. The AC was quiet and worked perfectly. We had a huge flat screen TV. We also had a safe (with a small daily fee). The bathroom had a bathtub and hair dryer. The hair dryer may not be incredibly strong, but it was handy since I forgot to pack one. The only con was that the bathtub was a little dirty. But we got some cleaning supplies, and my husband scrubbed it good as new. They also vacuum the carpeted floor daily. Our hotel room also had a refrigerator which made it convenient. The hotel also served free breakfast every morning. They included pastries, croissants, mini bagels, fresh fruit, miso soup, hot coffee, cereal, etc. They only charged a small fee for the omelette and waffle. They had a pool and public shower. They had free wifi on the 3rd floor. You could also rent the internet on the public computers. They have three different concierge services. I loved the way how this hotel had so many different services and amenities. The hotel staff was incredibly friendly and responsive. I would not recommend any other hotel in Waikiki. I would love to stay here again if I ever return to Hawaii. You're getting an excellent deal out of this one!

They are very friendly. The rooms are OK, Bathroom are small but has hair dryer.Very clean, Hallway, or rooms,pool deck, bathrooms. the Hotel is not new, but they allhave a balcony. The beach is across the street, which is very convenient. They alsohave a continental breakfast between 7:00-9:00am. Not bad if you like a crowd. They willlent you chairs and towels to go to the beach at no cost. The only things I can think that I mind is to use the wifi,it's only on the main floor as the other hoterl it is free access, thereyou have to pay for internet and the wifi. Second is there is A bar and that can be loud,butby 22hours it's closed

I had high expectations staying at this hotel based on the reviews I had read and sadly I was a little disappointed. Don't get me wrong.The place is right across from Waikiki . If you have a room with ocean views you are greeted to the most stunning views ever! Check in was a breeze. The place is a little dated and you don't quite get the feel of a big hotel when you turn up there. Maybe because you arrive on level 1 and reception is on level 3. They claimed to have wifi which I needed to finish off some work but sadly its only available on level three. Which was annoying as I never really found myself there when I needed to work.You can pay nine ninety five for twenty for hours of internet which is fast which I ended up doing.The free breakfast on the beach concept is good in theory I suppose but the poll area is bout really very nice so you can't comfortably sit and eat there. Right or side the hotel the strip of beach is under maintenance so there are diggers Abe dump trucks so you can't really go and enjoy the breakfast at the beach.Maybe once all the work is completed it would be more inviting. Breakfast consists of muffins, danishes, coffee and juice and some fruit.The bar downstairs always had something going on which was great.Live music and entertainment.it seemed very popular..even a few locals seem to hangout there.Overall I was disappointed maybe for the money I paid I was expecting more in terms of the size of the room and value for moneyFor the second part of my stay I am staying at a cheaper place which is more cental, has more in house facilities and is in a better location along the beach strip closer to shops and transport.Of course no view but then the balcony I got with my room was so tiny at the Aston two people couldn't comfortably sit there even.

Very courteous staff, breakfast was very good, accommodations were good, the only problems we had were the neighbors were noisy until we pounded on the wall and told them to be quiet at 5 AM. The only thing we did not find was a jacuzzi/hot tub.

This is our second time to have a one week vacation at this hotel. We love it. If you can get a good deal on the room rate, it is a great value.The breakfast option is very good with many options. It is served from 6:30-9:00. It is well attended, but the lines move quickly.We enjoy the location. It is right at the beach. It is at the end of the strip, so lots of walking as you explore dining and shopping, but nothing is too far away.Rooms are small, but beds very comfortable.View is lovely, but depends on floor and which direction you are facing.There is a $3/day safe charge.No coffee makers in the room. Thankfully we knew this ahead of time and packed accordingly. Free coffee is of course available during breakfast, but we prefer in room option.Free wifi is in lobby, but if your room is above pool you may be able to get it from your lanai.I would absolutely stay there again, but only if I was able to get a good promotion rate.

We really liked this hotel. It certainly isn't the quietest, given the location and the open air bar, but it is very convenient to everything -- right across from the beach! -- is very comfortable, and has a great free breakfast that you can take to the beach every morning. I agree with some of the reviews -- service is a bit hit or miss. Some staff were really friendly and helpful, and others clearly couldn't care if we were satisfied or not. Overall, though, we really liked this hotel and have recommended it to others to stay here too. We'd stay here again no problem.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for one week (March 24-31 2012). Our room, #1429, was an ocean front, king bed room with a balcony overlooking Waikiki Beach. The view was panoramic: uninterrupted ocean view and the balcony was able to accommodate two chairs and a small table. It appeared that the rooms having parallel views would not be nearly as scenic and in our opinion the room was worth the upcharge.The room was spacious and well equipped with effective air conditioning, a mini-fridge that did an excellent job of keeping drinks and fruits cold, and ample closet and storage space. The only complaint regarding the furnishings was that there was no place to store toiletries in the bathroom and we had to put items on the floor. The carpet, furniture and bedding were clean and in very good condition and showed little wear.Being located at the east end of the Waikiki strip (near the zoo), the hotel is in a less congested area (both for foot and vehicle traffic) which was a nice break after visiting the central beach area. The entire Waikiki beach is being “refreshed” meaning more sand is being added, and we were concerned this would be noisy and inconvenient and emailed ahead to the GM, but it turned out that while the beach immediately in front of the hotel is being worked on, you need only walk 100 feet east and the refurbished beach is wide and less busy than that further west. There was no noise to speak of.The breakfast provided was more than adequate. There was mixed, fresh fruit, cold cereals, instant oatmeal, muffins and breads (all fresh) tropical flavored yogurts and several varieties of coffee. There were also waffles available for $3 and Omelets made to order for $5. (We did not care for the orange juice so we went and bought a 1/2 gallon at the grocery store for $6 and kept it in our refrigerator for the week.) You are given a soft sided cooler that is sufficient to hold a six pack of soda or all of your breakfast items if you wish to take them to your room or the beach. In fact, there is often little available room to sit around the pool area where the breakfast is served.The facilities of the hotel are very nice and well kept. The pool does close at 7pm which seems quite early, and the water temperature was quite cold (about ocean temperature). The bell staff was helpful and security at the hotel is adequate. The elevators are key controlled and not nearly as difficult to use as you may read in other reviews- there is always someone on duty to assist if needed.Parking is quite expensive at $27/night. We heard there was cheaper parking elsewhere but were never able to find it and ended up parking for free (after 6pm) at the nearby park. There is also street parking nearby but you have to feed the meters until 6pm at $1.50.hour with a 2 hour max. We had several problems which were technology related. The safe code stopped working after 5 days and had to be reset by maintenance. We were told this was the policy but it was inconvenient as we were locked out. The safe charge is $3/day.Also, the internet in the room in not wireless- they do provide the hook up cable though- but it was a poor connection and had to be adjusted by maintenance.These two items were overall very minor and did not detract from our enjoyment of the hotel. We would definitely stay at this property again.

I am staying at this hotel currently and have been repeatedly disappointed in this place.  Unfortunately, I got this reservation on book it.com and can't even switch hotels without losing everything I paid for!   My flight was delayed 24 hrs due to "mechanical problems" and when I called the bookit representative, she told me the hotel usually tries to be accommodating, esp since it was a mechanical problem on the plane and not nature related.  We finally got here, exhausted from our travel here.  I spoke with the supervisor to see if they may be able to comp our room for the night we lost there and the entire next day, but she looked upset that she had to even walk out to speak to us.  She replied that they are unable to comp a night and were unable to offer anything else except that they would charge a little less for late check out on the day we depart!  Whaat?  I have never heard of being charged per hr on checking out late!  I have never seen a manager that does not seem to want to do anything to make the customer happy, esp. after all we went through to get here!  She just said, "Well that is the airline's fault, not ours."  Really?  I realize it's not their fault but they should be a little more accommodating. When we checked into our "partial ocean view" room I called the front desk and informed them that I did not see an ocean and there was only a view of the run down apt building next to it.  She pointed out that if you walk into this 3ftx1ft balcony and look through the corner to the right, there was a small view of the ocean....wow!  What a scam!  Sure enough it was there between a few buildings, but what a joke!  U think I'm really going to step out on this 1 ft diameter balcony to look to right and see the ocean???  So, we have 2 double beds and they are full size only and no queen size beds available. I asked about a king with a sofa bed and a roll away, and of course they want to charge more for each day.  I have never been to a hotel that has not accommodated such requests.  This just shows me how cheap of a hotel this is!  We went to breakfast which is 6:30 to 9 am.  It had a decent selection for a continental breakfast but the staff is so rude!  I asked for a cup to get juice for my kids at 9:05 and they guy there says the breakfast ends at 9 and refuses to give me any milk or a cup for juice!  In summary, I would never stay in a such a hotel in the future.  I am very disappointed in their service and their attitude here.  This may be a good, economical hotel choice for kids on Spring break, but not for a family trying to enjoy a relaxing vacation.

The hotel is right on the beach, as all the hotels on Kalakaua Ave are. It is the furthest hotel from the shops and restaurants of Waikiki. The room was small but the furnishings were nice. The staff was hit or miss, some nice and helpful, most seemed bothered by a simple request. The valet parking is convenient, but there is a free lot just on the other side of the zoo which is very close. There is also an hourly charge lot just behind the hotel, if you don't to spend $27 a day to park. The room was very noisy at night, between the thin door/walls, we could hear the cars at the intersection and the hissing wind while we tried to sleep. The elevator system is very annoying, for some reason you can take an elevator from the ground floor to your floor but not the other way around. Every time we left the hotel we had to wait for 2 elevators to get to the ground level. All around there are much nicer places to stay for the same price.

The Aston Waikiki is just steps away from the beach, just like the hotel advertises. When we first arrived and were placed in a room next an elevator so we asked to be moved. The staff was very accommodating of our request and we were moved to a far better room just after our arrival. The daily continental breakfasts were always the same but very good. There was usually a musician or dancers but since it rained most of that week it was only sporadic at best. Overall, we liked our stay there because it is central to the action going on; be it beach-going or shoppping/dining, whatever. We had a great time and would book another stay at this hotel in the future.

Just got back from a 7 nite vacation here and we miss it already! We were very impressed with the quality of the room and the staff. Of course you have to take into acct that you are staying at a hotel off of the ocean. The bathroom is small but we only needed to shower after a day in ocean and activities so just fine. The breakfast buffet was great! Staff was friendly and extremely quick to replenish the food as people get a bit crazy! Can't blame the hotel tho! Loved that we were at the end of the beach as it was quieter, but still close to all the shopping and restaurants. We ended up walking everywhere and took the bus to a few places...never rode a city bus and was very surprised at how fun and easy! Will be back next year!

Stayed here with my family for 5 nights. The location right on Waikiki beach is terrific. It is on the east end of Kalakaua Avenue, a little further from the restaurants and nicer stores but well within a 5-10 minute walk. There are plenty of hotel restaurants in the area. Attached is a Wolfgang Puck express which has good food, an ice cream and cookie store. Convenience stores are plentiful in the area as well as fast food restaurants. We did find our room noisy as there seems to be a lot of sirens and loud vehicles on the avenue. Mechanical noises also bothered is as the air conditioning had a rattling sound like I was running a clothes dryer all night long. The pool is small but who cares when the beach is across the street. The rooms are small but clean. The hotel has Hawaiian decor which is bright and makes you feel like you are away from home. As mentioned in other reviews, you do feel nickeled and dimed here because wifi in your room is a $10 /day charge, parking (only valet is available) is $28/day, the in room safe is $3 per day, and local calls are $1 per call. The free breakfast runs from 6-9 am on the pool deck area. The food is donuts, muffins, pastries and fruit. If you want waffles ($3) or omelettes ($5) they are an extra charge as with everything else. That said the hotel is pretty fair value for your money for this area. The rooms are comfortable and everyone except the reception desk is very friendly.

We were there with our 5 month old baby. Overall the stay was good. We had a room (803) that had a bad smell and was noisy, and staff made arrangements for us to move to another room. In general staff was friendly. The "breakfast at the beach" is a joke, they have a buffet that could be improved (bread, muffins, bread, muffins), the fruit didn't seem fresh and we were in Hawaii, where good fruit is abundant. They call it breakfast at the beach because you can take goodies in a bag they provide (which it's a good idea). So if you know that in advance, then you won't be disappointed:) We ended up getting breakfast at the restaurants next to the hotel. The pool is not big and is in between the reception desk and a restaurant, so it isn't a place to relax, because it's more like a walkway with lots of traffic. But considering that the beach is across the street, you probably won't want to spend much time by the pool.The hotel is in a good location.

My room on the 17th floor was comfortable, clean and modern, not huge, but had everything I needed and expected. The tiny balcony overlooking the pool was a bit disappointing size-wise -- barely big enough for one chair, but the view of the ocean and beach were very nice -- even if it was at a bit of an angle. If you want the full-on view, I guess you have to spring for the top priced ocean front room. I got the mid-priced ocean view room -- and I was happy with that for the money -- especially with the AAA discount that I found on their website.Like a few other reviewers, I had a few small nits to pick with the Aston, but overall I got what I paid for -- so no real complaints. I would be tempted to check out a different place next time, though -- no reason to fall in love with 3 out of 5, right?The whooshing of the elevator was audible in the room and a little annoying at times -- as another reviewer suggested, perhaps ask for a room away from the elevators.I guess you either love or hate the free breakfast. I went the first morning -- and I'm leaning more towards the "hate" department. It's a ruckus of people cramming whatever they can into the feed bag that they give you. One lady beside me had about a half dozen individual cereal boxes crammed into her purse and was yelling at her daughter to also grab what she could from the donut tray that was just put down before the "good ones" disappeared. I guess they would be more in the "love" department! I decided not to even bother the next day.The hotel is right across from the beach -- even if the beach is being dug up at the moment, just go fifty yards either way. The hotel is NOT right in the middle of Waikiki -- I have no idea why others say that. It's pretty much the last hotel on the strip -- but honestly no more than a very pleasant walk from pretty much anywhere. So it's location is not really a minus. In fact, if you're up for a good solid three hour walk, figure out how to walk from the hotel to the top of Diamond Head.

We stayed here for 1 week. I found the bed very uncomfortable. The tub never drained properly. The smoke detector kept going off at 3am. TV never worked proper.Very, very loud. We were told that we could get a late check out, but on the day that we needed it they wanted $75.The beach across from there was under construction. Over all i would not stay there again

To summarize what most people have said:- Location. You cross the street and the beach is there. There is some beach renovation going on, but it's not a big deal - not like the entire beach is closed or anything like that. - Location #2. The hotel is at one end of the shopping strip, so all you do is start walking the length of the "Broadway" to get to all the shops.- Expedia travel station is available to show you various excursions ... you can even book it there. e.g. I did the Hanauma Bay snorkeling, highly recommended, $18 round trip transportation with gear - can't beat that. ps. Some of my friends did the Luau, they weren't impressed with that outing - ymmv.- I stayed on the 5th floor, room 520-something. No view of the beach, just a sight of another hotel. I didn't mind, since I had no intentions of staying inside the room except to sleep. Big bonus - no noise! This section is away from all the noise from the Tiki bar and the pool. If you want a view of the beach AND no noise ... it's up to you to figure out.- I had no complaints with the room - looked pretty good in shape. - The breakfast is mediocre, but you should not complain because it's free. If you're a complainer ... please book a stay somewhere else and pay more :) After a few days I went downstairs to eat at other places just to break the monotony.- Plenty of things to do. Zoo, surfing, shopping, catamaran ride, etc. right outside the hotel.- You'll encounter some beggars but they pretty much leave you alone. One 'beggar' in front of McD's had a sign 'poor and hungry for McD's' but was talking to someone on his cellphone.- LuLu's is a great place to eat while looking out onto the beach. On Monday night it was packed with younger people (20's-30's), with a good DJ playing hiphop/techno music. Apparently Monday nights are 'industry nights' where locals go out to have a good time.- I took the public bus 'The Bus' to get to Pearl Harbor. 1.5 hours each way ... the bus stops everywhere. Cheap, but it does take a toll. Might want to check if Expedia has a shuttle service you can pay to get there quicker. ps. Pearl Harbor & USS Arizona is free; Expedia warned I may not get into USS Arizona unless I get there super early - but I had no problems when I got there during the week at 11am.- Diamond Head hiking trail to the top of the mountain - recommended if you are in shape!I came here with a bunch of people to play volleyball. Maybe you've seen us around if you were there the same week!

The room is a tad small, and the bathroom needs to be updated (a bit worn and needs ventilation for showers!!) but we had everything we needed. Beds are incredibly comfortable and our standard room (pool side) had a marvellous ocean view! The hotel is right across from the beach, and most importantly, the StoneCold Creamery is right on site!!! Staff were pleasant. I've stayed twice and definitely would again.

We love this hotel and always come back to the same hotel every time we visit Waikiki. This is our 3rd time stay in Feb. 2012. This hotel is in the center of Waikiki and location is A+. Everything is walking distance. I have to say the hotel manager Jon and stuffs Lave, Kevin and Kamaka were the BEST!!! We had the 5 stars service with a very reasonable price. I strongly suggest this hotel to anyone is planning to visit Waikiki if you want to save money and good location. ALOHA AND MAHALO TO ALL FRIENDS IN THIS HOTEL:)Happy customer:)

The hotel room was fine, good proximity to the beach. The experience was like a week in a college dorm, with crowds of people with varying levels of social skills. The breakfast buffet was like a feeding frenzy of people in a rush pushing in an out of line to fill their little breakfast bags each is given. Maybe plates, utensils, etc would make this more civilized. This is nothing complimentary either. There are coffee, tea, beverages, set up poolside all day (for a price). The bank of computers in the lobby take credit cards or cash. You may check in for your flight fee, but it costs $3.50 to print your boarding pass...and on and on. Carry lots of extra money.

We have just returned from a one week stay at the Aston. It is a big, bustling hotel with a continual stream of new guests and tour groups. For sake of definition, it is a "hotel" not a "boutique hotel" or "resort" - we were expecting a "hotel" experience and this is excatly what we got. If you want more of a luxury, sitting by the pool, resort type experience you won't get it here.Here are some points worth mentioning:- our room was clean and tidy. Not huge but spacious enough for two people who spent most of their time out and about exploring O'ahu rather than being in a hotel room. We received fresh towels every day and housekeeping did a great job at cleaning and tidying our room daily.- we had a Patial Ocean View room. Our room overlooked the pool and you could see the beach/sunset clearly from our patio area. The beach view was obscured by diggers and dump trucks, as the beach is currently getting a major upgrade, but this was bad luck in timing and nothing to do with the hotel.- we enjoyed the breakfast. Every morning we filled our blue bag and headed out - we preferred this to sitting around the pool to eat. It is a little hard to get your head around glazed donuts for breakfast but these made a great morning tea treat! - our room was on the 7th floor and we were not disturbed by the band or traffic noise at night. Our room was two rooms down from the lift and it was the "wooshing" of the lift going up and down that was more of an issue noise wise (the lifts are simple to use by the way). This settled down after about 10pm but started up again about 6.30am when people started heading down for breakfast.- the location is great. Across the road from the beach and just out of the crazyness of the main strip. The local bus stop is two minutes away and it is a mian pick up area for tours/transit buses.- Tiki's bar and grill next to the pool area was great - we had drinks here every night and a number of meals. The service is excellent and the food lovely. Hold onto your receipt as you get a free Mai Tai if you come back the next night and present your recieipt- we only realised this on our last day!! The herb seasoned fries at Wolfgang Puck Express downstairs were also a food highlight!!!Overall, we would happily come back to this hotel.PS. To any Australians travelling to O'ahu with shopping in mind, a trip to Waikele Premium Outlets is a must! The two hour local bus ride (which is a great experience in itself!) is worth it for the ridiculously cheap bargains. You won't be disappointed!

Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is pretty good. It's right across the street from the beach. It's close to tons of shops and eateries. The rooms are nice and spacious. There's a fridge but no microwave. I was shocked that you are charged three dollars a day for the safe. I've traveled a lot and never had to pay for a safe. Also you have to pay 27 dollars a day for parking. Wow!! Their continental breakfast is average. But I really liked how they give you a bag and encourage to take it with you if you're heading out for the day. The batteries in my remote were dead when I got there. I called down and they replaced them pretty quickly.Overall, pretty good but I'm not sure if I would return because the parking is so freaking expensive. Don't forget to add an extra $200 on whatever you are paying for the hotel so you can park your car.Tiki's - The restaurant below the hotel does not have very good service. We went there twice and had to wait a long time both times just to be acknowledged by a server.

This hotel was a great value for what we paid for it, right across from waikiki beach and close to many things to do. Breakfast on the beach was nice they provide you with a lil cooler to take your breakfast, it is a continental so you have your topical fruits, yogurts, donuts, muffins, cereal... You can upgrade to get an omelet, or waffle for like $5.00 not too bad considering the cost of Hawaii.There are a few restaurant in the hotel, tiki grill was great, and so was Wolfgang Pucks express, there is also a subway and an ice cream place.The rooms can be on the small side and when it says partial ocean view don't expect to see much water...The hotel is a major stop for a lot of thr tour operators so it was convenient to get anywhere we really wanted to go. If you rent a car be prepared to pay a ridiculous amount for parking, $23.00 valet only and it is off premises. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly and helpful.

If you're looking for a low-end/mediocre hotel set on the end of busy, main street Waikiki, then this is the place for you. We just came back from a 5 day stay at the Aston with a school group of 17 students. The overall impression was average. Breakfast: this is included in the room rate, but BE WARNED, the quality of the food is VERY low (VERY limited healthy options-with the exception of the fresh fruit), and there are so many people at the hotel that the breakfast buffet can be very chaotic and overwhelming at times.There are very few tables to sit at, so on a sunny day, people can be seen by the dozens sitting on beach chairs or in any open space by the pool. THERE IS NO REAL SEATING AVAILABLE FOR BREAKFAST, which now makes sense to me why the hotel advertises "breakfast on the beach" so much. They are trying to get the massive amounts of people off the property and across at the beach since they just don't have the capacity for everyone.The one plus side is that they give you a small lunch-bag to stuff with food and take away.Rooms: these were the pretty standard hotel rooms with decent beds, flat screen tv, table and chairs, refrigerator,and safe (that cost a few dollars a day to use). We had the corner room, so we had a great view of Diamond Head and the zoo out our window. If you stuck your head out far enough on the lanai, you could see a glimpse of the ocean. The lanais were small, barely big enough to bring a chair outside and sit on. Pigeons were always hovering as well (In fact, two friendly birds usually walked inside our room when we opened the sliding door).Hotel layout: VERY awkward. There is a reception area on the bottom floor where all the buses and taxis pick up. In the mornings, this area is usually crowded with guests eating breakfast (see my section on breakfast earlier). On the same floor, you'll see "Wolfgang Express" restaurant next to a "Subway" and "Coldstone Creamery". From the bottom floor, you take an escalator up to the main level where the reception desk(s), pool, and restaurant are located. From there, you have to take a separate elevator up to the rooms in the hotel tower. Very awkward setting...by renting out the various areas to restaurants, it seemed to us that the hotel just wanted to make money, while taking away valuable space for seating near the pool/lobby.Overall, the hotel is in a good location in Waikiki. Just in comparison to some of other nicer hotels further down the street (Sheraton, Hilton, etc.), this one was low-average.

This place takes some getting used to, but is worth going out of the comfort zone. Because it is a very BUSY location, the security is top notch...which means you have to get used to the elevator system-which I groused about myself the first day, but got over myself soon, when I realized it was me that had the problem-not them. There is a person standing at the elevator (most times) to help out-it's floor specific based on your key. They give you a breakfast cooler and you load up and head out to the beach. Amazing walking opportunities to great restaurants, and the aquarium and beach volleyball to watch. At night, its Waikiki in its prime. They are so popular, plan in advance.

I read reviews on this hotel before I left and saw many people complain about the elevators. I personally didn't think they were that bad. We LOVED this place! We paid the extra bucks and got a beach view which was well worth the money. Great to sit out on the lanai and watch the sunset... perfect! The breakfast that was included was great. I would go and pick it up while the rest of the family slept and sometimes we would take it to the beach... great coconut coffee!! Have nothing but good things to say about this hotel as well as the location. The only thing was that parking is $25.00 per night. We parked a couple of blocks down for $10 a night so it wasnt a big deal. Can't wait to go back to this hotel!!!
