we enjoyed this hotel.....the breakfast plan gives each guest an insulated picnic tote and the buffet is open on the pool deck from 6am-9am.....the food is generous and includes fresh fruit yogurt etc etc....on sunny days it is nice to sit by the pool and take in the live music and pretty hulu dancer...other days you are encouraged to take your meal back to your balcony or to the beach and they have beach chairs that can be borrowed.............all service was excellent...on a cool day the pool attendent offered towels to wrap in and hot cocoa...........there is free wi fi available in the pool area..........the location is excellent just down the street from the zoo and aquarium with a good view of the beach......evenings the music from the pool deck resturant bar is so enjoyable...lots of pickups from shoping buses or just a block away from catching the city bus if you want to go to the flea market or to the big shopping center......oh yes it seems that getting dry weather could be a problem in march...so bring your umbrella....its nice and warm even when it rains.

This hotel was clean, just needs some updating, especially in the bathrooms. Rooms are small, but fine for a short stay. The beds were very comfortable! All the food on site was very good from the free breakfast to the dining room for dinner. Wish the pool area was a little bigger always seemed tough to get a chair.

You might be attracted for the free breakfast option however they provide a small cooler bag (per room) and people just assemble around food and finding a chair is just a challenge so you end up having it in the room.Parking (valet) is really expensive therefore to save some bucks you have to go with a self park option 3 blocks away ($10 a day) from the hotel.Rooms are very small, not really well maintained and in need of cleaning.OverallI would not return.

For blue collar famiiles ths hotel was above our expectations. The morning breakfast was awesome. They give you a insulated lunch "bag" you can load up for the family and grab and go. This hotel has a good resturant (Tiki) but a bit pricey. However, the happy hour is good ($2.50 draft pints) from 2-5. We did not try the pool. The hotel has a Subway and Ice cream place right on site. Beach is currently under construction right across the hotel. Somethings to know- March is the rainy season. We were here 5 days total (3 full) and it rained 4 of those days. The rain canceled our Shark cage trip and our hike to Diamon Head. The city is crowded, dirty, and the traffice is terrible. There are many homeless everywhere. The tourists and natives are in no hurry- especially to cross busy streets. However, the drivers here are extremely patient and polite. They rarely honk their horns at anything. The people overall were very friendly. Out of the 50 states we have travel to, this so far is one of our least favorites (out of all 4 of us). See my reviews of other Oahu sites: Hukilau Cafe, Heleana's, Ono Hawaiian foods, Pear Harbor etc, Me's BarBQ, Matsumoto's Shave Ice,Vip Trans, Iilama tours, and Pleasant Hoildays and maybe the North Shore.

We stayed here over New Years 2012 and had an ocean view room. The Breakfast on the Beach deal is great (served poolside with coolers for the beach, room, or while touring). We walked to shopping, and the beach. The valet service was very fast and friendly. The hotel is at the end of beach at the foot of Diamondhead and right at a trolly stop if you want to aviod driving. The room was just a room, but we didn't come to Hawaii to stay in the room.

If you plan to stay around your hotel then probably want to keep looking... or if you will be outside most of the trip and dont really care abouth the details then this MAY suit you..... We chose this for the rate and location. The rooms are in big need of cleaning and updating..ie. old and stained linens, sand paper like towels, the doors, walls etc.. need to be cleaned and painted and the like. The pool is small and cold and often covered in shade due to the hotel tower location...The staff are fine and helpful- the Tiki bar/grill is awesome ( 2nd level) and reasonable with the view of the beach you want. Try the Mahi Mahi and the Fish Tacos! The free brakfast buffett is a positive if you dont mind the insanity some people experience when mini muffins are free! Watch out! Overall a decision is required of whats important to you on your vacation..For me- I would not return.
